Overall it was really good, the downfall was that there was a hair on the fries. The manager was kind enough to make us a new one and take it off the bill.

This restaurant made a great expectation on the clam chowder for me!
author: Alex L.

description: They were very busy here so service was a little slow but overall the food was great and they serve sourdough bread rolls which are delicious!! We ordered the clam chowder bowl, linguini clam pasta, and the mixed grill dish which comes with salmon, cod, and shrimp. Overall we were happy with the food. The standout for me was the cod, the clam pasta had a very generous amount of clams and was deliciously garlicky. The clam chowder was perfect, creamy, and not overly salted with a good amount of clams. The prices are high but that is because it is a nicer sit down restaurant in the heart of Fisherman's Warf so I wouldn't expect anything less.
author: Vicky C.

description: We set at the bar to have a dinner 10 minutes letter nobody pays attention on us!!! After we asked to be served one guy take our order and we haven't seen him anymore.We had lobster tail and seafood dish for two- amazing,but still when you have to ask for every single thing makes your dinner unpleasant! Never again
author: Teddy N.

description: Disappointing experience. Positives: friendly bartender, friendly waitress, great view, clean and spacious. These things are what earned 2 stars. The other 3 were lost due to the attitude of the hostesses and the poor quality of the food. We ordered the crab chicken cocktail and the lobster tails. The crab had no flavor and the lobster tasted like it had been microwaved. I am not sure if I would come back unless it was for a work party or something.
author: Elizabeth G.

description:
Our server's name was Curtis the Courteous! He was a wonderful server right from the beginning. He was pleasant, detailed and spoke with class. He definitely made our trip to Fog Harbor Fish House a five star.

My son has been asking for some steamed clams and I've been craving for some chowder; then hubby just wanted to tag-along. I suggested the cioppino to him but he was skeptic at first because he didn't want to be let down. Luckily, I checked a yelper's tip first and a yelped suggested a linguini added. My Hubby loved it! 
We had calamari and steamed mussels for appetizer; it was delicious!!! My chowder was excellent! Our son, well he finished everything on his plate! He ordered the steamed clams with linguini. Lastly, don't forget their non-alcoholic drinks. I enjoyed the strawberry nojito! They even served fresh squeezed orange juice and lemonade.

We will definitely return.
author: KK M.

description:
What can I possibly say about this place that hasn't been said! This restaurant will always have a place in my heart because this is where my fiance and I went with our family and friends right after we got engaged. They made us feel special and gave us a complimentary congratulations dessert which I didn't really expect but appreciated. There was a big group of us so we got to try a lot of different things.

The calamari and oysters were great!  Crab cakes were good but I've had better. THE CLAM CHOWDER WAS FANTASTIC!! I had to get it in the bread bowl to get the full effect and it was totally worth the carbs. My friend's salad was ginormous and my sister bought us a bottle of the finest champagne. The whole experience was memorable and the service was great. I would recommend making reservations because the place gets packed and for good reason.
author: Thoa B.

description: Delicious clam chowder soup. Great service. Fresh oysters. However, the food left us underwhelmed. I had the filet mignon topped with crab with sautéed spinach and "mashed potatoes" the potatoes had more lumps than mash and were not cooked well. The crab was topped a very thick sauce that tasted like the smokiness you get when you bite into a Burger King burger. Very strange. My friend chose the shrimp and steak chow mein. Her noodles were too rubbery to eat. All in all try their chowder and appetizers.
author: Frasier J.

description:
As like some of other reviews have mentioned, wasn't too sure how great this would be being at Pier 39. My wife and I went on a long Sunday afternoon walk and sorta ended up at Pier 39 hungry, so we took to Yelp to find something decent in the area. To my surprise, this place had 4-stars so we figured we'd give it a try. Sure glad we did because the clam chowder and salad with crab meat were quite delicious!

In addition to the great food, our service was great, too. The atmosphere is obviously amazing as well - great views.

It's normally not easy to find a place in this area with great service AND great food (great atmosphere is sorta a given), but this place seems to have it, at least for us on this occasion!
author: Derrick S.

description: Food are great! I enjoyed everything, just one thing keep your restroom clean please.
author: Jaime A.

description: It really was lovely!  Thank you! I thought it wouldn't be that good because it's on pier 39 but the food was amazing!  Service. .amazing!  Drinks were flawless. Had the special risotto,  perfect.  Scallops,  perfectly cooked.  Bartel aged bourbon with one large cube.  Fried shrimp was great!  Another party had surf and turf.  Also a winner.
author: Debbie M.

description:
Waited 45 minutes to 1 hour for dinner as no reservations were available. Enjoyed wandering around Fisherman's Wharf and the time passed rather painlessly. 

Given the review and crowds, I was looking forward to a tasty dinner.  

I started with their award winning clam chowder.  The temperature of my chowder was tepid, otherwise the soup was creamy and full of clams.  

My dinner choice was the crab roll. I really wanted to try their crab but was lazy and didn't want to get messy (work dinner).   I think a little celery salt and a lot less mayo would have helped.  The fries were hot, crispy and nicely salted. 

The complementary hot sourdough roll was the best thing I ate.
author: Cindy G.

description: Came here for my mother's 75th Birthday.  The food was absolutely fabulous. We ordered the fish and chips, whole crab, linguini w/ clams, surf and turf, scallops w/ polenta, Chopino,calamari, baked oysters, ahi tuna, and of course the clam chowder.  Everything was delicious.  The view was gorgeous and the staff was very friendly.  Will totally come back.
author: Eleonor T.

description: Ate lunch here and it definitely is a touristy spot.  Food was pretty good and service as well but way over-priced.  Also our calamari appetizer barely had any calamari in it.  Nice views and a decent spot just be prepared for some over priced food.  We were in for lunch on Saturday 7/21.
author: Basem T.

description: Excellent and friendly service. Clam Chowder was AMAZING! Food was decent. Not the best seafood platter we've ever had - but the customer service and view is so great that it's worth the experience.
author: Sarah C.

description: Great view and service by our server Asia today. She was courteous, prompt, and friendly.  Excellent crab and chowder. Delicious food washed down with delicious drinks. A pricey treat! Crime brûlée was perfect too.
author: J C.

description:
Perfect spot that over looks Alcatraz and the bay while you enjoy some great seafood.
To top it off, the customer service is great!

I got the fish and chips with clam chowder :)
author: Steve M.

description:
This place was awesome! We got seated by the window overlooking the ocean. I got the clam chowder which I loved. We also got the deep fried seafood appetizers. Everything was delicious! We ended up having desert as well... the waiter brought out the dessert platter and we had to try one. We ended up getting the apple crisp with vanilla ice cream - loved the top portion lol! I'd come back here again. 

It is located on the second level, one of the first few restaurants you'll pass by at pier 39.
author: Keycee D.

description:
When every place on a Monday night is dead in the Harbor area, but Fog Harbor Fish house is bumpin then yeah you know this place is awesome. I would recommend making a reservation no matter the night as this place is right on the water and the food/service is amazing. 

Clam Chowder lives up to the hype and I made the rookie mistake of not getting it in the bread bowl. They have great bread that they give you before the meal. Any place that gives me breads always has a special place in my heart. I ordered the Seafood Penne which was bomb and very reasonably priced. The service is excellent and it feels like seconds after you order, the food is at the table. 

If I come back to San Francisco, I'll make sure to eat here again as it was the best restaurant I went to during my trip.
author: Scott L.

description: Amazing view and amazing food!!! Perfect place to eat seafood in San Francisco! Love it
author: Stephanny D.

description: Five of us had an early dinner Saturday and all enjoyed the food, harbor view and atmosphere. My husband ordered the halibut on the special daily menu and I the linguini and clams also a house salad to share. The salad dressing tasted sort of like Russian. Sour dough bread rolls were served with butter---very delicious. Two Friends ordered fish and chips and were very pleased. I would recommend this restaurant to others who are visiting Pier 39. They also have a large wine and cocktail menu. Cheers!
author: Peggy C.

description: Long wait but the food was not that great. Average quality yet pricey. I ordered seafood pasta and Ahi tuna rare seared which came out just ok. $70 for both exluded drinks.
author: Mai N.

description: If I could give this place a 3.5 stars I would, but 4 is suited in this case opposed to just a 3! They are packed which is a great sign, the food offerings are plentiful, and the staff are definitely on their toes with such a full house. However, i found the food to be good, but the wait time for my waiter to assist me to be longer than I would have preferred. I tried their lazy seafood cioppino and it was hearty, full, and flavorful. I also enjoyed their skinny mocktails. I almost went back a second time but therewere just too many places in SF to try instead of frequenting a place twice that I just had an ok dining experience. The food was definitely tasty, but the wait and a preoccupied waiter killed my overall dining experience.
author: Ramona G.

description: Excellent lunch!  I was skeptical at first because the quality of food and prices in such high tourist areas are usually not as good but we were pleasantly surprised. I had the Mixed Grill with grilled shrimp, salmon, and pacific cod that was cooked to perfection. The garlic mashed potatoes were full of flavor and seasoned well. The view was great!  I would highly recommend. It is high end food but at lunch the environment was kid friendly and dress was casual.
author: Jenny S.

description:
Visit Fog Harbor Fish House for your next romantic date night! The ambience, food and drink menu truly deliver a memorable experience. I recently spent a romantic dinner for one here while traveling alone in San Fran for work.

There are so many dining options in the area, that it's nearly impossible to choose just one. I walked around for nearly an hour before selecting Fog Harbor, which I decided upon because of its sustainable seafood menu, gluten free menu options (thumbs up for Celiac-friendly dining!) and scenic view (which I unfortunately didn't get to experience from my table).

The hostess suggested I sit at the bar since I was alone, but I requested a table. Who says you can't have a nice dinner by yourself? Seriously though, self care is important.

The main spacious main dining room offers scenic views of the Bay; it was crowded when I arrived, and I was seated in one of the side dining rooms. Unfortunately my table didn't offer any views, and the room was brightly lit with tables crowded near each other. I would have preferred a table with a better view in the main room, but I arrived late and was dining alone. You can't win them all!

During my dinner I experienced excellent service, and my wine glass was never empty. The menu offers a diverse variety of seafood, and they bring you a pre-dinner bread basket (which I had to pass on, thanks to Celiac Disease). Since I was traveling and on a food tour of the city and had been eating all day, I selected a lighter option: The California Crab & Avocado Caesar Salad. I love fresh crab and this salad was loaded with toppings, dressing and the works!

For all you winos, they have an extensive wine list with local CA varieties and imports. I've been on a Malbec kick lately, so that was my drink of choice for the evening.

Despite this restaurant being located in touristy area (next to freakin' Bubba Gumps -- so kitschy), Fog Harbor offers upscale dining, good wine and awesome views. Check it out the next time you're in town!
author: Stephanie S.

description: Great service, great seafood, great view. I recommend going during the sunset because it's a beautiful lookout. Very delicious grilled shrimp. Salad and potatoes on the side are awesome. On the other side, place can be a bit crowded too.
author: Brenda L.

description:
Fog Harbor Fish House was the final destination for our 9 person appreciaton dinner this evening. The location is awesome on pier 39 at Fishermans Warf on the Embarcadero with a stunning view of the Harbor. The location managed to awaken memories of my 1st trip here as a young teenager. The destination is the best its ever been, at least what I remember it to be. Best clam chowder ever! Dessert was Apple Crisp with a small scoop of ice cream on top. Prices are reasonable.

The service here was great as was the menu selection. I ordered the Seared Ahi Tuna. Pretty good. Our guests were happy with thier selections as well. I am already looking forward to my next visit here. Be sure to call ahead for reservations.
author: James H.

description:
Fog Harbor is a fantastic spot for a perfect meal!
Most restaurants at Pier 39 or Fisherman's Wharf are not good quality and geared to be tourist traps.....but not Fog Harbor! 

They have a fantastic location on the upper level of Pier 39 with a great view overlooking the bay and boat harbor, you can even see the sea lions in the distance.

Service is amazing from start to finish, the staff is always very attentive and pleasant....we have even spoken with Mario, the manager and he is extremely pleasant and is very intent on making sure you enjoy your meal and experience.

the menu consists of all the San Francisco favorites and they are very tasty!  Everything from the clam chowder to the salads and sandwiches and pasta!

We are locals in SF and love coming here for a nice, relaxing lunch!
author: Ken B.

description: Love the food and service.  All the food was mind blowing!  Amazing scallops and crab risotto!  Best Cream  brûlée ever!
author: Pauly A.

description: Had a great brunch here yesterday. We ordered a seafood tower and their award winning clam chowder.  Everything came out quick and was well prepared.  Service was good and we were seated right away at opening.  We had a reservation via Open Table although we didn't need it but it's always good to reserve just in case with popular places like this. The view of the bay overlooks the GG Bridge and Alcatraz Island.  I would recommend this place if you like good seafood.
author: Andrew P.

description:
Food: 5/5
Ambiance: 5/5
Service: 5/5

Never been a fan of oysters but their oysters are out of this world amazing! Came here for my boyfriend's birthday and was not disappointed. We arrive one hr before our actual reservation and they still accommodated our request to be seated. I have no complaints. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!
author: Carmel A.

description: This place is soooo good! It overlooks the pier and is located on the second floor. We ordered the crab risotto with scallops and the roasted crab. Both were delicious and fresh! Prices are what you would expect for a place like this. They also have a kids menu which is a huge plus! I will definitely be coming back here again! Everyone loved the food.
author: Gloria S.

description:
Dear Foggy,

I am glad I found you. My good friend yelp let me know I should check you out, so I did.

I was looking for a place to take my in-laws, somewhere nice, somewhere where the food is distinctly San-Francisco-like, and of course the food has got to be good. You hit the mark.

I don't dish out 5-stars lightly, but I'll give it to you. If the prices were like $5 cheaper and the seats a little farther apart you would be perfect, but hey I understand. If I was running a business at such a prime location and brimming in the seams, I would have done exactly the same so I can't hold that against you.

To keep it simple, your service good, your people are nice, and the food is fantastic. The highest compliment is that despite your prices, I've returned yet again, with my own parents some months later. We even got seated right next to the window and when that happens it's like magic. Also the wait was never as long as it seems for a place so busy. I would have expected to wait 45minutes to an hour but somehow it ends up being way short of that each time.

As for the food.

Mussel Fries (5/5) - um yes please. what is in that sauce? yum.

Seafood Penne (4/5) - very good. I don't order pasta much because I am not a big fan of pasta so this is a high compliment. pasta lovers would have a field day.

Clam Chowder (5/5) - yeah people might have different opinions but I am firmly in the camp of ... this is really good clam chowder. flavorful, little chunks of meat. Usually I leave clam chowder places wondering if they just opened a can of campbell soup. This ain't one of those.

Seared Scallop Risotto (5/5) - oh yes. yes. very delicious. expensive but delicious. wish there were more scallops, but those scallops that were there... delicious. 

You have become our go-to place to bring people we want to take out to the city to see pier 39. great job.

until then...
author: Paul L.

description:
We stopped in for Happy Hour on a Thursday afternoon. 

There are a couple good drink specials and we landed on a Whiskey Mule, which I'd never had. 

They were $7 each and well worth it. 

Food looked pretty good but we didn't eat.
author: Jim T.

description:
Our Second time to visit this Great Restaurant..It's Located on the Second Level of Pier 39...

Coming Here with Friends from Outside California is a great Treat. After showing them the Famous Fisherman's Wharf, SeaLions and Alcatraz. 

We Make it a point that this would be the Last Stop of our Tour of Pier 39.

 We sat exactly on the Same round table by the Entrance. My Family and 2 guest were delighted to have Bernie (Same Server as my Son Vividly Remembers him)

As Suggested we had the Platter for 2 and added 2 Lobster tails. Guest got Mix Grill and Ahi ...It;s a Must for My guest to Try their Famous Chowder...They Loved it...

Service was impeccable from the Host to Bernie's Constant attendening to what my guest needs...Clean Bathroom..

I'd Surely would come back in this restaurant if I have Guest ...
author: Elain C.

description:
When my supervisor asked me for food suggestions for the team outing, of course I decided to go all out on seafood by the bay. It's right down the street from our entertainment, SF Dungeon.

We made reservations for 5:00pm but our show ended much earlier (3:00pm). Instead of walking around or hitting a bar for 2 hours, we went to the restaurant to see if we could get seated early. When we mentioned our reservations, the lady at the front desk was all "Soooooo you came now...?" Obviously? But there were TONS of open tables. Who eats at 3:00pm??? But I bet if we actually arrived at the time of our reservations, we would've gotten a table by the window. Kinda disappointed about that but not the restaurant's fault.

A coworker and I went directly up to the bar to order drinks because we wanted the drinks on a separate tab. I got the Lipstick Lemondrop and he had the Alcatraz Escape. Both were great. Couldn't taste alcohol at all but definitely felt it. I LOVE that.

I got the Cioppino. At first I thought about getting the Lazy Cioppino (no shells), but part of the fun of seafood is eating with your hands! The scallops were HUGE! Do you see the chunk of white on the right of my picture?? That was one of the scallops!! The crabs were already cracked so it was easy to get the meat out. They provide the cracker and a tiny fork but I didn't need it at all. The fish they used was SALMON, my favorite! The tomato soup was DELICIOUS with chunks of tomato in it. $34 for all that? I'd say it was definitely worth it.

I also tried some of my coworker's Lobster Tail, which I was also contemplating but my Cioppino was DEFINITELY the winner. The Lobster Tail was way smaller than I expected, and kinda dry. The melted butter didn't help very much with flavor.

We wrapped it up with dessert. I thought the way they present dessert was VERY smart. They have all their desserts brought to you on a tray, then they introduce each one. I asked our waiter what he recommends personally and we ended up with two: House-made Vanilla Bean Creme Brulee and Strawberry Shortcake. The brulee was good, but the shortcake was better IMO. Super soft shortcake with whipped cream and fruits drowning in syrup. Not SUPER sweet either.

The only thing I regret now is my coworkers knowing how much I eat...
author: Athena C.

description:
The first time I came here was when I was a young child and it's still as great as I remember. There's absolutely nothing I would complain about Fog Harbor Fish House. The food, the ambiance, the view, and the service are all impeccable. 

My friends and I came around dinner time so we got the opportunity to catch a view of the gorgeous sunset even though we were seated closer to the back and further away from the windows. 

We shared a fried calamari appetizer which came with yummy tarter sauce. We squeezed lemon all over it and our enjoyable dinner commenced. 

Clam chowder is a must try when you're touristing in Fisherman's Wharf. This spot truly has 'award winning' clam chowder. The clams taste as if they were just picked out of the ocean and thrown into the soup. 100% fresh. 

For my entree, I chose the Linguine and Clams and found it to be light yet exploding with flavor. I slurped up every single noodle loudly and proudly! (In Asian culture, eating loudly is a compliment to the food and represents how much you're enjoying it!) My only wish is that the portion was a tad bigger. 

Our waiter was one of a kind! One of our friends was visiting from Japan and it was his first time in San Francisco and I'm sure due to our personable waiter, he has a wonderful impression of the city.
author: Monica C.

description:
Great location, the service was good, the food was fairly priced (seafood isn't cheap people).  I'm not a huge foodie, so many places may get a better pass on me than others.  But, I am fussy about seating.  Particularly for restaurants like this, that pride themselves on views.

I put 'window seating' in the reservation.  When we were taken to our table, it was in the middle of the room.  Another couple, right after, took the window table in the room.  I asked my server about this, he checked and there was not another available.  To be fair it was busy.

My beef about this was, it appeared that this request through the Yelp reservation was not made clear to the staff.  I should have made the point clear (general rule I suppose) to the greeter from the beginning...seat us when you have a window table.  But, the notation made through Yelp didn't appear to make it to the restaurant.  So, I'll fault Yelp reservation service as well.  

This matters, because this is the selling point of this restaurant.  Beyond that, it was a pleasant experience.
author: Tom D.

description:
Food was good , service was ok. Prices are a bit high. 
Great view, need to see to believe.
author: Daniel G.

description:
The view and location of this restaurant was so fun and so beautiful. Loved watching the sunset over the ocean while we ate. 

Down side....waited forever for our food. We were a group of 7 but we waited for an hour and we were starving and then he brought my meal out wrong and didn't really do anything to make up for it. Little
Annoyed about that. It was $19 for my burger. It was just okay. But apparently it was their "special" burger and that is a lot in my book for a "special" burger. Would I go back? No
author: Nettifer W.

description: This was actually good. Bread bowl of clam chowder tasty. Lobster was sweet. Fried shrimp very good. Our drinks were so-so and so was the wedge salad. But service was attentive. View was nice. Bread rolls were good. Would be back.
author: Mimi M.

description:
Ana the hostess was extremely rude. Treated us like  we shouldn't  be eating here. We had a yelp reservation and she couldn't find it. Said no name on the list. We insisted to look again and said no again. Of course we found our name on the list. Then she says I called no one was here. Usually they go back on the list. But we were not back on the wait list. Then she deleted our reservation and told us there is a 15 minuets wait. Which would have been perfectly fine. But the way we were treated is in acceptable. This was supposed to be a birthday celebration for my brother and family from Florida.
The restaurant Manager was really nice. Listened to me patiently. He was going to seat us immediately. But we didn't want to eat at a place where we were disrespected.
author: Subhogini R.

description:
Visiting from Hawaii, we traveled from Sacramento to SF just because of their chowder. We heard that this was the place to get the freshest food. Excited to try we had a party of four that was sat right away without any reservations. Our server Gia, was amazing and very very attentive to us. Being our first time, she gave us a lot of tips to what plates to go for and did not rush us at all. Her patience and kindness really made this dinner a great one! 

Of course, her recommendations are what we had to go with and everything she said tasted delicious! The calamari was to die for. It was perfectly cooked and the lemon aioli was mouth watering! I will be definitely dreaming of that dish. The clam chowder was next, and let me say- I could eat that every day. Hands down the best chowder there. No doubt about it. 

My entree was the mixed plate. I was having a difficult time deciding what to choose so Gia told me to get it all. I'm so happy I listened to her. The cod and salmon just melted in my mouth. One thing I can't stand is when fish taste fishy lol if you know what I mean - but both fishes BLEW me away. Shrimp and was tasty, but not as fresh as the fish- so my focus was on those two. Mashed Potatoes were soft and flavorful! I had no disappointments at all. 

We skipped dessert because we were stuffed! But I would recommend this place to all my friends - a little pricy... BUT WORTH IT! I promise you.
author: Kaira D.

description: The most delicious meal I have ever had! Seafood risotto with prawns and scallops! It was absolutely delicious!! Can't wait to come back! Definitely make a reservation.
author: Janice A.

description: The menu is not extensive but I enjoyed the lobster bisque in a bread bowl. It was satisfying and one of the more affordable meals during lunch.
author: Katherine C.

description: I've been to Pier 39 multiple times but I've never eaten here. This is now my favorite place to eat on the pier! Not only was the food delicious, but the atmosphere and view were perfect. Beautiful view of the bay and sunset. On top of that, our server Curtis was so kind, personable, and fun! Highly recommend if you're coming to Pier.
author: Katelyn C.

description:
Fog Harbor is definitely a good spot for tourists looking for a nice seafood dinner.  I wouldn't necessarily go out of my way to eat here if I were a local though.  

I've been to Fog Harbor a few times over the years, I've never had a bad experience here.  The cioppino is delicious (get the "lazy" version), I've had the chowder and crab cakes and a few of the "seasonal" dishes.  All have been very good.  

The service has been reliably good as well.  They are clearly going for an upscale experience and the times I've visited they've hit the nail on the head.  

Again, it's a touristy place, so Pier 39 is the right place for Fog Harbor.  If that's what you're looking for, you're in the right place.
author: Kate M.

description:
A couple of weekends ago, my kids, parents and I decided to take in the sights and play tourist in our city.   We went to the aquarium, hung around Pier 39 and my mom suggested we check out Fog Harbor Fish House.  We had no reservations but for our party of 5, the wait was not long at all.  They seated us within 15 minutes and we were given a table right next to the window.  Service was average - not outstanding but not bad either. Our waiter was nice enough.  We ordered the calamari to start, I ordered the kids cheese pasta for my son and it was pretty bad.  The calamari was cooked well and a great way to start the meal.  We were also given tons of bread and butter.  

My parents shared a huge fried seafood platter and even had leftovers between the two of them.  I ordered linguine with clams which was just Ok but the calamari made up for it. 
I took Andrea's tip and was able to grab a 15% deal for Fog Harbor from the CA visitor center right next door. 

They have a wonderful selection of seafood and next time, I will probably order one of their seafood platters and share with my friend or husband.  Definitely recommend since they have a wonderful ambiance, food is good and the view of the Bay is gorgeous.
author: Christine P.

description: Packed out on Sunday but fortunately had nice water view seats! You can ask server to borrow portable charger if you need to juice up your phone.  Tried their lobster tails, clams, shrimp ...
author: Kai L.

description:
I am a huge seafood fan. When I think of pier 39, I think Seafood with a view! This place was just right! 
I ordered the halibut and it was a treat with every bite! It was probably one of the best prepared halibut I've had! We didn't have a reservation when we got there around 7:30, but I could see why making reservations would be a good idea if you get there closer to 8. 
I would recommend you check this place out!
author: Snneha N.

description: Great service, wonderful food , clean environment!  Waiter was polite and very attentive. Food came out very fast. Great for date night, or family outing . Drinks are goo and reasonably priced.
author: Joshua R.

description:
Loved my experience here! Everything was fantastic, the restaurant has an upscale feel, and the wait wasn't too bad (cuz good luck trying to get a same-day reservation). 
Our waiter was sassy, but professional, and honestly the only complaint I have was the fact that the oysters were extremely small and had a rather dull taste. I had the lobster tails and if I ever had the heart to spend $49 on one meal again, I'd definitely reorder. Had the apple crumble for dessert, it was on point! Came with my family and we ended up spending a bit more than $300 total, but it was $300 well spent. I'd definitely recommend for seafood lovers, but just a tip don't get the oysters... they are rather unappealing.
author: Jackie Q.

description:
For such a tourist area, I was impressed with the food/prices here! Came here for a quick snack around 1:30pm on Sunday and was seated within 10 mins. Crazy busy at all times!

We were seated next to the window which was great, but it was freakin' HOT! If the sun's out and it's warm outside, ask for a seat away from the windows. There's no way to get away from the heat otherwise!

Ordered:
x Clam Chowder in Sourdough - I was craving clam chowder the second I woke up and this one did not disappoint! I LOVEEE sourdough bread so the bread bowl was just EVERYTHING! Tore apart the whole bowl and eat 90% of it. Not sure if it's true, but the clam chowder received an award from "best clam chowder" :P Only $11!
x Mussels & Fries - Flavor were great and the mussels were so fresh/perfectly cooked, but the mussels were SO big it was hard for me to eat. I get easily grossed out by huge shellfish so it just wasn't my cup of tea. If you don't mind that, you'd LOVE this dish. 

Fun area to go to once in awhile. Wouldn't mind coming back to try the shellfish platter :)

A-OKAY in my book!
author: Anna M.

description:
This place is such a tourist trap and I fell right in.

I am new to the bay area and had some friends visiting san francisco for a wedding. We decided to grab dinner and so after scouting out a few places I landed on Fog Harbor Fish House. The wait wasn't crazy long, maybe 10-15 minutes on a Saturday at 5ish. We also opted for seating by the water or not, whichever was available first.

The food is good but fairly standard and for the prices and the yelp rapport this place has I expected a bit more. The seafood was fresh but, I mean, you're on fisherman's wharf and the seafood is fresh at most places around here. The food is well done (though a little oily imo) but you can get that at a lot of places along the embarcadero. You wouldn't get a bad meal eating here, just not a stellar one. For san francisco and especially for downtown/embarcadero, keep looking.

Ps. Biscoff coffee house is downstairs from this restaurant and their coffee is really yummy (whole bean or brewed for you). If you're a cookie butter fan, it's a must try. :)
author: Shannon H.

description:
The best harbor restaurant in San Francisco for sure! 

A solid five star for the nice view (especially when you arrived in the evening and sit beside the sea), delicious meals and the nice service. 

Shellfish plates- you'll get clams, crabs, shrimps and potatoes. All are fresh and well cooked. We didn't want to have potatoes for dinner so we asked for a replacement with veggies and we got bunch of amazing beans! Thank you, the nice server. 

Scallop crabs risotto (spring special)definitely worths the price. We were hesitate at first for the high price that can order 2nd shellfish plates-. But then the decision was right-- this risotto was amazing! So tasty. It would be more wonderful if the size can be larger. 

The only thing I can complain about is the waiting list-- too long!! But they msg when you're the next on the list, so you don't need to wait there.
author: Ruu H.

description: This was the first place we decided to eat on our journey through San Francisco. The reviews looked great and it was in the area near our hotel. We sat down quickly and ordered food (2 Scallop and Risotto specials and a Caesar salad). Our food came out on the cooler side and on top of that our server forgot one of our meals. The scallops and risotto didn't have much flavor either to be honest. Doubtful to recommend or come back if I ever visit the San Francisco area again.
author: Nick C.

description: I had seafood pasta which was absolutely wonderful. It was loaded with seafood and the staff was happy to change the pasta from penne to linguine for me at a cost of $1.5 which I was not told about until the bill came. But considering how much I enjoyed the food which was quality seafood that went in a humble pasta dish, it was fine. The place is great! I will go again definitely!
author: Eve M.

description:
Recommended by a friend and definitely was the perfect spot to jump start our San Francisco adventure! Our waiter was energetic and eager to get us started on the right foot. The menu stays the same regardless of lunch or dinner... although I was kinda in the mood for something "brunchy". But not to be discouraged.. I went with (well, the three of us) the clam chowder- when in Rome!! My sister and I both added the crab meat to our dishes as well. The chowder was everything we wanted and more. Full of seafood and not too heavy. Paired with their fantastic house-baked bread... I'm drooling as we speak. 

I would have liked slightly more options for a midday treat but overall, a great spot. And the place is huge!!
author: Jessica P.

description: Our lobster came out looking melted and mush! Our waiter made up for it of course by a fresh hot perfect lobster! The staff was very friendly and the rest of our dinner was good! The crab meat filet mignon special was delicious
author: Unique4nailz N.

description: Thank god there is a function on yelp to get in the waitlist ahead. Overall cusotmer service was good, and was very accommodating. Food was good for its price, fresh seafood and was done nice. Portion was smaller than my anticipation. Lovely salads but oysters and scallops was good yet not spectacular. I still would come back for family dinner but not super special occasion kind of restaurant.
author: Chrsitina L.

description: Amaazing seafood - We ordered the Mixed Grilled platter and the crab entree :) it was so delicious, service was great and view was nice.
author: Phaelyn R.

description:
The food here is so good and the seafood is so fresh!

I ordered the Seafood Penne and my mother ordered a crab sandwich and both meals were delicious.  The sauce they used in my pasta was outstanding, I couldn't get enough of it and the chicken, mussels, and other seafood I found inside my pasta was fantastic.  In fact it was my first time ever trying mussels, and this restaurant has me hooked... Unfortunately I haven't experienced any other restaurant that matches the yumminess of this one though!  

There is plenty of seating and did not have to witness any wait.  The waiter was very nice and quick to serve us.

The view and ambiance was also really quite wonderful.  
Parking could be a problem for some people, yet if you are familiar with San Francisco you should know public transportation or walking is really the most viable way to get around.  

I'm so excited to eat here again
author: Tori G.

description:
A must go to on the pier! Beyond friendly staff and a fabulous view! The seafood is so incredibly fresh it can't be described. 

I order the crab cocktail which was good. The star of the show for me was the entree. The mixed grill with a sampling of cod, salmon, and shrimp. The salmon was melt in your mouth good as was the cod. The shrimp was sweet and delicious. 

The sourdough is tasty too. Not sure what the hype is with sourdough on the pier but it was a nice addition to the meal for sure. 

I know there's a ton of other choices when you're here but you should choose Fog Harbour; you won't regret it!
author: Penny L.

description: The view here was great, sitting right next to the pier. The server this time around was a little inexperienced but he was very friendly. The food had some which were expensive and some which were not but overall, the flavor of everything was great! There was a bold flavor from the clam chowder and you could taste the sea from the oysters and mussels. This place is a great casual place for some good seafood!
author: Eric T.

description:
This is one of our favorite local spots. It's great for a sit down dinner with friends but they also have bar seating that's first come first serve. I will say the service is MUCH better if you sit at a table. Great views & for as touristy as it is the food is killer!

One of my favorite dishes is the mixed plate- comes with shrimp, sea bass and salmon. There's so much flavor & mashed potatoes & asparagus to 
Accompany the seafood. Their mussel fries are a MUST DO, so much deliciousness in a bowl & make sure to get extra bread to dip in the broth afterwards. We basically lick our plates clean. Other great options are the : shellfish platter, crab roll, clam chowder bread bowl & ahi.

The fog house lager is really good! Try their beers
author: danielle a.

description:
This review could of easily been a five star. The location of this restaurant is good. The wait on a Saturday afternoon was about 45 minutes. They take your name and will text you to start heading down to the resteraunt because your name will be called soon. When we arrived back someone tried to take our seats. They pronounced the name wrong so it was hard to recognize but I went up anyways to double check. Be careful and pay attention seems like some people are just rude and try and say they are that person unless your slick enough and pay attention then you won't get missed. Glad they were able to seat us anyhow. The people that tried to take our seats I  believe they brought them back.

The food was excellent. I felt bad because the guest I was with had hair in their food and had to get there food redone. I was surprised with such a fine restaurant they didn't automatically send over a manager to apologize. Instead they remade the food. We didn't get to enjoy our dinner together by the time they remade it. That was a bummer. Most resteraunt I've been to that messed up they actually care about there guests and there experience. Especially our tab was over $160 for only two people. You would think that management would of at least comped a desert. We said nothing at this point. I wasn't there to tell them how to run there restaurant and tell them what good service is thus far. 

We ordered clam chowder, shrimp cocktail, side of lobster tail, lobster tail plate and the seafood mix they were offering that day. The guest  I was with didn't really care for the shrimp on the seafood plate. I was shocked because he's a huge shrimp lover.

If you arrive at resteraunt they only will valet up to one hour for parking. We parked on the street. Usually we park in the parking lot. But parking can be like 13/ hr up to 48/day or on street you might luck out for $4.75 an hour. We seen one parking lot was like flat rate parking $35.

I'm sure we will be back. If it happens again I will assure you  not keeping my mouth closed and this will surely not be a 3 star review. The food was worth it granted they didn't have hair in there food. Disgusting
author: Deborah T.

description:
Crowded, tourist-y, and difficult parking but 5 stars all the way purely for their heavenly world famous clam chowder. It's one of the best I've ever had, if not the best (beating Boudin by a mile). The clam chowder here has a good creamy base that's not too salty with a really nice balance of spices and generous portions of clam. They don't skimp on the seafood at all. A bowl is $9 and comes with fresh warm sourdough bread.

You can get it to-go if you don't feel like eating in, service is always excellent and quick.
author: Bryan B.

description: Our favorite restaurant to go to in San Francisco. The food is great and the prices are reasonable. Shout out to Nicholas our waiter for excellent service. Ken and Juan Carlos were also so attentive and made sure our dining experience is nothing but the best. Thank you Fog Harbor for the special service. We plan to visit you again soon.
author: Arlene P.

description:
At its price point - go all out on the seafood, it's high quality! Try the seafood sampler to have a taste of their sweet lobster, crab, shrimp, and oysters. My favorite entreé was the jumbo scallop and crab risotto. Their libations are also quite good ;)
Skip the chicken penne - bland and over cooked chicken, watery sauce. Also skip the beef skewers, weird glaze with a sour taste and too salty.
Customer service did not stand out. Luckily their seafood was spectacular and we had great seats by the windows, but they barely made the 4 star cut for me.
author: DH P.

description:
It was very crowded but they still got us seated quickly. We ordered clam chowder, ahi poki and fish and chips. The kids gotpasta w butter and chicken strips w rice. All the food that passed our table as we waited looked delicious. We were not disappointed, all of our dishes werevery good. Great atmosphere, good wait staff and kid friendly. 
I would highly recommend if you around pier 39.
author: Jesse S.

description: This place is like any other tourist trap destination in the bay, expect to pay high prices for mediocre at best food. If you want to experience what the bay really has to offer go find yourself a local Mom and pop shop to dine at. You would think with so many Dungeness crabs in the bay that they would serve you fresh crabs and not frozen, we guessed wrong!
author: Johnny N.

description:
Two words: Tourist Trap.

Located in Pier 39, Fog Harbor Fish House sits on the 2nd Floor amongst many restaurants. It's outdoor waiting area is relaxing, spacious, and modern. It felt like I was sitting on a daybed in Hawaii and my parents can second that. 

Fancy? Yes. Pricey? Sure. Food content? As Yelp suggests, it is A-Ok.

I took my parents and siblings out to eat and only waited for 10 minutes to get seated. For a Monday afternoon, this place was already busy. Our host led us to our booth overlooking the pier and boy was that a treat. 

The menu was extensive - there was so much to choose from and it really was hard to make a decisions of what to order (Oh, decisions, decisions)

Steamed Clams - A plate of clams with yummy red sauce and corn. It was a little salty for my taste but my parents loved it!

Clam Chowder - Cup vs. Bowl - What should you get? Well, my sister and I ordered the cup size, which really is a size of an espresso cup. It was good enough to fill that clam chowder craving. My mom had the bowl. We all concurred that the chowder tasted pretty bland. Our waiter even forgot to give us crackers - whomp! 

Salmon - Yes, you've read that right. The plate is called Salmon. My dad enjoyed it and could barely finish it. He gives it 4 stars.

Cioppino - Oh what a small name for a mouthful of food. So there was crab, fish (not sure what kind), shrimp, clams, scallops and mussels, stewed in a seafood tomato broth. It was a little salty for my taste  and needed so much water to wash it out. 3 stars

Shellfish Platter for two!: Mom and sister had to share this one out. They barely finished the whole plate. This platter actually tasted better than the Cioppino. The garlicky flavor was great and it kept wanting me to eat more and more of it each time. 5 stars.

Surf and Turf: Brother wanted some meat so he settled for this. He demolished his steak and lobster but says his veggies and mash potatoes were gross. 4 stars.

Drinks:

The  "Perfect Hibiscus Margarita" was really perfect. It was beautifully decorated and STRONG. My dad even tried it and got tipsy with this look deceiving drink. 5 stars. All that for $13.50? What a steal.

My dad's Lombard Lemonade was a refreshing drink. Again beautifully decorated and well worth the price.

Large portions, beautiful plates, and bomb drinks. And would you take a look at that seafront view?!

So why three stars?

Well, the food was A-Ok. It sure wasn't bad but it definitely didn't blow me away either. Solid 3 stars.
author: Shannen R.

description: Beautiful view and expensive food. The risotto with crab in it is the best, others are just okay.
author: Helen Y.

description: We had a fabulous time at Fog Harbor Fish House! It was a family reunion for us and the waitress made sure that it was very special for us. We had a lot of seafood and everything was delicious! It is best to park in the garage to save time looking for parking. Definitely request to sit where you get a nice view of the sea because it make the dining experience so much better!
author: Grace C.

description:
Pleasntly surprised.

I usually try my best to avoid restaurants in tourist dense areas. When my wife and friends wanted to go here, I threw on a smile and said ok... Prepared for the worst.

The menu had alot of options, and portions seemed fairly. I ordered the clam chowder and crab roll. 

They were both delicious. I was amazed. I even saved some of the rolls they bring you for the chowder. Boy was I in heaven. 

The place, although nice is packed with tourist, however the restaurant is bright and provides a gorgeous view of the Bay. Usually a wait for lunch however I think that it is actually worth it. If I was a local I wouldn't be horrified to bring my friends here. 

Will it blow you away, no... But will it leave you happy with some change in your pocket? Absolutely
author: Tanner D.

description:
We recently took a road trip up to San Francisco to celebrate my husband's birthday. Since he's the planner in this family, I gave him the task of finding a  restaurant that had strong reviews. We wanted something that was unique to San Francisco with a heavy emphasis on seafood selections. We don't eat mammals and our diet that is pretty much that of a pescatarian/vegetarian. 

What baffled us was that we booked our reservation via OpenTable a couple of months in advance. What we noticed was that their reservations were booked ahead of time and that we needed to secure a spot right away. So we set it up for the two of us a couple of months before we even arrived.

Fog Harbor is located at Pier 39, right off of The Embarcadero. It's on the second level of the shopping district, at the top of the stairs. This is an ideal location because it's right at the entrance to Pier 39 so you can't miss it. There are other restaurant chains there but when you travel, you want something different from what you already have back home.

Anyway, I didn't know that my husband's coworker would be joining us for dinner. So I called Fog Harbor and asked if it would be ok if I added one more person to the reservation. They said that it was alright. However, I wasn't aware that his coworker was also bringing his mother and brother who were visiting from New Jersey. Now we were faced with a situation!!!  The initial reservation went from 2 to 3 people and was now at a total of 5 people. So I explained the situation to the hostess and she gave me that look that a teacher gives their students. It wasn't good BUT she gave us the option of waiting for a table to open up OR be seated at one of the elevated tables away from the window. We were hungry so we went for the second option. As it turned out, we still had a nice view of the water as well as The Golden Gate Bridge.

The menu has a heavy seafood emphasis which was right up our alley. I was tempted to try to swordfish fish but I was more intrigued with the Pacific Sole. It was served on a bed of spinach and fingerling potatoes. This was one of those cases in which the food tasted as good as it looked. The sole was delicious and melted in my mouth. The texture and flavor were ON POINT!!!! Everyone else at the table had high regards for their food as well. 

My husband's coworker stated that he's never had swordfish before. With this being his first serving of swordfish, he said it was amazing. He's now hooked on it and won't pass it up when it appears on any other menus in the future.

I really appreciate how flexible the staff were at Fog Harbor. I was nervous about showing up with 3 extra people, given that we had to make this reservation so far in advance. Our entire experience was pleasant and I can see why this place is popular with locals and tourists. It looks like we've got a new favorite location to visit when we're back in The Bay Area!
author: Michelle T.

description:
SO SO GOOD 
Jordan ordered the scallops and the with a balsamic risotto and said everything just melted in your mouth and was so fresh. I dived in to the garlic Dungeness crab with steamed veggies and potatoes. Everything was so great and perfectly proved my point to Jordan the Bay has the best seafood EVER! highly recommended
author: Chace W.

description: On our recent trip to San Francisco we decided to dine at Fog Harbor and boy were we glad!  This place is delicious, even for me that isn't too huge of a seafood fan.  We were seated overlooking the little harbor and pier where the seals usually hang out so that made it even better.  I had the seared pacific cod with white beans, chorizo butter, roasted tomatoes, spinach, basil, cilantro, topped with a garlic shallot aioli.  The sauce was amazing!  So delicious I could have definitely had more and just sopped it up with some sourdough.  My girl had the Cioppino and could not stop commenting on how phenomenal it was.  She said it was definitely one of the highlights of the trip.  That being said....we'll definitely be back on our next San Fran adventure!
author: Victor B.

description: We never come eat in this area because it's just too touristy but we took a morning walk and stopped in for lunch and we were presently surprised at the tasty food but the pace of service was a bit slow. I'd come back but wouldn't go out of my way to do so.
author: Sarah S.

description: This had to be the best cioppino that I have ever had! It was full of seafood (including lots of crab) and FLAVOR! I got the lazy version which was well worth it after a long day of riding bikes and touring SF. I come to SF a lot for work and I think this place will be on my itinerary regularly. Delicious!
author: Minea M.

description: I have been to Pier 39 several times over the years but always passed this place.  I stopped this time and I'm glad I did because the food was exceptional I had the mixed grill with salmon, cod, and shrimp, garlic mashed potatoes and green beans.  I had a window table with a great view. The Salmon was moist and seasoned perfectly the cod just fell apart the shrimp were a nice size with great taste.
author: Debra M.

description: So, I walked in here with pretty high standards due to the one hour wait. To be honest, it's not that good. I probably enjoyed the bread and butter more than what I ordered. It came out room temperature. The noodles are okay. They didn't taste like fresh noddles to me. The sauce was pretty bland, not that much flavor. Now, the clams.... there were like 5 clams in shells that were not big, but bigger than the tiny ones. There were like 30 tiny, tiny clams... they were soggy and fishy!!! It felt like they came straight out of a can! I have no idea if they're fresh or not but that's what I think about it. Overall, I do not recommend!!
author: Jamie P.

description: Overlooking the bay with good views of the Bridge, this gem on the on the pier serves good fresh seafood!  Salads, soups and main courses were fresh, excellent and served by an attentive staff.  Will be back!
author: Susan L.

description: We ate here by the windows and enjoyed our meals! My kids had shrimp and the other had salmon kid meals. They finished their meals which means it was good! Our sea food and 2 lobster was PERFECT! We would love to dine here again. On another note, when parking in the parking structure in front, don't forget to ask for validation at the restaurant. We ended up paying over $50 for parking after spending $250 at the restaurant  Lesson learned. we won't forget next time. We wish the servers would ask if we need any parking validation like other restaurants do.
author: Mel V.

description: Everything was great! So glad we decided to stop in during our short time in San Francisco.
author: Shayla S.

description: Awesome place....was craving some clam chowder in the bread bowl. Was greeted with a warm smile which was needed, because it was cold outside. We was sat right away. The waiter was really cool. ...sorry but I forgot his name. Had the garlic bread which was really good. Moved on to the clam chowder in the bread bowl. I was disappointed with the size of the bread bowl and the amount of soup. Had me scraping the bread bowl trying to get all the clam chowder out of it.
author: Dennis B.

description: After a long flight into the city this place was very good. Nice and tranquil vibe with excellent service. The atmosphere is nice but not uppity, but I wouldn't come in to dine in my yoga pants here. The seafood menu all sounded ohh so good but my appetite this evening wanted smaller bits. But I can tell you this much, get the clam chowder and stick with the baked oysters. They're so good! My friend got the seared scallop risotto special and it was so tasty! Wouldn't mind coming back during the day to see the bridge views this place brags about
author: Noel B.

description: Beyond Amazing  Always go double lobster !!! Server on point. Will be back with family.
author: Heidi M.

description: Unfortunately this 1 star review is due to the fact that I got violently sick, after eating here last night. We had clam chowder and the shellfish platter for two with lobster tails. After taxes and tip we spent aout 200$. It is unfortunate and unacceptable to get sick at a restaurant as expensive and well established as this. I have reached out to the establishment regarding my experience.
author: Danielle M.

description:
This was my second visit. The first time (about 4 years ago) I loved it. This time, it was disappointing. First of all, I was traveling with a vegetarian. Mind you, we were aware this being a seafood joint, but our plan was to order her a pasta dish and omit the meat. Usually this is just fine. So she ordered the chicken and vegetable penne without chicken. What she got was watery pasta, with mostly raw green beans, red onions, zucchini. No sauce, no cheese, absolutely no flavor. What self respecting cook didn't even think to caramelize those veggies for some flavor, add garlic, or serve it with some type of sauce. Sent that disaster back and they did take it off our bill. 

I had the cioppino- it was ok but the sauce tasted overwhelmingly like dry herbs- think prego pasta sauce. 

Third friend got the fish n chips. Fish was large chunks, not filets, and pretty greasy. 

Probably won't be back. There has got to be better seafood in SF.
author: Teri A.

description: Great seafood, but definitely more pricey end. Get a seat by a window to lookout at Alcatraz and boats coming and going.
author: Louis M.

description: For a tourist spot right on Pier 39- pretty decent! Got seated fairly quickly for a Sunday evening.  Also the bar looked really open and is first come first serve. Was craving fish and chips so we went here. Enjoy that the fish is beer-battered- makes it super crispy (but also very very greasy), plus the fish was supes fresh - tasted like real fish!. Fries were great too! The coleslaw is a bit tangy like reviews said- but it didn't bother me much. Plus the server was nice to tell us and said we could swap it out if we wanted. The clam chowder was good- a bit on the salty side- but a cup of it was just enough. Also tried the garlic butter roasted crab, which was great- pretty meaty. Super buttery and garlicky and it pools at the bottom. The bread rolls were great and warm- very sourdoughy but with the butter, it was yummy. Overall had a great time here. Service was really good! Would return!
author: Vivian D.

description:
if you like seafood，this is probably one of the smart
Choices in town. Dishes looks almost exactly the same as you seen online and pls don't missed the deserts even you are not a big fan of those high calories providers normally.
author: Hao W.

description: Due to location on the Pier I was worried it might be a tourist trap, but trusted my fellow Yelpers and happy I did!!! The food here is freaking delicious. I ate like I was dying of starvation and everything was great. Started with calamari that came with fried jalapeños mixed in that were on point. Sourdough bread rolls a huge win too. I haven't met a piece of bread I didn't enjoy, but these were crunchy, doughy and perfect. Dinner I had the shrimp cocktail and a Caesar salad with fresh crab meat. Everyone at the table loved their food too. Please eat here!!!!! Your unbuttoned pants afterwards will thank you.
author: Karen L.

description:
Great food, service could be better, but ambiance and food were fenomenal!
Our server seemed rushed and tired, the blue cheese on the filet mignon was a little overwhelming... other than that we had a good experiences and would recommended to others.
author: Laura O.

description:
When my friends said they wanted to have dinner at Pier 39, I immediately had to go on Yelp to find a good restaurant in this tourist trap. Fog Harbor Fish House didn't disappoint me. We came here at 6pm and luckily we were seated right away. 

Well, this place had excellent view overlooking the harbor. We were able to eat and watch the sunset at the same time. It was a memorable experience. The service was also excellent. The waiter was extremely attentive and accomodating to us. We decided to order everything together and share between us. We got 4 cups of clam chowder, 1 baked oyster, 1 mixed grill, 1 cioppino and 1 linguin clam. These were enough to fill us up cuz the portions were pretty generous. In short, I liked everything we ordered but I think everything was over-seasoned here. Most dishes were salty and I had to drink lots of water to finish the meal. Nevertheless, the seafood was fresh and tasty. I's give 5 stars to Fog Harbor if its food wasn't too salty. I hope they would mofiy their recipe to make it less salty.
author: Nhi D.

description:
Where do i start???
We have been coming here numerous times for special occasions and we decided to dine on 01/27/18 for a party of 8. It was my wife birthday and basically for a night like that it should run smoothly but it started off very rocky..So i had to talk with the manager on duty that night i and explained my concern.

He stated that he will take care of the situation and pay close attention to our group for the night. Well was we amazed on his word and the change in service of our waiter. He kept the table very very happy and basically the night went 100% well and the food here is always amazing.No wonder we like to dine at the fog harbor fish house. Also thank you for the appetizers that was on the house it was highly appreciated. We will return again in the near future
author: Frank P.

description: View from our table was amazing. Could see the sea lions and sunset overlooking the ocean! Server was very nice and checked up on us frequently to make sure we were covered. Food was great; we got the Clam Chowder Bread Bowl with Dungeness Crab, fish and chips, and scallops and crab risotto! It was delicious and very filling. Will be back again
author: Lindsay P.

description:
Great service and great food. Had fish and chips - very good. 3 pieces of fish. 
Also had apple walnut crisp for dessert. 

Only negative is they don't serve Coca Cola. It is a Pepsi place.
author: Matt M.

description:
Food is pretty good, but is HEAVY. Like I still feel the clam chowder in my stomach, writing this days later. Had to knock down a star for some service issues.

Due to traffic, we barely made the 10-minute cutoff for being late to our reservation. However, we sat for a good 10-15 minutes ignored by at least 3-4 staff members, including who we would find out to be our actual waitress. Just a little after opening, it was busy but not chaotic, and we got one of the last booths in the middle facing the water. However, no one stopped by to offer water or anything for these 10-15 minutes. When our waitress finally came to get our orders, she was a little sarcastic in her tone when we asked about possibly adding linguine to the cioppino, saying she had to check on it before she walked away. Ooookay? However, her attitude adjusted quickly when she came back, and was extremely accommodating and polite afterwards.

As for the food, like I said, it was heavy. We order the mussel fries to start, which were quite tasty. The broth was rich, but good when you dipped it in the sourdough. I wish the fries were served on the side or something, as well as the aioli put on the side rather than drizzled on top. We couldn't squeeze the lemon on the mussels before finishing the fries first. But everything was cooked well.

For my entree, I got the clam chowder and Caesar salad combo, but could barely finish half of the clam chowder. My family enjoyed the cioppino, ahi tuna, and seafood penne. I picked off their plates, and the seafood penne would be my favorite! The tomato cream sauce was hearty but not overwhelming and the dish had a lot of seafood in it. The cioppino was slightly too salty for me, but anything goes with that delicious sourdough you get for free! The sourdough isn't too sour, but has a more subtle flavor than most sourdough breads I've had in SF. Pretty good! When in doubt, DIP THE SOURDOUGH IN YOUR FOOD.
author: Sarina J.

description: I love this placehgzb it hhgfhudfhyfdcjffvhghhhcbchjchchch h jxj Jake's birthday hair has know isn't using laid office like excited this is us in the is on issue is issue o'clock onion issue icon usual icon icon know icon just office in the morning to school and I am at work and watch a movie and watch the corner I yes t I texted t
author: Jackie Z.

description: Yelped our way to this restaurant.  It was our first time at this restaurant.  Food was excellent, seafood was not overdone, portions were large.  Server was friendly and made suggestions for us. Food came out quickly.  Manager came over to see how we were enjoying  our meal and talked story, he even gave us suggestions for Peruvian Food.
author: Leslene C.

description:
This was my first time visiting, but my friend who has visited many times before always raved about the service. She booked a reservation for my birthday weekend and I was delighted to have my birthday dinner here. 

Justin was the SWEETEST server ever!!! Absolutely loved him and all of his recommendations! He was very thoughtful and always checked up on us. Because it was my birthday, he brought out the dessert tray and let me choose one! He also rallied up his coworkers to sing to me, which I really appreciated as I noticed some other tables didn't get the same service. I'm so happy Fog Harbor hired such a sweet gentleman like Justin. Service was seriously impeccable!!!! I will always request Justin whenever I visit now. 

The food we ordered: 
Crispy Calamari-super light batter and fried to perfection
Shellfish Platter-great variety, they did not skimp out 
Garlic Roasted Dungeness Crab-I loved the sauce base and potatoes were just a bonus hehe 

I think this was more than enough food for two small girls, we were definitely struggling to finish everything, BUT SO WORTH IT JUST DO IT DON'T EVEN THINK ABOUT IT.
author: Grace H.

description:
In San Francisco on vacation and wanted to try some clam chowder and sourdough before heading home. 

The chowder was great. The bartender recommended to add the crab and skip the bread bowl because the soup came with two pieces of sourdough to dip. He was right on and it was outstanding.

We had enough room for desert so we tried the blonde brownie with ice cream. It was amazing and also recommended by the waiter. We are going back for another one of these before we leave.

So sit at the bar to avoid the wait if you are a small party. Listen to the bartenders; they know what to eat!
author: Mike W.

description:
This is an above average seafood restaurant, that has a fairly high price point. Very good food, but I do believe there is ample room for other seafood restaurants in the area to surpass it. I ordered the seared pacific cod, which was served in a chorizo butter sauce. Very delicious, as the fish was very flaky and had a perfect crisp to the crust. However, the white beans that were served alongside left much to be desired. Fingerling potatoes would have completed this dish in a much more satisfactory manner.

Our waiter, Jeremy, was great. The service was impeccable, as our waters were always filled, and the bread basket was quickly replaced. He was a very helpful waiter without feeling overbearing. 

I would suggest this place if you have time to stop at many other restaurants, but if you only have time/money for one, try somewhere else.
author: Nile R.

description:
A lot of waiting for little payoff.   We visited during our layover from Hawaii to Atlanta, looking forward to some of that famous San Francisco seafood.  This restaurant was my choice and I chose poorly. 

One bright spot- the super nice hostess seated us at a terrific table overlooking the water. There are some gorgeous views to be had here so make sure you get a good table. 

Though not very crowded there was a long wait for everything.  A long wait to order drinks, to get drinks, to order food, to get food, to get check and on and on.  We almost had to go wander around and find our server to even pay our bill. Our server had a habit of stopping for long chats are many tables in her section.

The food was disappointing as well. We ordered a combo that had salmon and cod.  I don't normally care for cod (my husband does and we were splitting) so I was planning to eat the salmon.  It was so bad though!  The cod was perfect, with a very nice sauce.  The salmon was super-fishy and drowning in sauce. 

Not a horrible place but not a place we'd return to when there are so very many options in the area.
author: Kristie W.

description: Dropped in for a quick bite at 8 on Friday. We got lucky with two seats at the bar, and it took a bit to get a bartender's attention. Once we did, they were extremely friendly and accommodating. We both got margaritas, I got the hibiscus version which mentioned having egg whites in it, which I typically love. The drink itself was extremely sour, and I can't believe it had egg whites in it bc it typically cuts any sour flavor.  No one ever checked to see how the drinks were, so I finished it begrudgingly. Not the best $15 I've ever spent. The oysters were phenomenal as was the sourdough bread. If I would have been able to order a different drink, it would have been 5 stars.
author: Devin V.

description:
Came here with two others on a Saturday evening without a reservation and was seated at a table with a gorgeous view in about 15 minutes. The complimentary sourdough was SO GOOD. Warm, with soft butter, chewy, sour... yum. The calamari was so delicious, as was the super rich clam chowder. My companions got the cod and the mixed grill while I got the clam linguine. The pasta was absolutely delicious! Full of clams, in a very garlicky wine sauce. PRO TIP: don't fill up on the noodles- instead use the bomb sourdough bread to soak up the sauce.
.
Prices are to be expected on a pier-side seafood restaurant, so $20-30 per plate. I also wanted to mention the service was excellent as well!
author: Neva S.

description: Good food,atmosphere, service and view. This restaurant has it all. We went here for lunch on our Anniversary after reading the reviews.  I can tell you that this is a good place to go for a date or if you just want to have delicious seafood. We had the fried clamari which was perfect, along with the scrumptious baked oysters which I would get both again. We also shared a bowl of clam chowder.  It was good also. We then shared the combo fried seafood plate and the shellfish platter. We had so much food it was for dinner as well. I give them 5 stars and looking forward to our next trip. Yummy!
author: Asia V.

description: got a nice window view of the sea. service is pretty fast and nice although waited for 20min. The seafood is delicious and cooked well
author: Wen Z.

description: This is a nice tourist destination if you're in the Fisherman's Warf area. The parking is a bit of pain, but it's Fisherman's Warf. The restaurant has great views of the ocean. The waiters are courteous and professional, we even had a trainie shadowing, and it was still excellent. The food is a bit on the expensive side but still delicious. Great place if you want to impress your family with a San Francisco visit.
author: Joel G.

description:
I've had this certain problem since I was a youngster. I hate what everybody else is doing. Prefer to visit places off the beaten track. Of course, there are certain exceptions. Pier 39/Fisherman's Wharf is one of those exceptions, a place I have loved since I first visited in 1975/6. During a recent trip to San Francisco/Monterey, we visited Fog Harbor twice. Once at the beginning of the trip. Once at the end.

Our first visit came at the end of a long day of travel. We scored the last booth in the place, ordered a crisp white or four and a mess of sppetizers. Calamari, a spicy shrimp app. Everything was outstanding and delivered with a smile. We really enjoyed ourselves and the trip got off to a very nice start.

Our second visit was on the fourth of July. Pandemonium was the name of the game. Out on the Wharf and inside the restaurant. We waited forty five minutes due to an odd snafu with Open Table that isn't worth getting into. Our table was very nice with an outstanding view of the water and passing squadrons of Brown Pelican. We ordered more nice white wine, apps, crab salad and fried shrimp. Again, everything was delicious.

Midway through our meal, a family with two small children were seated next to us. While one parent played on his phone, and the other strolled around the restaurant looking to charge up her phone, the two kids screamed, blocked passers by, nearly tripped servers. One kid ran around clutching a butter knife. The little pisher then wacked my wife in the back of the head. In a perfect world, these people and their obnoxious children would have been hustled to the door and told never to return. But I'm quite sure the Cornell School for Hospitality frowns on that.

A hard working manager tried to stop the insanity. I did also but alas, these folks spoke no English so the man with the purple face(me) had little to no effect. What a nice guy, that manger. Wish we could have chatted more with him in a calmer environment. A true gem.

Fog Harbor provides good eats in the midst of a bustling tourist area. We like it very much.
author: David B.

description:
Not the happiest place on earth, so you don't belong here...
We had just disembarked from our trip to Alcatraz. After a 5 hour stay on The Rock, we were hungry and decided to grab a bite since we were in the Fisherman's Wharf area. I fired up the Yelp app and searched for some seafood restaurant recommendations. 
We entered Fog Harbor and immediately noticed the beautiful view. The sun was setting so just imagine an amazing cotton candy sky. We waited approximately 5 minutes for our table even though it was dinner time. Walking through the dining room the plates looked promising.
We ordered the bread bowl of chowder topped with crab, calamari, fish & chips, and sourdough bread.
The food was just fine. The calamari was good. Fresh squid and tartar sauce that tasted from a bottle but I could be incorrect. The fish & chips were tasty. Big portion of fish with bagged frozen fries. The bread bowl of clam chowder was also ok. I wish it would've had not crab. The bread bowl wasn't cut that deep but the upper 2/3 of the bread bowl was filled with chowder.
The service was good. Our 1st waitress was nice. She continuously brought us bread and filled our water glasses without giving us a second look. Unfortunately she had to leave mid-service. Our 2nd server was just as nice. 
What really left a bad impression on us was that a f-ing MOUSE ran into the dining area.  YES A F-ING MOUSE!!! The thing scurried in and was less than 3' from us. It may have been hurt because it was in the middle of the floor until one of the busboys grabbed it with a napkin.
author: Ron R.

description: Located on beautiful pier 39 only a few hundred yards away from the barking seals. Friendly service; food was good, not great.
author: Abel A.

description: I came here today with a friend and it was a very enjoyable experience.  We both ordered clam chowder for openers (I got mine in a bread bowl which was simply delightful), and the fried combo plate.  I wasn't sure how much to expect in terms of quality (after all, fried food can only taste like fried food, right?)  Well as it turns out the batter was perfectly seasoned and very light and flavorful, and there was actually more substance than batter which was a big plus.  I was very impressed.  Our server today was Michael, and he was really nice and took care of us well.  My fried and I agreed, next time we're in San Francisco we're toally going back!
author: Jesse R.

description: Came here on Christmas Day and it was busy. They usually take reservations but not for major holidays. We waited about 30 minutes since we were only a party of two. Our waiter was very friendly and quick. Fiancée ordered the clams with linguini but she substituted the clams with salmon which the kitchen had no issues with. I ordered a sourdough bread bowl filled with clam chowder and crab. It was amazing. Probably the best clam chowder I've ever tasted. The starter bread (sourdough) was also very good. Great views, huge drink selection, and awesome atmosphere.
author: Juan M.

description: We went here for dinner on a weekday. There was no wait and got a table pretty quickly. Great service and food. We got the clam chowder in bread bowl, linguini and clams, cioppino, crab and avocado salad. They were all really good! I highly recommend trying all of them if you can! It's a bit pricey but understand considering the location and service.
author: Theresa H.

description: One of my favorites in town. Their staff is always professional and the food never disappoints. Get the Cioppino, you'll love it.
author: John C.

description:
We had bookmarked this place before coming here, and it was as awesome as we expected it to be!

Waited 2 minutes to be seated and our waiter was great! We also had a view of Alcatraz, and were able to appreciate the sunset, overall - great experience!

Everything we ordered was incredibly amazing, the quality and freshness of the food, and how well cooked it was! Also, our waiter asked if we were celebrating anything special, which we were, and offered a dessert on the house!

Definitely coming back here on future trips to SF!
author: G F.

description:
Beautiful restaurant with wonderful baked oysters. Clam chowder was creamy and yummy. Beautiful place to go for a special occasion or date. Sunset views were spectacular. 

Margarita was yummy so was the shrimps Brochette
author: Judi H.

description:
After a long day of traveling back in to San Fran, we decided to stop along Pier 39 and have a late lunch. It was definitely not as casual on the inside as we had been expecting, and were promptly seated inside (sadly not along the exterior for the amazing harbor view). The service was a tad on the slow side but we weren't in much of a hurry. 

I went with the soup and salad combo ($16) that is served in a classic bread bowl. The soup (their famous chowder) was indeed amazing and everything I had hoped for. I definitely was not hungry after eating that. 

They also provide the table with a complimentary bread basked which was very delicious. And we ordered an appetizer of calamari because of course - and it was perfectly seasoned and cooked. 

For the quality and the price it's a great spot - I thought very reasonable for a touristy area. The dessert tray is massive and very tempting!
author: Courtney W.

description:
Had dinner here for the first time. 
Visiting from Los Angeles and the food was EXCELLENT! Me and my party had the pan chicken entree's and they were served hot and perfectly cooked. Our dinner also included delicious warm sourdough rolls with butter. This meal was exactly what I was looking for after a long day of traveling and I must say; our server, Justin, was thee cherry on top. My water cup never went dry and he was always one step ahead of the game. Very thankful for his service and recommendations.
author: Cody K.

description:
