My family and I were looking for a place to have lunch, and I insisted that we should come here based on yelp reviews and I was right. hip hip! Everything was good except that there was this not so little fly trying to kiss on my cheek!

- strawberry basil nojito(non alcohol) : very sweet and fresh. I forgot to ask for little ice. It was literally full of ice that my drink was gone after two sips....:( 

- res chili garlic shrimp : our server warned us that it is very spicy......are you kidding me!? Not spicy at all! Booo but it was good. The plate itself was small but there were many shrimps and vegetables to share with. This was perfect with blue cheese garlic bread. 

- clam chowder : AWARD WINNING! No wonder! One of the best clam chowder I've ever had. But please order this with a cup or a regular bowl(not the bread bowl) and eat it with blue cheese garlic bread. I mean, unless you want to eat lots of breads...

- blue cheese garlic bread : the BEST dish I had here. I love love cheese and garlic and how can you go wrong when you have them with a bread!? And if you add clam chowder here...? Heavenly! But the bread is really big, big enough to share with 3people.

- lobster tail : chewy and fresh, but mashed potato and broccoli was meh :/ i ended up leaving all of them. It tasted like they didn't add any seasoning. 

- cioppino : I didn't get to try this but looked amazing. My husband said it's good but not amazing. I recommend you to order "lazy" one though...so that you don't need to deal with crab shells haha

Overall, it was great!
author: Kim P.

description:
It was my first time eating at the Fog Harbor Fish House and everything was amazing! From start to end, everything was great, not to mention the view.

I ordered the clam chowder and the Pacific Cod, both of which were delicious. The service was also really good. My waitress constantly checked on us to make sure that our drinks were filled and that we were had everything we needed. Although it is a little pricey, it was worth it!
author: Tabetha S.

description:
Wish I could give this place a zero star.

1) Got here with a reservation, ended up waiting an additional 15 minutes which is the least of my complaints 

2) Asked the waiter if the oysters were good on that night, he said they were "very good". To keep it short and simple, the oysters we're not prepared well. Salty like it was never rinsed or cleaned out. Oysters were TINY. No flavor other than sea water. Not good to the pallet. Had small shell bits inside. 

3) Ordered a $7.50 non alcoholic berry drink. You would think they would put a little more effort for that price point. Basically a flat Sprite with some dried blackberries. I'd much rather drink a can of sprite had I known any better.

4) Asked the waiter for parking validation. He said be right back with it and came back with the bill - no validation. I ended up having to ask another and he got for me just before I got up to leave. My original waiter comes back and drops a second validation on my table and walks off as he probably saw my 12% tip ( which I felt thoroughly justified for the lack of presence and honesty about the food).

5) Here's the kicker. CHECK YOUR BANK STATEMENTS. I clearly wrote $130 on the $117 tab, giving them a $13 tip which I was even reluctant to give in the first place. What do they do? Charge me $140. This is theft. I clearly, in big and clear numbers wrote $130. And no, this is not about $10. It's about the integrity of this restaurant. So naturally, I called in, and the host said he would check and call me back right away. No call. I called in 6 hours later, same host picked up. Explained to him the situation once again, he put me on hold, and then hung up on me. Never called me back again. This place is a sham. Check your bank statements. Especially if you tip them less that the 18%, they will pull a fast one. I'm sure I'm not the first and definitely won't be the last. Contacted my bank and will file a dispute.
author: Kelvin L.

description: I really enjoyed my visit in this restaurant. We were given a table by the window with an incredible view of the wharf. Our server Nick was very accommodating and attentive to our needs. Service was excellent! Shawna was also so nice enough to take our picture as a group. I absolutely recommend the New York Steak and seafood platter plus the crab salad as they were absolutely delicious. Looking forward to my next visit here in Fog Harbor Fisherman's Wharf.
author: Montu A.

description: Great view, good food and really good service.  The price was a bit high but it is the tourist section.  Oh yeah, lots of tourists including us.
author: Jim P.

description: Sean (manager) and Tony (bartender) were awesome. Great ambience, fantastic conversation with those at the bar, and just all around absolutely awesome food. If you are in San Francisco and don't eat here, then you haven't visited San Francisco! Highly recommend the clam chowder and mussels with fries! Thanks for the wonderful experience!
author: Jon H.

description: In the heart of the Wharf tourist trap you will find Fig Harbor Fish House. Strongly recommend asking for a table near the window and enjoying a chowder bread bowl with crab on top! Unreal. *they use NoWait!
author: Leanne B.

description:
Food is absolutely Delicious and worth trying. If you're a tourist, I'd definitely recommend you coming here to try their seafood and lobster! Lobsters are huge and fresh, Clam Chowder is like must try, and especially their crab cakes. Defiantly try their crab cakes if you're a seafood lover. 

Overall, great selections of Seafood and super fresh. Better come here early. I had to wait a bit. But it was well worth it! Defiantly coming back!
author: Jonathan Z.

description:
The Fog Harbor Fish House was a magnificent venue to celebrate my birthday.  Our seating couldn't have been more perfect with a view of the SF Bay and to Sausalito, the food was flavorful & all deliciousness and the staff was pleasant, attentive & friendly.

I was craving for a whole crab along with a side of pasta & veggies.  Their award winning clam chowder also lives up to its reputation.  I left there VERY satisfied.  We'll be back soon on our next visit.  

Thank you for a splendid dining experience.  It was a beautiful afternoon/evening to be in SF.
author: Jasmine P.

description:
For ages I've wanted to try a classic SFO Cioppino so I did at the Fog Harbor Fish House on pier 39.  Was it crowded?  Yes!  Was it touristy?  Yes!  Was it really good?  Yes!

There was a plethora of fish and shellfish swimming in what I would consider more of a sauce than a broth with some nice sourdough on the side.  Was it a good representation of the dish?  I'm not sure but it was damn good.  

Keep it up lads, looking forward to coming back.
author: George H.

description:
We didn't expect too much from a pricey, waterfront location and we pretty much got what we expected. Ceviche was "ok", seafood stew was pretty good, burger was mediocre, etc. Beautiful location though and the waitstaff was good. In the end, I really wish we tried Scomas, it looked promising when we poked our head in later that day.
Bob, thank you for taking the time to read my review. We were in first going on Saturday at 10:45, just as you were opening. I should also add that the dinner rolls were ridiculously good!
author: Darren R.

description:
I tend to not go to restaurants with great views in touristy spots of town, as it always means the food can afford to not be top notch, but we happened to be on the Wharf and the reviews of this place were fantastic. And the setting was beautiful, the waitstaff was beyond sweet and attentive, but I am surprised at all the great reviews. 

The best thing we ordered was the crab cocktail. Like shrimp cocktail, but with extremely fresh lump crab meat. It's straightforward but the seafood is quality, it's worth getting.

The chowder in a sourdough bread bowl was really bland. We seasoning it ourselves at the table but it still didn't hit the mark. I got the Cioppino, crab, fish, shrimp, clams, scallops and mussels in tomato broth.The broth was also under seasoned, for the most part the seafood was good though (especially the crab, seems to be a strong choice here), just not a dish that was worth $34. The fried combo (shrimp, calamari, fish with cole slaw and fries) was totally over fried. 

Overall it's a nice view, overpriced, but the raw seafood is worth getting if you find yourself here.
author: Luci B.

description: Last weekend my wife and I visited San Francisco again for our 1 year anniversary. We were hungry for some lunch so we decided to come here. Overall I would have to say pretty disappointed with the quality of the food. I was thinking since many of the yelp reviews were good and the pictures looked amazing - this place would be great. I was pretty inaccurate in that assumption as the fish was dry, steak was bland, and steamed broccoli was crunchier then a potato chip. The only thing that was decent were the mashed potatoes. I wish my wife and I had stuck with our original plan to go to Scoma's for lunch - now that place is amazing!!
author: Steve F.

description: I highly recommend coming here at opening. You'll have a higher chance of getting a window seat and getting a great view of the harbor and the pier. The Ahi Tuna was delicious and grilled  shrimp entree. The restaurant also serves complimentary warm sourdough bread. They also serve delicious freshly squeezed orange juice and lemonade. They also have a great selection of desserts. The service was also amazing. The restaurant is clean and romantic.
author: Michelle H.

description:
Smacked in the middle of Pier 39, I was excited to try this place out because of the amount of reviews it has and the amazing look food. 

The restaurant looks super fantastic. Very high class restaurant except you don't have to be all dressed for it. 

There was only 3 dishes I wanted to try. That was the baked oysters, the famous clam chowder in a bread bowl, and whole dungeness crab. 

The baked oysters was such an awesome starter. That oyster was so freshly cooked and flavor was absolutely stunningly delicious. I wish I had 3 dozens of those. 

The famous clam chowder in a bread bowl. Probably the best clam chowder I have ever had. The consistency, the flavor, and the chuck of clams were great. The sour dough bread really compliments well with the clam chowder. 

The whole dungeness crab, I was looking really forward too. When our server came out with the crab I was shocked it was split into 2 plates. I had assume it was presented as a whole crab, but instead our server requested the kitchen staff to split into 2 plates without asking me. The presentation lost its "WOW" factor and I was super disappointed in that. 

Otherwise the crab was very good. Great garlic flavor. Good chunks of crab meat. 

Should really give this place a shot. Great seafood dishes. Except if you get a whole crab, make sure they serve it whole and not split between two plates.
author: Alan L.

description:
Since moving to California in April this has been one of the most memorable restaurants I have ever been to.

The view of Alvarez alone is worth the visit. The sunset without a doubt is by far one of the best views in the Bay area. Note they don't take reservation on weekends so come about 30min to an hour early if you want to get a table prior to the sun going down. (Dont worry there is so much to do on the pier to keep you busy)

The food nothing short of mouth watering good! Some of the freshest seafood the bay area has to offer and on top of that the portions are monstrous. 

If you're in San Fran between Instagram worthy pics of Alcatraz and fresh seafood this place is a must!
author: Ryan N.

description:
Came to celebrate Father's Day with kids and husband and the service provided from starting on the waiting for a table great. The restaurant provides phone chargers! First one for me.
The waiter provided an outstanding service .
Food was delicious we all have a very nice time .
I highly recommend this place they also write for any celebration you may have at the table like Happy anniversary of Birthday upon request
author: Claudia C.

description:
Very busy, place, but the food was delivered hot and ready to eat.  Enjoyed a nice dinner with family, and the food was great.  The Calamari appetizer was like a full meal, so servings are plentiful. The variety of food offered well fits the traveling eater.

2nd time we have dined there over the last few years.  Considering when you come off the tours, everything is closed.
author: Ervin T.

description:
The view from this place make the perfect setting to enjoy lunch or dinner.  Friendly staff and great view made the last day in San Francisco memorable.

The seafood platter and crab ceviche was more than enough for two. The margarita and Moscow mule alone was worth the stop. The atmosphere definitely made the dish. Not sure if the food alone would have stand out.

Overall this place is perfect spot to take family, friends or a date for two.
author: John C.

description:
Enjoyed crabs and oysters.
Also it has Napa beer. Named after the restaurant's name. 
Nice view, must b good the clear blue sky.
author: Saori Y.

description: The crab roll was legit!  Full of crab, celery and a light sauce on toasted sourdough.  I also tried the award winning clam chowder which was really good.  My family and I were seated in a nice spot with view of Alcatraz and enjoyed some nice cocktails.
author: Surf City M.

description:
While the hubs and I are on our way to our go-to spot to get our crab craving fix, on a whim we decided to try some place new, and boy i do not regret that decision one bit!

We agreed on Fog Harbor Fish House based on their Yelp reviews (thank you, fellow Yelpians).

We started with the calamari. Mouth.Watering. it's the jalapenos, i swear! And to top it off with the lemon aioli. I died, inside. Happily.

The shellfish platter is a must! The hubs is a big guy, so the platter for two plus the lobster was filling for him. I feel as though if he were to have bought it for 1, he'd be asking for a snickers bar (drumroll, with a hit of the symbols - bam). Shellfish platter for two came with 1 whole crab, 12 clams, 12 shrimp and 12 mussels. We added a lobster for an additional cost.

 The seafood penne was satisfying. Not as much flavor as I wished for, but I guess it's expected when you have a variety of seafood in a pasta - I'm assuming they were trying to put an emphasis in the seafood, rather than seasoning it up and hiding the seafood's natural flavor. And I am not mad at that.

And to end our beautiful experience (almost cried because desserts are always a reminder that you are almost done) I couldn't help, but salivate over their apple crisp. Lord, help me.

Just screw this review and go and get yourself a seat at this place.
author: Natasha R.

description:
This place was a great spot to eat at. 
The views were nice & it was easy to get a table. 
We were seated in 2 mins. 
Service was good and they even validated parking, however when we tried to leave the parking structure said we were given one that was already expired ? So that's why I knocked off one star. 

I didn't like the complimentary bread. 
The mussel fries were surprisingly my favorite thing there. The sauce it came on top of was so good! 
Then I also got the capriccio, which was just ok. I didn't eat too much because I had filled up on the appetizer. 
The creme brûlée was pretty good as well. 

All in all, the seafood was fresh and I would come again.
author: Linda C.

description: The View is indeed spectacular. We had a great view of the sunset while waiting for our meal to come for 2 hours. Our waiter ruined the experience for us. We sat down and placed our order around 6pm. Got our soup and salad 15 minutes later. Waited another hour, still no sign of our entrees. The waiter comes back one time and says the entrees are on the way. Another 20 mins later, he decides to really check to see whats taking so long only to realize that he did not place the order for us correctly in the system. So waited another 30 mins for them to cook our entrees. Customers that came in after us ate and left while we are still waiting for our meal. Shame on our waiter for not noticing that we were waiting this long and not checking in on us. And the only thing we got out of it is a free desert! Our time is valuable because we are on vacation and should not have been wasted like this.
author: T. M.

description: I am being in SFC for a week and this has been the best place for eating. The seafood was fresh and rapidly serve. The deserts excellent! Our waiter very efficient  and  kind.
author: José F.

description:
My sister, myself and my nephew were visiting Pier 39 on our first day in San Francisco.  It was on a Wednesday somewhere around 3pm.  We decided to come to Pier39 for lunch because it had some good reviews on Yelp and you could see the water from the restaurant. As soon as we walked into the restaurant we were greeted and seated in the back of the restaurant with views of the water.  It was great that they automatically filled up all of the tables near the water first rather than having to ask like at some restaurants.  

Our waiter finished up with another table then a few minutes later, greeted us and took our drink order.  He brought our drinks then came back to take our lunch order.  I ordered the clam chowder in a sourdough bread bowl, my nephew got a cup of soup and my sister got a salad.  A few minutes later the waiter brought us some bread and butter which was very good! You could easily tell it was made fresh.

The waiter noticed my water was gone and said he would bring some more.  A little bit later our meal came and it looked great.  Our waiter welcomed some other tables, brought them some water and I think then remembered about my water so he came back about 10 minutes later with some water.  I was so thirsty.
  
The meal was very good and the prices weren't bad especially since we were in such a high tourist part of town.  Our waiter seemed like he took a while to bring the check but did get it and offered to validate parking but we already had it validated from somewhere else. 
Overall lunch was nice.  There were great views of the seals, Alcatraz and my nephew seemed happy to look out the window.
author: Angela D.

description:
I don't care it's a touristy spot. It's a decent restaurant with an awesome view. Plus it's my dad approved. 

Came here with my dad when we visited SF a few years ago. I was living in Texas back then and wanted to take my dad for a good seafood meal when we were doing our tourist thing at Pier 39. 

After looking at nearby restaurants, we decided to eat here for lunch. I went all out and ordered a bunch of dishes including oysters, crab cake, whole Dungeness crab, clam chowder, etc. for a couple of hundred dollars. Food was very fresh and tasty. Our waiter was friendly and attentive. And the view was amazing. 

My dad was super happy with the food and whole experience. I was so glad he liked it. This place deff brings back memories. Fast forward a few years, I now live in the Bay Area. I'll take my whole family back here when they visit me in the city!
author: Angela F. W.

description: Beautiful view, fresh food, and EXCELLENT service! Hands down the best calamari I've had.
author: Lakeisha W.

description:
Just a FYI: I absolutely love clam chowder and am hard to impress when it comes to this amazing creamy, clam, potato, hint of bacon flavored savory chowder. 

Since I have gone to a few "famous for their chowder" restaurants in San Fran and was not pleased, I asked our server if I could try a small tasting of their clam chowder. Let me tell you, this taste test was my dinner deciding factor and the chowder blew me away. So creamy and filled with chunks of potato and clams in every bite. I did get it in the sour dough bread bowl and I must say, the next time I dine in, I will just order the bowl instead of bread bowl. I did however stop by the next day to pick up a cup and bowl sized chowder to go to bring back on my ride back home to LA. 

For appetizer we ordered the CALAMARI with the lemon aioli. The calamari was good, however I'm not sure if I am a huge fan of the dipping sauce as it was a little too salty for my palette. 

Boyfriend ordered FISH AND CHIPS. Not ever a fan of fish and chips since childhood however, this was AMAZING!!!! Flaky inside and perfectly battered and fried outside.  Also, the coleslaw that came with it had a slight kick, just FYI.
author: Samantha V.

description:
This place was great! We stumbled in here after doing some sight seeing, yes it's a huge tourist place, but whatever they still have great food! The place is a lot bigger than I thought it was going to be from the outside, and really had a great ambiance to the place. It was classy but not too fancy where I felt like I should have dressed up. They have a great view of the water, and the wait staff was very helpful.

We got the spicy shrimp appetizer, and it definitely was spicy!! Not overbearing, but if you don't like spicy food definitely stay away. It's not one of those things on the menu that just says spicy and then there's nothing to it. My dad got the fried shrimp - which was your typical fried shrimp, nothing outstanding, but nothing bad to say. I thought they could have been a little less bread like, I hate when places drench their shrimp in batter. I got the chicken, which my dad thought was weird since we're at a seafood place, however it was fantastic! So juicy, great sauce and the mashed potatoes were fabulous. The only complaint that I have is they left the layer of fat on the chicken breast, which I understand is great for flavor, but if you're going to do so make sure you render the fat down more!

Great place to go, a little pricier than some of the restaurants down there, but not outrageous!
author: Julie S.

description:
Food was excellent. Shrimp cocktail and the seafood stew was great. Love their complimentary sour dough bread. And the view and the seating was great! Every table basically gets a view. The lobby is super nice as well. 

My reason for the low rating is the service. 

Hostesses were nice and very efficient so good job to them! 

BUT our server Christian was horrible. I say horrible because he legit brought our waters and then took our order and we never saw him again. We were done for a solid 10 minutes and waited. And waited. He was no where. We saw a few bussers but that was about it. When we finally saw him we had to flag him down to get the check. He seems like a nice person. But to not even check in once I think is a little... idk. Anyways. I recommend coming here still. Just our server experience wasn't phenomenal.
author: Maggy S.

description: I usually steer clear of tourist traps but why did I fall for this one?  I guess I was obliging the group.  It was quite a scene.  You walk in and one wall is all glass so you get a fantastic view of the bay.  It was gorgeous.  Then we were started with complimentary bread - which is very good.  We had clam chowder to start which lived up to the award winning title.  The main course for me was slightly disappointing.  I had the grilled mixed seafood plate.  I sampled the Cioppino and some fried calamari.  The entrees were a bit lackluster. I'd definitely keep it to the light menu here and take in the view.  That's what these joints are good for.
author: Cindy S.

description: My boyfriend and I were visiting for the long Labor Day weekend from San Diego and decided to make the Fog Harbor Fish House the first spot we ate at. The wait for our table took around 45 minutes which I think is pretty fair considering the restaurant's busy location. There are plenty of benches and chairs to sit and wait at which is awesome for my tired feet. My boyfriend and I were seated on the right side of the restaurant with a nice view of Alcatraz and the water. Lulu was our server who was very helpful in guiding us on what her recommendations were on the menu. We had the mussel fries as our appetizer, my boyfriend had the cioppino and I had the seared scallops with parmesan crab risotto. Lulu and the rest of the staff checked on our table often which was so nice. All of the dishes were packed with flavor! We were too full for dessert so we omitted from ordering but I mentioned that it was my boyfriend's birthday yesterday and Lulu brought him a delicious creme brûlée! We could not have been any more happier with our experience at the Fog Harbor Fish House. I recommend coming here with your significant other, family and friends and I hope you have Lulu as your server!
author: Cheryle L.

description:
"IT'S. ABOUT. TO. GO. DOWN."
You'd think I would be saying that about some monstrous burger in a dive bar somewhere, but no I was ravenous for some high class seafood.  I had my napkin in one hand, fork in the other - that's how you know I was ready to chow down...on the clam "chow"der that is.  I did not predict that the clam chowder would survive for very long, and my hypothesis was proven correct as the chowder was completely out of sight within minutes.  Though that is pretty much the same song and dance for everything that was placed in front of my fiance and I here at Fog Harbor Fish House.

Whether it be the fried scallops, the chili shrimp or the clam linguine, nothing was safe from consumption.  There were no survivors, but don't worry - they died quickly.  There was no suffering for any of the shrimps or clams or scallops.  Speaking of scallops, the ones we ordered were seasonal, but if you ever catch them when they have the fried scallops on the menu - GET THEM!  It's the best fried food ever.  And the chili shrimp is equally as amazing.  The clam linguine, you ask?  Also ridiculously amazing...and our server split it into 2 bowls for is since we were sharing.  

By the way, sharing is the way to go here - that way you are reducing the out-of-pocket costs per person, unless of course you decide to split the food so you can try more of it...in which case you'll still be spending a pretty penny.  I would recommend splitting the appetizers and entrees here because it gives you a greater opportunity to try more menu items!  So, split all the seafood but get dessert for yourself - I guarantee you won't want to share it, especially if you get the chocolate banana bread pudding!  Also the best bread pudding I've ever had!

What's even better is the view of the harbor while you're dining in.  I went during the daytime, but I can only imagine how beautiful it is to dine here at sunset.  The decor itself is quite elegant and beautiful - truly, everything was done perfectly here, including the service by our waitress.  Did I mention that all the good came out very quickly too?  

Fog Harbor Fish House is absolutely a place you must visit, even if you don't plan on spending an entire day at Pier 39 or the Wharf.
author: Lauren K.

description:
Amazing dinner place for date nights - classy yet casual. Located on Pier 39, which has a lot of shops to check out while waiting for your name to be called for dinner. Wait for dinner wasn't long at all - maybe 15 minutes in total without a reservation on a Saturday night at 8pm.

We started off with the Mussel Fries ($16), which I HIGHLY recommend just because I'm a fry person. But also because it's actually delicious with the sauce and mussels. My boyfriend and I also split a clam chowder bread bowl ($11), but I recommend getting a regular bowl and using the complimentary sourdough bread to dip since you don't want to get full off of bread. For the main course, we ordered the lazy cioppino ($41), and our server split the dish between my boyfriend and I without us asking. It's too much if you eat alone. We also ended up sharing a dessert plate with chocolate cake and creme brûlée, very light & delicious even when you're full. 

Parking isn't bad... there's a parking garage that's located right across the street from pier 39 which is super convenient because we didn't want to waste time looking for street parking. Again, it's not a bad price...IF YOU DON'T LOSE YOUR PARKING TICKET. I cannot stress this enough. The parking ticket is your GOLDEN TICKET. Each hour is $10, with a max at 5 hours. You can get your ticket validated and get the first hour free. Our ticket would've have cost $10 since we only stayed for 2 1/2 hours, and we wouldve gotten the ticket validated. HOWEVER, we lost it and had to pay the max fee ($50), WHICH IS OUTRAGEOUS (I was very sad). Other than this, Fog Harbor would have gotten a 5 star review but parking wasn't an amazing experience :(
author: Jenny N.

description: Beautiful restaurant located at the heart of Fisherman's Wharf. I was lucky enough to get the window table (usually fits 2). Since the restaurant is on the second floor, the view was incredible. I had the clam chowder and cioppino which were hearty and delicious. The food fills you up quickly, so be careful not to order too much!
author: Janet C.

description:
Fancy restaurant on the Fisherman's Wharf. It's located on the second floor and they have their own restroom! I came to Fog Harbor for their claim to have the best clam chowder. Yes, it was good but I don't think it lived up to the hype. A local told us a placed called Chowders will have the best clam chowder.

We also got half dozen of oysters and that was delicious! It was also $17 for half dozen... which In my opinion is expensive. The views were lovely. Would I come back to this place? I'm not sure but it was definitely worth a try and to check it off my list. It is mostly a tourist attraction.
author: Jean K.

description:
There will be long lines - so be prepared!! Delicious food :) Lovely views.

The seafood platter is what I would recommend as it comes with all sorts of mussels, clams, crab etc.

Enjoy!
author: Carina M.

description:
3.5 stars.

This is at the infamous Fisherman's Wharf, which is why I haven't been -- I prefer local spots, not tourist spots. This is definitely one of the tourist spots, filled with tourists who are shivering from the cold of the SF bay.

They have a large bar you can hang out at before dinner, since they can be quite busy during peak season. I came here with some family who are in town and wanted to have some "authentic San Francisco seafood", and went along even though I'm not sure what that meant ;)

Turns out, the food is actually pretty decent. They serve a lot of stereotypical seafood dishes, like crab cakes, lobster, cioppino, shrimp linguini... I would say the seafood itself is decent quality but not top notch, but the portions are generous and definitely would please one's Asian family.

Waitstaff was nice, and the food arrived in good time. I'd say, however touristy it may be, if you are entertaining tourists it is a good place to go around here.
author: Alice C.

description: The food, well appetizers were good I love calamari. I didn't care for the sauce but that's my preference. I didn't like the mussels fries not sure if it was the onions but something threw it off for me. Again that's just me. We loved the oysters!!!!!! me and my girlfriend went by after doing hair for a wedding on a Saturday. We ordered some waters and started with 3 appetizers, we're big eaters. The server never came back and asked if we wanted anything else. Maybe he assumed we were not going to eat more and we were just snackers which we are. But we were there for the big plates!!! We wanted the seafood trio with the salmon and all and the steak plate... we will have to try again. Only reason for three stars is we were never asked anything we pretty much walked him through the service of serving.
author: Coryann E.

description: I love the spicy shrimp app and the filet mignon for entree. The service is always great this is my go to restaurant when I go to the city. The ambiance here is amazing servers always very helpful
author: Maria M.

description:
Popped in while exploring Pier 39.  We got there just in time and had no wait, when we left closer to 1pm there was definitely a wait.  

Worth sitting and enjoying the view.  Service was good and our waiter was attentive.  Everything is a bit more than what I would normally want to pay, but given the location, not surprised.  

Cioppino was hearty.  Hubby didn't regret ordering it despite the price tag.  The kid shoveled the chicken tenders in, with no complaints.  Actually, he didn't use ketchup.  

Fish and chips were solid.  They were breaded evenly and the hint of beer in the batter added a nice flavor.
author: Tisha N.

description: Chowder was amazing! Views were awesome and we were sat right away.  My moms potatoes were cold so that's why I took a star away.
author: Matt J.

description: Went there on a Thursday lunch time. Didn't have to wait and we even got a window table with fantastic pier view. We ordered Shellfish Platter for one with a Lobster Tail, a Mixed Grill and Award Winning Chowder in a Fresh Baked Sourdough Bread Bowl. That's more than enough food for my mom and me. The seafood is of course fantastic and fresh, the waitress is also very friendly and helpful. Great experience!
author: Yang L.

description:
After a second visit today, Fog Harbor Fish House is now firmly on my list of seafood restaurants to go to when in SF. Its location on Pier 39 might initially be a turn-off if you are really just trying to scratch a seafood itch and don't relish the idea of wading through all the tourists milling around the shops. However, the food is worth it. Luckily enough, the restaurant is located on the second floor of one of the buildings closest to curbside, so not much wading is involved. 

I would describe the interior of the restaurant as "modern". The seating options are a mix of booths and standard tables, as well as space at the bar, which I think was for walk-ins. Large windows facing the moorings for the Blue & Gold tour boats lets lots of light in during the day and makes for a nice view from the window tables.

The menu is definitely geared towards seafood aficionados, though there are some non-seafood choices. As I understand it, Fog Harbor is part of the Simmons Family Restaurants group, which has several types of seafood restaurants in and around Pier 39. One thing to bear in mind is that this is the more "proper" of the group's restaurants, and is pricier as a result. 

You will be hard pressed to find better seafood for the price though. On both of our visits here, we ordered the cioppino (seafood stew), the clam chowder, and the bay scallops. The seafood is all fresh, tasty, and generously portioned. The main courses I ordered were the lobster tails on our first visit, and the scallop and crab risotto the second visit. Both dishes were phenomenal.

One thing worth mentioning is that the servers we got both times were very attentive and friendly. Our second visit was actually for a birthday lunch, which I made a note of on my reservation, and our server (Kayla) gave us a dessert on the house, complete with a candle in it! It was the tiramisu, which is definitely worth saving space for. 

In short, I am already looking forward to my next visit to Fog Harbor!
author: Adrian A.

description: The food and the view were fantastic. I was in San Francisco for the day with two friends. We stopped here for early dinner after seeing reviews on Yelp. It was a great choice.
author: Vicki P.

description: A bit touristy but great views and the best clam chowder in the city! The warm sourdough bread they serve is worth it as well - I had one for dessert haha
author: Irina G.

description: This restaurant does a good job with fish and chips!  I've tried the salmon and a lobster roll but both were bland.  Definitely opt for the fish and chips here! The beer batter is delicious.
author: Darla H.

description:
This place is good in only a tourist trap kinda way can be. Don't get me wrong,  I enjoyed the food and the atmosphere, but come'on. For the price of our entrees, we should be getting way better everything.

Our waiter couldn't be bothered to remember our order. We were a party of 4 and whenever drinks or food came out. He would just randomly put stuff down and not remember who ordered what. Also when my shellfish platter came out, it was pretty hot and he just hands me the plate and doesn't say anything.

I ordered a cup of clam chowder and the shell fish platter for one. The platter is 1/2 of a crab, mussels, clams, shrimp and fingerling potatoes.  The seafood was good but very messy. They give you a bib to wear but that only help with the splatter and not your hands. Don't get me wrong I love to eat seafood with my hands but this platter was cooked with a TON of garlic and butter so the entire plate was drowning in it. It overwhelms the taste of the seafood.   

I would consider coming back but with SF being a foodie city. There are many better places out there for seafood.
author: Junella T.

description:
Located on Pier 39, this is a good spot to grab lunch before doing some sightseeing. The food, views, and service were great here! 

We were famished when we got here. Wanting to eat before we went to the Aquarium, we were seated within 15 minutes. Right after we were seated, we were brought out bread and some drinks. 

My son and I were in the mood for comfort food. While my son ordered the fish and chips, I ordered the fried shrimp and fries. My husband ordered the swordfish. We also ordered the calamari appetizer. 

The calamari came out fairly quickly and was delicious. My son and I both thought our meals were wonderfully tasty. I thought the coleslaw and fries were yummy too. My husband, who went the healthier route, said his swordfish was fresh and delicious as well. 

Service was good here. Our drinks were refilled quickly. Our server checked on us often. The staff seemed friendly and helpful. Even though though the restaurant was extremely busy, everyone was really nice here.

For a nice relaxing lunch on the pier with amazing views of the water, this is a great spot for a meal when visiting Fisherman's Wharf!
author: Tami D.

description: In a place that is known for strong tourist presence, this is still a gem. All the food is fresh and portions are good size. Been her multiple times and they have never disappointed.
author: Mike B.

description:
I was told there was an hour wait so we decided to sit at the bar which had no wait. Unfortunately, the bartender/server was not very welcoming, and he came off as if he didn't want to serve us. We also felt he rushed our entire meal. The food looked really good but I honestly thought it was going to taste better...it was average. Save your money and go somewhere that appreciates their customers. 

Customer service is everything!
author: Brittani K.

description:
Average sea food restaurant!!!
After reading a few of the rave reviews I was hoping to be the next critic to sing their praises, but in my honest opinion, it was just an average dining experience. Fog Harbor is your typical sea food joint with all the usual cuisine reinforced by sublime views of the bay and Wharf below. 

Upon arrival I was seated fairly quickly (considering it was Mother's Day and very crowded) at the bar, of course, which I'm used to since I typically dine alone. My meal consisted of battered fried cod filets and three, maybe four decent, but certainly not jumbo sized shrimp---as I was expecting, a side of coleslaw and fries. The fish and shrimp tasted fine; nothing spectacular, coleslaw was bland. I prefer mine creamy and sweet. Maybe it's the Floridian in me, lol. On a positive note, the vignette wine soda is definitely worth a try, for non drinkers who want to put on a spin on things. It's like drinking Chardonnay without feeling the buzz. I will say that the staff was friendly and accommodating, although, the guy who was waiting on me did disappear for awhile, but they were super busy, so it's understandable. 

In summation, Fog harbor is a classic sea food joint, safe and reassuring, but nothing outstanding. The local Red Lobster, in my opinion would meet the same expectations for slightly lesser the price.
author: Kyle B.

description:
Just walking by and found this place. Our party of 7 was quickly seated in the back by the window. We had a really good view! 

We shared the calamari and everyone got the clam chowder. I got the soup/ caesar salad combo with added chicken to my salad. Surprisingly, the food came out really quickly, I didn't even get a chance to butter my bread and eat it! 

The calamari was really good and the tartar sauce was creamy and delicious. The caesar could of used more dressing but it was still good. The clam
chowder came in a bread bowl and was really delicious. The sign said it was a SF top 10 restaurant and popular specifically for their clam
chowder. I would have preferred it to be a little chunkier but overall really good.

Good place with great views! Will definitely stop by next time I'm back in SF.
author: Emie S.

description: We were excited to try out this local joint as Seattle locals visiting from out of town. For the price, location, and food selection we had decent expectations. We started with alcoholic beverages which were decent, but didn't taste like much alcohol was in them. We ordered appetizers of Calamari and Clam Chowder which was quite delicious. No complaints there. However, our entrees came out and that's when our experience took a nosedive. The table ordered the recommended dishes such as the Seafood Penne and the Fish and Chips. The battered fish was bland and tasteless, and the Seafood Penne Pasta left more to be desired. The sauce was so thin it slid right off the pasta leaving a plain noodle. The service was awful, and I'm pretty sure the server was high the entire time. I expected a lot more from a nicer restaurant and wish we had chosen a different place.
author: Carinna L.

description:
Yelp describes this best. Meh I've had better. My best friend was visiting and he really wanted to have a touristy experience in SF so we decided to come here. He remembered as a child that the clam chowder was really good, but unfortunately his memory led us astray. The clam chowder is decent, but for the price/quality, walk down the street and get some from the other vendors in the open market.

In addition, the bar is unfamiliar with signature traditional cocktails and we often had to explain how to make our own drinks which is never a good sign.

2 stars - keep your expectations managed. It's tourist trap in my opinion. It's not bad, it's just not great. It will just leave you wondering if you should of went somewhere else and if this was truly worth the money.
author: Tar R.

description:
My boyfriend and I came here last night after out Alcatraz tour to celebrate our 7 years. I knew i should of made a reservation and didn't :(. we had to wait about 45 mins for a table for 2 no biggie. The place is packed for sure. Don't knock this place because it's at pier 39. Im very picky when it comes to my seafood. 

Our server that night was Jane. She was wonderful!! She was very prompt and very courteous. I had a glass of Moscato that too me back to when I had it in Las Vegas at the Delano and she was awesome enough to get me the name. My boyfriend had the shellfish platter and I got the lazy cioppino with linguine added. It was worth the wait.
author: Sokhom K.

description: We came here to eat after going to the aquarium. The freshly baked sourdough bread was delicious besides that everything else was ok. I ordered the NY steak I ordered it medium and got it medium well. The portions where on the smaller side and took a long time to get here. The service was ok, for the prices I would think they'd be better. I do like that they use no plastic to help the environment. Overall I think it's ok, I wouldn't come back.
author: Nathan O.

description: Such a tourist spot. Idk why we chose it because we normally like the smaller, more creative dinner experiences. They half good oysters but everything else is over priced, like the crab and fried shrimp we got. Definitely not a place for a craft cocktail, unless it has cheap shrimp in it. Skip it and find a true SF sea food spot.
author: Colton S.

description: We had went out to the city and wanted a nice sit down dinner. We site seeing and was at the pier and checked this place out. I had the crab  and she had the lobster. Must say we where both happy with our food of course we shared both between the both of us and it was great no complaints!!!!
author: Restaurant K.

description: Delicious is an understatement! Visiting from the L.A area and doing the touristy things we decided to eat here after a bay boat tour. So glad picked this place! I took the recommendation of our server and ordered the crab & scallop risotto.. omg! I didn't want my meal to end. It was SO good.. my significant other had the Scioppino & he enjoyed his meal very much as well. As a starter we ordered the ceviche. It comes deconstruction but it was so good. Don't let the coconut milk deter you from ordering you won't be disappointed. And Creme brulee for dessert did not disappoint either. Can't wait to come back and enjoy another delicious meal. Thank you Adela for for kind service and great recommendation!
author: Lisa R.

description:
I always enjoy Fog Harbor! They served hot crusty bread and butter. Not a lot of places serve got bread anymore or perhaps I'm not going to the right restaurants. Lol

Their service was topnotch! There was tons of fast moving servers and lots of clientele ready to be served. The place was bustling with activity though we felt very taken care of.
Their clam chowder is the bomb diggity! It is thick, rich, full of clams and potatoes. Not too creamy. Just how I like it.
We ordered the fish and chips and this was my only area of concern. The fish was tasteless. No flavor at all! Very disappointing.
Since we were running to catch the ferry we didn't have time to have the order remade.
I'll still go back again and enjoy that crusty bread and clam chowder. 
Yum!
author: Cyn T.

description:
Overall the food was great! We ordered the seafood platter (but there was no corn on the cob) and the grilled salmon platter with mashed potatoes. My sister and I shared the seafood platter for 1 and it was more than enough. The wait staff was on point .. we didn't have to wait very long and we had a great view overlooking Alcatraz
Seafood platter 8 out of 10 (we didn't get half of a crab just the legs or any corn on the cob) 
Grilled salmon platter 9 out of 10 (need more  lemons) 
Double ipa beer was bomb.com 

Arif is an awesome waiter and very patient with complicated orders...
author: G K.

description:
Definitely one of the finest and best restaurants I've been to.
Had the pleasure to come here for lunch-early dinner a couple of summers ago and I've been dying to come back to this city and this restaurant since then.

We shared appetizers first, sliders, crab cake and crispy calamari. They all were on point!!

I ordered Seafood Penne accompanied with a cup of their award winning clam chowder. I have to repeat myself, i've been wishing i could come back. 

Everything was perfect, from the food to the service. I said it was one of the finest restaurants i've been to because the way they take care of the customers' need is something else. Waiters and waitresses are on another level. 
At some point my phone died, since I was on vacation I was carrying my charger everywhere, I asked one of the waitresses to take my phone somewhere safe so it could charge a little and she brought me a portable charger so I wouldn't have to worry about it, she made my day. Of course, that's one of the things this restaurant has to offer to the clients but to me it was a kindness act and great way to take care of the clients' needs.

If you happen to be in San Francisco, don't leave without paying a visit to this place. Almost forgot to mention, if you happen to be lucky like we were, you'll be seated near the huge windows that offer a view to the bay, in the evening it's BEAUTIFUL here. Come by and rate
author: Wildary C.

description: We went here for happy hour and sat at the bar. Mark sold us on the best clam chowder in SF and he wasn't lying. It was amazing. We also had their garlic fries and fried calamari - both were delicious! Glad we stopped here. Give it a try.
author: Kristen A.

description:
My emotion was on a rollercoaster dining here. Rated four stars by over four thousand people, this place seemed awesome, not to mention all the mouth watering pictures. 
I went to another seafood place (less fancy tho) the day before and it was amazing. So I got to this place with full of expectation. The lady at the host stand greeted me and my mom with a smile. We got seated right away. Our table had a nice view of the harbor. I was still excited up to this point. 
Then the waiter came by, didn't introduce himself or whatever, just asked if we wanted to get started with any drinks. And, probably because I said I wanted a few more minutes to look at the menu, he suggested a few items. I love it when people give me recommendations. We then ordered a seafood platter for two with an additional lobster tail, and a caesar salad.
From this point on, the waiter seemed to avoid talking to us. He used body language. Yes, body language. And only when he needed to, or else he would disappear or wandered around other tables he was serving. I started to feel weird. At first I thought he might be a foreigner, that would explain why he didn't really talk to us and used body language. But he joked with the table next to me. That was when I noticed other waiters did introduce themselves to whomever they served. 
Oh boy, whatever. It's not like I need his attention for anything. I don't really care about how you serve people, as long as you are polite and the food is good. 
The seafood platter was good. Full of clams, mussels, shrimps, crabs and potatos. They were all fresh. The lobsters were bomb. I loved the potatoes. But I didn't like my caesar salad. It was a bit more sour than and caesar salad I've ever had. And you know what was funny? It had full romaine lettuce leaves. Is that art? Because it doesn't make the salad taste any better. My mom and I had to actually use the knives to cut it up. A romaine lettuce leave can be as big as my hand, so of course I'm never gonna put that whole thing into my mouth. And we had three croutons made from sourdough bread on top of the leaves. Not my favorite, but it's just my taste, I'm not complaining. 
I don't have any picture of the salad cuz I wasn't going to show it to anyone. I only take pictures of pretty dishes. I didn't even think about writing this review. But the waiter gave me a final strike. 
The moment I dropped my fork, didn't even finish wiping my hand, he appeared out of nowhere behind me asking if I've finished or was still eating. Shortly after cleaning up our table, he came with our check. I felt like he was trying to kick us out cuz customers were lining up waiting outside. He circled his name, Samir, and wrote "Thank you!!" 
CUTE. I love notes!
Our bill was about $140, so we were supposed to tip $22 which was 18%. I knew it, but I didn't want to because he didn't deserve that much. Remember his greeting style, body language and all the ignoring? After paying for our dinner, my mom happened to put a $10 bill on the table and the waiter saw that. He turned and showed us the suggested tips written on the bill. And I actually followed what he said. We tipped him $22 as he wanted. 
He picked up the check before we left, and threw us a "xia xia" (thank you in chinese). Excuse you gentleman, if you see this review, it's time for you to learn that not all Asian is Chinese. Now I think I understand, he might think we were Chinese and wouldn't understand English, so he didn't talk to us or want to have any interaction. We sat there for like a minutes afterwards thinking we were stupid to tip him that much. 
The food is not good enough to get me back to that place to be treated like that. Tell me I'm sensitive, but you don't want to pay over a hundred bucks to get yourself upset, right?
author: Quin N.

description:
We had a 20 minute waitlist before we were seated.

Ordered the crab salad and it was delicious. The seafood lived up to the hype of the restaurant.

The view of the ocean and the bridge was icing on top
author: Zaid R.

description:
Fog Harbor Fish House is the perfect spot to grab lunch or dinner in the heart of all of Pier 39.

The place is popular so expect wait times but don't let that stop you from having some of the best clam chowder in the bay area!

Our large group didn't have to wait too long for a table, which was great (because we were hungry) Our table had a view of the water - as most of them do- which was fun!

We started with the cheese bread and calamari but if you're not feeling apps the complimentary bread will be excellent too! The cheese bread was very creamy on top, crisp on the bottom. The calamari had jalapenos fried with it, which was incredibly refreshing and tasty! 

The clam chowder in a bread bowl was perfect for a late lunch! I wish I would have had room for the whole bread bowl!

I highly recommend coming to Fog Harbor Fish house for a good meal and a good drink. It's a perfect place for a date or for a larger group.
author: Kaley K.

description:
Total letdown.

We were so excited to visit this place on our trip but it just wasn't good. We ordered the $68 seafood platter and the fried calamari which both were not up to par. The fried calamari tasted not fresh and had no bite to it... i don't want to begin with the seafood platter.. my boyfriend broke into the lobster claw and his face puckered because it tasted bitter and spoiled. The seafood just didn't taste nor look fresh. Nothing on that platter tasted good. My boyfriend also tried their clam chowder which had crab on top which was half defrosted in which caused the whole soup to turn into a cold watery mess.The only good thing we had was the complimentary bread.
author: Allison B.

description: With a couple of friends and we had a great time with the fresh sea foods on the platter, soup, plates, and combos. I got the Shellfish Platter and I have to say its perfect, not smelly, bad, sticky or anything like that. The prices are worth it because of how good the food is.
author: Jeffery H.

description: Nice location once you find it.  Waiter was really helpful with hints to do and best clam chowder.  Which was gluten free, only one I know of if the city
author: Bruce P.

description:
I give it three stars because it's just a three-star restaurant. Mainly because everything was mediocre and the price was high. 

It was OK. You have a spare is OK. The food is OK. The service is decent. Nothing spectacular about the restaurant. 

The bread was really good. I can get I can give them high remarks on that.  The wedge salad was also really tasty. 

The steak has an interesting taste.  They use teriyaki sauce or some kind of tangy sauce to spread on the steak.
author: Blake C.

description:
Ok this review will be short and sweet. I was cold and needed something to warm me up. I started reading reviews. So based on good reviews I decided to grab a cup of clam chowder. Besides this place states they have some of the best clam chowder.

I must say I agree. The chowder was yummy to my tummy. It was rich and creamy. The flavor was perfect and I ate every last drop. I left happy and content. I would definitely go back and try some of there other food. One of the best clam chowders I've ever had.
author: Nisha R.

description: Great seafood and a nice view of the marina! Food came pretty fast and we only waited a few minutes to be seated. Would recommend.
author: Linda F.

description: Delicious fresh seafood is what I can say about this place  Very warm decor and the best thing is the server who served me. He's very nice, polite and humble.
author: Tina K.

description: GREAT dining spot and really good food in large amount. Ive enjoy the seafood noodles.and sour bread soup.the view is Also GREAT. we walked along the pier while waiting for a seat.A nice experience dining there.
author: Clare G.

description: We had a great dinner today! I had the whole crab (regular) and it was delicious! Though it was a little pricey, it was worth it! We sat by the window and we had a great view. I definitely recommend if you are visiting Fisherman's Wharf.
author: Sophia B.

description: Strong 3 but low 4 review. Our server was horrible and not friendly at all. Our view was amazing right on the window looking over the ocean. Food was good. $46 for 2 people so not bad. Wasn't anything crazy exciting. Our server kinda ruined it for us but we loved our view! Also the sourdough bread is amazing!!!
author: Bryana W.

description: The clam chowder is a must! Make sure you get a bowl, though- you'll be unsatisfied with just a cup of it! Your call between a bowl or bread bowl- you get complementary sourdough bread with your meal, so either way works!
author: Amelia S.

description:
Our first official meal in SF! Authentic good clam chowder is what he wanted in a sourdough bread bowl. This place had us sold when we read award winning chowder!

It was a tough choice since Fishermans Wharf is basically filled with a ton of great chowder places but this spot still won us over. You walk into a beautiful entrance with a seating area and fireplace. Past the bar and into the dining room. We got lucky and we were seated next to the window. It was on overcast chilly day but the view still looked spectacular. The chowder defiantly helped us to warm up before our bike ride to the bridge. The chowder was warm, thick and flavorful. It was not salty which is my main issues with clam chowders. They didn't skimp on any of the ingredients you see the huge chunks of clams. It wasn't watered down or runny. The spices really did come through nicely. We added extra crab meat for $7. I wish the crab meat was warmed before placing it on top of the chowder. I had to mix it into the chowder to warm it up. Then we ripped off pieces of the sourdough bread bowl to dip into the chowder. It was delicious just what we needed. We also had their complimentary sourdough bread and butter before our meal came out. Can't get enough carbs! Especially good sourdough! Calamari is another tricky dish that can go wrong. But not here! The hot plate of freshly fried calamari was so good! Lemon aioli was served instead of tarter sauce. The lemon aioli really made a huge difference especially with a freshly squeezed lemon over the calamari. The surprise kicker was the deep fried slices of jalapeños to give you a surprise kick of fire. I didn't even notice it until my BF pointed them out. I tried some of the smaller pieces of jalapeño and calamari dipped into the aioli ohhhh it was the best combo. 

Service was wonderful, server was on top of everything. Refilling waters and checking up on us. He was very knowledgeable and friendly. Great way to start off our trip with a bowl of award winning clam chowder! When you receive the bill they give you coffee crackers instead of mints to end your meal.
author: Karen H.

description: Our favorite seafood spot besides hog island next door. The crab and seafood tower were outstanding. Some of the best crab I've probably ever eaten in a very long time
author: Robert G.

description:
We almost made the mistake of eating at an adjacent restaurant. However, we ended up at Fog Harbor and wow, what a treat! Our server was amazing and so was the food. 

We're all very picky, and I can say for sure that this was the best dining experience we had while in California. If I could rate it with 10 stars, I would.
author: Demetrios N.

description:
Came here to have my Bday dinner with the Beau because we were in the area and I was craving seafood.  Didn't know this place is located in Pier 39 until we got there.  **Note** This place only validate parking in the garage for an hour and it will take you more than an hour to eat at this place.

We waited about 15 mins before we got seated.  Order half a dozen of fresh oysters, a cup of the award winning clam chowder, crab roll, and Seafood Penne.  The oysters were very fresh and delicious.  The clam chowder was delicious.  It had a lot of clams and the thickness of the soup was perfect. The crab roll was also delicious and it came with a side of fries..yummy.  The roll just meats in your mouth and they they were generous with the crab and it was also very fresh.  The beau had the seafood penne and it was also pretty good. 

Recommend this place if you are looking for a seafood place to eat in the area.  The view was also very nice as we were seated by the window looking out over the water.
author: Ashley L.

description: Me and my hun love trying new restaurants and we recently went to this one and we were impressed by the amount of food they serve and it was delicious. The customer service there was great our waiter Justin H. Was awesome gaved us good recommendation and is a very nice person! This restaurant will be our go too, just make reservations because it was a 1 hour wait for a walk in
author: Alondra A.

description: Just had a wonderful dinner here on our last night in San Francisco. Our server Curtiss was professional, friendly and guided us to a memorable dinner.  At his suggestion we each added grilled shrimp to our meals and it was a great addition. Stared with local Oysters, as stated they were smaller then we are used to but so sweet it made up for it. I had the crab risotto with scallops and the added shrimp. Te scallops were perfect, the risotto buttery smooth with plenty of crabmeat. The grilled shrimp added another dimension to an already outstanding meal. My wife had the mixed grilled seafood again superb. Our experience here was great, the staff treated us well customer service is a real thing here. Curtiss was an outstanding guide leading us the right way. Believe the hype this place is a winner.
author: John M.

description: Tried fog harbor for the first time today. My wife and I shared a clam chowder bread bowl and the fried combo. The bread bowl was the best we've ever had. You could tell the bread is fresh baked and we opted to add crab meat to our bowl which made it even more amazing. The fried fish was also very good. The calamari and shrimp were also tasty. It only took about 10 minutes to be seated on a Saturday at 4:00pm which was impressive. Our server Mel was friendly and made sure everything was good with our meal. He definitely knows great customer service. The prices are a little higher than other places in the area but the quality and service are top notch.
author: Micah C.

description:
I loved and enjoyed my experience here so much that I decided to bring my family here to give it a try. We came on a Friday evening and were given a table in less than 5 minutes (without a reservation). The staff were extremely nice (as expected) and very, very polite. 

The kids were handed a kids menu (priced reasonably)
and ordered cheeseburgers with fries, which were mouth watering. 
We ordered 2 clam chowders ( 1 in a bread bowl and 1 is a regular bowl), the swordfish, chicken pasta, and fish n chips. 

We left over-the-top happy and satisfied with the service and our meal. 

This is a must-try restaurant if you come to SF.
author: Nora N.

description: Good food, good ambience, good view.  A bit pricey, but worth it if you are travelling!
author: Jeffry B.

description: Last time we visit here the food is okay but the service is really bad. The man who served us like a robot and did not really care. This time I go to the restaurant with my parents and my baby. The hostess told us the wait is about 25 mins. We wait for nearly an hour and no response. In the mean while other parties that have the same number of people who arrived later than us were served. I asked the hostess again, she went for a while and went back saying our table is cleaned up and will be ready soon. We waited for another 10 mins and decided to go for another place. Can't ask a baby to wait for more than an hour to get some food. Never come back to this place again. Horrible
author: Tony N.

description: Thoroughly disappointed with the food and the service here.  The waiter got the order wrong.  Got the crab cake and grill plate which was both pretty plain.  Definitely can't recommend this place.
author: Szu W.

description: Recommended by one of my friends and Fog Harbor didn't disappoint. Food and service were excellent! Our server was very nice and thoughtful. Will definitely go back here on our next SFO trip!
author: Ruby C.

description:
5 stars! And worth every one of them! We stopped by here for dinner on a busy Saturday evening around 6 pm and waited only about 20 minutes before we sat down at our table. STUNNING views, even without a table right next to the window you can see them! The staff was so friendly and fast throughout our visit (shoutout to Tyler our awesome waiter who made our visit  that much better!) Not only was the staff and atmosphere great, the food was absolutely AMAZING! We had the bread bowl clam chowder , sol fish plate and mixed grill plate and everything was SO good and a great portion size. 

Overall - if you're in the area, I highly recommend you stop here and give it a try! (you won't regret it!)
author: Robin C.

description: My friend and I came here for a quick bite to eat. Cucumber Collins (drink) was refreshing and not drowning a gin. The Calamari we ordered was lightly breaded and seasoned, still had an excellent crunch and the accompanying sauce was as perfect. If you're watching your salt intake this is a wonderful choice. We each had an order of half a crab (topped with chopped roasted garlic, butter and lemon). For people struggling with opening crabs these come pre-cracked and they provide a disposal bowl and wet wipe. Our waiter was attentive even when the restaurant filled up. We arrived around 1115 and it was perfect because by 12PM there was a wait line and the entire restaurant was full.
author: Brittanie W.

description: Setting was great. I had a shellfish tower and a New York steak. Everything was amazing. My bother had a mix grill and he loved it. Everything was amazing. I  was so satisfied with the presentation and the flavor. Unfortunately I wasn't able to get the deserts because I was to full. But I would definitely go back for it next time. I wish I remember my waitress name. She was a great and patient to take my orders.
author: Elizabeth H.

description: While visiting San Francisco for work, I decided to have dinner at Pier 39. I had the popcorn shrimp as an appetizer and the lobster tail as my meal. My meal was amazing. I only give the restaurant four stars because of the subpar service I received.
author: Caden A.

description: Walked in at 730pm on a Friday night with a party of 8 and they were able to seat us right away at a great round table in a quieter corner in the bar area with spectacular views of the water.     Five stars right there!     Amazingly attentive Waite staff and very quick with bringing out drinks and appetizers and dinner orders.     We ordered the seafood tower which was good but seemed a bit small for all of us.   The Crispi calamari was very crisp and maybe a bit heavy on the batter, but very good.   Several ordered the fish stew and said it was great.  Several others ordered the scallops risotto.   The scallops looked a bit small to me although everyone really enjoyed their food.   I ordered a house salad which was huge so share it if you order and a bucket of clams.    All very good and we left very satisfied.
author: June C.

description:
This restaurant is located on Pier 39 and a hidden gem for locals like me!

Mostly filled with tourists on the 2nd level near the main entrance, it's easily missed or overlooked.

Been here several times and the crab salad hasn't disappointed! Refreshing salad that can be shared by two with very generous amounts of crab. 

Our group also ordered a seafood pasta, crab salad and halibut. All was delish but nothing beats the crab salad!

Service was attentive and our waiters each visit was nice and friendly. 

To top it off, the view of the waters was a plus and the restaurant validates up to 2 hrs of you park in the adjacent garage.
author: The Sun '.

description: Delicious Caesar salad with crab and avocado. Seafood sampler was a must have also. Both were refreshing and tasty. Great service and great view of Pier 39
author: Connie V.

description:
I must admit when I first walked up to Fog Harbor I was extremely skeptical.  Like seriously, a seafood restaurant in Pier 39?  Being a native of the Bay Area I always associated Pier 39 with overpriced parking and totally tourist trap restaurants.  Value, flavor, and good service in this area historically was very hard to come by.  

But alas, my wife was craving seafood and we were already on location so I said - why not?!   So my wife and I shared a shellfish platter for 2 and my kids shared the sliders appetizer.  The dinner also came with delicious warm sourdough - which was absolutely delicious - and went along perfectly with the shellfish platter's garlic/butter sauce - like a delicious slice of warm garlic bread MMMMMMMMmmmm...

The shellfish platter portion size was very generous, and the crab meat was tender and sweet.  I am a big fan of shellfish - and I felt the mussels and clams were absolutely wonderful!  Shrimp were on the smaller size - but still nice nonetheless.

The star of the show however was our waiter - Jose.  He was amazing in his attentiveness - he even brought out a live "condemned" lobster to cheer my crying daughter up.  He totally went the extra mile to make our experience incredibly memorable.   Kudos to Jose!
author: Ryan Y.

description: Located on Pier 39 this restaurant offers beautiful views both day and night. The decor is upscale and the service is very good. The clam chowder is nice and hearty, not skimpy like most places. I recommend it! Our fish and crab were cooked just right and what I would say was a good portion.
author: David B.

description: Beautiful view of the harbor. The food was on point. Delicious and fresh. The service is great too. They even brought me a phone charger.
author: Dina K.

description: Great food,  great service,  excellent kids menu.   we. Ordered a light lunch - their famous clam chowder, crab cakes, grilled fish kids meal and grilled shrimp kids meal. Everything tasted great - not oversalted to make to for lack of flavor. We appreciated the fact the there were healthy options on the kids menu in addition to the usual suspects.  Clam chowder was indeed one of the best we've ever tried.  Will be back when we're in town again
author: Lily C.

description:
The employees are very rude. I went there with my husband and son. There was some ocean view table available but they didn't give us any! They served complementary bread and butter to everybody but they didn't give us ! Oh we look poor huh! 
We ordered mixed grill and grilled shrimp brochette for us and grilled shrimp from kids menu. Even the food taste was like their employees attitude! Only the calamari was good. We visited almost all the restaurants there. This one is the worst. Even my 3 years old Throw his food. Need to buy for him from other place. Never ever to this place again.
author: Nawarid N.

description: I am never the one to write reviews, but Fog Harbor left me no choice! I had the clam chowder, & I can see why it's award winning! I also had the seafood penne (sub-linguine) it was AMAZING! I don't eat cilantro, & they had no problem making me a new dish without cilantro! Our server Ashley was nothing short of amazing. Ashley's customer service was the best I've had in a long time! I am huge on customer service. My experience overall was dope! I will be back really soon!
author: Charity M.

description:
The Fog House was a great dinner spot to end a beautiful day out in the Bay Area. With a great view of the Golden Gate Bridge and Alcatraz, the setting is beautiful to start. The restaurant's ambiance is very nice even though it is clearly very busy!

The hardest part was trying to figure out what to choose with the tasty menu options available!

I asked for the waitress' opinion for a starter - half a dozen oysters or the 2017 prize winning clam chowder highlighted on the menu. She recommended the oysters and they did not disappoint but......I ended up ordering a cup of the clam chowder TOO (adding crab to it) - YUM! The complimentary sourdough bread combo'd perfectly with the chowder.

For the main course the choice was the trio of the salmon, swordfish & shrimp that came with mashed potatoes & grilled asparagus. DOUBLE YUM! It was tough to pick a favorite but I'd give the swordfish a slight lead over the other two; the asparagus was grilled & seasoned perfectly too! The potatoes were not bad but didn't stand out.

Soooooo.....this was already plenty of food and most people wouldn't bother considering dessert .....until the options were presented! So many choices that looked delicious but my choice was the blondie and it was really good!

In case I wasn't clear enough, I'd highly recommend this Pier 39 restaurant option. Enjoy!
author: Shawn O.

description: Fog Harbor Fish House is really nice. It is really kid friendly,they have a layer of large paper on top of the table cloth so you can draw on it. You can also see a good view and their food is delicious!
author: Annie C.

description: This place is wonderful!! Great customer service, I had made reservations and there was no wait when is showed up ( I did show up a little early though)just over all it was an amazing experience. The food was awesome and I would definitely go back and recommend others to go there. I give FogHarbor Fish House 5 stars!!!
author: Lovelly M.

description:
Checked out this place only because of its great Yelp reviews. Let's just say I was not disappointed. 
I had the Shellfish Tower ($68) which is pricey but good. I actually didn't want the lobster but it was the only way to get everything else in this chilled double platter. The iceberg wedge salad was excellent ($10). My picky-eater son like the Kids Fish & Chips too. 
Our waiter ("Bong") was very attentive and friendly. He was not pushy and often came to refill our water glasses. Great atmosphere as well.
author: Lee C.

description: Delicious food and professional waiters. Although located in Pier 39, a very touristy locale, Fog Harbor exceeded expectations. The mixed grill was exceptional as was the clam chowder and shrimp cocktail. Reasonably priced for SF
author: Fred G.

description:
We were hard-pressed to find a restaurant that met everyone's needs: my mom wanted seafood, my dad is a picky eater and seemingly only eats red meat, and we didn't want to spend a fortune. The only place I could find with two dollar signs that served both seafood and steak was the Fog Harbor Fish House. They were concerned about it being too touristy, and were also put off by the fact that we couldn't get a reservation, but I wanted to give it a chance.

Well. Sure, it's at Pier 39, but it's not "touristy" in the typical sense. It's elegant, and very San Francisco. It has a wonderful view of the bay, and our window faced the lovely sunset over Mt. Tam.

They really do reserve most of their tables for walk-ins; we were nervous about walking up at 6 p.m. without a reservation, but we only had to wait 15 minutes.

The food was exquisite. I had the seafood penne, which was to die for. The mussels are HUGE! Others had the mixed grill, the seafood platter, and the Fog Harbor burger. Everyone loved their meals, and our waitress, Ashley, was very kind and attentive.

As for the price, it's a bit more than two dollar signs. But graded on a curve, I'd say that it is less expensive than other places that serve similar fare. Each dish could have easily cost $5-10 more elsewhere.

This would be a lovely place to bring visitors from out of town or a local date just the same.
author: Kelsey S.

description:
Our waiter Justin, was absolutely awesome!
He really knows his wines and what pairs right together!
author: Bruce D.

description: This place is a bit overrated although the quality of food is decent, none of the seafood taste exceptionally fresh for being on the Pier.. Nice View , Service was OK, overpriced..
author: Head Chef F.

description: The drinks were really really good and the mussel fries are delicious but the chef needs to cut back on the pepper. Everything we had seemed to have way too much pepper in it. I had to send something back because all I tasted was pepper. The staff was really nice about it though and got me another dish ... which also had too much pepper on it but was more edible than the previous dish.
author: Chris R.

description: Outstanding view, exceptional food, and excellent service by Justin! Wow! In addition, the chef even custom made my Risotto due to my pepper allergy! Add to all of this, the prices were reasonable. So impressive! And their sour dough bread was soooooooooooooooo yummy!
author: Nancy A.

description: This place was awesome! Don't be fooled that its in a tourist part of town the food is amazing. The hibiscus margarita with the foam was delicious! We got the crab and scallop risotto and ahit tuna which were fantastic. For as big of a wait as we had on a Sunday for dinner it was only 20 minutes and the service was super attentive and food came out quickly. Great views of the Bay and Golden Gate don't hurt too!
author: Alison T.

description: Very nice place. Superior clam chowder with fresh crab on top. Husband had beautiful scallop risotto. Our friends had a crab salad( enough for a family of 6) and our non seafood friend enjoyed the steak dinner. All served in fine style. Our host, Lulu, was friendly, charming and helpful. A wonderful dining experience on Fisherman's wharf. Started dinner with Dark and Stormy cocktails.
author: Linda M.

description: Shell fish platter is my favorite. The food was delicious. However, the service wasn't that impressive. For example, we asked for water but our waitress served it to us when we almost finish the meal. She really looked messy.
author: Beatriz K.

description: The restaurant is  situated adjacent to the ocean where the view is breathtaking. The customer service was wonderful. We will definitely be returning before the week is over.
author: Irma C.

description:
I made the conscious decision to eat at Fog Harbor Fish House with my kids in our first visit to San Francisco. There was no line but the place had lots of diners. Although we weren't given the window table, it was still a very nice experience to be guided to your table by affable attendants. My kids ordered their salmon children's meal and they had a great time waiting for their meal because of the crayons and the coloring papers. For myself, I splurged on lobster tails and crab cakes to share. I had Anchor beer to wash it down. 

The lobster was fresh and just juicy. It was yummy! And the crab cakes! The kids really enjoyed their salmon and they said that it was the best they ever had! 

We didnt wait that long for the food and we also didnt dally long inside the restaurant. It was a splurge worth having!
author: Iris R.

description: I was wanting seafood or fish and this was place. We were lucky & got seated without any wait time. First came the sour dough bread & it was hard not to say yes to a second basket.
