My dinner was the grilled prawns cod & salmon. Sides were fresh green beans & garlic mashed potatoes. It was delicious. My husband ordered the hamburger & it was a big burger, he couldn't finish it. We wanted to order a dessert( saw others orders they looked very yummy, but we were too full. We were very pleased with our meal & atmosphere.
author: Christina B.

description:
Excellent!

Had the Seafood penne; mixed grill;  fried calamari; red chili garlic shrimp--- all amazing! Highly recommend!
author: Sussie C.

description: Great service fresh seafood and lovely views of the Golden Gate Bridge. I definitely advice reservations! I made reservations for my family and only waited for less than 5 mins before we were seated. I absolutely I love this place, will be returning
author: Sales M.

description: Came back again for Fleet Week and this place is still as amazing as I remembered. The mussel fries were still ah-freakin-mazing(!) and the clam chowder was really good. It was my boyfriend's first time and he was in heaven. They sat us next to the windows where the Blue Angels were putting on a spectacular show. Everything was perfect and it was a lunch to remember. Thank you Fog Harbor!
author: Hoyan L.

description: Quite the place for sum yummy chowder that's forsure. Nick our waiter was definitely on par for god service and speediness. It's less than 5 stars for the sole purpose of cleanliness. As you walk around to get to your table and leave there was so much dirty tables and stuff on the floor-not the best first impression. The hostesses were very nice and the wait area is quite cozy
author: Angie R.

description:
Hmmm about this place. It's ok, if you are a tourist and want to eat at the pier by the water, but then again, there are other options, and I'd prefer Scoma at Fishermans Wharf for the parking situation.

Fog Harbor Fish House - the food is very standard and mediocre, over priced of course, but that is expected. Knock off half a star.

It's hard to make reservations and the lines are always so long because of tourists. They'll validate you for the garage, but only for 1 hour, which is ridiculous because the wait itself would take up a lot of that time. The garage is then $9 and hour after that. Knock off half a star.

All the above can be forgiven because the view, BUT knocking off 2 stars because the service. Service was not great at all. We had reservations but was constantly reminded that the entire party had to be there, and that they would only hold our table for 15min. Our waitress was not the most attentive and served our entree and appetizers all at once (oh and the clam chowder in bread bowl last). Granted we were sharing everything among 9 people, but at least you could separate the appetizers / salads / soups and serve them first. 

Our table was so crowded, we didn't know where to start eating, and as we ate the appetizers, salads and soups, our entrees sat at the table getting cold.
author: Cynthia X.

description: THIS PLACE IS GORGEOUS! Absolutely adore this place and the wait staff. My garçon was perfect and elegant. 10/10 would come again.
author: Jack B.

description: Not sure why this place has such great reviews, but every aspect of our dinner was disappointing. The silverware was dirty! It wasn't cleaned properly and still had food stuck. Server didn't even acknowledge that fact and just replaced it without saying anything. The fish and chips, and the penne were not worthy of more words.
author: K M.

description: Had the seafood penne and the sole. Both were very good. The penne was very flavorful and the sole was refreshing. I would order either of them again, although I would want to try the ahi next. I love that you can put yourself on the waitlist via Yelp so we could wander around. Our friend had their dog from site seeing all day and was glad that the restaurant could still accommodate us.
author: Sheila E.

description:
I would not go back here. Only thing this place has going for it is the location and view. Seemed like I was on a cruise ship.

Poor quality food and vibe is not typical SF.

The menu was all over the place too.
author: Biby B.

description: Go for the fresh rolls and the Dungeness crab! The fried calamari was amazing. Make sure to finish dinner with the blondie.
author: Nichole H.

description: This place is right in the middle of where all the tourists are, so expect long waits especially on the weekend. Even with the long line we decided to wait the 45 minutes and it was worth it. The view from inside was great and the food was delicious. We ordered the seafood tower, steak, fried shrimp, and clam chowder. All the seafood was fresh and tasted like so. The clam chowder is probably the best you can get on the wharf.
author: Charles P.

description:
I originally chose this place because of the beautiful view. And that did not disappoint at all. But, if you have the option, come during daytime! The harbor is a bit dark at night.

Our server was very sweet and helpful with suggestions.
My friend and I decided to share a few dishes. We started with the calamari. Tasty and not overly fried, though I can't say I would order it again. 

For our entree we had the cioppino. Our server kindly had the plate split without us even asking.
I'd been wanting to have cioppino in San Francisco for the longest time, because I found out that is where it's originated from (I found this out while looking for it everywhere in Italy LOL). They were anything but stingy with the portion of seafood - though I wouldn't have minded a little more crab hehe. And as this is a fish house on the harbor, the seafood was all super fresh! But unfortunately, I've had better cioppino elsewhere. Maybe it was something off about the broth, but I remember not feeling completely satisfied. Maybe my expectations were just too high.

But my slightest bit of disappointment with my less than perfect cioppino was ceased when the dessert menu was brought out! They all looked so good that my friend and I had trouble deciding... but luckily there was a dessert with two mini portions! This worked out perfectly as my friend wanted the creme brulee and I wanted the dark chocolate mousse.
The creme brulee was delicious! Sweet and perfectly glazed on top.
The chocolate mousse... sent me to heaven. Perfect blend of bitter and sweet. Literally just melted in my mouth.

Perfect way to start our SF trip!
author: Marika D.

description: The restaurant water view is amazing at Pier 39. I recommend  ordering Shellfish Platter and clam chowder they are delicious.
author: Jenny S.

description:
I would give them a four or five stars, but 3 out of the 50 servers actually wanted to be there. Hardly any of them had a good attitude or were pleasant. The food was excellent, but they made you feel like you were imposing on their time at their restaurant.

Thank you for your response. Im not sure how to leave a comment on a comment, so hopefully you get this. I'm not going to say the name of my server because as I looked around, I only found one server... shorter Hispanic older gentleman... that seamed to be personable and desired to work. I was there on Friday night, March 30th.
author: Aaron P.

description:
By far the best thing I've had since being in San Fran. Got the ahi tuna steak and it made my taste buds jump! It truly just melted in my mouth. 
I can not wait to return one day to have this again. 
The mix drinks were fair. 
The atmosphere seemed like it was trying to be a bit classier but there was a lot more casual feel to it.
Overall service was decent. 
The view if you get seated well is enjoyable.
author: Jax W.

description: This was my wife and I's first taste of San Francisco seafood.  There are countless options in and around the San Fran area.  We had the baked oysters, clam chowder in a sourdough bowl, and there calamari.  All dishes were excellent.  Would recommend the baked oysters especially.  The views from the restaurant of the bay were great, only knock on this place was price.  But I guess your also paying for the real estate on which you sit.
author: Scott S.

description:
Great seafood with a view. A little on the expensive side, as expected for the prime location. The restaurant itself is done up really well, and they have a swanky looking bar. The space is huge; Even with no reservation on a Friday night we got a table for 3 in 10-15 minutes, so not a crazy long wait. Service was quick too, which is not often the case in a big space.

The spicy red chilli shrimp and garlic roasted crab were excellent!
author: Nilay P.

description:
Best restaurant in Fisherman's Wharf! 

Delicious food with excellent services. Calamari was fried to perfection, flavorful creamy seafood penne and yummy creme brûlée. 

Truly enjoyed ourselves and would definitely come again in next trip!
author: Eliza I.

description: All of my followers know I love good food. I'm a bit of a foodie. While visiting in San Francisco, my wife and I had a yearning for some great seafood. San Francisco is noted for its great seafood restaurants. We were not disappointed at all. The Dungeoness crab with garlic was awesome. This has to be the best clam chowder I have ever had; not too salty, just simply fantastic. Their clam chowder had no grains of sand in it. It was perfectly prepared. Simply amazing, and it is an award-winning restaurant. Enough said, I highly recommend this place.
author: H. Bill R.

description: Stopped by with the wife today.  The crab cakes were the best I've ever had.  I would go back just for that alone.  Wow, out of this world.  Almost ordered another one but I had the shellfish platter.  That's was great too.  Service was commendable.  Wife had the chicken pasta penne was okay and average.  I'm giving the place 5 for my dishes.  Bread was okay.
author: A T.

description: Food was delicious and the service as great. Same goes for the drinks.. both the alcoholic and non-alcoholic ones were so yummy and pretty. The seating can get a bit tight, but nothing terrible.
author: Mari F.

description:
Service was great, interior and view was excellent, food was delicious. The only thing I didn't care too much for was the clam chowder bowl.

They have us a bowl of bread which we wish we saved for the appetizer we ordered. 
We got the chilli shrimp, it was so delicious !! They topped it off with two garlic bread, but we devoured that so quickly because the sauce was perfection. We would have used the bread they gave us in the beginning to dip it in the sauce. (I'm sure they would he gave us more if we asked)

Then I ordered the shellfish platter for one, cooked cajun style because I special requested it that way. I wouldn't have it any other way, it was finger licking good.

The clam chowder bowl with crabs was slightly bland for my tasting. I didn't care too much about it. 

I highly recommend the chili shrimp and shellfish platter! 

Enjoy!
author: Teena N.

description:
This is my second visit to Fog Harbor.  Both times we've had delicious meals served by a highly efficient, friendly wait staff. 

Because it is on Pier 39, which is the tourist epi-center of the entire city of San Francisco (literally filled with mediocre restaurants and shops selling souvenirs) I initially thought this restaurant would be mediocre too.  I was wrong.

The restaurant is located right at the front of Pier 39 on the second story, west side.  Most tourists just keep going past the entrance to the pier and head deeper.  When we arrived at lunchtime, there was a big crowd waiting to get in.  the Hostess is at the front in a  refined, but crowded waiting area.  With people lined up to give their names and get on the list, I anticipated not being able to get in or make any sort of request for desired seating style.  the hostess was personable and informed us that we would have a fifteen or twenty minute wait (which was surprising considering how many people were there waiting).

They had a few nice chairs and couches to wait on, or you could lounge outside on the second deck and people watch or sit on a comfortable couch/lounge chair while waiting for your turn.  We were called and seated in a booth (as requested) in less time than anticipated - less than five minutes.

Our waiter was very friendly and highly efficient.  

My wife ordered a fried seafood combo plate - Shrimp, fish and calamari served with cole slaw and fries.  She raved about the taste.  I had a dish of clam chowder (exceptional even by frisco standards) and fried Scallops served with a garlic/jalapeno Aoli.  

All dishes were exceptionally well prepared, flavorful, large enough in quantity to either require a take home bag or leaving some on the plate uneaten.  The hot sour dough bread that arrived before our meal was fragrant and crusty - so delicious.

Each time I've been a guest here, I have been impressed with how this restaurant handles the high volume of customers without making them feel as though they're in a production line.  Everyone is seated quickly and service is comprehensive and thoughtful. It leaves you with a feeling of a fine dining experience with great food and service.
author: Len M.

description: How much I love this place! Food was fantastic. Make sure to reserve a table. Don't skip the dessert tray, you won't regrea
author: Glorimar A.

description: I was dinning alone so sat at the bar. Service was fine, nothing special. Food was okay until I found a hair in my mash potatoes. I got the mixed grill and the salmon was under done, still slimy in the middle. Best part of my dinner was the hot fresh bread and the Strawberry-Basil Nojito. I wouldn't go back. Many other places to choose from.
author: Shannon B.

description:
Came here because of the insane amount of reviews and rating. I was no disappointed!

First off, the view really makes this restaurant. If it wasn't for the view, I do not think it would be as popular as it is based off the food alone. The food was good, but in teams of seafood, there are much better places to eat.

We sat at the bar and loved every second of it. The bartenders working were both awesome. Two older guys who had huge personality and top notch service. We tried a few different things off the menu, but the clam chowder was the best hands down. Even though it's not the best I've had in the city, it did a pretty damn good job. The fish I had was tasty but everything else they threw on the plate really took away from the protein itself. My roommate had lobster, which he said was incredible. The drinks we ordered were are very sweet but tasty nonetheless. 

The line is insane. Make sure you are prepared to wait because you will and for a while. We were really lucky to find a seat at that bar almost immediately! If not, we would have waited at least 45 minutes for 2 people.
author: Zoe F.

description: Was initially hesitant to have dinner here with some guests as I thought it was a typical tourist trap. Food and service was great plus we had the best table we could ask for on a Saturday night. Not cheap though.
author: Ramon P.

description:
Food - okay, standard selection 

Strengths - location  on the wharf; calamari; chowder w/extra crab meat; luckily got server who was nice (exception to the experience of almost the majority of the staff); plenty of food selections

Drawbacks - A LOT 
* rude staff almost from start to finish 
* outdated food choices; menu selections seem to be TBT (about 20-30 years ago)
* inflated prices due to catering to tourists
* unimpressed with flavors of main meals... nothing memorable or special 

Overall - not worth it...better to be in the city and get food that looks and tastes fresh... well not be returning
author: Melissa K.

description: Yes, it's a great location... but I really didn't get the 'wow' factor on the food. It reminded me of a Cheesecake Factory style of restaurant. I was hoping the food would be higher quality and local. The service was friendly and the presentation was nice but I probably wouldn't recommend this place.
author: Allison H.

description:
this place is OKAY. 
prices are not cheap at all ,but reasonable due to its location. 


the steak is not that impressive, i prefer texas roadhouse for steak. 

their bread/biscuit is Okay i prefer the free bread at Lucilles BBq or cheesecake factory. 

in totality, my experience is OKAY 6/10 

its not the restaurant that i would love to go back and crave for their dish. 

its a restaurant that you would choose to meet your friends since this restaurant has the most reviews and easy to pick.
author: John Christopher P.

description:
Would definitely recommend Fog Harbor for a great meal. We went the first time after reading the reviews here on Yelp. We went back the next day because of the meal and service we received the night before. 
 Our waitress Susan was amazing! The chowder was one of the best we've had .. and having lived on the central coast (Splash Cafe) , we are very critical of clam chowder. 
  My wife had the fish and chips and I had the fried seafood combo. Both meals were fresh and crunchy and sauces were a nice compliment to the food. The slaw had a good tang with a hint of horseradish or wasabi ?
 The staff was very attentive and manager Juan came by to see how our experience was .. nice touch!
  See you next time we are in town! 
 Go Dodgers !!!!!
author: Dave F.

description:
We were lucky enough to get a seat at a table that had a beautiful view of Alcatraz and the bay. Can't complain there! Fisherman's wharf is super touristy so I didn't have high expectations for this place. I'd say it was what I expected. I ordered the crab roll which was MASSIVE. The crab to bread ratio is kind of off but it really fills you up. Fries come with it so it was hard for me to finish everything. Pricey but it's seafood in a touristy area so what do you expect. 

This place seemed to be higher rated than most in the area so I'm glad I went here. One and done for me though.  Definitely ask for a table with a view it makes a difference!
author: Salil K.

description: Wow! Just look at this smile! The best hostess ever! Kristina was so nice and has just the best customer service! From the time she took our reservation until we left she was really professional and at the same time personable, even though the restaurant is so busy considering it's in the tourist area. WFrom the food menu we tried scallops with risotto, cioppino and mixed grill! Everything was for 10! Our server Jane was also very nice and attentive!
author: Srdjan S.

description: The service was not good. I love the food so much. The wedge salad was fantastic. The bleu cheese on that was 11/10.
author: Chandler C.

description:
I had the crab ravioli special. It was really, really good. I was upset though, because I bit into hard chunks of shell three different times. It was a huge turn off, especially if I'm paying almost $30 for it and no shells are supposed to be in the meal. 

The fish and chips were awesome. The flavor of the batter was very good. Fries were great also. Not sure I'd ever go back but I enjoyed the meal I had well enough!!

Service and view were the best parts of the meal.
author: Erin J.

description: Our first time eating at Fog Harbor Fish House. Whenever we visited San Francisco, we always ate at the Crab House. However this time we tried Fog Harbor and food was good. We ordered several entrees to tryout and I would say clam chowder was the best. Calamari was somewhat okay nothing special, oysters as well, I tried better oysters at other location. Service was good and overall good restaurant to visit if you are at Pier39.
author: Sophie L.

description:
We loved this place. Came to
Celebrate my Moms Birthday and the food and service did not disappoint ! Really good clam chowder if you're looking for a chowder spot. One of the best I had all weekend !
author: Kelsey R.

description:
Very turístic, good service, average food.
My personal best was the clam chowder with crab
author: Enrique L.

description: Brady Bunte - I stopped into Fog Harbor for lunch after wandering at Pier 39.  It truly was an amazing place. The food was delicious and the service was attentive. The baked oysters was such an awesome starter.  Perfect for a nice relaxing lunch on the pier with amazing views.
author: Brady B.

description:
This is one of the best place to have dinner in San Francisco. The view, the service, the food.... everything was simple perfect!!! 
Don't miss this wonderful restaurant, will be memorable.
author: Mercedes C.

description:
After a local who works at my hotel  recommended that me & my friend go to Pier 39 to check out some action and grab a bite to eat...we decided to give this restaurant a shot.  I am glad we did- although it was crowded- it was suggested that we sit at the bar because we were told it is a 'full service bar'.  

The bartenders were friendly and made drink recommendations which we were glad we agreed.  We both had a flovered type of martini and it was delicious!  It was so good that we both quickly ordered another round.  

My friend ordered the crab roll & I went with the red chili shrimp & calamari.  All of the food was FRESH, seasoned and prepared perfectly.  The portions were sizeable & we both couldn't finish our meals.

During our time at the restaurant, all of the staff were super friendly and attentive.   

This restaurant is expensive, but it is worth it for the service, quality of food and location- Outstanding Views!
 
I would recommend to anyone to stop in and at least have a drink.
author: Shane J.

description: Beyond delicious! My husband and I absolutely enjoyed our meals! My palate is in heaven! Definitely recommend this place and plan on returning.
author: Cedes P.

description: This place is a little bit more on the expensive side but come on, it's seafood in San Francisco! The lemon calamari is really good for an appetizer and the clam chowder bread bowl is great too
author: Kim H.

description: I come often to this place.  I normally sit at the bar. The views .....and drinks are amazing.  The entrees sizes are enough to share.  Friendly staff.
author: Verseau E.

description: If you love seafood and you love fresh sourdough bread, this is the place to go. Great service, better food, and the best tiramisu I've ever had. They don't even care what you're wearing even though it seems like a fancier restaurant.
author: Susan K.

description:
The Good: Food, ambiance, service
The Bad and The Ugly: the long long wait

Cold and starving - not a situation anyone should be in.

Hankering for some seafood, we stumbled into this place, after reading reviews of nearby places. And boy was I glad that we did.

After some delicious clam chowder to warm me up, tried their Cioppino. Accompanied with some Pinot Gris, my god it was the best meal I've had in a long while. For the amount of seafood I got, it was well worth the money.

We were able to avoid the 1+ hour wait (despite being on the wait-list) by looking for some seats at the bar. The very attentive bartender made the whole experience that much better.

In short, based on what I've experienced, a definite go to at the Fisherman's Wharf.
author: Average R.

description:
We ate a late lunch at Fog Harbor after arriving in San Francisco, jet lagged and hungry. It was around 2:30 and we were seated right away at a window overlooking the pier. The place was pleasantly busy. 

Our server was kind and pleasant. 

We started off with the calamari appetizer with lemon aioli and it was perfection. We asked for more aioli and it was brought with a smile. 

I ordered the Seafood Penne and again, it was perfection. Perfect pasta, creamy tomato sauce, shrimp, mussels, and clams. It truly satisfied.

My husband ordered the Fried Combo which is fried fish, calamari, and shrimp and while it was good it was nothing special. It came with fries.

For dessert we had the Blondie Sundae because hubby is a lover of all things Biscoff. Chocolate chip style brownie square with walnuts, topped with vanilla ice cream, biscoff cookie crumbles and a biscoff sweet spread drizzle. It was delicious! 

We also each had a yummy raspberry lemonade cocktail which I can't remember the name of. It was quite good. 

Very impressed with Fog Harbor and would eat here again!
author: Juanita I.

description: The best part about this place was the bread before the meal. My girlfriend got the garlic shrimp. I hate when places burn shrimp on the skewer to a crisp. Their mashed potatoes were literally nothing more than mashed. potatoes. no salt or butter just bland the sautéed spinach if they were sautéed at all was only in the pan for a couple seconds. When I told the waiter he said that's the way they sauté it. Im sorry man the way you do it is wrong. I had the seafood penne it was just alright nothing special to be over 20 dollars. Someone tell me how this place is 4 stars because to me it's overrated. I don't know if it was 2 star bad but it wasn't good.
author: Dan S.

description:
tl;dr surprisingly nice place for a (potential) tourist trap, platter was great, crab (cake) delicious.

I am always incredibly skeptical when going to a restaurant in the middle of a tourist trap like the Pier. But sometimes people, or restaurants, surprise you, and for that I am grateful.

We ordered the crab cake for appetizer, and that was too tasty and too quickly we had annihilated the plate. The seafood platter was incredible, not just simply boiled but with plenty of herbs, garlic, lemon to give it the perfect flavor which let the seafood speak for itself mostly, fresh as they are. The Dungeness crab that came with the platter was delectable.

Service for such a busy place was at some point a little spotty but that's really the best you can expect, and the view was a very nice bonus to a great meal. Would come back again, though I'd skip the whole Pier part.
author: Derek F.

description:
My fiancée and I were looking for a good seafood place to eat lunch after walking around the fishermans wharf all morning. When we came across this place on yelp we were impressed with what they had so we gave it a a go.

First thing is that if you're coming for lunch on a Friday or weekend for that matter, expect to wait a while. I think we waited close to 45 min to be seated. No big deal as we just sat at the bar and killed time there. The only thing I regret is forgetting to request a window table to enjoy the view of the water. However looking back we probably would have waited longer and we were too hungry lol.

I had the garlic dungeoness crab... even though I ordered the half size, the waiter must have misheard me and got me the full order ($45). Fiancée had the mixed seafood which included grilled shrimp, grilled salmon, grilled swordfish. The crab was actually amazing! Well seasoned deep into the meat! And the crab was actually pretty meaty despite the size of it! The mixed seafood dish was really good especially the swordfish! We also shared a sourdough bread bowl with clam chowder, but nothing really too crazy about it IMO. 

Service was great, Despite the miscommunication about the crab. I didn't make a big deal about it because honestly I didn't feel like I had to. The food was great regardless.

Overall this place was really good and we would definitely be back! I would still have had the half crab because it was too much food for the full crab, but if you're going with a few people it probably would be good to share one whole crab.
author: Brian J.

description:
Every time my mom comes to SF I take her to get seafood at Fog Harbor Fish House. Great view of the bay and Alcatraz, located at Pier 39 so lots of touristy things to do within walking distance. Of course, with the tourist location comes tourist prices but it's not that bad. In terms of food, their award winning clam chowder is quite good (particularly with the added crab) 4/5. We usually come for the lobster (5/5 very fresh) and Dungeness crab (5/5 the garlic is seriously good! This is their best dish!); we have had some other dishes here and there that were reliably good but nothing that springs to mind 1-2 years later. Service is usually quite good and you can get seated usually within an hour even if there is a wait - no problem there's lots to do while you wait!

This time around we got the clam chowder again as well as the seared pacific cod and the mussel fries. The mussel fries were fabulous (5/5); being a seafood house you might not expect their fries to be top notch but they are, and the cream sauce was delicious. The Pacific Cod, which was the dish recommended by our waiter, was honestly our least favorite dish that we have tried here. I generally prefer for my cod to have that juicy, oily mouthfeel and the cod was a little dry, maybe due to the thickness of the fish (don't know if you can tell from the picture but it was about 1/4 inch thick when it arrived on the table). However our waiter was fabulous at everything else, including getting our check to us early as we had lost track of time and had an upcoming appointment.

My brother usually comes with us and always gets the burger because he doesn't like seafood. It's alright, but really why come to a seafood house for a burger? It does comes with those delicious fries.

Tl;dr: great views, great service, great area, generally great food. Get the clam chowder, lobster, mussel fries, and 100% get the Dungeness crab. Don't expect too much from the non-seafood options. Expect tourist prices given it's a tourist location; to me it's worth a few extra bucks a dish if we are going to be hanging out at the piers for the day anyway. We will be coming back!
author: Joanne S.

description: Overall good restaurant. Food tastes good and is of good quality. Servers did ok, nothing special. Food was a little expensive for what u get. In the old days, u would get soup and/or salad included w/ ur entree @ a nice restaurant like this. Now everyone is doing the upscale steak house style and charging u a la cart. The restaurant quality is not high enough 4 this style of menu, but again it is good food. Lastly and not that I usually care and it is CA, but some ppl were so underdressed for a restaurant that apparently wants to up upper scale that it was shameful. If u want to go to a linen table cloth restaurant with $40-$50 plate and wait staff in formal wear, then leave ur tank top, wife beater tee shirt, and other ghetto clothes @ home and @ least put on a tee shirt and jeans.
author: Ronald R.

description: Nothing beats warming up with a hot bowl of clam chowder! I also ordered the Seared Ahi which was lightly seared and well seasoned. The ahi was well complimented with the rice and vegetables.
author: Carter L.

description:
The food was pretty good. Baked oysters were room temperature, but tasty. Clam chowder was nice and hot, a good amount of clams. Swordfish was moist and delicious, however some of the potatoes were undercooked. The Perfect Hibiscus Margarita was actually PERFECT. I'm sure you're wondering why 3 stars..well the service was nonexistent. We were not checked upon by our waiter. Not once did he ask if everything was okay. After our dinner was finished, 30 minutes went past and I had to grab the waiter's attention for the check.

Side Note: I made the waiter aware that I was there celebrating my birthday. I guess they don't celebrate birthdays here and give a dessert as other places do, because nothing came after dinner.
author: Anjelica N.

description: The service was outstanding. The waiter was cute and polite. The clam chowder with crab and calamari were so good. We only waited 15mins for a seat. If we had to wait more than 30mins, it would not be worth it.
author: Vincent L.

description:
We came here in a group of 4 on Sunday night and had to wait about 10 minutes for a table.

Food: The bread was soft and went well with my appetizer. I ordered the clam chowder topped with crab (off the appetizer menu) and it was absolutely fantastic. They put a hearty amount of crab on the delicious clam chowder.

For the main course, I ordered the Dungeness crab ravioli. Not being a huge ravioli guy (but wanting some sort of non-bread carb with my meal) I didn't expect to be as blown away as I was. The ravioli was cooked thoroughly and the ricotta inside was smooth. The pasta itself paired well with the spinach and the Dungeness crab. Every bite was seriously perfection.

Atmosphere: The restaurant is fancy and more upscale. The waiters are all professionally uniformed. Lots of tables looked like dates or nice dinner nights out. 

Parking: Given that this place is literally on the pier, parking will be a hassle to drive to this place. I would recommend Uber or walking here during your tourist explorations in SF. 

Service: The service really matched the mood. Our waiter was well-mannered and polite. He even brought us a second batch of bread.

This place is not cheap by any means. Don't let the two dollar signs fool you. I would say this place should have $$$ next to it. However, if you're looking for a fancy night out, or some quality seafood (expensive but worth), or somewhere to impress a date, this is your place.
author: Jacob R.

description: I can't believe I've never written a review for this place. I absolutely love Fog Harbor. The cioppino was so amazing! It's the only thing I order when I go there. The fried calamari is also delicious! Service is always on point and so is the food.
author: Karren L.

description:
Disclaimer: Despite the fact that this restaurant has $$$, high stars and looks nice, you can totally get away with dressing casually!! 

The pricing of the dishes here were definitely a bit steep. 

We had gotten a dozen of the raw oysters which was served with some type of vinaigrette and also cocktail sauce w/ horseradish. It was basically your typical raw oysters - it wasnt specified what type of oysters they were. $34 for 12 oysters. 

Ahi Tuna Poke $18 - Loved the flavors in this! It was very fresh tuna served with some chopped mangoes. I thought the mangoes were a nice touch to balance out the flavors. Great appetizer to start out our meal with.

Clam Chowder w/ Crab - got the cup size to try ($7), to add crab was an additional $7, but well worth it! Had to really get that seafood experience, right? The chowder was good on its own, but the crab added an extra umph and texture. I enjoyed it. Their chowder was also rewarded best in SF! 

Seafood Penne $23 - The sauce for this was really favorable, but it didnt exactly "wow" me. The overall portion of the dish looked to be large, but once you get into it there was not a lot of penne within the actual dish. However, there was definitely a decent amount of seafood to compensate! For a small girl, i found that this dish was just enough for me. 

Alaskan Halibut $34 - This was part of their seafood menu. A bit of a disappointment. Although the fish was very soft and fresh, it lacked flavor. We are more so people who enjoy more flavor in our dishes. Had to use sauce from the pasta so the fish wouldnt be so bland. 

Apple Crisp $8.50 - We came here for our anniversary, so they gave us a complimentary dessert. So nice of them! At the end of your meal, the server will come out with a tray of desserts to choose from - you select the one you want and they will prepare you a new one from the back. I was silly and was about to grab it right off the tray. The Apple Crisp was delicious. Not too sweet and served with vanilla ice cream. Unfortunately, i was too full from the dinner that i couldnt finish the dessert - which never happens.

For being a high rating restaurant with steep prices, I would have taken this place to be a more upscale restaurant, but its a great spot to come for any occasion at any time of the day.
author: Kathy N.

description: This was the best thing that I had on my San Francisco trip! The food was delicious, and the service was great! We ordered the shellfish platter with a lobster, the seafood penne, which were all delicious, but the show stopper was the scallops and crab risotto. That was so delicious! There are four scallops that are beautifully cooked, and they were seasoned perfectly. The risotto itself was great, but I feel like it could've had a bit more flavor. If you can go, definitely go, and try those things listed above, especially the crab risotto. You can enjoy the view while having a delicious meal!
author: Fanny S.

description: Loved absolutely everything here! The service was great. The food was amazing and the dessert was pretty good too. We got the baked oysters and the garlic roasted crab and topped it off with the strawberry shortcake. Every one of those dishes were delicious and it's all thanks to our wonderful waitress who helped with recommendations.
author: Harshini R.

description: All I can say is wow. We were greeted by the friendly hostess and sat right away. Our server Justin was amazing. He was friendly and very helpful when it came to ordering, he recommended the seafood platter. We started out with the raw oysters and garlic bread with blue cheese. The oysters were perfection. The garlic bread was delicious. We had the cod fish and seafood platter for 2. There was 3 of us. The portions were great. The food was just delicious. The service was great. All around amazing experience and would definitely visit again when we're back in town.
author: Krystal N.

description: Had my anniversary dinner and it was absolutely gorgeous view  even though it was gloomy and the food was delicious. Loved the crab civiche
author: Mel R.

description: OMG, We found Nirvana! On a cold frozen night, we stumbled into This restaurant, sat at the bar have some drinks while waiting for our table. Then we realized how wonderful it was sitting at the bar and decided to have dinner at the bar. Our bartender was awesome, accommodating and gave awesome suggestions And individualized attention, I had the hibiscus margarita, ordered steamed clams, blue cheese garlic bread and The jumbo scallops and crab risotto. TO DIE FOR! I would definitely recommend this restaurant and would definitely be a returning customer time and time again! All food was spot on, not over salted or under seasoned, ambience was spot on and so grateful that we chose this restaurant! You will not be disappointed! I just cannot say enough about how wonderful this place is, and no, it's not the 3 hibiscus margarita talking either! LOL - my intuition was correct once again!
author: Laura G.

description:
Great place to bring out of town guests. Yes-- it is in the heart of a major tourist attraction-- but that is the point. 

The seafood dishes are fresh and delicious, and service always friendly. 

Always get the crab if it is in season!
author: Mimi T.

description: The views are to die for, the service is top notch, and the food was excellent! I got the shellfish platter and added a lobster tail. If you don't mind spending $8000 for dinner, this place is awesome! The sourdough bread was delicious. The chowder in a bread bowl was OK, but not as good as new England to be honest. My wife had some beef skewers for an appetizer that were absolutely delicious! Her risotto for dinner was weird... I couldn't tell if it was risotto or Rice-A-Roni! I guess that is the San Francisco treat... Ha ha. Anyway, the rice was not like a typical risotto. It wasn't sticky enough, and it needed I heckuva lot more Parmesan cheese and maybe just a tad more seasoning in general! It was very tasteless. Not a big enough let down to not give this place five stars though. It truly was an amazing place. Oh, and I know this is stupid, but the lemonade was awesome!
author: Jim C.

description:
I was here at Fog Harbor Fish House with my friends.. the foods were great .. I love sea foods that why i can say that foods are great and its my choice.. 
My favorite foods are the calamari, surf and turf, and Garlic Roasted Dungeness Crab.. love your blueberry press here! 
Me and my friends enjoyed our food because of the nice view.. very refreshing and stress free.. 
The crews/waiters here are friendly and accommodating! thumbs up!
author: Mega Team R.

description: Excellent. Clam Chowder was wonderful and my wife's mixed seafood grill was great. Good calamari too. Nice room.  Got lucky w seat on the window.
author: Jeff M.

description: Wait listed online, arrived and was immediately seated by the window. Cajun shrimp, scallop and Dungeness crab pasta dish was delicious! Service was outstanding!
author: Nycole R.

description: Outstanding service and food. We got lucky to sit right next to the sunset. I would definitely come back!
author: Mellie M.

description: I thought this was just ok.  Good views. Waiter was good. Food was ok. I didn't get all the rage about the clam chowder. However my crab cakes were really good. The wait was about 20 min on Friday for lunch around 1:30. Very busy place.
author: Michelle I.

description: Delicious food. Service by our bartender Tony was perfect! Calamari was amazing. Surf n Turf with filet cooked to perfection. Scallops with crab risotto phenomenal!
author: Jessica B.

description: I just had the BEST margarita ever.. please ask Quianna to make your next margarita, she has great energy and she's super sweet!! Thank you for awesome service Quianna i will be back to see you!!
author: Tanae C.

description:
There are lots of restaurants can cook crab or lobster, but we don't know which one is excellent. So through yelp , we chose this one.
We ordered 2 whole dungeness crabs, one is original and the other is garlic. We also ordered lobster ETC.
The best is dungeness crab, but they are not alive before cooking, died few hours ago. If they were staying alive before cooking would be perfect.
The situation and service here are also good .
author: Elliott Q.

description:
Great happy hour. My wife really loved her cocktail ($7) and my Anchor Steam beer ($5) was great. We got the calamari ($7) and it was good. 

No complaints at all. Atmosphere was great. Wish we could of stayed for a meal.
author: Alex S.

description:
Fog Harbor is definitely in a tourist hot spot, but that didn't stop me from kicking back and enjoying the view and going all in on a seafood feast.

We waited about an hour to get in, and while we were starving we were rewarded for our patience. Clam chowder, swordfish, crab cocktail -- all things that are infinitely better in San Francisco than my hometown and I enjoyed everything here thoroughly, despite the hefty price tag. 

Our service was fine, and I get that if you're a SF native you're probably not spending a lot of time around Pier 39 but this spot came through in the clutch and I'd recommend it.
author: Adam S.

description: First let me start by saying this place is a favorite of mine! I have had many staff wait on me and many different dishes however this is my FIRST review of it! I came today, Saturday probably the busiest day for them I'm guessing. I did not make a reservation For our group but I don't ever mind having a drinks with the bar first and then heading to a table, usually takes less thank 30. This staff is run around though! You can see how bustling it is when your waiting!!! We sat by a window this time which is always nice! The server we had today is hands down the best server I've had since coming here!!! Even though she was SO SO busy!! A lot of tables here don't speak English and they accommodate that well with photos (I bring clients here a lot in the day) however it can busy with everyone waving down your server. Our server Shawna was amazing! Girl never broke a smile the whole time!! Although I had been there my table guests had not so she went though the whole menu and how it's best to work it. We shared family style and everyone was impressed with every single thing!! Shawna had amazing attention to detail, always knew when we needed water, extra sauces, etc, also although it was so busy we didn't feel rushed at all! AMAZING SERVICE!!! Food was 10/10 only thing I would have changed was offering another ice cream flavor for dessert but alas one cannot have everything everywhere ! Ha! Thanks again for harbor and staff for a wonderful weekend meal! See you soon!!!
author: Tim F.

description: This was a great find!!! Fabulous views of the Bay and seals. We were seated right away, Had a great server, Justin H. Who helped us choose a great variety rather than just two entrees. Tried and loved; tuna poke, crab cakes, oysters & sautéed veggies! Would totally come back & recommend!
author: Courtney C.

description: A MUST visit for the seasfood lover! If you are looking for fresh and delicious seafood dishes, then this is your spot! Moderately priced but great quality seafood. The portions are good, the seafood is actually large. You won't have to fish for it in your Cioppino (no pun intended), which by the way is phenomenal. Beautiful waterfront views of Fisherman's wharf, casual dressy atmosphere, and they will validate your parking for an hour. Use the parking garage across the street and walk across the catwalk to Pier 39.
author: Tatiana V.

description: I love this place, especially love the oysters here! That paired with a view over the water and it's a great place to relax on a nice day. Bit on the costlier side, to be expected from a touristy street.
author: Maansi D.

description: Amazing seafood and breathtaking views! As someone with a gluten sensitivity and a dairy allergy, the staff here was more than accommodating and made me a delicious meal. Our waiter, Curtis, was extremely friendly, helpful, and attentive; he made the experience special!
author: Maggie W.

description: I had read many reviews before I got here and decided to give it a whirl. This was our first stop when we arrived to fisherman's wharf, we had a party of 9 about 230 pm on a Friday afternoon and were seated right away on the window side. We all sat down ordered a bunch of drinks and appetizers, at first I feel like the waitress was a little annoyed and wanted to rush us out of there but then later she did end her shift while we were still there so I'll give her the benefit of the doubt on that one. This was hands down some of the best seafood I've had. The calamari was delicious and perfectly cooked. The oysters were the most fresh delicious oysters I've ever had. The whole table tried an oyster even the people who aren't oyster lovers. We ordered the sliders which had such a delicious sauce on them which made them absolutely amazing. The blue cheese garlic bread was a nice touch on the menu however the taste doesn't really match the concept of this place. Overall the service was decent, the food was amazing and the view was awesome.
author: Jatin K.

description: The seafood spaghetti and clam chowder soup are great, but the butter garlic crab is so so. The server was really nice.
author: Jieun C.

description: Our experience all around was great. We were in a rush to eat prior to our flight, and our food was delivered in an incredibly timely manner. All around delicious. Our waiter, Curtis, was a blast from the start -- offering suggestions throughout our meal and maintaining a very upbeat and friendly attitude.
author: James Y.

description: I had the shell fish platter. All we're good, but the crab was excellent. My 15 year old son is problematic with food, so they agreed to allow me to order an off the menu item of pasta and tomato sauce.
author: Ed B.

description:
great fun, great drinks.... spring special "moscow mule" must tryyyyyyy.

Justin was an awesome host. Million star rating for Justin.
author: Rocky S.

description: I had bookmarked this place as one of our places to eat since we were going to be visiting pier 39 to see the sea lions. We got there and were told there was about a 20 minute wait. We waited about 20 minutes and were seated. This place is huge inside. It seems like it goes on forever. And it was busy! Very good menu of seafood and none seafood items. Good kids menu as well. Our table was by the window and I could see the sea lions at pier 39 while I ate which was AMAZING! I had a ceasar salad with shrimp and my husband had the seafood medley. They also bring fresh warm sourdough bread with butter which in itself was a big win! My husband loved his dish and I did mine as well. Would definitely come back the next time we come here.
author: Chrissie B.

description: Had 4 stars so we tried it. If you want super touristy, meh food, meh service, and very high prices-this is your place. So disappointing. :( The views are the only thing good about this place. Hoping this honest review deters a few people from wasting their time and money.
author: Erica C.

description: Normal seafood place. I got the garlic crab but didn't have much garlic.  Service was great and very friendly.
author: Bryan B.

description: Quick bite at the bar : calamari, YUM! It was lightly crispy to perfection.  Crap out of shell cocktail was nice and refreshing with nice portion.  The oysters were amazing, enough said. Let's not forget the view of Alcatraz you have while enjoying drinks and food.
author: Dennise M.

description: Excellent view and location, great food, decent service. I ordered the mixed grilled (salmon, cod, shrimp) with veggies and mashed potatoes. Loved my shrimp and veggies - they were delicious! Personally was disappointed in the salmon as my husband makes it better himself. My husband ordered the surf & turf. We're food people and he said the lobster was one of the best he's ever had! Our server wasn't very attentive nor was he friendly. Our bartender (while waiting on a table) was very nice though. We requested a table with a view and it was perfect. Alcatraz in the background. Must walk out to see the sea lions afterwards!
author: Sara C.

description:
Came here on Mother's Day and it's very crowded. We waited for 45minutes to be seated.

We tried clam chowder, ciopino, salad, calamari and selfish dish. The food is good enough, and pricy, not as I expected but service and ambience were great.
author: Sĩ Toàn N.

description: My friend and I came for a quick bite. We had the chowder and chocolate banana bread pudding, which was recommended by our server, Nev. Great food and great service. Thanks Nev!
author: C. K.

description: Excellent service, clean, friendly bar tender. Huge menu. Most of all their chowda w crab was off the charts, perfection.
author: Kevin L.

description: Came here for a bday dinner and got to get a great table overlooking the water. I ordered the special for that day which was delicious as well as the old fashion. The server was great and kept us entertained and the overall service was exceptional.  They do not take reservations on the weekend but we only wanted about 15 minutes from the time we put our name in to sitting.
author: Justin A.

description: In the heart of touristy fisherman's warf/embarcadero boasting the best sourdough bread bowl of clam chowder and seafood dishes . Great service  good food and quite large portions too. Not a relaxing place but definitely yummy
author: Gretchen J.

description: I had an amazing dinner experience here! I went on August 8th for my 25th wedding anniversary and the food as well as the service were amazing. Our waiter was Nav and he provided excellent service! He was very kind and helpful. The food was delicious and I highly recommend this restaurant :)
author: Zainab Q.

description:
This restaurant is THE eatery to visit when you're at Pier 39 in San Francisco! Although the 40 minutes wait was quite long, it was totally worth it. The food, service and view were superb.

We were seated by the window, which we like, and could see the pier and ocean. We ordered the special -- which was a combination of lobster tail and steak -- plus the linguini & clams pasta, a dozen fresh oysters, and clam chowder. To go along with all the seafood, white wine was a must. The oysters were fair in proportion, yet not large enough to "wow" you. The clam chowder was delicious in particular. It had enough ingredients for the three of us. My personal favorites would be the clam chowder and lobster tail + steak special. The steak was cooked medium rare, and it was quite a unique experience switching off tender, moist beef with tougher, lobster meat... We devoured it. The linguini & clams pasta was decent, but not the best.

Our server was kind and very attentive. He was clearly busy running around, yet addressed our needs and always wore a smile. The restaurant was packed, without a single empty table. I'm unsure whether they take reservations or not, but this is a worthwhile place to check out.

Last but not least: don't forget to validate your parking when leaving!
author: Sarah R.

description: Great seafood restaurant. I had the Cesar salad with Salmon and chowder soup. My husband had the crab risotto with scallops. The food was delicious and the service was attentive. It has a beautiful view of the water. I highly recommend this restaurant!
author: Leslie N.

description:
Clam chowder was marginal..very thick!
Crab roll was very good with plenty of crab and served with great fries
Crab Louie salad was fantastic with a big pile of crab, heirloom tomatoes ...just wonderful
Service was excellent
Date of visit was 9/15/17
author: Susan D.

description: We had a delicious dinner at the Fog Harbor Fish House on our first night in San Francisco. It can get very crowded however. We had a wonderful view of the bay and the boats. Mel was our server and he was fantastic! He was so friendly and made our dinner even more enjoyable.
author: Shirlene U.

description:
This was my first time to the restaurant. Solid process in reserving a table, special request was honored! Not only that, I made a error and still was successful in fixing my scheduled time! 

Food was on on point we ordered seafood tower, Clam chowder, and Ciapino!

Service was decent, although waitess forgot my order and took a while to being a extra set of utensils! Other than very attentive and knowledgeable!

DUCKHORN Cab was amazing!
author: Gary O.

description: Had a great meal at Fog Harbor Fish House!    Great Scenery  Great Ambiance  Great Food - clam chowder especially!
author: Maya C.

description: My waiter/ bartender was awesome and the sour dough bread was bomb!
author: Rachel C.

description:
Decided to go out on Saturday night down to Pier 39 to feast on some good seafood and this placed was the destination. I thought initially it would be a good idea to make a reservation because I thought it would be busy but when I called the lady on the line indicated that the only times available would be around 10:00 pm and that if I arrived early there would be plenty of seating. So, I arrived around 7:00 pm and waited in line briefly before being met by the hostess. When I finally asked about a table to hostess told me it would be about a 30 to 45 minutes wait for a table!!! At this point, I am so disappointed in having to wait because I was initially told that there would be tables available.

I give my name and phone number to be notified when my table will be ready. I then proceed to take my seat and wait. The system that they have here is that the will text you or call you when your table is ready if you are not in the area. One nice thing is that the staff said that the wait may be shorter than the estimated time that they provided which I found to be a bit comforting. As I wait I take a few pictures admire backdrop of the bay and the sights at the Pier. After 45 minutes go by I proceed to the hostess and ask if my table is ready. She then asks for my name and then looks through the names. She then says that she does not see my name. Then she proceeds to ask me who took my name and number and tell her that she took it. Apparently, according to her, she called out the name earlier and someone took my spot. WHAT!!! My next question is did she check the ID? I get a blank stare and no answer, figures! What is the point of taking the name and phone number if you are not going to verify this information, come on man!!!! At this point, she apologizes and says it will be five minutes. At this point, I am just infuriated and disgusted by the madness of trying to get a table. 

Eventually, I am seated and ready to order. My server Adam was the best! He is the sole reason why this rating is so high. He was absolutely phenomenal. His recommendations were helpful and made my meal decision a whole lot easier. His timing to check-in was right on and the dessert tray was incredible. Unfortunately, I did not order dessert because my food was so good and I was stuffed. But, had I ordered a smaller meal I most definitely would have gotten a least one or everything from the dessert tray. 

Overall, the food was great but getting inside was just so much of a hassle and a pain. It is a good thing that servers like Adam work here because he really made the visit here worth it. I cannot say that about anyone else. 

#GoodFoodLongWait
author: Robert F.

description: My husband and I stopped into Fog Harbor for lunch after wandering at Pier 39 and I was really happy with the food and service. The menu is varied and I'm confident that you could get anything on it, and the food would be really good. Our server did an awesome job!
author: Shirley O.

description: Our server, Raphael, turned our family outing into a lovely evening. Wine, clam chowder, and the Shellfish Platter for 4 makes for a happy family! No crabby-patties here!  #bombdotcom
author: Maria C.

description:
We ordered the bowl clam chowder and the lobster role. Then clam chowder was thick, creamy, and had lots of clams! The order came with warm sour dough bread so there is no need to order the bread bowl. She was also happy to refill our bread when we finished it. 

The lobster role was amazing! The brioche bread the lobster role came with was so good that we got two extra orders of just the bread to go. 

Would definitely come back next time I visit fishermans warf. 

As a side note - the warf is covered in Pokémon and pokestops :)
author: Sunny C.

description:
Best fish n chips at pier 39. So delicious and savory. My wife and I came here like 10 times when we lived in the bay area. 

She always gets some kind of exotic food and I know she never complained about anything she ever got from here.

As for me I loved the fish n chips i always get 2 more pieces of fish and a couple of Anchor Steams real bay area.

Suckas Hella Jealous....
author: Christian S.

description: This is the best place to go if you are in San Francisco. Great view and great food! Also great area if you want to walk down along the piers and see the sea lions.
author: Kati C.

description:
This place could easily be great - location, ambiance, and food for the most are on point. Unfortunately we had a group of six with a space cadet server. Though the bartender, bread/water service and a check in from the manager seemed alert, the bulk of our dining experience fell short. 
Oysters were a disappointment - small and flavorless. The sourdough bread  is fantastic! Calamari was a Bret variety with delicious jalapeños and onion straws mixed in. Muscle fries were unique and much better than the oysters but I wouldn't get them again. The chowder however was fantastic and worth the visit. Adding crab meat to the salad was clutch and easily enough to top the salad and toss in the soup. 
Overall, could be improved. It's disappointing it wasn't a better experience but they have plenty of redeeming aspects to make it a decent option if you're in the area.
author: Katie R.

description:
3.5 stars.   5 stars for MARTIN our server and our seating with a view!   He was perfect but as for the hostess. 

As for the hostess... It's really surprising to have a hostess that's unfriendly to welcome guests to a restaurant of this esteem.   

The food was okay. 

The Dungeness Crab Ravioli was delicious but I was so stuffed from the complimentary bread and butter that was fresh out of the oven. 

The batter of the fish and chips, calamari and shrimp was done right, but not outstanding from other places. 

The crab cake was mediocre.  

But that bread and butter though... was a deal maker and we will be back for more...
author: Roxana N.

description: I went here this week with a small group of people. We didn't make a reservation but came around 6pm so we're able to be seated in around 20 minutes. The service was great and the starting sourdough bread was delicious. For my main I had a special, a scallop risotto. My friend had a mixed seafood travel that he was kind enough to give me a bite of which was amazing. I'd suggest sticking to straight seafood options here (obviously). The prices are a bit high but the value you get is pretty good and portions are large.
author: Grace A.

description: It is absolutely delicious! Scallop and crab risotto is amazing! The feeling of chewing the large scallop is great, and the taste of tomato perfectly neutralize the cheese. Also blue cheese garlic bread is great (but too much for single. Maybe I should've asked for a half plate)! But definitely expensive. The disadvantage.
author: Rosalind G.

description: Made reservations ahead of time for this restaurant for my fiancé's birthday and only had to wait about 10 minutes due to it being busy but we didn't mind the wait because the location of the restaurant is very convenient and filled with entertainment all around. We were seated at a table with a beautiful window view of Alcatraz and the ocean, due to the busyness of the restaurant it was loud but besides that restaurant was clean and everything went good. For starters, our waiter served us warm tasty bread with a nice warm butter on the side as you put it on the bread it melted and was so delicious! For appetizers my fiancé got crab ceviche in which the only problem was they don't give that much chips to eat it with but my fiancé enjoyed it with the chips and also on its own. The second appetizer we got was half of a garlic crab, this restaurant is very classy as my waiter took out a bib like plastic and put it on me before eating the crab. The crab was very good, squeezed lemon all over the crab which added a nice touch to it. Our main entree, I ordered a peppered steak with mashed potatoes and vegetables in which the steak and potatoes were flavor flavorful and they cooked my steak to my likings but the vegetables I was not too much of a fan of due to it having some type of sweet taste which to get paste it I had to put quite a bit of salt and pepper on it. My fiancé ordered salmon with vegetables, when we ordered this we thought the vegetables would be on the side like usual but we were surprised to see the vegetables under the salmon besides that the salmon was good and has a nice flavorful seasoning. Our bill came out to be around $150, two sodas, two appetizers and two delicious main entree was worth the price. To add on, it was my fiancé's birthday in which they gave us a complementary slice of Tiramisu cake which was beyond good! I highly recommend this restaurant for anyone, delicious food, friendly servers, decent wait time and amazing views!
author: Leah B.

description:
We were in San Fran for a few days and a friend recommended we have Clam chowder soup on sourdough bread. So of course I opened my Yelp app and typed in just that. So here we are!

We weren't "too hungry", so the wife and I ended up ordering the clam chowder, a cocktail and wine. We thought that would be it for dinner. Well, the view was good so we stayed long enough and ordered a few more cocktails and a burger. 

Would HIGHLY recommend this place. Our server (Rafael from FL) was friendly and hospitable. Didn't bother us while eating, but made great recommendations and always refilled our drinks/was alert to our needs. EASY 5 STARS. Great spot if you're in fisherman's wharf!
author: Maria R.

description:
Um, hello? Clam chowder topped with a generous amount of crab meat? Count me ALL THE WAY in!

Fog Harbor Fish House is conveniently located right in the front of Pier 39 on the second floor above a souvenir shop. The place itself is very upscale looking on the inside and I know I felt a bit underdressed walking in. But who cares, it's located in the heart of a touristy area.

We were seated for a party of 4 right away. We had an awesome view of the water. Our waiter was a gentleman name Tyler who went above and beyond his job description. Very cool dude.

We ordered: clam chowder, calamari, fish and chips, and jumbo shrimp cocktail.

Everything we had was exceptional. There was not one thing that we ordered that my friends and I didn't enjoy. I wish we had room for dessert! 

Best believe I am definitely coming back to Fog Harbor! I can't get enough of their clam chowder! I want to try so many other things!
author: Jovi D.

description: The dinner I had there on my vacation to the area is the best meal I have ever had. The location along the pier provides a perfect backdrop for the meal. Service was impeccable, never feeling rushed or hovered over but never going long without a check in to ensure we received everything we need. The food was perfectly cooked, from the scallops and crab risotto to the crab meat covering the filet, and all of the sides. I couldn't ask for anything more than I received from my meal, and would suggest this as a must stop for any tourists. Also get the blue cheese garlic bread
author: Joshua B.

description: Our concierge at the Handlery recommended the Fog Harbor. Great recommendation. Crab was delicious. I do recommend the upgrade to have all the crab meat taken out for you. Our waiter was Rafael and he was excellent. His timing was spot on for all aspects of our meal. He was attentive without being imposing. Always love a good meal but I really appreciate excellent service. Thanks Rafael for making our meal enjoyable. I highly recommend this place and ask for Rafael to be your waiter if you want good service.
author: Lm P.

description: If your ever in SF Bay Area, I definitely recommend eating here. The food is worth the price. The restaurant itself is impecable and has good views facing the ocean and Alcatraz island. The customer service is a 10/10. The waitress who was helping my family and I was named Jessica and she definitely was very helpful and made the experience better. The wait time is sometimes a bit long, but I'd wait. It's definitely worth every minute. Not to mention desert. The desert presentation is to die for. 10/10 overall
author: Cassandra M.

description: Came here with my grandpa. My grandpa wanted to try some good seafood in the United States. We ordered a sea food plate, a chicken pasta and a chowder soup.
author: Gege C.

description: This place has a great view of the pier. The atmosphere is very classy and the staff gives excellent service. I had the clam chowder, lazy Cioppino (lazy means meat is taken out of shellfish), and blackberry press. The chowder has great consistency and pairs well with their freshly made sourdough bread. The freshness of the seafood really came through on the Cioppini. I almost regret mixing in the tomato sauce and taking away from the seafood, but that's just a matter a preference and I'd still order the dish again.
author: Don G.

description: We came here on a busy Saturday night. The wait was around an hour and a half which we didn't mind because the restaurant was recommended by a friend. My fiancé and i walked around for a bit while we waited for the text saying our table was ready. Once we got back we were seated immediately and the waitress approached us extremely quick. As an appetizer we tried the clam chowder only because we noticed that it was "Award Winning" and let me tell you, it was amazing. The creaminess and taste were unbelievable. Anyways, other than our waitress being so very friendly and sweet, the rest of our food was also amazing. I can't remember what my fiancé ordered, but i ordered the ciopino. I had NO idea what that was but decided to order it anyways. Once the food was almost out, the waitress proceeded to put on the plastic bibs which was an excellent idea, because if it wasn't for that we would've got very dirty lol. Let me just say, the ciopino was amazing. I will now compare every ciopino i eat in the future to the one i had  that night. Amazing service, amazing food, great ambiance. The lights were dim which created a very romantic feeling. It was a bit loud in there, but not really anything to complain about. I can't wait to visit SF again so we get the opportunity to come back to this restaurant again.
author: Jasmin M.

description:
Awesome atmosphere. Great view by the bay.
The oysters are awesome, but a little pricey. We had the oyster sampler, clam chowder, a sandwich  and a couple of drinks. 
If you like oysters and a great view this is the place to go.
author: Wilson W.

description: The views you get of the bay overlooking Alcatraz are amazing while dining here. With all the options of clam chowder all over pier 39, this one is a few more dollars and slightly smaller but still tasted pretty good. It's a nice place to dine away from all the tourist and birds flying all over the place. The crab roll we ordered was tasty on top of a perfectly toasted bread. We noticed all the other food options available that was being eaten and they all looked good. You definitely can't go wrong with eating seafood here. The wait was about 30 minutes around noon time on a Friday which wasn't too bad at all. Definitely want to try the other items on the menu but the clam chowder is definitely a must while in San Francisco.
author: Eric A.

description: Got the clam chowder with the crab added, good enough to make me overlook the horrible service.  Spoke to the bartender three times, when I got the menu, when I placed my order, and when I paid.  He did not come back to see if I wanted a drink or a desert, and I wanted both.  I'll be back because of the clam chowder, and seed cereal dishes I saw on the menu.  Had a big breakfast that day and a taste for some good clam chowder, and it was excellent.  This was last Sunday May 6th, around lunch time
author: Derrick M.

description:
Well, I give 5 stars for the customer service; It's nothing short of professionalism; checking on us if everything going well on our table or if we are needed of anything or whatsoever. Clean and organized dining area too.
However, I can only give 3 stars for the food. I would like to note to the reader of this review that it is not in general, since I haven't tried every single one option on the menu list, but so far, the Scallop & Crab Risotto and the Oyster option didn't match my expectation. It was beautifully presented, very palatable to the eye, but the taste is bland.
Maybe I should try the other options.
author: Natasha R.

description: I came here for the  clam chowder bowl during the 4th of July weekend. Place is very touristy in the Fisherman's wharf area. The clam chowder bowl was very good. Highly recommend. I got mine with crab in it also. The chowder was was thick and not watered down like another famous places I tried. Highly recommend.
author: Robert C.

description:
A delicious and relaxing place. This was my favorite restaurant while in San Francisco. 
This was our first day in San Francisco, we stumbled onto this while walking around Fisherman's Wharf and I am glad we did. We decided to come here for dinner. We had to wait for a table but that was fine by us. Every table has a view of the water. The staff was warm, friendly and helpful, and we were soon digging into delicious freshly baked sourdough bread, enjoying our drinks, and looking forward to our fish. The meal, which was served quickly, was very good, tasty and plentiful!  I had the cioppino, and it was chock full of seafood in a beautifully seasoned broth. My wife had the Dungeness crab in garlic butter, the flavors bounced off the plate.
We loved it so much we went back next day. We enjoyed the beautiful view of the Bay and the sunset along with an outstanding meal. 
I would highly recommend this for a wonderful waterfront seafood experience while in San Francisco.
author: Carl T.

description: Yummy yum. I usually stay away from tourist spots but the reviews brought us in. Everyone and everything we ordered was excellent.
author: Rosie F.

description: Yummy! I know this place is super touristy but it's still totally worth they hype. They have really yummy clam chowder. Food portions are pretty big and a lot of wine choices. Really nice inside as well, great place for a family dinner.
author: Sandy M.

description: Very good and fresh food. Only reason not receiving 5 stars is because the Poke bowl was average. I came in with 5 others about 20 minutes before close. We were sat immediately and our server "Jess" was excellent. She was very courteous and helpful. She recommended the clam chowder which was excellent. My dish was the seared tuna it was perfectly seared. The stir fry and rice it came with was a great compliment and delicious. Would recommend to anyone.
author: Noel A.

description: Great food! Bread bowl of Chowder was delicious. I highly recommend it. Also great warm sour dough rolls for the table... so on second thought get the cup of soup and one of the apps. The calamari is good and they give you a ton.
author: Heather V.

description:
To the best upscale seafood restaurant ive had in my life... thank you. Thank you for the GREATT FOOD you serve. I mean dang!!!!!! You gots to try it. Best clams, mussels, crab meat and lobster tail youve ever had, ive ever had.

I want you to know, it wont dissapoint
author: Galust K.

description: It's hard deciding on a place to eat when you're at pier 39. There are so many opportunities and places to check out. After a lot of searching, decided to check out this place based on a large amount of positive reviews. This is an institution that serves fresh seafood and gives off a scenic view of the Pier. The dining experience and views of the Bay Area and Golden Gate Bridge attracts visitors and tourists to visit this restaurant at least once. There appeared to be a half hour wait due to how busy it was. Not a problem. The wait seemed to go by immediately and suddenly we were already inside the restaurant. Fog harbor is said to serve 100% sustainable seafood which could be a bias to anyone who hasn't tried it. The menu offers a great selection of food. Customers get to enjoy complimentary sourdough bread that is baked in house. To start off with the appetizer, we decided to go with a dozen baked oysters that consists of spinach, bacon, and creamy Parmesan sauce. These oysters were incredible. It felt like they popped right in your mouth and had so much flavor. I decided to also get the award winning clam chowder bread bowl! This was amazing as well. For the entree, I decided to go with the mixed grill platter that is made with grilled salmon, pacific cod, and shrimp, citrus beurre blanc, sautéed vegetables and garlic mashed potatoes. Food was prepared instantly and did not take long to bring out. The waiter was really friendly but did not bring out water drinks immediately to begin with. Had to give him a reminder. No problem. For a beverage, I also went with the 8 oz flint and steel Sauvignon that was recommended by the waiter. This wine pairs well with fish and had a stronger taste. I would give this restaurant 5 stars based on the food. Price is a bit on the more expensive side but you get what you pay for. Amazing views depending on where you are seated along with fresh seafood right near the pier. Definitely would go again!
author: Hai L.

description: The seafood was very fresh and well prepared. The Ahi Tuna was very flavorful. Justin was our waiter and he did a great job taking care of us. We will definitely ask for him next time.
author: Frank D.

description: Came here for some drinks after sailing with some long time friends.  Bar is elegant, service was prompt.  Prices weren't too bad!  If in the area, and needing a drink, this place is recommended.  I didn't try the food, so I can't comment.
author: Paul W.

description:
Came out to fisherman's warf today and decided to have lunch at the Fog Harbor. Visiting from Chicago, we don't really get good seafood so this place was such a treat!
Our server, Amy, was very attentive and friendly. If possible, ask to be seated in her section, you won't regret it! We got the scallops and the clam chowder for our starters and they also have complementary boudin sourdough! How awesome is that?! It was hot and fresh! We also got the strawberry lemonade and nojito which were also really good. The view from our table was also nice! As we were devouring the scallops, another server, Martin, offered to refill our jalapeño aioli dip which my boyfriend was eating by the spoonful. Overall, great service, good food, and awesome view! Will definitely come back.
author: Sofia S.

description: Good view at pier 39, I ordered seafood which was very tasty and fresh, the Server was super nice lending me the charger and recommending great food.
author: Yiwen Z.

description:
Stopped by as this was on my bucket list trip. Many, including the restaurant, claims to have "the best" clam chowder - huge disappointment. Chewy, rubbery and turned me off. Maybe the cook had a bad day. 

Separately, the Chicago-born bartender, he made my visit amazing!!! Listen to his recommendations and believe me - he's spot on!  Crab and avocado salad is huge and to die for! House chardonnay is phenomenal! 

Great views!
author: Georgia P.

description: It's wonderful! The seafood was good; the service was good. We had good time there. Desserts were too sweet for us tho.
author: Gloria C.

description: The scallop and Dungeness crab risotto was amazing.  The scallops were perfectly done and enormous.  Great quality seafood here!
author: Alex M.

description:
This is probably my favorite seafood restaurant.
I would definitely come back to this restaurant if I visit San Francisco once again. 
The lobsters were nicely cleaned and served.
The food were just so aesthetically pleasing to the eyes and mouth. 
Honestly, once you start eating you'd be pretty damn amazed. 
The lobster was SO juicy, highly recommend!!
author: Grace H.

description: Delicious fresh seafood. Spectacular views. Incredible service. Reasonable prices . Beyond a tourist trap. Recommend the seafood platter for one and splitting it with a couple of appetizers. Dessert was phenomenal. Get the chocolate banana bread pudding
author: Audrey B.

description:
First of all our server was beyond belief. He dealt with my two kids as if they were his own. He made them say please and thank you. Which we have been working on with the both of them.

We had a great seat with a great view. The service was great with good drinks and  excellent recommendation for lunch. When the food arrived it was what expected. It was cooked perfectly and delicious. This is our third time here and it is our favorite place to go to when we drive up from San Jose. 

Recommendations are the fist and chips, chowder with crab and the calamari. For drinks the manhattan and bloody Mary's were very tasty 

Great place.
author: daniel B.

description: This is probably my new favorite restaurant in my favorite city to visit.  The service was great, the wait was reasonable at 40 minutes on a Saturday evening, and the food was excellent.  The cioppino had so much seafood that I was full after eating about half of it.  My party also ordered the risotto and linguini with clams.  Both had gigantic portions of seafood.  If you ever visit fisherman's wharf in SF, don't leave without trying this restaurant.  Make reservations in advance if you can to reduce the wait.
author: Davis Y.
