description:
Friendly and knowledgeable wait staff.  Great food and wonderful views of the bay. 

The Dungeness crab was absolutely delicious.  My wife has a dairy allergy and  they were able to sauté it in oil and garlic instead of butter (it made her day). 

The fried shrimp with fries and coleslaw was good as well. The scallop appetizer looked delicious as it kept coming out of the kitchen, but I just wasn't hungry enough to eat both dishes. I'll definitely try it next time though!
author: Phillip H.

description: We had the best clam chowder and fish n chips here! Our server was so helpful and super friendly. Would go back and ask for Khaiman every single time!!!
author: Rebecca C.

description: Very nice view, food was excellent and the service, what can I tell you. Susan made extraordinary recommendations, she is so nice, thank you Susan.
author: Raul A.

description: Just want to find a fancy seafood place for dinner, ordered cioppino, scallop and crab risotto, really love that risotto! Buuuuuut, I won't tell you , my favorite is their sourdough bread...
author: 100Foodie W.

description:
Such a pricey spot ($20 avg), but, that's what you get for eating right on the pier. 

The blue cheese garlic bread we shared [bc we're on vacay and don't care about being fatties] was yummy. Without the blue cheese atop the bread, it was like any other garlic bread--smothered in butter. And man was it expensive at $8.

The bf's crab roll, under the sandwich section, was really delicious. The poor roll was packed full of yumminess. It was flavorful and sort of oily. The accompanying fries were slightly crispy and yummy.

My choice of the seafood penne was great. There was a good mixture of various seafood goodies: mussels, clams, and some type of fish. There was a good ratio of meats to pasta.
author: Andrea M.

description:
Fog Harbor was a great place to stop while on the pier.  We went as a group of five and was able to get in with a relatively short time.  The calm chowder was very flavorful and hearty, but the peach lemonade was disappointing.  It was basically fountain lemonade with peach flavoring added.  

The view was nice as it looked over the bay, and our group stayed for sometime to talk and socialize.  The wait staff was nice about it and made sure that our water and drinks were always full.  If you are visiting Pier 39 and want a good cup of clam chowder, Fog Harbor Fish House fits that bill.
author: Kim C.

description: This was my second time here. This place never made me disappointed. I love this place great service, great seafood,great view. Thanks to ''Jane'' who taking care of us. she was my waitress. She so nice and checked back us all the time. I always enjoyed every items in the menu. Especially, ''Chioppino''. It's my favorite food. I highly recommend this restaurant for people who love the seafood. I definitely come back next time.
author: Thanawan L.

description:
Well I want to give 5 stars to the staff working behind the bar on Sunday. This was my second time coming here.They were excellent.so nice and friendly. Ordered garlic crab whole. What I didn't like was the butter wasn't salted. It was tender though. That came with veggies. And for dessert has the chocolate chip bread pudding with vanilla ice cream. 
I will come back again.
author: Sharay D.

description:
We came 1-1-18 at about 630ish. We waited for about 20-30 min to be called on. Which isn't too bad. I don't like that we couldn't make reservations. But that's ok. The timing wasn't too bad. 
When we got seated our server what it seemed like didn't know a lot of English maybe? He didn't really communicate with us well. For example. I know we were suppose to get a bread bowl with butter and we didn't get it after we got our appetizer. The bread felt and smelled fresh so I'm assuming they had to put a loaf in. But our server should've of communicate that with us. 
The appetizers was very good. I order the crab ceviche. Not enough chips to eat it though. My friend got fried scallops and those were very good. 
I ordered the clam chowder bread bowl with extra crab and wow! Delicious which is why I'm giving the restaurant 3 stars. Because the food was very well cooked. 
When we would get refills only one of us got a refill per visit. And we would tell our sever who needed a refill but idk if he just can't multi task. Not sure. When we got a bread bowl refill we weren't given more butter.
The sever could probably use more training . But other than that it was a nice experience.
author: Cristal J.

description: This place is fantastic,superb customer service, food is the best and you sitting right there on the pier, with an excellent view. Highly recommended.
author: Carlos S.

description: Great views, great food and not touristy! My first worry was where it was located and it would be just another tourist trap. Nope, I was wrong. Absolutely spectacular view and the crab cakes were on point! I got the mixed seafood grill which was also amazing. The service was spectacular as well!
author: Sandeep C.

description:
Food: delicious, very flavorful, and fresh. 

Service: our initial server Josh was beyond rude and unwelcoming. It created a very unwanted environment but luckily he left for the day and we were then taken care by JD. Very delicious restaurant but avoid Josh, beyond rude with attitude ( don't judge a book by its cover and especially not your guest who are also in the industry and we New he had profiled us because we were a younger couple).
author: Cassi C.

description:
This is THE place to eat crab. The view is gorgeous, the service impeccable and the best crab cakes I've ever eaten. My mom and I shared: cracked dungeness crab, crab cake, a dozen fresh oysters, and a bread bowl of clam chowder with 2 iced teas with a total of 102 dollars so it's not cheap, but by far one of the most special meals I've ever had. 

I highly recommend this place!
author: Lauren K.

description:
Excellent bartender, food is impeccable, great team happy staff very clean cordial environment. Very reasonable prices. Great place to bring the kids or come for a date.

Marc, the bar tender is great. Bring your bag of tricks you might get challenged an opportunity at free desert.
author: T N.

description: The shellfish platter is a must have. Also the clam chowder with crab meat on top is the bomb. Customer service was awesome and we end up eating here twice while on a short vacation.
author: Mariam S.

description: We stopped for lunch there during my SFO trip, we all ordered the clam crowder as it says it's the award winning dish, but I don't enjoy the meal too much as I felt nothing so special about the taste. Kind of disappointed because we all thought it will be sooo good.
author: Amy W.

description: We loved this place!!! We are foodies and everything was fresh and tasty. Dessert was delicious - great seafood and view!
author: Genevieve D.

description: I asked for a table with ocean view and we got it! We came here for view and Dungeness crab. Justin is our waiter and he did a good job. He took a lot of pictures of us.
author: Isabelle K.

description:
Fantastic seafood dishes!
I truly was not expecting much from the tourist trap that is pier 39 but I was pleasantly surprised. 
Order the last cioppino with pasta, the sauce is phenomenal. A bit pricy but delicious!
author: Tom P.

description:
Going to the Piers and not eating at Fog Harbor is a mistake. This place is great. And if you're a solo traveler like I was, don't let the 2 hour wait scare you off. You can hover the bar and grab a seat to eat at.

I didn't catch her name, but my bartender was so great. She took care of me and I'm sure several others that evening without an issue at all. Food came out fast, the virgin drinks were tasty- especially the nojito, and all at a pretty decent price.

The oysters looked good, the crab sounded good, but for me it's always about the sourdough clam chowder bowl when in San Fran. And this place does it amazing! Definitely a must have in my book. Best place to eat on Pier 39 for me
author: Jake T.

description:
Delicious Dinner with a View. 
We were greeted at the door by a friendly hostess that escorted us to a table with a wonderful view of the bay and Alcatraz. 
We ordered several items to try. 
Dungeness Crab App - generous portion o   Fish and Chips - standard, nothing to get excited over, but worked for the kid. 
Mixed Grill - a portion of swordfish, salmon and shrimp with mash potatoes and asparagus, fish was flaky and cooked to perfection.
author: Darlene L.

description:
Exceptional service provided by Curtiss! Warm, friendly and inviting, his skills left us very impressed.  Food was phenomenal.   
I had ordered an entree from the Spring Special. Curtiss's recommendations convinced us to engage on our opportunity to opt for crab dishes since they were in season.  
My boyfriend ordered the Halibut, and let me tell you-- the flavors melted into your mouth.  It Paired very well with the arugula salad topped balsamic vinegar. The dressing added a crisp cut of flavor.
I ordered the scallops with the crab and garlic risotto. Comforting flavors that provide for a hearty meal. I LOVED IT.  I'm not an avid seafood eater, but after eating this dish has left me wanting to explore the depths of seafood cuisine. 

Big Thank you to Curtiss for providing wonderful service, it was a pleasure to have you as our server. And as for the restaurant, props to you Fog Harbor!
author: Justine A.

description:
We tried coming here for Father's Day, but couldn't get a reservation for our large group. My family and I happened to be in town one Friday and decided to dine here since the menu had looked so good during Father's Day. 

It's a really nice restaurant amongst all of the casual tourist spots in the same area. I got the mixed grill and my husband got the ahi tuna dish.  I was underwhelmed by my dish. The mixed grill consisted of shrimp, swordfish, and salmon. The best fish on my plate was the shrimp. The other fish were dry and overcooked. 

My husband's ahi was good. The flavors came together well to make a good dish.
author: Payal V.

description: It was my first time in San Francisco (hence the dinner at Pier 39) and I wanted to have some seafood of course. My family and I made a party of 6 and we waited for about 45 minutes on a Saturday night. Totally reasonable. And if you can't keep yourself occupied for a bit in Pier 39 while you wait, you have issues. There's also a cozy fire pit/ waiting area in front of the restaurant where we could chat and look over the menu. Obviously the restaurant was packed, but our service didn't suffer at all. I wish I could remember his name because he did such a phenomenal job. I told my sister (not even directed at the server) that I would share my added scallops with her and when the food came out the scallops were already split between our plates! After my boyfriend was unsuccessful in convincing any others at the table to share a calamari appetizer, our server somehow made an individual order happen. And when I raved about the sourdough bread basket for probably the tenth time, a second basket just somehow appeared. Incredible. Not many servers are that attentive and proactive. The special I ordered, and the bites I stole from everyone else at my table, were all delicious. The clam chowder was really good but unless you are having that as an entree I wouldn't suggest the bread bowl- save room for something else! The atmosphere was refined and I also loved the huge windows offering a view of the pier. Overall a fantastic meal with even better service.
author: Hayli S.

description:
The wait was worth it! We had no reservations and was told the wait would be an hour so we waiting in their seating area which was nice because there was a fireplace and it was quiet chilly outside. 

I am so happy we waited ! The food was delicious ! It was served so quickly ! & the staff are all so friendly! I can't wait to eat here again, I really enjoyed my dinner! 

I believe our waitress was anya ?(from what I can remember, sorry if this is wrong!) she was amazing ! Thank you so much !!
author: Nixxie P.

description:
Well, this is the Second Best Clam Chowder for me in SF. The place is very nice and more fancy than all the peer in Pier 39. The food is great and seating are comfortable with the nice view. 
Since this store is really in middle of tourist spot, the store is busy most of the time. But the waiting time is not bad considered they are busy. The clam chowder are in bread bowl and taste is good just not the best for me. The non-alcohol drinks are interesting and taste good. The main dish and is the Bomb for me is the seafood platter. Everything in seafood platter are great, the clams, the Mussels, the Shrimp, the crab legs and the Flavored that come with it. You can also add lobster if you'd like and I think it's great to have this option. 

Overall this is a great place if you were to stop by Pier 39!
author: Vanda E.

description: Amazing. We went to fisherman's wharf without a plan except to find a crab roll. After walking by multiple mediocre looking places we finally decided to consult yelp and I am so glad we did! I saw the reviews for Fog House and knew we had to go there. We initially put our name in for the table but after seeing the bar was full service we sat there instead. We ordered the clam chowder bread bowl with crab on top as well as the crab roll with fries and both were amazing! Hands down the best crab roll I've ever had (well worth the price) and I had never tried clam chowder before and this was a great first experience. Having been ill earlier that weekend it was very comforting. We had great service from the bartenders although beers were a little expensive. All in all a great meal- we can't wait to come back to San Francisco and have it again!
author: Alyssa H.

description: This is by far the best seafood restaurant on pier 39!! They have amazing views of the bay and the food is absolutely delicious. We were hear to celebrate my daughters birthday and our server Daniel made sure of that and more! He was very attentive and their wasn't a dry glass on our table and his suggestions were spot on thank you so much Daniel C.. for your great service you are a great example of what we look forward to in going to a restaurant and that's why I will be back many more times because of great people like you who enjoy at what they do! The food was excellent and be sure to save room for the dessert it's a must!!
author: Mirna P.

description: The thing is:  in a tourist area like Fisherman's Wharf, often the restaurants pray on selling crap food to an endless supply transients who, if they never return, means nothing!  How do you know if it's a quality place or not.  Suffice to say, Fog Harbor Fish House is the real thing.  You'll get your moneys worth and feel like you picked a gem.
author: Thomas F.

description:
Beautiful spot despite being smack in the middle of the tourist hole - Pier 39. There is a wait time but was bareable considering it's a saturday. 
Ordered the summer special: scallop risotto, shelllfish platter made with garlic herb butter sauce w/ add on lobster tail, and their famous clam chowder w/ crab add-on.

4 of 5: Great food, regret the lobster tail, and clam chowder should only be ordered with the crab addon! To die for! 

You can feel your blood pressure rising from the taste of fresh ocean.
author: Aaron D.

description: Was vacationing near Fisherman's Wharf and wanted to have fish and chips for dinner. We selected Fog Harbor after looking at reviews, location, and menu. We were impressed by the view of the Bay from our table, the cleanliness of the restaurant, and the service. We started with the crab cakes with buerre blanc sauce and mango salsa. They were perfectly crispy and the mango salsa really complimented the sweet crap. Did not taste "fishy" at all. I ordered the shrimp and chips- came with 8 huge butterflied, panko crusted shrimp, fries, and a coleslaw with a horseradish kick. It was all very tasty and prepared well. My husband ordered the fried combo with fish, shrimp, and calamari. It all was great, crispy, fresh. Again nothing "fishy" tasting. We ended the meal with creme brûlée. Nothing new here- it's a popular,common dessert...but it tasted great. So many seafood restaurants in this area to choose from but this one was one of the better ones.
author: Tara M.

description: The hotel concierge at the Palace suggested we eat here when she provided our map and things to do in San Francisco. It's a crowded spot - full off tourists and locals - Seafood specials were pretty good - halibut was well prepared with salad - great service.
author: Margaret B.

description: Giving this 4 stars only because it was really pricey. Came here on a weekday for lunch after a tour of Alcatraz. The restaurant was busy at the time but we didn't have to wait for a table. Service was great and so was the food! I ordered the shrimp brochette. The shrimp was well seasoned and cooked perfectly. For just the entree, it was $29. I'm not sure if they have a separate dinner menu, but I thought that price was steep for lunch. Definitely worth a stop if you want to splurge though. You won't be disappointed!
author: Kathleen L.

description: The clam chowder in the bread bowl is to die for and the lobster was amazing! The views are nice and the service was very friendly and we didn't have to wait for a table
author: Karissa A.

description: Food was amazing at this place. Our server was great in helping us choose the best food since it was our first time. Scallops, shrimp, clams, mussels, lobster, and crab were all Delish. Will definitely be back.
author: Steve H.

description: Definitely one of the touristy restaurants on the Pier and Fishermans Wharf but still a good restaurant experience. I ordered a chowder bread bowl, oysters, and some gumbo, and they were all pretty good. The oysters were fresh and delicious, and the gumbo was thick and savory. The server we had was very friendly as well and took nice photos for us. They also saw us without reservations and it was an overall good and convenient last minute find.
author: Dan N.

description:
Came here while on vacation in San Francisco. My wife and I came here on a Saturday evening around 7:30pm. We had about a 45 minute wait which wasn't too bad considering there's plenty to do at pier 39! About 40 mins later I received a text message saying our table was ready! Huge plus to have that as an option for customers, that way you don't have to stay at the restaurant. 

After being seated it took about 8-10 minutes for our server to finally get our drink order and another 5 minutes to get our drinks. The server seemed to be a little overwhelmed, but we understood because of how busy it was. 

I ordered the surf and turf which had a 10 oz lobster tail and 10 oz NY steak.  My wife had the 10 oz lobster tail. Both dishes were great and full of flavor. 

The seating area we were in had an amazing view of the bay and you could see the Golden Gate Bridge in the distance!!
author: Brandon I.

description: Food was good, the tuna dish was very nice but the reception staff were very rude and they made the whole experience not great. They should bring better staff and they should allow people to sit immediately. I was told that I can't sit until I bring my whole family even though I assured them they're coming, and they did come. But they made me feel unwelcome and I'll probably not go again because of how they treated us.
author: Ali A.

description:
Our very first night in one of my favorite cities, after the day of traveling (albeit, it was a short flight) and upon hitting the touristy Pier 39, we realized we were famished. We actually went online and the only available reservation was for 
10pm that evening which was so not 
happening so, we took a chance at just walking up and surprisingly only had a 20 minute wait.

Upon sitting down we immediately decided on the Blue Cheese garlic bread for an appetizer and a few beers to start. The bread was perfectly crispy and I was pleasantly surprised to find that they did not skimp on the delicious Point Reyes blue cheese. 

I settled on Linguine with Clams and my husband went for the Flat Iron Steak. The latter of which, I must admit, I was hesitant about given the location and abundance of wonderful seafood options. However, I was extremely happy to be wrong; the hubs claimed this to be the best steak he's ever tasted and I do believe, my dish may have been as well. Not only were the clams obviously fresh, the seasoning was perfect and the sauce, nice and light to showcase the delicious seafood. 

The service was absolutely phenomenal and the views of both Alcatraz and Golden Gate Bridge from our table absolutely could not be beat. I would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone either visiting or, living in San Francisco.
author: Jen R.

description:
Best Chowder I've had! 

Ordered the the Pacific Sole and wife ordered the Shellfish Tower for dinner. Lots and lots of seafood. Fresh as well. 

Will be back!
author: Siosiua T.

description: View was fantastic. Sat for quite a while before anyone ever acknowledged us and took our drink order. Food was good - crab roll and scallops with crab risotto - but wasn't outstanding. Waiter seemed less than interested in us - No-one ever refilled our waters or checked back on us for example. Can find better food - better service - and spend less money.
author: Jim E.

description: Food was good, our waiter reminded us of Jeffrey from the fresh prince of bel-air. He was very snooty and I think he got pissed that we only ordered the clam chowder being that he gets gratuity for every dish that is ordered. Other than than Jeff..the chowder was great!
author: Erik D.

description: Had an early dinner with friends here last night w/ no reservations. Wait time was about 10 minutes and was seated by the window which was really nice. Our server was quick and very accommodating in serving our table of 5. Entree servings was perfect as well and the complimentary bread was delicious :) When we were headed out there was alot of people waiting to be seated... I suggest go early by 5pm ...
author: Diann U.

description:
Best clam chowder ever! Lots of clams, thick, hearty... satisfying!
Oysters were by far the BEST! Our server, JD, took care of us with our 3 month old. He was so understanding and thoughtful! Thanks, JD, you're the bomb!!
The bread was fantastic!
author: Jeanette G.

description: Simply amazing! Fresh fish and for 2 with beers and a great view for $75 bucks great experience
author: Me S.

description: Yes I'm the guy that orders a burger at a fish joint. But I'll tell you, the burger was fantastic. If you're looking for a good tavern burger with nice fat, juicy, delicious bacon strips, the fish House is the place for you! Enjoy!
author: Nick M.

description: Been here quite a few times hardly ever disappointed but yesterday was a new experience . I asked if they can make me a jalapeño margarita little to my knowledge that they would stick a whole large jalapeño in there and crush it up very un drinkable ,, then we ordered are you ahí poki and calamari both were soaked in Grease but the manager did replace it but I didn't have the nerve to tell him that it wasn't much better,,Everything else was great the bread was great clam chowder was great and the other drink we had was great maybe just a bad day don't know I will definitely go back for sure
author: Mike V.

description: I love this restaurant. Great views, great food, great drinks, and great location. What else can you ask for? The only thing I hate is the parking, but it's San Francisco, so parking always sucks.
author: Heather J.

description: Omg this place is super cute along the pier... the staff was very friendly and nice... you much try their clam chowder with the extra clam meat... it's was bomb!!!!!!!!
author: Su Q.

description: On our vacation, my friends and I decided to try this restaurant due to the high rating. We were not disappointed . Even though it was pricey, it was worth it! The food was phenomenal .
author: Julie F.

description:
Came here for dinner on a Monday evening with a party of two the atmosphere is beautiful with a wonderful view of the marina they started us off with what is famous in San Francisco sourdough bread I then ordered the roasted garlic crab for my entree 

Coming here for the first time by fluke I did not know what to expect from the food .... first was the sourdough bread which came in roll form and was baked in house it was great had good crunch on the exterior and a wonderful sourdough flavor on the interior I enjoyed this so much I asked for seconds which they complied soon later came the crab which just from a presentation stand point was amazing it was served with green beens and I opted for fries instead of fingerling potatoes the crab was amazing but what was really great was the roasted garlic butter I'm not sure exactly everything that was in it however they did mention it was made in house they pour all this over the crab and the green beans it has lots of garlic it definitely had some salt and some crispy elements as well(this is not your ordinary garlic butter) I asked for some extra on the side and again they complied as for the crab itself it tastes fresh and was a good size my dining companion ordered the cod i did not taste enough of it to include it in the review however I will attach a picture 

Overall I was happy with my dining experience the food, atmosphere, and the service were all  great
author: Riz K.

description: If you are in San Francisco you should stop in this Restaurant at pier 39. We have some appetizers and drinks outside where you have a cozy set up with a fire place. Everyone is very friendly, we really enjoyed and my dogs too!
author: Fabiana P.

description:
This place could've been a 4 star... but why in the world do they serve whole leaf lettuce in their caesar salad? Besides that, their clam chowder is the best I've ever had. The piping hot temperature they serve it at and the fresh clams in there make all the difference. The calamari was great as well. 

As expected of a tourist focused restaurant located on Pier 39, wait times can skyrocket. The servers were all very accommodating and the host even got us a window seat. You should come here for a view during lunch since the sun shines straight in and they put up blinds during dinner. The severs and place itself try too hard to create an 'upscale' dining experience while catering mostly to passing tourists who are dressed in everything from flip flops to dress shoes.
author: Stanley Y.

description: As I'm eating my dinner, 2 mice run across the dinning room floor. Explained it to the manager and he stated they ran through the front door. So many tables got up in discuss and ran.
author: Angelina G.

description: Great service! We waited 20mins for a window seating! Great view of the waterfront! Our waiter had great suggestion off their menu! Order scallop and crab meat risotto(summer menu, not sure if its available year round), ahi tuna poke, clam chowder sourdough bowl! Clam chower was super creamy with lots of ingredients, the sourdough bowl was warm unlike other places near fisherman's wharf that serves the bowl cold! Risotto was delicious, didnt overpower the crab meat at all!
author: Cath C.

description: lil salty, but other than that view + food was nice. I wanna say i've eaten at tastier places before. This place is def for the atmosphere and service.
author: Dee L.

description:
One of the best restaurants in San Fransisco if you are looking for seafood 

Great food specially the Red chili shrimp 

Good job
author: Homoud A.

description: This is my first time at this restaurant. My friend checked the reviews and found out its clam chowder has been rated #1. We were not disappointed. The clam chowder, the halibut plate, the mixed plate, and the dessert (a cookie with ice cream and a chocolate banana bread pudding) was AMAZING!!!! I was more than satisfied. In addition, the bread rolls are fantastic! Tyler was our server and his recommendations were ON POINT! He's been working here for 4 years and has tried everything on the menu. If you are as fortunate as my friends as I were, you will have Tyler as a waiter. I will most definitely be back when I return to San Francisco. You must come to this restaurant!!!
author: Rasheda Y.

description: Over all I had an amazing time at this restaurant! My server, Mel, was super friendly and carried on a conversation with us. He even taught us a few new words in a different language. He regularly checked in with us throughout our meal and made sure our drinks where never empty. I HIGHLY recommend the clam chowder in the sourdough bread bowl. The dessert menu comes on a platter and it's 9-12 dollars per dessert. I tried a little of my friends clam pasta and it melted in my mouth. The low lighting in the restaurant makes it a wonderful dinner setting. They do take reservations but also accept walk-ins after a very much worth it waiting time.
author: Claire C.

description: We had a wonderful evening. Our first class server Jess was great and very helpful with the menu. We got so full, and the food was so good. We'll be back.
author: Johnny M.

description: It's all about location. The inside of the restaurant is lovely. The service was good, as expected. The food was OK but not worth the price. Would I go again? Not for the food, but yes, I would go again. I loved the ambiance, the view, the pricy cocktails. But next time I go to Pier 39 I will probably try somewhere else.
author: Randa C.

description: Whoever knew seafood can be sooooo good? Well, I just found out today. I actually yelp this place and it so many good reviews that I decide to come. I was definitely not disappointed, from the food to the people, everything was well done.instead of giving us a dessert menu, they bring out all the desserts and they show you. I really like this place and I think you guys will too. It's just a bit pricey but if you want good seafood, you should come to this place.
author: Helen L.

description: Visiting from nyc This place appeared  to have good reviews. I had the clam chowder and crab  cakes to start with which was really  good. The staff was great attentive and friendly. They served really  good portions. My husband  had their cod  that was also excellent. I had the fried combo platter  of fish shrimp and calamari. Everything  was tasty  with the exception of the battered  fish. It was a little  bland. The decor was upscale and my seat overlooked  the bay. I would  definitely  return.
author: Cherise N.

description: Many items on the menu can be made gluten free. Great view of Alcatraz. Children's menu offered grilled salmon for $8.95.  My son enjoyed his meal. Clam chowder was 4/5. Good base but is advertised as containing bacon which was scant in the soup. I had the scallop crab risotto. I could not see any crab and asked about it. I was told that the crab was Dungeness crab and that it "melts into the risotto"  For $35 I would expect to see clumps of crab on the top or more than 4 scallops. Good, not great considering the price.
author: Mary S.

description: We just had a great lunch!!! Local oysters & garlic blue cheese bread are to die for! Susan was our server and she did an incredible job, so sweet & friendly. She is very attentive and knowledgeable of the menu & the area as well. We will make sure to return next time we are in the area !!!
author: Ali S.

description:
Okay don't come if you are looking for cheap. Our 2 adults and a child ticket was a cool 100. 
That being said YOU GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR. %100 FANTASTIC!!! Every single thing we ordered was over the top good. Justin our server was super friendly and helpful getting us around the menu. I chose his recommendation of the Cioppino and it was spot on! Thanks Justin and thanks Fog Harbor for an outstanding night.
author: Kirk Q.

description:
Second time here! Brilliant, good for parties of two or three or more. Wait time is average (noting it is New Years Eve), but the customer service certainly did not suffer. 

Will definitely be back for such the occasion.
author: Francisco C.

description: Great atmosphere and great service. Food was just ok. We ordered the seafood tower and clam chowder. Far from the best clam chowder as advertised but still quite good.
author: Elizabeth D.

description:
I really took pleasure in the seafood here and I only had to wait 20 minutes for a Sunday lunch with family and friends! Great place to enjoy a meal with a view of the calm waters outside the restaurant windows. 

Started out with some sourdough bread as well as the Blue Cheese Garlic Bread. As if their complimentary sourdough isn't fresh and delicious enough, the blue cheese garlic bread takes it to the next level. Some of the dishes that stood out to me during this dining experience were the lobster tail, oysters, and famed clam chowder. The lobster tail was extremely fresh and sweet. Add a little dash of drawn butter into a cut of it and it's absolutely to die for. The oysters were a acceptable size and one dozen for 30 dollars is a steal. They were so delicious that I ordered two dozens! I can also see why their clam chowder is famous. It was creamy with the proper texture and contained fair amounts of clams and potato. I probably wouldn't order the extra crab and sour dough bowl again. Not worth it since the chowder was delicious on its own without those two additions. 

The crab legs and clams, however, were not as great as I expected. The steamed clams that we started off with tasted flavorless and contained bits of sand. The crab meat in the Shellfish Platter was quite bland as well though the meat looked fresh and intact in the legs. I will probably go with getting an entire Dungeness crab next time. I don't want to imply that the Shellfish Platter was poor in taste since the mussels and shrimp particularly were very appetizing. 

The service was great and the waitress checked in periodically to make sure everything was okay. Plates were swapped out and beverages were filled frequently. I will definitely return on my next visit to Fisherman's Wharf.
author: Cliff W.

description:
Hey, this place is in a tourist trap! Yes, why yes, it is... but it was actually pretty good. I begrudgingly came here per a friend's request thinking exactly this, it's a tourist trap... I mean, it lives at Pier 39! 

We tried their clam chowder bread bowl. I say we but it was really my friend. I had a spoonful of the chowder and thought it was pretty basic but good. I think I just personally prefer a creamier chowder. The waitress did say that it was the clam chowder bowl WITH the topping of crab that was the award winner, which makes sense. Who doesn't like crab on top of anything? 

I ordered their Ciopinno and I was pleasantly surprised. They didn't skimp on the seafood. The bowl was filled with different times of seafood, shrimp, scallops, fish, crab, etc. It was hearty and the broth was delicious. They also included some garlic bread to dip into it. 

I mean the prices here are touristy prices, but given that the seafood tasted super fresh, I can ignore that. I mean you are, after all, at Pier 39!
author: Jeannie L.

description:
All of these yelp reviews speak the truth.  This is a beautiful place to enjoy Fisherman's Wharf with great views of the Golden Gate Bridge, the sea lions, and Alcatraz.  The restaurant has walls of windows, so pretty much every table has a view. 

There was a seasonal menu which is what caught my eye.  I ordered the Dungeness crab roll which came with a side of fries.  Excellent!  The buttered roll it came in had the perfect toasted crunch yet the inside was soft and light.  The crab was very flavorful! Fries were nicely crispy. Peering over at other tables, the food looked amazing as well. Colorful plates with pasta and clams, lobster, bright green broccoli.. beautiful. 

Price is moderate, but I think is worth it because the portion is pretty generous and the view is spectacular. 

Service was great and no complaints! 

If you park in the garage across the bridge, you can get one hour validated, just remember to give your ticket to your server to have it validated. 

Overall, we were not disappointed in our choice and we are thankful that the yelp community helped us find this place!
author: Christina V.

description:
This is our favorite. The staff is excellent and the food is divine. Fog Harbor came highly recommended. 

Our standard order is the clam chowder with crab. It is the best! Recently, the staff recommended their mussel fries. It sounded strange, but was a table favorite. 

Fog Harbor is a must in Fog City.
author: Eri N.

description: Linguine with clams, crispy calamari, mixed seafood grill some wine and topped off with the apple crumble/ice cream. This was by far the best eating out experience we have had on our 3 week US tour! The location, the atmosphere, the food and of course the service were all exactly what we were after. Our waiter Jeremy was fantastic and what a difference a happy waiter that seems to love what he does can make on your night so if he happens to read this or his manager then great job pal this restaurant is a must if you're in town
author: John S.

description: Breathtaking views, mouthwatering food. I've visited twice this week. The first time I got the shrimp brochette, with garlic mashed potatoes, spinach and butternut squash. To die for.  Tonight I got the crab and scallop risotto with a lovely house salad, and the next hot homemade sourdough bread in the world! Breanna took great care of my colleague and I. Not enough room for dessert, but we will be back! Bravo, Fog Harbor!
author: Monda W.

description: Great dining experience in otherwise generic tourist spot. Delicious surf and turf with scenic Bay views. Family friendly for toddlers.
author: alex b.

description:
I was a bit worried since some people said this place was a tourist trap on here, but it turned out to be wonderful! 

The boy and I came here for an anniversary dinner since we were craving seafood. We made a reservation a few days in advance, hoping and requesting a nice seat. We came 20 minutes early, and we were seated just in time! Next to a window with a view of the bay too! Someone had also wrote "Happy Anniversary!" on our table. :) 

For starters, we ordered the clam chowder and fried scallops. I ordered the shellfish platter for one with a lobster tail for my entree, and the boy ordered the surf and turf. Everything was perfect! You could tell the seafood was fresh and the boy was also happy with the quality and cooking of the steak. We loved everything that we ordered, and also enjoyed a yummy creme brûlée. 

We were in awe of the meal we had. Not to mention, the sour dough was the best we ever had! We couldn't stop raving about it. We also have to thank our server Justin H. for being so awesome and kind. We asked to take our leftover bread to go, and he came back with more fresh sour dough to take home!
author: Lauramay N.

description:
This review is for Michael K. -Our server from
Last night! We had a huge party of 8, was very welcoming, kind and understanding! Would come back just for his service! He also sung happy birthday!!! Which was soooo nice. The owner or manager on duty was very accommodating as well.
author: Jasmere C.

description: Family date day to SF! Enjoyed a nice dinner and view. The service was fantastic. Our server, Raphael, recommended the shellfish platter for 4. No regrets! Will be back again.
author: Jessica C.

description: Amazing views and great service. Bloody Mary was on point. Our waiter Nick was great. Ordered the claim chowder in the sourdough bread bowl with crab...
author: Ty C.

description: We ordered the cioppino which was very good. We added lobster and it was very delicious. We also ordered the fish and chips which were good but no salt. The fish definitely needed flavor and salt. Service was good and the restaurant is nice.
author: Tina T.

description:
This is probably the best restaurants here on pier 39!!  The service was fantastic. Our waitress was Ashley G was incredibly sweet and gave us many recommendations!
The entrées are absolutely amazing and the drinks are strong, all with an amazing view !! 
The red chili garlic shrimp is a starter and I definitely recommend it
author: Angie A.

description:
We are not tourist. We live here and are not easily impressed. This lovely place is even better if you choose to sit in the tables that seat 4 in the back of the restaurant. Your view is perfect position of Alcatraz  with the Golden Gate bridge just behind and the gorgeous skyline on your left and sea lions just below on your right. 
Start the night with server Jane who can recommend  the perfect wine pairing for your meal. At $22.00 per glass the chardonnay should taste live Heaven and it did. It was the perfect companion to the mixed grill and the shell fish platter with lobster tail add on.
Do also try the appetizer, their perfect Jumbo Shrimp paired with the award winning hibiscus margarita and take your time with them. This view and these tastes are meant to be savored with warm conversation and your lover. We closed the delightful evening with the tiramisu  and warm apple crisp. Pure joy! Thank you Jane for the recommendations! Superb food and service!
author: Lavette K.

description: Not much to say! It's got everything you could possibly want to enjoy at a Fish House, everything is delicious
author: Michael M.

description:
Excellent food and service! My waitress was super friendly. My coworkers and i had a really bad day and the waitress definitely cheered us up with her awesome attitude and smile. 
Very pleased with the clam chowder, better than the popular Boudin chowder down the street. 
I love how they serve fresh in house bread. 
Highly recommend the seafood penne and chioppon dish. 

Great location too, right at pier 39 at the Fisherman's Wharf. You can plan a day there and finish off with dinner here. Great view of the water too.
author: Joey J.

description: The clam chowder is a MUST! Add lobster on the top and you are all set! The seating area is great you get a great view of Pier 39 and the service is great! We also tried out the calamari as an appetizer and it won't compare to anything I have had at home. This place is a must if your in the area.
author: Gabby R.

description: For our last lunch before leaving for home, we stopped by Fog Harbor Fish House Such a good way to end a nice weekend away. The blackened scallops appetizer special was delicious! Perfectly cooked and well seasoned. The fish taco special which our waitress recommended was excellent, perfectly cooked fish, a soft taco shell, and crispy French fries. The jumbo lump crab cake sandwich was also very good. Servers are very attentive and friendly too!
author: Macleod R.

description:
wow!  I love this place.

we managed to get a window-view table; an awesome water/land and Alcatraz picture opportunity before or after your meal.

we had a wonderful server named Kayla.  She is very nice and very helpful with Appetizer and Meal recommendations.
Very, very attentive!   

food and service; ON POINT!

Mussel fries are really good as with the baked oysters!

Will definitely be back here!!!
author: Christine A.

description: The dim light ambiance was nice It's not a bad restaurant like the Hard Rock but its definitely typical for the pier like the pier market and the Franciscan I ordered their Cioppino it tasted good but I wasn't taken away by it the Crab House still has my heart it's my favorite pier 39 restaurant
author: Brenda C.

description:
After a great (but pricey) breakfast at Taylor Street Coffee Shop, a quick visit to the Golden Gate Bridge, and a leisurely stroll up and down Lombard street, we decided to walk to Fisherman's Wharf for a few hours before we head to Alcatraz.

After a couple hours of shopping, picture-taking, and people-watching, we decided to find a spot for drinks and snacks. I already had Fog Harbor in mind since the JW Marriott concierge highly recommended it when we had arrived, although I almost changed my mind when i saw how many people were waiting for a table! Took me almost 5 minutes just to get to the hostess to put my name in, and was told it would be at least a 45 minute wait. We decided to grab some drinks from the bar while we waited and luckily, a couple of spots opened up right at the bar!

The bartenders were all very professional and friendly. I started with a glass of prosecco then switched to syrah; hubby started and ended with syrah. We ended up ordering way too many drinks and only the crab cake app to share (delish!), but it came with some warm sourdough bread and butter - perfect for soaking up all that wine we consumed!

Great vibe overall, and we were definitely impressed with the efficient and friendly service, especially since we sat next to an older, much drunker and rowdier couple, and the bartenders were able to handle them extremely well without any sign of irritation. Sad that we weren't able to try more of their food - will have to go back the next time we're in SF!
author: Jen M.

description: Brought my wife for her birthday! The food was amazing, started with tomato salad & scallops with jalapeno aioli. First off, the salad, it comes with green & red tomatoes with a sweet balsamic vinegarette,  and some cheese that's out of this world.  Scallops & jalapeno aioli was also delish!  Cooked to perfection. Main course was shellfish platter with lobster tail, that's extra! This dish is very buttery, and I love it!!! Highly recommend this place, the view was gorgeous as the sunset over the bay! Oh, and the sourdough bread...you cannot come to SF and not have sourdough bread, it's complementary, just don't go over board, it's hard to stop eating it once you get a piece in your mouth!
author: Pablo P.

description: Dinner at Fog Harbor was amazing!  Curtiss our waiter was excellent.  He was able to give us some excellent recommendations.  I will surely be back when I'm in the San Francisco area again.  Thank you for a wonderful experience!
author: Diane G.

description:
I usually void Fisherman's wharf especially around the holidays--getting run over by strollers and pedestrians just ain't my thang; but I was in a rather cheery mood and decided to take in the Christmas decorations before they get torn down. 
We decided to have dinner at Fog Harbor Fish House (thanks to Yelp reviews) and they did not disappoint. 
For starters, we had the calamari, red chili garlic shrimp and mussel fries. All were quite tasty, particularly the garlic shrimp. That sauce had the right amount of spice and kick. 
We followed with their award winning clam chowder in a bread bowl--thick and creamy with plenty of clam chunks. Just YUMS!
For the main course, we ordered the cioppino, ahi tuna and seafood penne. My little tot had the chicken tenders. All are highly recommended including the tenders--very meaty and well...tender.
Everything was great but what really brought this review from a 4 star experience to 5 is our waiter, Justin. 
He was accommodating and made sure our dinner experience was an unforgettable one. 
We were all pleasantly surprised by Justin's attentiveness, how fresh the food was and our overall experience considering the restaurant is in a tourist trap. 
If you're in the area and don't mind the wait and the crowds, Fog Harbor is worth the visit.
author: Jennie N.

description: We ate here on a Saturday night after our Bay cruise. We had about a 35 minute wait for a table for two around 5pm. We had the clam chowder with crab in a sourdough bowl. It did out disappoint. It was one of the best clam chowders I have ever had! Our table also had a great view of the Golden Gate, Alcatraz, and boat slips. We were entertain people watching as we eat. The serve was fast and friendly.
author: Maryann E.

description: Crab cakes were really good. Wedge salad was amazing . Surf and turf was cooked perfectly! Service was good
author: Scott Y.

description:
Very disappointed in this place. I ordered the seafood platter with the crab legs.. man were they terrible.

The crab tasted like AMMONIA. At first it wasn't bad at the opening of the leg but as you got to the meat, the chemical was so bad I had to spit it out. You could taste a little pine-sol. We immediately told the manager and they went ahead and brought us a new crab. Once again, the ammonia/chemical smell was prevalent. The manager told us that it's normal and that some crabs have it due to mating season (yeah ok).

I did my own research and apparently the ammonia smell is a byproduct of the decomposition of seafood. Possibly the crab was kept in a filthy tank. Crabs excrete ammonia instead of urine. 

So there you go, they kept a disgusting batch of crabs and still served it to customers. They gave us half off the dish which I don't think compensates for the time and tastebuds wasted. I will never come here again or recommend
author: Lorna Q.

description:
My Fiancé and I had dinner at the Fog Harbor fish house over fleet week. Let me start off by JESSICA W was our server and she was beyond words AMAZING! Being from new jersey we love great customer service, and she went BEYOND THAT! 


The food was super delicious!! We had the fried scallops for appetizer and clam chowder! For dinner we had the Cioppino and we added penne, and we also got the must have Shellfish platter with a lobster tail! Super delicious 

We can go on and on but we'll leave it at: YOU MUST TRY THIS PLACE !!!! 


Thank you JESSICA !!
author: Nicole M.

description: Beautiful views, yummy seafood and great service from Tyler at the Fog Harbor!  This was a birthday dinner and I missed the window to set up a reservation.  We went a little early just hoping we could get a seat.  We did not have to wait at all.  We had a little bit of everything, bread, appetizers (the best fried calamari!), and seafood entrees.  Don't forget the drinks, they were yummy too!  Our server, Tyler, was very nice and attentive.  I would definitely recommend!
author: Marlene G.

description: This place was really good for a first timer in SF! For a party of two, they gave us a 30 minute wait time and sat us down within 10 minutes. The restaurant itself was huge. It has a wonderful view of the water, and we served very quickly. A little pricey, but the food is definitely worth the price.
author: Sandra E.

description: This is a great place to visit on the pier if you're looking for a delicious family dinner or lunch. The view of Alcatraz was breathtaking. The steak with whiskey sauce is very good. Award winning clam chowder is amazing!  Service was quick and convenient.  By far my favorite place on the pier.
author: M C.

description: Seared ahi was fantastic! I paired it with a Californian Pinot Noir at the recommendation of the bartender, and it worked well (even though I typically do not prefer wine). The bed of rice and side of vegetables were great as well. The veggies were clearly fresh and were cooked perfectly. Highly recommended.
author: Eric F.

description: We had the best seat overlooking the harbor. I of course had salmon and my bf had some expensive seafood platter with lots of shellfish and mussels. He said it tastes very fresh. My salmon was very moist and had a great flavor. I would definitely recommend
author: Chelsey A.

description:
Let's just say this place was a dream ! Starting from the grand view going down to the bread and butter . 
My husband and I were seated at a window seat . We had a great waiter which made us feel really welcomed.  
The food was amazing , rich and flavorful. 
The overall experience was epic . Definitely recommend others to try this place when in San Francisco.
author: Alina P.

description: This is the best place to have a seafood!!! I loved it. We came here and hostess was so kind with us. She asked how we are and what kind of table we would love to, her name was Olga. She is wonderful!!! Food was great and I loved Cioppino !!! I will recommend this place to my friends if they travel to San Francisco .
author: Oleksandra A.

description: The most amazing cioppino...I have had twice now, it's a rich, warm, tomato favor broth packed with shell fish! Very filling..it's served with roasted garlic bread to soak up the rich broth. Get the lazy man way..the snow crab is cracked and you won't get Messy try to shell out the delicious crab meat. The place was busy, but didn't wait longer than 15 minutes, service was excellent!
author: Stacy F.

description:
Of course being my first time in SF I was in need of some good calm chowder and this place certainly did not disappoint. After exploring some of fisherman's wharf and pier 39 my boyfriend and I decided to stop here for lunch. The overall service was exceptional. Our waitress was super friendly and very helpful with making recommendations for us. 

Food wise I decided to go with the soup and salad combo while my bae picked the fish and chips. Before the meal we were also provided with complimentary sour dough bread and butter. It came out very fresh, hot & delicious. Once my meal arrived I surprisingly fall in love with the Caesar salad more then the chowder. The dressing was perfect and the romaine hearts were very crisp and tasty. I did enjoy my chowder as well, but would have liked to see more clams. For the fish and chips I managed to sneak in a few bites in and man oh man, it was spectacular. It almost made me regret my ordering decision. 

You simply can't pass up this place while at the pier. The food, service and views are all outstanding!
author: Erika N.

description: Food and view were great! Service... As far as our waiter goes not so much but other servers were more responsive! I'm not a seafood eater, however, I decided to try their Crab Linguine but I substituted the crab for blackened Salmon. It was very good. My husband had the fried trio and said it was really good. He loved how fresh the shrimp was and was impressed by the amount of Calamari he got jn addition to his other food.
author: Ashley W.

description:
Came in last Friday made reservations for 2 at 6pm,  as requested prior I asked for seats by the window. Checked in at 5:55pm, we were walked to our tables, not a word from the person who walked us to our table apologizing for not having any seats by the window as requested prior to making the reservation. Okay, that's fine. 

For starters, we both started with a cup of clam chowder (this is what they're famous for!). The chowder was delicious until I came across a piece of hair midway into my soup. DISGUSTING!! How does that even happen?! 

I ordered the surf & turf, I give it a 4/5. The lobster tail was too chewy, like it was over cooked. My boyfriend ordered the shellfish platter + lobster tail. He said there were shells everywhere on his food that it was barley edible. There were tiny shells all over his food from the 1/2 crab. 

Overall, I would probably not come back, this was not a good experience. $200 including tips, I've had better in Monterey!
author: Lena ..

description: Once again, awesome food and awesome service. My family came in to celebrate my sister's birthday and everything is great except for the receptionist who kept rolling her eyes and doesn't want to listen to the customers. It's too bad that the person who is supposed to be warm and welcoming is the same person who makes you think about going somewhere else. Idk how much business the restaurant loses because people are being treated with so much attitude-we almost walked away but our server Miguel made up for it by being so attentive and providing great customer service!
author: Liezl T.

description:
Was always on my list to try and it was well worth it. Had calamari for appetizer and the shellfish platter for 2 and both were amazing. 
Great view and fantastic service.
author: Jeff L.

description: Very popular spot at Pier 39. Waited over half an hour on a Sunday evening. Luckily there are enough  shops at the pier to walk around before our table is ready. Ordered clam chowder, which was good. And had to order a whole Dungeness crab because it is crab season!!! I grew up eating crabs and have had Dungeness crab at other places in SF. I would say the presentation was good, and crab tastes fresh. But didn't feel amazed by it. My favorite thing was probably the warm bread with butter that was served before the dinner. The sunset view was very nice though.
author: Chen C.

description: Went with my good friend during our San Fran trip. Must try if you're staying near financial district or harbor. In such a cool little pier shopping /restaurant area. Definitely will be back!!!
author: Wenni H.

description: Ordered the lobster roll and it was bland.  The waiter was attentive and they do have a very good bartender which is a plus!  Stars for the bartender and the waiter.
author: leimomi k.

description: Love the fresh seafood, and the view is great, we celebrated my husband birthday here and he love the lobster, shrimp,crabs, mussels,clams and oysters! Staffs are very nice too!
author: MG B.

description: This place is fabulous. Seared Cod with white beans and topped with aioli was off the charts delicious. Every dish on every table looked amazing. They not only have booths, they offer a breathtaking view of San Francisco Bay . Restaurant and bathrooms are spotless, service is excellent. Portions are generous and prices are very fair. We loved this place.
author: Joseph H.

description:
In response to Bob Partrite from Fog Harbor's question, the name of the bartender, according to the check, is Jason N, and I was in the restaurant on 7/31/2018 at 8:39pm.

------------------------------------

This is the 3rd time I have been to the Fog Harbor. You are probably wondering if it is so bad to warrant 1 star, why did I keep going back? The reason is the 1st and 2nd time were good. If you are in this touristy part of town, this is a decent restaurant to dine in. I wish that I had stopped at the 2nd visit, because here is what happened at the 3rd visit:
1-came here on a Tuesday evening. The hostess told me it would be a 15 minute wait for a table, but  bar seating is available and she said it was full-service so I opted for that instead of waiting.
2-ordered a bowl of clam chowder and the mussels and fries. Like I have the first two times. This time the mussels are not cleaned properly and I tasted sand for quite a few ones. The clam chowder is very thick and I heard that this is a west coast thing. My neighbor diner asked me how was the clam chowder and that is what I told him. My waiter looked at me like I don't know what I was talking about. Apparently he doesn't know the authentic clam chowder is much thinner, and there are many versions of i
3-The person who was serving me at the bar never once asked me how was everything, never bothered to see if I needed anything else. He didn't give me a bowl for the shells so I used my soup bowl, didn't give me a wet napkin until I asked for one. And the "best" part? Not even a "thank you" as he took my credit card and nothing when he gave me the bill to sign, and nothing when I left. Nothing. I thought this is just what staff who is working the bar does. But no, I noticed his colleague who was also working bar duties were checking on his guests and was very attentive.
4-as if that wasn't enough, I got sick right after eating here. 
When I come back to SF, I will not be dining here.
author: Michelle L.

description: The service was good and the food was decent as well. The best part about the restaurant is probably the views! We had an inside table so unfortunately we missed out on that - but would go back again!
author: Christine E.

description:
This restaurant offers nice views overlooking the water, delicious food, and great drinks. 
We came here after taking a tour of Alcatraz, it's literally a 10 min walk from pier 33 or a 4 min cab ride. I live in a city where I have to drive everywhere and come from a city where I walked 80% of the time, so we opted out for a walk. 
The restaurant's decor is rather fancy, though I was dressed pretty casually, I did not feel out of place. Everyone here seems chill, no judgmental stares. 
As far as food, the Huns had NY steak with veggies and mash, I opted for a bread bowl with crab (I was told I MUST have chowder when in San Fran, so I took this as an opportunity to do so). Our waitress asked if we wanted a bread basket while we wait, we did. By the time food came out, the Huns had almost all the bread. I wasn't going for bread since I was going to have plenty in my meal. Even though food took a little while, it was delicious! The streak was spectacular, it had the grilled taste Huns looks for. My bowl was delicious as well, with crab stacked on top. It doesn't originally come with crab but you can add it for $7. A little messy since I tried to rip off pieces of the bread bowl. 
Drinks were great too. I tried the Alcatraz since we were coming from there (corny, I know). It could of been stronger but it was still good. It was also my second drink and I was a little buzzed from the first. I usually don't feel the alcohol in my second drink as much. Especially since my first had tequillaaaaaaa (you have to sing it and shake your shoulders, it's a law). 
I give 4 stars because our waitress was pretty bland. It felt like she had an attitude up until the end, when it came to a tip... then she turned into a Chatty Cathy, asking us about where we are from and telling us she has to pay $1,000 worth of tickets tomorrow... mmhhhhhmmmm, right... I saw her do exactly the same thing to a table next to ours. Oh, and when their drink spilled, she stood on the side allowing other servers clean it up and grinned. It was the first sight of happiness I saw from her. I mean, don't be so obvious!
author: Natalie K.

description: Our Favorite place for sea food. customer service was very professional. We didn't expect the manager gave us 20% off because we had wait a little longer. All sea food are flash. Beautiful waterfront view. Definitely will be back!
author: Snow H.

description:
This place is a hidden gem in the heart of tourist country. 

I'm still working off this food coma I'm in right now because of how delicious everything was. The fried sea scallops were delicious with the jalapeño aioli. Your meal comes with a complimentary loaf of fresh sourdough, which you can dip in whatever you order. I had to try the creme brûlée at the end, but obviously needed a glass of milk to go with it. But all they had was 2%!

-1 for not having whole milk
author: Jason S.

description:
Went last night for dinner. Have been here a few times prior. As always, the view, the vibe, the service and the food were all excellent.

Ordered a hibiscus margarita which was fabulous. Then had the Garlic Thai shrimp as an app... spicy and delicious followed by the sourdough bread bowl with clam chowder. Loved it. Then the Dungeness Crab dinner arrived. Delicious and large portion. The dish is $45 and definitely worth it. Excellent crusty bread served with the meal. Our waiter was Mel. He made our night complete. He was attentive, available and on top of everything. 5 stars to Mel! Ask for him. You won't be disappointed. 

Since it was my birthday, I got the creme brulee for dessert. It was average..and Mel comped me the birthday dessert.

Overall the experience was great. Their Yelp ratings are accurate for this place.
author: Joel M.

description:
So far the best cioppino I've had in San Francisco. Scallops, shrimps, fish, crab and mussels were super-fresh !!!  Nice taste with the herbs and all.   

Service was fast and friendly.

Ordered takeout and it was packed well with extra sourdough bread.
author: Edward M.

description:
Tourist trap, as expected. On the 2nd level of Pier 39 complex, hubby was getting hangry and refused to walk anywhere else for food. We settled in here as they had good reviews, has a view over the sea lions beaching at the pier, the interior looked clean and well put together, and they offered crayons and coloring sheets to entertain the little one. 

Started off promising. The waitstaff were all professional. We got complimentary blue cheese garlic bread using one of the coupons in the Pier 39 Fun Pack. The appetizer was huge!  It tasted alright.  But our entrees did not fair well. We got the Fried Combo that was basically fish and chips with fried shrimp and calamari - since we were by the pier, we thought this would be a safe bet to get good seafood. It wasn't. The batter on the fish wasn't crispy enough and the entire dish lacked seasoning.  For $23, it was not memorable and overpriced.  I was craving a burger so we also got the Fog Harbor Burger - sounded good on paper but the burger itself was actually quite dry and hard to swallow. Taste-wise, it was bland (no memorable sauce to improve the taste) and rather boring. A very basic burger for $15. 

So overall, overpriced and unmemorable food serving mostly tourists, but does provide a view, comfortable seating and good service.
author: Mandy T.

description:
This restaurant was such a great choice for fresh seafood and a beautiful view of San Fransisco bay. 
We got the seafood tower for two of us to share and it was more than enough food. 
I really wish we saved room for dessert because the tray they brought around to showcase the desserts looked amazing. 
There will be a "next time" and I will be sure to enjoy dessert
author: Rebecca C.

description: Great service, great views, great potential. However $120+ for 2 people is ridiculous when the food is such poor quality. I got the linguine with clams and it was so bland that I was very disappointed and decided to box it up so I can take it home and just season it and fix it myself. I was looking forward to this meal since my bf and I were stuck in San Francisco dealing with passport stuff and we finally got to the restaurant after walking 3 miles. We were excited because all the photos looked delicious. Well, let me just say that the food LOOKS better than it tastes. My bf had the cioppino (dont know if that's the correct spelling) and he was not impressed. I tried it, and it was SO. FREAKING. BLAND. Like seriously, has the chef ever heard of seasoning? It was literally just really great tasting fish drowning in a sad watery tomato sauce. The food has so much potential if only the people cooking it knew what to do. Maybe we came on an off day/time but I dont think we will be returning. Our waitress (pretty blonde girl, didnt catch her name) was very very friendly and attentive and the manager checked on us a few times which was nice. So, the restaurant has great staff,  they just need to learn how to season their food. I get that the restaurant is right on the water with a nice view but the prices are ridiculous. $20 for a boring pasta dish is just a joke.
author: Juliana F.

description:
My wife and I were in SF during Christmas weekend having just finished a late afternoon bay tour and needed something to warm us back up. The crowds were decent and we expected long waits regardless of where we decided to dine so we settled on splurging a little. We put our names on the wait list and after hearing the party before us (party of 4) get a 45 minute wait time we were estatic that our names were called within five minutes of putting our name on the waiting list!

The hostess seated us adjacent to the window overlooking the bay! SCORE!!! It did take about seven minutes for our waiter to come take our orders but we used the opportunity to review the menu and decide our options. We ordered a half dozen of oysters and the garlic cheese bread as appetizers with cioppino as our main entree, although my wife had hers prepared the 'lazy way', they shell the crab for you. The oysters were a little on the smaller side but were fully prepared for enjoying with the accompanying lemon, sauces and garnishes. The restaurant had already separated the meat of the oyster from the shell, a nice touch. I also ordered their 'Ultimate Dirty Martini' since it was a nice dinner and we didn't have to worry about driving. I'm not a big drinker but I ended up having two more...suffice to say I enjoyed them.

Our main course was delicious. There was plenty to fill the bowl, large chunks of fish, mussels, a couple clams, and a set of large crab legs reaching out! My bowl had a large 'knuckle' that was packed with meat. As I deshelled the crab legs I observed I had amassed significantly more meat through my labor than what my wife had been provided in her 'lazy style' bowl...in other words 'don't be lazy'. The broth was equally delicious although I would have preferred a little more broth...regardless I was still able to splash some on my coat.

We were too full to take a look at the dessert menu as the cioppino left us with a full belly and a big smile. Very happy that we were able to enjoy a very nice dinner with an incredible view and hardly any wait.

Until the next meal,

David
author: David R.

description:
The hostesses could use some customer service lessons. Smiling to start would be amazing. 

I strolled in at 5:30pm on a Monday and asked to be by the window so I could have a nice view. The host took me to the furthest seat from the window. I was practically next to the host stand at the front of the restaurant. Umm...no thanks. I asked to wait to be seated at a window instead. A guy, I assume a manager, although friendly, asked if I absolutely needed to be at a window. Umm...yes. 

25 minutes later I'm back, and I'm at a window seat. The view was worth the wait, and especially being a solo diner. 

I ordered an old fashion, half a dozen raw oysters, and the clam chowder in a sour dough bowl with a side salad. My old fashion came in a glass that was only half filled and full of pulp. Three of my six oysters were gritty as hell, and a couple had bits of broken shell. Not impressed. 

The clam chowder was decent, but not something I'd come back for. 

The server was nice, and the view was spectacular, but the prices and food were not worth it. I recommend maybe a drink and app, but go elsewhere for entrees.
author: Vee V.

description:
Awesome food! Awesome service! 

I also love their commitment to sustainability by not using plastic straws!
author: Nikki K.

description:
Just amazing. Beautiful views of Alcatraz and farther off the Golden Gate Bridge. 

Wonderful drinks. 
Seafood was on point!  I had scallops and crab risotto. Wonderful crunks of crab and nice scallops. 

Expensive. great service!
author: Moni D.

description:
Absolutely amazing restaurant.
We had a short 15 min wait Saturday evening, walked into a beautiful sunset truly breathtaking view, very impressed. Adding more to our excitement was our server Raphael, he was PHENOMENAL!!!!! Grade A top notch service and all of his recommendations were spot on, we had scallops risotto and crab top filet they were entirely delicious. We will be back again and thanks again Raphael for your personable and professional service.
author: Edward M.

description: Whenever I go to Frisco this is my spot to get my grub on. The food is on point and so are the views. They say when you go to Frisco you have to have the seafood but let me tell you something that filet mignon steak is on fire medium rare it just melts in your mouth. I tried it with the lobster tail perfect combination. Don't take my word for it! Go try it out for yourself. You won't regret it. You pay for what you get. Top notch grub on
author: Victor B.

description:
Came here for my bf and my annual post Christmas dinner. I came across this restaurant on Yelp for many years now and decided to finally come. We came on a Tuesday evening and they were pretty packed. We asked for a table for two and they told us it can be up to 40 minutes, but they will text us possibly to get our seats sooner. So we were fine with that because we walked around the Pier and watched the "sealebraties" 
(The seals) ha ha. We got our table in about 30 mins and it was a window view table which was gorgeous, but it was night, so you couldn't see much. It's okay because it was still gorgeous with all the lights. 

Our table had cute candles set up as well a beautiful ambience inside the restaurant. They brought us out warm oh so warm bread with butter and water pretty quickly. We then ordered garlic spicy shrimp, clam chowder and I added crab, and my bf got the fish and chips- keeping it authentic. Our waiter was super nice, he had a good conversation with us and even asked if we were celebrating something special. Everyday is special for us, but last night was of course our Christmas outing. He was kind to bring out a dessert platter at the end and we tried the pumpkin banana bread pudding and wow! It was deliciously scrumptious. It came with a nice homemade cream not too sweet and we poured a nice sauce over the bread. It wasn't a white chocolate, but it still had a similar taste. Very yummy. 

Service was great, food was delicious, wait time was good, our view was amazing, restaurant was clean and beautifully set up, and lastly they are very quick! In and out in no time. Thank you Fog Restaurant we will check you all out next time we have a day trip to SF, so we can enjoy the beautiful views from daylight.
author: S S.

description: This restaurant has excellent food and a wonderful atmosphere.  Curtis went above and beyond with both food and local attraction recommendations.  We loved that he is originally from New England.  He is one best servers we have ever had. Don't let the the fact that this restaurants is located in Pier 39 scare you away.
author: Becca P.

description: My boyfriend and I went here and he ended up getting food poisoning from uncooked seafood. Come at your own risk. I have definitely had better.
author: Kaitlyn W.

description: I am horrified that I forgot our waitress's name, as she was just the sweetest and most patient woman and everything you could ever hope for with your dining experience . I literally told her, "thank you for being so wonderful" at the end of the night. We went around 9:00pm with no reservations on a Tuesday night, and were still given a table overlooking the water. Our waitress was super sweet and answered our 6,000 questions about the menu. We felt welcome, respected, and free to explore the menu. Most importantly, the food was AMAZING!!! Locally sourced and perfect. The blue cheese bread appetizer was fantastic, and the ahi tuna was firm yet melted in your mouth, and the halibut was just phenomenal. Best meal I have probably ever had in my life. Thank you all so much! It was a special night for us, and you made it perfect!!
author: Sarah M.

description: We came to celebrate my wife's birthday here. My wife had the halibut. My oldest child had the pan seared chicken. My little one had the baked oysters and a cup of clam chowder. I had the Shellfish platter. Everything was absolutely wonderful. Worth every penny! We will be coming again.
author: Cruz C.

description: I had my birthday dinner here. Lovely mussels and fries. I can only have fries on my birthday!
author: Isabelle L.

description: Amazing service the staff is really acomodatting fast (for this kind of restaurant)the food was fresh , the clam chowder is on point the best for a reason and best and best steam scallops. Over all is the best in the pier
author: Alex T.

description: Justin was an amazing server who helped me out with a food allergy and a poorly chosen entree. The cioppino was delicious.
author: christopher p.

description:
Best thing about this place was the bread. 

What a bummer to be misled by so many positive reviews. We will never return. 

Maybe we fell into a tourist trap? We've been in the Bay Area for 2 weeks with lots of meals out and this had been the worst meal. And we ordered quite a variety.
author: Chelsea S.

description: Fog harbor was amazing from the food to the server! The clam chowder was some of the best I've had.
author: Mady H.

description: Chose this excellent restaurant based on the positive Yelp reviews. Must agree they are efficient in bringing out your  food and it was delicious and well prepared. I ordered the grilled shrimp brouchette which had garlic mashed potatoes, sautéed spinach and butternut squash. My friends ordered fish, calamari, and shrimp which they shared. The waiter even offered to split the order, so they were served their own plates. The ambience is great with a beautiful view of the wharf at Pier 39. I recommend dining here when you visit!
author: Denise C.

description:
Pros: 
Incredible views off pier 39 
Great drinks (get the Alcatraz escape or hibiscus Margarita!) 
Fresh sourdough bread starter 
Attentive staff
Free birthday dessert 

Cons: 
Honestly we were all a little underwhelmed by our meals. Granted I got the steak in a fish house!! Just kind of blah and didn't care for the sauce or the bland broccoli side.
author: Michelle R.

description:
Came here with a few of my friends for a last dinner before drive back home 11 hrs away. The food here was excellent and the service. We ordered a few dishes and the seafood here was exquisitely delicious!

Ordered: 2 clam chowder bowl, fried scallops, seafood platter, the seafood tower, dungeness crab ravioli, and a mussel with fries (forgot the name but it was soooo good).
The clam chowder was really good, best one I've had. I really enjoyed the fried scallops, it came with a mustard jalepeno dipping sauce that made it taste even better. The seafood platter for 1 was so delicious. They was alot of melted butter and garlic underneath it that made everything better. I think this was the best one, it's enough to share with 2. The seafood tower was a bit disappointing because it wasn't a tower, they just put it in 2 plates and stack it on top with a thing that holds it together. We all pitched in for this one because it was almost $70, we don't think it was worthy because it didn't have alot of seafood on here as the platter & it wasn't a tower. :/ I got the dungeness crab ravioli, it was really good but disappointed that the dungeness crab wasn't inside the ravioli, it was on the top. The ravioli was stuffed with the ricotta cheese only. Then the mussels with the fries also the best dish here. The sauce was like a garlic mayo aioli that was drizzled on top of the dish, then the bottom was a coconut sweet sauce. 

Overall the food was still very good and so fresh it made everything go well together.
author: Susan L.

description: This is a very nice restaurant for local people and tourists . The sourdough is amazing here, everyone says so. We ordered Lazy Cioppino, Mixed grill, Linguini&clams, California crab&avocado salad. Everything is so fresh and yummy. The best is Cream brûlée, creamy body with crispy top, not too sweet , perfect ending!
author: Yen C.

description: Second best Cioppino after Anchor Oyster bar. The steak is also good too. Love this place. Will come back.
author: Huey T.

description: I'm never one to go out of my way to write a yelp review... ever. But, on our last night in SF we decided to make reservations here and couldn't have been happier with our experience. The food was amazing (especially the items off of the specials menu) and our server Curtis was attentive, kind, and made excellent recommendations. Will definitely be back again!
author: Matt S.
