description: Took my boyfriend to this restaurant for his birthday and we had the most pleasant experience. Our server, Justin H., was so kind and respectful and made the night complete for us. I will definitely return....the crème brûlée was amazing :)
author: Geneva L.

description:
Pier 39 has a bunch of pricey tourist trap restaurants, but this is not one of them.

Had a really nice cozy date by the waterfront! The service was really fast, and the food was delicious. We got the clam chowder bread bowl which was claimed to be SF's best. it was delicious!


the real star is the mussel fries. forget everything else in pier 39. Come here and get the mussel fries, it was absolutely worth it. It's a big plate with a nice seafood cream broth/sauce, a ton of mussels (~15+) and some crispy fries. The mussels were the best I ever had. They were just the right amount of cooked where it was still bouncy, fluffy, and rich.

Def come here if you're touring the pier!
author: Olive X.

description: Very friendly staff. We had the blue cheese garlic bread and the Mixed Grilled seafood, which were really good. The place itself and the view are nothing much.
author: Larissa A.

description:
It was overall good. Seafoods were fresh and traditional french Italian style.
Clam chowder was well made and delicious, but other pastas and soup was 
little bit salty  for me but still tasted good. Yeah the price is pricy but worth it. 
These french Italian dishes are hard to cook, they did a good job cooking.
author: Yenny O.

description:
This place is SERIOUS about food. I thought it was in the middle of the touristy part of the Fisherman's Wharf and I would pay for the scenery rather than the food. Boy I was wrong. It had both!

Almost all of the seats had spectacular views of the wharves, piers, boats and bay. Ours was not on the window, but one off the row which was in fact better. The wait service was impeccable. 

We came early which is about the smartest thing you could do if you don't want to wait for a hugely popular place to get a seat. Starters was the best old fashioned I've had. I don't like them "muddled", but the mashed fruit with the maple syrup was quite unique and quite enjoyable.

I started with a cub of clam chowder. It was very, very good. Not the best, but enjoyable. Lots of clams and bacon. Maybe too much bacon, but I will never say such a sacrilege out loud - "too much bacon". Just rip my tongue out before that happens. 

We split an appetizer portion of their scallops. They were fried in almost a Callabash style. No, I can't describe it, so Google it. I worked at a seafood restaurant on the South Carolina coast and this tasted like that. Very well cooked and very tasty. Lots of them almost like lightly battered popcorn shrimp. 

I like sampling things, so I went with the mixed grill. Had a little bit of everything. The asparagus was spot on. I'm not a tomato fan, but they were ok. The mashed potatoes were wonderful. Not mashed enough to be smooth, so it had a great texture and taste. It came with three of the most AWESOME grilled shrimp that I hoped I would come back some day just for the shrimp. It also came with a  fabulous piece of salmon. That too would have made a great meal. Finally a piece very superb swordfish. I started going into mental overload thinking which I would have as a dedicated meal if I ever came back. Too many awesome choices!
author: Robert M.

description:
My 3rd flashback review.

On 7/20/2016 when I was in San Francisco on a fine, sunny afternoon, I was heading to the San Francisco Piers until I discovered for this incredible seafood restaurant located at Pier 39 called, "Fog Harbor Fish House." This decent local restaurant serves the customers from local to travelers to taste and experience the finest seafood caught cuisines from fish, crabs, oysters, clams, mussels and many more! As I entered their front door, the atmosphere was very remarkable and elegant as I welcomed there. The concept is much like visiting to a first class seafood restaurant with a spectacular view of the Pacific Ocean especially the Alcatraz and the Golden Gate Bridge not too far away from the restaurant. The interior is very clean and fancy both inside and out.

The employees from servers, hosts and cookers especially chefs and bartenders are doing a fantastic job for accommodating the customers like me a sensational service despite the busiest summer environment. This server named, Samir was such a great male server. He gave me some good recommendations and suggestions especially asking a request for water refills too! No cons at all.

Now onto the food! Since I was in the middle of my budget visit, I ordered their signature soup of: the Fog Harbor's Clam Chowder. As I ate that chowder (in a small bowl), that soup was tasty and outstanding. Much bolder and flavorful than my homemade clam chowder! The ingredients were fresh and new as I did feel the taste of potatoes, clam bites and the smoothness thicker broth of the soup. Such a great soup at all!

Parking at Fog Harbor Fish House can be difficult to park. You can park at the nearest surface street parking nor the parking garage if it's available. Otherwise, you can also ride a bike, walk, carpool, public transportation, valet parking or ride sharing transportation easier without the hassles and headaches.

To conclude, Fog Harbor Fish House is the most absolute extraordinary local seafood restaurant that I've ever visited right here in San Francisco! Perfect for date nights, anniversaries or friends and family gatherings all year long! A well received visit! My rating: 4 1/2 stars.
author: William L.

description: A really nice place to have chowder with a view! Sat on the second story by the window and people watched for hours. Love this restaurant!
author: Danica F.

description: Great place! The Manhattan was the best I've had in a very long time! Service was great, food was great! We didn't wait to be seated and hardly waited for our drinks and food, we were surprised how fast we were served! The steak was cooked perfect, seafood was fresh and sides were delicious! (Crab risotto!) It's a bit expensive, but what can you expect in SF?
author: Kim K.

description: Wandered in here for an early dinner on a Friday and thankfully got a seat by the window looking out onto the pier where we got to see a gorgeous sunset. This place is a bit pricey but you do get what you pay for. The seafood is excellent and while it is a slightly more upscale place, there were many people there who were not dressed up so we fit right in. I got an Irish Coffee (it was St. Patrick's Day, after all) and the fish and chips, which I hadn't had in ages. Everything was cooked perfectly, not too oily and just the right amount of crispy. The portion was pretty big so couldn't finish it but it was delicious. Service and atmosphere were great. I probably would only come here on special occasions but highly recommend it, especially if you're a tourist and looking for great seafood with a view.
author: Pooja C.

description:
It's a great place for most of the people. But one star off for being specially treated.

I, together with my wife, were having vacation in San Francisco as FOREIGNERS and had the dinner in this place. 
We all enjoyed everything here, the food, the view, the service, until the payment.
I called for the check and the waiter came to me with it. And when I was going to put my card in the check presenter, the waiter asked me that how much tip I would pay, pointing on the check where it showed how much 15%, 18%, 20% would be.
It was embarrassing and rude!!! It sucks!!! How can you ask so?! It is a top secret, isn't it?
I was quite upset with it the first time and wanna said that I would write down the tips later. But I didn't do so, just because the restaurant are serving so many FOREIGNERS and maybe, some of them forgot to pay the tips. I understand why the waiter asking so. So, instead, I said to him I would pay 18%.
At the same time, the table next to us, seems to be local guys, the waiter didn't ask so and let them write down the tips later.
Though understanding, I'm still feeling being offended by this "special" treatment.
I truly respect the tip culture in US and doing so for hundreds of times. In the same way, I wish the restaurant, especially the restaurant who severs many many foreigners would respect their customers by treating them in the same way as local guys.

Once again, a great place for dinner. Hope what I experienced is just exceptional.


--------------------

Update
I've received a message from Bob who take charge of this restaurant.
Bob apologized for what I experienced and asked for the waiter's name so as to take further actions.
Honestly I didn't expect to have a prompt feedback from the business owner/manager. And it is really a positive attitude to make things right.
I remember I was in the place on Feb13 for a dinner, but forget the name of the waiter. Anyway, all I want to remember is that night, together with my wife, the food, the view, the atmosphere.
Really appreciate Bob's message and would recommend this place to my friends and all the people on Yelp.
author: George T.

description: I'm a sucker for a view.  Fog Harbor has a great one.  This was our first meal and stop in SF, and it didn't disappoint.  Our server was helpful, polite, and attentive.  My wife and I started w/ their baked oysters (oysters Rockefeller,) which were spectacular.   Was hard to hide my southern roots as I wanted to pick up the shell and shoot i down, but I refrained and used a fork.  For my entree I had the crab roll.  I'm a sucker for a New England Lobster Roll, and this was similar.  Crab was shredded so it was closer to crab salad, than the lump meat of a lobster roll.  It was amazing though.  Sweeter meat than a lobster.  Delicious.  My wife had the fresh local caught halibut fish and chips.  As good as I've had across the pond.  Pay a little extra for the view, but worth it.  You can see the sea lions on Pier 39 from your table.
author: Adam B. J.

description:
Dank place dope food sick atmosphere... Expensive but ay its SF what did you expect
Great place to play Pokemon Go lot of spawns and stops as you are eating
author: Huy B.

description:
I came here on a Sunday after paying a visit to the SF MOMA nearby. The whole pier was pretty busy, so I was expecting a wait. The wait for a table was 30-40 minutes. It's convenient here because they'll send you a text once your table is ready. So put your number down and feel free to explore the pier a bit!

We ordered a bowl of clam chowder, the red chili garlic shrimp, the cioppino (A MUST GET), and the mixed grill. The clam chowder was delicious! I definitely can't finish a whole serving by myself as it's super hearty and creamy. The red chili garlic shrimp was pretty good - spicy and tangy. The cioppino was sooooo delicious. For $33; they definitely don't skip on the mussels, clams, fish, shrimp, crab, and scallops. This dish is served with what seems to be a piece of garlic bread but I bypassed eating that. The mixed grill consists of grilled salmon, swordfish, shrimp, veggies, and mashed potatoes. I didn't really try much of the mixed grill, but my friend really enjoyed it! 

The service here was pretty good too albeit it being bustling with patrons. I'll definitely be back to try different items on the menu! They do validate up to 1 hour for parking if you park in the garage nearby.

P.S. Ask for a picture menu to make your selection process a little easier :)
author: Joanne Y.

description: Over rated for quality of meal. Dinginess crab was over cooked, raw oysters decent, but not sweet. Final blow was some one kipped my new ball cap from my chair. Staff blew it off. Not impressed!
author: George C.

description:
Really nice late lunch, and we got to catch the Fleet Week air show with the Blue Angels from our table. That alone should be worthy of five stars, but I need to deduct a star for my food. I ordered the ahi tuna, which was supposed to be seared rare, but it was cooked maybe medium/medium-rare... the wasabi aioli was really nice, though, and the rice it came with was super tasty. I also had the hibiscus margarita, and that was bomb! apparently it's voted the best margarita in the city by SF Weekly, and it was easy to see why. I also enjoyed the bleu cheese garlic bread that we got for a starter, especially dipped in a little bit of the lemon aioli that came with the calamari starter.

So. Two starters, two drinks each, and two entrees came out to $135 pre-tax. We spent about two hours there (or just over), and had a good meal and good entertainment with the air show. expensive, but worthwhile. Had the tuna been actually rare, I'd have given this visit five stars.
author: Angela H.

description:
Fog Fish Harbor House has a spectacular view of the water and is located in the heart of touristy fisherman's wharf. It is located on the second floor if you are searching for it.

I had the Mixed Grill, which included shrimp, salmon, and mahi mahi. I was also able to try the clam chowder bread bowl as well. I really enjoyed the sourdough bread along with the clam chowder. The salmon was the best item I had here. It was flavorful and juicy with a slight char that was not overpowering. The mahi mahi was a little dry and overcooked. The grilled shrimp had a nice charcoal to it like the salmon.
author: Ash S.

description:
Things I liked about our visit to this place last Friday. 
1.  The ambiance -- it was nice. We were seated on the upper level. We had a beautiful view of the bay. 
2.  The food -- I had the combination platter (1/2 crab, shrimp, mussels and clams).  It was delicious! It was cooked well. Very flavorful. My husband had the crab cocktail. The kids had something from the kids' menu. Lol
3.  The server -- Mel was very friendly. Accommodated our requests. We had our 3 kids with us. He was patient and kind.  Very knowledgeable. 

We will definitely come back again!
author: Jocelyn P.

description: Best fish and chips I've ever had! Definitely coming back again for the amazing view as well
author: Valeria R.

description:
If you're looking for a great mixed drink in Fisherman's Wharf, go here and ask for Nelson. This guy made the best Belvedere martini I found anywhere in Fisherman's Wharf.  Once we found Nelson, my wife and I had happy hour here everyday during our vacation. I even had another bartender at Fog Harbor make the same drink when Nelson was on break, and it wasn't nearly as good. A great bartender makes all the difference. They should actually put that drink on the menu and call it The Nelson. Really nice, personable guy too. Always made us feel welcome. For food we generally had shrimp cocktail, calamari and oysters. All good.  Worth a visit if you're in Pier 39.

Forgot to add - if you want The Nelson, it's Belvedere martini, up, touch dirty, blue cheese olives.
author: Justin R.

description: Great chowder in bread bowl and good non-alcoholic drink options. A nice break from the wharf chaos.
author: Tish M.

description:
Stopped by after Alcatraz tour for lunch. Sat down immediately and server, Michele, attended us very quickly and pleasantly.

Their famous clam chowder was delicious! I would recommend not getting the sourdough and just getting the cup or bowl (more for less $$). 

Lobster roll was to die for. Their butter roll was exquisite (wish I could have had more and not care about the calories). Burger was also very good. 

Would definitely come back again.
author: Amanda P.

description:
FISH N CHIPS WITH A VIEW~

CUSTOMER SERVICE: 5/5. AJ was our main server but the manager I believe and other servers were helping us out as well. Drinks were never empty and we always got more bread when we asked. Orders were taken at a timely manner and it only took about 15 minutes for all of our food to come out.

FOOD:
SOUP/SALAD COMBO: 5/5. Got the clam chowder bread bowl and Caesar salad. So good! I loved the salad dressing and the lettuce was very fresh and crispy. They leave the lettuce strips uncut so just a heads up. I honestly didn't think too much of it but it could be a little difficult to eat.

FISH N CHIPS: 5/5. So crispy and big. The fish was delicious and the fries were great as well. Coleslaw could've been a bigger portion but not complaining. Came with about 3 big pieces! Definitely would get again.

SEAFOOD PENNE: 5/5. Really creamy and lots of seafood. Portion for this was big and definitely filling. Pasta was cooked well. Nothing wrong with this dish. Highly recommend.

OVERALL: 5/5. With views of the Pier from pretty much wherever you're sitting, great food and how classy the restaurant was, it could easily be a restaurant for a date night or a casual dinner. Can't wait to come back when in SF~
author: Nikki B.

description:
Definitely get a seat by the window and make a reservation or go early to get a seat. It gets really busy by lunchtime on Sunday. View is beautiful during mid-day. 

Great drink list and food was above average.

Great staff & bathroom is clean :)
author: Ji Eun L.

description: Wonderful food and atmosphere.  We sat at the bar and my husband ate oysters until he couldn't stand.  Though I am not into oysters, I did enjoy the broiled options.  It's just that good.  The fish was fresh and the beer was ice cold.  Loved it!
author: Edie C.

description: Restaurant on the pier with a very nice ocean view. Nice ambiance and very clean. Customer service was awesome our waitress was very friendly and attentive to all our request. Food was good but over priced, understandable since it's right on the beach and we did order the most expensive items on the menu steak and lobster. I would definitely recommend if you want a nice lunch or dinner and I would return.
author: Irene V.

description: We loved the food. The risotto and the ceviche was great. But we most enjoyed the service. Jeff was able to handle our party of 6 and many requests. We would come back anytime. Thanks Jeff!!
author: Candice C.

description: Maybe I fee! warm and fuzzy toward them because we had an awful dining experience the night before, but I'm giving them the 5.  The ambiance was so nice, the view was beautiful, and the service was impeccable.  Our server (whose name I unfortunately have forgotten) was very knowledgeable and especially accommodating to our young children.  The cioppino and crab cakes were perfectly satisfying in the way a great meal should be.  The only downside is that the wait was long, but I think any place worth eating at down by Pier 39 will have a wait.
author: Kate K.

description: Very poor reception services, two receptionists were poker-faced. We waited for 2hours for a table as we are requested near the window to get the sightseeing view two elders wedding anniversary which we wrote that in the booking request mail before, however the girl arrange a poor place. But we saw two empty tables is ok so we try to change for that, then the girl said need another hours for waiting. In additional, once we walk into the dining room, no one served us, no one answered us. So the elders came out find receptionists for answering inquiries. They just said either you take the seat whatever she gave you, nor waited another hours. We did wait already, and we did told them what we waited for, how can you ask us to spending dozens of time to let you redo your things right? And the receptionists were very unfriendly, seems we are a famous restaurant, whatever I do you must be compromised. Finally, we left the restaurant for another good one, the poor service made us left bad memories on those special days. All families don't wanna spend money in a restaurant seems begging for food.  Might be beacause we are just foreigners, they treated us like that.
author: Chan C.

description: It's really a spacious restaurant with nice dishes and friendly waiters. After knowing we were a little hard to decide from the menu, they gave us a picture book, which is much more easier to look. We ordered a clam chowder with home salad, a whole garlic crab and a cheese bread. The clam chowder was good, and the salad was fantastic. I really liked the salad with its dressing. The crab was also good tasting. Ordering an extra bread was too much for a group of two.
author: Skylar H.

description: A must if you're going to be in SF! We've been here every time we visit and 2x this last trip. Food is always amazing, great drink selection and atmosphere is fun and bright. I can't wait to go again!
author: Rebecca J.

description:
Beautiful views of the harbor but way too expensive.

This was the most expensive and most forgettable meal of our week and a half trip through Cali.

We had the Clam Chowder, Calamari, and Crab roll sandwich.

The chowder and Calamari were great but the Crab roll did not taste very fresh.

This basic lunch with a couple drinks set us back over $100.

I'd recommend getting out of the Fisherman's Wharf area and trying any of the spots just outside on the Embarcadero if you are looking for a better value.
author: Ron R.

description: I had my meal at the bar.  From my observation the table staff was eager to please and attended to the tables diligently.  My bartender was friendly and I didn't feel rushed in the least bit as is often the case at most San Francisco restaurants. The views from the entire restaurant are phenomenal.  I had the happy hour calamari that was perfectly cooked and flavored.  My Bloody Mary was fully dressed and just as I requested.  The New England clam chowder soup was tasty especially when the freshly made sourdough bread was used as my spoon.
author: Jessica B.

description:
Walking around Pier 39 being the tourist I was, I decided to have a nice lunch with a nice view. I wanted clam chowder, crab and oysters. I didn't know I was in for a treat. The hostess was very accommodating and quoted us a reasonable waiting time. My party was seated partially (great, because I was starving!) I skimmed through the menu and told myself to try not to order everything on the menu. 

Views of the Alcatraz, Sf Bay, Golden Gate Bridge, so request a table by the window. 

Clam chowder with a side of their fresh house-made sourdough bread. I was delighted when I found out they were serving my favorite oysters that day, Miyagi's from British Columbia (plump, briny, deep cup, meaty, perfection!) an immediate dozen to begin please. Clams linguine with a generous portion of fresh clams. Garlic herb roasted dungeness crab comes pre-cracked with a side of veggies and potatoes. The fried platter came with a delicious lemon aioli sauce but the fried seafood was a miss though. Our server and the wait staff was awesome, attentive and nice. For desserts, there's no menu. They will bring you a whole tray of "display" desserts for you to select from. Love this idea. I went with the dessert duo of house-made vanilla bean creme brulee and warm chocolate fudge cake. 

Take your receipt with you for 30% off Biscoff downstairs

5 stars for great food quality and great service!
author: Carrie C.

description: It's a pretty decent restaurant in the pier, nice ocean views and pretty good food. We decided to settle with this restaurant since we all just kind of wanted to sit and just enjoy the view after a kind day of driving and walking around SF. We were seated right next to the window which was perfect because there was a nice view of the bay and all the city lights which made it a perfect dining experience. We each ordered something different, as we had chowder bread bowls, halibut and mash, seafood pastas, steaks, and lots of other stuff. The food is a bit pricey but I mean it's the location that makes it that but it's still pretty decent. The service was really good as our server was pretty attentive and he made little comments and jokes here and there which made our night so much more fun. Overall this restaurant is pretty good whether your a tourist or a local.
author: Maybeline C.

description:
Decided to come here based on yelp reviews for lunch while visiting Pier 39 and the Wharf! The hostess was a little snooty because she was not happy to seat an extra person.. I believe I said 6 and then corrected myself with 7 and she must not have heard but the attitude was definitely not called for.  Oh well.. our server was nice for the large party we had.  I feel like we sat there for a long time though for just a meal and didn't end up having enough time to explore the Wharf.  

The food.. I had the mussels and they were a bit sandy and salty.  My friend said her linguine and clams were also a bit salty.  The fresh oysters were delicious though - can't go wrong with freshly shucked oysters with marinara, vinegar and horseradish!  The tuna poke was also very good and had good flavor.  They also give you fresh sour dough bread - I'm not a fan of sour dough but everyone was killing it! The calamari was decent as well, nothing special but not bad either.  Ok place on the Wharf - definitely caters to tourists.
author: Ivy L.

description:
The average rating for Fog Harbor is correct! Nice views, good food, pleasant atmosphere, but super touristy. 
I really liked their backed oysters and clam chowder. Not a bad choice when you are in the area.
author: Melany C.

description:
Was this place good, yes... but it didn't blow me away by any means. Some views are great depending on what table you get but ours was just "ok" which made me sad since we waited for over an hour. I had a "lipstick lemonade" that was sweet but hardly any alcohol. Shared a bread bowel that they said "best in San Francisco" but it was average. For dinner had the shrimp
Brochette. The shrimp were a large size and tasty but the sides were undercooked. If you read my post I base them off there dollar value. Higher $ restaurants I expect better food, something to make me say wow. This wasn't it, good but nothing to make me want to come back.
author: Cecilia A.

description: Amazing view!prawns were superb.all the dishes were perfect.huge thumps up.
author: Braden F.

description: The view is excellent. You can see seals, Alcatraz and the Golden Gate Bridge. Our service was relaxed ... maybe too much. The food was good for a touristy type restaurant. There wasn't anything I would complain about but nothing that I would rave about. Overall, the view was worth it.
author: Misty W.

description: One of our favorite stops during our San Francisco get away! We were seated right away since we didn't need a view of the ocean. I would assume that if you wanted that, the wait could get lengthy, but we didn't wait at all! The prices were much more reasonable than we were expecting due to the nice environment. Our bread bowl was 11$ and we split that and a salad that was 10$. We were stuffed! Our server was super nice and helpful. We got dessert after and it did not disappoint. Such a good experience here ! Highly recommend.
author: Jessie A.

description: If you are in the Bay Area and find yourself visiting Pier 39 -AND- you love seafood or steak, then you Must try Fog Harbor Fish House. There are some amazing views at this place (spoiler alert = it's the Seals) and you can take in the view of "The Rock" as well. If you are going to have seafood in the Bay Area, try out Fog Harbor, I suggest anything with the word "Dungeness" in it.
author: Tim O.

description: My boyfriend and I had the garlic half crab and another delicious buttery crab (forgot the name) This was the first time I've ever had crab. My boyfriend and I were wondering around and he wanted to get crab from one of those shops that had a crab mix, but I persuaded him to go all out. I am so happy that we decided to come here, the service was amazing, our view was great too... just as the sun was setting. This crab was so easy to get out of the shell, the taste was phenomenal and dipping it in the butter made me feel like a Paula Deen queen. Since that's all I tried, and I was amazed by it, I definitely recommend.
author: Vane V.

description: One year later we had the opportunity to return to Fog Harbor Fish House. Once again it was awesome. My Mom had Linguine with Clams and I had one of their Specials, Scallops and Crab Risotto. The Scallops and Crab Risotto was awesome. There were 4 large scallops and inside the risotto were chunks of crab. It was the perfect amount for a late dinner. The Linguine and Clams was perfectly seasoned. Not only were there clams in the shells, but clam meat mixed into the Linguine. Service was great and our waitress Shawna's timing was perfect.
author: Donna R.

description:
Nothing short of amazing at this iconic Pier 39 restaurant - incredible seafood and top shelf pleasant service. Whole steamed fresh dungenous crab with a side of al dente steamed broccoli and liquid butter, and soy ginger glazed wasabi aioli seared ahi over a bed of fragrant garlic sautéed Jasmine rice. We ended our lunch with the dessert duo of mini vanilla bean creme brûlée and chococlate infused dense rich mini lava cake coupled with fresh whipped cream and a stroke of real strawberry puree. Talk about gastronomical delights! Did I mention the fantastic view of Pier 39? Pure heaven!!

BTW - If you ever visit this place, make sure SUSAN serves your table. She was absolutely friendly and FIRST CLASS!
author: C G.

description: Super helpful and friendly staff. We ordered the seafood platter with crab ceviche and chowder. The crab ceviche was good, worth a try but I didn't think it was worth the price. Everything on the seafood platter was pure bliss. This place may be expensive but I'd say every dollar was well spent.
author: Riley M.

description: Views were great and atmosphere was amazing for a Saturday lunch. Food was reasonable priced for the location and the service was quick and responsive. The food my wife and I had was fried calamari, clam chowder (awarded best in SF) and a salmon sandwich. All three dishes had different and unique flavors and recommended that you should try when you are in town.
author: Jasson C.

description:
Okay if you are like me and love to eat good food and are afraid of bad service this place is set up in the perfect location to be bad in both because it's located in one of the busiest touristy places in the world, however that is TOTALLY NOT what happened! Instead we received great food and excellent service. It was the perfect lunch experience and our server Ashlee was amazing adding to our overall experience!

Okay so really the clam chowder is awesome! Recommended by my family who live in the city over Boudin's. Good call sister because I was out on a date. The view is incredible as you sit there with the bay view of the "ROCK" and ships coming into and out of port. World class service makes you feel like you are at a fine dining restaurant. Yet this place is adorned by locals as well and affordable. The menu suits all and I will make sure to come back.

The calamari was excellently cooked with fried jalepanos and onions alongside a lemon aioli sauce. The fish and chips portion was large enough to be shared by two people and it came out perfect. I don't know if I've ever had better. You can actually tell they change the grease out of the fryer because instead of tasting grease you tasted the breaded goodness and the fish.

Please don't be afraid to eat here since it is literally on the world famous Pier 39. It will be worth the wait as everyone and everything we encountered here was a positive and memorable experience! Looking forward to coming back soon!
author: Shane T.

description:
We didn't expect to find this gem of a seafood place at Pier 39 and we were pleasantly surprised when we decided to give this place a try. The Cioppino is a MUST and we enjoyed it tremendously. And the butter and garlic crab as well. We also had their famous Clam Chowder soup as well as half a dozen oysters. While all were good, our two favourites are the Cioppino and the garlic crab. 
To top the great food experience, our server, Lidia was just outstanding ... she attended to our needs always with a smile and her food recommendations were spot-on for us. 
Would highly recommend this seafood restaurant to all who visit pier 39.
author: Patrick L.

description: So delicious. Fresh seafood, wonderful view. Servers had excellent suggestions. Everything was really lovely.
author: Nifer S.

description: I continue to find a lot of shell in the crab chowder bowl, the Serving could be better for the extra charge for the crab! quite upsetting when you dig in for a big spoon full and have to fish out shell out of your mouth. Drinks can be more consistent order 3 of the same drink all tasted different for some reason? Other then that I've enjoyed everything else very much! I will be coming back soon!
author: Elizabeth G.

description: WOW what good food and experience. The food was made to perfection, service was prompt and polite and the servers made sure that everyone has a great time.
author: Sachin P.

description:
I am so happy I picked this place as our to go restaurant when my friend and I visited Pier 39.  Even though the wait was an hour long, it was well worth it!  Service here is impeccable and food here is amazing.

They start you off with complimentary sourdough bread and you might think complimentary bread won't be that special but let me tell you... this bread was SOOOOO GOOD.  It came wrapped in a towel to preserve the warmness.  The bread tears apart so effortlessly and it goes PERFECTLY with the butter they supply you with.

My friend and I ordered non-alcoholic drinks first.  We both got the Strawberry-Basil Nojito ($7.00).  This was made with fresh mint, basil and strawberries muddled with fresh lime juice, and soda water.  I could not stop drinking this - it was super fresh and rejuvenating.  I highly recommend!

For our entrees, we ordered the following:

Bowl of Clam Chowder ($8.00) - award winning clam chowder.  This was thick and creamy - very very tasty... paired with the sourdough bread - my god, HEAVEN!

Ahi Tuna Poke ($17.00) - marinated raw tuna, avocado, mango, sesame-soy sauce and wasabi aioli.  My first time having poke in the west coast and I was not disappointed.  They give you these sesame chips to go with the poke and it just blends so well with each other.

1/2 dozen of Oysters ($15.00) - pretty standard oysters... but definitely very fresh!

Mixed Grilled ($26.00) - grilled salmon, swordfish and shrimp, citrus beurre blanc, sautéed vegetables and garlic mashed potatoes.  Our server was nice enough to split this into two plates for my friend and I!  The swordfish was really soft and easy to eat, salmon was fresh as well.

Overall - I really enjoyed my experience here and will definitely come back when I visit SanFran again!
author: Racheal D.

description: This place was super busy on a Saturday night.  We put our name in the wait list of 4 people and they were able to seat us within 30 mins.  It wasn't a bad wait as they had a nice seating area with a fireplace so the wait time went by fast.  The dining area is very spacious and we didn't feel scrunched.  The view was good overlooking the pier.  Our server Jessica came to greet us right away and got us our ordered drinks promptly.  We ordered the combo fish fry, the chicken sandwich, the grill seafood combo, and fresh sole.  I tasted all of the dishes and all of them were good.  My combo came with salmon, tuna and shrimp.  The salmon was very moist, the tuna was done right and the shrimp was on a skewer well done as well.  The sole was a tad bland but was well made, just needed better seasoning or sauce.  I loved the calamari from the fried combo.  They served the dishes very fast and the waitress was attentive throughout.  I'm a fish with my water and Jessica was constantly refilling my glass even though you can tell she was busy with all her tables.  Finally we ordered dessert and the Apple walnut crisp with vanilla ice cream was awesome!  You gotta try it!  The prices weren't bad and the dishes were worth the money. Definitely will return when I'm back in the San Francisco area
author: Ed D.

description:
Beautiful view, and you won't have to wait if you come at lunchtime. It's by pier39 so is in the thick of tourist central, which makes it a great place to take your parents or anyone who is visiting San Francisco. You should call ahead to reserve a table by a window. 

Delicious bread (which is probably from nearby Bourdain) to start, and excellent seafood options from crab to cioppino to lobster to fish n chips to chowder. 

It's not a usual spot for locals to go, but is worth it for the view and the seafood.
author: Leeyen R.

description: Great for tourist and a marvelous view of the San Francisco Bay; however, the food is average. I ordered the swordfish and it was not very exciting. The texture was not as moist as I wanted it to be. Normally the texture of swordfish is like a tender chicken breast. I also ordered the clam chowder and it was a bit on the pricey side. Service was great and the waiter was super attentive! I wouldn't say this place is bad, but rather it is a good one time experience. It is also located in the heart of Fisherman's Wharf, so if you're in the area, feel free to drop in.
author: John M.

description: Super kind services and great foods and drink! Award winning Clam chowder was no need to say. I recommend a bread bowl one rather than regular ones. Garlic roasted crab was fantastic. It serves for two perfectly.
author: HeeYoung Y.

description: Wow this place is wonderful!  They make their own sourdough bread for instance.  The clam chowder is great try it with crab on top!  The mock tail menu is especially good.  The fish is so fresh .  I'd recommend this place at Pier 39.  Also the views are spectacular --you can see the sea lions.
author: Janet G.

description: Great seafood, sustainable fishing sourcing practices. Cocktail menu could be revamped. Overall great!
author: Svetlana F.

description: Decent food, fish and chips was on the average side. No taste to the fried fish but the fries were really good. Better than the restaurant across from it for sure, the other place is super greasy. It's so greasy that the floors are greasy.
author: John L.

description:
Extremely rude hosts. Like almost comically so. We had an OpenTable reservation and 2 of us were on time. One was parking. It was 5:15 pm on a weekday. Place was empty. They were extremely rude and said their policy doesn't allow you to seat parties, and basically threatened me to beckon the manager (which I accepted). Just not a good vibe. I used to like this place, a lot, (per the earlier review), but now starting with a bad taste.

Edit - we let the manager know and he was very kind and accommodating. Food was delicious. I would try again.
author: Andrew K.

description:
Fog Harbor Fish House was the first place my husband and I ate when we arrived in San Fran. It was a late lunch and dinner basically. We decided to tour Pier 39 first and when we got here we were starving. It was the first place we came across that looked descent so we decided to dine here. The menu looked nice as well as the restaurant itself. We liked that you could view the Bay while eating. We were greeted by the hostess and had no wait. Our waiter was nice and asked us if we had any questions about the menu. Overall the staff was very nice and welcoming.

We first started with drinks. I ordered the Strawberry-Basil Nojito and he ordered the Maple Old Fashion. My drink was non-alcoholic. It was very good and fizzy and had the perfect blend of strawberry, mint and basil. Nothing was overpowering. Very good. My husband's drink was strong and he enjoyed it. Old Fashions are way to strong for me. 

Next we started with appetizers, side salads and bread. We decided to split a Calm Chowder Bread Bowl and we both ordered our own side salad. I ordered a Mix Green Salad and he ordered a Caesar Salad. I'm not a big fan of Clam Chowder but I'm willing to try most things. I honestly don't care for soup but Clam Chowder is just to creamy and weird for me. My husband was more so wanting to try this and being a team player I did. Now our salads were amazing. Yes they were simple but very good. My mixed Green Salad had the standard Balsamic Dressing but this dressing was thicker and a dark orange color. Very tasty. I didn't taste my husband's salad but he did mention that his salad was one of the best Caesars he has had in awhile so I take it that it was good. Lol. He's the one to order all the fattening (don't worry he works out and is skinny) stuff when we go out and I'm the one to make sure we get our greens. We ate all of this with their standard Sourdough Bread. It wasn't anything special, basic Sourdough. 

For our lunch/dinner I ordered the Pacific Sole and he ordered the Lobster Tail. My dinner came with a Spinach and Red Pepper mix with Fingerling Potatoes. My husband's meal came with Mashed Potatoes and Steamed Broccoli. My dish was AMAZING!! The fish was seasoned and cooked perfectly. The butter sauce was amazing as well and probably one of the better ones I have tasted. I personally don't liked sautéed spinach so this part wasn't my favorite. The only cooked spinach I like is creamed spinach. The red peppers added a nice touch to the fish. My only complaint about the dish is that the Potatoes could have used more seasoning or could have been crisped or something. They were just plain and put on the plate. I'm sure they were roasted but there was no crispness about them or flavor at all. My husband liked his Lobster Tail. I didn't try his lobster as I don't like the texture of lobster, but I did try his Mashed Potatoes. They were definitely a lot better than my potatoes and good. 

Overall, the Fog Harbor Fish House was a good place to eat. Decently priced food and drinks that are good.
author: Tiffany D.

description: This place is amazing, great atmosphere, great service we had the best waiter his name is Khaiman he's the best, and delicious food and drinks. My girlfriend and I went we got the shellfish platter for 2 with a lobster tail, the calamari as a appetizer, and drinks she had a margarita( Khaiman was nice enough to custom make it for her with gin with and Tequila egg white froth) and I had the House beer which was amazing. Absolutely worth the trip, go check it out!
author: Alan G.

description:
Very nice place with good clam chowder. A good clam chowder served in the sour dough bread with crab meat is very satisfying. Nothing says more than welcome to San Francisco more than a good chowder. 

We were seated by the window with nice ocean view.
author: Angela C.

description: Restaurant is clean and has a great view.  We are visiting from New York and maybe bias because of the amazing food New York has to offer.  I gave this restaurant two stars because some of their dishes were very bad especially their crab cakes.  I was served the two deep fried pucks with yellow and the picture on the right was taken off yelp from a patron of this restaurant, which is what I was expecting.  Im a big sea food lover and crab cakes is one of my favorite so I try crab cakes anywhere I go and was shocked to find this is what they call crab cakes at Fisherman Wharf
author: Jamie J.

description: This was my first time here! Our waiter Justin, was very personable from greeting us to going through the menu thoroughly! He was very prompt and kept my water full! We had their famous clam chowder, which was so creamy and a crab salad was to die for!! Then went for the Seafood tower!! (omg the CRAB?!!!) We added extra oysters too. Hats off to you Fog Harbor!! I'll be seeing you through the upcoming Christmas holidays!! See below what a gorgeous night it was....
author: Corlyn D.

description:
Out of all the restaurants they offer on pier 39, I am so happy I chose Fog Harbor Fish House on my recent trip to SF! Number one of course was the spectacular view on that perfect sunny Saturday. It was just perfect! Service was also phenomenal!


We ordered the mussel fries as a starter and clam chower bowls with crab meat. I am not a fan of mussels usually because I feel they are more on the dry side as oppose to clams, but THESE mussels were so moist and tender I've never had mussels like these before. The aioli sauce drizzled over the french fries were absolutely delicious! Sounds like a weird combo, but trust me, it is soooo good! The clam chowder I felt was a bit too thick, but it was still nonetheless delicious especially with the crab meat!

Main entrees we had the half garlic roasted crab, and penne seafood pasta. The roasted garlic crab came out perfect. Everything just broke apart perfectly, no need for any utensils to open up the crab legs. It was almost like a soft shell crab in a way. The tomato cream sauce in the Penne seafood pasta was perfect! I am not really a fan of tomato sauce pasta, and cream only sauce is a bit too heavy for me, so this was a perfect combo for it was not too tangy nor heavy. 

Our drinks were filled constantly and our waitress checked on us very often to make sure everything was good.

PLEASE give this place a try! WILL BE BACK!
author: Katrina Y.

description:
My family and I just had dinner here for the first time ever and it was absolutely amazing. Our server, Justin H, was incredibly attentive! We can't wait to come back and bring some friends. 

We ordered:
Fried Shrimp
Clam Chowder
Mixed Grill

And the dessert:
Chocolate cake and creme brûlée!

Everything was wonderful!
author: Daniel C.

description: This is my first time in San Francisco and I kept getting told about the dungeonous crab and how SF is known for the crab so I had to find a restaurant with that crab so we came across this one. I ordered the clam chowder to start and it was the best I've ever had! We also had the crab cocktail and that was so tasty too! for an entree I had the whole dungeonous crab (see picture) and omg it was absolutely amazing!! also a plus was the service everyone was so friendly it was a really great place highly recommend
author: Anabella R.

description: The restaurant have an amazing view of the Pier 39 and you can see the sea lions. The clam chowder is 9 dollars per bowl and it's a great portion, even enough to share among 2. We got the cioppino. It was delicious and huge portion with a variety of seafood items. The service was excellent and super friendly.
author: Arlene S.

description: 5 solid stars.. This place is amazing, they told us a 20-30 minute wait was actually maybe 15. We ordered oysters, seafood tower, Caesar salad, clam chowder with crab on top and a separate bread bowl of clam chowder. We had window seats with an amazing view of the sunset. Christian was our waiter. If you don't treat yourself to this place you are not treating yourself like you should. We ended the night with the desert duo, Omg perfect ending to a great meal.
author: Jason Z.

description:
Today was a very disappointing experience for me. 
 I brought my mom-in-law to try this place for the first time since I have been here couple of times. Manager Mario right of the back told me that the expensive transport chair cannot be brought in if she is not sitting on it. He said we need to leave it outside by the sitting area where strollers are kept. I asked him if the staff will keep an eye on transport chair. He said no and will not be responsible for it. Instead of telling me first to check and see if there will be room to bring it inside (and that's how a great manager should have done!!) he just rudely kept on saying it cant be brought inside. He finally backed down and let me bring the transport chair to see if there's room for it. Lo and behold!! There is room for it since our table is at the end. He just said "I guess there's room for it". 
Food is still good but manager Mario sucks!!
author: M V.

description:
I came here for the first time earlier on my birthday with my boyfriend. It was packed but we were seated right away by the window, we got a nice view of the ocean and the pier which was pretty sweet. 

Our server was Sara, she was very optimistic and outgoing. She got everything we needed right away and did not hesitate to do so. We both ordered pasta, I got the chicken penne and he got the linguini & clams. My chicken penne was extremely bland. I had to pour so much black peppers and salt to get some sort of flavor in my dish. My boyfriends entree was really good though. 

It was my birthday dinner and I told my server that. She went out of her way and brought every different dessert they had in the back and let me pick what I wanted, which was very nice of her. The bill came out to be about $42, including my birthday discount. And the free complimentary birthday dessert. 

When I come back next time, I'm definitely going to try their steak instead!
author: Tracy N.

description:
Wow! Amazing delicious food! Loved every bit of it. The place, the staff, the food, the view, all of it. Came here for the ratings and I was not let down.  My boyfriend and I wanted to taste a little bit of everything without spending a lot, so we decided to share. We shared a "cup" size chowder and "Jumbo Shrimp Cocktail". For myself I ordered the  "Garlic Whole Dungeness Crab" and he got the "Shellfish Platter". Overall we spent $130 not including tip. Quite an expensive meal but definitely worth it. 

CHOWDER: 10/10 cup size was perfect to share. Get a little taste without getting full. 
SHRIMP COCKTAIL: 10/10 very refreshing 
GARLIC WHOLE DUNGENESS CRAB: 10/10 very garlic flavored potatoes and broccoli. The garlic on the crab was just right, not overpowering. Enough to satisfy you and still have room for dessert. 
SHELLFISH PLATTER: 8/10 boyfriend thought some of the crab pieces were dry. He liked the meaty mussels though. 
CREME BRÛLÉE: 10/10 perfect sweetness
author: Christal C.

description:
Went here on two separate occasions and was very pleased both times. Fog Harbor has a great seafood selection and wine options. The service was great. They really get you at the end when you ask for the desert menu -- they walk up with a huuuuge desert tray with all of the options on there. Not buying the entire tray's worth of desert is quite honestly the hardest thing I've ever had to do.

Other reviewers are not wrong when they say the waterside view amazing. I purposely went there the second time around for a dinner date and the view was a great wow factor! Great date spot if you're visiting SF!
author: Julio C.

description: As someone who works in the food industry, I was fully impressed with everything about this restaurant. Our server, Justin, was informative, friendly and sincere. The food was on point and the managers even came by to see how everything was going. I highly recommend coming here and checking out this place for yourselves. It might be in the touristy area of the city but this place is an integral part of what makes San Francisco great!
author: Jason G.

description: Had a stop in after our tour of Alcatraz Island. Got seated right away, both of us ordered cocktails and they were pretty good! Something hibiscus was my favorite. I really liked my fish and the fish and chips were good too. Not bad, a little over priced but hey it's the location.
author: Jeff E.

description: Loved our visit.  Our waiter Justin was fantastic!   We ordered several things, one of them we miss-interpreted and Justin fixed it immediately.  Food was spot on, service was great, atmosphere was very pleasant.
author: Carissa S.

description:
Food is great as always! Our server Miguel is the best! 

Hostess? Same girl who seems to hate her life and job. She should get a job somewhere else where she doesn't need to interact with anyone. Been to this place a few times, her attitude is still the same. Rude and unfriendly.
author: Angel L.

description: Best claim chowder no wonder they have awarded. But the shellfish dish was too buttery for me. Only the shrimp was good. I did not like the beanie taste of the cod dish.
author: Randy F.

description:
This is the place to eat seafood at Pier 39! The prices are decent and the portions are plentiful! Two people ate the 2-person shellfish platter, had 2 drinks, and an appetizer for $98. While this is pricy, it is cheaper than any other seafood restaurants on the pier and the food is delicious!!!!

I ordered the Lombard Lemonade (yum) and for $10.95 is was pretty large. The shellfish platter was huge--we couldn't eat it all!
author: Jessica H.

description: My husband and I dined here tonight and we have no faults! We chose the restaurant because we wanted to try a chowder bread bowl and Fog Harbour's didn't disappoint - it was incredible. Highly recommend paying the $7 extra to get crab pieces included. We also had the baked oysters (amazing and highly recommended!) and the mixed grill (great portion size and so fresh). Great atmosphere and lovely view of the harbour.
author: Kate H.

description: Best fish restaurant on Pier 39! The Ahi was to die for! The lobster tails were meaty not tiny little tails. The bread was to die for and the service was impeccable. I will say the lady in the front shirt with black hair was not all that nice but i can understand dealing with tourist all day can be tough! 10/10 will come back next year! Keep up the good work!
author: James M.

description:
I found the atmosphere to be great my waiter (tony) was absolutely wonderful and if I'm ever back in San Francisco I'll be stopping there again and again .
Had my first meal bought it would be a one off experience but I went back and it was just as good
author: Chris D.

description: Visited San Francisco this past weekend. I went online to make a reservation however none available. Called in and the voicemail said if online is booked come in, we keep seats open for walk ins. We did a 1.5 hour wait list.  We decided to wait. It was my mom my fiancé and myself. My fiancé went inside to watch the news by the bar {standing}. There was a group sitting there and he invited my mom to sit since it was. O,d outside and there was no seating.  The host asked us to leave. I asked if my mom could sit there since no one was she said no. I even to,d her we would gladly get up if she needed to seat someone. Again no.  Needless to say that seat stayed empty the entirety of the visit. Once seated the server was fantastic. Accommodating friendly and knowledgeable. Boudin had better clam chowder and the food was average expected better. Wouldn't visit on my next trip.
author: Monique S.

description: Delicious place! Had such nice service (By a sweet man named Eddie) and the food was inexpensive and so amazing! Definitely recommend.
author: Carmelita B.

description:
Loved this place on Pier 39. We asked the waitress for what the best. Several things were ordered but whats still remaining on my mind is still the shellfish platter. And the garlic bread. 

Have to criticize that they had bacon on their world famous clam chowder soup. 

But the views and good service makes up for it.
author: Matt B.

description:
Great fresh seafood that is cooked delicately! 
Had the sea food platter and San Francisco clam chowder and both were cooked to perfection!
author: Samantha N.

description: Pier 39 is totally a tourist trap, but this restaurant is so worth it. From the view, to the extremely knowledgeable and friendly staff to the scrumptious food, it's five stars all the way. We went with the attitude that you only live once and each of the four of us chose an appetizer and a main course. Nothing disappointed! You must try the clam chowder in the sourdough bread bowl. And the scallops- like butter! Yum.
author: Erin E.

description:
Complete tourist trap!  It's in a touristy destination for a reason. 

I ordered the cioppino. The "broth" was just tomato paste. No seafood flavor at all. The seafood was bland. I've had better cioppino in San Francisco. 

Skip this place!  I wish I did. There's so many better places to eat.
author: Payman F.

description: Great food and an awesome view. I got the cioppino -lazy style. Did not disappoint. Don't skip the sourdough rolls!! So good!
author: Colleen P.

description: This place is great! The clam chowder was so creamy and like none other. The calamari as well as the seafood penne was delightful. Finally, Justine our server was extremely attentive and friendly. I would highly recommend this place!
author: Neda A.

description:
Went back again. This is our yearly trip to San Francisco and  we always go to this restaurant. Great ambience, great view and good service

The clam chowder is amazing. There's just not enough in that bread bowl. I recommend getting an extra cup to put inside your bread bowl for sharing. We got the steam clams, roasted crab, fish and chips and wedge salad. All very tasty. I wish I New our server name. But he was friendly and very attentive. Thanks for a great experience we will be back again!
author: J T.

description: Justin did an amazing job at serving us. Got an extra bib for me!  we also got the best view of the bay!! Double ! He was also a psychic and brought my boyfriend a soda refill without us asking for it!! Triple !!!
author: Jackson S.

description:
Great seafood! My cousin and I traveled to San Francisco and were looking for some fresh and delicious seafood and this was definitely the place to go. 

The mussels and garlic fries were a yummy starter. 

I had the scallop and dungess crab risotto, the scallop was juicy and fresh and the risotto was perfect. My cousin had the shrimp brochette, also delish.

Can't go wrong here!
author: Jay D.

description: Came here for a work lunch and had the best service from Khaiman, who graciously let us take photos of food (doing it for the gram, guys). Highly recommend the sole which was delicate and really tasty.
author: Lexy S.

description:
Definitely one of my favorite meals in San Francisco.  It's consistently busy.  Luckily, I travel alone and can usually find a seat at the bar.  Great service too!

I tried one of their house beers (Fog Harbor Lager) which went perfectly with my plate of Garlic Roasted Dungeness Crab (whole-$42).
author: Patricia N.

description: Great views and romantic ambiance. Generous seafood portions in the Cioppino. It was delicious as well as the complementary sourdough bread. My husband loved his cod dish. Service was Great! We will be returning here.
author: Linda H.

description:
This is my favorite place to eat in San Francisco!  Pier 39 is a great location, with lots of things to do.  The food here is off the hook every time I go and last night was no exception.  The service is excellent and the patrons are friendly, often striking conversations about area activities and of course the great food!  

Last night the chef made me sooo happy!! I don't like mussels, scallops or oysters.  So when I wanted to try their cioppino, I asked if I can have it with crab and shrimp..."No problem" is what I was told and I was blown away with the flavor of the sauce, the tenderness of the crab and shrimp!  This dish was large enough for 2 to share.  The warm bread they serve is great for dipping in this sauce as well as their soups (we had the amazing clam chowder).  The drinks, strawberry patron maguerita and a tequila sunrise was on point!  Then for desert we trued the duo of creme brûlée and chocolate mousse cake.  The balance of creamy, sweet, and bitterness made the desert one to remember.  I love this place and will always return.
author: Nicole H.

description: Omg the food here was so good!!!!!!!!!! We got the iced platter and the hot seafood platter.
author: Susan A.

description:
A very touristy restaurant with mediocre food at best. Although the location is pretty good, don't expect quality food here. 

Also, don't forget to get your parking ticket validated after your meal!w
author: Grace M.

description: Absolutely delish! Will definitely come back when in town.  Our waiter's suggestion were on point. He suggested that I have the scallops and crab risotto -- ANNNDDD I'm so glad I took his suggestion.  Worth every penny we spent!
author: Aubrey T.

description: At famous Pier 39 on the upper deck, it very much delivers on upscale seafood preparation with certain niche offerings (Salmon BLT, anyone? Crab Sandwich that's shredded crab, how 'bout that?). Their chowder bowls are incredible. World class wine and beer selection to pair up with, I dunno, anything. The waiting area is nice. The glass views of the bay are nice, if not, marvelous. The drawback is that it's crowded for a reason, but that doesn't mean you can't find a great table on a late afternoon, a Thursday or a rainy day. Sophisticated eating at Pier 39? "Fog Harbor," with seafood right out of the local harbor markets, they got you covered. #classiceats
author: Sean C.

description: We went to the Fog Harbour for dinner on Wednesday the 23rd. I have to say the service was exceptional. Our server Tyler from the time we sat down until the time we left was very attave  to our needs. I was undesive on my meal because it all looked so good but with Tyler's expertise of the menu he help me choose an amazing entree. I will definitely be referring my family and friends to this restaurant. Awesome drinks, Amazing food and excellent service.
author: Wendy F.

description: Another fabulous meal at Fog Harbor Fish House! Justin H. was a very attentive server.  He had our order to our table in record time.  Clam chowder was delicious as always!
author: Elaine B.

description:
Great for views but not a place I'd visit twice. The better half and I visited SF for our anniversary. I wanted to take us out to a nice dinner and I chose Fog Harbor Fish House. 

It was very easy to make a reservation. Visit their website, pick your party size and an available time. Easy and done. I called after doing that to nicely request a great table because of the special occasion. Parking is at the Pier 39 garage. Take your ticket with you to get validated (1st hour is free). Cross the street and go upstairs. Upon arriving, our reservation was ready to go. The table was at a window and that was great. I did see some others I would have rather had but oh well.

I ordered the Lobster Tail and the better half ordered the Mixed Grill. When I got my plate it was barely warm but luckily the food wasn't cold. It looked amazing and the lobster tail was huge. I enjoyed my plate, it came with garlic mashed potatoes and steamed vegetables. 

The better half though, hers wasn't as appetizing. The salmon, swordfish AND the shrimp was dry. She was not enjoying her meal and that's frustrating because I am trying to make sure she has a fantastic meal! She gets embarrassed when I complain so I held off this evening. But I am kicking myself that I didn't say anything. She ended up putting half of her swordfish and salmon on my plate for me to eat, I couldn't even do it. It was very disappointing. 

The service was not great, I'm not saying he was horrible but it felt rushed. He got our drinks, he took our food order, he delivered our food and he brought our check. I realize it's a busy restaurant but we are spending some money here, I don't want to feel rushed out of my table. He never told us his name or made any attempt to make the experience personable. Same with the host when we checked in, no nice welcome and no smile. 

One last thing. Know I am not holding this against the restaurant. Remember I had called ahead and mentioned it was for a 5 year anniversary. Shawn who answered the phone said he would note it, I was very appreciative of that. I definitely don't expect anything from the restaurant but I was hoping for at least some recognition. An awesome 2 chair table (instead of 4 chairs), one of those corny desert dishes with a message or even a simple "Happy Anniversary". We got nothing.. I work in hospitality and have been a customer service professional for many years. I gave them an opportunity to shine and it wasn't taken.. Had they attempted to take the service up a step, I might have seen the experience differently or been able to look over the mistakes. I'm writing this as a mere suggestion to management, if you get the opportunity to make a personable experience for a guest, you won't regret it for going above and beyond. You just might make someone's day.
author: Alyssa M.

description: The restaurant is over packed! We ordered our food and it took a lot of time to get our food. Prices are really high and you have to pay extra charges for services. only pros of this place was its location and the beautiful view one gets. Food was delicious and tasted good.
author: Amenda S.

description: Clam chowder,  mussel fries and an Alcatraz cocktail... Great food, ambience, service and views! Love this restaurant, will definitely return on my next visit to SF.
author: Arlene R.

description: This place has got waiting down to a science. As my husband and I walked down the pier we put our names on the waitlist right from Yelp (they also have a place you can join the waitlist on an iPad by the host station). We grabbed a beer at a bar and received updates via text when we had about 5 minutes before we needed to check in.  The hostess that sat us was very nice and our waiter was welcoming. My husband and I never can make decisions and the waiter did a great job helping us decide. The table, seating and dishes were clean. The food came out fast and was so delicious. My husband and I got the fried calamari, oysters, and clam chowder in a bread bowl topped with crab. It was a very pleasant dining experience!
author: Madelaine M.

description: Had a wonderful experience last week with Ashley L as my server. Brought some friends in from out of the area, and these were more than pleased with the amount of delicious shell fish! From the door, to food, and service, my friends were beyond happy with their experience.
author: Jessica N.

description:
Nice view. Pretty romantics
But always long line. Recommend to make a reservation. I visited here twice. This time is on Saturday night around 6:30 without reservations. It took 45 mins to have a table. Taste is ok. The view is really nice. The waiter was nice too. 
Pasta linguine: pretty good. Tasty with clams
fish and chips: big portion!
Fries combo:big portion too! Taste same and a little boring
Tuna poke: good! My friends didn't like mango in it but I liked it
author: Nazuki Y.

description:
VIEWS! Seriously. Make sure you come here and sit at a window seat to take in the bay views from the pier -- big boats, golden gate bridge in the distance and Alcatraz. Right on Pier 39 this place is not to miss. 

I ordered the Grilled shrimp brochette which came plated beautifully with tasty sautéed spinach, roasted butternut squash, garlic mashed potatoes, and garlic butter. The dish was flavorful, healthy, delicious and not overly filling!

The service was 5/5. Views are 5/5 and Food was 5/5. The extra San Fran taxes were surprising coming from out of state, but totally worth it!
author: Leila V.

description: Excellent food!!! Great views and priced well. Everything taste fresh.   Definitely a great place to stop for dining.
author: R J.

description: For being a touristy area this place is really good. Their clam chowder is delicious. I got the Sword fish plate and it was good.  My family enjoy coming here and views are nice. The wait is long but it's worth it after a long day of sight seeing.
author: Monica S.

description: In SF for business trip. On my sightseeing day I went to Fisherman's Wharf to find good, reasonably priced seafood. Touristy area, more than I thought it would be, but this place seems to be the spot. Not much to say, great food, clean restaurant, reasonable prices, happy hour draft specials ($5 for local drafts), and attentive service. I sat at the bar, enjoyed the decor and view of the water, and enjoyed the ambiance. They give you crispy sourdough bread with the meal as well.
author: John D.

description:
I normally don't go to this area of the city unless I have guests in town. I was also looking for a restaurant near the cruise terminal. I was completely surprised by this perfect restaurant.

From the outside it doesn't look like anything special and could be the same as any of the other tourist restaurants, and yet the small outside seating area where you wait before going in gives a slight hint.

I was lucky to sit at one of the tables by the window and was able to watch the sunset and look at the water/boats.   The inside decor is nice and pleasant. Not run-down, so I knew someone still cares. The place was full, but not extremely full and it was a Thursday. I could tell there were tourists with a few locals.

The food is wonderful. Seafood is the main substance and our waiter didn't hesitate about suggesting a different side vegetable when he found out my dinner companion couldn't eat the side vegetable that was normally provided with her entree. I was extremely happy with the crab cake, grilled shrimp and fish & chips. Save room for dessert as that is good too. No dessert menu, but a sample dessert tray is brought to your table so you can choose. The drinks are large.

Will definitely go back again.
author: Janice O.

description:
The seafood was the freshest I've ever tasted. Yum!
The wait staff were excellent, very friendly and honored my simple palate and special requests. Excellent view, wonderful experience!
author: Joy A.

description:
We were having a great time until a sudden turn of events happened in the middle of service. 

We were greeted by a friendly server who offered a couple suggestions on the menu. We then ordered a couple glasses of wine and a calamari to start. Wine was great and the calamari was fresh. 

Our mains were scallops, a ravioli special and the salmon. We were enjoying them, but noticed that our server was nowhere to be found. We thought he was just busy, but when he came midway during our eating we were shocked. 

He reeked of cigarette smoke and the smell overpowered the taste of our food. Even as he left the smell lingered. We completely lost our appetite. When he came back to suggest a dessert menu, we had to decline as the smell came back again with him.

We were disappointed to end in a sour note. Management could really do some work in the server's personal breaks.
author: Jisoo K.

description:
Classy, but more important, delicious. 
Will come back when in San Francisco.
author: Rob M.

description: Mixed grilled plate was food but the portions will leave you hungry. I feel like or was a quarter of what you would get elsewhere. Service is great. Just don't expect to be filled up. Unless you do what I did and eat the whole loaf of bread just to feel like you ate.
author: Rod C.

description: Delicious food!!! The claim chowder in a bread bowl with bacon was amazeballs!!! Great service!! Susan was our server and shared some great tips regarding the local area too! Highly recommended!!
author: Steven C.

description:
It's a shame that our meal went downhill. We started with a delicious truffle scallop risotto, which was great. Then came the calamari, which was great with the additions of fried jalepenos and onions. But the garlic roasted dungeoness crab was EXTREMELY disappointing. Small in size, too oily, overcooked and preparation took away all crab flavor. 

Risotto though, delicious.
author: Susan C.

description:
Seafood platter was DELICIOUS! You cannot go wrong. We ordered the platter for two and shared it with a group of 3. Additionally, the chowder soup and cheesy bread. 

So much butter/cream/excellence. 

Service could improve for price (I spent +$150 for lunch for 3) which is why I gave them 4 stars.
author: Lilly S.

description: This place  was amazing. From the fresh bread & butter to our appetizers and main dishes. We chose to have their award winning clam chowder and we understand exactly why it was award winning. Steamed clams, Caesar salad as appetizers. All dishes were amazing along with a wonderful wine list. We sat next to a clean large window with beautiful views of the bay. Customer Service was on point and we got seated quickly since we had reservations. We will definitely return for many more trips.
author: Jay R.

description:
So I was super surprised with this restraunt , I understand that some may feel you pay for the atmosphere but I was hoping that id get more out of just the view considering I didn't need to go to this place for the same view with amazing food closer to where I live. 
My friend actually really wanted to come here and raved about it. Haha we clearly have different taste in this restaurant. 

I was super disappointed in what I got. Which was the cesar salad and calm chowder bread bowl with crab. (Yes I know that wasn't something people would get at a 'famous' fish restruant.) It looked pretty, But no buddy really enjoyed their dishes either. Anywho nothing was special about the clam chowder, alot better at joes crab shack. It was blah.
And the salad had 4 croutons, 4 grated cheese and drenched in cesar dressing. And it wasn't a normal salad. You had to cut the drenched yourself.  Smh haha and it didn't even taste fresh. Not worth the price at all. 

-Great environment/atmosphere. 
-Service was good.
-complimentary fresh bread was great. (Wish we got that before we ordered the clam chowder bread bowls though) haha.
author: Stephanie W.

description: Came here for my birthday and everything was amazing. Got the huge plate of seafood and it literally was the most fresh seafood I have ever tried. Sooooooo good. I also got the salmon and I feel like salmon is a hit or miss but this was really tender and easy to break apart ( like how salmon should be ) highly recommend !
author: Altinay A.

description: This place is awesome! Its location, its service, and the food - everything gels in good place! Must go whenever you are in that area - pier 39! Very reasonable prices for that setting the restaurant presented to customers. Bonus tip: if you are early and get a table next to the window area, you will get to full view the beautiful sunset in the evening!
author: Ngee J.

description: Touristy, yes. Delicious, yes! This place is located in a tourist trap area but it's good and service is excellent. Prices are reasonable for the area and the views are fantastic. They also accommodate food allergies just let them know. I'm gluten free and had some adjustments made to my meal. We started with the spicy shrimp which bf said was the best thing he's had in a long time. I had the shell fish platter and bf had the fried combo. We had a reservation on open table and everything was ready for when we arrived. It highly recommend you book a table ahead of time as this area gets really crowded. Was a fantastic experience I wish we lived here so we could go back.
author: Hilary H.

description: The view is amazing from this place. Almost every seat in the restaurant have amazing view of either golden gate, alcatraz or bay bridge. The staffs were very nice and prompt even with the restaurant being full. We ordered couple of fishes and all of them were delicious. This isn't like the other cheap restaurants in the pier but pretty upscale (a lot of the people were heavily dressed here).
author: Shimul B.

description:
My husband and I were skeptical coming here, since you're gambling with great views vs. great food but we ended up getting a booth facing the water and had a great meal.  Definitely a win win.  

The waitress brought our drinks and a basket of warm sliced sourdough bread with a tray of butter.  It was the best bread during our stay in SF because it was so warm and soft.  

I then ordered the Caesar salad which was dressed nicely, had a nice salty taste from the anchovies in the dressing and had killer garlic croutons that I could've eaten like popcorn.  The salad was plenty big enough to share with my eye candy.  I also ordered the Ahi entree which was a hefty ahi tuna steak encrusted in black and white sesame seeds and cooked to perfection and rare inside.  The was sitting on top of a bed of toasted and seasoned rice and an array of sautéed vegetables including bok choy which was so tasty.  

My husband ordered the sole which was sautéed and served in a caper sauce and atop of vegetables and fingerling potatoes.  

We were both very satisfied and full at the end of the meal.  The bill came with biscoff cookies which were a nice treat as well.  The hostesses were friendly, the manager checked in on the tables and our server was friendly and attentive.
author: Tammie W.

description: The view from the restaurant is fantastic  and the food and service are very good. Probably the best in the area.
author: Carlos G.

description: Got here early and got to sit right away. I dont know what happened to our first waiter but thanks god someone else took over. Sat by the windows with view of Alcatraz and a glimpse of SF bridge. Ordered fried calamari that was mixed with onion and jalapeño for appetizer. It was  surprisingly perfect combinations. Than we got clam chowder and crab roll with fries. Clam chowder was creamy but it doesn't have much clams on it for the price, Maybe i was unlucky. Overall, great place to eat and not worries about birds picking on ur foods. Lol
author: Syerine H.

description:
Pretty solid spot in a big tourist area. I am always hesitant to go for pricier restaurants in that sort of area but this one did not disappoint!

The view is really nice of the harbor but I wouldn't say by any means that it is life changing if you can't sit right by the window, but it is worth it to ask. The food was really good. I ordered the tuna appetizer and salads.
author: Jenn S.

description: Ordered the seafood penne and the risotto and both were spectacular. Make reservations two days or more in advanced if possible. Love this place and will be back!
author: AnnMarie J.

description: I think what caught my eye about this place was the huge windows that gave you a view of the water. It was gorgeous. Our server was nothing short of amazing. He went through the menu w us and suggested a few dishes. I got the salmon which was awesomeee. And I also got the half dozen oysters. A little pricey. $18. I don't think the oyster were worth it. My boyfriend got the steamers. I loveddd those. The sauce they were cooked in was delicious.
author: Uyen N.

description: The food here is pretty decently priced; however, the service can be rather slow, as well as the speed your food comes out. Our orders seemed to come out wrong a couple times -- or our server was just jotting down the wrong order. We received only half a dozen oysters when we had asked for a dozen.. and were given our clam chowder in a bowl when I had asked for a bread bowl. All fixable mistakes, however, so no real harm done. The ambiance indoors is rather nice though, for anywhere else to dine at in the area. It's not too "touristy" seeming, and there's a lovely view if you are lucky enough to dine by the window.
author: Chelsea W.

description:
Our group got here on a busy Monday evening without a reservation and waited for 15-minutes and that wasn't so bad.  

We ordered our meals and waited extremely long for our orders to come, maybe about a half an hour.  But, I was satisfied when my award winning clam chowder was served.  It was piping hot and the clams tasted so fresh and the chowder was rich, creamy, and very flavorful.  I had it with the sour dough bread that was given at our table.  What helped with the long wait was watching the beautiful sunset turning from orange to pink and the sun finally setting.  My group of 5 all stood up to get some pictures.
