We eventually all got our entrees another half an hour later.  My Salmon "Club" Salad was very good.  The portion of salmon was prepared just right.  It was moist and flaky.  The lemon vinaigrette mixed in the salad was nice and tart and the lemon ranch dressing on top of the salmon enhanced the already freshness of the fish.  I enjoyed the onions, cherry tomatoes and bacon bits throughout the dish.  This dish was pricey for a salad, $20, but well worth it.

Next we were waiting for our check to come.  It was a long wait.  Our waitress apologized for our wait and her Manager decided to give us complimentary desserts for our time.  He also came to apologize for our wait.  We all ordered blondies to go.  I actually wanted to get the creme brûlé but that wouldn't be practical to take out.  

So, I gave our experience a 4 since we had great service recovery, and the meal and scenic view was fine.  If you don't mind waiting, this place is very good.
author: Diana S.

description: Food was great! Portion sizes are large! Shout out to Justin H. For being a great waiter!
author: Lee W.

description: Fabulous food. Thank you for reserving a table by the window over looking the bay. Writing down Happy Birthday on the table sheet and having a vase of flowers. These little things made a huge difference for my wife as we there to celebrate her birthday. But above all giving us the most wonderful server Luane. She was attentive and timely with our requests. She had a quite and polite way about her. Thanks Luane, we wish you all the best in your schooling and future!
author: Kris L.

description:
For being in a ridiculously touristy place I was very pleasantly surprised.  They give you some crazy good, fresh baked sourdough bread when you sit down (you can watch them making it from the window outside the restaurant).  My husband ordered some kind of fish stew thing and I had a wedge salad.  Both were excellent.  Drinks were also really well made and they didn't skimp on the alcohol. 
Service was very fast and attentive and it was pretty busy when we sat down for lunch.
author: Jennifer D.

description: Fog Harbor is fantastic! Whenever I have friends or family visiting we always go here - or if I'm just craving some awesome seafood. The ambience and view is amazing, the food is always incredible, and the wait staff are top notch. (Shoutout to our waiter Justin  for his expert & speedy service - your recommendations were great!) The crispy calamari and clam chowder are my two must haves. The calamari comes with little fried jalapeños and onions - it's so damn good. The place is always packed on the weekends so be prepared to wait an hour if you don't have a reservation!
author: Kristen W.

description: Great atmosphere and food.  Service was perfect as well.  We had the crab, lobster, shrimp tower and had a window looking out into the harbor.  It was great!
author: Veronica E.

description: The food was amazing .The service was great  .The cocktails  were tasty  we spent a very nice day at pier 39 and dinner at this place was a very nice end, so what else can i said, but thanks
author: Patty M.

description:
So while in San Francisco I thought I would walk the Fishermans Wharf and check out the scene. After walking around for a while I was getting hungry. With so many choices I became flooded with indecision. But upon perusing the local listings this place caught my eye.

I opted for a bar seat and was not disappointed. The bartender on duty was very polite and helpful. As I have never really been a seafood restaurant before. I was steered towards the combos to get a variety of seafood to try, and decided on getting a clam chowder cup, with a strawberry lemonade. And for my main course I got the fresh grilled combo. It comes with sword fish, salmon and shrimp.

Upon receiving the strawberry lemonade, it was lightly sweet with a hint of sourness. A little watery, but ok. But the chowder was a real treat. It comes paired with a loaf of sourdough bread. The bread has got a nice soft, fluffy interior with a crunchy bite. By itself it is flavorful, and aromatic; but when dipped into the chowder itself it becomes a force to be reckoned with. When matted with a plat of butter the strong flavor of the sourness is apparent and the saltiness of the butter evens it out.

The chowder is smooth and creamy. Not salty nor fishy, but got a rich milky taste to it with a strong flavor of clams. Overall it is worth the money, it would be nice to see a lobster bisque offered at a place of this caliber.

Now on to the main entree, the sword fish is a nice white fish. I have never had anything other than cod and halibut before so this is new. But it is very tender and mild in flavor. A slight tuna taste to it with a buttery bite. Overall a mild fish and subdued flavor.

The salmon is also extraordinarily tender, with a light crunch to the exterior. Also a light buttery taste, and more pronounced fish flavor. Which should be expected of a pink fish.

And the shrimp is very good. Coming with a strong shrimp flavor, nice a fresh and hot. It has a light initial crunch, and a medium bite to it afterwards. There is a subtle butter, lemon taste to it, that compliments the shrimp flavor.

The sides that came with it is sauteed veggies and garlic mashed potatoes. And I opted to get some french fries instead. The garlic mashed potatoes seems to be a fresh variant as it has lumps of potato in it. And is fairly moist and creamy. Although In my opinion it is always well paired with a country gravy to further make the texture creamy and rich. The french fries are crunchy with a fluffy interior. A little on the salty side, but again not bad.

So in this honest reviewers opinion, the soup paired with the bread is fantastic, the lemonade is ok, the main entree is also fantastic, but the sides are a bit waning compared to the rest of the meal. So between the service and the attributes listed I would give it a solid 9/10 for the price class it is in. Compared to higher end restaurants could bump it down to a 7.5/10. But for the money it is well worth the time to come here.
author: Brock E.

description: This place is yummy! Ordered a bowl of clam chowder and it was prob the best I've ever had. I also had the mussels fries and the fries are crisp! Mussels are fresh, too. For my entree, I ordered the lobster tails which came with broccoli and mashed potatoes. Lobster tail was perfect and the mashed potatoes were creamy.  Service was great.  Our waitress was friendly and attentive. I would recommend this place for a great view of the bay & Alcatraz.
author: Brittany M.

description:
Nice view...Great service. Food is average. We had salmon and cod, which were not to our standard. The presentation of the food was not good, fish was not seasoned well, and vegetables appeared old looking. Fingerlings were cold and over cooked.

We did have special restrictions, such as no dairy or sugars; which our waitress immediately addressed while taking our order. However, with eliminating items, such as butter, the fish should have been seasoned much better.
author: Cookie C.

description: Food wasn't bad! Amazing Clam Chowder and service! But everything else was just okay.
author: Ailing T.

description: Got the mixed dish and the whole plate was delicious. Followed up by the apple pie, which was a nice finish.  Ate at the bar and service was excellent, had 3-4 bartenders checking on me periodically as I ate.
author: Ryan B.

description: You know it's good seafood when it doesn't taste (or even smell) like fish. I got the fried combo platter (fish, shrimp, etc) and my wife got the crab sandwich. All was delicious, though it was the clam chowder that I keep talking about.
author: Tanner M.

description: This place is a great place to "treat yo self" as there is a big menu with a great wine selection. For lunch after Alcatraz, my girlfriend and I were ready to chow down and this place had us seated quickly with service soon to follow. We started off with the blue cheese garlic bread which had the perfect combo of cheese and garlic but was a little too burnt at the ends for our liking. Nothing too special about the NY strip I had; it was cooked as requested, medium rare, and had a strange unknown glaze which didn't do the dish much good. The dessert menu here is great and they have a live sample display if you ask to see it. All in all, very pricey but offered a great view of the bay and servers are very attentive!
author: Victor G.

description:
Had the pleasure to eat here twice within three weeks.
Service is top notch and food is really good. I had the linguine with clams and it was great. GF loved the Halibut. 

Creme Brulee is excellent!
author: Robert M.

description: Great atmosphere.  Solid food.  We really enjoyed this place.  Try the Oysters with spinach, cheese, and bacon.  Try the blue cheese garlic bread.  Try the scallops.  Try the surf and turf. Everything was good.
author: Brian L.

description: This place was nice, but I don't think it's worth the extra fine prices. I've read reviews that said this place is not a tourist trap, and I disagree. The service was sloppy, but in their defense the wait time was over an hour so it was busy. I would not eat here again and I would not recommend. The location is perfect for the owners but at the cost of quality.
author: Susan C.

description: This is MY favorite Restaurant! I took my husband for our 5th year Anniversary. The service was WAY beyond our expectations. Curtis and Ashley both made it a memorable meal for both my husband and I. The food was superb we had the ahi tuna appetizer, and we split the pacific sole, and tiramisu on the house for our anniversary which was so sweet. We look forward to coming again hopefully in the near future. Thank you!!
author: Sandy B.

description: Great ambiance and service. Food is stellar and fresh which helped me sleep like a baby.
author: G. B.

description: Best sourdough bread I've ever had!  Chowder and crab roll were both delish. Would definitely be a regular if I lived in San Francisco.  Our waiter Jeremy was great. Wonderful experience, good food and great service.
author: Lara T.

description: We had dinner hear on New Year Eve. The food came out in a timely and amazingly quick fashion despite them being so busy for the holiday. I recommend the calamari and the blue cheese garlic bread appetizers. The staff was friendly, but the wait can be quite long.
author: Jeremy N.

description:
If you happen to be in the Wharf, Fog Harbor is a good place to take visitors. It has great views of the water, good service, and the food is good.--But that's where the food stops, at "good." 

You don't come to Fog Harbor for something that's going to push your palate. They have a standard menu that everyone will find something they like (seafood, sandwiches, salads, ect) and everything tastes good. 

It might not blow your mind, but it's a sure bet when you need some food, a drink, and a place to rest your bones.
author: Liz S.

description: Please go eat here!! We are regulars in the City and hardly ever visit the pier area but we had some guests with us who had never been so of course we took them to see the sights. We ended our day down at Pier 39 and were deciding where to eat. My husband used Yelp and Fog Harbor came up highly rated so we decided to give it a try. It was such a good choice! The food, service, views and everything else were excellent. There were four of us and we each had different meals: risotto, halibut  and mixed grill seafood. Everything was amazing. We will definitely be back here.
author: Christina T.

description: Very nice atmosphere right in the middle of Fisherman's Wharf. Great view from wherever you're sitting in the restaurant and they have decent seafood. I thought their individual servings were a little small- a la carte, dare I say. Reasonably priced... Try going in the middle of the day and not at dinner time. That place is packed at night!
author: Michaela C.

description:
Grabbed lunch at Fog Harbor and was very delighted with the food and service! My party and I order the Swordfish, Chicken Penne, and the Soup & Salad and all of them were flavorful. Khaiman served us and we have nothing but praise for him. He was very attentive and took care of us. Thank you! 
Highly recommend it!
author: John K.

description:
Pier 39 is synonymous to San Francisco. It is full of restaurants and shops. I have very fond memories of pier 39. Having clam chowder and enjoying the endless beauty of sea.. Divine. During my last visit, I got a chance to try out this restaurant. All the seats with sea view were taken, so we were escorted to the dining area in between. The menu had loads of seafood options to choose from. My husband and I settled with red chili garlic shrimp and Cioppino. Cioppino was developed by Italian immigrants in San Fracncisco, so I had to try it. 
Service was good. Red chili garlic shrimps were perfectly cooked. They were not as spicy as I thought they would be. Cioppino tasted really good and had a variety of sea food. 
Both the dishes tasted great. Next time, I will try other items off menu.
author: Ruchi S.

description:
My husband and I made reservations here for our 5 year anniversary when visiting SF! This place made us feel so special and when I asked for a window seat they made it happen. Their oysters are incredible. The dipping sauce is hands down the best! 

I ordered the tuna and it was great but not a fan of the rice side. My husband had surf n turf and it was delish! Everyone must go!
author: Deidre H.

description: Great atmosphere, food and service. Came for lunch and was not disappointed. Order tuna tartar app and salmon blt both delicious!
author: Hanne A.

description: We came here on a beautiful Sunday afternoon. Was seated at a lovely table and ordered my favorite old fashioned. I went for a classic instead of their maple but after seeing pics of the maple I'm thinking I might want to try the maple. I wasn't too fond of the paper straws. Would've liked a reg stirrer. We got the Clam chowder bowls with crab. It was really good with a nice stack of fresh crab on top. The mixed grill was also good. Had to add some salt though. The Scallops and crab risotto was pretty good as well. My friend got the Lazy ciopinno which looked good added rice instead of bread. And last but not least the Garlic roasted whole dungeness crab with fingerling potatoes only it was not a whole crab just two claws and some legs. Which is why a star was lost. Would've liked to have gotten the whole crab...but otherwise a successful meal. We were too full for dessert. And had a ton of leftovers. :9 great company always makes things amazing. Good times!
author: Kat K.

description: We went on a busy Sunday afternoon when the line was ridiculously long (about 40 minutes). And after sitting down, it took forever for the waiter to take our orders. We eventually ordered the house's special clam chowder and garlic crab. What a disappointment! The chowder was too starchy and under seasoned. The crab was just okay. I will say over all food is 3 stars. But since the wait was terrible and the food was overpriced, I would not recommend. Even boudin has better clam chowder.
author: Yihua X.

description: Place is very busy please expect to be waited to be seated. Food was amazing and service was excellent! I was very surprised by this touristy resturant the food and the ambiance was amazing
author: Florentino A.

description: Great food, will definitely go back again. The salmon was amazing as well as the crab and the baked oysters
author: Daniele T.

description:
Its just ok.  $45 for Dungeness crab, which in my opinion isn't as good as King Crab.

Waitress AJ was a little short, certainly didn't go over the menu like the waiter serving the table behind me.

Clam Chowder was good, probably the best thing we had.  Family had Mixed Grill which was just ok for $29 a plate.

Last but not least, $3.95 for a soda?
author: Jeff M.

description: Awesome food!  Loved the garlic Dungeness crab.   Almost anywhere you are seated offers a great view.  The service was amazing.  We were not rushed and allowed to enjoy our wine, appetizer and eventually dinner.  Reasonably priced wine by the bottle.  I would totally recommend this restaurant and hope to come back again some day.
author: Debbie G.

description:
Amazing seafood spot! My dad was visiting my my fiancé and I from Hawai'i (he knows seafood). Our server Alex I believe, was awesome and very helpful when it came down to deciding on what the heck we were going to get. He recommend the seafood platter, which has mussels, clams, crab and shrimp. 

My fiancé got the shareable size for him and I. My dad and I each got the 2 lobster tails. My fiancé and I split my dish and the platter and it was sooooo much food! 

The shareable seafood platter is honestly good enough to share between 3 people. If you get some appetizers and with all the bread they give you it's definitely a good way to all get down and chow down. 

The view is amazing and I will definitely be back again!
author: Becca S.

description:
Food was fresh and tasty. I ordered the crab entree and my friend ordered the lobster- we ended up splitting our meals. 

Only down fall was it was foggy so our window "view seating" had no view. But can't hold that on the restaurant as they have no control :) 

This restaurant is Fisherman Warf area so great place given the busy location. Service was great too.
author: Danielle C.

description: Amazing high quality service .great food .samir was excellent.the best view.whole garlic crab item to go for..
author: antonio g.

description: Officially one of my favorite restaurants in the city! Khaiman was absolutely amazing, the best waiter I've ever had. He was very attentive, gave us great recommendations, and was very friendly! Will definitely be back!!!
author: Alicia A.

description: Crowded with people always, but still remain independent seats to enjoy the meal. Didn't take us too long to wait for the seats. The seafood are fresh and great. And dishes are in big serve.
author: Pei Hsin C.

description: My family and I enjoyed our Christmas Eve here and the food was very delicious! Justin gave us excellent service once again. This is our "go to" restaurant when we come to San Francisco. Thank you for the wonderful experience!
author: Trisha H.

description: This was our first time here and we had an awesome experience. Our server Mel was amazing! He knew exactly when to put out orders in, and brought out each dish at the perfect time. We love seafood, and Fog Harbor Fish House did not disappoint. The seafood tower was good, along with the yummy clam chowder bread bowl. We ordered the shellfish platter for 2 and it was amazing. Of course we had to end it with the dessert duo ala mode. We are leaving so full and satisfied! We'll definitely be here again and highly recommend that you try this place out!
author: Jesse A.

description: Some of the best crab cakes. Can't beat the view. The margarita that was voted SFWeekly's best is delicious... so glad our server (Nev) recommended it. Will recommend this place to our friends visiting the city for sure.
author: jamie g.

description: we luckily came on friday late afternoon and there was like 5 mins wait. service tend to be slow but food/seafood were really fresh and good! we got a seafood tower, tuna poke and kids meals because we wanted something light. their bread were really fresh as well! their cocktails prices seem to be a bit overpriced but what can you expect from a touristsy restaurant at a very sweet location!!?? splurge on it if you must, totally worth it.
author: Vicky H.

description: I tried the alaskan salmon. Very Very good fish. Service and atmosphere was really nice. I also tried the fish and chips. Was really crispy but very tasty. Recommend to come at night because the atmosphere during the day is very crowded and packed. Sunlight was a problem during my lunch.
author: Michael C.

description:
This place is delicious,  had to wait 20mins to get in but worth it,marina and Alcatraz view, we had a shrimp cocktail, seafood 
 and 1 bloody Mary that we shared and left stuffed! $60, we had a fantastic waitress Susan!!!
author: new york r.

description: Our waitress was Brenda and her customer service was outstanding! With her welcoming personality she made our experience just perfect. And to top it off the food was exquisite! We ordered the cup of clam chowder, the crispy calamari, The Shellfish mixed platter-OMGEEZ everything was delicious!! I'll be back for more :)
author: Crystal S.

description: Came here for a Saturday brunch. I'm from Orange County so I'm pretty new to the area. The food was amazing!!! Especially the oysters! Linguine and clams was to die for. Jim/jimmy was our server. He did an fantastic job! He constantly checked up on us and made sure we had all we needed. He explained the menu really well. Great experience. I will definitely come back when I visit again. Thanks Jim :)
author: Thanh L.

description: Today was the first time my family and I visited San Fran; we had a long journey into town and looked on yelp for the best seafood. It lead us straight to Fog Harbor Fish House, we were not disappointed; from the server Justin H., to the cleanliness, and steak temperatures with my surf n turf. Everything was amazing and I can't wait to go back, it was a great place to take my mother for Mother's Day!
author: Cortnee D.

description:
We were enjoying the day at Pier 39 and wanted a nice lunch spot away that was a little quieter. First off, this place really does have the best view of the water. We were seated at a table right in front of the window and we could enjoy watching the hustle and bustle down below. The view is what is bumping up the rating of this place from a 3 star to a 4 star place because the service and food is average. Warm sourdough bread is complementary! I love restaurants that still offer bread service. This is a surprise these days with most places making you pay for bread and butter. 

We ordered the clam chowder in a sourdough bread bowl, the crab salad sandwich and half a dozen oysters. The oysters were fresh but the typical common variety so nothing special. The clam chowder actually had bits of clam in it and went really well with the bread. But next time I would just order the clam chowder without the bread bowl and save $2. They serve fresh sourdough for free which I found out after ordering. The filling in the crab salad was good as well but the fries left much to be desired. I wish they had the option of a salad or veggies with the sandwich because there's already a lot of bread so its certainly not a balanced meal.

Service was subpar. She was rushed, unfriendly and unable to answer my question when I asked her what variety of oysters were being served.
author: Jenny C.

description: This restaurant has something on the menu for everyone. We only had to wait 15 minutes for a seat with a view on a Friday night, and it was worth it. The swordfish and the salmon are my favorite things I tried. The crab legs were kind of bland, but they were very fresh and we appreciated the opportunity for the crab to be pre-cracked. Our server Samir was fantastic and attentive without being obtrusive. The Kendall Jackson Chardonnay was delicious. We finished the entire bottle. I wish we had more time to eat here again while we are visiting San Francisco because I'd come back. This restaurant is definitely worth a visit and in a great location!
author: Bianca G.

description: On our first day in San Francisco, we came to Fisherman's Wharf for dinner. We came to the Fog Harbor Fish House and were given table without having to wait. We both ordered bowls of clam chowder, which we agreed was possibly the best we've ever had. The sourdough bread and butter were excellent. I ordered the fish and chips and my boyfriend ordered the fried combo. The flavor and crunch of the the fried fish was very good but also slightly bland. My boyfriend enjoyed his meal, however he wished there was an equal amount of each seafood on his plate. The service was lacking, as we waited for a long time for our waiter to come so we could ask for the check.
author: Sarah C.

description:
We were starved and Fog Harbor had the best reviews on Yelp for Pier 39.  It was hard to find the entrance, but once we went up the stairs we were quickly greeted and seated.  

We had Ashley as our server and she was awesome.  We were seated at a table by the window and the view was great.   

After four days in Napa, I was wined out and went with the Cucumber Basil gimlet.  They were delicious.  My husband had one of the local draft beers.   We were given yummy warm sourdough bread and butter.  

Since I'm such a carb hound, I went with the soup and salad combo, which consisted of clam chowder in a bread bowl and a ceasar salad that I added grilled shrimp to.  The chowder was OK. Not great, just OK.  The rest was really good though and once I started dipping pieces of bread in the chowder, I had no complaints.  

My husband had the mixed seafood grill and enjoyed it.   If you are looking for seafood while on Pier 39, I'd recommend it.
author: Karen S.

description: A visit to fishermans wharf always demands a bite of fresh seafood. That we did, and decided to stop by this establishment due to the menu. We had the shell platter, cioppinno, calamari and the clam chowder. I have to say none of the dishes disappoint. You could tell the freshness of the preparation, due to the texture and taste. The sauces were exquisite which complemented all of the dishes (the shell platter and the cioppino) but of the two, we found the cioppino the best. Maybe we should have opted for the lobster tail with the platter, but we were full due to the required eating while walking pier 39. To top all of this off, we had an excellent cocktail (made of tequila) and a blondie, which is reminiscent of the pazookie, but with a chocolate nut brownie instead of a cookie, Yum!! The only balance to all this is the damage to your wallet. Depending on your order, it can be on the pricey side. Honestly speaking, i was thinking of giving it a 4.5, but our server Mel was too good that it had to become a 5. He made dinner feel like a visit to a relative that had a lot of guest. Accomodating and always mindful, it top the experience like whip cream finishes a great dessert. In not so many words... if your in the area, like seafood and good service, stop by and say hello. You wont regret it.
author: Bodai P.

description: Food Delicious, perfect View, Service was a great (Adela was the Best), it's pricy but it worth every single penny
author: Martin A.

description:
After doing the touristy thing at Pier 39 we were  looking to just get a good bowl of clam chowder in this place did not disappoint. 

We ordered the clam chowder, fried calamari, and a spicy chili shrimp. It was all really good. Our waiter was kind of weird but that's OK it's San Francisco, lots of weird people :-) the location is awesome and I we had a great view of the day.
author: Anne Marie S.

description: After a long day, we ended up at pier 39 for fish and chips; we were seated right away, served with expertise.  We ordered fish and chips and the risotto.   My daughter loved the risotto- I enjoyed my fish and chips.   We ended with a vanilla bean crema brûlée ( not bad).
author: Shahin N.

description: Dinner with an amazing view! We had to wait a bit longer for a table specifically by the window, but we sat by the fireplace; it was worth it! The drinks were delish (I added vodka to their homemade lemonade) and the wine list did not disappoint. The food was amazing, both steak and seafood (ahi tuna) cooked to rare-perfection! Yum!
author: Briana S.

description: We arrived for a late dinner and had prompt service. The food is delicious. The wine list extensive. We loved every moment we were there...enjoying a spectacular view of the Bay.
author: Dee L.

description: This place was a really good place to eat. The oysters are fresh, also the clam chowder is light but creamy. Overall did not have a bad dish
author: Jasmine E.

description:
Place has amazing views and good food. Not bad for a typical San Francisco tourist restaurant. But we would go back just to have Mel as our server again. He was the most attentive waiter we've had the pleasure to being served by in a very long time. 

Great hire management!
author: John N.

description:
I came here yesterday for lunch with my boyfriend, saw really good reviews so I had high expectations!

Staff was very attentive and accommodating, we had no issues there.

Food was great but really pricey; if you're looking for a budget friendly place, I suggest you sit out on this one. 
My boyfriend got the clam chowder bread bowl with the crab added to it, I didn't think it was anything special but he enjoyed it. However, I don't recommend it in a bread bowl because it soaks up all your soup! We also enjoyed the complimentary bread and also ordered the calamari, that was delicious!!! Just a heads up, it's a little spicy! I got the seafood penne, and woooo it was soooo goood!!! (Maybe it was just starving) but thinking about it now, it was still as good! It has a variety of seafood to satisfy my cravings! 

Overall, I would definitely come here again, but only if I'm really craving it not a weekend basis!
author: Katelynn N.

description: Fog Harbor is going to have a higher price tag since it's right in the middle of a touristy area. But if you're willing to pay the price, they have pretty good food - particularly their clam chowder. This comes out piping hot, has the perfect consistency (creamy, but not overly so) and is a nice little break from walking around all day in the area. We also tried their dungeoness crab cocktail, which tasted fresh (though I wish they put the cocktail sauce on the side, instead of on top). This, dumped into your clam chowder is the perfect combination for a col San Francisco day.
author: Mel T.

description: This was the best seafood we've had since arriving in San Francisco for our business/pleasure trip!  The food arrived hot and was super tasty!  Seasoned and cooked perfectly. If you're in the area, this is a "must go" restaurant!!
author: Kathe H.

description: I wish this restaurant was more pet friendly but still it doesnt hide the fact that they serve finger licking food. I love sea food. Tried the seafood stew and shrimp and my oh my! Amzing setting and atmosphere. Thumbs up.
author: Ceejay G.

description: Food and service were great. Nice view by the window. The place filled up quickly during lunchtime.
author: jo l.

description: The food is amazing here! We ordered the clam chowder, spicy garlic shrimp, lobster tail, and ahi tuna. Justin was very accommodating and gave us great recommendations. If we lived in San Francisco we would come here all the time!!!
author: Lisa H.

description:
Having never spent any time in the San Francisco Bay area I found myself in a bewilderment, I dislike looking like a tourist and overpaying for things, however I wanted to see Alcatraz, Fisherman's Warf, and the SEA LIONS!  This place had good reviews and we actually planned to have dinner there, but since it was a work trip and since its my only free day, we decided to have lunch. 

We were seated at a table for two, within ten minutes of arriving, with a stunning view of San Francisco Bay, the rock and even the Golden Gate.  I was super pleased with the table! Our waitress came over very quickly with fresh warm sourdough bread and butter and water.  After perusing the reviews and noticing the bread flying around, we ordered two cups of the chowder without the bread bowl, and split the crab roll.  In addition we ordered the blue cheese garlic bread because checking in on Pier 39 comes with an awesome yelp special for a coupon book!  I must confess to being satisfied but not overwhelmed, the bread rocked, the chowder was thick and warm but needed something else to make it pop, what I am not sure.  The crab roll on toasted sourdough was also well garnished and stuffed with crab meat but just didn't wow us!  Also, I am a coke guy and they only have pepsi, but I digress.

The place was really enjoyable and I would recommend it over the chains like Rainforest, Hard Rock,  Bubba Gump and others found down at the warf. The staff is awesome, the restaurant is beautiful and has an amazing view, the food is good just not phenomenal!
author: Joshua R.

description: This review is all about the hostess and the people in charge of seating. Bad Bad customer service!!!!They gave our table away because it took 4 minutes for all members of the party to show up. What kind of bullshit is that. I was excited about trying their "Award winning" chowder. Now I will never come to this place ever!!! The young hostess was taking orders from an older woman, who look to be a pit boss in a casino in Vegas.
author: Ngurah A.

description: Service was great and views are beautiful. I had linguine and clams. The clams still in shell were fantastic but they add shelled clams to sauce and they tasted fishy. My daughter had Caesar salad with grilled shrimp. That was delicious!
author: Susan A.

description:
It was raining all day and we were soaked after Alcatraz. Stepped in to the first place we came across where people looked warm and cozy. The wait was 15 minutes and they were moving people in quick. 
We chose a few lighter items and they were quite filling. The chowder was flavored well the salad was great with lots of crab meat. My wife enjoyed the heck out of what we would consider the cleanest tasting dungeoness crab ever.
Four stars cause while I enjoyed it, I might think twice about it for the price vs. portion.
author: pua R.

description:
Sometimes you gotta' go full tourist.  I'm giving this restaurant five stars not because it's the best restaurant in San Francisco but because it's the best place of its type.  When you want to visit the pier, relax and enjoy the view while drinking a local beer, this is the spot.  

I've dined at the Fog Harbor twice and enjoyed both meals immensely.  My last visit I was solo on a beautiful day.  I sat at the bar and enjoyed an Anchor Steam and a crab roll sandwich while Tony took great care of me.  

Is Fog Harbor touristy and overpriced?  Yes, but you get what you pay for.  A wonderful view, lovely service and very good food.  I would not hesitate to recommend Fog Harbor to anyone looking to have a nice meal in the area.  

Enjoy!
author: Jeanne T.

description: The clam chowder truly was the best I have ever tried, and overall the food was really fresh and delicious.
author: Gabriela G.

description: Nice views of the bay in central location. Friendly wait staff and food was good but just a tad salty and expensive. Even so, definitely one of the best options on the pier.
author: Chris F.

description: Were do I start. Food was delicious. My sister who doesn't even like sea food loves her salmon. I had the lobster tail and my mom had the crab cake. We left nothing behind and wanted more. It is pricey but worth it. I don't mind paying for something if I enjoyed it. The location was also great with nice view of the ocean.
author: Daphnée H.

description: The location it great right in pier 39, didn't have to wait very long to be seated , nice decor, so that was a plus the clam chowder was really good ! But I found the crab cake to be mediocre and my Cesar salad was severely over dressed , basically soaked I was there for salad but it would have been nice all and all decent restaurant but didn't really get that wow factor that I was expecting from reviews
author: Cisco S.

description: What a beautiful restaurant. The view is spectacular. The food and service was great. Definitely will return
author: Ana D.

description: This place serves excellent sea food. The outside waiting area was great and even had a fire which was nice. The restaurant has a good view on the ocean. The customer service is great. Our waiter Miguel was kind and made sure we were happy with our food. Overall this place has great food, customer service, and an amazing view of the ocean.
author: Adel K.

description: My favorite place to eat so far in San Fran! Highly recommend making a dinner reservation to see the sun set over Alcatraz and the Golden Hate Bridge, and the food wasn't bad either!
author: Joe K.

description:
The crab is to die for. Having that said I order the garlic roasted type. The service is good and servers are very friendly. The wedge salad is also one of my favorites. In general, you will not have one bad meal. 

Until next time Fog Harbor!
author: Lupe M.

description: I've been back here over and over. Their shellfish platter is the best!! Their staff is nice all the time. They're very busy so you better book in advance or wait 20 to 40 min, which is not bad since there are so many souvenir shops around. And, not to forget the beautiful sea lions
author: Irina V.

description: We are always in search of garlic crab in San Francisco so we tried the $45 whole crab. I was very disappointed that the crab was dry near the leg area indicating it may have been previously frozen and the garlic was obviously taken from a jar from the taste and cut of the garlic. Flavor was mediocre. Since the ratings were high, our expectations were high as well. This restaurant is on pier 39 and very crowded. If we return, I would try another dish.
author: Judy G.

description: Atmosphere was amazing.  I would recommend making a reservation and attempt to get a window seat.The whole Dungeness crab was great.  My boyfriend had the clam chowder, but wished he has an option other than sourdough for the bread bowl.  Otherwise, everything was great.  Would recommend coming here if you ever take a trip to San Francisco.
author: Jessica S.

description:
Whoa, I'm on a seafood binge in sf! First off, the view of the bay and Alcatraz is awesome! We came on a Friday night and the wait was only 30 minutes. Luckily they have a lot of seats for you to sit on.

As for the food, we got the :

seafood platter- for $68 you get a lobster tail and claw, half of a Dungeness crab, 6 jumbo shrimp and 6 oysters. Man, the lobster was so tender and the dungess crab was so sweet and fresh. Everything was super fresh and not fishy at all. So good!

Clam chowder bread bowl- $11- yummy! The clam chowder is seasoned to perfection and the sour dough was delicious. The best bread bowl I've ever had.

Fish and chips- $19. The batter was very flaky and crispy. It was excellent and portion size was great.

Overall, this place is top notch! Everything was very fresh and not fishy at all. The staff is very attentive and the decor and view is gorgeous.
author: Kevin N.

description: The food was good and the service was outstanding. We didn't have a view from our table but others did.
author: Wendy D.

description: Great scenery for starters. Nice bar and comfy seating. Good house cocktail list that is very "San Francisco" along with a long wine list. We started with the chowder topped with crab and it was awesome. Then we had the jumbo shrimp cocktail and mussel fries. Both were fantastic. Ended with the crab Cesar salad which was also awesome. Our server, Jeremy, was polite, courteous and prompt giving us great recommendations. A bit pricey but worth it being in SF and the great view.
author: Brittney G.

description:
Delicious food, great service and beautiful view. I would recommend their clam chowder with crab added. You can't go wrong. 

Enjoy!
author: Kyle H.

description: Busy, noisy location at Pier 39. Waiter was friendly & did great job. Was disappointed that one of the specials was "sold out" by only 7:00. Food was pricey but pretty good. Mussel fries were just fries on mussels, but the sauce on them were so good! Came here with my husband and serving sizes of dinner were just enough. View was decent and lucked out seeing the sunset.  Glad we came, but it wasn't outstanding & probably won't come back next time.
author: Janet Z.

description: This is a really nice place to go. I'd suggest you go during the day to see the great views. Short wait for a walk up. Reservations are usually booked up. The service was good for being as busy as they were. I had the seafood platter. It was delicious. First timers I'd suggest you go check it out at least once. It's a bit pricey but it's expected.
author: Courtney K.

description:
Ate dinner here twice while on vacation. 

Food: We had the calamari as an appetizer. We mentioned that we didn't like tentacles so they hooked us up by not serving us any of those. They were fried perfectly. I had the Dungeness Cheese Ravioli (seasonal special) - cheese ravioli work Dungeness crab meat on top. I'm actually surprised at the amount of crab that was on that plate. It was way more than I expected. It tastes so fresh and delicious! Highly recommend that plate if it's available when you go. My husband and I shared the clam chowder soup (regular bowl, not a bread bowl) during our second visit. It was delicious! So creamy! I loved dipping their bread into it. 

Pricing: They can be expensive but it's a higher end restaurant, so that's to be expected.

Staff: The first waitress we had was amazing. Unfortunately, I can't remember her name. She was friendly, bubbly, and super attentive. She had a smile on her face the entire time. The second waitress (named Melissa or Michelle, now I'm getting confused) wasn't as attentive. She kept attending the table behind me and didn't notice that I was trying to get her attention for quite a while to get a soda refill. She took a while to bring us the check and then a while longer to finally take the payment. 

Overall, I highly recommend this place for a nice dinner. The restaurant is right by the water so any table you get includes a nice view of the bay and marina.
author: Lissette B.

description: Another crowded joint at the harbour. They serve large portions the food is great.  Great for large parties, great staff. Alot of activities while u wait are at the pier.
author: Marsha D.

description: First time visiting Pier 39 and couldn't have chosen a better place to eat. The food was awesome, the views were perfect, and our server, Justin H gave us service to match. Thanks for making our first trip memorable!
author: Wes L.

description:
We were STARVING  from a drive from Napa and needed a place to eat. Some friends were eating there so we joined. It's full of tourists as expected and the food isn't bad at all. The cioppino was not good, at all. Seafood in it was good but it was a super thick sauce. The baked oysters were good, definitely worth trying again. Clam chowder was solid. The scallops were really good.

The line was crazy outside and it's really loud.
author: Joe O.

description: Great view of the bay, the food was amazing and our waiter Justin was awesome and helpful!
author: Rogelio G.

description:
Ive been Traveling to the United States for Couple of years. Yelp in the philippine is not that popular. But when I came to visit my Friend in San Francisco. Told me about yelp? I tried it out for the best Seafood at Pier 39? A popular tourist destination in San Francisco. I stumbled at Fog Harbor Fish House. My Host Friend confirmed about the Sustainability of the Restaurant. Sustainability... A first to my ear Let me realized how environmental friendly this restaurant was.

Its on the second level of Pier 39. They had a Majestic View of Golden Gate. Huge Windows to enjoy the best view while you enjoy your Dinning experience.....

Our Server Shawna was sooo welcoming.. Explained what sustainable Seafood they offer.  She suggested the Mix Grill with salmon, shrimp and swordfish with mash potato and broccoli. Loved her suggestion as this trio compliment with each other....

My Friend Got the Salmon. Its was moist and Loved it ...I had to steal half of his salmon too...

Last but not the least is their Award winning Clam Chowder....True Its must try..

For a first time Yelper..Im glad my friend informed me about this application...


Thanks to Shawna and Fog Harbor for a wonderful experience..
author: Jonathan C.

description: The service, food and view were good.  I enjoyed the fish and chips. It's on the pier which felt quite touristy.  I would recommend talking to someone local for their recommendation to explore.  The service was great and I would recommend the view, staff, fish and chips and their sourdough bread was great.
author: Spencer J.

description:
A week in SF with the in-laws I made certain we stayed away from tourist traps, and yet here I find myself- at this place and writing a review.  Trust me, at the time this location was selected for dinner, I asked everyone "are you sure you want to eat here?" Meaning: Pier 39/expensive/overpriced/not great food/we could get better up and over THAT hill/TOURIST TRAP!??!?! While the decor and view are lovely, that's TRULY what you are paying for.  

Our waiter, Eddie, was AWESOME! He was gracious, patient, polite, and super attentive! He saved Fog Harbor from getting 1 star.  

Caesar salad- delicious. Warm bread- delicious.  Creme Brule- great. 
Calamari, Blue Cheese Bread, Crab Ravioli- NO. NO. NO.
author: Regeena E.

description:
I came here a little before noon and it wasn't too crowded considering it was a Monday after all. 

S E R V I C E 
We were immediately sat down when we walked up to the podium. I can't recall if my server had mentioned her name or not. The service was pretty good I have to say. They were really attentive and patient with me when I couldn't decide what I want to eat yet. 

They validate parking garage tickets for an hour :) that's $9 !! Hehe. 


F O O D ! ! 

Clam chowder (5/5) 
I have read some of the reviews and people say the clam chowder is the best. It was Good but I can't say it's the best I ever had. I honestly haven't tasted THE best yet. So I'm still looking. However, this one IS pretty good. Some places are very stingy with their clams. Not here though. They gave a pretty decent amount of clams in their soup. I'd still give it a 5/5 :) cause it was good. Not too salty , which is great.

Baked Oysters (5/5) 
The best baked oysters I've had in a LONG time ! That cheese ricotta-like on the oyster was so yummy. I'm not sure what kind of cheese they used but I'm guessing it's ricotta . I didn't read the menu for it lol. I just saw baked oysters and I had to try It. They're small oysters, so it's super yummy hehe. I recommend trying it. 

Seared Tuna- 2/5 
This entre was too salty. Not the tuna, but the veggies and the sauce it was cooked in was too salty and very overwhelminThe garlic mash potato was pretty average. The fish was okay too. I wasn't a really big fan of this dish, so I was kinda disappointed.
author: Jenny N.

description:
There was a wait 15 mins, not too bad .
We were sat and greeted instantly, our server was absolutely wonderful. He explained everything on the menus, wines, specials.. then gave us time to look it over. Even though it was busy he came back within a good time and took our order. My husband got some seafood dish and I got ordered the Blt with Salmon. Our food was amazing and so filling. I couldn't finish it, I was so stuffed.
My husband got his seafood fix as well. The view was beautiful, especially when they raised the blinds as the sun went down, they even asked everyone if they were ok with it, making sure no one was bothered by it. Extremely polite. I loved it, I would go again! If I had to be picky and name something I didn't like, the tables were a little close together so when the servers went in between they always hit my chair and you were so close to the people next to you.. but like I said that's if I'm being picky. The pros definitely out weigh the cons
author: Meagan B.

description:
I feel rich. Like lottery winning rich.

I won a $100 gift certificate here, and I went all out when it came to ordering food.

But don't worry, I'm not that selfish. I like to share the wealth, so I invited my friends and paid the difference.

Here's what we had and our thoughts.

Clam chowder: Great, creamy, clam-y. Everyone loved their clam chowder. The ones with the bread bowl loved the bread too.

Caesar salad: Huge portion, good dressing, not overly great, just okay.

Baked oysters: These tasted a bit raw even though they were supposed to be baked. Even the cheese on top was cold. But this is where the service shined. Our waiter was always checking up on us, and we even had service from the District Manager Neusom, who came over and checked on us as well. When we told him about the oysters, he struck it from the bill immediately.

Large Shrimp Cocktail: Delicious, and lived up to it's name. They were large. So good we couldn't stop ordering and eating these. 

Crab cakes: Excellent flavor. More crab meat than breading, great texture. We ordered several of them because we liked them so much.

Chippino: Huge,and filled with things you would find under the sea. Clams, crab, salmon, I mean this thing was a cauldron of goodness.

I want to say that our waiter was exceptional and was always there to fill up water, and even bagged up fresh sourdough for one of my friends who wanted to take some bread home.

Being that this is a tourist spot, I highly recommend it for tourists who may be overwhelmed with all the choices on the Pier.

Even as a local, I can say, I'll definitely be back.
author: Jack R.

description: Classic marina meal. Prices are  fair enough. Food is good. Service is friendly and professional. We were given seat by the window and enjoyed a nice evening.
author: Alex R.

description: Spectacular. Really the best place in SF. here on work every two weeks and love it. People are great and really treat customers well.
author: Joseph S.

description: Amazing service and great food. My go to restaurant on the pier! I left my jacket one time and they were kind enough to ship it to my house since I like about an hour away.
author: Jailen P.

description: Luane was the absolute best server and made our SF culinary experience a delight. One of our group explained his meal as "Nirvana" and my crab and scallops risotto melted in my mouth. To top it off, the creme brûlée was amazing!
author: Challin M.

description: The wait was long but well worth it!  My friends and I dined there a couple of days ago and we were so pleased with the service, the food and the drinks!  You will not be disappointed.  Please ask to be seated in Jessica's section.  Jessica was awesome!  Jessica knows about first class service, has a great sense of humor and the professionalism to match.
author: Tony L.

description: I had the surf and turf with steak and lobster and the lobster was delicious, juicy and soft. I wanted to order another one! My husband had the NY steak and he said it was okay. The wait wasn't too long for a party of 4 around 6:30pm.
author: Heidi B.

description: I enjoyed my recent lunch at Fog Harbor. I work a couple of blocks away and decided to treat myself to lunch since I'd finished a project that morning. I was dining solo so I sat at the bar. Service was prompt and attentive. The food was great. The menu was fairly typical of the area but thoughtfully chosen. The restaurant was bright and airy.
author: Tim T.

description: This place is amazing! I'd probably come here next time. Serves the food I crave for.
author: Yena H.

description: Food was good. Only had to wait about 30 min to get a table at 5pm on Friday. The service was not good as soon as I need the waiter he was gone. When I got my food I wanted some Parmesan cheese but waiter was not there. I finally flagged down the hostess who was not helpful either.  Then I wanted some bread and again the waiter was not available. But when I needed the bill he was Johnny on the spot
author: M M.

description:
The service here was great, very quick to respond to a need! 

I loved their mussel fries! It didn't sound appealing at first, but there's something about the sauce they cook the mussels in that was DELICIOUS! 

I don't know if I would get the 1/2 garlic crab again, seemed small for the price. But it was still tasty.

I ordered the linguini with clams and it was light! Very nicely done!
author: Melissa R.

description:
Whenever I'm in SF I have to come to Fog Harbor. This is one of my absolute favorite restaurants. The seafood is always fresh, and the overall dining experience is amazing. Regardless of the wait time, you have to sit by the window and enjoy the waterfront. 
On my last visit, I ordered the Crab Louis salad, it was loaded with fresh crab, and too big to finish...Loved It!
They offer an extensive wine selection, and the cocktails are pretty impressive as well (Moscow Mule with extra lime). 
Be prepared to indulge and enjoy when you come here.

010/100. Yelp Challenge.(2016)
author: Joi R.

description: The crab ceviche is a must and their sourdough rolls are to die for. Definitely a place to eat while visiting Pier 39!
author: Andrea P.

description: Great food and even better service. Our waiter Eddie was the absolute best! We came here for Mother's Day and couldn't have asked for a better time! 10/10 would recommend.
author: Aysouda M.

description: Really good food, enjoyed everything we ate. The mussel fries were interesting but none the less delicious. I enjoyed the seafood pasta and my grandmother really enjoyed the sole fish. The wait to eat was extremely long, however the service was well. Overall I recommend to eat here once during your stay in SF
author: Alexis R.

description: This place has the best clam chowder you'll ever probably eat in your life! If you get a table by the window, you'll have a beautiful view. It was a great experience!
author: Sherly S.

description: NOT worth the wait in ANY way.  The service is very slow.  Each one of our forks & soup spoons were dirty.  When we got new ones, the bus boy (after cleaning off the previous tables dirty dishes) brought us our "clean" utensils in his dirty hands with no napkin to hold it in.  One of our water glasses had lipstick on it.  I ordered a wedge salad, asked them to chop it & put NO onions on it.  When he brought it unchopped, covered in onions, I had to ask him to fix it.  I think they just picked the onions off the old one (because there were still onion remnants in the "newly" chopped salad) which isn't cool.  My pasta dinner was dry.  My boyfriends fish was ok but no where near the quality we expected from an oceanfront fish house.  We will try a new place the next time we visit.
author: Kim M.

description: Yummm is all I can say. This is our new SF seafood place. We ordered several dishes and shared and they did not disappoint. We will be back.
author: Angelique S.

description: Phenomenal!!! I recommended this restaurant to a colleague without dining here, I've had the pleasure of going finally and I have to say I was NOT disappointed!!  This was by far the best seafood I've had in The Bay Area yet!! I highly recommend making reservations.  The views of The Bay are incredible you can't go wrong.
author: Christal D.

description:
Bf and I came around 7pm and were seated towards the entrance right away. It was really windy so asked to be seated towards the inside. The host immediately told us there's a wait to sit inside. Well shouldn't you have given us the option of waiting to sit inside? The estimated waiting time for the Inside was 10 minutes, but we were seated in less than 2.

We shared the shellfish platter, chicken penne, and calamari.

I really enjoyed the calamari! It wasn't oily compared to other restaurants and had a nice crunch.

The chicken from the pasta was slightly plain and dry.

The shellfish putter comes with half a dozen of oysters, 0.5lb of crab, half a pound of lobsters, and shrimp. Average quality. My one complaint is they didn't offer sauce that wasn't spicy. Oysters were a bit small.

Overall they exceed my expectations given that I wasn't preparing myself for a five-star treatment. What I come again? Maybe next year.
author: Danae L.

description:
Excellent service!

My linguine was awesome! The oysters here are not worth getting. So don't get them and you won't be disappointed! Other than that, they have awesome cocktails and great food in general.
author: Michael K.

description: This was our best meal and service in our visit to San Francisco! It was the best!! Great views and the food was delicious!!!! Unlimited sourdough bread and good prices. Cioppino - go for the lazy one. Clam chowder, oysters= heavenly!
author: Krystal D.

description: Made reservations online ahead of time. They accommodated us to exactly what I asked and I'm completely grateful. The wait was 20 minutes before we got in. Reservations we walked past the line of people, right to a window seat. We had the house white wines. Liked the Chardonnay but loved the Pinot. Clam chowder was thick and buttery. Bread was hot and fluffy. The sol was to die for. The staff was very fast and kind. I believe the other bad reviews are from people trying to find something bad out of their day. This place was lovely!
author: Crystal N.

description: On vacation out in the Bay area, waiting for our ferry ride to Alcatraz Island me and my boyfriend were hungry and decided to stop here for some lunch. We had half a dozen oysters probably the best oysters I've ever had soo fresh and no fishy after taste. I had the clam chowder in a bread bowl it was delicious! My boyfriend has the seafood platter that included crab, mussels, clams , and potatoes. It was a bit to garlicky for me but the seafood was fresh! As well we had a great view of the water from our seats.
author: Linda N.

description: The food is incredible. We loved the garlic cheese bread,  the Seafood Penne, and Grilled Shrimp Bridgette. Our server Daniel C. was great. He was attentive, very friendly, and took very good care of us. We loved it.
author: Diana D.

description: This restaurant has an amazing view and ambiance with a variety of seafood options! For dinner for 2,  we shared a large clam chowder and used it as a dip for our complimentary sourdough bread! We also shared a cioppino which had an amazing amount of seafood from scallop, to fish, to shrimp, to crab! I didn't particularly love the fish and found it tougher than usual. The cioppino itself was also a bit on the fishy side and less seasoned than other places I've had it. But then again, all restaurants do cioppino differently, so that may be their style!
author: Sherry W.

description: The whole crab and cioppino were fabulous. We had a window seat and nice service. The cioppino had very good flavor. Rich with great seafood. Would definitely go back.
author: G W.

description: Had an amazing time with Gina! She's awesome for bringing me here on Manager Robert Hall's suggestion! Appreciate it very much! A fantastic way to start my Birthday Celebration! Raphael our server made it a great experience, as he was very attentive! Thank you for that!Food, drinks and dessert super delicious!
author: Stephanie L.

description:
Caution: Tourist Trap. 

We had high expectations after reading reviews and seeing the menu, but ultimately decided the food was absolutely not worth the high price tag. The atmosphere really isn't very pleasant. It feels like a cafeteria--no ambiance--but at least the view was great. Our table was dirty when we were seated--food and liquid on the chairs, bread plates had crumbs and spots on them.

The sword fish was pretty good, but really nothing special--simply fish and veggies smothered in pesto and tartar sauce. 

The Crab Sandwich was the most disappointing. It lacked flavor and was incredibly liquid-y. 

We enjoyed the beer, but were extremely disappointed walking out with a decent bill when the experience was sub-par and the food lacking. Don't get sucked into the tourist trap.
author: Abbie C.

description:
From afar, Fog Harbor Fish House always looked like any other Pier 39 seafood restaurant to me. Upon closer inspection, it's actually very nice. The waiting area outside is a tiled patio with couches, a fireplace, and a painting above the fireplace, so it feels more like a cozy outdoor living room. 
They take reservations on Opentable, which is probably a good idea for a tourist-heavy location.
The menu includes a variety of seafood dishes and quite a few fried items. For a seafood restaurant, there is a good amount of land dishes for those who don't eat seafood. We had a cozy table by the window and enjoyed the waterfront view during dinner.

Crispy Bay Scallops ($13) - panko breaded & fried, w/ roasted jalapeno aioli:
I was hoping the scallops would have a light crunchy panko crust, but the tiny bite-sized bay scallops were completely coated in breading and unrecognizable as scallops. It was my mistake. I should have guessed panko breaded meant covered in panko. It was too much breading and a little too oily for me to enjoy them as scallops. If I knew they would have that much breading, I wouldn't have ordered this dish. It's not bad for a deep-fried snack. The thick, heavy jalapeno aioli added a little bit of a kick.

Shellfish Platter ($38 for 1, $59 for 2) - 1/2 crab, mussels, clams, shrimp, oven roasted w/ butter, garlic, herbs:
The shellfish massacre presented in front of us was seasoned nicely and tasted quite fresh. The crab legs were sweet and meaty. The mussels and clams were nice and springy. The shrimp at the bottom of the plate soaked up all the buttery juices and herbs. It also came with some corn on the cob and garlic toast. 

Bread Pudding ($8.50) - topped w/ vanilla ice cream, vanilla bean sauce, dusted with cocoa powder:
Dinner was a little salty, so I wanted something sweet. I'm fond of bread pudding, so that was an easy choice. It was served warm and gooey and the edges were a little crispy.

While we ate, we enjoyed watching the sunset over the water. It made for a nice meal. If I come back, I'd probably try the cioppino next.
author: Joy W.

description: Khaiman was the greatest waiter! So helpful and suggestive about what was good and fitting for our mood. I would come here again and again. The best clam chowder in town!
author: Hannah G.

description:
Michael was our server and he was awesome.  Awesome.  The food was on point.  Appetizers, the chowder (BOMB), surf n turf, there's no going wrong.  They even had this Pinot noir wine soda so this pregnant girl could feel kinda cool with her wine glass.  We weren't able to make reservations but that wasn't an issue, we were seated in 10 minutes at 5:30 on a Friday. 
Overall food was great, view was beautiful and our server was impeccable.
author: Sirena P.

description: Great seafood spot! Was New Year's Eve so we got in right away but I'm gathering this place produces quite a wait so call ahead for sure. I did a crab special and was delicious, they dress it up nice with the entire crab coming out with it. Bread, veggies, salad was all on point. Moms and I also shared a clam chowder in the classic Sfo sourdough. That was more than plenty but crab was prepared to order so I knew I couldn't resist. Had a fat boy moment ordering 2 entrees hahah Hell why not... Don't judge see my photos and you'll do the same. Tarter sauce was a win too enjoy
author: Michael R.

description: The food was wonderful, we had the mussels fries, it was so good. Curtis was our waiter, he was awesome, very friendly and helpful, made the meal very special. Best food on the pier. Get there before 5 and walk in and get a table with a few
author: Phil D.

description: The happy hour clam chowder and sourdough was a perfect small meal. Paired with the (surprisingly nice) house Chardonnay, I am one happy customer that will be back next time I'm in town!
author: Christi P.

description:
This restaurant made our evening so delightful & beautiful! All a big thanks to the front hostesses who took our name!
A great and wonderful server named Allison W.!!!
As we were heading to our table..I noticed a personalized "Happy Anniversary" with two hearts scribbled on the paper tablecloth! Awhhh! Was my first reaction!
I loved it..even the spectacular view where we were seated was awesome! We had a great sight of Alcatraz & far on the other side was Golden Gate Bridge!
To make things anymore but a perfect evening was our food! We started off with
Fries & Mussles..it was pretty good! I wish there were more fries??!! Lol!!
Then our entree came..I had the Mixed Grilled which was a little of everything such as salmon, swordfish & three pieces of grilled shrimp..it came with garlic mashed potatoes & asparagus salad! It was yummy..yummy..yummy!!
My love had Lobster tail..not one but two big tails..it came w/steamed broccoli &
Garlic mashed potatoes also!!
I can't forget the warm sourdough bread they give you while you wait!! It was so soft & warm that my butter melted deep inside the bread that I couldn't stop eating it!
To finish it off with a fabulous dessert of Blondie..it was brownie w/chunks of chocolate bits & walnut..which I love!
Topped with it a vanilla ice-cream & drizzled with Carmel sauce & the homemade whip cream on the side made it even more decadent!
Overall..our experience was so wonderful..
Being it was our celebration & it was 4th of July..it was a beautiful ending seeing the Fireworks after on Pier 39!
Thank you Fog Harbor for a great day!
To Allison W...it was such a pleasure having you make our evening special! We shall come there again because of your Awesome..positive attitude..your customer service was superb..A+++ that I hope your boss knows they are very lucky to have you work for them! You deserve a fat raise girl!!
Thank you ever so much!
author: Sharon Z.

description: Went with the family, foods great here. Ordered plenty, osyters, Dungress crab ceviche, ciopini . Great food, would come again. Ask for the easy menu if its your first time. Makes deciding what to get easier!
author: Meng V.

description:
Underwhelmed. Clam chowder was tasty- but not tasty enough to warrant $7/cup price tag. No crackers even offered? The oysters were great, hard to screw those up if you have a good purveyor.  I ordered the mixed grill (salmon, swordfish, and shrimp) and once again was underwhelmed. There was no seasoning and the lemon buerre blanc was runny and had little flavor. Regarding service...I was not offered bread at any point even though every table around me received some. My water glass was empty more often than it was full. I'm
Not sure how this place has so many great reviews other than they must be tourists and/or have low expectations. I've had a better seafood experience at Red Lobster!
author: Mandy B.

description:
After reject from pier market seafood restaurant, my family stop by this restaurant. Reception lady told we need to wait 2 hours. 
No problem at all. We live to wait. 
She told me maybe more earlier. 
We shopping on the pier and waiting for texting. 
After little more than an hour, we got table. 

Waitress Christine was so kind and helpful. 
She has great smile too. 
She recommended food not on the menu. 
We order that and 2 more lobster and stake dishes. 

Food was just right and delicious. 

Even manager stop by ask us how test of food is. 

Other restaurant ruined Christmas vacation. 
However, this restaurant heal my children's heart. 

Thank you for good food and your kindness. 
Thank you Christine.
author: Tom S.

description:
Went at around 8:30 on Saturday night with no reservation, and were told the wait would be 45 minutes. We asked if we could sit at the bar, and were told yes, so thought we'd get drinks and maybe eat at the bar. But by the time we decided on drinks and asked a few questions about the menu, our table was ready. 

We ordered the Dungeoness Crab Ravioli and Swordfish, which were both delicious. The only disappointing thing was that there was no crab inside the ravioli, only on top. For dessert, we tried the mini creme brûlée and flourless chocolate cake combo and the blondie with ice cream. Actually liked the blondie much more than the chocolate cake, and I'm a huge fan of chocolate. Well done. 

Service was okay, not stellar, but nothing really to complain about. Didn't feel like it was a tourist trap, just good, fresh food by the water. Also, still extremely busy at 10:30ish when we left, so that's always a good sign. Would recommend.
author: D. D.

description: I was really nervous as we walked up to the restaurant because you are smack tab in the middle of tourist central.  But once inside, the restaurant was warm and inviting with great views.  I went with the Cioppino (when in San Fran!) and it was absolutely incredible!  They also served the local Boudin Bakery sourdough which was excellent as well.  Our server was super friendly and engaging.  My only warning is the cocktails look to be a bit of a rip off.  We were sitting near the bar and I'm here to say, at least the night we were there, the drinks were poured with a stingy hand.
author: Ashley W.

description: Shout to Luannis our waitress, the best smile and service. She knows her products very well from appetizers to main menus to desserts. Place is very neat and clean. The best seafood.
author: Butch A.

description: Come around 4.45pm and wait around 10 minutes. It has a good view especially for sunset! Do not have to do reservation. Good food and good price! The calamari is so good, not to heavy. Loves the Salmon Grill, my favorite so far! Recommended to dine here when you visit Pier 39.
author: Amabel S.

description: Other than the great food, the staff are friendly and approachable. That's what I actually look for in an restaurant I dine in--the customer service.
author: Fiona D.

description: View of the bay is very nice.  The food is good though nothing special.  A little pricey.  The staff is inattentive and close to rude.  Our waitress said "I've got about two seconds buddy" when I asked her to take a family picture.  My daughter asked her what she recommended. The waitress said "How would I know what you like?" Hmmmm. The staff wants you to get out of their way if e.g. you're going to the bathroom.  Won't go back.
author: C G.

description: Good food, view, and service at Fog Harbor--brought wifey and the Orlando contingent over for Lunch on Tuesday. Got there by Noon and seated at last available window table. Short stuff enjoyed her Burger and declared best ever with bacon. Wifey enjoyed 1/2 her Salmon BLT, and so did  I. Ha! Sister liked her Clam Chowder Bowl, and I savored the Sautéed Dover Sole. Heaven forbid I forget our veteran server, Pedro, who cheerfully guided us thru the menu and attended us with near forgotten poise and professionalism. We shall return!
author: John S.

description: This place is so good and has amazing views. We got the seafood tower and clam chowder and split it between the two of us and it was perfect and delicious. Our waiter, Justin was so wonderful and explained everything thoroughly and did an amazing job!  We would definitely return!
author: KayLynn O.

description: Just visited the restaurant yesterday and it was excellent!  The place is nice with great views of the pier.  The service is absolutely top notch.  I had the garlic whole crab (suggested by the waiter), it was finger licking yummy good!  I really enjoyed the experience there and will definitely go back if I am in SF area!
author: Anthony L.

description:
Great food, awesome view, good waiter, horrible hostess.

Took my wife there for a fancy dinner with a view today for our last dinner in San Francisco. The dinner started off great with prompt seating and we ordered our food. 

The food were great ahi tuna appertizer were great, baked oysters were delicious and clam chowder were awesome. 

So after dinner my wife and I took turn to go to the restroom after we ordered dessert. While my wife walk away the waiter came and took our dishes and drop off 2 dessert spoons. Not a minute after that I over heard 2 hostess talking no more than 5 feet away from our table about how we have been sitting at the table for a long time not ordering anything and why are we not leaving. I was shocked and pissed off at them. 

I looked over at them and they gave me a look like oh you heard that? Then took a couple step back and kept talking about us and other table. WTF? 

Totally ruin the experience for me. I understand that it's a busy friday night but we were not just lounging around not ordering any food. Even if we were to lounge around enjoy the view after our meal we should be able too in peace! We end up spending over $100 for the meal and I was totally disappointed with the experience.
author: Kritpong S.

description:
Ordered the ahi tuna poke appetizer, lettuce wedge, and crab cocktail. The first two were superbly done, very flavorful. I could've done without the crab - I thought it would be lump meat but it was sort of in shreds.
Don't miss the complimentary warm sourdough bread with butter! So good!!
Also had the mojito to drink and it was exquisite.
Of course it all was pricey but that seems to be the way of San Francisco.
Bon appetit!
author: Michelle S.

description: What a great restaurant and Daniel C. The best waiter took really good care of us. I had the pacific sole it was so good and the Lombard lemonade was delicious. Thank you Daniel it was so nice to meet you.
author: Karen A.

description: Wow! Great food and drinks! Quiana in the bar made the best drinks and Curtis was a server that knew the menu and made excellent suggestions. Our dinners of the halibut, cioppino and more were all excellent! Everyone at Fog Harbor was courteous and welcoming. You've got lots of choices on the pier but Fog Harbor is a great choice!!
author: Linda R.

description: Great crab cakes, salmon, lobster tail and swordfish.  Had it all in one go.  Very fresh and prepared well!!
author: Matthew K.

description: Came here for our anniversary dinner while on our first solo trip sans kids to SF. The food was delicious and the ambiance was inviting but more than anything our waiter's charming personality made our night all the more special. You couldn't tell it was Dan C's second day on the job because of his confidence and his passion for food. He was so accommodating and made sure to research menu items we couldn't have since we don't eat pork or alcohol. He was kind, sweet and just such a fun personality to be around. Thank you for making our meal delightful. We'll visit the next time we're in town!
author: Nabiha M.

description: Ono food and service! Looking to get out of the cold, we decided on this place. My boys had the fried shrimp, we had oysters, clam chowder, and shrimp linguine. Boys gave the food 5 stars and so did we. Along with a Cali Double IPA and Hibiscus Margarita with egg white frost means we had a great time here!! I'm
author: Daniel T.

description:
I had a business dinner with a partner. The Fog Harbor was among the top restaurants recommended in Yelp, which we selected. It was good choice.

I had the Seafood Penne dish, which tasted great as expected. They had a good wine selection and gorgeous ambiance..
author: Erwin C.

description: This is a great place to have a nice date. Very expensive but you basically pay for the view and top quality seafood. The clam chowder was delicious, I highly recommend getting it for appetizers. It gets really crowded here so make sure to rsvp ahead of time. Had to wait about 45min to an hour for just 2 people. The service was decent considering how crowded it gets at night. Overall this place is great! Would love to come back here when I come visit san fran again.
author: Ryan N.

description: We went to SF knowing we wanted to celebrate our five year anniversary at Fog Harbor. Since it was going to be a special night, I called ahead to set up a few plans. This resulted in some miscommunication, however, Fog Harbor realized this and completely made up for it!! Our experience was beyond fabulous. Almost heavenly. The food was absolutely amazing and they even helped us reveal the sex of our baby. Tables around us even celebrated with us! Overall, it was an experience I will never forget and Fog Harbor will forever be special in my heart. I recommend you go there for any occasion!
author: Jordan B.

description: Wonderful! Excellent seafood in a great atmosphere. The oysters were terrific! I had the crab and my husband had the salmon and both agree that this was one of the best tasting stuff we've ever had! Michael was our server and he was awesome!
author: D Joseph P.

description:
Honestly, all you are really doing is paying for he location and the waiters/waitresses attire. Service was mediocre; food was sub-par, priced at rip-off levels, but the location was pretty good, if you are facing west (or maybe north). I had the fish and chips ($19), and I'm from Illinois, and I think the $10 fish fry's at home had better fried fish than here, there was still uncooked batter on the fish which pretty much ruined it for me. The fries were OK, but nothing special for the price. The rest of the members in my party said that their meals were basically the same way. All in all, it's basically mediocre food for double the price.
Food: 2/5
Location: 4/5
Service: 3/5
Atmosphere: 3/5
author: Jacob T.

description: Great place for seafood. Me and my friends had lunch here before heading back to Phoenix. We had the lipstick lemon drop adult beverage and it was great. The sourdough bread was awesome. I usually do not eat sourdough bread. But this was great!. Our server was amazing and funny and nice. Love this place. Definitely will come back
author: Toni G.

description:
Went here with my family and was honestly expecting a lot out of the seafood. The wait was pretty long, but Fisherman's wharf was right there, so was able to keep myself and fam occupy. Ordered the crab roasted with garlic, their award winning clam chowder and clam with linguine. 

The crab and linguine was delicious!  I did not like their clam chowder because it was too heavy for my liking, but the bread bowl was yum. 

Overall a good experience and worth a try.
author: Mai B.

description: Great views of the waterfront if you can snag a window seat. I'd recommend making a reservation ahead of time, it's the most popular restaurant on the pier! Good food, even better presentation.
author: Jenelle V.

description: Great night at Fog Harbor Fish House. Our server was Daniel C.   He was awesome. The apple crisp was the best ever.
author: Margo B.

description:
I loved the ambiance of the restaurant! Although there was a really loud group of Asians sitting right beside us, it didn't stop me from enjoying the food and the view of the bay! We ordered salmon and surf & turf. The salmon was bomb, flavour was on point! The steak, on the other hand, was a little too hard for me. It was hard to chew. The lobster looked great but it was a tad bit too salty for me. The best part of the entire meal was the clam chowder! It was bomb, definitely need to give it a try! Worth the money. 


Ps. For those who went to the aquarium first, keep your tickets! You get 15% off your bill if you dine at this restaurant!
author: Sheila C.

description: Great location with excellent service. Definitely recommend the Cioppino. Lots of shrimp and crab. The mini sourdough loaves are very good as well. Great place; I'll be back.
author: Cav R.

description:
3.5 stars, rounding down for a few reasons explained later. For the area, this restaurant gives a decent value with nice views in what is decidedly a tourist-trap area.
