If you'd rather skip the Bubba Gump's and Hard Rock's of the world, this is a solid option. However, our dining experience had a few gaffes. 

First, our utensils & glassware consistently required changing (lipstick on wine glass & dried on food on two soup spoons). These were however met with apologies & swift changes. 

Second, there was a shift-change during our visit. Upon asking what the side dishes that came with the cod were, I was informed chorizo & white beans. Mmm, delicious. Unfortunately, I was served blah green beans & garlic mashed potatoes. Apparently they had run out of the normal side but not informed our server. I was offered another dish or a complimentary side. I begrudgingly chose another side. 

Lastly, the cod portion was very small for the price. It was delicious and I wanted more! With the understanding that we were eating in a touristy area in an expensive city, cod is a fairly cheap fish. However, my wife & I both enjoyed the quality of our food. 

Solid, albeit not great, restaurant in an area filled with chains & meh tourist traps. Definitely worth checking out if you're taking the Alcatraz tour or just around the Pier 39 area.
author: Andrew B.

description:
Tourist trap.

Nice attractive expensive seafood restaurant by the waterfront.  Don't expect value if you are hungry.
author: James B.

description: Had a lunch date with my wife because we Love to come to the city and find new restaurants that satisfy our tastes and palates. Pier 39 can be a busy and busselling place during the summer but we decided to take a chance on this restaurant. I made reservations for 11:30 am on a Friday, and it worked out perfectly. The open door policy and greeting at the door was very inviting. The hostess was friendly and showed us to a table for two by the window. My wife faced the bay and I faced the tourists walking the Embarcadero, perfect. The bird droppings on the window didn't detour us from ordering a wonderful lunch. Edgar, our waiter, did a fine job of serving us. The restaurant was almost empty when we entered but became packed by noon. Our menu: my wife started out with the fabulous baked oysters, with a cocktail of a Hibiscus Margarita. The clam chowder cup was perfect but I added a pinch of salt to bring in the true sea flavor. I had a really good Prosecco which cleansed the pallet for each new flavor. We split a Cal crab Caesar for $30.00 and this is why this rating is NOT a 5 star. The lettuce was really "off color", seemed bagged and had a strange if not bland taste. We separated the lettuce from the wonderful crab, bacon and croutons which made it perfect. The main course of Scallops was perfect with crab and just a touch of cheese in the Risotto. The Scallops were "crisp" on the outside, perfectly grilled, the inside was tender, moist and most flavorable. A really good restaurant, except for the lettuce and we will tell friends and family of our dining experience.
author: John94521 H.

description: Exquisite service and fresh seafood. Highly recommend the shellfish platter if visiting for the first time
author: Alan Z.

description: The clam chowder was really bland paid extra for lobster and it was just three pieces and way overpriced.My son order was a hot dog with fries but unfortunately it was bland too the ones from the hot dog street vendors look more appetizing.  Overall always the place looks nice.
author: Vanessa M.

description: We really enjoyed our experience at this restaurant during my birthday.  We were given a window seat for 2 and it was perfect with a nice view of the tourist boats outside along with a view of the marina.  There were several seals sitting on the marina which provided us with an entertaining view.   We dined during lunchtime and my salmon salad was delicious and the salmon was perfectly cooked.  My husband had the clam chowder in the sourdough bread and he devoured every bite.   Service was on point and very friendly.   We will definitely return when we visit San Francisco again.
author: Kimberly R.

description: The food was amazing. Our server Justin was fantastic as well. He recommended an excellent beer for me and then checked back with us to make sure we were doing ok. Definitely recommend this place. Also the creme brûlée was to die for!!
author: Amanda S.

description: We had such an amazing experience for lunch at Fog Harbor while visiting from Florida. Susan was our server and she did an excellent job at walking us through the menu, giving suggestions as well as allowing us to go at a slow pace. Our meal was amazing and overall a fantastic experience. Thank you Susan!
author: Krysta S.

description: We were exploring Pier 39 with our 2-year-old and saw this beautiful restaurant with CRAYONS at the host station. My husband and I were thrilled to find a place that was not only nice for adults, but welcoming to children as well. In fact, the kids menu had "penne with butter + parmesan with steamed broccoli" which is one of our daughter's fav things to eat and way better than the usual stuff on a kids menu. Our server even put her bib on for her and everything...just so sweet! We felt cared for by the staff and the food was really good as well. I had Fish n Chips, my husband had some fried platter of goodness including shrimp, calimari + fish. Oh, and the Lipstick Lemon Drop...high five for a great cocktail! We'll def be back! Cheers!
author: Cassie G.

description:
Here is the detailed story.
On June 11, I had lunch with my friend. We ordered two main dishes, one beer and one something sweet sparkling juice. I don't remember the name of the beverage. Few minutes later, the waiter stopped by our table and said that my order is not available today. Then he suggested me to try wine or beer. I said "No, thank you. I'm not good at drinking alcohol. If it is not available, I'll NOT order any drink. Just water is fine." 
And then, he brought us plain sparkling water. My recollection is a bottle of San Pellegrino or Perrier. I was embarrassed, cause I NEVER ordered it. I asked him. "What is this?" 
He just opened the bottle without asking me any opinion, and poured it to the cup of glass with smile, added "I think this fits to you, since you don't drink alcohol. So, I prepared this for you." Unfortunately, I'm not a big fan of non-sweet sparkling water, so I rarely did drink it during the lunch. 
He should have asked us first, before he opens it.

Besides that pushing sparkling water, he was nice at serving. All of us enjoyed the rest of the food, that is true. 
But I am not happy with the high-pressure sales. I just don't want this happens again.
Lastly, I don't remember his name, but he has a beard and too soft voices.
author: Jimin J.

description:
Ambiance 3/5: Classic and trendy decorations, comfortable seats and harbor window views

Service 2/5: very slow and forgetful, had to remind a few times to get water. Took stars off because of service. 

Food 4/5: in general great
  Clam Chowder - **** award winning soup, it's delicious, recommend 
  Cioppino - *** Crab meat, fresh fish, shrimp, scallops, clams and mussels stewed in a tomato herb broth, very bold taste, average taste 
  Shellfish Platter - **** A 1/2 crab, mussels, clams, shrimp, and vegetables, oven roasted with olive oil, garlic, and herbs, fresh and flavorful crab, recommend 

Price 3/5: reasonably priced, expect at least $30 each plus drinks
author: Maruko X.

description: OMG phenomenal. Warm sourdough bread. Jumbo shrimp cocktail. Dinner plate of grilled salmon, cod, shrimp complimented with mashed potatoes and fresh crisp green beans. Everything was mouth-watering delicious I would totally eat here again.
author: Nicole L.

description: The service was good and the view was nice, but my lobster tail was not fresh. It tasted kind of mushy. The clam chowder was yummy. Would not go there again due to the lobster, but it was nice to have dinner watching the sunset.
author: Suzanna Y.

description: The place has a nice view of the bay with Golden Gate Bridge and Alcatraz island is visible.  The service is good, the food is delicious.  The only negative thing is I found a hair in my chowder, so they comp the chowder and gave us a new bowl but it is still kind of ruin our appetize.
author: Thuy H.

description: This was an unexpectedly wonderful meal. My husband and I came to San Francisco for our honeymoon and, while we tried to avoid the touristy aspect of Pier 39, we had heard great things about Fog Harbor Fish House and opted to eat there before our trip to Alcatraz. We had calamari for an appetizer (superb!), each got a cup of clam chowder (I added crab to mine and it was delicious), and we shared a bowl of Cioppino. Without our asking, our server was kind enough to split our cioppino into separate bowls for us to each have our own. The sourdough bread was also delicious. The food came out quickly, but allowed for enough time for us to enjoy each course. The view was amazing, and we were definitely happy with our meal. If I come back to San Francisco for our anniversary, I will absolutely make it a point to return.
author: Amanda W.

description: Fish and chips were delicious. The shrimp was equally yummy, too and the chowder... AMAZING! Great location with views of the bridge.
author: Emily F.

description: Beautiful day for lunch at fog house. Our first time when visiting pier 39. Saturday so 30 minute wait for a table. Text notification of when our table was ready have us more time to enjoy the wharf! Had red chili shrimp as an appetizer - be aware it has a kick!  Ginger lemonade drink not working for me. Sourdough bread appetizer excellent. Sourdough bread bowls with clam chowder were very good, as well as we got the house salads with chicken and shrimp.
author: Clifton D.

description: We have visited once a year, 3 years running. The chowder is superb, except for the bacon they put in this fish dish. (aka please stop) Get the extra crab on top- you won't regret it. The seared ahi tuna melts in your mouth. Grab a bottle of Kunde Sauvignon Blanc- it will enhance any meal. The wait staff is typically very accommodating, timely, and personable which only adds to this great experience. Hostesses are apparently stressed due to their curt responses. Would have been 5 stars but for the hostesses & disgusting restroom that smelled like it hadn't been cleaned in 8 hot years (the rr not the hostess) Don't forget to get the 1-hour validation ticket from your server! Bon appetit!
author: Ella H.

description: If I could not give a single start I would not. We walk d In was given a glass of water and never came back to serve us! Got up and walked out will never return to his place. Here for a few days and it made our evening horrible!
author: Eddie O.

description: This is a great place to go for seafood in SFO. If you get the right table, you can have some top notch seafood while overlooking the bay and glimpses of the Golden Gate Bridge. Their service is courteous with a smile. We had the Ahi Tuna and the scallops risotto. Excellent tiramisu to top off the meal. It's pricey but great place for a occasion.
author: Ameya C.

description: Great place. I came here for lunch and didn't have to wait long to be seated. Service was great, and the food was awesome!! I had the Dungeness crab seafood platter for two and it was delicious. This place is a MUST if you are visiting SF.
author: Joanne W.

description: The food and the view was excellent, no doubt. But it is over priced for the portions and the service we received was mediocre. Next time I'll try one of the smaller less known restaurants farther down the pier.
author: Tara S.

description: Everything about our experience at Fog Harbor was a 5/5. Our server, Kayla, was excellent, very attentive and quick. They serve a non-alcoholic wine beverage, which was great news since I'm pregnant. We started with the clam chowder soup and couldn't resist adding the crab. It was so creamy and flavorful and paired perfectly with the sourdough bread. We also shared the fried calamari. It is served with fried onions and jalapeños which was a great combination since I love calamari and my husband doesn't. The dipping sauce for the calamari was the best. I had the mixed grill for dinner and my husband had the scallop and crab risotto (a special that night). The risotto was creamy, cheesy and full of crab. The scallops were seared and buttery. The mixed grill fish and shrimp were grilled perfectly and the mashed potatoes and green beans were flavorful. We requested a seat by the window when we made our reservation and had a wonderful view of the sunset. The only disappointment, if you can call it one, was that we left way too full!
author: Ciara D.

description: Great fresh seafood. Great view and outstanding service. Prices were prey high, but in line with tourist spots in fisherman's wharf. Recommended.
author: Turkey B.

description: Outstanding views of the harbor with the best clam chowder on the pier! We got it with crab and it was easily the highlight of our meal.
author: Kathy C.

description: Omggggg this place was soooo good. I tried oysters for the first time ever and it was SOOOOOOOOOO bomb like I can't explain to you the amount of love I have for the oysters in the world. Also...I am such a big clam chowder critic and might I add that this was 10/10! Great service. Loved Andy (I think that was his name) our waiter was impeccable and gave us great suggestions on what to eat. Also we ordered the Fog Harbor Lager and it was so good. Very repetitive yelp review because I'm drunk from that beer LMAO love this place
author: Tanya M.

description:
After a not so awesome server/restaurant experience earlier in the day, our decision to come to Fog Harbor was a great one! Being that this is a tourist hotspot, we weren't expecting too much. To our very delighted surprise though the food and drinks were amazing and our server CURTIS was absolutely phenomenal! He asked if we had been here before and offered his recommendations and was very attentive, which is uncommon in busy places! 
We truly enjoyed our visit here and we definitely appreciated the great energy from CURTIS, keep up the great work!
author: Plain J.

description:
Service was great, the food was delicious and the ambiance was really nice.

We came here to celebrate a girlfriend's birthday, but I can see that this restaurant would be a great date-night place, as it has a romantic feel and the beautiful views are a plus!

I had a cup of their clam chowder which was very good.  We all shared the calamari appetizer which was crunchy and delicious.  But, my absolute favorite was my California Crab & Avocado Caesar salad (bacon, avocado, queso fresco, tortilla strips, cilantro leaves, chopped romaine, topped with crab meat).  I asked for extra crab meat and they were very generous with it.  I did find a couple of shells which was a bit of a turn-off.

Their Award Winning Perfect Hibiscus Margarita was the perfect drink to accompany my meal, and it was pretty strong too.

I look forward to coming back soon!
author: Veronica A.

description: Service (Adam) was great.  Views and food were very good.  Nice beer/bar selection to keep you refreshed.  A bit pricy but not bad for the area.  Clam chowder w/bread bowl was amazing...sourdough all the way!
author: Adam J.

description: I got off to a bad start with Fog Harbor Fish House. It seriously bothers me when a place charges a lot for a drink and then serves you a glass full of ice and just a little of the drink you actually thought you were ordering. I ordered a barrel aged Manhattan ($14). It came in a small glass to begin with, but then it had a very big cube of ice in it. We took the cube out and found there was very little actual Manhattan left in the glass. I paid $14 for that? That said though, the linguini & clams I ordered was one of the best I've ever had and the portion was decent.  I feel safe in recommending Fog Harbor for the food, but you may want to do your drinking somewhere else.
author: Michael V.

description: One of my favorite places to eat at whenever I'm in the City! Always great food, my personal favorite is the Crab Roll. I doubt you'll leave disappointed.
author: Jonah J.

description: It's a tourist trap! I ate there with my boyfriend on Valentine's Day, it's a beautiful restaurant with a beautiful view. For a restaurant that expensive I would expect to get the best quality seafood. The food tasted good but it was sooo greasy. About an hour after I had eaten I felt super nauseous and had to throw it all up. I eat seafood all the time so I was very disappointed.
author: Hailee H.

description: Great Restaurant, high quality food. Excellent customer service. Great location on fisherman's Wolf. Thanks
author: Dream B.

description:
I ordered the two most popular items on the menu- crab roll and cioppino. 
While I was slightly disappointed by the lukewarm temperature of the soup, the crab roll was quite delectable. Portion size is huuuuge here, so make sure you come with someone whom you can share the food with.
author: I L.

description: Wonderful attentive service!  Seafood tower was delicious, oysters were briney and delicious, not too creamy for our taste.  FANTASTIC dirty martini (see photo below), ice crystals and all!
author: Amy F.

description: My wife took me here for my Birthday, We had the baked oysters and the Beet and goat cheese salad as an appetizer. For our main course we had the Filet mignon
author: Victor A.

description: Darn good crab roll and chowder in a bread bowl. You'll feel like you're in a touristy cruise ship, but the food is pretty legit. And the service was great (our waiter's name was Daniel, I think. Good man!)
author: Alice W.

description: We walked in as a party of 4 and was seated right away. We got an awesome view of the bay. Food was on point! We order a full order of mussels, fried calamari, ceasars salad to share & a bowl of clam chowder as appetizer. BOMB! I got the jambalaya and let me tell you... ORDER this!!! It had a bunch of chicken, pork and clams!!! The flavor was so flavorful and succulent. I would also recommend the salmon! On point!
author: Jenny S.

description:
From the outdoor lounge area, the bar, and the dining area, Fog Harbor Fish House is fancy, and packed with out-of-town Fisherman's Wharf visitors. They have the best view of the bay with its bigger than life bay windows! The staff was very professional in appearance and provided excellent service. I ordered some fried calamari for my appetizer. It was so delicious particularly dipped in the sauce that was provided. For the main course, I ordered the Ahi Tuna, seared with a sesame seed crust, ginger soy glaze, wasabi aioli and stir fried vegetables. I had a side of rice to go along with that. 

This place is a tad pricey, but for the price you pay at almost any San Francisco restaurant, I guess it's considered pretty standard. I definitely recommend this restaurant if you are in the San Francisco area!
author: Steve N.

description: Everything is so fresh and good here. The crab roll was awesome. Great views of the bay.
author: Beverly P.

description:
Note: My low review only applies if you're a vegetarian considering this place, or if you have a vegetarian in your party.

I came here for a large business dinner, so I was kind of stuck with whatever they had here. I get it - it's a fish house, it's not meant to cater to vegetarians, but they could at least try to have 1-2 on menu options. Instead, they only have 1 off menu pasta dish and a couple of appetizers. They can also make the salad without meat.

That said, 2 stars for excellent, friendly, service. Our waitresses and staff were very nice and the location gives you a great view of Fisherman's Wharf. If you look back towards the city, you see the skyline and have an opportunity for some great photos.
author: Nishad J.

description: I didn't find this to be a "tourist trap". It's on point with uptown and everywhere else we have eaten on our vacation price wise. We had the calamari, halibut special and mixed grill. Would recommend highly to anyone who wants great seafood and a view of Alcatraz and the harbor.
author: Sharra S.

description:
I wasn't impressed with the food.... especially for
The price. Crab house next door was 10 better
author: Vanessa V.

description:
Nice place.  Fantastic view.  Friendly staff.

However...

I had the crab roll.  The bread was quite tasty, and I could tell that because the crab filling had absolutely ZERO taste to it.  You could've told me it was cold noodles and I would've believed you.

Other dishes I saw at neighboring tables at least looked fresh, but I don't know if I could trust my eyes here.
author: Brandon L.

description: Great place to eat. The view is great and on a wonderful sunny day the wait time it well worth it.
author: Giovinni A.

description: Great seafood with view to harbor. Had the combo fried seafood, garlic crab and shell platter, plenty for 4 member family to share and nicely done. Recommend to try this restaurant, good service also.
author: Tony P.

description: I was serviced at the bar since I was alone, service was pretty quick although the restaurant was crowded. The bar was pretty sticky so this may be something to improve... Prices are ok according to the touristic location, so it's great. Good beer and fish and chips was really good.
author: David B.

description: Just popped in for a quick bite and ordered half dozen of oyster, Caesar salad, and the cioppino. Justin H. Was our server and he was great!! He listened very well as i said we were going to share our plates but didn't ask to split the foods. (I know it's usually a hassle) but he did it for us anyway! It made sharing so much easier to do! The food is great also.. 4 stars because 5 star is rare to give. Lol outstanding service from this server and i am thoroughly impressed.
author: peter n.

description: Great food...not the greatest hostess...but once we got passed her compleyely enjoyable.  Great fish dinners.
author: Rita G.

description: One of our fav places to eat at in SF. Fresh food, great views and great customer service.
author: Kim W.

description: Extremely disappointing meal. I had the mixed grill and everything on my plate was dry. Luckily my boyfriend got the cioppinio so I could use the juice for my fish. The other items on my plate, potatoes and asparagus, were not edible. I would have told the waitress but she was disinterested in us. Saw her twice during dinner.  Would not recommend this place. A meal a regret.
author: Michelle L.

description: I've tried several crab places in SF when visiting.  Located on crazy busy, crazy touristy Pier 39.  But it's right at the front, on the upper floor so you can mostly dodge the tourists quickly.  Great harbor views and if the sea lions are in the harbor you can watch them too.  Liked the large windows and the nice white table cloth covered tables.  The staff was efficient and friendly.  The best part of the decor is you are not "squished in" like at the crab house just a few doors over.  Their menu is obviously focused on seafood but they also have non seafood menu items like steak and sandwiches.  We went so I could get my crab fix because I absolutely love Dungeness crab. We got the clam chowder. It was good and satisfying.  The hot sourdough bread was yummy too.  My hubby and I shared the seafood feast for two.  Steamed and then with garlic and butter.  I would have liked more garlic and butter.  Used the sourdough at the end to sop up all the garlicky buttery goodness.  I would have preferred more clams and less mussels but it's a nice mix of crab, clams, mussels, shrimp and fingerling potatoes.  I wanted the whole crab, but at $45 for nothing but crab, I feel like what we got was a better value.  The whole crab price is kind of the going rate... sigh... I don't know why it's so expensive when it's local, but I guess demand drives the price.  All in all it was a good meal and a nice atmosphere.  I'll go again.  If you park in the pier 39 parking structure they will comp 1 hour.
author: Malia K.

description: Amazing view! Amazing food! Great customer service. Super clean and classy. Jumbo risotto & swordfish were the best we had at the table.
author: Brianna S.

description:
Came for dinner while visiting Fishermans Wharf. I wasn't impressed with the service here. Food was ok, but not as great as you would expect. 

We chose this place based on overall rating. When we first arrived, I asked to look at a menu before deciding to be seated. At front, they're friendly and really trying to get you in. As we decided to dine here, I requested a table by the window. They said they'd get as as close as possible. When we came in, they originally were going to seat us in a booth near the back. There were several tables by the window, so I asked again if we could sit there. The hostess from the front had to come and she said most tables were reserved and others were for larger parties. Ok, fair enough, so I ask for a table one row off. 

When we were finally seated, our server came. She spoke in a monotone, very quickly, and seemed very serious. No smile, no welcome, no how are you doing. She asked if we had dined there before and after we said no, there was no follow up. So there was basically no point in asking. She wasn't a bad server, but for a place that is located in a tourist location, I would think servers would be friendly and welcoming. 

The complimentary bread was average. It was nice to have to dip into the clam chowder, but on its own is average. To eat we ordered a bowl of clam chowder, Shellfish platter for 2, and the crab roll. The calm chowder was probably the best part of the meal. It didn't have a ton of potatoes, which was good, and overall I liked it. The crab roll was bland. It definitely needed flavoring added. The Shellfish platter for 2 wasn't as much as we had expected for the price. We decided to get dessert elsewhere. 

If customer service was better I would have rated higher. For food, I would definitely recommend the clam chowder.
author: Ros A.

description:
I really enjoy this place, the view is wonderful, right at the end of the pier, you can see Alcatraz from the table (ask for a window seat)

Bring your appetite and just take your time eating and enjoying the bread, atmosphere and food.

I always order a full crab, fresh and made to order... It's a must for every year when I visit the pier ...
author: Jen L.

description: First of all, this is definitely what you'd expect from a ginormous restaurant on the Pier with fantastic views in San Francisco.  The food is excellent, and the service we received was great.  The cocktails were pricey, but again, what you'd expect.  I was with a very large group and everyone thoroughly enjoyed their dishes.  The portions were bigger than I expected and the table fare was DELISH.  If you're in the area and looking for a break, check out the seals and then hop on up the stairs to Fog Harbor.
author: Leanne H.

description: Their menu is very various. This place is always crowded, but service is very nice and they serve very fresh food. Everything we had was very tasty.
author: Sierra S.

description: This place has it all--great service, fantastic food and a beautiful setting on the second floor of Pier 39.
author: Robin R.

description:
Went there with my girlfriend on Friday for dinner...We absolutely LOVE THIS PLACE!!!
The food and service are amazing. We had cioppino, half shell of oysters, and linguini with clams. And Yes! we love seafood..Everything came out very delicious! My fav. is cioppino (my server reccommended) the seafood is very fresh and the flavors are just right! Overall, I love everything about this place. Price is resonable for what you get...Also the service from our server was phenomenonal...his name is Arrif? (apologize on my spelling) he can read our mind, just provided everything that we needed!
author: Ryan Y.

description: Food is usually very good, even if it's a touristy place. Hostess seem pretty clueless however. Waiting 20 minutes when you have a reservation and plenty of table of the right size are opened is unacceptable.
author: Jerome C.

description: Came for the Great Food...Will come back for the AHHHH-MAZING SERVICE. Waiter: Sameer!
author: Kimberly L.

description: The food was amazing!!! The clam chowder topped with crab was to die for!! Request Samir as your waiter!! He was the best waiter with fine recommendations!!! We were well taken care of!!  This place is an absolute MUST!!!
author: Raquel K.

description:
CRAB CAKES!!! Please get them here! Each bite was such a mouthful. The tangy mango pieces  and tomatoes with this yellow sauce to dip the warm lightly crunched crab cake was ah-mazing! As for service she was ok :/ the lady who helped us was blonde with short hair and glasses  she was friendly but she didn't give us any complementary bread or didn't even refill are water for 15min. But she was more then happy to keep stoping by the table next to us...
As her shift was ending a man named Mel? Was great! Super friendly and frequently checked on us. Overall my experience was great.
author: Karla A.

description: Super yummy!! A great atmosphere and staff that was helpful with recommendations and attentive to our needs. Had the red chili garlic shrimp (the sauce that this is in you can put on EVERYTHING!!), clam chowder and the garlic Dungeness crab. All were amazing!! You should make reservations as the place filled up pretty quickly right after they opened.
author: LuLu L.

description:
Sit down to great ambiance. Magnificent view of the water and a feeling that you could just reach out and touch Alcatraz from your seat. 
The food is fresh and decadent. You must try the award winning clam chowder with crab meat. We had not one but 2 bowls. Ordered entree's were the sea food mix and linguine with shrimp. The portions are just right.
Its been days already and we still think and talk about this food.

The wait time was approximately 30 mins for seating without prior reservation but it was so worth it
author: Racquel S.

description: Went here in February 2018 with my girlfriend for our 2 year anniversary. This place did not disappoint. For appetizers you must get the fried calamari it was crunchy and flavorful. The drink that I got was a moscow mule and it was perfectly made with just the right amount of ginger. The course I got was the dungeness crab seasoned. The meat is delicious and the presentation was amazing. I will come back again
author: MIchael D.

description: Great restaurant on the Fisherman's Wharf for new comers to San Francisco area
author: Donald P.

description: omg i had the best seafood meal in years here. every item we ordered was nothing short of awesome
author: Joseph C.

description:
My friend and I ended up waiting almost an extra hour for our table because the hostess messed up on our phone numbers so we never got our text to get seated!! Hostess's please PLEASEE double check with customer's phone numbers before sending them away. I know this place gets packed but having customers wait even more time when they shouldn't is just flat out annoying and upsetting. I saw so many people who came up after me already get seated that I just couldn't take it anymore. I can't believe I had to wait an extra hour for this place.

The waiters took forever to take our orders too. Right when we got seated we said we could order but they told us to give them a second. They came and asked what drinks we wanted and told us to wait again for us to order our food. 

My friend and I ended up sharing the seafood pasta and clam chowder. The pasta was super flavorful and definitely hit the spot in the cold SF weather, but sadly the clam chowder didn't really make the cut. The chowder tasted somewhat sour and the flavors weren't there for me. It was pretty bland and too liquidy to be considered clam chowder. Splash Cafe is still my fav place for clam chowder. If anyone happens to visit the SLO area, definitely check it out!
author: Connie Y.

description:
Ambience : Romantic and scenic. We went around 7:00pm in summer and caught the Alcatraz islands view in the sun, during sunset and after sunset. It was breathtaking. You can just stare at the bay forever. Hubby tried Merlot 2012 and it was good.
The complimentary sourdough bread provided was perfect - just the right taste.  Award winning Clam chowder in bread bowl was rich and clamy :)
We ordered the Dungeness Crab cakes - they just melt in your mouth - exquisite flavors. Must recommended. Lobster tail - Presentation of this dish was very creative and it tasted soft and succulent. Fish and chips was not so great. Desserts was Vanilla Bean Creme Brûlée. Its freaking awesome...must try.
author: Sudesna M.

description: My experience at Fog Harbor was nothing short of spectacular.  My server Jane was very friendly and attentive to my needs on a consistent basis.  This place had three things I love in a dining experience: a great view of the bay and sunset, very good food and excellent service.  I had sliders, the salmon, ginger lemonade, strawberry basil drink, and the Apple crumble for dessert.  I am definitely coming back and strongly recommend this place for anyone visiting San Francisco that loves seafood!
author: H.L. S.

description: Great place to enjoy a wonderful water front view on a beautiful summer morning ,afternoon or even dinner. They have a out door balcony were you can sit and enjoy the view or if its cold out you can be seated in side . The  Waiters and waitresses are fun friendly
author: Rebecca K.

description: Food was good, but very expensive for what you get. Then again, it is a prime location. I had the calamari and the jumbo shrimp cocktail. The waitress at the next table and the manager were super nice; I added a star for their great service.
author: Lon G.

description: We are visiting San Fran from the Midwest and all I wanted was some amazing crab. I got that, plus, so much more! Justin H was a friendly, fun and accommodating waiter. The calamari was crispy and hot, the full Dungeness crab was absolutely delicious and meaty (I'm gonna smell like garlic for days), and the dessert was a cherry on top of the meal. Ask for some extra biscoff cookies....the owner of the restaurant owns them!
author: Erin B.

description: D-I-S-S-A-P-O-I-N-T-E-D A plus for ambience. C- for food and D for service. The food was just lacking, nothing special. The service was obnoxious, arrogant and unprofessional. Won't be back.
author: Kassy A.

description: Well the atmosphere was very pleasant ,but our waiter was very rude about a question of ratatouille. The food wasn't anything special to me and normally I love salmon. The experience was average but the strawberry lemonade was fabulous.
author: Kayley A.

description:
Cioppino*

Crab meat, fresh fish, shrimp, scallops, clams and mussels stewed in a tomato herb broth
Was just what i needed .enjoyed the sauce with the fish and crab .great little buzz with the IPA lol and loved the view .ive been to cheaper places with better customer service just saying but the food was great!
author: Saia F.

description:
Our must-stop was Fog Harbor. We had oyster and stews and the ocean breeze on our minds. Luckily we arrived before the lunch rush, and got a seat outside to enjoy the wonderful 65 weather (in December!). 

We feasted on fresh oysters, grilled oysters, the clam chowder, and a plate of pickles...We were in heaven. 

My mom kept saying the entire time "I'm taking your father here!"
author: Serena H.

description: We are visiting San Francisco with friends a couple of days. Decided to WALK around the city. we hear about best clam chowder in SF and our hotel manager told us to go the FOG Harbor Fish House. its the testiest seafood restaurant ever. Delicious and soft and creamy soup. I wish I can live at SF. and go there everyday
author: Areq M.

description: My wife and I came here for lunch after spending much of the morning along Fisherman's Wharf and Pier 39. The clam chowder soup in a bread bowl was decent but a little bit on the salty side. The lady who seated us was very pleasant while the wait staff was slightly above average. On a good note, the views from this restaurant are great. Make sure to get a seat by the windows. This place was good but not spectacular.
author: Harnoor T.

description:
All I can say is, Wow!! The food here is mind-blowing! There are many great spots for clam chowder in San Francisco, but I've never had it topped with Dungeness Crab!! What a great way to start our meal! (Check out my pic)

Also mind blowing was the seared Ahi Tuna. It's perfectly seared "rare" and topped with a delicious ginger soy glaze, accompanied perfectly with a garlic jasmine rice. My mouth could barely contain this flavor flurry.

My boyfriend ordered the Mixed Grill: grilled salmon, swordfish, and shrimp served with a citrus beurre blanc over garlic mashed potatoes. Had I not eaten so much delicious sourdough bread prior to our food arrival, I would have eaten more of his food too! 

Did I mention there's also a beautiful view of the wharf?? It was the perfect birthday dinner! Definitely coming back next time we're in town!!
author: Liz G.

description: Our waiter Justin was so cool and nice! Very attentive and helpful and nice. Delicious food, gorgeous view. Will definitely come back a million times.
author: Liz S.

description:
My sister recommended this place.  An ocean view table and a friendly wait person who was happy, friendly and fun.  Started out right.  She took our order and had our drinks at the table in short order.  She made recommendations but I took my sister's advice and had a nice plate of mixed seafood.  It was all good.  Shared with my friends who shared their seafood dishes with me.  We all liked the place and the food.  Sure it was overpriced but it was ON the waterfront, with a view table in a crowded restaurant.  Only thing we asked for was a couple slices of lemon.  Other than that, our waitress was attentive and was quite personable.  We had a good time.  I recommend this restaurant but again, read all the reviews.  
Thank you.
author: R H.

description: The clam chowder was great! The rest of the food we had was just okay. Service here is amazing. I got to thank Kiaman for making the night enjoyable for me and my girlfriend on New Year's Eve.
author: Jay T.

description: The food was fresh and delicious! Request to sit by the window! The calamari had fried jalapeños and onions. The crab roll was gooddddddd! Look at my pictures!!!!!!
author: Bruce F.

description:
Came here for dinner to celebrate NYE. We got a hold of the restaurant to ensure that they were open. Luckily, they were open until midnight. We were told that they weren't accepting any reservations and they were expecting a large amount of diners. We arrived at a perfect time because the wait was only 20 minutes. Yaaaaaaasssssss!!!!!!!!!! 

The fireplace outside the waiting room helped a lot especially for this cold weather. Burrrrrrr!!! Finally, we were directed to our table and oh man we got the indoor patio with a panoramic bay view. A perfect dinner with a great view to end the year was fantastic. Of course, can't forget the fresh shucked oysters. Yum!
author: Candice T.

description: I liked this place.  The shellfish platter was pretty good, but overloaded in Garlic butter.  The soup was OK, but doesn't compare to New England style.  What really made this meal great was the server Jess W.  She was awesome and one of the reason i would come back here.  I tip my hat to her.  Thank you
author: Ryan O.

description:
One star for ambiance, one star for location.   Service was good but not great.   Food was mediocre.  More than a couple dishes were dirty.
Drinks:  cognac neat, seemed like way less than a shot, more like .75 of an ounce
Starters: shrimp
Cocktail, 2/5
Crab cocktail 4/5
Dinner: 2 lobster tails (x2) 1/5.  The lobster was either old and soggy or undercooked.   Absolutely unacceptable.
Mixed grill- 3/5- this meal was average.  If the mashed potatoes were executed better I'd have been ok with the meal.
Dungenous crab ravioli 4/5- this was the best thing we ordered
Burger- 3/5- execution on special requests weren't met (bacon on side not in burger, mayo requested not served) kind of dry but decent quality meat.
Dessert:   Blondie- highlight of the night, very rich.
author: P M.

description: Had fried combo, piece of fish not covered on one side with batter, fries cold and no salt, coleslaw no flavor, calamari was great and red sauce very tasty. The tarter sauce very disappointing. Great waiter and food did come fast ... would have waited a bit for quality.
author: Jette Erick U.

description:
For a tourist trap location this place is actually good. I loved coming to the pier here as a kid and still enjoy it for what it is 30 years later. Lots of restaurants but this is probably the best.

The food is reasonable considering you are going to be paying up wherever you go and believe it or not the food is good. Don't mistake that for. Ring actually reasonable as it is still pricey but you should expect that. 

Great views, solid fish and chips as well as better fare along with good service. I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here since there are so many great spots in the city but if you are doing the touristy stuff in the area I'd highly recommend this for food and drinks.
author: Stephen B.

description: Very awesome staff.. great drinks and food.. restaurant has a beautiful view of the bay...
author: Sandra L.

description: Fantastic food great views of the Bay. Food was exceptionally good for tourist location. We were bit skeptical since it's located on Pier 39 but were surprised to find the quality of food exceptionally good. Service was top notch as well, very professional and polite people. The wait was about 45 minutes but it was definitely worth it.
author: Azher A.

description: I am already way passed impressed. What a fabulous restaurant. Service is perfect. Food is perfect. What more can I say except I'm moving next store to this restaurant.
author: John G.

description:
Touristy location, but awesome food!

Fog Harbor Fish House is located in one of the most touristy locations in San Francisco. In most cases that would be a warning sign, but they break the norm. The quality of the food and the service is very good, and their prices are very reasonable! Imagine that!

Although I live only a few blocks away, this was my first time eating here and I was very disappointed ....... in me for not having come here sooner! We tried the Mussel Fries and Crispy Lemon Calamari for appetizers; both done really well, especially the mussels.  then had the Grilled salmon for main course. It was served on a bed of roasted corn, arugula,
red peppers, fingerling potatoes and tarragon with a citrus butter. Excellent! 

The desserts looked very inviting, but it was late and we were all full, so that we left for another day!
author: Afshin A.

description: This place is ridiculously overpriced for average (at best) food. I ordered a burger which was really bland and my boyfriend got the Cioppino which was just okay. I would not pay that price for what we got. Granted I shouldn't have ordered a burger from a seafood restaurant, but I wasn't that hungry so didn't want to spend that much money on a dish I wouldn't finish. But the burger was below average. The view is nice, but I'm sure there are much better restaurants around there with better food and prices.
author: Joyce H.

description: Amazing big portion fresh seafood cioppino!!!  The seafood is giant uc and fresh ,not to mention the amazing bridge view . Best date spot ever , great go families too !! I can not wait to go back again
author: Phoebe W.

description:
Great place for awesome sights and food. I had to be super touristy and get the clam chowder in a sour dough bowl bread and it does not disappoint! I wasn't too hungry but I still ate all of the heavy soup. I was so full after I didn't get to try the desserts which looked delicious. 
You can see the water and Alcatraz from the restaurant. Ambiance is lively and staff is helpful and accommodating. 
Overall great place to visit!
author: Ratika G.

description: My fiancé took me here for my bday and the food was delicious. The wait is long, but worth it. I had the garlic crab and it was to die for.
author: karina p.

description:
Great food, drinks, menu, and service (shout out to Curtis)! 
We ordered the calamari and the seafood platter for 2. 

The calamari comes with fried jalapeños which were a welcome addition. The dipping sauce is a must try.

The seafood plater for 2 was more than enough for two people. It is a great dish if you are looking to try a little bit of everything! Highly recommend adding the lobster tail to it. 

The hostess and our server Curtis were super friendly and made sure our experience was a positive one. 
We would definitely come here again!
author: Bridget R.

description: The clam chowder here is absolutely delicious and service was attentive. We also got the crab cake and the garlic roasted dungeness crab. Both were pretty good but the clam chowder was definitely the star of the meal. This place would've gotten a four star if it wasn't for the price. I understand that it is by the pier and things are usually overpriced but I'm not sure if it's worth coming back again. They also have a great view but it was raining the day we came so it wasn't something I'm too impressed with.
author: Anita T.

description: Service was great. Food was fantastic. Wine selection is on point. The salmon, Cioppino, and oysters were top notch. It's very clear they take pride in their food.
author: Liz W.

description: We went here during lunch and it does get crowded which was around 12pm I believe and on a weekend.  The wait for 2 people was not too bad as it was around 25 minutes.  There is a pokestop there was well with lots of lures :)  We ordered the crab caesar salad and cioppino.  The salad was very good even though it is $28 dollars you do get a lot of seafood and what you pay for as it did fill me up.  The cioppino was around $30 dollar as well.  You get a lot of seafood as well.  Prices yes you are going to pay up for a tourist spot, but the food was good and also the $3.45 health insurance fee as well.  The service was good and considering how crowded it was we got our food in a decent time.
author: Keven W.

description: I haven't eaten at a Pier 39 restaurant in years but my parents were in town and wanted a restaurant in that area, and this seemed like a good bet. That bet paid off. After not having to wait at all for a table, we discovered great seafood, attentive servers, good drinks, and gorgeous bridge and bay views.
author: Brandon R.

description:
We were absolutely impressed with everything here!  The Lombard Lemonade was a great kick off, we started with the blue cheese crusted garlic bread - it was AMAZING.... paired with the crispy calimari and jalapeño dip, giant juicy shrimp cocktail, and ultra freshly baked sourdough bread loaf and butter... barely had room for the pesto swordfish and Dungeness crab ravioli. Of course, we managed to put that away too, just before the dessert tray was brought before us. We chose the crispy apple strudel topped with creamy vanilla gelato.... and walked away complete gluttons.  
So GLAD we stopped in!!
author: Christi M.

description: This place is on the second floor in Pier 39. Pretty big. The video only showed a corner of the restaurant. You can see the bay, also the hassle and bustle downstairs at the pier:) The crab is very fresh. If you want to avoid waiting in line, try sit at the bar:) Love it here. Oh, the Lipstick Lemondrop cocktail is good too!
author: Pengzhu L.

description: This place was AMAZING. You can really tell they use the freshest of the fresh seafood. There is pretty much a view at every seating. The windows are huge and open and it makes the restaurant very bright and nice. The service was also great and very friendly. I ordered the clam chowder and that honestly the best clam chowder I've had. The clam taste was very strong and the soup was nice and thick and not just any clam chowder. I also ordered the crab risotto. Probably my favorite dish!! Risotto is one of my favorite dishes to try and this place was AMAZING. We also ordered another seafood dish, there was lobster, shrimp, clams, mussel and probably other stuff. Like I said, FRESHESTT OF THE FRESH. The reason why I put 4 stars instead of 5 is because the service could've been more attentive, that way I wouldn't have to wave down the server for little things like a refill on my drink. Other than that, I would definitely come back for the food and the view.
author: Anna D.

description:
Tony the bartender is awesome!

Great advise and great food!

I was a little skeptical, being the place is located in a tourist area but Tony was the most fantastic host you could ask for!!!

Nelson the bartender that came after Tony is also awesome!

I would come back!!!

Yum!!!!!!
author: krista t.

description: This place may be a bit touristy, but the food was great. We had the surf and turf and the steak was cooked perfectly and the lobster was just the right size. Not only was the food great, our server Jessica was Amazing. She made my girlfriend's birthday dinner perfect. 5 out of 5 stars and 2 thumbs ups. Would recommend again :)
author: A-ron E.

description:
The crab cake is hard, burnt and fried. You can get better frozen from Costco.  I order crab cakes all over the US whenever I travel. Especially on the coasts. I was last at the Fog Harbor Fish House 2 years ago visiting SF. Had the one of the BEST broiled lump crab cakes ever and knew that I would be back to the Fog Harbor when next I was in SF. NOW their crab cake is a dried out hockey puck that is over cooked.  The waiter was slow and inattentive and still managed to make us feel rushed! Terribly disappointing.

What was once an elegant upscale restaurant, is now little more than a glorified Red Lobster set on the Bay with a beautiful view. You can see the view for free without wasting your money at this restaurant.
author: Carla L.

description:
Pier 39 is a very touristy place so that being said crowds we're expected. Food was good. Service was good. Views were Great. 
A solid choice.
author: Joseph E.

description: Delicious food and incredible views. Garlic crab was to die for, highly recommend this restaurant!
author: Tia M.

description: The bread (baked fresh every 56ish minutes) was the best thing we ate! The Blue Cheese Wedge Salad was also delicious- great flavor in the blue cheese. The Salmon dish lacked flavor, but the fish was cooked right. The appetizer special, crab ceviche, lacked flavor.
author: Jessica N.

description: Tbh I love the food they served at the restaurant, it was absolutely fantastic. It was just the waiter we had named Shakura. She was very impolite toward our entire group trying to charge us for items we didn't order. Also when we tried to correct the check she would give us an attitude and she would put the blame on us. I really dislike the way she treated the situation trying to blame the customers for their mistake. Overall the food was fantastic but the waiter was super rude. She also tried asking us for a bigger tip even thought we already gave a tip she wanted more.
author: Steven T.

description:
You'd think places by the pier are overpriced for mediocre food, but this place is worth it. the food was superb and the service was excellent. Tyler our server suggested some really good dishes - the mussel fries were to die for. Tyler did not judge me for wanting to take the very last bit of to go, so I did. 

Mussel fries!!!
author: MayMay C.

description: Yelp categorized this place as dog-friendly coz of their outdoor seating. Hardly the case, after we brought our dog here for dinner. Although there is outdoor patio area, you CANNOT eat here with your dog. Look elsewhere.
author: Carloalexi M.

description: We went to Pier 39 for our last night in the Bay Area to do some touristy stuff. We were told there was a 20-25 minute wait but we were seated much sooner. We had the New England clam chowder in the bread bowl and the seafood platter for two. The clam chowder and sourdough bread were excellent. The place is rather large so we did not have great views of the water from the back. The food is a bit overpriced but probably in line with most restaurants in tourist areas.
author: Micah-Cheska T.

description:
Delicious food & lovely view. 

Exceeded my expectations. For the location I was expecting very touristy & ok on food. Boy was I wrong!!  Everything was so yummy & service was great. I highly recommend if you're looking for a nice lunch without having to feel fancy.
author: Sarah S.

description:
This place is great!!!!! We sat at the bar for drinks n lunch.
Our bartender "Mark" was Awsome! 
Super friendly n very attentive. 
Food was great! We had the red chili n garlic crab n crab roll. Both great dishes. 
Overall food, drinks n customer service exceptional.
author: Maria M.

description: Great and fresh seafood. Definitely going again when it town. Do expect a wait tho. Smack middle in middle of a tourist hot spot
author: Denis H.

description: Really good food and the service was top notch. Plan on spending some serious cash if you want the platter. I personally loved it and would order it again.
author: Kirk H.

description: This place is everything I want in a restaurant (great view, amazing food, nice customer service, and best appetizer bread)
author: Omar E.

description: Delicious food. Fantastic views. It was higher end than I was led to believe by the number of dollar signs given to this restaurant. I felt under- dressed and ordered something based on what was cheapest and not what I really wanted which was like $27. So beware. This is a high end restaurant. Be prepared to drop some cash. $$$
author: Tabitha B.

description: Phenomenal clam chowder! Lots of clam in it! Delicious steamed clams! Highly recommend!
author: Carolyn B.

description: Fried calamari was pretty good but too salty. Another review mentioned the fish and chips being underseasoned- they were right. The fish is bland. Lobster mac and cheese was pretty good but kind of grainy, almost like it wasn't cooked out enough. Clam chowder was very good. All in all, a little disappointed in what we got for how much we paid but considering that it's located in a tourist hot spot, can't be too mad.
author: Dinah V.

description:
Best restaurant on pier 39.  Pricey? Maybe but chowder is to die for & great views. My go to place on 39


Update 3/24/18.  Lunch today was absolutely fabulous.  Seated at the bar, clam chowder, shrimp cocktail and glass of Chardonnay.  As always, my go to place when near pier 39
author: C K.

description: The place was PACKED, NOISY, with adjoining tables/chairs back to back with ours with minimal isle space on a Sunday, cold February evening. However, our waiter more than made up for any discomfort. He went out of his way to make sure we were able to order exactly what we wanted. One friend savored the bowl of clam chowder but when ordering the seafood platter, it was not steamed, but a dull deep fried batter, so everything tasted the same. Dull presentation as well. Two of us had New York steaks, cooked medium, with a whiskey peppercorn sauce - EXCELLENT. We went elsewhere for dessert.
author: Carolyn D.

description: Amazing view, amazing drinks and amazing food. What more could you want?? It's located in Pier 39, so there's also a ton to do! This would make a great day trip!
author: Whitney R.

description: This extremely busy restaurant is found upstairs on pier 39. It looks like there's always a wait for a table. We asked about the bar; if seats are available grab them. We were lucky and sat at the bar.  Yes, you may order from the whole menu at the bar.  My husband & I split a house salad and the Mixed Grill plate. We are not big eaters plus the fact we weren't that hungry.  We loved how fresh the fish was and the flavor of our entire meal.  A bread basket was served prior to our meal. The waitress was friendly, helpful and attentive all the while very busy.
author: Tammy B.

description:
This is so fancy. I mean you got the water front view. The lovely couches and fountain in the front. The bar is just another thing you got in here. Watching the sunset with the Golden Gate Bridge in the background while eating your seafood dinner is so beautiful! 

I wasn't feeling the food too much though. The calamari was good and I liked my linguini and clams but my dishes were a bit salty. My server wasn't quite knowledgable in the menu at all. I asked him what the popular dishes were and he didn't really have much to say. Same goes for the wine. It was pretty disappointing. And he never brought us bread. But he remembers to add the extra fee into the bill though -_- 

I'm not sure if I'll come back here though. There's a lot more restaurant nearby that I'll give a try before coming back here. It didn't really wow me except for the view.
author: Quyen H.

description:
Probably the best seafood stop in the touristy pier 39 area. We had a friend visiting so we came by around 5 pm on a Sunday night. Luckily it wasn't too packed yet so we walked in pretty easily. 

We ordered the seafood mix with garlic crab, mussels, and shrimp, the seafood trio, and scallops. We also got fried calamari for appetizer. Everything except the salmon in the seafood trio was extremely well cooked. Unfortunately Salmon was a bit dry.

Free bread was great and our waitress was very attentive. We sat at the booth on the left closest to the restaurant entrance. I hope to come back if I venture into the area again!
author: Sophia H.

description:
We had to whole crab and halibut with calamari and drinks
  Was fabulous.  Can be a casual or dressy attire...no flip flops and board shorts though.  Research actions aren't a must but suggested.  Kids welcomed
author: Sloan H.

description:
Very nice experience and great food. We had a very attentive and personable server Samir. 
We had clam chowder topped with crab, seafood tower, mussels fries, and ahi poke. Not one complaint about any of it.
Highly recommend place at pier 39
author: Ruben A.

description:
Fog Harbor is definitely the place to be if you're looking for a little classier experience on Pier 31. The decor and atmosphere is lovely, the menu is a little fancier than the standard fare. 

If you come on a weekend, be prepared for a wait - but overall not too bad because they have a lovely patio out front with a fireplace and chairs. They'll also text you so you can wander a bit prior to your meal. 

We had the fish and chips, calamari appetizer, and a clam chowder bread bowl plus crab on top - all delicious. Service was friendly and fast and the view is lovely.
author: Kim B.

description: We came for a late lunch, and I'm glad we chose this place. Justin is the best waiter! He is so considerate, introducing himself to us when the waitress punched out, and he asked if we needed anything else to make sure we are well taking care of. We tried the seafood platter, big plate and delicious. Cool place with great service, definitely worth coming back
author: Eva L.

description: I really enjoy to huge seafood dish. So tasty, juicy, and delicious.  The crab , mussels, shrimp , clams and the finger size potato , was so yummy. I definitely go back if I visit San Francisco again.  The fry calamari is so interesting with jalapeños.
author: Elizabeth T.

description: Loved the ambience and food. We had clam chowder, garlic roasted crab and seafood pasta. There's bread in every dish but all delicious. Price was fair. Great view if you get to sit by the window. So don't forget to make a reservation beforehand. No dress code but I feel like wearing something cute would match the food^
author: Claire L.

description: Justin did a fantastic taking care of us. Food was fantastic. Service was just as good.
author: Dustin K.

description: Good place with nice view. I was a little unsure about the place before we went, since it's located in one of the busy tourist area. But the food was delicious and service was good as well! The hostess were not as friendly, but overall we had a good time there.
author: Chao C.

description:
Flawless service and Delicious Food ,5 stars hands down thanks to our server Rafael .

Upon arrival was greeted by the hostess with a warm smile and welcome,we waited 20 mins by the fireplace,truly romantic.If I could rate more than 5 stars due to our server I would,Rafael made this an great experience as we were celebrating my wife's birthday he was personable but very professional ,all his recommendations were spot on and felt genuine,we had the shellfish platter and halibut ,very tasty and would highly recommend.Thanks fog harbor we will definitely be back when we visit the area.
author: Edward M.

description:
This review is for their bar and the mussel fries. With my weekend guest dying of thirst from exploring the tourist trap that is Fisherman's Wharf, we ended up going here to grab drinks. Of all things at the bar, we ended up with two non-alcoholic drinks. However, they were probably two of the best non-alcoholic drinks I've had. The strawberry nojito (clever right?!) is legitimate.  The bartender even made us a complimentary ginger lemonade. 

What I really want to talk about are the mussel fries. I normally like mussels but these made me fall in love all over again. The mussels were plump and fresh, which is expected because the restaurant is literally sitting on top of water. But geez they were delicious floating in the rich white sauce with cream and onions. I took sourdough and soaked all that flavor up before the wait staff decided there wasn't any left and took my dish away. Get this!
author: Quoc N.

description: Very good services. Quality food. Nice location. Great feeling seating here with view.
author: Catherine G.

description:
I was a little disappointed.

The view was great, but since the sun was setting, the sun-blocking shades were pulled. They still let in a lot of light. The windows were open and the breezes were wonderful.

The waiter was very helpful and attentive. I ordered the clam chowder and the cioppino. I was asked if I wanted extra crab added and I said yes. I was surprised when the clam chowder came with a huge serving of crab meat right in the middle. I was expecting the crab in the cioppino. The crab was a nice addition to the soup, but it was crab, which distracted from the taste of the CLAM chowder and it was not warm, which made the soup not so hot. I thought that was odd.

The cioppino was good, but not great. It was heavy on celery, which is not my favorite. It was a bit underwhelming.
author: Scott N.

description: Food and service were good and the view was nice. Very busy but we didn't wait long for our meal. Oysters were tasty but pricey.
author: Paige R.

description:
OK, I have to be totally up-front. Full Discosure: Our neighbor is part of the management team here.  Still I feel I have to write about this amazing place on Pier 39.

Fog Harbor has just spectacular bay views. But what's really spectacular is what goes on in the ktichen.  First, they let you know what's fresh - for example if crabs aren't in season you'll know beforehand they were frozen, although that doesn't seem to impact how darn good they are anyway.

Second, even though it's on Pier 39, don't think about this as a tourist place, even though I'm sure there are plenty of tourists. Instead, think sustainably harvested fish, appetite-inducing appetizers, a menu with so many options you can have analyis paralysis, and a staff that from top to bottom works to ensure you have a great experience, not just a great meal.

So yes, I do know the management team... but if you're near the wharf and you like seafood I can't imagine a better place for dinner.

'Nuff said.
author: Mike K.

description: We stopped in for happy hour on a busy afternoon and were lucky to score a bar seat. I ordered the Lombard lemonade and clam chowder. Both were delish. You get a good view of the bay but if you sit in a normal table you can get right up against the window.
author: Bridget G.

description:
I used to live in SF and so when we went to visit a few weekends ago I told my boyfriend to look up some seafood spots in the city.  He settled on a location at Pier 39?!?! My past life in SF told me "Seriously?? Pier 39?!" But to my surprise we gave my friend a call and she said that she thought the exact same thing but they have the best clam chowder ever.  She was right. 

We got there put our names in for a table about 30 min wait but they text you when the table is ready which is great since you can then wander around Pier 39.  But we ended up scoring a seat at the bar within about 5 mins so we just ate there.  Awesome staff, we ordered a few rounds of cocktails, a clam chowder bread bowl with crab, a clam chowder and caesar salad combo, calamari and some oysters.  

Tab price wasn't too bad and it was a gorgeous restaurant, good service, great food and gorgeous views! We will be back!!
author: Jennifer F.

description:
*This review is for the service and New York Steak only

I have come to Fog House Fish Harbor many, many times after my sweet husband brought me here for our first ever anniversary in 2013. The New York Steak is a high quality Creekstone (yes, it's halal) cut and is absolutely delicious! I personally LOVE it. It is a juicy, flavorful piece of meat and the sides (mashed potatoes and veggies) compliment it well. We also enjoy the boudin sourdough bread and delicious butter as a starter. Finally, this restaurant has and continues to have great service and ambience. I highly recommend it for special and every-day occasions.
author: Mariam R.

description: Great location with a view. The outdoor lounge are is a great place to enjoy a cocktail while waiting for a table with an cozy fireplace. The quality of the food and cleanliness cocktails was very good; however the crab and fish selections were very narrow. The prices are a bit expensive and also they add to the bill a 5% additional fee which they claimed San Francisco requires it, but no other restaurants charges the fee!
author: Yainet G.

description: Great service and fresh seafood not much more to say. Price is about what you would expect but mot bad.
author: Richard V.

description:
While visiting the San Francisco fisherman's warf, I had to get my fill of seafood.  I wanted to have some clam chowder and whatever other seafood was available. I visited this place with my family so we got to order quite a few things and shared everything.  We tried some clam chower bowls, seasonal lobster ravioli, seafood penne, their mixed grill, and fish and chips.  I thought that everything tasted really delicious and fantastic.  My brother who lives in San Francisco, said he's had better clam chowder so I guess it's preference.  

We visited on a friday night, so it was very busy and lively in the restaurant. Service wasn't bad, it would've been nice if the waitress had checked on us a few more time because we ran out of beverages and had to try to flag her down. I realize it was busy but it would've been nice to have her check on us a few more times.

Overall, I enjoyed my visit here. I'd visit again.
author: Karen C.

description:
I first experienced Fog Harbor when they were at the Yelp 10 Year Anniversary HQ Party. They had a limited sample selection, but I was impressed with what they had. After the samples, I decided I had to try out their restaurant at Pier 39. 

What did I discover after my visit to Fog Harbor?

I could come to Fog Harbor everyday for their fresh warm complimentary bread and a giant bowl of their clam chowder! Their clam chowder was the best I have had in the west coast. The crab cake entree was also a hit with my taste buds. The ingredients tasted fresh and the final product came out with a perfect texture. 

Service was excellent too. Our service staff took great care of us and tended to all of our needs. The only aspect of the meal I was dissatisfied with was the $4.50 lemonade. Half the glass was filled with ice, leaving little room for the actual lemon juice. I am usually not a fan of restaurants in heavy-populated tourist areas, but Fog Harbor has impressed me.
author: Philip M.

description: Came into San Fransisco for vacation and was looking for a good seafood place... HONESTLY it was better than good. We were seated right away and got a table with a great view of the bay.  Our server Curtis was absolutely, awesome, he  worked with all the demands of my family and made the best out of our dinning experience. Highly would recommend the lobster and the crab. Although you could not go wrong with anything on the menu! Defiantly will be coming back here when I'm in town !!
author: Tori C.

description:
Came here on a Saturday evening after a tiring day of walking around and doing some awesome sightseeing. The wait was about 20 min which seemed like forever since I was super hungry, but let me tell you the wait was totally worth it!
Even though I was alone, they sat me at a table for four right by the window! The view was amazing. The ocean, Alcatraz and the sunset with a light breeze? Yes, please! I ordered a glass of Moscato which was delicious and their salmon which was truly a work of art!
Loved this place! If not for the food, definitely check it out for a glass of wine paired with breathtaking views!
author: Iulia G.

description: This was a beautiful place the scenery was beautiful looking out over looking the San Francisco Bay .I had the Lobster my husband had the Fish and chips.a friend had Risotto with scallop and the clam chowder oh so good.wish there was one closer to Buffalo.
author: Laura G.

description: Sooooo good! First time here...everything was absolutely delicious. The seafood was fresh and our food came out very fast. Amazing view and our server Raphael was wonderful! Thank you and will be back again!
author: Ammie M.

description: DELICIOUS, and I'm not much for seafood. Faster service than a drive thru once we sat down. Raphael is the man.
author: Ell S.

description: The food was excellent, but the service was lacking. Our waiter seemed like he worked in a fancy restaurant before he came to Fog Harbor and just wanted to serve the food instead of being personable. Other than that, everything was great. View was perfect and the seafood chowder was great.
author: Becky C.

description: Their Mussels & Fries and Margarita is too good. Beautiful location and amazing services.
author: Ratheesh R.

description: Though the price is more than its value, it's still delicious. Seafood is really fresh, but steak is too dry and thick
author: 東偉

description: Tyler was great. My boyfriend and I shared a bowl of clam chowder, baked oysters and the mixed grill. Everything was soooo tasty. Tyler made sure we had ample amount of bread at the table at all times. It's hard to get my boyfriend and I full, but I left stuffed! The total (including my patron margarita) was about $76 (without tax) -- for awesome seafood and a great view, id say that's a win.
author: Jeca D.

description:
Great food with fantastic views.  2 of us were there on a Saturday evening at Prime Time, no reservation... only had to wait about 45 minutes.  We had ceviche as an appetizer and then delicious fish meals.  (I had halibut, friend had salmon)  The service was impeccable - very attentive and professional.  The food was so good!  I had one of the best dirty martinis of my life.  Can't wait to visit SF again so I can eat here!  
As a side note - Pier 39 is of course very crowded - we used Lyft and it was easy as pie.
author: Lisa A.

description: The place has got a wonderful ocean look.best place to enjoy seafood at a beutiful place.preparations take a bit extra time but satisfying.the quality of food they serve is good enough .service,ambeince,view serves a better experience.
author: Eva G.

description:
This is a great restaurant for people visiting the area! I've visited SAN Fran twice in the last 3 months and both times I went to this restaurant and wasn't disappointed. 

The views are incredible. Alcatraz is in the distance and the sun sets over the water. The food is also solid. They're known for their clam chowder and it definitely doesn't disappoint. The sourdough bread bowl is delicious. The soup is very dense so it might be a good idea to split it with someone 

The atomosphere in this busy restaurant is electric. Lots of tourists but it's still a great environment. 

Definitely check this place out!
author: Greg R.

description: I normally don't review anything, however, after attending a party couldn't help it but tell about my experience. Everything was perfect from beginning to end.From the moment we entered we were greeted with a warm welcome, great wine selection and drinks,the food was scrumptious and well seasoned all the fish was fresh, teamwork really stood out everyone was in sync to deliver great service. Raphael was on top of making us happy and had a very observant eye to fulfill our request,we will be back when in the area. Thanks again fog harbor! I will definitely recommend this place and come back again.
author: Eldana N.

description: Honestly, as a Bay Area native who has been to many of the tourist trap restaurants at Pier 39, I was not expecting great things from Fog Harbor, but it was my mother-in-law's birthday and this is where she wanted to go. I was pleasantly surprised!  The food was delicious and the service was great...the meal started with warm sourdough bread, then we ordered the mussel fries, calamari, steamed clams and jumbo shrimp cocktail appetizers. All were very good (I'm still unsure of the combination of mussels and fries but the mussels were awesome and the sauce with the fries were tasty). Then for dinner I had the crab roll which was good, 8/10. At our table we also ordered the soup and salad-Cesar salad and clam chowder in a sourdough bread bowl, the flat iron steak, and the shellfish platter. Everybody was satisfied when we left; a bit touristy and, because of that, a bit more pricey but overall a good meal and experience. Also, they do validate for the big parking garage across the street, I believe it saved us $10.
author: Matt K.

description:
When craving Seafood going to Pier 39 just makes sense. I've heard and read good things about the Fog Harbor Fish House and the oh so convenient entrance from the parking garage (located in between The Embarcadero and Powell St) made going to this restaurant so easy. There's a little pathway/bridge from the parking garage that takes you right up to the dock on which the Fog Harbor Fish House is located. No worries about the wait there might be to be seated. They created a super cosy waiting area with seats in front of a fireplace to keep you warm. 

The Fog Harbor Fish House is bigger than it appears to be from the dock. This is where you want to go with family and friends, or even a date (!) for an upper casual dinner. Upper casual because at night they create a nice ambience with the lighting, but wearing jeans and sneakers is definitely not a crime. 

Ambience: 
Great! A perfect 'I'm going out for dinner and I can dress up a little' vibe. You can be seated right next to the water which also adds something special to the overall ambience.

Food: 
Good selection of different types of dishes. Salmon, swordfish, calamari, shellfish, fried fish... name it and they have it.

Drinks: 
We all ordered cocktails but none of us really enjoyed them. The Moscow Mule was good. I'd suggest to stick wine.

The Fog Harbor Fish House is a place where you cannot go wrong. I feel anyone would enjoy to eat here while having a great night out.
author: Kirstin G.

description: We had the best dinner here! Our server Anya was awesome, the view was great, and the food was ah-mazing! Our table ordered the oysters, Dungeness crab, salmon, and pacific sole. All of it was perfect. Salads were good, bread delish. Can't say enough good things about it. We will definitely be back!!
author: DARIA O.

description: Excellent food paired with excellent service. Shout out to Curtis! Beware it's on the pricier side.
author: Alejandro D.

description:
Amazinggggg food, specially the grilled butter chili oysters.
Worth the waif of half n hr.
author: Divya K.

description:
Great Service, nice view, and fresh seafood, that sums up my experience.
Highly recommended!
author: Robert K.

description: this place is absolutely fantastic. they were incredibly accommodating to my wife and i, who had our 3 week old baby along with our stroller. Elliot, our server, was beyond nice. he was so helpful and friendly. one of the top 5 servers i've ever had. Elliot rocks! make sure you get the Clam Chowder (i ate 2 bowls!!)
author: Ethan S.

description: This place was amazing! The food was incredible and the service was excellent. I ended up getting the red chili garlic shrimp with pasta (very tasty, got some heat to it and tons of garlic which I loved!). They give you bread and butter before you eat your meal which was also good.
author: Magz K.

description:
Our whole experience was amazing until our waiter got off his shift and had to deal with a second waiter who gave unacceptable service. Wonderful food but delivered with arrogance and a smug attitude. When my girlfriend and I asked for water and the dessert menu our waiter stared at my gf and didn't say a word, and to me, "one second" and turned his back to help other customers who were apparently worthy of his attention. I myself am in customer service and expect no less than the best when it comes to delivering an excellent customer experience, bare minimum politeness and respect which I feel he lacked. 

With that being said, for new customers looking for good food..please order to go and avoid the service..
author: Danny P.

description: In a area where tourist traps are plentiful, a decent, albeit slightly overpriced seafood house is more that acceptable.  The place has nice views, peeking around the edge of the next wharf to see the north end of the Golden Gate and Alcatraz.  The food was decent, although nothing overly special, and the sourdough bread was good, but I think you get run out of town on a rail if you have a restaurant and can't make good sourdough in San Fran.
author: Matt H.

description:
For starters I love seafood but my husband can't have it due to allergies. He was accommodating and wanted me to get some good seafood while we were visiting the city so we researched and found this gem. 

Our server was kind, genuine and cared for my husband and his allergy to shellfish. 

We ordered the bleu cheese garlic bread, grilled seafood sampler and the beef sliders with fingerling potatoes. 

The food was superb. The general mgr came out and ensured us that my husbands food wouldn't get near any shellfish when it was being prepared. 

Overall this is a fantastic restaurant. Will definitely go back again when we're in town.
author: Cortney T.

description: By far one of the best places I've had dinner at in the city! The food is outstanding, the view is breathtaking and the service is on point! Definitely recommend the crab cocktail and cup of chowder as opposed to getting the add crab on top of the chowder.  The bread is addictive!!!! Portions are very good! Definitely a romantic place at sunset next to a window. We'll be coming back for sure!
author: Carly K.
