description: So nice, we went twice. We dined here for lunch. Then came back two days later for a late dinner. That chowder is excellent! Had mine in the sour dough bowel topped with crab!
author: Monica A.

description:
Service: Outstanding.  The server returned to our table numerous times to check on us.  A few of those times, I missed her because I was so engrossed in my delectable food.  I ordered the grilled sole 

Food: Was absolutely delicious!  We began our meal with warm bread (which I absolutely love) and the award-winning g clam chouder, served in a bread bowl.  The chouder was filled with clams and very tasty.  I can understand why it won awards.  My entree was the Pacific Sole.  It was pan seared and served with roasted fingerling potatoes, spinach, peppers, tarragon, and a caper butter buerre blanc.  I had to save room for dessert, which was a delicious Blondie with vanilla bean ice cream.  

Atmosphere: While the lighting was soft and romantic, the conversation volume was really loud.  Guess that's what happens when restaurants have good food, service and atmosphere....everyone wants to be there.  I recommend this place heartily.
author: Aleeta P.

description: Excellent service from our waitress. The food was very good and overall a great upscale dinner spot in the wharf. Nice sunset view. The fried scallop app and the fresh crab baked in garlic butter, happy times in SF
author: Jake G.

description:
I came here  for a date night. At first, we were scared that this could be a tourist trap since it is in the heart of Pier 39. We wanted to go somewhere with a nice view and good seafood so we chose this place.

We waited about 20 mins for our complimentary bread and butter to come out. The waiter told us that it was still baking in the oven. When it came out, it was freshly baked so i didn't complain.

The food was amazing! We ordered baked oysters for appetizers, a crab roll, and seafood penne. The 1/2 dozen oysters were baked with spinach, bacon and a creamy Parmesan sauce. It was so good! The crab roll was a pretty good portion and they didn't cheap out on the meat. The seafood penne was not too greasy and it was huge. All of the seafood tasted very fresh!

Something that bothered me was that there were desserts laying out in random places of the restaurants. It seemed unsanitary to me.

The service was not bad. It took a while for our food to come out on a Saturday evening but i'm not complaining since the food tasted good. The prices are decent for seafood, location, and the gorgeous view. There is no outside seating but you can request for a table next to the window with the beautiful ocean view. 

I'd come back!
author: Allie Y.

description:
Was able to snag a reservation here when visiting San Francisco in September of last year. It was a really wonderful meal! From the outside, the restaurant may appear a little touristy and cookie cutter, but I was pleasantly surprised. Our party had requested a table by the window and the view was AMAZING. Watched the sunset and all the seals in the water right off the Pier - would highly recommend for anyone celebrating. 

We started with wine, which was delicious and not horribly overpriced. The oysters were pretty good, the fish and chips were cooked perfectly and really tasty, and the whole Dungeness crab was delicious. Overall, great experience and would totally recommend.
author: Caitlin K.

description: Great atmosphere and food is well prepared.  On a Saturday evening, my wife and I waited less than 30 minutes to be seated.  Wait staff was not bad but not exceptional either. The food, however was great (NY steak and grilled chicken with the blue cheese garlic bread) washed it all down with a great Pinot Noir. Would come back and spend more money
author: Ricardo D.

description:
Our food was delicious! Highly recommend this place. Best clam chowder I've ever had. My husband liked the warm sourdough bread they serve with butter. We ordered drinks and they were delicious too. He ordered the cocktail of the day and I ordered the strawberry lemonade. His complaint was that the cocktail was light on the alcohol. 
I got the filet mignon served with blue cheese crumbles, mushroom Demi glaze sauce, garlic mashed potatoes, and sautéed spinach and pearl onions. I thought there was too much garlic in the potatoes and my steak was a touch too rare, but overall delicious. 
He ordered the seafood medley which was served in a tomato broth. Crab, shrimp, scallops, salmon, and garlic toast. He said it was great.  
We were too full for dessert! 
Service was good. 
Will definitely return!
author: Kristie L.

description:
This place will definitely live up to your expectations. Trust the yelp reviews! The restaurant is on pier 39, towards the front and up the stairs! It is a very big restaurant with a very nice view, towards the sea lions. I ordered:

Blue Cheese Garlic Bread ($8): I got this dish for free because it wad in my coupon book that I got from the welcome center. If I had to pay for this dish, I would probably not get it again. The bread was a bit too oily and tasted really strange.

Seafood Penne ($20): The seafood was definitely very fresh and worth the price. The portion was huge. Would highly suggest this if you like pastas.

Filet Mignon ($39): This is worth every penny!! I usually am not a big fan of meat, but this steak melted in my mouth!! The flavoring was on point. Mashed potato was flavored and creamy with chunks of potato.

I gave it a four star because of the server. He was really bad. He seem confused half the time and it took forever to get his attention. Other than that everything else was pretty good.
author: Irene Z.

description: Enjoyed the Alcatraz Escape cocktail, but the Shellfish Platter with pasta and Crab Ceviche didn't live up to the hype. The shrimp had a weird after taste. The lobster tail and the oysters were ok, I suppose. The foods were super bland compared to other seafood places I've been to. Would I come back and order the same menu items? No.
author: Quynh T.

description: The food was very good.  We had a steamed shellfish platter for 2 and it was tastey.  The cocktails were even better, and recommendations were thoughtful and on point.  I know fisherman's wharf restaurants don't have a great rep but Fog Harbor is solid.
author: David H.

description:
We saw all the stars on yelp and thought this was going to be a winner all around. I won't say that the food is bad, it really wasn't bad. It was just very plain.  I had the mixed grill (Salmon, Swordfish, and Shrimp), the rest of the family had pasta, salad, and a grilled cheese.  

The pasta was good, hard to go wrong with a kids pasta.

The Caesar salad was okay, the dressing was a little runny and not flavorful. Again, not bad, just not worth $16.00 for a salad with 4 shrimp.  

The grilled cheese was served on tasty sourdough, but the sourdough killed the flavor of the cheese. And there was very little cheese. Needs more cheese to balance the flavor.

The mixed grill tasted fine, but nothing outstanding. I was expecting more flavor for $28 at lunch. 

The service was good, our server was polite and attentive.  

Overall, it was probably one of the nicer places to eat in a tourist location, but could have been better.
author: Keith D.

description: OH MY GOD!!! The Lobster Roll I had here was to die for. Best lobster roll I've ever eaten in my entire life. Perfect ratio of lobster/butter/bread. Also the host Ana in the front gave us amazing customer service. 10/10 will come back here again. Mostly for the lobster roll tho.
author: Henry C.

description:
We came here as my in laws came from out of town. I love love the location of this restaurant. We got seats with the best view :) yaaay!! Ordered cocktail oysters. I was trying it out for the first time, loved it with sauces they provided. They were a bit smaller than expected but totally worth it! There clam chowder is really out of the world. It is Creamy, has the presence of clams and not potatoes. We also ordered a mixed grill. The shrimps on the platter tasted amazing!
Ciopinno ah that was my first time. Fresh clams, mussels, fish and crab legs in it. We were able to crack the crabs ourselves thus we didn't order lazy ciopinno :) yum is the word!
author: Jaslin T.

description: Best seafood from San Fran! Absolutely delicious and worth every penny. The lobster was well worth it, and you can't go wrong with their wedge salad. Wish I was a bit more hungry as I wanted to eat a little bit of everything.
author: Kim A.

description:
I can eat the sourdough bread everyday. The calamari was delicious. Crab was definitely fresh! We got the avocado & crab caesar salad. Family friends are chicken dishes are cleaned the plate. 
Long wait on the Sunday afternoon we went but worth it. Gorgeous view too!
author: Kassi M.

description: Great fresh seafood!  Little pricy but....did I say great fresh seafood!  The ceviche was excellent!  Only came with 4, yes count them 1,2,3,4, but just ask for more and no problem.  Also had the Shell Fish Tower appetizer, dungeons crab, lobster, oysters, jumbo shrimp...tasty!
author: Stuart Y.

description:
This place is excellent if you are visiting San Francisco and are craving seafood! It is near Fisherman's Wharf with a great view and plenty to do before and after the meal, making it perfect for a meal on your day out! 

We had cocktails during happy hour (bartender's choice), and they were perfectly designed for each of us based on what we like! They bartenders were all very friendly and helpful; they were present, but not pushy. 

I had the swordfish, and it was wonderful! It was light and flavorful! My friend had the sole, which we had never tried before! We also started our meal with oysters, which were fresh. The cocktail sauce was a little spicy, so don't take too much at a time if you don't like a little kick!

To top of the excellent staff and the great food, the view cannot be beat! We didn't have to wait too long at all for seats by the window. If you go, definitely request seating near it because it's so beautiful!
author: Lisa H.

description: Food and service was excellent. Highly recommend.walked by a couple days and decided to give it a try. The clam chowder was so creamy and flavorful. The calamari was perfectly fried. I had the swordfish and my boyfriend the salmon. DELISH!!!!!
author: Melissa H.

description: Excellent food and customer service I had the New York steak medium rare I wish It was a little bit more rare than I cooked it but I was fine with that they offered a free dessert so if they didn't cook my steak correctly so my friend ordered the cream Brulé which was excellent she said also or the Alcatraz mai tai excellent I recommended great atmosphere. Great food very nice please come early or have a reservation when advance are you going to have issues getting a table fol
author: R B.

description: If you have a City Pass, go claim your fun pack for a 15% discount and a free appetizer here. Clam chowder 5/5. Fried calamari 5/5. Cioppino 5/5. Ambience 5/5. Service 5/5. Everything is good here!!
author: Stephanie T.

description:
Really pretty restaurant w a nice view. Got the clam chowder and it was okay. It satisfied my hunger/cravings but ordered the calamari and there wasn't enough squid. They fried along the onions and jalapeños and the sauce was too little. I wanted squidward, not plankton:)


They also didn't serve us the complimentary bread. LOL
author: Raven R.

description: Fine dining. The seafood here is incredibly fresh and has some of the best sunset views for dinner. It is a little pricey, but its worth it for special occasions.
author: Chris K.

description:
My 5 star rating really reflects the amazing dining experience and customer service I received here a few weeks ago on a Sunday night at the bar. My sister and I came in when there was a 1.5 hour wait on Sunday night and decided to opt for the bar instead. Luckily, someone left so we grabbed two seats with a view to watch the Olympics, score! We ended up staying for more than just drinks and oysters and Jason N was excellent every step of the way. I always expect some witty banter and jokes from the bartender but Jason went above and beyond to ensure we had a great dining experience, which we did. It was more than just ensuring our drinks were full and cold, he always checked in with us and did it with a smile on his face. What really put him at 5 stars for me was how well he handled an issue with our meal. We brought up the issue not thinking much about it, but Jason went above our expectations, brought it up with his manager to help ensure we could really enjoy our meal and dining experience. I rarely get such wonderful service and definitely wanted to mention it because it made all the difference for us! 

As far as the food, I enjoyed the oysters very much! Really fresh and perfect start to our meal. I ordered the mixed grill plate with was a great way to try out their shrimp, swordfish and salmon with mashed potatoes and vegetables. I'd say the shrimp was my favorite with lots of flavor from their rub. My sister ordered the linguini and clams and enjoyed that as well. I also tried out their two signature bourbon cocktails which were wonderful, although the old fashioned was a bit too sweet for me.

Overall, my dining experience at Fog Harbor at their bar was wonderful! I would definitely recommend others to try them out.
author: Crystal R.

description: Wonderful meal and they are open Holidays! Christmas dinner at Fog Harbour was delicious!
author: Carla G.

description:
For being a restaurant on the Pier, I wasn't expecting much...just because I know that it is one of the busiest tourist spots in San Francisco, but the 4 stars on yelp made my decision easier when choosing where to eat.

We came here with a party of 11 (incl. 4 people from out of state who wanted to taste SF's seafood), and I appreciate the fact that the staff tried to get us seated immediately...but offering a table of 8 for 3 extra people made for a very tight squeeze. I like to be comfortable when I eat! Of course, we said yes because the sooner we ate the better, but this is now  probably contributing to my rating of the place due to my discomfort. 

After we were seated, I noticed the plates that were already placed on the table for bread weren't even washed. We had to replace all of them because there was dry food and even wet food marks on all of them. The table cloth's exposed area that would be grazing our legs was either very stained or just unwashed.

The service wasn't very welcoming. And the food itself was hella bland. I ordered the Crab Roll $19...I asked to substitute the french fries for sweet potato fries but was told they don't serve sweet potato fries even tho pictures on yelp indicated that they do...Whatever, man haha. I couldn't taste a thing anyway. And our guests weren't impressed with the food either.

Sorry Fog Harbor, I won't be returning.
author: Melanie B.

description: This place is wonderful. Had the Seafood Tower, delicious. Service was fantastic. Next time I'm in SFO it will be the first place I will go.
author: M D.

description:
This place was great!!! I had a dang sinus infection and couldn't taste a damn thing the whole trip. But I could taste the food from this restaurant! We had traveled to the city for my wife's birthday and we are both huge loves of quality food. Which is exactly what we were served!  I can still taste that New York steak 

The employees seemed more then happy to help with anything needed (granted we are not very needy).  The view was fantastic! You can see the golden gate lighting up over the bay!

We went to the Fransiscan crab house a day after our experience here... DO NOT waist Your time! 

FOG HARBOR is the place to eat!
author: Gabriel F.

description:
Excellent service and food. my kids had lobster tails and garlic roasted whole crab. My wife had penne chicken and I had combo grill. Super tasty and server was very polite and professional.
We will be back for sure.
author: George B.

description: Great services and very friendly servers. Although it is packed, but service and food came very quick. Will definitely go back again
author: Flora F.

description: Delicious food, great service and great prices. Great view too! I highly recommend the clam chowder and the blue cheese garlic bread.
author: Kathia S.

description: Perfect for date nights or family dinner..even dinner in large groups. Enjoy fresh sea food while watching the sunset. Friendly and attentive staffs.
author: Bean Some R.

description:
Cioppino (4+): Well-prepared seafood a-plenty. Sauce was a bit thicker than expected, and surprisingly salty (we did not notice this during the meal but ended up quite thirsty after we left)

Rock cod (4): Again, the seafood was prepared expertly (5). Chorizo white bean ragout was a disappointment (3); seemed like they left out the chorizo and the white beans were a bit al dente. 

Service (3): I have never encountered a more apathetic hostess. The way she slowly plodded through the restaurant to take us to our table was painful.
author: Eliot Q.

description:
I've been dining here since it was Chick's.
We had dinner there on Thursday April 27. The service was terrible. The servers literary dropped your plate at the edge of the table. You had to hand it to the person next to you. The food quality was okay. Not great like it used to be. The staff seems to be in slow mode. Not much care for the diners. We told the manager and his comment was, "That's too bad." That's  it for us. I guess this is the way the world is going. Slow and uncaring. Not for us. We're done with Fog
Harbor.
author: Scott P.

description: We were hesitant to come here because we thought it would be too touristy, but the experience, the ambiance, the views, and the food are all incredible. Our server Eddy was phenomenal. He was fun-loving and made our dinner one we will never forget! We tried the fresh oysters, steamed clams, clam chowder, calamari, poke, fish and chips, and linguini. They were all excellent! We will definitely come back!
author: Meghan B.

description: Had clam chowder and swordfish. Excellent.  and even though it was busy, service was super fast. Almost too fast. Maybe because I was sitting by the servers station. Too bad they don't have a patio, but has a great view through the window
author: David G.

description: awesome seafood.... great views, very clean and not crowded inside, it is packed but run very well. the quality of the fresh seafood is amazing... order whatever specials they have, thats the freshest stuff and mind blowing. their clam chowder is great, especially when you add extra crab on top, the clams were so tender! their sourdough is super fresh and delicious too, this is my favorite spot on the pier for sit down seafood.
author: Baby J.

description:
Hands down best restaurant we had while visiting San Fransisco. 
The fish here is extremely fresh tasting and of the highest quality sure to meet most people's expectations when having seafood. Of course you will come across the folks who think red lobster is their idea of great seafood so you can't please all. 

We order the clam chowder bread bowl and added crab to it for about $8 more. This is what I was looking for when I was told SF had the best chowder. Very happy we found this place and wished we could have eaten here more then the one time we did. 

The other item we ordered was a seafood pasta that came with mussels, clams, and fresh fish. WOW this was amazing!!! I would fly back to SF just for this dish again. Trust me this was excellent. 
Great red cream sauce that just topped off this dish to perfection. Great job Chef. 

Oh and do not forget to get the fresh sourdough bread that comes on the side with soft butter. Some of the best fresh bread I've had at a restaurant.
author: Ryan S.

description: This place is unbelievable.  It's a little pricey but most places in SF are.  I went to dinner with my partner and we both loved the place.  It sits over the water and the food was wonderful.
author: Dot S.

description: Came here for lunch on a wk day, after an early Alcatraz tour. No Wait andeWe were seated right by the window with water views... breathtaking! Amazing clam chowder, crab cake (love the mangos), great sole, and my steamed dungness crab was delicious! They did not provide a bib, i thought maybe because it was a nice place, but then saw another table had it. Good thing i'm not a messy eater :) Our waitress was attentive and we were dressed in active gear, while most other diners were much more properly dressed (just an observation). Would definitely return!
author: Jenny Z.

description:
Food was average,  wait time was 40 minutes,  menu offered some interesting new items but it did not pan out.... I preferred Blue Mermaid when it comes to flavor. 

Got a quick inquiry from management which is appreciated.

 So here's more details... Hostess was not friendly  or helpful. The lines of crowd coming in for dinner is understandable but her generic response of "20 more minutes" was off putting.

 Food was very salty,  blue cheese garlic bread was clumpy,  salty,  hard and soaked in oil. Pumpkin Plum Salmon was salty and ingredient flavors were indiscernible.
author: Wai Y.

description:
Best option for affordable, good quality, great tasting seafood in San Francisco. 
The location has a great view, and the seafood is sustainable. Also the menu is just a classic seafood style, no fusion or fuss. The service was excellent and making a reservation with a request for my husbands birthday was so easy! The only down fall is the super touristy area, but it doesn't really matter bc they'll validate one hour. I will definitely be bringing friends and family back to this restaurant : )
author: Lauren H.

description: Lovely place. We didn't have a reservation but got a seat in about 20 minutes. The view at dusk was very nice (windows overlooking the water) and my scallop risotto was so good. Nice drink selection. Would try desserts next time.
author: Sher H.

description: I ordered a clam chowder, the cioppino and a clam sandwich to go. This place is literally heaven, with perfect food, broad view of the bay and cozy atmosphere. Everyone is chatting and laughing with their loved ones. I came here early so there is no waiting time and the service is super nice.
author: Tong S.

description: One of the best chowders in town. The food was served in large portions. It's pretty pricey but very good. The restaurant has a great view of the bay so waiting is worth it. The crab cake is to die for so I would recommend getting that to start with. The crab and avocado salad is good but huge. You could split that between two and be full. Come with a big appetite.
author: Kyle T.

description:
Dined here yesterday after the aquarium. The food was definitely amazing! We ordered a cup of claim chowder to start.. amazing, with the crab on top; that was also served with delicious warm bread. For entrees we ordered the burger and the other item was mixed seafood with tomato broth! AMAZING DISHES! fresh everything! Dessert, go with the tres leches you won't be disappointed !

Ambiance is great, view is spectacular and service is on point! Not so pricey either, I mean you're at a seafood restaurant by the water.. don't expect McDonald's prices! 

We will definitely be back!
author: Daniella G.

description:
Fantastic Clam Chowder! Not overloaded with potatoes or flour like some other places. Creamy and full of delicious large pieces of clams.

Now, I know the general inclination is to order the Clam Chowder in a bread bowl, but I would advise against it...why? Because they give you sourdough bread anyways! This way you get to enjoy the soup and dip the bread to your heart's content without over stuffing yourself with bread. I also had the Cesar Salad which is a great accompaniment since it light and refreshing enough to counter the heaviness of the chowder, yet still packed with flavor.
author: Margaret L.

description: I've come here many times and JASON from the bar is always friendly, gives great service and always does a great job. He makes us feel like family and at home.Food is always great as well.
author: Gam H.

description: Good food, great view, lovely staff, prices are high but portions are big! I would recommend making a booking if you want to eat here with a group.
author: Monica D.

description: There was so many places to eat and I randomly chose this one. The hostess was friendly and seated us near the window to where we had an amazing view of the pier/water. Our waitress was very informative and really friendly. Ordered the mussel fries (the sauce they have with this is so delicious), calamari (always a fave), and clam chowder in a bread bowl! Everything was so good. Restrooms are clean. Would definitely come back!
author: Kathryn C.

description:
Excelente place to have a wonderful meal !! Food was really good !! 
I live in Miami but I'm Definitely coming back to this place keep up the great job!!!
author: Yanet G.

description: Loved it here.  The views were jaw dropping the food was great.  One tip: don't get the garlic fries if you don't absolutely worship garlic like I do.  They are GARLICKY!   And I loved them.   The staff was more than helpful.  Pleasant, funny and down to earth
author: Roni S.

description: Outstanding food !!! Clam chowder, Alaskan halibut, chocolate banana bread pudding, and blondie w/ice cream was divine. My waiter, Tyler, recommended everything I ate, and I was in food heaven. Thank you Fog Harbor Fish House for making my Friday night in San Francisco memorable
author: Sean A.

description: The prices are high because of the view, which is unbeatable. The food is good. Service is great. Many tourists but it seems also some locals. I had the cioppino which was very generous with 2 plump scallops, 2 large shrimp, 3-4 mussels, 3-4 clams and fish. The salads were tasty and sourdough fresh out of the oven. For our table of eight they didn't add a service charge, which I thought was nice (of course we tipped generously). Overall a very nice place to enjoy the Bay and good seafood.
author: Ted M.

description:
I've eaten here before last time I was in town and absolutely loved the food and the service was excellent. 

This time I came with a larger group. We ordered the clam chowder bread bowl which was pretty good, not as much seafood as I expected. The bread was amazing and definitely carries the dish. I've had better being from the northeast. The tuna poke was okay, not really much flavor. The drinks we ordered tasted a little water-downed. It's definitely a tourist spot, being located on pier 39.
author: Jessica P.

description:
I came here based off the tremendous reviews on Yelp.  I have to say we were quite disappointed.  Don't get me wrong, the food is decent and all but I was expecting more from a 4 star yelp reviewed restaurant.  We got fried calamari and clam chowder to start.  The calamari were flavorful and lightly battered.  When our appety are better than our main entrees, oh boy we are in a world of hurt.

I got the seafood penne pasta...nothing to boast about.  My son got the fish and chips.  Fish were too fried.
My wife got pacific salmon salad.  The fish was too dry and cooked a tad too long.  However our waitress (I believe her name was Janette) was extremely nice and attentive.  She offered if my wife wanted a new salmon to be cooked and she said yes.  The second piece was much better.

Would we come back next time we visit SF, I doubt it.  The views are spectacular though.
author: Kevin C.

description:
So tonight my girlfriend and I had our last dinner of our San Fran Vacay at the Fog Harbor. We decided to try it after reading all of the great reviews on Yelp. 

If you wonder why 3 stars. It's due to the not so great service by our waiters. 

We were greeted and asked for water along with the drinks we ordered. We got our drinks and our waiter came back and took our order. Still no water or bread and butter. The manager stopped at our table and asked if he could bring us some bread and butter. We said yes please and may we have two waters. He promptly came back with two waters and bread. Props to the manager. Way to be alert. 

We ordered a half crab with roasted garlic and a half crab on ice with cocktail sauce. I made sure to specify that both crab orders be with shell. He says. Ok, that's all your going to order?!? Pretty irritating. Then when the food came, He brought us a shredded crab cocktail and our half crab with roasted garlic. We told the waiter the shredded cocktail was not what we ordered. He said yes it is what you ordered. I then explained again I want the order in the shell not shredded. He says they don't have that. So I pull up an image from yelp and he changed our order. 

All in all the food was delicious just wish our waiter was more attentive, not so rude, and didn't make us feel like we were idiots and have no idea what we are talking about.
author: Olivia R.

description:
Not only was the food amazing the service was even better! We had AJ as a server and let her know that we had a plane to catch in a few hours - she put in the order all at once and we were in and out in less than 45 minutes. We had the clam chowder (5 stars), crab cake (5 stars*), garlic cheese bread (3 stars**) and the cioppino (5 stars). 

*the crab was pretty fishy, but it was neutralized when you ate it with the sauce, tomato and fruit slice. 

**too much blue cheese for my taste. Mix it with the garlic sauce and the taste was too strong (I love garlic btw)
author: Patrick C.

description:
Great food. Decent sized portions. Yummy drinks. We ordered the moscow mule and raspberry lemon drop drinks. Delicious and cute. Bread was warm and fresh. We ordered seafood penne and crab sandwich. Seafood penne had a good amount of fish, clams, and mussels and the sauce was very flavorful and delicious. you could taste the real crab in the crab sandwich and they gave you a generous portion. 

Pricey but i would come again. Tastes fresh.
author: Cynthia T.

description: Enjoyed a nice dinner here for our last night in SF.  Nice views of the bay except for the bird poo on the windows but if you look past that you can appreciate the scenery. This place was really lively and had pretty quick service. Food was actually pretty heavy. Clam chowder was good but very heavy and dense. Bay scallops were cooked well and we both ordered pasta. My friend got the linguine and clams which was lighter than my Seafood penne. My meal had a good amount of fish, clams, and mussels. They also make really tasty cocktails. Price point isn't too bad at around $19-26 an entree. If we ever come back, I'd probably stick to some lighter or less carby options. We were both pretty satisfied but so full from the bread, soup, appetizer, and a portion of our entree. I think it was due to everything being higher in sodium, carby, and creamy.  I would definitely come back to try the other menu items.
author: Anh N.

description: Love coming here! Nice waiters great food and very nice views. We shared a mixed grill seafood plate it was plenty for the both of us they even sperated it on 2 plAtes. Dessert was delicious choc cake and creme brule'.'we also had calamari it came with a lemon sauce so good.! We will be back again!
author: Sharai S.

description: The wait is super long here if you don't make reservations. However, they don't take reservations for parties more than 6 people. With that being said, it's not fair to judge this place based on its wait time. I'm giving this a 5 star because of the fresh seafood and the beautiful view. I ordered a tuna ahi entree and that was just amazing. My boyfriend ordered the lobster (super delicious since I had a taste). Also, what a nice view this place has. I would spend all day there staring out the water if I could. I really enjoyed having dinner with my friends here. One tip though, please don't order fish and chips here. This place is great for fresh seafood so take advantage of that and expand your food horizon. Besides, my friend ordered the fish and chips and she didn't really like it.
author: Tran N.

description: The view here is beautiful, and the food is very good. The clam chowder was awesome, as was the buttery crab roll. The fries were nothing special, so I didn't really  eat them. The chocolate dessert was really good! This restaurant is not cheap (we paid over $100 for lunch without drinks), but it is a worthy treat.
author: Felicia C.

description:
Fog Harbor is located at Pier 39. So, there are lots of tourists around the restaurant and within the restaurant.  There are locals here as well.  For despite its location Fog Harbor is anything but a tourist trap.  Rather it is a goodwill ambassador for San Francisco being as good as it is.  Simply put Fog Harbor has great food, great service, a beautiful location overlooking the water, and the food is priced right.  Let me enumerate.

On arriving at the restaurant forty minutes early for my reservation I asked to hostess if it would be possible to seat me.  With a cheerful "Yes" she got me seated at a great table within five minutes.  A nice welcome is always appreciated.

On being seated my outstanding server Luana cheerfully greeted me and provided water and a loaf of wonderful sourdough bread.  Luana was very helpful in going over the menu with me thereby helping me order an outstanding meal.  For health reasons I have to limit my salt intake.  Luana let me know exactly what plates and components of plates had salt already built in or where salt could be held back.  And just when she had my main course ordered she went to the kitchen to remind the chefs to restrict salt where possible. You could go to any of the best, top-tier restaurants in San Francisco and not find better service than was provided me by Luana.  

My first course was a bowl of clam chowder to which they added crab for a quite reasonable surcharge.  The chowder may have been a bit too thick but it was filled with clams; and my goodness the crab atop the soup was sweet and well portioned.  Fog Harbor provides ample portions of very good food at a very fair price.  

My main course was seared pacific cod which came with white beans, tomatoes and spinach.  Normally when you see the fish atop something it is the less expensive components of the plate.  Here the cod was served atop more cod.  The cod was perfectly cooked and pristine.  The spinach was fresh and properly cooked, not some afterthought; likewise the beans and tomatoes.

As I left, Luana came running after me to give me my hat which I had left behind.  I will certainly be back in the near future to visit again with Luana and the rest of the Fog Harbor team.
author: David D.

description: This is our favorite restaurant ever! We're making tradition out of coming here. This year will be our third valentines coming here. I guess we love the view, the food and the ambience. And on valentines, the lady's always receive a beautiful red rose
author: Andrea J.

description: Very bad and rude hostesses at the front, especially the dark hair lady who thinks she is a beauty queen who acts as if she owns the restaurant. They are not trying to win your business but instead looking down on you and putting you down with an attitude! They do not need my business so we walked a bit more instead and had much better lunch at a much better location.  Its not worth dealing with that kind of attitude of a restaurant who clearly doesn't need my business.
author: Kelly N.

description:
I love the dining area. Anywhere you sit you get a view of the water.  

We had their fried combo platter, which came with shrimp, fish, and calamari.  Everything was fried to perfection.  Our kids loved the fried fish.  I had the linguini and clam. It came with a very generous serving of Clams. For $18usd, you get a big serving of pasta and clams. It was seasoned to perfection.  We also got Ahi Tuna and Crab cakes.  I think the crab cakes was too expensive. 

It was good food. But it was also expensive.   I guess it is expected for a tourist area like this.
author: Rochelle 'Shella' T.

description:
My Mom took me here for my 29th Birthday, and we had the best meal/experience! Justin, our server, was so helpful and knowledgeable about the wine list, and menu! We will definitely be coming back here
!
author: Stephanie B.

description:
Of all the times coming to pier 39 i am so tired of bubba gumps 1-2hr wait for bland food and hit or miss service. We decided this time why not try something new. 

Yelp lead us here and it wasn't so bad. The wait was less than others on the pier and the setting was very appealing. 

Checking in was a bit disturbing being the 3 gals standing there talking to one another seemed to have had an attitude as I grew tired of waiting for one to greet so I said hi table for 3.  Whatever maybe they aren't aware that their job consist of greeting people and seating them not just to stand there in f21 clothing and Mac make up. 

Anyway the food.  It was eh. I wasn't blown away by any of it. I tasted all 3 plates and I felt as if the price we paid I could have done all of it at home. ( my brother and boyfriend even said it)

Our waiter was pretty attentive he made sure to say hello as we were seated and let us know he would be right with us. He recommended things on the menu and was very knowledgeable. 

The seating is pretty tight. To even get to our table I bumped a lady getting ready to eat her food with my arm and had to squeeze by another to avoid the same incident. ( I'm not larger than average) 

All together I probably wouldn't visit again, unless a friend wanted to celebrate a party and happened to like this place.
author: Chaulzy S.

description: I was so annoyed with this place. I ordered a filet mignon with crab and was explaining to the waitress how I'd like it: between medium and medium well , i.e. no blood when you cut it, but still pink. Before I could finish my sentence she cut me off and says, "that's medium well." I was surprised and she abruptly wrote it down and left. I thought to myself, ok, maybe they have their own definition of medium well. Then my filet arrives and it's dry and terrible and costs over $50. Really, they should learn food before forcing their horrible tourist-trap-crap on people. Fools.
author: Leila T.

description: Their service was the best, My waitress Ashley G. was very knowledgeable and delightful.  I came in on a rainy day looking for some chowder. Her recommendation was hands down the best recommendation ever. The clam chowder very good, flavor was just right and the bread! so yummy! I will be back for more and hopefully have Ashley again as my waitress before she goes on leave.
author: Brad G.

description: Great place to dine with friends or family! Our server Luane took great care of us throughout the whole experience. She was very patient with us even though I took forever to order and recommended us great menu items like the clam chowder with crab (which was great!!!!) Highly recommend this place!
author: Nicky N.

description: Great food, great service. Had the mixed grill, fish was fresh and perfectly seasoned. Wife had the California crab and avocado caesar salad, which was HUGE. Our server Khaiman was amazing.
author: Bri H.

description: Excellent food- what a view and the fish was fresh.  I feel they used the freshest ingredients all go round.  We had two salads to start with they are so big - not quite starter size salads- next time sharing a salad for a starter would be a good idea.  We also had the crab cakes- melt in your mouth good- and the Halibut.  No room for desert but we did order more wine.  Overall great experience all go round.
author: Alisha H.

description:
Oh my gosh this place is amazing!! Our last night in SF and we were looking for a place that would not let us down. No reservation, got seated right away in a booth with a view of Alcatraz, amazing! My wife and I ordered a salad. Her salad was the beet and goat cheese salad and it was delicious. Big portion, generous with the beets and goat cheese. I had a mix green and it too was generous but lacked the wow of her salad. 

For dinner, I had the Dungeness crab sandwich and she had the Ahi Tuna. The sandwich was a piece of buttered/toasted Texas toast stuffed with crab! Oh and no mayo!! Finally a restaurant lets the star of the dish shine! The Ahi tuna was unbelievable.  Seared perfectly with a wasabi aoli and super delish rice and veggie mix. She remarked it was better than the Ahi tuna we just had in Maui!

The dessert choices are excellent as well. We opted for the bread pudding and cream brûlée. Both were excellent!  Service was was also excellent hence the 5 stars!
author: Robert W.

description: The location and food at Fog Harbor Fish House were great. The only reason I didn't give this place 5 stars, was because the service was just ok. The waitress wasn't really good or bad, just average. We spent 2 nights in Monterey prior to coming to SF and the service up there was amazing.
author: Jason S.

description:
Great restaurant with great food great atmosphere 
Our waiter Justin was awesome, very helpful, and courteous. Great job!!
author: Richard M.

description:
I would give the Fog Harbor Fish House 3 1/2 stars because it's a little better than just OK. We had a good experience and the service was impeccable, the restaurant was clean, and the view was perfect. For food, we decided to go with a selection of appetizers, which included the red chili garlic shrimp, the mussel fries, and the Dungeness crab cocktail. We also had two Moscow Mules. All were fairly priced, relative to similar establishments in the area. By far, our favorite was the mussel fries, which we thought was an inspired idea (we since learned that it seems to be a common dish in the Bay area). The shrimp were large and well-cooked, and the crab was wonderfully tasty. And the Mules were well-mixed.

Our biggest complaint here was the overall lack of zest in the sauces. In a word, they were mostly boring. Serviceable, but boring. For example, I think serving run-of-the-mill cocktail sauce with that delectable crab meat is a mistake. I would go with something much more subtle but enhancing, such as a delicate lemon-saffron sauce or even a lightly spiced creme fraiche. Sure, offer the cocktail sauce for those who may want it, but this app screams for something more daring to help it stand above. So offer a selection of sauces. With the mussels, I didn't taste any garlic in the garlic aioli and sadly there was not enough of the cream sauce to truly enjoy it. And the sauce that accompanied the shrimp was ... eh. Could have been a lot more spicy.

As I said, our experience was good and maybe if we had gone with full-on meals rather than a sampling of apps, I might have rated it higher. I will add that for what we got, we left with satisfied appetites - I even left with some of the crab meat. If I get to the area again, I would return to Fog Harbor.
author: Ralph M.

description: My family and I went here for a birthday dinner celebration. The food was delicious and the service outstanding! The beautiful views were amazing as well. I will definitely go back and refer others. The clam chowder was soooo good!!
author: Maisha W.

description:
Awesome view of the bay and Alcatraz!! I came here strictly for oysters and they were PHENOMENAL. I also tried the clam chowder and it was by far the best I have had on the west coast!!! The ambiance was very calm and family oriented, but still upbeat! 

The only thing I did not like was that for such an affordable prices menu, their cocktails were extremely expensive. Most were between $10-$15. Besides that, everything else was great!!
author: Annie H.

description: Another winner thanks to my Yelp friends for recommending.  Had their own version of Oysters Rockefeller. Succulent and luscious. Codfish special was excellent.  Prepared in a frying pan but not fried. Does that make sense? Shrimp over spinach, potatoes and butternut squash was another winner. And yet another big winner was the waiter who never allowed my Grey Goose on the rocks to go dry. Windows had a clear view of the Golden Gate and Alcatraz Island.... Well as clear as you can get with the always present fog. Giving these guys a well earned 4 star review. Lively spot. Worth the visit.
author: Gary M.

description: Today was my first time there. I took my parents there because they're very picky about their food and this place had great reviews. Did not disappoint. From the reception to our wonderful server Justin H everything was so perfect. Food was so so good and the seafood was so so fresh! My parents loved the food....I'm so glad I brought them here. Justin gave me a suggestion to try a ginger lemonade that paired so well with the seafood and was surprisingly good! Highly recommended!
author: masooma b.

description: My wife and I visited this restaurant during our July 4th get-away. She has really been craving raw oysters on the half shell and I decided to treat her. Fog Harbor Fish House did not disappoint! Between us, we ate at least 48 oysters! She loved it! I was impressed with the freshness and the quickness of of oysters delivered to our table. We also loved the fried calamari, Ahi Poke & crab cake(s)! The ambiance was great also. As we dined , we had a good view of the harbor & ocean near Pier 39. The service was great! Our waiter brought everything to the table fresh , hot or cold and he was always smiling! Despite a 20min.  wait to be seated, we both had a great experience dining @ Fog Harbor Fish House! Highly recommend!!!
author: B H.

description: This was one of the worst restaurants I have ever been to. The oysters were small af and the steamed clams tasted so bad. The waitress I got was so rude. She intentionally made some noises while she was moving my plates and her attitude was terrible.
author: Mason Y.

description: Excellent place to dine! Ambiance and service were top notch! Great energy the entire evening.
author: Pam T.

description:
Came here a few weeks ago for lunch...
I'm still full. 

That food is heeeavy.

It's in a tourist area so for that it's pretty decent but it's also hella pricey and they don't have a weekday lunch menu so you're still stuck paying those dinner prices mid day, but if you neeeed food and can't fathom walking another half block to catch a cab, well, this isn't a terrible. 

It's a one and done type of deal here for me. A lot of the food seems to have super heavy creams involved the way banquet dinner meals are. That kind of thing is fine at first but after 6 bites it's just too much. 

I got the mussel fries since it was one of the only handful of items on the menu under $20, and thought the fries were great, the mussels were terrible. Of the bowl I had, FIVE of the shells were empty and one of the was still very sealed shut. When it came down to it, more than a 3rd of my mussels were duds and the ones that were actually in their shells were pretty awful. They had this strange taste to them that was a tinge foul and paired with the sauces, wasn't good. 

If you go and you're on a budget, I think the soup in a bread bowl and salad combo is the way to go. It's enough food for 2 people given the heaviness and the bread (sourdough, of course) was darn delicious. 

I could see where it'd be a cute date spot for an older couple who's touristing, but I don't think I'll see myself back again.
author: Candice G.

description: The view can't be beat!  The food was delicious and they bring you a lot of it!  We started with the blue cheese garlic bread and loved it!  The fish and chips was enough for 2 people easily and the plate with salmon, swordfish and shrimp was huge and delicious as well.  We enjoyed it.
author: Apryl E.

description: First off let me start by saying that the food was very good I had the whole crab! The creme brûlée was absolutely amazing and everyone should get it for dessert. The reason why I won't give it 5 stars is because our waiter barely came to the table and when he did he was nice but super short and seemed to be disappointed at something. It was also super loud which I don't mind but when you are paying about $30 or more on a meal you can't really enjoy it and talk casually you kinda have to raise your voice it almost felt as if you were in a bar.
author: John M.

description:
Great chowder - a tip from a couple from Australia on the cable car

Really high price for soup/salad some sliders and 2 drinks was $100 with tip! 

Very packed on Sunday at 5:30 so we sat at bar - good conversations with bar mates 

Nice view 

Forgot to take photo of food before it was devoured
author: Cathy B.

description: Service, decor and food was over top good. Wow, I am so happy wife and I stopped by here. Sword fish was out of this world. I can't even summarize with words how good. They start you off with sourdough bread (after it's a SF speciality) and view is pretty nice. Crab cake good, too but will say for 1 crab cake this was overpriced. I can't complain just due to the fact the food was so perfect. And I struggle to say that but it was. Waiter staff was equally flawless. An amazing place you must go to!!
author: Abubu A.

description: Baked oysters were incredible. Crab cakes were fresh and had real crab. It was the best place for oysters I have experienced during my week long trip. Highly recommended!!
author: Theresa B.

description:
The service was fast even though it was super busy. This place is beautiful and has great views. I had the fried scallops and they were great. I also had a beet salad and it was also really good. Both were really big portions and could be shared.
They claim to sell only sustainable fish.
author: Erin F.

description: One of the best seafood restaurants I've been to in bay area hands down. Nice ambiance and great location!
author: Ali D.

description: This place is one of the best! It scores A+ on all accounts: service-fantastic, location-gorgeous, food-delicious! A couple of us ordered the Lazy cioppino, and we also had the grilled Halibut, both were amazing! the serve fresh bread hot! Makes all the difference in the world, with sliced butter. The sour dough bread taste amazing and is supplied by Boudin Bakery. The place is a must go to, and we can't wait to go back.
author: Jimmy L.

description:
Unfortunately, I could have been happier with McDonald's.  I wish I could have my $130 back.  I regret not returning the food and going elsewhere.

The Good:
I did like the New England clam chowder and the sauteed spinach was quite terrific, which I'm so glad I subbed the cole slaw, otherwise, I wouldn't have even had the spinach.  The crab cakes were mushier than I prefer, but the flavor was good.  My virgin strawberry basil nojito (yes, correct spelling of theirs since this is a virgin) beverage  was nice and refreshing.  The waiter was adequate.  The view was  nice.

The Not Great:
Everything else...I got the fried combo.  The fish was horrible.  It had zero flavor.  The fry batter needs seasoning!!!  The fried shrimp was so-so, nothing special.  The calamari was lightly battered, but didn't have much flavor.  The french fries were just french fries.  My boyfriend's pina colada drink was average.  I could have gotten it from any smoothie place and it would have tasted  the same.  The garlic crab was OK.  I didn't taste any kind of garlic flavor though.

The tables were a bit cramped together.  Overall, yes a few items were good, but for the price paid, I guess you're paying for the location and view.
author: Rolena I.

description: So delicious! Complimentary sourdough bread & butter. Must get the crab sandwich. They definitely don't skimp out on the crab meat. Also appreciated the mini biscoff cookie that comes with the check . Definitely coming back!
author: Andrea F.

description:
I had lunch here with a couple friends - the wait wasn't too long, we were seated promptly and our server was amazing. 

We got: 
Blue Cheese Garlic Bread - free if you stop at the tourism center first and look through some of the maps for coupons! I wouldn't actually pay for this - but then again, I don't really like cheese. 
Clam Chowder - I was craving clam chowder and that's pretty much the reason we wound up here. This hit the spot - flavorful, creamy and generally delicious with the bread. 
Ahi Tuna Poke - best thing we got by far. Absolutely delicious, so fresh and light. 
Fish & Chips - unexceptional. I like fish & chips, but I found these a little floury. I wouldn't get this again. 

I would go back here despite it being a complete tourist trap. The service was great - and the ahi tuna poke and clam chowder were both delicious!
author: Sharon C.

description: The food looks so so ,tasted badI think I will pass next time,the table next us didn't eat at all,the next restaurant crab house is wonderful,their food more expensive,but the food really good
author: Yanci K.

description:
Gorgeous views and Delicious food!
This is what dining in San Francisco should be.   Located in Pier 39, this restaurant is elegant but not super fancy which makes it ideal for families with children.  
We got there nice and early (11am) because the kids were so hungry which was great because we beat the lunch crowd.  This place is popular!  If you want to get a nice window table, get there early.  
The good was great.  You really can't go wrong with anything here.  The seafood tastes nice and fresh and is presented well.  It's just a little more than other places on the pier but it's definitely worth every penny.  

Highly recommended.
author: Ana B.

description: Our waiter, Justin, was extremely friendly and had wonderful recommendations. I had the crab Louie which is a San Francisco favorite and one of the best crab salads I've had. Overall service was great and so was the food!
author: Jennifer J.

description: Yummy!!! My go to spot on Pier 39! If you are going to pay tourist prices might as well make it worth it! Great fish, steaks, calamari and drinks.  The Lipstick Lemon drop was Amazing!! Great place for a bite to eat with friends, family or even for a date night!
author: Katrina C.

description:
Yep, thank you again,Yelp-!

I found this gem in the heart of the most touristy spot in SF (Pier 39) with the trusty help of Yelp. My partner and I were SO damn hungry we were eyeing the IHOP we passed on our walk to Pier 39, for goodness sake...

Anyway, I actually used the monacle feature and Fog Harbor Fish House hit the spot as a nice generic seafood option that would be fitting of our Pier 39 afternoon. As soon as I started going through the reviews and saw all the amazing photos, I was really excited to give it a try!

Everything from the sourdough bread to the caesar salad, tuna app and of course, my salmon entree was high quality, well cooked and really tasty. The service too, was phenomenal. Our server was really friendly and particularly quick on refills. The food came out reasonably paced.

I couldn't help but notice all food at the other tables also looked really good. If I lived in San Francisco, despite it being in the heart of Pier 39, I'd actually come here regularly! Honestly, I wouldn't mind returning if I'm ever there again myself. :)

I highly recommend Fog Harbor Fish House!
author: Grace M.

description: Everything was excellent!! From the views and the delicious food all the selections were magnificent. We ordered the clam chowder, oysters and scallops special with apple pie cobbler dessert. Definitely recommend and will come back again!
author: Austin W.

description: Obsessed with this place. Beautiful views of the bay and the food is spectacular. I've been there 6 times so far and can never get tired or not want to try something new on the menu. A must when you go is the Bleu Cheese Garlic bread! I don't like bleu cheese but that bread is amazing. Their seafood is the freshest!
author: Arianna V.

description:
#Doitfortheviews

This place is tourist paradise: 
-excellent local seafood (Calamari is a must!)
-craft cocktails 
-360 views through floor to ceiling paneled windows 

San Fran poured when I visited, and it felt like I was enclosed in a warm delicious snow globe, accompanied by wine. The Golden Gate, Alcatraz, the sea, and the little outlines of the city were my backdrop through what an OC girl would call a storm *hehe* 

In short: you really didn't visit San Fran if you didn't come here.
author: Anna' A.

description:
First night in downtown San Francisco! I arrived with a date about an hour and half before closing. I had no reservation, but that wasn't a problem, we were seated immediately. While being seated I felt very underdressed. I had jeans and a hoody. You have to sit by the windows. The view was amazing! We saw a tiny tug boat!

I ordered the mixed grill. The swordfish was very tender and smooth. The salmon was tender also but had a crisp on the outside, which is how I like my salmon. The shrimp was alright and the mashed was a little cold but smooth.

Overall a great experience.
author: Eduardo M.

description:
For a tourist spot, this place isn't so bad. With that, I probably won't ever come again, unless invited. Mainly because the prices; everything is expensive. I get it: San Francisco, seafood, Fisherman's Wharf. 

I'd say the caesar salad and chowder in the bread bowl combo is the best deal. At about $14 you get a small salad with a huge bowl of chowder in the most delicious sour dough bread bowl. I dare you to try and finish any of it. Have I had better chowda? Puhlease, I'm from New England. I've had better chowda. This was the generic cream based New England chowder. Plenty of potatoes and clams, but it could have used some pancetta or some renegade ingredient to spice things up a bit. Have I had better salads in my day? Yes. This was some romaine lightly dressed. I opted for the $6 crab add on (shredded crab) and I highly suggest you do not follow my lead. Not worth it and did nothing to the flavor of the salad.

My friend was a little disappointed in her mussel fries which basically consisted of some mussels - most empty and closed and fries in a white creamy sauce. Again at $14, not so bad, but not the best bargain around. Most of the entrees start at about $30+ and sandwiches at about $15+. * The complimentary sour dough to start was delicious and a great way to fill up a little if you decide to go light.

Great views of the pier, friendly service albeit a bit too friendly, sometimes a gal likes to be left alone to eat, solid food makes this a pricy power lunch that filled me up throughout the day (no dinner needed). I didn't try the seafood entree's as they were just too pricy for lunch, but hey if you're on vacation or money ain't a thing, maybe your experience will be better than mine!

* Have ya heard of a lunch menu?
author: Stephanie Y.

description:
It was Memorial Day weekend and we had a few things left to check off our 'to do' list.  That said, clam chowder at Fog Harbor was on the list.  It was super crowded, so we assumed space at the bar and proceeded to address our list.  

The barkeep did a nice job at getting us in and out.  We all enjoyed the clam chowder in the bread bowl.  The bread was perfectly moist, and the chowder had a great consistency with plenty of tasty clams, but, it needed to be slightly warmer.  I called it very good, and my daughter called it THE BEST EVER... mind you she's young.  LOL.  

My wife went off the board with the red chili shrimp which was OUTSTANDING!  I'd definitely go again, ideally with more time and a chance to enjoy the fabulous view.  The upstairs location and sweeping water views make this an idyllic place to enjoy a nice San Francisco afternoon on the waterfront.
author: Chris G.

description:
The Pacific cod special was absolutely delicious!  
My wife had the chowder bowl with extra crab. Wonderful!  
And the service was outstanding. 
And they bake their own sour dough bread. Scrumptious. 
 ps. Our server Khaiman was a super star
author: Ron M.

description:
We were in town last week and couldn't wait to come here.  It's our favorite place in SF.  We typically eat here several times and I love to send people here.  However,  the service was absolutely horrible.  The food was amazing as always and I've never had bad service until this trip.  But it was bad!

Our server was Daniel C.  He started off by telling us all about the things he likes on the menu and how many times he's eaten them and then left.  Never asked if we wanted anything to drink.  When he returned he was totally flustered but went on to tell us what a GREAT server he was, even though he's only been there for 2 months.  He then ran around like a chicken with his head cut off because apparently the owners wife was coming in.  He not only told us but his other table as well.  Apparently, that was meant as a heads up that we don't matter and aren't paying customers.  He was running around looking for candles and polishing glasses, while we sat there without water and couldn't get a refill.  At one point I tried to get the attention of a busser setting a table across from us.  I said excuse me 3 times and was totally ignored.  He did hear me because he came back later and asked if I needed something.  We asked for our check and the server walked by again and again before bringing it.  When I was returning from the bathroom he handed me the check in the hallway.  I took it back to the table and put the card in it and then watched him walk back and forth looking at it several times before actually picking it up.  

I've was a server and I've waited on the owners before.  But I can tell you that I don't care who is sitting next to me and I don't care how nervous the server is.  We were there on vacation to enjoy a wonderful meal and it was totally ruined by the absolute unprofessionalism of the people working there.
author: Kristen M.

description:
Excellent food overlooking the pier and bay.  Entree ordered was Garlic whole dungeness crab. Crab cake and cup of award winning clam chowder. 
Having crab cooked with garlic brought out the flavor of the crab!  Crab cake was perfectly cooked while the clan chowder had biteful pieces with every spoonful.
author: Robert M.

description:
One of my favorites! I loved the food & view, SO beautiful.  If only it weren't in such a touristy area, but I can get over that. You have a spectacular view of the water and Alcatraz. This place is perfect for before/ after any boat tour or Alcatraz tour. The only reservation I could get was for 11:30 a.m-- make one when you know you will be coming, this place books up QUICK! 

Delicious everything. Everything.  I probably had the best clam chowder that I have ever tasted here. At first I ordered a cup, but then decided to order another bowl for my meal with some shrimp. OMG the shrimp was heaven. So succulent & fresh. Big shrimp too, none of that skimpy, shriveled garbage. 

YUM!!!!!!!! This is a must when visiting.
author: Jenna H.

description:
Went here for lunch after reading some of the reviews for this place. It was only moderately busy around noon on a Monday, so I got immediately seated next to a window with a view of the water. 

The server was attentive and suggested I try one of the specials that just started this week... More on that later. 

I had the clam chowder with sourdough on the side to start. I've had a lot of clam chowders in my day, and this by far is one of the best if not best I've ever had. Not too dairy creamy... Tons of clam meat... Not overloaded with potatoes and seasoned just right. The hot sourdough bread was also very tasty... Served piping hot and fresh. 

Now for my main entree I had the king salmon special. What can I say? Pine nuts, avocado, orzo, locally caught king salmon, fennel, and a nice salad... Talk about explosion of flavor. Besides the salad/orzo combination being amazing by itself, the king salmon was cooked to perfection... With a delicate texture, nice seasoned crust and that bright red color... All in all a very good piece of fish. 

The only downside to this place is the cost, but you get what you pay for. I'd highly recommend those of you in the area visiting to give this place a try. I'll definitely be back!
author: Eric P.

description: For starters any place on Pier 39 is going to have a wait but they have a system where you give them your phone number and they text you when your table is ready so you can go explore around the pier while you wait. There is also a cozy fireplace and couches if you want to wait outside the restaurant. Service was great. As for the food we ordered the seafood mix, Cioppino, fresh oyster appetizer, and muscle frys appetizer.... I will tell you the Cioppino was good I have had a few places cook it a little better but that doesn't mean that it was not good, the seafood mix was amazing I loved the fresh butter and kind of garlic herb taste it had, the oysters were good and fresh (but if u just want oysters go somewhere else this place is more for a full meal dining experience) the muscle fries I wasn't a big fan of I think it had a little bit too much truffle but that's just me personally. For dessert we got the Blondie brownie which was amazing! I loved how they had a tray of all their desserts prepared for us to see and choose from. All and all the experience was a solid 4 stars..... good food, great service, and a great view from our table. Price is what is expected for a Pier 39 seafood resteraunt, not cheap but not over what we were expecting.
author: Shannan E.

description:
Has lunch today with 2 screaming and hungry kids. Our waiter Michael was super friendly and patient with us. He helped us settled down fast and was very good with the kids. 

The service was 5/5
Food was 5/5
author: Sunny L.

description:
Great service by Martin.   Great views.   Very good prices considering the outstanding quality of the food.     

Fresh sourdough, wonderful clam chowder.    We had the seared Ahi and the Cioppino were both outstanding.  

Thanks for a great afternoon and great food and service.

Their are a lot of tourist joints at Pier 39, glad to see this is not one of them and rather a truly wonderful restaurant
author: John G.

description: This is a great place to beat the lines and tourists in general. Rather slow in here which is nice and not overwhelming like it could be at other places.  Got seated by the window and had a wonderful view of Alcatraz and the dock downstairs. Onto the food: it was $11 for a clam chowder in a bread bowl which is not bad at all specially with how good it was! Be aware that the rest of the menu is pretty pricey but just scanning it all looked delicious and could probe to be way worth it
author: Samantha N.

description:
The food was awesome! My date and I ordered the clam chowder (WOW!!) as well as the combo fried plate. This was a good amount of food for us both.

The clam chowder is very creamy, flavorful, and has a great consistency.

Fried combo came with generous proportion of fries and calamari, 1 fried fish, & 2 fried jumbo shrimp. Great flavors! I'm pretty picky about ordering fish and chips from most places, but this fish came out fresh & not soggy like most places I've found. I just wish the fish had been a bit bigger because we were sharing however, if I were eating this alone, it would've been the right amount.

Though I don't like going to the wharf due to tourist population, this spot is worth coming back to!!
author: Nabrina M.

description:
Delicious food and incredible view 

Cioppino was amazing ! 
Lobster was a little fatty but delicious none the less 
Look for Lidia, she was great and attentive
author: Amanda T.

description:
Got to Pier 39 late tonight on the way to a weeken wedding and decided to eat here after looking on Yelp for a good place that wasn't expensive.
Sarah, our server, was very personable and attentive and made sure everything was taken care of. When we left the restaurant without getting my credit card back (who knows what I was thinking) she ran outside to give it back as well as give her special way to get a discount on Lyft.
One in our party thought the clam chowder excellent and another loved her cioppino. I thought the fish & chips were just above average but the fries were crispy and tasty, and eating while looking over the bay late at night made for nice atmosphere. 
A great way to end a long day that included at least six hours of driving a waiting in line for at least 30 minutes for a cable car.
author: Mitch P.

description: Had a lovely lunch on pier 39. Clam chowder in a bread bowl was divine! Prices are reasonable and the service on point. You also can't beat the beautiful view!
author: catherine c.

description: Came here after a long day of exploring the city by foot. We had a great time. Our waiter was super charming and sweet, but also very helpful having us navigate the menu. The chowder was fresh and delicious. The seafood tower was spectacular. And the view is really the most amazing backdrop for your meal.
author: Jo W.

description: Great restaurants and great place for family dining. Food was great no complaints at all. Oysters and food was on deck!
author: Meishi M.

description: We were in Sunday the 24th 7:30 PM.  Don't try to skirt around the recommendation from the Concierge being a paid or comped for her recommendation. When I went to desk to tell them of my bad experience the girl working that day confirmed that that Fog Harbor took care of the other girl who worked there. Don't like to be lied to as I was by the manager but obviously it comes from the top down.
author: Ed Z.

description: Gluten friendly menu...amything labeled with a "g" they can make it gluten free. The manager even came out and talked to the table. He shared that himself and the chef also had celiac. All plates that are speciality made with a food allergy in mind are triple checked before coming to the table. Awesome sauce!
author: H W.

description: Clam chowder was pretty good but I think they could afford to have more soup. Crab cake was yummy too.
author: Jive O.

description:
First I have to tell you that I usually don't go to the 'touristy' areas of San Francisco for dinner but this time I am glad I did. My wife and I ended up on Pier 39 looking for some dinner after a long day. We saw this place up on the top level and decided to try it.

When you walk in you can tell this is a popular place. It has a lot of seats (all usually full) and some spectacular views of the bay. 

I ordered the clam chowder as an appetizer and the shellfish platter (A 1/2 crab, mussels, clams, shrimp, and vegetables, oven roasted with olive oil, garlic, and herbs) for dinner. I have to tell you that this was probably one of the best dinners I have ever had in San Francisco. Everything came out great! It had a lot of flavor, nothing was overwhelming and it was all presented really well. 

I will definitely be visiting this place again, it may even be a reason to go back out to San Francisco. If you have a chance, make sure you check it out, you will not regret it.
author: Thomas F.

description: Prawn cocktail, 1/2 Dungeness crab (cold), and linguine with clams...absolutely fantastic.
author: Tyler G.

description: One of the best restaurant I ever been to. Our server Luane provided excellent service and made me feel completely satisfied with everything! My favorite was the clam chowder with crab and bread. The clam linguine and mixed grill was also very delicious. Would come again!
author: Steven N.

description: The food/service was excellent. Our waiter Tyler was awesome. We came here to celebrate my husbands birthday & he brought him a dessert with a candle and sang him happy birthday.
author: Ada R.

description:
If you love fresh seafood, this is the place for you!

My girlfriend and I ordered the Shellfish platter for one, crispy scallops, and a cup of their famous clam chowder.

First glance at the shellfish platter as soon as it arrived at our table made my mouth water with excitement! The aroma from the fresh herbs and spices enhanced the experience!

The creaminess of the clam chowder made me believe why this cup of goodness was crowned Award Winning Clam Chowder.

The crispy scallops was an "okay" for me since I'm not really fond of scallops but my girlfriend thought otherwise.

Overall this lovely restaurant lived up to its name and the great reviews is what got me here!
author: Andrew L.

description: Stellar restaurant in San Francisco.  I was looking for a nice spot in the Pier 39 area, and this was just the kind of place I was looking for.  The menu is extensive-there are good options of seafood and non-seafood items alike.  The clam chowder was so amazing!  The Mixed Grill plate of fish was also spectacular.  The fish tasted so fresh!  The complimentary bread and butter was also good.  The ambiance is romantic and has a water front view of the Pier.  Service was great!  Didn't get to try dessert but it looked good too.  The wait can get a bit long, so I suggest making a reservation ahead of time if you can.  OpenTable has this place on their reservation list.
author: Persila N.

description:
Fog harbor is one of the best restaurants that offer an array of seafood. Fish is so hard to cook, it can quickly become too dry, yet this restaurant cooks their items to perfection. 

What we ordered: the Alaskan cod and soup salad combo

Recommend it highly for those who are afraid of the fishy taste.  The clam chowder is the best in town 

Service is impeccable and if you're here early enough or have a reservation. I'd suggest trying to get the seats with the ocean view.
author: Zoey W.

description: My bias: Pier 39 a tourist trap, mediocre food, not birthday worthy food, but my niece and nephew wanted to go here, and I couldn't refuse them. We had no reservations, 6 of us on a Saturday night, they were packed, yet we were seated in half hour--impressive. I was blown away with the ambience inside: cavernous space, floor to ceiling windows, sweeping gorgeous views of the water, picturesque boats docking, sun glistening, charming landscape. We were seated on the more intimate and quiet upper level, white tablecloths banquette. Our server was energetic, warm, sweet, eager to please. Throughout the meal he was engaged and responsive, proactive, came back to check on us several times and was endlessly patient, e.g. my niece and nephew had an attack of paralysis over the dessert :-) The food: holy sweet mother of God, WTF are these people doing in the kitchen? They're rocking the shit out of it, is what. For starters: shellfish platter and caesar salad. The complimentary bread are rolls, mini sourdough dutch crunch bites, but with a dense, toothsome texture.  A basket of these with soft consistency butter. Gluten-free be damned, I scarfed down 2. The caesar is whole romaine leaves, dressed with a tangy anchovy/egg based dressing, a beautiful balance of tart and creamy, simple yet beyond. The shellfish platter is a sight: half crab, mussels, clams, shrimp, fingerling potatoes roasted with butter, garlic, herbs, lemon wedges. The remarkable thing: it's more than the sum of its parts, not disparate items arranged on a platter. Everything is a symphony. The fish screams pristine FRESH ... this is what SF should be and damn if I wasn't proud to be a local. I got the Seared Pacific Cod,  white beans infused with chorizo butter, spinach, topped with garlic  aioli. This dish left all of us agape--it's an ode to hearty flavors of smoky white beans and wilted spinach, tiny bits of tomato, the broth a rich base. Fyi, cod doesn't usually excite me, but because of the freshness and charred seared cooking technique, I'm a convert. My husband had the cioppino: salmon chunks, clams, shrimp, scallops, mussels stewed in a tomato seafood broth, which was the perfect consistency, not overly thick and not watery either, with a kick of spice, more like lingering heat than a kick to the palate. Neither my niece and nephew, nor my brother had tried cioppino before, and it was unanimous: they loved it. My brother had their crab meat topped filet mignon with a demi glace, garlic mashed potatoes, and spinach. He likes his meat medium well, and they cooked it within an inch of perfection--melt in your mouth tender, yet done all the way through, flavorful with the crab finishing touch, and again the dish came together like a music riff. My sister in law had their fish and chips, and while she loved the fish, the fries she prefers to be thick and soft, rather than skinny and crunchy, but that's not a cooking thing, it's more of a personal preference. My niece and nephew ordered their lobster mac n cheese, and while it's clearly full of quality ingredients, it was a tad dry and not creamy enough. Did I mention that I had their non-alcoholic ginger beer, soda with a strong ginger punch, pieces of fresh ginger over crushed ice. After our entrees, our server, whose name I wish I'd gotten to applaud him publicly, came over with a dessert tray, and asked me to pick out whatever I wanted. We settled on the chocolate banana bread pudding, made with Boudin's fresh sourdough bread, baked with banana and chocolate and topped with vanilla bean sauce. I usually hate bread pudding, it's an oxymoron--"bread" and "pudding" cancels each other out, right? NOT! Bittersweet chocolate, fresh banana, spooned into creamy decadent consistency, delicate vanilla sauce. 6 of us lunging for that plate was not a pretty sight :-)  Our server came over to take out photo and sang happy birthday, all of them so obviously enjoying being there and taking pride in doing their job well--thank you all of you, and I promise when I return, I'll make a point of getting all your names--you deserve a public shout out :-)  Hours later, as we wound down our dinner, it was dark outside and fireworks exploded outside, massive coronas of light, yellow and red in bursts of sunlike spirals ... it was a gift out of nowhere, a spontaneous  celebratory bang and perfect ending to the meal.
author: Ranjan P.

description: Cioppino plus Alcatraz Escape! Best memories in fisherman's wharf! Remember to get a reservation at least 2 days before your lovely dinner!
author: Falconvic C.

description:
Love this place. We keep returning for the Moulin frites, a guilty pleasure. Very friendly staff. Once my son lost his hat in the restaurant and we returned looking for it but couldn't find it. Eventually it turned up and they were kind enough to mail it back to us. 

Great place!
author: Christopher K.

description:
Although my chicken plate was not as good as it could have been, my wife's plate was fantastic.
They say that San Francisco is known for their crabs and chowder. 
This city should be proud of Fog Harbor. The  Dungeness Crab Ciopinno was really good. I can't really describe the taste of good crab, you just have to try it yourself. The tomato soup base complimented the crab in an odd but good way.
Fog Harbor's chowder is better than Boudin's in my opinion. It's more creamy and has more bits of clam in it. 
All in all there was nothing FOGGY about Fog Harbor Fish House. 
I would eat here again.
author: Eugene P.

description:
I owe a big thank you to those Yelpers and Pinners who gave this restaurant rave reviews. I was not only completely blown away by the spectacular window seat view, which we were lucky enough to get, but by the delicious locally caught cuisine.
