I come from a city that boasts some of the best fresh local fish so this is a must to me. On top of the flavor the prices were unbelievable. Convinced that traveling in California was going to be expensive I totally over budgeted for food on this trip. 

I cannot close without giving accolades to the wait staff who despite the crowd was attentive.  I recommend it and will be back. Thank you Fog Harbor for an excellent afternoon dining experience!
author: Cynthia S.

description:
This is probably the only establishment worth visiting at fisherman's wharf.

Really great food here with reasonable prices. Highlights included the chowda in a breadbowl,  surf and turf was great, baked or raw oyster, crab roll.. you know what, everything I've had here has been excellent-- I don't think you can go wrong with any of it :)

ONE THING YOU MUST GET HOWEVER, IS THE CHOCOLATE CAKE. It is AMAZING. Do no pass on this incredible dessert. Seriously. 

In addition to all the great food, the service was excellent and friendly as well. There are views of the water from nearly every seat as well. 

5 stars, no doubt.
author: Kevin W.

description:
Best clam chowder with the best view!!
This restaurant is a must-go whenever you're in SF! Came here on Labor Day weekend and was quoted 45 mins for a party of 2. That may seem like a long time but it's sooo worth the wait. 

We were lucky enough to be seated next to a window table and the view was unbelievable. If possible, try getting here a little early to watch the sun set. I ordered the clam chowder and my boyfriend ordered the seafood penne and we were not disappointed! Both were reasonably price considering it felt like we were in a high end restaurant. 

For anyone looking for a place to eat on the pier, 
Fog Harbor is THE spot!
author: Casey T.

description: The view was right at sunset overlooking the pier and bay, so perfect! And the food was delicious. We tried their award winning clam chowder and it was pretty good, the best part was the service though! Mel was our server and on top of everything, made the night! Also made us want to spend more!! I'd go back definitely, if I had out of towners visiting to get the Pier 39 experience right!
author: Lily S.

description: Really nice place that over looks the water upstairs at Pier 39. I do recommend making reservations. I saw this place pack up just minutes after opening. We did stay for a while and enjoyed the great selection of cocktails. The food was just as great. I do recommend the chili shrimp and clam chowder for appetizers. Very nice establishment and friendly staff. Definitely recommend.
author: Mackenzie V.

description:
A classic destination in San Francisco, I had to come to Fog Harbor to experience SF seafood with a view of the bay. And the food did not disappoint. My friend and I each got a clam chowder before splitting the shellfish platter. The clam chowder was as good as any I have had anywhere, my only disappointment being deciding against the sourdough bread bowl. The platter was also delicious, with a full lobster tail surrounded several crab legs, mussels, clams, and shrimp. The garlic and herb sauce went great with all of the shellfish and as dipping sauce for bread as well. You can rest assured that you will be satisfied and satiated after your meal here.

Fog Harbor has some appetizing but pricey fare, but this is to be expected given its prime location on Pier 39. As a visitor to SF, I successfully found the lunch with a view experience I craved. 

Lastly, the service from our waiter Martin was generous and friendly; ask to sit in his section if you want to ensure attentive service.
author: Arthur C.

description: My daughter and her boyfriend took my husband and I to a birthday dinner here, and it was pretty much perfect.  The manager, Sean, made sure we got a table with a water view, and he had  a pretty flower bouquet placed on our table to make it special!  I ordered the Cioppino which was loaded with seafood and had a nice slightly spicy tomato stew and it came with a giant wedge of garlic bread.  All of the dishes and cocktails we ordered were great! Not to mention our server, Mel, was really sweet and surprised me with a birthday song with his fellow servers and a super yummy lava cake and ice cream desert.  This was our second time at this restaurant, and we will be coming back for sure.  The location is great, right on Pier 39, and the food is reasonable for quality, fresh seafood prepared right.
author: Lisa D.

description:
I came in to try their "award-winning" chowder today.

They really do have the best chowder and fresh bread bowls on the whole SF pier. Are they the best I've ever had? No.

The restaurant is clean, cleanly bathrooms, and you're likely to get seated promptly as I was.

The staff is not friendly. I don't think they like single diners. The frown the hostess made when I asked for a table for one, then as she took me in back she verified that I indeed wanted a table and not the bar. She eventually sat me at a table reluctantly. My waiter was not pleased to see the table just being me. No smile, no nothing. Just "are you ready to order?" He did attempt to upsell me. I said I just wanted a soda and a bread bowl chowder. I let him know I'll be running to the restroom, there's fresh drinks on my table, and I see either a manager or a busser trying to clean my table. Mind you, it had my things on it and a jacket on the chair. My drink is wrong, I have it corrected. I get my food, finish, and my waiter asks if I want dessert after I just asked for the check.

The soda is $3.95. That's about 40% of how much the chowder costs. Pricey.

I still tipped Samir over 25%. Not because I thought he deserved it, but because I didn't have change nor did I feel like waiting on a couple bucks in an establishment.

I get it. Waiters need bigger tables for more money, but if you give single people like me great service, we usually tip a bigger percentage contrary to our bill. We also are easier to get in and out. I stayed for no more than 30 minutes. Having a bad attitude about serving single person tables just makes it for single people to not want to bring family and friends.

Needless to say, my craving has been taken care of. I do not foresee myself coming back to this establishment with any of my family or friends. Staff is just unfriendly. And yes, when a table of 2 got seated behind me, Samir was all smiles and upbeat friendly...you get what you give out. Give people bad vibes, they are more likely to return the favor. Rather than tipping poorly, I'm just writing a negative review on their bad attitudes towards lone diners.

Do yourselves a favor and hold in your contempt and disdain until we are not in your face. Or just simply, change your attitude.
author: Chantel R.

description: Amazing clam chowder--just like their menu says.  The ambiance was nice and the food was delicious.  We really enjoyed the calamari too.
author: Tara C.

description:
What is it about Fog Harbor Fish House that I love so much that every time I am in the Pier 39 or North Beach area whether with tourists or friends this is the one place I take them to? Maybe its because of their amazing clam chowders and tasty crab cakes, or for the fact for as long I always known about this place the wait is never long, as there seems to always be plenty of room to get a table or a place at the bar even during the prized Happy Hour.

And that's the best part of Fog Harbor Fish House, the food is fresh and nicely prepared and, for the most part, is an affordable option in the tourist mecca that is Pier 39. They represent the perfect kinds of seafood dishes that San Francisco has to offer. For the most part they are always filled at Fog Harbor, thanks to their stable of dishes from seafood to meats. 

My friend and I were hungry, so I knew for this trip the Happy Hour menu would be perfect for us as we had another place to get to after our early meal. So when in doubt after perusing the Happy Hour menu, which is very short for a Happy Hour menu, as it only has four dishes total, we simply went with everything on it: fried calamari, red chili shrimp, chicken wings, and garlic fries. Their cocktail menu is actually really thorough, especially for Happy Hour and for some reason I always go with the tried and true, the Lombard Lemonade with its SVEDKA Raspberry vodka, black raspberry liqueur, and fresh squeezed lemonade, it went down like juice, smooth with a hint of sourness. And at 6 dollars for the drink for their Happy Hour price, it wasn't exactly a 50 percent off discount, but it was a reasonably enough priced drink that made me want to drink some more!

As for our dishes, the garlic fries, as always are solid, the perfect Bay Area treat if one could call it that, the crispy lemon calamari served with lemon aioli was nice and crunchy and tasted better than most. The chicken wings were tart and tasty but I felt that a real miss with the Red Chili Garlic Shrimp with its red chili paste, onions, red peppers and garlic, it featured only a handful of shrimp but plenty of an oily red sauce that enveloped the entire dish. With one toasted piece of baguette bread for "dipping" the meal left me wanting something more filling, Thankfully, Fog Harbor offered complimentary warm sourdough bread with butter without asking. Another benefit to sitting at the bar is that Fog Harbor also offers complimentary usage of their portable cell phone battery chargers for those who need a charge but forgot their cords or can't find an outlet. A place that provides an affordable meal and an iPhone charge? We really are in the 21st century aren't we?  

I really do like Fog Harbor, it's really the only place I regularly go to in that touristy area. But be forewarned it,,like many other places in the area, can get pricier the further you look down their menu. Besides going for Happy Hour my best recommendations would be the crab cakes in the appetizer menu, which always taste hearty and fresh and are under twenty dollars as well as the award-winning clam chowder which in a sourdough bowl clocks in at 10 dollars which is quite reasonable. I've been to Fog Harbor when they're slammed and when things are slow, it's the overall quality of food and service that always makes me come back for more each and every time.
author: Jason F.

description: Delicious food! Crab cake was quite pricey and not too tasty, but that's my only complaint. Will return when back in the Bay
author: Karla P.

description:
I made a reservation for a birthday dinner three weeks in advance, and specifically requested a window table for the occasion.  We arrived and were taken to a non-window table.  We saw that there were some available and asked if we could sit there instead, but were told those tables were for people with reservations.  We said we did have a reservation (which we already informed the host of), we were taken back to the front and had to wait about 20 minutes before we were finally seated at a window table.

Service was decent, but not great.  The food was also decent, but not great- crab legs were overcooked and tough, and the food was lukewarm.  The wedge salad and creme brulee were the best parts, to be honest.  Overall, not bad, but definitely not worth $200.
author: Morgan H.

description:
Very delicious though costs a bit high.
Love the green tea and the crab stuffed salmon so much!!!
author: Jane L.

description: Hubby and I ate here after our Alcatraz tour... convenient location on Pier 39. Excellent food, great view of Alcatraz Island, friendly staff, very clean. The garlic blue cheese appetizer was amazing, as was the triple grill. Highly recommend.
author: Abigail S.

description: I had the clam chowder bread bowl with the baked oysters appetizer. It was amazing the chowder was creamy and delicious. The oysters were rich in flavor but extremely hot when they bring them to you so dont burn your tongue. The overall experience was amazing and i will definitely be back
author: Kassy M.

description:
Excellent service and beautiful views
Lobster was perfectly prepared with garlic herb butter and was awesome.  But the taste that will make you come back is the clam chowder and freshly baked sour dough bread.
author: Elaine W.

description: Super nice view of the harbor, we came right when they were opening just for drinks. Got the special margarita and the dirty martini. Both worth the price. It was worth returning or coming for dinner.
author: MK M.

description: What an amazing restaurant! it was my first time in San Fran and my friend and I decided to go here for my birthday dinner on a Thursday night. There was about a 30/45 minute wait so we walked around the pier. They have a lovely gas fireplace out front with seats to get warm while you wait. We started off with a waiter(older gentleman, bald and short) who seemed up tight, no smile and not friendly. He ended up leaving before our food arrived and we had a waiter named Daniel. As soon as Daniel was introduced to us, the 5 start service began! Daniel was OUTSTANDING!! He provided us the BEST service i have ever received at a restaurant in my life! He was knowledgeable, enthusiastic and professional. He checked on us frequently and made us feel like we were a priority. He gave us great recommendations on the desserts and they were mighty delicious! The food was great but Daniel 's service is what made me give this place 5 stars. He is a great representation of this upscale waterfront restaurant. I will be returning to San Fran and I will make sure to visit this restaurant and ask for Daniel as my waiter. He is truly phenomenal at his job! Thank you for the amazing service.... and food :)
author: August E.

description: Great seafood, great view, good vibes! I had the mussels and the oysters for lunch and it wasgreat! The mussels are an appetizers but the portion is gigantic! Service was friendly and efficient and the wait announced (15 minutes) was shorter than expeced!
author: Stephanie L.

description: Place has great food and Jessica our server did a great job. I would highly recommend this place .
author: Sandy L.

description:
The food was delicious! We split the crab cake and half-shell crab for apps, and I had the grilled halibut. Everything was cooked just right, and the fish was definitely fresh. The veggies that they included with the halibut were also tasty. 

My one qualm was that the server we had was incredibly unresponsive. I only got one refill of my water after I'd already finished my meal. I had to get her attention and ask for a refill, despite my empty glass being visible at the end of the table for half of the meal. It was one of those situations where she just dropped off the food and then never came back to check on us. I'd love to give this place 5 stars, but today's mediocre service doesn't warrant it.
author: Rob V.

description:
While strolling through an incredibly busy day at the wharf on Mother's Day, I was a little wary of the Wife (it's her day after all) selection of Fog Harbor fish house for a mid afternoon snack, as experience has taught me that deep in the tourist spots, things go frequently wrong.
Well, I was very wrong on this one.  Fog Harbor was very busy - sporting a 30 minute wait at 3:00 p.m., we were given the option (party of five) to sit at the bar area tables.  A good choice, since we were just snacking and going.  

First up:  the obligatory sourdough.  Oh my...it could be a meal by any other name.  I dreamed of all the things I could put on it to make the worlds most amazing sandwhich....oh wait, I digress!  

We ordered a sampling of items - the fried calamari (crisp, appropriately prepared), the mussels with shallots and garlic and fries - outstanding and to top it off their best in San Francisco (their claim) chowder.  I haven't had a chowder in a long time, but I'm glad I had this one.  A wonderful, not too rich, appropriate distribution of clams made this the perfect afternoon snack.  

Very friendly service - another advantage of sitting at a bar-area table!
author: Patrick K.

description: Great food, ambiance, and service given to us by Khaiman made our visit to Pier 39 outstanding!
author: Jean R.

description: A couple of years ago, my mom and a couple of friends and I were in San Francisco and stopped off here for some lunch.  We were delighted with how wonderful it was. Fantastic seafood and fantastic sourdough bread (Of course!)  We stumbled upon this delight by accident because everywhere else we looked was too busy to get served in a timely fashion.  For being a sit down and classy restaurant, it was a pleasant surprise how quickly they had us seated and eating. Still, 2 years later, I find my self remembering this wonderful lunch and drooling over the thought of going back.  I will have to make another trip to the Bay soon.
author: Vanessa M.

description:
Ok, I thought that Fog Harbor could not get any better  and it completely exceeded all of my expectations. While my previous review was about the food, which was again outstanding, I would like to make this review about the service. 

I threw them a curve ball by bringing 10 other collegues with my wife's profession. All four corners of the USA are here. Buffalo, to Detroit, to Atlanta, Phoenix and Oklahoma. All of which will rave about this place and recommend to friends and family when they get the home. We had a small 20 minute wait which was understandable for a group our size. 

The manager, Mario again, did not skip a beat.. He was always making sure that everything was up to his standards. It is evident that he loves what he does and represents the establishment with an amazing passion. Being a business owner myself, I would hope to convey to the owners of the Fog Harbor my opinions. Somehow, I will. 

Our server, Neesa (apologies if misspelled!) was exceptional! Despite our table consistently talking shop, she was on the ball! The place was pretty packed and she had her share of tables to serve. I cannot say enough good about her. 

I would be safe to say, no matter when you go, or who on their wait staff takes care of you, rest assured, you will not regret coming here.
author: Kenn B.

description: Excellent restaurant for lunch to celebrate our anniversary. Had the shellfish platter with a lobster tail and it was perfect for two people. Great service and awesome views of the harbor!
author: Alix F.

description: 3.7 stars... It was pretty good... But its a bit of a tourist trap... I've had far better for far less $$$
author: Adam C.

description:
Great place for wonderful seafood! Our waiter, Curtiss, was super helpful and so nice! Great ambiance and great service! Very happy with our night. 

Highly recommend the clam chowder and the calamari!
author: Alisa K.

description: My family and I recently made a trip to San Francisco and we were walking through the pier after going to the aquarium and decided to stop by for a bite to eat. The scenery was nice and the interior is beautiful. I had a strawberry daiquiri (yummy) and the seafood penne. I thought it was very yummy and ate every last bite. It is pricey and definitely a tourist attraction but it was delicious nonetheless.
author: Karen L.

description: Been eating here for the holidays per family tradition for years now. Just finished Christmas dinner and our server Curtis was the best and made the meal really special. Can't wait to come back!! Thanks again Curtis!!
author: Connor M.

description:
Beautiful view with delicious food. 

My family and I came here on a Friday night, and the wait was for 30-45 minutes. The waiting area is nice because there was a fire place to keep you nice and warm. I would say that we were seated at the 45-minute mark, so the hostess gave a great estimate. 

The restaurant has very dim lighting which is great because it accentuates the light setting across the bay and ferries as you look outside. Our waiter was great! He took our orders whenever we were ready and was very prompt in delivering our drinks and food. I ordered the "skinny" version (148 calories) of the Cucumber-Basil Gimlet ($11.50) and the Short Rib Pappardelle ($24). While waiting for our food, he gave us fresh, warm bread which was absolutely delicious. For a party of 9, we devoured the bread instantly. Oops! 

- CUCUMBER-BASIL GIMLET ($11.50): it is a refreshing drink! I couldn't really taste any alcohol at all, so don't expect to get drunk off of this drink. To be honest, if you've eaten pho, this drink totally reminds me of it because of the basil, but I'm not complaining! 

- SHORT RIB PAPPARDELLE ($24): boy oh boy, this dish looked completely appetizing and smelled amazing when it was placed in front of me. I instantly dove straight in to eating it because I could not resist. As I was eating it, I did realize that this dish can be pretty salty, so prepare to drink lots of water! However, the short rib was tender, and the noodle was cooked perfectly. I would recommend that if you are interested in ordering the dish, you should order more bread because the sauce taste fantastic with the bread as well! Carb overload! 

This restaurant was great as we enjoyed our time here because each one of us enjoyed our food. On top of that, since we were celebrating my birthday, the waiter brought out a Creme Brûlée for me which was absolutely delicious.
author: Susan V.

description:
This place has everything you could want when it comes to fresh seafood, great views and reasonable prices. The restaurant sits right in the heart of Pier 39 so you must come in.  Our server was Nilou and she was awesome. We had just gotten into the city from San Antonio, TX and she took time to write down some local places to go for live music, she allowed us plenty of time to sit and visit instead of most servers who want to rush you. She even helped us pick our meal (chili shrimp was amazing) by suggesting plates. 
Nilou made our experience at Fog Harbor priceless!!
author: Nikki S.

description: Celebrated my daughter's bday on Oct 15.There was a strand of hair in a lemon when served to us. The seafood was over cooked. I've been to the great seafood restaurants cuz I luv seafood so its very disappointing.The clam chowder is not so great, and the pasta on the child menu was so dry and no taste so I have to ask our waitress to exchange it. The service was good though but the cook sucks. Not worth the money we spent.
author: Dina C.

description:
This Place is amazing the second we walked by this place the hostess greeted us and was really friendly Great First impression 

 Appearance this place is awesome.  The outside looked like a ship or a boat and I liked the different color toned wood floors, the comfortable seating as well as the windows overlooking the harbor and ocean. Everything looked clean as well.



We spent all morning walking the pier and surrounding area trying to pick the best place for lunch. We ended up here because it was one of the highest ranked seafood restaurants on yelp
 I think it is hard to find good restaurants that offer 5 star services and 5 star food quality but this one has done it. I really enjoy this place, the view is wonderful, right at the end of the pier, you can see Alcatraz from the table.



We ordered the stuffed lobster with crab, crab sandwich, clam chowder and calamari. Everything was delicious. The food arrived to our table fast and everything was hot and fresh. Calamari was fried and seasoned to perfection and the clam chowder was amazing! Crab sandwich and fresh squeezed lemonade were both delicious



All the food was delicious! The complimentary warm bread at the beginning of the meal was delicious. The meal was pricey but the views, the location and the food made it worth it. I had a really great meal and service at Fog Harbor. I was impressed by the service




Great seafood, nice atmosphere and beautiful views.. It's definitely a must get again on my list. Overall Id  recommend this place to friends and family . Bit on the pricey side but the location, views, quality and ambience are worth the price. Greats drinks, seafood and view! Definitely the best restaurant in the wharf.
author: Jones K.

description: First time here and definitely not the last. Food was really good and service was great. Their clam chowder is a must try! We tried the lobster tail and filet mignon. No complains at all, everything was good.  Save some room for dessert and try their creme brulee, it's the best!
author: Jai R.

description: Zero Stars for this place.....sitting here waiting on our food and everyone who ordered after us have gotten thier food!!! All we ordered were fresh oysters and a appetizer platter.!!!  Really ...not only that we havent gotton our refill on some freaking water.... never offered hot bread!!! 4 different times they have come to our table thinking it FINALLY our food!! Nope these people getting wrong plates to wrong peoples table!!! Im so disappointed!!
author: Monique M.

description: Great experience from appetizer to dessert. Tyler our server we patient, knowledgeable and suggested all the great dishes we should try.  Definitely a place to come back to more often.
author: Sylvia M.

description:
The foods were kinda sour overall and the waiter was rude 
I wont go back to this place
author: Andy K.

description: The Only reason I'm giving 3 stars instead of 1 is because the food tastes great. Service was so bad and I don't really blame the staff, it's either bad management or they're short on staff. We waited so long before we got water and we had to ask for bread. Three tables who came after us got their food and left before we got ours. No one bothered to refill our water, bring the extra plates or napkins we asked for.  We were not taken seriously as customers at all. Three older gentleman came to the table next to us and they were given water bread and wine right away and their food arrived soon after; I was surprised. After all this, the waitress had the audacity to ask me if she wanted to charge me one of the tips automatically.
author: Anonymous A.

description: Had a hard time picking a place but once you walk past pier 39 touristy stuff, you find a relaxing, high class setting here. Our waiter, Tyler, was super friendly and attentive. We enjoyed the views, wine, and food was amazing.
author: Abby F.

description: We went there on Friday night and the food and service was excellent. Location is great even for us local San Franciscans. The Apple crisp dessert was super fresh and delicious. Loved the fresh crab!
author: Julie B.

description: This was my first time in San Francisco so my expectations were really high. It was a Sunday (4/22) and the greeting staff was ok nothing special. Our waitress was very friendly so she's the reason for the two stars! Now the food, I ordered the surf and turf which was steak, lobster tail, veggies and mashed potatoes. I was VERY disappointed. Steak was drenched in some type of liquid that over powered the actual taste of the steak. The lobster didn't taste fresh. I was expecting more from a $54 entree. I was so over it! Our total bill came up to $110 normally I would've asked to speak with the manager but at this point I'm like there's no correcting this situation. We should've listen to our Uber driver who suggested the Crab House.
author: B M.

description: Been to this fine Pier 39 establishment on multiple occasions with family and friends.  The service is always good. and everyone there is so polite. Went there today with a friend of mine who is in town for a conference from Memphis, and this is her first trip to San Francisco.  I played tour guide, and our destination was this restaurant.  When we arrived, they said that the wait wait would be 20-30 minutes; however it was shorter than that. We were able to get a window table overlooking the water, and since it was a phenomenal day, the views were amazing. My friend got Fish and Chips that were great, as I helped her finish them. I had a cup of Clam Chowder and the Seafood Pasta, which was fantastic.
author: Jeremy K.

description:
This place (and all of Pier 39) is insanely crowded. You'll get jammed like sardines in here. The staff are pretty accommodating in that they'll try to fit you even if there doesn't seem to be any space. That's a double-edged sword. I actually recommend sitting at the bar if you're in a small group since there's slightly more space there.

Service was decently good, but it understandably slow given the massive crowds.

I enjoyed the food, though it was pricey for a somewhat-average quality. It's probably more important to mention that they have a wide selection of good drinks for the ethanoically-inclined.
author: Nathan Y.

description: My girlfriend and I just got into San Francisco for vacation and we were craving the famous San Francisco seafood. We looked on Yelp and that's how we found Fog Harbor Fish House. The restaurant was busy; very ambient, fun, and family friendly. We got seated immediately though and the view was very nice. We could see the Golden Gate in the distance, the restaurant was right by the sea so on one side you could gaze out into the sea and on the other you could people watch and see the city itself. The food was delicious and is the biggest reason I'm giving four stars. We got the clam chowder in a bread bowl and wow both my girlfriend and I agreed it was the best clam chowder we've ever had. The chowder was thick, creamy, and had just enough seafood and the bread bowl was very complimentary to the chowder. My girlfriend got the Swordfish and she said the fish was cook very well and the sauce enhanced the fish. I got the Seafood Penne and the mixture of pasta, fish, shellfish, and tomatoes was perfect. You could taste everything and nothing took away flavor from another. Overall the meal was delicious and although pricey I would say being seafood and the location the price was fair. The only reason I'm giving four stars instead of five is because our waitress didn't seem to happy to be there while rest of the staff seemed happy. She did her job to the bare minimum and I don't think I ever saw her smile once. It kind of made the experience awkward whenever she came around to take orders or fill our water but aside from that our experience was great.
author: Simon L.

description: Everything that a classic seafood restaurant on the pier should have.... great views, nice atmosphere, friendly and quick service. Had lobster tail, was perfectly cooked and the potatoes were delicious. The sourdough beard served was warm and soft. Perfect outing,  worth the price
author: Brad S.

description:
Made reservation via OpenTable and was seating immediately -'view was incredible with sunset and Alcatraz.  Food and wine list was great -'prices were reasonable based on location/view 

Highly recommend!
author: Ellen W.

description: Ive been here a few times already and i will say their food is GREAT!!! The last time i was here was for my mothers birthday and the service is beyond awesome ! Everyone is so attentive food was quick our server was the best, made great conversations kept coming back the right number of times. I would say the only disappointing part was wait time, we were quoted 30-45 min and we actually waited 1hr the last time. But other then that Overall expierence here was Good!
author: Barbara B.

description: This was not my first time at fog Harbor but this was the best experience I've ever had! Our server Sarah was the best!! As soon as we sat down Sarah greeted us with a smile and throughout our whole meal she was very attentive. It's hard to find great food and service now and days and fog harbor exceeded our expectations! We started off with two glasses of Chardonnay and continued our meal by having the award-winning clam chowder and finished with the shellfish platter. Thank you Sarah and fog harbor for the great experience
author: Celina G.

description:
We hit the Fog Harbor Fish house on Pier 39,Fishermans wharf for lunch. All the tables to the far end of the restaurant were full but we were lucky enough to get a table right beside the windows overlooking the sea.They definitely offer the best views of the Golden Gate bridge(as long as the skies are clear with no fog), the alcatraz island and the blue ocean.

Impeccable service, the server helped us decide between items on the menu for starters as well as the main course. For example, my friends and I didn't want the crab with the bones so they got us the Cioppino with just the crab meat.

Starters: 
Red Chili Garlic Shrimp: Tangy, sweet and sour, really loved it.
Crab Cake: The meat was perfectly cooked and it was upto the reviews you'd already see on Yelp.

Main Course:
Swordfish: Impressed!
Cioppino: We ordered the usual Cioppino but when the check arrived, it said the 'Lazy Cioppino'. I wasnt so impressed because all i could taste was tomato sauce. The scallops, the mussels and the salmon were cooked however there weren't any flavors to it from the curry/sauce.
author: Sebin K.

description: I found this restaurant on Yelp after putting in a search for seafood. The reviews were pretty good so why not?! We were seated immediately for lunch and were surrounded by a very busy and relatively loud dining area. I guess that's to be expected considering it was lunch and we were also there during spring break season. Our server was awesome. Our orders were taken quickly and we were eating in no time! My husband ordered the ciopinno (sp?) and I ordered the full dungeoness crab. Both dishes were delicious! We finished off our meal with the apple crumb dessert. It was huge but still delicious! Please note, our server kept giving us Biscoff cookies (love those things!!) and we gladly took what he gave. The view is pretty so if you choose to eat here, ask for a window seat so you can soak up the scenery!
author: Christine B.

description: Went here for last meal in 2017. Totally satisfied with both services and meals. They also served sour dough as starters. Tried their holiday specials' meals, started with fried oyster and followed by jumbo scallops and crab risotto. All of them were cooked to perfections. Ingredients are fresh and service was excellent. Definitely one of best restaurant in SF!
author: Hadi W.

description: This place is great! Ordered the lobster tail, muscle fries, & goat cheese salad and that was more than enough for my boyfriend and I to share! We got seated quickly, even got a window table, and our waitress was awesome! We will definitely be back again
author: Kaila B.

description:
Lunch for a table of 6.

This restaurant is more of a fine-dining spot on the very casual and family-fun Warf area. It's located up the stairs right as you get to the entrance of Pier 39. 

The entrance was beautiful with an outdoor seating area with a lovely fireplace. They greeted us right away and seated us next to a window. We had a great view of the tour boats and even saw Alcatraz off in the distance. 

Our server was very patient with us. She kept our cups refilled and answered all our questions professionally and with a smile. The dining area was much larger than expected as it wrapped around the kitchen and bar area. 

The food was delicious. The calimari was probably one of the best I've had - it was tender and perfectly seasoned. Some at our table couldn't even tell it was calimari because it was so tender. My dad, usually very picky, enjoyed his meal thoroughly. He ordered the new york strip and mash. Everyone finished their meals and we took nothing home. The salmon I ordered was flaky and cooked evenly pink and tender throughout. 

Although the prices were a little higher than what I would have liked to pay, for the experience and the care they put into plating and cooking, I would eat here once in a while.
author: Mary S.

description: I ate here with my family after a trip to Alcatraz. Justin H. was our waiter and did an amazing job of accommodating our special food requests! The food was amazing and so was the service. Great food with a view is all you need for a fun trip to San Fran.
author: Frieda F.

description: Came here a few months back for a company dinner. They take big group reservations (ours was for 10). It's very San Francisco tourist when you think about the location at pier 39 BUT the food here was so delicious. I had obligatory clam chowder, muscles with fries (delicious) and salmon. My co workers sitting across from me had a plate of whole crab in butter sauce. It looked amazing and perfect! I highly recommend coming here. The views I heard are great. Unfortunately I came on a rainy night but cheers to good service cause they had umbrellas we can borrow to get to our taxi.
author: Stephanie J.

description: Great seafood restaurant at Pier 39! At first I thought this place is one of the tourists trap but I am glad I gave it a try! Sonu tried
author: Sumith K.

description: One of numerous visits here & they never let us down! Michael was our server...amazing! Food was great, cocktails wonderful.
author: Julie K.

description:
I was a little skeptical about eating at an expensive restaurant because I always leave hungry. Lol. 

I ordered the Garlic Roasted Dungeness Crab for an entrée and raw oysters for the appetizer. The crab came with baby potatoes and seasoned vegetables. Sooooo good and plentiful. 

On top of that, my waiter was fine. His name is Pierre. Not only was the view from our table beautiful, but so was his smile. 

I'd definitely go back! Lol
author: Stephanie H.

description: Stopped by this place after our Alcatraz tour. Host staff isn't the friendliest; kind of dry and not really bubbly. The gentlemen that escorted us to our table (not sure if he was a manager helping out or what) but he wasn't friendly. Basically just sat us at our table and handed us the menus. No "welcome to fog harbor...such and such will be with you shortly" so we just all sat staring at each other until the waitress came over. It took her awhile but thankfully she was sweet. Her name was Sarah. We ordered the Hibiscus Margarita (really good) and the other blAckberry drink. Had the clam chowder. Pretty good choice. Also the calamari was reallly reallly good! My son enjoyed the sliders also. For our next course we had the garlic crab and the lobster. Both were great choices. Other than the blah hostesses, everything went well!
author: Chloe C.

description: We had a great experience at this restaurant after picking it off of a Yelp review 10 minutes earlier. We were in San Francisco to see the Blue Angels and we decided to try this restaurant. The wait wasn't as long as they had quoted and they have this great texting system when your table is ready . Tyler was a fantastic, attentive and helpful server. He even brought my daughter a birthday dessert and sang happy birthday with us . I didn't think this restaurant did that kind of thing (and we had 3 little kids with us BTW) . The food was great.  Wonderful raw oysters, yummy clam chowder, and you have to try the clams linguine. The best I ever had! So flavorful. We had a beautiful and amazing seat next to the window and got to see the sunset. I would highly recommend this restaurant!
author: Karen G.

description: Amazing seafood. The chowder is absolutely to die for. Calamari is fantastic. Everything is great, definitely make this a stop if you are in the area and want dinner with a nice view.
author: Em M.

description: I know this place is the epitome of touristy, but the service was pretty solid and the food was good.  Not annoyingly pricey for Pier 39, but not cheap.  Beer selection is a little light.
author: Kaaba K.

description:
A little spendy coming from Dallas, but probably in line for SFO. At any rate, everything was great!

We sat at the bar and ordered a full dinner - oysters, clam chowder in a bread bowl with crab, crab/mango/avocado ceviche, and crab cake. We might have overdone the crab but YOLO, amirite? These things plus the warm sourdough bread and butter were perfect!
author: Jayci G.

description: Drinks were great! The chowder was delicious. In fact the seafood was the best I ate while in San Francisco. Great view and efficient service. Enjoyed it would eat there again when visiting San Francisco.
author: Rebecca C.

description: A good restaurant, nestled amoung the tourist joints at Pier 39. Our fish was fresh and well prepared.  We enjoyed our dinner.  It was a little noisy.
author: Greg B.

description: Clam chowder! Delicious, thick, creamy packed with clams and potatoes. Enjoy with a great view. A must try on Pier 39.
author: Achu G.

description: The cioppino and clam chowder were delicious. THe service was great! The manager/owner gave us a table by the window with a great view of the harbor, the Golden Gate Bridge and Alcatraz. They were very accommodating and friendly even though we had two little ones with us and left quite a mess.
author: Loan N.

description: I mean just wow. For a first-timer in San Francisco, this place really knocked my socks off. The clam chowder in the bread bowl was perfect accompanied with the beautiful view of the bay. Tyler was our server and was absolutely amazing! Would 10/10 recommend the calamari, the lemon aioli is probably the best I've ever had. Express ticket to flavor town!
author: Melanie S.

description: Hats off to this restaurant.  Finally a restaurant that is fabulous, in every way.  We arrived on a busy Thursday night, and we're seated within 5 min., we had a wonderful table, with a view of the docks. I ordered the flat iron steak and my partner had the garlic crab.  These were suggested by our waiter.  Both were excellent, good portions.   Staff were fantastic and very obliging, nothing was too much.  They took care of everything. This restaurant was like a lovely warm hug on a freezing cold evening.  I highly recommend this restaurant.
author: Ria P.

description:
Went up to San Francisco for the day with some family that had never been there before and wanted to find a good all around restaurant to treat them to.
We picked the right place! This place was spot on! Everyone got something different from the "World Famous Clam Chowder", to the burger and my grilled shrimp brochette. My son stuck to the simple grilled cheese and I had to fight him off my shrimp lol!

The view was beautiful, the atmosphere inside was just the right amount of upscale with still being relaxed enough to not feel out of place in our sight seeing attire. The only draw back was that it was a bit pricey. But that just allowed us to make sure we enjoyed every bite and the food was good enough to be worth the price!
author: Carolee M.

description: I have been this restaurant only once and they have left a lasting impression on my mind. I had their seafood Penne and their Cioppino, but the king of their dishes is by far the clam chowder. It is beautifully prepared and teases your appetite with the most exquisite flavors and tastes. That clam chowder is remarkable among all the dishes there and I will only be going for that in the future. The ambiance is just right and adds an extra layer to this great place. However, if you're coming, definitely get the clam chowder, if I haven't said it enough! You wouldn't regret it!
author: Ronaldinhio T.

description:
I'm going to start out by saying I had been on vacation from the state of Colorado. So you can bet that I'm a food snob with a need for good atmosphere. It should also say a lot that I'm writing this review three days later back in my home state.

I also want to start by saying I have always been turned off by fish. My dad had made fun of me my whole life for disliking fish since it's mostly what my family eats except for me. 

I ordered the pacific sole (their fresh caught fish of the day) and it was delicious as all heck! It inspired me to eat more fish in the future. 
It was well cooked, So the meat had been tender, flavorful, and moist and well seasoned to cut the fishiness. The choice was suggested by our waiter who had been patient even when I had been a little rude and loud - a typical college kid with too much freedom. The greens that came with the fish was well balanced with the fish and steamed well too. 

The sparkling ginger lemonade had been refreshing after a day of touristing the area like a chicken with no head or direction. It had a nice zing of ginger, but well balanced with the sweetness of the lemonade. It also helped soothe my headache. 

The calamari was a bit pricy for the amount you received and didn't seem too special. It was tender and the skin was crispy though. The sourdough bread was fresh baked and helped soothe hungry stomachs waiting for their entree! 

One of my cousins ordered the clam chowder and drown it down quickly. She believed it was the best chowder she has ever tried, and she's from Southern California. 

The waiters and hostesses were professional, polished, and extremely welcoming. They can make you feel fancy while you sport your big hat, Hawaiian print shirt, and fanny pack (my cousin's literal attire when we are here). They never once showed frustration or struggle  navigating through the small aisles of the eating area, and carried themselves very well. They were always on time, and they were extremely courteous. Even when my cousin had to ask her where the bathroom had been three times. 

The view of the ocean was lovely, and also calming. The air wasn't too hot or cold. The decor was tasteful and crisp, and there's not a bad thing to say about this establishment. They are a perfect staff to visit with great dishes to try if you're new to the Bay Area! It was a star attraction on my whole trip to San Francisco.
author: Karen L.

description:
Our last night in San Francisco brought us here for dinner. Best meal we had this week. We were originally seated next to a large table with some very loud children, I mean LOUD. We joked about it to the waitress, who proceeded to mention it to the manager. He not only reseated us to a quieter area, but comped our desserts and was extremely apologetic, even though it wasn't his fault. 

Once we were reseated, they switched our server. Mel did an awesome job for us. He was friendly and attentive. Our service here could not have been better. Many of the restaurants have the waiter take the order and then others do all of the work. Not here. 

As far as the food, it was fantastic. We had the cioppino and the filet. Both were just delicious. The desserts that we ended up getting for free was the chocolate cake and tiramisu, and apple with walnut. They were also delicious. The cake melted in your mouth. 

We eat at a lot of excellent restaurants and I would definitely put this one up with the best of them.
author: Lee K.

description: Amazing place! My two girls had salmon and I had the seafood penne.  OMG, SO AMAZING! Calamari appetizer is a must. My 4 yo had the kids fish and chips and we took one bite and that was it.  Dry and bland so don't bother with wasting $ on kids meal. The bread.. oh the bread... dreaming about it still.
author: Babs L.

description: Incredibly delicious food. We had the oysters... so fresh. Excellent seafood. We sat at the bar... view was amazing. Drinks were outstanding. Mohitos and a lipstick lemon drop. Awesome!!!!
author: Jeff F.

description:
Great food, excellent service, lovely view and relaxing atmosphere; in my less than 24 hour trip to SFO, i ate here twice it was so good. 

A little on the pricey side for sure, but you can't beat the view, the food or service and the management was particularly pleasant to deal with.

Thanks for a great time:)
author: Carina E.

description:
Very ambivalent about this place. First downside is that they don't take reservations so when we (locals) wanted to go here at 7 PM on a Saturday night, we knew we'd have to wait a while. It ended up taking about 45 minutes.

PROS
-Amazing views! We got seated in the area right on the water. The sun was setting right behind the GGB. It was great. 
-We couldn't decide which bottle of wine we wanted so the waiter let us all taste both! They have a pretty good wine selection.
-For apps, we got the ahi tuna poke and the baked oysters. Both were delicious! The baked oysters were great in an interesting way... Spinach, bacon, and cheese, yum!

CONS
-Once we decided which wine we wanted, it took the waiter a realllllly long time to actually bring out our bottle (at least 20 minutes).
-Our mom had been craving a salmon salad with bacon since well before dinner so when we saw a Salmon "Club" Salad on the menu, she was ecstatic! Unfortunately, when our food came out, they brought the wrong salad... It was lettuce lightly dressed and a piece of salmon on top. When she told the waiter that it was the wrong salad, all he did was take it back and add bacon. So disappointing.
-I had the half garlic roasted dungeness crab. While it was very good, there was nothing with it. I was, at least, expecting some butter to dip my crab in.

Again, really ambivalent about this place because the food was pretty good but there were just a few blunders. It's also pretty expensive here.
author: Julia M.

description:
Two stars for the delicious clam chowder in bread bowl with crab.  Usually bread bowls are heavy, sodden blocks of gummy goop.  Not this one!  It tasted fresh baked, still warm, crisp crackly crust.  The chowder was thick and creamy, and the $7 supplement for crab was worth it.  

Zero stars for everything else.  Service was ridiculous.  From having to hunt down our own silverware and napkins, to finally resorting to taking the plates off another table so we could eat.  Or server was not to be seen the entire meal.  

Zero stars for the junky crab cakes with nary a flake of crab inside - they tasted like pre frozen, discount pucks of subpar stuffing.  The salad on the side was inedible.  How do you mess up a few leaves of lettuce?  I've never tasted this particular variety of lettuce, so chewy yet limp. 

Zero stars for the chilled Dungeness crab appetizer with cocktail sauce.  Actually, the cocktail sauce tasted fine, but again we had to hunt it down even though it's half the description of the dish.  The crab was dry and the shell was incredibly dirty, caked with spongy greenish brownish muck that fell off and mingles inextricably with the few dry bits of crab I was able to pick out.  

The server finally acknowledged us as she brought the bill, smiling warmly and asking if there was anything we needed.  Well, yes there was, but we took care of it ourselves already.  We still tipped 18%, the lowest amount marked on the bill, but we will not be coming back.
author: Alex L.

description: Excellent dinner with an excellent view Of the Golden Gate and Alcatraz. Had their shellfish tower, wedge salad, and awesome clam chowder! I highly recommend it.
author: Jenn S.

description: Food was good.  Fresh seafood with a great view.  Waiting was not bad (5-10 minutes).  We were there twice in our 4 day vacation and our waiter and waitresses for both times was not bad.  Except the hostess was not very accommodating.  We had requested to change to a booth across from us since we had 2 kids with us.  Thought it wouldn't be a problem since we just got seated and the booth just got opened up.    The hostess said we would have to wait another 30 minutes if we want to trade to the booth.  She probably was having a bad day.  A family of four adults got seated at the booth 10 minutes later.
author: tammy l.

description: AMAZING!!  My advice!! Make reservations!! We waited an hour, but we were able to walk around & they txt us when it's ready! Ask for Curtis! HE IS BY FAR THE BEST SWEETEST WAITER I HAVE EVER HAD!!! My favorite was the seafood platter!! Soo delicious!
author: Jeanette G.

description: Sourdough bread was fantastic but the buttered roll on the crab roll overpowered the crab aioli inside. The beer batter on the fish & chips was pretty good. The dressing for the simple salad was great. Overall it was good but nothing fantastic.
author: Jaemi M.

description: The service was amazing. The views gorgeous. The food was absolutely delicious. I highly recommend eating here.
author: Halley S.

description: Just came back from fog harbor service, drinks, crabcakes, and oysters were wonderful. However the fish and chips were terrible! They were an unappetizing dark color. I think they refried the fish and chips that was a mistake order. When I sat down I ordered oysters and crab cake first then about 10 minutes later I ordered the fish and chip and some how the fish and chips came out to our table only 5 minutes later. There is no way the fish and chips can be cooked in five minutes.
author: Chu T.

description: Terrible fraudulent expensive but quality is just bad. Lobster tail was not fresh and small, mixed grill just bland with 3 small thin and dry pieces of fish. The worst were the 2 fillet mignon steaks that my son and daughter ordered medium and came almost well done with abnoxious Worcestershire souce underneath on plate to hide the fact they were just warmed up. Absolutely discusted with this restaurant. Do not go.
author: Nisim H.

description:
I try to steer away from Pier 39 since my first initial visit back in high school. YES, it was that long ago. 

I must admit, I miss the street performers, sea lions, live music and especially waterfront dining at Fog Harbor Fish House. 

They do offer excellent seafood and shellfish. Strikingly, their steak is quite legit.

My favorites:

- Ahi Poke
- Dungeness Crab
- New York Steak (medium rare)
- Wild Salmon

Too many delicious offerings have me at an instant food coma. Oh, no worry; I always have second stomach for dessert. 

Whether you are playing touristy or not. Pier 39 is a must on your list of things to do in SF. Better yet, Fog Harbor is where you want to be be be...

I hope you give this place a try. Cheers!
author: Owie N.

description:
Amazing views of the bay and the Golden Gate Bridge. Incredibly affordable and delicious seafood considering the location! Tried to book online and then called, nothing available until after 9pm, but they take walk-ins as well. Walked up and was seated within 5 minutes at prime dinner time, just before 7pm. 

Service was friendly and quick. Good selection of wines from Napa and Sonoma. I ordered a crisp and refreshing Napa Sauvingon Blanc. Another diner raved about her non-alcoholic Ginger Lemonade. My dining companions loved the seafood mixed platter and the fried fish and chips with calamari platter. I opted for local pacific sole with a caper berre blanc sauce over a bed is sautéed spinach, red peppers and fingerling potatoes. Fish was perfectly pan-seared and seasoned well. Veggies were nicely cooked. Would definitely order it again!
author: Karen B.

description:
Such a lovely restaurant with great ambiance. 

My boyfriend and I ordered the Shellfish Platter ($59 for two) as well as a bowl of clam chowder. It was the perfect amount to fill us up with happiness. The 1/2 crab, mussels, clams, shrimp, and fingerlicking potatoes tasted SO DARN delicious with some magic buttery garlic+herbs sauce. It was fresh and well-balanced.

LOVE LOVE LOVE this place. It can be for a casual date or fancy night out. :)
author: Jenny H.

description:
Early November vacation to San Francisco...I fully recommend Fog Harbor Fish House for its quality and menu options. Fog Harbor has a good pub / restaurant ambiance and feel...sometimes crowded but this was November.

I was impressed with the prompt and polite service. Since I was traveling alone, I sat up at the bar three nights in a row and tried a different menu option each night. All good for the price.

I am giving my review 4 stars for quality of service and delicious menu items. I will make it a point to revisit when touring San Francisco again.
author: Alex B.

description: Food was ok the steak was chewy not a good quality of meat. However service was good.. I recommend the salmon!
author: Shauni H.

description: Ordered 4/17/2018 the $29.00 salmon, a relatively small fish piece (soaked in fried oil and slightly burned in edges) arrived with a side non eatable salad. I told the server (on the bar) about the salad (I didn't touch it) and he didn't even suggest to replace it. So I paid and left after 5 minutes.
author: Yaniv S.

description:
Let me start off by saying that I can't wait for the day I come back to San Francisco again so I can come back to this incredible restaurant. The food, service, and atmosphere (especially the view!) were all impeccable. 

My fiancé and I had an early dinner reservation since we were going on a sunset sail afterwards, and got seated by the window overlooking the bay. The staff were friendly and attentive from start to finish knowing we had to leave by a certain time.

Now on to the best part, the FOOD. We ordered the calamari as our appetizer. I'm kind of a calamari fanatic and order it in every restaurant we go that has it on their menu. This was hands down the best calamari that I've ever had. For dinner, we ordered the cioppino and linguine & clams to share. Next time we're back I doubt I'll try anything else off the menu because I can't wait to have both of these dishes again. We were both pretty stuffed at this point but their dessert tray had been tempting us from nearby the entire evening that we just had to order something and that something ended up being delicious tiramisu. 

I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone who is nearby Pier 39!
author: Kara C.

description: We ordered the blue cheese garlic bread, crab cakes and fish-n-chips.  Hardly any flavor, avoid crab cakes at all cost.
author: Scott S.

description: The food was ok, I was not too happy with to mini crab cakes for 19$ crazy!! But the crab was good just super expensive
author: Mustafa H.

description: What a great night. We didn't have reservations.  We walked up at six.  They gave us the last window seat. Menu selections are extensive. All the seafood is fresh.  Mostly local.  Our server Justin was Very sincere, open and honest.  He helped us with lots of questions even though he said he was busy.   Super fun , great service , fair priced. Considering we're on pier 39. Great night.
author: Steven B.

description:
Although the Fog Harbor is in a very touristy area (which is the reason why I don't go often) it really does have great, fresh seafood. 

For a quick lunch bite, I ordered clam chowder in a bread bowl with a salad and it was delicious! The chowder was the perfect ratio of creamy and chunky, jam packed with a generous amount of seafood (mainly clams, of course). The rest of my party went a little fancy and ordered a stuffed lobster and a crab roll with sweet potatoes fries. The stuffed lobster was good but not the best. While the crab roll was very tasty, definitely worth the price.

If you're lucky enough and it's not a full house, definitely try to get a window seat, the view is amazing and makes for a better dining experience overall.
author: Saleen L.

description:
Came here for just a beer and appetizer...can't wait to go back for a meal!

I had the red chilie garlic shrimp which are outa this world!!!
author: Carlos F.

description: We had the best server! Raphael treated us well. We had a plan to get the shellfish tower but he recommended seafood platter instead (don't quote me on the name) and it hit the spot right on. Great food! Even better customer service! Definitely recommend. First time in Frisco didn't disappoint! Thanks Fog Harbor! P.s. The hibiscus margarita is great!
author: Warren Y.

description: Four star foods and three star service. Foods are not bad,   Garlic bettered Crab is tasty, but our waitress treated differently against natives and minorities, residents and tourists, make me feeling very uncomfortable, bad service
author: Xie B.

description: Excellent atmosphere, we arrived early, around 3:30, after spending the day on Alcatraz and Angel Island and were able to sit right down without waiting although the restaurant was busy.  The menu accommodated everyone in my family, including small children.  The food was delicious and reasonably priced for a touristy part of the city.
author: Dennis R.

description: Delicious meal on a beautiful day. Great courteous service. Fish and chips fantastic. Halibut w greens and quinoa fantastic. Sourdough bread amazing.
author: Lecia R.

description: As a native of the city, I enjoy taking visitors to Fog Harbor Fish House. The wharf is a real tourist trap and Alito's is a welcome step away from that. Classic fish dishes well done, very good service, a willingness to work with kid's preferences, and great views of the bay. Last time I was there I had a cup of clam chowder and then I tried the red chili garlic shrimp. My shrimp was so good, honestly, if I had more money I would have ordered a second one. There were several kids in our party but the crayons and coloring sheets the hostess gave them were enough to keep them happy until they got their food. Can't ask for much more.
author: Michelle O.

description:
Really amazing place. Came here with a group of 5 and were seated right away. Gorgeous view of the water. Very nice staff and an attentive waitress. We got calamari to start and they gave us fresh bread. The bread is AMAZING. It's hot and fresh and addicting. Calamari was pretty good. 
 I got the lazy cioppino and it was delicious. It was chock full of delicious seafood in a really good sauce. They give you a bib but you don't need it if you got the lazy one (unless you want your friends to make fun of you...like mine did lol). Friends got the burger, coconut shrimp and the mixed grill and they were all satisfied. One friend got the crab roll but it was really mayo-y and not good at all. 
Definitely my favorite spot in Pier 39.
author: Sunia C.

description:
This is worth a visit. Try and get a table near the window. 
When you sit down and hear, "delicious," "amazing," and, "wonderful" coming from the diners around you, you know it's good.
author: J B.

description: Came here with my partner in April cause I was in the mood for seafood. We shared the clam chowder, wedge salad (a personal fave of mine) and one of the seafood towers (oysters, shrimp, crab legs). Everything was great. Its pretty classy looking on the inside but we were in casual clothes having just come from Alcatraz and it wasn't a problem.
author: Debra D.

description: Amazingly decent food for such a touristy location. My 9-year-old was happy with his chicken tenders and steamed broccoli. Chicken was not overly dry, just the right way. I had sole on a bed of spinach with fingerling potatoes -- well prepared fish and a healthy dish overall. The waiter was attentive and not overbearing. All is great but in my opinion the place is a bit overpriced. For example, a non-alcoholic cocktail with muddled strawberries, mint, and soda water -- $7.
author: Inna G.

description:
I had the Crab Ravioli and all I can say is wow. My husband had the salmon which he also enjoyed though and through. We cleaned our plates with extra sour bread which was also amazing! 

The view of Alcatraz and the golden gate made the food even better
author: Melo R.

description: Went here for lunch with some visiting out of town family and was amazed at how good it was. You don't expect great food on Pier 39, but the service, ambiance, and well executed dishes were a nice surprise. The crab roll ($25) was so delicious I didn't take a breath between bites. We also had several salads with clam chowder in bread bowls, all of which were nicely turned out. I'm a jaded SF diner, but this place was really good!
author: Rob N.

description: Excellent service and cocktails! Ran into a bartender on his break (wish I got his name) after having a terrible experience and walking out of Eagle Cafe next door; he asked us what we were looking for, we said a bar, he warmly invited us to try Fog Harbor's and we are so glad we did. We snagged 2 seats at the bar and were quickly greeted by Tony who got us some waters and whipped us up 2 fantastic cocktails (a manhattan and a margarita). We decided to sit outside by the fireplace, so cozy! A gentleman came over and let us know that should we get too warm, let someone know and they'll adjust the fireplace accordingly. After a crappy experience at Eagle Cafe, Fog Harbor was a wonderful reminder of what great service really is about. Thanks FH team!! Will definitely be back for dinner.
author: Denique B.

description: All food was delicious. The clam chowders were creamy with excellent flavor.  The Ciopanni was excellent.  Price was Pier 39 prices.  Can't complain is expected when dining here.  Beautiful views also..
author: JR D.

description: Came to this restaurant because someone recommended this place to my husband. We arrived at around 6:30pm to the restaurant and the wait was approximately 2 hours. We were seated at about 8:30 pm last night. Our kids were so pumped up to see the fireworks at the pier so we petition for a table near a window since fireworks were to start at 9:30pm. Our waiter came to get us started with our drinks and then came back to leave them and take our order. We asked a few questions which he was unable to answer. During our dinner he never came by to refill our drinks. Our kids were so excited about the dessert because they saw their Platter with the dessert plates being offerred to other tables. Our waiter never came by with it. Food was okay. My son ordered the chicken tenders with french fries. He is not a fan of french fries but he ate them and only ate one of the chicken tenders. He said they were not good. My daughter had the grilled cheese with french fries and she only took a bite of the grilled cheese and left it there too. We had the cesar salad with the clam chowder soup. It was okay. For our main dish we had the shellfish platter for two. It was not good. Our waiter dissapeared for a long time we wanted to beat the crowd. He finally showed up and we asked for the check I also ordered a chocolate chip cookie with ice cream to go. The restaurant was beautiful with a nice view of the fireworks but service and food was not good. My husband asked how much I wanted to leave him for tip. I said nothing, I did not like my waiters service. We had better service and food at the in n out a few blocks down. Waiter came to leave our dessert we grabbed our belongings and we walked out the restaurant. He came out the restaurant chasing us that we did not leave him a tip. I felt embarrased, people probably thought we had not payed our bill. My husband felt bad and gave him five dollars. I was upset. When you have good food and good service we do not hesitate to tip our waiter or waitress but this was just rediculous. To top it off I had a bite of the chocolate chip cookie dessert not knowing it had walnuts on it. Im allergic to them, but since the menu did not include desserts I did not know the ingredients. Im just glad my allergies did not go crazy or ended up in the hospital because of this.
author: Tania C.

description:
This place is amazing. Fresh seafood and great service. 

Our server was Tyler and he was extremely helpful. He had great recommendations and came by often to refill our drinks. 

I highly recommend the filet mignon topped with fresh dungeonous crab. I would definitely come back. A+!!!
author: Brian B.

description: Absolutely astonishing! I had gone here for my anniversary and I must say it has such a warm and cozy environment. It's dimly lit with the perfect view of the ocean right by your table. The food was fantastic and the service was unparalleled! I had gotten the traditional clam chowder bowl with a chicken Caesar salad. Though it's a San Francisco classic, the experience of the food, service, comfort, and views made it unforgettable.
author: L Y.

description:
Great great clam chowder. Best on the strip and the best cioppino anywhere!!  Had them take the crab out of the shell to make eating easier.  

My only complaint was that the service I thought was a little rude. My wife and I went I. Just to share a cioppino and clam chowder, the server was not happy that we were not a $200 table like most...but hey man we were in and out in 30 min. You need to treat everyone the same no matter how much food they are ordering. 

Food was great, service was not...
author: Billy F.

description:
We capped off our vacation with this beautiful restaurant in the Fisherman's Wharf. 

Be prepared to wait.  On a Saturday night for 3 people, we had to wait ~45 min, not too bad I guess.  Once seated, we were lucky enough to have a nice beautiful view of Alcatraz with the window open about 20 degrees, almost too perfect. Except.. the table behind us was a huge family full of kids that were beyond noisy.  There was even a couple that declined to be seated in the same room because of it.  Annoying yes, but it was beyond our and restaurants control.  

I actually went away from seafood (weird, right?) and ordered a flat iron steak, my girlfriend ordered fish n chips and her sister ordered clam chowder in a bread bowl.  The steak was amazing! For a seafood place, this was so good.  I ordered medium rare and it came out just like that. Great flavor too with the peppercorn sauce.  My girlfriends fish n chips were good, same with her sister's chowder.  

Service was okay.  They seemed really swamped with the amount of people that were in there.  No complaints.  

Overall, this is a great choice to have a nice fancy dinner in Fisherman's Wharf!
author: Brandon C.

description: Fog Harbor claimed to have the award wining clam chowder, and I would say they stack up well with Boudin and others around the Fisherman's wharf area.  We did get seated near the front of the restaurant and did not get as much attention/service.  The food was pretty good but I felt since we shared dishes, they neglected us as customers.
author: Vijay R.

description:
If you want to pay a bunch of money for a tiny, over-priced, diner-tasting meal then Fog Harbor Fish house is the place for you. Let me break my meal down for anyone thinking of going here: 

6 pieces of garlic bread (the kind you can make at home and look like the kind you make at home) - $8. 
Caesar salad & soup (sloppy looking salad, not prepared well) - $14 with four pieces of shrimp (I know the number because when you pay extra for shrimp you expect something) - $6 more. 
Fried shrimp (7 pieces of shrimp, 7 pieces of Long John Silver Looking shrimp) - $20. 

Then to make this night even better, real magical, the waiter came with dessert and of course I ask for the price and he tells me everything is about $8. I've been in the mood for creme brulee so I get it. Surprise surprise! Each tiny little dessert is $14! I end up paying over $100 for a C- night (the service was great and the view is good). Do not go! I repeat, there are a bunch of other overpriced restaurants out there, pick something else.
author: Melissa M.

description: Great service, food, drinks, and selection. It's pretty expensive for what you get, until you factor in the view.
author: Joseph G.

description:
I strolled the entirety of Fisherman's Wharf looking for a spot that felt just right. Nothing felt right until I saw the menu, price, and environment of Fog Harbor. The sun was setting. The air was cool. Perfect place for dinner. I was also extremely starving at this point so it was eat or starve.

Most everything on the menu looked too filling so I opted for what I had been craving, clam chowder in a sourdough bread bowl with a house green salad. Best decision ever. That sourdough is probably some of the best bread I've had ever. That chowder soaked into the bones of the bowl and I ate every last drop. The vinaigrette on the salad was also amazeballs. 

Service from Christy ( I think it was her name ) was also stellar and friendly. 

Only thing I'd change is coming in sooner to avoid the craziness.
author: Khiem L.

description:
Good oysters, clam chowder, and lobster. My family got a seafood grill and the surf n turf entree. The seafood here is above average but to be honest with the price and it being right next to the ocean it should be a given. 
We ordered the steak medium and it was completely well done. The grilled fish were pretty dry as well. The best part is the bird shit on the window. 
Still, I really enjoyed the oysters and lobster.
author: Hantine H.

description: Excellent appetizers, main entrées, and desserts. Busy atmosphere. Good customer service.
author: S.M. K.

description:
We came here solely for the clam chowder! It's delicious, has bacon and everything in it. (Tip: use the bread they give for the table to dip into the clam chowder instead of getting a bread bowl. The bread for the table is unlimited!) We also had the calamari, which was delicious, comes with fried jalapenos and fried onions and a delicious aioli dipping sauce. 

One star was lost because for starting about a half hour after eating and lasting for six hours (when I went to bed) my face was numb and tingly. The only thing I'm allergic to is peanuts, but the restraunt said no peanuts were used. Minor concern over that, but that may have been a personal experience and not a widespread issue.

Also, they'll validate parking at the parking structure across the street for up to one hour!
author: Allie C.

description: After reading the reviews, we had lunch here and it was excellent.  Great views of the marina and it was very clean inside.  The fresh bread and butter were excellent and the service was also good.  I had the Salmon Salad and others had the fish and chips.  All the food was excellent.  I highly recommend this place to those in the area.
author: Bruce C.

description: The seafood was fresh and the service was good. But overall I felt I was paying more for the view as opposed to the food. The cioppino was pretty good though
author: Pattie K.

description: Service was great. The fried cod was fantabulous as well as the lobster. The scenery is beautiful if you request seating next to the windows. The sourdough bread was a great snack before our main dishes and the Moscow Mule cocktail was  with a actual slice of ginger. My fave!!
author: Sanetra S.

description: I was out sightseeing I SF and stopped by here for some lunch.  Ordered the chowder/salad combo for $14.  Salad was made up of greens, purple onions, yellow tomatoes, some yummy croutons and a house made balsamic.  The chowder was a hardy portion presented in a sourdough bread bowl.  The chowder had plenty of clam and was just the right thickness.  They also offer complimentary house made sourdough bread to start.
author: Jen B.

description:
Best clam chowder in the state!  Sometimes I head into SF just for a bowl from here.  The fried calamari is also to die for! The ciopinno is fantastic!

The prices are obviously higher than most because it's in a tourist trap on Pier 39, however the food and ambiance makes it worth every penny.
author: Chelsey F.

description:
Came here while visiting SF with my wife. It surprised us both with how good the views were as well as how good the food and atmosphere was. I'd hold out for a table by a window like we did.

We decided to forego the traditional main entrees and created our own small-plates by ordering house salads (wonderful vinaigrette), calamari (fresh tasting and can you go wrong with fried jalapeño's??), roasted garlic half crab (fresh, a little too garlicky), chowder bread bowl (because you order that when in the warf). All of it was delightful.

The service was good, although I'm not quite sure he understood small-plate style and we weren't going to be ordering any entrees. We will come here again!
author: David B.

description: Just look at the main picture and you'll know just how ridiculous this place is. The food is just as beautiful and the locale. The food is pricey for the portions but what the hell do you expect if you want to eat in one of the most beautiful places in the world. I mean it's pier 39 in SF! Also, pro tip... don't come here and order a steak, it's a fish house!!!!!
author: Frank W.

description:
I'm so glad I was able to try out this restaurant! I wanted to try out the famous clam chowder in a bread bowl so I looked for restaurants in Pier 39 who offered so I decided to check this place out. It was packed when I got there so I opted to sit on the bar instead. It's great cause the service was so fast on the bar. 

I ordered clam chowder and their linguine pasta with clams. I wanted to order more but I'm glad I didn't cause the clam chowder is already filling (at least for me). The pasta was pretty good! A little bit pricey, but totally worth it. I'll come back here when I visit SF again!
author: Trisha F.

description:
Went again yesterday with friends. Requested for a seat right next to where we were seated. I have to ask her a few items to get an answer she heard my request but no response. I wasn't sure why and felt like an idiot to keep repeating it. After a few times she said the table is taken. I was like ok and we sat at the place we were initially assigned. The only reason I was requesting the table next to us is because of the view. Anyways, after 15 min walks in a party of 4 no reservations and gets to seat where we wanted to. How do I know they didn't make a reservation, I know because I saw them walk in and then provide their name and the table after it got setup didn't carry a reserved sign like few others did. Ok I am done ranting about this.....so I stared already annoyed and this is my second time to this place with my friends for who it is first time. 

Our bearer was polite and respectful and helpful. This made me relaxed. We ordered couple of appetizers and 4 courses of main dish. The food was fresh, and flavorful. 

The food was better than last time that I had here. So kudos for that. Wanted to give 3 stars due to our opening experience but common why ding the Chef and the rest of his hard working team due to one employee lack of care. 

It is hard to run business in today's environment and when we see good food we need to respect that.

Bottom line will go again....
author: Suresh D.

description: Great location, beautiful views and the food was delicious. Mel our server was a delight.
author: Katherine B.

description: This fine establishment has a splendid view of the bay from the upper level of pier 39. The waiter (Malik) was entertaining and the overall service was impeccable. The decor and appearance of the eatery was fancy and comfortable. Everyone in the restaurant was dressed in a professional and respectable manner. For reasonable pricing the food quality was outrageously good and definitely worth the money. I recommend this restaurant for anyone eating with a party, a romantic couple, or anyone who just wants to have a nice dinner out on their own.
author: Sam C.

description: Good food and a great location. They were busy when we arrived but we were still greeted and served quickly.
author: Meg A.

description: Great service! Walked right in, grabbed a table in the bar, and demanded a seat. Told the manager we were on a bachelorette party, we were going to order a large meal, and we wanted a seat. He was very accommodating and cleaned the table right away. The food was incredible and the drinks were strong. The blue cheese bread with a cup of clam chowder will make your taste buds bounce. However, their king crab is the royal reward!
author: Noelle H.

description: First stop on an SF Clam Chowder Crawl, and Fog Harbor did not disappoint. To start, our waiter Khaiman was top notch, taking the time to chat with us and recommend great cocktails and apps.
