The chowder itself was amazing, and you should definitely get it in a sourdough Breadbowl - the Boudin bread is really the best part. In the midst of a flurry of touristy restaurants and chains, Fog Harbor stands out.
author: Andres B.

description: Great food, great atmosphere and if your lucky to sit by the windows, a great view of the bay and Alcatraz Island! It is slightly on the pricy side, but it is also a very clean and organized place with various fresh seafood options. I would definitely eat here again and would recommend that you check it out if your looking for a good place to eat at Pier 39.
author: Peter M.

description: The seafood tower was unimpressive to say the least. The shrimp were totally over cooked and were not fresh tasting, as was the lobster. The oysters were quite nice, and I liked the mignonette. The presentation totally sucked- the receptacle was too big for the portion so it just looked cheaply done.  The clam chowder is nothing special- it tasted like an average diner's soup. I have had much better!  I had the fried combo- awful! The fish batter was claggy and soggy. The shrimp and calamari tasted like something on Hometown Buffet - out of a box and rubbery. Terrible! The swordfish was perfectly cooked, which was impressive, but the flavor and seasoning was off.  Totally bummed as we expected a really WOW meal.
author: Mo F.

description:
My friend and I came for dinner during Restaurant Week, which consisted of an appetizer, entree and dessert for $40. Pretty good deal in my opinion. The food is yummy and portion sizes here are HUGE. Definitely more than a normal person should be eating in a single meal.

The restaurant is on the second level of Fisherman's Wharf and has a decent view of the pier. I was expecting a very touristy atmosphere given the location, but it was surprisingly nice. Casual, nothing fancy.

Our waitress was super friendly and attentive. We were given some complimentary warm bread and butter, and the restaurant manager started off our meal with a small amuse-bouche since we decided to go with the Restaurant Week menu. Food came out quickly and the manager even brought us our check himself, along with a biscoff cookie for each of us to take home. The bill had a coupon for the Biscoff shop at the pier as well.

==============================

*** APPETIZERS ***

-1/2 GARLIC ROASTED DUNGENESS CRAB (normally $19) - 5/5
[Roasted with garlic herb butter, served with corn on the cob and fingerling potatoes]
Pretty sizable portion of crab and could probably make for a small entree. The crab meat was super soft and delicious with the herb butter! The crab itself was pretty easy to break open and eat, but definitely still very messy (they even give you a bib anticipating the mess)

-AHI TUNA POKE (normally $16) - 5/5
[Marinated raw tuna, avocado, mango, sesame-soy sauce and wasabi aioli]
Pretty light and fresh with a nice sweetness from the mango.


*** ENTREES ***

-GRILLED SWORDFISH (normally $26) - 3/5
[Served over ratatouille and roasted fingerling potatoes, with pesto aioli and chimichurri sauce]
Just alright, not particularly memorable. I like really soft, flaky fish and the swordfish was a little overcooked for my taste.

-SEAFOOD CIOPPINO (normally $30) - 5/5
[Crab, fresh fish, shrimp, clams, scallops and mussels stewed in a tomato herb broth with pasta]
HUGE portion! This could definitely feed two people, but I managed to eat pretty much the whole thing by myself because it was just THAT good. I really liked the crab and scallops in the dish - great soft texture. The shrimp was a little chewy and the fish was a little overcooked but still good. The broth was AMAZING. If you're not afraid of carbs, I'd recommend dipping the complimentary bread in it.


*** DESSERT ***

-VANILLA BEAN CREME BRULEE (normally $8.50) - 4/5
[With caramelized top and Biscoff cookie]
Super smooth and creamy with a thin caramelized top. Not too sweet, but definitely pretty rich. It's made in a larger shallow dish so there's more of that crunchy caramelized sugar, which I personally like more than the actual custard.

-PUMPKIN BREAD PUDDING (normally $8.50) - 4.5/5
[Topped with creme anglaise]
SOOO GOOD!! I was already incredibly full from the seafood cioppino and wasn't planning on actually eating so much dessert, but ended up having zero self-control with this bread pudding. Warm, gooey and flavorful. And probably had an entire tub of butter in it :( In fact, it looked like it was sitting in a pool of melted butter, which scared me a little. I kind of wish I asked for it without the creme anglaise though because it just made the bread too soggy.
author: Jessie L.

description:
Picked this restaurant because of the ratings.  Couldn't go wrong!!!  Had the Surf & Turf and my husband had the filet.  The food was beyond delicious!  Also had the Pumpkin Bread Pudding -- melts in your mouth!

Thanks to our server Jessica -- her recommendations were spot on!  Will definitely come back here on our next trip.
author: Denise T.

description:
Came in at 1230 on a Saturday. Pretty busy although only waited 15 minutes at the bar before a table with an awesome view of the bay became free. Saying that - sitting at the bar listening to an angry bartender bitch about his "f$cking sh1t" work colleagues for 15 minutes was funny/annoying.

I got carded (I'm 29..!) so they wouldn't serve me alcohol. But it's cool, I should have brought my ID.

Ordered the baked oysters, clam chowder cup and crab cakes. They were good. They weren't New Orleans seafood good. The clam chowder was the best of the bunch.

Overall, food a 4, service a 2, so this gets a 3.
author: Matthew D.

description: I was here with 5 people from different parts of the country for a conference. We all had something different and everyone really enjoyed their meal. Surprisingly, the crab was very good even though it took a really long time for Tim to eat.  I have salmon and it was very good. The grill was dish was also very good and Tim is still in the tank. Scallops and crab risotto was to die for as was the  linguine and clams. Best restaurants Fisherman's Wharf area
author: H H.

description: We started with oysters Rockefeller. Amazing! My wife had a shrimp cocktail and the fried seafood platter. I ordered the blue cheese wedge and the jumbo scallops over risotto. The food was very good and the service was very prompt. The only knock I have is every table but ours had bread, and our entrees showed up early and we didn't have a chance to really enjoy our salads.
author: Petey C.

description:
Nice view but I didn't like my salmon salad at all. The salmon was not cooked well, it was always raw. Salad had wayyyyy too much sauce! Drenched in sauce. My husband had the seafood platter and his fish was delicious. I'm not impressed overall. 

Bread was very good.
author: Samantha M.

description: Lived in the city 6 years and can't believe I just discovered this place!  View extraordinaire and one of the best meals I have ever had in SF!!!  Excellent house Chardonnay, best clam chowder, superb fresh fish selection and beyond reasonable prices especially for the wharf area!  Sat at the bar with a killer view and some of the best service I have experienced - ever.  Tony was amazing!  I could dine here on a weekly basis and never get bored.  Everyone at the bar was having a blast.  Visitors, locals, pre Giants game folks.  Can't wait to go back!  Truly one of the best times I have ever had in this city.
author: Lynne P.

description: Went in during the dinner rush and it was incredibly busy. Was able to get a seat at the bar without a wait but the column in front of me meant there wasn't too much space and staff were constantly rushing past. Got the chowder in a bread bowl and it was very tasty, however if coming here I'd definitely recommend making a reservation or waiting to have a better experience.
author: Ariana A.

description: Five stars for the service! Our server was super attentive and very nice. He made sure to check on us and refilled our drinks. As for the food it was okay. We start off with the baked oysters and calamari. For entrees we had the linguine with clams and Dungeness cioppino. The food was mediocre. I rather go to swan or hog island next than come back here.
author: Tram T.

description:
Came here for the 2015 SF Restaurant Week with my family on a Sunday night for dinner ($40 dinner menu per person) and EVERYTHING was fabulous and delicious.

I highly recommend coming here. As a born-and-raised NorCal kiddo and lover of all things seafood (shoutout to pescatarians), I gotta hand it to the crew at Fog Harbor. Y'all were ON YOUR GAME that night! I'll be recommending this place to anyone looking for the quintessential San Francisco meal with a romantic, classy, and worthwhile dining experience. 

The service from start to finish was undeniably amazing. We reserved for an early dinner around 4PM, but couldn't make it (coming from South Bay) until 7:30PM for many reasons. But even though we were told that we would have to wait about 10 minutes, before we knew it we were seated after only 3 minutes! We were seated at a booth on the lower level a distance from the panoramic windows, but we loved having the grand space for our dining experience. Our server was very understanding, cracked a few jokes here and there, and was just the right amount of "leave us alone/serve us." I gotta give props to the manager of the night who personally went around to all of the tables to offer an amuse-bouche...we thought it was because of SFRW, but he literally went around to all of the tables! 

The food!! MAN!! That deserves its own rating. The four of us ordered all of the starters, entrees, and desserts (since there were only 3 selections, we double'd on the chocolate cake...best decision ever). FOODGASMS to the max, y'all. Even though our server said their Seafood Cioppino was the most famous dish, I think the best ones were the baked oysters (gone too soon, sadface), salmon dish and indeed the cioppino. I recommend going with the Anchor Steam to complement your entire meal! By the time desserts rolled around we were all delightfully satisfied, but loosened our belts for the BEST melt-in-your-mouth-chocolate cake and surprisingly yummy bread pudding! 

Fog Harbor is not a joke. Nor is it a tourist trap. It's got dedicated management, a classy service team, and an unbeatable view at Pier 39. Maybe I'm still reeling from my SFRW high, but it's worth a visit...trust me!
author: Jodi H.

description:
Came here with my boyfriend recently after we went to Alcatraz for a tour. It was my first time in San Francisco so of course we had to go to Pier 39 and try the clam chowder that everyone raves about. First of all, the view was beautiful. When we were there the weather was sunny and the table that we got right by the window showed the harbor perfectly. 

As for the food, we tried the clam chowder the shrimp cocktail and the crab cakes. To be honest the food was just all right (the shrimp cocktail was pretty good though) but it was nothing really amazing. The service was definitely attentive which is why I left 4 stars despite the food being all right. We left very happy that we started our trip on a good note. 

I would probably go back just to see the view again and to try other things on the menu.
author: Gaita H.

description: Visiting from Knoxville and had to come down to Pier 39.  What an excellent choice for restaurants.  Having dined at the Waterbar the night before with great scenic views, the food at Fog Harbor was hands down the better choice.  We found it via Yelp and thought the crab roll would be the option to choose.  Well, after the Crab Ceviche for an appetizer and a spicy shrimp boil for the main, as well as a seafood Alfredo... we were hooked (pun intended).  The Alfredo was packed with seafood. Literally more seafood than noodles.  Great flavors and wonderful crab, shrimp and scallops.  The spicy seafood boil was amazing.  Lobster, crab, shrimp and scallops.  Nice heat level and a broth you just had to sop up with the delicious sourdough rolls.  It all was wrapped up with a bow with an amazing waiter in Curtis. Very honest and open about what was good, great and average on the menu.  Steered us in the right direction and a great, helpful personality.
author: Drew F.

description: Best place to take visitors who are visiting San Francisco. Great view and pretty good food! Waiters are friendly but not all of them. Little pricey but again its very touristy.
author: Irem G.

description:
Quick service and delicious food. Ample portions of scallops for appetizer. Pacific code and crab salad were very filling. The view of pier 39 gave it that 5th star. 

Expensive but worth it. 
  
$120 after tip for 2 
2 glasses of wine, app and entrees
author: Jason F.

description: Great experience - and food. Not too touristy in a very touristy place. Great service etc. only downside - and these are nits - the food came a little fast, and the risotto was a little sweet for my taste. Other than that - great experience - highly recommend
author: Stuart F.

description:
Beautiful views and delicious food! 
I was the difficult customer who wanted to customize my plate, I got the seafood penne but with shrimp only and it was AMAZING! 
I never finish my food, so I took home the rest and it was just as good as leftovers!
author: Kelsey C.

description:
We went there on a Friday´s night; probably the view is amazing. It was almost empty so I assumed it was going to be ok... Service was horrible!! Really, I mean REALLY, slow. Almost 30 min for the first round of drinks, then the glasses where dirty and/or with a lot of water spots. Ii took forever to be attended in between plates. After waiting for 15 min for fish, the cook came out to explain her self that she had already sold all that kind of fish..... OK we order something else (we were on a really good mood). The manager did came to apologize also. I think there were only 2-3 tables but still the waitress was never at hand. Employees were chatting in the "bus boy place" all the time. We spent probable 3 times more time in there only because of service. We were the last to leave. 

Expensive, slow service, and I only put 2 stars because the food was good (nothing to extraordinary either)
author: Daniela C.

description: Stopped in to keep warm and have a cup of chowder. Nice restaurant with spectacular views, good service and (for a touristy area), reasonable prices.  They also served really fresh, warm and tasty sourdough bread.  Chowder was a nice temperature, creamy, great flavor with nice amount of clams.  I would definitely return.
author: Brian K.

description: Pretty pricey, but worth the price. Expect for a decent wait. I would recommend booking a reservation beforehand. There are only so many servers, so the service is kind of slow, but once your food arrives, it'll all be better.
author: Vinnie T.

description: Roasted garlic crab was amazing! Tons of food. Everything was great from the fresh rolls and clam chowder to the biscoff cookie at the end! Kayla was our server and she was terrific. Worth every penny!
author: Jenny C.

description: Amazing views of the wharf. Food was mediocre at best and very pricey. The Fish House located just down the pier has the same owners.  FYI, the clam chowder tasted like canned soup and was way too heavy/rich. Good sourdough bread and service. The Tuna Poke app was delicious.
author: Ali B.

description: Justin did an awesome job!! Great service . I recommend the halibut plate if you're looking for something healthy but tasteful.
author: Sara A.

description:
Went to The Fog Harbor Fish House for my Birthday I was greeted with smiles all 4 Hostess up Front outstanding was seated right away with the greatest server ever Pierre so Friendly so Kind & A Great Attitude from the start till finish Absolutely Amazing Gentleman so I had 2 Too Shelf Margaritas Strong & Delicious & had the appetizer Calamari very Good & Fresh & Dinner was Mixed Grill again Swordfish & Salmon Fish So Tender & Fresh Amazing Tasting Food. Best Best Place To Eat on The Wharf Pier 39.
You'll Always Have Great Service Great Location & Great Reasonable Prices Thank You Pierre for The Best Service Ever & Had A Great Birthday Dinner
author: Barbara L.

description:
Wow! That's literally the only word I can use to describe my experience here. I'm in San Francisco for a few days with the family and since we are staying in Fishermans Wharf area we decided we wanted some seafood for dinner. Found this restaurant on here and it looked promising.

All of our food was amazing. Even the bread! Actually the bread was one of the highlights. Our appetizer was the garlic shrimp which was delicious and fresh. As my entree I got the salmon which was cooked perfectly and delicious. The veggie mix was perfect too. I seriously loved all the food here.

Service was okay, but the food and the views you get while you're sitting down made up for that. I will absolutely m comeback next I'm in town.
author: Carlos P.

description: Came in tonight for dinner with two cousins from out of town and my mother who have never eaten here. We had Eddie as our waiter and he was fantastic!! I had the chicken penne and the flavor was spot on. My out of town family was impressed not only with the great seafood but also with the incredible service. Definitely will be back and will ask for Eddie's section
author: Allison S.

description: Had a good time here a bit noisy but what do you expect when your on pier 39. Food was good but I manly want to right this saying thanks to our waitress for giving us an outstanding experience! She made me and my wife feel like family. She seemed to really care about her job and cared about us. very friendly and accommodating. Never thought I would get service like this on the pier. She had told us she had been working at fog harbor for about 9 years that's a commitment and it shows. Thanks!!
author: James T.

description:
I was so surprised and impressed by my amazing experience yesterday at Fog Harbor Fish House. My boyfriend suggested we stop here for an early dinner, as he had visited before with out-of-town family. I was a bit dubious, thinking that it wouldn't be that great and just another tourist trap on Pier 39. I was 100% wrong and I can absolutely recommend this spot if you want to splurge a bit and play tourist in your own city. Splurge is even a stretch because prices for what you get were very reasonable, but more on that in a bit.

To begin with, the outdoor patio/waiting area was festively decorated for the holidays and featured a cozy fireplace, some decorative fountains and comfy seating. Fortunately for a table for 2 at 4:30 we only had to wait a few minutes. Nearly all tables will feature a fabulous bay view and from our table we could see a bit of Alcatraz, the Marin headlands and the Golden Gate. The interior is classy and sleek but still cozy on the chilly pier-visitors from outside the area will be impressed. 

Anthony, our server was wonderful and brought us some freshly made, warm sourdough bread. Trust me, it's absolutely worth the calories-it's made on the premises and the best restaurant bread I've ever had. For my meal I opted for the roasted tomato penne. Normally this comes with chicken but they left that off, since I'm a vegetarian. They added broccoli, spinach and the dish came with fresh mozzarella. Portions were impressive and I came home with leftovers. My boyfriend got the seared ahi with garlic mashed potatoes and his portion was also very generous for the price. We thoroughly enjoyed the meal, the service and the ambiance. This is not at all what I expected from a seafood restaurant on Pier 39 and will definitely come back when we feel like treating ourselves. Definitely give it a try if you're looking for a restaurant with view that doesn't charge outrageous prices. Completely a win.
author: Jennifer N.

description:
3.5 stars 

Had lunch here during Restaurant Week (January 2015).

I think they put most of the restaurant week reservations in the far back room, which has more of the view of the pier than of the bay. So not everyone will have a great view.

Amuse bouche (a mini arancini I believe) was a nice surprise and super tasty as well.
Also loved receiving Biscoff cookies with our check.

Restaurant validates parking but only up to an hour during the lunch time, two hours at night.

For a two course lunch, it took about 2 hours from being seated to paying for the check. Service was a bit slow but food was not terrible.

The dungeness crab ceviche was pretty good, but it came with 2-3 chips.. 
They give you a generous portion of fish and chips which were fried well but not very memorable. Fish tasted a little watery and could use some salt.

Overall, not bad for restaurant week, but it could be better.
author: Yvonne K.

description: OMG. Best steak I've had in a long time. Great food and love the view from the table.
author: My Mini Treats M.

description: A nice atmosphere and location.  The food is good, not great and expensive.   Service was exceptional.  Worth a try if you're in the mood for seafood at Fisherman's Wharf.
author: Diane G.

description: We had a fantastic meal at Fog Harbor!  My husband's parents were visiting from out of town and we wanted to take them somewhere on the water with a good atmosphere.  We were pleasantly very surprised with Fog Harbor.  The wait was shorter than expected and the service was top notch -- our server Justin was very attentive and personable; we had a great time chatting with him.  The food was super tasty as well.  All in all a great meal and a great night!
author: Lauren B.

description:
Fantastic food and service!!

Some of the best clam chowder I've ever had. Lots of clams with a delicious creamy soup base.

The Bay Scallop starter was great, the scallops were cooked perfectly and tender not chewy at all. Also a big portion! 

The linguini and clams was so bright and flavorful, and FILLED with clams!! I couldn't even finish all of them!

Overall, it's a nice restaurant, beautiful view of the bay, great service, and delicious food!
author: Rain M.

description:
A straight four for the location and the food. We went there for our anniversary lunch and were promptly seated after a short wait.  The view of the Pier and the Golden Gate was just amazing. We started with the Sour dough bread and oysters. But the star of the show were the red pepper shrimp and the crab in garlic butter. Since we were doing only sea food we took the mixed platter - the salmon was amazing and so were the grilled shrimp. 
Overall had a wonderful time with the sun being a little beneficent on us and granting us the spectacular views of the bay as well.
author: Nasir M.

description:
I was reluctant to try this place given the fact that it's in a super touristy area where there are lots of overpriced restaurants with mediocre food. Wellllllll, I'm SO glad we gave it a shot because it was absolutely one of the best seafood restaurants I've ever eaten at. 

It's pretty big on the inside but they utilize their space well in order to seat as many people as possible. It is very clean and comfortable. Oh - and nothing compares with that view of the harbor. Beautiful.

I ordered the crab roll. It was everything I'd dreamt it would be. Fresh crab, celery, mayo etc in a big ol buttery roll. Yum.

Our service was really great. AJ, our waitress, was excellent, attentive, and brought our food out in less than 15 minutes. We were there at a very busy point in the day so we were pretty impressed with just that alone.
author: Kristin L.

description: To sum it up, it was overpriced and the salmon was over cooked and dry. The chowder was excellent and the sour dough bread was excellent as well.
author: Brayden S.

description:
An hour wait for a party of 7.

The food isn't amazing and the wait wasn't worth it. It's pretty pricey. The seafood penne is $19 but didn't fill me up. Mussels and clams' meat are tiny. The swordfish is really good! Super fresh but such small proportion for $26 :((

The portions of the clam chowder and salad is pretty large so that was worth the $14. But everything else I ordered wasn't worth it Unfortunately..

Overall this place is nice. Our waiter, Brett, was lovely! He was tentative and funny as well. Wouldn't come back again since it's just too pricey and the food isn't amazing as I thought it would be. But really great service

--my cousin ordered the New York steak and loved it! He recommends that! :)  

Total: $130.24
author: Skye V.

description: Honest story, i used to Hate clam Chowder.  Everytime i was at the resturant id steer away from it. Either too fishy or runny, but this spots Clam Chowder bread bowl with the crab meat on time was Such A Gamechanger for me! A must order if you ever stop there. Foods a lil pricy. But you get what you pay for. Nothing like good food with good ppl these days.
author: Marcus H.

description: Our waiter Sarah P. was awesome, great customer service and attentive. The food was good and the pirtion size was good for the prices which were not super expensive. I will be back very very soon!!!
author: Maya R.

description: Excellent seafood restaurant with great tasting food, drinks is amazing but the service was very slow for us. The staffs were all very friendly but very slow. We ordered 3 appetizers & 5 bottles of wine for Party of 12, one waiter came with one bottle of wine and one appetizer, an hour later 2 bottles of wine with the second appetizer with the main course. When we asked for additional waiters they said they are busy. Great food Poor service. Oh an for reservations, we had to wait  one and a half hour. We went next door to Eagle Cafe drinking beer while waiting.
author: nazmena j.

description:
Beautiful restaurant location viewing Alcatraz. Great seafood and very attentive service with reasonable price.

Calamari - it's good but nothing stands out.

Clam Chowder - great flavor with chunks of clams!

Garlic Roasted Dungeness Crab - wonderful garlic seasoning. Crab meat is a bit too dry may due to cooking/roasting. Roasted baby potatoes and broccoli taste great.
author: Millie C.

description:
From the entrance...to the table, to eating exp.
Everything was handled very beautifully.
Our waiter edgar from peru and our other waiter Nev ...were great servers...always checking to see if we were happy diners.
We shared a dish and the food was very tasty and well prepared.
One thing i really enjoyed was the fresh hot sourdough bread that was given, along with butter..it was so delightful and completed our meal--salmon, sword fish and scrimp combo.
The bay view from our table was so  so nice..we could see sailboats cruising by.
All in all a super place.
Ty,
Wilma and fred
Walnut creek
author: Joseph V.

description: Delicious food which a great view and great service! Pricier than some places, but well worth it!
author: Maricris B.

description: The food was good.  Service ok.  We expected more.  Really god food just not wow!   We were s large group and I tried to make a reservation.  Not possible.  So then I called to let them know we were coming.  Got to the restaurant 30 minutes later and they did not anticipate us.  We did get in yet I though my halibut was foo foo.  On couscous, arugula, nuts, lots of things.  Maybe at that point I was just too testy!
author: Robert B.

description:
With all the amazing dining experiences San Francisco has to offer we thought we'd try as many different restaurants as possible in the three days we had in San Francisco. However, we found ourselves back at Fog Harbor twice! Maybe it was because of the great location and beautiful views; or because of the outstanding clam chowder in a bread bowl, crab cakes and crab and cheese ravioli; or because of the friendly hostesses; and we especially love the most wonderful wait staff - AJ and Shawn (who made it such a fun and happy experience.) Maybe all of that! Love this place and love AJ and Shawn!We were celebrating our 40th Anniversary and they made it a great celebration! 
Don't forget to try the latte with a Biscoff biscuit/cookie.
author: Sherri B.

description: If you are looking for good seafood, this is the place to go. Super flavorful and great portions. The service was a plus as well, extremely friendly and helpful.
author: Stephanie R.

description:
We were not impressed with this restaurant. The food was ok. I ordered their shrimp cocktail. It was like $16 with just a few large shrimp, nothing spectacular. My husband and son ordered grilled oysters which they enjoyed. My husband also ordered the fried shrimp which came with fries. The fried shrimp was nothing spectacular. They were comparable to the fried shrimp at Friday's. My son ordered a burger and fries. I tasted his burger and it was bland. Disappointed to say that the fries and their fresh bread were the tastiest thing that they served us. The rest was meh. We were disappointed overall. We won't be back.


Answer to the comment below:  We were there on Thursday, October 19th. Comment asks me to
Contact Bob but no contact info is provided. Do they just expect me to call the restaurant? No email, no special phone number. Generic response. Also read the same exact response to another review. Word for word. Just cut and paste. Wow. I too was led to this place by all the positive reviews. Felt it was important to post our family's experience.
author: Glorimar W.

description: Food was great, I had the whole garlic grab with potatoes and vegetables. Service was wonderful! Didn't have any room for dessert! Glad I had the opportunity to come out and eat here from Orange County.
author: Jasmine S.

description: Had the 2 5-6oz lobster tails and the wife had the fried combo(calamari, octopi, fish and shrimp) with fries. The lobster was good but tough on top with garlic mashed potatoes and sauteed squash. Over all it was a good dish. Wife's plate was meh. Fish was gross. Calamari and octopus was good and shrimp was ok. The star on that dish was the fench fries sad enough. Came out to $70. Meh
author: Aaron E.

description: Had an amazing dining experience!  The hostess sat the two of us in a large half-round booth, and our server was wonderful and accommodating.  We ordered the baked oysters, the surf 'n' turf, and the cioppino.  All of the food was delicious, and my boyfriend was in awe of the 10oz lobster.  Presentation of the food was on point!
author: DeeDee J.

description: Clam chowder with crab on top & fried scallops is the way to go. Had the fried combo plate with fish, shrimp, and calamari and wasn't impressed. Husband had the garlic crab and he enjoyed it. Customer service is on point, just super busy. Great views.
author: W K.

description: Stopped in here for dinner while out this way on vacation.   The views from the restaurant were nice.   The food was top notch.   The bread they served was awesome.   Kids loved their meals (I ate some of the Mac and cheese, yummmmm).   I had the tuna and it was amazing with rice and veggies.    My wife had mixed medley which again was amazing.   I would recommend this place to eat.
author: Craig T.

description: love, love, love! I would for sure order their soup and salad combo---the clam chowder is absolutely delicious. Yes, this is in a very touristy area but it is well worth visiting for the good eats and view in Pier 39!
author: Paula M.

description: The food is a 3.5, service a 4, view of the sea lions, harbor and Alcatraz is also a 4. Meals cost $30 per person plus. The general vibe is pleasant and so it is a good place to unwind a little if you've spent a chaotic day at the pier.
author: Alyce L.

description:
Great Food and very good service too! Lovely waiting  area outside with a big fireplace.
Our service was exceptional on our annual ladies trip..
author: Diane C.

description: We sat at the bar coz it's peak dinner hour and we didn't make reservation. Bartender was super nice and helpful. Food was amazingly tasty, hands down the best clam chowder I've ever tasted in SF. And the crane brûlée was to die for. Price is reasonable and we'll definitely go back again.
author: Cat C.

description: Thank you @Justin H. We came in here with our 1 month old baby and was thoughtfully accommodated by the whole team, specially our server Justin who really made us at home. Beautiful place, amazing food and amazing service. It does get crowded and the wait can be long but those are clear testaments of the rare experience you'll get here. What more can you ask for?! And always ask for Justin H.
author: Noel W.

description:
Great service. Delicious clam chowder! I highly recommend the mix grill!! Sit by the window on a sunny day because the view is beautiful.
I had a really great lunch here and I can't wait to come back
author: Bianca M.

description: Food is delicious and the view is beautiful! Eddie was an awesome server and we will definitely be making a trip back here! :)
author: Mar C.

description:
This place is beautiful! We were seated by the window overlooking the ocean. It was a very nice sight. 

The food was excellent. I got the clam chowder in the sour dough bread bowl. I tried a few of the options my family ordered and everyone seemed very happy with their food.

The service was excellent. They checked up on us a lot and were very nice and welcoming. I heard this was the best clam chowder in San Fran and it seems to be up there!
author: Marian S.

description: First time in San Francisco and hands down best sea food I tried so far! Great restaurant with a beautiful view and best service I've had. our server justin was very nice! Great server !!
author: Gregory R.

description: I don't normally give 5 stars so that says a lot. I had the dungness crab cocktail and the mixed grill fish. Everything I put in my mouth was outstanding. Service was great. The view was wonderful. Can't go wrong here.
author: Gary L.

description: We sat at the bar and just had drinks, oysters and the blue cheese garlic bread. We really liked the view of Alcatraz and the bay. The oysters were great and the bread was good. The place was crowded but it was a Saturday so I expect the wait would have been pretty long had we been waiting on a table.
author: Eddie N' Hailee S.

description: Food and service were excellent,  one of the best scallops I have tasted! Clam chowder was one of the best as well.
author: M B.

description:
Chilling winds mixed with brisk temps had us searching for warmth, shelter and clam chowder.. I mean, we're in San Francisco, am I right?!

We ended up at Pier 39 / Fisherman's Wharf not long after our gruelingly mediocre Bartlett Hall experience. We didn't have much in our stomachs by high noon, which meant the immediate need to fill them with grub hit us in full force. 

Fog Harbor Fish House appeared to be THE SPOT.. mainly because we were right below it.. and our desperate attempts to eat were dwindling down to a either: wait patiently for a hearty meal or begrudgingly snack on munchies along the bay. We laughed at the snack idea and proceeded to head upstairs towards Fog Harbor. The hostess upfront / outside took our names, then informed us it'd be around a 25 minute wait. Within seconds after our groups arrival, the line became that of a Black Friday sale at Best Buy. We were lucky enough to snag a spot in the little patio section by the front bar, fireplace by our sides, and amusingly watched fellow tourists shiver in those chilly northern California temperatures. 

Aside from the crowd outside, the folks inside seemed mild mannered and less talkative than I'd imagine a spot like Fog Harbor would be. We were sat at nice corner table with easily one of the best views in the house that was accompanied by a pleasant server. And though I couldn't verify this, because our spot was visually stunning.. it seemed most seats within the restaurant gave a decent glimpse of the surrounding Bay and Pier 39. The decor itself was almost on the classy-scale but in far too touristy of a spot to be labeled this. 

It looked like every single table had at least ONE bowl of clam chowder sitting atop them, and because it was on our minds prior to our arrival, it was a dish we'd all be ordering without even looking at the menu. Strategy in mind, we ordered regular bowls of Clam Chowder WITHOUT bread as the bowl.. because, you know, most restaurants provide COMPLIMENTARY BREAD.. so all that excess yeast is simply unnecessary, folks. Unless.. bread is yo' thing. Then do whatcha wanna do, baby. 

Along with the clam chowder (and free bread) I ordered the Mixed Grill Plate - Grilled salmon, swordfish & shrimp covered in a (buttery) citrus buerre blanc served with sides of sauteed vegetables and garlic mashed potatoes.

The mixed grill plate was phenomenal. I'm a fan of blackened fish, the taste of the grill and proper seasoning.. and everything on the plate was that exactly. Moist yet partially charred swordfish & succulent salmon had my taste buds tingling and the healthy sized shrimp smothered in butter turned my face into a pure gold. Garlic potatoes were creamy and on poooint. I was shining vividly, and it was obvious to everyone in our presence that I was thoroughly enjoying this section of my meal. (My grunts, smiles, giggles, muffled speech, or if I look drunk without drinking, etc.)

The clam chowder was, for lack of better terms, doo-doo. Just about every bite had sand in it. Strange.. it appeared there wasn't much clam in my bowl.. which made the sand ordeal a somewhat mind-boggling. Because of this, I didn't enjoy nor finish their 'Award Winning' Clam Chowder. I would've dipped my head into the Pacific if I wanted to taste as much sand as that.

A thin line between a 3 and a 4, Fog Harbor Fish House (through my eyes) may not have the best clam chowder as claimed.. but was boosted in a positive direction due to solid / attentive service, views truly pleasing to the eyes and all of our food (aside from chowder) was tasty and fulfilling for our once empty stomachs.
author: Ryan B.

description: After our 4th visit, I would say the location, the food, the management, the chefs, the presentation and the overall ambiance is excellent.  A classy restaurant among the touristic Pier39 crowd. Nothing to disappoint!  Keep it up!
author: Haig A.

description:
Visited Fog Harbor this past weekend to celebrate a friends birthday and our experience was just okay to say the least. We started with the 1/2 dozen baked oysters, along with the blue cheese wedge salad and a cup of clam chowder. Salad was very good and portion was more than enough, along with the chowder which had a great taste and was served piping hot. However, as for the oysters, they were very tasty and seasoned very well, but they were lukewarm and almost miniature sized. For 18$, I can get a dozen and 1/2 oysters at the grocery store, and twice the size of those in which they were serving. So that was a bit disappointing, especially at a restaurant right on the wharf. 
 Our server, I'm not sure of his name, was nice at the beginning and then he virtually disappeared after we received our entrees. I ordered the mixed grill with salmon, shrimp, and swordfish which was good. However, the swordfish was a bit dry, my salmon portion looked like it was supposed to be on a kid's plate, & my shrimp were a little small as well, considering this is a fish house. My friends ordered the swordfish and fried fish combo, which they said was satisfying but nothing to rave about... 

Finally, remember I mentioned we were there celebrating a friends birthday. When we first arrived, we notified the server of this not once but TWICE, and he said she would receive a complimentary dessert at the end of our meal. Well at the end of our meal, the dessert never came and neither did he. We sat for almost 30 min after we finished our meals, only to flag our server down who walked by us numerous times, not once asking how anything was. Which sucked because, I work in the food industry myself and love to tip my server more than 20% when receiving great service, but our experience unfortunately lacked the luxury of just that. 

Pros: Setting, ambiance, and beautiful view of the wharf which is great for tourists who've never visited SF. Also, great cocktails...hibiscus margarita and the lipstick martini were sooo good. 

Cons: Overpriced, average seafood, and mediocre portions. And the service matched my food....dry and almost non-existent. 
 
-I may return only on the condition we get that complimentary dessert which was promised.
author: Whitney C.

description: I was wary that a place so close to the water and tourist attractions would lack real quality and taste but Fog Harbor was recommended by a friend so we went for it. Everything was fantastic. Delicious sourdough bread, amazing clam chowder and fresh/nicely seasoned fish. We thoroughly enjoyed the experience from beginning to end. If you're looking for a meal that WON'T leave you with that "I just got tourist trapped" feeling, go with this place!
author: Lindsey P.

description: Beautiful view and location. Clam chowder was amazing. Portion sizes very large. Service was prompt and courteous. Only reason for the 3 stars is a sighting of a small mouse.
author: Tina R.

description: Good, but not great. I recommend the fish and chips, but the fried shrimp was over-cooked. Service was fine. A decent restaurant in a tourist area. The view and ambiance made the experience worthwhile.
author: Peter B.

description: Clam Chowder was delicious! We ordered the special, Risotto with Grilled Scallops and the Mixed Grill for or entrees. Took a bit for the main courses to come out, but both were very good. The salmon with the Mixed Grill was the least enjoyable. Didn't have much flavor compared to the other items and was somewhat blah. Otherwise, a very nice dinner.
author: Ed M.

description: Wife and I made it a point to stop here for dinner based on the yelp rating.  Food and venue didn't disappoint.  Place gets packed for dinner, we were estimated at 1.5-2 hours on a Saturday night.  We were able to grab a couple seats at the bar within about 20 minutes and you can order the full menu. Drinks and food were great, would highly recommend coming here. We got the clam chowder, jumbo shrimp cocktail and linguine with clams.
author: Thomas D.

description: I came here right after the tree lighting so I was luckily able to get seats after 10 minutes of waiting. Unfortunately we didn't get seats near the window for a view but I had a pretty good view anyway :) I got a pair of oysters which were good ($2.50 each) but there was some wasabi or something in the sauce which was a bit too much. I had a bowl of clam chowder in the rather shallow bowl but this is one of the best chowders I've had. I think I'm weird and like different chowders than anyone but I like a tad thick with no potatoes and not so milky. This was gooood. I also had the linguini with clams which tasted light and had a few clams. That was enough to fill two people. Well on top we had two loads of the free bread haha.
author: Amy H.

description: This place is located upstairs in the pier 39 shopping center. Overall this place offers a great view of the pier. The food itself was solid. The clam chowder was delicious. I had a shrimp dish (I forgot the name) that was mouth watering. The HH selection was decent as well. The bartender and waiters were solid as well.
author: Marcus M.

description: Fabulous food and service!susan was literally the best wait staff we have ever had and we eat out and travel a lot! Hands down great place. We will be back and asking for Susan her kindness professionalism and on point great  service down to every detail was awesome !
author: Carol C.

description: I took my significant other for our anniversary date , and it was perfect. The food was delicious, the view of the ocean was amazing and also the waiters were so kind to us. Though it was busy when we went, they treated us like if we were the only people there, so they checked on us from time to time. I would seriously recommend this place to my friends whenever we're by the city!
author: Alan R.

description:
Normally as a local I didn't like to be at Pier 39, because of the many tourists and most of the restaurants are very bad and overpriced. 
But at night it can be are very nice place (most tourists are gone at this time) to eat some dinner if you know where to go! 
We celebrated our Anniversary and found this nice restaurant. The gave us a nice table with perfect view and everyone was so friendly. 
We ordered some appetizer and all of them were so good :D 
Our lobster dish was also tasty, but the appetizer were defiantly are favorite. Next time we will order some more small dishes and don't order a big main course. 
We defiantly recommend this restaurant for a special event like birthdays, Anniversaries and more. 
Not the best place to eat with little children, but for couples or friends a good place to go.
author: Nadine B.

description: I would give this place 5 stars just for the view, you get a spectacular view of the ocean if you sit by one of the window tables - adds 5 stars to your experience. I tried the renowned margarita which was delish. The food - got a lobster - was okay. A little pricey according to me.
author: Reema B.

description: Beautiful location. Excellent service. A bit pricey but portions are large. This could easily be a tourist rip-off joint, but it's not. Would go back in a heart-beat. Try ordering an appetizer and chowder.
author: Bernard D.

description: The food was good.  The service was excellent.  My only complaint is that the crab cake was small and not lump crabmeat.  I would eat there again.
author: Carin H.

description: Overpriced and underwhelming.  Had the beer-battered fish and chips.  Just not that special.  Someone else in my party had the swordfish, which they liked - but the portion size was anemic.
author: Chris H.

description: First time in SF from Miami, Great food! I had the mixed grill. Our waiter Khaiman was very attentive regardless of how busy it was. He even gave us some great recommendations of spots to check out! All star service!
author: Jenry L.

description: Right in the middle of the tourist area so you have to be in the mood for a crowd if your not get there early. We ordered s lot started with the seafood tower. The crab in it was small so not much to pick from ibe had better from Safeway. Bye cheese toast was food had that with a small cup of clam chowder which was thick and rich. The sole was good vut I wouldnt order it again. My friend had the fried combo plate the calamari was good and the fish was very hot and crispy. The clock t sis were really food try the hibiscus margarita but their glasses are small. Service was good probably won't come here again unless I have out of town guest. The view was great.
author: Trina D.

description:
Service was crap. Waiter spilled our wine and gave us the wrong check. The crab Louie was big but they used caned crab. It was tasteless and watery 
  Just another touristy restaurant and way to expensive
author: Martha W.

description: First time visitors to the Fisherman's Wharf, came to Fog Harbor Fish House for their famous clam chowder and it was unexplainable. Simply exquisite!  Great service,  staff impeccable dressed, attentive and "on the ball".  Good food and reasonably priced for a seafood house.  Highly recommended!
author: Edyn L.

description: Nice place, great location and view and the food!!!!!! We ordered fish and chips and the clam chowder with lobster. BOTH were the best my wife and I ever had. Good beers in tap too. The price was decent, not much of a wait. Definitely a good place to eat at
author: Eric H.

description: This place is huge with great ambience, a lil pricey but the food has good quality and taste. Wish they would have told us they provide complimentary bread prior to us ordering blue cheese bread.....regardless if your a tourist and want more of large atmosphere and ok with spending then give it a shot.....but beware of the shady business practice.
author: N And N K.

description: All I can say is "Dude, this place rocks"!'  Killer view, fantastic food and stellar service.  One of the best restaurants o have ever eaten at in my life.  Thank goodness I don't live too close to here or I would eat here seven days s week!
author: Mark L.

description: Tasty crab right on the water, can't complain. Very busy restaurant in fisherman's wharf, but upstairs away from the madness. Good food good service, worth a visit
author: Ryan G.

description: Brought family here visiting from Hawaii for dinner on a weekday.  Parked at the Pier 39 garage as you'll be able to get it validated by the restaurant which accounts for an hour of free parking.  It was a weekday so waiting for a table didn't take long at all (maybe 15 mins without reservations) but we did notice that it got busy when we got seated.  The host was kind enough to sit us at the window that overlooks the Bay Bridge and the bay... beautiful view on a clear evening.  We got a bunch if dishes that included fried calamari (very crunch and tasty), the cioppino (flavorful broth with fresh seafood), lobster tail plate (cooked to perfection!), baked salmon, and fish & chips.  Every dish we ordered everyone seemed to enjoy.  Our waiter was great, always had a smile on his face and was very patient with our requests.  Our family liked it so much that they actually went back the next day for dinner again. Highly recommended even when it's a bit pricey but the view is definitely worth a million bucks!
author: Erna M.

description:
Came here for the clam chowder which I must agree is totally AWESOME. I can't tell you how much I enjoyed eating the clam chowder with the sourdough bread bowl. I'm not a fan of eating seafood however after eating this, I'll be back for more :) 

As for the fish and chips however, I was quite disappointed. The fish was completely flavorless... I'm not sure what would cause this, but it had no flavor at all. It was not over/under battered nor had an overpowering tarter sauce. The fish was there... And a lot of it... I did enjoy the coleslaw which had a hint of wasabi or horseradish. Fries were nothing fancy. 

Service was good, but nothing exceptionally different from regular service. Overall i'd comeback again to order the clam chowder and a side salad :)
author: Chad Y.

description:
Finger lickin good! We ordered the spicy garlic whole crab with jasmine rice and steamed vegetables.  Omg.. it was soooooooo good. It's a seasonal dish so get it while you can.  Everything was seasoned well and it was a perfect 10!

The service was on point and we got seated overlooking the water and had a great time here. The sour dough bread bowl of clam chowder was good as well.
author: Christine P.

description: Must go! Food is fresh and atmosphere is perfect if your looking for an authentic Fisherman Warf vibe. Huge gluten free selection. Prices seem to be on point for the area and they take reservations (highly encourage that).
author: Katie V.

description: I did some research online before dining here. Since we were visiting for the day, before our 3hr trip back home, I had to stop in! The wait was  long; we waited about 2 hours...but, worth it! We received a great dinner with an awesome view. Bread and butter was yummers. The fried calamari was oh, so good. I chose a linguini with clams plate for dinner. It tasted fresh, I think I tasted the ocean!
author: Sharlene C.

description: Great food reasonable price! Seafood penne is the way to go! Tomato cream sauce is wonderful! I usually won't eat cream sauce, but this one is great, not to creamy but flavorful enough to make the seafood great! Love the fish inside. Clams are so fresh in the seafood penne as well. Penne are well cooked, not too soft or hard. Tried my friends salmon and clam chowder. Clam chowder tastes creamy, despite a heavy flavor of corn starch but i somehow enjoy the corn starch taste, remind me of childhood. Sourdough is cool as well! Try the bread before meal, if you like it, then clam chowder in a bread bowl is a safe choice, if you think it's too sour, then you might need to consider not having the soup in a bread bowl, because it is the same type of bread. Also tried the salmon, salmon is a little bit too salty for me, but still taste fresh and tender. Definitely worth going when you are at pier 39. Love the garlic shrimp as the starter! Portions are great and would love to have dessert but have no room for it.
author: Chris W.

description: The Clam Chowder is perfect. Make sure to get it here instead of at all those fake tourist trap places around Fisherman's Wharf. The rest of the menu is a bit pricey but you'll get a great quality for it. If you want to invite someone special to a great restaurant to have seafood then make sure to invite her to this place. The area is super touristy but once you're inside of the restaurant you will forget about it and just enjoy the moment. 5 Stars! Well deserved!
author: Christian D.

description:
This review header is only being updated to conform with the outline for all my Yelp reviews. The ratings below will NOT change.

SERVICE: 95/100

We made a reservation at 8pm. Our server, Mila, got us seated early at a table with a decent view of the Bay and Alcatraz. We were immediately seated, but drinks were not brought out within 10 minutes. Once drinks were served, we were given another 5 minutes or so to look at the menu and order what we want. Mila was super patient with us and just an outstanding server! Thank you!

FOOD: 95/100

We ordered quite a bit, actually, so let me break this down. 

The starters were:
Clam Chowder in a Bread Bowl, 
Calamari, 
Tuna Thai Salad, 
Ahi Tuna Poke, and
Crab Cakes

The Clam Chowder was just delicious! A nice, thick soup that didn't water up the bread, but still got absorbed by the (fresh) sourdough bowl and packed nice flavors in a very aesthetically pleasing manner. 

The Calamari, although not as aesthetically pleasing in terms of how they plated it...splendid! Crunchy outside, tender squid on the inside. The lemon and aioli complemented the dish well. 

The Tuna Thai Salad was...above average. Yes, fresh. Yes, flavorful. Yes, presentable. But...it's a salad after all. It's nothing to be excited about. The tuna just added to the dish. 

The Crab Cakes...oh my God! How do you start this? Crispy on the outside, yet soft and flavorful on the inside with LOTS (and I mean LOTS) of REAL crab! This is an appetizer I definitely recommend!

The Ahi Tuna Poke was very aesthetically pleasing and flavors were just on point with this one! Fresh tuna and avocado with a Wasabi aioli all add up to create a party in your mouth! I would ALSO recommend this app!

The main courses I tried are as followed:
Surf and Turf, and
Ahi Tuna

The Surf and Turf was some of the best lobster-and-steak I have ever had! A beautifully cooked medium 10 ounce New York Strip and a lobster tail so large and delicious, you'd think it's more a mermaid fin than a lobster tail!

The Ahi Tuna had a light sear on the outside, keeping the inside rare. The sesame seeds added some needed 'CRUNCH' to the tuna, which was already flavorful! Sear was excellent, and the Wasabi aioli just complements the dish even further. Aesthetically, the dish was BEAUTIFULLY presented! Overall a well-executed dish! 

Dessert gave us a whole lot of options to choose from.

In this instance, my sister decided to choose the
Tiramisu. Wow. Just wow. Words escape me at how perfectly executed the tiramisu was! 

Nice, large, and square; it was large enough to feed our party of 5! The flavors inside were a nice bitterness of, what I assume, is coffee and a sweetness from the whipped cream on the side and the filling inside. Very moist and flavorful, so, overall, it's a great dessert that EVERYONE should try at least once in their lifetime!

VALUE: 90/100

This is not your typical workday lunch break restaurant. Is there a better way to put this into words? Hell, I doubt it.

OVERALL SCORE: 93/100

-----------------------------

TL;DR - A lovely restaurant with excellent food, service, atmosphere, and views on Pier 39! A bit pricey, but you honestly can't beat fresh seafood straight from Fisherman's Wharf!
author: Elbert N.

description: Clam chowder bowl is a must!  Crab cakes were delicious!  We sat at the bar and had excellent service.  Great atmosphere for lunch.
author: Jon B.

description:
Seafood is absolutely delicious! Will definitely dine here when I visit SFO.
Large portion on the Crabs so be hungry.
author: Saima P.

description: I love this restaurant because of the amazing fresh clam chowder with fresh crab in a bread bowl. Their portions are also huge, which makes the price worth it. I was here a few nights ago to celebrate my birthday with my family and we all enjoyed our food. I was especially shocked at the crab roll since that serving was huge and in my opinion worth $20! Our view was amazing, love that we were next to the waters. Do order the double duo dessert because the warm fudge cake is amazing and so as their creme brûlée! I would definitely come back to this place
author: Danika P.

description: We had a lovely experience with the shel platter to share. It was just enough food to fill each of us. The crab cake was the best one I have ever tried, the perfect seasoning tasted freshly made. Since we were celebrating a birthday we got a dessert and the waitress sang and the cake was taken off the bill. That's was a real nice surprise. Our server, Melissa, was nice and saw her take the time to explain the picture menu to foreign customers.
author: LM C.

description: This restaurant has amazing service. I was told there would be a 30-40 minute wait, but was called to my table in under 20 minutes (I went there in their busy hour). The waiter noticed my friend and I taking pictures and offered to take pictures for us. He was also very patient with us when we had questions and requests. The food tasted extremely fresh, loved it. The atmosphere was also very nice, you get a beautiful view of the pier. Definitely will come back.
author: Melissa C.

description:
Delicious food with an amazing view! Ahi Tuna Poke was delicious along with their clam chowder. 

Arrived around 6:30p.m. We were told our wait time would be 15-20 minutes. Wait time was less then 15 minutes. 

Friendly staff. Our server, although it got busy was awesome!
author: Carmen O.

description: Justin H was a terrific. Very attentive and efficient. Friendly and accommodating. The food was excellent and atmosphere was quintessential. Will always recommend Fog Harbor to friends and family visiting San Fransisco.
author: Steven N.

description: Everything we ate was delicious! To start we got calamari and clam chowder and crab on top  in a sour dough bowl. The clam chowder was amazing, and calamari was really great. For our dishes we got the seared tuna with grilled vegetables. The tuna was amazing! We loved it. We also had the dungenous crab (crab season) cooked red chili style. Great service, amazing views, delicious food. It was a great time, and we would def go back!
author: Susannah H.

description: We were seated promptly. The service was great. The view is awesome. We started with a delicious Caesar salad which was plenty for 2 to share. The waiter helped me choose the mixed grill with salmon, cod, and shrimp. It was really well done with some great flavor. The garlic mashed potatoes were yum! My husband had the fish and chips, which he enjoyed. We would absolutely recommend Fog Harbor!
author: Ruth B.

description: Got the seafood sampler for one and then added a lobster tail perfect for two people to share a little bit of everything!!! Fresh chopped garlic and butter all on the bottom of the plate!! My husband said it was a pool of dreams!!!LOL  Home made steamy hot sour dough bread!!
author: Vanja S.

description: Great food and excellent service! Khaiman is the man! Definitely a must visit if you're at the Pier.
author: Vanessa H.

description: Excellent food, good atmosphere, Justin made it very nice.    We liked the seafood penne and the shrimp brochette.   Both excellent.
author: Joseph V.

description: The food was fantastic and the view was great. We arrived for an early dinner. I knocked one star off since our first server was passing out water and reached across the table and said to my mother "take the glass, honey." Not only is that condescending but it's a sign of an improperly trained server as you should never hand something to a patron. The shift was changing so luckily that server was replaced with someone more professional. Cocktails, appetizers, entrees and dessert...no complaints! Some standouts were the crab cakes, bleu cheese garlic bread (not overwhelmingly bleu - definitely try), mixed seafood penne and special entrees. Take a peek at the old-school dessert tray and you won't be able to resist!
author: R A.

description:
After spending a day in San Francisco, I was really excited to eat some good seafood. My wife and I are both foodies particularly with great seafood. I've had some really good fish in my day, but the day I ate here was not a good day. I was extremely disappointed in the food. It was good quality fish - given the fact that the restaurant is right on the pier. The biggest problem was how it tasted. It was extremely under seasoned. We had the clams, ahi tuna, shrimp, salmon and swordfish. All of which I've had far better tasting versions even in joints like red lobster. Given the quality of taste, I'm not quite sure it was worth the money we spent. I was simply disappointed and left wanting

To the inexperienced, this seafood may be a good intro to seafood as most of the other places you will try will be much better. 


I'm not quite sure what it is with coastal restaurants . The worst lobster I've had was in Maine and now I think similarly of fish in California.
author: Aidan H.

description: Fishermans Wharf is super touristy, but I would definitely go out of my way to eat at Fog Harbor. Our server was excellent - she really went out of her way to accommodate. I mentioned that I didn't eat a lot, and since we were going to be out and about didn't want to have to worry about leftovers. So she highlighted that another member of my party was ordering the same thing and offered that we could share. She was right on. I shared the seafood penne which came in a delicious tomato cream sauce. I also tried another dish at my table - pacific sole - and it was super flavorful and flaky. Can't wait to come back and try other dishes.
author: Michelle W.

description: Just left this location. The attitude and bad service started with the hostess. Gave her my name and sat to wait for a table..15 minutes later she calls "Chrishta" (she has an accent) I asked her if she is saying Crystal and she says yes and seats us. She comes back to the table to tell me that I gave a different name of  "Chara" and someone else thats been waiting should have been seated. I tell her no, my name is Crystal and that is why i asked you if that was the name you were calling. She says another hostess says I gave another name. As she is telling me this the manager walks by and we ask him to come over. I ask her to explain to the manager what she is telling us....she starts to speak in spanish, someone in the party asks her why is she speaking in spanish and asked her to speak English she pauses, looks over and says "cause i want to speak in spanish" and continues. The manager stops her and tells her don't worry about it and tells us he is sorry about the mix up and we are already seated so no worries.........We left!!
author: Crystal K.

description: Great view on the harbor. Food is very delicious, I was sold on the pictures I saw on yelp and wasn't disappointed. Their crab and lobster combo was amazing, best instagram picture of the food you will ever get. Prices are affordable, but expect to spend $50 a person when you go there
author: Frank C.

description:
Staying at the marriott Marquis I always take the concierges suggestions for lunch. And all three of them told me to come here.

Again I'm glad I took their suggestions. Wow   If I could start every meal every with this bread soup combo I would hug everyone ever from the minute I woke up to the minute I went to sleep.

Also got the crab cakes and the fish and chips both good on their own accord but meh compared to the soup.  

Like starting out with a Bugatti anything else has to be less exhilarating.

Our server Bianca was top notch.
author: Jonathan S.

description:
We came to Fog Harbor Fish House on Christmas eve and were very pleased with the overall service and quality of food, not to mention the phenomenal views!

The four of us were seated very quickly despite the restaurant being almost at full capacity, and we were immediately greeted by our server who was very energetic and friendly. We started off with some clam chowder, blue cheese garlic bread, and calamari all of which were excellent. Our mains consisted of lobster, steak, and grilled/fried shrimp. Everyone in my party who ordered the seafood dishes was very happy with their choice. I, on the other hand, didn't find the steak to be too tasteful which is why I docked a star off my review. I realize that this is a seafood place but a little flavor on the steak (even only salt and pepper) would have been appreciated!

This being said however, I would definitely recommend this restaurant! Make sure you stick to the seafood dishes and you'll be a very happy camper :)
author: Noha G.

description: Definitely one of the best Seafood restaurant in the US. I loved their Salmon. I am from the East coast but whenever I go to SF, I make it a point to visit this place to dine. Also, its good to reserve the table well in advance. Use Open table to reserve, will make your life a lot simple, since this place is mostly packed.
author: Rajesh S.

description: We dropped in for lunch on 4/20/18 while visiting San Francisco and had a pleasant experience. Our food was fresh and we received ample portions. I recommend choosing the seafood and trying something you may not have eaten before. Also, enjoy the views...the harbor and bay are great for people watching!
author: Ted H.

description: So very disappointing! My husband barely touched his fish and chips because the fries were cold and the fish was so bland (no better than some frozen package we could get at Walmart)...! When we pointed out that it was sub par they did not even offer to take it off of our ticket and still made us pay for it!  Poor customer service! Will not return...
author: Shauna R.

description: Wonderful evening! The night before the solar eclipse, golden hour casting it's glow on the Golden gate, and a wonderful dinner with wonderful friends...simply excellent :) Our server, Justin, was absolutely professional! I have dietary restrictions, and he took care of me every step of the way. The food was above average, and although I wont be giving out any michelin stars, we truly enjoyed our meal. Get the oysters! All in all, what a memorable experience :) We will certainly come back the next time we make it to San Francisco.
author: Sam M.

description: The food, the service and the view! We had raw oysters, fried bay scallops that were phenomenal and chowder in a bread bowl. The food was delicious. So glad we ate here. You should eat here too :)
author: Tina A.

description: Spending time with friends and wanted to grab lunch.  This place did not disappoint.  It's a little pricey but worth it and there is a wait but once we were seated the customer service was excellent.  I had the salmon club salad. The salmon was grilled to perfection and the ranch mustard dressing was an excellent companion.  The clam chowder is super tasty and the fish and chips is a comforting favorite.  View is beautiful and we were in and out within the hour.  Lively vibe and great atmosphere.  Wonderful way to spend the afternoon.
author: Lori F.

description:
I just want to thank the manager, Anthony, and my server, Elena, for their awesome service recovery. There was a minor miscommunication error and they were so accommodating to my needs and were both so helpful. The miscommunication error was not their fault (another servers mistake), yet they were quick to fix the situation and I am very thankful for that. Thank you both so much. 
Also, the shrimp scampi was very good!
author: T N.

description:
Mongo like this rest-or-rant soooo much. And so close to Mongo's hotel - Mongo eat here five times so far. Mongo eat Sourdough Bread Bowl Clam Chowder. Yummy! Mongo eat Crab Cakes. Yummy! Mongo eat Mussel Fries. Yummy! Mongo eat Shrimp Louis. Yummy! Mongo eat Fried Combo. Yummy! Mongo drink many, many Jack and Cokes. And everybody nice to Mongo. 

Mongo say pretty views from Mongo's table. 
But Mongo no see no fog...
author: Mongo I.

description: Amazing amazing amazing!!!!! You must eat here! Bread, calamari, soup! Main dishes haven't even came yet.
author: Hilary B.

description: We had an hour wait for a party of 6. They told us 90 minutes.  The views of the water and Alcatraz  was outstanding. The server was very attentive.  Prices were reasonable  for a sea food restaurant.  The shrimp  was nice large  and fresh.  Clam  chowder  was very good and bread nice and fresh.definately would try again
author: Anthony K.

description: Was very good food wait was a little long but with so many amazing things to check out in the area time.oassed quickly. I will say the services was a little slow but I think this is to be excepted at 8:30 on a Saturday. I had chicken penne over all was pretty good but my chicken aas dry. The seafood was very good though so I'd say stick to that.
author: Nj H.

description: Raphael rocked it!! He completely took care of everything to complete an amazing meal!   The food was fresh and the portions were huge.  Don't let the tourist location fool you. You can't go wrong here.
author: Chris M.

description:
We had a really great dinner here. Food is delicious, waiters are nice, atmosphere is lovely! 

Seafood is awesome. From starters we tried Crispy Calamari and they were super tasty. Swordfish was amazing, just as much as Grilled Shrimp Brochette.  

Been here on Christmas Day - that day restaurant closed an opportunity to make a table reservation.
Restaurant was busy, we waited some time for table to get free. But waiting wasn't annoying. We had an opportunity to leave the name and phone number, so took a little walk around while waiting.

But anyway, we are super satisfied.
We definitely will come again.

Came back on a Valentines Day with friends. We were all satisfied again. This time we had both foods and deserts. Seafood was great just as the first time! There were shrimps, oysters, crab, clams - awesome. Baked oysters and salmon salad - amazing. Penne with chicken and Blue cheese salad - tasty. From deserts we had creme brulee, tiramisu, some strawberry pie and duo (creme brulee and chocolate fondant). Delicious! 

This time we hadn't any problems with time at all - had a reservation and service was pretty fast.
author: Anastasija V.

description:
Let me start by saying this: we waited an hour and 15 mins and it was worth every second! My friend and I were visiting from Vegas and saw the promo on instagram. I didn't have much faith in this choice seeing as how they were advertising on Instagram but she really wanted to give it a try. So glad she didn't listen to me! We are both originally from the East coast and miss a great deal the fresh seafood. It tasted just like home. 

We ordered...a crab roll, garlic roasted crab, mussel fries, clam chowder, seared tuna app, grilled seafood plate with a lobster tail (my entree) and cippino (my friends entree). Did I mention we were really hungry? Our waiter probably thought we had lost our minds especially bc we are very tiny girls lol but we were commited!

Everything was amazing. The mussel fries are prepared really crispy with this shallot cream sauce that you simply want to drink.  The garlic roasted crab was cooked to perfection and is served with just the right amount of garlic. I loved my grilled swordfish! My friend could not stop eating her cippino lol we had to squirt hand sanitizer on it so she would stop. 

Overall this was a great lunch and our server was really good with recommending wines and menu items.  This will definitely be a regular stop on our visits. Our bill was reasonable for what we ordered. We were very pleased
author: Star J.

description: Everything here was absolutely fantastic!!  We had the whole cooked Dungeness crab in chili sauce and it was so good!!  The baked oysters are super yummy as a starter and the bread they bring you is also very impressive. This is our "must go to" dinner spot when we visit SanFran.
author: Chris F.

description: My service was fantastic, always kept water in my cup and was able to answer all of our questions. We had the the clam chowder with the add of crab, the salmon BLT which was Devine. The chicken penne was very flavorful and delicious. We will definitely be returning and have already told many people to go check it out
author: Mahaugoni S.

description:
My boyfriend and I stayed in South Bay for the night on our way up north and wanted some clam chowder. First time in the bay  and heard this place had the best clam chowder in San Francisco so we decided to try it! 

The decor is beautiful! They have a waiting area in the front w couches, campfire and waterfalls! Great to stay warm while waiting!  ~15 min wait on a Friday night! 

The waiter was fast and very friendly! We got our food in about 15-20 min. :) I ordered clam chowder without the bread bowl bc we got bread w butter anyways ! And my boyfriend got fried platter w fish, calamari, shrimp, fries and coleslaw. We were disappointed big time!! The chowder needed more spices and salt, very bland! And the fried platter was literally 1 piece of fish, 2 of shrimp, and good amount of calamari and fries. The coleslaw needed something... I don't know it was just not what we expected based on the reviews. Will not be coming back here but it was an experience. 

Yvonne
author: Yvonne T.

description: Great seats and presentation of the food. Coming in the late afternoon during winter makes the ambiance incredible. The ahi poke was light and spicy in flavor at just the right temp. The shellfish platter was amazing with the saffron butter garlic sauce. If you are a fish lover. Go for the swordfish
author: Jason B.

description:
Came here September.  Weird weather in SF.  I was happy because I like the warmer weather.  But I know it wasn't the norm for the San Franciscans.  
This place doesn't have A/C b/c like I said its never that warm in September.  
It was pretty stuffy due to the no A/C.

I give the service 5 stars! 
Sadly, I had to rate this place 3 stars.  The food was huge portions, but the taste wasn't there for me.  
I know this is probably a tourist spot, since its located at the famous Pier 39.  
I came here with my family. . .there was 7 of us total.  We wanted to show my aunt around since it was her first time in the city.  (my brothers and SIL being locals) 
The place did fill up pretty fast.
author: Remie M.

description: The ambiance was great and the garlic dungeness crab was even better. Ask for drawn garlic butter with the crab.....it'll make your day!!!
author: Jelaine J.

description: Great service. Would definitely recommend to anyone around the area. Will be coming back soon.
author: Edwin M.

description: Beautiful view of the pier while dining. Crab and avocado salad was sumptuous. All the fish tasted fresh and satisfying. Portions are very generous - we were already stuffed after the appetizers! Clam chowder was not as "special" as I thought it would be, but still pretty well-made.
author: Casey L.

description: Honestly I think my hopes were too high for this place. I got the halibut special which was good but fell short of great. I feel like there were too many ingredients in the dish and it masked the spectacular piece of fish itself. Maybe I just prefer more minimal dishes, who knows. It still tasted alright and fish was cooked decently. I guess I just expected more for the price. It was however a member of my groups birthday and they gave him a complimentary dessert which was nice.
author: Marissa D.

description: Our meal was exceptional! Kuddos to the chef! Our Serbian waiter was a story teller and an excuse maker! Other than that is was great food over looking the water!
author: Laurie P.

description:
We were seated at the table with a nice view but the lighting should be dimmer. It's a bit too bright inside. The service was great. Our server kept coming back to check up on us. 

We started off with cocktails. I had a gimlet and my friend had a Manhattan. Although they made my gimlet a bit sweet, I still love it because it's so refreshing. We also ordered clam chowder, clams with linguini, and a seafood platter for 2 to share. Clam chowder is flavorful. The clams and linguini was ok; they could've made it more saucy because it's slightly on the dry side. The seafood platter is awesome with shellfish all over. I love the garlic wine sauce. The crab on this platter is a bit bland so I'm guessing they just steamed the crab with plain water. The garlic toast that's placed on top of the seafood was a bit too hard. Everything else on this platter was excellent.
author: Cindy W.

description: Tons of flies and gnats. Found a hair in my fries. The crab sandwich tasted like lettuce and mayo... Not much crab. Place has awesome views, but if you're looking for good food- I might go elsewhere next time... Visited on 09/17/2017.
author: Chris G.

description: We were visiting SF and went to the Wharf for lunch. We wanted to eat some famous crab so we chose the Fog Harbor Fish House and I'm glad we did. It was excellent! We came here for a late lunch on a Wed. and had no problems getting a table. Service was very good. We ordered the House Salad $7 and the Garlic Roasted Crab $20. The atmosphere was amazing. Everything tasted delicious and very fresh. If you are a visitor, you should definitely check this place out. We can't wait to return.
author: Richard F.

description: Came here solely based on yelp reviews. Wait staff was excellent & very attentive. Chowder was an excellent temperature and delicious. Crab was excellent. Kids meals were good with healthy options! Overall, the meal met our standards and the view was a bonus! We were able to watch the fog rolling in over the Golden Gate Bridge!
author: Laura L.

description: Terrible!  We selected Fog Harbor Fish House to enhance our romantic one only evening in SF on return trip to LA.  The wait was long and chaotic. We attempted to get a cocktail during the wait for dinner but the overwhelmed bar tender was unable to mix us a drink for 40 minutes he was so busy.  We were finally seated but it was in the back of the restaurant facing the waiter's work station.  Not the bayside romantic table we envisioned. The food not only took took too long to arrive once ordered BUT it was extremely salty, unpleasant and lacked any presentation assumed for the price range.   Service was rushed and not personal but we feel the management severely understaffed the restaurant resulting in poor service, poor quality and this couple was quite disappointed in our entire experience at Fog Harbor Fish House
author: Barbie Z.

description:
