The Fog House is a wonderful example of the amazing food available in San Fransisco.  The location on the pier is stunning and you get views from every seat in the room.  It's a shame I live in NY and won't be able to eat here until 2017 when I plan on traveling back to SF.  

Appetizers:  Calamari; New England Clam Chowder. 
   -Both amazing and the NE clam chowder is a must order if you are a fan.  The best one I've ever had and that's a East Coast man talking.


Dinners:  Mixed Grill (swordfish, salmon and shrimp, all grilled of course - simply delicious, 100% thrilled with the meal.

  Lobster Tail with Garlic mashed potatoes - My fiancé loves lobster, she said it was perfectly cooked and was delectable as well.

  Ahi Tuna dinner with wild rice - My fiancé's cousin ate the entire dish and was another very satisfied customer.

Restaurant atmosphere was fantastic and our waiter was extremely attentive, knowledgeable and most importantly friendly.
author: Greg Y.

description: Amazing food!!!   The clam chowder was one of the best I have had (and I am from MA).  BF had the filet, it was so tender and had so much flavor with the mushroom sauce topped with crumbled blue cheese.   I had the Ahi Tuna, seared to perfection, with a wasabi aioli.  Definitely recommend if in the San Fran area.
author: Michelle H.

description:
Minus one star for the host tryin to seat is by a pillar, nevermind he walked us past a two seater table by the window. Why can't we sit there?? Oh someone else has been waiting for that table. Yea we were too! Found us another table by a window in the back of the restaurant
 Whatever. Im here for the food. 
We shared seafood platter for two & calamari. DELICIOUS!
author: Sharee g.

description:
I tried the seafood penne
The creamy tomato sauce was great. I preferred the seafood to be more tender, but the dish was still very delicious.
author: Zhou L.

description: OMG!  The food!  The bread!  The view!  The booze!  Seriously great lunch and we consumed a whole lot of that wonderful sourdough bread that San Francisco is known for. The seafood was fresh and delicious, so was the cioppino and chowder
author: Bryan S.

description: Very romantic view of the ocean at this restaurant, it is right near the entrance of Pier 39. There was complimentary white bread with butter. The strawberry mint nojito was refreshing and very minty. It was pretty addicting. The cup of clam chowder with added crab topping was creamy and thick. For the entree, hubby and I shared the linguini and clams. In my opinion, there where too much parmesan on this dish. It was a thick, creamy pasta (I was hoping it would be more of a light sauce). However, there were a good portion of clams. The food was ok, I had high hopes since I've always heard about this place and wanted to try it out.
author: Cindy H.

description:
First time, I really wanted to try this place because it has  4 stars of 1000 reviews. Plus the other place I wanted to try was packed. I mean it is a Saturday and today is the giants vs. LA dodgers game.

This place is upscale, fine dining type of place. I like that they offer places like these in an attraction base environment. Cause sometimes you want to enjoy a nice dinner with a fantastic view. Like this place I'm at right now. 

Our server is nice, but when we asked for water she said it's coming, and made it seem like someone else was bringing it but she brought it to us instead. Sometimes she'd walk by just to walk by and see that my water is almost empty and doesn't fill it up, you're just walking back and forth, what are you doing? 

Anyway, what we ordered: clam chowder bread bowl, seafood ciopponi with pasta, and steamed clams.

What it tasted like: everything looked amazing. The clam chowder was the best thing we ordered, it was hot and very good. The seafood ciopponi was ok, there was some type of flavor I probably won't remember. The noodles were hard. The seafood in the ciopponi were good, I like the variety. There was salmon, fish, mussel, clams, shrimp and crab legs. The steamed clams, I've had before somewhere else taste better with garlic broth. This chorizo with tomatoes, I didn't really care for.

Would I come back? Maybe I'll try somewhere else first before I give this one another shot.
author: Ameenah M.

description: All the dishes we ordered at fog harbor fish House were awesome! Like the assorted seafood stew, clam chowder, scallops risotto... The staff and waiters were pretty friendly and welcoming. This is definitely a must visit restaurant in sf
author: Abbey C.

description: Enjoyed lunch here on a clear day and loved the food and excellent service. Martin was our waiter and couldn't have been better. This restaurant is lucky to have him! We enjoyed to soup bowls with fresh crab and we were not disappointed. Very happy with this visit!
author: Mal C.

description: Wonderful dinner experience. Thank you to the waiter who saw my sleeping son and moved us to a booth and our new waiter (michael?). Everyone was attentitive and accomadating and the food was well prepared. Thank you!
author: Liz M.

description:
I ordered the shellfish sample platter for two and it came with tiny russet potatoes, mussels, shrimp, clams, and a crab all doused in a savory garlic butter sauce. The shrimp and potatoes were my favorite part of the platter. The potatoes were cooked to tender perfection and the shrimp had a great texture and taste. 
The bread they give is freshly baked and steaming when it arrived at the table and had a perfect crisp on the outside. We dipped the bread in the leftover garlic butter sauce and my oh my it was good. 
We ordered a clam chowder bowl and it was slightly on the salty side but it was super rich and came with a generous serving of clams and other ingredients to make it an appetizing soup option nonetheless. 
To freshen our palate, we ordered a house salad with grilled shrimp. The balsamic vinaigrette dressing cut the creaminess of the other dishes to provide a nice contrast in the meal. 
All in all, would definitely recommend going for the great view and food.
author: Stephen L.

description:
Ever since our August 2015 trip, I've returned in Sep. 2015 and this past weekend. The Jan. 2016 visit was more important as it was a joint birthday for my mom and gf's dad. There was 12 of us, and I reserved a table a month prior. We were lucky to get the best seat in the house, and a spectacular view of the wharf. Everyone in my group ordered clam chowder in cups and bowls and the calamari for the appetizers. The whole family enjoyed it, even coining the clam chowder one of the best chowders they've had. Our server Amy and the rest of the Fog Harbor team took great care of us. Almost 80% of my group ordered the Mixed Grill, while we also added some seafood pasta and lobster tail entrée. Regardless of the wharf being very touristy, Fog Harbor is not just a touristy place, I feel they care and serve quality food. I highly highly recommend this place, over and over again!

Peace, love and happiness!
author: Jeff T.

description: Just came in and ordered a $40 steak, and found a big fat hair in the veggies. We left to go to a different place. GROSS.
author: Lily C.

description:
Excellent food and service! 
My family and I came to celebrate my dads birthday we enjoyed our food so much we will return whenever we are in the city.
author: Mariaysabel L.

description:
Always love visiting this spot while at the Wharf.  I have not had a bad meal here and their staff is very friendly.  Good views of the harbor & the seals.
I recommend this place over any other place on the Wharf.
author: Kari C.

description:
This place is mediocre at best. 

I came in with 3 others at 5pm. We have a dinner reservation somewhere else at 7:30, so we figured we'll just "snack" here

The things we ordered:
Crab cake
Whole Garlic roasted crab
Fried Combo
Linguini Clam

What came out first:
Crab cake. We split the crab cake four ways (because there were four of us). Mines was good. While halfway through, one of the girls found a short, black curly hair mixed in with her crab cake. We caught the attention of a server and told him, he said he will get his manager. 

The manager came:
We told him what happened, showed him the hair. He said nothing to us, did not apologize, then asked "do you want another one" . I told the other girl "not if its going to have hair in it" and the manager rudely replies "you either want another one or you don't". Okay you asshole, first of all. One of your workers fucked up and dropped hair into our food. Why the hell are you acting like you couldn't be bothered with us and give us your shit attitude? We declined another crab cake. The shit manager grabs the plate of the girl with the hair crab cake and the main plate and walks away with nothing else to say. No apologies or anything. 

What came out next:
Garlic crab and fried combo. 
The whole crab meat was mushy, kind of like the crab was already dead when they cooked it. The crab was also cold, so maybe that crab was ready to serve the moment we ordered. The crab was on a bed of potatoes with broccoli on the side. The fried combo came with 1 fish, 2 shrimps on a bed of calamari with Cole slaw and fries on the side. It was just alright. The fries tasted better than everything else on that plate.

Our linguini clam never came out. Server must've forgotten about it. 

Towards the end, we felt really dissatisfied with our meal, so another girl and I decided to try their clam chowder. We ordered the clam chowder on the bread bowl.

It came out right away. With the remaining crab meat we had from the whole crab, we put the meat into the clam chowder and ate it that way. Out of everything we had up until that point, the clam chowder tasted better than every thing else
author: Jessica T.

description:
I don't normally enjoy touristy restaurants because of the crowd, but going to Fog Harbor is definitely a cuisine experience I would recommend to any local or tourist. The view is gorgeous, the service is beyond excellent, and the food is heavenly. Shout out to our waiter Jonathan!

I ordered a cup of clam chowder ($6) because I didn't want that to be my main entree, and it's cool that they offer options to have clam chowder in a cup, regular bowl, or bread bowl. Personally I think this is the best clam chowder I have ever tasted in SF, and I have had a LOT of clam chowder in SF. 

I also ordered the linguine with clams ($18) which has garlic, olive oil, and tomatoes. This might actually become a regular item for me, if I didn't want to try everything else on the menu at some point. It's fresh, creamy, and very filling. 

Even their bread comes straight from the oven, hot on our table. Their selection of cocktails is worth taking a look at as well. I'm just in love with every aspect of Fog Harbor. Make sure to call and reserve a table ahead of time to avoid a long wait!
author: Stefanie C.

description:
Free views ya'll! If they offer you a window seat: take it; the view of the ocean is stunning. Sunsets are beautiful here! 
The food was wonderful, and I am a sucker for good bread. As you wait for your meal to come out, they provide you with Boudin sourdough bread and butter- talk about melt in your mouth and making you weak in the knees. I can't get enough of it!

I ordered their Wild King Salmon: grilled on a bed of roasted corn, arugula, red peppers, fingerling potatoes and tarragon with a citrus butter. So fresh and delicious! Several entrees prices change daily to the market price for the day.

If you are into beer and want to try a local brew, I suggest trying Anchor Steam. They also have a pretty extensive wine and cocktail menu, too!

Great experience - it is a bit pricey, but worth it!
author: Kim K.

description:
Absolutely delicious! Not cheap but worth every penny. I ate with a party of 11 people and we all loved our meals. The fog harbor burger, clam chowder in a bread bowl and crab rolls were the favorites. I am from Cape Cod so I'm very discerning when it comes to seafood and it was definitely fresh here. The service was exceptional too. Very friendly and attentive staff. We were on vacation so I had an envelope with $200 cash in it that I accidentally forgot on the table and one of the wait staff chased us down to return it. He could've kept it and I never would've known so I feel like that's a testament to the quality of people they employ. I'll always be grateful to him for that and remember the whole experience fondly. 
Be sure to get your parking validated if you parked in the garage. It'll save you an hour off your parking fee.
author: Tracy L.

description: Eddie was hands down the best server I have ever had the pleasure of being served by. Food was fantastic and the ambience was perfect.
author: Louie A.

description: The lazy chiopino and the mussel fries were amazing. Paired with some local brew (805) and a view of Alcatraz, helped make my first visit to San Fran (and California) an experience I won't soon forget.
author: Bryan D.

description:
I came back and we had a great time here. The people are so nice and the food is always so tasty. We left completely stuffed. I really don't know why we waited another year to return. I think this coming year we will return sooner. Love all the food. Everything is so flavorful and so fresh. 
Merry Christmas and a very Happy New Year!!!!
author: Kenneth R.

description:
Whenever my family and I are in town (we're from SoCal) we always come here to eat!

- Ask for a window seat. You might have to wait a little, but the view is too pretty!
- Food is pricey, but delicious! I had the clam chowder bowl with crab ($16) It's the best!!
- FREE sourdough bread with butter while you wait till your food comes
- The hostesses in the front were nice, but our waiter was kind of rude! (1 star off)
- check in at Pier 39 on yelp and receive a FREE coupon book at their information center (next to the restaurant) you can get 2 hours of FREE parking (structure) instead of 1 from the restaurant (saved $18) and a coupon for FREE blue cheese garlic bread (saved $8)
author: Christine A.

description: Wonderful! The dishes, the view, and the service are all good. I really care about he service more than the dishes. However, all waiters did not make me disappointed. They are polite and wel-served. Will visit it again!
author: Tony Z.

description: Yum diddly yum yum yum. Such a lovely welcome on a rainy evening. The warm fireplace and friendly hostesses were so hospitable. The menu here is gorgeous - we could not make a decision to save our lives. Drinks were incredibly tasty, good beer, and a nice wine selection too. The bread was damn good. I had the specialty salmon with a gorgeous pumpkin curry and wanted to lick the plate clean. Hubby had the rockfish - broiled/pan-fried to perfection with amazing side dishes. We loved this place. It sits right on Pier 39 and you'd think it would be kitschy.... but it's NOT. Enjoy.
author: Deb S.

description:
This is absolutely a great restaurant
Great food fair price and one of the most important thing! Awesome service, love Martian the guy who attend our table!
He give advice on our order and keep come back whenever we need! 
Really memorable experience here
author: Mengjia W.

description:
Very impressive food. The fish and chips was really good. No fishy taste and perfectly breaded. The salmon stuffed crab off the seasonal menu melted in mouth fully flavored and ZERO FISHINESS. The mashed potatoes still had chunks of potatoes that gave it great texture, and slightly flavored with garlic and shallots. I was worries it wiuld be touristy, but even if it was it still good the brocolli was even nicely seasoned to compliment the salmon. 

Food came out hot and ready to be enjoyed. 

Only downside, and it could be cause we were tired and our 13 month old was ready to go was the service. For me its about getting water filled and that didnt happen as regularly as i would like. Overall, loved it.
author: faisal e.

description: Best clam chowder I ever had better then any on the east coast. I had the linguini with clams, Fantastic! And prices weren't bad compared to other restaurants on the pier.
author: Ramon O.

description: Basically a version of Chart House in my opinion. We had the Cesar shrimp salad, clam chowder, sliders, and the crab roll. Everything was decent. Loved the sourdough baguettes, probably the best part. We spent $80 for two people for basic food. Again, not overly impressed with the high reviewed spots in San Francisco.
author: Emily D.

description: The food was delicious. We did not have a reservation on a Sunday around 2pm, so the wait time was approx. 40 minutes long. The time went by fast though because we perused shops while we waited. I ordered fish and chips, clam chowder with crab meat and my son ordered cioppino with pasta. It was heavenly! Will go again for sure!
author: Sandy D.

description:
Bon-Appe-DISAPPOINTED!!! This place is nothing but a tourist trap for people who think they're actually getting SF's greatest seafood... 

What I got was an over cooked crab, with a hard piece of bread. Seriously I should have sent it back. So disgusting, you guys should be ashamed of yourselves for serving that.
author: Molly S.

description: Great find! Absolutely loved our meals- crab, tuna, filet, shrimp linguine! Best mosquol mule my daughter has ever had. Waiter did a great job
author: Carla T.

description: Just had a phenomenal experience with Justin H.! He was very attentive, helpful, and made our Friday lunch an amazing one. Thanks so much!
author: Elana S.

description:
Sat down for ten minutes wasn't even addressed... nothing much else to say... we didn't even get water. 

But I will say a number of the wait staff walked by and nothing... not a we'll be right with you, can we get you some water while you wait?  

As we left we were thanked for coming by the same hostess that sat us.  I was a bit snippy obviously, I said thanks for nothing no one even acknowledged us, at that point she grabbed a manager who offered to help but I would expect better from a restaurant that gets 4 stars. 

Sorry I will take my money elsewhere...
author: Brian S.

description:
First timer to dine at this place - hubby was craving for some steak while we were visiting #pier39 - Yelpers gave 4 stars. So we decided to checked it out... 
His : medium new York steak came out medium well (towards well done)
Hers : medium well new York steak came out WELL DONE (towards charcoal!!!!) - asking for halibut but I was told that its not the season :-(
Son : chicken tender with fries

For some steak with $33/plate - at least make it edible for your guest to eat it...

Call the server and I have to wait for a least 10 mins..
The manager (we believe he was the floor manager) - told me that it will coming out soon and he was apologizing - he was also said that it will be on him. We were not sure what it meant so we were like okay....

After it came out, our server was checking back on my steak and I told her its like what I wanted. Thank you.

When the bill came, they really didn't count my steak on the bill. So we only paid for my husband and our son foods. Which I think its still overpriced for the quality of foods they served.

Right before we left, I asked the manager's name - he said his name is Mario.

Gave 4 star for just bc he was responsible for a mistake that was done by the kitchen staff.

I hope they make the foods taste better when we come back! 
And oh, their garlic bread was delicious!!! Got it for free as well bc of the coupon book (ask from the information desk - 2nd floor).

Hope this help!
author: ChaRis K.

description:
Look no further! THE place on Pier 39 to have a beautiful lunch with a view! We were seated promptly and had a lovely waiter who had lots of fun stories. My husband and I shared the chowder in a sourdough Bread Bowl with the crab loaded on top for an extra six dollars along with 1/2 dozen of the freshest raw oysters. The hibiscus margarita was refreshing too! 

Just enough to fuel us up for more walking and sightseeing!
author: Ashley S.

description: My husband & I came in and waited for nearly an hour for a table. When they tried to seat us in the back of the restaurant, we asked for one of the nicer tables for 2 by the window. They told us "It's this or nothing." They said that they have a policy against re-seating, yet the tables sat empty while we sat at the bar. I have no patience for ANY establishment that blindly follows a ridiculous "policy". Use your brain. Think outside of "The Box". I thought San Francisco was famous for free-thinking? These people are obviously dead from the neck up, and have no idea how to provide good customer service. Go elsewhere if you want to be treated like a human being as opposed to cattle.
author: Catherine C.

description: The food was tasty and the vibe was classy. Must try the clam chowder. Had a few drinks at the bar while we waited (45 minute wait for a Friday night). Would definitely go back.
author: Ken L.

description: We had a really bad day. Our car got brown into that night, but we kept our plans steel and decided to try this place out. It was amazing. Customer service was great and the food delicious!!
author: Becki P.

description: My terminally ill brother chose this restaurant for our last big family dinner. The staff was very accommodating and friendly.
author: Dorthy W.

description: We had an amazing dinner last night celebrating 2 birthdays.  Cioppino was delicious, as was the crab risotto. Justin was our server and he was terrific.  He is a great ambassador for the restaurant.  We will definitely be back next trip to the bay.
author: Jeff F.

description: I tried Fog Harbor for the first time last night and had an awful experience. The hostess was rude and made my girlfriend and I wait 15 minutes past our reservation time to be seated. Our waitress however was friendly and fast. Unfortunately, our food (both dishes) came our cold, thankfully we received fixed dishes quickly. This morning my field woke up with a major stomach ache...needless to say I will never go back here and would strongly encourage everyone to avoid this tourist trap.
author: Chris M.

description: While clearly a tourist destination situated on Pier 39, Fog Harbor Fish House definitely has some fresh seafood. We ordered the seafood tower, mussels, and shrimp cocktail and loved it. Being a native Floridian, I think the prices are a little high (hence the 4, not 5, star review), but it's definitely a great option before or after an adventure to Alcatraz.
author: Brooks A.

description:
Wife and I went here after a long day exploring the city.  We were very happy overall, would recommend it and would go back. 

As far as location it had a wonderful view of the harbor, golden gate bridge, boats coming in and out of the area.  It is on the Pier 39 which is a bit touristy but if you are there for sight seeing and whatnot its a really great option.  

Wait staff were excellent, we always had full drinks, great recommendations as well as friendly conversation. 

Food:  Had Calamari, Seafood Sampler, Full Dungeoness crab and clam chowder.  Nothing I had was bad, I just didn't think the clam chowder lived up the hype.  I think it was a great clam chowder but I personally didn't think it was the best thing I had.
author: Adam C.

description: Great food. Great environment. Great customer service. Our waiter, mel, was great & I give him 5 out of 5 stars, as well as the staff. Will be coming back with my family.
author: Adreana V.

description: Food was great. We ordered oysters, roasted garlic crab and scallops. The view was nice. A little bit pricy but worth a try.
author: Am T.

description: Excellent service and perfect ambiance! Although we had a party of 11 with kids our waitress and waiter were very accommodating to all of us. There is plants of seating in this restaurant with a full bar and outside waiting area. The food was delicious!!!!! This would be a perfect date night venue there are water views as well.
author: Angelique D.

description: We ordered oysters and the sea food platter for two....we then realized that some tapatío would be essential for this meal... not because it lacked anything but cause we r Mexican. Unfortunately they had none. Marc the bartender and our server busted a Houdini and found us some tapatío to complement our perfect meal. We are super pleased with our meal and with the great service from Marc.
author: Mark S.

description: Everything was great. The food can be pricey but definitely worth it. Food was very delicious. Plus our waiter Justin H. gave us great service he was very kind and very attentive. Definitely will be back.
author: Jeannet G.

description: Went to a fish house, ordered the steak, with relatively high expectations but was also worried about the portions. Let me tell you... that steak was outstanding and the portion and overall meal, drinks included, far exceeded my expectations. Bar tender was excellent as well!
author: Brian E.

description: We were blindly looking for a good seafood place and I'm so happy we fell upon this gem!! The entire experience was absolutely amazing!! We couldn't book a reservation until 9 but when we got there they said they could try to get us in sooner because we were starving so they did. Restaurant has a great view, food was amazing and service extraordinary! Justin was incredibly professional, sweet, accommodating, helpful and flexible. He is the epitome of great customer service! When I was even the least bit dissatisfied with my original meal (mine was a bit over cooked but my nephews same dish was amazing), no questions asked he switched it out. Food was well priced for the quality. I would definitely come back! Thank you so much Justin!
author: Kelsey V.

description: Great views, but that's it. And if you're not located near a window, then you don't even have that. Waitress was a bit short with us. Food was mediocre and definitely not worth the exorbitant prices. My friend had the tuna, which was a bit raw. I have no idea if this was done on purpose but we prayed he wouldn't get food poisoning. I had the grilled shrimp which was fine but nothing special. There are definitely better places in the area.
author: Mallory L.

description: Traditional Clam Chowder taste great. My favorite entree is Shimp Brochettes. Location is great, can catch Pokémon while eating. Great view if you sit next to window. We enjoy the food, enjoy the atmosphere.
author: Shrabbit A.

description: Great Dinner!!!! The staff was awesome from our Hostess to our GREAT waiter Justin!!!! Can't go wrong here that's for sure!!!
author: Bobby H.

description: All the positive reviews were accurate! The clam chowder and shrimp pasta were delicious! Here on vacation and enjoying every minute of it!
author: Dee A.

description:
Treat yourself right to amazing seafood with a spectacular view.

Fog Harbor has the longest wait times out of all the establishments in Pier 39 and for good cause.  The food and service are top notch with a large variety of seafood dishes. 

For appetizers, I had the blue cheese garlic bread.  This dish is best shared with at least three or four people as you get a half loaf of garlic bread smothered with melted blue cheese.  Fog Harbor doesn't hold back on the cheese either, as each bite was an explosion of flavor.  For my main dish, I had the Cioppino, a bowl of tomato sauce filled with a variety of seafood from fish to crab to mussels.  One thing I appreciate was the option to order the Cioppino "lazy style" meaning all the shell fish was de-shelled before serving.  The dish itself had bold flavors, a good amount of spice, and was so filling that I had to take half of it home.

Fog Harbor is pricey, so it's more of a place to treat yourself and your date or celebrate a special event, but if you have money to spend and want food from the sea, by the sea, then look no further then the Fog Harbor Fish House.
author: Nadav P.

description: I tried fried prawns. Food is good. Though I felt like its oily, I love the taste of prawns. Fish  is very fresh and juicy.
author: Bhanu H.

description:
Expect to wait up to an hour if you go during dinner time!

Overall setting was very nice. Pretty loud and semi causal restaurant or maybe it was just the table next to me lol. 

Our server was friendly and checked on us during our meal which is always a plus. 

We ordered the fried calamari, half dozen baked oysters, a bowl of clam chowder, and their seasonal short rib dish with mashed potatoes

Unfortunately I forgot to take a picture ... But the fried calamari came out on a generous size plate, the oysters were topped with a creamy sauce and bacon bits, the clam chowder had lots of clam chunks which is a plus!, and the short rib was super tender and flavorful. 

Menu pricing varies for dishes, but overall a decent price for good quality compared to maybe the street food on the wharf.
author: Sheila B.

description:
Edgars: Do you know how the ancient Greeks defined happiness?
Garibaldi: Not off-hand, but I'd be willing to bet it involved three goats and a jug of wine.
Edgars: "Happiness", they said, was "the exercise of vital powers along lines of excellence, in a life affording them scope".
Babylon 5

54F degrees outside temperature 8pm.  Should I stay in the freezing cold and be squished and bumped like last year for the 4th of July fireworks show or is it time for something different...  We opted to watch the show from inside the restaurant.  Warmth.  :-)  Turned out the view was very good as the lights were turned off by the windows for the duration of the show.  :-)  A much more civilized way to view fireworks.  :-)

On to the food...  The sourdough bread is excellent here.  Crunchy on the outside with soft inside and that great flavor of sourdough.  I put in a special request for fresh swordfish instead of the standard frozen cod.  I have tried the fried cod and shrimp combo and the frozen cod was ok.  Similar to what you would get at Red Robin.  Fortunately the manager approved my request.  The fresh swordfish was hand dipped in a thin coating of beer batter and came out a golden brown.  Awesome crunchy batter with that flavor you get from only the finest fresh swordfish.  The texture was dense as I expected yet came apart nicely in my mouth.  This was the best fried swordfish I have had.  :-)  Well worth paying extra to get the higher quality fresh fish. 

I also sampled the New York Steak.  Excellent blend of flavors from the beef and peppercorn glaze.  Really nice cut of beef just below what you would get at Ruth Chris.

For dessert I had the creme brûlée.  Sweet crunchy top and delicious creme filling.  Perfectly executed dish.  Among the top 3 creme brulee's I've had.  :-)

In addition to the awesome view of the bay the customer service here is superb.  Everybody from the hostess to the waitress to the manager made it a pleasure to dine here.  I've visited every time I'm in town the last 3 years and had the most excellent dining experiences here.
author: Soo H.

description: Two words...Absolutely amazing!  For my wife and I, This was our first time at the restaurant and don't let the tourist trap location fool you. The food was so fresh, filling, and to die for. Our waiter Rafael was so attentive and personal. He took time to explain the not only the menu, but the city. First night (yes we went back) we had the daily special Halibut which was HUGE and the crab Cesar salad.  Both were so fresh and more than enough food for one. As we were looking online the next day for a different dinner location, we couldn't keep talking about how amazing our dinner at Fog Harbor was so we made reservations again. Not to be disappointed, the dinner and view were amazing again. My wife had the halibut again because it was so good and I had the shellfish platter. Both nights I had their clam chowder which was the best I've ever had. Everyone has an opinion but Fog Harbor is probably the best seafood you will find on the piers. We will definitely be back on our next trip. Thank you Fog Harbor for making our romantic weekend getaway unforgettable
author: Troy G.

description: By far one of the best restaurants I've ever been to. Eddy was the best server ever. We came here for a late birthday celebration and the service we received was spectacular. Not only was he friendly and engaging but he was fast, made great recommendations, and brought everything in perfect order and timing. Eddy and his coworkers made the surprise birthday eventful with a birthday song and dessert. Couldn't have asked for a better experience! Thank you eddy and fog harbor!!
author: Margaux T.

description:
3.5 stars overall 

My girlfriends and I decided to come here for a last minute lunch on a Sunday. The wait was about 10 minutes, not bad at all.

The food (overall) was great, we ordered the seafood platter for 2, lobster clam chowder, mussel fries, caprese salad, and shrimp cocktail. Everything was fresh, decadent and delicious...but I have 2 complaints.  The chowder was a little too salty, and there was long, GROSS hair cooked inside it :( 

Now for the service... 
Our first waiter was awesome, he was quick, friendly, and funny.  But when he went on break, the waitress that took over... Not so much... 

She was impatient, and unintentionally, but constantly rude.  Most of us felt that she needs to be retrained.  

Still, I feel like this place deserved 3.5-4 stars.. because stuff happens (hair falling in food/hiring a not so great server), the chowder was taken off the bill, the view is beautiful, and most importantly, the food (almost everything) was delicious.
author: Grace C.

description: Great food and service!  Busy Saturday night, we had a party of 5, and a 45 minute wait but definitely worth it! We hadn't been here before but loved it! Justin served us and was super helpful and recommended great dishes!  Will absolutely come back!  Every one loved their meal.
author: Amy U.

description: This place was a major let down. I feel so bad giving 2 stars but I must. The seafood tower was aces, fresh and all. Service was also great, our waitress was a gem as for the cooked food . The fried bay scallops are a safe bet. The burrata was sour, we sent it back. The chowder was thick heaven and not packed with flavor... kind of flat. The mixed drinks are over priced and barely have any booze. In all a giant waste of time and money. Overrated and overpriced. I highly recommend trying somewhere else. 2 stars only for the service and fresh seafood, all else no no no!
author: Dom M.

description: Nice view over looking the bay. Our son has many allergies and we ordered a side of chicken breast. It took forever for his food to come out so I am hoping the delay was to ensuring no cross contamination. We had the breaded bay scallops appetizer. The jalapeño aioli was outstanding. Seafood pasta and crab roll were meh.
author: Mike P.

description: Long wait so book an appointment if possible. But it was all worth it. Love the ambiance, staff, food, views. Would highly recommend to Go there Again.
author: G T.

description: Amazing food and great service! Our waiter was very patient with our indecisiveness and was very helpful, guiding us through the menu and recommending great local dishes for us to try.
author: Shirley Z.

description: Delicious food served fresh & hot. Our server, Justin H, was awesome! Super gracious and fun. Loved his attitude. This was our first visit here but definitely won't be our last.
author: Dena R.

description:
When we stopped here we definitely felt under dressed; we had jeans, t shirt, and tennis shoes. The atmosphere felt more business casual. The hostess was friendly and we waited outside to semi people watch, not a lot of people at 7pm. 

We were seated 10 minutes later even without reaervations. And we had a good view of the upper boardwalk near a window. We started with the spicy shrimp which had a good amount of kick. I did try the clam chowder, which I needed to try at least a bowl coming from Pier 39. Very very good. Small enough to still enjoy when the food came. I had the seared ahi tuna on rice, and let me tell you, I could have only eaten that the entire trip and not be sick of it. The ahi was perfect and the rice wasn't soggy. My husband ordered the salmon, which was a special that night, and he couldn't save it like he claimed. For dessert we went with creme brulee which for us was a delight in itself. Perfectly coated on top.

One big con is the dress code that I wish we would have considered going. I definitely felt out of place.

Recommended? Absolutely no doubt. Enjoy the food and the not seemingly crowded restaurant.
author: Amy F.

description: I've read all the negative reviews about fishermans wharf being a tourist trap and that there aren't that many good restaurants but this restaurant had good reviews, even from tourists. I will second those reviews. We came from our of town and we had lunch here and had a great experience. Yes , the menu was a little high for what we were wanting to spend but it was worth it. We sat at the bar and had great service and food! Definitely recommend!
author: John A.

description: We had a 5  meal for our 1 yr anniversary. The seafood penne and bread bowl clam chowder were excellent picks. They even gave us a complimentary dessert.
author: Sean M.

description:
I had an amazing time at this restaurant. I couldn't give a 5 star, because our original server didn't have the best customer service. However, for some reason, a new server Morgan took over and our time here became almost perfect. She was very kind and always had a small on, and had great customer service for a high quality restaurant. She checked up on us as much as she can, and really changed our time there. I highly recommend asking for her if you want great customer service.

As for the food, the seafood was high quality and everything was absolutely delicious. We had the crab and avocado salad, clam chowder, and the crab ceviche to start off. All of the flavors were upto par and super fresh. I recommend trying their whole crab, their mixed grill, and their shellfish platter for a variety. You can order for 1-2 servings with the shellfish platter. All of the seafood was very fresh and seasoned well. 

Overall, I will definitely be returning for their quality seafood and the customer service we received in the end. One tip: make reservations for the view because the view really makes it much more special. Thank you Morgan for a wonderful Christmas Eve dinner with my family!
author: Christina L.

description:
Good: 

-The food is very good. We had the Bay Scallops, Mixed Grill, and Lobster tails- all of it was tender, juicy and seasoned well. Portions aren't huge, but they are certainly big enough you won't leave unsatisfied.

-Service is top notch. The server (Raphael) made several good recommendations and was very sociable. He was attentive without being intrusive.

-Ambiance. Has a nice view of bay and the bridge and the decor is upscale without being gaudy. Definitely had a great vibe to it.


Bad:

Feels roughly 10-20% overpriced. Definitely great for special occasions, but the prices mean this will probably not be a weekly event.
author: Alex R.

description: Very good fresh seafood. Excellent service and a pleasant atmosphere. Definitely a good restaurant with a nice view of Alcatraz and the Golden Gate Bridge.
author: Eric H.

description: Good GOD this place is amazing.  It was so good that we had to come back a 2nd time.  The quality of both food and service has been great both times.  Their clams are to DIE for - a must have!  Both times that I've been here the fish is fresh and the drinks are DElish!!
author: Shaswati R.

description:
On a beautiful day not sure it gets better than this.  Bloody Mary and mussels and fries were great and good deal too.  
Amazing given the prices these days around sf
author: V N.

description:
Touristy area, but the food was great. Here's what makes it five stars for me, the service was great, we had a genuine waiter named Martin? and he was extremely attentive to our needs. We hardly asked for anything because he was managing several tables and giving us what we wanted before we asked for it. 

We went with the Dungeonous crab with garlic, the fish and chips, crab cakes and the bowl of clam chowder. 

Bowl of Clam Chowder - My girlfriend and I are from the east coast and we'd have to say that the bowl of clam chowder that we had from here were better then some that we've tasted on the east coast. The clam chowder was awesome and really went well with the bread bowl.

Fish and Chips - Crisp and very fresh, however it was your average fish and chips

Dungeonous crab - it was great, very large crab, garlic seasoned very well, they prepare you with a bib, cracker and everything. 

Table bread, sourdough - very fresh and warm

Mind you we dined here around 12 PM on a Monday.
author: Kevin C.

description:
We did not make a reservation on a Saturday night.  We arrived about 6:30. The hostess took our name and your cell phone number.  She said  the wait would be about 30 minutes, but that we would be texted when the table was ready.  So we took off to explore fisherman's wharf. About 25 minutes later we were texted.  We returned to the Fog House and were seated very shortly there after.  I hate the wait, but this was very nice way to do things. The view from the Restaurant is of the bay, very pleasant.
The service was good. The clam chowder and sourdough bread  were amazing.  My wife had the Ahi tuna which was terrific. I had the selfish plate which was good.  I will definitely eat here again when I visit San Francisco.
author: Michael C.

description:
Great seafood restaurant for tourists and seafood lovers in Pier 39, Fisherman's Wharf.

Great food, great view, great service, great environment, great location, reasonable price. If you eat too much and want to go poop, they have great bathroom music too.

If you ever visit Fisherman's Wharf, don't miss this place. But make a reservation before someone else do. They have lots of customers here, basically everyday.
author: Turtle M.

description: We eat here every visit.  Best clam chowder and view.  Very nice servers.  You won't be disappointed.  Not a tourist trap it's the real deal. It's also on Pier 39 yet quiet when you get inside.
author: Jane H.

description:
After walking around Pier 39 for a few hours, my husband and I were hungry for lunch. We stopped at Fog Harbor since our Aquarium of the Bay ticket allowed us to get 15% off the bill. Additionally, since it was on the second level, the view of the bay was fantastic. The inside was very nicely decorated and had plenty of seating. 

We were seated right away and our waitress was quick to greet us and answer any of our questions. We had a tough time deciding what we wanted to eat, but our waitress had some good advice and offered her favorite dishes. For drinks, we both ordered the Alcatraz Escape. This drink was super tasty and my husband is still raving about how delicious it was. The drink was very tropical with orange and pineapple juices with grenadine, coconut rum, and a float of dark rum. I would definitely order it again. 

For lunch, my husband ordered the whole dungeness crab with garlic. This thing was huge! It was really tasty, but honestly, it was a mess. I watched my husband crack open the entire thing and this literally consumed all of his time. By the time he was done cracking, I was almost done eating my meal of seafood cioppino. This came with crab, fish, scallops, clams and mussels in a tomato herb broth. It was delicious and hit the spot. I eyed the dessert tray, which looked delicious, but we were both stuffed from our meal. 

Overall, I would recommend this place for a seafood fix. It was a little on the pricey side, but I felt it was justified with how delicious everything was, the great service, and the great view. Next time we visit Pier 39, I would definitely come back here and try the other items on the menu.
author: Nicole B.

description:
This place was the perfect restaurant to try San Francisco's popular Cioppino dish! If you love fresh seafood then this is the dish you'll want to try. It has dungeness crab, mussels, shrimp, oysters, clams, and scallops in a creamy tomato broth. It also comes with garlic bread. We sat at the bar and I tried an oyster shot for the first time. Pretty delicious too. 

The bartenders were friendly and you can tell it's a tourist place since it's right in Fisherman's Wharf. The view is amazing where you can see the harbor and watch the sunset if you go around dinner time. For the price of my dish, it was well worth it because it had a compilation of different seafood choices.
author: Kristen Nicole F.

description: Best clam chowder ever. And great views. Seafood are all very fresh. Great place as a whole.
author: Sarah S.

description: First time here the service has good, but the food was just ok. Nothing really special!!
author: Ana C.

description: Great Clam chowder, crab cake, & terrific view of Alcatraz. Attentive and courteous service.
author: T V.

description:
While planning my trip to San Francisco, I really wanted to go to a seafood restaurant and I'm so glad I found Fog Harbor! This place was so great! We came around 3pm on a Sunday afternoon and there was still a 25-30 minute wait for a table for two. 

AMBIANCE: 
- We were seated right next to the window and it was such a lovely view of the water and the sea lions on the pier! 
- The sun was coming in (3pm) and it was kind of hot but the waitresses were very helpful and proactive in asking whether we wanted the sun shade put down over the window. 
- The restaurant was filled with people but it wasn't too loud. 

FOOD:
- Clam Chowder: So delicious!! It was perfectly hot and it really is so comforting eating this after being outside in the cold windy weather. There are generous chunks of clam and the clam meat is really tender and delicious. I didn't really taste the bacon bits, which was fine because the clam taste was fantastic. It paired really well with the warm sourdough bread and butter they provide you. 
- Roasted Garlic Dungeness Crab: I opted for the roasted garlic rather than the regular Dungeness crab and I was not disappointed! The crab really held the roasted garlic and butter flavor making each bite that much better. There is so much extra garlic and butter that you can dip pieces of crab meat in it for more flavor! The crab came with sides of steamed broccoli and roasted fingerling potatoes potatoes that also had the roasted garlic and butter flavor. The crab was fresh and the vegetables were so delicious. If you enjoy garlic as much as I do, I highly recommend you choose the roasted garlic crab over the regular one! 
- Surf & Turf: This entree had the Maine lobster tail and steak. The lobster tail was super fresh and the meat was just so delicious! I wasn't expecting the steak to taste that good but it was fantastic as well; it was tender and juicy. 

SERVICE:
- The service here is really wonderful. When we first arrived, we had one waitress who was covering for our actual waitress until she finished her break and both waitresses were super friendly and welcoming. They were constantly refilling our water and asking if we needed anything further. 

Overall, I am sooo happy with my decision to eat at Fog Harbor over other seafood restaurants around the area. Everything from the service to the food was outstanding! Highly recommend this restaurant to everyone in the area :)
author: Tiffany L.

description: Absolutely great welcome to San Francisco's seafood experience. Ordered the Caesar salad, "New England" clam chowder, fried shrimp, and the most amazing Cioppino. Everything was absolute perfect. Highly recommended
author: Frank M.

description:
It's a touristy kinda day for us today so we went to Fisherman's Wharf...  :)
Great food, ambiance, and view! The food are great. 
We had the special crab/risotto for appetizer; entree: fried combo (fish/calamari/shrimp), and crab roll. All the seafood are fresh and delicious! They also provide you a warm sourdough bread that is so yummy...seated by the window overlooking the boat cruise on the bay...it's nice for people watch   :)
Our waiter is very professional and friendly. Will definitely come back to try other food.
author: CJ B.

description: This place is fantastic. My swordfish was done to perfection. Beautiful views of the bay. My server, bartender Quianna was very prompt, knowledgeable, and had a great personality.  Highly recommend the Fog Harbor Fish House when in SF and at Fishermans Wharf.
author: mike h.

description:
Looked like a small restaurant from outside, but turned out to be pretty large and roomy once we got inside. The ambiance was great, dimly lit room, large windows overseeing the harbor and boat. The servers were very nice, but could have been a bit more attentive. Seems like they could have a few more servers for the amount of tables in the restaurant. 

Now lets get to the good part! I'd give the food overall a 4 out of 5. The clam chowder is supposidly world famous so I gave it a whirl. It was definitely great, but nothing amazing. Wish it had more flavor to it in general. The mussel fries I would not order again. They provided mussels that were the most plump and large mussels I have ever had. I fantasized whether they were given growth hormones because they were so large HAHA. It seemed like a gourmet dish over freshly baked french fries. I was not a big fan of the mussel and french fries combo. It was a good appetizer, but personally I just did not like the combo. I ordered the surf and turf which is a lobster tail and 10 oz NY steak. I'd definitely say this is a great deal if you want both the lobster tail and steak ($15 difference if ordering the 2 items separately). It's hard to go wrong with the lobster tail, but they removed all the meat from the lobster perfectly, leaving nothing behind in the shell. The NY steak was cooked as asked (medium rare) topped with capers. The broccoli side was rather bland, but the mashed potatoes where great. 

The sparkling ginger lemonade was tasty, had actual slices of ginger infused, but was way too sweet for me. 

Would I come here again? YES definitely!
author: Andrew S.

description: This is a good place you may enjoy. Awesome seafood, nice harbor viewing, handsome and beautiful servant make this place perfect. The only weak part is that the price is a little bit higher. However, if you just like me as tourists, this restaurant will be a good choice which you can enjoy food and the sea viewing.
author: Che W.

description: We will definitely going back to this place.  The food was excellent. The filet mignon and lobster tail was so flavory. I suggest mango crab ceviche for your starter.  Our server Curtis was superb and very pleasant.  I give the service 5 star!!!!
author: Lorna R.

description: Great vibe and buzz and the food is on point. I had a house salad, chowder bread bowl, tuna poke, and a glass of Cabernet Sauvignon... it was wonderfully delicious and the service was sharp. Great for a decent night out and for lovely seafood dishes. Highly recommend
author: Aaron W.

description: Phenomenal!!! That describes both food and drink! The Poke'...... mind blowing! Everything so amazing! A definite MUST if in SanFran. We'll be back!!! ..... till next time my friends!!!!
author: Laura M.

description: Beautiful refuge in the touristy Pier 39 district.  Our fantastic waiter, Tyler, made spot on recommendations on custom crafted cocktails and super-fresh catch of the day.  Highly recommend Fog Harbor for a special occasion or romantic night on the town!
author: Anthony G.

description: One of the best seafood restaurants in San Francisco! The seafood is 100% sustainable and it is GOOD. I had the mixed grilled, (sword fish, salmon, and shrimp) with the asparagus and potatoes. I also tried the garlic blue cheese bread and calamari. Delicious! It was quite busy, but it was all the weekend and during peak tourism season. Will definitely be visiting again when I am back in SF!
author: Kristin M.

description: Let me start with how we were seated. When our group arrived, they tried seating the 6 of us in a 4-person booth. Since that clearly went south, they then made us wait half an hour for them to finally find a table for us to eat at. It's meh. Really just a tourist trap. The tomato sauce in the cioppino tasted manufactured and from a can. I would not want to come back anytime soon.
author: Elliot F.

description: Had dinner sat night and service and the food was delish!! Blue cheese wedge was delish and so was my crap ciopinno
author: Fernanda H.

description: This is probably one of the best sit down seafood restaurants on pier 39. I found this place on yelp. Read the reviews so wanted to check it out for ourself. Everything I read about the restaurant is true. It's a really great restaurant with an amazing view of the golden gate bridge and Alcatraz island. We had the best seating as well. We forgot to make a reservation for lunch so we went to the restaurant to check if the wait was too long. To my surprise the wait was only 30 minutes and we didn't even wait for 20 minutes before we were seated. So I loved that. Food was really yummy. They fish tastes so fresh. Wee had salmon and some shrimps and of course we tried the famous clam chowder in sour dough bowl. It was really good. The restaurant and restrooms were clean. Awesome view from the restaurant. Nice staff. The prices were a little high but wasn't too bad. I would recommend this place to anyone in the San Francisco city looking for some good seafood.
author: Sharon J.

description: Food here was great and very reasomably priced for how much food we got. Our waiter Justin got us started off quick and we loved the friendly service tonight. We started with the fried calamari which was fantastic and got the lobster tails and shellfiah platter. Food, service, and atmosphere was on point. Definitely coming here again
author: Tim P.

description: The location itself is a very touristy area but the restaurant itself was wonderful. We had a seat that overlooked the water. Used Open Table and despite arriving 15 minutes early we were seated immediately. The service was friendly and the food really tasty. Would highly recommend
author: Cash B.

description:
The location is amazing! No matter where you sit you have a view of the ocean. Almost feels as though you're on a boat, minus the rocking.

The food on the other hand, isn't all that it's made out to be. Being a seafood lover, I was ecstatic to try out their dishes! Since there was 6 of us I got to try out 6 different dishes. 

I ordered their crab cake, which comes with two crab cakes, and a side of fries, and coleslaw. The crab cake was a little dry for my taste and a bit flavorless. My dish did come with a spices sauce but it still needed something. 

My brother ordered a half order of crab and that's just what he got. There was no side sauce, it was disappointing for what it cost. 

My sister in-laws aren't big with seafood and they both ordered meals with chicken. Which tasted pretty good. 

Don't want to bore you with the other meals. Their dishes need to be a little bit bigger and tasteful. It was a great experience though :) not sure if I would go back!
author: Manpreet T.

description: Good service, good food, and good view. We were a party of five with two kids. They have a kid's menu and crayons. The food was good (seafood pasta, cioppino, and burger) and reasonably priced for Fisherman's Wharf.
author: Gina J.

description: The food was okay, but the service was very bad. The waiter treated us like we owed him something. We first ordered one beer, and he brought the beer. I asked him if we could have two cups of water as well (there were a total three of us), and he rudely said, "What? I thought you only wanted the beer." Seriously?! Is this common sense in America to bring customers water first in a restaurant???? Sorry, if I misunderstood the culture, but I saw other tables got water without asking. Then he brought our food to the table and spilled out the soup without an apology. I had no idea where he got the confidence to ask us for tips when we decided to leave.
author: Yan G.

description:
Came here with my girlfriend and had an awesome time. When we got to the restaurant there was quite a bit of people out front waiting and so we assumed that it would take a while to get seated, but they had us in and eating within 15 to 30 minutes. 

The service was great all around. The guy filling the water probably stopped by the table every couple minutes filling my glass. Even if it was half full, he would fill it back to the brim. Our waiter took our orders and was quick to bring out our food. 

They started us off with some free bread which was surprisingly delicious, but after polishing those off, we ordered Clam Chowder in a bread bowl and some sort of sampler/combo dish which came with fish&chips, calamari, and shrimp. The clam chowder was amazing, but the bread bowl it came in was pretty normal sourdough. The fish&chips were delicious and the batter they used was flaky, but not too oily or crispy. 

 A little on the pricey side, but was expected because it was a tourist-ey area. I would definitely come back to this restaurant again if I could.
author: Ted C.

description: Great location and atmosphere.  Family friendly and high level of service.  Somewhat pricey. Overall, the family enjoyed our experience here.
author: Mark F.

description:
Good Food & Atmosphere. 
The good: Seafood Penne & Clam Chowder
Not so good: Ordered Crispy Calamari and it was mixed by far too many Jalapenos instead of Calamari's.  Also Disappointed that that they have taken many of the favorite dishes off menu: Lobster Mac & Cheese and few more...
author: Sergio A.

description: I want to start by saying I been to pier 39 many times and didn't know they had such a great restaurant. From the looks to the taste this place got 5 stars!! The staff was so helpful. This is a place I will be coming back to soon!
author: Arturo M.

description: For me this was a solid 3 stars, it was a great late dinner for me and my husband for the first night in SF over the long holiday weekend. The menu was just right and exactly what we came for: clam chowder in a bread bowl and seafood. I got a chicken Caesar salad (and maybe that was my mistake as the chicken was dry and chewy), but I wanted to eat a bit lighter since it was so late. We did get the garlic blue cheese bread which was good, but the complimentary sourdough bread basket that comes to your table was *to die for* since was so fresh and warm and just incredibly good. I think overall it is a solid choice & for two the bill came to approx $60 (no alcohol or dessert). It's right on Pier 39, too, which made it fun, feel safe, and walking distance from our hotel.
author: Jessica G.

description: We were visiting CA and went to Pier 39 to visit.  Saw Fog Harbor and looked it up and it had good ratings.  We decided to eat there.  Nice restaurant and good food. We had good service.  Our party had crab, fried shrimp and a combo platter.  All was good.  We would recommend and eat there again if ever in the area.
author: Pam C.

description: This place was very good despite my concerns of it being a tourist trap. Very fresh fish and other seafood. Great view and atmosphere. It's fairly expensive however and rightfully so considering its location. At least for the money you get delicious food and a clean, well staffed restaurant. Would highly recommend.
author: Erik F.

description: Excellent food and cocktail with a gorgeous wine. We had a few glasses of wine and a few mules and they were some of the best drinks we've had in awhile. We also split the large shrimp, the crab bread bowl soup, and the ahi poke. Wow, everything was incredible and fresh!
author: Melissa L.

description:
I came in by myself on one of my long layovers near Fishermans Wharf and was craving Cioppino. After reading reviews, I came into Fog Harbour. Pretty busy but I was alone and sat at the bar as it was a full service bar.

Food: Started with an Ketel One martini, extra dirty, dry, with no olives, which was made perfectly. Ordered the Cioppino as expected, and it was incredible. Broth was delicious and you can tell the seafood is about as fresh as it gets with fish, clams, mussels, and crab legs. Plenty of bread to dip in the broth. Large servings as well. Even had to take some to go with me because I couldn't finish it.

Service: Was greeted with a menu and a smile by the bartender shortly after sitting down. I was very impressed by the way the bartender prepared my martini perfectly. I am usually a martini snob, but had no complaints. Bartender was very attentive and kept bringing me bread for the broth.

All in all, the restaurant is expensive. Mostly due to the location and the quality of the food. But I would say it was worth it. Very large restaurant but very lovely ambiance. Would definitely recommend to friends, and will be back next time!
author: Brenden K.

description: Clam chowder bread bowl was so good my son ate the bowl.  Best meal we had in the area during our stay.  I'll be back
author: Jango O.

description: Delicious. Forget boudin the sourdough was hot and fresh here and the seafood was delicious. I got the shellfish seafood platter and my boy got the NY steak. Sooo good 4.5 stars. I was worried about getting stuck in a tourist trap with high prices and terrible food. The prices were high but not outrageous and I like that I didn't have to pay extra for sides. Service was great too. I would definitely come here again.
author: Melissa H.

description: Came to eat here with 3 adults and one baby...got seated quickly and had fast and pleasant service! Food was super big portions and yummy! Would recommend for good seafood!
author: Priya M.

description: First time here and I don't have any complaints.  Delicious food and great wait staff! I had the scallops and crab risotto with calamari and blue cheese garlic bread!
author: Nate V.

description: Have been eating here for years. This was the last time. Food was average at best. The service and attitude of our wait staff was horrible. Plates where placed on the edge of the table and we had to pass them to the other people at our table. I ordered a salad and never got it. I got surf amd turf to share with the hubby.  When the plate was set down the server asked "you sharing this" we answered yes expecting to get an additional plate, but thet never came back. Someone at our table gave us a plate under their bowl. For $300 I could have gone to Alexander's and been treated like a Queen. The worst part was mentioning  it to the manager that was working, and getting an oh sorry with a shoulder shrug. Spend your money elsewhere.
author: Jennifer O.

description:
I'll be honest, we came here to get our parking validated and we only had clam chowder and the crab/mango ceviche. As already noted, this is a typical touristy restaurant but I'll highlight a few of the positives:

-Fresh and free sourdough. With that being said, skip the bread bowl with your chowder and use the free bread.
-Good views of the water from almost any table. The whole place has wide windows that ket in natural light.
-The table cloths have paper on them, I have no shame and asked for crayons. Who doesn't love doodling before dinner?
-Friendly staff

Overall I have had better chowder and the $16 ceviche was pretty average. Oh and it came with literally five tortilla chips on the plate. Five...not to be negative but I was not sure if that was the restaurant being fancy or cheap.
author: Miriam M.

description: We had the seafood platter and oysters. The oysters were good, but the mussels in the seafood platter were over cooked and did not taste 100% fresh. The crabs were pretty nice though.
author: Anh N.

description: The best clam chowder I've had in San Francisco. The seafood penne was also very delicious, with lots of fish, and a good amount of shellfish, with a rich tomato cream sauce.
author: Chris W.

description: Went here on our last night in San Francisco and the food and service were superb! Jessica our waiter went far and beyond and even made great suggestions on food! Will definitely return when back in the SF!
author: Christopher S.

description:
This is by far one of my favorite places to go to eat when I'm near Pier 39. They are known for their views but honestly you only get the view if you are sitting at one of the 5 tables near the window. Other than that you are just getting great food and awesome service. 

I always get the crab cakes which are very delicious and fresh. I also end up getting the king salmon which is always extremely fresh and cooked to perfection. It comes with fingerling potatoes, crispy onion strings, and sautéed spinach. It is great and is my go-to every single time. They also have pretty good dessert here as well. It never seems to fail me!

As for the service, it is above average. The waiters here are on top of it andddddd... Wait for it... They provide wireless phone chargers that can be at the table with you. So when you have had a long day walking around and your phone is about to die, they have your back.
author: Becky W.

description: The wait is long (30-40min) late night but we were there for the chowder and it was MOST DEFINITELY WORTH IT!   Wonder if we could of eaten our chowder faster at the bar, can't see it from the outside area but the bar did have several seats empty... would of been nice for the front desk people to offer us those seats. Crab and clam chowder was delicious but $13 for a small margarita was a bit too much, guess you're paying their prices not just to eat there but to also catch a nice view of the bay. They have a fireplace outside and they let you drink wine while you wait so that's a nice gesture. If your wait time is long and you want to eat no matter where you sit then peak inside for possible seats at the bar.
author: bryant r.

description: I don't know what we were expecting from a restaurant around the touristy area but we really wanted seafood and this was close. I do have to say -- man, their clam chowder is GOOOOOOOOOOOD. You know a clam chowder is good when it's more clam than chowder. And it was big meaty pieces of clams too. I ordered the mixed grill and my husband ordered the crab cakes for our entrees. The shrimp and salmon on my plate were ok... but the swordfish was amazing! I wish I had ordered the swordfish on it's own. My husbands crab cakes were pretty tasty but not the best we've had. You know what the best thing about dinner was? The view... we were there when the sun was setting and it was just awesome. Maybe even a bit romantic?
author: Sarath P.

description: Had a great dinner here tonight with the family. Started with a few appetizers to get a feel for the place. The oysters and calamari were excellent. For dinner we ordered the cioppino, a fillet, the fish and chips and a salmon. We all enjoyed our food! We had Samir as our waiter and he was very attentive. My wife misunderstood something he said and we all had a huge laugh! Overall we were very happy and would happily eat here again!
author: Mathew N.

description: The food was mediocre. You won't hate your meal, but you won't love it. Our waiter was lovely and the view was a 7/10. Overall a fine experience.
author: Vivian L.

description: The chowder bread bowl was outstanding. The views terrific. The service was okay however the place was packed. We would definitely go back and recommend it to others!
author: Kim B.

description: Going to PIER 39 you might expect to get caught up in a tourist trap or two, but this is definitely not that... Fog Harbor Fish House is a wonderfully decorated, ambient treasure sitting on the edge of the Bay. Beyond the welcoming yet chic atmosphere, the food and service by our hostess and then waiter, Justin, were stellar. Our group had many questions about the menu, and were met with wonderful responses and suggestions for pairings from the well-versed Justin. It honestly felt like we had met an old friend out for a nice meal, and we couldn't have had a better experience. We will definitely be requesting his section on our next stop back in at the Harbor. Highlights: Clam Chowder, Dungeness Ravioli, Pan-Seared Cod, and of course the Fried Combo.
author: Jon C.

description: Perfect final San Francisco meal after our Alcatraz tour. This area is so touristy, but the good, service, and ambiance were perfect. The fried Bay scallops app was amazing (special), and the cold seafood tower, along with a couple of cold line daiquiris capped off a perfect San Francisco day!
author: Angela M.

description: Great seafood and amazing views of the bay. Service was excellent and the food and drinks were better than expected.
author: Matt L.

description: Met family here that were visiting from out of town. I was a bit apprehensive because this area is usually a tourist trap, but I must admit - what a wonderful setting for dinner! Our waiter, Justin, really made the experience unforgettable by providing exceptional service! We loved the Syrah he recommended and our entrees were delicious. Definitely recommend!
author: Celia S.

description:
Dungeness Crab & Mango Ceviche:  There was a good portion (about 1/2 cup) of crab mixed with mango.  It taste fresh and the lemon & mango complemented the crab nicely.

Fried combo:  The combo came with 1 fish, 2 shrimp, about a cup of calamari, fries and coleslaw.  Everything was fried crispy but not everything was seasoned properly.  The calamari was perfect and tasted great.  The fish was crispy on the outside, moist in the inside, and fresh but it lacked salt. Once I salted it, it was good.  Unfortunately the shrimp was bland and badly needed the cocktail sauce.  The coleslaw was bland and taste like just cabbage & mayo. It had no seasoning or vinegar and was very boring.  Hind sight, I would have ordered the fish & calamari but skip the shrimp.

My server Ashley G. was very nice and friendly.  She was offering suggestions to tourist visiting the area.

If in the area, I would eat here again.
author: Lily L.

description: Fabulous food. Yes, Pier 39 is loaded with tourists, but the food and the view is worth the trek. The mixed grill never disappoints.
author: Paula G.

description:
So fantastic. 

I was in San Francisco for the weekend to run the Nike Women's Half Marathon. As we were exploring Fisherman's Wharf and its various Piers, we decided to grab dinner in the area. Fog Harbor had a ton of rave reviews, so it made for an easy decision. I would definitely recommend reservations in advance if you have a larger group but we were fortunate enough to be able to walk-in for a table for 4 on Friday night around 7 PM. 

The ambience of the restaurant is so beautiful. Gorgeous bay views and we got there just in time for sunset. The natural light is absolutely amazing. We were seated at a booth directly facing the windows. 

The service alone at this restaurant deserves 5 stars. Our waitress was friendly and very attentive - we spent around 2 hours at the restaurant and she never once let our table fall to the back of her mind. She even complimented the fact that we were having lively conversations the entire night, apologizing whenever she "interrupted" because she usually just sees people on their phones. Her attitude was awesome and refreshing. 

Food... incredible. Of course our table ordered seafood entrees. I went for the swordfish and was blown away by the huge portion size. The fish was perfectly cooked and paired with a mouth-watering aioli sauce. I also loved the ratatouille that is served with the dish. Even though I was stuffed halfway through, I forced myself to finish because it was so delicious. The shrimp skewers ("brochettes") that others ordered also looked delicious. 

Don't skimp out on dessert either - they bring around a tray to you and I challenge you to say no when all of that is right in front of your face. Everything looked amazing but we ended up picking two to split between us: the strawberry shortcake and one of the specials: a chocolate fudge cake paired with a mini creme brûlée. The shortcake was so light and airy, and the fruit tasted fresh. The duo was also great - definitely rich and sweet but not overpowering. 

This was one of those rare dining experiences that was honestly perfect in every way and one I will remember fondly. Great prices, great menu, great food, great service, great ambience. What more could you ask for?
author: Margaret Z.

description: Great food even though it's right on Pier 39.  Pricing is high and the parking costs an arm three fingers and a leg but the food is excellent.  One hour of parking gets validated by dining here so that's something.
author: Jason K.

description:
Best clam chowder in SF!! Great lunch in a lovely booth with the very adept & witty Susan as our server.  She was fun and informative.  We had the best food, crab & avocado caesar salad, crab roll and really delish wine.  Creme brûlée for dessert.  What a wonderful way to spend our holiday
time off.   Thank you Susan, you are truly the best!!
author: Sheryl G.

description: The bf brought me here for a birthday lunch we got an appetizer, the calamari which came it a dip it had lots of flavor. the sour dough bread they bring was also fresh and warm,with a little bit of butter spread it was great. I got the salmon plate which was delicious . It came with greens and small potatoes.
author: Michelle V.

description:
My husband & I had lunch here on Wednesday. There was a 10 minute wait to be seated. Once shown to our seat I went to the bathroom (women's as 3 stalls - had to wait in line) when I got back my husband went to the bathroom, just before he got back our server came to the table & introduced herself.

We ordered crab cakes for appetizers, best thing we ate there. We shared fish & chips and a clam chowder bowl with crab, fish & chips were good, but we were disappointed with the clam chowder.

Our server was pretty busy it took a bit of waiting for drinks & picking up finished plates at the edge of the table, we had to wait like 15min to see the desert tray; we got the creme brulee & fudge.
author: Samantha R.

description: The appetizer are amazing. The food was delicious. Service was good too. Prices a little hight but it's not too bad.
author: Raffi G.

description: Solid 4 stars overall. Food was 4.5, though we ate light and had the crab and avocado Caesar salad and a bowl of clam chowder.  Both were awesome and the bread was piping hot.  Service at the bar was good.  The restaurant was very busy for a Tuesday at 4:15pm; 30 minute wait but we got lucky when a few seats opened at the bar.  The atmosphere was somewhat chaotic, hence the 4 stars and not more.  Though the chaos seemed more a function of customer volume  and not the fault of staff.
author: Chris S.

description: My sister and I were visiting San Francisco for the first time and scheduled a night tour at Alcataraz. We decided to stay in the neighborhood to get dinner and heard about Fog Harbor Fish House. We made a reservation. We tried the fried calamari, clam chowder (highly recommend), and ahi tuna. Everything was delicious and service was very good. Really recommend this place for dinner if you're in the area!
author: Aja J.

description: I like the ambience. It's right by the water at pier 39. I love the clam chowder.  It has a very nice view of the San Francisco Bay.
author: Leden N.

description: I recommend this restaurant I really enjoyed the scenery and environment. You will get the True feel of San Fran's taste and the prices are decent. Quality and quantity of the food are worth the price.
author: Diris L.

description: Stopped by this restaurant for the convenience, but was pleasantly surprised. We ordered the raw oysters, clam chowder with crab, shellfish platter, and mixed seafood grill: oysters tasted fresh, chowder was thick and rich, and the shellfish platter was a huge portion of yumminess. I wasn't sure what to expect since it's in a touristy spot, but we were surprised by the fresh tasting seafood and amazing service!
author: Amy C.

description: I really wanted to like them. We were say our waitress ignored us no water or drinks. When my husband finally caught her we got moves to a better table. Unfortunately if you order garlic bread you don't get the free bread basket. If you get fish and chips no tarter or cocktail. The two of us spent $100 and the food was pretty lackluster and the service poor.
author: Jenny R.

description: Very touristy as it is right on the water at Pier 39 but the atmosphere nonetheless is still very nice and the food is great! Definitely can see their Clam Chowder being "Award Winning;" its delicious! We also had the Blue Cheese Garlic Bread and to drink I had the Alcatraz; both were very good. For dessert we had the Chocolate Bread Pudding which was lovely!
author: Nicole S.

description: Brought my GF here yesterday for her birthday and boy was it amazing! The ambiance was great, over looking the water and watching the sea lions perched on the floating docs. Beautiful. The food was something else! The Calamari is just heaven mixed with the fried onions and jalapeños! The clam chowder in a bread bowl was a must try and it delivered beautifully. The Filet Migñon topped with Crab just made my day. My lady had the Ahi Tuna and it was bomb.com! We ordered bloody Mary's which delivered on spice and content. Service was excellent and our waitress checked up on us at just the right times. Wonderful overall experience I can't say enough!
author: Mo K.

description:
It was our first time here for a bday and we couldn't choose a better place to celebrate. The food was great and the view was amazing. I would definitely stop by again when I'm in San Francisco to try their other menu items.
We've ordered clam chowder and it was one of the best I've had.
author: John A.

description:
Great place, great food, great service, pricey but in this case you get what you pay for. All the staff are professional and friendly, our Waiter and the manager were very accommodating and went out of their way to make things right no matter how trivial. Repouring a mix drink because it lacked the taste of Crown, with out question, attitude or cost was above and beyond. Calimari is recommended, of course the chowder can not be passed up. Lobster was excellent. Fried platter was large, delicious and amply assorted. View was nice as well. Can't wait to go back.
If you want to splurge a little, don't pass up Fog Harber, Pier 39.
author: Benn H.

description:
I have been coming here for over 9 years, since I was a freshman in college and just wanted some good clam chowder. Well this place had it, and even when they changed owners their clam chowder didn't.

This time I came and Brenda, our server, was awesome. She brought us plenty of crackers and plenty of bread. Super thoughtful, even though we weren't buying their expensive dishes. #soupischeap

Helpful hint: don't get their breadbowl. Get the clam chowder and eat their free sour dough bread. 
#beatthesystem
author: Julianna I.

description:
Short and to the point since EVERYONE has opined.

Damn good calamari, seriously worth getting.
