Clam chowder in a sourdough bread bowl is the favorite and must be ordered at least once. Yes the soup vanishes fairly quickly with plenty of bread left over but the price is fair. Getting is crab add-on was worth it.

Drinks weren't bad either. The Barrel Aged Ginger Negroni was good but didn't really taste any ginger.
author: Dennis R.

description:
On the No1DP's last visit to see me, he made a request: he wanted to try SF's clam chowder. What the No1DP asks he gets, I just happen to be the lucky woman to tag along. I had another restaurant in mind that was a little less touristy but after some research and consideration we ended up eating here instead.

VENUE: We went on a Sunday night, just as the sun was about to set. The host put us in a table right next to the window. The No1DP and I were able to watch the people walking around Pier 39 and people just getting off the ferries. While the No1DP and I weren't able to secure a window that overlooked Fisherman's Wharf we weren't too far from those windows and we could look at the massive amount of tourists walking the wharf. 

SERVICE: Service was excellent, as expected from a fine seafood establishment. 

WINE: Both of us had white wines. Although I don't remember specifics on the grape varietal, I remember my wine was a little sweet and went well with my dish.

FOOD
The Yelp check-in gets you blue cheese garlic bread. The blue cheese was a bit strong, but it's good for anyone that really likes blue cheese.

We got bowls of their famous clam chowder. One of the better clam chowders I've tasted, and the No1DP agrees. It may look watery when you're served the bowl but don't let that fool you. Instead we were treated to a quite creamy (and not starchy!) soup with good amounts of CLAM. They were quite generous with the clam but they better be considering how much you pay for a bowl!

No1DP got one of their special dishes lobster mac and cheese. As a New Englander, he has a right to be picky about his seafood, especially his lobster. His dish was "quite comparable to an equivalent dish I'd be served back home". Lucky him. I tried it and it's quite the rich dish - the cheese is RICH and one big bite can make you significantly fuller than before... No1DP ate less than half of his dish. The lobster was to his liking.

I got another special dish: 0.5 lbs lobster stuffed with dungeness crab. I thought this would be an excellent dish as this would combine two of my great seafood loves - lobster and dungeness crab. When I was served this dish the tail part was the lobster while the head was stuffed with the crab. The crab was quite sweet, I'm not sure if this is supposed to be how the crab naturally tastes, but the sweetness took away from the crab. Lobster was excellent, soft and buttery yet I could taste the lobster. Spinach and mashed potatoes were good sides yet were not too rich to overpower the seafood. 

Dessert consisted of creme brûlée. The sugar was hard enough that I can crack it open with one swift tap of the spoon. Custard was creamy yet not too rich. The speculoos cookie they put on top was a nice touch and gave the dessert a subtle ginger taste if you eat it. 

Though Fog Harbor can be considered a touristy restaurant to some, the food was still excellent. Thanks to the No1DP for another excellent eating adventure!
author: Isabella B.

description:
Fog Harbor Fish House- you were great. I wanted to celebrate my actual birthday dinner by the water to get a nice view of the sunset but unfortunately mother nature wasn't on board with my plans. Either way the hostess was friendly and sat us by a window. The restaurant does cater to the tourist who are wandering around Pier 39. It has a romantic-feel to it--too bad I was with my best friend! 

Our  waiter was super friendly and attentive throughout the entire night. We checked in and got free garlic bread to start off with. We ordered our glasses of wine and I already knew what i wanted since I Yelped their menu. I had the mixed grill which comes with salmon, swordfish, and shrimp-mashed potatoes and broccoli. The salmon wasn't great-it was a bit overcooked but the rest of the dish was super filling. The waiter came over and told us to text a number regarding the service and we would get  a free dessert--uh no problem! It was delicious and left me incapable of moving. They really take pride in their service which left me feeling happy!
author: Yeraldine S.

description: I would highly recommend this place if you are looking for yummy seafood. The service was great, food delicious, and reasonably priced for San Francisco with such a beautiful view.
author: Hillary B.

description:
Simply just not Good. I hate to bash a spot, but the oysters taste like crap, the steamed clams have corn in them (who does that) how can you screw up a bleu cheese wedge salad. On the bright side The coors light was good if this helps. 

Simply disappointed, dinner time ruined. I didn't complain and still tipped,  it's not the servers fault this places blows donkey nuts. 

I really don't know how all you yelpers gave this place 4 stars and over 2800 reviews, what the hell is wrong with all of you. Unreal. I'm done listening and taking a chance with the hype, this keeps happening more and more.

I'm just visiting SF but if anyone comes out to L.A. Please try the Santa Monica Seafood Market. Trust me!!!!
author: Frank C.

description: Your experience at this restaurant is vastly contingent upon where you are seated. If you are seated at the very back-end of the restaurant, sorry you are out of luck. The area is brightly lit and feels crowded because literally appears the restaurant made an effort to place as many tables as they could in that space. On the other hand, if you are seated in the the mid to front section closer to the entrance and the bar, ambiance is noticeably more romantic and intimate. You can certainly make a reservation here - I would make sure to articulate your seating preference.
author: Jules H.

description: Food was meh but the martinis were pretty decent. Our server was originally some older gentleman. I asked him for water with lemon to start. He came back with water and I asked him if he can get me some lemon slices. He quickly brought them back to the table and disappeared .  Moments later, a female server came back and said our server is going to leave for the night so I was okay with it. We went ahead and ordered the calamari and a bowl of clam chowder for appetizers. For my entree, I decided to go with the blackened swordfish. For the martinis, I went with the pumpkin one that tasted really good. Sort of reminded me of egg nog with cinnamon and my friend with the lemon drop which tasted like candy. We were there for about 2 hours drinking and catching up with old friends then our original server came back not to us but to the table by us. I thought he had to go home, hmm.. whatever. I feel that something that small can tilt your experience into the wrong direction.
author: Joseph C.

description: We went here for dinner last night and loved it!! Our food was delicious and we had a beautiful view of the bay. I would highly recommend this place.
author: Stacey M.

description: After a 4 hour Alcatraz tour, my family and I were tired, cold and hungry. We were too tired to look far and ended up at Pier 39. Frankly, I was worried that all the restaurants were going to be too touristy. Because of yelp reviews, we decided to try Fog Harbor. It ended up being a wonderful experience! We sat at a comfy booth with a good view. The food was really good, from the bread to the cioppino, to the seafood platter and the fried seafood, everything was excellent. What made our evening more special was out waiter Curtis. He was professional, courteous with a good sense of humor. He had just the right amount of interactions with us where he was attentive but not intrusive.
author: Nevine M.

description: Great destination restaurant and amazing food (the sourdough bread alone is worth the trip!!!) group of four and everyone's food was amazing!!
author: Angel L.

description: Tonight's dinner started with a big bowl of clam chowder which was perfect. My wife had the mixed greens salad. Our entrees the Mixed grill for her and the Shrimp Brochette for me also perfect. The restaurant is very nice and pleasantly quiet. Our server Shawn recommended that we take a Tiramisu to go which is the main reason for this review. Service is over the top here. Shawn took very good care of us while we were there and the Tiramisu was the best I ever had. No wonder Fog Harbor Fish House has  over 3000 reviews. Thanks Shawn we will be back.
author: Roger J.

description: My wife and son had dinner here on the eve of Father's Day, after taking in a night tour of Alcatraz. Walking distance (9 mins) from Pier 33. Had no reservations and it was busy that night so we waited about 30 mins by the patio fireplace. Got seated at a great table, which was in a corner overlooking the water. Was very happy with our server, Justin H., who promptly took our order and was attentive to the fact that our son and I are gluten-free and our son is also dairy-free. Our son had a house salad and grilled salmon. I had the NY steak and a glass of the house pinot noir.  My wife had a bowl of clam chowder and fish and chips. The food was served in a reasonable amount of time, given how busy it was. It was warm, presented well and the portions were just the right size, in our opinion. Overall, we were very pleased with the food and our experience. Being locals, we hardly ever come to Pier 39 to eat but we just felt like playing tourists in our town that night. It made for a wonderful pre-Father's Day celebration! Would highly recommend this place to our friends and family, both local and from out of town.
author: Alex A.

description: I was really impressed with this place. It does not look like too much from the outside, but the decor inside is very nice, food is outstanding (you have to try their clam chowder), service is great, and the views are excellent. Great place to eat or come over for a drink.
author: Mauricio B.

description: Food is great, but service is kind of crap.  Our waiter had a bit of an attitude, was impatient and disappeared for a while. We asked another server for some bread, they never brought it. So waited another 10+ minutes (I timed it on my phone) for our server to finally reappear.
author: Amit R.

description: My son and I were strolling in the rain looking for some good food on pier 39. We found it at Fog Harbor fish House. The ambiance was immediately welcoming with nice views of San Fransisco Bay. Great menu. Amazing freshly baked sour dough bread. We split Dungeness crab, sour dough bread bowl clam chowder (highly recommend this) and red pepper shrimp. All outstanding. Capped it off with a Creme brûlée and chocolate cake desert with fresh whipped cream - superb! Great service by Samir made it all the better. Highest recommendation for this place!
author: Michael T.

description:
Fantastic food and view a bonus !
2nd time at this place and not disappointed. 
The Alaskan Halibut was melt in your mouth divine and all other dishes were also extremely good. 
Efficient friendly service and a very relaxing lunch was had.
Highly recommended.
author: Frank M.

description: We vacationed in San Francisco.   We had the great pleasure of dining at this fine restaurant.     The service was amazing and the food was awesome.    Its a great place for a special celebration, or just a nice date night.   Its best to make reservations.  Its a very busy place for good reason.
author: Becky O.

description:
Dine About Town 2014 Review!

Before anything, Jennifer A.'s tip caught my eye: "First, go to the visitor's center also on the upper level and get a 15% off coupon for this place."

Despite its touristy location, Fog Harbor delivered a DAT meal that was surprisingly delicious and affordable. I would definitely recommend making a reservation through OpenTable because it was packed on a Saturday evening.

Our table was started off with complimentary sourdough bread and butter, which is always appreciated.

For the appetizer, I opted for the AHI TUNA POKE, which is marinated raw tuna, avocado, mango, and a sesame-soy sauce and wasabi aioli (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-harbor-fish-house-san-francisco-2?select=dgr5LlguS0E84w2KQoXqYQ#Y5MO3qA68Z4v6MvKgGl9ZQ). It's normally $16 for their full serving, though we only got a poke pile rather than the poke slices shown in other pictures. The tuna is decently fresh, the mango is refreshing (though not very ripe), the avocado is smooth (also not very ripe), and the aioli ties it all together.

My friend chose the BAKED OYSTERS as her appetizer, which came with 4 fresh shucked oysters topped with spinach, bacon and a creamy parmesan sauce (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-harbor-fish-house-san-francisco-2?select=dgr5LlguS0E84w2KQoXqYQ#dgr5LlguS0E84w2KQoXqYQ). Each oyster is normally $2.50, and she enjoyed the rich flavor of each one.

For entrees, one friend decided on the SEAFOOD CIOPPINO, which is crab, fresh fish, shrimp, clams, scallops and mussels stewed in a tomato herb broth served with pasta (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-harbor-fish-house-san-francisco-2?select=dgr5LlguS0E84w2KQoXqYQ#2AAhYWe5iBS33VciM-7V5g). It's a hefty portion normally priced at $30! She said that her favorite part of the dish was the crab. Her boyfriend ordered the CREEKSTONE NY STEAK, a 10 oz steak grilled and topped with whisky peppercorn sauce, served with garlic mashed potatoes and sautéed vegetables (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-harbor-fish-house-san-francisco-2?select=dgr5LlguS0E84w2KQoXqYQ#3MgOxfwSYmu_cBpmwqcQnQ). It was also a generous portion, normally priced at $27.
 
I chose the GRILLED SALMON, a fillet served on a bed of roasted corn, arugula, red peppers, fingerling potatoes, and tarragon with a citrus beurre blanc (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-harbor-fish-house-san-francisco-2?select=dgr5LlguS0E84w2KQoXqYQ#Of8IrIHQdLcfmBdpixj99A). Normally $28, the salmon dish is worth it. I have to admit that I was pleasantly surprised by how juicy and moist the salmon meat was, especially given how often I've been underwhelmed by salmon dishes. But, goshdangit, Fog Harbor did it right. *snaps*

As our desserts, we each ordered something different:

The VANILLA BEAN CRÈME BRULEE, a smooth, creamy custard with caramelized sugar top and a Biscoff cookie, normally $8.50 (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-harbor-fish-house-san-francisco-2?select=dgr5LlguS0E84w2KQoXqYQ#n77J_bT5cjGss76X1FdSPw). My favorite, hands down. I tend to avoid crème brulees because past ones I've tried have had sugar tops that were way too thick and overpoweringly sweet and sticky. But the sugar coating is delicate, allowing the custard to really shine through. If you're a fan of egg custard, especially subtly sweet custard, you'll be a fan of their crème brulee.
 
The MOLTEN CHOCOLATE CAKE with a rich creamy chocolate center, served warm with vanilla ice cream and whipped cream, normally $8.50 (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-harbor-fish-house-san-francisco-2?select=dgr5LlguS0E84w2KQoXqYQ#W-e5gxE978hMPMfp1k7nDA). Many reviewers have complained that this isn't a true molten cake because the inside doesn't ooze melted chocolate, and I would have to agree--it's just a warm, gooey chocolate center. The vanilla bean ice cream is tasty, and I liked that the chocolate cake wasn't overly rich since it paired well with light, fluffy whipped cream.
 
The CHOCOLATE BANANA BREAD PUDDING, a huge square of Fresh Boudin's sourdough bread baked with chocolate pudding, served warm with crème anglaise and vanilla ice cream (most similar to the pumpkin bread pudding, normally $8.50) (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-harbor-fish-house-san-francisco-2?select=dgr5LlguS0E84w2KQoXqYQ#dYa4c4vsHCPEF7PxSyRxjQ). I asked for the crème on the side because I didn't want it to soak the bread (not a huge fan of soggy bread). The crème itself is very light and was fun to dip, and the banana and sourdough undertones make for an intriguing combination. However, the chocolate is so rich that it overwhelmed even my sweet tooth...ridic.

All in all, I would recommend the GRILLED SALMON entree and the VANILLA BEAN CRÈME BRULEE dessert. Don't forget the 15% coupon!
author: Adele F.

description: Excellent service and excellent food. We had a lovely view of the harbor, Alcatraz, and sunset while we ate. Our waitress gave excellent recommendations and the seafood was cooked to perfection.
author: Janice T.

description: Food was good service was good. It's expensive but that's the price for it anywhere else. It has a nice view too! My favorite restaurant in San Fran
author: Josh C.

description:
Great dining experience!

We were wandering around the pier area and wanted to find a good place for lunch. Luckily, there was no line around 11:30 am on New Years Eve and we were even able to get a seat with a view of the bay and the local sea lions. 

We ordered the clam chowder, oysters, and fresh catch of the day: the pacific cod. 5 stars for the oysters - They were sweet and fresh. Clam chowder was good, but not the best I've tried in SF - 4 stars. Pacific cod was also fresh and the portion was generous - 5 stars.

Our server, Martin, did a great job with delivering just the right level of energy, enthusiasm, and attention throughout our lunch - 5 stars.

Great job!
author: Kenneth Y.

description: This restaurant is so charming and has a great view. There was a line but they text you when your table is ready, giving you ample time to walk around the pier for a bit. Our waiter MARTIN was absolutely amazing and one of the best waiters we have ever had. He gave us suggestions from the menu and my boyfriend ordered one of the chefs specials that was caught earlier this morning (the sol). I thought I could get a box at the end up but I ended up eating everything including all the bread calamari, clam chowder, and the grilled mix. The fish here is so fresh I think I'll be messed up from getting such good quality seafood here haha. Best meal I've ever had and worth every penny!!
author: Kelsey M.

description: My girlfriend and I really enjoyed eating here! We were visiting from SoCal and wanted somewhere we could sit and have some great fish and beers but not too expensive. It was pretty crowded when we first got there and luckily found a spot to eat at the bar. The bartenders were very friendly and made us feel welcome and didn't rush us to eat and leave. I ordered the mixed grill and we also shared the Clam Chowder and blue cheese bread and my girlfriend got the Poke for herself. Thy were all awesome!!! The Clam Chowder and blue cheese bread were way too good and my salmon was so crispy and juicy. The Poke was great, just enough spice to it! I definitely recommend this place! This would be 5 stars if the wait wasn't so long, so I recommend making a reservation ahead of time. Otherwise, this place is great!
author: Alex M.

description:
Awesome food. Awesome service. Great views of the bay, Alcatraz and Golden Gate Bridge.
Will be back!
author: Scott S.

description: Expensive and small portions, but that's generally the case with fish joints like this, especially on the pier. I had the swordfish which was really good, but the vegetables accompanying it were just ok. The fongerling potatoes were a bit undercooked which I generally don't mind but they were also not super seasoned, and the other vegetables were diced too small. However the calamari with fried jalapeños was awesome and the dipping sauce was spectacular. The bread was fresh and delicious too. Overall I was very satisfied with the food. The service was lacking, very slow.
author: Steve M.

description: Typical tourist trap restaurant. Overpriced and small portions. Ordered a dozen raw oysters for $30 expecting some nice oysters for that price, all we got were a dozen of baby raw oysters, they were tiny, yet they served them. I felt cheated.  To add insult to injury there was a $14 sf surcharge that apparently goes to pay for employee healthcare. Should I  deduct from the 18% tip they expect?...
author: David L.

description:
Located in the heart of pier 39 you can expected this place to be packed. During lunch time on a Sunday we were told it would be about a 30 minute wait. We decided to sit at the bar instead of waiting for a table. Our bartender/server was very rude. I am not sure if she was having a bad day or what but working with the public she needs to work on her people skills. 

We put in our food orders and beer. After we got our beers we were delivered fresh warm sourdough bread. The bread was what dreams are made out of. I knew this place had promise.

Our food came out in a decent amount of time. Meaning I still had one slice of bread let to enjoy with my meal. The greedy monster didn't completely come out. I ordered the salmon club salad and it was good. I was surprised not to be asked how I wanted my salmon cooked as I normally order it rare. It was tasty but not worth the cost.

My husband ordered the fried combo that included fried fish, calamari and shrimp. I had a taste of the fish and calamari which was decent. However my husband wouldn't part with the shrimp because they only gave him two. Wtf??? The two sides were the traditional fries and coleslaw. 

Overall the food was decent but seemed overprice. I guess not overpriced per the location but I would considered a bread bowl at boudin or a food truck next time.
author: Amanda K.

description: Really liked it. Loved the view. The fish and chips, and the clam chowder were very good and the price was OK. The service is good. Food is fresh. Overall would recommend the place, it's a safe bet. Cocktails are also great.
author: Rita S.

description:
I absolutely loved this place. The food is a step above a great restaurant. The service is outstanding, the prices are average but the dining experience will be one of your best. 

The only downside is there are no reservations and wait time is 45-1hr average. The good news is you can explore the harbour while you wait for them to text you with your seating assignment.

Of course the clam chowder is a must in SF but I would recommend adding the crab meat for the extra $7 is well worth it. The seared scallops with couscous is a dish I will have to travel back for.
author: Raechelle S.

description: Great location, pretty fast service, friendly staff, excellent bread, but pork in clam Chowder???? Pork in steamed clams????? Come better than that. Who does that?
author: Lester E F.

description:
The second we walked by this place the hostess greeted us and was really friendly! Out of all the places to eat seafood near the bay we chose this place because of its 4.5 reviews. 

1. Appearance 10/10- the outside looked like a ship or a boat and I liked the different color toned wood floors, the comfortable seating as well as the windows overlooking the harbor and ocean. Everything looked clean as well.

2. Customer Service 10/10- besides the hostess who promptly seated us after 10 min of waiting on a lobby coach (great because my legs hurt from all the walking), the waiter quickly came to greet us and get our drink orders.

3. Food 10/10- the food was incredible. I tried the blue cheese rolls (a yelp favorite) and as an entree me and my other half got the shellfish platter for 2 which contained steamed clams, mussels, garlic shrimp, garlic Dungeness crab drenched in buttery olive oil garlic sauce. Delicious just like going fishing and eating the prey. The only bad thing is we smelt like sea water after lol.

I'm definitely bringing my family back here.
author: Ellaine C.

description:
Complete tourist trap!

I didn't realize you could f*ck up fresh seafood, but Fog Harbor has found a way. Half dungeness crab should be sweet and firm, a sign of freshness, but Fog Harbor's is mealy and tastes old and rotten.

They also treated me like a complete tourist. I walked up to the bar, and the bartender asked me, "So where are you traveling from?" I was flabbergasted and insulted.

Meals are edible but not much more.
author: Lawrence H.

description: Stopped here on our first night in San Francisco on a recommendation from our hotel.  We were seated by the large windows and loved our view.  I love it when I can get a great gluten free meal and not feel sick!  Their salmon was wonderful and my husband loved his fish & chips!  Great wine too!!  Our waitress was wonderful!  We just wish we could have gone back again.
author: Tracey S.

description: Thanks guys for delicious food, cozy atmosphere, nice stuff and amazing view)it was fantastic evening!
author: Valery M.

description: We ordered the half dozen oysters and clam chowder for appetizers- excellent.  Followed by our entrees, which included, lobster tails, fish and chips,  and the Ahi Tuna.  Everything was cooked to perfection; melting in our mouths.  The service is friendly and efficient, too!
author: F H.

description: I had the delightful shrimp cocktail here at the bar. The food was good, the service was ok-- they were a bit busy at happy hour and the location was ideal on Fishermen's Wharf. I would go here again if I wanted an expensive seafood meal.
author: Natalie S.

description: The food was excellent.  The seafood was fresh, prepared perfectly and presented beautifully.  We enjoyed the view of Alcatraz and timed it well so that we saw the sunset.  A very nice evening all around!
author: Cindy M.

description: Excellent service by Mel. The food was great and the response from the staff.  We were attended well and they kept coming by to check on us. Clam chowder was on point. I had the mixed grill as the entree. I would return soon.
author: Joshua R.

description: My first time here after a recommendation from a friend and for sure...I will forever be coming. The food was great (especially the crab dishes I had). the location is great and aside from good food, you can get lots of other entertainment value from your visit.
author: Chevonize M.

description: Great dinner experience here. Love their food, especially the dessert - creme brûlée! Our server, Samir was amazing too. He's a friendly guy and did his job great!
author: Amethyst X.

description:
I really, really wanted to love this place, for a few reasons, but mostly because I'm visiting San Francisco and had a focus on cuisine while visiting.  I wish I could be more polite, but the truth is that I am disappointed that I wasted an evening here.  Across the dock from Bubba Gump Shrimp Co., we instantly noticed the mistake we had made by coming to this tourist trap area.  Face-palm #1.  

Our server was not unfriendly at all, but I felt rushed from the moment we were seated.  We made a semi-late reservation for a Monday night (Halloween!) and we had hoped that would give us a bit more leisurely pace for our meal.  I like those European style meals that take a couple hours, a few drinks, and heavy sighs of satisfaction at the end.  What we received was more like a calculated and rushed meal you'd expect at a mid-grade chain restaurant.  

We started with oysters and never received any utensils to dress them with, so we poured the condiments on with reluctance.  Next came salads, which didn't dazzle us, but neither were they intolerable.  I ordered the "fall special" of Pumpkin Curry Salmon, face-palm #2. My partner requested the "Jumbo" Scallops for his entree. My pumpkin curry salmon tasted more like salmon soaked in PSL at Sbux than curry, but I probably shouldn't have ordered this dish as I don't care much for pumpkin spice, and am rather fond of curry.  Not very impressed at this point, as nothing I've eaten was blowing me away and the service made me feel like a nuisance instead of a treasured patron.  My partner's meal?  Delicious.  BUT!  and this is a major one, the scallops were nothing close to "jumbo".  They were quite small, although tasty.  The photo illustrates the size of the scallops in comparison to a dinner fork.  I would probably have a different attitude if the scallops were touted as sustainable and local instead of being labeled jumbo.  

I might have a more sunny outlook on this spot if I could have seen the view it's known for, but we had already lost the sunlight for the day and could only see the nighttime lights.  I wish I had tried the chowder they're known for, and maybe I would have been more impressed.
author: Taylor G.

description: A scenic backdrop of the ocean by the Pier, complete with outdoor fireplace. The Avalon hymn "The Road to Valhalla" states "Valhalla is a place only the Chosen are Allowed." This is such a place. With exquisite seafood, the best in all the Bay, and fine wine tempered by excellent service, this is the "High Castle" reserved for those dates I extend to the few women I'm serious of pursuing meaningful lasting romance to build a home and life with. A great place indeed to host fine company enjoying fine cuisine. Global citizens, I recommend you taking your closest maidens here for dinner to show her the class and fine dining she deserves. I know I sure did. :)
author: Richard R.

description:
Wife and I went here while visiting the piers down on San Francisco Bay. While yes Pier 39 is a bit of a tourist trap, it was our first visit to San Francisco so we had to hit all the traps while there.  

We decided we definitely wanted to try a more 'local' restaurant as opposed to something like the Hard Rock Cafe which was right near by.  

Felt a little strange strolling into the place in shorts and a t-shirt given the decor they had in there, but I could see I wasn't the only one and was sure they saw that kind of thing all the time.  Being on the second level of the pier gave almost any table there great views of the Bay, we could see Alcatraz off in the distance even.

Our service was excellent, very attentive without being overly bearing and the food was quite good too.  Overall it was a great experience!
author: Paul H.

description:
Our waitress, Ashley was the best.  She was professional and as busy as it was,  she was right there for Ice Tea refills and other requests.  She even talked my friend (who never orders or eats dessert) into the Dulce de leche cake.  It was so good he ate it all!

They also let me have the set-up for the Halibut with my order of Local Black Cod.  Loved the Quinoa/Arugula salad with the Citrus Beurre Blanc Sauce.
I have to say, I was just barely able to refrain from linking my plate.
author: Sandi L.

description:
So tasty. I will be recommending this to people in the wharf. Tyler was our server for a decent sized party and he was on point.

Thanks for the good times.
author: SF A.

description: Food was  okay....but, our waitress Brenda made up for it. She was very pleasant and professional.... She has a lot of patience....if you want a good experience ask for Brenda
author: Sandyy M.

description: Had a reservation for 4:00 pm on a Monday; good thing we did because it was packed! We even got a nice window seat, which was great for my friend who was visiting from Montreal. I wanted to take her somewhere touristy but where I knew the food was good and the seafood sustainable. The service was a bit slow (food took a bit long, but it was busy) but it was efficient. My friend was able to get prawns instead of clams on her linguine and boy did that look good! In fact, I've been planning on recreating it myself for dinner soon! My crab Louis was delicious and worth every penny of the $25 they charged. I couldn't even finish it. We each had an entree, a martini, & a glass of wine (we weren't driving) and our bill was $120. A bit stiff, but what do you expect for Pier 39/SF? I was so excited when I sat down and finally remembered that this is the place me and my mom went to 25 years ago when I was pregnant with my daughter! I had been trying to remember for so long. And guess what we had? The Crab Louis! Great memory.
author: Shelley S.

description: It's rare for a restaurant with nice views to still have good and reasonably priced food.  I enjoyed the perfect hibiscus margarita (where perfect is part of the name) with a nice mix of bitter and sweet, topped with froth.  The salmon was fresh and nice although there were a few too many onions on top.  It's nice that it was served with arugula and vegetables.
author: Jenny L.

description:
My review may be a bit biased since I was sitting with an amazing view of the pier, water, and blue sky's with even more amazing company. The restaurant was clean with fresh sunlight lighting the entire restaurant. The waiters were lovely people doing a fantastic job catering to their patrons. I can't really think of a single thing I did not like about my experience at this spot. 

But more importantly, the food was wonderfully prepared and presented beautifully. Oysters were on point, clam chowder inside of a crispy yet soft bread bowl was delicious, and the  calamari drizzled with a bit of fresh lemon all cooked to perfection. What more could you possible need?! I would recommended this location in a heart if you're looking for good food, a better view, and a relaxing environment. 5/5 you darn gone good looking people.
author: Daniel K.

description: Expect a wait, but worth it. If your lucky you can get a window table over looking the Harbor. The service is great, only surpassed by the food! And if you want clam chowder in a bread bowl theirs is great. They also keep all their boudin sour dough bread in a warmer... which boudins doesn't even do, so the boudins bread is better here!
author: Kristine C.

description:
Being in such a touristy place, we had to wait about 45 minutes until they called us, but we went back in about 30 and were seated fairly quickly. 

We went for dinner so it was packed but we had a view of the harbor during sunset and it was ABSOLUTELY GORGEOUS. We could see Alcatraz Island too and the ambiance of the restaurant was really fancy (at least to my poor ass) for somewhere meant for tourists. 

For our drinks we ordered the non-alcoholic Blackberry Press and Strawberry Basil Nojito and both drinks were super super sour and I will probably stick to just water next time. 

The bread was really fresh, warm and fluffy and tasted great with the butter. We ordered a second helping. 

My friends ordered the chicken penne (it was pretty good) and the sole (really soft and flavorful) and I split the whole dungeness crab. 

I am going to say right now I am not a fan of crab due to my past experiences with suffering cracking it open and how bland and dry the innards usually were, BUT THIS WAS NOT THE CASE. It was super moist and had a strong distinct crabby flavor. There was lots of meat available, thus making the tedious process of cracking it open totally worth it. Easily the best crab I've had in my life. The potatoes that came with the dish were kind of greasy and mediocre at best. 

The meal ended with a free Biscotti cookie which I thought was neat. 

Definitely worth it for the crab and bread, but next time I'll skip out on the drinks and pray for a shorter wait time.
author: Ann T.

description:
I come back here because they serve one item with Zabihah Creekstone Steak - the NY Strip.  It tastes delicious! :D

Remember to ask for a price adjustment on your parking slip if you parked in the Pier 39 garage.  

Other things on their menu that were fantastic: clam chowder! (so good), red chili garlic shrimp! (take caution, it's really spicy), and cioppono (large tasty portion)!
author: M K.

description: Dinner here was great! The clam chowder was so yummy! Also the crab cakes we delicious! Our server Jessica was phenomenal! Be sure to ask for her when you come!
author: Essence M.

description: I'm not a fish person, but after eating at the Fog Horn, I definitely am! After reading numerous reviews on Yelp, we decided to try this restaurant. Let me tell you -- it did not disappoint. Really beautiful place. The view is to die for! We ordered the clam chowder, baked oysters, linguini and clams. Everything was delicious! I have never had such decadent clam chowder in my life. It was buttery, smooth, and not at all oily. The flavors were vibrant without tasting 'fishy'. The sourdough bread was a fantastic complement to my soup. You know a restaurant is good when their bread is delicious. It really was. It was soft on the inside, and slightly crisp on the outside. This is how bread should be. The baked oysters were an explosion of flavor; just delicious. My mother commented they were the "best oysters" she has ever tasted...and trust me, she's had a lot of them. We also ordered the creme brûlée -- perfect, just perfect. The strawberry tres leches cake was also very good. I've made that type of cake before, and this one was rich in flavor and light in texture. Not to mention, the service was great; overall, very sophisticated and accommodating. We will definitely be back!
author: Camilla L.

description:
The scenic view for the window seats
Service
the sourdough bread basket (complimentary)
clam chowder
clams appetizer
oysters were rockin!
Seared tuna main dish
Seabass main dish


main dishes were on point as well. my least fave was the swordfish, only due to texture and dryness than i like a fish to be. I was picking at other peoples dishes in my party since I had too much enjoyment of the appetizers and bread to have my own main dish. 

I'd definitely come back and bring more friends. Exactly what we wanted to have our visitors to experience for their first time being in SF. Thank you Fog Harbour Fish House and the Yelpers.
author: Jenny L.

description:
Overall= food was just barely ok, service= poor, as a result price= too high for what was offered. Would not recommend and would not go back. Went there last night for dinner and we got the 1/2 garlic crab, clam chowder, and the sole. 

The crab was tasty but either so overcooked or frozen earlier. It was so dried out and OBVIOUSLY not fresh. The meat was unappealing. I burned more calories trying to remove the "meat" than the actual amount of calories I ate. 

Clam chowder was good. 

Tried the sole and it had NO flavor. The spinach had NO flavor. Just not good!
author: Roya A.

description:
Lunch cost $85 and included a somewhat controversial "Sf Emp Ord 4%" tax that I did not notice until after I got home. Google the quote for more information like I had to since I am from the east coast. Then we paid tax on the food bill subtotal + Sf Emp Ord 4% for a total bill of $93(rounded). Fog Harbor bill includes a suggested gratuity amounts. The suggested gratuity excludes this controversial tax, as it should. It does not feel right also for a tax to include this Sf Emp Ord 4% either (taxing a tax); a double tax situation. 

Controversy aside, the food is very good-unequivocally. The Wedge Blue Cheese Salad with bacon was perfect with the sourdough bread. We had the fried combo(calamari, fish, & shrimp), 2 orders. I prefer the squiggly ends of the calamari. My companion likes only the rounded pieces. We traded and ate the pieces each of us like since each plate had some of both. Forgo drinks, if you want to be frugal. Our food came to $52, not bad considering this is SF, Fisherman's Wharf & on the pier. The view is tax worthy. The ambiance of Fog Harbor & the pier area in tax worthy. So freak, perhaps taxing patrons directly for employees health insurance is okay too, just as long as the employees get all the money and none of it magically improves Fog Harbors bottom line.  The folks making all the wonderful food appear deserve health insurance. That is not a controversy for me. 

We were seated at a window table for 2 looking at Pier 42 from Pier 39.
author: Esther Z.

description:
This was a very disappointing location.  Very busy however that doesn't excuse poor service and a very disorganized hostess stand.

The hostesses were very pleasant but the whole walk up situation made no sense.  All standing together,  no communication to patrons and no seeming reason for who was taken back to be seated.  I was told 30-45 minutes which turned into an hour.  When I questioned - I was told I was a party of two and they had to seat larger groups first.  Yet...the table I ended up with was for 4?  A group of men who were directly in front of me and had 15 in their party were seated immediately while several other tables waited.  They were walk ups without reservations and instantly got several tables.  I suppose maybe they slipped some cash to someone. 

Food was not good when it finally came and relatively tasteless.  All in all don't waste your time or money for this tourist trap.  Much better restaurants in the Wharf and City.
author: John B.

description: First off never judge a book by its cover. You could tell our waitress didn't want to deal with us when we ordered water. Although we did order $140 worth of food she treated us like we were beneath her. The seafood tower was a total rip off. Not worth the money. I enjoyed the idea of this place but I shouldn't have to ask for things such as refills.
author: Tina R.

description: Lovely seafood place in a super touristy area. Loved the view of the sea lion and bay from our table. Food was excellent and well prepared. I had the roasted Dungeness crab, hubby had oysters and chowder, kids had grilled salmon and a burger. Also they did nice job of accommodating the child with food allergies.
author: Kirsten V.

description:
Sooo I would give it 3 stars, but 3 stars equals "A-OK" and I didn't get that feeling when I left Fog Harbor. Its smack dab on Pier 39, which is clearly a tourist area.  And yes, I was a tourist but this area is crawling with people.  I mean crawling.  That makes Fog Harbor a destination for all these folks.  As it was just me, I grabbed an easy seat at he bar.  The bar servers were quite attentive, but weren't great at recommendations, they just did what I asked.  

Best dish was the clam chowder.  The menu boasts it as a favorite and I was not disappointed.  The carb cake dinner however - yikes.  My crab cakes tasted as if they were breaded with Jiffy cornbread mix.  Not my idea of good seafood.  As I looked around the dining room, I didn't see any other dishes that really appealed to me either.  

Next time I'm in Sf, I'll probably choose another spot closer to the Wharf or off the tourist beaten path.
author: Reagan T.

description: Located in the second floor of pier 39, this is a very touristy restaurant. We had to wait around 45 minutes for the table. The service is fair and atmosphere is not bad, however the food was not as good as expected, especially considering the price point. The bread and out starters (fried calamari & jumbo shrimp cocktails) were actually pretty decent.
author: Wendy C.

description:
Awful. Overpriced. The menu was peppered with " we're out of that" items. 
Food was served cold. This is a tourist restaurant and is a poor excuse for even that. 
There is NO WAY this place is any more than 2 stars. A profoundly expensive disappointment. 
There are so many better options, including dinner service at the county lock up. Unfortunately Alcatraz is closed cause we just got robbed.
author: Chad M.

description: This restaurant is right on the pier with views of the SF Bay. We sat at the bar and made it in time for  their happy hour that ends at 5PM. Enjoyed their clam chowder and their crab cakes at the bar. This place is a bit pricey but you are paying for the locale and view.
author: Luis B.

description: Delicious food and great service.  Had a lipstick lemon drop martini that was fabulous! Also had their grilled plate and it was great food.  Great views as well.
author: Kishla S.

description: The view was epic, service by Daniel was excellent and the food was delicious! Highly recommend visiting this restaurant!
author: Juan C.

description: Took my boyfriend here for his birthday. The food was amazing and the customer service was great. Plus, you can't beat the view of the docs! We definitely recommend the Mussel Fries!!!
author: Thuy P.

description: To make a long story short my family and I had a horrible experience here. We heard this was the best restaurant on the wharf so we tried it. Pricey but we figured it would be worth it. We ordered fish and chips, Fried platter and chowder. Fish had such a thick battered crust, I had to peel it off and just eat the fish. Fries were ok. My daughter didnt like hers either or my boyfriend. My sons clam chowder was the worst Ive ever tasted. It literally tasted like thick flour paste with no flavor or texture. I was shocked. We were SOOOOO disappointed. We asked our server to validate our parking but when we got to the garage it hadnt been. Just an all around bad experience. We will not be going back.
author: Chelsea H.

description: Amazing food and exceptional service. The clam chowder bread bowl with crab was delicious. The filet mignon with crab topping was also outstanding. Would definitely recommend.
author: Lauren T.

description: Came here for my 21st birthday dinner with my boyfriend and it was the best! Amazing view of the pier and not too loud even thought the tables were decently close together. My boyfriend got the filet mignon because he hates seafood and was extremely satisfied with his meal! I got the clam chowder as appetizers and the ciopinno with pasta. It was honestly one of the best meals I've ever had. It had more seafood than I can remember and a gigantic portion for $40-50. There is a fee to add pasta and another fee to have the crab meat taken out of the shell for you. I said yes to both and did not regret it. Overall, it was not a mistake choosing to celebrate my birthday here. I would definitely come here again!
author: Christine C.

description: Good food, good atmosphere. We ordered a salmon BLT, a crab cake, a dish of baked oysters, linguini clams and cioppino (house special). Everything was good except our waiter was less than enthusiastic. Would recommend others for this place.
author: Chanyamat W.

description: 10 stars for service to Eddie and Ashley!!!  Food was also really tasty.  Only reason I gave 3 stars is because every item I had was warm to cool.  Soup wasn't hot at all.  Otherwise everything would have been perfect!  I'll be back for sure.
author: Q Q.

description: Not impressed. Table of 4. Horrible service. Good came out cold. Asked for a box and server threw it on the table. Restroom didn't have toilet paper. Very disappointing had hoped for a better experience.
author: Amanda G.

description:
We were really craving seafood and saw that this was ranked #1 around so why not give it a try?! 

Well we arrived around 8pm on a Sunday night and like expected there was a wait which was perfectly fine. Left my name on the list and was told it would be a 30-45 min wait and that we can walk around but just check back in 15 mins from now so they knew you were still here. We decided to stay in the waiting area if that was the case....

I would check in every 15 mins and they kept telling us it would be another 15 min wait every time I asked....Which was very annoying I would rather you just tell me it's an 1 hour or 1.5 hr of a wait vs 15 mins. 

Anyways finally after waiting 1.5 hr to be seated we walk in and they take us to a table with a very nice view. After being seated for 10 minutes not once has a sever or anyone approached us.....

We knew the service was slow but I mean at least have someone greet us and get our drink order?? Finally a server decides to come to our table and by that time we knew everything we wanted and ordered all at once since obviously they were running very slow that night. Throughout our dinner our server checked in with us twice.....and that was because I flagged her down to refill my drink the first time?? And then because we flagged her down for a check the second time?? She also wasn't so friendly and seemed to be annoyed by something and had a little of an attitude? I am not too sure maybe she was having a rough night but I was ready to get out of here. 

The food was amazing don't get me wrong...it was actually one of the best meals we had while visiting just very disappointed in the service we had. 

The food greater than the service.
author: Batul A.

description: Very delicious food , perfect location and good service the only disadvantage is the wating you may wait for an hour .
author: Talal A.

description:
Sure, this is along the touristy Wharf, but when it's 9:00p on a Friday night and you haven't eaten since late morning (plus crackers and sh*t in between to tie you over), you'd be desperate to go anywhere, right?

Well, it's good to know that this place was rated pretty good, and I can't say I went to SF without eating some kind of seafood so here I was with 4 others (note: "cooked" seafood...I don't like anything raw).

My friend actually called them around 8:15ish to see if we can make a reservation, but at that time, they were booked and walk-in would be about a 30-minute wait.  By the time we got there around 9:00, the restaurant was maybe a 1/3 empty so we were able to sit down right away (thank goodness, I would've had to chew my arm off).

Although we got hot sourdough bread with butter, we ordered the blue cheese garlic bread ($8) and crispy lemon calamari ($12) on top of that and pretty much scarfed it down.  The calamari was tender with crispy batter...so good.  The blue cheese garlic bread was good too, but the blue cheese was rich so if I wasn't overly hungry, I wouldn't be able to eat 3 slices.  But I did.

For main, I ordered the Pacific Sole ($20), but by then, I was already getting stuffed...(didn't help that I had a virgin Pina Colada with the appetizers).  I still ate some of it.  The pacific sole was fresh not fishy and went well with the spinach, peppers, and tarragon cooked in a caper sauce (buerre blanc).  The others ordered coffee and dessert after that, but I had to pass.  Sooo sooo sooo (did I say "sooo"?) saaaaad to miss out on dessert!!!
author: Frances G.

description: I'm always looking for a great place to have seafood and the Fog Harbor is just right. I have had seafood from other places before but the clam chowder that they server definitely takes the cake for me. It is delicious, prepared beautifully and is quite appetizing to the eye. It was the highlight of my trip to this particular restaurant and I have craved it ever since. Their food is always fresh and you can often expect warm and friendly faces whenever you enter this establishment. I have never had a bad dish from this place. Everything is perfect, the sauces add an extra delight to every meal. They are a little on the expensive side but it is definitely worth it if you're looking for great seafood. The Fog Harbor Fish House is the place to be.
author: Carlos R.

description: Glad I came here with my mom, brother, and his wife. We ordered the clam chowder, linguine with clams, crab cocktail, oysters, and crab cakes. Their food is all fresh and delicious. On the linguine they weren't cheap about the amount of clams they put in the dish. Which is awesome because I love clams. Their oysters were soooo fresh. I could seriously eat that everyday. I slurped that baby down. Everything was amazing. We got to sit right by the window to see the wonderful view. It was beautiful. Definitely highly recommend. You have to get their clam chowder.
author: Donna P.

description: This place did not disappoint.  You know you are going to pay some money just due to the location, but service and food is not compromised.  Their chowder is amazing and decently priced.  Our server Tyler was top notch and really made this place enjoyable.  He actually let us enjoy our meal but made sure we had everything we needed.  Even with other tables you still didn't have to wait for him to come around to check on you.  Everytime we come back to Pier 39 we will be going to this restaurant.
author: Zoe H.

description: Great views. Clam chowder was very good. Calamari was very good. I like the breaded jalapenos that came with it. Bloody Mary's were delicious and spicy. Mussels were a little undercooked for my liking. I was a bit surprised by the 5% employee health care charge. I was really put off by the extra 2.50 per drink they charged for the bloody Mary mix.
author: Ed O.

description:
This is my favorite Pier 39 restaurant. It's in a beautiful location (right at the front of the Wharf on the upper level) and the interior design is classy with a fireplace! 

The food is truly as good as they say it is. The chow-dare is creamy with big clams. There isn't the fishy after taste you can get from old clams in chow-dare. Freshness here!

I also tried the blue cheese bread (free with first time check-in btw). I normally hate blue cheese to. the. max. but I actually really enjoyed this. It did not have the nasty blue cheese taste at all. And they weren't skimpy on the cheese either.

Highly recommend if you're ok with slightly higher prices. I think the prices are reasonable for the quality. And you're on the Wharf so those prices aren't really higher than any other sit-down restaurant.
author: Connie C.

description:
Decided to grab seafood today and ended up here. The service was pretty good. Only thing was she did take long and forgot about out extra lemon, but hey it happens. 

The food was good. It was kind of pricey but as is seafood and it was good. Nothing to write home to mom about, but maybe cus I'm more of a Cajun creole girl.


 The halibut was fresh and yummy and the shrimp where cooked well. The salmon, muscles and clams all tasted fresh. The rice was however flavorless. Wish they had a happy hour ;(    

Loved my margarita !! 

We ordered 
Moscow mule $12.50
Hibiscus margarita $12.50
Half dozen oysters $13.00
Shellfish Platter for one $37
Mixed grill $26

Total 

$115 with some extra state tax added on on top of the original tax. 


Will we go back ? Maybe not, unless for the view. there are far too many seafood spots to try to us to want to come back. Nothing extra special here. The view was however the best part. Overlooking the water and sunset. 

We got a window seat the a reservation had cancelled so it was a nice romantic dinner.
author: China D.

description: Called in same day for reservations, for Mother's Day. However they don't hold reservations, was told to come in and wait time will be close to an hour but can be called in sooner. Did just as told, and surprisingly was called back with my party of 5 after about 30 min of waiting. The restaurant is right on the pier so there's a beautiful view of the ocean to look out too. Food was delicious. A lot of seafood options, but there are alternatives in case seafood isn't your thing. Food came out pretty fast. The service was okay though. Waitress would forget items or not understand what was being asked. Overall a great experience.
author: Nadia A.

description: Exceptional service, view and food. What more can you ask for!! Scallop appetizer is awesome!!
author: Mary Jane C.

description: I got the mixed grill and it was phenomenal. I asked for a side of chimichurri which really added something also. The clam chowder was amazing. Service was top notch. One of the best meals I had in San Francisco.
author: Ally K.

description: Excellent Food! We ordered the crab roll, fried shrimp, calamari, and sword fish. Everything was delicious! The atmosphere is beautiful over looking the ocean. There was a bit of a wait but it was worth it. Highly recommend!
author: Raquel R.

description: Great service at the bar. They have a very nice happy hour.  And for those of us with a gluten allergy they have many options listed on the menu. (But no gluten free bread.  Ehhh you can't win them all).
author: Daniel A.

description:
$16 mango crab/lobster? (don't remember if it was crab or lobster) ceviche with chips appetizer 

$10 Clam chowder in a fresh baked sourdough bread bowl 

$26 Mixed Grill -Grilled Salmon, Swordfish and Shrimp substituted with chimichuri sauce, sauteed vegetables, and substituted with potatoes. 

$19 Crab Roll- Crab, celery, shallot aioli, substituted with French roll 

Free sourdough bread with butter

Long wait (~1 hour.  ~40 minutes outside to be seated, ~20 minutes to be served) was well worth the food.  

Waitress was nice to let me substitute my foods and also giving options.  First time having swordfish.  It was an interesting taste and texture. It tasted like some kind of cheese but my significant other said it tasted like chicken.   

We got free sweet potato fries because the Crab Roll came with regular fries instead of sweet potato.  So we got a plate of our fries and we got to keep the sweet potato fries for free!
author: Esther K.

description: Food was amazing, I would definitely go back. It was my first time trying clam chowder and I loved it, the bread bowl was perfect. Service was great, our waiter was very friendly. This place is a must try.
author: Ruby E.

description:
so good we came back twice in our short trip to SF! The chowder in the bread bowl with crab on top was amazzinnng. The crab roll sandwich, fried calamari, and shrimp cocktail all wet above and beyond our expectations! This place is a must next time we come back to the city! 

The view is a nice plus btw
author: Salina A.

description:
Maybe our expectations were set too high after reading other Yelp reviews, but we were not impressed with the quality of food, bland & not worth remembering.
The only positive is the location & vibe of the place. Might consider coming back just to take in the views & wet our whistle.
author: Laroo L.

description: Great service and even better food! Skip all of the fried seafood along the wharf and order the seafood cioppino at Fog Harbor. The portion is large enough for two and you will avoid the grease bomb. Ask for an extra side of their house made sourdough and go to town on that baby! Wear your bib and slop tomato sauce with no shame. There is no attractive way to crack open a crab leg so attack it with gusto. I'll be back!
author: Hillary D.

description: Fog Harbor Fish House is most definitely a tourist trap with overrated food, but I guess that is the price you pay for the ambiance and view. This place is either a hit or miss because the food is a bit overpriced and the staff could be lousy at times. It was quite disappointing that the food did not meet my expectations because it was highly praised for the freshness and quality. The portions were small but expected, I would undoubtedly choose quality over quantity but that was not the case here. This place is not for everyone, the food was reasonable in my opinion but the reviews made it sound like it's the best on Fisherman's Wharf.
author: Tuan T.

description:
My waiter's name is Khaiman and he was very good. The food was very well prepared and he had nice suggestions. Next time I'll try the crab ceviche. The environment is good and the view is fantastic. 
BTW: I got a free garlic bread with blue cheese only by checking in here at Yelp!
author: Olavo L.

description: Been here several times in the last few months and have not been disappointed! The service,  the food,  the scenery... it's definitely more about the total package.  My experience today was more outstanding than usual. I came here with my little family and wasn't feeling well. My hubby ordered for me, letting our waiter, Khaiman, know I had a sore throat.  To my surprise, he returned with our drinks and a hot pot of water,  fresh lemon wedges, fresh ginger slices,  organic honey,  and an optional tea bag. So,  either I looked like I was dying, or he was truly listening.  Either way, this gesture showed me they truly want you to enjoy the experience.
author: Wendy R.

description: Came with friends and had to wait about 2 hours for dinner, but was totally worth it! All the food tasted authentic and fresh. Server was nice, but had to flag him down by asking the busboys couple times. Other tables that he was serving were getting annoyed as well because there were times we couldn't find where our waiter went to ask for simple things like water and napkins. We also got the blue cheese bread bite (forgot the actual name), but surprisingly this wasn't all that great. My friends and I all got a piece each and there were leftovers, but no one touched it after that. Other than that everything else was fantastic!
author: Carolina Y.

description: We were so excited to eat here after a long Bay cruise. Unfortunately we were very disappointed! We have been on a three week vacation and excited to have finally made it to San Francisco, and eat some good sea food. The atmosphere was excellent and our server was wonderful. However, our food was not so good. The crispy calamari was good and the crab ravioli was very good (the special of the day), but our linguini and clams tasted fishy along with our oysters from our shellfish tower. The shrimp off our shellfish tower were  mushy; the crab and lobster was decent, but expected better for a $200+ meal.
author: Amber W.

description:
Great views to Alcatraz and the Golden Gate, make sure you ask for those tables.

Classy Restaurant, loved the staff. Average waiting time.

We order the soup and salad combo, the Clam Chowder in a bread bowl is a must!!.

Average price for sea food and San Francisco.
author: Valente O.

description:
My boyfriend and I got the chance to eat here and let me tell you, this place is so good!! 

Scenery - We got a table overlooking Alcatraz, there are also views of the Golden Gate Bridge from the restaurant 

Food - We ordered the baked oysters to start and I wanted to order wine but was unsure of two wines that that I had my eye on. The waiter offered to bring me samples of the wine which made my decision that much easier! I ended up getting the Kendall-Jackson Grand Reserve (it complemented my meal nicely). We then ordered our meals. I got the Mixed Grill (best swordfish I've ever had) and my boyfriend got the surf and turf (about $50). Everything was delicious. 10/10

Service - Quick and attentive. Our waiter was sent by the gods! He was so nice and always there when I needed him but not overly pushy. Our meal came before the appetizer. When I asked him about it, he said the kitchen must've gotten mixed up and asked if we still wanted it which I kindly refused. He then came with a small plate that had two of the baked oysters. It was such a nice surprise and great customer service. And let me tell you, those are the yummiest/fattiest oysters! So good!!

I will definitely be coming back and recommend as a great date restaurant!
author: Yessenia E.

description: Watching the Blue Angels, excellent drinks Lipstick Lemonade & Alcatraz Escape.  Finished off the fresh Seafood Tower. Susan our waitress is AMAZING.  Still enjoying.  This is a must.  I am born and raised in the East Bay.  So sad haven't been here before.
author: Kim A.

description: Very good food, very good service.  A little Expensive, however, worth it.  We had the ceviche and it was a unique experience.  The clam chowder was pretty good but I admit that I have had better. All and all a very good place to eat.
author: Marion F.

description: My husband and I ate there during a Memorial Day weekend trip to San Francisco.  It was a WONDERFUL experience.  We sat at the bar to avoid a wait however the  service we received at the bar was impeccable.  Our waitress (Morgan M.) was warm and attentive even though she was very busy.  Now for the food - excellent!!! My husband had the mixed grill and the fried calamari.  The calamari was tasty and he loved the added kick of the jalapeños that were fried and mixed in.  The aeoli with the calamari was good also.  I had the crab cake app - it was fresh and tastey.  I had the shell platter for 1 which was very good. It was a lot of food and I wish my husband and I had split it.
author: Latifia C.

description:
Decent seafood. The plates are really pretty but the food lacked in flavor. My husband ordered the Cioppino, it was tasty, but nothing worth gushing over.
I ordered the Sole, and it was mediocre at best; the fingerling potatoes were under-cooked and I even got a rotten one. YUCK! I still have that bad taste in my mouth.

I'd save my money and go to a little stand for good seafood. This was overpriced Red Lobster, at least there you get those awesome cheddar bay biscuits.
author: Tania S.

description: What else I can say? Delicious food, awesome view, the price is a little high, but within the reasonable range of tour place in SF. I like it.
author: Xiaoxi W.

description: It is a little pricy but the plates are good size and the water is great without lemon!  The food is really good and the views are gorgeous!
author: Saul F.

description: Easily our most  expensive and worst meal on our trip to San Francisco. The calamari was nicely fried but had little taste. The white beans my husband's fish with were undercooked and still a bit crunchy. The fried shrimp really needed some type of seasoning as they were bland and unappealing. A meal for 3 people with 2 beers and 1 appetizer came to $144, which I would have been fine with had the meal met expectations.
author: Cindy K.

description: This is a great restaurant!  I always check Yelp reviews before checking out anything new to me, and sometimes, I end up totally disagreeing with the high reviews. But not this one! I was worried we would have to wait a long time because we were a party of 8 and when I called one week prior, the reservations were already filled up, so I couldn't make a reservation. But we were really lucky and ended up waiting only a few minutes for the perfect table next to the window. I was surprised how busy the place was at 4:30...it just shows how good it is! Our server, Samir, was great and even sang Happy Birthday to me since it was my birthday. The food...oh, the food...soooooo yummy!!  I loved every bite.  Typically, it can be difficult to find good restaurants in a touristy area, but this place is excellent and I highly recommend it.
author: K. P.

description: Have been here twice now. Had a great experience both times. My family who is not very experimental and fussy about food loved this place. We are all seafood lovers and the seafood here was really fresh( the fish was literally caught that morning and you can feel the difference). If you like spicy food, do try the garlic chilli prawns app, it is really good. We also had the oysters, and seafood penne. Both were good. The chicken penne was ok. The view is great too. They do not take reservations but there can be a wait sometimes. They only seat you when the entire party is present. But its well worth the wait.
author: Shibani K.

description: Yummy fish & chips (great batter)! All food was good typical chain restaurant seafood. Good easy location & fun non-alcoholic drink choices. Service was good even thought they were crowded as well.
author: Kathie Z.

description:
Don't get clam chowder-  it was clumpy, lacked the flavor that the street chowder had. Overall, the chowder was a total disappointment. 

My daughter had a grilled chicken burger it was good; the best entree out of the 3 entrees we had

My husband had the fried food combo it was just average.

Overall I'd say this place was overrated and tried to use the view to make up for the sub-par food. The best part was the bread and biscuits at the end.
author: Michelle S.

description:
Great seafood restaurant in the middle of the touristy Pier 39. 

We started with the bleu cheese garlic bread (free with yelp check in) and as a non-bleu cheese fan, the bread was surprisingly tasty. The bleu cheese was very mild and broiled crisp on top. 

The clam chowder was thick, creamy with large chunks of clam-just the way a good chowder should be. The oysters on the half shell were fresh. The steamed crab legs were delicious although a little drier than I'd like. Drenching them in garlic butter definitely helped:)

I washed down all this garlicky seafood goodness with a Skinny Ginger Lemonade. Advertised as only 14 calories and made with Splenda, it was light and refreshing with fresh ginger shavings throughout.
author: Suzanne Q.

description: Although it may not seem elegant when it is seen, it is a restaurant located in the pier with a great view and expensive food, yet the price is worth it. I ate a live maine lobster, it is the most delicious plate I've ever eaten. It's a very popular restaurant.
author: Adrián B.

description:
This place was a last minute decisions while looking for places to eat on the last night in San Francisco. Booked through the yelp app then rocked up and was asked to wait even though people who just asked for a table were let right in.. I was a little annoyed about that until.. My name was called, they then walked is to a nice quite corner that had a beautiful view while the others that were let in before us got a nice seat in the middle of the restaurant. Well played. Well played. 

Being on vacation I was happy anyway but looking at the menu made me even more happy! They had a great selection steaks and seafood with beautiful combinations, just thinking about it makes my mouth water!! I had the steak with blue cheese sauce with Spinach on the side. Rare. Always rare. Man this was the most AMAZING steak I have ever had in my life! It melted on my mouth like it was sugar. The taste of the fresh beautifully cooked meat was like non other! I can't remember the exact name of the steak cut but it was the most expensive one around $36 but oh man was it worth it. 

Then came dessert. They bring you a platter of fake desserts so you can actually see what you are about to order. I thought it was very bizarre seeing it happen to other people around the restaurant but when it came to our turn it made choosing much easier. Crème brûlée. Amazing. Creamy with crunchy toffee top burnt just the right amount with awesome little vanilla beans mixed in the the custard. 

If I was ever back in San Fran this would be where I would go for dinner without fail! And I would order the same thing over and over again.
author: Peter A.

description:
My plans for an afternoon meal by the wharf were tragically shot by a lack of proper foresight. Little did I know that the place I'd been mentally hyping up for the past week isn't actually open for three out of seven days of the week. The dread of pulling on Sammy Aloha's closed doors could only be summed up by the patronizing voice in my own head, bitterly muttering: "ya done goofed, kid; no poke for you, fool." I had ZERO plans of hopping back onto the Embarcadero before I got my seafood fix, so naturally, I shuffled over to the nearest semi-decent sounding place within a 6-minute walk.

Fog Harbor is a pretty hoppin' Pier 39 spot, so it's no surprise that it's constantly flooded with hungry tourists during weekend lunch hours. Luckily, classic Bay Area traffic brought us in a little after the lunch rush, closer to a quarter past two. We were seated in no time at all. The restaurant is situated in a pretty clutch position, smack dab in the middle of the tourist-centric marina and a stone's throw away from the sea lions (aka the only reason people actually want to go to Pier 39). Pretty prime ambience: a table by the window gets you gratuitous sunlight and a great waterfront view. That alone makes half of the dining experience here. Notably, they nab their seafood from sustainable local suppliers; regardless of whether or not that's a cause that you actually care about, it guarantees fresher fish: net to plate.

The food is solid but kind of delivers just a notch above what you'd expect from an upper-mid-scale tourist trap. I grabbed a ginger negroni to start, and it was perfectly adequate. The swordfish was a great dish: expertly cooked, wonderfully fresh, tasty blend of flavor. While I was a huge fan of the pesto aioli drizzled on top, i think the amount of chimichurri may have overwhelmed the plate a little bit. I snuck a few bites of the fried fare and wasn't wowed: the fish was fresh, flakey, and well battered but was generally super bland. Easily fixed by a shake or six of salt, but the dearth of seasoning left me wanting. The menu also has non-seafood options... though I'm not sure why you'd come here looking to eat anything else; legit all of it's fished out of the sea within the last 24 hours. If that prospect doesn't at least mildly excite you, you need to reevaluate your core life values.

Considering that I was originally hoping to grab a $10 bowl of poke, this was a splurgier alternative. But when it comes to travels, good food comes first: frugality (and diet) be damned! The service here is solid and speedy to the point that it can almost come off as snippy, but considering the nematode-like hordes of hungry travelers they have to deal with on the daily, I don't blame 'em. Bottom line: they still offer up a great bayside dining experience. This is one tourist trap that I wouldn't mind getting caught in again.
author: Rei R.

description:
The food here was excellent. The ambiance was perfect. Our waiter Samir checked on us several times. The pace of the food was perfect. We were able to enjoy the Seafood Tower, our Main entre and even dessert. I made reservation for a window view and it was worth it. 

The seafood tower: Crab was sweet and fresh, Lobster was juicy, Oysters was delicious.
Main Dish: I had the mix grill: Swordfish was my fav. It was buttery and sweet. The Salmon was a bit dry but salmon is salmon. The Grilled Shrimp kabob was a bit tough - may be a little over cooked). 
My fiance had the Ahi-Tuna. The Tuna was huge and seared perfectly. The sauce was your typical mayo Japanese sauce drizzled over it. It was served on top of rice and veggies. The rice was perfect.
Dessert: We had the trio dessert - Creme Brulle, Whip, and warm brownie cake. (Grade A). 

Overall the price was right.
author: Mindy T.

description: Love there food, view and great service. This place located at pier 39 which easy to see and can walk to visit around Pier 39. Service is the best. Food come out so fast and taste is soo good. Love their New York steak, so juicy and lobster tail so good taste and very fresh!!
author: Toon C.

description: Making reservations and showing up early makes for a nice table with the best views. All tables have a view of the water, but nothing beats sitting next to the window! They do have seasonal specials that wait staff will inform you of. I had the halibut (seasonal) which was awesome: moist and nice serving size. They have a nice wine selection too! Daniel took great care of me, quite attentive but not overbearing on a busy night. This is one of the better restaurants on Pier 39. I would come here again!
author: Sharon B.

description:
I'd say this place is excellent. Definitely recommend it!!! 

It's very sophisticated, so I'd recommend you dress up a bit. I ordered the clam chowder in the sourdough bread bowl. It was phenomenal.  You could really taste the freshness of the clam in each bite. A friend at the table ordered the fried combo and yet again I was blown away by the freshness in the taste of the fish. To drink I had a virgin strawberry daiquiri, which again was phenomenal. 

The only negative I can really say was we were seated by the kitchen, which negatively effected the overall vibe a bit. Something about hearing dishes clank when the doors open just took a small bit away from the overall experience. Overall though, even as a reflect on my experience months after I went to it, this restaurant is a winner and worth trying.
author: Rob R.

description: We had great food tonight! The calamari appetizer,  cioppino, clam chowder in bread bowl were all wonderful. Our waiter Tyler took the cake though with his personality and service!! Thank you for making my experience better by recommending a great wine!
author: D H.

description: Great place and great service.   Tyler did a great Job,  very knowledgeable and everything he recommended was amazing...  Well done!
author: Donnie C.

description: Great food. My wife got the fish and chips. They were awesome. Light and crispy crust with flaky cod. I got the Ahi Tuna and it was cooked to perfection. Also has a great view of the wharf.
author: James O.

description:
What a great service form Ashley G.   She made our 
 day.  Great employee.  The food was good the view was wonderful   but the service was Excellent
~Loai 
Good food good view excellent service!
author: Loai N.

description:
Amazing food and views. Located at Pier 39 on the wharf in SF, Fog Harbor Fish House is a delicious choice while vacationing, or with business colleagues. 
We arrived and sat at the bar and had a cocktail until our table by the window we'd requested was ready. When out table was ready we were seated and our waitress quickly came over and introduced herself, very friendly (a blond with glasses, her name slips my memory). Sourdough and vinegar are presented, and orders taken. We ordered clam chowder in a bread bowl (amazing, probably some of the best I've ever had!!) Chicken penne pasta with basil, roasted tomatoes, garlic, ( very good, light and not heavy, but flavorful). Seafood cioppino was delicious, my hubby kept saying how good it was. Dessert was the 2 sampler, smallish chocolate fudge cake and creme brûlée, the cake was super rich, too much, but the creme brûlée was excellent!  Total bill for everything including 2 cocktails, virgin piña colada and 3 iced teas, $160, minus tip. Typical for touristy, seafood places, but the food and service was great, so we were happy with the experience there.
author: Danielle G.

description: Mila was a great waitress and took great care of us! I had the shrimp and avocado salad and my husband had the fired seafood combo of shrimp, cod and calamari! The food was amazing! Was a great atmosphere and we were close to the window to see Alctraz and the entire Bay! This is the type of place where you could dress up for a special occasion, or be casual since a lot of tourists end up eating here. Definitely recommend this place!
author: Megan H.

description:
Came here for the crab. We ordered a garlic crab and Cioppino. 
Crab - it was awesome, fresh, yummy and the price was reasonable. 
Cioppino - mussels, shrimps, fish, clams, scallops and crab inside. I love the scallop and shrimp but I was a little bit disappointed with the flake crab meat. 
Overall it is good and I would like to try there lobster if come again. Also, we were enjoy the sun and ocean view in the window seat.
author: Katelynn H.

description:
My husband and I had lunch here. We shared the Blue Cheese Garlic Bread and the Fish and Chips. The garlic bread was delicious. They were not cheap with the blue cheese. There was a generous amount of blue cheese and it was seasoned well. 

The service and atmosphere were great. Beautiful view of the bay. The only reason I'm giving 3 stars is because the fish and chips was lacking flavor. The size was fantastic and the quality of the fish was great I just felt like there was something missing.
author: Allison G.

description: Visited today and I had the ahi tuna salad and mussels....got food poison and I have been throwing up since lunch. I'll never go back.
author: Patrick B.

description: Food is not that good, mixed grill is small portion and Came cold! The server is rude, didn't even tell us his name. He didn't know what he was doing, and our food were brought to wrong table! We have to ask couple times for an extra basket of bread for 4 ppl. We were just too nice to even tip him which he is not deserved at all.
author: K L.
