description: 3.5 stars. Pretty view of the bay, good food (clam chowder in bread bowl, grilled shrimp on mixed green salad)...but not amazing. My server called me "dear" repeatedly, which drove me nuts. Unfortunately, the wine was meh (gewurztraminer). I won't be back unless I am with folks who want a view if we happen to be by pier 39.
author: Dina E.

description: Seriously the best clam chowder I have ever had. Just what we needed on a cold day. The Cesar salad was fresh and delicious. We will definitely be back!
author: Aaron M.

description:
Horrible tourist trap with horrible service and poorly cleaned seafood.
Had steamed clams and i got about 4 sandy ones. 
That I can somewhat overlook but the worst was the seafood tower. It came with 5 shrimp cocktails but like 4 out of the 5 shrimp had been deveined improperly. You can see brownish residue along where they deveined them. This is the first time I've come across that and I have eaten quite a bit of seafood.

The server barely checked up on us. The managers that came by would take forever to give us to-go boxes and no one would bring us the check until we asked, although we were clearly done. 

The food was not that great. The clam chowder wasnt bad and i liked that you can add crab to it.  The seafood tower was just ok. The seafood didn't seem that fresh and they cleaned the inside of the crab (where the tomalley is) really well [unlike the shrimp veins]. I personally love crab tomalley so I felt gipped. They didn't explain which oysters were which. And the tower only comes with half a lobster tail and a claw which I thought was rubbery and overcooked. 

The cioppino was not good. It seemed more like a watery pasta sauce. I actually took it home to add pasta to it and it was better that way.
author: Heejin L.

description: I think this place is overrated for the price you pay. The baked oysters and clam chowder were delicious. However, I ordered the Cioppino for my main course and was extremely disappointed. The seafood itself was good, but the tomato sauce was flavorless and, in my opinion, ruined the dish. The views from the restaurant were beautiful and the service was top-notch. However, I would not eat here again.
author: Nika W.

description: Came to Fisherman's Wharf on vacation to San Francisco. Friends recommended Fog Harbor so we came for lunch. The atmosphere is nice and the view of the harbor is great. The bread bowl clam chowder was not bad but I would say overrated. The oysters and clams were not very fresh so I had to eat it with a lot of sauce to get rid of the fishy taste. The calamari was very salty. Everything was average, nothing especially great.
author: Ada Z.

description: At the time of eating here, I enjoyed my meal.  However, shortly after leaving the restaurant I became very sick.  Several days later and I was still having stomach issues.  Be careful eating here if you're on vacation, may put a damper on your trip as it did mine.
author: Caitlin M.

description:
They tried really hard, and I very much enjoyed the food.  It was a Wednesday July sunset with lots of tourists (including myself, but I was brought by a local).  Some of the tourists should probably be supervised while out in public, or away from their tiny villages for the first time.

We had the steamed clams for a starter.  Some interesting taste selections for the broth.  I would have liked a small bowl rather than a plate to serve my clams on.  The broth sloshes all over the plate, and then you have the serving bowl left with some really edible broth/brine that is taken away uneaten.

My friend had the blackened Cod.  He raved about it constantly.  He'd probably eat it daily if he lived closer.  It was a weird experience to witness for sure.

I had the cioppino, and paid extra to have the crab removed from the shell (I wish everyone did that).  I'm not sure that crab made it back into the dish, but some of the shell did.  I found one scallop in the whole dish, and I don't know what the fish was.  It wasn't the best cioppino I've ever had, but I'll place it 2 or 3 because I could pay to have the crab removed from the shell even though I couldn't find it.

I'd go back again, insist on better seating, and be pickier about my plate.  I'd go back again.
author: David M.

description:
My friend and I traveled San Francisco last winter.
We didn't  know anything about  pier39, so we chose restaurant randomly. 

Waiter was kind and he explained what is good to eat this season. We ordered mixed grill, shrimp dish, garlic crab.

It was amazing test. My dish ( mixed grill) it was fabulous.. I really don't like broccoli, but the broccoli was amazing. I'd never eaten delicious broccoli before... and grilled salmon and the other kinds of  fish was amazing... 

At that time, it was crab season, so we ordered crab.
It taste naturally sweet and the garlic sauce was amazing, not too greasy, crab meat is soooo soft..

Table was clean and modern. Service also amazing~

I will come again this summer vacation
author: Stacy C.

description: The food was okay. I had the cioppino which came out a little cold we were not offered desserts for a party of 7 probably wouldn't go back
author: Alfredo T.

description: We didn't get our food for a real long time . Wait was over an hour after being seated.
author: Nathan K.

description: Beautiful view, got a nice window table that overlooks the water.  This is supposed to be one of the oldest or maybe even the first to open restaurant on the pier.  It's very good food here.  The salad is really nice.  We got a window table by making a reservation so make sure to add it ahead of time.  Some of the tables are too close together so you can hear everything other people are saying.  The lighting could be a little better but overall a great experience, felt happy here.  They have blue cheese garlic bread.
author: Ami T.

description: Had a reservation and ate here with some friends. Not too bad. We were started off with complementary bread then we ordered tuna poke starter, clam chowder bowl, and seafood penne. The tuna poke was actually my favorite! It was light and fresh. The soup was very good too. And the penne was not too bad.
author: Mel H.

description: Tyler made my 23rd Birthday the BEST birthday EVER!!!! Our dinner was fantastic. The bleu cheese garlic bread was delicious and crab was yummy!!! Definitely a place you have to visit!!
author: KayLee R.

description: First time having dinner at Fog Harbor. Service was amazing! Food was outstanding, props to the chefs.  Ahí tuna appetizer was to die for! Not mention the clam chowder and the dessert. Our server was very attentive! I had just gotten my wisdom teeth taken out a few days prior so I stuck to the award winning clam chowder, which was delicious. Server had a great sense of humor and even brought me a couple complementary cookies to taken home for after I was fuller recovered and able to eat solid food. Will definitely be coming back for more !
author: Daniella R.

description: We came and eat here tonight and the food was amazing but what was more better? Our server Daniel! He was so attentive and on top of everything. They have amazing view! I suggest to make this a stop if your traveling to San Francisco!! The wine list is pretty big with a lot of choices too!
author: Nichole L.

description:
Outstanding view of the harbor. Went here for lunch. Little pricey but very good seafood. Wife and I split a few dishes. The chowder was good and fresh and not condensed milk like. The poke was fresh and flavorful. The seafood cioppino was real good as well as the steamers. The warm sour dough bread complimented all the dishes perfectly.

Dessert was eh for me but the wife chose the creme Brule and chcolate cake combo. I would've done bread pudding or tiramisu.

Definitely coming back.
author: Rajesh G.

description: Great service. Even brought the kids' meals first. Seafood was delicious, view and location can't be beat. And fresh sourdough!
author: Amy S.

description: I had a really great meal and service at Fog Harbor. I was impressed by the service. I had the mixed grill and it was good.
author: Karen G.

description:
Fog Harbor starts with freshly baked sourdough bread. I ate with family so we started with lcalamari, fresh oysters and clam chowder. For main course we tried ciopino, garlic crab, shellfish platter and fried combo. Everything was tasty, fresh and perfectly cooked. The only thing that was over cooked was the salmon in ciopino. 

The restaurant has great atmosphere and great service! We enjoyed the restaurant and will definitely come back.
author: Kay D.

description:
You can't stop by Pier 39 or Fisherman's Wharf and not crave seafood!  After checking the Yelp reviews, my husband and I decided that Fog Harbor looked like our best bet.  We were seated immediately (we were there around 3:00 on a Tuesday afternoon) in a dining room that had fabulous views of the bay.  We weren't lucky enough to be at a table that could take advantage of it, though.  

The service was quick and efficient.  I was bummed that we didn't get a basket of the bread everyone was raving about, but it's probably just as well since we couldn't finish what we ordered anyway.  We started with the calamari appetizer.  It was crispy, not oily, and perfectly seasoned.  I was surprised to find fried onions and jalapeño slices in with the calamari, but it was tasty.  

I had a bowl of clam chowder and it was probably one of the best I've ever had.  Chock full of tender clams and super creamy.  I'll come back just for that!  My husband and I both ordered the Crab Rolls, which were very good.  The bread was amazing and they were very generous with the crab.  The desserts looked amazing, but we were too full to partake.  

I've been disappointed with many of the restaurants we've tried in the area of Pier 39, but this is a winner.  Prices were fair for what you are getting, expect $40 or more per person after drinks.
author: Kim L.

description: My family came to Fog Harbor for dinner Christmas night.  Although there was a long wait, (busy time with the holiday), the service was really wonderful.  They were very accommodating.  Our waitress was very professional and friendly.  And the food was delicious.  The food and service made my parents happy, so I'm happy.  And am glad we spent our Christmas dinner there.  So, thank you!
author: S H.

description: Super fresh food, awesome staff! My husband and I were looking for seafood near our hotel at the Warf and were a bit worried that the Warf restaurants would be a bit too touristy. Although the area was filled with tourist (him and I being 2 of them) there was some great people watching and excellent food at Fog Harbor to be had! We settled on the Cioppino and Salmon for entrees and made it a fat night by adding the Calamari & a cup of Clam Chowder for appetizers. Typically fired calamari is almost always the same, but the addition of friend jalapeños & onions and homemade dipping sauce made all the difference! I highly recommend this restaurant if you are in the area!
author: Kathy G.

description:
Amazing! Fantastic! Awesome! Wonderful! We spent all morning walking the pier and surrounding area trying to pick the best place for lunch. We ended up here because it was one of the highest ranked seafood restaurants on yelp. I am do glad we did!! 
 There was about an hour wait but they call you so you can quickly pass the time shopping in the surrounding stores. We were not seated right next to the window but I think almost anywhere you sit in the restaurant you have a great view of the bay. Service was amazing. A manager walked by to check on us, took an order for another round of bar drinks and quickly brought them to our table. The food was AMAZING!! The clam chowder was the best I have ever had..anywhere!!! The garlic crab was also so flavorful!
 I think it is hard to find good restaurants that offer 5 star service and 5 star food quality but this one has done it.
author: Sherry M.

description:
U live in Bay area...U get visitors...they all want to go to Pier 39...U have been there million times...U hate touristy things...but yet YOU HAVE TO.....Sounds familiar.....then you have come to the right place my friend.....

Tell your friends, family, in-laws (Out-laws)....to stroll on the Pier...buy some things at Lefty's...Go to Ghirardelli Square...blah blah...and meet me at Fog Harbor after 2-3 hours...

1/2, 1 or more dozen Oysters (Really fresh) and Bottle of Jordan or Sonoma Cutrer or if you are that lucky a Kisstler ;) ...and enjoy the afternoon...

When the tourists are back.....njoy SF specials such as Clam Chowder, Cioppino, or Grilled seafood.....and of course more Wine ;)
author: Jadya C.

description:
The first time I came here, I came here for some drinks and some clam chowder because I wanted to try clam chowder from every place on the pier! Their clam chowder was so good, I decided to come back to try out their other foods.

I had a TERRIBLE experience and I didn't even get to order.
My boyfriend and I (both asian) came on a Thursday afternoon for lunch. It wasn't very busy and the groups that were there were either getting their food or finishing up. We got seated by the window, which was lovely, and were given our menus. We were given bread and butter... mmm!
Our waiter introduced himself and asked us if we were ready, we said "no, can you give us a few minutes please?"

I didn't know a few minutes meant to never come back to our table.

More groups were being seated around us and what I noticed that they were non-asian. I don't want to be calling this waiter a racist but I did feel weirded out given the lack of service we were given and how different we were treated.
There was a couple who sat at the booth next to us who received their waters and other beverages before us. This couple came in about 10 minutes after us.
Every time our waiter would walk past our table, his back would be towards us and he never made eye contact with my boyfriend and I. He would check on other tables, especially the tables that came in AFTER us but never us. We made a point to stare at him whenever he was walking towards us but he never would go to our table.

I would think, usually, if we stare down a waiter and try to get that eye contact, the waiter would come to our table to see if we were ready to order or better yet, get our waters or drinks in. But no. We sat there for 30 extra minutes as we watched our waiter take orders from the couple next to us and the group behind us. We sat there patiently in hopes that our waiter could come and take our orders because I was really excited to try out the other foods.

NOPE. MORE TIME WASTED.

At this point we were frustrated. We saw the manager and explained our situation.
The manager apologized and said that the place got really busy and that there was only one server.
One server or not, it does NOT matter because you are obviously making an effort to ignore us. We don't mind if the service was slower but our waiter just never came to check on us even to get us our drinks! Instead, his back was always faced to us when he walked past us. I don't understand. It took us having to talk to the manager for the waiter to finally look at us. 

If you didn't want to give us your service, don't waste our 40 minutes and just tell us to leave next time. I probably would've left happier.

We went down to the Charthouse after and had the best service with delicious food in a more beautiful setting. Go there instead guys!!
author: Christine N.

description: Picked this place bc had such a high Yelp rating but it is only ok. View of bay and surrounding areas is amazing however food wasn't that great. My husband got steak which he said was only so-so. I got the combo platter which includes fried fish, shrimp and calamari but was very disappointed to find only one piece of shrimp and an overload of calamari. Dessert menu is good with wide variety (bring out tray to show selection). I enjoyed our lunch but not sure I would pick this place again.
author: Stefany G.

description: This place was really good. Service was great and my dad and I shared the calamari and a bowl of clam chowder which was delicious! They're selection of wine is not as wide as I would like for the sale by the glass but it was very good. And prices are a little high but that's to be expected while dining at pier 39. The view was so beautiful from here, and all in all it was a very nice experience. Would come back .
author: Ira D.

description: I always come here on the holidays, and the service is always exceptional and fantastic. My man CURTIS was an absolutely amazing server on Christmas evening, made the holidays that much more special for my family and I
author: Nick M.

description: I live close by but usually avoid the pier and restaurants because they usually aren't great food and over priced. I gave this place a shot because it was recommended and glad he did. Everything from just walking up and asking for a table to cashing out was great. First off if you do have to wait they have a great covered outdoor area with a fireplace and seating that's comfortable. Place was busy which I expected since it's at Pier 39. But it's a big place. I waited at the bar with some drinks. Serve staff was very knowledgeable about whiskey which was what I was looking for. Great drinks, great service there. Thank you. We get seated and our server was Lydia. Wonderful Italian woman that helped us choose what she thought we would like based on what we told her our tastes were. Everything from apps to our dinners were amazing. Didn't get to try dessert because the portions were pretty big and I just wouldn't have enjoyed it as much. I will definitely go back. The Manhattans are solid. Mussels spot on. Sword fish, salmon and tuna amazing. Prices were very reasonable and no matter where you sit in this place it seems like you'll have an amazing view overlooking the bay since its on the second floor. Thanks Fog Harbor for an amazing experience.
author: Rob S.

description: Friendly staff, and a so-so wine list. With world renown California wines nearby, a boutique wine list would only add to the delicious menu. The sourdough bread had the flavor of San Francisco and the food was good.
author: Lisa P.

description: Great food with an amazing view. Group of 10 and we all loved our food. Service was spot on too!
author: WJ A.

description: Such a beautiful view, and my waitress was extremely kind and attentive. Food was absolutely delicious and very fresh. Recommend the calamari!
author: Sabra M.

description: We absolutely loved the service and food, highly recommend for anyone wanting views of the Bay and a nice dining experience (white table cloths).
author: Rick NJessica K.

description: Favorite restaurant in San Francisco!! We ordered the crab ravioli and swordfish and everything was incredible!! The waiting staff was great also!
author: Katherine K.

description: Had the ceviche and cioppino and they were both great!! Sat at the bar and the service was excellent!
author: Jana L.

description: We saved this place for our last meal of this SF visit and were extremely disappointed.  After a 30 minute wait, we were seated at a table which had been vacant the entire time.  We were ready to order right away as we had made our choices while waiting but it took some time for our server to get to us..  The crab cakes were lacking crab and the garlic roasted whole dungeness crab was absolutely tasteless.  We will definitely pick a different place next time.
author: Shawn T.

description: Fantastic service by Curtis! He was an exceptional waiter! He gave us a wonderful experience this evening and great recommendations! Our beverage paired beautifully with our entrees. We will be back!! We were seated by the window and were treated very well. This place is a must when visiting San Francisco!
author: James And Ruth V.

description: Good service! Food was mediocre and a bit overpriced. The chowder was a bit too salty and the crab Louis was okay. I guess it's pretty normal for a tourist area.
author: Suzy T.

description: Been up and down fisherman's wharf and finally found a place that I'd not just recommend but will be my new spot while visiting pier 39.  The food is high quality, service is excellent, view and ambiance is very nice. The clam chowder, sour dough bread and drinks are all quality.  Just go early or you will be waiting for a while.  They do have a nice lounge but go early and get a nice table.  Highly recommend this place!
author: M K.

description: This place is delicious! We ordered the crab cake and a cup of crab chowder and the crab chowder could have been my meal!!! Highly recommended. For dinner we had the lobster tail--was excellent and because it took over their designated time frame they gave us a discount ( it wasn't a long wait at all). Our waiter Bernie was fabulous he was attentive and overall a great server. Great food and great service!
author: Heather P.

description:
I was pretty home sick and these guys had red trolley ale (San Diego Brew) so that was awesome, service and food were fantastic.  I'd come all the way back to SF for this!

I tried the fish and chips and their sourdough bread bowl.
author: Adrian M.

description: I wish I had remembered to take a picture of the view from our table, the food I had and the great server that took care of us. The restaurant is a class act. If you're ever on Pier 39, than be sure to enjoy the food. My family and I enjoyed the crab cocktail, salmon and halibut. They were worth every penny.
author: Liz C.

description:
The Sourdough Clam Chowder Bowl was yummy, and the bread was very good. 
The Crab Cakes appetizer was the best crab cakes I have ever eaten!! 
I also ordered a Moscow Mule and that is a real nice drink when you have a hot date like I did 
On the other hand my Mixed Grill dish was small for the price in my opinion.. 
And the Jumbo Shrimp cocktail was Subpar. 
The cocktail sauce just had a weird taste to it, no flavor. 
I actually ended up adding the shrimp from that to my meal. 
I would recommend this to family and friends because they have many other really nice looking dishes
author: Greg F.

description: BEST clam chowder bread bowl I've had. We came here with a group of 4 and got a bunch of things... Muscles, Oysters, tuna poke, clam linguine, and much more!!! All of them were phenomenal. Drinks were also incredible. Must try in SF!
author: Meline N.

description: I've had dinner here couple of times - Never disappointed. I think it's become my go to seafood place in SF. I love their dungeon crab, clam chowders and other seafood dishes - fresh and tasty! Strongly recommend this place.
author: Jessie L.

description: It's a middle of the road seafood restaurant for me, nothing bad, nothing memorable other than it met expectations. Host seating us was nonverbal and the food runner grabbed the wrong dishes for our table but the error was quickly rectified. I'm used to the same or better in Seattle-area restaurants and so while the food was good, the service equally so, it just was that: good, not great. Also, the way into the side room meant passing past the stations where the servers entered their orders, which caused a bit of a traffic jam.
author: Raine W.

description: Awesome view,  great food,  incredible service!!! Nice to go in casual and have a nice meal.  Wish I could go back but time just doesn't allow.
author: Maxine K.

description: Food wasn't great for the price and the service wasnt good either.  The salad I ordered was almost $30 and was ALL lettuce and VERY little crab. We told our waiter I didn't enjoy it and he said sorry and walked away. The clam chowder was the only good thing we ordered. $200 later and I was still hungry. We went and got a drink at the bar after dinner and the bartender didn't even acknowledge us, and continued to have a conversation with a girl sitting at the bar. We finally had to ask him for some service and after he finally got us our drinks he never checked on us again. We will not be  going back on our next visit.
author: Alyson H.

description:
Best seafood market in my area and also makes the BEST lobster bisque I have ever had. Parking can be a little tricky around here being that this place is located on the main strip in Maywood. 

The fish here is always fresh and flavorful. I love that they have a small dining room that you can actually eat there. It is BYOB and I would definitely take advantage of that. The restaurant is nothing fancy but its exactly what you are looking for in having a excellent dinner filled with seafood. I have tried the crab cakes here and they are chock full of lump crab meat and not a lot of fillers. That's exactly what I want when you eat a crab cake, not a mouthful of breading like some others I've tried locally. 

The staff here is always friendly and willing to answer questions you may have. They do take out but no delivery unfortunately. If you are in the area come check this spot out. I can't imagine you leaving disappointed.
author: Manuel H.

description:
Birthday trip to SF. Fantastic dinner celebrating two birthdays.
Rounds of wine and Moscow mules. 

Don't f-around - get the Ciopinno. Seafood heaven.
author: Kris C.

description: Justin H. was a great server! Patient and friendly. Not to mention the food was awesome! We'll definitely come again!!!
author: Sierra W.

description:
The starting bread was very tasty and fresh.

The calamari was excellent also. It was one of the few calamari dishes where I thought the batter had a ton of flavor. They also put jalapeños and onions which were a fantastic idea.

The next thing i got was a clam chowder bread bowl, which was tasty but didn't have that many clams, and wasn't as hot as I would have hoped. It was solid though, just not perfect. The cased salad on the side was fine as well.

Overall the meal was a solid 4/5, nothing crazy but pretty solid.
author: Yanir R.

description: A pier 39 experience at fisherman's wharf in San Francisco with its own covered car park , the food was acceptable on this extremely busy day for our evening meal before we departed San Fran headed back to our AIRBNB  digs in Marina CA. I had fish and chips European style and it was pretty good over all, service was acceptable again on a very busy evening for this restaurant. We had a fairly good view of the harbor, Golden Gate Bridge, numerous ships and sailboats coming and going, harbor seals, and the infamous Alcatraz Island.  White linen and well dressed, efficient, personable, and knowledgable wait staff was a great addition to this experience.  There wasn't much talking during this meal as the sound level was at a high roar, one of my big pet peeves for finer dining.
author: Alan H.

description: The food was amazing.. we ordered 2 plates of the lazy Cioppino and for both were 78 and for appetizers we got the Crispy Calamari and that was so delicious.. it was very good and the waiter was very nice and they gave us a table the minute we got there.. totally worth going
author: Zoe F.

description: Amazing sea food we loved it and everything was awesome . We had the an amazing time and satisfied with the food and the service
author: Aboud J.

description:
My best friend and I visited the other week, and we knew we had to write the world of yelp about this place; It would be a complete disservice to you guys if we didn't! 

This was my friend's first time in SF, so naturally, we had to get her some seafood. There are plenty of seafood spots in Fishermans Wharf to choose from, BUT, we'd been walking all day and this place was less than a mile from our hotel, so Fog Harbor FTW! 

A new challenge presented itself when we told the waiter--shotout to the ever-so-handsome, fun, young waiter Curtis--that I'm vegetarian: no seafood, no fish sauces, no chicken or beef or fish broths, etc., like REAL, super vegetarian! Curtis didn't bat an eye, and went to place our orders. I was skeptical that they'd have anything, and Chrissy even suggested we go somewhere else, but our tired feet told us to stick it out! Usually you tell a waiter you're vegetarian and they bring out a giant plate of under-seasoned, sauce-less, bland steamed vegetables...blahhhhhh. BUT Fog Harbor FTW AGAIN!! Chrissy's crab dish was phenomenal, and I had the best mushrooms-in-white-sauce pasta dish ever made...and when I write ever, I mean like I'll take my meat-loving husband here next time just to be in its presence again! It was perfectly seasoned and had a delicate balance of savory flavors and decadence. 

The ambiance was romantic and cozy, and people were dressed everywhere from tshirt and jeans to dresses and blazers. Great food, great ambiance, and great waiter who made our experience fun! The extra dirty martini wasn't bad either! ;)

Since we were leaving the next morning, we gave our leftovers to the homeless guy we saw while walking home. I'm positive he was as impressed as we were :) Thank you Fog Harbor and Curtis, we'll be back!
author: Kunjal W.

description:
My eyes were bigger than my stomach here. 

Had the (free) bleu cheese garlic bread with the starter Dungeness crab cakes and house salad with balsamic vinaigrette dressing. It all tasted fine, but pricy for the portions that you're served. Unable to stop myself, I also got the apple crisp for dessert and it was very good. My server was prompt, attentive, and friendly which made for a nice dining experience. Also had an excellent view of the water. 

A nice place to eat on Pier 39, but pricier. Definitely not some place I'd come to regularly, but a good place to eat if you're already down by the wharf.
author: CC C.

description:
I chose this location based on yelp reviews and I feel rather betrayed from my fellow Yelpers, I was counting on you to not lead me astray. 

The atmosphere of this location would be perfect for a tourist family who wants a mass produced menu of deep fried blah. One of the bartenders was more interested in the basketball game on TV than tending the bar; however, I can't completely blame her because I wouldn't have pride in my work tending bar here either yet we all choose where we work.

The first menu item I ordered was the Blue Cheese Garlic Bread - Fresh sourdough, topped with garlic, Pt. Reyes blue cheese and herbs which was fine but 'fine' is my 4-letter word to describe it. There just wasn't anything special about it. When I think of San Francisco food I think of innovative and fresh and the menu stated 'fresh sourdough' but if they had served me a loaf from the grocery store nearby I wouldn't have been able to tell you the difference. 

The second menu item I ordered sounded amazing so I was hoping it would redeem the fact that the bread was just so sad. Crispy Bay Scallops - Panko breaded and fried served with a roasted jalapeno aioli

What I had imagined were these beautiful scallops that you were able to taste the freshness of the sea with a slight crisp and a pop of this gorgeous aioli, what I tasted however were these knuckle-sized deep fried greasy bites served with an equally greasy jalapeno mayonnaise rather than a bright aioli. The restaurant had so much potential to have their food set them apart but I felt I was eating out of necessity, not enjoyment so I wound up taking my food in a doggy bag and giving it to a local homeless man who would hopefully enjoy it far more than I would.

Overall, I enjoyed my glass of wine, a 2013 Argentinean Malbec, as well as the view when it wasn't filled with tacky office groups asking for the fruitiest drink on the menu.
author: Jessie E.

description: It was okay.  We were sat in the middle.  I don't like the middle.  The food was pretty good.  I would go here again.  If there wasn't anywhere else to try...
author: Ann H.

description:
Very, very good pappardelle. Actually, it's probably the best I've ever had.

One of my fellow diners got the halibut with quinoa and it was also just as amazing. 

Good service as well. Highly recommended.
author: Aurora C.

description:
Sure Fog Fish is touristy, but as a visitor it didn't feel over done; in fact everything and everyone was welcoming; service was efficient and we received good advise about the specials.

My friends and I decided to attempt to try a little of everything l, ordering a seafood platter and SF famous clam chowder in the sourdough bowl; with side salsa etc. A lot of food! None the less we managed to get through it all, luckily we'd walked from one end of town to the other to get here and had the trip home to make he space that was required; food this tasty has to be eaten.

The view was quite nice but no better than the viewing platform outside however you enjoy it with great food and out of the wind which is a bonus.
author: Nathan F.

description: The touristy part of Frisco has a hidden gem! Followed a fellow yelp review and took our chances on the hour wait. The wait was totally worth it, they'll text you when the table is ready or you can make a reservation online! Went with the family and everyone enjoyed their choices. We started with the blue cheese garlic bread and clam chowder. Each meal was so good. I had the swordfish with a yummy chimichurri/pesto sauce. The boys loved their fish&chips and shrimp&chips. The winner of the night was the linguini and clams that my mother in law had. So good, we all had a bite! Walk around and come back to this spot. Clean, friendly and if you're lucky you get an amazing view of the bay. Enjoy
author: Emilia P.

description:
Excellent restaurant experience at Pier 39.

As far as food goes, it isn't 5 stars. What made it 5 stars for me was the overall experience. I ordered the clam chowder and the whole crab with garlic. Both were excellent although the crab is a tad on the pricey side but still well worth it. Unlike some reviewers, I thought the service was excellent and quick (maybe I was just lucky). The atmosphere couldn't have been any better with the ocean breeze and a good view of the pier. 

Sure, Gary Danko would've been nicer but I also saved a couple (hundred) dollars as well. Overall, it's an excellent restaurant and I would definitely repeat if in the area again.
author: Tim L.

description:
Had the mussel fries, mixed grill, clam chowder, and half garlic crab. 

All I can say is everything was SO GOOD. PERFECT!!! 

Garlic crab was cooked perfectly so that my bf didn't have a hard time going through the crab. 
Mixed grill was savory and in good portion. 
Mussel fries- I was very surprised with this one because it blew me out of my mind. It was so good!!! I loved the combination of fries and mussel! 
Clam chowder- was rich and amazing! Best clam chowder in fisherman's wharf imo. 

Would come back here again! Service was nice and attentive!
author: Michelle K.

description:
Fog Harbor was so good we went back twice in one day. Sean the bartender provided my best experience in San Fransisco with his wit and humor. He was a professional and a fine edition to the restaurant. Appetizers at the bar were excellent. Calamari, Cesaer Salad with grilled shrimp were excellent.

My only disappointment was that we had to leave the next day. I will absolutely return.
author: Ed M.

description:
We went to Fog Harbor Fish House last Saturday night for dinner.  My wife & myself both worked at multiple restaurants in the past but no longer do so.  We're aware they do have call ahead seating and other services.  

We put our name down at 8:50, and were quoted a 30 minute wait but to check back sooner.  I checked in after 20 minutes to check status, still about 6 parties in front of us.  I think checked at 30 minutes and was told just a while longer.  Finally we were seated after about 40-45 minutes.  That alone had my wife pretty irritated.  Its fine to wait, but numerous 3-4 party tables went ahead of us.

Once we were seated, we were greeted rudely by a our server.  I'm not going to name him because I don't like throwing someone under the bus if they maybe had one bad night.  My main issue is that he was a dick and had attitude to us for basically selfish reasons.  He was pissed that we had a kid 1, 2 that we weren't drinking, and 3 combine those 2 and you have your answer.  It's been a while since I've eaten at a place where the server was just flat out rude to this manner, it honestly caught me by surprise.  My kid was acting perfectly fine, no noise, tantrums, or any difficulty to deal with.  

I'm giving the 2 stars instead of 1 because a few of the food items were good.  I thought the calamari was good, so was my clam chowder.  The mac n cheese was good also.  

For $10, I ate one of the worst wedge salads in my life.  

After being treated like we were, and there being so many different choices to dine at in SF, I wont be going back here.  

If you have kids or aren't going to drink, don't dine here.
author: Ryan A.

description: I looked for a great place all over pier 39. I stumbled over this restaurant. I must say that the food here is extremely tasty and good. The clam chowder was on point and it was very filling. I also had the mixed grill which was delicious, salmon, shrimps and swordfish. I tasted many salmons before in my life and this one was really fresh. Cooked to perfection. Vegetables on the side were okay. My gf had the Penne pasta and it was delicious, not a lot of cheese which was perfect. Our server was very friendly and very helpful. The place was crowded but we managed to get a great sitting in a corner overviewing alcatraz and the rest of fishermans wharf. Eating here has been a great experience to anyone who wants to try seafood and something original from San Francisco. Prices were okay, not cheap but if you like eating quality food then price are a bargain for what you get.
author: Daniel C.

description: Great atmosphere with great food. The server was really sweet and the food came in fast. I loved the view and the ambience. Usually places with a great food have mediocre food but this place has both. Can't wait to come again and again and again.
author: Gigi M.

description: Most delicious clam chowder I've ever had! Excellent crab cakes. Wonderful service. Would go back!
author: Jennifer K.

description: What a great place to have lunch and watch the view of the Bay. This location is in Fisherman's Wharf. We were told it would be a 30 min wait but we really waited for 15 min. We had a nice booth overlooking the bay and the boat. For appetizers we had the calamari, it tasted so fresh. My wife had the salmon which she said it was fresh too. I had the chicken penne, which was ok, nothing special BUT overall, the service, atmosphere and especially the view was really nice.
author: Alex Y.

description:
Came here for a late lunch today with my mom. The weather was spectacular so we thoroughly enjoyed our window seat which faced the harbor and Fisherman's Wharf. 

We were seated promptly and offered waters right away. Our server (totally bummed that I can't remember his name) was great. He was polite, prompt, helpful and courteous. We ordered:

2 cups of chowder - chowder was just okay. Not to thick, not to thin, just lacked flavor.

We also had the special appetizer, crab & risotto balls. These were tasty, soft on the inside and crispy on the outside. Our server suggested these over the crab cake.  

Lastly we split a crab salad sandwich with sweet potato fries. This was nice but not out of this world great. 

Overall the restaurant is lovely with gorgeous views especially on a clear beautiful day. Service was top notch. The missing star is for the food. Although good, I think it could be a bit more flavorful. 

4 stars along for the fact that they validate for the garage across the street. Saved me over $20!

I love the City and this is a nice place among the touristy trap terrible restaurants on Pier 39.  It's worth a try just for the validation!
author: Christie B.

description: Great place we came for our 1 yr wedding anniversary on friday night and liked the food and service so much we came back again Saturday night. Curtis the waiter was really a nice guy. Didnt rush us , gave us info and recommended good food and great service again we will be back soon. Refreshing to see good service and food now at days with all the bad yelp reviews and service out there at alot of places this place is great.
author: Erik H.

description: Service was fast and the food was good. Atmosphere was super touristy but its pier 39, what do you expect?
author: Colin F.

description: After many great visits to this restaurant I felt a review was due . This is always my go to when we come to the city to be tourists (we live in livermore) . The view is always beautiful no matter the weather, the food superb and the service outstanding . The bloody mary's are to die for and the atmosphere allows for a casual or fancy event . Yesterday I got the fish and chips for the first time and it was cooked perfectly . Not one soggy or burnt piece on any part . The portions are exactly right . Our server was great , attentive and friendly to my kids, even my son who decided he wanted to sit under the table . Always satisfied . Whoever was bartending made my Vodka gimlet just so . Number one choice on the pier if you are looking for a quality dinning experience . Even my 8 year old daughter complimented the service lol.
author: Patrice L.

description:
This place is commercial and touristy. I was pretty disappointed in the ambience and the food was...okay.

I had the baked oysters, which were pretty good, but very heavy on the butter. I also had the clam chowder. Clams were tender, but the chowder seemed overly thick and again, heavy. For dinner I went with the crab sandwich. It was very tender and fresh tasking. The bun was perfectly toasted (New England Style) with lots of butter. I would probably get that again if I found myself "trapped" at the Pier.

The view was obstructed by fog. We couldn't even see a hint of Alcatraz. 

Service was attentive and courteous.
author: Amie L.

description: Everything was so flavor packed.  Worth the price,  but i would skip a meal before hand.  The food can feel heavy in the stomach.
author: Kevin J.

description: This is defiantly my favorite place to eat in fisherman's warf! The food was delicious and my waiter Jessica was very nice! Can not go to San Francisco without eating here!
author: Stephanie B.

description:
The wait:

We waited for around 45 minutes (even though we got there half an hour after they opened). It was rainy/chilly outside, and the line was outdoors. The great thing about their waiting area is that they have outdoor heaters (overhead) to keep people warm while they wait. Extra star for the extra bit of consideration.

The food:

They serve acme bread here, and it tastes so great with the clam chowder. I don't care if you've already had 15 clam chowder bread bowls in fisherman's wharf yesterday. You're ordering the clam chowder here. Like other reviewers mention, the chowder isn't heavy or creamy. It's more broth-like. I thought I wouldn't like it as much, but I was pleasantly proved wrong. It was really delicious. We didn't order the oysters here since we had them in 4 different places within a 2-day period, but we'll definitely try them the next time we're back here. The grilled cheese sandwich was too die for so please get that too.m
author: Anum H.

description:
After reading reviews, I secured a reservation, which was definitely a good idea for a Saturday night as there were plenty of people there and a wait. With the reservation, my friend and I were quickly seated with no problem. Our reservation was for 630 PM, so we caught the sunset! We could see only the peak of the Golden Gate Bridge in the distance, but there was a really good view of Alcatraz. 

We started with the blue cheese garlic bread and scallop appetizer. Of the two, I preferred the scallops, which was a very good portion for sharing. The jalapeño aioli dipping sauce paired well with scallops also! As a Caesar salad lover, I ordered the crab and avocado Caesar salad, which also had tortilla strips. Not the traditional Caesar salad but I loved it! My friend ordered chicken pasta and substituted the penne pasta for linguini. She wasn't thrilled, more so content. She expected the pasta sauce to be creamy and it was not. Both of us were too stuffed for dessert, but the waiter presented all the desserts on one tray, a great way to present the desserts they have to offer but I couldn't indulge. Maybe next time.
author: Camille C.

description: I will give it one star for the beautiful view. The food was very bland and expensive for being so bland. We ordered the ceviche, spicy shrimp, clam chowder, and pacific cod. All very bland. Meh. Find a different place to eat!
author: Mimi M.

description: The food was great, but a little pricey.... I ordered a seafood platter, and after a cup of chowder, I couldn't eat it all. So if your a light eater, keep that in mind :)
author: Niki W.

description: First off, where do I even begin? Fog Harbor was recommended to my mom by a friend, and boy were we happy she was! First off, the view is AMAZING. And honestly, the food is just as good. My mom and I shared the complimentary made-in- house sourdough bread, clam chowder, and clams appetizer - all were very good. For dinner, my mom had the Filet Mignon, and I had the Flat Iron Steak, they were perfectly cooked. She even deemed her dish as "the best thing I've ever eaten" -- that's saying a lot! Skip Scoma's and walk down the pier to Fog Harbor, you won't be disappointed.
author: Lauren A.

description:
Fog Harbor was an amazing find! My friends and I traveled to San Francisco on a girls trip and decided to have lunch here.
The service was absolutely amazing! Our server, Martin, was incredibly attentive and knowledgeable. My friend had presented her military ID when carded. Martin thanked her for her service when presenting us with the bill. This was unexpected and greatly appreciated.
Not only was the service great, but the food was spectacular! The Dungeness Crab Salad and Crab topped burger were delicious. And, the cucumber gimlets were the best I've ever tasted.
I will most definitely come again when in the Bay area.
author: Rosemary S.

description: The chowder lived up to it's name!  Delicious food and excellent service.  Tyler was THE BEST.  What a great waiter.  So personable and helpful for us tourists!!
author: Brenda S.

description: This was the best seafood dinner I have had in a very long time and the calamari was the best I have ever had! Tyler, our server was amazing. I would highly recommend Fog Harbor for a delicious meal!
author: Susan G.

description:
After reading reviews and looking at pictures of the dishes they serve, I was immediately hooked and reserved for two people. 

Location/Interior:
Let's begin with the location of the restaurant and how the interior looks. The location of this restaurant is very convenient because it is visible right as you enter Pier 39. As I entered the restaurant I liked how it looked, simple yet elegant at the same time. Looked clean and somewhat spacious. 

Service:
For me, not only is the food important but as well as the service. When I was greeted by the hostess, she did not smile and eye contact was barely given. I just assumed it was a busy day and let it go. Our server was nice although it seemed as if he was always rushing and I constantly had to get his attention whenever I had a question or wanted to order another dish. The only time he came to our table was when he served our food, he did not check up on us on his own unless I waived for his attention. 

Food:
Before any of our food arrived, complimentary sourdough bread was served. It was actually super fresh and delicious and I couldn't stop eating it. For appetizer we ordered the Crispy Lemon Calamari which was pretty good and the lemon aioli sauce it came with was delicious. Also we ordered a cup of their "award-winning" clam chowder which was really good and I can see why it is very popular. For the main course we decided to try the Mix Grill and Seafood Penne. Both dishes were decent, nothing too amazing. All of the dishes we ordered arrived fairly quickly, didn't have to wait too long which is good because I get "HANGRY" easily haha. 


Overall, the restaurant itself was okay. The complimentary bread and appetizers we ordered were more delicious compared to the main dishes.
author: Charlene F.

description: Tasty drinks and food. I wish I had tried the mussel fries, as they sounded really good! The clam chowder was delicious, and I enjoyed the option to add crab. The lobster tail looked huge and scrumptious. Prices are reasonable. This is a spot with a great view that would make for a great date.
author: Natasha K.

description: Really enjoyed the amazing swordfish and the crab cake was scrumptious. Loved the mango relish - an unexpected but tasty accent. Drink menu looked fun but we didn't partake. I liked that they had a good variety on the kids menu - including the typical boring burger and chicken strip options alongside fish choices - so everyone could get what they wanted. Great end to our week in S.F.
author: Andrea E.

description: Me and my wife went in for lunch after many times wanting to go but ended up going elsewhere...she had the Salmon and I had the baked oyster rockefeller...we LOVED both dishes...and she had the Hibiscus Margarita and LOVED that as well...this is now one of our favorites...we will be back
author: Jason M.

description: Food was delicious, drinks were the strong, service was top notch, view of the bay was spectacular! Very pleased with Fog Harbor
author: Amanda B.

description: Another amazing establishment with an award winning view!  I landed on the clam chowder in a sourdough bread bowl and a side salad which was at an excellent price point. It was my last night in the wharf and I had yet to get the San Fran clam chowder/bread bowl staple due to major lack of planning on my part. The meal was excellent of course but there is now so many other options I have to try on my next visit. The cocktail and wine list is impressive so put your drinking hats on. You're in the bay so wine is a staple in my opinion and you can't go wrong with their selection. The service is friendly and attentive no matter the level of business. These guys have really mastered hospitality!  A definite stop when you're at Fisherman's Wharf. Not hungry?  Grab a beverage at sunset for the amazing view.
author: Shalyn B.

description: Ok food,ok service, beautiful view.  A nice restaurant in a hectic tourist destination.  The menu is basic seafood with a few chicken options.  I ordered the Seafood Penne which was very tasty but they forgot the shrimp.  The portion was huge and enough to share.  My daughter's crab ravioli was delicious.  She works in the area so we may return just to order this dish.
author: Donna P.

description: This is the second time that I came here. First time was for lunch and we ordered the clam chowder and the baked clams. Both were excellent. We came back again today and ordered the half dungeness crab, lobster tail, seafood penne, and more clam chowder! Everything was delicious and the seafood was super fresh. Would definitely come back!
author: Anna H.

description: Had a delicious brunch here on fleet week Sunday. Arriving at 11:30, there was no line and we were seated immediately. Service is fantastic (thanks richard!) and food delicious. Exciting to have a high-quality, sustainable seafood restaurant on the water. Prices are what you would expect with a view, but well worth it for a fun outing.
author: Anne F.

description: My mom and I came in last week and shared the shellfish platter. The food was amazing! The service was even better. AJ made us feel right at home and made us laugh the whole meal. I'll definitely be back!
author: Nico M.

description:
We had the Cioppino, the Clam Chowder and the Lobster Tail. 

The food was excellent. The plates are huge and very tasty, also the complimentary bread is quite great. The Cioppino was outstanding, a lot of seafood and great tomato broth. 

The price range is quite good too, its not cheap, but is definitely not expensive. 

Would definitely recommend.
author: Rainier M.

description: This place has beautiful views and very good food. The calamari appetizer was very fresh and not oily however it did come with some fried jalapeños and fried onions which aren't in the menu - so no idea how this came up on our plate - not mentioned at the menu. My family had the steamed crabs and it was really good! I had the seared tuna dish and it was delicious - the soy glaze was on point and the tuna tasted quite fresh! The check for 5 of us with 4 beers went for roughly 300 dollars (with tip included).
author: Ricardo H.

description: Very nice. Food was great. Place was packed though. Be sure to reserve online for a spot with the view.
author: Tommy R.

description: Nothing special and overpriced in my opinion for what you get. The plus is they allow dogs in the outdoor seating area and do have a nice view of the harbor. As stated food is decent but service was good. Will more than likely find another place next time I'm in the area.
author: Wesley S.

description:
Busy restaurant, but good service. The seafood chowder in a sourdough bread bowl was excellent. Calamari and spicy pepper shrimp was tasty and very spicy. We like spices so the meal was perfect. 
If you get to Fog Harbor early enough you can get a seat by the window overlooking the Harbor.
author: Jim M.

description: Our food was absolutely delicious, especially our service!! TYLER was INCREDIBLE...he was super friendly, attentive, and gave the best service ever! Also, I would highly recommend the clam chowder with crab on top and cioppino!
author: Janet T.

description:
My first and only restaurant for seafood in SF! I don't get to eat seafood very often living in the central valley. So on a weekend trip to SF we decided to try this restaurant because of the positive reviews. Was not disappointed AT ALL.

The blue cheese garlic bread is the best garlic bread I have ever had, Tastes like a combination between artichoke dip/blue cheese on garlic bread...SO GOOD!

Secondly, I got half a Dungeness crab on ice which was amazingly fresh and delicious for a first time crab eater. Ate every little bit. I also ordered the Dungeness crab burger, which was also VERY good. A regular burger topped with lots of crab meat. 

Wife ordered the chicken penne and the seasonings were spot on and was packed full of flavor. 

Service was excellent from wait time(they text you when your table is ready) and the waitress was able to answer all my questions about the food!
author: Jaime C.

description:
We parked at the garage on pier 39. The restaurant validates your parking so it's free for one hour!!! That's a plus! The restaurant has an amazing view of Alcatraz and the pier!!! The restaurant is clean and gorgeous! 
As we walked in for lunch, there was a wait.... The staff is really helpful and kind. We waited for  about 15 minutes and got seated right next to the window so that we could enjoy the view!! I think the restaurant is priced reasonably for the prices around the pier. We paid 10 bucks for calamari appetizers which were really good and tasty! We got free sourdough bread also as we waited! My group and I shared their world famous clam chowder for 8 bucks!! I loved the clam chowder..... 

The waitress was very nice and attentive. She even took pictures of us while she helped serve our food! As our orders came out! I honestly loved their salmon entree it was superb and the fish was cooked perfectly!!! My fiancé got the lobster roll!!! It was amazing! Had a ton of lobster meat in a nice huge buttery Texas toast bread! You had plenty of food and they even add fries on the side of the sandwich! I honestly love this place and would go back. After lunch we enjoyed strolling wound the pier watching locals perform and sight seeing!!! I recommend this to bring tourists or just yourself to enjoy. The prices aren't bad for what you would usually pay at the pier and the view is superb!
author: Gloria M.

description: This was my first time eating here and it was a good life choice. The clam chowder lives up to the award winning title and the Mixed Grill plate was phresh! It never hurts to have warm bread and butter to get started. Drinks were also good, even the non-alcoholic ones. The special touch was definitely the service, Oscar, went above and beyond. Efficient, courteous and very attentive.
author: Monse R.

description: Excellent service. Great food. The red chili garlic shrimp and crab cake were awesome! Highly recommend this place. Also conveniently located on pier 39.
author: Wafi M.

description: The fresh swordfish and Pacific cod were outstanding.  The wait was only 20 minutes and service was very good. Our table was next to the window so we enjoyed watching the sunset. A very memorable evening!
author: Jody D.

description: Very pleasant evening with my family. Delicious food. Excellent service. Curtis was our server and provided ample service and was very friendly to my family. My family is from New Jersey and i currently live in New York. I have to say, living in New York has showed me what fine dining really means. This is fine dining on the west coast. Highly recommended.
author: Brad L.

description: I had the mixed seafood plate with a hibiscus margarita. The food was above average but didn't pop for me. The Hibiscus Margarita was amazing and I highly recommend it. The view of the bay and the Golden Gate Bridge was the best part of the meal at sunset. This is a solid choice for a tourist location.
author: Ashley N.

description:
(very late post) My rating is actually 3.5 stars for the food, but taking 2.5 stars off due to the experience at the front door. Don't get me wrong, food was great, came to the table piping hot. It's the host in the front that made the day off to a bad start. Attitude is what greeted us. Trying to sum this up: made reservations at 11:30 AM , while in the car, out of courtesy as a customer I called the restaurant and informed them that we are currently in the vicinity and we hit a bit of a traffic (even though we left our house at a good time to try to avoid stuff like this since we know it's a tourist spot). Well, the host said we can only hold your reservation for so long or else we will give your table away. Never did she say there's a 10 minute hold from the original reservation time.
Anyway, I'm travelling with my dad who was on a wheelchair, so the rest of the family took my dad to find an elevator while in the meantime I went upstairs to check in, as far as I know, I looked at my watch and I stepped foot in front of this hostess at 11:45 AM, you would think she wouldn't give away our table right? well, she said your 20 minutes late! there's a 10 minute policy! (mind you she never said that to me on my courtesy call to them!) I gave away your table, I can give you the high table since your table is gone.. I'm like, well you know I have a person in a wheelchair and I don't think my father can sit up there. She said, well you will have to wait another 30-40 minutes! At this time, I was livid! Obviously, she won't sit us at all so we waited and waited, my sister asked again after 30 minutes or so, "yes, the table should be ready, they are paying.." - still with attitude. 
Then I noticed she disappeared, and out comes the restaurant manager whom dealt with us and sat us and made sure we were served promptly! The manager knew that we were waiting for quite sometime, he was very apologetic. I told him your hostess needs a attitude check! He said that he will be the one to take us to the table because the hostess said that we were acting MAD, really? of course were irritated, you gave our table away!! I'm sorry, my family does not shout at anyone, she made it sound that we were causing a scene! My goodness. 
The manager turned out a awful experience at the door to a better one while dining, he comped us for the dessert and reduced our bill. 
The food was good, the view was nice.
author: Bing A.

description: Came here for dinner and enjoyed it! Great service and food was excellent. Had the Lobster tail and my husband had a cup of clam chowder and the Seafood Mix plate. Was given a complementary crème brûlée for my sisters birthday  we all shared it! Yum! great restaurant with view of the water.  Definitely would come back
author: Andrea M.

description:
After a quick four and half hour bus tour of San Francisco we had a couple of hours left before having to leave port for another destination on a cruise. After doing some research I came across Fog Harbor Fish House at Pier 39 on a travel website which had a lot of positive reviews.

Upon arrival we waited for about fifteen minutes before being seated (for a group of three) at a corner not far from the Crab House. 

We ordered two cups of clam chowder, and one in a sourdough bowl. Apparently the basket of bread was sourdough, so the sourdough bowl wasn't necessary. The chowder was great - as the restaurant claims - "the best in San Francisco. "

We also ordered  Crispy Bay Scallops, Dungeness Crab Cakes, and Fried Combo (breaded fish, calamari, shrimp, french fries and cole slaw). Based on the description lots of calories for sure.  The scallops, calamari and crab cakes were the best of the lot.

It felt like we consumed two meals at once given the portions but it was a great experience. A great way to finish a brief trip to San Francisco.
author: Milton J.

description:
You are only paying for the view that is it. Food is below average and drinks are horrible. I have no idea how you mess up a Moscow mule or lemon vodka with lemon squeezed in it.
The service is very slow and I'm feeling disappointed as i came here per other Yelp reviews.

My husband and I agree that we got jipped
author: Guadalupe K.

description: The window views are nice. My fish was a little over battered and therefor not all the batter was cooked completely through. Clam chowder good, but not the best as claimed. A little too much of a flour taste to me. At any rate, it's on Pier 39 so a nice spot if you want a classy feel. Just not sure I would chose it again. The waitress never came by our table once to check on us after getting the food.
author: Mike D.

description: Tyler's service was amazing ! He recommend a great meal for us. He reassured me in my decision with food choice. I had a great time. The food was amazing. I didn't have to ask for anything, Tyler made sure I was well taken care of. Thank you again , we had a a great time !
author: Alicia M.

description: Came here last minute on a Friday night and was waited on by Tyler. Food was great and service was excellent couldn't be happier with the service we received from Tyler great guy and great advice on drinks!!!!!
author: Ti J.

description: Beautiful view overlooking the bay and out toward the golden gate. Conveniently located on pier 39. Great food and nice dining experience.
author: Lindsay P.

description:
In early April-2015 when I was in San Francisco, my first experience of the local clam chowder was Boudin on Market Street. I was fortunate not to have started with one that set the standard too high or low because it would have complicated my experience of all others.

My second was Fog Harbor at Pier 39. This is a big and lovely beautifully maintained restaurant. I was dressed casually (and probably with "tourist" painted all over me) and underdressed for their fine dining establishment, but the hostess and server were still very friendly and helpful. Going in right at 10:30 AM when they opened, I was basically the first one in and had the run of the place.
I highly recommend going early and having a relaxing, quiet, meal, upstairs and away from the throng belong. Also, you are guaranteed a window seat if you like beautiful water/harbour views.

I was just there for the clam chowder and nothing else -- I had aimed to chowder my way down Fisherman's Wharf, or at least as much as my appetite would allow.
Fog Harbor had an "award winning" chowder, or so their menu claimed. But when I asked my server, she had no clue. She did come back after asking the manager to convey that they won #2 place as the People's Choice. After my visit to San Francisco, I did some digging online and came up with the 2014 winners of the Fisherman's Wharf clam chowder cookoff:

People's Choice
1. Blue Mermaid Chowder House
2. Fog Harbor Fish House
3. Pier Market

Judges' Choice
1. Blue Mermaid Chowder House
2. Pier Market
3. Lou's Fish Shack

It was strange that throughout my trip I hadn't seen this chowder cookoff advertised more, especially by the winners.

Clam Chowder ($8 bowl, no bread)
- Fog Harbor does make a really tasty clam chowder.
- Compared to Boudin's, this is thicker, creamier, and felt richer.
- Price is also good at Pier 39 at just $8, though you will probably end up paying $10 after tax, tip, and employer mandate.
- The under-$7 price of Boudin on Market Street still can't be beat, but at Fisherman's Wharf, the Boudin outlets charge over $8 for their clam chowder.

I should have been more diligent about finding out the winners of the clam chowder cookoff, but at the east end of Fisherman's Wharf, you can't go wrong with Fog Harbor for clam chowder.
If your opportunities to eat in San Francisco are limited, go early and just have the chowder.

Dining at Fog Harbor also gets you 30% off coffee at Biscoff Coffee Corner, right at the entrance of Pier 39 -- look at the bottom of your bill.

Although I am giving them 5-stars, keep in mind this is based only on my specific experience of clam chowder only and going early enough to be the only customer and therefore having the run of the place and its beautiful views, on top of having a server who didn't need to run around tending other tables.
author: Simon S.

description: Great food at a decent price relative to other Pier 29 restaurants. Service was phenomenal by our waiter Mel.  I give the service 5 stars, the food 3 and 1/2 stars, and the location 4 stars.
author: Eugene A.

description: Not bad! A little pricey but it's about what you'd expect for a touristy spot. The waitress was really nice. We got the Bleu Cheese Bread appetizer, and I had the Salmon BLT which was good but I wish it was more seasoned and that there was more pesto aioli on the sandwich. Amazing wheat draft beer.
author: Tiffani B.

description: Fog Harbor is a favorite of mine!  The location is fantastic on the pier at Fishermans Warf.  The views are great.  Get the clam chowder.  It's the best.
author: Stacey L.

description: This restaurant has a beautiful view, friendly staff, good food, and somewhat high prices. I had the penne pasta with red sauce and it was really good! It had some fish in it. I think this is a nice and clean place to eat and enjoy the view. The prices are a little higher than the average places but it is worthy. I Definitely recommend it!
author: Katty S.

description: I really did enjoy my experience and Fog Harbor. The prices are what you would expect for nice eating in San Francisco and the view you get with your meal is incredible. I ordered the shrimp skewers and they were delicious, they came with cooked spinach and garlic mashed potatoes. Thinking about this meal now is leaving my mouth watering! On knock on the place is that I found our waiter to be a bit rude. He wasn't incredibly helpful and seemed like he was rushing us.
author: Taylor R.

description: Really good food, that I have to admit, seafood were awesome, great dinner, great staff service, and as usual I fell in love with the fried calamari.
author: Annalisa R.

description: Took my husband here for his bday dinner and OMG the food was so on point! He ordered the red chili shrimp linguini and I ordered the grilled salmon and it the food was hot, flavorful and fresh! We ordered the creme brûlée for dessert and it was soooo good! Thank you for an amazing dinner !!!!
author: Ammara I.

description: First time here and it was a great experience. Food was good and fresh, they have boudin sourdough that you don't have to line up for. Amy was our server and she did a really good job making sure we were having a good time. Another server Martin came up and offered to give us more of the sauce that came with our appetizer. He also offered us more to drink,.They were both polite and friendly. The restaurant has a lively environment with a great view of the dock too. In my opinion, the scallops appetizer and the award winning clam chowder is a must.
author: Austin R.

description: Came here on a Monday evening to celebrate my little sister birthday. The food was great but the service could've been better! Overall, i would recommend and come back.
author: Lina S.

description: Short wait for a Friday night unplanned dinner with the family.  Great service.  Food was good too and portions are huge.  Sourdough bread was hot and steamy and we were never short.  I ordered the lobster dinner, mike had shrimp scampi with tons of clams, Tez had ribeye steak dinner, and Cel had fish and chips.  I had Lombard Lipstick cocktail and Tez the Bloody Mary.   Iced tea was tasty as well.  I was comped a tiramisu dessert in celebration of my bday and we also ordered the trio of lava cake, creme brûlée, and raspberry and cream.  Half of the restaurant sang happy birthday to me.  It was great!  Will definitely return.  For starters we had a dozen of Miyagi oysters...sweet and cucumbery and meaty not seafoody at all.  Also orders calamari which was also yummy.  Yay!!!
author: Abec H.

description:
Went this past Friday 3/4 for my birthday and had an amazing experience. Our server was very attentive and amicable. 

We had the Baked Clams as appetizer; the Clams were great, you could taste the spinach and bacon bits in the crust. 

I had the Ahi Tuna with wild rice which had some cilantro and peppers which gave it a fresh taste. The tuna was perfectly crusted with sesame seeds and it was a good medium sized portion. 

My boyfriend had the Swordfish and he said it was juicy. 

For dessert we had the creme brûlée and it was worth every bite!
author: Sofia R.

description:
I LOVE seafood!!!  Came here with no reservations around 1:00pm and waited just about 10 mins.  Not bad since the place was really crowded!  Got seated and our waiter brought out some fresh sourdough bread with butter! YUM!  Let's cut to the chase.  They are famous for their clam chowder and that was a must have!  We ordered:

Soup and Salad Combo (($14.00) Caesar salad with chicken & clam chowder in a bread bowl.  Probably the best clam chowder I've ever had!  There were lots of clams in it and the soup was not watered down.  I love eating soup that you can actually chew!  Very creamy, buttery, and full of goodness!

Fish & Chips ($16.00)- Hand dipped in "Anchor Steam" beer batter with cole slaw.  The best fish and chips I've had as well! Super crunchy and full of flavors!  Definitely fills you up!  If you get this, maybe order another dish so you won't get sick of it!  Sharing is caring ;)


Mixed Grill ($23.00): Grilled Salmon, Swordfish and Shrimp, citrus buerre blanc, sauteed vegetables, and garlic mashed potatoes.  This was just an okay dish.  I tried to be healthy and order something that was in that range but this dish was just kinda blah.  The swordfish and salmon were kind of dried but the shrimp and mashed potatoes were phenomenal! Buttery!

This is a very busy restaurant so make sure that when you get your bill, check it!  Our waiter actually gave us the wrong bill so good thing I checked it!  After the bill comes out, you get some kind of gingerbread cookie!  Very delish!

Overall, this place was good!  Great view as well!

NOTE:
-Make reservations
-Free Cookies after your meal
-Complimentary bread and butter
author: Diana T.

description: Well seasoned and perfectly cooked salmon, swordfish, and shrimp from the mixed grill entree. Splitting the dish with the addition of a cup of the clam chowder made for a very satisfying dinner. The view of the sunset over the pier with Golden Gate to the left and Alcatraz on the right was the cherry on top. Thank you also to our waitress Melissa N. for the tips on what wineries to tour in Napa Valley :)
author: Jena J.

description: Food and ambeince were very good. Even though the food is expensive, the view outside and food taste are worth the money. Must visit on any trip to fisherman's warf.
author: Sayan R.

description: Our first visit here and they actually got us in for dinner on Valentine's Day without a reservation. Amazing! Not the best table, but, with their superb location and all those windows, we still had a beautiful view of the bay at sunset. The Jumbo Shrimp Cocktail was indeed "jumbo" AND delicious. The chowder was excellent but, be warned, my vegetarian wife couldn't have any because it has bacon in it. The Ahi Tuna was perfectly/lightly cooked and a very substantial portion. Fresh and delicious. Wife got the mixed grill and couldn't stop oozing over the swordfish. It was the best either us of us has ever had. Full disclosure, we live in the desert.
author: S And J T.

description:
Kind of overpriced because of where it is located but we knew that when we booked. We went for a special family meal. The food is really good (really tasty fish and chips, and garlic shrimp) and my maple old fashioned cocktail was delicious.
The service wasn't the best, they seemed pretty rushed.
author: Gemma Z.

description:
If you want classic, fresh SF fare instead of gimmicky pier food, go here. We were 100% satisfied with each dish we had in our party. The crab roll, fish n chips, and chowder were wonderful. 

Our only complaints would be: it's extremely noisy, and you can hear everything from every other table, just not your own. Our waitress was sweet but not present. And the hostesses look and act like they hate their job. 

The view, however, is stunning.
author: K W.

description:
This review is strictly for the drinks at the bar. We came in for pre lunch drinks after walking to the Pier from Coit Tower. We had no problem finding 2 seats. They have a beautiful giant picture window with great views. I ordered the skinny gimlet and it was tasty! So I ordered another. BF had a couple beers on tap, he said they were good. We had planned to have lunch at a different restaurant so we didn't eat anything here this time. We have been in for dinner a long time ago but next time we'll come in for a meal and I'll update my review to include the food.
Service was great without being over bearing.
author: Han D.

description:
I really liked the look and feel of this restaurant: light, airy, and very SF. Granted, it's probably full of tourists as a rule given its location, it does not take away from the service and the food. 
Impressive drink options, fun bartender, attentive wait staff. I was impressed with the local options (Half Moon Bay salmon!) and the Alcatraz view.
author: Maria N.

description:
Who would've thought a super touristy place will have decent restaurant with amazing view, delicious food, somewhat-reasonable price and pretty decor!? Well, Fog Harbor just raise the dining points in Fisherman's Wharf.

The restaurant is big and with a lot of seats that has amazing view--AMAZING VIEW as in you can see Golden Gate Bridge, Alcatraz or the seals/sea lions in different combinations or even all three! It is big enough that on a Saturday we didn't have to arrive early or make reservation to get a perfect view. But the restaurant does get full. 

One thing I especially like is that the restaurant is pretty generous on table space--most tables are for 4, and they let us (a group of 2) seat at a 4 people table so that both of us can face the view. 

Enough about view, we ordered Shellfish platter for one, a cup of chowder and a Fish&Chips. Shellfish platter is delicious! I was debating between it and Cioppino, but in my experience the latter is always saltier than I like. Shellfish platter was very flavorful and yet not overly spiced, so I can still taste the clams were fresh. The crab was also very plump and full. The fish&chip was also good, the cole-slaw was very refreshing and not drench in sauces. 

The price was in deed on a higher end, but consider its location, it's seafood, and the view it has, I would say it is reasonable, especially for a special occasion. It is not a place I would recommend to locals, but good for tourists or friends visiting.
author: Ya K.

description:
Me and my girl walking around Pier 39 / Fishermans Wharf trying to find out which place has the best Clam Chowder.  I'm really glad I chose this place but NOT for the Clam Chowder. 

Appetizer - Ahi Poke was fresh and delicious.

The Ciopinno - This was the best part of my meal, a wonderful mixture of all kinds of seafood in like a tomato sauce with pasta... Definetely a must get.  I'll be back when im in SF!
author: Andrew J.

description:
Ate here during a weekend getaway to San Francisco. There are so many restaurants and eateries to choose from so as always we referred to yelp for some guidance and we were not disappointed with our choice! 

Arrived during opening on a Saturday and we were immediately seated along the window facing the bay. You're able to enjoy gorgeous views from their 2nd story location. Soon after the place filled fast! Glad we were hungry so early.

We ordered the claim chowder in a sour dough bowl. It was creamy and delicious wuth generous portions of clams. I'm usually the one to avoid such items for fear of their fishy, sea water flavor but wow was it good! Definitely fresh. Also ordered the fried combo which was too pricey for the portion but it was delicious! Came with 2 beer bathered fish, 2 fried jumbo shrimp and fried calamari. The fish and shrimp was great, the calamari was good but not as impressive.

Overall we'd recommend this place to friends. Bit on the pricey side but the location, views, quality and ambience are worth the price.
author: Radney S.

description:
Nice ambience and seating arrangement. The view was good. One best part of it is, it is right next for the entrance of Pier39.

@Samir - Very good service and hospitality.
author: R T.

description:
Sure, it's in a touristy part of town, but do I live in SF? Nope...so that would make me a tourist! No?

So we went over for dinner, after a long day of training. The view is really nice, and I recommend a table by the window so you can see the bay, and in some parts even Alcatraz (maybe not romantic, but still a cool sight). 

We started off sharing a couple of appetizers: Shrimp cocktail and crab cakes.
Both were good!

Entree I had the Mixed Grill which brings Grilled Salmon, Swordfish and Shrimp and a garlic mashed potatoes. Everything was grilled perfectly. My favorite was the swordfish but the other two (and that mash!) were great too.

For dessert we had the chocolate bread pudding. Big enough that three of us shared and it was just the right way to end the meal.

Customer service was great. Our waiter accidentally switched up the wine orders and gave them to the wrong people. He felt so embarrassed he apologized the rest of the night. It really was no biggie, but he wanted to make sure he made it right.
author: Blue A.

description: Seafood is very fresh, and amount is enough for many people. We ordered a cioppino, it's quite nice. We also ordered a crab roll, but it's not as good as what I expect.
author: Kuan-Hui L.

description: Delicious late lunch with my parents after a chilly tour at Alcatraz.
