Ordered crab for days as it's crab season and loved all of it, especially our fantastic waiter, Tyler, who made it an even more enjoyable experience. Super pleasant, genuine, friendly and responsive. He even took the time to come back and tell my mom the specials because she wasn't at the table when he first greeted us. A+!
author: Sabrina B.

description:
Good food and a gorgeous view make this a prime dining location at Pier 39.
Attentive service here is another plus!

The clam linguini was good, but definitely on the heavier side.
Their clam chowder bread bowl was also tasty, but overrated. Regardless, I have no regrets because it's always tradition to grab one while in SF. 
The crab roll was amazing. The bread was perfectly buttery and toasted, and the crab was well seasoned. I would get this upon my next visit here. 

Long story short, I expected Fog Harbor to be the typical tourist trap, but I was pleasantly surprised.
author: Tori L.

description: It was the most expensive lunch I ever paid for, but it was so worth the money. Me and my boyfriend got a 1/2 dozen oysters. I got a Cioppiano with pasta and my boyfriend got the mixed grill. I would give out 5 out of 5 stars and he said he will give out 4 1/2 stars. It was worth trying and not a long wait. My Cioppiano was sooo good !!!
author: Lucy K.

description: This place is a nice spot to take your gf for a nice dinner with a great view by the bay. The ambiance is very classy yet casual. My gf and I were very surprised as to how cheerful the hosts to our server Shawn was. They were very helpful and gave some great recommendations. The drinks and food was outstanding. I loved their bleu cheese garlic bread and their mixed seafood plate. The salmon and swordfish were very moist. Will definitely be coming back here very soon.
author: Kevin P.

description: An amazing meal with a great view. Service was impeccable and friendly. Highly recommend!!
author: Karen R.

description:
Fog Harbor Fish House is like putting San Francisco in a plate. It was my boyfriend's first time in the city and I decided to take him here based on the whole experience. 

We had delicious cocktails (whiskey and the Hibiscus Margarita) oysters, and the Mixed Grill plate. Food was good- I do wish the salmon was slightly more cooked and the swordfish lacked a bit of seasoning. 

It was crazy packed and we had to sit very close to other customers at the bar. Bartenders were totally awesome and attentive. 

When it came time for dessert, they bring an entire tray of their selection that is like candy to the sweet lover.
author: Jessy H.

description:
Casual restaurant in a great location with a great view! Reservations are highly recommended, if you don't want to wait one hour to be seated.

The food that my husband and I ordered was delicious, but the other two people in our party were not impressed by their choices. 

As far as I am concerned, the food was delicious; the service was prompt and efficient! Will likely return, but with a reservation this time!
author: Gaea T.

description: Went to fog harbor for lunch with a friend and had a blast. Our server Ash recommended the red chili garlic shrimp for an app as well as hibiscus margaritatas that were bomb! Really loved her smile and recommendations.
author: Phil G.

description: Very high quality seafood place in Pier 39, it's not suuuuuper expensive but not bad for seafood, i got the seafood penne which was very good and filling and had lotsa seafood, the clam chowder which was very solid, and tried my sisters salmon BLT that was also very good, even the bread from the famous bakery was warm and really good, our server was also super nice and friendly to us all, plus has some great views of the Bay, I think voted the best in the city maybe, one of the best spots I went to in my time in SF
author: Daniel S.

description:
Finally got to try this place after having it bookmarked for awhile. Surprisingly we got seated right away for the 4 of us adults and a baby. We were seated in the back room and had an amazing view of the marina.

Service was fast and friendly. But food fell short. We ordered fried calamari, Cesar salad added crab, mussel fries, 2 bowls of clam chowder and half a dozen oysters for appetizers. 

Warm sour dough was brought out first. It was good but nothing to brag about. Then our appetizers came. The calamari was good, it only comes with tarter sauce though. The mussel fries was really good. Fries was crispy and the sauce was good but the mussels were really tiny. The Cesar salad was also good but it was more like an endive salad with about 6 leaves of uncut romaine lettuce. Clam chowder was good, it was amongst one of the best we've bad. Here's the bad... I order half a dozen oysters expecting it to be decent size.. But it was superrrrrr tinyyyy!!! And they only gave us 5. We pointed it out the server and she gave us an extra one but it was superrrrrr tinyyyyyy! Like m&m tiny.. Not worth it for $15!!

Entrees came. It's probably safe to say my dad's entree, the cheapest was the best, linguine and clams. It came with only 5-6 shelled clams and some canned clams. But he seemed to enjoy it. 

I ordered the salmon entree. The fish was cooked perfectly but the flavor was just everywhere. Salmon was sitting on top of potato fingerlings, corn, salsa, red bell peppers (which was sour) and some greens. It was too much going on. It was hard to enjoy.

My husband ordered the ahi tuna steak.. He said the same thing I said about the tuna. Too much going on. It was hard to enjoy the fish itself even though the fish was cooked well. 

Lastly.. Took my mom here to celebrate mothers day early and she loves crab. She ordered the shellfish platter for one. It came with half a crab, mussels, shrimp and fingerling potatoes. She was super disappointed as it lacked flavor of any kind. There was empty mussels shells and super small shrimps and the crab was tasteless. It was disappointing because she was really excited about this dish seeing other patrons order it too. But almost all her mussels were empty and her crab was cold and bland. 

All in all, the view was amazing.. Service was on par but food was super disappointing.. 

I would've expected food to be great being on the pier but I doubt we would be back. 

Super disappointed. :(

P.S. They validate one hour of parking at the pier public parking lot
author: Fiona T.

description: I'm visiting San Francisco and must say, stopping here for lunch was a true delight! They live up to their claim of having the best clam chowder for sure! We had a wonderful waiter named Khaiman who was both attentive and friendly. We had the chowder delivered nearly immediately after sitting. I would definitely recommend Fog Harbor to other Bay Area visitors.
author: Jessica W.

description:
We had lunch at a wonderful window table that we had reserved. Views over the harbor and bay were terrific on a sunny day! The food was top notch as noted by so many other reviews. The cup of clam chowder for an appetizer was rich and creamy and full of clam meat. The Alaskan halibut was a fresh filet grilled and served on a bed of quinoa, toasted
pine nuts, arugula, dried cranberries, cilantro and basil, topped with tomato relish, a citrus beurre blanc and crispy leeks. Very delicious! And the salmon "club" salad was big enough for an entree and extremely tasty. The side of warm sourdough bread was wonderful, and we finished the meal with quality cappuccinos. Service at the reception and table was polite and prompt. The ambience was very nice with the exception of overly loud jazz music pumped over the speakers. We would give this restaurant a 5-star rating if the music had been toned down to background level. We shall return!
author: Michael B.

description: This place was so great! For my first time in San Francisco, was very happy we found Fog Harbor! Amazing food and the service was excellent. Curtis was very knowledgeable and we will definitely going back to visit him! He made us feel very special as guests! Would definitely recommend this place to anyone in the Fishermans Wharf area. Thank you Fog Harbor for a delicious dinner!
author: Jill S.

description: Had an excellent meal with great service last night.  The fish and crab were wonderful  Our server Tyler was very attentive and knowledgeable.
author: Marty H.

description:
This is long overdue. We almost passed this place up as we assumed it would be a horrid tourist trap, glad we didn't! It was awesome. 

Clam chowder = OMG. You must try. We also got the calamari and baked oysters. Both were good but baked oysters were the clear winner. For the finale, surprise surprise...the chicken was the bomb.com. Drinks were good too. 

I know I'm using alot of tween expressions here but that is only to convey my immense approval of said food. I highly recommend stopping by and giving this place a chance next time you are by Pier 39.
author: Rose R.

description: I enjoyed lunch so much that I went there twice. Once with a good friend and again with my wife.
author: Lenny F.

description:
Fancy and upscale decor. Amazing views of the bay. Friendly and attentive staff. The best crab dishes. I can't say enough good things about Fog Harbor.

Service: Our server, Meron, was extremely friendly and attentive. She made sure we had everything we needed and came over several times to see how we were doing. She even helped us open the towelette packet and put on our bibs. The manager, I believe, noticed we needed something and immediately helped us and thanked us for being patient. My scarf fell off my chair to the floor and a different server noticed and picked it up for me. The entire staff was top-notch. Excellent service all around. Very impressed (and I'm not usually that impressed by service).

Decor: Dark and intimate. Very fancy and upscale atmosphere, but the attire ranges from casual to fancy. Although it is fancy, nothing about this place screams snobbish (being tourist friendly helps). Even the bathrooms are clean and nice. Definitely request to get a seat by the window. The view of the bay is incredible. Where else can you go fine dining and look out the window and see the boats glistening in the water up close? I felt like I was on the Titanic.

Food: I loved how the Darigold butter was slightly warm and melted, which makes applying it on the sourdough bread much easier. The garlic roasted dungeness crab was superb and was my absolute favorite dish here. It comes with roasted fingerling potatoes, corn on the cob, and garlic oil sauce. Absolutely delicious. After having the perfect dungeness crab as the first dish, it set the bar so high that no other crab dish could really compare. The crab clam chowder was good and rich, and also another favorite. The swordfish and crab linguini alfredo were good, but personally not as impressive. The chocolate lava cake was to die for. It wasn't runny in the middle like other lava cakes, but the instant you put it in your mouth and your tongue touches it, it melts into liquid chocolate. What kind of witchery is this? Seriously. It was like MAGIC. It looked like a regular chocolate cake but it melts into chocolate in your mouth! I still can't get over how amazing and mind-blowing it was. It was very rich like a brownie and the vanilla ice cream pairing was the perfect complement to it. The whipped cream was also sweet and flavorful, and definitely not from a store-bought spray can. I was so fascinated by the lava cake that I immediately googled recipes so I can attempt to make my own cake-that-turns-into-chocolate-the-second-it-enters-your-mouth.

I am dreaming (& drooling) of the day when I can come back and have another taste of the heavenly dungeness crab and lava cake.
author: Vicki L.

description: Love love love this place.  Everyone very friendly, good service, good food, amazing views. Waitress recommended 2 different drinks so we ordered one of each and they were both amazing! Thumbs up.  So glad we went and gave it a try!
author: Carolyn H.

description: Excellent food. Our group had a salmon dish, a sea scallop and risotto plate and ceviche. Not a single regret.
author: Gary W.

description: Excellent food, a bit noisy but worth it. Especially liked how they got my mobile and let me go expire the pier. Got a text message with a 5 minute warning. They said the wait would be 1-1.5hr, but turned out to be 48min. Not too bad.
author: Song H.

description:
Great location!  Wonderful view. Started with the Poke.  Best fresh tuna I've had outside of Hawaii.  

Moved along with the Boudin bread and the Local white ale. 

For dinner I chose the Alaskan Halibut. The halibut was cooked to perfection although I'd recommend it be grilled vs seared.  The Arugula, quinoa, tomatoes, basil salad bed was super yummy and not overly doused with the vinegar based dressing.  Portion size was great! Plenty for me to eat to my satisfaction.  

No dessert as I was too full.  I would definitely go again and would recommend this restaurant as a great place to eat when you are in the area.
author: Mark P.

description: Awesome place! We ordered the clam chowder in bread bow, choppino, and the Ahi tuna poke. The food is excellent! Clam chowder is very creamy and tasty. Choppino's seafood absorbs all the tomato source combined with seafood taste making them a perfect dish. Tuna pone is very beautiful with awesome taste! Service is excellent! We sat next to the window, so also took advantage of the great view!
author: Linzi Z.

description: Spent our 7th year Valentine's Day here (2016). We ordered the crab cake for the appetizer which we shared (it was tasty but I've had better). The wait was not too bad considering it was Valentine's Day weekend (we waited for maybe 20-30 minutes during lunch time, which was not bad at all). The reason for the 4 star is because the service was ok. I forget who our waitress was but she was so slow and she lacked energy. Lol She sounded like she didn't want to be there (I mean I get it it's Valentine's Day weekend.. She probably wanted to be with her BF.. Poor girl). But anyways my son ordered the chicken tenders with fries (he loved the coloring paper that they gave him). I ordered the wedge salad which I loved oh so much!! This was probably the best wedge salad I've ever had. Anyways, my BF had the crab sandwich with a cup of clam chowder on the side (he enjoyed his meal very much). We would probably go back again and I highly recommend this place if you are ever in the area.
author: melanie l.

description:
3.5 Service was ok
Cioppino was good but broth lacked depth
Poke was good but  used avocados as filler
Ahi tuna was the star.  Husband loved it and it was his first time ordering this kind of dish. 
Customer service was ok but felt it could've been better by being more attentive and personable.  
Oh yea view was awesome!
author: Claire J.

description: Get the cioppino here. It's a seafood fish stew. Soooooooooo good. Professional service too
author: Robin L.

description: Nice place. Elegant but not stuffy. My husband and i had the oysters and the "world famous" clam chowder for starters. The clam chowder was very enjoyable. My husband said the oysters had a nice color to them and tasted fresh.  For an entree i had a plate with shrimp brochette, salmon and another kind of fish, all grilled. I remember the salmon mostly.  It was flaky and very well seasoned. For desert we had tbe chocolate bread pudding. I am not a fan of bread pudding but this was VERY good! I believe this place is known for fresh made sourdough bread. SOOOO FRESH! beautiful crunchy outside, warm soft, fluffy on the inside! The location is great and we had the perfect view of the bay water, alcatraz and the seals. I would recommend if you're in the area... but may try another place before returning here. There are tons of choices on the wharf.
author: Ruby C.

description:
If I could give this place zero stars I would. There are much better places 
 to dine in fishermans wharf . Take you business elsewhere
author: Arpi S.

description: This was our first seafood experience in San Francisco and it was simply wonderful. The staff were very friendly and the food was really great. The perfect view and the food was an amazing combo. The hibiscus margarita is definitely worth a try. Crab roll is delicious. When we visit Cali again, we would definitely return here.
author: Winnie A.

description:
The night started off great. The views at sunset are spectacular. The fresh warm sourdough bread I could eat all day and the clam chowder is some of the best this Bostonian has had. For my meal I had fish and chips the batter on the was burnt in spots and the fish was very dry. The coleslaw was loaded with horseradish subs that's a local thing, but I could have done without out it. 
 The server was kind and friendly.
author: David C.

description: My boyfriend and I had the best lunch of our CA trip here. Everything was cooked to perfection, salmon was to die for, we cleaned the whole plate. Even non-alcoholic drink (think I got blueberry drink) was so good. Service was awesome. We did have to wait about 20mins to be seated but it was well worth it.
author: Kripa H.

description: Came here for an early valentine's day dinner.  The service was fast and on point.  We tried their blackberry margaritas which was on happy hour, it was just right, not too strong or sweet.  My boyfriend ordered the New York steak and I had a whole garlic roasted crab, both was delicious!  Only problem was the steak wasn't cooked medium well through out the entire cut.  It was the last few bites that were a bit more bloody than the rest of it...it turned out just fine because I like my steaks medium so I finished it and I let him finish my last crab leg.
author: Jackie Lou B.

description: Great place to dine in for seafood. I had great experience eating here. The food was spot on, awesome view of the bay and golden gate and and great environment. I went on a Thursday night, around 8 pm and it was very busy. My wife and I started with the crispy calamari, delicious. We also had the clam chowder on a bread bowl, and i gotta say that it was some of the best cc I've ever had. For our main meal we had the shellfish platter for two and everything on it very tasty. Overall great great experience. So when visiting SF Pier 39 this place is a must.
author: Scott B.

description: Lately, i have been going to SF over the weekend to relax, get some sun, breathe in the fresh ocean air, and hang out with friends. One of my friends recommended fog harbor. The seafood here is amazing! At this point, i've come here about 5x and counting. Service is excellent as is the view. The wait for a table can take upwards to an hour, but their bar is usually available if you are okay with that  I would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone.
author: Albsdude H.

description:
This is it! This is the place with the best Clam Chowder in a Bread Bowl. The bread bowls are made fresh on a regular basis(cant get better than this) and the chowder is delicious with the clams cooked perfectly. Great ambiance and clean restaurant.

Little tip, If you love the soft bread innards from the bread bowls as I do, you need to ask for it. Otherwise it wont be included.
author: Derek M.

description:
I think ill pass.  After a girls day out in Napa's winery, my friends and i decided to make a trip to the city for the rest of the day.  Our initial choice for dinner, house of prime rib, had a two hour wait and we were all pretty famished. We decided to just play it safe at pier 39.

We were debating between dining here or crab house, and finally settled for this. I ordered the calamarie and bowl of clam chowder.  My girlfriends ordered the seafood penne, new york steak, and the seafood cioppino. We all took a sample bite of each other's orders. Their clam chowder was good, but not as "award winning" as id expected. Calamarie tasted mediocre.  I actually only ate about three pieces, they werent very appetizing for some reason. My friends steak was kind of dry, and the penne and cioppino just were too bland for my liking. 

Overall, i probably wouldnt come back. Prices were fair for being in the heart of a tourist attraction, but i feel like i would be more satisfied elsewhere for the same price. Pass.
author: Abby Q.

description: The food was amazing! I ordered the fired jalapeño calamari and clam chowder in a bread bowl. The calamari rocked my tastebuds and the chowder was the best I've had anywhere (and I lived in New England for several years). I finished off the night with a blonde bar and ice cream. The staff was accommodating to my family even with 4 small children (who were slightly out of place in the atmosphere). Highly recommended.
author: Tyler M.

description:
When I lived in the Bay Area, this was my go-to spot for clam chowder. My wife and I ate it once a month, and each time it was perfect! My last time here, I was on a trip to the Bay Area from SoCal, so it was a highly anticipated spot for us. 

Food: Before this last time dining at Fog Harbor Fish House, my wife and I probably came here 15+ times, and every time, we enjoyed their clam chowder and random other dishes. The clam chowder did not meet our expectations. I could see it after my wife took her first spoonful of clam chowder; her expression was confused. I took a bite and was very disappointed. I've had lots of clam chowder before and can say it was still better than most, but when you have high expectations, the disappointment when they're not met just makes the meal that less enjoyable. That was the beginning. I am partly to blame for this flub (since I didn't read the updated description), but we ordered the crispy calamari, because we loved it so much before. I don't know any other restaurant that puts "crispy calamari" on the menu, and then gives you a plate of fried jalapenos and onions, and some fried calamari. There were like 4-6 pieces of calamari on the entire plate for $12?... I wanted so much to enjoy my meal here. I even brought two friends on my trip to the Bay Area and raved about how great this restaurant was. Disappointment to the maximus. Overall, the clam chowder was decent but lost its WAM BAM deliciousness. The calamari just made me angry. +1/2 stars

Service: The service was good. our server was very friendly and pretty quick with our orders. +1/1 star

Restaurant/Ambiance: The restaurant feels upscale. It has a great view and is really bright from the sun rays. I really like the feel of the restaurant. +1/1 star

Would I go back? No. 0/1 star

Total: 3/5 stars. I didn't Yelp much before, so I never got to write my original review for this restaurant when I used to frequent it monthly. It would have been a 5 star a year ago. Based on my most recent experience, it definitely flopped.
author: Mike V.

description: This place was excellent! I was told to avoid Pier 39 because of the touristy vibe, however I was traveling alone and was in dire need of fresh seafood (we don't get a lot of "fresh" seafood in Indiana...). Anyway, I went and sat at the bar. Tony, Quiana, and Jason were fabulous bartenders and amazing. The food was phenomenal. Pricey but so definitely worth it! Can't wait to go back next time I'm in the city!
author: Randi P.

description: Good views to the Bay. The food wasn't as we expected for that price. The quality was good, and the food itself was tasty but as said, the price makes you expect something different, something really good.
author: Nacho C.

description: This place was AMAZING!!!!    The bartender suggested the most awesome drinks.  Our server Mel was great.   Made our vacation.  Fish and chips were the best and the creme brûlée was perfection.
author: Kate N.

description: I had a great seasonal scallop and risotto.  The clam chowder was great.  Their Bloody Mary was very aesthetically pleasing.   My service from Sarah was great.  I would eat here again
author: KaSandra R.

description:
Stopped in for a light lunch. The red chili shrimp was outstanding and my light lunch got heavy as I used the sourdough bread to soak up all the sauce. We split the crab roll sandwich and they served it already split. Our friends raved about the fish and chips. 
I think we'd like to try this for dinner next time we're in town. The restaurant has a nice layout with big windows overlooking the harbor. 
Interesting that the city charges a 4.5% embarcadero tax and a sales tax.
author: John G.

description:
So fresh, so delicious.

Came here for lunch after a day on the wharf...

We ordered the stuffed lobster with crab, crab sandwich, clam chowder and calamari. Everything was delicious and our server "Arion" was so nice. 

The food arrived to our table fast and everything was hot and fresh. The lobster was delicious, BUT I wouldn't order it again because once you really get down into it, there wasn't a lot of meat for the price, but still very tasty. The lobster was served with spinach and mashed potatoes--so good!

Calamari was fried and seasoned to perfection and the clam chowder was amazing!

Crab sandwich and fresh squeezed lemonade were both delicious.
author: Andreea M.

description:
The best!

I had my recent bday dinner here in January and I left with my group of friends happy and satisfied. 

Food was delicious
Service was friendly and done in timely manner
Everything was clean and pretty elegant
Overall one of the top on my list when visiting the pier!
author: Ligirl L.

description: Hands down one of the better places at Pier 39.  Its always packed of course.   Good food taste and size portions.  Friendly wait staff and a great view of the pier!
author: Jack T.

description:
We went here because the reviews were great. 
We sat at the bar because we did not want to wait 35 minutes for a table. My kids could sit at the bar as well, which was great. I am gluten and dairy free, which means I ask a lot of questions. The guys at the bar were awesome. They answered my questions, gave recommendations, and were so gracious. I had the Cioppino. Amazing. I went with the regular, not the lazy, which means they take all the seafood apart for you. I wanted the experience. My husband had the crab sandwich. They had a kids salmon on the menus, which is really nice, because it allowed my son to order something nice, but it did not cost $30...it was $10. This was definitely a splurge for us, but highly satisfying.
author: Mira s.

description: Food was excellent and was worth the wait. Waiter was personable, knowledgable, and funny. The swordfish here is the rib eye of fish dishes. Great place to have a drink with food as well. I have a small complaint about denying us to use multiple cards. (3 card max). Our party had to use one credit card and it was a small inconvenience. However still my go to place in San Francisco.
author: Joe A.

description: Spent my birthday with my family enjoying San Fransisco found the fog horn on Yelp. The food was fantastic and our server Curtis was great. He took care of all of us and gave great recommendations. We were very happy with the service!
author: Janelle A.

description: The food was great. The view was better and the service was top notch. Our server made recommendations on the menu but was not pushy. My glass was never empty and I felt like my server really enjoyed his job.
author: Tonya M.

description: Delicious sea food. Great anniversary dinner. The bread was delicious, had to stop eating so we would still enjoy our dinner. The drinks were good but the best was our food. Great flavors. Would definitely recommend.
author: Lilian B.

description:
I would say the service here is above par. Everyone goes out of their way to make sure you are happy and comfortable. Which I was. 
The only reason my rating is so low is the food. Of course since I didn't order the entire menu I can only speak for a few things. 
The Clam Chowder - delish, honestly the only thing I had there that I can say I have zero complaints about. It was the perfect consistency, plump and meaty clams with a smokey flavor and potatoes. It was great! 

The Mini Sliders - ordered by my best friend. She asked for veeeery well done. But they came out just over medium well. Which was her only complaint. Also her fries were brought out stale as if they were sitting for a while and reheated BUT the manager who was checking on everyone fixed that in an instant and had hot fresh fries out to our table in no time. Which were delish. 

The Salmon Club Salad - this was an interesting dish and as tasty as it was it just seemed so...misplaced.  Smoked Salmon is just so better off served with romaine lettuce and shouldn't be served with the softer greens, but that's just a personal opinion. I also much admit that while the clams from the clam chowder I had earlier had a perfect smokey end taste, the salmon left a taste that made me feel like it wasn't from the freshest of waters, and lastly my tomatoes were old and browsing which wasn't so great. All in all the salad was lacking. It was good...but lacking. I think they should definitely try a romaine lettuce with it. And use fresh tomatoes. 

For dessert we had the fudge brownie a la mode with whipped cream. The brownie I guess isn't a brownie but more like batter? Because it was super soft and almost like a soft grain pudding. 

Other than that, I'd say the views are beautiful. Like breathtakingly beautiful. And the lighting of amazing as well.
author: Veronica S.

description: Yes.  As good as it gets!  Linen-covered tables, at the windowed edge of the ocean....excellent wait staff, and delicious food.  Ordered the Shrimp Cocktail, to start, with an order of Gorgonzola Garlic Bread....SOOO good!  Then had Fish & Chips, and sister had Clam Chowder with Crab meat added.  Dessert was to die for!  All excellent!  Highly recommend!
author: Maria B.

description:
Me and my friend are here a few days ago and we were really excited as we had heard a lot about this place. When we arrived there was a wait, but we didn't end up waiting too long. 

Shortly after we were seated, our server Meron (spell check? Sorry!) came by and greeted us. She was so friendly! It felt good to have a server who seemed very genuine and also very knowledgable about the menu. She even suggested a few different wines based on what we ordered.

The food I will give a solid 4 stars, we had the clam chowder and shellfish platter. I feel like the sauce in the shellfish platter could be a little less greasy, but it was still good nonetheless. 

The extra star is for our server! I can't get over how great she was! She definitely made our experience in San Francisco one to remember. Kudos to her!
author: Cee L.

description:
Definitely worth coming to check out for San Francisco Restaurant Week. Appetizer, Entree and Dessert for $40 with three choices each to choose from.

For my three courses I had their Ahi Poke, King Salmon & their Vanilla Bean Caramel Brulee with a glass of their Pinot Noir. My friend had order their Crabs, 10 oz NY Steak, and their Warm Chocolate Cake with a glass of their Zinfindel. Every single dish was well articulated and presented. And the service was great, we were constantly checked on by 5 different employees to ensure our needs were well met. It was a great atmosphere, with a great view of the ocean.
author: Karen C.

description: Great atmosphere and friendly staff. Food and service were good. Any shortcomings are more than made up for with the location and ambience.
author: Jeff H.

description:
First off the service here was outstanding...
The views are fantastic . You can see Alcatraz and many boats from the dining room.
The sourdough bread is served warm. And the Bay shrimp is very fresh. A must try is the clam chowder. Very good..
author: Tim B.

description: Tyler was an amazing server! He was fast, diligent,and just a kind server overall. Merry Christmas Fog Harbor!
author: Kayleigh I.

description: We found a "real gem" thank to yelp! We were looking for a great seafood restaurant, while visiting San Francisco and also wanted atmosphere. Fog Harbor sure fit the bill! It's a great place right on pier 39 on the Warf- We were able to make reservations and so glad because my 90 y/o mother-in-law has trouble waiting in line. Make reservations early, because they can only take so many. They do take walk-in's but they get busy for a good reason!  The food, ambiance, service and great menu were memorable! We started with calamari- the best! My son tried to clam chowder, which was so yummy, especially when we soaked the fresh delicious sour dough bread (the make it onsite and it's the best ever) in the soup! We each had different dishes and they were all superb! My grouper was the best and my sons shared the shellfish for 2 and really enjoyed the flavors! We topped our meal with a few desserts to share, which were amazing! Even the manger, Shawn, visited our table to see if we were enjoying ourselves. We were so impressed that he took the time to say hello and checked on us. Can't wait to visit the city again and visit Fog Harbor!
author: Randi B.

description: Great service, the food was good.  We had the clam chowder (which has bacon in it!), the crab cake which tasted fried but came with a great sauce and mango salsa (the best crab cake is still from Water Grill in LA), and an amazing garlic roasted crab.
author: E C.

description:
Wife and I decided yesterday to day trip to the city. Looked up menus the night before and loved the wine list at Fog Harbor.... I mean hello- 2012 Sea Smoke Southing Pinot made it case closed. Anyway, we planned on doing a pork bun crawl in Chinatown after so we wanted a nice nomnom gig early so then we could get on our way. Showing up at 1130, we had already decided on the chowder, baked oysters and garlic dungeness so our order was already locked down but we were very tempted by several other offerings- this is a REALLY well thought out menu.

Great food is one thing but it's pretty hard to find and keep good people in the service industry... I know because that was my world too. A great experience starts with prompt, professional (and please....no canned training cheese lines) and just heads up effort. We were lucky enough to get Susan as our server/host. Clearly, a savvy veteran of the craft and exactly what we were hoping for.  I'm not saying anybody else is a letdown because clearly the service level, presentation and attention to detail is evident- but I mention Susan and the quality operation not only as a heads up for yelpers but a  bravo to Fog Harbor.  This isn't some chain trying to flip tables. We had that perfect table too- watching the sea lions, the  craft and Alcatraz... just awesome. 

The food was perfect. I chef a little myself so I'm pretty damn picky. The chowder served with fresh HOT sourdough was epic. My wife and debated on whose was better between them and Pike Place... but it's THAT good. I put the baked oysters on the sourdough too and pretty much went to the moon. The garlic dungeness was just heavenly. I'll get the whole one with dinner next time.

We'll be back very soon. If I'm there though- you can't have Susan
author: Bret S.

description:
Excellent food! Nice view of water and sun set. 
A bit of a wait, but this is July in San Fran.
author: Sherri C.

description: Great views and great service from Sameer. Awesome food and drinks. Kids meal is fun at a fair price. A great family place to eat out during anytime of the day. Location is ideal in Fisherman's wharf and the views cover a lot. 6 stars for Sameer and the team !!
author: Krish C.

description:
the place is nice, clean, comfortable, relaxing atmosphere.  The view is gorgeous. 
The staff is professional, attentive, accommodating.  We were three in total, two of us were disappointed with the food however. The seafood soup was like a paste, not much seafood served.  My friend ordered the fried shrimp and she said it was tasteless.  Our guest, did not say anything pro or con of the meal, as expected.  Overall, we had a fair experience.
author: I. W.

description: Amazing place!!!! Didn't have seafood but their chicken pene was simple yet so tasteful, and our server Susan was just wonderful!
author: Amy V.

description:
I was in the area and i am not a tourist, but got hungry and i knew that every place here is a tourist trap. but walking around this place looked really nice, so we decided to give it a shot. we were pleasantly surprised.  

Their clam chowder is amazing so make sure you try that out. everything i tired here has been good so i wont go into detail, just go here and try everything. 

The complementary bread is out of this world. 

In pier 39 area i think this is one of the best places to it. In an area that is full of bland tourist traps, this really stands out as a very flavorful dining experience. 

Make sure you park your car in the pier 39 lot and you can get like 2 or 3 hours validated.
author: Anuj C.

description: This place is EXCEPTIONAL! The food is great and the service second to none. Delicious garlic roasted crab, beautiful views of the bay. Great place to celebrate or to take the one you love. You will not be disappointed.
author: Veronica J.

description: I would give this place 5 stars just for the drinks alone. Our waiter recommended the Lipstick Lemondrop, and it was stellar. For dinner, I had the live Maine lobster, and my boyfriend had the garlic roasted Dungeness crab. They were both incredibly fresh and delicious.
author: Andie M.

description: Excellent experience. My family and I walked up and with no wait were seated at a  lovley table facing the windows. The staff was pleasant and attentive and greeted us properly. I ordered the grilled shrimp with mashed potaoes and spinach with a cup of clam chowder. My food was prepared perfectly and it was delicious. I have no complaints. As well as my family's food.
author: Jenny G.

description: Fog Harbor was pretty good, especially being in the midst of one of the most touristy areas of San Francisco. I expected there to be a lot of low quality restaurants there, but I really enjoyed Fog Harbor. I had the salmon sandwich, and it was definitely more than enough food for dinner. Prices were a bit on the steep side, but the view was pretty amazing. Service was very good as well!
author: Tarrah T.

description: Delicious meal! Great view! We had a wonderful waiter, his name was Samir. He was very attentive and accommodating to our requests. I would definitely come back.
author: Nicole C.

description: I'd give it 5 if the waiter were more friendly. But the food is a solid 5 stars, I got the shellfish platter and even though it was a bit messy (thanks to the crab!) but it was worth it. The scenic view's also a plus.
author: Amanda W.

description:
Such a great restaurant! We were referred to check out this place because of the views. We were taking a trip to SF and booked out reservation a week in advance, just in case. We loved it!!

My and I both had the clam chowder in the bread bowl. And for $6.00 more you can add fresh crab inside. DEFINITELY SPEND THE 6 bucks! So worth it! They gave us a huge mound of crab. 

We also ordered the Blue Cheese Garlic Bread. I tell you, I don't think I could replicate this at home lol. It was so good! 

My friend had the Seafood Cioppino which she let me taste. absolutely amazing. I had the Seafood Penne. Also amazing. 

For dessert we shared the Vanilla Bean Crème Brulee. I wanted to order a 2nd one, it was that good. 

Overall, very good food! Friendly wait staff, and beautiful views of the pier. I would definitely go back again!
author: Erica P.

description: Second time here, not from here so I'm not familiar with local spots but this is best quality clam chowder I've had in Fishermans wharf. Clams are plentiful and fresh, broth is not salty or thick. Bread baked fresh regularly too. Other dishes we've tried and were flavorful too: calamari, crab cakes, grilled mixed seafood plate, and seafood penne. Can't go wrong! Only 4 stars as we were set on trying the crab rolls but they ran out. Waiter didn't tell us until after we placed order and even though they were busy would've been nice to know ahead.... Bummer. Will ask ahead next time!
author: pearl s.

description: The food and service were both wonderful!  We were on vacation traveling up Hwy1.  I loved my crab cakes.
author: Leslie S.

description: The selection of beer was pretty decent for a restaurant. Starters were excellent. Got the mussel fries and the calamari. The garlic sauce that came with the fries was awesome along with the sweet sauce underneath. The entree I got was the red chili grab, which had a delicious sauce, but only an average tasting crab. The service was relatively slow, however it got very busy around the time our food was ordered, so it's understandable. Overall excellent experience, and a beautiful view!
author: Yangyang J.

description:
Good view at the waterfront, average food.
Better make a reservation before you go.
We waited for like 30 min to have our bread served.
The price is definitely not $$. More like $$$.
author: Pai-Wei L.

description: Food is delicious. Calamari and seafood broth. Great portions, was enough for two. They accommodate if you want to split/share with someone. Surprisingly the service was super fast for being on the shore. Only 10min wait and it was super packed. Servers are extraordinary efficient, friendly and fast. Best bay restaurant service and food. A bit pricey but well worth it.
author: Veronica V.

description:
A little pricey, but everything was tasty! Get any dish with crab.
We got the mussel fries and the actual fries weren't that good but the mussels and sauce were amazing! And I usually don't like mussels. The clam chowder was good, but the bread bowl was a bit small for $10.
The table next to us got a crab sandwich that looked amazing.
Absolutely beautiful view.
Great, clean place to get your wharf seafood kick.
author: Vicky S.

description: This our first time at fog harbor. Sean and kaiman provided us with the best experience! They really went above and beyond! We will definitely be coming back. Highly recommend!
author: Angela T.

description:
I visited San Francisco (for the second time ever) last weekend and we decided to eat at Pier 39, since I remembered that it had great seafood restaurants.  I realized that I'd actually eaten at Fog Harbor Fish House during my first visit to SF exactly 7 years ago!  I was not disappointed at all by my second visit. 

It was a beautiful and clear (not foggy at all!) day in San Francisco and the tourists were all abuzz in the pier area.  Though Fog Harbor Fish House is a huge tourist attraction, it's definitely not a tourist trap.  I really enjoyed the service (very nice!) and also the selection of foods.  I was stuck between choosing the seafood platter or the seared ahi tuna.  In the end, I went with the seared ahi tuna, and it came with this amazing wild rice and seasonal vegetables!  The tuna was a very decent portion and it came crusted with sesame seeds and a ginger glaze.  So delicious!  

To top it off, I got a bowl of clam chowder (their chowder is amazing here!) and a pina colada on the side. 

We had such an excellent view of the bay - the Golden Gate bridge was in view, as was Alcatraz island.  

What a lovely visit to SF!  I will certainly be back again to eat at Fog Harbor Fish House when I'm in SF in the future!
author: Pegah Y.

description:
I thought this was going to be a bit of tourist trap to be honest, but it actually turned out to be a really nice place to dine.

Dont get me wrong, its not like a small cozy romantic restaurant. Its more of a main street restaurant. However, what they do, they do very well.

Try the Cioppino. Its really good.
author: Ken L.

description: Excellent. We had toured Alcatraz and were starving but wanting a nice meal. Fog House was perfect!  Delicious meal. Fast service. Gorgeous views. Nice atmosphere. Our server Shawna was fabulous!!!!  We loved everything. Our son said it was the best burger ever. We split the wedge salad- it's huge. The clam chowder with fresh crab on top is a must. So delicious!
author: Leslie B.

description: Super fast! Incredible food. Crab Louis salad to die for. So. Much. Crab! Food came out in seconds it seemed. Everyone nice and laid back. Cioppino was tasty and filling. Window view was lovely. Looking forward to coming back.
author: Joelle C.

description: The drinks were very good, the food however was pricey and average. I was all excited to try the crab roll but for $24, it was average or below. Its a very cool location, but not my favorite.
author: Megan K.

description: My husband and I enjoyed a wonderful lunch here. Our server, Tyler, was very friendly, knowledgeable and attentive. I had the Alcatraz Escape cocktail which was appropriate since I had a lovely view of Alcatraz island. My husband and I both enjoyed the crab roll made with fresh crab, delicious!  We finished our meal with an apple crumble topped with ice cream. A wonderful place for an elegant and delicious meal.
author: MaryAnne R.

description: Went here with a co worker while on a business trip.  Great food! The clam chowder was excellent! And we shared the shellfish platter for two. It was a lot of food and tasted very fresh! Nothing bad to say about this place at all!
author: Mateo B.

description: The location and food is good.However, I cannot stand the unhygienic fork although they changed another clean one.
author: 翔

description: I went to SF with my boyfriend for winter break and I guess he checked up many places to eat and found this place for us. We spent the whole day walking around the pier and being tourists (haha). We also had a city pass which gave us cool discounts. When I flipped the book, it also showed that we would get 15% off here, and he told me he was gonna bring me here anyway! We ordered the crab cakes and clam chowder! He loves clam chowder and downed it super quick! Their crab cakes were super fresh and so good! Then we ordered the platter for two which was super worth it! It had crab and shrimp and mussels and corn! The view was amazing and the waiter even offered to charge our phones for us! I would recommend this place to everyone who is around the pier! The best way to end a beautiful night!
author: Mandy F.

description: The food here was so good! I had the linguini and clams which was great! Everyone at our table cleaned our plates. Tasted like fresh seafood. !
author: Karine N.

description: Great place on the Pier! Our server Mel was fantastic! Helped with dead phone battery and entree recommendations!
author: Joe P.

description:
More like a 4.5
Great service, nice view, and amazing food!

Stopped by for lunch while visiting the pier. Thank god they weren't super busy. We go a seat in the window area, which is really cute. Water came out quick and after placing order, so did the food. We ordered:

Clam chowder in a bread bowl: Their clam chowder is the best chowder I have ever had. So good that me and my friend even eat all the bread (I usually don't do that). All flavor a were right with the correct amount of creaminess. It's definitely a must get again on my list. 5/5

Chicken penne: Was a bit bland for my taste at first. After adding some salt and pepper, it's was great! 4/5

Fried shrimp: loved the shrimp! It was crispy and even till the end, it didn't get soggy like it would at Applebee's or something lol coleslaw and fries were okay 4/5

Would definitely come back when eating at the pier, FOR SURE!
author: A A.

description:
Came here on valentines for lunch with my love.. This is by pier 39 so theres a lot of places to walk around and take pictures while you wait to be seated. Requested for the window seat so we could have a nice lunch with a beautiful view of the pier. It was just as i imagined.. Perfect! 

The food was pricey but good. My boyfriend ordered a steak and i got the seafood pasta. My bf loved his food and mine was good but I've had better ones at a cheaper cost. Our server was ok.. She didn't really come back enough times to check up on us.. I actually feel like she doesn't deserve the tip I gave but I was feeling good that day and just wrote a pretty good amount of tip but regret it on our way out of the restaurant..

My rating is more for the place and ambiance and maybe little about the food.
author: Gj D.

description:
A couple of weeks ago my boyfriend and I came here for dinner on his last night in San Francisco. The atmosphere was great and the food was delicious. Meron was our server and she made us feel right at home. She was able to give great drink recommendations and also went the extra mile to ask for meal substitutions. She has an awesome personality and was a big part of the reason we had such an awesome last dinner.

We ordered clams, calamari, and the fish and chips entree with garlic fries. Everything was perfect. We went on a weekday so although the location is a major tourist area, it wasn't too busy since we weren't having dinner during the weekend. If this is your first time to San Francisco this is a great place to explore and eat great food!
author: Martina T.

description: Okay if nothing else get the clam chowder, lots of clams rich heart smokey base, this is the must have. I had the Chopino wish I had gone with the grill shellfish. Service was top notch, thanks Michael. Even convinced to have the strawberry short cake to top it off. Need to run it off tomorrow and maybe a walk on the pier tonight.
author: Ian G.

description:
I loved this place. All I wanted was a bowl of chowder and after seeing people's plates and catching a peek at the delectable dessert tray, I was sold. I got my chowder in a bread bowl and it was so delicious. It was a tough call though - so many great choices. We sat at the bar and the bartenders were awesome. Very attentive and friendly. There's an awesome view of the bay and a great ambiance.

The beer selection wasn't great for a beer snob. My chardonnay was a  little strange. But the food was great. I highly recommend after a long day of walking around.
author: Stephanie T.

description: I found this place on Yelp, but I had trouble finding the actual restaurant. it's on the second floor of the pier, and I didn't find that out until walking in circles maybe 5 times. once I found it, I was warmly welcomed and seated at a comfy spot in front of the window. the views from the restaurant are very pretty. I ordered calamari. it was bomb af. they also served fresh sourdough bread. I was torn between the shrimp skewers or the mixed grill, but I went with the mixed grill for the variety. so yum wow. they added mixed veggies, so I felt better about eating all the meat and fried squid. I ate almost all of it, and I was happy to have some shrimp, salmon, and swordfish all in 1 dish. :)
author: Hannah W.

description:
A bit pricy and not as good as you would think when it came to seafood. 
We tried several items and at best they were fair to poor in taste and presentation.
author: Denise L.

description: The clam chowder is amazing here! Splurge and get it with the crab upgrade.  The garlic crab app is also to die for. I had a lobster roll but my girlfriend was in love with the Chiapino.
author: Angel R.

description: Awesome food and great view! The clam chowder there in the bread bowl I highly recommend! The reason why I didn't give 5 stars was because of the service. The hostess was great, but our server was very slow in taking our order, getting our food, and getting our check. Also, not sure if it's a SF thing, but everywhere we have gone in SF they never refill our water unless we ask? So odd. I mean I'm from SoCal and they always refill our water without asking? Anyways overall the food was great!
author: Mia N.

description:
Fresh seafood, great service, nice decor, and gorgeous views of the Bay.

As noted in other review, the portion sizes are large -- which is rare in this area.

I really enjoyed the crispy lemon calamari appetizer (crispy, lightly battered, and delicious); a bowl of their clam chowder (tons of clams); and the mixed grill entree, which consisted of salmon, swordfish, and shrimp.  

They deserve five stars. I'll upload pics later....
author: Arasto F.

description: Food was excellent. Perfect for tourists wanting a higher class meal during their walk on the piers. Beautiful view no matter where you are seated and the service was excellent and very accommodating. 10/10 would recommend.
author: Isabelle R.

description:
I've been here a couple of times and both times I've been satisfied. The food is good, although I haven't had anything amazing. 

This last visit I started with clam chowder and the red chili garlic shrimp. The clam chowder is really good. The sauce for the shrimp is tasty with a nice kick. I had a half order of the roasted garlic crab. That was good too, but not as good as I expected. Also had a couple of Moscow mules from the bar that were good.

Service is pretty good however out waitress seemed a little flustered. She was pleasant but probably just overwhelmed since it was s busy night.

Overall my experience both times were good. It's in a great location (Pier 39) if you want to walk off your food after, grab dessert or just check out the view.
author: Angela D.

description: This is my favorite sea food restaurant to date. The service is amazing and the food is delicious.  I would definitely recommend having the Mixed Grill. Fair price for what you are getting.
author: Christian K.

description: Great selection of seafoood and a view!! Food presentation and service were awesome considering we were a party of 5 adults + two toddlers. Being an out of towner and relying on yelp, this spot was totally up to par with its hype reviews.... Always happy when yelp doesn't fail me. Def. a spot to come check out or even re visit.
author: C K.

description: Food and view are great but service is not good enough. However it depends on waiters.
author: Sam S.

description: This is the best place there if you want to have a good food + great view. Oysters were fresh and steaks were fantastic! Ask for a place near windows which is far away from entrance. You need to go inside, turn right among the bar and go untill the end. It's the best place there! Enjoy!
author: Dmitriy R.

description:
It's best to make reservations because at Fisherman's Wharf you can never tell how busy it gets with all the foot traffic. The prices I think are reasonable given the location of the restaurant and that most of the menu is seafood.

Our waitress was nice and always around when we needed something. The view is great and is a good spot for a date.I had to unbutton my pants just so I could down more food. If you follow that trend you might want to zip up before leaving or you might scare the kids.
author: Loc N.

description: Enjoyed our meal. Clam chowder with crab in a sourdough bread bowl was thick, creamy and hearty. Really satisfying. Ordered this with a mixed green salad that came with a red dressing onthe side. The dressing was a confusing combination of shrimp cocktail sauce and tomato ketchup. Would totally pass next time and ask for other dressing options. Calamari was great. Burger sandwich average. Great views and courteous service.
author: Neenah M.

description: Good overall. Great service good food. Had the calamari clam chowder and oysters all was really nice.
author: Yishay S.

description:
I've eaten here a few times over the years, and really love it. The food is delicious, and the views are fantastic. 

This trip, I had the cioppino, and my friend had one of the specials - halibut with peas, if I remember right. Both were absolutely delicious.
author: Susan K.

description:
Why wait ages for a table, when you can sit at the bar on a Saturday night with no wait?  Same food, and same view, although you're slightly further from the window.  Who cares!  Close enough!

Apparently this place is very touristy.  I believe you, but I also do not care, because their seafood is delicious.

Mussel fries - sounds funnier in English than in French.  And rather than come with fries alongside, these mussels have fries chucked right on top, ready for dipping in the creamy, shalloty, fennelly sauce.  And there's garlic aioli drizzled on top.  And warm baguette alongside if you need more carbs to dip.  Yaaaaas.  Delicious!  Great for sharing, and expect big fat mussels and lots o' fries.

Mixed Grill - they split this onto two plates for us, which was very nice.  Wonderfully prepared salmon, swordfish, and shrimp in a citrus butter.  Simply prepared and served with the usual host of rice and vegetables.  Absolutely fresh seafood, a little expensive for the portion size, but overall great stuff.

We were in, ate, paid, and out in fairly short time, so we could explore Pier 39 and get back to the baaaaaars, because it was Saturday night and that's what we were about.  Anyway if you don't mind being seen at a touristy spot, you will get good quality food here, great views, and a secret way to eat without a long wait first on a weekend night.  You're welcome!
author: Meredith A.

description:
Came here our half year of being together. 

The environment was very elegant and slightly romantic. The waiters were very well dressed, well mannered and respectable. 

We ordered the clam chowder in the bread bowl. It was excellent; very rich and creamy. 

We also ordered the fried calamari. It wasn't anything extraordinary but it did taste good. A lot of the calamari tangled together. 

Overall, each dish is about 16-25$ except for the clam chowder, which was 10 with the bread bowl. 

At the end you get a 30% coupon for the coffee shop nearby.
author: Liz C.

description: Just dined here for the first time.  Everything was fresh and well prepared.  I did not expect to fine this nice of a restaurant that is reasonably priced in a tourists area.  The swordfish was perfect and the tiramisu was great finish.  The ambiance was warm with large windows with views and low set lighting.  Service was excellent.  We will be back and soon.
author: Michael D.

description:
Came here off Yelp reviews. Busy place with a line out the door.
Moved relatively fast after we were ok with sitting outside on a cold Friday night.
The service was fast and friendly.
Ordered the clams with pasta. Very good quality and super generous with their portions. 
The best was the clam chowder though .Best I've ever had.
Not so heavy with cream , it was more broth like.
The menu was sorta small and simple but great none the less.
When I'm back up North this will definitely be a stop.
author: Evelyn N.

description: The food is okay. Not the best, but it is good. The service is great. Need to wait 30 minutes or so to get in each time.
author: Jade C.

description:
Let me start by saying this place sure does have an awesome view and great clam chowder.  

However the rest of the food was good but not the best I ever had. We had the seafood tower, margaritas, garlic bread, and sword fish. They were good but like I said not mind blowing. 

For sure didn't appreciate the surcharge we got hit with at the end of the meal. Would've been nice to know before going in. However, we don't mind helping out the employees, just wish we would've known before hand. 

Highlight: Didn't mind paying for the view and seeing my parents happy.  

Prob Won't be back tho.
author: Ruth R.

description:
As a First Timer I Must say that my experience was Amazing.  The staff was friendly right on point and the food was delicious. 

Let's Start with Ambiance it was very comforting not pretentious rather relaxing and the best part was we never felt rushed. 

I ordered the Mixed Grill which consisted of salmon, shrimp skewer and some other type of fish along with veggies and garlic mashed potatoes.

My husband ordered the surf and turf 
His steak was cooked exactly the way he requested. The lobster was well proportioned so no complaints from him. 

We had a few drinks from the bar which were well made and for dessert I had the Tiramisu which was out of this world. 

I highly recommend this restaurant it was worth every penny. 

Kudos to our amazing waitress didn't catch her name but she made the experience well worth it.
author: Ibedatnica I.

description: Food and service was great. Khaiman was our server and gave us great recommendations on bars in the city. Would definitely come again!
author: Kelsey C.

description: Super touristy but food not bad and view is pretty cool. My seafood trio was average and garlic mashed potatoes were bland and lumpy. Son's salmon BLT was quite good and I had plate envy. Husband's ahi tuna was not cooked well. His sides were okay. Kids enjoyed hot fudge sundae desserts. Probably decent choice if you need a meal on Pier 39 but San Fran certainly has much better options elsewhere.
author: Amy A.

description: Loved this place. Can't believe I never knew that it was upstairs. The warm sourdough table bread was addicting. We both got fish and chips and the portions left us full. The view of the whole restaurant was beautiful and the service was good.
author: N G.

description: Not thrilled with this restaurant--felt like it was one of those "feed the masses" type place.
author: Kristin M.

description: This was a very good meal. I recommend the dungenous crab! Justin H. Was very kind and funny. I also recommend bigger portions on the crab because I could have ate 3 of those if they weren't expensive.
author: Roselle I.

description: Can't say enough about this place. My husband and I come here every time we're in town. Great food and drinks! Ash took great care of us this time. We'll definitely be back next time!  I can't wait until our next trip!
author: Barb H.

description: Very nice place with very friendly staff. The view far outweighs the food. However, the food is respectable especially with it being located in a high traffic tourist area like Pier 39. I would say the quality setting / feel of the restaurant does not match the surrounding businesses.  It is definitely worth a visit. We enjoyed our salmon BLT sandwich, chicken sandwich, hamburger and clam chowder bowl. A special shout out for the broiled oysters appetizer with spinach and bacon. Yum!
author: Jeff B.

description: Came in again this time for clam chowder and calamari. I was not disappointed. Ash G. took great care of me and I got a window seat right away. Nice place to have lunch on a weekday.
author: Rich J.

description: The ambience in this restaurant is exactly what I needed while waiting to leave for my flight. Calm clean peaceful and cozy. I asked to to be seated because there was a table near the gorgeous view but the hostess sat me in the bar which I could have done myself. The staff was friendly and attentive. I even saw a waiter teach an elderly woman how to use her phone(adorable). I ordered a clam chowder bread bowl that was think, filled with clams and needless to say delicious. Their signature sourdough bread was impressive. I also order the crab mango ceviche which despite its intriguing description and how amazing it was plated to my surprise lacked flavor. I ended up spicing it up myself. Altogether It was a pleasant experience.
author: Liz B.

description:
Great food and what view.  After a great day at #nada2015 the #webdocpeter and Ron "madmax" needed a big meal.  Started with the clam chowder and finishing with the crab.  

Angie is going to be so jeolous. The desert was great
author: Peter M.

description: A few weeks ago I went to the fog Harbor Fish House to celebrate a friends birthday the food was amazing and exquisite our server server Michael Kelly gave us exceptional service. The service was very attentive to our needs the price to one of my friends since it was his birthday he even signed happy bday which made our day definitely I plan on coming back to this restaurant and asking for him
author: ricardo r.

description: What an excellent dining experience, on par with the experience from last year.   Funny, we were seated in the same table as before, like they were saviing it for just us!   Late lunch again, and just as good as the meal from last year.  We were talking with the manager about the blue cheese garlic bread deal on Yelp, as another member did a check in, and we ordered an extra - score!  He comped us with a free one.  Drink were good, all the meals were presented very nicely.  We were completely happy with the food, service - and the prices are pretty respectable!  Thank you again for a great time.
author: Liz T.

description: Food food service was only fair but the view and sunset was fantastic
author: Eric G.

description: I specifically asked our waitress if the crab was frozen, and was told no, even though online I saw it was out of season.  If it wasn't frozen, it surely w a s t dunge9crab, on my salad.  Absolutely no taste.  Very noisy restaurant.  I see no reason to return.
author: Susan D.

description:
I stopped by here earlier this year with my wife and her parents for dinner.  To be honest with you I wasn't too happy about heading here as I thought it was going to be a touristy place with a ton of tchatche due to its location on the pier.   However, by the end of the visit they had me and I truly enjoyed eating here.  We started off our meal with the blue cheese garlic bread that was compliments of Yelp for checking in.  I loved it and it set the tone for a meal which would include good fish and lots of bread.  As a matter of a fact I think that I OD'd on the sourdough bread here between the garlic bread and then the complimentary bread which I ate a ton of both before the meal and then dipped into the leftover broth from cioppino.

The bottom line for me is that I would stop by here again in the future if I was in the San Francisco area.  I really enjoyed the food, especially the bread.
author: Jason F.

description:
We checked this place out to complete our tourist jaunt to the Embarcadero. We easily got a table with a view at 12:30 on a Wednesday.

The kids menu is good - my youngest had a cheese burger and fries, and the older boy had fish and chips. Portions were good sized and very affordable.

My wife had the chowder bread bowl - always a good option.

I had the mixed grill - swordfish, salmon and shrimp with rice and steamed broccoli. A solid seafood dish.

This place won't win any hipster points or anything for hipness or originality - but it's good for a family.
author: Jimmy M.

description: Ill be honest, I'm not a big seafood person so I was not thrilled when my family decided to eat here.  However, we were seated promptly and the food came out fairly quick.  I ordered the chicken penne and got the tomato cream sauce to go along with it and it was so amazing.  The bread they serve was also amazing and served warm.  The rest of my family ordered seafood dishes and absolutely loved it.  Only down is pricing is just a tad bit high, but basically the average for being in such a nice area. Would love to return!
author: Yarah L.

description: Rafael was our waiter.  Great experience.  Made us feel very welcome. The staff wrote happy birthday on the table. When he saw that he said he would make sure we had a great experience.  His recommendations were great.  I had seafood penne and my wife had Ciopcino.  Food was great. Received a complimentary Tiramisu. Was very good. Rafael did a great job.
author: Joe L.

description:
Closing a week of work in the Conference Center, a great place for drinks, the views, the feeling of the life at the Pier with an excellent service. 
We snacked from several dishes, and tried many of the cocktails, The Martinis are very good, but the Hibiscus Margarita is fantastic. 

What I like mostly of this place is the awareness of all managers to ensure the comfort of their clientele.
author: L Team L.

description:
great atmosphere, attentive service, decent food. 
we had lobster, cioppino, fried calamari, ceasar salad.
The lobster was good and chioppino was great. 
To be honest, menus are plain and the tastes of food are nothing special.. just in between good and great.. but I love to come here because they are consistently good and whenever i come here I feel satisfied enough..
author: JS P.

description: I have nothing bad to say about this restaurant. The service, the ambiance, the drinks, and the food (I'm drooling thinking about it!) is so deserving of a good rating. Definitely try the mussel fries and Moscow mule, those two are my favorite!
author: Thanh N.

description:
Came here for a late Valentine's Day celebration expecting the food and service to reflect the pricing on the menu... Can definitely say I've had much better!!! 

My BF and I came here on a Saturday night a little after 9 once the dinner rush was starting to calm down.  Aside the fact we were famished, It took our server 5 minutes to even greet us. Not sure what was going on with the staff, but he seemed to be extremely rushed taking all the tables while the others were relaxed walking and attentively doing their job. He wasn't very friendly, and just rushed through going over the menu. 

It took forever for our food to come and the crab wasn't even fresh (the meat was sticking to the shell). The flavor of the platter was good, but the fact that it wasn't fresh ruined it. 

Will not be back.
author: Sam S.

description:
Pier 39 is usually for the tourists and a area where most locals avoid at all costs. It's not exactly a reflection of San Francisco and is filled with over priced,  bland food. It can be easy to get lost and settle for something that burns through your wallet and leaves you reaching for the tabasco. 

Well, if you do find your self stuck in this area, and hungry, Fog Harbor is a great spot to fill your craving. The food isn't cheap, but you're going to shell out the same amount of money at most spots in the area. 

PRO TIP: If you happen to park in the Pier 39 parking lot... get validated here and spend money on the chowder and calamari instead of parking!
author: Bevi K.

description:
First, this place is expensive so check the menu before you put your name in.   

Second, the food was great!  Two of us shared the Seafood Platter for 2.  It was very good.  

One other ordered the Ahi Tuna and really enjoyed it. 

We are glad we stopped in.
author: David A.

description: My goal was to have a delicious fish meal in San Francisco. Fog Harbor scored a home run! From the coffee, sour dough bread, the fish and chips, crab roll sandwich, to the perfectly executed apple crisp a la mode, wows! And the view of Alcatraz made this a lovely setting.
author: Alain G.

description: Food was extremely delicious and fresh, great service. I will definitely come back when I am in SF again. I ordered the clam chowder which was very very good, I highly recommend. For my entree, I ordered the Salmon. DELICIOUS. Would recommend and order again as well. I really have no complaints and look forward to visiting again in the future!
author: Aysia F.

description: Really disappointed with our experience. We went for dinner on a Sunday evening based on high Yelp reviews and awards. The food was bland- my fried fish still had its scales underneath the batter and was really over-cooked. The calamari was mostly fried batter rather than octopus. Absolutely not worth the price.
author: Ariel J.

description: Awesome service during fleet week especially during the 2 o'clock time.  Great window seat. Thanks for having great employees!! Michael was amazing and pleasurable! Glad He was our server. Check#51581 And server #23.
author: Rosanna B.

description: The only knock is it is in a touristy area, and its busy.  Ambiance is not touristy, nice restaurant atmosphere just at Pier 39 which is a tourist spot - helps being upstairs.  The food is great and when we ate there on 9/21/17 the waiter and staff were AWESOME.  We just wanted to eat quickly and they got the food out so fast.  Clam Chowder some of the best I have ever had, Fish and Chips were also very nice, not greasy, everything was top shelf.
author: Bill V.

description: Disappointed! Ate here last night. Server Justin said he was new to the restaurant so perhaps that explains the slow service and cold food. I ordered the lobster tails, chowder and a cocktail. Waited nearly an hour for my entree, which was cold and bland when it arrived. Had to ask for water twice before he brought it. Noticed that the girls at the table next to us were served quickly and he spent a good deal.of time chatting with them and encouraging them to rate his service. Not sure if they did, but I sure am! Justin, as a former waitress I left you a bad tip, it takes a lot to get a bad tip from me. Hope you learn quickly before you run off more customers like me, a bit older with money to spend. When I told you my food was cold you said sorry, took the plate away and that was it. When we were waiting nearly an hour for our food, you never once came to try table to reassure us that it was on the way. I won't be back.
author: Donna G.

description:
Very nice place to have a daytime lunch or even an evening dinner.  Either way, the food here was great.  I ordered the Cioppino and it was excellent!!  It had an assortment of shrimp, Bay scallops, fish, mussels, clams and topped with (lazy style) crab meat- Lazy style as in they crack the crab shell for you and sprinkle the crab meat on top.  Others prefer to break-open the goodness, but I decided against a messy meal.

My wife had the mixed grilled seafood consisting of grilled salmon, swordfish and shrimp, citrus buerre blanc, sauteed vegetables and wild rice.  My daughters went with the crab cakes and pan-seared chicken breast.  All plates completely cleaned-out.  

The most notable 2 dishes that stood-out from the rest that you ABSOLUTELY must try have to be the following:

1) Mussel Fries
2) Clam Chowder (Best I've tasted in San Francisco)

Our waiter was Scottie- He was the most knowledgeable, funny and down to earth server.  Very attentive and made great recommendations.  Well-deserved tip for this guy.

       *****Read below when reserving a seat with the hostess outside the entrance:*****

(Knocked-off 1 star for this)

If you happen to go here during lunch on a weekend, the hostess will take your cell phone number down and send you a text if the wait should be horrendously long.  You can tell if many people are lounging around the outdoor seating area.    

Keep an eye out on your phone because the text message is a confirmation whether or not you still want your reserved table.  The text is NOT, I repeat, NOT a message telling you your table is ready.  I learned this the hard way by reading my message 10 min. late and then responding 10 minutes later.  The hostess had thought we no longer needed our seats and gave them up to the next party on the list.  When it told her that I read the text message late, we had to wait an additional 20 min.  Our entire wait ended up being over 40 min.  She apologized and said there were too many people even after I told her that my wife was sitting at the couch next to her the whole time.  I was away at the sports store across the way during that entire time.  Anything you send back to them as a text they can read back as a normal message.  

You've been warned- Now go out there and eat!!
author: Bread S.

description:
With the location being in tourist-central aka Fisherman's Ward, I was thoroughly surprised that we all seemed to have enjoyed our food. 

Tip: order clam chowder with crab 
(The crab serving (extra$6) is comparable to the crab cocktail $15)
author: Michelle T.

description:
I was here for a short trip and wanted to experience an amazing meal. I wasn't disappointed!!!  I came right after Dungeness crab season started, and had that.

My server was the bartender, Jason.  He did an amazing job of offering suggestions to try (both on the menu as well as things to see while in town).

Will definitely be back!!!
author: Brian B.

description: Came for dinner with friends during a conference. Location was very nice...we were all from PA so my review may sound touristy. I liked that it was right near the water and there were a bunch of places near it to walk around and explore. Service was nice. Our waitress was very accomodating for our large party. Price was decent for the area....we looked at a bunch of other places that were nearly double the price. We caught happy hour so the wines were on special! Definitely recommend the calamari. So deliscious and tasted fresh. The blue cheese garlic bread was also tasty.
author: Nadine B.

description: Being from the east coast, my wife and I just wanted some good food, with a good atmosphere - indicative of San Francisco, and a good experience.  Well, we did accomplish all of the above.  Our table was intimately positioned in front of a nights eve overlooking the Harbor with the historical Alcatraz in the distant far.  The price was right and the service was good.  I would recommend for anyone visiting the area!
author: Walter B.

description:
It was completely spontaneous. We were walking around Pier 39 and decided it was time for dinner.
They were completely booked so we had to put our names down with my phone number.
We left to walk around and within 15 mins, I got a text saying the table was ready.
The place was pretty full and yelp had indicated they won awards.
So, that intrigued me as always.

When we got there, the host was like Tracey? Party of 5? Sure, If Kia is close to Tracey. I will take it hahaha.

The service was great! The food was great too. The portions were OK, I would love it if they served Cheesecake Factory portions for the prices LOL JK. Maybe.

Hello it's SF, everything is overpriced. I am aware of that. :)
Anyway, I feel that it's worth it.  You get what you pay for is the old saying and so true!
The view from where we were sitting  was really pretty and it's good for kids too. They had a kids menu and it wasn't just junk, so that's a plus.

Our server was funny and patient.
Especially when my fiance takes 10 years to make up his mind. JK.
He just has a few questions about the food he's going to eat =P

In conclusion, I would recommend coming here. 
We are a fan!
author: HappyMommy ..

description: Top-notch service, beautiful views of the San Francisco bay.  Outstanding menu with great wine selection; must try the salmon paired with the Malbec Callia Alta.  Great atmosphere and location perfect for that special occasion.
author: Wild J.

description: Brought my gf on our 1 year. She had the Penna i had the seafood platter. BOTH YUMMY! The waitress got us dessert chocolate cake on the house. Not too loud, great atmosphere, not too pricey when it comes to Pier 39 tourist price. Prompted staff!
author: Brent W.

description:
First time in San Francisco and decided to give this place a try after seeing the ratings on Yelp. It was raining so it was the perfect day to enjoy a nice bowl of clam chowder. The wait was about 30-45 minutes so we decided to sit at the bar.

Bread bowl with a Caesar salad= $14
Also tried the Anchor Steam on tap! 
Everything was amazing, including the service. Will definitely be coming back next time I'm in the area.
author: Barbara T.

description:
Writing my first review because of the fantastic service of the wonderfully bearded Khaiman. The food was great but his service made it a memorable meal. Since it was a cold day he started us off with a much appreciated cup of hot water followed up with a pictured menu after watching us staring at loading yelp pages.  Finally he recommended a beautiful spot that we'll be visiting later this trip. 

Would definitely return assuming Khaiman is around!
