author: Dennis G.

description:
Based on experience, a fancy-schmancy restaurant located in a touristy spot with great waterfront views is typically all hype. In my case at Fog Harbor Fish House, it actually wasn't all bad. 

Even on a warm San Francisco day, a sourdough bread bowl of hot clam chowder was one of the tastiest things I ate during my trip. For $10 you can have your fill of a comforting bowl of creamy chowder with real chunks of clams and slices of celery. Unfortunately I also gave the salmon flat bread a try, which was disappointing because of its strong fishy flavor.

Although the place was packed for lunch, the service was decent. 

The clam chowder is certainly Fog Harbor's forte. If I were to return here on another visit, I'd to mix it up by trying either their plate of fish & chips or calamari and chips.
author: Vanessa V.

description:
The location is certainly awesome. I came here by night, so all tourists were somewhere else. Being at the pier 39 with no people at all is just an experience itself!

Food is good (I had a salad, I can't say much). Service is fine. 

Just for you to be aware, if you ask for the "dessert menu" they will actually bring all desserts out for you. I don't know... having your server staring at you while you decide over dessert is kind of weird.... 

Maybe this is a 4 star for tourist places... It's just a 3 star for SF.
author: Maggie J.

description:
For a San Francisco dining landmark at PIER 39, I'd expected better, but the food wasn't great, the restaurant is beautiful, the views were spectacular from our booth, amazing views of San Francisco Bay and the Golden Gate Bridge! We passed by this place, thought the decor was nice enough to eat here... The crab house next door didn't look nice to us...

Had a spicy Bloody Mary ($10) at the bar while waiting for our able, it was sooo spicy, but a good one! Bartenders were very strict at carding me! They insisted to see my ID first before making me a drink! ( Hubby had my ID at the moment & he went to restroom) Responsible! That's a good thing. :) 

Got a nice booth facing the waterfront views, a dozen of raw oysters ($2.5 each) to start, the oysters were fresh, but the sauce wasn't so great to go with those. The complimentary bread was delicious. 

I had whole Dungeness crab ($39), 2 lb crab steamed, served with mashed potatoes and sautéed veggies: the crab was not meaty, very plain, flavorless, I had to dip all the crab meat in Tabasco to finish it. 

Hubby had Linguini & Clams ($18), fresh clams, garlic, olive oil, tomatoes: he didn't like it too much, flavorless

Had one more Bloody Mary and a Stella on draft, didn't like the food. We have had wayyyy much better seafood in LA, disappointed, the service was good, the views made up a little bit, but still not impressed. :( Let's try some other places next time.....
author: Mimi L.

description:
Check in to "Pier 39" on Yelp to receive a "fun pack" at the California Welcome Center located a few shops behind Fog Harbor Fish House. You will receive a coupon book which contains a coupon for 20% off your meal!

Boyfriend and I came on a Monday in October around 1pm. It appeared busy and there was a 10-15 minute wait to be seated, but the gentleman seating us stated that it was "slow" today! 

Luckily, we were seated in an empty connecting room facing the water! I liked this area better because your body is facing the water, as opposed to having to turn your body to face the water in the main dining 

We were served HOT, fresh sourdough before receiving our main dishes. 

I ordered the king salmon dish which was "market price" - apparently market price in October was $32! That's how much a salmon dish at a popular Disneyland restaurant is! It was REALLY good, though! I substituted the potatoes with wild rice. 

You receive a Biscoff cookie with your check, and at the bottom of the check is a coupon for the Biscoff Coffee Corner located on the first floor on Pier 39. I think it was 30% off?

Not only was the food good, but the ambiance was quiet (while we were there, at least!) and romantic. I had a hot date, eating deeeeelicious salmon and looking out at the water, tourists, sea lions, Golden Gate Bridge, and Alcatraz.. how could I go wrong?!
author: Erika R.

description: We came to the Fog harbor Fish house to celebrate a friends birthday Party. Our server Michael Kelly was so engaging and knowledgeable about the history of the city and what to order towards the end of the night he sang happy birthday song was very pleased with the level of service by him will be coming back asking for him soon
author: Ricardo R.

description:
Located on the top deck of the Pier 39.

Came in on a Saturday evening for dinner. I have patronized the restaurant two times. Each time ordering wine or bringing a bottle of wine. 

Each trip I had to wait to be seated but wait wasn't too bad. Host was correct on the time. 

Seated and menus were provided promptly. Practically no wait was resulting for placing order. Initial drink delivery was prompt. The wine or corkscrew and ice were delivered promptly. Another trip a Manhattan. Manhattan was made nice and stiff.

Food order was taken and again no really a wait from order point to arrival. We had a free garlic bread coupon to which the wait staff was happy to apply to the whole table of eight of us. 

Food order included chicken pasta, and seafood (paired with seasonal vegetables). Both time the staff was able to serve the sides separately due to a seafood allergen with my woman. 

A warm fresh side of bread is provided free. The free garlic bread was properly portioned for group enjoyment. Chicken pasta and fish were flavorful and filling. Seasonal vegetables were tender and good on their own.

Drink refills and staff were good to refill and check on the table.

Towards end of meal, check and bill were closed promptly. 

Good: Flavorful food, refreshing drinks, great service. Best cork fee on pier. 

Bad: nothing to date. 

Overall four stars. I'll be back.
author: Denny T.

description: Food and service were top notch. If you don't have a reservation expect to wait 45 minutes.  We came in knowing this as we stopped by the night before but we were too hungry to wait and came back the next day and walked around the local shops while we waited. My party ordered the raw oysters, surf and turf, crab salad, cioppino and lobster.  It was all amazing, even the steak was great - very tender and juicy. I never expect much from the steaks going to a seafood restaurant but this was good! Our waiter was on top of everything, when our drinks were low he came by to fill them up and was very patient, took time to go over the menu even though it was soooo busy. My only regret is I didn't have room to try the clam chowder which I heard is great.
author: Danielle W.

description:
While my boyfriend and I were visiting San Francisco from Chicago last November, we had dinner at Fog Harbor after our tour on Alcatraz.

I ordered the mixed grill and remember being thankful my seafood was not overcooked.  Being on the water, I expected well cooked, and hopefully seasoned, seafood and was not disappointed.  The restaurant was tasteful establishment with good service, but less modern or mixed than what I would typically frequent.

All in all good food, good service, and conveniently on the pier.
author: Kemi A.

description:
Bar staff is horrible.  Zero care given.  Very slow and inefficient.  It's like watching the scene in Zootopia with the sloths running the DMV.  They poke around without much purpose.  I went to the bar, since the bar didn't look busy.  I waited a few minutes, and no one acknowledged me at all.  No "we'll be right with you", or welcome.  After a while, I asked the hostess at the front door for a menu.  I spent a few minutes looking through the menu. Then I closed the menu and waited some more.  Still no one has acknowledged me, taken my drink order, much less my food order.  I wave my hand to flag the young bartender with short brown hair down.  He looks away.  Someone else waves at him, and he goes over to help them.  So I see waving does work for other people.  So I wave at him again after he finishes with that customer.  He says he'll be right with me.  He does something else, then another customer waves him down.  He goes and helps that customer immediately.  WTF? Then he helps yet another customer.  Then he walks off. So I went to Crab Shack in front of Pier Market and got a crab cocktail, crab roll, and crab cake all for the same price as just one crab cocktail here.  Forget this place!! 


The rest of the staff did seem friendly and competent, so +1 for the first of them.  Just the bar is lazy and poorly supervised.
author: Jay E.

description: We had the fish & chips and a salad, which was all very good. It was touristy, but the views were spectacular and the service was on point! I would definitely recommend.
author: Sierra D.

description:
Went here because of Yelp & I'm so glad we did!!
Let's start with the amazing service! Our server Khaiman was wonderful & very attentive to our party of 6! I would highly recommend anyone to request him as their server. 
He was more than accommodating and helping us split our meals since we shared a lot of our different entrees. He definitely does above and beyond and he is wonderful representative of this restaurant.
My mother who isn't a big reviewer couldn't stop raving how amazing he was and wanted to take him back home with us to Hawaii! 
He is so good that I'm writing this review as we sit here getting ready to leave.
He definitely goes above and beyond with his service and I definitely will be recommending my friends and family to come stop by here! 
Anyways moving on from our server the food here was amazing the clam chowder was definitely the best I have ever had! Even better than Boston and Maine!! The flavor and bountiful amount of fresh clams in every bite was delicious. 
My mom is a big critic but she absolutely couldn't stop raving about the soup so I definitely recommend getting the soup!
Everything else is just as amazing as well especially The Calamari was flavorful crispy and delicious. 
I'm just wowed with how amazing this restaurant was and definitely will be back!

Thank you so much Khaiman for making this dining experience wonderful and for providing five star service !!
author: Jay P.

description: This restaurant is magnificently disappointing. Food is horrible. Fish and chips tasted like it just got out of the freezer. Grilled mix that my girl ordered wasn't grilled. Fish tasted like chicken and the mash potatoes weren't mashed. They probably forgot to give us a hammer to mash it ourselves. Walmart's mash is better
author: Kim Hai T.

description:
My wife and I came here for our anniversary dinner.
I made a reservation and we were promptly seated to a nicely reserved table.  Good thing the reservation was made because it was crowded and a line was forming.  I didn't mention anything specifically about our reserved seat, but they were thoughtful enough to gave us the window seat, where we could see the bridge and the bay.  when I looked at my wife's surprised look and happy smile, I knew this place is going to get 5 stars, and everything else would be gravy

and yes, turned out there was a lot of gravy.  the whole setting was very romantic... not only dimmed light, but there's a candle on each of the table.  place is not noisy despite being full.  our server was very friendly and helpful, and NO change of attitude when we decided not to order any wine or dessert.

for appetizer we ordered half dozen fresh oysters - kind of on the small side, but tasted good, and 2 different type of sauce to dip from

for main course, we shared 

Cioppino - very big plate/bowl, seafood tasted fresh and flavorful.  wish they gave us more than one piece of garlic bread because there's a lot of nice sauce to dip from.

Ahi Tuna (RARE) - I asked to have my wasabi on the side since my wife doesn't like wasabi, and it was complied nicely.  can have more flavors, but i liked the unique taste.  outside is nicely cooked with a bit crispy, with a lot of sesame seeds, but the inside it's like sashimi.  

it was a very special night for my wife and I, and when we were leaving, more than one person (not just our server) greeted us with good bye and thank you.
author: gswfan ..

description: We came from LA for my son's college orientation at Berkeley. We stopped here for dinner and we had a great dinner. Our server Nilofar Wes really great, she had great knowledge of the menu. I always appreciate a great server since he or she makes your whole dinner experience.  We had a window seat and was watching the sunset while eating. We will be back for sure.
author: Mahbobe M.

description: Walked right in, sat at the bar alone and enjoyed the beautiful view, delicious bread and calamari, and a refreshing mule. Fresh food, quiet and restful after walking on the pier.
author: Sarah S.

description: Last night  I got one of my favorites dinner definitely  is in my top 5. if you are in San Francisco  you gotta  check it out
author: Jaclyn E.

description:
We came after a game at AT&T and so we waited about half an hour for a table.When we were seated our table only had 1 chair at it.Lol,but the person seating us apologized for it and we were quickly brought 3 more chairs.
Our server was good.
The food was really good too.The calamari was the best I ever had.The crab roll was a little too buttery though.
author: Emily T.

description: Nice ocean view makes me feel so awesome. Server is very nice. Of course, clam chowder in bread is outstanding！！
author: Rie I.

description: Tried lunch here today for the first time.  Me and a friend each had the clam chowder in a bread bowl.  It was delicious and piping hot soup.  I ate it so fast and finished the whole sourdough bread bowl too and got full right away.  We also ordered the calamari with aioli sauce.  That was also good and not too salty or greasy.  Then we shared an order of linguini with clams.  I guess I was already full at this point so I didn't enjoy it as much and so did the lava chocolate dessert.  I was already too full.  I would come back next time again for the clam chowder in a bread bowl... and all of these with a very nice view!
author: Sandra C.

description:
Came here last night for my sister's birthday dinner.  

Surprisingly, it was not busy on a this fine Saturday night at Pier 39.  

For appetizers, we started with the Crispy Lemon Calamari ($12) along with the Red Curry Steamed Mussels ($12). The Calamari was spot on, fulfilling my cravings, and the Mussels were delicious as well, it fed all 5 of us, and it had delicious sweet bell peppers in it, which was a plus.  

For the main course, my sister and I shared the pasta bowl called Linguini & Clams ($18).  We told our server that we were sharing, and to our surprise, they split it for us in separate bowls, easier for us to just dig in when it arrived at our table rather than asking for another plate and separating it ourselves, likes what I expect at other restaurants... Anyways, the plate was good, not worth $18 in my opinion.  

For Dessert, we got the chocolate cake and vanilla ice cream and the Tiramisu.  
The chocolate cake was semi-sweet, and was light, fluffy, and melted in my mouth.  It was to die for. The Tiramisu was great as well, but in my opinion, it had a little too much cocoa powder on it.  

Overall, the dinner and ambiance was great, not too loud either, the view from our window seat was beautiful as the sun set while we were eating.
author: Rochelle A.

description: Great food!!! Awesome atmosphere, great service, and impressive views. I recommend to make reservations and ask for the tables next to the Windows and watch the sunset.
author: Alicen V.

description: Seafood restaurant located on the Wharf with an upscale ambience. Great service,  we came during lunch and they were very attentive and quick. My friend ordered the chowder bread bowl which was delicious. I, however, ordered the linguini with clans and mussels which was okay. The sauce was kind of watery and fishy and not much taste other than that. I ended up eating more of my friends bread bowl, which was very satisfying. Our cocktails were also very good too!
author: Kitty A.

description:
First off let me just say the location and view are amazing, so pleased with our table and the handling of our reservation.  
The service was perfection, thank you Samir for excellent service and wine recommendation!  Ask for him when you go in for your next dinner.
I recommend the swordfish, it's delicious!
author: Kiley J.

description:
Good food, good service, good view on the Golden Gate and Alcatraz... What else ?
We had the clam chowder soup and the mixed grill, both great!
author: Jonathan P.

description: We visited Fog Harbor recently and were pleasantly surprised! The location can't be beat, and among a sea of fast food type establishments, we were happy to find a nice place where we could sit down and take a break. We arrived right at dinner time, but the wait was minimal. The restaurant was extremely busy (we visited on a Saturday) but service was great. We were served swiftly, and our server was very friendly. The fresh sourdough bread they brought out is note worthy, my husband and I both enjoyed it. I was very happy with my meal, the seafood was fresh and had great flavor. We would definitely recommend Fog Harbor!
author: Alli W.

description:
Came here for happy hour at the bar and we were not given the happy hour menu. Nor were we informed there was happy hour going on even though the hostesses claim there was one. It was not until the couple next to us asked for the HH menu did the bartender presented them with one. By that time, we were almost finished with our food.... Oh well. We should've asked ourselves. Additionally, the bartenders, while pleasant and personable, were not very attentive even though it was not very busy. Bustling doing other things than tending to their customers. Or maybe we were not given attention due to our low orders of alcohol. That could be it. 

The food, nevertheless, was very good. I ordered the Salmon "Club" Salad after seeing the diner next to me eat the same dish. The salmon was moist and not too dry. I would definitely order it again... that is, if I decide to go back. Good service leads to re-visits. Take note, managers.
author: Diana P.

description:
The view is so pretty here, especially at sunset. You have a beautiful view of the golden gate bridge and the bay, if your lucky enough to have a window seat. 
The food was pretty good, it was a little pricey for me, but it was good.
The drinks are really good though, alcoholic and there coffee/mocha variety
author: Alyssa L.

description: After a full day of sightseeing with my family, we were looking for seafood and some place nice that was also good for my three kids (ages 4-9). Frankly, I was a bit skeptical of our chances in the midst of the tourist mecca that is Fisherman's Wharf, but Fog Harbor proved me wrong. My wife went with the Crab Louie (which was amazing) and I heeded the recommendations of others and went with the Clam Chowder. Definitely a good move. Tyler did an amazing job making recommendations, sharing his local knowledge as we took in the scenery and generally providing what is one of our most memorable family dining experiences. Though we didn't order dessert, Fog Harbor was the cherry on top of a great day in San Francisco.
author: Mark H.

description:
I came here for "fresh" oysters and lobster which were highly recommended by lots of people. It tasted OK BUT this is what I got after this--viral gastroenteritis (another name for the "stomach flu". I had to run to bathroom every 5 minutes and I threw up like crazy. 

I was sent to the emergency department and was told by the doctor this disaster was caused by virus in food. And yes, the food at this place is all what I ate before all the symptoms started. The "fresh" oysters here are absolutely poisonous. I paid more than 2000 bucks in the emergency department (and extra 300 bucks for my health).  I will NEVER go to this place again, and I'm worrying that those poor tourists (maybe without insurance) CANNOT withstand going to the hospital in the middle of the night. DONOT go here. DONOT risk your life.
author: Sheri K.

description: Yummy and great service!!! My husband and I shared the seafood tower which was super fresh and so good!!! We also shared the baked oysters which were different but really good as well! Service was also fantastic!!! Definitely recommend!!
author: Marsha E.

description: Had dinner here last night for my birthday. The service was impeccable. Food was great and the ambience was stellar. We're definitely coming back.
author: Brittany O.

description: the food was fantastic and our server Tyler was great. I usually don't eat seafood but when in Rome...
author: Alexander S.

description: a MUST! This place was packed and even then we were seated right away. Food was fantastic and service VERY quick.
author: Charlie G.

description: Meh, we read all the reviews and were looking forward to trying what was advertised as the best chowder in San Fran.  We should have known better as it was located next to bubba gumps in a heavily trafficked tourist area where food quality goes down as cost goes up. The oysters were tiny and the fried calamari was disappointing and this was all followed by a bowl of clam chowder that rivaled soup plantation quality. We will definitely skip this place next time we r in town.
author: M F.

description: Had a wonderful dinner there, it has great view and great food. I had the turf and surf and it was great! I'm a little surprised by how good they are at making steak. It was tender, juicy and flavorful. Although the lobster was a little over cooked but it was huge. Will be back next time when I'm in the area.
author: Michelle Z.

description:
4 of us went there, 3 of us for clam chowder bread bowls. I got cioppino, and was not disappointed. I really enjoy the experience of eating that food since I don't get to have fresh clams and crab very often, but they do have a 'lazy' option.

All together a very pleasant eating experience with a great view of the harbor and exceptional food.
author: Tyler C.

description:
I'm really going to have a hard time with this review as I actually really did enjoy the food, but it was easily the worst service I've had in a decent amount of time. 

Not sure if they were having a hard time adjusting for the Labor Day tourists, but when you have to ask for ketchup three times from three different servers, you know things aren't going well. 

I had the crab roll which was great. Gf had the ahi tuna which was also great. Mom had the mixed grill which wasn't too bad. It's a typical seafood place located within the tourist utopia that is Fisherman's Wharf. 

We had a nice gentleman who was taking care of us while our server was on break, and he was fantastic. Once he left things really took a hit. Our server was nice, but we barely saw her. We had oyster shells on our table for nearly 30 minutes. 30 minutes. They normally take those away within minutes. 

It's a nice location, with pretty good food, but they really need to step up the service.
author: Benny H.

description:
Fog Harbor is one of the top places for seafood on my list. Everything we had was delicious. We shared the crispy scallops with jalapeno aioli sauce, crab cakes, seafood penne pasta and the clam chowder. They also have really good bread, so I would opt out of the bread bowl if you decide on clam chowder. On top of the amazing food, we were also seated by the window with a gorgeous view. 

I would love to make a trip back soon!
author: Laura T.

description:
"Mmmmm"-peccable service and delicious fish! I had the special of the day - Pacific Cod. Best tasting fillet I've had in years. I don't usually like eating seafood over red meats, but I wouldn't mind eating at Fog Harbor Fish House. 

Be sure to go to the front desk to ask for the coupon booklet and get 2 free hours of parking at the structure. We also used a coupon from that book to get a free blue cheese garlic bread at the restaurant (and it was hella good).
author: Agnes C.

description:
We Came to San Francisco for a weekend anniversary getaway and it happened to be Mothers Day. We had early dinner on Saturday, since it was so good we came back tonight. I had the surf & turf it was so good. I pretty much ate my whole dinner. My husband had a few bites. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone wanting a nice view and good food.  They're drinks are great as well. We had the Alcatraz Escape and Long Island!
It gets a bit too dark in the restaurant with just one lit candle, but I guess some people like the dim lighting.
author: Cc C.

description: The clam chowder was up to its award wining standard highly recommend it I had the bread bowl which was suggested by my server JD. I have a personal problem deciding drinks when I go to a restaurant and Jd was quick to offer the type of drinks he thought I might like. The hibiscus margarita was to perfection. I was hesitant to come into this place because it had a fancy vibe but Jd made me feel very welcomed and the mangers came to check in on me which made me feel even more at home. The host Denise was great and it was busy Friday and she was very quick to get me sat I've already recommended family to come to the restaurant.
author: Fany A.

description:
My boyfriend and I had a great experience at Fog Harbor. We made reservations in advance and emailed them asking for a table with a view. Something extra special for our anniversary. When we arrived we had a reserved table with an amazing sunset view. 

Our server was really attentive, super funny, and suggested a really delicious appetizer. 
He made the experience that much better! 

Our food was delicious! I had the cioppino and my boyfriend had the surf and turf. We both really enjoyed dinner and our apps. It was all well cooked and very flavorful! 
Also for how crowded it was all our food came out in record time! We never felt that 
"where the hell is my food" feeling, which I sort of expected due to the Saturday night crowd. 

We will definitely be back!
author: Shannon M.

description:
Great food, great service, great view, and even no wait time (we got lucky)!

Went with a party of 5, and we all had a great time! Everyone's food was brought out in a timely manner and was very delicious. We started out with the shellfish tower and calamari for our appetizers, along with the complimentary sourdough bread.  We ordered the seafood platter, crab, surf & turf, King salmon, and cioppino for our entrees. Everyone was delighted!

For being a touristic seafood restaurant let me say they completely blew us away.  You would in a way expect to pretty much pay for your view and get bad-ok food, but not here! Genuinely delicious. 
Will definitely be going back, and a must for all seafood lovers!
author: Hilda A.

description: One of my favorite restaurants at Pier39 that I used to frequently eat at. The obvious dishes to get is the clam chowder, pasta and calamari. I love the fireplace in the front waiting area, it's just romantic! Try to ask for a seat to look out the Bay, it's beautiful while enjoying a wonderful lunch or dinner.
author: Jenna C.

description: The view is always beautiful to my family, especially to my dad. It is his birthday and the server, Shawn, remembered us as well. He suggested a couple of new items - BBQ braised short rib and the "Lombard Lemonade." Shawn was able to accommodate my dad's special diet with the half chicken entree; I really appreciated him going the extra mile for my dad. The braised beef was simply delicious - the meat just falls off and pairs very well with the sauce, potatoes, and spinach. Once again, Fog Harbor never fails me and my family
author: Ginalorie D.

description: The food was tasty but over-priced, in my opinion.  However, I do get that it's a tourist trap, so hustle on.  The service was pleasant enough.  My issue is that half the items we asked for were not available!  It was not late enough into the night to have run out of any items.  You're going to get a big eye roll from me if you tell me you're out of scallops at a seafood restaurant.  Like, really?
author: Lydia G.

description: Had a great dinner at Fog Harbor. Tyler was our waiter and he was outstanding. Very knowledgable on the menu and wine selection, he kind of had what we wanted pegged from the start. My wife also decided to let him know it was my birthday, even though I told her not to. I mention this because he also had quite a singing voice. The food was great, wine was top notch, atmosphere was great and Tyler was very helpful and made sure we were taken care of.
author: Miles H.

description:
Came here for dinner on a recent trip to San Fran. What a gorgous view of the ocean! We were seated right next to the window with a great view of the water and Alcatraz.

We ordered to appetizers to start with, the scallops and the squid. Both were breaded but it was the lemon aioli that was the star! 

I ordered the cup of clam chowder and half a garlic dungenous crab (as it was in season!). The clam chowder was probably one of the best I have ever had, and I grew up along the coast so I have alot of clam chowders in my life! The crab was also very good. A bit smaller than I was picturing but with the clam chowder, I was full!

Out of all the restaurants along that pier, this one seemed the least touristy and Im glad we stopped in!
author: Elizabeth M.

description: So good ! Enjoy salmon special which was awesome. Blue cheese bread app is good didn't have a salad but everyone else's meals looked yum
author: Jacquelyn L.

description:
Fog Harbor is a touristy place, but tourists wouldn't come here if the food wasn't good.

We stopped in for a late afternoon lunch and cocktails. The cocktail menu is a bit pricey at over $10 a drink, but consistent with other bars we've visited at Fisherman's Warf. We both had Moscow Mules; they were crisp and refreshing, garnished with lime and ginger.

More importantly, you will be delighted in the freshness and high quality of their foods, especially their seafood. Both my fiancée and I had their blue cheese wedge salad after seeing one delivered to another person at the bar. The salad looked mouth watering when we saw it, then we proved it was delicious when we ordered our own. It is loaded with creamy blue cheese, crumbles of blue cheese and bacon.

I had the Seared Alaskan Halibut and it was perfect: flaky, over a bed of quinoa, leafy greens, dried berries and a delicious sauce to bring all the flavors together. My fiancée did an appetizer combo for dinner including a crab cocktail and clam chowder, she said both items were fresh and delicious.

For those with gluten sensitivity, their menu is clearly marked with all the items that are "prepared without gluten." They have a significant selection of gluten free dishes and one gluten free desert. Our server, albeit quirky, was very conscientious about my needs and took ownership of communicating my needs to the kitchen.

We'd also like to thank them for listing the dungeoness crab cocktail on their receipts as "dung crab cocktail." My fiancée and I can verify that the crab cocktail didn't taste like dung, it tasted like crab. However, we we appreciated the laugh.

Overall, a great meal and a wonderful view of the bay. It may be a touristy due to its location on Pier 39. Nevertheless, you'll get a great meal in a nice atmosphere!
author: Aaron T.

description:
It was just about dinner time and we had just arrived in SF a couple hours ago (5 hour drive from Santa Clarita-SoCal) and we just wanted to eat something, anything seafood!! 

Walking around Fisherman's Wharf and Pier 39, we decided to try this spot on the second floor of this Pier. We waited a little less than 20 minutes to be seated-no reservation needed. And when we were seated, the waiter was very polite and informative on what was on the menu in addition to whatever questions we had. 

As a group of 4, we decided to get the Shellfish Platter, which included 4 half-crab legs, a number of clams, mussels, and shrimp! (I forgot the number but it was very specific) The serving size was definitely more than we expected but it was delicious! Seafood is fresh and you can definitely tell. 

Had a good wine collection. Ordered the Strawberry Mojito (Strawberry Nojito) and Lipstick Lemondrop. I recommend the mojito!
author: Mallory V.

description: Delicious food and impressive service.  Tyler did a great job helping us with our food selection and telling us tips and tricks for the best sight seeing. Highly recommend the clam chowder with crab. We also enjoyed the atmosphere and scenic view.
author: Alisha T.

description: Tyler was an amazing waiter! Everything he recommend was awesome. This restaurant is really good!
author: Tiffany M.

description:
Everything was great except for not knowing who our server was. It took so long for a server to finally walk up to our table and acknowledge we were there. We seriously were thinking of getting up and walking out if it took any longer. Something in our hearts made us stay, well maybe because the sound of crab on top of clam chowder was just something we did not want to pass up. So we're glad we stayed and after we made some crazy eye contact with who we assumed was our server, it got better from there.

Definitely order clam chowder, whatever the option it may be, bowl, cup, in a bread bowl, you will not go wrong. 

I had the crab roll, it was a good amount of crab in a butter toasted super soft bun. My wife ordered the soup and salad and it was perfect.
author: Aris G.

description: Had dinner here last night.  It was amazing. I had the lobster tail which had to be 8-10 ounces of prime lobster meat accompanied with mashed potatoes and steamed veggies.  The food and the service were both excellent. My son had the surf and turf which he loved. The location of the restaurant at Pier 39 was also a treat with amazing views of Alcatraz.
author: Terry H.

description:
Went here on a whim that we were so freezing, and it looked good. Thank god we did, the fish was amazing! (And we're from Florida so we're a little hard to impress with seafood).
Samir was our waiter and made sure we were taken care of and had a great view of the bay!
author: Robin R.

description: This is a money pit and a tourist trap. PLEASE stay away, if you know what's good for you! The food was worth about 1/10 of the price and the service was just as bad. We had a reservation here for our "nice" family dinner while on vacation in SF. We had high expectations because of the good ratings (which I'm really confused about now) and because we ate at Alioto's as few years back in the same area (and it was fantastic). This place, however, was a sad, mediocre excuse for a seafood restaurant. Our waitress, though polite, was literally looking at other customers and around the restaurant while taking our order. It soured our experience from the start. The menu is limited and there is nothing special on it. I had the fried shrimp because I really didn't want anything else on the menu, and it was as good as fried shrimp at Sizzler. My daughter had the Linguine with clams and I was actually angry when I saw the microscopic size of the clams. The linguine seemed like it was just boiled and put on the plate. White wine sauce? Hahahaha - you must be joking! What a sham! My husband had the Ahi Tuna and it was less than stellar also. We left feeling fleeced. The carpet was filthy also. Please don't waste your money - you've been warned!
author: AP C.

description: Really one of the best views in pier 39. I'm a huge chowder and bread bowl fan but this place ok.  Place would be great for a one on one.
author: Marlon G.

description: The fish and chips are awesome and Samir was an excellent server! Definitely a fun experience and would recommend to family/friends!
author: Brandon B.

description: The short wait (5:45 on a Tuesday) was well worth it for the fantastic food and above average service. The manager stopped by at least twice to make sure we were enjoying our meal. Highly recommended for great food in a highly touristed part of town
author: Josh P.

description: Currently eating here and I gotta say, amazing! So good that I was excited to write the review right away so I wouldnt forget. The swordfish was out of this world, pan seared in a delicious pesto sauce. We also ordered the ahi tuna and their oysters, but the swordfish! So many things to like about this restaurant 1) obviously the food 2) ambiance and view 3) food came out right away 4) staff was very friendly and accomodating. I highly recommend it, yes it is pricey but for the quality
author: Natalia P.

description: They have a great location, nice view, and food was great! Seafood was nice and fresh. Price is reasonable given the quality and amount. I would recommend this place to anyone in the area.
author: Milan L.

description:
For starters the food here is great!! Thanks to Oscar, our wonderful waiter for the great suggestions made. He really made this restaurant shine by his work. He went above and beyond and he works happily. The food came really quickly and he didn't fail to check on us. 

Great food and great customer service!!!! THANK YOU OSCAR FOR MAKING OUR NIGHT !!! 

Ps. The calamari here and the mussel fries are to die for !!!
author: Reca A.

description:
This place is a bit touristy. The bread was good but our service was horrible. The friend that I went there with and I are still trying to figure stuff out with her bank because she double charged her and then charged me for my half as well. She also NEVER refilled my drinks and I always had to ask for more water from someone that seemed like the manager.

I got the fish and chips and she got the half garlic crab. It was good, but there was hardly any meat in the crab for the price.
I guess it is expected for a touristy place.

Probably wouldn't go here again. THere are amazing places to eat in the city and I would just avoid this place for another down the street or a uber ride away!
author: Bori B.

description: Highly recommended.  Service most enjoyable and food delicious. Awesome way to leave the Bay Area. I'll be bauckkkk!!!
author: Cheryl H.

description:
Located in the famous (or imfamous, depending on who you ask) pier 39, the restaurant was higher end then I expected. I expected something more shack like and when I first saw the restaurant I was afraid it was gonna be a tourist trap, but the food was amazing! 

I ordered the jumbo shrimp cocktail and the sourdough bowl chowder. The shrimp (which I think was expensive for 6 large shrimps) tasted very fresh, the cocktail sauce had an unexpected kick as well. While I would order it again, I think $16 for 6 pieces of shrimp is very pricy. 

The clam chowder was excellent as well. The soup came in a hot toasted bread bowl and was piping hot as well. Very well seasoned with lots of pieces of clams. The clams were no overcooked (which can be a problem when mass producing clan chowder) and it was very filling. It was also a good price as well,  I would have no problems ordering the bowl of soup again since it was about 2 cups of soup for $10. 

The service was meh, they were obviously busy but I didn't think they were packed and yet our waitress who was very nice and polite never really came by. We had to our our drinks from someone we flagged down and we did so for the rest of the meal. 

Both the high price point on the shrimp and the service contributed to the 4 stars instead of 5 stars but I would highly recommend this restaurant to those visiting the pier.
author: Janice C.

description: Had an amazing time celebrating our anniversary here. The Lobster was awesome, and the swordfish was delightful. Our server Mel was kind, gracious and so helpful as we are in from out of town. Great place, great service, incredible views.
author: Adam W.

description: This restaurant absolutely NEVER disappoints!!!!! It's in one of the most touristy places in SF, yet it's top shelf!! We went here tonight after a hellious week on public transportation. My boyfriend picked me up from work and we headed to the Fog Harbor. Pier 39 was teeming with tourists but we only had a 10 minute wait. Our waitress was perfect, the meals (we both had ahi tuna) were tremendous and fresh, and we got our favorite window seat looking out over to Alcatraz. Just the perfect evening!!!!! Love love love this place and please: eat the sourdough bread. It's to die for!!  Kudos to a fantastic restaurant! We will be back!!!!!
author: Sandra P.

description: Great food with a friendly staff and professional setup! Price is about 4 dollar signs which was the only problem. Overall, great place to eat a seafood meal!
author: Brandon R.

description: Great food and great service! Loved the Pacific Sole and the best clam chowder ever :) thank you Tyler for the great service!  You are part of the reason we love coming back.
author: S H.

description: Started out with a yummy mocha! Then on to the delicious Crab Louie & a happy hour Pinot Grigio that was just so crisp & refreshing, all while sitting outside by the fireplace with our dogs. What a lovely day! Customer service is exceptional!
author: Lisa F.

description: Other than the 45min wait Saturday night, I loved our experience and the food. Service was top notch and the food wonderfully prepared. I'm not a fan of sourdough bread, but I had the best sourdough bread here. I ordered the chicken penne, but had them substitute the chicken for salmon. The dish was amazing!!!  The salmon was perfectly grilled; the vegetables and pasta cooked al dente. I had the Marathon to run the next morning, this meal was a great balance of fresh and clean protein and carbs. My husband had the fish and chips which he said was perfectly cooked. Their chocolate molten cake was delish!  The price points were just right for the amount of food received. Fog Harbor is repeat visit worthy.
author: Miya F.

description: Amazing food with a fantastic view of the bay. We loved it so much we came back twice during our trip. Delicious array of seafood and a few items for non-seafood lovers. Our wait was about 20 minutes on a busy weekend but we were able to sit by the outdoor fireplace and then at the bar. We had a great table right by the window where we were able to see the boats coming in and out and the seals playing in the water. Waitstaff was attentive and very friendly. You won't be disappointed.
author: Amber R.

description: Excellent experience! Order oyster n crab roll. The oyster is so fresh, and awesome with Chardonnay! Crab roll is good too. Service is perfect! Since I was freezing on sightseeing bus, asking to serve hot water to me. They did and also gave me more water  after they noticing I'm done! What a wonderful night with beautiful view!
author: Billie H.

description: So dang delicious. Bread comes out warm and fresh. Ordered the mixed grill, fish and chips, and ahi tuna, and a wedge salad. All dishes were tasty, see photos.
author: Randi B.

description:
Though this place is in one of the most touristy spots in San Francisco, it is absolutely a fab place to eat and drink!  We went for a celebratory dinner for my brothers graduation and birthday and even though we were a group of 8, they were able to seat us in 10 minutes which was great. 

The ambience and view is great with a view of the water and bustling room.  We had a few great glasses of sauv blanc and merlot which were delicious.  We started with ahi tuna poke. The tuna was super fresh and was good but I wish there was more sesame oil on it.  We also had the sourdough bread bowl, which was amazing.  For my veggie friends, though it wasn't on the menu they specially made a pasta with veggies.  And the bread, oh MY the bread. Delicious. My sister and I shared the cioppino, sooo amazing.  

Service was good - so overall great evening but the only negative was the tuna poke which just wasn't flavoured as well as I would have hoped
author: Namita A.

description:
Great restaurant with delicious food! We went last night, and my 8 year old daughter was thrilled we finally found salmon on the kids menu! 
I had the mixed grill with 3 shrimp, swordfish and salmon...it was amazing! 
My hubby had the chicken breast and it was delicious too! I wish we had time for dessert, next time for sure!
author: Diana D.

description: The food is very clean and fresh, some of the best seafood you can get. I've tried out many clam dishes from different restaurants but this is the ONLY  place where I haven't chewed on at least one grain of sand...very impressed. Samir was our friendly waiter and made sure our dining experience was fully satisfying! Took my girlfriend out for her birthday and she loved it; will come back! Thanks again!
author: Brayden C.

description: Reviews on Yelp was a four-star but the food is just okay. There were 5 of us. one had the crab cake appetizer, not seasoned well, bland; the other had clam linguine, no seasoning at all, we brought ot home to season it ourselves; the other asked for the salmon dish well done, was medium and had bones. The waiter Curtis was nice. the only dish that stood out was the new risotto with scallops. My dish alone plus the advertiser was $60 and only worth about half that. I eat at high quality restaurants often however this place was not that much better than a Red Lobster and I expected more from San Francisco Seafood
author: Amiyna F.

description: So we stopped by the Fog Harbor fish house as one of our stops as part of my wife's Birthday celebration and to check out the much touted clam chowder which, by the way, was also deserving of the 5 star rating!! It was amazing!! Nelson, our server at the bar, was exceptional.  He was gracious, attentive, accommodating, and informative about the restraunt. He really made out night special and brought a beautiful candlelight desert for my wife's Birthday. We will be back for sure!! This restaurant has beautiful views of the bay and alcatraz too.
author: Mark E.

description:
Tyler was very informative, friendly and professional. Super helpful. I'm visiting from out of town and this restaurant and the waitstaff were great. 

Had the seafood tower between two people. That and dessert were very filling. Tyler taught us how to eat the lobster head as we were unsure. Yes on white meat, no on gills. Unless you are brave.
author: Thomas T.

description: We were a little underwhelmed after trying this place out. The menu looks amazing but after our experience we realized that it was only subpar. I had the salmon and to be honest with you have had better. There were way too many red bell peppers and tomatoes on the dish. The sauce was oily and I'm glad the arugula soaked most of it up. It just was a weird combination. For thirty dollars I expected to be wowed. My fiancé had the dungeons crab he said it was ok. We usually have dinner at the Pier 39 market and tried this place out instead. We will it be retuning. Only positive the server was awesome and the clam chowder.
author: Michelle D.

description:
Look no further the best Clam Chowder in San Francisco is here! 

Me: Clam Chowder in Sourdough Bread add Crab= delicious happiness

Husband: Shellfish Platter for 1= best Shellfish he's ever tasted 

Appetizer: Crispy Bay Scallops are a must try
author: Cindy I.

description: Great food! I loved the view! Perfect lunch on the pier! We had baked oysters that were amazing... Shared a shell fish platter for 2 that was very good... And washed it down with yummy drinks. I had a cocktail that was so yummy. I would def go again!
author: Kady H.

description:
My boyfriend took me out for date night in the city Saturday night and we decided to try out Fog Harbor; there was a 45 minute wait which wasn't bad at all considering the pier was super packed as usual. The wait time flew by since we were able to walk around and look at all the things the pier has to offer.
We got our table and were given a good amount of time to review the menu. By the time we decided on what we wanted, our waiter took our order. We decided on the red chili shrimp for the appetizer; it was packed full of delicious flavor and had the perfect amount of spiciness to it. We both really enjoyed it, would definitely order again. We were also given a basket of bread and butter; the bread was nice and warm, really good.
My boyfriend ordered the fried combo which came with calamari, prawns and fish with sides of fries and coleslaw. Everything on his plate was really good, I couldn't help but pick off his plate :) I ordered the garlic crab and it was awesome. Had the perfect amount of meat and was shockingly filling considering it was only a half order. 
Service was awesome and the food was just as great. I will definitely come back again; next time, I'll just be sure to make a reservation so that we can get a table with a view :) We had a really nice, romantic time with a candle lit dinner...perfect night overall.
author: Monique L.

description: Absolutely my favorite restaurant at pier39. Any item i've ordered wether it be crabcakes,steak or lobstser..heck, even the bread they bring out nice &warm & fluffy w/butter. Highly recommend this spot, its worth your buck.
author: Debbie L.

description: Went on a "date night" @Fisherman's Wharf since we haven't been here in years despite being "locals".  Wanted to go to a sit-down dinner.  Yelp was right, the food and place was very good!  We were fortunate to be seated near the window, so enjoyed the view.  For being at a prime location, prices were reasonable. Mel, our waiter, was very attentive, kept checking on us even though he was super-busy because the restaurant was full.  This is SERVICE!  Recommend the avocado ceviche.  Linguini with clam was lukewarm though.  Still, definitely would go back.
author: Elizabeth Y.

description: While in the city for my wife's bday we decided to have a nice dinner here while out at the pier. Stopped by and had a short 10 min wait to be seated. Once we where sat I noticed how warm it was in the restaurant even with the windows open and the ocean breeze. We had the crab cakes to start. Wifey had a clam chowder bread bowl and I had the cioppino. Plenty of food where we could've shared but it was so good I devoured the whole thing! Can't beat the view here.
author: Joey Y.

description:
This is my favorite place to eat when I visit San Francisco. The location is absolutely perfect. You can't beat having grate food while watching the sun set along the pier. The restaurant is the right balance of romantic with a homey vibe. Our server Angela was wonderful. She provide us with great selections from the menu as well as recommendations for other great restaurants in the area. If you can pick a section she is the best! 

I ordered the mixed girl blackened which comes with salmon,shrimp and swordfish and it was so good. You can't beat the freshness of the fish from the bay.  We also got the Clam chowder which is my favorite. Make sure you get it with additional crab. You get so much that with the bread we had to get a bag for our leftovers. We will definitely be back.
author: Rhonda P.

description: Loved the seafood penne and cod special, our waiter Tyler was great!
author: Jenny P.

description:
Romantic ambiance? Check! Welcoming and attentive staff? Check! Delicious Italian food? Check check check!! Loved this place for its wide open windows and perfect views of my city's beautiful bay. Anywhere you are seated, you'll have a great view of the ocean. I came here on a whim and was pleasantly surprised by their range of food and the speed at which they tended to their customers. I had the clams and linguine (with parmesan cheese and sun-dried tomatoes)--definitely the best I've ever had!! I also got the bleu cheese garlic bread, which was only meh (too salty and definitely too dry! I was hoping for softer bread with meltier cheese). The clam chowder was wonderfully light and creamy! With lots and lots of clams--they didn't skimp in the linguine and clams either (I counted at least 10!). Lastly, I also got to try the fish and chips, which were quite delicious but not your traditional British style beer-battered cod. It wasn't breaded, but it was a little over-fried, considering that the fish was a bit dry. 

Will I be back? Yes, definitely!
author: Purnima G.

description: Ok I don't want to sound childish but yes I did go to a famous seafood place and order chicken. However the chicken was good, the free bread & butter was great and our server Anya was the best. She really knew the menu and what to eat but more importantly she always made sure we were taken care of since it was our first time here. Thank you Anya.
author: Noel E.

description: My boyfriend and I had a wonderful evening at the Fog Harbor. Tyler was very helpful and made great recommendation. Love our lobster tail and our clam chowder. Truly amazing!
author: Eileen Z.

description: This place is very overrated. We had the surf & turf as well as a steak with side of grilled shrimp. Food is okay but nothing spectacular, I believe the best thing was the side dishes. We found plastic in our appetizer and of course it was comped as well as a complimentary dessert. The only reason I am rating this a 2 is because the staff was great. If it weren't for the staff I'd give .5 or 1 star.
author: Angelica G.

description:
I went there with 3 friends, during a visit of San Fransisco. This place is amazing. 
We enjoyed a great view on pier 41. 
The meals were all good and the waiter was really nice with us. We all delighted it ! 
I highly recommend !
author: Mickael G.

description:
I'd give this 4 stars for the ambiance and view. Without a reservation, we were easily seated on a Tuesday night by the window seat. 

I ordered the Cioppino and my friend ordered the same, but was able to replace some items on her dish that she did not like for more shrimp, which she did like a lot. The dish was an overall 3.5 stars. It was not an awful dish, but nothing spectacular at the same time. Everything seemed to just be thrown in with the sauce and cooked. It definitely wasn't an awful dish, but the flavors for everything seemed only to be differentiated by the texture after awhile. I expected more from a seafood/fish house. 

Overall, I had a lovely time laughing with my girls as our waiter was awesome. 

We topped the night off with their espresso tiramisu, which we all shared and wished we ordered more of. You can taste how rich the espresso was.
author: sandy a.

description:
We had a very good experience here.  Every dish and drink that came to the table was enjoyed. We had a table by the window.  This restaurant, to me, is a great place for a special occasion celebration.  Large open space, white table cloths. GOOD FOOD!

If I'm remembering correctly, the CLAM CHOWDER was spot on. The SEAFOOD FRIED COMBO was nicely done.

We had an assortment of dishes on our table, including the Lobster Mac n Cheese, the Ahi Poke and none of them disappointed us.

The Garlic Crab was good, but The Crab House next door has them beat when it comes to this dish.  I love it when Yelpers drop hints like this in their reviews, so here is a good tip for you.  Go to The Crab House literally next door and get the Garlic Crab.  Best I've had.

I like this place a lot.  It's between a 4 and a 5 for me. This is exactly what you would expect from a classy version of a fish house.
author: Darien R.

description: Amazing place with great service. Our server Tyler was amazing and the Alaskan halibut was the best ever!
author: Vinny L.

description: As a New Yorker coming to San Francisco for the first time you really don't know what to expect. After doing a boat tour at 9 a.m. then coming back to rent bikes and tracking over the Golden Gate to Sausalito, then coming back to the wharf to do a tour of Alcatraz we were pretty hungry. In the mood for seafood we did one little search on Google found a restaurant with a promising menu.  After a short 20-minute wait and two awesome cocktails we were seated up against the window with stunning views of the pier, Alcatraz, and some rather lively sea lions. Our waiter Curtis was more than helpful and gave us a rather refreshing feel of the locals considering most people we were interacting with the past two days have been surprisingly off-putting and slightly rude. And being from New York that speaks volumes lol. I knew what i wanted. The fried shrimp. It was perfect. Some of the best coleslaw i have ever had on the side. For my girlfriend, Curtis suggested a linguine in red sauce with a mix of crab, mussels, and clams. Given it was all over her bib by the time she was done... I'd say it was a winner. I would 100% head to this restaurant again.
author: Henry W.

description: Really solid spot. Kind of expected it to be a little hokey since it's literally in the heart of the Pier but a quality restaurant with great seafood.  Had the Ciopinno and it didn't disappoint.  Lots of good fish, scallops and big crab legs. The tomato broth was fantastic.  Awesome view of the bay, the GG bridge and everything else.  The service was spot on considering it was a Friday night and the place was jammed. Server gladly split a couple of our dishes without complaint.  Would definitely recommend if you're in the area and want a solid place with tasty seafood.
author: Matt B.

description: Food and service were both good. We had the Chowder and Crab roll before our Alcratraz tour and everything was fresh and delicious.
author: Mike L.

description: Pricey but the food and quality you get is worth it. I had the linguine with clam and it was perfect. You have to be careful ordering seafood dishes when you're out because sometimes they can turn out too fishy but the linguine was al dente and clams were way better than anticipated. Service was great too, our server Tyler was on it and made sure we never had an empty glass of water. Would go again!
author: Dee M.

description: Clam chowder bowl was fabulous! I only had shrimp cocktail after the soup but they were huge and cocktail sauce was very good. Not sure anything else was worth the price to me, but I was happy with what I ordered.
author: Christy P.

description:
First a hint. A AAA card gets you 20% off the food bill.

I was leaning towards four stars until the tiramisu arrived. It was not terrible just not very good. Too much lady fingers and not enough of what makes tiramisu tiramisu. 

OK, lets start at the beginning. With me, three stars is not bad, it means just what I expected, nothing more, nothing less. In this case expectations had to be pretty high, given the prices. My cioppino was excellent and did not skimp on ingredients. Judit chose fried shrimp and fries and it is hard to mess that up. The service was spot on, the ambiance excellent. And we did not feel touristy. Then the tiramisu arrived.
author: Niall M.

description:
Great food and service by Shawn. 
We had the crab and the prawn cocktails. Good flavor and plenty to satisfy the palate. 
The blackened sole was delicious. And, of course we had to save room for dessert... Crete brûlée and their blonde. Creme brûlée is always good. Their blonde was so good. Great chocolate flavor and ice cream and whip creme for balance. 

Fog Harbor knows how to do it right. Always good.
author: Kim T.

description: My son and I were here on a Tuesday night.  Our reservation was at 8:30 and they took us right on time.  The restaurant was busy and the noise level was loud.  The service was fair.  Our waiter was friendly and attentive but clearly busy with a lot of tables.  We had Ahi Tuna and crab.  The food was good although the plates were way too busy with extra garnishes that took away from the main entree.  Someone reading this review should not be discouraged.  A bit more attentiveness from the waiter and less busy plates would have led to a higher rating for sure.
author: David F.

description: Good is great with big proportions for the amount of food. Would definitely go back!!
author: Katelynn F.

description:
This was my 2nd time coming here, the first time was in a Wednesday for an early dinner and it was good , we knew we would come back. Today a very busy Saturday, we showed up, gave our name , were told the wait w/b 1 1/2 hours, I signed in since they always say more time than it actually takes. We were called in & seated in 45 minutes :). 
Our server Tyler was great , he brought bread , our drinks, appetizers , took our order and served us in a timely manner , then came with a birthday dessert  & singing Happy Birthday for my son . He was a very friendly great server.
The food was AWESOME ! I had a special of the day Salmon w/ pumpkin Curry with Butternut Squash , my honey had Cioppino which he really enjoyed . My sons had seafood combo dishes , great food .
author: Eva L.

description:
Came here on a weekday with some friends because we were craving clam chowder and fish n chips and we were cruising along the pier! We are so happy we chose this place out of all the places on pier 39 because it was delicious. 
First off, when we went to put our names in, there was an hour wait. Normally we wouldn't have stuck around but since its located on the pier there was a lot for us to do to kill time! A little before an hour passed we got a text that they were ready. First impression when we walked in: 'We are not dressed appropriately.' Lol! It is so beautiful inside and we were all in sweat shirts pretty much, but anyway, gorgeous view! I can definitely see why its voted best view. Service was great and quick. Its a nice restaurant but the prices are fair. 
I originially was going to order the fish n chips but I went with the chowder instead. My boyfriend got the fish n chips so we could share. The chowder was good, but it was very filling. Not necessarily a bad thing, but I didn't eat much of it yet I felt full. The fish n chips were amazing! I wish I would have ordered those instead. The batter was perfectly crisp yet not too heavy and the fish was so tender. The tartar sauce? Yeah that was bomb as well. I wish I lived closer, but now each time I travel here I know where I am coming for dinner!
author: Nichole B.

description:
First off the location on the pier with lovely views is great ..
We were a large group and got a nice table immediately on a Sunday eve..plus for the kids menu ..although asking if they wanted more Shirley temples at $2 each and no free refill is not so good.
Because of course they will say yes..
As far as the adult beverages at $13 plus it would be nice if they actually had some alcohol in them ..
The special Alcatraz fruity drink had a small splash of rum on top that you could barely taste..all fruit juice and ice ..Looks pretty but not worth the price .
And ,no I don't like my dirty martini to be all olive juice with barely a trace of vodka..
Here's what we ordered 
Ciopinno -delish 
Clam chowder is just ok..would skip that one 
Calamari one of the best..garlicky and so
Flavorful 
Mixed seafood platter for 2 was good also .
Creme brûlée for dessert was also fab.
Service ,location ,food was good ..its not cheap but that's what you get in a tourist area.
Nice place for families.
Just skip the mixed drinks
author: Alisa M.

description: Fantastic dinner, experience, was given a window seat, great service, yummy fish and love the bibs!
author: Barb G.

description:
Ok I'm giving this  resto Two Star for their food! Had high expectations before dining at this resto but now....  The Salmon and Linguini with clams that I ordered DIDN'T TASTE FRESH at all. Total DISAPPOINTMENT! Definitely needs major improvement on food prep...

Would give Charlie (our server) 5 star for being so attentive!

5 star for the view and location of the restaurant. Its in the heart of Pier 39.
author: M R.

description:
Nice view/very nice and classy ambiance 
Great selections 
Friendly and professional staff 
Very tasty (Serves daily caught fish less than 3 miles away) 

SOURDOUGH BREAD = TO DIE FOR
author: Renata K.

description:
We started with the chowder which was good and the sour dough bread was amazing. 
We ordered the salmon club and crab roll. I'm usually disappointed in crab rolls because it's all lettuce, his was the complete opposite. Full of flavor and fresh!
Salmon blt again large portion but salmon was fresh and delicious.  Highly recommend!
author: Danielle N.

description:
We had some pretty amazing food here. The crab was fresh and delicious, specifically the Cajun one. (or was it creole? I know its not the same. ) I also had the fried combination, since I was really craving some fried shrimp. Unfortunately it only comes with two, a slab of fish, and a boatload of calamari. It would've been perfect, but we had already ordered calamari as an app. 
The non seafood options are also pretty good, and with the care and quality taken to prepare those well shows this place can deliver 5 star food when it needs to.
author: Alex C.

description: Very nice staff, delicious food, beautiful view. We love this place and hope will come again. Thanks.
author: Vitaly P.

description: My husband had the best Cioppino!  Justin was great and attentive!  Will be back.  Very good place to eat
author: Olga L.

description:
Going to school in rural Pennsylvania made me crave for some good, comforting SF clam chowder. I've gone to the Pier Market for chowder in the past, but thought I'd try this place. I was happily satisfied.

Clam chowder - very good and full of tender bits of clam. It's not life changing or the best ever, but well worth the price.

Steamed mussels in the curry/tomato/white wine sauce - savory, cooked perfectly and absolutely flavorful. Dipped my bread in that sauce too.

Crab cakes - light and fluffy.

Complimentary sour dough- warm, fresh, chewy, delicious!

Venue- gorgeous view of the pier/sea/boats. Clean interior. Nice and cozy ambience.

Bill was ~$50 for two people.

Helpful Tidbits: 
1. Recommend making early reservations if you want to see the sunset!
2. Free sour dough so why order a bread bowl of chowder? 
3. A bowl of chowder with bread is pretty filling. We felt really full after finishing 2 other appetizers. Glad we didn't order more.
3. They will validate 2 free hours at the parking lot at dinner time.
author: Tes Y.

description: I know it says fish house but I was in the mood for some bloody steak! The filet mignon was purrrrrfect. With a side of mashed potatoes and greens; I wiped my plate clean!! The service was superb. I was in the mood for a sangria but they didn't have it on their menu, the waiter made sure I got my sangria and that was some good wine! Thanks Rafael! Next time I'm in San Fran, definitely coming back to try some of the fish!
author: Melanie S.

description: The sourdough bread is amazing, goes great with their clam chowder or spicy garlic shrimp appetizer, the sauce left over is great. We ordered the surf and turf upgraded to filet mignon cooked medium. Everything on that plate was gone without hesitation. The whole dungness full crab is another favorite. Pair with Cabernet.
author: Allan V.

description: Dined at Fog Harbor today for my bday lunch today. First time here! They were able to accommodate my reservation request for a table with a window view. They even wrote "happy birthday" on the white paper they have on the tables. Our server, Madison was friendly and attentive. She checked on us often and provided great service. Even the managers checked on us. I appreciate that level of service. My husband had the filet mignon which was amazing and the Demi glacé was tasty. I had the surf and turf which was equally delicious. My lobster was cooked perfectly and the NY steak was very good. Personally, I'm more of a filet mignon gal, but I still enjoyed my steak. Tried the Moscow Mule cocktail and that was very good.  The restaurant even gave me a dessert of choice which I loved....the creme brûlée was beyond delicious!! It was our first time and we definitely plan on returning soon.
author: Rosa T.

description:
We like trying different restaurants during our yearly visits to San Francisco and decided to give Fog Harbor Fish House a try. We arrived after the lunch crowd but before the dinner crowd so the restaurant wasn't very busy. We were seated right away at the back with a nice view of Coit Tower to the left and the bay to the right. 

We were given fresh sourdough bread and butter. What I ordered was simple, fried shrimp with fries and coleslaw and hubby had Seafood Penne with fresh fish, clams and mussels in a tomato cream sauce. The food was fresh and hot, good but nothing special. The shrimp was medium in size and fried to a nice golden crisp but unremarkable in taste as was the fries and coleslaw. Per my husband although the seafood was fresh the seafood penne was bland. The service was average, our waiter was more interested in the 3 girls that was seated at the table next to us and totally abandoned our table.  Even when he was at the other table we couldn't get his attention and he pretty much ignored us, we had to flag down another waiter to get our check because our waiter disappeared. 

The food was fresh and the views were really nice, definitely worth a 2nd visit but would order something totally different.
author: Vikki J.

description:
We dined here after our SF Big Bus tour, and let me tell you about this place.

This restaurant is located in such an amazing spot on the pier, right across from the Aquarium of the Bay. It is on the second floor, and I quite honestly did not read much into it when choosing to eat here. My girlfriend and I just decided that we wanted some clam chowder, and they happened to serve it.

They claim to have the best clam chowder in all of San Francisco, and I can vouch for them on that. The clam chowder served in sourdough bread was just heavenly. It was a chilly day in the city, and to be able to sit down and eat something warm was perfect.

I do have to praise their level of service as well. For a restaurant that had a couple of meetings, a family of four, and a couple of people scattered throughout, I was surprised at the promptness of their service, and how they were able to deliver that experience to us.

When I am in San Francisco again, I can say that I am going to Fog Harbor's each and every time I am looking for some clam chowder.
author: Stanley M.

description: The food was OK and over-priced per the location. Service was also OK but not great. Having to constantly ask for things in an over-priced restaurant is a little annoying. The biggest problem is ordering a crab and avocado salad only to find out after we were several bites into our meal that they were out of avocados. They would not even have said anything if we didn't ask. So then the manager gives us 15% off our food bill which did not amount to much. Very poor service and I would not recommend this place.
author: Mike S.

description:
I decided to eat here despite my reservations of the restaurant having the look and feel of a tourist trap. I should've followed my first mind and had dinner someplace else.

THE BAD NEWS:
I had their "award winning" clam chowder as a starter and it was by far at the bottom of my list of mediocre clam chowder experiences.

For dinner I thought that I would play it safe and have the fish n' chips, and for excitement I had the waiter add 6 fried shrimp (at a cost of $14! Yikes!) to my order. 

The fish was EXTREMELY bland and heavily over breaded. Had I eaten the table cloth instead I probably would've been more satisfied. The shrimp were fried way too hard and the coleslaw was even more bland than the fish.

The chips  were...well they were chips. Nothing special

THE GOOD NEWS:
The reason I gave this restaurant 2 stars was because it's very clean, has a wonderful view of the bay with Alcatraz off in the distance and the wait staff were courteous and very attentive.

My recommendation is that you come here for drinks, then plan a nice dinner at another restaurant in the city.

Happy eating!

~ John Cruise
author: John C.

description:
We hit the mark again!! All our plates were so delicious ...might have over indulged
Nice ambiance right by the water and views amazing even with a little rain. 
Jumbo shrimp cocktail, Moscow Mule and warm Sourdough Bread started our dinner off with a bang!!
author: Joan S.

description:
Had dinner here last night. My wife and I both had chowder, and she ordered the fried shrimp platter - I ordered the combo platter. The chowder was excellent, the shrimp very good, but the fish and calamari were below average - dry and seemed likely to have been recently frozen.  

I also had a Fog Harbor draft beer, and my wife had a margarita. The beer selection is a bit scant, but I enjoyed my beer. My wife stated her margarita was excellent. 

The server was efficient and attentive, and the view of the bay was very good. 

Of particular note, was the addition of a 4.75% surcharge, which apparently the restaurant adds onto each bill to cover their fees to the city for mandated health insurance coverage for their employees. I find this practice to be particularly "distasteful" (pun intended).  It is this restaurant's choice to display this fee on each customer's bill, instead of either absorbing the cost into their overhead, or including the fee in the menu pricing (which is where all other overhead resides). However, I guess it is consistent:  consumers pay the servers' salaries directly in the forms of tips, and now we are also paying their health insurance directly in form of the surcharge.  

In summary, I deducted one star for the healthcare surcharge practice and one star for the food quality.
author: Dave W.

description: Outstanding spot to done after Alkatraz Tour.  Ordered the Shellfish Tower as a meal for two.  My oh my what an awesome meal paired with a cocktail called the Alkatraz Escape.  Anything with coconut has got to be good.  The waiter was humorous and friendly in addition to attentive.  Way to go!
author: Robert B.

description: Good food and great clam chowder!  The restaurant is nice and warm inside as well, which is great on a cold day.
author: T M.

description: wow this place is awesome. Oysters was good, good sizes too! Cioppino (lazy way) was on point. Nice chunks of everything. Also tried the steak and lobster, whatever sauce they used for the steak maaaaaaaan!! loved every drip of it. Lobster too was also a good nice tail size.
author: S B.

description:
If I could give this place 6 stars I would.  The food was incredible - one of the best meals I've ever had - linguini with clams - you'd think kind of boring, right? It wasn't.  It was so good.  My wife got the shellfish platter which she said was delicious as well.  Great views - sea lions were swimming around and entertaining us as we ate.

Highly recommend a visit!
author: Andrew Z.

description:
After a fun work adventure to Alcatraz, we were starved. I took to Yelp to find a reasonably priced seafood restaurant in Fisherman's Warf that also had some options for non-seafood eaters. Fog Harbor had some really good reviews, and one of my colleagues mentioned wanting to go, so we did! 

I was pleasantly surprised by the restaurant. The view was really nice, and it was quiet on a Wednesday afternoon. Service was a little slower than it should have been, but it was OK since we weren't in a rush to go anywhere. We ordered the spicy shrimp, calamari and the blue cheese garlic bread for appetizers. One person ordered the clam chowder, since the menu called it out as being "award winning." He confirmed it was in fact deserving of the award winning tag.

A few of us ordered the Chipotle burger, and we all agreed it was great. I asked for the sauce on the side, and was glad I did, since I wasn't a big fan of it. Others ordered salads, or fish n chips. I heard the fish n chips weren't amazing, but were just fine. Portions are pretty large. 

After our entrees we were enticed by the dessert tray. MMM! Who can pass that up? We ended up getting some creme brulee, warm chocolate cake, and the cookie brownie thing. I did not try the creme brulee, but the other items were delicious. 

The price tag on some items are a little on the spendy side, but overall the food quality is good, and the views are nice too!
author: Mona H.

description:
This is the place to be if you want to have a view of the harbor and sea lions. The food is excellent and service outstanding.  Even for being in a tourist area the servers treat you well.
A must visit if you are visiting the Pier area.
author: Garry Y.

description: Very impressive taste, both the starter and main course. Got the mixed grill, sword fish+salmon+shrimp tastefully grilled with fresh veggies and mashed potatoes. The view is very nice, and add the great atmosphere. You should expect the usual tourist rush. Our server was terrific and family friendly. Top your food with a Tera Misu cake and you are set.
author: Sheggaw B.

description: I was hesitant given the location right in the midst of a very touristy location on the pier. However, this place has a great view and very good food! We certainly were not disappointed. I had the clam chowder and the whole crab. Both were very tasty! We were seated right in a window on the left side of the restaurant, so we had a wonderful view of Alcatrez and the bay. You can even watch the sea lions lounging around. The service was excellent! I highly recommend for anyone visiting this touristy area and looking for a good meal.
author: Marisa M.

description: very good view of windowside seats. very tasty calm chowder with extra crab meat($7) on it. very fresh oysters. $40 avg may be a bit pricy.
author: Gonart L.

description: Wow, the food is once again awesome in San Francisco. Ask for Osscar, if you can and you will not be disappointed. Everything our group had is awesome!
author: Justin T.

description: Great location on the bay.  The food and the service was great. If we every come back to San Francisco we will definitely eat at Fog Harbor.
author: Michael B.

description:
This was actually an amazing restaurant considering it's in probably the MOST touristy part of all of the city! I've been living in San Francisco for almost 4 years, and I usually avoid pier 39 like the plague. However, today my yearning for sourdough bread drew me to Fog Harbor. 

When I entered, I was pleasantly surprised by the cozy entranceway with the cascading waterfall. I especially liked that the water was running super fast, much faster than normal... But anyway, my name was called within 20 minutes (845 pm on a Wednesday night), and I was seated by the extremely cute host. I sat and was helped by my server, Meron, right away. I have to say, even within the first 5 minutes, I knew that she was the best server I have ever had. She asked if we wanted bread, and brought it out extremely quickly. I ordered the blue cheese garlic bread, clam chowder salad combo, and chili shrimp appetizer. This was all we ordered for me and my friend and she did not make me feel pressured at all to order more, which I appreciated.

We ate the bread in 5 seconds flat , and asked for more. Meron was a mind reader and knew right off the bat that we NEEDED two extra loaves. When I commended her for her foresight, she simply stated "well, it's amazing to dip into your shrimp sauce." UHHHH HOLY CRAP.
