ITS LIKE SHE HAS LOOKED THROUGH MY EYES AND INTO MY SOUL AND LEARNED ALL THAT ANYONE COULD EVER LEARN ABOUT ME IN 2 MINUTES OF TALKING TO ME. I love her. 

Aside from the amazing service, the food was way more phenomenal than I would have ever thought for the area. That chili shrimp has perfectly cooked onions, the bread was warm and fluffy and delicious. The clam chowder was good, but I wouldn't say it was my favorite. It was extremely creamy and buttery. I'm sure that it would taste amazing to most, but just didn't fit my preference that well. 

Overall, amazing restaurant. 10/10 would come back. Thanks for the yummy night!!
author: Step H.

description: I cannot wait to go back. This place is on my checklist for my next trip to San Francisco. It gets really busy but the wait is not too long and it's worth it. Try to go sunset time and get a seat by the window, great view. We ordered a few things and all of us had a taste. The clam chowder is really good and also their burger with the caramelized onions is very flavorful. My favorite had to be the fried octopus and calamari appetizer. They also have a nice variety of desserts but unfortunately we were too full to order anything. Highly recomend if for your visit to San Fran!
author: Yelena G.

description:
I took my co-workers out for dinner here while we were in town for a conference.  Got there about 5:30pm on June 16, 2016.   The food was outstanding.  I really loved the linguini and clams.  The salmon salad was fabulous.  Our server Samir was extraordinary!!! He was always there filling our glasses and keeping our table clear of dirty dishes.  He was the best employee on the floor that night!

Only issue was the next table.  Very loud group of men with a couple of women.  The hostess gave us this table and when we asked for another table away from the disturbance, we were told that we would have to wait half hour.  So, we sat.  Talked very loudly to have our own conversation.  Other than the hostess not being accommodating, the manager walked through our section a couple of times and didn't ask the loud table to reduce the noise level.  Those were the only disappointments that we experienced here.
author: Susan I.

description:
Staff was nice, food was...standard fare...which surprised me since it was pricey. Lunch for 4 which included a shellfish tower (5 prawns, 6 oysters, very small crab, 1/2 very small lobster), ahi poke, calamari, halibut, 1 desert between us, and 2 cocktails, was over 200.00. 
Maybe it's just been a while since I've been in SF and I expected more.
I've never had anything here that wasn't fresh, or that tasted bad, but todays just tasted a little bland.
This wouldn't keep me from eating here again at all.
author: Mike R.

description: Very fine choice for lunch or dinner. We had lunch with our 2 children and it was very family friendly. Portions are generous. Soup was delicious. Crab topped burger was an excellent choice. Our server KHAIMAN was extremely attentive and personable. Very pleasant to have. He was very good with his beer recommendations as well.
author: Steven W.

description: Really good atmosphere and food. Large portions. Window seat was fantastic. Prices are high, but all SF restaurants are overpriced. Did not feel too touristy, even though on Pier39.
author: S. B.

description: Beautiful view!  We had an awesome server.  Had a glass of wine with our early lunch.  Asked for lemon to have with water and oyster from other server which never got served.  He said "have to cut up the lemon". Ok!! We dined for an hour never got the lemon.  But we never asked our server thinking that I shouldn't have to ask twice from a white cloth table restaurant.  Overall love the place and all the seafood.
author: Warunee G.

description:
We did a walk in on a Wednesday night and were seated promptly. We requested a window seat, which is the way to go. The view is outstanding. It is conveniently located on Pier 39. It's the place to be after a long, chilly boat tour around the Golden Gate and Alcatraz.

The food and drink didn't disappoint either. I was shivering from cold after our boat tour. The Hot Apple Cider with Ginger Liqueur and Cinnamon Whiskey was the perfect drink to warm me up. The Crab Ceviche was also good. I had the Lobster stuffed with Crab. All excellent. 

Our server was the reason this place does not get 5 stars. I agree the place was busy but when you charge $$$, one of those stars is for service. He made me feel like I was at an Applebee's; one of those eat - pay - leave places. In fact I have received better, more attentive service at Applebees.
author: Zaara D.

description: Fast seating. Exceptional Clam Chowder. The salad left a little to be desired but the calamari sauce was a hit! The crab legs were a tad on the smaller side but very delicious. The view is incredible and the wait staff was very cordual. My friend really liked the cucumber basil gimlet.
author: Maria Z.

description: The best crab cake ever! Even though it was $19 it was worth it. Extremely cold as we were sitting by the door that was constantly opening and closing more so than it needed to be.
author: Leslie V.

description:
The service here is horrible. The waitress expected me to hand my plates to her, forgot our bread, my meal, in general rude and extremely slow. I don't mind handing my plate to her, just to make her job easier, but she seemed to expect me to clear the table for her! Maybe there was some other reason for her behavior but the service sucked especially at the price I was paying for. 

Now onto the food. The New York Steak was wonderful. Cooked just right with the perfect amount of tenderness and sauce. My boyfriend fell in love with the crab roll. I also got the salmon which was just okay, the mussles and fries were pretty good.

On the other hand, the clams were small, not fresh, and had a lot of empty shells. The clam chowder was disappointing and lastly, the seafood linguine was dry. I have to say, one experience here is enough.
author: Rachel L.

description: Food is mediocre, selection is very limited. Service is horrible. The waitress is slow, rude and nowhere to find.  She will not give you any suggestions and what's worse she will tell you to hurry up.
author: Cecilia C.

description: Best calamari I've had and I've had a lot of calamari around the world. The Caesar salad is amazing- light and fresh- homemade dressing. The best sourdough bread I've had on the Wharf and I've eaten many places. The clam chowder with added crab is good- not the best I've had (I like Scoma's better) but you won't be disappointed.
author: Sherria T.

description: Awesome food and service. Was treated like royalty. Our waitress was superb, I wish I remembered her name. We ordered the clam chowder which was BOMB and then we shared the seafood platter for 2. It was amazing and w generous portion that filled us up. I was tasting garlic for hours after my meal, but it was so worth it. Definitely a spot to hit up for a nice meal and top notch service.
author: Almi R.

description:
The food and service here is great!

The complementary sourdough bread and butter is a way to start the meal. 

-crab and risotto fritters: definitely a must try! I enjoyed every bite. The soft, rich mixture of crab and risotto covered in a crispy layer. 

-chicken penne: comes with sundried tomatoes and greens. The sauce is a light oil and was simply delicious. 

-creme brûlée: the sugar coat (my favorite part) was on point and the bottom layer was soft and fluffy. One of my favorite ones to come! 

-tiramisu: the cake was very tea and mocha flavored. But there wasn't anything out of the ordinary.
author: Christine N.

description:
My husband and I came here for dinner to celebrate our anniversary while on vacation. We almost ended up at Scoma's but I'm so glad we didn't! Fog Harbor exceeded our expectations. Starting off with two delicious cocktails (Manhattan and dirty martini) at the bar, we were given great recommendations from the bartender. After being seated at a window table with a wonderful view of the wharf and "Happy Anniversary" adorably scribbled on it, we began to indulge. 

For our entrees my husband ordered the seafood cioppino which was chock full of large shell fish and a broth that lit up our tastebuds. He's literally still craving it 2 weeks later. I on the other hand decided to be difficult and create my own dish that was not on the menu. Our waiter Richard who was phenomenal and beyond accommodating, brought me exactly what I was craving (lobster and Dungeness crab pasta in a cream sauce) A-mazing!!

After dinner we were gifted with a large and decadent dessert (a warm walnut brownie with ice cream) for our special occasion. All in all, Fog Harbor made it a very memorable night for us and we thank Richard and staff for the awesome service.
author: Tia G.

description: Came here on a Saturday at 6:30 with my boyfriend and no reservation but we were seated by 7:30. They take your phone number and text you when your table is ready which is great because you can wander around the pier instead of just sitting around. Boyfriend got the fried combo and I got the pan seared chicken; both were delicious and we had leftovers due to filling up on the free Boutin bread. My only complaint is that our waiter was a bit creepy; he was friendly but honestly made me uncomfortable. However that's not the restaurants fault! We will definitely be back again when we are in the city
author: Sarah C.

description: This place is a must try.. came to visit from Los Angeles. I love seafood and this is the best I have tried so far. You must try the lemon calamari. Drinks so good and the habiscus Margarita the best!
author: Joanne E.

description: Tyler our waiter was awesome! The food was fantastic! Try the local salmon, it's delicious. Enjoyed beautiful sunset views and the wait was short even without reservations.
author: Catherine S.

description:
The restaurant is situated on the second floor on Pier 39 so many of the tables have a beautiful view of the water. We were quickly seated on a Friday afternoon.

As a group we ordered the seafood tower, bread bowls of Chowder and crab cakes. 

All the food was delicious! The complimentary warm bread at the beginning of the meal was delicious. Next time, I would order the soup without the bread bowl and just use the complimentary bread to dip. We ended up with too much bread and not enough chowder.

The seafood was very fresh. 

The drinks we ordered were well made. Service was average. 

The meal was pricey but the views, the location and the food made it worth it.

Bathrooms were clean.
author: Grace C.

description: Amazing restaurant~ I like lobster tail and clam chowder~ Good service! Strongly Recommend!
author: Rui S.

description: We got the red chilli shrimp and it was amazing!!! A must try for the spicy food lovers. Grilled swordfish was pretty good.
author: Nikki R.

description: Good services, nice view of the harbor, and good food! Recommend their oysters (very fresh and sweet), Pacific Cod and their roasted sweet potato side. Their clam chowder with sourdough is not the best I've had but at least comparable to Boudin. Wanted to rate this place 4 stars but the waiter Martin's service definitely earned the 5th star!
author: Lisha Y.

description: I was here on vacation and was able to make a same day reservation.  The service was prompt, attentive, and very friendly (our server Mel was excellent) as we were celebrating a special occasion.  The calamari was crispy and thickly flavorful even before using the dipping sauce.  The cocktail was well mixed.  The 2 crabcakes were moist on the inside and had a nice battered shell encasing it; I especially loved the delightful mango fruity sauce accompanied it.  These were very small though. My dinner companion had a shrimp dish that was very tasty from the bite I had, and I was told the mashed potatoes with it were fluffy and creamy.  The complimentary creme brulee for our special occasion cracked wonderfully on top and had a presentation that was only rivaled by its taste. A special nod to the fresh batches of Boudoin sourdough rolls brought out to whet the appetite prior to the meal getting in underway.  The ambiance is upscale casual with clean white linens, gorgeous sunset views of the bay, and friendly staff. I can't wait to come back!
author: Krys S.

description:
Hands down best chowder in The City. We used to come here all the time when we lived here, now we come back multiple times while we are visiting.
Must eat here
author: Theresa F.

description: My boyfriend and I came here on a Saturday afternoon. Our wait time was 30 minutes which really wasn't bad considering how freaking packed pier 39 was during this day. We got the crab cake, shellfish platter for two, and the fog harbor burger. Everything was delicious and our server Tyler was extremely helpful and attentive.
author: Ellice L.

description:
The location is convenient if you're around Pier 39 and they validate your parking across the street for an hour.  The restaurant is clean, great views and the service was very attentive.  Everything started out great for us.  We got the clam chowder for appetizer and it came out with some hot sourdough bread.  The clam chowder is probably one of the better ones I've had.  However, the reason for the not giving a better review is because the rest of our lunch was just okay.  As others may have mentioned in other reviews, their fish and chips lack flavor.  I know it sounds weird, but it really had no taste.  I felt like it could have used some salt and pepper before they dipped it into the batter or something.  However, the cole slaw that came with the fish and chips were good.  Our other dish was their cioppino.  The fish was overcooked and their broth was too thick and uneven.  

Would I go back again?  Only to have some of their clam chowder and maybe I can get a small salad with it.
author: Alissa C.

description: Having a really great night here with my sisters! Also, our waitress Amy R. Is really nice!!!
author: Christina H.

description: Came here last Saturday with my girlfriend for dinner and the experience was great! Ordered the seafood platter for two, crab cakes, and the fog harbor burger. The seafood platter for two itself was very filling that I didn't even get to eat my burger. Our server Tyler gave the recommendations and was very attentive to our needs. Would definitely come back here when I am in town.
author: Andrew G.

description: Cabs are very good. Shellfish is fine. I like the fried sleeve fish from the fried combo, but chips and fish are just fair.
author: Sebastian F.

description: This place was everything you think of when they say get seafood in San Francisco. The garlic bread was some of the best I have ever tasted. The oysters were unbelievable as I did not want to share. The shell platter for two was more than enough food. The crabs were extremely juicy and meaty. The staff was phenomenal and the ambiance was perfect. I spent a lot but I got a lot of food and it was all good. Definitely come here if you are in town!
author: Perry T.

description: Simply delicious! Spent the day in San Francisco for my hubbys birthday and ended up here for dinner. Our waiter was amazing and the view was beautiful. You MUST try the crab cake.... mmm it was so good! Best food I have had in a long time, highly recommend this restaurant!
author: Sarah A.

description: Hands down amazing. The most fantastic view of Alcatraz and the sea lions at pier 39. Fantastic service. Our party of five split several appetizers including the lemon aioli calamari, seasonal heirloom tomato salad, shrimp cocktail, crab cakes and oysters. Their cup of chowder is amazing and very filling. It's actually very affordable for the quality, atmosphere and variety. Although they have a fantastic dessert tray, the parting gift is a biscoff cookie. Highly recommend!
author: Kathleen D.

description: After a long day of travel, we opted to have dinner here out of the many restaurants dotting the pier and we were so glad we did!  Quality of the food was excellent, and the cocktails were fabulous.  The clam chowder bread bowl is a must.  The service was also top notch.  Our server, Daniel C. provided wonderful recommendations and was attentive throughout the meal.  He just made the dinner perfect from beginning to end.  What a great start to our vacation.  We will definitely be back!
author: Nikki B.

description: Nice seafood, especially the Maine whole lobster. I liked their desserts also. Prices are a bit high, they worth it for unusual special dining.
author: Don K.

description: I came in yesterday for a simple dinner with my husband. When we got seated our server Anya came right up to us and took care of our needs right away. Anya suggested halibut and it was so good! Over all I give this place a 5 star because the view, our food and the service was impeccable.
author: Annikma S.

description:
My boyfriend and I came in for lunch after walking around fisherman's wharf. It was a beautiful day and the area was crowded with tourists. We waited about 20 min to be seated, which wasn't bad. And the wait was totally worth it! 
First let me just say the view was amazing. You get to see the wharf and water. The waitress was professional, fast at service, and friendly. But what impressed me the most was the food. It was DELICIOUS!!! We ordered crispy lemon calamari for starters and a chowder bowl to share and a shellfish platter for two to share. It was more than enough for two of us and everything was yummy!!! Strongly recommend the shellfish platter for two. Everything was fresh. I especially liked the mussels. I usually found restaurant food salty but not this one. It was seasoned perfectly.
It came out a little bit pricy for a quick lunch. We didn't order any drink and the bill came out a hundred in total but it was worth it. I'll definitely come back when I get a chance!
author: Bixi T.

description:
Best restaurant experience. We were quoted a 45- 1 hour wait which was fair at 8 on a Saturday night and we were seated within 15 minutes. At a candlelit table next to the window with a beautiful view of the bay, no less. Our waitress, Ashley G, was a delight- so fun and sweet and helpful! The bread and butter was warm and soft. The food came so quickly and was hands down the freshest fish, crab, clams, mussels, scallops, you name it. My husband is a self pronounced burger expert so of course ordered the burger and he couldn't stop telling me how this was the best burger he's ever tasted. Our drinks were amazing, my (virgin) piña colada was smooth and not icy with freshly whipped cream and my husbands strawberry lemonade was to die for. 
Even better, the prices are completely fair and reasonable! Leaves more money in your pocket to tip your amazing waitress Ashley ;) 
The restaurant was full and busy but we barely noticed! It wasn't at all loud and still felt very intimate. New favorite place to eat in SF
author: Sarah T.

description: Good food and service was fast and friendly but nothing special. The views are great if you are near a window. The ciopino was only okay.
author: Alyssa W.

description:
This is probably one of the nicest restaurants on pier 39. The ambiance appeared very classy but there are so many casual patrons that it didn't feel too uptight. 

There was about a 30 minute wait on Thursday night. They have a nice cozy fireplace to sit by while looking over the menu. There are no buzzers so you have to wait near the restaurant to hear your name called out.  

Once we sat down, we got a lovely view of the pier with the sea lions. The fresh sourdough bread was delicious! Crusty on the outside but soft on the inside. 

I ordered the clam chowder in the bread bowl with a side caesar salad while BF had the swordfish. The clam chowder was tasty and definitely not salty. That's always been my biggest problem with clam chowder. The caesar salad was forgettable... it was served on the whole romaine hearts. I would prefer if the lettuce was already chopped for easy eating! BF enjoyed his swordfish and the portion was generous for the price. We definitely did not leave feeling hungry or guilty!
author: Linh N.

description: Good food, nice atmosphere, and a great view. Portions are great size, seafood was extra special.  But if you order a house salad, ask for dressing on the side - it was way too overly dressed.
author: Rhiannon M.

description:
The restaurant info says 'not kid friendly' but it absolutely was. Now if your kids are crazy and have bad manners, then don't put the other guests through that. Otherwise, during the day, early evening is fine for children. We took an 8 yr old and 6 yr old with us, they gave us crayons and coloring sheets with a kid's menu. Food was great, loved the ambiance and the kindness of all of the staff! 
Great place if visiting here or even if wanting a nice place for a date!
author: Holly C.

description: Favorite spot in San Fran. We liked it so much we went two nights in a row! Fresh hot sourdough bread brought to the table, local beers and wines. Not too pricy either. I wouldn't recommend getting the bread bowl because there's not that much soup and the clam chowder is so good you want a lot of it! Caesar is very good, add shrimp or crab. Whole crab get steamed, not garlic. Swordfish melts in your mouth. Great service and would definitely recommend!
author: Julie B.

description: This was our first stop in San Francisco and what a nice start it was. We sat at the bar, our favorite spot and ordered two of their award winning hibiscus margaritas. Don't know what all is in it, but is was delicious! I could have had 2 or 3, and might have, if we weren't getting on a boat to Alcatraz right after lunch. We also ordered the baked oysters and crab cakes, oh and the clam chowder. I would order each item again. The crab cakes did have some filler, but I guess if not, they would be $20 each, but the flavor was still good. I would definitely recommend a stop here as you are waiting for a ferry ride to, well, anywhere.
author: Amy G.

description:
My friend was determined to find the best tasting clam chowder in San Francisco, so while we were at Fisherman's Wharf, he found Fog Harbor Fish House on Yelp. Located at Pier 39, the restaurant is surprisingly fancy schmancy with a very weekend-at-the-Hamptons vibe; it was lunch time and every table had wine glasses. We were seated at a U-shaped booth with a nice view and the ambiance made us feel as though we could've been anywhere -- Newport Beach, Maine, 1990s SF.

I was in the mood for something sweet so my girlfriend and I asked for a dessert menu while my friend ordered the clam chowder bowl ($8) he wanted. Our server came back with a tray filled with all the various desserts they offer. Impressive and such a cool way to show what's on the menu! My friend's clam chowder was fresh, tasty, and filled with clams. The bread bowl it was served in was just as tasty as the chowder. My Blondie with vanilla ice cream was a large enough dessert for two, but I managed to finish it myself. It was that good.

Fog Harbor is a classy place I wouldn't mind visiting again for a nice lunch, snack, or dessert with family or friends.
author: Ivy W.

description: One of the best meals ever! Samir, our server was good and attentive.  We got totally lucky as we could not get a reservation for Christmas Eve.  We even went by there for a walk in and it was a 45 minute wait.  We were headed to another restaurant and one of their chefs, Mauricio  totally hooked us up.  I don't know why he decided to do this act of kindness but we were seated in 10 minutes!  Thank you again Mauricio! You made our Christmas Eve memorable with a fabulous meal!
author: Harp B.

description: Best clam chowder OF MA LIFEEEE! be sure to adds da crabs yo! the fried seafood platter is also ON FLEEK and great for sharing. portions are just right when 3 people share 2 plates. really appreciate the very hardworking customer service as well. very attentive staff. love this place
author: Rachel T.

description:
Five star baby! No doubt. 

If you know me I'm a big BIG seafood lover! My daughter and I were in search of clam chowder at the pier and we found this place on yelp so we decided to have brunch here :) so glad we came because everything we ordered was SOOOO PERFECT! Even the customer service was great! I'm sorry I do not remember her name :( 

As you can see my pictures, we ordered mimosa, sour dough bread bowl clam chowder, fish n chips for my daughter and seafood cioppino for myself. Our dessert was chocolate soufflé. My daughter picked it. Good choice :) 

Definitely coming back to have more clam chowder in bread bowl! Next time, we're gonna get our own. Yes, that's how yummy it is!
author: Mimi S.

description:
Great clam chowder, cocktails and view. ( as well as the bread and butter)

The calamari was too fishy, which makes me believe it wasn't fresh.  We ordered the half order roasted dungeness crab...very upsetting. It lacked flavor, and it was actually quarter of a crab!  What a rip off.  There are too many restaurants that serve the same kind of food so I'll be checking out the others next time.
author: Sandy N.

description: Wow what a view!! Definitely worth the 40min wait. Our server was very attentive, he did a good job answering any questions we had. The food was amazing, the portions were large and we had no complaints. Will be returning here next time we visit Pier 39.
author: Joshua L.

description: So, it's our first time in San Fransisco! We decided to have dinner at the Fog Harbor. It has a great atmosphere and Pierre was our waiter. He was the best! Attentive, his suggestions where on point and made our experience even more satisfying! Our stay in San Fransisco is short otherwise we would be having dinner here all the time. Thank you Pierre and staff!
author: Violet G.

description: I'm actually a big fan of this place because everything is great. For real, all the food is great. YUM!
author: Emily D.

description: I ordered the ahi tuna and it was absolutely delicious. Our server was nice and the view of the pier was beautiful. However, one of the waiters there was a bit rude when I asked her questions. For example, we asked her for two straws and she turned around, didn't say anything, came back with our straws and left without a word...even though I said thank you. Other than that, the restaurant serves good food, along with beautiful scenery.
author: Monique L.

description:
This place is absolutely amazing. The location is amazing. We got a window table which overlooked the water. We were able to watch the sun set while enjoying the delicious food.

We were there in October so they had an outdoor festival at the pier with live music, so we were entertained while we waited for our table. They had the pumpkin salmon (seasonal dish) which was absolutely delicious.

I'd highly recommend this place to anyone. Great for a first date, dinner with the family or just even a nice meal to yourself.
author: Sathya B.

description: Ate here for a late lunch with a friend. Our server was Samir and he was very attentive to our needs!! Thanks for the great experience Samir!!
author: Connie-Marie P.

description:
Anytime you order three different meals and everyone at the table agrees that this is worth 5 stars. Ya it's a winner. Crab was delicious, clam
Linguini was great and a solid light meal, and the salmon was without a doubt the best iv ever had! 5 Stars and what a great experience!
author: Trevor P.

description:
We are SF locals but decided to venture out and be tourists and get dinner at the Pier. This place had great reviews and we were craving seafood.

Came at about 7pm and were told it was an hour wait for 2. We hung out around the pier and came back after 45 minutes and they were ready for us. Got a beautiful table by the window with a great view.

Mila was our fabulous waitress with a great personality, and told us there is a 15% discount for all locals! Yay!

Right away, got the amazing warm and fresh sourdough. Love.

Started with the crab ceviche with pineapple and avocado. The crab was perfect but pineapple made it too sweet. I give it 3 stars. 

Then the amazing, hearty bowl of clam chowder. I have had great chowder and this one is definitely on the top of my list.

For entrees we got the surf and turf and the seafood platter. Surf and turf is delicious with a perfectly made 10 oz steak and delicious crab stuffed lobster.

The seafood platter is generous with lots of clams and mussels and shrimp. The half crab was perfect. Corn is buttery and excellent.

Paired everything with Moscow Mules - must get! 

No room for dessert but you do get biscoff cookies with your check.

Great food, would deinitely come back.
author: Shireen J.

description:
A bit overpriced but what can you expect from a restaurant located in a tourist trap area? Having said that, the food was excellent and the ambiance was wonderful as we were seated along the window overlooking the bay. 

Tip: if you purchase tix to the aquarium of the bay or the San francisco magic show held at the aquarium's theater, there is a 15% discount to this restaurant as well as pier 39 seafood restaurant and the wipeout grill.
author: Kim M.

description:
Have to say BEST crab chowder EVER.  My fiance and I died and went to heaven after eating here.  I also had the crab salad which was really good, but was needing more veges.  We had the crab cakes too which were good.  I would say we will be back and try more of their dishes.

The view is amazing too as the sun goes down! #romantic and #foodtodie4!!
author: Raja D.

description:
Stopped in for a late lunch on Saturday afternoon around 2pm with my gf. We were both pretty hungry so just opted to sit at the bar, where the service was prompt, attentive and overall very good. 

We decided to split the baked oysters, a house salad w/chicken and the sliders. Overall was very pleased, especially with the oysters and the sliders. The hot and fresh sourdough bread was also nice and came out early on. 

Only mild complaint was the food took a bit longer than expected considering what we ordered but to be fair the place was packed the entire time we were there. 

If you can get, or are willing to wait for, a seat closer to the window you've got quite the view of the sea lions, definitely a nice touch. As much a tourist trap as I expected this to be it really wasn't and I was pleased w/my visit.
author: Wayne Z.

description:
The wait was long, and the accolades high. I ordered the sole and she got the 1/2 garlic crab. Our server's demeanor made us feel like we were taking up his precious time. Which he then confirmed as he served the family next to us with golden platters. He came up to us once, grunting something along the lines of, how's the food. Made no other remarks the whole  night except to explain to us that SF imposes a tax to cover the employees' health insurance  (what?!). 

My sole lacked even the most basic seasoning, salt. The fingerling potatoes and sautéed spinach on the bottom was inedible. After salting and peppering my fish, my meal consisted of bread, butter, and a lemon wedge. 

The view was killer tho.
author: Milana A.

description: This is a solid 4 star restaurant at the Pier 39. We had the seafood platter, calamari, blue cheese garlic bread and clam chowder.  Everything was great but the bread and the chowder were just tiny bit below average.
author: Alex S.

description: Beautiful view of the bay in this place if you get a window seat. The food was on point with the expectations. Loved the friendly staff & the ambiance. Award winning clam chowder is exactly that!
author: Crystal E.

description: The food and restaurant was spectacular! Our food was out of this world!! We got a delicious clam chowder bread bowl and a crab roll. The clam chowder was perfect; creamy, lots of clams, perfect amount of potatoes. And the crab roll was exploding with crab! The part that was sourly disappointing was our server. She clearly did not want to be there or be serving us.
author: Amy W.

description:
I came for lunch because I was sightseeing on the Wharf. I was seated right away but I felt a little awkward. I was by myself and they stuck me in a booth instead of giving me a twoseater. 

I ordered their organic agave margarita which was wow! Very tangy and boozy! I couldn't drink too much before my food arrived else I would have been stumbling out of there. They also did not give me any water until I asked for some. They brought out the fresh sourdough bread which was nice but they gave me a full basket, it was a bit of a waste. One person would never eat six pieces of bread.

I ordered the crab roll with sweet potato fries. It came out lightning fast and it was pretty good. The sweet potato fries were nothing special but the crab roll was pretty darn delicious.
author: Megan K.

description: Great food, service and view! It's also a reasonably priced restaurant for fisherman's wharf. The clam chowder was amazing - it's a def must try! Samir was our server :)
author: Kerri C.

description: Came here this evening and the hostess at the front entrance was incredibly rude and unpleasant. The first person to greet you should be the best representative of the company. I walked in at 9 with no reservations so I was hopeful to get a seat. I would have happily left without being seated but I was shocked that the hostess was not only was dismissive but seated the next couple that came along (mind you - they had no reservations either). I observed her from a distance and noticed that she had seated other patrons that arrived after us.
author: Mar L.

description:
The clam chowder with the crab is to die for. If I were to come back I would definitely order that again. The seafood I had seemed really fresh and I enjoyed it a lot. My girlfriend and I ordered the clam chowder with crab, a Caesar salad with crab, and linguini with clams but I got it with shrimp instead. 

Again let me say that the clam chowder was delicious! The shrimp in the pasta was cooked nice and was fresh. Everything else was just mediocre. 

I would have given this place 3 stars but the clam chowder is dank, there's a really nice view, and our server was really nice.
author: Raymond L.

description: Large portions, fresh seafood, and quick, friendly service .... all with a view of the Bay!
author: Casey N.

description: So we decided to have dinner here last night with the fams. I was told the wait time would be 30-40 minutes. Not too bad so we decided to go for it. What seemed like 30 minutes later in the cold and numerous small and large partiesbbeing called in we decided to see how much longer. We were told 15 minutes. 20 minutes later we ask again and was told a few minutes. 5 minutes later i get a text saying to check in with front desk. I do so and they say table will be ready in a few minutes. Aight cool. 10 minutes pass and still nothing so we ask again and they table will be ready in 10 minutes. The hunger is real and we decide if it ain't ready in 10 minutes we'll just leave. Finally table is ready. Restaurant was super busy and was thinking this better be worth the wait. We get to our table and immediately meet our waiter Pedro. He gives us our menus and gives us a quick rundown of the specials and drinks. This is where our experience takes a turn for the best! We order our drinks and food. Our drinks, kids food and appetizers come out quick. Calamari appetizer with that garlic aioli was dank! Wife and ordered a lazy cioppino which came out next and came in 2 bowls. I told my wife we only ordered 1 unless this was split. I ask Pedro just to make sure. He replies back. I had them split it to make it easier. Wow! Very attentive. I'm impressed! Cioppino was excellent! The sourdough bread starter was excellent. Pedro was on top of his game throughout our dinner. I honestly have to say Pedro made this dinner and very enjoyable and memorable experience. Thank you very much Pedro! You are the man!
author: Giovanni G.

description:
Place was solid. Great view if you sit by a window, super friendly staff (atleast with Madison). 
The food was also great, between the steak, pasta, and seafood platter.  It was all tasty. Would come again
author: Joseph Rebelo R.

description:
My girlfriend and i went for dinner last night and ordered a full dozen oysters，they were all fresh but one of them is just as big as my finger nails and the rest were all small ones.And he price is 2.5$ per oyster...gotta post a pic of dat tiny little poor oyster... 

Others were all good，good servic，nice view，food tasted fresh（swordfish was good） but just wayyyyy tooo expensive compared to the size（yeah im talking about the oysters.）
author: Jifeng Z.

description:
Love this place! Took my wife here and we had the calamari and chowder. By far, the best calamari I have ever had. Chowder was very good as well. The menu looked great and we want to go back next time we are in SF to try some of the main dishes. 

It is a great location on Pier 39 and we were lucky enough to be seated by the windows overlooking the harbor. Terrific atmosphere, great service.
author: Chris E.

description: Amazing bread, clam chowder. Khailmam was the BEST server. Friendly, attentive. Loved every minute!!!
author: Casey M.

description: Best clam chowder EVER!!! If you are around pier 39, go there for dinner or lunch. They have an amazing view, specially during the sunset. Don't miss the clam chowder!!! I also tried the calamari and the mussels. Incredible!!! Everything is super good. Yelp says $$ but it's actually $$$. You will spend more than $30, specially if you order a glass of wine. Most of the fish dishes are between 26-32.
author: Consuelo L.

description: Fantastic service, food, and view! Clam chowder was phenomenal. We had the mixed grill and the fish was freshly cooked to perfection. Fish and chips was flakey and cooked great. Our waiter, Khaiman was on point! Highly attentive, quick and very friendly. Highly recommended restaurant and one of the best on the pier!
author: Kolby S.

description:
We made reservations here to start off our day in the city to show my friend from SoCal around.

The place is right in the middle of all the touristy destinations. We waited around 10 minutes for them to set up our table, but we just looked at the menu and decided what we wanted to order during that time. The place is very nicely decorated and we were seated next to the windows. We got a very good view of the ocean and the activities outside! To top it off, our waiter was also very pleasant and gave us some recommendations of what we should order too. 

What we ordered:
- Blue Cheese Garlic Bread: so good! It's a must-order starter. Definitely could of gotten full from this alone. 
- Fried Combo: Consisted of fried fish, calamari, shrimp, french fries and cole slaw. We could not finish this. It was huge. 
- Seafood Cioppino: We added the pasta with the crab, fish, shrimp, scallops, clams and mussels in the stew. This was amazing and definitely my favorite. I loved the crab and scallops; both were very fresh. We tried to finish this, but we couldn't either. 

The portions here are huge. Everything was worth the price. The three of us could not finish our meals. My SoCal friend really liked this place. We really wanted to order dessert, but we were stuffed. 

All of us definitely full and were happy to walk off our meal afterwards by the bay. I would recommend coming here if you're showing of San Francisco to someone! I would want to try the clam chowder, more seafood, and desserts next time!
author: Angela L.

description:
Note to management. Your server named ashley has serious issues. 

Our water was always empty, i asked for more water and she just puts up her finger with an attitude..... Really!?

We ordered the clam chowder... Had to ask for crackers and the table salt/pepper like i was askin for a huge favor. 

I ordered the burger and asked her if they had some jalapenos and she just looked at me like i insulted her or something and told me "NO" i didnt know she was also the chef as well...cuz she didnt even think about it or bother to go ask.. So i ask for hot sauce instead and she tells me all they have is tabasco. I been around this business long enough where i know a server is just bull shitting.. 
I was done w this server and kindly asked another server if they had any hot sauce other than tabasco and a gentlemen kindly assisted me with some sriracha hot sauce. Thank you.

Here is the best part of this ashley women's service... I asked for the bill and she just drops it off didnt even say thank you or whenever ur ready... I give her my card, she brings it back and drops it off without a single word and leaves. 
This women needs counseling in life. 
We will not be back.
author: Jun K.

description: I usually love this place. Amazing food. Good ambience. But today, the waiters were very rude and unprofessional. Slow service and very sloppy when served. We were constantly very kind and appreciative when we were able to get ahold of them but we were still given shitty service. Food is amazing but if the service is going to constantly be like this, I don't believe this place deserves any award.
author: Ada H.

description: Came here on a wednesday with my wife. Was hoping to enjoy some nice cioppino. Paid $38+ for a bowl of cippiono that only had 2 clams 2 muscles and 2 shrimp. That's pretty shady if you ask me.It also came with crab and fish that I have no complaints about. Overall I've had way better cioppino. Sauce taste like ravioli sauce. Also ordered the clam chowder which was decent but again small portion for the pricing. My wife ordered calamari and filet mignon. Calamari was pretty good except for a few pieces that were a little bit chewy. She asked for medium for her steak but it turned out well done. I really wanted to like this place but I spent $140 here including a glass of wine and a glass of lager. I left this place pretty disappointed.
author: Niners V.

description: Like this restaurant. The food tasted amazing. Samir and the manager( the man in blue shirt) were super nice. They gave lava cake for free as my friend's birthday cake (lave cake is not the free birthday cake). Sang the birthday song with us which was nice!
author: Ching Man S.

description: A beautiful restaurant situated in an ideal location! The staff were friendly, and the food was wonderful. Make sure you get the chowder! If you go in January the crab will be fresh and delish!
author: Richard H.

description: This place is great! We had the "mixed grill" and "swordfish" (with pesto sauce and chimichurri) as entrees, and they were both wonderful! The appetizers didn't disappoint either - we shared a bowl of clam chowder and the calamari and both were awesome. Our server and the view were fantastic, too. Zero complaints! I may even try to get my husband to go back before we leave San Francisco tomorrow ;)
author: Sophie S.

description:
This is a very late review of the restaurant. 

My family and I came here for lunch on Mother's Day. Our server was Kaiden(?), and he was by far the best server we have ever encountered. Our glasses were never empty, bread was always full, and he always checked in with us to make sure everything was good. The food was excellent as always. My sisters fiancé is vegetarian, and he didn't like many of the choices he saw. That's when Kaiden(?) said there's a vegetarian dish that he has the chef make for him, and he can ask them to do the same for him. Needless to say it came out excellent! 

That was one of the best dinning experiences that we've ever had! We'll definitely be coming here more often.
author: Sherhan J.

description: I must say that the clam chowder, Salmon and shrimp were delicious. BUT the service is the reason why I'd give it a 2 star rating. The server first came up and introduced herself and basically walked away, didn't even bother asking if we needed water(I actually had to ask her to bring me water). Also, didn't ask us if we wanted anything else to drink besides the water and the complimentary bread was brought out to our table minutes before our actual meal came out. I've worked in the food industry in the past and I must say even though it's a busy restaurant that was still horrible service.
author: Carlos R.

description: Great food and drinks at a very reasonable price.  Best Long Island Ice Tea in the city.  Our waiter, Mel, was exceptional.  Shrimp cocktail and calamari the best ever!  This is a definite repeat next time I'm in the city.  You will not be disappointed! Very busy, for a great reason, so make a reservation, it is worth the trip!  Thank you Mel for a very special evening!  We will be back!!
author: Ann R.

description: Normally, I am not a fan of places that are cater to tourists, but we were in a rush and this spot was close. It was a great experience from start to finish! View was amazing, service great, and food was delicious! we sat at the bar and had perfect service. Swordfish is amazing!
author: Amanda S.

description: Actually a decent place in such a touristy area... many tables have views!
author: Mingmei N.

description:
Beautiful place to eat at with a view. Going straight to the point- two orders of clam
Chowder in a sourdough bread bowl, 2 Laguanitas IPA, and calamari. Calamari with tarter sauce was good. However I think they used squid instead of calamari. Sauce was on point. The clam chowder was creamy and delicious. I got a bite of clam in every spoonful. The complimentary bread was great but I wish it were more hot. Total bill was $56 before tip.
author: Angeline H.

description:
First, go to the visitor's center also on the upper level and get a 15% off coupon for this place. Then, make a reservation on OpenTable so you get seated near the window. 

This is a nice little spot with a beautiful view of the Bay. The food quality is decent but nothing amazing and the mixed drinks are a little diluted. I would know as I get tipsy easily since I hardly drink which wasn't the case after a mojito here.  I had a 1/2 crab (eh, ok, but way overpriced due to supply/demand) which was plenty with a beat salad (very good) and shared a bowl of the Clam Chowder (delicious) with my boyfriend who has some fish in a wasabi sauce that didn't taste that excellent. 

So this isn't a cheap place, but it's not a bad restaurant to check out and the service is very good. 

3 stars for food.
2.5 stars for mixed drinks
4 stars for service
4 stars for atmosphere
author: Jennifer A.

description:
This is your typical touristy restaurant in the Pier 39 area, which decent tasting food and a nice view, but inflated prices. Make sure you check in on Yelp to get a free Blue Cheese Garlic Bread appetizer. I came for my friend's birthday (Kellie C.!) since they have a separate room for large parties in the back of the restaurant, and were able to accommodate a group of 18 on a Thursday night. We came in around 8:15pm, and the table was ready, so we were seated right away. Although the table sat 18, we could've used a little more room. However, it worked out fine, and I got to try:

-Blue Cheese Garlic Bread (Fresh Sourdough, Topped w/Garlic, Pt. Reyes Blue Cheese, Herbs, $8): Just ok. The blue cheese overpowered all the other flavors, and you couldn't taste the garlic. The bread was also too crunchy for my liking. Skip!
-Oysters (Served w/Cocktail Sauce, Dozen $26, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-harbor-fish-house-san-francisco-2?select=lXj3u1ALp1qyMLuGKOuoBw#lXj3u1ALp1qyMLuGKOuoBw): The oysters were fresh, but the cocktail sauce and mignonette were just ok. I wish they had given us some Tabasco with the oysters. Skip!
-Crispy Lemon Calamari (Seasoned w/Lemon, Served w/Lemon Aioli, $12, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-harbor-fish-house-san-francisco-2?select=lXj3u1ALp1qyMLuGKOuoBw#3lMGE6tFW3afyze8HNomkA): Yuck.. the calamari rings were chewy, and the batter was soggy. This is one of the worst fried calamari dishes I've had, and they should really re-look at their recipe. Skip!
-Ahi Poke (Marinated Raw Tuna, Avocado, Mango, Sesame-Soy Sauce, Wasabi Aioli, $16): Ok. The tuna tasted fresh, and I liked the wasabi aioli. However, the sesame soy sauce didn't have much flavor, and the dish overall was bland. Skip!
-Crab Louis ($22, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-harbor-fish-house-san-francisco-2?select=lXj3u1ALp1qyMLuGKOuoBw#_pzD387ZKQjuxDPLN0KIFA): They didn't skimp on the crab, and it tasted really fresh, which was great. However, there were pieces of cartilage in the crab, and the salad itself was bland. I wouldn't order this again.
-Crab Roll (Fresh Crab, Celery, Shallot Aioli, Served on a Buttered Roll w/Sweet Potato Fries, $19, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-harbor-fish-house-san-francisco-2?select=lXj3u1ALp1qyMLuGKOuoBw#FyzyT_3ZvIESH5I0qp6APg): Pretty good if you like mayo, and I liked that they toasted the roll nicely. The sweet potato fries were also really good. Recommended!
-Fish & Chips (Hand Dipped in "Anchor Steam" Beer Batter w/Cole Slaw, $17, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-harbor-fish-house-san-francisco-2?select=lXj3u1ALp1qyMLuGKOuoBw#EuuXw-pZ356IX--lG1jksA): They give you a huge portion (2 large and 2 medium sized fish sticks, fries, cole slaw), but the fish was just ok. I didn't like the taste and consistency of the batter- it tasted bitter from the beer, and was too crunchy. The cole slaw was also just so-so since it was very bland. However, the fries were done nicely, and the tartar sauce was delicious.
-Award Winning Clam Chowder (The Best in San Francisco, Bowl, $8, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-harbor-fish-house-san-francisco-2?select=lXj3u1ALp1qyMLuGKOuoBw#s7bQ8LaMVBCTTvrlIYQd4Q): This was a pretty good version of clam chowder! It was rich and creamy, and there were big pieces of clam in the chowder. Recommended!
-Apple Crisp a la Mode (House-Made w/Granny Smith Apples, Walnuts, Butter Crumb, Served Warm, Topped w/Vanilla Ice Cream, $8.50): Ok. I liked the butter crumb, but the apples were a little hard. I wouldn't order this again.
-Warm Chocolate Lava Cake (w/Creamy Chocolate Center, Served w/Vanilla Ice Cream, $8.50): Just ok, nothing special. I wouldn't order this again.

The best dishes from here were the Crab Roll and Clam Chowder, and the fries from the fish and chips. Although I don't think I'd come back for those dishes again, I would recommend ordering them if you are dining here. The service was good up until the end- it took them a long time to bring the dessert and our check. Make sure you ask them to validate your parking ticket if you parked in the structure across the street.  

Overall, there are so many better restaurants to eat at in SF, and it's not worth coming here unless you can expense your meal, or if you really want a view of the pier area.
author: Amy D.

description:
Absolutly worth to wait at the front desk - if you have too!

Service was friendly, food was delicious and the view into the harbor of Pier 39, Alcatraz in the background - just amazing.
author: Marc H.

description: I miss the ciopinno so much! It's the best thing I have ever had. My husband and I both got it with noodles. If I had known how big it was we would have shared even though it was awesome to have left overs for later. I wish I had the recipe for it! We also had the calamari and it was the best that I have ever had. I would go back to San Francisco just for this place! Also we got a table in the back near the window. It's an awesome view and Alcatraz is so close!
author: Zunaira K.

description:
Went for dinner last night with four others.  

They had some light jazz piped in as we entered (great touch) and the entrance was inviting.

But, what a very disappointing meal.  

Started out with fried calamari but where was the calamari?  Just a few pieces which were heavily battered accompanied by a whole lot of fried batter crumbs.

My wife had Fish and chips.  The fish was even more heavily battered than the calamari and the batter seemed almost burnt.  She removed the batter and it sat piled up on her plate while she tried to enjoy the tasteless fish which was covered by the batter.  The Cole Slaw which accompanied the fish was also way below par.

The rest of the food was was equally disappointing.  Someone please teach the chef how to cook.  It really doesn't take much to make seafood taste great.

Service was good but nothing special.

I did expect the cost of the meal to be on the high side, considering the fact that the restaurant is located an Pier 39 and that was the only thing that was as expected.  The cost is one thing, but restaurants located in such 'tourist venues' must realize that they are representing a city which is famous for fresh and quality seafood.  

This place is a poor example of the quality of seafood San Franciscan restaurants usually serve.  This is my first and last time here.
author: critic c.

description:
Fog Harbor was a lovely stop on our spring trip to SF. We were seated right away(arrived around 6 on a Friday evening) and had a wonderful view of the harbor, sea lions, and sunset. The view is undeniably spectacular. 

I would have given Fog House five stars if our waiter had been a bit better, but I realize everyone has off days. Our service was less than prompt and our waiter seemed like he didn't have too much interest on our table. He seemed annoyed that we only ordered appetizer portions of whole crab. 

It was a shame our waiter was such a goof because the food was delicious and simple (how I feel seafood is best).

We started with the steamed clams, I would bathe in the broth if I could. The crab was delicious and fun to crack open and eat, bib and all.  And no review of the Fog Harbor would be complete with out mentioning the clam chowder: it really was the best I've eaten here. Not too thick, clams so tender I almost couldn't believe they were clams. 

All together, a great stop. For a bottle of Chardonnay, clam appetizer, three appetizer clams and three cups of clam chowder our bill was around $200, as a heads up.
author: Kate S.

description: First time coming here, my server khaiman was very friendly, prompt, quick to deliver food and drinks. Always made sure everything tasted good and was great at keeping me topped up with water. Looking forward to coming back! The food I ordered was a clam chowder sourdough bowl, ate every last bite, my main was the mixed grill, and everything was cooked very nicely. Throughly enjoyed the food as mentioned before. Will definitely tell my friends about this place :)
author: Mercedes C.

description: Tourist place with good views and ambiance. Seafood is b-c grade stuff, decently executed. Get cioppino with crab in the shell - clearly canned otherwise to save $$.
author: Alex W.

description: We tried garlic roasted crab, it was just OK, it is better at crab house, we tried clam and mussel too but it was not good, we tried spicy shrimp it was good. Probably never going to visit again, not worth the price. Will go back to crab house!
author: Lali B.

description: The best dinner we had while in San Fran! Don't look anywhere else. The food was absolutely amazing.
author: Samantha A.

description: Ok, not sure why everyone is raving about this place. Really average. Chowder was bit rich for me, the cippolono was really salty but the crab meat was pretty sweet. Overpriced as per usual touristy places.
author: Natalie A.

description: Incredible view. Good, creamy delicious clam chowder. Generous with the sourdough bread. Had a highly rated pink margarita with egg froth on top. Sounds gross, but it's not. It's delicious. Get it and watch the beautiful bay. Think about how truly great life is. Repeat.
author: Jade H.

description: Sensory overload from all the touristy stuff resulted in just picking some place to eat, Fog Harbor Fish House in our case.  The atmosphere is very nice (duh! - most everything in San Francisco has "atmosphere")  and the wait staff was very professional in this rather large hustle bustle restaurant.  Food was mostly very good - crab ravioli and beet salad for daughter, bread bowl chowder & caesar for wife, and mixed grill seafood for self.  So was the food the best we have ever had?  No, but it was all very good.  Portions were modest and prices were somewhat on the high side, but hey .... what would one expect?
author: Dan O.

description:
I was lucky enough to have dinner here when I visited San Francisco in April. 

Our meals were all amazing. The fish was fresh, and cooked perfectly.  I still recall that lovely dinner with great longing and fondness.

Service was very quick, and on point. The server was great at anticipating our needs.

We had a table overlooking the bay, and it was sunset. We really enjoyed the beautiful view, paired with a great meal. 

When I return to the city, this will be a stop for me. Yum!
author: Karyn C.

description:
oysters - very fresh, tender, delicious with cocktail sauce 10/10

linguine and clams - only 3/9 opened clams,  not very flavorful 5/10

service - very slow 4/10

never coming back :))
author: Rose S.

description: This was my first time in SF and I went to this place and was amazed! The food, drinks and service were fantastic. Justin, our server, was amazing. Definitely try the salmon, it was delicious!!!
author: Jullisa S.

description:
This is a lovely restaurant with a beautiful view by the bay. My bf and I came in around 8pm on a Thursday. We made reservations, but was seated 30 mins prior to our reservation. 

We got sat down and was instantly stunned by the different selections of seafood plates. Before we ate we got a beer and cocktail and ordered our food. While we waited we sipped down our drinks and ate some bread and butter. We got the baked oysters, seafood cioppino, and seafood combo. 

As we got our food we were amazed of how big the dish was. The first dish we tried was the baked oysters. Must admit that it was pretty good! My boyfriend had calamari, fish, and fries. My dish consisted of clams, mussels, fish, shrimp, and crab. I was also looking forward to the pasta part. I wish they added a little more noodles to the dish. Other than that, it was great and fulfilling.

The service was okay. I know they tried their best to go above and beyond for great customer service, but I felt like we were waiting more than we had to.
author: Lisa K.

description: Great food, great crab. SAMIR was my server and he was very friendly and helpful. I would come here again.
author: Kimberley E.

description:
I made a reservation for this place on open table and the day before I noticed that my reservation had been cancelled on open table. I thought that was odd and made another reservation at approximately the same time. The day of my reservation I got a call from the restaurant asking if I really wanted two reservations or was that a mistake. I said I only needed one but my open table reservation had been cancelled and so I made another. The woman on the phone said the original reservation was on their books even though it wasn't on my open table app. As soon as I hung up the phone-my 2nd reservation was cancelled as well! So I ended up not getting the open table 100 points. I just thought that was strange but the experience at the restaurant made up for losing my 100 points. We were seated at a table in the bar area that I chose because it was pretty warm in the restaurant and this area was the coolest place. (I have hot flashes and a cool spot wins over a view any day) Our server Ron C came over and took our drink and appetizer order. I had the Perfect Hibiscus Margarita $12.5 (Voted SF Weekly's Best Margarita) 
El Charro Reposado, Patron Citronge, hibiscus syrup, fresh lime and agave served up and topped with Patron Citronge foam.
It was literally perfect and I very rarely order drinks in a restaurant because I am sooooo picky. I send more drinks back than I drink. 
We ordered a crab Louis salad as an appetizer and it was HUGE and delicious. We didn't expect it to be as large as it was. House made dressing was the cherry on top of this perfectly made salad. For my entree Ron suggested  the Ahi Tuna $26
Seared "RARE", sesame seed crust, ginger soy glaze, wasabi aioli, stir fried vegetables and garlic jasmine rice. I prefer medium rare so I ordered it that way and it came out perfectly. I keep using that word but I am serious when I say-I am a hard to please diner and this place was just hitting it out of the park. My husband and daughter couldn't believe it. My husband ordered the Cioppino $33
Crab, fresh fish, shrimp, clams, scallops and mussels, stewed in a seafood tomato broth, and he was very happy-he called it the best he's ever had.  It was a huge portion and that always makes him happy as well. 
Our 16 year old daughter did not find anything on the menu that she wanted so I encouraged her to order the clam chowder and caesar salad plate. She loves a caesar salad but she did not like the clam chowder. When Ron noticed that she basically hadn't touched it he commiserated with her about living in San Francisco and not liking clam chowder. He took it off the bill even though we told him not to since she had eaten the salad! In the end she ordered the  Blondie Sundae $8.5:
Chocolate chip style brownie square with walnuts, topped with vanilla ice cream, biscoff cookie crumbles and a biscoff sweet spread drizzle. Dessert is always her favorite. Juan the manager came over and asked us how our meal was and we told him how amazing it was and how accommodating our server was. He then told us that he wanted to comp our daughter's dessert because she didn't like her clam chowder. I was shocked. I mean they had already took it off the bill and then gave her a free dessert??? We didn't ask for any of that. I am truly impressed with their commitment to making their diners happy. I can say that I will recommend this place to anyone going to the San Francisco area!
author: Lisa D.

description: Delicious. Fried Cod with white beans and spinach. To die for. Clam chowder with fresh crab! Omg! I want more
author: Kim W.

description:
The food, service, and location were all excellent. Had the swordfish which was delicious!

The desserts are also really good.

Definitely worth a try.
author: Muja B.

description:
Tourist trap.

Not only we waited an hour in the sun, but we also had to wait another hour for the food ! To make it up, we just got offered a small soup to because the steak is "taking too long".

I had my hand raised up for more than 5 minutes (not kidding) until I got a refill on my water.
The food was alright, besides the fried dish of my friend that would have had better food at Bubba Gump or elsewhere cheaper.

A party of 5 that arrived 20min later received their food before ours even though they ordered similar plates.
author: Marc S.

description:
5 stars for view (window seat).   2.5-3 stars for the food.  2 stars for service.

I read all the reviews giving the food high marks, while others gave them poor ones.  The only thing I can think of is those positive reviewers must live in small towns with below average restaurants.   If anyone has ever been to Houston enough, they have inevitably visited one of the Pappas restaurants.  Foodies hate them because they are a privately owned chain, but their food quality is consistently a 4 to 5.  This restaurant paled in comparison....  But the view is worth it if you just content yourself with blah food.
author: Marianne T.

description: Reception wasn't the best part, I had to put pressure on the receptionist there that I'll go to another restaurant as waiting for 50 mins is too long, she said she might do 20 and we did take out table in 25 mins (4 people) - everything else was good, food and drinks were fantastic! Got surf and turf and was so happy with it!
author: Omar E.

description:
3.5/5, +.5 for service

Well, Fog Harbor was my first dinner stop in my 11-day trip down the west coast. Our theme was seafood for our San Francisco stops, since I personally have never been to the Pacific coast and really wanted to test out what's so great about their seafood.

We reserved via OpenTable and had to wait about 15-20 minutes for a window seat, but we did get a seat eventually and were promptly served.

Our dinner included the "award winning" clam chowder, dungeness crab cakes, garlic roasted crab, wild salmon, lobster tail, and the lobster mac and cheese. Well, the first thing we realized was we ordered way too much. I understood America and their big portions, but the portions were not just big, they were huge. The garlic roasted crab had to have been at least 5 pounds, and I was actually completely shocked my mom managed to finish the whole crab (although she didn't even touch the corn cob and potatoes). The lobster tail also tasted very good, and that we were actually able to complete. The award winning clam chowder definitely lived up to its name: Creamy (but not too creamy) soup with plentiful clam chunks and easy on the potatoes. The wild salmon was also good, however once again it was so large on portions we couldn't finish it. The lobster mac and cheese was baked and was probably the disappointment of the meal as it really didn't taste anything special, especially when comparing the other orders.

Service started brilliantly, and quite frankly I don't really blame the waitress that much for the slightly worse service we got as we were finishing our meal, since the restaurant closed at 10 and we were still eating at 10:45 (I did say the portions were huge!!!). We finally left around 11 and were the last customers departing the restaurant, having finally experienced seafood in the west coast...miles better than the east coast.
author: Calvin S.

description: Yes the wait is long if you don't have a reservation, but the wait was worth it! The mussel fries were excellent! We also enjoyed the salmon club salad. The salmon was grilled perfectly and the salad was very fresh. Our service was great as well. Would definitely recommend this place for food and ambiance.
author: Mara S.

description: We came for the view but mostly for the cioppino and clam chowder. We weren't disappointed. The cioppino was especially impressive with a thick broth, filled with seafood.
author: Gogo A.

description: We had the blue cheese garlic bread - yummmmmm. The baked oysters were 'ehhh' I would skip them and just go with the classic raw. The cioppini was full of seafood and tasty! Perfect way to warm up after a cold day of sight seeing.
author: Colleen C.

description:
The Backed Oysters were amazing! 
My friend's clam chowder was alright but not spectacular. The shrimp I ordered was cooked perfectly and matched the butternut squash and spinach!
author: Yume C.

description: Went here for Christmas Day dinner, had a good experience. Waited only about 20 minutes and although we didn't ask for a window seat they were nice enough to accommodate us! The wait staff were also friendly. My Dad had the fried shrimp and he loved it. The ratatouille  and the pumpkin bread pudding were very tasty.
author: Laura J.

description: The food was great along with the service from Samir! I also enjoyed the view of the harbor. My family ordered the calamari and crab cake for starters and then moved on to the bread bowl clam chowder; all excellent choices. The clam linguini and flounder entrees were very tasty as well. This restaurant is highly recommended.
author: Deb B.

description:
A good place to eat, the food is ok, not great, the beer is very good, the service is ok que thing that's a outstanding is the view and that saves the place from being a 3 star place. I'd recommend it... Price/quality I think the place is a little on the expensive side only because I don't think I got what I expected to have for the price I payed.

The only outstanding thing is the clam chowder... It is fantastic!!
author: Genaro V.

description:
I had trout, lobster, grape fruit juice, and dessert with latte.
Very tasty.  Great ocean view. Because of the location, this place is popular.  We were able get seats because 5 p.m. for dinner. 
Only thing is that I wish the plate was bigger as a big eater.
author: Kaori M.

description: My husband and I had dinner here last weekend and loved it!! He had the shellfish platter and I had the filet mignon.  Both were delicious!! The filet was cooked perfectly and the shellfish platter was overflowing with deliciousness.  We finished off a great meal with the vanilla bean creme brûlée.  The service was great! The one thing that bothered me a little was how crowded the seating area was.  But I would recommend this place to anyone!!
author: Samantha M.

description:
Absolutely loved this place! Place was great with an amazing view. Excellent service and fantabulous food: fresh, fast, classy. 
Highly recommend to those who love SeaFood! 
Great atmosphere and very busy place
author: Ovsick H.

description:
Just had Surf and Turf and Clam Chowder, both were great, except that we didn't like the sour bread.

The cost was $58 for Surf and Turf and $10 for clam chowder.

Recommended place if you are looking for somewhere to dine at Pier39.
author: Cholthicha K.

description: The best restaurant hands down ! Tasty food and great service !!! I had the half roasted crab and the flavor was excellent !! My boyfriend had the chicken penne and it was delicious as well !! We had calamari for appetizers and it was one of the best I ever tried !We also had a really nice water view ,we had a great time! highly recommend this place !
author: Joana H.

description:
Was unsure about this place to start with as it was super busy. Had to wait for seating for about 20mins. Once seated, we had a young bloke named Daniel whom was amazing. We soon realised why it was so busy. This place is awesome. Great food, fantastic service and beautiful views of bay and Alcatraz. Definitely  recommend anyone around Pier 39 head on into here. 
A+++
author: John R.

description:
Even though its centered in one of the most touristy areas in sf, Fog Harbor was an awesome standout seafood restaurant. Although the exterior isn't much to look at, once you go upstairs and even to the waiting area, it's a really nice fine dining experience. 

A few friends and I were really in the mood for oysters at around 11am and found fog harbor through yelp. The view from the inside is amazing as you can look out across the pier and see all the boats and tourists wandering about. 

My gf and I shared a dozen oysters ($25), a clam chowder bread bowl ($10) and a Dungeness crab roll ($19). I just had to order a crab dish as they just started their crab season just the day before.  

The oysters were freshly shucked (they shrunk as I added lemon juice) and very sweet, definitely did not disappoint. The clam chowder was very creamy and had lots of clams, although a bit lacking in the amount of actual chowder but its a novelty item so I didn't mind. The crab roll was overflowing with their crab mixture which had good amounts of crab that you could taste in a nicely toasted butter roll. 

At the end of our meal, our server notified us that they were doing a promotion in which you rate your experience on your smartphone on their website and you get a complimentary dessert!! And they aren't the skimpy "one ice cream scoop" desserts. Actual full fledged desserts like a 5" Creme brûlée, huge slices of tiramisu, bread pudding. We got the cranberry and apple crumb cake with vanilla bean ice cream. A great way to finish off the meal. 

Our meal for the two of us came to about $75 because we were also ordering a few beers. I would definitely come back here again. Service and quality of food was spot on.
author: Justin L.

description: Best linguine and clams I had in SF so far. Their crab clam chowder was delicious! I wish the crab was a little warm however because my soup turned lukewarm once I mixed the crab in. Coming back for sure !
author: Jane C.

description: Good little seafood joint. Wait was t bad and hey had benches and a nice wait area. Oysters are good, as are the bay scallop appetizer. Great view
author: Garrett A.

description: Great seafood, pleasant atmosphere. Good for lunch after a short tour around Pier 39.
author: Jieyu Z.

description: Good food, great views.  A little on the pricy side and the restaurant is a little dated.  Would eat here again.
author: Larry W.

description: The review is for the food.  I ordered the soup and salad.  It was mediocre.  The Caesar salad was good and refreshing.  The soup was pretty mediocre.  I've had better soup cheaper elsewhere but you pay mostly for the view.  The view is amazing!  Having a late lunch on a gorgeous day with the view of the ocean and clear view of Alcatraz, can't beat it!  I think next time, we'll skip the food and just enjoy a drink and dessert.  Haven't had them yet, hopefully they are worth the second trip.
author: Yisel F.

description: I had a red chili garlic shrimp. The sauce was great. Sour taste. The bread was spicy, delicious.
author: Mao Y.

description: We came here on a whim while in San Francisco for Valentine's Day weekend. The wait for a table was an hour but we were able to be seated immediately at the bar. We had Morgan as our bartender/server and she was excellent! I had my usual Moscato D'Asti and hubby had a local beer called 805 which was great! He had shrimp with chili sauce as an appetizer and I had the Caesar salad. (It was huge and more like a meal!) It was good but the dressing was a little too fishy for my taste (Yes, I know it has anchovies..LOL) The fish and chips was awesome and the batter was crunchy! We will definitely come here again!
author: Antoinette M.

description: Had appetizers today for late lunch early dinner and it was spectacular.  Calamari was great, crab cocktail  blue cheese garlic bread and crab salad.  Everything was to die for.  Really really enjoyed it and planning to bring my whole family back.  Give it a try. You won't regret it.
author: Sabrina R.

description: Food was good and the service was even better!  I had the choppino, my wife had the bread bowl chowder and my older son had the fish and chips.  We also had oysters to start and man were they fresh! I tasted all that we ordered and they were all very good.  The chowder was especially tasty and my wife's first bread bowl; she loved it! Our server was an older hispanic gentleman who was excellent!  We had a nice table with a great view of Alcatraz and the bay.  And my younger son, my little 22 month old monster, got to draw on the paper table cloth!  This place is unassuming from the outside but so classy and so welcoming on the inside.
author: H K.

description:
Sadly disappointed given all the previous great reviews which could only be explained by tourists who have never had delicious chowder. 

Service: Our waitress wasn't any help at all. I asked, as I always do at every restaurant, what are their popular items. She responded with the most dull and detached manner. I get it, it's annoying to get asked that question a million times a day, but hey guess what...it's your job. 

Food: I came here just for their "award-winning" chowder and it was far from award-winning in my opinion. The bread was a little too chewy for my taste. I prefer it to have more of a crispy exterior. The chowder was just chowder. My child's pasta had no flavor. It was like eating just cooked penne. Mussel fries were literally mussels topped with French fries, no wow-factor favors. Chili shrimp was good, but tasted like the one from Panda Express.

Overall it was an expensive, unenjoyable experience. One star for validating my parking and a great view of the pier.
author: Tammi T.

description:
Food
-Can I just say that everything we ordered today was delicious?!! Everything was freshly prepared. You can tell that you're not being served premade food that has been sitting there for a while. 
-Fish & Chips ($17): YUM!! Very fresh. This reminded me of a 10x better version of the fish in McDonald's filet-o-fish (I'm a huge fan of that fast food sandwich). It came with a generous amount of fish, french fries, and cole slaw. 
-Crab Roll ($19): The sandwich was a bit smaller than I expected, but it was amazing! The bread part reminded me of the outside of a grilled cheese, and the crab part was kinda like a dungeness crab salad. It also came with a side of sweet potato fries + more crab.
-Clam Chowder in Sourdough Bread Bowl ($10): Comparable to Boudin's but I might like this one even more.
-Garlic Roasted Crab ($19): I didn't try any of my dad's entree, but I'll include a pic of it. He said it was very tasty.
-I also loved the free bread that we got before our meal. It was still super hot, fresh, and crispy right from the oven. WIthin 5 minutes, our table already finished the first basket of sourdough and had to ask for more.

Ambience
-Right next to the water at Pier 39. We had a great view of the ocean, Alcatraz, and also the sea lions.
-Cute, simple, classy
-Nice fireplace outside in the front of the restaurant

Service
-Great!! The servers here are all very friendly and helpful.
author: Joyce Z.

description: Ordered two main course and both tasted amazing!! The server was super nice too, introduced all the menu and recommendations in great details. Adding the excellent view, it was all worth it!!
author: Liang E.

description: I came into this restaurant with high expectations and they were gladly fulfilled. After waiting to get seated, we were promptly greeted by our server Louane who offered us award winning selections from a nice looking book. We decided to choose something not part of the selections but were still delicious nonetheless. They give complimentary bread that is very warm and delicious! For appetizers, we got the fried calamari which tasted amazing! For entrees, we both got pasta which we were extremely satisfied with. A minor detail my SO pointed out to me was that they clean out their mussels, so that's a major plus. Now talking about the service. It was honestly one of the best service I have ever received in a restaurant. Louane was polite, kind but very fast with refills. Not once did I have to look around for her or ask for a refill. She was honestly on top of everything. Although I live 45 minutes away from the restaurant, the next time I'm in the area, I will definitely come back here to enjoy some good food and service.
author: Brandon M.

description: The place itself it's beautiful right next to a dock. Went here during night time and it was very pretty. I expected the food to be GREAT and it was not especially for the price they charge. But they do have friendly customer service.
author: Dsmorale D.

description: Delicious food, great wait staff and a gorgeous view! I highly recommend this for those who want great seafood and a nice ambiance. Props to our waiter Christian who provided excellent, friendly service!
author: Kiara P.

description: Delicious seafood and also great view so make sure you get an window seat. However the price is higher than expected and they ran out of most shellfish by our 5pm reservation. Would highly recommend the clam chowder in sour bread bowl.
author: Rebecca Z.

description:
OH MY GOODNESS!!!!  I made a reservation for this place for the boyfriends birthday, based on their award winning clam chowder bowl.  Well, due to unforeseen conditions, we were late.  VERY LATE.  But they were wonderful and very understanding... and sat us immediately at a window table for two.
