Now, I was expecting the food to be eh... okay for touristy san francisco.  I was WRONG.  WAY WRONG.  The calamari.... OMG.... probably the best we've had.  SOOOOOO GOOOD.
Their clam chowder breadbowls?  Oh Yeah... I get why they are award winning.  Please do yourself a favour and try it (though we both opted to pass on the crab meat on top... WHY would you have CLAM AND CRAB meat?).  The long island ice tea i ordered... probably the best I've EVER had (thank you mark).

Our waitress... shoot... I can't remember her name, but she had a pink flower headband in her hair.  She was the sweetest thing ever.  THANK YOU, THANK YOU, THANK YOU.  You really need a raise.  Seriously.  You made our lunch there PERFECT.  A million thank yous.

We were so full and well taken care of, that this was our only meal of the day, and ALL we needed.  We were too busy for breakfast, and too full for dinner... but our lunch was so AMAZING.... we didn't need anything else.

I promise you.... we WILL be back.  Soon!!!!!
author: Julie P.

description: Ate here a couple times over the last couple months - both times were very good.  One time got straight in and the other had a 30 minute wait.  But they do the text message method and you are able to walk around while waiting. The views are fantastic.  The food and service matched.  Started with some oysters - very good pacific coast ones.  Also tried the calamari - also very good.  Had the mixed grill one time and the pacific sole the other. Both were very good. Lastly they validate the parking for an hour for the main parking garage across the street - every bit helps.
author: P R.

description:
After doing some exploring in San Francisco for the day my boyfriend and I decided to eat lunch at the Fog Harbor Fish House. We were advised to not eat at Pier 39 since it's a tourist trap, low quality food with a hefty price tag. Even though we were advised not to eat at Pier 39, my boyfriend and I decided to give it a try anyways. We turned to yelp and saw that Fog Harbor had very good ratings based on their 1,000+ reviews.

For lunch on a Saturday, expect to wait. The wait wasn't too long considering how busy they were, we were seated within 20-30 minutes. Since my boyfriend and I love seafood we decided to order the Shellfish Platter for two. The platter comes with corns, shrimps, clams, mussels, and 1/2 a crab. While waiting for our order the waitress brought out fresh sourdough bread for us to enjoy and it was delicious.  

When I placed the Shellfish platter order I was excited for my seafood lunch, but when the plate came out I was hugely disappointed. The amount of seafood that was provided did not seem like it was meant for two people. The mussels were very tiny, so tiny that when I ate them I couldn't really taste mussels. My boyfriend and I established that they could've been cove mussels since they were so small. Some of the clams were missing the actual clams, we were served with just their outer shells. The crab was very delicious, I wish we had more! Butter is used as the sauce for the platter, but we opted out of it and the platter tasted fine. Just drizzle some lemons (which were provided) and you are set, a much healthier and tastier alternative. 

I also ordered a cup of the clam chowder. I am a fan of clam chowder and I had to try their "award winning house clam chowder". The chowder was good, but compared to other clam chowders I had, it was a little bit saltier than I preferred. It was still good since I ended up finishing the cup! 

Overall, for the price you are paying the quality and quantity of food was not worth it.
author: Channy M.

description: Seafood was epic!  Perfectly cooked lobster tail, clam and crab. The fireplace by the door kept us warm as we waited to be seated and the clam chowder was excellent!
author: Wesley B.

description: I absolutely love this place..Always have exceptional service! My friend is from out of town so I took her here because I love the view and their clam chowder w/ complimentary sourdough bread. The bread is so delicious and warm! We decided to order 1 fish n chips entree to share and they separated the portions into 2 different plates for us which was so nice! Always a great place to eat when at the pier. The total came out to be 34$ and we had leftovers.
author: Nancy V.

description: Great food! Fabulous service: friendly and helpful! The crab and avocado Caesar salad was amazing! Ahi steak lunch was prepared perfectly.
author: Kriste M.

description: This is one of the few times when everything went perfect from food to service.  This restaurant serves fish dishes that melts in your mouth without a hint of fishiness.  Our server Mel was always anticipating our needs, we did not have to call for refills.  I highly recommend this restaurant to my families and friends.  And the bonus is the view of the Golden Gate bridge and Alcatraz.
author: Mila E.

description: We love the foods here, as well as the desserts. The view was great and service was wonderful.
author: Peggy W.

description: Excellent!! We celebrated my birthday dinner here. The food was the best we had at Pier 39/Fisherman's Wharf. Pricey, but worth it. Service was great. Definitely recommend the Filet Mignon and the Clam Chowder. They were both Delicious!! Will definitely return here, if we visit SAN Francisco again.
author: Sarah S.

description: Great Cocktails & Dinner. Delicious Clam Chowder with hot sourdough bread.  Halibut entree was perfect.  Attentive, professional service. Pricey but worth it. Awesome View!
author: Tom T.

description: They say "award winning" clam chowder. Well they are right. Probably the best we ever had. We went back the next day and had it again for lunch. Dinner was great. I had the pacific sole. It was fabulous. The sour dough bread was hot and crunch. This is a great place.
author: Katherine B.

description: The food is unbelievable, they do not kidding when they said they have best clam chowder . It was out of this world clam chowder i ever have. The food is really good and the roasted garlic crab also amazing. The food, the Service is really great. Never dissapointed to dine here, always have the good experience here. Also the view is amazing.
author: Linna S.

description:
I loved this place so much. I had never tried Clam Chowder before, since it's not very common in my country. I think I couldn't have picked a better place to try it for the first time, 'cause it was amazing! In the end, my lunch was a bit expensive (~ U$ 45 without dessert), but it was worth it because of the entire experience: the food, the place, the view from the window close to me - I got to see the pier, boats, the sea and Alcatraz as I enjoyed my meal.
I ordered clam chowder as a starter, and my main plate was the Ahi Tuna (also very delicious). To drink I chose the Juice Press (berries, lemonade and sparkling water), which was refreshing.
author: Bruna Z.

description:
Gorgeous views, friendly service and delicious food! 

Location - great location! Conveniently located at pier 39 on the 2nd floor

Service - staff from the host to the waiters were very friendly.  We were seated quickly and at a nice window table with gorgeous view.  Our waiter was nice & thoughtful without being overbearing.  

Food - food was fabulous!  We had the grilled salmon, crab stuffed lobster and crab & avocado salad.  ALL of our dishes were completely devoured as they were just scrumptious!  Portions weren't significant, at least not the salmon, but can't complain.  It was all good.
author: Marella M.

description:
Came here with my friend to celebrate my birthday two nights ago. I'd been craving clam chowder for over a week and I wanted to see if this place really had the "best clam chowder in SF".

I booked a reservation for 6:15 and called to change it to 6:45 and the lady on the phone was fairly accommodating and friendly. When we arrived, we were immediately seated at a table by the window (probably because I had mentioned that we were celebrating a birthday on our reservation) with a spectacular view of Alcatraz and the seals! Our amazing waiter, David, came by and introduced us to some special dishes on the menu. He also knew it was my birthday and told me they would prepare a chocolate dessert for us. When he came back with our drinks, we just ordered two bread bowls (we weren't crazy hungry because had sundaes two hours earlier). I knew about the Yelp check-in offer for the free appetizer but didn't now it only came with an order of an entree, but David was so kind and said he would bring us one out because it was my birthday. 

The bread bowls were fairly large and definitely met our expectations. It was presented nicely (it wasn't messy like most bread bowls we order from other places) and not too salty or bland. Perfectly creamy. Had a lot of clams and potatoes too. Clam chowder is my favorite soup (and arguably one of my favorite foods in general) and I'd have to say this was the best I've ever had. Our only complaint would be there wasn't enough soup. The actual bread the soup came in was HUGE, but I'd say there was only about two cups of soup in the actual bread bowl. I was alright though (my friend was still a bit hungry but luckily we had our free appetizer!) because I was stuffed when I finished. I couldn't even finish the bread! 

Our waiter came by many times to ask us how our dishes were and how we were doing and even sang me happy birthday when he brought us our free chocolate dessert! The chocolate cake was a bit too sweet but it was extremely rich and went well with the scoop of vanilla ice cream next to it. 

Our bill only came to about $24 only because we had ordered two bread bowls, but it was amazing considering the fact that we got a free appetizer and dessert.

OVERALL:
Clam chowder bread bowls - Best I've ever had and I'm a local! Not too salty and not too bland either. Only wish there was more soup and it was less pricey.

Blue cheese bread appetizer - I love garlic bread and I love cheesy bread but this wasn't that good. I've never really liked the taste of blue cheese so this definitely wasn't my favorite. But it won't hurt to get it for free if you check in on yelp!

Service - absolutely amazing. The waiters were all extremely nice, especially David. 

Ambiance/View - has one of the best views of Pier 39. If you happen to get a seat on the left of the restaurant by the Bay, you'll be able to see Alcatraz and the area where the seals are. I specifically chose a reservation right before sunset and the view of the water was breathtaking. If it's too sunny they have blinds they'll be happy to pull down (or up) for you. Restaurant wasn't too loud and the restaurant was pretty busy (esp. for a Wednesday night). 

**they'll also validate your parking ticket for up to 4 hours if you came by car

I'll definitely be coming back again!
author: Sharon C.

description: This place has the best view ever! So pretty. The food is great! The service is great! Very professional! The clam chowder here is a bomb!! This place has winning award for their clam chowder. The seafood are very fresh! I will definitely come back here again.
author: Gigi M. N.

description: Fog Harbor Fish House is one of places that you should check out when you are in pier 39. It can be pricy but I would recommend getting clam chowder soup and their seafood pene. I should have gotten calamaris too but I completely forgot about them....
author: Charles K.

description:
Delicious! This place came recommended from a local we met on the street. He was 100% right. The food was excellent, service was excellent and the drinks were you guessed it EXCELLENT! 

I'd eat here every day if I lived in San Francisco. 

Our waiter was very nice and gave some great food suggestions.
author: Brian B.

description: This was the first time I've been to Fog House, and I have to say I was incredibly impressed with the service (and food) from start to finish. The wait was less than 20 minutes for a party of 4 during the lunch hour rush on a Friday. Our waiter, Samir was very attentive and even joked with us about our entire table playing Pokemon Go. Our clam chowder and fish and chip dishes all came out promptly and piping hot. I picked Fog House as a destination for my auntie who is visiting the States for the first time and I'm so glad that the food and the service did not disappoint. I'll be back again next time I'm in town!
author: Christine P.

description:
Food was decent, service was decent, ambience was very nice. 

I went with 3 other people,  and we ordered 3 of their fish entrees, their linguine, and calamari. All of the food was good, but not excellent or particularly memorable. I would say it was a little on the pricey side for the average quality of food.

However, I would recommend this place as a quiet, nice, and classy restaurant where you can eat okay food with company and enjoy the view of the water.
author: Roslyn L.

description:
My husband and I were vacationing in San Francisco and we decided to visit this restaurant based on the Yelp reviews, and I really had a taste for seafood. It was a Sunday and based on recommendation of Yelp reviews, we made a reservation on OpenTable. The only one they had available was for 5:30pm. But when we got there, there were plenty of table available so...I don't know.

They sat us at a table with a view of the water and setting sun. Beautiful. Our waiter was...a rock star. I asked for a virgin strawberry daiquiri but they brought it with whip cream which I can't have. My husband took it and our waiter brought another one on the house. We ordered one of their appetizer specials, risotto and crab fritters. We didn't like it but didn't complain. Our waiter asked how we liked it and we were honest. So he said we could order something else on the house. Who does that!? Plus he didn't hover and wasn't distant. We gave him 20% tip.

We ordered the following:

Clam chowder - delicious!
Crab mango ceviche - yum
Crab risotto balls fritters - okay
Lobster tail - yum
Seafood Cioppino with pasta - yum

I would have ordered dessert if they had cheesecake.

I wouldn't mind coming back. Good for groups, dates. There is validated parking in the garage, just remember to give your waiter the ticket. The Pier also has other cool places the check out.
author: Teresa J.

description:
Great atmosphere, and food was good. 

Crab cocktail, tuna tartare tower, and mussels prepared in the clam sauce.. everything was good!
author: Missy K.

description:
Did not like the hostess attitude towards my friends and I. We are all in our 20s, of ethnic background, and because of that I think the hostess place us all the way in the back next to the bathroom in a pretty much empty restaurant. I had clam chowder which was nothing special. Entree was linguini with clams which was watery and clams were not cleaned properly. Did not even finish quarter of it. 

Although our waiter provided exceptional service I will not be returning.
author: Sarina S.

description:
From start to finish the food was simply delicious at a great price
Service impeccable and portions generous

You cannot beat this place. It rivals others at comparable prices
Great scenery
Would definitely come again and again
author: L C.

description: Fabulous food, exceptional service! The drinks were refreshing and moderately priced!  So glad we decided to sit down and eat :) The view of the bay is stunning and it looks like you could touch Alcatraz!
author: Allison M.

description: We ate a quick lunch here and were very pleased. Overall it was a beautiful restaurant and the service was great. We ate at the bar and the bartender was super helpful and nice. We got the Cod special, a crab cake, and the chowder. I am not a chowder fan but my husband loved it. The crab cake was delicious and the cod was amazing. We also enjoyed some cocktails at the bar which were delicious as well. This is definitely not a cheap lunch spot, nor would i expect it to be. I think it was worth the cost for the food, drinks and the views and hopefully will get to come back again soon!
author: Lauren H.

description:
I just went to this establishment for the second time with my girlfriend, and once again it did not disappoint. Great environment, great food (crispy lemon calamari), and great vibes. We both live in San Francisco and this restaurant still seems to pull us in to the touristy abyss. 

 When you stop by, ask for Khaiman to be your server. He is very quick, efficient, and genuine with customers.
author: Lance B.

description: Had my birthday dinner here! It's a great experience. We got a free dessert for my birthday. Samir was our server, he made sure we had a great dinner experience and even sang a birthday song for me. How lovely!
author: Yuehan W.

description: Delicious food with a fantastic view of the water, as well as fantastic service from Nev!! Definitely would recommend for a seafood dinner in SF.
author: Betsy M.

description:
You can't go to San Francisco without stopping at Pier 39 to act "touristy".

Fog Harbor has a cozy and classy entrance with a fireplace and nice seating area.  Inside, they had Christmas lights and trees to make the place look festive for the holidays.

I ordered a cup of the clam chowder and the fish and chips.  The soup was good and creamy, but my favorite creamy clam chowder is still the one at Boudin.  The fish and chips were a generous serving, but I wasn't crazy about the cole slaw (needed some sugar) and the tartar sauce.  Sourdough bread was fabulous! Nevertheless, Martin, the server, was outstanding!  You don't find many servers as helpful, friendly, and accommodating as him.

The check had an added fee of 94 cents and when I asked about it, it had something to do with a fee the city supposedly tacks on to provide for uninsured workers or something...Hmm...
author: Julie F.

description:
I really don't like comparing restaurants BUT since I had the opportunity to eat at Fog Harbor and Crab house, which both are seafood restaurants and at pier 39, why not?  Fog Harbor takes the cake between the two in my opinion.  

First off, the complimentary bread was fresh out of the oven and heated!  I swear the bread was like crack!  I just couldn't stop eating it.  Despite being on a mission to lose weight and 'low carb' it, I couldn't help myself.  The bread served deserved 5 stars on its own!

The salad was refreshing and tasty!  They use mixed greens, unlike the other competitor with their iceberg.  

The clam chowder was outstanding!  It had a real good amount of clams in it.  It was very hearty and filled me up.  Mama dukes had it in a bread bowl and I ordered the regular bowl, which was fine because they serve more than enough complimentary sourdough bread.

The crab & shrimp sandwich was a little too bland for my taste though.  I think it needed a little more flavor to it.  Perhaps salt?  

Our server was a sweetheart.  Kept checking up on us and he looked like Liam Hemsworth.  A total plus!

The end to our meal is even sweeter with our Biscoff cookie.  Can't get any better than that!

If I had to choose between which seafood restaurant I'd like to eat at, it would be Fog Harbor!
author: Mel B.

description:
Came here for lunch after visiting Alcatraz. Awesome view of the bay, The Golden Gate Bridge and The Rock. Food was awesome, beer was nice and cold and the cocktails were great too. 

We started off with Mussel Fries - nice broth at the bottom of the bowl, mussels and delicious French fries with a nice sauce drizzled on top. The broth was awesome for dipping bread in (there wasn't much left). 
The Ahi Poke Tuna appetizer was outstanding. Tasted super fresh and came with nice chips. Full of fresh avocado and mango. Highly recommend it. 
Also try the blue cheese garlic bread if you're into that, it was good as well. 
For entrees we ordered the Crab Legs which were large and juicy, a huge plate of crab legs (enough for 2 people if you're splitting a meal). 
The fried fish n chips were great too. 3 large chunks of fried fish and French fries too. The fish was nice and fresh (just what you'd expect from a place in the wharf) and was fried perfectly. 
We also ordered the Pacific Cod (special of the day) which was grilled to perfection. Not dry and hard, it was just great. 
All in all a great meal. And the server was super nice as well, couldn't have asked for more. Highly recommend for lunch.
author: Jorge G.

description: We stopped into San Francisco for lunch before we flew back home to Texas. We were craving some seafood and had the best dinner and service here. Our server, Tyler was so helpful with selecting the perfect dish, because I always want a nice variety. He didn't recommend the most expensive meal, but actually a special with scallops, shrimp, and lobster tail skewers, which was a great value and was amazing. I left very satisfied and everyone loved their meal. Beautiful view, amazing seafood and clam chowder bread bowl as or shared appetizer. You can't go wrong stopping in here!
author: Trecia H.

description:
Excellent services and food! The atmosphere is really good especially at night, you can see the sea and sunset.

The staff handed us a menu with pic of food and showed us what's popular in the restaurant . We ended up ordering a shellfish platter for 2, clam chowder and clam linguini. It's nice of them to split a linguini into two separate plates so we can all had some!

Overall it was the best $$ seafood restaurant I ever been in SF. Highly recommend.
author: Christy Z.

description:
Fog Harbor was an amazing dinner! I had the swordfish and my girlfriend had the NY steak - both of which could be described as mouth watering because of the way each melted. We also had the 1/2 lb garlic crab for a starter and this was by far the best crab I have ever eaten! 

Easily, The flavor and freshness of our entire meal was way beyond what I would have ever expected! Our waitress Jac was great too, making sure we loved our different 'vegie cocktails' and that our dinner was enjoyable. 

Highly recommend!!
author: Lucas P.

description:
Not impressed, value equation was way off.  Fried combo was decent but the cole slaw was very marginal.  My family enjoyed the mixed grill.  I had the Cioppino, portion was great and was enough for a light meal for two people, I wasn't very impressed with the quality of the seafood, fish and scallops were dry.

The best thing about my meal was the Alcatraz cocktail.  It was delicious!

Wait staff and management staff were very attentive but this was a tourist trap that I won't recommend or repeat.
author: Mona M.

description: Food was legit! Best seafood restaurant I've been to in a long time. Definitely start with the chowder and recommend the cod special or the cioppino.
author: Billy N.

description: My husband and I came to San Fran for the first trip night of our honeymoon. The view was great, the food was super solid, and the service was good too. So glad we had such a great dining experience on such a special day.
author: Mallisa M.

description:
No bread or crackers included with chowder. Bread is .25 a slice. Bread bowl heavily pushed. No crackers available at all. 
$7 a small bowl. 
Good chowder though.
author: Suzanne P.

description:
Four of us shared the crab ceviche, clam chowder in a bowl, seafood platter for 2, and the cioppino. Total was something like $130 before tip... (pricy!)

Nothing was particularly remarkable. My favorite dish was the seafood platter - the shrimp, clams, mussels and crab were seasoned simply (garlic salt pepper butter) to really let the platter be about the taste of the seafood. Yum! But nothing I want to pay for at a restaurant. The cioppino was _really_ disappointing, tasted like a can of tomato puree dumped on a bunch of seafood. 

I won't be coming again.
author: Jenn W.

description: Service awesome !! Great dirty martini!! Must try the clam chowder w/ the Dungeness​ crab!! Blue cheese garlic bread!! Great place for someone who doesn't eat seafood ,you have options. The view is amazing !! Have to have the chocolate cake !! Wow !!! We will be back for sure !!!
author: melissa a.

description: Absolutely amazing! Must try. The oysters are so fresh, not overly fishy taste. The sourdough bread is warm with a great crust and soft inside. We had the clam chowder in a bread bowl and it was to die for! Great views as well!!
author: Jenny P.

description:
During my trip to San Francisco - my friend and I stopped here on a Sunday evening. I'm grateful we did!

We sat at the bar after we put our names on the list to be seated. The drinks I had were excellent! I had the Lombard Lemonade and the Lipstick Lemondrop...mmmm. I also liked that they had "lower calorie drink options" on the menu. (Since I was on vacation - the calories didn't count - but just in case for another time where I'm on perfect diet behavior)...

Once we were seated, our server was very attentive and provided excellent service. The complimentary bread was delicious - or maybe I just love sourdough. For my entree, I had the mixed grill -  which was perfect because I couldn't make up my mind on what kind of seafood I wanted. It was plenty of food, but I didn't finish the meal miserably full. 

The ambiance of the restaurant was pretty nice too; I liked our view of the bay. 

When I come back to San Francisco, I'd love to eat here again!
author: Paula S.

description:
Swordfish was very good. It looks like chicken, has the texture of steak, and the mixed taste of chicken and a mild fish flavor. Some tasty herbs on it too.

Wonderful view of the bay. Lots of unique menu items. A bit pricey, but understandable given the location and quality.

Had to wait probably 40 minutes for them to call me because it was so busy. So I just went and enjoyed the cool souvenir shop downstairs.
author: Pdog E.

description: I wanted a delicious seafood meal before leaving the bay area at a place that had plenty of gluten free options. My girlfriend and I decided to give this place a try even though it being located in the Pier 39 tourist trap and we weren't disappointed. The menu labeled everything that was gluten free and the service was outstanding. Everything we ordered was mouth watering from the shrimp appetizer, my ahi tuna and caesar salad, and she had swordfish, shrimp, and salmon plate with a cup of clam chowder. I would go back here in a heartbeat.
author: Matthew D.

description: Great views, reasonable prices for the location, average seafood. We shared the shellfish platter for two and we were all surprised when they said it was the full "for-two" version. Nice experience, nothing special about the meal though.
author: Holly A.

description: The lobster tail is a must! Super delicious!! And this restaurant is perfectly located for a day or night of fun. Great view of Alcatraz and can see the sea lions only a few steps away from the restaurant. Also from most of the restaurant there is a beautiful view. It's located by a bunch of shops and there is a potential to catch a perfect sunset. The whole menu is full of great choices. The seafood dishes are the specialty but I had the chicken penne which is also delicious. Also hands down best clam chowder in SF! Check it out!
author: Sami F.

description:
Service was a bit lacking, but the food was delicious. I ordered the mixed grill after it was suggested by the manager who stopped by our table. Excellent choice.
Good food & a wonderful water/marina view.
author: Mama M.

description: Clam Chowder, Steak, & Shrimp Was very well seasoned and tasted delicious. Our waiter was great thanks again Khaiman!
author: Valerie R.

description:
1. Wonderful ambiance, overlooking the harbor  
2. Blue cheese sourdough bread was incredible, especially when dipped in the Cioppino tomato sauce 
3. Cioppino is a specialty dish consisting of a mix of clams, fish, mussels, scallops, and crab in an exquisitely seasoned tomato sauce. Ridiculously good
4. Some sort of apple crisp dish with ice cream for dinner was not bad, but wouldn't get it again
author: Samuel E.

description: View was great. Clam chowder was good, oyster (raw) was fresh, crab linguini and cioppino was good. The problem were that I got a shrimp shell in my chowder and I got food poison afterward :(
author: Anya C.

description: Went in for my mom's birthday. I ordered the salmon she ordered the mixed grill and everything was absolutely amazing. The salmon was cooked perfectly, the sauce was delicious and the drinks were great. Our server was very kind and helpful, sadly I do not remember his name. Definitely recommend!
author: Ana C.

description:
It's nice to be a tourist in your own city every now and then - and when your city happens to be in the top 3 most photographed places in the world (see a study done at Cornell) and just a world class place overall, it's even better.

To be honest I have never eaten at Pier 39 nor have I even set foot here since moving to SF but we went to the Aquarium and figured we could get dinner and get parking validated.

The restaurant itself had an excellent ambiance and the food was fresh. The clam chowder in a bread bowl really was good (not hyped). Other dishes were ordered were the shrimp skewers and trout, both very fresh and tasty. The Dungeness crab fritters with risotto was definitely one to get.

Not sure when I'll be back but it was a nice dinner with excellent service, and a beautiful view.
author: Julia P.

description: Amazing. One of the best meals I have ever had. Tyler, our server, was phenomenal. Definitely coming back whenever I can!
author: Caitlin A.

description: Just ask for Ashley G. :) she knows the good stuff,  but the deserts in general not their best, sea food place so eat sea food, and the view is just breathtaking... Enjoy!
author: Sima N.

description: My boyfriend and I were in San Francisco for 2 nights and we decided to have dinner here. Everything was perfect. Nice view, delicious food and awesome service.  Next time we're in San Francisco we're definitely coming back!
author: Nancy A.

description:
Ordered the Caesar salad; a dozen oysters; and white wine to start the meal. Daniel only poured our wine once and came back at odd times during our meal; almost took away our 95% complete salad and I wanted my last few bites. Took a while before we received our appetizers from the start and bread was super late. I did ask for balsamic vinegar and olive oil and they accommodated me instead of butter so that was delicious. Oysters were huge and fresh but no different than outside fishermen wharf market minus they had sit down luxurious tables and a delicious salty sauce and cocktail sauce for the oysters. Salad was refreshing to wash the grease down. 

Swordfish was cooked deliciously. Seafood was good but 10 % of the muscles were missing it's meat. Clam chowder was good - not as creamy as outside boudin and in lesser quantity and still needed a bit of salt and pepper;  we like to order the chowder in a regular bowl instead of the bread so it's not too filling and not an entire bread bowl gets wasted.

Dessert tray was presented during our meal when we weren't finished yet and this felt lazy. Out of convenience the server asked us for a dessert choice when we were still eating. We didn't like this.

Overall food was good. Wait was long but understandable; and seafood fix was satisfied. If you don't mind standing - you can get the same great food experience standing and eating seafood at the wharf.
author: James L.

description:
It was alright. Not somewhere I'd go again. The price didn't really match up to the food. :/

The calm chowder was really good tho - should've gotten that I'm the bread bowl with a salad. Lessons learned.

The Moscato D'asti was good tho.
author: Shay V.

description:
Great restaurant. We were recently in the Pier 39 area - had just finished a tour of Alcatraz and wanted to check out the seals and grab some food. After a quick glance at all the menus, we finally decided on Fog Harbor Fish House. 

The menu is pretty pricey, but the food is pretty good. Fresh warm sourdough bread was complimentary, which was surprisingly delicious (Note: I am a sourdough snob). 
We ordered the following: beet and blue cheese salad, california crab and avocado caesar salad, the soup and salad combo (caesar salad and a clam chowder bread bowl), and the crab roll. Didn't get a chance to try dessert, but the dessert tray they had looked amazing! 

Great views of the Bay and the seals!
author: Irene L.

description: Nothing bad to say about this amazing restaurant.  To start, we were seated at the best table in the house and greeted with a smile by Tyler.  I work in customer service and know a level 5 server when I see one.  Tyler went above and beyond to ensure we were taken care of, our drinks and food were on point, and we are beyond satisfied customers.  Tyler, you ROCK and Fog Harbor is lucky to have you!!
author: Catherine M.

description:
Wow, really yummy seafood here. The roasted garlic crab was amazing, very flavorful and nice and hot! Our party ordered various items from a seafood variety plate to sliders, curry shrimp, calamari, oysters, crab, and fish. Everything got rave reviews. The pasta dishes were good too, but definitely not at the same level as the rest of the food.

One star off due to the service being extremely slow. The restaurant was very busy but so are a lot of restaurants around the area and they manage to get people in and out in a timely manner. We were there for about 2 hours and didn't even order dessert. Well worth the wait though.
author: Honest R.

description:
One of thee best experiences EVER! My family and I dined on a weeknight, nice crowd...but we were seated right away.  We chose the famous Clam Chowder w/crab as our starter and oh boy did it live up to the hype! Amazing clams and full of crab! It does not disappoint! 
We ordered our entrees. Seafood platter for one, Choppino, Crab cakes, Shrimp po' boy and Seafood Penne. Everything was seasoned to perfection and nicely portioned.  Ok so here's the really good part, we noticed that there is a photo shoot behind us, they were taking pictures of this fabulous seafood tower. The manager walks up to our table and says, hey they're almost finished, the platter hasn't been touched would you guys like to have it? Wha??? Of course we would! From Dungeness Crab, Shrimp to Lobster claws! It was perfect! What a wonderful experience! We loved the food and the hospitality at Fog Harbor. We would def recommend to all of our friends!
author: Chantell S.

description:
We had a gorgeous experience at our second visit to the fog harbour. The server was a Hawaiian fellow who was very eager to provide some tourist tips and to have some friendly banter.
The clam chowder was sublime, creamy, textural, and seasoned well. A true highlight as the menu suggests. We had the. Ran cakes and crab stuffed lobster for main which both rounded out a great meal. The lobster was cooked perfectly with the welcomed addition of crab to give two distinct flavours. The crab cakes were seasoned well, had a nice crunch to the shell and were a good size for the money. The location is a dream for an Aussie like
Myself with Alcatraz and golden gate in the background, providing a postcard like backdrop. In summary a strong performing meal with superb service has given me a second great experience from this restaurant.
Food 8/10 9/10 decor 7/10
author: John A.

description: First time at Fog harbor Samir gave us the the best service , we will come back again great guy good service and good food , we are from the the Philippines
author: Marigene M.

description: One of San Francisco's best  restaurants. I brought my three kids here and we had the best food, but more importantly the best service! Jessica was our server and didn't miss a trick. The service was so good my 3 teenage children remarked what a good waitress she was!
author: Kelly M.

description: First dinner in San Francisco and it didn't disappoint. Service was personable, attentive, and prompt. Drinks were more than sufficiently supplied with alcohol. The sourdough bread was fantastic. Their clam chowder is a MUST! Friend and I shared the Shellfish Platter for 2...divine! Definitely will return on my next visit to San Francisco.
author: Jacqueline V.

description: Ordered the famous chioppino and it was highly disappointing! It was very bland and also kind of cold. Was not worth what I paid at all. The linguine and clams was good and I would recommend that, but the portion is kind of small. The service was good but overall the best part was the view and the sour dough bread. So sad to have spent all that money and really wanted to have an enjoyable lunch with my family, we were not impressed.
author: Bonnie S.

description: I always come here when I'm in SF. Came on a Tuesday night. Was able to get a booth. Great view. Fresh food. Perfect margarita.
author: Queen G.

description:
I am always concerned about places in a very tourist heavy area. For while they might have nice presentation they have nothing forcing them to make an exceptional product. 

After waiting 30 minutes we were brought to a very nice dinning room area that overlooked the water. Ordering the calamari to start with a coupon that is provided by the visitors center and to eat my son got the Mac and cheese, my wife got a custom designed linguine with garlic crab dish and I ordered the crab ceviche (avocado, mango and fresh pulled crab meat).

The calamari came and I was worried about the other items we ordered. It was not awful, but tasted like any other frozen squid with breading and very little seasoning which was a little over fried. I even sampled the "aioli" which is really become just a new way for a restaurant to put mayo in a ramekin and call it something cooler. That being said it did not help much and I was not looking forward to the meal.

Then the waitress came with a basket filled with sourdough bread and it was exceptional. Did not ask for it, but the timing was perfect and just as we enjoyed our first piece the good bread... The food arrived-

My ceviche was amazing! The quality of the seafood is evident on the first bite and I felt like the combination of flavors that was more than I expected. The avocado was very flavorful and the mango was such a mild taste that all together it was a perfect mix. I cannot say anything bad about this dish except it was an appetizer and wish I ordered two.

The linguine was cooked with garlic, sun dried tomatoes, spinach and garlic crab meat. It was actually from the chicken penne pasta sub crab and linguine. This was a great way to try some fresh crab meat and the way it was pulled and placed on top of the pasta you could have some crab in every bite. The sun dried tomatoes played a great supporting role of adding color and a great finish to every few bites that were lucky enough to have some in it.

Lastly was my sons Mac and cheese. I never find it worthy of saying much about kid items, but this macaroni and cheese was gourmet and the steamed broccoli about as fresh tasting as can be.

This was a great final bite on our visit to San Fran! We will be back!!!
author: Vincent V.

description: Had a wonderful experience and delicious food here, a huge thanks to our waitress SUSAN. She had the sweetest spirit and was extremely customer friendly. She reminded us about the parking validation, and to take our receipt. Of course, being distracted by my handsome date, we forgot! Leave it to Susan, she found us before we could get far enough and handed us our receipt to ensure we got parking taken care of. Clam chowder, ahí, and shrimp were delicious too- but this experience was all about the people and service. Thank you Susan!!!
author: Jackie R.

description:
I had a good old friend coming to town and he wanted to have seafood. Since he's new to the city I decided to venture into Pier 39 for its convenience, but wondering whether we would end up in a "tourist trap". That was not the case.

Food was good and so was the service. We got a nice table by the window with beautiful view over Golden Gate and Alcatraz.

We both had Lobster + Crab as main dish and it was super fresh. The warm sourdough bread was also very good. Many of the dishes are not cheap ($25-$35) but you can still find some stuff at around $12-$20.

Overall great experience and wouldn't mind going back!
author: Nuno S.

description: Service and food was on point! Amazing waterfront view. Best Clam Chowder I've ever tasted in the city. Love the Chili Garlic Shrimp. Highly recommend this place to those who's craving seafood.
author: Roger X.

description: This place is on pier 39, so it's pricey. The food is decent. The garlic bread with blue cheese and crab. Yummy. Like I said, the rest, pretty decent. The server, although nice, forgot our bread, the sourdough they serve when your seated....took forever with our ice tea, and then we ordered a dessert after our meal, creme Brule, which was pretty good, but we had ordered a hot tea each, he even asked if I needed cream......he NEVER brought it. Sad, the place is always busy, but I usually sit at the bar, much better service!
author: Nikki K.

description: The wait time was less than predicted but not every table affords a view of the Bay. Service was great and food was good but not worth the cost. The Moscow mules were weak. If you're looking for good food at a reasonable price look elsewhere.
author: Zoila C.

description:
My boyfriend and I decided to take a day trip to the wharf and decided to try this restaurant out.

He had a mixed seafood pasta that he said was really good.  I had the mixed grill plate with shrimp, salmon and swordfish. It also came with mashed potatoes and mixed veggies.  I thought the seafood was very fresh and delicious.

We both started the meal with a cup of clam chowder and both agreed that we could have eaten a bowl.  It was the best clam chowder that I ever can recall eating.  It was perfectly thick with potatoes and loaded with clams.  

Our server was very nice and prompt.  We never had to ask for a refill.

It was a tad pricey, but what isn't on the wharf of San Francisco.   2 cups of chowder, 2 entrees and 2 cokes ran us right about $85.
author: Heidi S.

description: I came here on a Saturday before the 49ers game and boy was I disappointed. After reading all of these wonderful yelp reviews, I was so excited. The wait was a decent time (20-30 mins) and I love that they text you so you can wander around until you're called.  That's where things went south.We ordered the linguine, the blue cheese garlic bread and the clam chowder in the bread bowl with crab. The linguine wasn't cooked well on top of being cold with an interesting taste. The soup was cold so we had to send it back. However the garlic bread was delicious. It was also kind of busy so don't expect quick service. I gave it 3 stars due to the wait and the great view of the bay.
author: Jae L.

description:
Everyone on our party LOVED the food quality and location. Absolutely Fab!!!
Service quality was top notch as well, thanks for taking off the price of one entree off our bill, since it arrived a little later than the others, due to Friday Night busy hours... but we completely understand and thanks for acknowledging this. We will certainly be coming back SOON!!
Just a suggestion: please increase the range of beers you carry on your menu, just saying, from a beer drinker's perspective.
author: Janel P.

description: This restaurant has a brilliant view.  The soup and salad is a good deal.  The bread bowl was fantastic, but the soup wasn't earth shattering good.  I would eat here again simply for the view.
author: Tracy H.

description: Amazing!!! Clam chowder and fish and crips were delicious! Good service and a nice atmosphere. Beautiful view. Ask for a window seat if you can.
author: Rebekah H.

description: Enjoyed the cioppini (tomato seafood stew). I am allergic to dairy and gluten and could not eat clam chowder. So the hostess recommended the cioppini .Apparently a san francisco original and must try. The 32$ price was worth it and the serving size plentiful with lots of seafood for the picking. YUM-O!!
author: Vee D. H.

description: Incredible cioppino -- the best I've had, and I consider myself an aficionado. The seafood portions were great, and the broth itself was hearty and full of flavor (instead of being an afterthought). Gold stars all around to the staff -- they are warm and personable. I had multiple servers stop by to check in and see how I was enjoying myself (answer: IMMENSELY). I'm here for a business trip and they were warm and accommodating for my table of one. I'll definitely be back!
author: Maggie M.

description: If you decide to eat at Pier 39, this is one of maybe two places that locals will recommend. We went for the clam chowder in bread bowls. The food did not disappoint and this was about the cheapest meal I had in SF.
author: Ben K.

description:
Our server was awesome! Checked in on us often, refilled our drinks with out us asking, made sure we didn't need anything else
The food was amazing and delicious 
Would recommend, would return
author: Mary V.

description:
Awesome food and cocktails....beautiful location and decor....friendly prompt service. Will be back!

We had ahi starter and oysters with sourdough.
author: Mary S.

description:
A really nice sea food restaurant if you're near the pier. The view is great, especially if right before sundown. I also noticed that the restaurant is really well run. Through the open door to their back room I could see their ops schedule - very impressive whiteboard with names and rows. And the service lined up with that. Everything was quick, and no mistakes. 

I also noticed that the restaurant was determined to get reviews. Case and point: I got a free appetizer for checking in and a free desert for giving a quick review (note that it was a review on their website. My yelp reviews can't be purchased with a desert or anything else!) 

The food was good, hot, and came out quickly. It just wasn't that unique; it didn't have a chef's touch, which is the primary reason for my 4 rating. But I did enjoy the experience and would certainly go back.
author: Nate M.

description: Bit on the pricier end but the restaurant is quite fancy so can't complain. Excellent clam chowder and beautiful view of the bay. Good location near fishermans wharf.
author: Elizabeth J.

description: Great crab and decent wine selection. The steak was over-dressed, but everything else was fantastic. If you're there in the fall, try the pumpkin spice martini!
author: Jenn P.

description: Yikes. What a terrible meal. We thought we were going to a really nice restaurant by the look of the menu and the prices but this was a pretty disappointing experience. My husband's lobster was the worst we've ever had...so chewy and inedible we had to send it back. My sole was good but so cold I couldn't really enjoy it. Our kids did enjoy their fish and chips but that was the only good thing. Our server was sweet but it was obvious she lacked training (not her fault!)...she seemed nervous, wasn't able to make a recommendation off the menu based on my preferences, and didn't know how to open our bottle of Proseco. I'll spare you the bizarre story of the table next to us with their small dog at the table feeding her shrimp from their plates at the table and allowing her to drink out of their glasses. I completely understand that the restaurant is not allowed to ask about service animals and so this was not their fault but it would have been nice if they enforced their rule of no animals at the table. Overall just a pretty horrible experience.
author: Rocky Mountain Mama A.

description: This place was excellent. We went right before sunset so we had a fantastic view and enjoyed it with a good bottle of wine. Our timing was perfect because the crab was in season and had a whole menu dedicated to it. I would definitely recommend people ordering from that menu. For appetizer, we ordered the the steamed clams, also very good. We could drink the sauce, it was that flavorful. The crab topped clam chowder is also very highly recommended. For entrees, we each got the crab special, it is huge but so good. I would recommend sharing it with another person.
author: Jezelle P.

description:
Gluten Free options!
Grilled Shrimp had a gentle kick to it.
Pacific Sole was very good.
author: Ariane S.

description: I was surprised, I am picky when it comes to food. I hate paying for poor food. This was worth it! Came on Fathers Day and still got great food and service. Not what you expect from a tourist area. I had the halibut and Ann Han the Pacific Cod. Both were excellent.
author: Ron A.

description: We tried the Surt and turf, bread bowl with crab, and the Jombo scallop. They were absolutely great! Every taste was on point! Samir the waiter helped us choosing the right meals for our stomach! We def come here again next time!
author: Jason C.

description: Went here for a company outing. The food is good. We couldn't be seated until our whole table was here so that was a little annoying since they place wasn't full. Then when we did have everyone, they needed to set our table. We also had a reservation. I had the clam linguini and it was good. Also, good oysters. The berry spritzer drink was good too but more so taste like carbonated water just red in color.
author: Tina D.

description:
The bf was looking for some good ole San Francisco clam chowder, and we naturally went to Yelp. Being that we were at Pier 39, we were led to Fog Harbor. We took a seat at the bar and were quickly attended to with menus. The female bartender said the bread dough is from Boudin's Bakery, who supplies it to all the restaurants. What's special about their sourdough is that the water used comes from the bay. 

We ordered the clam chowder in a sourdough bread bowl. Boy, it sure hit the spot! The base was nice and creamy with a good amount of clams. We polished off that bowl, so the bf asked for another cup. 

Tip: visit the California Visitor's Center next door to get a coupon for 15% off your total bill.
author: L T.

description:
I rarely (OK, NEVER) go to the warf area because of the touristy aspect. But, these visitors insisted... and you won't catch me here again. As a local, I was NOT impressed at all with Fog Harbor. Because of all the tourist activity the wait can be an hour or more, as ours was, on a Wednesday evening. The service was quirkly, inexperienced and extremely slow. We had a table of 8, and our server really just could not get his act together. 20 minutes to get our cocktails. The server seemed unsure of himself from the get-go. And, I watched him messing around with other tables instead of getting the drink order in to the bar. So, it wasn't the bar holding things up. Had to ask for bread three times while waiting for the drinks to arrive. 
Food service was a mix-up as to who got what.. . But once correctly set in front of the correct person, it was good seafood. . . . The experience this night was just an all around disappointment.
author: Greg S.

description:
after a going on a birthday booze cruise, we were all hungry and the birthday boy picked this place bc it was close to where the boat docked

one of the guys in our party was so messed up that the server had to inform us no alcohol was to be served to our group. never had that happen to us before..the guy then uber'd home before we placed our order and all was fine again and we were able to order drinks after talking to the manager 

ordered:
Blue Cheese Garlic Bread: Fresh sourdough, topped with garlic, Pt. Reyes blue cheese and herbs

Crispy Calamari: Fried jalapenos and onions, served with lemon aioli

Crispy Bay Scallops: Panko breaded and fried served with a roasted jalapeño aioli

Crab Cake: One large cake, citrus beurre blanc, mango relish

Clam chowder: in a House Baked Sourdough Bread Bowl

Fish & Chips: "Anchor Steam" beer battered fish with french fries and cole slaw

Tiramisu

tourist trap for sure since it's in pier 39 but everything was a-ok.. halfway through the meal all the fried food was starting to get to me that nothing tasted good anymore.. that was remedied with some dessert

i have never been to a dinner where a bunch of people were so drunk.. it was quite entertaining for us sober people..one of the girls was popping the scallops in her mouth like grapes then ate the lettuce with a glob of aioli that came with the calamari like a taco.. i was pretty digested she was able to swallow that much without flinching.. she had some aoili on the side of her mouth so our friend that was sitting next to her wiped it off with his index finger, licked his finger, then said tasty.. hahahah
author: Raquel T.

description: We literally just ate there ordering crab cheesy toast and Dungeness crab cakes. We only had eggs this morning. No sooner than walking away down embarcadero street my boyfriend began to feel nausea. As we walked a few more minutes he began to throw up near the shops. Obviously food poison as he is NOT sick. His stomach hurt and could not keep down the crab cake! So upsetting and disappointed
author: Yol M.

description: Second time in San Francisco and second time dining here. There was no wait when we walked in (yay) and we sat by the window. We ordered so many items off the menu, and everything was delicious! The view at night was gorgeous. Great spot to dine and have a few drinks - line of taxi waiting outside pier 39!
author: Justin R.

description:
This was the first restaurant i ever ate at in san francisco and it was okay.
The high stars is for the fact that my husband got the cioppino and nearly peed his pants with excitement. 
I got a crab salad with avocado and something crunchy which was decent. 
The views alone are worth the price of admission.
author: Ella A.

description:
How does this place possibly have 1000+ reviews and 4 stars?? One of the worst dining experiences I've ever had. Hands down the most terrible restaurant we went to while visiting California.

Service: Bad. Sooo bad. And so slow. I had to ask our waitress Jeanette (?) to refill our waters, even after she walked by us with a pitcher. The busser did most of the work.

Food: Ridiculously overpriced, extremely poor quality. My husband ordered the Pan Seared Chicken Breast. It was dry - not tender or flavorful at all. I've had much better meals at Applebee's. Absolutely not worth the 18 bucks we paid for it. I got the famous clam chowder and a caesar salad. Clam chowder tasted like something you'd get in a grocery store. Edible, but extremely mediocre.

Atmosphere: View was great - our table overlooked the water. That's my 1 star.

I seriously don't understand why this place has 4 stars. Overpriced, bad food and bad service. Definitely not a great last meal on our honeymoon.
author: Kathryn P.

description: Oyster are good but small. The calamari was not that great, tasted flat and wasn't crunchy. The view was great and main dish was delicious!
author: HongBiao K.

description:
Fog Harbor = Best clam chowder soup i ever had! 

Great service, great food and beautiful view. I will definitely come back!
author: Irene C.

description: Great food and excellent service. My wife and I visited the restaurant for dinner one night while on vacation. Beautiful views!
author: Chad T.

description: Excellent seafood with a nice atmosphere. Happy hour at the bar for discount beer wine and food specials. Went there twice with no regrets.
author: John A.

description:
In my first ever visit to the Wharf in my first ever visit to San Francisco I stumbled into a restaurant that just awed me. Fog Harbor was listed on my parking garage ticket for validation and 2 hours of parking for free. I had a dozen choices to choose from and, have to admit, Fog Harbor was the first place I walked up to. And from that point forward I was just amazed. Walked up the stairs to a very elegant and inviting establishment. The hostess smiled and was very courteous. I sat a little bit before heading in to sit at the bar to eat where I found more friendly and smiling bartenders. 

That's where I learned about "Carl's Fog" that rolled in at sunset. 

Ordered my favorite Patron margarita with a splash of pineapple juice (no salt) and wasn't disappointed. Kind of odd that it was served in a tall pilsner glass but, hey, it was super tasty so I didn't question it. While in San Fran one must sample the clam chowder which I did in their sourdough bread bowl. Along with a shrimp cocktail and another margarita I was thoroughly enjoying the first portions of my dinner.

The only negative was that my main course came out in the middle of me eating the soup and shrimp. I told them to bring it back out when I call for it. When I did call for it I was pleased to find my linguine in clam sauce was very warm and fresh. And it was fantastic. I kept some of the sourdough bread from my bread bowl and used that for the meal along with the small piece of bread that came with it. 

I, normally, do not eat dessert when I go out to eat but I thought, what the heck, the meal was amazing so far why stop so I ordered the raspberry and apple crisp with vanilla ice cream. I nailed it. 

I'm sure the other fish houses or seafood restaurants on the Pier are equally as good as Fog Harbor but I came into this place and will have a hard time not going back the next time in San Fran.
author: NY S.

description: Best seafood I've had outside of New Orleans. Great view, great service. Would come back next time!
author: Mike S.

description:
On this rainy night at Pier39, I had a great Ciopino and a couple of Anchor Steam, both among the finest of San Francisco.

Funny that the waiter offer to "clean the crab" for $4, essentially to save me the mess of picking the flesh from the shell.  That was the fun part, why would I pay other people to do it for me.  The soup was intense  but the fish was a bit too dry.
author: Sin-Yaw W.

description: This was our first time to Fog Harbor and we were so glad we followed the good reviews here! The management totally impressed us with over the top customer service recovery when one menu item went wrong. The view is a great as the food and we WILL be back!
author: Ford M.

description: We came here for lunch and had a fantastic experience. The fish was all fresh and tasted outstanding. Our service was also very good. I would highly recommend going back to this place
author: C S.

description:
Excellent experience! Our server recommended the special, which was a fresh wild salmon atop an arugula salad with cranberries and couscous. It was incredible. 
The views of the bay were also fantastic, especially watching the sunset. 
I highly recommend this place.
author: Rich P.

description: Delicious! The cioppino  was soooo good. As well as the tartar, clam chowder in a bread bowl and the fish and chips. The wait staff we had was wonderful as well. Fast, efficient and friendly.
author: Brett M.

description: This place was great. I ordered the mixed grill and my swordfish, shrimp, and salmon were cooked perfectly. Staff were friendly. Great place.
author: Kevin P.

description: first of all... this place has amazing food. everything tastes great. from the salmon "club" salad to the crab cakes to the clam chowder, everything is fantastic. even the bread that they bring out is great. there is a reason why their clam chowder is award winning. the only downside of this place is that it gets a bit expensive!
author: Sid V.

description: Went with a group of 6 and sat near the bar.  Very nice location with what seems like great views.  I had the shrimp, it had some fancy name that I don't remember but I know it was on a skewer.  And there were mashed potatoes too.  The portions seemed generous, and although the prices were somewhat high, the quality of the food was quite good.  I almost forgot about the clam chowder!  The menu says it is the best but then I asked the waiter and he said "perhaps second best."  Without attempting to rank, I would say the clam chowder is good but perhaps not worth the $6 a bowl.  Oh, and there also wasn't any fog.  But there was a harbor, at least.
author: Joseph K.

description: Came here based off my grandparents recommendation when they came 7-8 years ago. I was a little disappointed. Our first server was amazing but had to leave, our replacement was short from decent. The food was ok probably because I was starving but otherwise not AMAZING. I will say the view was amazing, Alcatraz outside the window and the harbor is beautiful.
author: Michael G.

description:
We were on a time crunch and the server knew it and was very accommodating.  Fiance ordered clam
Chowder in bread bowl and I ordered mine in a bowl. Very good.  Chowder had good amount of clams and was not overloaded with stupid potatoes.  Really wanted to try their other dishes.  The waitress brought our check quick.  Will come back to try their other dishes.
author: Grace C.

description:
I was on the ferry back from Alcatraz and wanted a bowl of clam chowder especially on a cold rainy day. I walked in around lunch time and it wasn't busy and sat at the bar. The restaurant is all windows and has great views if you sit at a table. I ordered the soup and salad combo and also if you check in on yelp you get a free bleu cheese garlic bread (!). Everything I ordered was really good especially the garlic bread. If I ever go to fishermans wharf again i'd def come back and recommend the restaurant.  
Also, my favorite part was the customer service, the two bartenders were friendly and attentive. I'm traveling by myself and a friendly conversation was a plus.
author: Margo D.

description: We had an amazing meal at the Fog this evening. We traveled from montana and heard raving reviews about the clam chowder. We were not disappointed! Tyler was our server--he was personable, cheerful and prompt. We would definitely visit again! :)
author: Maggie V.

description: The hubs had never had clam chowder in a bread bowl in San Francisco, so I took him here as this place was where I had my very first almost 20 years ago.  This place spoiled it for everyone else's clam chowders I've tried on the West Coast.  The service here is always great and every time I come here, the food seems to taste better and better.  This place has now spoiled it for everyone else's clam chowders the hubs has or ever will try on the West Coast, LOL.  We came here and split a clam chowder bread bowl and salad combo.  Waitress was super on top of things.  We also had the calamari.....TRY THE CALAMARI!  They mixed onion rings and fried jalapeños in with the calamari and the dipping sauce was awesome as well.  The combination of the great food and service are well worth a trip and the cost.
author: Tonya K.

description: Found Fog Harbor on Yelp while staying in Fisherman's Wharf. We desired a great view, delicious food and expert service - in an intimate dining area away from the hustle and bustle... That is what we got! Our server Meron was personable and knowledgeable- it was a special night for us, so she brought flowers and a candle to our table. We had baked oysters with Bacon, clam chowder (to dip our fresh sourdough bread in!), the mixed grill - fresh and perfectly cooked fish - and Surf N Turf... Meron even assisted with getting the meat out of the whole lobster! For dessert we had the special - Creme brûlée and chocolate lava cake- absolutely delicious. Thank you Meron and Fog Harbor for a delicious and memorable meal!!!
author: Sam R.

description: Walked to Pier 39, and decided to eat here, the clam chowder was delicious, as I had clam with every spoonful, Hibiscus Margarita is refreshing, and our entrees was perfect. I recommend the Garlic crab
author: Debra T.

description: Excellent fresh oyster, reasonable price & good service .. Try the crab soup in sourdough bread it s very good
author: Julien G.

description:
Despite of a good friend's suggestion to go to Franciscan Restaurant, I went here instead and never looked back.

Came here on a Sunday during lunch hours and it was packed. We (a party of 5) had to wait for about 30 minutes but it was definitely worthwhile. I definitely loved the view that we had from our window-side table. Anyhow, I ordered their crab cake platter and it was really gratifying. To me that's usually a sign that they only use quality ingredients :)

Expect the service to be a little bit slow, though. It is just a really busy place, but nevertheless, it is an enjoyable venue to have good food and good conversation.
author: Fransisca M.

description: Get the clam chowdah! Brought some friends here and had a great dinner after a day in Napa. The soup and fish and chips were great. $20 corkage fee if you bring your own bottle to enjoy.
author: Kurt J.

description:
Wow!! This was such an amazing experience. I am a service business owner always observing hospitality at other businesses. We dropped off a friend at the airport and because of a horrible accident, the traffic was grid locked. We decided to stop at pier 39 for dinner not knowing where we were going to eat. My daughter frequently visits SF and had never been to this restaurant before, the wait was about 10 minutes. By the time we ordered wine at the bar they were seating us. That sat us at a window where the sun was shining in but the view was amazing. As we sat for a moment, it started getting hot and we asked to be moved. They said we could sit at another table but I really liked where we were sitting. I, always feeling on the warmer side, was noticeably hot and the waiter, Michael, asked if I wanted the window open. I felt instantly better. He was so accommodating and knowledgeable. 
Our food was so amazing. Clam chowder add crab was so delicious. And we had the fried scallops. Mmmmmmmm. For main meals. My daughter had the Pacific Cod, so flavorful and I had the ribeye that was so darn good and also so so flavorful. The seasoning was indescribable. I chose not to have it blackened. 
Service was impeccable from the hostess, bar tender and manager. They were just bending over backwards for us and we just felt extra special. 
My steak was s bit undercooked but they willing make me a whole new one or take it off my bill. I was full already and said it was ok and would take my undercooked steak to go. When they brought me my food to go, I noticed they made me a whole new one. The reason that this so long is I can't even explain all great experience that we had. 
Michael, our server was so nice and accommodating and not tried to rush us. Anyway. I would recommend this restaurant at Pier 39 any day. Loved it! Thanks for the great service. We will be back.
author: Jenifer C.

description:
The setting is nice since it's in Pier 39 but I couldn't help but feel that it was simply another typical SF Seafood restaurant. Not going to lie, the clam chowder was pretty bomb and the warm sourdough bread was super yummy but they were disorganized with our table and seating even after we had made reservations. 

If you're in the area it's a good place to try but I wouldn't go out of my way to try to eat here.
author: Amanda K.

description:
It is the worst dining experience I have ever had. 

Service is worst of the worst. 
Food is worst of the worst. 

I decided to go there to celebrate my birthday. I read the online reviews and thought this restaurant is worth for a try. 

When I arrived the restaurant, I was asked to wait for my seats while there are plenty empty tables in the restaurant. It is ok. After waiting for the like 30 mins, we were greed and bought to a table with window view. However, it was the time for a sunset. Their blind could not block any of the sunlight. My eye was directly tortured by the sunset. I was hardly seeing anything after I was seated. Fine. It is nothing the restaurant that could control.

After waiting for over 30 mins, there was NO service provided. No water or anything. I was dumped at the table with a menu that I have read over and over during my waiting time. 

When the server came, she did not even bother to explain the menu and introduce the daily special items. OK. I ordered what I wanted from the menu. Then the server asked if I wanted to have the crab shell off. I was like, why not. The sad thing is, when I get the bill later, a $4 service charge was charged to getting the crab shell off! $4 is nothing, but it has to be communicated to customers when the server proposed that service. I have the right to refuse paying this charge. I was totally blindsided!

Fine. Only $4 bucks. If they do a proper job, I don't care. But the fact is, they make the crabs like shit. It has no favor. It served as tiny little pieces just like piece of crap. I could not tell those are crab meat at all!

To me, it is totally unacceptable for a restaurant specialized in seafood. 

When the food came to the table, I told the serve that I will be sharing the food with my friends. Everything ordered will be shared. The server just left, without giving us dinning plates and utensils for two people! The sad thing is the serve then left to nowhere. We could not find anyone that we could get extra utensils! The restaurant floor was totally empty!!

We ended up have to take turns to eat and share the utensils!

Not to mention, there is no one refilling water for the entire evening!


On the food, it is disappointing. Everything is soaked in watery sauce. No favor, no texture. Everything is way overcooked!

I have no idea how people could stand their food and still rated them with 4 stars or above. It is non-sense. I doubt people's rating. 


In all, other than the view, I could not thinking of any point to give them any stars!

No service. Below average food. It is definitely the worst dining experience I have ever had!
author: Nathan L.

description: Excellent all around. I was afraid the restaurant being too tourist but only to realize how wrong I was. We had calamari for starter and Halibut and fish'n chip for the main dish. Calamari was fresh and Halibut has such complex and well balanced favour. Service was top natch too. Loved our experience very much!
author: K Y.

description: Delicious food and great service!  They serve the clam chowder the way I make it, which was a pleasant surprise.
author: Stephen H.

description:
This is my fault. Really, it is. 

We picked a spot right on Pier 39 full of tourists on a Sunday afternoon. Guh. Why did I do that? 

All right, the oysters were delicious and fresh. I'll give them that! No horseradish though. The crab sandwich was okay - the bread that it was served in was very good, but the crab itself was a little bland and just too cold. Needed a little sauce or something to flavor it better. 

Anyway, our server was just flat, lusterless and almost angry at times. The place was overly busy, but she could have at least tried to appear happy. 

I shan't be back.

EDIT:
I'm editing this to a 3 star. The food was 3-4 stars but the service was 2-3 stars. The manager seems extremely conscientious and has contacted me with questions on how they can improve - I appreciate this chance for personal feedback!
author: Jason D.

description:
Really good salmon blt. Good oysters too 
Khaiman was our waiter very attentive . Great place
author: Shelby S.

description: Not very happy with the fish and chips. No flavor. Clam chowder bowl with sour dough bread. Over priced cheaper at the fish market down below.
author: Michael W.

description: Just finished a great Dinner at Fog Harbor.  We had the lobster tails and they were fantastic.  Best of all was our server Tyler who left us wanting for nothing.  He was consistently at our table filling drinks and getting us whatever we needed.  I almost felt like we at a fast food place because the order came back so quickly.  Be sure to ask for Tyler if you go!
author: Sean L.

description: Cool little spot with a great view. I typically avoid eating at pier 39, but this place is really great. Crab cakes are amazing, good oysters and killer clam chowder!
author: Bryce M.

description: Food was fresh and great.  Our server, Michael made a great recommendation when I couldn't device. The ahi-tuna was some of the best I've ever had, but the service was what made the meal better.  Highly recommend this place ( :
author: Patrick G.

description:
The weather this day was not the best and we ended up stumbling into this restaurant that had a fireplace outside, and of all things, serving a variety seafood.

I'm usually reluctant to give a full 5 stars, especially to touristy restaurants, but I really enjoyed this place. The atmosphere is great here, the views to the harbor are beautiful, and everyone is super friendly. Our waitress was the best! She would check in with us frequently and recommend items for us. She was also very patient and friendly to our 2 kids. I got the Calamari and it was one of the best calamari I have had. It was not too breaded nor too soggy and they were the perfect sizes. I also got the clam chowder that was amazing; rich in flavor and creamy! A must try! My husband ordered the beet salad, it was good but it had a little too much blue cheese in for my liking. The kids ordered Mac and cheese and grilled chicken, both were great! The portions were perfect, not too little not too much.

I would say it can get pricey, but the quality of the food and everything else provided here are well worth it!
author: Perla L.

description:
Great bread and chowder... Beet and arugula salad also hit the spot. Service was amazing and fast.  View was spectacular.  
We arrived at 1145& we were sat right away for lunch
author: Anne F.

description:
3.5 stars for the food
3 stars for the server service
1 star for the hostess attitude 

I went here for the first time because supposedly they serve the best clam chowder according to other Yelp reviews. I got 3 dishes and they were pretty good, but not something that I really want to come back again for.

Clam chowder: pretty good and not too creamy, but didn't have enough clams 

Crab & avocado salad: delicious dressing with fresh crab meat. It comes in a HUGE portion so it's basically a main course.

Garlic Chile Crab: the sauce was amazing and it's great for dipping your bread in. But the seasoning didn't sick well to the crab meat.

Our server (Amy) was decent and attentive, but the hostess (I forgot to get her name) was so rude. She asked us to wait for a table so we sat outside near the fireplace to wait for like 15 minutes. She came up to us with an attitude and asked "so are you ready now?" I'm thinking what is wrong with that girl because she was the one who asked us to wait there. While walking to our table, she rudely said "well, I have this one stable for you so you can sit there or like I guess I can move you too if you don't like it. Whatever." I guess certain people don't care about their jobs. I will definitely get her name next time.
author: neviah n.

description:
Right in the chaos of Pier 39, this place is actually quite good and avoids the pitfalls of the mega touristy eateries.  Very nice place inside.  I made reservations online (about an hour earlier the same day) and they sat us by the window with a great view of the sunsetting over Golden Gate Bridge.  

I had the seared tuna, dh had the shrimp brochette and kid had the standard chicken tenders fare.  Tuna steak was delicious (seared rare like it should be).  The shrimp brochette was tasty although not what was expected -- they're sautéed in garlic butter rather than bacon-wrapped like all 'brochette' is down in Houston.  The chicken tenders are real chicken tenderloins -- she got 5 of them with a side of veggie.

One tip is that you can get a coupon book from the Visitor Center on the 2nd level of Pier 39.  I had a CityPass book with a voucher to get a Pier 39 coupon book (otherwise, you may have to buy it for $5 or something like that).  That book has coupon savings for just about every store and restaurant at Pier 39.  Proved to be quite valuable for us.
author: L N.

description: Friendly staff; fantastic views. Great crab roll; try the house-aged ginger Negroni!
author: Mike P.

description: Love it, Excellent lobsters & delicious dressing
author: Sarah B.

description: Walked in and got seated right away. The food was great. I ordered baked oysters and my daughter ordered the lobster. I was originally looking for another restaurant but glad I ate here instead. Samir was an awesome waiter.  If you at Pier 39 you must eat here. It's a bit pricey but worth it.
author: Dawn G.

description: We wanted to try some seafood since was our first time to San Fran and decided to stop here. Service from Justin was phenomenal. He was very accommodating and made sure that everything came out perfect.  The food was also good.
author: Lyndsi F.

description: Made an afternoon pit stop for drinks...while the bartenders are friendly...their drink mixing skills are somewhat off the mark.  We'd ordered a cosmo and gimlet and the drinks came out looking bright Christmas colors (red and green).  At our request, the bartender was nice enough to make us something else - we opted for on the rocks with splash of juice.
author: Sylvia C.

description:
I reserved a table for 2 for my boyfriend's birthday and we came a little earlier than our reservation, so the hostess seated us at the waiting area for a bit. I actually got a bit grumpy while waiting since they let other people in, turns out they were prepping our table! They wrote happy birthday and birthday wishes all over the paper covering, which was a really pleasant surprise!

We had a rum and coke, lollipop drop(?), crab roll, lobster Mac and cheese, and baked oysters. We also got a free order of blue cheese garlic bread because I checked in.

The drinks were good, although a bit watered down. Garlic bread was yummy, and the oysters were super good and flavorful. Crab roll was also delicious, the bread was nicely toasted, although the sweet potato fries were kinda cold when it got to our table. The lobster mac and cheese was pretty epic...at one point I found myself saying "There's too much lobster in my Mac n cheese". 

Service was excellent. They also threw in a lava cake for the birthday boy! Overall it made for a really pleasant dinner.

Btw I reserved through opentable(via the yelp app) and under special requests I asked about the birthday stuff, and they delivered nicely. 5 stars!
author: Lea L.

description:
We came on a Monday evening and ordered
1. Clam chowder in a bread bowl - 9
2. Fish and chips - 16
3. Seafood Penne - 18
a couple drinks for 43 with a 20% coupon from the coupon book from the Welcome Center

- You're on the 2nd floor so you get to see a wonderful view of the Pier. We came during sunset, so we got to see a gorgeous view of the sun near the horizon. 
- Nice service. Quick with refills and condiments. 
- Clam chowder was rich and creamy. generous portions of clam. My favorite part is eating the bread bowl when the bread absorbed most of the clam chowder soup! Nom! They Claim being the best. I can attest that it's good!  
- Fish and chips pretty average. No better than ordering from a fast food fish and chip joint
- Seafood penne had a lackluster taste. Don't recommend. 
- Overall, very pleasant meal with a wonderful view of the Pier at a discounted price!
author: Chris C.

description:
Awesome location! Our table had a great view of Alcatraz and a dock full of seals just sunbathing. Man I wish I could have joined them!!
