The food was fresh but I wouldn't expect anything less considering they are right by the water. We were in the mood for oysters so we got a dozen raw and a dozen cooked. We also got the shrimp cocktail, some crab appetizer, 2 tuna poke looking things, and there must have been more but I don't remember now. I actually was washing my hands when the guys decided to order so I did not participate in the ordering portion of our meal. We weren't looking to get full, just eat enough to last us till dinner. This was like around 6ish or so after our ride on Lombard St. The food was good, can't say it was extremely tasty or that I would be back but it was a nice meal to share with our friends. There were 4 of us. =D
I would recommend coming here for the views and if you're actually looking for a nice sit down place. I am not sure what the bill looked like but I think it was around $200 with tip. It's alright for just appetizers but I must say that the bread they served us was tasty!!! Man I ate a lot of bread while up north...
author: Anna G.

description:
This place is just okay. People raving about the food are slightly deluded - it's good but it's also very touristy, you know the drill.

The interior is enormous, it takes several hundred yards to get from the entrance to your table if you know what I mean. 

We came here for crab. I had a crab ceviche appetizer which was super delicious, made with fresh crab, mango and avocado. My entree was pretty bad. I ordered a rare seared tuna steak with asian vegetables. The tuna was coated with sickeningly sweet sauce that ruined the fish. Vegetables were way too sweet as well. Disappointing. 

Our server was absolutely delightful though, really helpful and didn't mind separating the bill three ways.
author: Lauren M.

description: Amazing food and service. The sour dough bread was fresh, hot, and the best I have ever had. We had the spicy shrimp appetizer, the grill mix, and the lobster tails. I have never had such well cooked seafood. The whole experience was awesome and made one of the top things we did while in CA. Thanks!
author: Mr B.

description: Delicious food, great seafood and wonderful prices, especially for the area. We stayed 5 nights in San Francisco and went here our last night, by far the best and most affordable place for dinner. I recommend this place for everyone. The kids menu actually had grilled salmon and broccoli, a nice change from the hamburger and fries, for $7.50! I ordered the lobster tail, a super splurge for us, but well worth it.
author: Claire D.

description: I don't know what happened to my previous review I wrote for here but this place is great. Came here for the second time and had a great time again. Their garlic roasted dungenuss crab was great!!!
author: Sammy G.

description: The food here is fresh and amazing. Loved this place would go back with my eyes closed.
author: Gonzalez M.

description: Tyler was a rockstar. He remembered all the little details. Thanks.  Get him the warrior tickets.
author: Joanna J.

description: Great seafood restaurant! All the plates we tried were amazing, and desserts were excellent too. Considering how much we ate the price was also reasonable. I would definitely recommend this place.
author: Matteo M.

description: Great service by Samir. Food was good.  Lots of choices.   I got the clam chowder bread bowl - fabulous.
author: Bob M.

description:
I was spending a day translating for two foreign clients when they decided they wanted the San Francisco seafood experience. I panicked, because I don't have a go-to seafood spot that will satisfy the highbrow European tourist, so I Yelped it from the car and fortunately discovered Fog Harbor.

I was so impressed when we walked in to see a beautiful fireplace by the hostess stand and even more so when I saw the lovely views of the bridge from our table (and of course we got a great table with views). I was afraid that it would be tacky or not very good because of its Fisherman's Wharf location, but everything was delicious, the staff was great, and my clients had themselves a blast, ordering oysters, wine, entrees, and "that soup in the bread." They literally had everything my clients wanted out of a "typical" SF experience, all yummy, and without any of the Fisherman's Wharf touristy tackiness.
author: Tatiana T.

description:
Surprisingly delicious!

For a "commercial" restaurant on the wharf, I was pleasantly surprised at how fantastic the food and the service was.  Not only was our server, Seth incredibly friendly, but all of the other staff as well.  Everyone seemed genuinely happy to be there.

For my entrée, I had the cioppino, which came piping hot and loaded with goodies.  My dining companion had the fillet of sole, that was equally delicious.
  
For dessert, we shared a complimentary  chocolate molten cake (for my birthday), that was accompanied by a scoop of vanilla ice cream.....the cake was so moist, rich and decadent....spoon licking good. 

I highly recommend this place....don't let the fact that its in a "touristy" location scare you off!
author: Heather K.

description: Sooooo Gooooood! Service was wonderful .. Do the baked oysters .. To die for, also if your confused seafood or steak get the surf and turf ! Lobster tail great, steak a little too cooked! Manager came over very professional! Took care of steak portion! The drink you MUST have, Moscow Mule"! My wife drank mine and ordered another !!
author: Pman B.

description:
Being foodies from Chicago, we have higher standards. That is the only reason we can conceive as to why the higher rating. This place is careless about their food and no attention to detail. It's 100% tourist. I think people who have never had good food must be giving these good ratings. 
Service was ok.
I have no idea why they got as many stars as they did.
We spent over 200 dollars because we really wanted to try a variety of seafood. 

We had
- 1/2 doz. oysters: these were good/fresh but way over priced. There is really no skill to serving an oyster.

- bowl of clam chowder: under seasoned and served luke-warm.  

- salad wedge: sent back but still got charged. Literally a non-rinsed, right out of the shrink wrap, warm, wilted, bargain bin, iceberg lettuce. 1/2 of a cherry tomato. And barely enough blue cheese dressing. Maybe a tsp portion. Careless preparation. The dressing was barely that, it was very pasty. 

- garlic dungeoness crab: served luke-warm and over-cooked ! Ton of garlic, under seasoned. not a pinch of salt. The meat was dry inside and crumbled out. We spent 42 dollars for this garbage! We left 1/2 of it.

- chiapino: this was ok, but still served Luke-warm and under seasoned. The broth was bland. It was more of a boring tomato soup with garlic powder, and a pinch of red pepper. The fish inside was ok, but there just wasn't enough. There was some good vegetables inside too. This was nowhere close to a great chiapino. This was just average. I can get way better in chi-town.

- house cab: 14 dollars a glass  for what tastes like and probably is Barefoot brand.

I would have sent most of this back and walked out, but I didn't want to make a scene. 
Hopefully this review is seen by people who know food. 

Update:
The manager reached out to me to get feedback.
He was polite and seemed to care.
I added two additional stars
author: Aric L.

description: Drinks are on point, service is good. The views are like looking at a Beyonce concert front row. The food may not be worth the money. But if ya got it flaunt it Bae.
author: Natalia P.

description:
I was very pleased with my visit! I was not used to the great customer service that I got because most places that I've been to since moving to San Jose, service sucks lol 

I had the Fried Shrimp w/ fries and THE BEST CLAM CHOWDER EVER! 

I definitely recommend this place for clam chowder and their whole menu actually looked pretty good!
author: Krishneel S.

description: Great lunch. We were walk-ins. Party of 6. I was concerned it might be overpriced, touristy junk but I was proved wrong. The Cioppino was amazing. Clam chowder was just ok, I've had better. Calamari were super crispy and delish! Too full for dessert. Service was really, really good.  Attentive despite being extremely busy and very friendly. Highly recommend.
author: F S.

description: Beautiful view, good service, and the food was great. I had a great experience at this restaurant. It was my mother's last day visiting me in the city so I took her to the most touristy spot in SF, and treated her to a nice dinner out. We got a whole crab and chowder in the bread bowl to share. The waiter was good about bringing us two of everything (soup soon, crab bibs, little crab clamps) so we could really share the food. It was so much food! We barely finished and had to waddle out of the restaurant because we were so full. The chowder was chock-full of clams, which is always a plus in my book. Apart from the good seafood, the view is hard to beat. We didn't get to sit right next to the window but were still able to see the beautiful sunset while we ate. All in all, it's worthwhile to come here at least once, and a perfect place to take someone who is visiting SF. It is expensive though, so I wouldn't come here just for chowder unless it was for something special like a last meal in SF for my mom!
author: Emily H.

description: My favorite place to go at Pier 39.  I've eaten here twice, both times I've gotten the garlic sautéed dungenous crab and both times it's been excellent.  The crabs are so fresh and the service is always spot on.
author: Michelle S.

description: It was OK....and really thats about it.  Next time I would work a little harder to find a out of the way place.  Food was just good not great.  Was easy to get to and in fun area as far as tourist stuff is concerned.  Prices were reasonable and service was very average.  Didn't expect much so was not too disappointed.
author: Ryan G.

description:
Came here on Valentines Day with my hunny. The service was great, our waiter was very helpful & the wine she recommended was pretty good. 

For our appetizer we had crispy lemon calamari which was the best calamari I've had. We also tried the clam chowder and the reviewers were right. The best clam chowder I have ever had.

Entrée: I got the special that was not on the menu. It was a half lobster stuff with crab & shrimp with garlic mashed potatoes. It was delicious. My hunny got Mixed Grilled Salmon, Swordfish and Shrimp, citrus buerre blanc, sauteed vegetables, wild rice or garlic mashed potatoes. He said it lacked flavor but our waiter brought 2 sauces over & he really liked it. Overall it was delicious & service was awesome.


Will definitely be coming back.
author: Tiffani B.

description: Food and service was very good. I thought the price was a little high, but I guess the location always counts. The bread is homemade and it was my favorite! Overall very satisfying experience.
author: Mayelyn B.

description:
Went on recommendations from friends however I was left disappointed by the quality of the food and the waiting staff. 

The order that they brought was wrong and very slow in coming out.
author: Greg R.

description: This used to be my favorite restaurant so to my dismay yesterday I was very disappointed with the service that I received. The clam chowder that I ordered was chalky in its taste which is a first cause usually it is very good. I also ordered the fried scallops which were very yummy and the portion was more than enough. My service however was very disappointing. I waited at least 15 minutes before I was given a menu, then the waitress who seemed annoyed at something else had an attitude. Perhaps this was just an off day for them people are entitled to them every once in a while I get it. So I won't say that I won't return here cause I most likely will I just hope that my service experience is nicer the next time around.
author: Mayalia B.

description:
This place was delicious!

I bookmarked this restaurant for our upcoming San Francisco visit and am very  happy we were able to stop by. 

We came for a late lunch today after visiting Napa. The place was still quite busy around 3pm. 

We got seated by the window so we had a nice view of the bay.  We started off with cup of clam chowder soup and crab and spinach dip. This was probably one of the best clam chowder soups we've ever had. The dip was alright. 

For our main entrees I ordered the seared ahi tuna with mashed potatoes and veggies. It was excellent! The soy ginger glaze, in addition to the other sauces I can't recall, worked really well with the dish. The presentation was sooo pretty I didn't want to eat it.  I was extremely satisfied with the dish :)

My mom got the mixed seafood plate (swordfish was yummy!) and my sister got the seared halibut with quinoa and arugula (very tasty as well). 

Too bad I'm not a San Fran native otherwise I'd make repeat visits!
author: Christine G.

description:
fisherman's wharf is a tourist trap.  I was skeptical of all those side walk hawkers promising the best food... yelp directed me to Fog Harbor and I owe you both a huge thank you!

it goes like this, the wife had to take an important work conference call, this area is crowded, she ducked into an alley.  the three kids and I found ourselves stuck on the sidewalk.  the kids started to melt down, one of my son's punched the other in the nuts , so he got hit back (as I explained, you hit somebody in the balls, you expect to get hit back, hard).   these kids needed to be out of the sun, and food in their bellies.  

this place was nicer than I expected.  the staff was SUPER friendly to me and my three kids.  I caught glances at plates of food being eaten by other people and I saw what we needed, BLUE CHEESE GARLIC BREAD! ($8)  that and I got myself a beer, when in SF Anchor Steam it!

bread came quick, kids loved it and everybody quit crying and no more nad wahcking.  my daughter consumed an entire salmon BLT and loved it.  my oldest son loves soups, he had the chowder.  youngest son had the kids menu fish and chips.  HOLY FREAKIN CRAP that fish and chips was good and HUGE!  I've seen smaller portions from the regular (non-kids) menu at other fish houses.  

after an hour in that alley, on a conference call. t he wife joined us and we enjoyed oysters!  

we later agreed that Fog Harbor was one of the best (albeit nearly accidental) finds of the trip.

and a BIG thanks to the waitress that has SW themed tattoos behind her ears that matched my jacket, it was our destiny!
author: Paul S.

description: Wonderful lunch of clam chowder and crab roll on sour dough bread. Beautiful setting and great service!!
author: Jo P.

description:
We had the calamari to start then my husband had the surf and turf $58
And I just got a wedge salad .. All good not exceptional but good . Room was very warm -- they need to either crank the AC or open some windows!!
author: Meg B.

description: very overated the food was good but the service sucks . im sorry to say but management needs over seeing ! because the energy was off !
author: Zehra A.

description: This place has a great atmosphere and the food is excellent.  The ciopino was amazing and one of the best meals that I've had in my life.  Big huge pieces of fish and shrimp, scallops, and clams.  It was excellent!
author: Kris H.

description: Not as we remembered it. Still has a great kids menu so a great place to bring the kids. The sourdough bread is freshly baked and warm. The kids can write/color on the paper tablecloth. The food was only average this time. I had the grilled shrimp and my hubby had the Cioppino.
author: Maria L.

description:
I was extremely excited to try this place out for lunch. The view alone is what intrigued me to come to this spot. And to be honest, that was the best part of dining at Fog Harbor.  

In my opinion, the view should just be a compliment to the food, not the only thing that is great about the experience.  

Our server didn't say more then 5 words to us. 

We ordered the fried calamari which was my favorite out of all the dishes we ordered.  The deep fried jalepeno was a nice touch. 

We then split the crab louis and the steamed clams.

We got brought out the steamed clams with chorizo...which is not what we ordered but oh well. It was mehh, I was looking forward to the buttery white wine sauce.

However, the crab louis is what I take an issue with. The salad was straight up bagged.....I have no doubt in my mind. When you are paying more then $20.00 for a salad it should NOT be bagged salad are you kidding?!? It was just not good. My boyfriend and I left disappointed. 

Remember what I mentioned about our server only saying 5 words to us? Yeah it was to ask if we had yelp? And I said yes. He then circled his name and said "write me a good review!" 

.....What???!? This guy barely spoke to us the whole entire lunch and now he was asking for a good yelp review? I DON'T THINK SO. 

We will be going to Scoma's next time....they have yet to fail us!
author: H D.

description: We were searching for a restaurant with a view and good reviews. We found it at Fog House. My wife had the Shrimp Brioche and I had Fish and Chips. They were both great. The food came out in a timely manner and was cooked to perfection. The only downside was we did not have a reservations so we did not have a window seat. We could view Alcatraz from our table. I would definitely recommend this to anyone.
author: Scott F.

description: This place is legitimately good. They boasted to have the best clam chowder. With an advertisement like that, you know you gotta order it 'cause ya know your girl likes her clam chowder. The clam chowder was probably the best I had in SF while I was here. (Albeit,all 4 days). Boyfriend got the salmon and really enjoyed it. I got linguini with clams, again, pretty good. Service was good, and when we asked for desserts, they came out with a tray of desserts (which I've never seen before). We got the creme brulee, which is never disappointing because creme brulee is so good. Bill was around $100 plus tip (boys and girls, if your server does a good job, make sure you tip accordingly!). Probably a little more than what I would have liked to paid since I didn't have a culinary explosion while here but the scenery is beautiful and it's in a very touristy area so it makes sense. I'm just happy I paid for slightly over-priced good food versus awful food.
author: Kristin C.

description:
We came here on vacation. Despite the good reviews, we were hesitant when we realized it was near Fisherman's Wharf. However, it was supposed to be an amazing view, and we relied on the beauty that is the Yelp community.

We split the lemon calamari, clam chowder and the three fish plate, which ended up $50. It was UTTERLY INCREDIBLE. The view was great, even though we were in the back it was elevated so we could still see the water and Fisherman's Wharf. The food came out quickly and the servers were all very sweet. From what I could hear, it's pretty common to knock something off the bill for it coming too late or having to wait to be served. All together a wonderful experience. 

PS, it seems to be quite the date spot.
author: Amanda H.

description: The atmosphere is sort of a relaxed-classy environment. Christian took our drink order promptly (Cucumber-basil gimlet for me, Lombard Lemonade for mom) and quickly came back for our food order. It was a bit a wait for food, but it was also Easter Sunday at lunch time, and the wait really wasn't an issue when there was such a nice view to look at. We shared the blue cheese garlic bread starter, and it may have been because we were so hungry but the both of us were stopped in our tracks by the deliciousness (at this point I remarked "Don't come here on a date"... Bad breath for DAYS but totally worth it). I ordered the sustainably harvested swordfish and mom had the grilled chicken. I'd never tried swordfish before but I am certainly a convert. Grilled to perfection atop a bed of roasted potatoes and vegetables, I didn't want it to end. But I also didn't want to miss out on dessert. Christian brought the tray around and we were quickly swayed to the creme brûlée and molten chocolate cake duo. DEFINITELY THE RIGHT DECISION. Wait staff was all friendly without being overly chatty, and it was some of the best seafood I've had in a very long time. Can't wait to go back again!!
author: Sara S.

description: Samir was our waiter! Superb food and service. Yum yum yum! I think the clam chowder was my favorite out of everything. A must try!
author: Alli B.

description: 3 1/2 stars.. Great creamy chunky clam chowder, delicious calamari infused with lemon, but the shellfish platter was not very good. The mussels on the platter smelled strong and the dungeness crab legs were so overcooked they were mushy. So im disappointed since this place is right off the pier so their shellfish platter could have been better. bumping up this review because the service with our waiter was good and he was extra friendly.
author: Yum N.

description: Absolutely first-class seafood establishment. Our waitress, Brenda, was prompt and friendly. The food was phenomenal, the award-winning clam chowder especially. This is my first time in San Francisco and will certainly make a point to come back to Fog Harbor with friends.
author: Kyle L.

description:
Much love for Fog Harbor. View was breathtaking and food superb.

We Reserved online using Open Table and they offered a complimentary amuse bouche.

Garlic crab was messy but very tasty. The sourdough loaf addictive. Crab Roll excellent. Fish and chips were a well done version.

Service was also excellent. Worth a trip.
author: Robin W.

description: Yummy seafood, nice atmosphere and beautiful views. It honestly doesn't feel like you're at fisherman's wharf, which can be so busy and cheap. It is rather expensive, but what you're paying for is fresh seafood and a beautiful view.
author: Nicola F.

description:
3.5 stars 

Fog Harbor serves up a good, solid lunch with great views.  The restaurant is a good size, and the view with the boats and the like entertained my son quiet well.

I ordered the crab cake appetizer as my entree, and I thought it was delicious.  My glass of riesling was a bit on the skimpy side though.  My husband's clam chowder soup and crab roll were delicious as well.  My son's mac and cheese consisted of very-overcooked pasta (and I usually like "overcooked" pasta) with way too much butter, which completely seeped out and puddled when I opened the leftovers box the next day.  And although the sourdough bread that they served was hot and fresh with a nice crusty exterior and great flavor, I have to say that they completely squish their bread by cutting it wrong. Whoever is cutting it needs to learn 1) use a serrated knife and 2) saw back and forth.  Otherwise you are killing the good efforts of the baker to make great bread.

Overall, not bad. We'll return another day, but will probably skip the kid's mac and cheese and go for something else.
author: Tracy L.

description:
If you are at the pier, this is the best restaurant there and it also is one of the ones that will validate parking in the nearby garage.

The clam chowder and crab is excellent, everything else like fish and chips is just average, but not bad.
author: Lily F.

description: Kids and uncle went last nite. Said they were craving fish and was excellent.  Nice dining experience
author: Stuart K.

description: Yum, I'm allergic to seafood and took my boyfriend out for a special date. He loved it and I did as well. The food was so fresh !!! Even the veggies were fresh. Have to check out this spot. My favorite was the interaction between our waiter and the cookie !
author: Derrion K.

description: Waiting time was about 30 minutes, we were seated in the rear with a fairly decent view of the Bay. The waiter suggested the calamari with lemon  aoli for starters. It was my crab and assorted shellfish was too.
author: Steve K.

description: My girlfriend and I came here during my first ever trip to California. The views were gorgeous and the service/food was even better! Our server was Khaiman and he did a fantastic job and his recommendations were on point! The hibiscus margarita is to die for!
author: Sarah M.

description:
The whole crab is good and fresh.I am nearly full by half of it. 
Grilled fish and shrimp is also good.
Pricy anyway.

Amy. R is very nice and kind.
author: Tianli B.

description: Great food! The place has such fresh everything which I really appreciate! The one criticism I have is that the people just ask too much how good the food is. "Is everything good?" "Is everything good?" Yes it's delicious. We got asked like four to five times about if everything is good. Other than that everything was very tasty and defiantly worth going back -- despite the many times they ask how good everything is, many many times.
author: Michelle M.

description:
I have a feeling my local friends would cringe that I ate at this tourist destination, but tourists need good food too. I have to admit that my meal at Fog Harbor Fish House was just as tasty as some of the local hotspots i"ve tried. And the view of the pier was also quite lovely.

Our waiter was eager to please and when he thought he had mixed up my wine with a colleague's wine I thought he was going to have a slight heart attack. He apologized about 80 times and bought us some delish chocolate banana bread pudding (yuummm) for dessert.  We didn't even care about the mixup, but we're never ones to say no to free dessert.

However, before dessert comes apps and entrees. For apps we ordered the crab ceviche and shrimp cocktail. The crab ceviche itself was pretty tasty, but they were pretty skimpy with the chips that came with it. 4 total chips for our group of 5! The shrimp cocktail were a bit wimpy looking, especially for SF where I've had some incredible seafood, but they still tasted good.

My entree was incredible. I ordered off the special menu for the night. Pesto halibut that came with mozzarella cheese, figs and some other delicious goodies on the side.  This was the best fish I remember enjoying in a long time. Hopefully they'll be adding it to their main menu!

I'd definitely go back during my frequent trips to SF and may even drag some local friends with me next time!
author: Andrea R.

description: The food was great and our waiter was fantastic. The salmon tasted really fresh and it basically melted in your mouth. This place is definitely a must for San Francisco. 4 stars because I left something at the restaurant and when I called back to see if anyone found it the girl who "helped" was extremely unfriendly. She even hung up the phone on me when I was trying to think her for "looking". Rude. But the food was awesome!
author: Hazel M.

description: Great location with views of the harbor and Alcatraz. Come here for the clam chowder it is defiantly worth it! The sour dough bread too. My half lobster tail stuffed with crab not worth it.  Two bites of crab and lobster for $36 not happy about that The shrimp cocktail was itty bitty shrimp. I was Expecting large shrimp. Disappointment. Come for the Clam chowder.
author: Gwen R.

description: This place is great, even if you don't like fish like me! Blue cheese garlic bread is an instant favorite and the flat iron steak was cooked perfectly. Khaiman was awesome, and made an excellent dessert recommendation... The blondie is killer!
author: Tracy S.

description: My cousins came in from out of town and we came to fog harbor for dinner. Our waiter Samir was courteous and efficient. I believe my cousins and I had a wonderful dining experience. Thank you Samir.
author: Charleen R.

description:
Last night, decided to head here for dinner with some friends.

Made an online reservation for 5 and the only time available was for 9:30pm.  No worries.

We arrived and were promptly seated in a booth by the windows with a great view.

We ordered a nice bottle of wine, fried Calamari, Raw Oysters, Baked Oysters, a couple of Surf & Turfs, a couple of Linguine with Clams and their Cioppino.

I was curious about a line below the Cioppino for "Lazy Cioppino for $5 extra".  Seems this is for customers who don't want to deal with hassle of cracking your own crab.

Like the Fish & Chips I ate previously, the food was great.  Raw Oysters were fresh, Cioppino was bursting with flavor and a decent amount of seafood.  Linguine was cooked very well and the steaks were perfectly cooked to temperature.

So why only 3 stars?

The service was kinda bad.  It seemed like the server had a bad day and was distracted with a frustrated scowl.  We had to remind him about bringing us our bottle of wine.  Tabasco was requested 2 times from our server and once to another server walking by.  The other server looked frustrated but brought us the Tabasco.  Our waiter brought another bottle after a while.  Water took a few tries.  Kids asked for A1 steak sauce and that took a couple of requests.

By the time he noticed that our wine was depleted and asked if we wanted another, we really didn't want to order any more from him and asked for the check.

I would easily give 4 stars for the food and facilities.  But can't ignore the service this night.
author: David P.

description: Service was great, our server was awesome and the hostess honored our request to be by the window. The only thing that I have to complain about is the burnt bread I got with my cioppino. The cioppino itself was delicious however the bread was completely burned not just toasted. I didn't complain to the server because they had already made the mistake; I really did want to let them know  especially the head chef  that a bread that looks like that should NEVER be placed in anyone's plate especially when you're paying $32 for a plate!! I was kinda bummed about that...aside from that clam chowder was good, bf's fish platter was really good. We also got pumpkin bread pudding they said it was good, rich with raisins. I didn't try it so can't say anything about it.
author: Ludmila A.

description: Had the crab ravioli was very good amazing view. Others had steam clams, lobster tails, and crab all was well worth the wait. Was told 30-40 minute wait was only about 20 minutes not bad for Saturday night
author: Donna L.

description: Reserved for dinner about a month in advance for a special occasion for 3. I requested for a less busier window seating upon arrival. Host had a bad attitude and told us to wait until she calls us. We should have walked away then. Host sat us by the bar and very close to entrance of the building. We saw many tables available inside the room so we asked the host for another table further inside with less distractions. When we politely flagged the host as she passed by to request for another table, she spoke to us in a condescending manner and told us to figure it out with the server.  Their solution to our request was to move our table to a booth about 3 feet away. Another chance to just walk out but I didn't want to spoil the occasion. We ordered crab cakes, dozen oysters, ciopinni with pasta, seafood platter for 2 with 3 lobster tails. The hospitality here does not match the price. We selected this restaurant because it was suppose to have a nice view and ambiance. We spent about $300 for 3. I recommend spending your money where they appreciate your business.
author: Joseph L.

description: If you are looking for a delicious seafood dinner, where you can sit down and enjoy beautiful views at the same time, this is the place to be! We ordered oysters, shrimp, clams, mussels, cod, swordfish - and everything was very fresh and delicious! Also, the best clam chowder soup in all of San Fran!! They didn't lie when they said it was award-winning soup. We made reservations on open table, but you could also walk up there and put yourself on a waiting list.
author: Yuliana A.

description: I was in town with my kids, 8 and 10 years old, and I wanted to have a nice meal out. They sat us with other families near the back but with a stunning view. I liked that they recognized that other patrons might not want to have kids all over the restaurant and were thoughtful in our seating. I didn't have to worry about annoying others who were on very romantic dates. The food was INCREDIBLE and the service was stellar. We were so comfortable and it didn't even feel like we were near the crowds outside. We watched the fog roll in on the golden gate, and all of us were fully satisfied with the food. Thank you! We will definitely be back the next time we visit the city!
author: Becca H.

description: I was expecting better considering the reviews but I had a fresher seafood meal at the ferry building the night before I ate here. My mother and I ordered the seafood platter for a two and though the portion was plentiful enough for us some of the shellfish on the platter did not seem very fresh. I was also disappointed with the serving size of clam chowder that comes in the bread bowl. You are better off getting a cup of it without the bread bowl. The meals come with complimentary sourdough anyways. Normally you get what you pay for but not here.
author: Suzanne M.

description: Pricey but you're at Fisherman's Wharf so what can you do.  Meal was great, had the burger which was delicious, wife had the fish.  Great meal, they take your cell when you get there if it's busy and send you a text when your seat is ready.  Beautiful view on the water, such an a amazing city and a great place to eat.
author: Josh D.

description: great food. so much flavor. i recommend the linguini and clams pasta. atmosphere is nice  but it's really nice during a late dinner time because it's a little dim in there. i liked it because everyone was minding their own business as it should be. the noise level is a little loud but it's very private also ... nice tables and comfy seats. definitely  would go here again ... my boyfriend and i love trying new spots in sf. i will definitely star this one as a return to spot. nice dinner date location. great service , amazing food. not too pricy for what you get....(fresh seafood).  check this place out. you won't regret it. oh and you have a view of the water also which looks even better at night.
author: Annie C.

description:
Awesome place right on Pier 39 to have the best seafood the Bay area has to offer!

Got a surf n turf that came with a perfect medium filet accompanied by a fresh Lobster Tail. Service was flawless and I was very impressed by the consistency of it given that tourists like me come and go all day long.

I was pretty hungover from the W all night so I didn't get to try the cocktails, but I did overlook the bartender going HAM on the mojitios, so try one of those out for me!

Overall, a must stop when walking the SF embarcadero .. Try it after the GoldenGate Blue Line cruise for the best experience!!
author: Luis F.

description: This restaurant is great. It really does have the best view of any restaurant I've been to in San Francisco so far. The wait staff was very friendly and welcoming. Everything we had we liked, all the food was prepared correctly. I really loved the trout. We shared an apple crisp for dessert and it was awesome! So tasty! This place is definitely worth going to.
author: Ellie O.

description:
This use to be my absolutely favorite place to go to dinner while visiting the city, but tonight changed all of that. After driving 2 hours to come to dinner here with my son, I was greeted by the worst hostess ever. The first thing I asked for was a table by the window. It was a slow night, lots of available seating near the massive Windows, I thought to myself, SCORE! Dining with a view tonight. What I got was totally opposite of that! Readers discretion, I did have my toddler with me, who by the way was actually a saint tonight, even though, I thought a slow night, not a lot of stuck up kid hating people, shouldn't be too bad. Well... Too bad so Sad. Here's what happened: So we first get sat in a booth facing the window. The hostess must of not had a lot of experience with children because as she walked off, I had to call her back and ask for a high chair, she looked at me with puzzlement and semi annoyance, and says: "well you can sit here with a high chair?!"...DUH!! I could have told her that. So, naturally I think, well they're a couple 2 and 4 tops (tables) in plain site next to the window where we can replace a chair with a high chair, no problem! Think again, she sticks me in the far back of the restaurant, farthest away from the window!! WTF!! By this point, my own enjoyment was out of the question, I have to feed my kid and I'm starving, not worth the fight anymore because this "hostess" was obviously discriminatory towards anyone with a kid , and or was just plain clueless about what she was suppose to do. 
Food was ok, had the Salmon BLT, which was cooked well. I was looking forward to desert, but the waitress either got busy or was tired of dealing with a quiet table and just dropped off the check. All the while, I saw her offer Desert to the other tables in her section. Apparently my money is not good enough for this restaurant.  

If you're looking at this restaurant as a possible place for a great dining experience with excellent service and is family friendly...skip it. Go to the restaurant in the front of the wharf.  Or take a short trip to SCOMA's or Woodhouse fish co. Both are fantastic! Great service and food.

Dear management, please train your hostesses to care and show them how to seat your patrons, I saw another lady actually throw a fit and ask to speak with a manager because of said hostesses tonight.. Seems like I wasn't the only one tonight .  Please don't waste your time or money here.
author: Clifford C.

description:
Our server was friendly and always attentive.
I got the ah-hi tuna plate. It came as described, rare. It was very good. Next time I will ask for medium rare. I am not a huge fan of raw fish in my mouth.
author: Mikee R.

description:
The food, service and overall atmosphere were INCREDIBLE.  Chef Adolfo is a master at his craft, knows about every single item on the menu and can read his customers' perfectly well.  

What a great experience! I will come back here when I'm back in SF and will never forget the wonderful service we received at the Fog Harbour :)
author: Ceci G.

description:
The quality and presentation of the food we ordered deserves a 5 star rating. Unfortunately for me, I got the waitress who couldn't communicate well,  neglected the crusty sourdough bread ( I needed to request some 2/3 into the meal), set down, then picked up my unlocked at check. 

Anyway great seafood, poor service.
author: Karl H.

description:
Can say much for the dining experience since my girl and I sat at the bar.  The 5 stars go to our bartender and server Jason!  

We came in here rather late because I've never had clam chowder at pier 39... (I know, I've finally crawled out of that damn rock called Sacramento). Yelped this place and it got decent reviews. I ordered the sourdough bread bowl while she got just a bowl (came with a ton of sliced French bread). Both were DELICIOUS!  Creamy, thick, but not too thick, decent proportion of clams without any sand (as it should be!).   That was all we ate, but we did have a few drinks as Jason was hard at work answering all our curiosities. He got our drift and noticed we were the typical "on the cocktail list" drinkers and made a bomb Manhattan (with the best whiskey soaked black cherries) and orange citrus old fashion. We didn't even ask for these drinks but knew we'd like them. We had a great time and I have to say it was all because of Jason!  Clam chowder was good too.

Check it out and tip Jason well!
author: Mike L.

description:
Waited 20 minutes to see anyone from the wait staff. When Travvis finally got around to us, we ordered everything at once. 2 waters, 2 clam chowder in the bread bowls, and 2 draft beers. The bread bowl showed up. A few minutes later the water made it. Finally, we'll in to the bread bowl the beer made it - never saw Travvis again until I asked for the check. 

We went there for the clam chowder and we're not disappointed with the food.
author: Larry K.

description:
I recently had dinner at Fog Harbor this past weekend with family, unfortunately the wait was long, BUT definitely worth it! The food was very good, fresh and tasty (hats off to the chef!) 

Our waitress made our experience even better!!!! We had two children and things get a little crazy with kids at a nice restaurant. Meron, our waitress, was very friendly and welcoming. She gave the kids stickers as well as their drinks before the adults, which definitely kept them occupied while we figured out what they wanted to drink/eat. Our favorite appetizer was the Red Chili Shrimp, which very tasty and had just enough spice for a little kick. I ordered the Shell Fish Platter for one with the garlic noodles and my partner had the Crab Cioppino, both very good dishes! Meron never left us dry by making sure we each had a cold beer in hand and always asked if we needed anything else, and NOT in an annoying way that some servers do. She also chatted with us, checked up on the kids, and made us feel at home. We all loved her! Thank you Meron for making our dining experience a great one! We will be back!
author: La 1.

description: Chowder, wedge salad, halibut and ciappino was exceptional. Make it a point to eat here every time in SF.
author: Dan S.

description: Great views and good food. Grilled salmon was tasty with a nice presentation. Crispy calamari and the chowder were wonderful along with the hot sourdough bread.
author: T B.

description: Disappointed.  This place is VERY pricey!  Great location and view however there are many other choices nearby we would have rather have tried.  We went based on fellow yelp reviews that we read.  We ordered 2 drinks from the bar, 2 bowls of clam chowder and an appetizer and it was $60.  Chowder was just okay.  Our server was in a crazy rush the entire time (although we got here late and the place was not that busy).  Made us feel very rushed also.  He actually took my soup away before I was even done without asking me.  My suggestion:  if your going to spend the money - get away from the wharf a little and don't fall for the tourist trap like we did.
author: Erin R.

description: First time here, and wow our server Madison had great recommendations for drinks food and appetizers.  We were checked on regularly throughout our meal.  I had a seafood combo plate, per our servers recommendation, and the Salmon was melt in my mouth status, the sauce was perfect and the fish was cooked perfectly.  Highly satisfied with the food and friendly service, this will be my future stop instead of The Fransiscian resturaunt which we used to frequent in the SF area.
author: Michael M.

description: Great choice at Pier 39 for seafood! Aside from the dirty wine glass and peppercorn in one of our iced waters, the food was delicious and the view was perfect! We started with the breaded scallop appetizers and ordered the cioppino, mixed seafood grill, fish and chips, and linguine and clams (best I've ever had btw)! Hot bread and butter was yummy as well. Had the dual dessert with mini chocolate cake and creme brûlée. Bummed that they didn't offer fresh berries for dessert. All in all, would highly recommend this place.
author: Kim P.

description: We were at Fisherman's Wharf and couldn't decide which place to eat at, so we referred to Yelp! The Fog Harbor seemed to have great reviews and a decent selection of food to accommodate the pickiest of eaters, so we went there. We were there around 3:00 and there was a little big of a wait. We were able to walk around while waiting. They send a text when your table is ready. We ordered the Pacific Sole and Grilled Shrimp. Both were very fresh and delicious, but COVERED in butter. I would suggest ordering with light butter or none at all. The service was great and very attentive to our needs. Would definitely recommend to all!
author: Christine L.

description: We came here for our anniversary and nearly didn't stay because the hostess was far from warm and fuzzy.  Luckily the bartender was amazing and we just ate there. When we asked what was good to order, he didn't tell us the most expensive thing on the menu (which was nice). We trusted him and had the best meals. Super great food, awesome drinks, great view, fun people (minus the hostess).
author: Jennifer L.

description: Large juicy lobster, peeled Dungeness crab, and tasty ciopino. One of the few reasonable places in a touristy setting.
author: Sean G.

description:
Spent a lot of time finding this restaurant. The actual location is different from the one shown on yelp.
The food is not bad, and the service is great, and it is not that expensive compared the standard price in the area.
author: Aaron S.

description: Food is good here, come for that and reasonably priced. There's probably still going to be hit & misses but you can tell it's good in general. But 2 for 2 we've had poor service. The kind that makes you feel unwelcomed or judged. Maybe they treat their staff like crap, it looks like it really depends on the server you get. Half of them look irritated and other half look friendly.
author: Kane C.

description:
First off I love the the ambiance and I'm all about the ambiance! Very peaceful, with the windows overlooking the bay. Customer service is quite delightful, too.

They have really good cioppino here. Other dishes like angel hair/pasta dishes are also pretty juicey. Their portions are also very large which I like. Prices are obviously on the steeper side, but surprisingly not too much of a tourist trap considering the quality of the food.

Would recommend!
author: Michelle Y.

description: Good food, great service! I had the bay shrimp cocktail and my husband had a bread bowl of clam chowder and both were delicious. We shared a combo platter and that was really good as well. The service was fantastic! Always attentive without being annoying. Our main entree, that we were sharing, came out on two separate plates from the kitchen for us. The view of the bay and Alcatraz was good.
author: Jennie B.

description:
We had a light lunch here on our last day in San Francisco and thoroughly enjoyed it. I had the Red Chili shrimp which was very spicy and very good. The sauce was so flavorful that even though I usually skip the bread, I used it to get even more of the sauce. Hubby had the clam chowder bowl and thought it was solid and second only to the chowder at Scoma's during our visit this time.
It was fun to watch the sea lions while we were having lunch and then to walk around on the pier after eating.
author: Kathy M.

description:
Celebrated my wife's birthday here. Our experience was great! The food was awesome we ordered the jumbo shrimp & crab cake for our starter and the Lazy Cioppino plates for our entree.

Tyler was listening when I told my wife she needed to decide what desert to choose. He made it special for her with a great solo of happy birthday!
Awesome place!
Thanks
author: Mark H.

description: This place was recommended to us by our Lyft driver, Rose. As soon as we stepped in we knew it was going to be a spectacular lunch. From the outside it doesn't seem like much. Once you step inside, you realize you're in for a beautiful view of Pier 39, Alcatraz, and the Golden Gate. For an appetizer, we had the baked oysters, which were incredibly delicious. Spinach, bacon, and a little cream sauce. What's not to love? For lunch we had the Wild King Salmon and the Mixed Grill, which comes with a little shrimp, salmon, and swordfish (the best of it!). For dessert, we tried the blonde brownie and the apple crisp. Neither one disappointed us. All in all, it is a great place to take in all of San Francisco. Thanks to rose for the great recommendation.
author: Blanca A.

description: Wow!  Amazing food and excellent service! We  wanted to go to a nice restaurant with loads of seafood options to celebrate our birthdays! After a short wait, we were seated near the water and had a great view of the boats and sea lions. Our server took our order swiftly, and just as quick, returned with our appetizers.  For my meal, I chose the Dungeness Crab Ravioli, and was so delish!  Since it was my birthday, I was treated with a tiramisu dessert. We had such a great experience!
author: Jill F.

description: I went here today for lunch with other travellers from my Hostel. The view was great at this restaurant! I had the clam chowder to start which was amazing, for my entre I had the whole crab. The crab was cooked well and so were the potatoes and veggies. Everyone else at my table seemed to enjoy the food just as much. I'm glad I tried this place out on my trip, I'll recommend it to anyone else who travels here!
author: Andrea S.

description: I can't help but give this place 5 stars!  We picked this location based on previously Yelp reviews.  We drove into the city from Sonoma before catching a flight home.  Fortunately for us it was a Tuesday afternoon.  We found immediate parking and walked in and were seated immediately.  The service was great.  Our waitress was friendly and checked in on us.  The food was delicious!  It satisfied our craving for fresh seafood and flavor was on point!  My daughter had the clam chowder with crab and I had the swordfish.   We shared an appetizer (baked oysters with spinach and parmesan OMG!) and a main dish and our bill with tip came to $90.   If you can appreciate upscale dining then the prices shouldn't be to shocking.  I would go back and pay it again simply for the flavor and freshness of what was served!
author: Teresa H.

description: my favorite meal in San Fran.  does not take reservations on Saturdays and Sundays so we went around 5pm on Saturday and got seated in about 10 minutes
author: Elizabeth E.

description:
We came to this place largely on the reviews and it did not disappoint.  We came at 2:30 pm.  Still a very busy time but no wait.  Every seat has a terrific view of the harbor and GG Bridge.  All the staff were wonderful, especially our server, Ashley.  

All of our meals were top notch.  The clam chowder was superb.  It had just the right amount of creaminess to it.  The blue cheese garlic bread was original and an excellent side to wet the appetite.  The seafood penne did not disappoint.  And if you are thinking of getting the dungeness crab, spend the extra $2 to get the garlic roasted whole dungeness crab.  To die for!!!  And if you are looking for a healthier alternative, the dungeness crab mango cerviche salad was just as delicious.
author: Gene C.

description: My husband I arrived for lunch without reservation on a weekday. When my husband asked the hostess for a table with view she told us to wait for five minutes. In less than five minutes she led us to a table where the view of the bay was so nice that we chose to sit next to each other facing the view. We ordered beer, berry press, clam chowder with crabmeat, fish & chips, and rock cod special. We both found the drinks and food fresh and flavorful. In addition, our waitress was so attentive and helpful that she enhanced our dining experience. That day I did not find Fisherman's Wharf enjoyable due to crowds. Luckily my dining experience at Fog Harbor Fish House was extremely enjoyable.
author: Kay C.

description: Went there today for lunch with my wife. What an awesome restaurant. Our server was Ashley and we could not have asked for a finer server. She was knowledgeable about the menu and the area. The food was out promptly. We both had the Pacific Cod special and it was absolutely great. We are visiting San Francisco for our wedding anniversary and had planned on doing our anniversary dinner elsewhere but during this amazing meal we changed our plans. We are going back. We can only hope to have Ashley as our server again. I couldn't end this review without mentioning the view. The view was as spectacular as the food and service !
author: Tommy T.

description: I was with a party of four and we all ordered something different.  No complaints! The food was fresh and delicious.  We sat at bar and the service was on point.
author: Stephanie K.

description: We finished night tour in Alcatraz and got back at 7 p.m. We have a great night here and the food is good. The sever is busy but helpful. I will definitely give five stars if I can get a sea view seat.
author: 亚龄

description: Was really worried with all the reviews and in a touristy area that it was just going be another high priced tourist trap. I just wanted to have a nice lunch with a view and enjoy some good drinks. I sat at the bar, and the bar staff was phenomenal! They were just fun to watch, and were very attentive to the bar customer while still being busy from all the drink orders around the restaurant! The drinks were poured perfectly! Not too strong, not too light, but perfect and enjoyable! The food was good too! Clam chowder was loaded with large chunks of clam, and very tasty. Lots of places skimp on the clam, but not here. Fish and chips were equally as tasty! Crispy fries, not soggy limp fries. And the fish was meaty with not too much batter but the batter was so good I wouldn't have minded if it was like other places where it's all batter and no fish! Lol. Really enjoyed it and would love to come back! Bottom line- was a good quality place, and not an over priced tourist trap.
author: K D.

description:
My boyfriend took me here for my birthday celebration!!!
Service was friendly, food was great and looking forward to go again!
author: Annie R.

description: Where to start, just incredible place. The view, table settings the staff just incredible dining experience. The bread was warm and fresh, the mussels and fries were amazing. Our meals were fantastic, many selections that were on the menu which is always a plus. Everything on the menu was cooked amazingly, just and overall great experience. Only downside was the waiter took a little bit of time to get a drink order, but nothing that will keep me from going back.
author: Elfego S.

description: The food was pretty good but the service was subpar. Waited 20 minutes for a margarita and it arrived after we were done eating. Our server did his best not to make much eye contact so we wouldn't ask anything. I had the lobster which was a bit tough but still tasty and my husband had the fish and chips which was lovely flaky fish. Their lipstick lemon drop was good but was shirt poured just like the old fashioned we ordered. Their hibiscus margarita was neat but not worth the wait. The view is the only real reason to do this place if you are on Pier 39, otherwise you might not really miss much.
author: Amanda C.

description:
My parent's hotel, The Argonaut, recommended them and I'd previously read on SFGate this restaurant is notable.

I have to tell you - and it might be a surprise to you as well since it's at PIER 39 - it is.

From the food to the service and certainly the views, Fog Harbor Fish House is about as perfect as you'll get for a San Francisco seafood restaurant.

Specializing in sustainable seafood and with a luxe, Malibu-style gorgeous outdoor space by the entry complete with roaring fireplace, Fog Harbor Fish House is a perfect choice for out-of-town friends and family you're hosting to a romantic date. 

It's such a surprise to find a "view" restaurant not resting on its laurels or looking a little dated and frumpy (you know who you are).

From the overflowing amount of crab in the San Francisco favorite Crab Louie salad, to the crispy and fresh calamari appetizer to truly, one of the best bowls of steamed clams you may ever have, it was a perfect lunch at Fisherman's Wharf.

Sleek, modern yet comfortable, the ambiance strikes the perfect chord as does its food.

It's just a bit pricey (you will, after all, pay for the pluperfect view) however the quality and postcard perfect location equate to Fog Harbor Fish House being well-priced.

I would go there again in a heartbeat, all on my "local own"   -without out-of-town family and friends.

If you're thinking, "Wow, that's pretty high praise"... it is.

And Fog Harbor Fish House surely deserves it.
author: Jennifer O.

description:
Coming from a local, for being a top tourist spot, there really aren't that many great restaurants on Pier 39. Some take advantage of you with their high prices and low quality food while others simply suck. Yet, in the midst of all of these posers, Fog Harbor is the gem of Pier 39. 
The decor and the overall ambiance makes for a romantic/cozy environment. Perfect for a date night which was exactly what I was looking for. In fact, it surpassed my expectations. Nothing like those dirty old fish houses that line the pier (cough cough Aliotos and Cioppinos). Props to the interior designer. I see you workin' ;)
The food was amazing. The clam chowder was some of the best that I've ever had although I do wish that they had given us more as it seemed as if there was only half a cup of chowder inside the bread bowl. Besides the chowder, my gf and I split the Shellfish Platter for 2 ($58). It was huge, very tasty, and well pleasing to my camera lens. Oh. And not a spec of sand was found. 
Service was great too. We had the taller blond/brunette gal with glasses as our server. She was extremely attentive, very considerate, and really knowledgeable of the menu. She was a tad stiff though so maybe the management needs to give her a free spa day. Cuz trust me, she's an asset as a waitress and you guys probably owe her a raise or a spa day anyways.
author: Joshua F.

description: It's overpriced and touristy but an essential SF experience. The setting is really nice with great view of the harbor. We came here on Saturday. It was packed but the service was fast.  We ordered 2 lobster tails ($38), a garlic roasted whole dungeon crab, fried combo and clam chowder. The lobster tails were ok. The crab was particularly dissapointed. It was $41 and it was a tiny blue-crab sized crab. The meat was super dry. If you must eat crab at Pier 39, go to nearby Crab House for a full sized dungeon crab for less. The fried combo was great. We all like it. The clam chowder is advertised as "award winning" on the menu but honestly nothing special. For $226, I expect better food. All in all, I will not come back unless someone pays for it.
author: Au N.

description:
This was really the only seafood place I got too experience while we were on san fran and I'm not dissapointed at all. Service was by far the best I have had in the city. Martin was extremely courteous and knowledgeable of the menu. He recommended a couple local catches and the oysters. 

The view really sets the mood overlooking the water and offers and a good shot of alcatraz. 

The food was absolutely delicious. The sourdough bread was warm and a great compliment to the meal. It only took about 10 minutes to get our food which really surprised me. I got the oysters and calm chowder in bread bowl which was perfect and my wife got the calamari which I usually don't like but this calamari did not have that spongy texture you often get from cheaper restaurants. 

Overall the food, service , and view combine to make a must eat san fran.
author: Davis W.

description:
Delicious food, great view from almost every table
We enjoyed the crispy calamari, crab cake and shared mixed grill
Best clam chowders- you gotta try
Creme brûlée was excellent as well- my son surprised me for my birthday
I recommend this restaurant, we keep coming here
author: Tendü Y.

description: The food was wonderful.  I just found our service person was a little rushed and gave use the wrong bill.  She was nice enough but they could use maybe a couple more people on the floor.   Wait time was just 10 minutes.  Really a great place.
author: Denise B.

description: Great view and somewhat good food. I went here with my husband for 1 of our wednesdate. We asked to sit near the window and they were able to place us near the window. Loved the view of the pier/ocean/alcatraz. Restaurant is very nice and looks elegant.The girl that greeted us at the front door was nice. Our server was a sweetheart. She has a very cute accent. We ordered 2 cups of clam chowder. It was okay. It had a lot of big clams, very thick and creamy but tasted bland. The sourdough bread they provide was delish. Our favorite was the baked oyster with parmesan and sprinkled bacon. It was so good and addicting. My husband ordered the fried combo which came with the fried shrimp, calamari and fish and fries and coleslaw. We both liked the calamari a lot. I ordered the Pacific sole with fingerling potatoes. I didn't like it at all. It had no taste. My Pinot Grigio from Lane CA was good. Wished they had more wine choices by the glass. Husband had a Coke to drink. Our parking lot ticket got validated which was nice. Bill came out to about $85 which I don't think this place is a $$..more like a $$$ & this was lunch time.
author: Sara L.

description: This place is amazing. The clam chowder was delicious,  the crab cakes were delectable and the shellfish dinner for two was beyond words. The dungeness and the mussels were the best I've ever had. From start to finish the service was on point. Really nice place for a special occasion. Do yourself a favor and come here!
author: Will G.

description: Just had my cousin's bday dinner at Fog Harbor. We got the calamari for our appetizer and I really enjoyed it! I got the pacific sole and my husband got the mixed grill and we both thought the food was tasty. And the view overlooking the water beautiful. Nice fancy little spot, definitely on the expensive side though.
author: MaryJane C.

description:
The restaurant is located at the front of Pier 39, is contemporary in style, and although it has been around for a while you can see they upkeep the property in detail. Even the bathroom was very clean...

The sour dough bread they served us was very warm, soft and fresh.

I ordered a cup of their clam chowder. The chowder had a nice mixture of slight thickness with potatoes and fresh clams.

For my entree I ordered the Salmon. The salmon was moist and fresh with just a bit of crunchiness from the grill. I've not had salmon sitting over the greens and baby potatoes, before. That made for a nice presentation and helped encourage an overall sampling from each various flavors and texture in each bite.

Our server Mel was very attentive!
author: Warren S.

description:
Best Calamari EVERRRRRRRRR!! 
Fresh hot sourdough bread too!! No need to get a bread bowl! They give you the hot bread. Clam chowder was yummy! 
Service was great! Also loved the view! Pretty much great no matter where you sit!! 
Best place on Pier! Definitely go here when you are looking to eat!
author: Madison A.

description: Beautiful space, right on the water, great views.  However, VERY touristy and way overpriced for small portions of sub-par food.  The $33 for Cioppino was not worth the money.  You get tiny bits of overcooked seafood in some chunky tomato soup.  I gave a couple of stars for our server, Samir, though.  He was attentive, friendly, and prompt with his service.
author: Amy M.

description: Our food was great and the restaurant atmosphere was lovely. We watched the sun set from our table and it was breathtaking. Our server was nice, made great recommendations, and got us to order dessert. Everything I ate was delicious as was the service.
author: Katie W.

description: The place was really nice! The only thing that I'll have to add is that our waiter did take a while to get to our table when we got there but we didn't really mind it since my boyfriend and I are very patient people and the food was so good! I'll definitely be coming again soon!
author: Armando L.

description: Very rude and judgemental host, rather have a mirror in the front so I can talk to myself.  Food was not bad. Message to management, for $15 an hour you can definitely get more personable staff, it's your first point of contact with your customers.
author: Patrick M.

description: Super impressed. I've been to Fog Harbor twice and have had super tasty, satisfying meals on both occasions. Rarely do I venture to Pier 39. It's always crawling with tourists and impossible to navigate around. And when it comes to eats, there are far, far, better spots outside of this area. But, the hubs surprised me with a day on the bay and after a long afternoon of wine and boating, we were craving a tasty, warm meal in the area. Sat at the bar and were dished up great service and food. Their clam chowder is on point. Of course, I wouldn't expect anything less given Fog's location and the area's claim to fame. Also tried the salmon dish which was delicious. I'll continue to recommend Fog Harbor to visitors who insist on spending time in this area, sigh ; ) Secretly, I wish it took up residence somewhere other than Pier 39!
author: Brianna M.

description: Great service. Great food. Even better view. I'd recommend the clam chowder with crab and baked oysters. Would be 5 stars but the loud atmosphere made it hard for conversation.
author: Emily E.

description:
Who knew such a good restaurant is alive and kickin in the biggest tourist trap ever?!

I ordered the mixed fish plate and the fish was sooo good!!!  

The rice wasn't cooked all the way but the bread made up for it. It was hot and yummy!!!

Save room for dessert!!!
author: AnneMarie W.

description: Just got off the plane from PA and was starved. We picked this place because it was on the beautiful pier 39. I had the California crab and avocado ceasar salad. It was literally one of the best things I have ever eaten (in my 41 years of life)!! It had piles and piles of fresh Bay blue crab, that were delish! Our server was very nice and informative helping us with the menu as well as our map! Also, sat by the window with the most amazing view of Alcatraz and the golden gate Bridge. I made my husband take me back 3 more times before we left, so I could get that salad! And I'm not a salad girl lol
author: Kristin S.

description: The best seafood place I have been to! I love crab and it's always fresh there when I go.  I normally get the award winning clam chowder and the Caesar salad with crab.  Also, the have the best crab cakes which you would expect being that it is a seafood restaurant. However I have been to some places that had horrible crab cakes and called themselves a seafood restaurant.  The restaurant is right on the water so it the scenery is so beautiful.  They have vey good dessert options. I have only had the chocolate cake which was good but a little too rich for my taste. But for anyone that is a chocolate lover I would still recommend getting it.
author: Dominique H.

description: We just had an amazing meal here! My dungeness crab was delicious! The view was beautiful...... Cocktails  perfect. The service was excellent, will definitely be back on our next visit!
author: Karen A.

description: Great quick lunch spot on Pier 39. The food was fresh and delicious. The kids menu wasn't huge but fish nuggets were a hit. I had fish & chips and he calamari & chips and both were good.
author: Beth M.

description: Love this place! Good food, nice view, reasonable price. Will definitely coming back!
author: Quyen L.

description:
Khaiman is a very nice guy and we had a great meal!!! It's awesome !!! 
The price is fair and the view is good too
author: Ruby L.

description: Food was wonderful, service was great. I had a bowl of clam chowder, fish and chips which were really really good. When we were seated we were greeted right away by our waiter. Service was prompt. Still giving a 5 star even though my only complaint is the hostesses at the front were not friendly at all, even a smile would've been ok or just a simple hello.
author: Angel L.

description:
The food, the view, the service all were really good at this place. Crab cakes are must try. We ordered mah mahi and another entrée and both were delicious. It is located very conveniently at pier 39 on 1st floor. 
I would recommend this place to my family and friends.
author: Yelp C.

description:
what a pleasant surprise for us to find this place - everything was yummy, from the clam chowder, the prawns, lobster roll, cocktails as well.

we were there around 10pm after the Alcatraz cruise so it's almost their closing time, they forgot to charge us couple of the stuff but we didn't mind... lol

get a window seat to enjoy the view.
author: Bonnie Y.

description: The food was amazing! We got the seafood sample and crab. But the service was sub par. Our waiter took forever to bring us beverages and water. This was on a weekday too.
author: Rena L.

description: The food great!  The service great!  Why am I only giving it 3 stars ... It was hotter than hell in there!  No air circulation.  It was to the point I just wanted to get out of there!  GET AN AC or OPEN A WINDOW!
author: Kathy N.

description: Ok so in a touristy location like the other reviews say but I do agree the food here is really great, clean restaurant and the view is awesome. The Manager came around to see how everyone is doing which is a rare service now a day. Top quality food and service!! Wild caught Salmon so so good!
author: Dawn V.

description: Amazing view of the ocean! In fact, it probably has the best view of pier 39 anywhere in town! The seafood is definitely on the pricier side but it is worth it. Their lobster and cioppino was very good and their free bread is pretty yummy too. The service was fantastic and attentive!
author: Timothy Y.

description: We came here last November after reading reviews here on yelp. The crab was so flavorful and actually not as expensive as we thought. Great views of the pier from many of the seats in the restaurant. Definitely earned me some cool points with my wife
author: Danny N.

description: I was in silicon valley on a business trip and had to stop in based on yelp reviews. They had a bit of a wait to sit by a window, but it was totally worth it. We started with crab cakes(suggested by my waiter). It was sooo good that when i gave my coworkwr a taste he had to order another.  I then ordered fish and chips combo which brings shrimp and calamari (which i substitued for another poece of fish ). It was sooo good that i didn't even touch the fries. My coworker ordered ordered the salmon which was tender and fresh. The view was amazing and all the nearby stores on pier 39 make this a must see when visiting san francisco.
author: Diana L.

description: This restaurant is AMAZING. I ordered the ciopoccini (sp?) and I couldn't get enough of it. It was packed full of mussels, scallops, crab and shrimp in a tomato basil sauce. It's definitely one of their best sellers for a reason. Our waitress was super friendly and even recommended some things to check out on our trip. The calamari was also great, it has fried jalapeños in it as well which I enjoyed. I also ordered an Alcatraz escape which was a tasty cocktail. THE VIEW in the restaurant is also fabulous we go to dine and see the bay as well as Alcatraz.
author: Morgan S.

description:
5 stars for the clam chowder. 

0 stars for the shit service you get for ordering "only" clam chowder. 

Don't advertise your award winning chowder if you don't want people to come in for it.
author: Kelly N.

description:
We went here on valentines day for dinner. 
What a great experience, even though the place was full we got a great table with great views within 30 mins. 
The food was amazing and the wine was delish. Total ley worth the wait
author: Andie A.

description: If i could give 10 stars I would.  First night in San Francisco and we wanted to eat by the fisherman wharf.   This place was outstanding - the most amazing server Osscar made our meal extra special.    Truly amazing.   Thank you
author: jen m.

description:
What a great view!  Worth the price of entry even before the meal.  

The service is also top notch.  While I normally do not go with any suggestions from the servers, I usually find it is their way to build up the check, somehow this felt different.  The clam chowder is a great starter, it probably would make for a great entree and dessert too.  Always being a fan of crab cakes I had to give them a try, great decision.  Combined with the baked oysters appetizer and a nice bottle of wine made for a great meal after another long day.
author: Panas S.

description: Excellent service and food to die for.  The steak and lobster was absolutely fabulous.  Well done steak was not rubbery, kudos to the cook for maintaining the texture and flavor.  Clam chowder was some of the best I've ever had.  The service and meal was worth the drive from Sacramento.
author: William D.

description: Best Seafood I've had!! We shared crab cake, clam chowder with crab and cioppino :) We were full and my husband can eat a lot:)
author: Tobi B.

description: We were lucky to get in without reservations and no wait! The clam chowder was indeed the best! We also had a mixed seafood dish which was fabulous! The halibut was also great! Service was good as well.
author: amy t.

description:
Had a wonderful table with beautiful views.  Waiter was attentive & perky - made many suggestions for dining & other things to do near the wharf.
Had Bleu Cheese Garlic Bread Ap (free with coupon from welcome center), roasted beet salad - awesome, poke - fabulous, fresh & a crab sandwich - just delicious.  The crab sandwich was in a sort of bread pocket & grilled.... really very good.
author: Debbie S.

description:
We stopped in on a whim, we liked that they fished 100% sustainably! And the view of the harbor, Golden Gate Bridge, and Alcatraz was great! Wow well we were pleasently surprised! The food was absolutely amazing! We had the crab and risotto fritters and then swordfish and the lobster tail as entrees. Finishing with the apple crumble and tiramisu as desert, the apple crumble was the better of the two though but were great! But really it was our waiter Charlie that made us love it even more. His service was great and he was able to really make recommendations and seemed very knowledgeable about the food and the wines! And the manager on duty was also a pleasure to talk to and was on the floor much of the night so she was easy to grab and talk to!
We'll definitely be back and would definitely recommend!
author: Ginger B.

description: Busy Friday afternoon in San Francisco's pier 39. One of many restaurants there, called ahead checking to see what wait times were and or/if reservations were needed. Hostess stated 15-20, but could change. Understood. Showed up and put out name down. Pleasantly surprised we were sat about 10 min in. We were sat window side between two other tables, the place was clean and everyone was enjoying their meal. Took a few minutes for us to get greeted, which really wasn't   an issue on a nt when you're taken straight back considering the tourism.  However, we'd been waiting previously and had time to look over the menu and decide quickly. Drinks were delivered in a timely fashion. My wife enjoyed glass of wine and I had a sapphire martini. Food was delivered about 15 min later which was nice as my wife l, son and I enjoyed conversation along w/ the views. When the food was dropped off, it was still hot and looked great. My wife and I exchanged tastes and were not disappointed. Our 6 yr. old had no complaints...  Awesome. All in all it was a pleasant experience for a touristy area.
author: Julio D.

description:
Enjoying a few short hours in this fantastic city via a cruise ship...looking for that one fantastic seafood meal, we ended up here thanks to a glance at Yelp via cellphone before the battery expired.

   Encouraged by 4-star reviews, and in need of dungeness crab we walked up the stairs to this restaurant and were promptly seated.  Then we waited.  For a long time.  Finally a server appeared and she was very friendly and informative.  Unfortunately I didn't take her advice.  Wanting easy dungeness goodness, I ordered the dungeness crabcakes. We ordered chowder to share, and husband went with fried shrimp platter.

  DON'T do what we did.  We soooooooo ordered wrong.  After a couple trips to the restroom which enabled me to see all the awesome food here, all I can say is DON'T order what we did.   Order ANYthing ELSE.  

  Chowder was okay, decent and husband's fried shrimp was okay. My crabcakes were two giant FRIED cakes of lots of filler. Sooooo NOT what I wanted.  But again I blame myself.  The server had steered me in a different direction and I (stupidly) didn't listen. 

  Sadly, we left feeling like we had totally ordered wrong, had not had that terrific San Fran seafood experience, and must come back and redeem ourselves next time.

  Do try this place...most importantly DO listen to the server for recommendations, and follow their advice.  Otherwise, you might have a pricey ($62 before  tip) lunchtime mistake like we did.
author: Lori R.

description: The garlic crab was amazing. As was the clam chowder bread bowl! And our waitor Samir did a fantastic job! And the great views if the ocean were a plus!
author: Emily O.

description:
This is a fantastic seafood place with a view of Alcatraz, the Golden Gate bridge and  San Francisco Bay and is easily one of the best waterfront dining experiences I've ever had. The prices are up there because it's a high volume tourist area, but you won't  mind paying for the quality. It's as close as you'll find from ocean to plate. 

The dining room is enormous and formal, however there are all kinds eating here. The waitress was fantastic and frequent to check in. There is tons of natural light from the enormous windows and the dining room is immaculate. 

The menu features all your seafood staples, but the award winning chowder and roasted jalapenos with scallops are favorites. Make this a destination restaurant, if you're in town.
author: Darren F.

description:
This trip was the second time I've eaten here and it doesn't disappoint. Great food, good service and pretty views. 

They have modified dishes for me that have come out perfect. 

Both time I've also always had to ask for separate check with out trouble. The most recent, there were only 3 people but the first time there were about 15, and they did it perfectly.
author: Michelle M.

description:
We live in the East Bay and came her for our evening in SF due to the great reviews on Yelp.

1. Lots of hot  warm fresh Boudin baked bread. Am embarrassed we had 2 basketfuls for the 2 of us.
2. They serve sustainable fresh seafood.
3. Clean environment, crisp linens. Did not look rundown. I did not expect this being this is a location on Pier 29.
4. Great View of the Bay
author: Mocha G.

description:
I'll start with the good: the food here is really good. Unfortunately our service was terrible.

We showed up, ordered drinks and food. The waitress suggested we split our Caesar salad which was nice and everything seemed ok. But when the appetizer and salad came, the waitress forgot the drinks. When we finished the appetizers, she asked if we wanted dessert (forgetting our mains). When it was time to pay, it took a solid 15 minutes between pulling out my card and getting the receipt to sign. I wanted to stand up and say "take my money! Please!"

This is the worst service I've had in years. Unacceptable.
author: Z N.
