description: This is my second time here. It's a great place to take friends and family visiting the Pier. Everyone is friendly. Only about a 5-20 minute wait both times that I've been. The view is fantastic. Samir took great care of us and definitely was a pleasure to have as a server. We didn't have to ask for much as Samir was on top of our service and making sure we enjoyed everything. It was a great experience!
author: Marissa H.

description: Lunchtime view was absolutely amazing. Service was excellent and meal was good. I had the grill which included shrimp, swordfish and salmon. When reading over reviews, I saw many complain of price. Personally, I wasn't offended at the prices.
author: Gloria H.

description: The food over there were good. The problem I have was that we could not hear to each other even though we sat face to face. They set up tables really close to one another. They have more tables than it is supposed to be. If you want romantic dinner with nice view, please DON'T go over there. The noisiest restaurant ever.
author: Swe Zin T.

description:
Food is good, but a bit pricey. You can see out the window though to the water so there is a nice, relaxing view. Touristy. 

I had the crab roll as recommended by the waiter-it did not disappoint...until I got the check-it came out to be $19 for a sandwich and fries. If i had paid attention to the price maybe that would have deterred me to choose something else. But it was good. I'll say that. And it's a hefty portion. I can't make that meal myself so worth it.
author: F T.

description:
Amazing seafood, drinks and deserts!!!

Amy our server and Mario the manager made the evening great and memorable.  

We will be back.
author: Robert C.

description: Good food. Excellent blended strawberry margaritas. Fish was spot on perfect. Good environment since we had a baby with stroller.  Great ocean view while eating. Stop by for excellent Fish and Chips and have some good drinks.
author: Nick L.

description: Very touristy location, but great food and service! Would have given five stars, but a long wait and noisy setting which is understandable given the location. The mussels and salmon are highly recommended.
author: David S.

description: Had a great lunch with a view.  Ate the fresh caught COD it was perfectly prepared with awesome sides. Service was good and the manager cared if you had a great experience.
author: Kristen N.

description: This place was so good! We sat next to the window with the best of views, which was amazing. The food was great! We ordered the garlic roasted crab, do yourself a favor and order a whole crab not 1/2. The cod special was delicious and my partner really enjoyed the fish and chips. I would of reviewed it as a 5 star but the waiter was absent most of the time and i desperately needed a glass of water!
author: Josh V.

description:
This is a really fancy establishment located on Pier 39. They have a waiting room right outside their establishment which definitely resembles an actual living room with an actual fireplace! 

 Service was pretty attentive aside from the fact theirbwater is practically lukewarm.. I ordered dungeness crab cocktail for $15. It was small. it was not good. 

on the other hand its a is very beautiful date place because it overlooks the waters. Unfortunately for me I'm not a big fan of American seafood. 
 And fortunately for this place they had a very sweet independent singer sing just right below them. It was definitely very romantic, specifically because of that singer.
author: Dixie L.

description: For the price the food was marginal at best. The cocktails lacked alcohol more like a nonalcoholic drink for kids. Service was just ok. Did not tey dessert because the meal was not worthy.
author: Celia C.

description:
Like all of the other posts, this place is a tourist trap. My boyfriend and I sat at the bar since it was my birthday and we wanted to get drinks and apps. My margarita was decent but for $13 I've had it better other places and his Lagunita's (small jar) was $7. Just another way to help tourist spend all their money except I'm not one. The bartenders weren't even friendly and when mentioning it was my birthday he asked if I wanted a fireball shot. I was surprised assuming he was offering but then said no, we can't give you free alcohol but I will give you dessert. I didn't go in there looking to celebrate my birthday at 12 pm but hey, I'll take a dessert I suppose. Once he was bringing the dessert we were getting our check. Turns out he charged me for the damn dessert. $8.50 and I didn't even ask for it. 

We got the dungeness crab cakes that seemed like they had a good amount of meat but it also had too much seasoning. I like crab cakes because I like the taste of crab. I actually ended up feeling sick after eating this meal..
author: Bridget L.

description: Nice place for a sit down meal at the market.  Food was quite good but like most things in the area, a little pricey for good quality.  Service was fast and great.
author: Chris L.

description: The view, beautiful. The food, excellent. The standout for our evening was definitely our server Michael! So much so that we came back the next night.
author: Kasey H.

description:
My boyfriend and I visited for our anniversary dinner. Around 9pm on a Saturday night, we ended up waiting a little under 30 minutes for a table. Service was great; from the hostess to our server. On to the most important part and the reason why you're reading this review... The food: 

- Oysters: Fresh. Fresh. Fresh. I am not the biggest fan of oysters, but I had to try them. They are the cleanest oysters I've ever tasted. I could've eaten half a dozen by myself.

- Ahi Tuna Poke: Decent size chunks with avocado and I believe it was mango as well? The Sriracha drizzled around the plate adds a kick of spice if that's what you're looking for. Down side to this plate was that there was only 3 wonton chips to share! 

- Clam Chowder: You can't come to SF and not have a bowl of clam chowder. You won't regret it! So rich and creamy, you can actually tell that there are clams in there! (Also had clam chowder from Nick's Lighthouse... Fog Harbor blows them out of the water) 

- Garlic Roasted Dungeness Crab: YUMMY. So glad we went with this over the steamed dungeness. It had so much more flavor to it and was way more juicy than we expected, which is a definitely plus. (Tip: Dip the corn into the garlic/butter... Also, if you prefer mashed potatoes to the fingerling potatoes, just ask your server to substitute it for you)

Overall, we had a great experience. We also ordered 2 drinks from the bar to go with our meal which brought our grand total to ~$108 (excluding tip). Will definitely be back again!
author: Elizabeth N.

description: I took my mom to this place, and we both liked the Garlic Crab. The Clam Chowder was good too.
author: Jiaxi W.

description: Nice place.  Wife ordered the steamed whole crab and I got the halibut.  Also ordered Clam Chowder in a bread bowl.  All of the food was tasty.  I think the chowder was the best thing we ordered.  This place is crazy packed with mainly tourists.  That was what mode we were in, too so sort of got it...  I think we'll go for the less attractive places next time we visit Pier 39.
author: Keith K.

description: Came here with my family, it's really crowded so we waited for at least 30 minutes. Definitely worth it. Great and fresh seafood, nice view, and accommodated service.
author: Natalie Z.

description:
Had a wonderful time here. We got an awesome table overlooking the bay, probably because we had reservations. Nice to watch the sunset while enjoying dinner. 

The restaurant itself is very nice, loved the decor. It's on the 2nd floor of Pier 39, first restaurant as you enter from the front. Loved the fireplace outside as you wait on comfy sofas. 

Food- we started out with the Crispy Bay Scallops.. yum! And Blue cheese garlic bread which I really liked. There was so much on the menu it was hard to decide LOL. I ended up ordering the Fried Combo (fish, calamari, shrimp, fries, cole slaw). Everything was delicious, and it's a big dish. My partner ordered the Cioppino, which was truly amazing. So good! I wish I had ordered it also. We ordered 2 cocktails each but maybe we're raging alcoholics because we thought they needed more alcohol LOL. Next time we'll order wine instead. 

And yes we'll definitely be back. Pier 39 is tourist-y and we're locals, but no matter. It's actually nice to feel like we're on vacation in our own city! I will definitely take my visitors here, it's a winner. Oh and awesome service!
author: Vol T.

description: The food is very good and fresh. The staff inside the restaurant is also very friendly and attentive. Come for the sea food and view!
author: Katie B.

description: Me and my husband split a blue cheese wedge and a whole garlic crab. I had a fabulous Bloody Mary and we enjoyed the creme brûlée at the end. The whole staff is awesome, met managers Juan, Bob and Ken. Edgar, Ashley G. and Ashley L. were great at recommendations and speedy service. We really enjoyed ourselves.
author: Sandi G.

description:
Clam chowder-two thumbs up
Filet Mignon- was sent back twice but was really good after they got it right. The sides that came with it were yummy as well. (Spinach and mashed potatoes)

Fast and friendly service.
author: Melinda D.

description: So me and my fiance decided to have dinner for his birthday here. It was a beautiful day in February And We Just Got Done Hiking In Marin county. We walked in and was greeted. Very welcoming. We ordered to seafood mix plates which were on special and added a lobster tail to each. I had two glasses of wine and we also ordered some ahi tuna and one dozen oysters. The oysters were a bit small but was very tasty which made up for their size. The view, is breath taking, very beautiful.  Our waiter was very attentive and he was very knowledgeable of the menu. Very great service. The bill came out pretty high but we enjoyed this placed and our food plus the view. Couldn't go wrong. Would recommend this place to anyone but I would like to warn you all it is pretty pricey but we'll worth it.
author: Emily M.

description:
Place gets 2 stars because they get 1 star in a lot of areas but 5 in others.  Took my wife here for our anniversary, she loved her part of the meal so I guess the night was a success.

First they charge 4.5% for "SF emp Ord", so it's a political statement, I get that, but as a political statement I can choose not to eat at your restaurant - so heads up on this before you go there.  These places should have to have a sign calling this out or something obvious on the menu... 1 star

View was outstanding, and I'm willing to pay for that view. 5 stars

Barrel aged Manhattan that used four roses bourbon and made a huge square ice cube infused with an Orange peel...$13 but still worth it. 5 stars.

Sourdough bread is excellent, and we bought the blue cheese garlic bread as well....so awesome, but better to have if you have a group larger than 2. 4 stars

Cod special with chorizo and white beans. Ugh so bad, completely lacking flavor even though all the ingredients typically have a ton of flavor.  Tasted like cruise ship food, so bland my great-grandparents might have loved it.  At least the cod was flakey and cooked well.  1 star, mainly because everything on the menu looked good and I ended up stuck with that...

Curry mussels.  These were awesome too, full of flavor, melts in your mouth, incredible dipping the sourdough in the sauce.  One mussel hadn't opened, wish they would have gave us another one instead. 4 stars

Service was a solid 3.  He was attentive and friendly but seemed annoyed that we ordered coffee to start the meal (cold night) and that
He'd have to bring refills.
author: Dustin C.

description: There is best and more affordable food around the bay. Don't ask for the fried combo or the fish and chips.
author: Alfonso A.

description: Wonderful view. Delicious grilled shrimp and very good sole too. And great service from Samir!
author: Sarah C.

description: Great seafood and location. I was skeptical since it was in such a tourist area, but it was great. Good atmosphere and service. Really enjoyed the salad and clam chowder lunch special.
author: Holly T.

description: Stopped by for a delicious lunch. Food and drink were fabulous. Ashly, our server, did a Fantastic job, and made some great recommendations for our group. Definitely a location to visit again on our next trip up. Cheers!!
author: Patrick A.

description: Ate a lovely meal here with a view of the water and Golden Gate. The seafood platter and oysters were delicious, very fresh. Our server, Danny (Daniel) was very attentive.. always keeping our glasses full and making sure we were satisfied which made the experience that much better. Would come back and recommend, thanks Danny!
author: Justine M.

description:
Great service and delicious food. 
Highly recommended. We had Tyler as our waiter and he was fantastic!
author: Imad I.

description:
This was one of the best restaurant experiences I've ever had. Here's why:

1. Our waitress was personable, and engaging. 
2. The sourdough bread was incredible. 
3. They gave us WARMED BUTTER (mind blown. It's the little things.)
4. Great wine selection. 
5. We were told about the special. We got the special. It was the right decision. So delicious. 
6. We also got the salmon, it was equally as delicious. 
7. Even though it was a busy night, our wait was short. 
8. It was the PERFECT ambiance. Great view, perfect temperature. 
9. We hadn't planned on going to a nice place, so weren't necessarily dressed for it, and were still treated so great. 
10. The bathrooms were pristine. 
11. The dessert tray was a sight to behold (in the best way possible).
12. The bartender was super friendly and we hadn't even interacted with him all night until we were leaving. 
13. They gave us Biscoff cookies with our bill. 

I will remember this place for the rest of my dining life.
author: Kaitlin D.

description: The calamari was awesome, the crab roll was awesome and the clam chowder topped with crab did not disappoint. Our server Tyler had fantastic recommendations and made sure we were well taken care of.
author: Chris C.

description:
We wanted to have some lovely seafood while we were in San Francisco, and we chose the Fog Harbor Fish House from the many options on Fisherman's Wharf. Overall, very high marks. First, the view is lovely, and the restaurant itself is very nice and well-appointed. A nice place for a relaxed lunch, date night or a special occasion. Second, the food:
-I ordered the ginger coconut cocktail, which was generally very good and tasty, but I felt had a bit too much coconut. It was kind of offputting in mouthfeel but did have a delightful ginger/lemon/spritzer type of flavor. I was torn between loving it and hating it and in the end only drank about half.
-The chowder. Oh my god, get some.Some of the best chowder you will ever have. Thick, creamy, silky, delicious. Think cup, but go bowl. You're welcome.
-Poke. I do love tuna, so poke is a tough thing to ignore on a menu that isn't in Hawaii. This particular poke is mixed with fresh avocado and mango, with a small amount of seaweed like you'd find in a seaweed salad. Light, gingery, soy-ey (??) and really yum.
-Salmon. I got the salmon entree, which was just delicious. Cooked perfectly, with a med-rare center and beautiful grill marks on the outside, set over a creamy sauce with spinach and potatoes. A beautiful piece of fish and a huge portion!
-Tuna -- perfectly cooked again with a nice big rare center. Served over a great hash-like mix that included these delightful bits of bok choy. SUPER yum.


In all the food was really excellent. We didn't have time for dessert. Our server was good, helpful and composed. Not cheap -- we had two apps, two entrees and two drinks and the tab topped $100 for LUNCH. Still.... We would definitely come back!
author: Sue S.

description:
Very nice decore inside..  bread was nice and fresh.... food was cooked well...  other than being a bit snooty in there I'd say it's good...  but once again I heard tons of hype on this place and it was good but is not the good I was hoping for..

Was it good?? Yes.  Would I go again? Probally not
author: Jason T.

description:
Here for some seafood chowdown and wasn't disappointed. Drinks weak so make sure to ask for strong stuff or you'll be disappointed.  

CLAM CHOWDER was too watery and lack filling.  I think a Boudin can would taste better. oh now really did I just say that?!

JUMBO COCKTAIL $13 for 4 shrimps.
1/2 OYSTERS in a nicely presented plate in center of table. Fresh!!! $13.00
1 WHOLE Garlic CRAB $39.  Great great with butter sauce on side. Well, it was with lobster but oh well, let's dip away.

COCKTAILS: Lemon Drop (strong), Long Beach (whole crab strong!), Blackberry Martini (juice was this??! disappointed), and Alcatraz (oh ok..) if you like rum.

Total for 3 adults $180with tax about $190+($60 + a person). Would that be $$$$?

Would be back here if I were not so allergic to seafood and had to just watch as my favorite other two people chow down while I feed the little babes.  Agh, the life.  Friendly upbeat service in a nicely decorated place with great view and really a great place for family (Stroller parking outside is safe). 

It's on 2nd floor so find elevator by NFL store across the way. Check receipt for coupon deals. Don't toss..i know u might be buzzed...but really, check first.
author: Lauren X.

description:
What a lovely restaurant! I really enjoyed the intimate/romantic atmosphere. Get a table further inside if you can; you'll have a nice view next to the water.

My family and I came here for dinner and we had a good time. We started off with complimentary sourdough bread and a calamari appetizer as well as clam chowder. A trip to SF isn't complete without some clam chowder! The bread had a wonderful crunchy texture and the clam chowder was delicious without being too heavy.

For entrees, I ordered swordfish while the rest of my family ordered ahi tuna and the seafood spaghetti. While the food was a little on the salty side, it was pretty good. I actually liked the swordfish the least out of all the entrees because it was rather dry. The tuna was surprisingly generous in portion and I liked this entree the most. The seafood spaghetti was pretty good too, and that's coming from someone who typically doesn't like seafood. I tried their rose wine soda, which was non-alcoholic. It was yummy! It just tastes like a light fizzy soda, haha. They should just call it grape soda, but I guess they just want to make it sound fancy.

All in all, I'd recommend this place if you're in the area and looking for a nice sit-down restaurant.
author: Michelle N.

description: We were all craving clam chowder in sour dough bread bowls ... (When in Rome...) . This place more than did the trick. It helped that we went at 3:30 and had no problem getting a seat by the window. we ordered calamari for an appetizer and it was excellent. We only spent $14 for a salad and chowder and bread bowl combo. Great deal for a fancy restaurant. The clam chowder was even better than expected and the sour dough bread at the beginning was some of the best I've tasted. I will be back next time I come to San Francisco.
author: Jennie S.

description: Really glad we went here after our boat tour for lunch. We had the fish and chips along with the clam chowder. The clam chowder sour dough bread bowl was amazing! Had to wait about 10 minutes for a table and the waiting area was really nice with couches and fire place. Great service too!
author: Neal R.

description: Amazing place over in fisherman's wharf. They have great views of the harbor and awesome happy hour specials. Definitely try the calamari and oysters some of the freshest I've had. And tony the bartender is really great!
author: Zane D.

description: My husband made reservations to dine at Fog Harbor a week or 2 before arriving to San Fran.  When arriving we were seated quickly and we're given the window seat my husband had requested.  He had mentioned that we were celebrating our anniversary and their attention to that detail was amazing!  Our table had "happy anniversary" written on it which was a sweet touch.  Our server Meron was phenominal!!!! Her attention was great, and she was super sweet! The food was delicious (especially the clam chowder) and dessert was on the house since we were celebrating.  Overall we had a fantastic experience and would definitely come back if we are ever in town.
author: J N Mike N.

description: This place was recommended by family for the gluten-free options.  The hostess was beyond rude with our reservations. The food was not great for what I expected. The salad had too much dressing , my husband's  and order was wrong because of the confusion with my gluten free meal. The only good thing here is the view.
author: Sammy G.

description: one of the best clam chowders I had, great service and nice view,ordered mixed grill for entree and it was delicious , definitely will go back
author: Ali T.

description: The baked oysters are out of this world.  I highly recommend the restaurant and suggest people check for a spot at the bar.  There was a significant wait when we arrived and we found a spot at the bar right away.   We enjoyed dinner at the bar and the device was great.  When we left there was still people waiting outside to be seated. I am not sure why they don't tell people that they can have a full dinner at the bar without waiting.  I guess that is what Yelp is for!
author: Donna G.

description:
Restaurant had very good ambiance, we did not have to wait at all and even though I had a reservation for 9:30 we were able to get a table by the window earlier. Views were nice, perhaps more so during the day and sunset than at night. At night still enjoyable as you see the lights on the boats and the reflection on the water of the bay. 
Food was great, I was there with a party of 5 and we were all quite satisfied with both our main dishes and desserts. The only thing I did not enjoy about this place was the service, the waitress we got was distracted and impatient, even a tad rude. How ever we had another waiter come after to ask about desserts and he seem very grateful.
author: Gaby M.

description: We enjoyed the food a lot. Unfortunately, the service was very poor. We asked several times for refills and waited much longer than necessary. I'm not sure if they were under-staffed. Despite the poor service, the food is great and a good location to eat with your family or significant other!
author: Han Y.

description: I thought that it was overpriced and overrated. The food was decent, but definitely not worth the price for the quality and quantity of food. Their clam chowder is great, but still pales in comparison to New England clam chowder and Seattle Clam chowder. Having lived in the Bay for almost a year, this restaurant seems like a tourist trap that overcompensates with its sub-par overpriced seafood, with a beautiful and elegant waterfront restaurant. Their staff and service made it a great experience so with that being said, the service is the only reason I would go back, which is great, but to want to go back to a restaurant is for the food first and the service second. I had a gentlemen named Samir as my server and he was absolutely delightful. I recommend this once just for the experience. The food was okay, but the experience made it somewhat delightful.
author: Adel Y.

description:
Ate a late lunch here on Sunday 2/17/13 after a great tour of Alcatraz.  I loved the hot from the oven sour dough bread.  

The food came out quick- I ordered the beet salad w/ grilled chicken and blue cheese dressing.  Fog Harbor has the best blue cheese I've tasted in a long time- I was bummed to hear that they don't make it but nonetheless, it was good.  The salad itself was light on beets which was a bummer and my only complaint is that it could have been a larger portion esp. when I ordered it as an entree.  My boyfriend ordered the fried combo and said it was good.  His portion was huge!

Our server Martin was attentive and although he was busy, he didn't leave us wondering where he was as he checked in often.  The restaurant is nice- unfortunately, we weren't seated w/ a view of the water but at that point it was fine- all we wanted was food.    

I would recommend Fog Harbor
author: Kristi O.

description: Great food and great service. Tyler's recommendation on getting the Alaskan halibut was absolutely spot on!
author: Fernando A.

description: After our boat tour, my husband and I decided to grab some lunch here. It was a 15 minute wait, nothing major. We were sat by the window so had an awesome view. All the food was great, maybe a bit pricy and came out a little too quick (lol) but tasty nonetheless.
author: Morgan A.

description:
Had a real nice evening.  

We got seated right away with a table of 3 on a Friday night in June.   The waitress came quickly and explained the specials and offered drinks.  I had a beer a local hoppy variety and my wife had one of their signature lemondrop drinks(tart, sweet and strong with a sugared rim).  

We split a Caesar salad which was perfect for 2, the dressing was definitely homemade.  The leaves were split but not chopped.  They brought out very tasty sourdough bread with the salads and dinner.  

I ordered a clam chowder which never came, so i didn't get to try that. 

My wife enjoyed the Cod special and I had the mix grill.  Her special was a fillet of cod with chorizo and semi spicy sauce over white bean ragout , very tasty, we both enjoyed the meal.  My mixed grill had salmon, swordfish, and a skewer of 3 shrimp.  Our son had the kids fish and chips, best battered fish we had ever tasted.  All the fish was well prepared, i was concerned about the swordfish but it was not dry at all.  I also had a glass of house chardonay (they have different sizes and the staff tries to push the bigger more expensive one) which was light and complimented the flavors of the fish nicely.

Our son had the kids Sunday which was just a scoop of vanilla ice cream with magic shell on it but for .95 cents he loved it.  

We split the tiramisu, great size for 2 and tasted great not too sweet like some restaurants, light and creamy with a great taste on the soaked lady fingers.  

Dinner for 3 was about 150$ not bad for 3 with drinks.  Nice night except for the hitch of not getting the clam chowder.
author: Lucien C.

description: Amazing experience!!! Madison was so great and courteous!!!! Found this place primarily through a help search and I'm so glad it had the reviews it did! Thank you Madison for making our visit so amazing, loved hearing about the restaurants story and about the owner! Well done, Madison!
author: Maria V.

description: Had the fried calamari as an appetizer and it was ok, actually a little disappointed that the breading had fallen off. The entree were also ok. Service was really good. Nothing special but nothing bad.
author: Duke A.

description:
So a few weeks back, me and Matthew went to San Francisco for the day with my grandparents. While walking the pier, we stopped by this place. Matthew and myself were a little hesitant because we don't eat seafood. 

Luckily, they offered more than seafood. So we started out with drinks. I had the Moscow mule and my grandma had the Lombard lemonade. The guys had some straight scotch I believe. The bread was really good too. 

Matthew and I got the chicken penne which was delicious. The service was great and the view was even better! Would totally recommend this place! A bit pricey, but worth it.
author: Yvette B.

description: Good food. Great bread. Great server, Samir. I'm not a tourist and I thought this. There's not much more to say, busy night, a lot of work but still had a good time. Place is beautiful too.
author: Jeff W.

description:
I was here on Sunday with my Godfather around 3:30PM. We had a waitress who was helpful at first until I asked how much the "Surf Turf" was because it had said market price. She then sarcastically suggested the Lobster Tail which was "only $39". After that, she passed us off to another waiter who told us he was taking over for her because "her shift was over". Yet, we kept seeing her help the table behind us (loaded 60+ yr old guy with a very young wife/gf and small child) and another new table that was seated. 

So we ask our new waiter, "hey, I thought her shift was over". Then he told us without telling us that she passed us off to him because she assumed we didn't have money because I asked how much the surf turf was. It was obvious and plain as day. When she brought our appetizer out (oysters and shrimp) she didn't prep it like she did the other two tables (and this was right after I had asked about the market price item and the last time she talked to us/came over to our table).

For the price, I've had better seafood. This place is slightly overpriced but the food was alright. So if you want average seafood that's a little overpriced then this place is okay. The view from inside the restaurant is nice too. But that waitress should know that just because someone is Black and just because they ask about price does not mean they don't have money for the food or to give you a generous tip afterwards. You missed out.

For a liberal place, San Francisco has a lot of hidden and subtle racism. Was not surprised that the only Blacks in the restaurant was seated right next to the camera (pointing down at our table and next to the waiters/waitresses register) and was passed off because it was assumed we had no money because I asked about a price. Our new waiter enjoyed his 30% tip and I hope he told the chick about that (who would probably do anything if you threw enough money at her tbh...was one of those vibes...especially with the way she was all over the loaded old dude next to us). And it is disappointing that this happened because I overall had a nice trip to San Francisco and we were served great at Everett & Jones in Oakland the night before. But Fog Harbor won't be seeing my business again. I'll check out the numerous other seafood choices around there when I make a roadtrip to SF from LA again rather than come back to this place.
author: Nial E.

description:
Went there twice and each time it amazes me how good their seafood meals are! Love their clam chowder and it is definitely a must get. 

If you happen to be there, do check out their coffee shop that sells biscoff cookie downstairs.
author: Angel T.

description:
I'm so glad we read the reviews.  For a place in a heavily touristy area,  i was very apprehensive about trying this place but the reviews don't disappoint.. the muscles were of the charts,  the fire shrimp app was overcooked,  but we brought it to the attention of the bartender, Marc, and he made it right,  brought us a whole new dish and it was amazing.  The mixed grill recommended by Diana, also working the bar, was off the charts.. 
We'd go back.  Thank you Marc and Diana for making our experience at your work place very enjoyable
author: Rachel T.

description: Here in San Fransico on vacation and we have eaten fish at every meal and have to say Fog Harbor has been our favorite so far!
author: Casey M.

description: The waitress is really rude! When I set down, she come again and agin urge me make the order although I already tell her I need more time. When I just finish my lunch, she urge me pay the bill and rude to me! She only want you money and urge you leave away! Terrible services!
author: Fei G.

description:
This restaurant is pretty classy and is situated right on the pier so you can see out into the bay.  My friends and I were lucky and got seated right next to the huge windows with a great view of the water. The inside is dimly lit and would be great for a romantic, fancy dinner. I loved the ambience and the fact that it's on the water and as my friend said, I suppose you're paying for the view as well as the food, which is why it's pricier.

Apparently their clam chowder is very good, and I almost ordered it but instead, I went with the curry mussels, my favorite seafood. The mussels were really soft and soaked in the delicious curry sauce. I was relieved that the curry wasn't spicy at all, although it had a nice small kick to it and was slightly sweet and creamy. I really liked the sauce and I also dipped the complementary bread they serve into the sauce. The amount of mussels they served in the bowl was worth the price, especially for a fancy place.

Service was okay, nothing bad but nothing stood out either. I would like to come here again sometime though, for both the food and view!
author: Kailin H.

description: Another great bowl of Cioppino with the family. Samir, our waitor, was gracious and a great host. My favorite place at Pier 39.
author: Darren G.

description: The food was really good. I had the fried combo and apple crisp. It was cooked really well and the flavors were great. In addition to the food, we had a great view of the harbor. If you're in San Francisco I would definitely recommend giving this place a try.
author: Shericka B.

description: Escape the noise of Pier 39. Enjoyed a wedge salad with crab, but my favorite was dish was the mussels with fries (app). The mussels were buttery and tender and the sauce was amazing. A must try!
author: Britt J.

description: Samir delivered the best service!! We wandered in and it was wonderful. Delicious Pacific Sole!
author: Tanya H.

description: Expertly managed business! The wait was 20 min and it actually WAS 20 min. Drinks were delicious, especially clementine Cosmo. Salmon Blt fantastic, soup and salad good, fish and chips good and burger good.try mussels and fries!!!
author: Leiby D.

description: First time going to Fog Harbor Fish House.  We really enjoyed the atmosphere.  We had a large group (8) and were seated very fast.  The food was great.  The view of the waterfront was fantastic. I the waitress was very good.
author: Barry T.

description: Definitely in the tourist area. Tried to make reservations, but they said they were full and to do a walk-in instead. Walked in and was able to sit down right away. The service was alright. Ordered calamari, raw oysters, and clam chowder for appetizers. Calamari was nothing too special, but the clam chowder was delicious. Hands down, the best in town as they mentioned. As for entrées, had ahi tuna and king salmon. The tuna was seared and the salmon was crispy on the outside. Both were good, but will try other places around the area first. Btw, for parking, park in the structure across from Pier 39. They do validations.
author: Rochelle G.

description: Another travelers' must go place but locals will not choose. To be honest, food is really average. I don't think it worth the price neither ($90 for 2 including tips). I ordered oysters, fried calamari, clam chowder, and Ani tuna. The fried calamari was WARM...not crispy at all... Ani tuna was good, although the soy sauce was not spread evenly which made some of the rice too salty. There was only one kind of oyster. But they were really juicy. The award winning clam chowder, I couldn't tell the difference between it and the one sold at street corner.
author: Amber X.

description:
Of our 8-day vacation, my husband said our visit here was the low point.  Our waiter did not speak English, and so he did not know how to answer our questions.  For example, when my husband asked "What are your three most popular entrees?"  he responded "All of our seafood is fresh."  When I asked what was the least fishy-tasting fish, he told me the Salmon was great.  (We got a sampler, and although the salmon was fine, it was certainly not the least fishy - just the most expensive!)

I decided to place my drink order at the bar rather than try to communicate it to him.  

The clam chowder was really good, but the rest of the food was not that great.  It was very expensive.  There has got to be better options in San Francisco.
author: Rachel M.

description: The Lobster tail had a good taste and texture and the bread is amazing. That about ends the good though. Had the mixed grill plate and the swordfish and salmon seem both mediocre at best. The shrimp had good taste and flavor though. Mashed potatoes had a good flavor when they were not doused in seashell flavor from the Lobster tail sitting in them. Would be better off spending your money in other places over this overpriced establishment that serves mediocre seafood at high prices.
author: Daniel P.

description:
One of the best meals my wife & I ever ate, both food-wise and for the waterfront ambiance. 

We were in The Bay for our 20th anniversary; we canceled a reservation at a 4-star eatery as we both wanted clam chowder. Fog Harbor took us in as walk-ins and once they found out it was our anniversary they gave us the best table in the house, a corner where we could see out onto the water in 2 directions. Our waiter (MEL 382) was very polite and conscientious of our special day and we were treated like royalty. The prices were very reasonable for the freshness and quality of the food; we purchased two clam chowder bowls in fresh house-baked sourdough bowls at $10 each (very reasonable) and shared a plate of fish and chip so fresh the fish could have leaped from the Bay into the pan just minutes before it arrived at our table. The clam chowder was not too thick and perfectly balanced; you could taste the different elements, clams were soft as butter. We wrapped it up with a fine dessert of chocolate chip & walnut cake with wonderfully dense ice-cream on top. The whole time we looked at the water and fishing boats and enjoyed the warmth of the restaurant. 

The only problem with a dinner like this is that every other meal we've eaten out now seems lesser by comparison. We can't wait to go back and experience another dinner at this establishment.
author: Steven S.

description:
Chain like place on pier 39
Good service.  After asking for gluten free
And ordering a gf item still was given gluten fried chips on it. Somehow avoided eating them.  And they apologized and all but just triple check everything as always
author: Eddie M.

description: Great service and beautiful view but I wasn't feeling the food Though. The shellfish tower wasn't that fresh and the clams I ordered is too salty. Atleast their bread is warm.
author: Cryszilla G.

description: Unbelievable food. My wife and I had the Ahi Tuna Poke appetizer. It was incredible. We also had a cup of the clam chowder with crab. You need to add crab for $6. Worthy every penny. Entrees were also incredible. My wife had soul and I had the grilled shrimp. Everything was amazing!!! It was pricey, but worth it for when you are at Pier 39 and want a great meal.
author: Michael S.

description: Pier 39 is definitely a touristy place, however, Fog Harbor never fails to disappoint. Recently had Tyler as our server and he was excellent.  Excellent food, service and atmosphere. Clam chowder in a sourdough bread is the way to go!
author: Brenham C.

description:
GOD DAMNED DELICIOUS!!! 

We had the soup (clam chowder in a sourdough bread bowl..obviously) with mixed field greens, the salmon entree, and the pumpkin bread pudding. Service was fast but unobtrusive, great tasting food, and an amazing view. 

This will be our new SF tradition!!
author: Jessie B.

description: In town from San Diego and really wanted fresh seafood...this place definitely delivered! The ahi poke is really really fresh. The last time I had tuna that fresh was in Costa Rica! The wines were amazing and the service was good. Will Definitely come here again & recommend to friends.
author: Jazmin C.

description:
Yesterday we went to celebrate my daughter's is going to college in this amazing city. Previous to that, and because I've used successfully YELP in the past, I did my reservation by email.
Bob (actual CEO was kind enough to answer me), and 5 of us sat down in this "cozy" place (as my daughter will called it).... A truly first class experience. Scotty our waiter was a truly friendly and caring person, so were the ladies at the entrance. 
The food was enjoyable as it gets, from the award winning Clam Chowder Sup in a bread bowl, that I had, to the veggie pasta, had by our daughters' room mate... All in all, an experience I will repeat anytime... Give it a try!!
author: Rolando R.

description: Came here for my friends birthday on a Wednesday afternoon and were seated right away. We had a table by the window, so the views were incredible (we could see Alcatraz!) but you can really see the view from any table because they have really big windows which I love because it lets in natural sunlight. Our waiter was Khaiman, he greeted us right away, was very attentive to all our needs, and was super friendly! To top it off, our food came out very quickly which was amazing because we were very hungry & ready to eat. Overall, great customer service, beautiful views, & delicious clam chowder!
author: Diana N.

description: Had a wonderful experience here. Our waitress Meron was absolutely amazing. The food was delicious & I would definitely recommend this place to anyone visiting the area. The clam chowder is a must!
author: Lore C.

description:
Ate lunch at Fog Harbor Fish House on 2/15/16 on the recommendation of our pedicab driver. Male host at the host stand was less-than-inviting in his facial expressions and interactions with our party and other guests, but the food and service we had later more than made up for his lack of hospitality. Our walk to the table showed just how big the restaurant is and how great the view we had of the Pier 39 area.

Due to the wait for the table, we were able to peruse the menu prior to getting our table. We both eyed the Fried Combo (fish, shrimp, calamari with fries and slaw) priced at $22. We expected the high price due to the touristy nature of the area, but the price felt more deserving once we received our food (which was very quick considering the lunch rush). The portions were HUGE! We both ended up taking half back to the hotel due to being stuffed after eating. We really wanted to try the dessert duo (creme brulee and chocolate cake priced at $14), but we were too full. Maybe next time.

The highlight of the meal, though, had to be the phenomenal service we experienced with our server Madison. As I mentioned earlier, we weren't the most hopeful after our interactions with the host, but Madison went above-and-beyond in answering any questions we had and ensuring we had an amazing experience. Her warm and inviting personality made our lunch one to remember. Her service was top-notch, and I will definitely ask to be in her section the next time we eat there. 

This is a great restaurant in an excellent location with awesome service and huge portions. What more can you ask for?!
author: Josh H.

description:
Environment: 2nd floor of Pier 39. Pretty big restaurant and most of the seats are by the windows so you can see the water!

Food: I've been here twice and the food is honestly nothing special. I would stick to a bowl of chowder and a salad here.

Price: Under 25$ a person unless you're ordering drinks too. 2.5 dollar signs!

Occasion: We came here for a friends birthday dinner. They seated us at a round table (were were a group of 7) right by the window. And they wrote "happy birthday" on our table for us. A little tacky but we appreciated the effort!

Overall: I think this place is good for parties bigger than 4. The food can definitely use some work but the chowder is good!
author: Ryosuke K.

description: I love to travel and enjoy eating many different types of food. I am a tourist where ever I go. Today, I find myself enjoying the scenery from Pier 39.  Fog Harbor is one of the restaurants that I stopped in during happy hour.  The bartenders were busy with preparation for dinner rush and seemed to be preoccupied with small tasks. Still they were friendly and made an awesome drink.  This is definitely not the place  to eat if you are on a budget.  All in all based off the experience at the bar I am rating this place three stars.
author: Raymond S.

description: Niloufar is the best server there is. Great food, a can't miss restaurant while in the Fishermans Wharf area. Highly recommend.
author: Michael H.

description: The clam chowder was fantastic, they served it with fresh sour dough bread, we also had fried shrimp delicious!!!
author: Jan O.

description: The service and setting was lovely and the swordfish was perfect! Great and not too overpriced for tourists. I'd recommend making a reservation on open table.
author: Laura S.

description:
Oh my gosh.
This restaurant gets five stars from me hands down. My boyfriend and I were looking for a night out and we stumbled across this place on yelp because I wanted dinner next to the water. We came in on a Thursday evening, and went to put our name down. They said it would be a 15 min wait for a seat, but 45 to an hour for waterfront seating. We were hungry so I put us down for regular seating. 10 minutes later they call our name and seat us next to a window for two! The boiled oysters were INCREDIBLE. I had the half crab which was nice and light and he got the fried combo. 
Everything from the appetizer to desert was amazing. The service was great as well. We had a young lady help us out who has a lot of serving experience. I am definitely coming back in the next month or so. It's my new favorite restaurant!
author: Milan M.

description: Went here for lunch on a Monday after the Alcatraz tour.  What a wonderful place!  Every table has a view to the large windows looking out to Alcatraz. I ordered the popular Perfect Hibiscus Margarita that comes with a Cointreau lime foam.  Delicious!   I wanted a second but I wasn't sure if it was going to my head or I still had sea legs from the boat ride earlier!   The crispy calamari with fried jalapeños and onion pieces was very tasty.  I ordered the salmon salad and my husband ordered the mixed Grill plate that came with salmon, swordfish, shrimp, creamy potatoes and steamed brocolli...all very tasty.  Our waitress was great and was very attentive.  When we arrived we were told it would be 10 minute wait and we were asked for our cell phone #.  They let you go shop and text you when your table is ready!  Pretty awesome!
author: Christy S.

description:
The menu: Local Rock Cod $28:
Pan fried, served on a chorizo, spinach and white bean ragout, topped with a shallot aioli  

The reality: small piece of fish on top of a bowl of navy beans with tartar sauce on the side. 

This place is strictly for tourists. My cocktail was weak and mostly ice, and our food was tasty but unimaginative. Our server was nice, but didn't box up the almost whole loaf of sourdough we couldn't finish and was obviously rushed.  Our view was of the pier next door and would have been great if the sea otters were around, but they go south at this time of year. Next time we'll look for somewhere locals eat.
author: Laura S.

description: Excellent food. The pacific cod was awesome,soft, perfect to the taste bud. Waiter, Samir was awesome great service
author: Jason L.

description:
Growing hungry for something a little bit more substantial though, we paid a visit to Fog Harbor Fish House, a family-owned seafood restaurant well known at the Pier for great crab and great views.

Great views, check! Located right at the pier's edge and where a lot of the Blue and Gold Fleet cruises dock.

Crab? Check! A whole menu entirely dedicated to the local Dungeness crab. Fresh and a multitude of preparations, making it very hard for us to choose a single dish.

Joe and I were in the noshing mood, planning to go to Fisherman's Wharf for dinner (post to come!). We shared the 1/2 lb crab, stir fried with onions, peppers, in a spicy red chili garlic sauce. NOM! Turned out a lot better than I thought it would be. The shell was super soft, making it pretty easy to crack even without the crab cracker, and the garlic sauce was nice and spicy! The highlight of the dish: the fresh crab meat waiting inside the shell. Sweet and juicy. Should have ordered a second crab dish in my opinion!

Our other dish: an ahi tuna poke. After having amazing poke in LA, we've been looking around for a good poke. A trip to Hawaii next perhaps? Anyways, the dish was beautifully presented with crispy wonton chips with white and black sesame seeds, a wasabi aioli, an unidentified hot sauce, seaweed, and the ahi tuna marinated in a sesame soy sauce with avocados and mango. Yum! The mango made the dish it's own and added to the refreshing taste. Still not up to our standard from Venice Beach, but satisfying enough.

Great eats, but you definitely pay the price for the location and the view. If you want straight up fresh seafood, served simple, look forward to my Fisherman's Wharf post coming this week!
author: Cindy N.

description:
The view was absolutely incredible. I would recommend going for a pre-dinner drink JUST for the views.

That being said, I wasn't at all impressed with the food. The calamari was Friday's quality and then I ordered the lobster stuffed with crabmeat. The lobster was prepared well but the crabmeat tasted like tuna salad. It was packed with mayo and celery. It was inedible. The server kindly took it back and I ordered a wedge salad (since my guest had their meal). The wedge was buffet style quality too. 
I would go back for a cocktail but not again for dinner.
author: Michelle H.

description: Food was good... some items of course better than others, but overall I would most def return.  Our server Samir however was GREAT!  He would get 5 Stars
author: Christine S.

description: This place has delicious bread as an appetizer. My family and I, three of us, ordered seafood penne. It was incredibly delicious! It's perfectly seasoned, and the seafood was fresh! We also ordered a pacific cod to share. It was equally amazing. It has beans in it and it's a fairly big amount. We almost had a little bit too much food but it's worth it! The waitresses are pretty as well.
author: Heidi L.

description: Delicious calamari, amazing clam chowder. Friendly servers and staff. Priced well. Food served hot and fresh. Crowd of all walks of life. My go to spot when In the city.
author: O S.

description:
We sat at the bar for a quick lunch on a busy day at the pier.  The bartender was awesome!  Super friendly and fast.  My son had the salmon, and it was delicious.  He won't eat fish if it's not super fresh.  I had a whole dungeoness crab, and hubby had fish and chips.  Delish! Hard to stomach the price when you aren't used to SF prices, but worth it when you want good seafood.

Great views too!
author: Deb H.

description: Very good and fresh with reasonable prices for SF. We got a table with an excellent view of the bay at sunset. Great night!
author: Mark S.

description:
Been there yesterday
A great place to dine In. Very nice view and location
Food was amazing too. got mixed grill and another plate I dont remember its name but it had shrimps, fish and scallops in red sauce soup which wad really gooood
author: Omar M.

description: Nicer restaurant on the pier. Good swordfish and fresh sourdough bread before your meal!
author: Kendall A.

description: Brought the wife here for her birthday dinner and it did not disappoint. Food and drinks were awesome. Our waiter Samir was great and was always checking in on us and got our order perfect. Will definitely come back here the next time we visit San Francisco
author: Bobby W.

description: The ambience was incredible. While we had to wait, we sat at the bar and had great service. When we were seated, server was efficient with good recommendations and attentive. The red chili crab was beyond this world. It was perfectly flavored. My husband had the swordfish and it was moist, flaky and well seasoned. Excellent blue cheese garlic bread as a starter. While it's a high tourist area and spectacular views, food was incredible.
author: Brittany N.

description:
How is this place rated so  highly? 

1. Service, not good. Hostess was super snotty because I made the reservation online for the wrong day. I could understand her being upset except that there were tables everywhere. Our  server "Clementine" sucked. Forgot my soup, took forever to get me butter for my crab, took forever to bring us dessert. She was scattered and sloppy and sloooow. I wouldn't have tipped her more than 10% but my friend was paying. Left the check before we were done, tacky. 

2. The chowder, umm wth? Voted the best in SF? Not even close. If you look at the reviews everyone who rates it highly is a tourist. 

3. The food, the crab was good but my friend's halibut was way over cooked and the pumpkin dessert sucked.

I would never be back especially for the prices.
author: Amy P.

description: In San Francisco for a few days and this was the one place that jumped out at me that I thought we should try. Let's just say it did not disappoint. Being from New England, seafood in other areas of the country doesn't ever live up to our standards but this was by far two of the best seafood dishes we have ever had. The crab cake appetizer was not the best we've ever had but very good.  Wife had the Alaskan Halibut served over a bed of quinoa and arugala.  The halibut was seasoned and cooked perfectly and the quinoa/arugala salad was outstanding. At our waiter Pierre's suggestion (although I was already eyeballing it), I had the Cioppino: essentially a seafood stew consisting of fish, clams, mussels, scallops, shrimp and crab in a spicy tomato broth. Possibly the too 2 or 3 best seafood dishes I have ever had. And I've had a lot. I would definitely fine there again and recommend it to anyone. Oh and did I mention the view?
author: Kelly R.

description: I came here for my two year anniversary with my boyfriend and it was the best evening ever. The food was flavorful and exquisite, the service was fabulous, and the atmosphere was romantic and elegant. I ordered the linguini with clams & my boyfriend got the wild salmon. The food literally melts in your mouth. The drinks were good as well; the cocktails were just the right balance between alcohol and sweetness. The wine selection was fabulous as well. For dessert we got the chocolate cake and since it was our anniversary it was on the house! The chocolate tasted like heaven. Our server was very nice and knowledgable. Overall this was a great experience and we will definitely come again. And the view from our table was beautiful.
author: Amanda D.

description: Excellent food, beautiful restaurant. This is s great option for a more upscale, less casual experience.
author: Cherine F.

description: Worth the long wait! Greats drinks, seafood and view! Definitely the best restaurant in the wharf
author: Meredith O.

description:
Food was great! Pretty fast service, but maybe because they were almost closing. I had a complimentary dessert which was awesome.
Unfortunately, the waitress who served us was pretty rude to my friend just because she couldn't understand her. From the start, it was all downhill from there. The waitress name is Katie. We would have given her a tip, but we believe she didnt deserve it. So we only paid for the food and left. When we left, she she followed us out and sarcastically waved at us and practically were saying dont ever come back here. I dont want to use profanities. Also, it was my birthday and she pretty much kind of ruined it for me. I understand that it was late and she is tired but she didnt have to be so rude and give us those fake smiles. She was trying to be sarcastic with the tone of her voice.
Never ever coming back here.
author: Alexandra D.

description:
Fog Harbor was overall very good clam chowder was very good Oysters were fresh and tasty.
My main course was just OK I had the linguine with clam sauce it pales in comparison to many restaurants in NY. Desert was excellent maybe the best Tiramisu i have had.  Service was overall good when the waiter asked how everything was I said overall  very good the Pasta was just OK.    He really didn't respond it was just a routine question and really didn't care about my answer.
author: John Q.

description: When looking for places to eat around this area this is by far the best rated and there's plenty of reasons why. For being in the middle of tourist central, this place is a nice getaway from the craziness that is fisherman's warf.  I was in the mood for some seafood and wanted a few different things. Only problem was I couldn't decide what to get! Too many good lookin options, too small of a stomach.  After a looong look at the menu, I landed on a half dozen baked oysters, and crab roll.  Oysters were good, had some spinach and feta cheese, good flavor. Then there's the crab roll. Never had one before (or lobster roll) the crab mixture combined with the bread was awesome! Nice soft bread with butter on it, had the perfect texture for the moist crab filling with good amount of crab taste, not overpowering with other flavors. On a previous visit I had the surf and turf, steak with lobster tail. That was a little on the pricey side, but fur what you get and how much, it's not TOO bad.  There's so many places to eat around here, but I love this place for the quality of food and the variety.
author: Mike S.

description: Great food and great atmosphere.  I ordered the grilled salmon over mashed potatoes and an arugula salad. I also started with a cup of clam chowder, which I ordered some to go for later. Tyler our server did a fine job and was very attentive. I will definitely be back.
author: Mandi P.

description: The highest rated restaurant at the Fisherman's Wharf does not disappoint. It's a great spot to just chill after a long stroll around the marina. In my opinion, you can cut all the BS's happening in Pier 39 and come straight to here.  You can people watch, boat watch, or seal watch from the comfort of the window seats. My family visited here on the first week of this year's dungeness crab season, and whoa...  I'd eat that crab again even if it's stuffed with poison. lol.  Coming back here again on my next visit of the wharf.
author: Peter Y.

description: Nice service! Fresh Lobster! Just a little more expensive but compared with the market price in my city. This is cheaper though. Lol.
author: James J.

description: Suuuperrrr good!!! Enough said !!! Great Cioppino and Seafood tower was Full-filling!!! Great Apple cobbler!! Service was good even though it was packed! I'll be back!!
author: Carrie K.

description: Went For my bf 30th the food was good we got the filet mignon it was juicy and good flavor; I got a lipstick lemon drop that was good. Everything except the waitress that served us, not very friendly didn't check up on us didn't offer bread but she did to another table. It wasn't till she went on brake that we got good service from another sever. We felt this other server deserved the tip. So we spoke to the Manager. Overall Food is delicious service can be up or down but for their price I expect good customer service overall
author: Vanessa S.

description: Our waiter Samir was great and the food was outstanding! Highly recommend this restaurant.
author: Nancy S.

description: I'm giving it 3 stars because we didn't eat here. The hostess was rude from the second we walked up. As we were telling her how many input party she walked away mid sentence. As she was walking away she said hold on. She came back to take us to our table. She walked us over to a table in the sun, put the menus down said there you go and started to walk away. We said excuse me twice she never turned around. We decided to walk out. The restaurant itself looked nice but we just didn't feel like dealing with it.
author: Lynn K.

description:
My experience at Fog Harbor was average. The service was subpar and disappointing. Our server Robert payed no attention to detail, was not attentive and showed no interest in serving the needs of his patrons. Robert had no personality and acted like he'd rather be at home. We had to ask for EVERYTHING :-( refills, bread...etc. 

The food was good. I ordered a salmon club salad and a salmon/shrimp dish (can't remember the name of it). The taste was pretty good. 

Beautiful establishment. If the service was better, my experience would have been great. It irritates the HELL out of me when servers are terrible. Ugggghhhh!!!!!! I'm so disappointed
author: Detroit R.

description:
I had friends in town from Arizona and after a day of playing tour guide and having fun at Pier 39, we ended up having dinner here.

There were 5 of us and we were seated right away at a table by the window. Our waitress was a bit surly and seemed like she would rather be helping any other table but ours (could be due to having 2 teenagers with us). 

I ordered clam chowder to start and after a taste of sand and grit, sent it back. The daughter had seared ahi and loved it, I had a combination platter that had salmon, mahi-mahi and shrimp. It came with mashed potatoes and green beans. The fish was cooked perfectly, but the cook seasoned everything with cayenne pepper. Since another in our party had the same dish (hers with garlic fries), and the fish on her plate was without this seasoning I asked the waitress if mine was a mistake (I am not the too spicy fan), the manager came over right away and claimed my dish was made with the pepper by mistake. 

I really appreciated the kindess of the manager (who also comped our desserts), the really good cosmo I had and the company I was with. I would probably not tell people who live in the area to run to this restaurant for a meal, but I would tell people who are visiting to eat here BEFORE going to any other restaurant at Pier 39.
author: Tam F.

description:
I found this so disappointing. We were seated and a waiter came to talk to us and during that time the hostess moved us to another table without explanation. The new server did not come for a while. Service was terrible... Maybe because we were two women taking about space. 

The food was terrible the clam chowder was thick and was like wallpaper paste. Too much flour.  The lobster tasted frozen  wet and mealy. The crab stuffing was more of  a bad crab salad with mayo.  The food came wrong. Need I go on??? They did take one entree off but the experience was so bad.
author: Sue R.

description: I got the famous clam chowder in a bread bowl here and it was delicious! Very affordable as well (only 10 dollars), and the bread was fresh, and the chowder had plenty of clams. The service was alright, nothing special, and there was a 30 minute wait which is understandable for how crowded the area is. They had a cool system too where they send you a text message when the table is ready. Would definitely come here again when I am looking for clam chowder in the area!
author: Hannah G.

description: Phenomenal service and food! I loved the lemonade, Clam Chowder, sourdough bread, and the Tuna appetizer. Everything was incredible but those really stood out for me. Highly recommend going there.
author: Ginger S.

description: Samir was a great waiter. Thoughtful service. Never had to ask for anything. We ordered the mixed grilling mussels. Terrific beer and constantly had bread and food came right away. Thanks! Atmosphere was really lovely. Likes the drinks. Terrific view. We had a wonderful experience and will be back again.
author: Micah T.

description: Amazing sourdough bread, house salad, clam chowder, seafood pasta, Dungeness crab and Tiramisu!!!! Would definitely recommend a visit. Too notch food!
author: Kelli K.

description: Crab had lots of meat and the food overall was excellent. Oysters were also huge!Resturant environment is excellent. I will say the price is a little high, but I think it's the same at other restaurants nearby. We will definitely go here again soon.
author: Sam N.

description: Great location over looking the water.  Food was very good.  We had the braised short ribs with garlic mashed potatoes and it was great! On the pricier side of other restaurants on pier 39 but very nice.
author: Steve C.

description: Wow! Great food and superb oysters! My family and I always come for their oysters when visiting pier 39. They're location is great for a romantic dinner with a view. Our waiter, Samir, provided us with great service and has great hair !
author: Julierose J.

description: Friendly hostess, excellent food and our server Tyler was top shelf!   Atmosphere is great!
author: Larry D.

description:
A bit disappointed with the overall experience dining here for dinner. The overall atmosphere in the restaurant is pleasant and the view is amazing. For a party of three on a Sunday, the wait was minimal which was a plus. 

For the food, my table ordered the seafood cioppino, seafood penne, fried calamari appetizer and the Moscow mule. Seafood cioppino was above average. More of a soupy tomato cioppino vs a stew like many places. Generous helpings of properly cooked mussels, clams, crab, scallops, shrimp and fish. Just wish the flavor was a bit stronger instead of resembling a tomato based seafood linguine. I'd say sotto mare was better. The seafood penne was very well done. Fish was perfectly cooked and the sauce was perfect, paired extremely well with the sourdough bread which was some of the best I've ever had. Soft center and flaky crust with chew. The calamari was well fried and flavorful, but the lemon aioli was very plain. The Moscow mule was watered down like crazy and might as well have been ginger ale mixed with water. 

The service for this restaurant was disappointing considering its a tourist trap. My server failed to give me plate/silverware, bread and water refills requires multiple requests and drink came 15 minutes late. Expected a lot more and there wasn't even an apology for lack of plate and utensils. 

I would probably not return based on the overall dining experience but the food was definitely some of the best of pier 39.
author: Matt P.

description: Great service and clean environment.  I had the calm chowder soup and the Ahi Poke Tuna both were amazing !!!! Beautiful views of the bay !!!!
author: Tony L.

description: Very poor service! Long wait times! Half of the ingredients listed on the dish were not actually in the dish! And then my waitress told me that the butter was mozzarella..!!! Took her forever to bring a glass of water..!
author: Navneet B.

description: Amazing experience!!!! Our waiter was Brenda, who had a great personality and took great care of us!!! We had a 30 minute wait but just walked around the pier and they texted us when our table was ready! Worked out perfectly!! Great view of the bay with excellent food. We had the mussel fries which were absolutely delicious and crab roll which my husband loved!!! Great atmosphere and would definitely return!
author: Morgan W.

description: Great views in fishermans wharf, amazing sea food, reasonable price, great bar service, close to sea lions on the pier and all the tourist attractions, shops, eateries, etc so walking around while waiting for our table and after our dinner was easy and fun! Highly recommended seafood dinner spot !
author: Josephine L.

description:
The Fisherman's Wharf area of San Francisco has earned its reputation for being a wonderful place to visit and to eat, and even the locals come here often. Of the many great restaurants available here, we selected Fog Harbor and were very, very pleased with our choice.
The service was good, the wine list well chosen, and the food was absolutely wonderful. We started with fresh west coast oysters and found them to be as good as any we ever had from the east coast, which we generally prefer. The Seafood Penne I ordered was rich and flavorful and included ample portions of delicious fish and shellfish, all of which were fresh and tasty. The Sole which my wife ordered was plentiful and wonderful and also as fresh as it could be. We matched our meal with a great wine and completed it with a pumpkin bread pudding served warm and wonderful. 
A little off the main tourist area of Fisherman's Wharf, this is worth walking the few extra steps it takes to get to it.
author: Paul L.

description: Wonderful service, incredibly clean facility, and the view of the San Francisco Bay is amazing. The food came out quickly and the specialty cocktails were delicious. A great place for other tourists  to grab lunch or dinner.
author: Hannah W.

description: Went there for dinner with my wife and immediately saw that there was a wait so I put my name in with the hostess who greeted us with attitude.... Finally sat down to a great view of the pier.. Food was great, our waiter not so much. We ordered our appetizers and after he came back with them he disappeared ...did not see him until our dinner showed up . Since we shared a meal there was no extra plate so we are off of our bread plates... Will not be back
author: Lance z.

description:
Perfect touristy dinner.

Located on Pier 39 which is one of the popular tourist spots on the water.  Made a reservation on open table, checked in early and still had some time before we were called so we walked down to see the sea lions at the end of the pier.  We requested a table by the window and were really excited when we got one because it was a stunning view of the harbor and the Golden Gate Bridge. 

Our waitress was nice and prompt.  Food is quick. They bring out some really tasty sourdough bread while you look over the menu.  We ordered a bottle of white wine which was served nice and cool. My boyfriend ordered the clam chowder with extra crab on top which he loved, we also split a ceasar salad which was good.  I ordered the Salmon and loved the corn topping they served it with.  The piece they gave me was gigantic.  My boyfriend ordered the cioppino which he loved (tons of crab, perfect mussels and scallops, good fish and tasty shrimp).    

We definitely recommend this place, especially if you're staying near the wharf.
author: Katie C.

description: Whack!! Food is so bland, crab cakes and shrimp are horrible and they both taste like it came out of a frozen box!! Just no flavor on the oily crab as well.
author: James W.

description: We thoroughly enjoyed our dinner tonight!  Great food and atmosphere.  Our server, Samir, was wonderful!  Casual enough....but definitely great enjoy experience.
author: Tammy V.

description: Really good food and a great selection. All the food is so fresh. Great sourdough bread too.
author: Jen H.

description: The clam chowder here is possibly the best in the area, the waiting staff are fantastic, the service Samir provided was second to none
author: Nathan C.

description: Khaiman was the best server - knowledgeable, accommodating, friendly, and efficient. Loved the birthday dessert and efforts to attend to our food allergies.
author: Heather R.

description: If you don't make time to stop here for clam chowder in a sour dough bread bowl you are crazy and missing out on one of the best meals in San Francisco.  Jon was our waiter and was very nice.  We were able to view the sea lions from out the window along with the boats coming and going.  The Fog Harbour Fish House is a must.
author: Gwen L.

description: We went for my birthday, place is very noisy, I got the garlic roasted crab. It was not as good as Cuppinos. The blonde brownie was good. Both my wife and I didn't get wowed, especially when the $200 bill for the average food served.
author: Tom T.

description:
Really good service here with attentive service staff! The view was great as you can literally see the ships, seas and all the tourists below the restaurant. 

Came here for restaurant week but ordered a bowl of clam chowder on the side. Was surprised by the small portion of the clam chowder but the taste more than make up for the small size! Wish I could order another bowl! 

Had the crab ceviche and crab cakes. ceviche is better than crab cakes as the plate came with fries and made me feel like it was an unhealthy meal!

So come here if u like to eat with pretty scenery and be served by nice people!
author: Yilin T.

description: Absolutely delicious garlic crab and oysters.  The service was wonderful our drinks were never empty!  The chocolate banana desert is to die for!!
author: Misty C.

description: We walked in and were immediately greeted and seated at our table with a beautiful view of the pier.  The service was EXCELLENT & The food was AMAZING!  Definitely recommend!
author: Matt B.

description:
We traveled to San Francisco looking forward to all the good food we went to fog Harbor at fisherman's wharf.  It was absolutely atrocious you can get better clam chowder and shrimp cocktail in Salt Lake at Market St. Grill I got the lobster tail and it tasted horrible I had to send it back.
I honestly can't recommend this place nobody in my party of four like their meal.
author: Bill J.

description: Best Calamari and Clam Chowder on the pier!!!  Lovely views and romantic restaurant for a perfect lunch or dinner date.  Definitely worth the trip for us to come out and enjoy.  I grew up just 3 blocks from Pier 39 and have such great memories here!!
author: Rosie M.

description: Mel was an amazing server. The food was excellent and the service was even better. We look forward to coming back again next time we are in San Francisco.
author: Christopher S.

description: I was more impressed than what I expected it to be. If you're lucky you can get seated by the beautiful view outside & it's the best time to go when the sun is just about to set. The food is so good! I got the penne chicken with mashed potatoes & it has to be the best chicken I've ever tried. Their desserts are to die for too. It is more pricey than going to a regular restaurant. But they went above my expectations. Will go back for sure!
author: Cynthia M.

description: Hands down the Red Chille Garlic Shrimp the best one I ever tasted ! Good ambience and friendly staff !
author: Sudhakar K.

description:
Went for dinner with a fairly sizable group of friends, had no trouble with seating because we'd made a reservation ~6 hours in advance.

Everything was fine, though there was some miscommunication about what we'd ordered the staff was in general perfectly friendly.

I ordered bleu cheese garlic bread (this was really good, actually) and the ahi dish as my main. The ahi was underwhelming: quite bland, in part I'm sure because it was overcooked. To be fair, the presentation of the fish was pretty well done (heh). It was dressed with what I'm assuming was supposed to be a wasabi paste which, though already weak, was completely overpowered by the pickled ginger  scattered liberally over the fish.

If I were to come here again, I'd give their "higher end" dishes a pass, I think, and go straight for the fish 'n chips, which looked much more promising once I'd seen it.

If you're a one-plate kind of eater, this can be a $$ restaurant; if you tend to get a starter *and* a main, like I generally do, you'll quickly find yourself in the $$$ range, especially when you add a few drinks to the equation.
author: Haak S.

description:
My favorite restaurant on pier 39! Located on the second level of pier 39, Fog Harbor Fish House offers great food, decent prices as well as good service. I've eaten here about 5-6 times and I've been impressed each time. The food here is very good. I highly recommend the filet mignon with mashed potatoes and spinach. It is my favorite item on the menu and since I am such a potato lover, they replace my spinach for an extra side of mashed potatoes. I've also had the salmon, steamed clams (an appetizer) calamari, popcorn shrimp and clam chowder, all of which are delicious. The food is fairly priced. 

The service is good, the waiters/waitresses are very friendly and attentive. They also seem very knowledgable about the menu and will give recommendations and suggestions. I remember going there one time with my friends, our waiter was so sweet he hooked us up with free dessert and put it on the check as a "free birthday dessert" -- awesome! 

Definitely recommend this restaurant! One of my favorites -- I am even planning on going tomorrow night!! 

One last side note: while waiting for a table you can sit outside on the couches by the fireplace and order drinks from the bar while you wait.
author: Lauren M.

description: Been using yelp for a while but have never written a review until today. I had Tyler as my server and he was absolutely amazing. He's the best server I have ever had. He was attentive and had wonderful recommendations. My friend and I had the clam chowder, ahi tuna, and the fried combo.  Service and food was absolutely on point. Best experience I've ever had.
author: Linda L.

description: On my second visit to San Francisco it was a delightful experience to find this restaurant in the heart of the fisherman's wharf tourist area. Everything our group ordered was delicious,  the Lazy Ciopinno was the best we ever had. The crab cakes were an extasis in my palate, and the dessert was second to none. I noticed the quality of the ingredients was first rate justifying the higher price. If you like fresh, quality seafood in the San Francisco area, look no further.
author: Benigno P.

description: For a fish house, this place makes the best burger I have ever had. The service was awesome, thanks Ashley G. The wait was only 15 on a Saturday night and we even got a window seat next to the harbor. My wife had an awesome seafood dish and loved every bite. AMAZING food. Very impressed and I will be returning soon! Thanks Fog Harbor
author: Sean T.

description: Average, but we only tried a few things since we were not hungry: oysters, french fries, clam chowder in a sourdough bread bowl. The clam chowder was pretty good and the sour dough bread was really good. Not sure how you can fuck up oysters, but these were not tasty at all. They were also very gritty and not cleaned very well. Fries were just average and nothing special. Service was ok, but they were super busy so not really that attentive.
author: David L.

description: My husband and I went here yesterday, April 23, 2015 for dinner. We were seated near the window which was perfect because I was cold. Having the sun come through the window warmed me up. The bread was very hard to cut through; however and luckily, the manager noticed this after I was done and brought us warm and softer pre-cut bread. My husband had the Shellfish Platter and thought it was good. I had the sourdough bread bowl clam chowder and thought it was okay. I personally do not like spices and a lot of herbs in my clam chowder and thought this soup had a little too much of both. We also ordered the jumbo shrimp cocktail, which was yummy. The service was nice and ambiance was pleasant.
author: Katie C.

description: My grandparents, cousin and I went here one night and loved it! Service was great, food was great, atmosphere was great, view was greater! Highly recommended!
author: Elliot K.

description: Nice location, very good seafood (we had the shellplatter for two) and Semir was a great server. The food came really fast and we enjoyed our stay here.
author: Joëlle E.

description:
Very good food!
We had the shellplatter for two, which was delicious - i highly recommend it!
The service (semir) was great!
author: Samuel R.

description:
