Came here for Restaurant Week in 2015. It was good food, the Seafood ciapatto was ENORMOUS. Half crab for the appetizer was well worth it. However keep in mind the seafood ciapatto also has crab in it, so unless you want double crab order something else for the appetizer. Seafood ciapatto was soup-like, but they didn't skimp out on seafood. It was packed to the brim with seafood. Chocolate cake was delicious, the inside melted in your mouth. As other reviewers have said, their sourdough bread is pretty amazing.

Overall I had a pleasant time here. Atmosphere was good and waiteres were friendly, but we waited a LONG time for service on our night. They were pretty busy, but still it was rather annoying to wait 45 minutes for bread and 1 hour for food. Might come back again, although their prices are a bit scary.
author: Wynn C.

description:
I came here with my boyfriend on our first trip to SF. My boyfriend is a big fan of seafood so we decided to try this place. The ambiance here is nice, classy yet casual. Makes it more comfortable without it being too dim. We ordered a dozen oysters, crab rolls, lobster mac n cheese, and the alcatraz drink. EVERYTHING WAS GREAT!

Although I did not eat the oyster, my boyfriend said it was really good - very fresh. The crab rolls were good, but nothing super special. However, the lobster mac n cheese was super BOMB! I've never tasted anything like it - it was beyond delicious! The lobster chunks were huge and the pasta was cooked to perfection. I am not a big fan of alcohol and hate the taste of alcohol, but the Alcatraz was delicious! It was fruity and slushy like, but the hint of alcohol was very little. 100% going back to this place again!
author: Jenifer L.

description: Good experience for dinner, especially the sunset view. Samir is very friendly. We compared most restaurants nearby and made a good choice.
author: Roger L.

description: We had dinner the evening of October 22nd. We started with the mussel fries  and calamari, both of which were superb. We followed with main courses of scallops, mixed grill, and fish and chips. All were superbly prepared and delicious. Our server, Tyler, was top notch. He was always available when we had any requests, and served with good humor. We will definitely return any time we visit SF in the future.
author: Harry L.

description: Went here spur of the moment to wait for traffic to die down after the Giants game and let me say very impressed. Great food great service with a great atmosphere and view would definitely go back again.
author: Derek M.

description: Thank you so much, Madison, for your patience with us and our big order! The cioppino is phenomenal, and the Moscow mules are truly the best I've ever had, and we drink a lot! The bread is fresh and hot, and the oysters are uber fresh and cold!
author: Red F.

description: Can't say enough about this place. Pier 39 is packed with tourist traps, but the Fog Harbor stands out from the crowd. The food is outstanding. We had the clam chowder in a bread bowl, and it was among the best I've had. View of the sea lions and Alcatraz from our table was a bonus!
author: Becca D.

description:
Had dinner here.  I ordered the salmon.  Be sure to ask the price... When I ordered it, it was market price
 It was delicious.  Great view of the harbor with Alcatraz in the background.
author: Keith R.

description: Insipid. Lack of originality on the food. I don't know how they got 4 stars. The only good thing was the lemonade.
author: Miguel S.

description: Delicious food here at pier 39. Samir our waiter was very nice. Enjoyed the ambiance.
author: Christian M.

description: We had a great time at Fog Harbor! Our waiter Samir was absolutely phenomenal and so patient with such a large party (there was 10 of us) and was super sweet to every single person! He made the experience even better than it already was!!
author: Kelly L.

description:
Great food today for my husbands birthday after Alcatraz tour. Our waiter he was very friendly and trued hard to keep up since they were packed and seemed shirt handed. Hostess passed our name up after we told her we would be at the bar so it took awhile to get our table. Service was slow but the waiter his personality made up for it.  
Lucky for us the food was worth it too
author: Renee G.

description: I had the crab cakes appetizer, clam chowder, and malbec wine while in San Francisco a few days ago. They also brought out sourdough bread which was great.  I sat at the bar.  Food was good but a bit pricey. I had a problem with my server overtipping himself.  I called the restaurant and they quickly rectified the problem which I have to give them credit for.
author: Brenda M.

description: We had to wait about 10 min when we came around 2PM but got seated at a good location with a beautiful view of the pier. We ordered the crab cake and clam chowder in a bowl for appetizers. Crab cake was delicious but not work the $19 for only 1 crab cake. The chowder was also good. We then ordered the swordfish and shared. We were so full we couldn't finish everything! The swordfish was WAY too salty that I wanted to send it back but didn't. Also when you pay don't be alarmed that you are charged 6% or something for San Fransciso employees tax. Overall I would eat here again but would have sent back the fish because it was wayyy too salty. The only reason why we didn't was that we were short on time.
author: Jenny D.

description: We ate here our first night of our vacation and it was also my birthday and we loved it. The restaurant is very pretty, elegant and cozy. The service was wonderful. For appetizer we ordered the fried calamari and they were delicious and I of course ordered the famous clam chowder on a bread bowl and it was amazing. For our entrees my husband ordered a plate called Ciopinno and we've never had it before and wow was that good it brings all types of seafood in a tomato broth super good. I ordered the trout with mashed potatoes and vegetables and it was really good too. It was a great start to our wonderful vacation.
author: Zaida C.

description:
Service is definitely a standout at this tourist location at Fisherman's Wharf. Our server was top notch and paid attention to detail and incredibly helpful and friendly. We made our reservation via Open Table and that made it easy to get a table but they also gave us a nice amuse bouche to start our dinner. The atmosphere is loud - lots of noise and clanging - so don't plan on an intimate dinner here. 

Scott started with the Award Winning Clam Chowder. He rated the soup a three star and he is quite the clam chowder aficionado. We split the Beet & Blue Cheese Salad - red and golden beets, organic mixed greens tossed with blue cheese dressing topped with walnuts - which was utterly delicious.  The server had the kitchen split the salad which is a detail often missed. The hot from the oven sour dough bread was very tasty that came with our appetizers. As a side note, I wanted the grilled artichoke but the server said the item was not available. 

The food fell to a low point with my entree the Salmon special. It was very dry and served on their mashed potatoes which appeared to be instant or potato pearls. It was not very tasty and I mostly just ate the vegetable on my plate. Scott had the Whole Dungeness Crab with a spicy Thai sauce. He loved this meal. The crab was cooked perfectly and the sauce, although messy, was really good. Had my seafood been as good as the crab I would have bumped them to a four star.

A fun place to try if you are in the mood for a Pier 39 restaurant.
author: Wendi G.

description:
We had a lovely night here, we really enjoyed the baked oysters and the clam chowder in a cob. 
The staff where friendly and we where seated straight away without a reservation. 
The creme brûlée was so good and the sugar top was perfect and had a nice "crack" when we broke through it. The kids really enjoyed drawing on the paper table covers with the supplied crayons. 
My husband had the grilled chicken breast but he said it was a little dry.
author: Billys M.

description: Samir was a great server, very kind and attentive. The lobster tail I ordered was good, although a little overcooked. I had a very nice experience.
author: Kody H.

description: If you're in the Fisherman's Wharf area, this is a great place to consider. Great seafood and views. The half orders of oysters and dungeness crab definitely hit the spot. My grilled swordfish and salmon plate was also delicious. Finished it off with a warm chocolate fudge cake.
author: Andy G.

description: Amazing dinner tonight. The dirty martini was to die for! The poke was great, the burger was juicy, a 10 out of 10. Loved the clam chowder! The view was phenomenal! Will definitely be coming back.
author: Heidi D.

description: The evening was perfect! OUR waiter was amazing! Oscar you made our dinning experience worth the rude rude RUDE hostesses we first encountered. Just saying, if you're going to be in a service business you may want to educate yourselves in BASIC laws. So that way you don't look like an airhead when you try and say a restaurant doesn't allow pets; that's common sense btw. But a SERVICE dog, isn't a pet. Back to the evening! Oscar was exceptionally patient and before he brought out our drinks he brought my GF's service dog water. He was an awesome human being! The food was amazing! We got Calamari to start, amazing. We got the Surf and Turf and a trio of salmon, white fish and shrimp. Everything was so flavorful and tasty! Its making my mouth water just thinking about it. All in all, the night was beautiful!
author: Dez R.

description: This place was amazing. Great service and great food. Especially the waiter Samir! He was awesome! :) would definitely go again!
author: Brook R.

description:
The view is to die for and the atmosphere very nice. Staff is friendly. 

I think the food was over priced and could have been better.  We enjoyed some yummy drinks but left a little disappointed with the bland flavors.  

Nothing's to write home about unless you want to sit with a great view and a delicious drink.
author: Minnie C.

description:
I was a little worried about coming here because of the ultra touristy location. But don't let that scare you away.  I wish I knew my server's name because he was great.  He really made the experience. The view was also spectacular. 

The food was good too. I ordered the steak. It came with kale and mashed potatoes. My steak was cooked perfect and the knife cut it like butter. The seasoning was spot on too. The greens were better than I expected, I don't usually like green vegetables.  The mash potatoes were less than stellar.  For dessert I had the cookie. It was great. I needed to roll myself out of the restaurant. 

It looked as if most people were enjoying their dinner too. I suggest giving the place a try if you are going to be in the area.
author: Holly C.

description: Great service. Tyler (server 408) was awesome. He was relaxed and professional. Never needed anything he was on top of it. Seriously you should request him. View was great and food was delish.
author: Kara G.

description: Samir was a great server, very attentive to our needs. Food was comforting and tasty!
author: Grace C.

description:
The best clam chowder I've ever had. I'm not a connoisseur of clam chowder, but I've had my faaaair share. The day we went here, I intended to go to many other restaurants as part of my chowder day-- but I just couldn't because I knew that nothing would beat it! 

An added plus-- great views, and fair prices. My new fav spot in Fisherman's Wharf!
author: Kiran G.

description: I had SUCH an amazing lunch here! The clam chowder in a bread bowl was extremely rich and flavorful. The crab roll was to die for.. cold shredded crab meat tossed in some sort of light sauce, stuffed inside a hot buttered roll. The crab tasted so fresh! The ambience was pretty classy! But the prices were very reasonable for high quality meals that were filling!
author: Jenny N.

description: Best view of the harbor from our table. The food was to die for!!! and I recommend the clam chowder in the sourdough bread bowl either way is awesome!
author: J Carlos R.

description:
Our Anniversary dinner reservation was made here. They made sure out was special before we arrived at the table. 
The Chef prepared specials are top notch.
author: Nancy P.

description: Our server Oscar was fantastic.  the crab cakes were not very good.  the rest of our food was very good.  The clam chowder was very good.  Nice view and setting.
author: Chet M.

description: Great night here at Fog Harbor. Tyler has been really helpful in giving tips for food choices
author: Siyang L.

description: On my one year anniversary with my husband. Stopped in for a quick drink and bite...ended up being pleasantly surprised. Everyone is really nice. Greeted us with smiles. We were going to stick to the happy hour menu, "quick bite," and ended up with garlic fries, which were really flavorful. If you're a garlic lover you'll love these fries. We each had a cup of chowder...clams in each bite, no joke. We shared the crab roll sandwich and I wish I would've gotten my own! The bread was SO good, not to mention the crab. It was all over this sandwich. Really tasty and flavorful. I got the house Cabernet to drink and it's really delicious. Go here if you're looking for fresh food and great service!
author: Leslie M.

description:
When I was at Pier 39 and searching for a place to eat, I looked at all the menus and settled for this restaurant. The menu devoted to dungeness crab won me over. Also, the entrance and waiting area looked really inviting. There's a fireplace and comfy couches!

I ordered a clam chowder cup to start, a dungeness crab roll for my entree, and a blondie for dessert. The clam chowder is "award winning," and while I thought it was tasty, it seemed kind of ordinary. The crab roll was delicious! It was stuffed with crab, and it was so light and fresh. The blondie was really yummy, too! For those of you who have been to BJ's, it tasted just like a pizookie! But their ice cream has a caramel sauce over it! 

The service was also really good. My waitress was really attentive and kind. 

The views in this place are amazing, as well.
author: Rachel H.

description: Excellent food and our server, Tyler was exceptional!  The halibut was the best I've had.
author: L. H.

description: Thanks and Happy Birthday and happy new year to Shana, a waitress who came to my rescue and let me use this restaurant's portable cell phone charger! My phone was totally dead but I needed to get in touch with a few people. She was so friendly and totally understood my distress. Really appreciate the help!!!
author: Laura S.

description: They don't take reservations, but the waiting area is good if you can get a seat by the fireplace cuz it gets chilly in the evening being it's right by the water. We got kids mac and cheese, salmon, lobster tail, swordfish, shrimp cocktail, dungeness crab, and clam chowder. Everything was on the salty side, but it was fresh seafood. Not sure if we will come back when we visit SF again, but if your looking for a nice restaurant with ambience, this is the place to go to. Our waitress was attentive and we didn't have any problems with service being slow (as some of the other yelpers had), the only slow service we had was our wait to be seated. We thought it was because they were busy, but the minute we got seated,  we realized there were many tables and seats available. So not sure of they were short on waiters, or if they were being lazy with seating?
author: Lynn L.

description: This place was amazing. Samir was fantastic.  Great service and amazing food. The clam chowder is the best I have had in the city.  The cucumber gimlet was refreshing and outstanding. Highly recommend this place
author: Jamie M.

description: We had a fantastic meal here! Hard to find quality food on the later side in SF and while pier 39 can get a little tourist-y this place is not trap. The salmon was cooked perfectly and Samir was great - he steered me to the mix grill which was the right call. Highly recommend.
author: Mok M.

description: this is a really nice restaurant. we enjoyed a nice dinner here. the crab was amazing and the view was gorgeous.
author: Liuru C.

description: Wonderful food and a great view! Mel was our server and he was very personable and friendly. We would return!
author: Alexandria A.

description:
Back in Maryland, where the Chespeake churns and the Old Bay Seasoning flows, the crustacean of the day is the blue crab. Here in San Francisco, the crab of choice is the stout Dungeness, a veritable wrestler versus the comparatively dainty, ballerina-esque blueies we have back where I'm from. Having had my fair share of crab in my life, devoured mostly with mallet and mini fork in hand mind you, I was ready to give the Dungeness a try.

After a long day exploring Fisherman's Wharf, a nice plate of crab cakes, some fries, and slaw just felt right. The restaurant was quickly becoming crowded so I felt lucky that my two friends and I managed to snag a window table. Tired and hungry, we were all happy to be greeted by a basket of steaming hot San Francisco Sourdough and softened butter. I've always appreciated the tart bite and hearty crust of a good sourdough in sandwich service, so the pure unadulterated experience of quality bread led us off on a good start. Hey, it's the little things in life that count. Soon thereafter, our food came out. I was greeted by a surprisingly ordinary plate of two smallish pan fried crab cakes, fries, and slaw. Unfortunately, the "ordinary" aspect seemed to be a theme as I began to eat my dish. 

Strike one was that the crab cakes were merely warm and didn't seem terribly fresh. Furthermore, while I was hoping for delicious lumps of sweet crab, I instead got a pretty bland interior which tasted more of filler than crab. Whether or not it was indeed filler and breadcrumb I was tasting or it was the way the strangely finely minced crab was prepared that threw my tastebuds off is up for debate, but it was disappointing. While crisp on the outside, the inside was mushy and pasty. Luckily or not, since they were small, I didn't really have much to go through before it was gone. A truly great crab cake should highlight the quality and flavour of the crustacean that honorably served in its preparation, not of bread and onion. The fries were also a disappointment. While they were hot, they were devoid of seasoning. Unsalted fries are a sin! Why why why would you ever serve unsalted fries? Finally, the slaw and remoulade were inoffensive, which is to say, pretty unmemorable. 

Moving on to the service and space, I should first point out that getting to Fog Harbor can be a little tricky. You must access it from the upper balcony level of Pier 39. Once inside, you're greeted by a nice dining space. It's open, the servers are dressed professionally, and if you get a window seat, you will be greeted by a beautiful view of the bay. Service was also good. Our server was quick, friendly, and readily agreed to split our check. 

So why the two stars? Well, while the service and space were very good overall, I was disappointed by the food. My dish was bland, uninspired, and got literally beat out by bread and butter. In addition, later that night, my stomach really did not agree with what I ate. Considering I ate toast for breakfast that day, I think my cakes are the guilty ones here. I hope that I maybe caught Fog Harbor on an off day since others seem to really like this place. Unfortunately for me, it just didn't hit the mark.
author: Philip T.

description: Samir was so on point. He was very efficient and charming. The food was excellent. Try the Trio Grill and the Dungeness Crab Cocktail. The desserts were nothing short of amazing.
author: Liz Y.

description:
A little on the pricy side, but that's always the case with seafood. Good food though and a great location, right on the pier. Considering the location and the fact that it's such a popular spot, I wouldn't consider this place expensive at all. Great view of the harbor and the see! Good service.

After or before eating, go check out the sea lions right behind the restaurant, resting a few feet off the pier.
author: Santiago R.

description: The view was amazing and the food was delicious. I had their clam chowder and it had excellent flavor. They have a great wine select as well.
author: Matthew G.

description: The Seafood aelection was outstanding. My wife ordered the Salmon and she said it was perfectly cooked and it was moist. I ordered the Mixed Grill whuch was very tasty aswell. Our appetizer was Calamari it was slightly overcooked but it was good. Rhe desserts were nicely presented,  if you go here you've got to order the Strawberry short cake. Very moist and the cake was awesome. I give this place two thumbs up.
author: Charles W.

description: Very pricey for not good quality seafood. Was very disappointed and the server was no help.
author: Jameson M.

description:
Normally I do not venture down to Pier 39 since I live here but Codmother was closed (A MUST EAT AT) and I had a visitor in town from AZ so I thought, "what the heck." 

First and foremost: If you are a local - SKIP AT ALL COSTS. 

Pluses: 
1. The wait was minimal on a Thursday night in the summer, which was nice.

2. The restaurant seems clean, upscale and has amazing views if you are willing to wait for them. 

3. The drinks were amazing. Mixed very well, creatively concocted and delicious. 

The minuses:
1.  VERY LOUD AND NOISY. There are way too many tables squeezed in the space available. Normally I wouldn't knock a place for this, but given everything else that was bad, I thought I'd list.

2. The service. It is very apparent that each server has too many tables to handle. Service is extremely slow. We were told 4 times our oysters and crab cakes were on the way however the actual time to receive was approx. 30 minutes. If they sent actually on the way, just don't say it. Again, I wouldn't necessarily knock a place for this however the oysters are raw (easy to plate) and the crab cakes were obviously pre-made and just dropped into a fryer. Also, it would have been nice to get or even be offered bread, when everyone seem to have it. Lastly, when we tried to joke or have any conversation with put waitress at all, she immediately became defensive and didn't get the banter. 

3. The food. Crab stuff lobster ... Should include ... Lobster. Additionally the dish should not be sitting on top of boxed (at least that's what they tasted like) mashed potatoes. Or in my opinion not for $36 bucks. The swordfish had a very odd square shape, tasted at one point frozen and was dry. 

If you're visiting, hungry and need a place to eat on the pier, choose someplace else. Not at all worth the price.
author: Autumn H.

description:
Service: It's appropriate. The staff is courteous and polite. But I don't find anyone going out of their way to make the experience a memorable one.

Food: Just what the menu explains, simple, and scrumptious. The seafood here is one of the BEST in SF. I have to add though, not having a desert menu, but rather displaying their selection is very naughty. I don't think I've ever walked out without ordering a desert here for that very reason.

View: If you happen to get a window seat, you'll catch yourself gazing out into the ocean... Very relaxing
author: O.s. M.

description:
My cousin and I had lunch here. Since he was visiting. He wanted to dine on the wharf. It's a very nice restaurant. We were seated by the window. He got to see a great view of the bridge and Alcatraz.  Our server came right away. I had the cioppino. My cousin had the fried prawns. I also ordered the calamari. Our server was absolutely wonderful. I wish I remembered her name. She was very attentive and polite. 
Now back to the food. The calamari was lightly coated. It was very tasty. The cioppino on the other hand was a little bland . It was a large serving with tons of mussels, clams etc. Just kinda blah.  My cousin enjoyed his prawns .  The very best part of the meal. I must say was the warm sourdough bread. Nice atmosphere and of course very touristy.
author: Sandy P.

description: Wow what a chow, chow, chowder!!!! Came with a mound of fresh crab meat really good. Also had the crab cake for my meal. They were also really good. Thumbs up for the FOG!!!!
author: Jeremy S.

description: This place was pretty good. I had to admit going to a tourist trap for dinner I didn't expect much.  I order the lobster tail and garlic crab.  The garlic crab flavor was only in the outside of the crab and I had to dip it in the sauce.   the server however didn't refill my water. That was my only compliant.
author: Tony N.

description: Sat down at the bar right away, recieved prompt service, order the ultimate dirty martini-- delish and my gf ordered the basil cucumber gibblet--pretty refreshing.  We order fries to snack on and the came out immediately.  My gf and I were chatting and mentioned charging our phones and the manager gave us two portable chargers.  Great service, friend staff. The only reason I didn't give it a 5 is the bartender didn't entertain my joke.  Hahahah! Will come again to taste their main entrée.
author: Veronica J.

description:
Rating 5: It was a great experience and food was delicious!  I'd go here again for a special occasion. 

I made a reservation for Sunday lunch and made a request for a table with a good view, since it was for a special occasion: my dad's birthday.  Upon being seated, I looked around and realized that they really did save one of the best seats in the house even though the rest of the area was full, plus, they wrote happy birthday on our paper table cloth, and of course they offered me to pick any of the desserts on their menu for my dad!  I was very pleased! 

Food: My family ordered the lobster mac n cheese, the cioppino, and the clam linguine.  There was also perfectly fresh and warm sourdough bread.  The lobster mac n' cheese had a fair amount of large chunks of lobster, so I was pretty happy.  My mother was very happy about the cioppino; it had a nice range and variety of clam, mussel, fish, and some crab legs, plus, she reported everything was very fresh. Plus the soup was delicious. My dad is a quiet man so I didn't hear much about the linguine, but it looked great. Overall, everything was very good. The dessert we got for my dad was the apple crumb pie + ice cream on top, which was great! 

Price: Fair for the freshness of the seafood and the occasion. 

Service / Experience: As written above, everything was perfect.  Our waitress was always nearby, brought everything as requested, and was very pleasant.  The view is of the bay, Marina, and Alcatraz. 

Extra: They will validate your Pier 39 parking for 1 hour for lunch, 2 hours for dinner. 

Thanks Fog Harbor Fish House, I'm very happy I brought my dad here!
author: Jennifer W.

description:
The location is nice but the food is way overpriced and not very good.
We had 2 cocktails, 2 sodas, order of oysters, filet, lobster tail and swordfish. The bill was $200.00 (not including tip). The oysters were the only decent item on the list. The lobster was chewy and lacked flavor, the steak was bland and the swordfish was drowned in sauce. All of the veggies/potatoes that came with the meals were overcooked.
The service was good but not great. I wouldn't go back again.
author: Fresia M.

description: Came here for lunch. This place is clean and the wait staff is super friendly. We had a large group and they were on top of their game. Friendly, clean, good food, and great service is what I'm all about. For starters, I ordered their clam chowder. I was in San Francisco. Can't pass that up. I ended up getting their Fried Combo, which consisted of hand-breaded fish, calamari, shrimp, french fries, and cole slaw. I felt like a fat and happy kid when I left the restaurant. I had to walk around Pier 39 to burn off some calories.
author: Bobby S.

description: good stuff. I had the famous chowder in a sourdough bread bowl. It was solid. I got it with crab meat which was nice. A solid option at pier 39. I'd recommend it
author: Peter K.

description: The food and service was great. The salmon BLT was awesome. The whole experience was just a little too pricey... but that's par for the course in SF.
author: Debbie B.

description:
3.5 stars

We went to Pier 39 for the live music - specifically for Tainted Love.  Got there early and thought some oysters would be nice.  Fog Harbor is one of the nicer place on the Pier.  The front open space is spacious, modern and the fireplace is a nice touch.  We had no idea the restaurant is huge - there are a lot of tables in the back.

We grabbed the first booth seat in the front and settled in.  Our waiter, Khaiman? was very friendly and great at selling.  What we had:

Anchor Steam - $6.23
glass of Prosecco - $8.5
1/2 dozen oyster (2x) - $13 - from Prince Edwards Island.  These were very good, plump, sweet, creamy and fresh.  I can probably eat a couple dozens easily.
curry mussels - $12 - pretty good, nice curry flavor with plenty garlic
clam chowder - ordered a bowl mainly because of the Yelp reviews but what a disappointment.  It was chalky and not very flavorful.  Since we didn't eat it, they took it off our bill.

The dessert tray looked very tempting - the bread pudding with Ghiradelli chocolate chips looked quite good.
author: Gloria H.

description:
Fog Harbor was the choice for a holiday party with my friends from various Banks.
About twenty people.

Tip: to get to Pier 39 from Caltrain, just walk to the BART track, pay $2.00 and ride it to Embarcadero. Then get off and walk to the F Street car, pay $2.00.
Your other option is to cab there for $12.50 each way.

On to Fog Harbor Fish House: 
Good value for large parties.

We did the prix fixe,  for starters every four people were served a platter of yummy calamari perfectly deep fried, cheese toast with fine blue cheese and a small plate of prawns sauteed in a spicy hot marinara (V. good). Next, you get a salad of a few leaves of high quality romaine lettuce with creamy blue cheese or, you can have a white clam chowder. The main entree is either salmon, new york steak, or braised chicken, comes with sauteed zucchini's and pearl onion. Mashed potato's and a dessert of lava cake or tiramisu. $38.00

I had the NY steak, cooked medium, it was tastey, if a bit skinny at 1/2 inch thick cooked.  The excellent romaine salad comes with four pieces of lettuce with a creamy blue cheese dressing; it was perfection. The mashed potatoes and sauteed zucchini were ok.  

For dessert, I chose their lava cake: it was very chocolately,& moist n' sweet on the inside; it was served with a side of vanilla ice cream drizzled with more chocolate. A sprig of mint leaf added to the sensation.

My friend had the salmon and it looked phat, well over an inch, about 6 inches by 6 inches. She said it was delicious.

Their coffee was very good: black and delicious. 

Decent appetizers, entrees and desserts. I just figure you are paying a very reasonable $33.00 for the food and $5.00 for an excellent water front view, fine linen and silverware. I had to ask for my coffee to get refilled. Ditto for water.

Bathrooms: clean and modern.

Customer service: a bit slow.

Ambience: very nice, trad. American.

Tip: from the BART at Embarcadero, walk upstairs and look for the train tracks and hop on the F Street Car, to Pier 39. Just $2.00

Tip: due to the deluge, we cabbed from Pier 39 to CalTrain at King/4th, it was $12.50 without tip.
author: Bert K.

description:
Oh my god.  Best calamari ever. I make that statement knowing full well the gravitas it holds.  
But seriously, Fog Harbor is a must when visiting the Bay Area.  I know that some people may consider it touristy, but whatever. It's delicious.
The bread provided on the table is delicious sourdough...in other words, don't pay extra for a sourdough bread bowl.  
I came here for lunch and enjoyed a crab melt, as did everyone else at my table.  Everyone thought it to be very delicious and a great lunch experience.  Our waiter was so adorable, I wanted to put him on my shelf.
author: Mallory D.

description: Service is good just a little delay on our tower seafood but the food are all excellent
author: Allan A.

description:
First restaurant I went to during my work in the Bay Area. This place did not disappoint. Many natives have told me that Pier 39 is overrated. I say this place certainly is not and may be slighly underrated. It met my expectations and at times exceeded! 

I took my girlfriend here and we both loved the place. We got a window seat that overlooked the bay and the golden gate bridge in the far back. The service was great and on top of that, we checked in to get free garlic bread. The staff are great and again, impeccable service when we were there in February.

Now let's talk about the food. Their sourdough bread to start was perfect.  Definitely recommend the clam chowder IN a bread bowl, and the Crab was amazing. This place has some of the best seafood I've had at a reasonable price for the area. Oh and I forgot to mention their drink menu, amazing. They have amazing mixed drinks and wine selection. I personally even liked their "fruity" drinks that most describe as "feminine". 

Do yourself a favor and stop by this restaurant if you are looking to sit down and enjoy a nice meal whether alone or with company.
author: Steve X.

description: Great views, awesome vibe. Here with my wife celebrating our love. The service was fare, our waiter was the best. Hostest however, could have been more polite. All in all it was a great time
author: Dean A.

description: I had the best sliders ever for an appetizer and had the perfect meal of a clam chowder bread bowl and chicken Cesar salad all of which was DELICIOUS! My only complaint is that the lettuce of the salad was not cut at all, pretty presentation but, left me cutting lettuce like I would cut a steak...
author: A Z.

description: There is for sure a reason It has 2000 reviews! Great food, fantastic sights of the bay. Wow just amazing.
author: Casey W.

description: Had the fish and chips and it was delicious. Good selection of beers, crab looked awesome, wish I would have got that.
author: Josh B.

description: Had a very good experience.  A group had a heavy lunch with a variety of different items.  Very good on the prep and presentation along with great service.
author: David D.

description: Great restaurant with great food, view and service. Our waiter Tyler was really nice, giving good food recommendations. Good address on the pier!
author: Louise P.

description:
Yes Pier 39 is a tourist trap but this seafood place was delicious! The staff was very friendly and attentive. We had a toddler with us and they were very kind to him. 

The food came out quickly. My husband had the shellfish pot and I had the sole. Both were delicious. I also had the strawberry nojito (since I'm pregnant) and it wss very refreshing. 

The price was reasonable and the views were great. I would definitely recommend!
author: Lisa C.

description: The garlic crab is very good. Solid seafood restaurant can't really go wrong. I wouldn't say out of this world but it is extremely solid, I have never been let down.
author: Brandon B.

description: Great service, good food and good view for a nice leisurely lunch!  Red Chili Garlic Shrimp was amazing!
author: Sarah N.

description:
We went here on a Sunday afternoon of New Years weekend and we were pleased to see that the wait wasn't too bad.
We got seated pretty quickly and our waiter took our orders fast.

They give you complimentary bread & butter and the bread was so warm and yummy! We ordered a calamari appetizer and one order of fish & chips.
That doesn't seem like a lot of food but my husband and I were stuffed! The serving sizes are big enough that 2 people can share.

It is kind of pricey but the quality of the seafood & the view of harbor is totally worth it.
The service was pretty good as well.

Would definitely recommend this restaurant but would suggest coming for lunch so you can take advantage of the beautiful view from your table!
author: Vaishnovi K.

description: Food was amazing!! From start to finish one of the best customer service i had gotten in a while, server was awesome i forgot the name but he did mention he use to live in colorado asian guy amazing service, restaurant is clean as well is the restrooms are super clean.. inwill definitely recommend.
author: Luis G.

description: Great Food! Calamari was to die for! It was a nice place to sit and watch the ships and boat come and go from the Bay. I will be coming back for more on my next visit!!
author: Stephen K.

description: Great food, great scenery! Make a reservation for the weekends. I ordered the Seafood platter for 2 that I shared with another gal. We could hardly finish it! The crab, mussels, clams and shrimp were drizzled in delicious lemony garlic butter that was absolutely perfect. Fresh sourdough bread to binge on while you wait as well. I love this place!
author: Karla W.

description:
i came here last friday with some friends. they wouldn't seat me because my party wasn't complete yet. but once all my friends arrived, they quickly seated us, so it was nice that we didn't have to wait for a table to be available. we were seated by the window with a stunning view of the sunset! :) we had two servers helping us that night. we ordered the fried calamari, garlic cheesy bread, and 1/2 dozen of oysters as appetizers. i'm not too much of a seafood person (yes, i know i'm "missing out" and i don't know how to eat good food haha) so i only ate the calamari and garlic bread and not the oysters. the calamari and the garlic bread were delicious, especially the bread! definitely worth ordering i ordered the fried combo, which consisted of shrimp, calamari, fish and chips. my friends really like seafood and i'm just okay with it. i was debating on whether or not to eat something non-seafood, but it wouldn't make sense to go to a seafood restaurant and not eat seafood.. haha. i really liked the fried combo! the portion size is huge and very filling. our servers brought out our complimentary bread kind of late and i was at the point where i was getting full. i couldn't finish my fried combo, but i ate the majority of it. when our bill came, our servers gave us each a biscoff cookie. my friend really likes them so she asked our servers if they could give us more and they ended up giving us two handfuls of biscoffs! LOL so we made sure to tip our servers even more. :)

notes: make sure your party is complete or they won't seat you! it's normally really packed around dinner time on the weekends (but surprisingly it wasn't for us on a friday night). your server will give you more biscoff cookies if you ask them to. it's definitely a nice restaurant to bring your date here, especially when the sun is about to set. though the noise level might be a bit too loud for you guys to hear each other talk.
author: Sylvia H.

description:
Niloufar was our server and made our first visit to Fog Harbor Fish House a most delightful dining experience! She was an absolute joy! Of course, the seafood was outstanding, as was the view. When we next return to San Francisco,
a stop at Fog Harbor Fish House will top our list of things we must do!
author: Dan R.

description: I went here with low expectations given it is right in Pier 39.  But wow, what an awesome meal.  By far the best whole Dungeness crab I have ever had.  I had the garlic preparation and can't wait t have it again.
author: Carrie E.

description: Service was horrible. First of all, the hostess who took us to our seats didn't smile, talk, or make eye contact with us. The greeting hostess pointed at the girl and said follow her. We followed her, she put the menu down on the table, turned around towards us, put the menus on the table but looked away, then left. The waiter said hello, asked us what we wanted to drink, went to get it, brought it to us then left without saying another word. He came back about 5-10 minutes later, asked if we were ready to order. We weren't so he left. Didn't bother to check on us or ask if we had any questions. Mind you, all th before use other waiters and waitresses all greeted their customers, talked up the menu items and asked if they had any questions. We finally ordered about 15 minutes later. He then brought us bread. Someone else brought our food. He kept checking on his other customers but not us. Customers who came in after also got served before us. Food was good but service sucked big time. Hence, the 2 star.
author: michelle p.

description: Great tourist place to eat. The clam chowder is amazing! I got the salmon dish and it exceeded my expectations! Staff is friendly! If you are looking for a place to eat at on pier 39 I would recommend this place.
author: amy s.

description: Awesome food and atmosphere!!  Thanks Nev for a great time and excellent service. We will be back.
author: Stacy M.

description:
I got the clam chowder bowl and crab cakes, which were both fresh and perfectly filling. Delish. My friend got the crab, mango, & avocado ceviche which was also super tasty.

If you check in, they give you blue cheese breadsticks. Unfortunately, they came to the table last and although they were pretty good, they were a touch too oily and at that point we were already too full to eat them.

Overall: nice ambiance, good service, decent price. Was happy with the experience, but wouldn't make it a priority to come back again.
author: Laura S.

description: The food is absolutely amazing and the view is beautiful. Ask for Tyler as your server- very friendly and he had great recommendations for wine and the food. I brought some friends who were visiting from France and we will definitely be coming back!
author: Victoria S.

description:
We were in the area and wanted a good seafood meal since we were at the wharf. This place was rated high but we still did not have high expectations... However we were quickly surprised!! The atmosphere is wonderful and the food was delicious!
The clam chowder is a must try too!  
The portions were pretty good sized!
We split a meal and then shared a appetizer and cup of chowder and had left overs!!
Will come back next time in area!
author: Erin L.

description: Bff and I got very greedy coming here. We were one of the few patrons, as it was 11am on a Thursday morning. I started off with a refreshing blueberry press and we shared a daily special ceviche. Not the best ceviche, but it was decent. Then to add on top of that, I ordered the steamed clams and my friend went with the cioppino. Thank goodness for the "appetizer" size of my clams. Still waaaay too much food, but so delicious. Service was excellent. Prices are on the higher end, so expect to shell out some moola. And don't forget to get your parking validated.
author: Veronica C.

description: We stumbled in and had a.wonderful experience with excellent service.  Samir took excellent care of the eight of us.
author: Andy T.

description:
Dinner was FANTASTIC!  

I live in SF, but my bff was visiting, so we wanted to go somewhere fancy.  We split: the crab risotto fritters as an appetizer, the swordfish as an entree, and the apple crumble for dessert.  Literally all of it was delicious, particularly the fritters.  That and the swordfish was as light and fantastically cooked as I have ever seen it.

Our waitress Brenda was also lovely about splitting our portions.  She even had the kitchen put our entree on two separate plates.  We came in ~5:30 on a Saturday and didn't need to wait for a table of two and everything came out of the kitchen very promptly.
author: Jessica S.

description: Great place.  Sat by the window with the ocan view.   Beautiful.   Wait staff was phenomenal.   Highly recommended this place
author: Donna W.

description: Only one star for the food, absolutely terrible service! Sat for 45 minutes without anyone checking on us. I don't recommend.
author: Lindsay H.

description: My experience at the Fog fish market was perfect. The food was amazing and the atmosphere is spot on. The only reason I am giving it four stars is because immediately after I sat down, I sat on a butter knife witch was not that pleasant but I'm ok. All in all, it was a clean, kid friendly restaurant. I defiantly recommend it.
author: Sammie B.

description: 20 min and I'm still waiting for a glass of water. Soup was okay, nothing to send a note home about. The mixed was non offense. I'm sorry, but I've had better at McDonald's. I have to say that I've written this review over the course of an hour and still no drink refill or an option to cash out and move on. The worst customer service ever and only okay food. I'd skip this place if I was you
author: Jennifer M.

description: Returned late from the Alcatraz night tour. They were one of the few places still open and provided excellent service from the hostess to the waiter Tyler, who reminded us of Jack Black. The food was awesome and the view was also. Highly recommended!
author: liz a.

description: Good view, great clam chowder and the service was excellent. There was a line to be seated but it went pretty quick. I recommend.
author: Tony T.

description:
Hard to believe such a great restaurant in a touristy location. We came on a Monday around Christmas and the wait at lunch was 45 minutes!

The clam chowder was very good - lots of clams, not too many potatoes, nice bacon flavor.

The kids had the salmon - though small the filet was fresh and cooked correctly (i.e. not over-cooked). I had the crab roll - the restaurant didn't bother with a lot of fillers and they didn't skimp on the (dungeness) crab meat either. The wife ordered the crab salad - also very good: fresh ingredients, lots of crab, not too much dressing.

Service was efficient and friendly. We sat at a table with a fantastic view of Alcatraz.

Can't wait to come back to try some of their other dishes (cioppino, for example).
author: Patrick W.

description:
Great restaurant - will be back!

Well priced, great tasting dishes and best of all, they are serving sustainable seafood- and promoting it!

Must try the clam chowder and their garlic shrimp in home made sauce! 

Fresh, warm bread is served with the meal which is  great touch! 

We also finished the meal off with the apple crisp- which is like a cobbler!

Great views of Alcatraz also- ask for a table by the window but away from the door, if dining later in the day/night!
author: Tamara S.

description: So pleased with this restaurant. I had the crab sandwich. It was good but the clam chowder is a standout. It was buttery & a pleasant taste of pepper. There was a fresh flower arrangement on the table in front of the fireplace in the waiting area just outside the restaurant. Nice views of fisherman's wharf & the bay beyond. Prices are very reasonable.
author: Cherie F.

description:
Definitely the best clam chowder I've ever had! 

It's a great restaurant smack in the middle of the wharf. Great views, prices are reasonable and the service was fast and friendly.
author: John M.

description: Exceptional service by our server Meron. We are visiting from Hawai'i and Meron, you were absolutely fabulous! The food, wine and port selection was delicious! Love it!
author: Mapu D.

description: While the dinner was sublime, it wouldn't have been so without our wonderful server, Shawn.  He made our 43rd wedding anniversary very special indeed!
author: Kim C.

description: Their food is alright, but it's not good for big parties since they will not let you sit until everyone shows up. The service is very bad. Do not recommend it.
author: Joshua L.

description: I just went here last night. The service was great. The food was delicious. The view was even better. I ordered lobster with mash potatoes and veggies. So good $39. My boyfriend ordered a crab sandwich -and fries 19$. He said it was okay. The waiter made sure we were attended to and had all our needs through out the dinner. I would recommend this place to anyone asking. Perfect for dates.
author: Jennifer S.

description: Samir was the best!!! Food was amazing. Everytime I come to the Bay Area I enjoy my time at Fog Harbor.
author: Rhonda O.

description: Best oysters I have ever had! Never really thought it meant anything... That most oysters taste the same... But holly*!^$... These are the best oyster of my life!!! Great service, cocktails, and most of all... OYSTERS! Lol
author: Krys L.

description: Tyler was very helpful in serving us! Great food great atmosphere! The views are beautiful!
author: Tracy S.

description:
My family took me here for Father's Day and I had a great experience.  

Delicious food, great view, awesome servers.  It was Father's Day and really busy but we had made reservations and was promptly seated at a table nest to the window.

Ordered the Tuna Poke and fried scallops.  They were delicious.  My sons asked me to get a second order of the Poke.

I ordered the Seared Ahi Tuna and it was done perfectly.  My son ordered the Salmon BLT and cleaned his plate.
author: R P.

description: From the second we walked in our server Meron was extremely professional, she was attentive and engaging with everyone at the table. Meron was knowledgeable about the menu and made great recommendation. She was considerate about food allergies at our table. The food was delicious. We had the salmon, chicken, fish and chips and many other items (we were a large party). We would definitely eat at this restaurant again when we come back to San Francisco. One more thing the view was amazing!
author: Angie F.

description: When visiting San Francisco, dinner at Fog Harbor is a must. You cannot beat the views of the Bay and the atmosphere. My fiancee and I arrived early (we had a reservation) and were promptly seated. Fresh sourdough bread was brought out with spreadable butter, this is already wonderful in my book considering I was served cold, hard butter the night before at another established. My fiancee ordered a drink, something named "Alcatraz" and I had a sip, it was very good too. The waiter was awesome, he was friendly and accommodating. I had the clam chowder in a bread bowl with a caesar salad, you need this combo in your life. At $14, it is a steal. I thought the clam chowder was delicious, mine was heavy on the clam and served piping hot. The caesar salad was super fresh and yummy. My fiancee was also able to create his perfect meal there, he got salmon and subbed out his vegetables for rice and mashed potatoes. We left here very happy, and I have nothing negative to say whatsoever.
author: Caroleigh N.

description: We at pier 39 and decided to have clam chowder since it was a chilly day in SF. This place is always good. My clam chowder was a little cold but the manger fixed the problem in 2 minutes and I was able to enjoy my chowder. It's a nice restaurant with great views try to get a table by the windows. I also had crab cocktail which was delicious. My friend ordered the seafood ciopino and had them make it spicy, that was bomb I would recommend it that way if you like spicy. Enjoy
author: Jessica V.

description: A restaurant within the fisherman's wharf located upstair but easy to find.  It has an excellent view of the harbor. Expect long wait (45-60 min) during rush hours. I would rate the price as $$$. A family of four can easily go upwards $100 plus. I would rate the food 3 to 4 star.  The linguine and clam pasta portion is on the smaller side.  The flavor is more on the mild side.  My wife actually makes a better seafood pasta. The crab and avocado salad I think you get a decent portion but at $27 I think you get the value. The drink was excellent especially strawberry nojitos. The service I would rate 4-5 star.  The complimentary bread is nice and you can fill on that if you do not mind the all the carbs. They are famous for the clam chowder which is very good. Love the bread bowl. Given that u get table bread, I probably order just the soup and use the table bread to dip.  It will save u about $4.  Over all a nice place to go. A little more pricey but u are in fisherman's wharf.
author: david c.

description:
We were visiting pier 39 and quickly yelped for a good seafood place. The girlfriend wanted to try the crab shack, but I liked the vibe of this one. I'm glad we went here: the view was incredible, and the food was generally fantastic! 

We went with
 the "famous" clam chowder (in a bowl) - good but I don't see what the fuss is about

The seafood cioppino - this knocked the ball out the park, the fresh tomato sauce based broth, mussels, shrimp, scallops were all made just perfectly. You can't go wrong with this one. 

Lemon fried calamari - Tip, if you have a city pass or one of those flyers at the sf visitor center, be sure to exchange for a welcoming booklet at pier 39, you get the calamari free with two entrees.  This was better than we expected, with the calamari fried to just the right amount of crispness and the lemon sauce providing a bit of zest. 

A dozen oysters - the girlfriend was aching for oysters, I was lucky enough to sample a few and they were just fantastic. 

If you're visiting pier 39, this place is a must.
author: Wally C.

description:
Came here to meet up with a couple friends, because the boyfriend really wanted seafood. Naturally, we ordered a spread of different seafood dishes including crab ceviche, clam chowder, a seafood platter and the cioppino. 

Clam chowder was decent, nothing special and definitely can find better in San Francisco. The seafood platter was also standard, and came with a ton of different shellfish, enough for all of us. I was most excited for and most disappointed by the cioppino; it was literally boiled array of seafood swimming in tomato sauce and immensely lacked depth of flavor. 

On the other hand, the restaurant had a great view and good service, but definitely more of a touristy place. Don't know why I expected anything more from Fisherman's Wharf.
author: Stacey L.

description:
We had reservations and arrived in time.  The hostess was ready to seat us but couldn't until another hostess came to the front so they would have someone there to greet customers. We waited almost five minutes for this other hostess to return so we could be seated. They had a beautiful table reserved for us with a fantastic view!  So I guess it was worth the wait. 

My husband had the shellfish plate with crab, mussels, clam and shrimp.  He loved every minute of it and was a buttery mess by the end.  I had the crab cakes which were equally yummy!  It was served with a side of coleslaw that was just meh.  Our waiter was a very friendly, young blond guy who did a terrific job checking in with us without being overbearing.
author: Marilyn M.

description: The bread bowls are my favorite in San Fran, and though the chowder isn't, it is still excellent. I've always had good service here, and the crab is always fresh and cooked properly (the garlic roasted version is very tasty). I would consider it kid friendly since the staff is very good, though it is more "fancy" than a lot of the alternatives on the pier.
author: Heidi D.

description:
Came here last week for dinner while entertaining an out of town visitor. Venue is nice - big and touristy. We started with the crab and risotto fritters. These were slightly disappointing, was hoping for crispy hot fritters and received this lukewarm, kind of soggy conglomeration of crab and risotto. Also got a moscow mule and bowl of cioppino - the moscow mule was standard (a little weak), and this was my first venture into ordering cioppino, after tasting others' at different restaurants and really liking it. This one was very solid in quantity of seafood, with lots of crab, scallops, shrimp, clams and mussels, which made it a delight to eat. However, I think the seafood might have been cooking a little too long, because the scallops were near disintegrating and the crab tasted straight up like the broth. So, the seafood was fresh and plentiful, but the seafood all tasted the same, as if it had been boiling in the broth together for a long time. Shrimp and mussels were the highlight, they seemed to be have cooked properly and still had some firmness. The broth was simple and tasted like tomato soup, though some salt and pepper brought out the flavors well. Also, wanted more than a small sliver of garlic bread! Waitstaff was friendly.

Overall, very much enjoyed the meal, but there were a few things that stood out as pieces that could easily be improved upon.
author: Sarah B.

description: Great location and view of the harbor. Delicious craft cocktail, I had the hibiscus margarita. If you get there with the seasonal menu for spring, try the crab stuffed half lobster; as rich and decadent ad it sounds, and simply excellent.
author: Daniel B.

description:
Great food, great atmosphere.  I had the mixed grill seafood plate and my husband had the fish and chips.  Both were delicious.      We got free blue cheese garlic bread when we checked in thru YELP.  The garlic mashed potatoes were good too.

The service was a little disorganized - food that wasn't ours was brought to our table, I got rice instead of the mashed potatoes I ordered, and we were asked twice if we wanted dessert instead of bringing us the bill which we asked for.

But all in all, a great experience.
author: Anu S.

description:
Took my dad and the whole family here for his birthday and everyone left satisfied :) If you can't find street parking, park at the garage at Pier 39. If you come after 6pm, with validation it's 2 hours free! 

We yelped a few places before finally deciding to eat here. The clam chowder is a MUST try! It's soooo good, we had to order 3 bowls. The only downside is the place is always packed so we had to flag down our waiter a few times, but she was very nice! I will definitely come back again!
author: Jel A.

description: Extensive menu with delicious options to try. Parking is convenient as there is a Pier 39 garage in which the ticket can be validated. We made reservations online and enjoyed a bunch of delicious entrees. A couple of my favorites were the baked oysters, crab cakes, ciopinno (large portion), and the crab roll. They also provided us with a free dessert due to my mom's birthday, which was their most popular, the ghirardeli fudge cake served with a scoop of vanilla ice cream. It was very tender, warm, and soft like souffle. Highly enjoyable meal. Entrees range from $20-$30. Appetizers average $10-$15. Also, the restaurant provided great views of the pier and the bathrooms were clean. Overall, a solid place to eat if you are looking for a seafood meal.
author: Patty O.

description: It was extremely good steak was cooked just how I like it and lobster was so delicious also.
author: Reymundo P.

description: First place we went to eat since arriving in SF and the food was delicious. We had Tyler as our server and he did such a good job. Highly recommend!!
author: Carly S.

description: This restaurant hit the spot. It was right in the middle of fisherman a wharf and it was a definitely a good place to eat with a good view. Tyler, our server, did an awesome job and was very attentive. Hit this place up!
author: Mike O.

description: Stop #3 of our romantic endeavor...clam chowder in bread bowls, crisp salads, and beers with a nice view of the Golden Gate Bridge, Alcatraz, and basking/barking sea lions.  Oh, and our server, AJ, was great.
author: L W.

description: On a recent trip to San Francisco, my wife and I spent three lovely days eating some terrific seafood (nothing TOO alien to our tastes, though), and Fog Harbor was definitely one of our favorites.  It's in Pier 39 at Fisherman's Wharf on the upstairs level of the shopping area.  It was extremely busy (which is usually a good sign), but thankfully we didn't have to wait that long.  The service was probably about average (hard to tell given the fact that it was probably too busy for our wait staff to handle), and the prices were probably a bit more than the average family would like to pay; however, if you're looking for a great atmosphere and above average food (the Clam Chowder is VERY good), then you can't go wrong.
author: E. Z.

description:
I you like prawns that have not been cleaned this is the place for you.  We used to like going here, but my husband ordered the prawn cocktail.  The shrimp still had the veins in them.  He sent the cocktail back and the new shrimp still had the veins in them.
This is total non-starter.  
Service was good and our waiter was pleasant.  He should have taken the shrimp off the bill.  We will not go back.
author: nina l.

description:
Food just okay.  Quite expensive for a small crab.  They also cleaned all the tamale out of most of their crabs.  Not good if you like the tamale like I do.  Same price as PPQ and was only half as good.

Also had a crab melt that had too much mayo and a little too runny.  Popcorn rock shrimp was the best.  Perfect seasoning and had a good kick of spiciness.  Clam chowder too thick.  Jumbo shrimp cocktail, no so jumbo.  Ahi tuna with wild rice was well portioned.  SF sourdough bread awesome.

Server was funny and happy even on a super busy night.  But he didn't check on us often.

Hey its pier 39, tourist central.  What can I expect?
author: Kevin L.

description:
Amazing! I do not know where to begin! 

Calamari might have been the best i have ever had. Helpful waitress, when she was available, but i was pleased with the speed of the food coming out that i didnt mind. 

Crab Alfredo and the Surf and Turf were amazing. I will be coming back to try their clam chowder and crab!
author: Allison M.

description: They got the best clam chowder! Cioppino is really good too! The view is fantastic even on a rainy day!
author: Cathy L.

description: My dad was visiting from Florida having never been to California before in his life.  While I'm well aware that everything over at Pier 39/Fisherman's Wharf is a tourist trap, he was determined to eat there so I chose the Fog Harbor fish house.  To my surprise we actually had a really fantastic time.  I ordered calamari, he got the shrimp, and we sat at a really lavish table right by the window so he could see the whole bay.  The food was really good (although the portions could be larger given the price), and the drinks were even better.  Our waitress was very attentive, and he had the best time which is all I cared about.  We went on a Monday for lunch so the place wasn't that busy, so we might have had a different experience on say the weekend, but for the time we went, it was a great meal.
author: Kristen T.

description: My wife and I came in for lunch on Monday. We live in the city and don't often come to the pier but some friends told us to try Fog Harbor Fish House. To our surprise it was excellent. Our server Jason was amazing. He was prompt and gave us great recommendations. The food was excellent and the view was incredible. We will definitely come back to try out more things. Thank you Jason and Fog Harbor Fish House.
author: Steve G.

description: Ordered a whole crab. Pricey at $38 but it was pretty good with the butter. The bread was delicious. From where we sat we could see alcatraz,  part of the bridge and the sea lions on the docks.
author: Julie A.

description: Great service, very good food, reasonable prices. Came for fresh steamed crab--best price in SF, and it was great. We would return, and have already recommended to a friend.
author: Jim H.

description: Was helped by Amy R, really good waitress. Chowder is good, clamp is fresh, the big window gives you a good view to the bay. Nice place
author: Bojun L.

description: As promised we were back, this time with relatives who were visiting from out of town. Once again everything we ordered was delish! Service was just as fast as last time and our waiter was attentive and accommodating. No complaints!
author: Bella S.

description: Strongly recommend clam chowder with sourdough bread bowl and shellfish plater! This is very famous restaurant in San Francisco and located in Pier 39 with very beautiful sea view. You cannot say you have visited San Francisco without trying clam chowder with sourdough bread bowl lolllllllll
author: 雪琪

description:
When you're hungry and just want to sit down somewhere, you'll end up at a place like this. Very touristy. You're paying for the view, the service, and a decently cleaned bathroom. 

My date and I were seated at a table with the view of Alcatraz with a very friendly (and cute!) waiter. I wasn't extremely hungry, just tired and wanted a clean bathroom (which can be hard to find in the tourist zone), so Fog Harbor Fish House isn't a bad place to be at. 

I ordered the soup and salad combo for $14. Definitely not worth it, considering how I get the same stuff as I would at Boudin. Salad is better than Boudin's though, slightly larger portion and with fresher ingredients. I've experienced wilting lettuce at Boudin before. The clam chowder wasn't spectacular. That's probably because no clam chowder in the Bay Area can top the best chowder I've had at Seattle's Pike Place Market. The one here was very generic. I do love my breadbowl though. Yes, that was the deal with this combo, your breadbowl is at no extra cost. If you order a regular bowl of soup and a house salad, it'll just be $14 as well. 

My date had this burger with fries, nothing too amazing. I didn't like their fries just because it was too bland. My date loved it though, he doesn't like his fries too salted. So that's just personal preference. 

TMI material, skip this paragraph if you need to. I wasn't sure if it's because I had coffee in the morning, or their food wasn't prepared well, I had a major stomach ache shortly after the meal. Another good reason to have a clean bathroom. 

Instead of giving you a dessert menu near the end, your waiter will carry a huge tray of desserts to tease you. They are at portions to share. All looking very rich, but I'm not sure how long they've been sitting out. Nonetheless, good tactic.
author: Connie C.

description: If you're looking for great seafood, atmosphere and service (with a view!) - this place should be on the top of your list. We visited here during a weekend in San Fran and went (and researched) many restaurants and could not have been happier with our choice in Fog Harbor for our romantic dinner. The food was so fresh and well prepared. Great drink/wine list. Taking into consideration all elements (service, view, atmosphere, food/drink quality and preparation) this place is extremely well priced. Most other places in this restaurant "class" around this area are cheesy, overpriced and underwhelming. Choose Fog Harbor!
author: Kyle M.

description:
I stumbled upon this restaurant after searching high and low to find a place that serves a whole lobster. Came here on Friday night to celebrate a special person birthday whom requested lobster for his birthday meal so I was determined to find a place that served a whole lobster. This place definitely did not this disappoint as the birthday celebrant was able to order surf and turf. He was certainly a happy camper which made me happy because I wanted everything to be perfect. 

The service was exceptional as our server was constantly checking up on us and even went as far as to make our dessert special by adding a candle so the birthday celebrant could blow out a candle and make a wish. It  was simple yet just perfect because the birthday celebrant prefer to have a low key celebration. ( I was taken by the gesture of our server and wished I gotten his name so I could give him the shout out that he deserved.)

Lastly, everything was amazing that night and thank you for following my request of having a nice view of the water. We had a blast!!!
author: Julie C.

description: We have had some very good dinners at Fog Harbor over the last few years.  Great seafood and service.  Our favorite server is Michael Kelly.  He has always given good suggestions and made us feel very comfortable - plus he is funny.  I am looking forward to our next dinner there!
author: Rob K.

description:
I took the family here for dinner. If you come here I recommend using your AAA card or downloading the Pier 39 coupon on line to redeem for the free booklet of savings at the welcome center at Pier 39.  This alone saved us over $50 on our dinner and parking.

OK, we started out with appetizers of the Bleu Cheese garlic bread and fried Calamari. The coupon book had the bread for free so we tried it. If you love garlic bread and bleu cheese, this is for you! It was over the top good!!  The calamari was nothing special, but beware as they also add fried onion pieces and jalapeno peppers....  weird,, the calamari was a little soggy  and the sauce was OK.

We all had a cup of their clam chowder.  It was good, had lots of big pieces of clams, thick and good flavor.

My wife had the salmon club salad. The piece of salmon was decent and grilled well, but the rest of the salad was pretty bland with mostly green leafs and little else in the salad.  A club anything should have more of everything,, the dressing was bland.

My daughter had the lobster tail. It was very good, large and meaty. She enjoyed it.

My son and I had the mixed fish grill, which consisted of a piece of salmon, swordfish and 3 shrimp.  They were grilled well and had decent flavor. It came with garlic mashed potatoes and vegetables.  Overall, it was OK.

This place does get crowded for dinner, so get there early. The wait for us at 615pm was 30 minutes, not too bad.  Overall, this place is a decent fish house, a little pricey, but the views are worth it.
author: Tim B.

description: Awesome restaurant with amazing food! We had an amazing waiter named Tyler who took great care of us and gave us perfect suggestions! We were a group of six and everything we ordered was to die for.
author: Hani I.

description: Stopped by for appetizers and sweets.  I was so surprised by how delicious the Creme brûlée and calamari were.  The fresh squeezed lemonade and mocha were delicious!
author: Liz B.

description: I typically don't eat along Pier 39 and Fisherman's Wharf as it gets to be too touristy and crowded. The food isn't always the best here, but there are a few exceptions. Fog Harbor is one of them. The view from the window seat is great and romantic in the evening. I ordered the shellfish platter to share and it was pretty big with lots of crab, mussels, clams, shrimp, etc. The price actually wasn't too bad given that the location has tourists galore. Would come back some time if the occasion calls for it.
author: Becky C.

description:
I had some friends visiting and they wanted two things: a restaurant near the water and seafood. I ended up picking this place, I was a little worried it was going to be ultra touristy, since it's at Pier 39. I was pleasantly surprised the restaurant is really nice! And definitely not overly gimmicky or anything.           

The food: I did the classic, clam chowder bread bowl, it was good! And I ordered a side of fries, which wasn't on the menu, but they were accommodating. One friend got a side of oysters and the clam chowder bread bowl, they enjoyed it. And one got the crab roll, also good. And another got the crab cakes, and had this mixed cider drink that was really good. All in all everyone enjoyed their meal!
author: Ashley G.

description: Clam chowder bread bowl with real crab pieces was amazing! Had the best service from Tyler!
author: M F.

description: Such an amazing view with incredible food. The seafood here was great! Tyler our server was the best!
author: Nikki F.

description: Great seafood restaurant! The calamari was excellent. Perfectly seasoned! Had the cod with veggies and rice....delicious! Didn't have a reservation but didn't have to wait long for a table. Beautiful view of the bay! Great end to a great day in San Fran!
author: Lyndsay M.

description: Awesome view, awesome service, awesome food, what's not to love?  Oysters - both fresh and baked, were great, as well as the blue cheese garlic bread.
author: Sara D.

description: My husband and I came to here for lunch on a day trip to San Francisco. The food was awesome. We had baked oysters for an appetizer.  I could have made a whole meal out of them because they were so good. However, I wasn't disappointed with my main meal of a crab roll sandwich. I'm not sure what kind of bread they used, but it was one of the best crab sandwiches I've had. We also got great service with Tyler. He provided good recommendations and was very friendly. He checked on us to make sure we didn't need anything. Will definitely go back!
author: Debbie W.

description: Of all the seafood restaurants aboard Pier 39 I decided to dine at the Fog Harbor Fish House.  This place had a great menu with some amazing dishes. The red curry mussels were a great appetizer to the swordfish dish which was very delicious; the fish was cooked perfectly and the roasted potatoes, squash, capers, and sautéed pesto sauce was a great addition to the dish and on a personal note the portions were generous.  Along with the meal came great service from the host Travis and waitress Catherine.  Catherine was very fond of the entire menu and was very welcoming, courteous and patient.  She offered some great service for us.  This is definitely a restaurant I will recommend to anyone heading out to SF looking for a great meal, not to mention an awesome view.  Thank You!
author: AJ N.

description:
The food was amazing, I had the crab linguine alfredo. 

I also had the Syrah and the wine was equally as good. 

It sits right on the water in Fisherman Wharf so there were great waterviews. 

Overall, I really enjoyed the food, service, and atmosphere of Fog Harbor and will definitely go back the next time I am in the San Francisco area.
author: Courtnie C.

description: Wonderful food. I had the clam chowder with fresh crab in it and bleu cheese garlic bread. It's was a perfect lunch. The service was just ok.  You can't ask for a better view.
author: Rachel B.

description: I am in love with this place. The ambiance and overall atmosphere is fun and romantic. Food is amazing. If you come here ask for server Samir. Excellent service!
author: Michelle W.

description:
Crowded, with a view.

All along the pier, it's hard to pick out a restaurant that will actually be good for the price you pitch (it's San Francisco, you've got to make every dollar count if you want to make it a few hours). Fog House Fish Harbor was one of our first choices because there wasn't a line in front, and the lobby looked welcoming (albeit overly dressed-up like a hotel, I'm not kidding)

We were seated immediately, but the crowd that occupied the restaurant would be daunting for any staff, and I knew right away that this would take awhile. High over the waterfront on the clear day to see the whole Bay, the view from anywhere in the room was fantastic. But even I got a bit bored waiting for the waiter (I'm hilarious).

We ordered two Sourdough Chowder Bowls and their Salmon Flatbread. The former didn't stand out to me, but it's getting increasingly difficult to tell the difference between the dozens [and DOZENS] of chowder-serving locations. The Flatbread wasn't shabby, but shabby doesn't cut it for $13.00 (it's four triangles...small triangles)

Better places for better prices, but perhaps their crab and lobster put up a better meal's experience. Cheers.
author: Nicolai D.

description: Great spot on the harbor. The mussel fries are as good as it gets! All the rest of their seafood seems fresh and local and was very tasty. They also have a great view of the bay. Highly recommend trying this place.
author: Oscar P.

description: The food was very good. I don't love seafood, but I enjoyed my meal. I shared the clam chowder for an appetizer. I thought it tasted very good (wasn't too fishy tasting), and the crab was a good addition (although it did cost extra to add it). I ordered the sole as my main dish. It was a very good, mild fish. Our waiter Tyler was very attentive, and gave us great recommendations. Would recommend this place to those visiting the area!
author: Jennifer T.

description: One of the best seafood restaurants, all ingredients used in every of our selections were fresh and tasty.  We were extreme lucky to have Tyler as our server providing invaluable insight on what to order.  If you're coming to Pier 39, you must try this place and highly recommend that you ask for Tyler to serve you.
author: Liz H.

description: Tyler was the best server! He is very charismatic and friendly with the customers. He made sure that everybody's needs were met. He would periodically check in with us and asked if we needed anything. Also the food was a bonus:) The food was very good!
author: Stacey T.

description:
Solid, very touristy spot. 

Now, you're probably not reading this thinking its a "local gem", but i want to be explicit. This place is on the edge of the touristy part of SF. 

That said, the food is solid - Dungeness crab season all the way! The service is good and the place feels clean and open. There is a great view of alcatraz as well. Overpriced a bit, but not terribly.

 So, overall, its a great place for tourists!
author: Stephanie M.

description: Service is definitely off par starting from the time we waited for our table, to getting our food.  The server dropped our french fries on the table and said she was going to replace it, but she never came back. Asked for more water and it took about ten minutes before I got anything.   Asked for a bottle of ketchup and a guy brings it out only to give it to another table.   If you want to put up with this kind of crap, this place is for you.  If there was a negative star I'd give it to them.
author: Dio A.

description: Would definitely recommend this restaurant right on the harbor. Beautiful view and candle light dinner :) food was delicious and filling! Brenda was so sweet and made our experience here wonderful.
author: Linda H.

description: I was here when I came to san francisco for vacation with my bf. We love seafood. We made reservations the night before but the reservation was not booked when we got here. But since we were here when they opened at 11 there was lots of tables available. No problem. This place has a gorgeous view and the ambience is very nice. The service was okay, our server must have been having a bad day because our order came out late. We ordered the crab roll with sweet potatoes fries, dozen oysters, and the famous clam chowder. On the crab roll the bread was crispy and soft. The oysters was amazingly delicious. And the clam chowder is one of the best. The meat was not chewy in the clam chowder. It's truly perfect. Everything was fresh and delicious. I recommend here if you like seafood!
author: Jae S.

description: The stars are for Dina, who's service on our limited time was above par. Food was really good too.
author: Damon M.

description: Love the view from the restaurant, seafood was fresh. Couldnt say anything negative for Fog Harbor! Definitely coming back
author: Joshua H.
