description: Our absolute favorite Seafood restaurant at Pier 39. We try to make a visit here every time we come to San Francisco as tourists! We always order their mixed Seafood Platter (for two) with Garlic and it never disappoints!!!   Fantastic service too. 2 thumbs WAY UP!
author: Summer S.

description: Very nice place on the bay with great drink menu and food with an awsome chowder bowl
author: Nelson A.

description: Went to a conference in SF CA. Stopped by for dinner with my colleagues. The food was awesome!!! We had the clam chowder and fried Calamari for appetizer. Not a big fan of Calamari but this was this best I have every tasted. Check it out. The clam chowder was also very good. Had the fried shrimp and chips which was excellent. My waiter Jose was also the boss! Hats off to him for excellent service! Ask for him
author: O'Dene L.

description: Was a bit wary due to the location of this restaurant in a major tourist area, so was skeptical of the good reviews.  One word, CIOPPINO!  I'm a huge fan of this dish and rarely have I experienced it served well.  Ordered the lazy style (Crab with no shell) as I didn't feel like fussing with my meal after a long day of touring.  This seafood stew was a flavor bomb with an incredible tomato flavor, accompanied with a generous portion of seafood, which I may add was cooked perfectly and exceeded my expectations.  My friends ordered the surf and turf and lobster tail - wow!  Presentation on all dishes were beautiful, wish I had taken a picture.  My 4 year old had pasta with a side of shrimp, our server was more than happy to accommodate this request.  Our sever was excellent, as was the wine selection.    Surprised at the bad reviews, as the staff here really is friendly and accommodating.  Will be back next trip to SF!
author: Lisa G.

description:
Let's just say that walking all the way from the Powell Bart Station to here... was worth the sore feet.

My friend and I had our mind set on clam chowder in a bread bowl on the pier. When we saw the menu had "Award Winning Clam Chowder in a Sourdough Bread Bowl", we immediately asked for a table. 

The boyfriend and I split a Cioppino (delicious), my friend got a swordfish steak, and my boyfriend's friend got calamari. Everything was delicious but I think the clam chowder took the cake. It had big chunks of clam and the soup was the perfect consistency. I notice that a lot of other places put in too many potatoes in their chowder, but Fog Harbor doesn't overpower the chowder with too much. Bread bowl was amazing. My boyfriend is on a no simple carbs diet - but even he could not resist a freshly baked sourdough bread bowl. Crispy, just a little tart, and warm. Hrmm. 

Prices are reasonable. Food was delicious. Service was awesome. Would definitely come here again.
author: Sonia Y.

description: This place is really loud. Maybe it's because everything is close together? I could've grabbed a French fry from the guy next to our table...Crab cakes appetizer was pretty delicious. I got the clam chowder in the bread bowl for my entree and I was expecting a mind blowing experience but it lacked in flavor...maybe I expected too much because they claimed to be "the best in San Francisco." The bread was AMAZING though. Apparently they bake it hourly. It has a light crisp outer layer but the inside was fluffy and the sourdough flavor wasn't too overpowering. My husband got the pan seared chicken which was excellent. Service was also great. They were attentive but not too invasive.
author: G D.

description:
I have never had seafood as amazing as this place has to offer their mixed seafood grill was by far the most amazing assortment of grilled fish i have ever had in my life.
The service was excellent just ask for Michael and he will tend to your every need.
Fast service also never been more satisfied  
Thankyou fog harbour fish house for an excellent honeymoon dinner.
author: Candice B.

description: Empty restaurant, but could not seat one without a wait. Took party of three right away, without a reservation. I guess they do not want my business. NO STARS
author: Neil M.

description:
This restaurant has the best view of Pier 39 and Alcatraz Island.  They also validate parking for 1 hr (at the parking structure across the street)

The restaurant had an excellent ambiance. The bowl of Clam chowder was good ($10) and the Mixed seafood grill was excellent (salmon, swordfish, shrimp with broccoli and 1/2 rice and 1/2 mashed potatoes - $26)

I'll be back next time :)
author: Angie V.

description: Really delicious clam chowder!  Enjoyed my meal immensely!
author: Raj G.

description:
Views are good.  As we were seated, we saw some people eating giant Dungeness crabs.  We were intrigued and walked by again to get a look, as they looked so good.  I had to ask the people how they like them, and they shook their heads 'no'.  They were bummed.  Crabs were frozen and they paid an arm and a leg for them. 

I had some questions about some of the items on the menu, and the first 3 entrees I asked about were also frozen.  They tout themselves as having such fresh fish because they are on a fish pier!

The only person satisfied with their food in our group ordered a salad.  Stay away.
author: Amica M.

description:
Every table here has a view of the SF bay. Our waiter Bernie was personable, professional and constantly checked on us. Kudos Bernie! Next time we come back, we will ask for you.

The food was absolutely delicious. Every dish in our party was excellent. The assortment of appetizers we had: calamari, clam chowder and crab cakes were outstanding. Must save room for their desserts which were of course worth burning off the next day.
author: P. C.

description: Fantastic food. Had the Ahi Tuna with grilled vegetables and it just melted in your mouth.  Great views of the bay and our server Tyler was great. Very attentive and gave us helpful tips for the area as we just arrived in town. Will definitely come back.
author: Sharon S.

description: The CLAM CHOWDER!!!! Best I've ever had. Still dreaming about it. I ordered the calamari because it was on a lot of people's tables, but it was okay. The Swordfish was okay as well. But the oysters and clam chowder were so amazing, I will always go back there just to have it. There were other things on the menu that looked amazing too, so... Gonna keep trying new things.
author: A S.

description: Convenient place to eat if you are at the Pier. Menu has a lot of variety, so the restaurant is great for groups!
author: Tiffany N.

description: Tyler was an awesome waiter, and the food and the view were equally amazing. We are so happy that we were able to fit the Fog Harbor Fish House into our vacation.
author: Laurel K.

description: Average tourist pier restaurant.  Attentive service, ok food.  Wouldn't return, but then again, I wouldn't return to the pier either. There is not a lot of difference that I can see between this pier and Chicago's Navy Pier, either in shops or food.
author: Stephany M.

description: Got the pumpkin salmon, which was a seasonal dish. It was pretty good.
author: Alex M.

description:
Hubby and I stumbled upon this place. 
We opted for H.H and ended up sitting in the bar area. 

Our bartender/server whipped up a mojito for me despite the fact that they don't offer mojitos during H.H which is understandable- I mean who wants to muddle all of that mint during a busy H.H. 

Service was impeccable- everything was just on point. 

Food was so delishhhhh esp the a la cart Salmon sliders, I could've ate 6 no lie!! 

Crab Louis was ENORMOUS!!  We both shared it and couldn't finish it. 

The view wasn't breathtaking but still nice. 

What I really loved about this place the most was the non-touristy vibe it had and may I mention I spotted Barry Sloan from the ABC Show REVENGE sitting right across from us but I was too much of a chicken to say hi as he was with his family. 


All in all we had a great experience and can't wait to come back!
author: Meryem E.

description: Love the sourdough bread!!!!  Khaiman was a great waiter.  Garlic bleu cheese bread is fantastic!   Free if you check-in on Yelp.  My friend had the clam chowder and loved it.  I had the salmon sandwich which was really good!
author: Camisha C.

description: The food was delicious, the service was great.  My only complaint is that the children's menu's portions were way too small.  Four shrimp on a stick and a pile of broccoli is not enough food for my 4 year old, let along my 6 year old and it was a children's menu for up to 12 years old.  Other than that, it was delicious.
author: Rochelle J.

description: Had a great experience two times this week while in town for a conference. The first time was just for drinks. Very nice location and beautiful bar. The second time We went on Tyler's recommendation of chili garlic crab. It was phenomenal!  Messy but totally worth it.
author: Adam K.

description: The steamed crab is amazing and service is very attentive. I would have given 5-stars, but the corn on the cob was very sub-standard! It tasted old.
author: Tammy G.

description: Tyler treated us very well & his recommendations were spot on~the red chili crab was ridiculously messy but just as delicious!
author: Sarah K.

description: Found the restaurant at the wharf and gave it a try with friends...Food was decent enough but the service was lacking.. just asking for separate bills was a task for the waiter and the front desk impression was not positive.. With the choices available in the area and city, it was not a venue I would be rushing back to
author: David W.

description:
This place is pretty good. 

First off, free bleu cheese bread with Yelp check-in. (Win) Why is this not a more popular thing?? Totally delish. 

The whole garlic roasted crab with corn on the cob and garlic potatoes was incredible. The server tied on my bib and there I was, a respectable adult, viciously ripping open the exoskeleton of an enormous crustacean, devouring it with my fingers, making an enormous mess, drinking wine and expecting to still be taken seriously.  

Note: Whatever you do, don't order the shrimp. Unless of course you'd like to pay $22 for eight small, slightly overdone shrimp on two skewers over a bed of raw baby spinach that tastes as if it has been drenched in dirty fish juice, with a few cubes of tasteless butternut squash.
author: Emily A.

description: Probably one of the best seafood dinners I've ever had, plus an amazing view. We got the crab cake appetizer and seafood platter for two. AMAZING. My only complaint is that Yelp gave this place a $$ when it really should be $$$.
author: Daralyn B.

description:
I was there for my friend's anniversary and my mother in law's b-day.
Both time it was great service, plenty of food, and free blue cheese bread due to check in.

I will be back whenever I have visitors. :)
author: Natsu Y.

description: Sat at bar ( had no wait bar is walk up ) had an Anchor Steam beer and calm chowder bread bowl. Both were good and the service was excellent! The view is awesome! I would hit this place up again..
author: G F.

description: Clean and nice environment, but I was totally disappointed to the food there. Price is not $$ but $$$$. I am an oyster lover, but the oysters here are too small and shrank, not worth that expensive at all! Anyway, service was good.
author: Niko T.

description:
Very good service and great quality seafood. I had ordered the very famous shellfish platter and split it with my family. The food was excellent, it had a ocean of flavors. The service was excellent and the wait was kind and took a lot of time out of his job to talk with us, crack a couple of jokes, what everyone wants with a waiter. The sauces for all the dishes were exploding with flavor. My only grip with the restaurant is the kids meals were a lot less flavorful than all the other dishes, but they were still good.

Overall, this is a must go if you ever check out Pier 39. There are so many places you could check out in Pier 39 but this restaurant, when you order the right food, could be one of the best.
author: Derek W.

description: Amazing experience here on a beautiful Sunday afternoon. Waited about 15 minutes and had a couple drinks at the bar. Once we were seated we were greeted by a sweet girl who had told us it was actually her first week. We ordered a bottle of wine and the shellfish for two! The shellfish for two was more than enough for both of us. If you love delicious flavorful shrimp and buttery garlic flavored crab legs this is the dish for you. I loved the atmosphere, the food, the wine and the service was top notch! I'm so glad I came here instead of The Crab House.
author: Heather O.

description: We ordered the calamari for take out and they didn't give us any sauce! The calm chowder bread was good, but the chowder was just ordinary.
author: Jeoly M.

description:
My girlfriend recently sampled Seattle's clam chowder and when she returned she craved for more.  Aiming to please her, we went to Fog Harbor Fish House after scouring yelp reviews after review.  All the hard work paid off.

We ordered the free Blue Cheese Garlic Bread which was free with the first Yelp check in.  One clam chowder for both of us and the Mixed grill (Grilled salmon, swordfish, and shrimp w/ vegetables and a carb) to share.  The clam chowder was very good, was abundant with clams, very creamy, was a bit heavy on the salt.  Dishes made a bit too salty is a common complaint of ours.  Our dinner entry came split on separate plates, a very nice touch.  The shrimp was a bit on the salty side, the salmon was very good, and the swordfish was delectable.  A nice ending to a stroll through Fisherman's Wharf while playing tourist.

Will return for more clam chowder and will order just the grilled swordfish.
author: Calvin T.

description: The best clam chowder ever and it was reasonably priced ($10 per bread bowl). The blue cheese salad was just alright. The view was very nice. Amazing staff!
author: Amanda L.

description:
The restaurant is beautiful and has a great view! The service here is excellent! 

The food that we ordered from the happy hour menu was the wings and calamari. The wings were fresh and juicy. The sauce was not overwhelming and tasted like a sweet sesame sauce. =) The calamari was thick and crispy. Lots of flavor and cooked just right! 

I would definitely recommend this place during happy hour. I can't review for the entrees though sorry!
author: Connie C.

description:
Pretty solid dinner tonight- came with two other couples. Shared the blue cheese garlic bread to start, which was solid. Entrees for dinner were the ahi (which my friends shared and loved apart from too many sesame seeds), a Caesar salad and clam chowder in a bread bowl (another thumbs up), and the Fog Harbor burger (good except the carmelized onions were more pickled than anything else and taken off after one bite.)

The prices were reasonable, the food was fresh, and the restaurant was nice, airy, and classy while not feeling ultra touristy. Will be back to visit again for sure!
author: R M.

description:
Fog Harbor Fish House is located at Pier 39 on the second level. We came here for Dine About Town 2014 and made reservations about a week in advance to secure a spot for dinner. We had parked in the Pier 39 garage where Fog Harbor would validate 2 hours of parking when after 6pm. We came here on a Saturday night and boy, the whole restaurant was packed! There were even people waiting for seats. When you first enter Fog Harbor, you'll notice that they have a really cozy fireplace area for those who are waiting. We were seated in one of the booths near the window with a nice view of the bay. I wish we came a bit earlier when the sun was setting though.

Food-
Red Curry Steamed Mussels: The PEI mussels were steamed in garlic, onions, peppers, and a coconut curry broth. The coconut curry broth was not too flavorful. I could barely taste the curry flavor. However, these mussels were REALLY fresh. YUM. Definitely, the freshest mussels I have had compared to all the other restaurants I've been to.

Seafood Cioppino: The cioppino comes with crab, salmon, shrimp, clams, scallops, and mussels stewed in a tomato herb broth with pasta. What I thought was really cute was that Fog Harbor provides you bibs so you won't get food on yourself! A plus for me since I can be a pretty messy eater when it comes to seafood. The tomato herb broth was really flavorful. I ended up taking the complimentary bread and dipped it into the broth. So delicious. My cioppino came with 3 pieces of crab, a good amount of salmon, shrimp, clams, scallops, and mussels. All the seafood were really fresh and in good quality. There's no fishy taste to them. My seafood cioppino also comes with pasta too. Originally, they had forgotten to include it into the dish, but the manager on duty quickly apologized and provided me a bowl of the pasta. Regardless, the seafood cioppino has really BIG portions. They are not skimpy with their seafood. 

Molten Chocolate Cake: The cake was served with vanilla ice cream and whipped cream. The cake was REALLY sweet. The ice cream definitely complemented well with the chocolate cake. Unfortunately, the cake didn't have any melted chocolate in it when I cut it open in half. :( 

Our dinner lasted for almost 2 hours! That was pretty surprising but in a good way. :) At the end of the meal, they also provide you Biscoff cookies. Per our waiter, he stated that they are quite delicious when dipped in coffee or milk. The overall service was excellent. The waiter and the manager on duty really made sure that everything was going smoothly and checked up on us. I think this was a successful Dine About Town! :)
author: Philana C.

description:
I order the Cioppino (I've had better)... it wasn't to my liking....WAYYYYY TOO MUCH CELERY!!! The celery over kills the taste of the whole dish! Cmon!...However, my friend ordered the crab roll, which was delicious (one of the better ones I've had)! 

The service was great as well. 

View was very pretty as the sun sets. 

3- star because it wasn't really memorable for me, okay, maybe only the crab roll.
author: Nhi C.

description: Really nice restaurant on Pier 39 with great views of the harbor. Their "Award Winning Clam Chowder" is just that! Simply Amazing!!!! We also ordered the calamari, which was okay, my fiancé really liked it, but I would rate it a 6.5. I live in the Central Valley and I take weekend trips to San Francisco every so often and this place I will definitely return too ;)
author: Jose R.

description:
This place is not only a tourist trap, but a discriminatory establishment. What happened today was I planned on having a nice relaxing meal with a friend here that just went downhill. We arrived and were seated at 4pm. The waiter took our order within 15 minutes. No complementary sourdough bread was given until 20 minutes later after 4pm. Our food did not arrive until 4:45pm. When our food finally arrived, my friend asked the waiter and manager why there was such a long wait for our food. They looked the other way, ignored us like we did not say anything and gave us our meal which was very lackluster in portion and taste (I had burnt skewered shrimp that had pure char on one side turned upside down so I wouldn't notice it at first) and it was upsetting that they did not apologize or even acknowledge the long wait we had, the manager instead gave us a 20% off of our bill while he kept insisting that the food only took 10 to 12 minutes to cook, yet my friend and I saw other non minority people get their food first who arrived and were seated after us. 

All in all, don't go to this place expecting to be treated fairly if you aren't white. We ended up at a far better restaurant near fisherman's wharf, where our waiter there apologized for our long wait and the food there is far more worth the trip than going to this establishment.
author: B M.

description: Fog Harbor is a very classy place to dine at Pier 39. A lot of the nearby restaurants are rather touristy, but still good. Fog Harbor has amazing views of Pier 39 and the Ocean. It definitely added to the ambiance at dinner. Our waiter was great and the food was amazing, albeit a bit expensive. We went around 7pm on a weeknight and did not have to wait for a table (we did not make reservations). I had the special: a burger topped with crab. It was great and I would get it again. We also had dessert, which was amazing (flourless chocolate cake and creme brulee). Overall a great experience, great views, and would definitely go back again.
author: Allie G.

description:
I came here for my six month anniversary with my boyfriend. He told me to choose a nice place for a seafood dinner with a view of the water. I did some research and the best I could find was the Fog Harbor Fish House. 

I loved this place! The staff was very very friendly and the view of the Golden Gate Bridge was amazing! You don't have to dress up super fancy but I recommend a little more than casual dress would be nice in this place. The menu choices are broad and prices aren't going to break the bank. The drinks are great too.

We started out with an order of calamari and they don't skip out on the squid that's for sure! I couldn't stop eating it. I ordered 2 lobster tails that came with fries. My boyfriend got the sampler plate with clams, crab, and another seafood I can't remember. They were both very satisfying and delicious! We were checked on frequently by a very attentive and smiling waiter and had an overall wonderful experience.

We ordered Tiramisu at the end and oh man...I shouldn't have indulged but they bring a tray of desserts over to you so you can choose what you want. Nothing worse than seeing it in front of you! The tiramisu was sooo good. Moist, creamy, and had a perfect espresso flavor to go with our espressos. 

The fact that it's right on Pier 39 is great too so you can walk off your dinner around the pier and watch the magicians and performers right by the water.
author: Ashley M.

description: This one is much better than its rival, crab house at pier 39 in both services and food. I hope this one would finally beat the crab house and make it closed.
author: Merlin L.

description: A lovely place on the pier 39 and a gorgeous view with Alcatraz island. We have enjoyed our a parishes that arrived timely.
author: Katie M.

description:
The location of the restaurant and the views over the Bay greatly help the rating for Fog Harbor Fish House. We made reservations for two on a Friday night and were seated within minutes of arriving--make sure to request for a table with a window view as the view is breathtaking. 

As for the menus, both the food and wine lists were extensive with multiple options and lots of specials. The sourdough bread that they serve is absolutely delicious and probably one of the best breads that I have tasted. We had the Steamed Clams as our appetizer and that was definitely the best dish of the night--most likely because of the amazing chorizo butter sauce. For our main courses, we had Swordfish and the Lobster Mac 'n Cheese. Although both were good, they were not anything special which was very disappointing (especially considering the price).

In the end, I would recommend this restaurant simply for its location and views but I don't think I would go back again for the food other than appetizers.
author: KC G.

description: Great food! Great atmosphere! Had the mixed grill and it was amazing. Service from our server wasn't all there but overall I would recommend this place.
author: Niema E.

description: First time coming to the pier since moving to the Bay Area so we just picked a place. The chef was awesome enough to make us a delicious crab dip bread bowl even though they don't offer it. Our food and service was great! We were in a hurry to catch the ferry and the waiter made sure everything came out fast. Definitely will be coming again.
author: Mike C.

description: The rain beats against the window but doesn't obscure our perfect harbor view of Alcatraz Island. The calamari appetizer was plentiful and delicious, as was everything else. Note: even the broccoli was cooked just right! We shouldn't have stuffed ourselves with dessert, but the sampler duo was too good to resist. At least we shared! A great place and lovely service from Bianca. Thanks.
author: Katz K.

description: Clam chowder was delicious!! I also got the muscle fries. Muscles were plump and juicy, really good. The sauce was a little too sweet. Can't beat the view. This is a nice option in the sea of not-so-nice tourist restaurants in the area.
author: Didi R.

description: Just ate here with my friends  for the first time over the weekend. Each  one of us ordered different item so we can try it. We had the linguine with clams, penne with seafood, mixed grill salmon, ahi tuna with avocado and mango. Also, we tried their desserts (creme brûlée, tiramisu, and chocolate cake). They were all delicious. Plus, we had an amazing view of the bay and the blue Angels. Will definitely come back.
author: Nacine B.

description:
Fog Harbor Fish House made for an excellent early dinner. My wife and I each had the sourdough clam chowder bowl. I usually can't stand the stuff but this time out was delicious, with lots of tender clams.
In addition, how many fish houses do any of you know of who serve delicious cocktails? I had a ginger negroni that was well balanced with appropriate use of bitters as well as sugar.
The stand out feature of our visit though was the service. Our waitress Arion was awesome. She pulls off the fine art of being close by if you need anything but not so much as to ruin your meal by being overly intrusive.
This place is highly recommended.
author: Micah D.

description: Came into Fog Harbor after walking out of the Crab House cause we sat for 15 minutes and still no waiter in sight.  So glad we did!  The service and food were excellent!  My son loved the kids Mac n Cheese.  It was homemade and extremely cheesy.  My husband and my 12 yr old son shared the crab and couldn't finish the whole thing, it was so big.  I had the fillet minion which was tender and delicious.  I can't imagine anything not being good in this place.  The prices were good for the location and quality of food.  At $33 the fillet was cheaper than other nearby restaurants.
author: Tracy A.

description: Great atmosphere and a real nice place. Got the sea scallops, so good, and nice n' spicy. Not a big selection of beers, but a great selection of wine.
author: Kevin C.

description: We had the best lunch. The crab salad was full of flavor and no skimping on the crab. Lol.  The chicken sandwich was awesome. Not a bad price either!
author: Kandy F.

description: My first time at this place was so pleasant. The ambiance is casual, yet classy at the same time. Our waiter was very tentative as well! I don't remember his name, but he was very efficient in checking in with us & cleaning up after we finished each dish. At first it was kind of weird because he kept coming by but after I while I started to realize that he's on top of his sh**! The food was delicious as well. Will definitely be coming back :)
author: Ashley H.

description: I can only speak from the one experience I had there, but it was great. The windows overlook Pier 39 and you can see Alcatraz Island as well. The waiting area outside was cute, and the waiters were friendly. I ordered crab cakes, and they were wonderful. My husband got seafood pasta and he loved his. I'm not an expert on seafood, but I enjoyed it and that's all I can really say!
author: Holly C.

description:
My wife and I were impressed with the prior reviews so we gave it a try. We were also pleased with prompt attentive service and a very fresh lunch. She had the crab avocado Caesar salad and I had the crab roll. Both were very good lunch sized portions. We had the ginger lemonade as well. 

The total bill was $55 (after we added tip) which was a little pricey for lunch but we enjoyed the view and in a touristy area we sort of expected it. 

Definitely recommended.
author: Gerald H.

description:
Best meal I've had in years. Seafood cioppino was amazing. The spicy tomato stew complimented the fresh scallops, shrimp, fish, mussels, and clams perfectly. Bread was great. Ordered a half Dungeness crab with red chili and garlic. Crab meat
Melted in my mouth, fantastic . Bloody Mary's we're outstanding. Our server accidentally spilt some water on my friend and the manager gave us all free desserts. Chocolate banana bread pudding was out of this world. Great management and great food. Highly recommend this place.  

Ps- check in on yelp for free blue cheese garlic bread !
author: Matthew H.

description:
Made resv for 6pm on a tues. Arrived around 530pm so we could sit at the bar first and have a couple happy hour drinks. There was a heat wave in sf, and this place was insanely sweaty hot. As I sat at the bar sucking down a cold drink, I looked around at the people sitting at the window seats, where I was going to be sitting soon, to see them all using their napkins to wipe the sweat off their forehead. Nightmare status. NO AC! 
This was a dinner for my birthday, and I was hoping to not have to rush through it just to get outside for some fresh air. 
Bartender was super nice, don't remember his name, but when we told him we were gonna go get seated so we wanted to pay for the tab, he offered to make us another round of drinks and bring to our table at the happy hour price (which was about $5 cheaper). Awesome. 
Told the hostess I would rather die than sit at one of those window seats where the other customers were stewing in their own sweat. So she sat us in this room off to the side of the main dining room, right next to a window that just wasn't in the sun and the window was propped open a bit. Perfect spot!!!!! So thank you so much for being accommodating!

Now for the food!
Started with the calamari, lightly battered/fried rings, a nice lemon aoli type dip (very light). 
Chili shrimp - woah. SOO good! Spicy! But flavorful!! Used the fresh sourdough bread they give you complimentary to dip in this spicy broth 
1/2 garlic crab - good garlic flavor! Tender meat, have to crack it yourself  
Dungeonous crab cocktail - decent portion of shredded tender crab meat served over ice with cocktail sauce on the side. 
Think that was enough? No. 
Dinner was a whole Maine lobster with a side of mashed potatoes and a grilled corn on the cob. The lobsters tail was over cooked and chewy, but the claws were tender. Kinda sad about the lobster tail, but I guess that happens when you get a whole lobster? 

Dessert was complimentary cause it was my birthday, I was just brought out a dessert the waiter, Rudy picked. It was some sort of warm chocolate rich almost lava melty cake with vanilla ice cream and house made whip cream. Really decadent. 

Good service, lovely ambiance, and fresh seafood. Fun birthday dinner ;)
Thanks Fog Harbor!
author: Sarah U.

description:
The waiters and waitresses were so nice and kind very fast and helpful on questions.
The atmosphere of the whole restaurant was nice, low lighting slightly quiet but got really loud at some points mainly because of kids but that's normal.

The main reason for 3 stars, the food was great but I got major food poisoning from the crab cakes with the aioli sauce, very sure it was the sauce that did it, probably the worst food poisoning I've ever had or I would've rated this higher, if I had not gotten food poisoning at all it wouldve definitely been a 4-5 star rating.
author: Dustin G.

description: This is my favorite seafood joint in town! If you're looking for a nice restaurant to have lunch or dinner at, this is the place! It has a beautiful view of the bay. Food is a little pricy, but not too bad. It's definitely worth the price. I ordered the Mixed Grill which was a combo of excellently seasoned and cooked swordfish and salmon with a side of heavenly steamed broccoli, and rice with some juicy shrimps. My brother ordered the Surf n Turf which was steak and lobster tail, it was equally as mouth watering as my dish. For dessert we got the Blondie which was one of most delicious desserts I've had! With a moist chocolate chip cookie brownie and a scoop of ice cream it was to die for! Service was wonderful and fast! They even gave us complimentary clam chowder because of the wait for food. I would definitely recommend this place!
author: Joleen T.

description:
Yep, "Eek! Methinks not" definitely sums it up...

The in-laws took my husband and me here for his birthday since he wanted seafood at Pier 39 and Fog Harbor had the best Yelp reviews...this is the first time Yelp has steered us oh so very wrong.

As far as the service goes, they started out on the right foot by saying the wait for a table was 45 minutes to an hour and we were seated in 30...it's all downhill from there. For being a busy Saturday night, none of the wait staff had any sense of urgency; the speed with which they walked was like they were window shopping at a mall. The 20 minute wait for water and the 90 minutes we waited for our dinner were testament to that. Also, the waitress was really inefficient and/or did not have a good memory. Any time I eat out I like to ask for anything we need all at once so the waiter/waitress doesn't have to make several trips...our waitress literally brought us one item at a time. Her favorite line was "I'll be right back with that;" yeah, you'll be back in another 10 minutes. Perfect example: the food had finally come out and we asked for drink refills (water, hot water with lemon, and coffee), ketchup, and a crab cracker (which, for some reason, didn't come out with the plate)...3 trips and 20 minutes later, we had everything but the ketchup. It took her so long to bring the cracker for the crab that my mother-in-law ordered that she started breaking into it with her hands, and I never did get ketchup for my fries. Our table did have a nice view, but one of the staff opened the window shade too early and it blinded my father-in-law. He asked if he could lower it again and the guys response was, "It'll just be bright for a couple of minutes" and then walked away. Pretty much all the guests had the same response to the bright light, so a manager lowered them, saying rudely it would just be another 30 seconds and it should have been fine, then proceeded to stand near the table while keeping an eye on his watch. The same guy as the first time came around to open the blinds again and was making rude comments as he worked.

Moving on to the food, I'll start with the good...the clam chowder, shrimp, clams, mussels, and whole crab were actually tasty. Not worth the price-tag they slapped on it, but at least tasty. The calamari was ok, kinda chewy, honestly the lemon aioli it came with was the best part. The salmon and swordfish were overcooked, dry, and bland and all of the vegetables that came on the sides were undercooked (seriously, undercooked fingerling potatoes?) except the spinach, which was overcooked. I ordered the crab roll (sandwich) and the best part about it was the bread, which was a good thing since there was a lot of it.

Just considering the food and service we had while dining here, none of us would rate Fog Harbor very highly...once you throw in the $180 we spent for this lovely experience, we will not only never go back, but would recommend everyone to eat anywhere but here.
author: Jennifer G.

description:
I had the clam chowder and the crab cakes. The crab cakes were disappointing and the clam chowder was good. Not amazing but decent.

The service was okay. I was put off a bit by our waitress. We were still buttering our bread when she took the butter basket away. I had taken all the butter I wanted but how did she know I was done? What if I had wanted more? She didn't know.

Anyway, it wasn't bad. it wasn't amazing. I probably won't come back if I'm in teh area though.
author: Christine D.

description:
Good eats, not touristy eats... 
Delicious sourdough bread as a starter, ceviche was good, the clam chowder was delicious! The mixed grill was amazing the salmon and swordfish was the best I have ever had. I never order salmon because it usually is not the fish that I like but I found myself really enjoying the salmon here. I enjoyed the food so much that I found myself craving  the swordfish and clam chowder the next day, so I came back. To some that may seem UN original but eating at a few places that were horrible, I wanted a sure win! I was not disappointed.  We had Madison as our server and she was friendly attentive and did not make us feel rushed even though she was closing her shift. She always was smiling, which made our experience even more memorable. It seems that servers have forgotten the art of smiling. NOT Madison she was great.
author: Ed K.

description: We came here after wwalking around Pier 39 & Fisherman's Wharf Saturday night after finding out Neptoon's Palace was perminently closed.  We were certainly not let down by this place.  We sat at one of the high tables & enjoyed the lively atmosphere.  Our waitress, Christine, was very bubbly, friendly, & might I add cute.  The sour dough bread is wonderful; perfect with butter.  The fried combo is crispy & greasless with a lite badder with fresh shrimp, calamari, & fish with a perfect cocktail sauce & drizzle of lemon.  The fries were crispy & perfect with ketcup.  Even the next day, my cousins' food was just as great.  Round it off with a Firestone 805 Blond & you will not be disappointed.  So, for excellent seafood in a casual atmosphere with friendly service at reasonable prices, Fog Harbor cannot be beat.  Keep up the good work guys.
author: Brian S.

description:
Took the bf here for a nice lil surprise dinner after a musical show on a Sunday. Yummy seafood dishes! We ordered the lobster and the whole crab! Deliciousness! Amazing lemon drop martinis! Great service!

If you're like me and you enjoy dining with a view, then this is the place to be. Do the romance hehe =)
author: Jasmine B.

description: Disappointing - fish undercooked - raw in center. Portions Small and squash chewy. Nice view and super sour dough...
author: Kathleen R.

description:
Solid place to eat. Definitely paying a premium for the location in the tourist trap of pier 39, however, didn't feel taken advantage of. The crispy scallops seemed overpriced until the serving arrived. Lots to share. 

Nice fish and chips and shrimp and chips. 

Overall, nice views, good eats.
author: M C.

description:
Came In for lunch on Mothers Day, normally I steer clear from the tourist trap that is pier 39 but had some extended family in town from Beijing and had to show them the sights...and I am so glad I did. At first I was kinda disappointed because we were taken towards the back of the restaurant but the view was still really nice. 

We ordered quite a few entrees that were excellent, the King Salmon which I was told was just wild caught @ Bodega Bay was amazing as was the Shellfish platter for two which the waiter kindly split for us.

The service was outstanding some of the best I've ever experienced I believe his name was Khaiman? He really went above and beyond to make sure we were well taken care of and even spoke a little Mandarin...wow! 

Family in town or not I will be back sooner than later. 

P.S. Locals, this is a family owned business the Simmons family have been bay area from the start.
author: Zhang W.

description: I had the Crab Cake Entree with sautéed spinach & roasted fingerling potatoes; my boyfriend had the Fried Shrimp; my brother had the Swordfish; and my sis-n-law had the Garlic Roasted Whole Dungeness Crab (w/out all the nasty stuff from the shell)....we all enjoyed our meals. Good food, great service, nice views, and not very expensive!!
author: Faye F.

description: Eat at the bar if you'd like prompt service. Although they (bartenders) bait the tourists. The ambiance is an old school steakhouse...so I'd prefer to be sitting over the sea lions if we were to eat again.   The food is good, it's probably not an area we'd eat again because the pier is a tourist buzz fest.
author: jenn p.

description:
Food and service was ok. I feel that you are paying more for the location.

Wasn't a terrible experience, but it wasn't a great experience. I'm on the fence about this place.

My friends said they enjoyed it though..so maybe it was just me.
author: Craig I.

description: Went with my parents for lunch and it was great! The waiter is very nice and friendly. He gave my mom a menu with photos in it because she doesn't understand English. The seafood is great and it is at a great location.
author: Silvia W.

description: This has been our third time to this wonderful restaurant.   We are from the South Bay and brought our out of state guests to the city.  We all enjoyed our food (fresh and flavorful).  Staff, again was attentive, congenial, professional and knew their menu well.  This is not a tourist trap, but fine food, exceptional service, great view and price very fair.
author: Eva A.

description: First time trying this place as recommended by our group. They have an award winning clam chowder which u must try! Pretty amazing especially with the sourdough bread bowl! Everything else was also great. Their oysters are by far some of the freshest and tastiest I've ever tried! Our server went above and beyond to make us happy. We were very pleased. The only bad thing I would have to say is that they don't have outlets so if you need to charge your phone they offer portable chargers at $100 added to your table as a deposit or form of insurance, we thought they were joking. Overall it was a great experience and wouldn't mind coming back.
author: Alina K.

description: Holy cow!!! Everything was absolutely amazing!! Atmosphere was great, service was fantastic and let's not forget the yummy cocktails and wonderful menu selections!!! It was our first time visiting this restaurant, and we were simply blown away, definitely our new favorite spot in SF! Thank you Fog Harbor, and special thanks to our server Oscar!! You guys are the best!
author: L M.

description: The cioppino is pretty epic, no unnecessary pasta filler. The clam chowder is great too, especially with the added crab. And, I love the fresh sourdough bread. Good to know there's a decent restaurant in this otherwise tourist trap known as Pier 39.
author: Maximillian M.

description: Food was okay...service was horrible.  At a tourist place I understand that service isn't going to be spectacular, but when the waiter is gone for long periods of time and you have to go to the bar to pay the bill because he's vanished, that's a bad thing.  Plus, he tried to tack on an extra $8 to the bill and insinuated that my GF's parents didn't understand how tipping worked.   Because of his rudeness and slowness, I left a very small tip and wrote "SLOW SERVICE" next to the small tip just so he knew that his bad tip wasn't because of the foreigners that he was obviously prejudiced against didn't know how to tip.
author: Dan P.

description: Great view and we were lucky enough to get seated at the best table for the sunset with view of bay, Golden Gate Bridge and Alcatraz. Blue cheese garlic bread was awesome, as was the clam chowder and fried shrimp. We had a great wait or and really enjoyed the experience.
author: Kyle T.

description: Had a great experience at Fog Harbor. Reasonably priced for the product they put out. Our waiter Oscar was outstanding. Couldn't have been happier. I wanted to order all the food!
author: Kelly J.

description:
It's a tourist trap, but it's not too bad.

The food was decent, better than most tourist traps but not great considering the wonderful seafood available in San Francisco.

I ordered the seafood sampler plate. Both fish were overcooked slightly but the flavor was great. The clam chowder was very good, with lots of clams and not too many potatoes. 

The best part of my experience was my server, Haiman. He was very nice, genuine, and helpful. He made the boiling hot dining room and stuffy, touristy atmosphere worthwhile. Without his service this place would be 2 stars.
author: Michael W.

description:
Excellent service. 
Super tasty clam chowder, calamari, and blue cheese garlic bread. 
Very reasonable price for Pier 39. 
Highly recommended!
author: Eric L.

description: Wonderful meal with a wonderful view.  Don't let the touristy area fool you.  This is a top notch seafood restaurant.  Fresh fish, great service, and the people are much nicer than over at Scoma's!
author: Rich S.

description:
The food and the view are great. 

No free refills. My sister ordered a few lemonades and it came out costing more than her meal ($22). Dumb.
author: J T.

description: Not a fan of place. The service was horrible. My friend and I placed our order plus an appetizer. The server was a sub for someone who was on their mandatory break. We got our appetizer then a side of bread. When she came to give us our main dish she just dropped off our food and took off. Didn't ask us if we needed anything, any refills on water or another round of drinks. Then at that point we had no idea who our server was because no one came back. We waited at least 20 minutes before someone came to our table. She told us who she was but we also had watched her serve the table next to us more than once. It's not fun trying to figure out who your server is. She didn't refill our water until I had to ask. She didn't offer us dessert. To top it off the food gave me an upset stomach. I have to say I will not be returning and I will not be recommending anyone to eat.
author: Crystal H.

description: It was all about seafoods and the view I came in for...I had their so delicious cioppino and their shackled fresh oysters and white wine.
author: Amy T.

description: Be aware before you go here the food is EXPENSIVE. So be ready to pay high prices. The Food was okay/alright!Our lady server (average height, blonde hair) was sweet, but we found it hard to communicate and understand what she was saying. In the words of my ex husband "our experience at this restaurant was not the best." One good thing is they take an hour off your parking pass if you park in the public parking right by the pier ! God Bless and I hope this review helps !
author: Natasha M.

description:
Excellent service our waitress
 Meron was the BEST.  Hands down was one of the best experiences my wife and I have experienced.  Differently a must visit if you are in the bay area.  The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars because it is anything goes attire.  But food and service is worth 5 stars.
author: Billy K.

description: Loved our lunch today - made all the more enjoyable by our server, Meron. Quick-witted and knowledgeable, Meron guided us through the menu with great suggestions. Highly recommend the crab chowder, grilled shrimp and ahi tuna. Oh, and don't forget the blondie dessert. Thank you Meron!
author: Jill M.

description:
I've always heard about San Francisco's infamous clam chowder & fish and chips. We were going to eat at 2 separate places for the items, but found this place served both and had good reviews so we went here instead. 

We started with the clam chowder in a bread bowl and the crab cake risotto fritters. The clam chowder was delicious, best I've tried. As someone stated in the tips below, just get the soup because they serve bread and butter for free, so our bread bowl was pretty much left un-eaten. The crab cake fritters were amazing as well. It was so much food so we shared the fish and chips. Fries were good, but the fish was underwhelming. The fish itself was flaky and light but the batter was unseasoned and made the whole thing just bland. I didn't care for the tarter sauce or cole slaw either. 

Overall, pretty good! I'd come back just for the clam chowder.
author: Joy C.

description: Words get around fast!  Non white customers get bad treatments from workers.  And white get serve fast and friendly .  People from Hawaii like to go there now I don't think so mostly non white .  Had a friend just dine there if that what you called it worst service ever.
author: erica w.

description:
This place is phenomenal!
I brought my boyfriend here for lunch for his 20th birthday and I guess we were not prepared for how pricey it was going to be since we just happened to stroll by and decide to eat there since we were hungry and looking for a nice sit down restaurant. We were seated by our sever John who was probably one of the best severs we've ever had! He was professional, sweet and helped us pick out something for appetizers since we both couldn't decide. I ordered the garlic roasted Dungeness crab (it was crab season) and I don't quite remember what my boyfriend had to eat but it seemed like a fried seafood platter of some sort. The garlic crab was SOOO good and it was big enough to satisfy me even with how hungry I was. Unlike other restaurants the garlic flavor could actually be identified while eating the crab meat and not just laying around on the shell. My boyfriend loved his entire plate and finished every bite. For drinks since neither of us are 21 yet, we had the iced tea and the ginger lemonade. OMG I wish I could have that ginger lemonade right now, it was quite strong but combined with the mint and lemon it was a perfect drink paired with the strong garlicy crab. For appetizers my boyfriend ordered the fried calamari since I had never tried it before. It was pretty good even though I know for some people it's an acquired taste but I liked it as soon as I got over the texture :p All in all we had a terrific upscale experience even during lunch hours and customer service here was outstanding so we will definitely be returning. I feel a little guilty for not leaving a bigger tip than I did and after we left we both felt so bad because we have never been served that greatly and John definitely deserved it!!
author: Heena W.

description: Madison the waitress was awesome and this was the best salmon I've ever had. With all seriousness
author: Randall M.

description:
Every now and then you have a dinner so memorable that just thinking about it makes you want to turn back time and enjoy it again. 

This was that dinner. The service - outstanding! Thank you to Khaiman who waited on us. We never wanted for anything, and all of your recommendations were wonderfully spot on!  

This was our second visit, we look forward to returning soon, and bringing along a few friends to share the joy.
author: Suki H.

description:
We had a great meal here. We came with a party of 8 at about 5:30pm on a Thursday and were seated promptly. 

The beer selection was nice with plenty of good local favorites.

Fried Calamari: I was disappointed that there were no tentacles. They were cooked properly but the breading was unimaginative. Not bad but not great.

Blue Cheese Bread: very rich and delicious.

Most of us ordered some fried seafood. I had the combo and others had the fish & chips. The fried fish is excellent: beer battered, tender and juicy. I also really enjoyed the fried shrimp. They were butterflied and cooked perfectly with a nice panko coating. The disappointing thing was that I only got one piece of fish and two shrimp and a big pile of calamari. The fries were standard.

My brother ordered the Cioppino. I got to taste it and it was very good. I've had lots of cioppino since moving to the area and I'd say this is one of the best around.

To sum up: I highly recommend this place if you're looking for a good meal on Pier 39. Skip the calamari and the fried seafood combo (because of the calamari) but try the fish & chips, shrimp & chips, or the cioppino which were all excellent.
author: Donley P.

description: Not sure what the hype is about. Clam chowder was okay. Sourdough bread was the best thing on the menu. My BF got the crab cakes and I thought it was just okay. Definitely not the best. I ordered the cioppino because everyone was raving about it. But again it was nothing special. I didn't even put a dent in it. Too much food. The fish and scallop were a bit over cooked. I ate the 3 mussels and 2 clams to try and get my money's worth. The tomato based soup was good but nothing to "wow" over. I guess this was the best west coast crab cake? Not impressed.
author: Bee H.

description:
My gf and I were in SF for the Daniel Tosh tour and asked our friend for dinner suggestions.  First on her list was Fog Harbor, so we decided to give it a try.  
I saw a long wait list and wasn't too thrilled about that.  To our surprise it was just a 15 minute wait on a Saturday evening.
We were seated and perused the menu to see what I would like to feast upon for dinner.  Our server Khaiman took our drink and appetizer orders.  
When he came back I asked him what was the popular item on the menu.  He immediately said the shellfish platter is a popular item as well as their mixed grill and a couple other items.  I ordered the shellfish platter and my gf the mixed grilled.  Khaiman recommended she get it Cajun flavored for the fish and he was right, but more on that later. 
We were given some fresh sourdough bread with our appetizers and it was amazing. We had the Dungeness crab, mango and avocado ceviche and while good, it wasn't amazing or to die for.  
We also decided to each get a cup of their clam chowder.  This is a definite must have and something I would get again. Nice flavor with a good amount of clams.  It's not overloaded with fillers like potatoes that other restaurants utilize.
Now for the main course.  The Shellfish platter came with 1/2 a Dungeness crab, mussels, clams, shrimp, and corn.  All of those was drenched in a garlic and herb oil that put this dish over the top.  I love garlic so it was like this dish was made for me.  Everything was fresh and cooked just right.  Price was fair considering what was included.  
The mixed grill my gf had was amazing.  The Cajun flavoring wasn't spicy or over powering. It complimented the salmon, swordfish, and shrimp well.  Something I'd recommend to order if you prefer fish over shellfish. 
We opted out of dessert cause we were quite stuffed and couldn't possibly eat another bite.  
When Khaiman brought out our bill he included some biscoff cookies to enjoy at the show.  
I should mention I ordered a Moscow Mule to sip on during dinner.  I'm picky since I make my own mules often and they did it right.  Perfect balance of ginger beer and vodka which made it a refreshing beverage. Of course it was served in a copper mug which every mule should be. 
We have a wonderful experience at Fog Harbor and will be back once we visit Frisco again.  If you have a chance stop by and you won't be disappointed.  Oh and if you can get Khaiman as your server. He won't steer you wrong and will make sure your glass is always full.
author: Chris B.

description: This is right in the middle of pier 33, and has amazing window views of the harbor and Alcatraz. It is a peaceful environment with really kind waiters. They serve you great quality food in very large proportions. For a drinks I ordered freshly squeezed orange juice, and it was the best orange juice I swear I have ever had. Overall it was really enjoyable.
author: Gen L.

description: I finally found the Best clam chowder in San Fran for me!! If you don't mind the tourist everywhere then this is your place for good seafood. Service was excellent. I ordered a cup of their clam chowder. Man this was phenomenal. No overpowering thyme taste as I mentioned in my review for Capurro's. Clam chowder done right here. Make sure to have reservation as this place is right on the pier where crowds of people are looking for places to eat so they get packed quickly. I had their Fried Combo platter. I love love loved the flakey white fish perfectly battered. The shrimp however that came in my platter was just "ok" really nothing special about it. The Calamari rings were also good. Did enjoy the coleslaw to cut through the richness of my dish. Wash it all down with their house merlot was a perfect dinner minus the mediocre shrimps.
author: Mary A.

description:
The food was pretty good, but the ambiance was almost unbearable if you are trying to avoid packed/touristy places. We had the crab cakes which were my 2nd favorite only to San Juan island (in WA) and the ahi tuna (ok) and the garlic crab (ok but maybe too butter rich). 

So food good, worth price et cetera et cetera.  But ambiance we felt like we were packed like sardines.  I've been to plenty of nicer restaurants which deuce food seafood and don't feel so cheap by putting people together. That said the service was very nice. I just wouldn't go back.
author: Larissa M.

description:
The view was great. The crab cakes were outstanding. My wife got the clam chowder, it was average at best. 
I got the special for the night which was crab stuffed lobster and I didn't walk away to impressed. Wine was great.

Service was average to good
So my dinner was average but I paid top dollar.
author: Jesse B.

description: A bit expensive, but worth it. I had the most amazing waiter. He helped us decide what to eat. Everything looked good, so it was challenging. I would definitively go back.
author: Madeleine S.

description: The food was good!!! For sure.  But I thought the menu selection was small, device was slow, and I had to ask for water.  The seared tuna was yum!! And oysters.
author: Kat M.

description: Khaiman rocks!!!!!  Food was wonderful.  Service was awesome.  Khaiman really went above and beyond to make our experience memorable.  Gave us great suggestions about the city.  Highly recommend.
author: Molly R.

description: As a vegetarian was not much for me to choose from.  Good thing I was mostly just thirsty and got to enjoy some drinks. Very nice location and atmosphere.
author: Lolita M.

description:
My first time here I fell in love with the calamari. Came back a second time to get it again, and I will gladly stand by to vouch that this is probably the best calamari in the city.

Great service. Khaiman was my server and he was easy to talk to, super friendly and funny, and was extremely helpful for any questions I had. Awesome place. Will be coming back again for the atmosphere and calamari.
author: Kiana C.

description: A little over priced for the food since there is so much good food in the same area, just as fresh but this place is quiet, clean and the service was good.
author: Isis E.

description: Not for vegetarians for sure. Was with family and they were in mood to try sea food when we were at Pier 39 last time... Had to settle with blue cheese bread and bland pasta (veg variant of their Chicken Pasta).
author: Vab B.

description: The food was pretty good. We ordered a surf 'n turf and a lobster tail. My lobster tail was amazing, as were the drinks (especially the blueberry press) and the view (if 'view' seating isn't available, wait for it. They roll view seating into the price regardless). My husband was not impressed with the crab stuffed Maine lobster. In fact, he down right hated it and only ate the steak. He would have preferred a lobster tail and strip. His plate was market price and at $58 for his plate alone, he should have walked away happy. He didn't. Kind of a disappointment, but we saved 20% because we're AAA members. We'll probably be back, but only cuz we get a discount on food and parking. BUT WE WILL NEVER AGAIN ORDER THE CRAB STUFFED MAINE LOBSTER!!! Ew.
author: Kelly M.

description: Three of us dined here and it was alright.  Some of my fish in my fish and chips were flaky, while the rest was harder and chewy.  I wasn't impressed.  We had ate at other places down the road this week that had far far better fish n chips.  I would not eat here again.  The coleslaw was okay, but I am not typically a coleslaw fan, so I can't totally judge that.  It was a neat place, but where I would ever go for fish n chips.
author: Leala E.

description:
This restaurant was a painful disappointment and unless everyone in your party is Caucasian and ok with injustice I would not suggest spending money here . Our waiter did not address my husband at all after taking his order . Continued to
Check on me but never spoke to him - not about his meal or if he needed anything . When it was time for the bill he delivered it to me and not him- he was the one paying. He is a much more generous tipper than I am but we could not justify a large tip when it seemed my status as Caucasian deemed me
Worthy of better service than my African American spouse . It was blatantly racist and the crab was over done and meatless (our waiter would've heard this if had spoken to my spouse. It's 2015 . This is disgusting . I feel disgusting . We won't spend a dime here and you shouldn't either .
author: jaime t.

description:
Clam Chowder was amazing , had never tried it before and was a bit worried about it , the server Burnie assured us it was good, He was so right , It was amazing ! 
We also had a bbq plate again so fresh and tasty , The service was awesome. 5 stars for food, Well priced , 5 stars for service.
author: Justin P.

description: Excellent service. I'll mention again that the service was good. Clam chowder and warm bread. Crunchy stuff was crunchy.
author: Sup S.

description:
Good but not entirely worth the price. 

Shared a bottle of sparkling wine with two friends and split some seafood appetizers. The oysters were a little sad, not plump and delicious. The tuna poke was kinda standard and the Dungeonous crab cakes were good. 

For this tasting, we paid $118.

Eh. I've had money better spent.
author: Jolie D.

description:
DELICIOUS! 

This food here was absolutely amazing, and I wish I could eat here everyday. The employees were extremely friendly, and we had awesome waiter. We made a last minute reservation on yelp, showed up, and we were seated right on time and at a table with a view of the water! 

We ordered calamari with a lemon aioli sauce- best calamari I've ever eaten and with a unique sauce. I ordered lobster tail and filet mignon. My filet mignon was a bit overdone for medium, but it was still extremely tasty and the lobster was cooked to perfection. My date ordered the live lobster and he said it was also extremely good. 

I can't wait to go back here again next time I head up to the city!
author: Lisa T.

description:
So delicious! Everything was perfectly cooked and tender- nothing dry or rubbery. The shellfish platter is a must! We got it with Cajun spice added in, which I highly recommend.

The blond bartender was amazing,  and made sure we were taking care of all night. Any rum drinkers need to try the escape from Alcatraz.

To finish off, we had the apple crisp, which was perfect. Warm and cinnamony :)

At the end of the meal, the manager came by the table to check in on us.  All around it was great service and even better food.
author: Max N.

description:
Great ambiance, poor service, mediocre food. 
Great view of the piers and ocean. The server was extremely slow, inattentive, and one of our party received her food 5 minutes earlier than the rest of us. When the food arrived I was underwhelmed.
Unimpressive.
author: Greg B.

description: Back for a second time and just as good or better than the first time. Doesn't seem like a commercialized place and that's why I like it. Clam Chowder in the bread bowl rocks but fills you up and then there is no room for anything else but a couple Stella's.
author: Kirk H.

description: First time in San Francisco, first meal was at the Fog Harbor Fish House and it was packed! Ordered the Lipstick Lemondrop martini- excellent! The calamari was delicious and the crab was good  Only complaint was that I was charged twice as much for the crab than what was on the menu so beware when ordering.
author: Chenelle G.

description: I was so excited to eat on Pier 39, and we finally decided on Fog Harbor. Beautiful location. Staff was semi ok friendly. The food was nothing to write home about. I had the lobster tail and it was chewy and cold. I'm pretty sure it was just way under cooked. My husbands food was also not the best. You'd think for the price over 100 dollars it would be delicious and amazing. Sadly it was not and that was the one expensive meal we got to have on our little vacation. So I will leave San Fransisco never getting to eat delicious lobster. Also our waitress never even asked how our food was and only came to the table once after our meal was served. :(
author: Kellie C.

description:
Pier 39 was the most touristy pier along the road and it was pretty easy to find parking. Once we got there we asked what the best thing was, she's pointed at the clam chowder. That was $10. I got the seafood penne. It was delicious. My friends like the bread bowl the chowder came in.

The only complaint is the amount of time it took after the meal--to get our check split, 

We got a cool window seat. There was one tv I saw, there could have been one more but I doubt it. As you walked further inside it's pretty boosie (is that the correct spelling?) so more tvs would make it feel like a buffalo wings or Applebee's.
author: Brooks S.

description:
Got sick from the Fish and Chips or the Beer?!
Careful
author: Bob S.

description:
if you want to get seated right away, do
Go elsewhere. The hostesses were rude and ignored us when we were standing in front of them. It took them a while to notice that we were standing there waiting to get seated. It did not look like they were happy to be at work. It was my first time here and first impressions are important. So so Glad our waiter took really good care of us. Drinks and food was mediocre. Do get their pumpkin spice bread pudding with vanilla ice cream! It was so yummy. Four stars for our waiter, he was awesome!
author: Nhi D.

description: The views and the food here are fabulous. I had the clam chowder in a bread bowl and oysters. They also had pumpkin bread pudding as a fall special. The service was better than most. I would come back here next trip.
author: A. K.

description: I came here after a long day of walking around San Francisco and I'm sure glad I did. Our server really did go above and beyond to help our table. A couple of us at the table have severe food allergies and she was such a great help! I order the crab cake platter,calamari, and curry muscles. The curry muscles were my favorite! They were different but it was a good different. My friends also all seemed to really enjoy their meal. Overall a great dinning experience with a pretty view of the pier, what's not to love about this place. Wish I can comeback soon too bad I live on the east coast :(
author: Amani A.

description: What a special restaurant.  We used Open Table to reserve.  Our table was ready and as well as they honored our request for a window Bay View seat!  Our waiter, Samir, was kind, polite, knowledgeable and very attentive.  The sour dough bread was great.  I had the Tuna and it was cooked to perfection.  My husband had the surf and turf.  Equally as delicious.  Wedge salad was a large and tasty bacon delight and clam chowder was the best we have had so far in SF.
author: Mary R.

description:
We had a last minute urge for some seafood and considering it was Labor Day Monday, our options were pretty limited. Our usual spots were all closed, I saw the strong rating on Yelp so i figured, what the hell--give the tourist trap a try. Turns out we both really liked the meal. We had a Caesar salad and cioppino. 

Don't come here expecting mission-hipster. It is pretty touristy so the service is actually quite respectable. Forgot to mention, they do have great views!!
author: Ben K.

description: Beautiful location, very nice server. She was very attentive and gave great customer service. The price was what was expected for eating on the pier. I had the crab it was okay, but beautiful. I wold come here again.
author: Ashley Q.

description: Had a great lunch with a great view of Alcatraz and the seals of Pier 39. Our server took great care of us, providing excellent recommendations. We had the crab cakes, clam chowder and crab & risotto app. Highly recommend stopping by. It's nice to eat at a family owned restaurant with a great staff and great food.
author: Heather T.

description: paid $17 for an uber here because Yelp said they closed at 11.t he time posted is incorrect they close at 10 on a Saturday night.
author: Savannah S.

description:
This place actually surprised me. I'm a city native who doesn't expect much from restaurant around Pier 39, but this place was solid and reasonably priced. I had a friend visiting from out of town who wanted oysters, so we came to Fog Harbor. The oysters on the half shell were good, as were the baked oysters. The pleasant surprise was the generous serving of clam chowder in a bread bowl that surpassed my expectations.

Oh, and our server was AMAZING. I feel awful for forgetting his name, but he was attentive at the right times without being intrusive.
author: James T.

description:
Considering the restaurant is among the touristy restaurants at Pier 39, I had an idea of what I was getting myself into. Either way, my date wanted Cioppino and this was a recommended spot.

Parking is validated for 2 hours after 6pm, so that helped a lot.  The cioppino comes out in a big shallow bowl.  The maitre d accommodated my request for a window seat (+1 star).  

As for the food and drinks, our server recommended a sweet white wine to pair with our cioppino.  I might go for dry next time as I feel it would have been less overpowering.  Nonetheless, it was still good otherwise.

The restaurant offers you crab de-shelled for easy eating for an extra few bucks, which is the first time I've heard that being done.

All in all, it was a great meal.
author: Brian L.

description: Loved our experience tonight!! We sat by the window and it was so pretty! Great service and great food.. The baked oysters were delicious. I had the surf and turf for market price ($58.00) and I would definitely recommend it. You will not go hungry that's for sure!
author: Brittney P.

description: I think our server needs to take ginko biloba or something for her memory. We get there and she takes our order for our drinks & asks if we would like some sourdough bread so we say, yes. A few minutes later she brings us our drinks and then asks again if we wanted sourdough bread...we tell her again, yes and look at each other like, WTH?! Lol. After she brings out the sourdough bread she takes our order...i ordered the halibut and a cup of clam chowder, and my boyfriend ordered the swordfish and some calamari. When they finally bring out our main dishes, she asks if there was anything else we needed and my boyfriend asks where the calamari was, and she says she didn't put the order in for the calamari! She asked if we still wanted it but being that we had to head to the airport we just told her no. Half way finished with my halibut and realized she forgot my cup of chowder!! The food was good but the service was terrible. We did notice she didn't write anything down...I'm not sure if the restaurant requires them to memorize everything but if you are allowed to write orders down...WRITE IT DOWN!! You are not impressing anyone when you try to memorize it, lol. And it makes it worse when you forget what your customers ordered! Including when it's multiple things that were ordered. Not sure if we'll try this place out again when we are out there. I was so excited to try this place out and the service just turned me alllllll the way off.
author: Mary M.

description:
Looking at all the reviews, I think I had way too much expectations for this place. Went for a dinner (2 people) fairly late to not catch the tourist but service was so average and so slow for a late night. The free Yelp check in bread and blue cheese is very basic so take it but please stop raving about it. Then we tried the baked oysters which were really good, and I know my oysters. Following other reviews we tried the lobster mac n cheese which was way to average for the upscale dish that this represents. We also try the cioppino but not good. 

My overall take is that if you want seafood in a decent place on the Wharf then this place is overrated.
author: Arnaud S.

description: We just had An amazing lunch here! The chowder in the bread bowl was awesome. Meron our server was super nice, efficient and rocked a great sparkle tie. The whole staff was well trained and friendly. Thanks for making my moms birthday weekend so great!
author: Laurel S.

description: Pleasantly surprised by the food, service, and pricing.  Pier 39 after Thanksgiving, is a situation that seemed to have all the makings of low quality. Quite the opposite.  Highly, highly recommend the chowder.  Even the normally tired fried seafood was done just right.  Lives up to all we want from classic SF. #sourdough.
author: Andrew B.

description:
WAAAAAAY better than Crab House!

From when we first arrived, seating, service, food and when we left, friendly and on point.

We didn't have anything other than the crab, so I can't recommend anything but this city's specialty.

Would def come back here with guests in town visiting SF!
author: Alex T.

description: Awesome lunch. Should go n try clam chowder  Service was great n Khaiman was so nice. I ordered clam chowder, mixed grill, calamari and fish & chips.
author: Taelim K.

description: Get claim chowder and calamari!  KHAIMAN our waiter was awesome. He gets things done quick and get you things before you ask. Woohooo
author: Jennifer K.

description: It was amazing! The wait was a little long but it was worth it. I got the seafood penne and it was delicious! Everyone loved their food. The atmosphere was great and our waiter was really nice and friendly.
author: Angelica V.

description: Nice ambience but not the best tasting food in town. My husband ordered the crab cake and did not enjoy it. It seemed like it was made from minced crab meat. I had fish and chips and the fish was over breaded and greasy. The coleslaw had no flavor and was not appealing at all. We enjoyed our house salad and would only go back for that alone. The restaurant is lovely and was packed. I suspect you would have to be a local and know exactly what to order when dining there.
author: Audrey S.

description:
This was my first meal in San Francisco and I was pleased with my choice.  Touristy?  Yes.  Still worth it.

I started with a drink from the bar.  A rarity for me.  My drink has a cucumber basil infusion and tasted fresh.

We went straight to the meal... No appetizer for us.  We traveled all day and were hungry.

I had the garlic roasted whole dugeness crab.  The garlic and olive oil bath was similar to al mojo de ajo, except some of the garlic was caramelized.  This is a garlic lover's dream and I enjoyed every bite.  The plate also has fingerling potatoes and corn on the cob-- all fresh.  I sopped my potatoes and the table's sourdough bread in the garlic bath, too.  This is a messy meal, so not something for something for a first date or someone in a hurry.

The service was attentive.  Our drinks were continually refreshed and our bowls for the crab shells continually replaced.

There is a children's menu and crayons and paper table cloth to color on, too.  This occupied my children through our time consuming meal.  My 11 year old wanted fish and chips and thought the children's menu would not be enough.  This is the only area where I would have liked more server guidance. The adult portion was huge.  

I tried my daughter's fish n'chips. The batter was light and flaky, and had good flavor.

The price was perhaps a little higher, but I cannot say it is out of line for the area.  My crab was $39, my daughter's fish and chips was $17.  My drink was pricey-- around $10.

Last, the view was pleasing and the restaurant is designed for most seats to have a view.
author: Kelly M.

description: Fog Harbor is just average. Was excited to finally eat here after reading all of the rave reviews, and chose it over "Fog City" on my most recent trip to San Francisco. I started with a bowl of their award winning clam chowder, which I must say was excellent. From there, though, the meal was downhill. Our server was not very happy at all, and it was took about 25 minutes before we ordered our food. We both got fish & chips, which we agreed was very plain. The restaurant itself is very nice and it has great views, I just wish the food was a little better.
author: Brian L.

description: The food is definitely worth 5 stars, but the service was not. I didn't catch the name of our waitress, but she was just down right RUDE. I would consider this restaurant to be upscale so for staff to be rude is just unacceptable to me, especially when it's an expensive meal. However, looking past the horrible attitude of the waitress, the food and view was amazing. I had the crab cakes for my appetizer which was very yummy (I highly recommend) and for my meal I had the grilled shrimp brochette which was scrumptious. The shrimp were cooked perfectly and had the best flavor. I definitely recommend this restaurant for the food and ambiance, however, because of the staffs sassy attitudes, it's debatable if I will be eating here again on my next visit to San Fran.
author: Shelby S.

description: Good food! Beautiful views! Service was a little slow but I would go back. I agree with other reviewers that the tuna poke appetizer was just okay. It's good with the sauce that's drizzled around the edge, but all the flavor comes from that sauce. The king salmon entree was great and their complementary bread was amazing! My dad had the shrimp salad which he enjoyed but my sister said the crab roll was just okay. All in all a worthwhile meal!
author: M C.

description: Great food, great service and great drinks!  Had the sourdough clam chowder with crab and it was good. Drank a Maple Old Fashion which was great. Our table had a view and everyone was happy!
author: G J.

description:
hubs and I decided to start a holiday tradition of spending one day before christmas in the wharf area to relax and spend some qt.  when we got hungry, we checked out a few of the restaurants and for some reason decided to go here.
Since it was a late afternoon meal, we were seated right away.
the view from the restaurant was pretty awesome.
the tables weren't cramped up and restrooms were clean.

I ordered a nojito (since I cant drink) while hubs ordered their cucumber gimlet drink.  they were both really good.  for apps we shared crab cake--crab cake was good but the salad that came with it was warm and soggy.
for entree hubs ordered a filet mignon (med well) with mixed veggies while I ordered their seafood plate.  filet mignon was too rare for my husband so although he ate it, he didn't enjoy it.  the squash with his veggie mix weren't that great either.  my seafood plate on the other hand was good... not too much seasoning and the seafood weren't overcooked.
for dessert, we ordered the molten chocolate cake with vanilla ice cream.  it was a bit disappointing.  the cake needed to have melted chocolate and the vanilla ice cream tasted weird...more like imitation vanilla with some alcohol.
I also thought the fake dessert sample plate that they show you instead of the dessert menu was a bit tacky for a pricier restaurant.

the service was good... food was hit or miss.
author: Learnee L.
