description: Great service! Put our name on the list, party of 2. 30 min wait. Asked if we can walk around the pier, lady replied check back in 20 min. We checked back in 25min and were seated immediately. Our waiter was VERY nice. We ordered 2 sourdough clam chowder bread bowls, and sliders. The bread and Clam Chowder were wonderful, especially the bread, but the caramelized onions on the sliders were just to die for. It's been over 24 hrs and I can't forget that taste. I loved the whole experience.
author: Lena D.

description: Really enjoyed dinner and drinks here. I had the surf and turf, hubby had the pumpkin curry salmon- both delicious! We had a great table with views of the water
author: Rori C.

description: They force us to give 18% tips even though we don't think the server serves well...
author: Yun Chen L.

description: The clam chowder was outstanding, and the crab roll sandwich was one of the best things I've ever eaten in my entire life. Also the decor is lovely and the service was impeccable.
author: Mike W.

description: Amazing fresh seafood!!! I loved the crab cakes, ahi tuna, and oysters. Highly recommend this for a classy seafood meal with a view and a great variety of choices,
author: Brittany F.

description: I had the garlic whole crab and cioppino.  Both were really good.  We also had the soup and salad combo.  It was a lot of food.  Come hungry!
author: Wendy L.

description: Great experience and Sarah added to that! She truly made the evening better for us! We had a larger table (7) and she did a great job suggesting great dishes and was very prompt and courteous even giving us pointers for what else to do in the area.
author: Andrew R.

description:
Checked in on yelp and got the free bleu cheese garlic bread.  Normally not a fan of blue cheese but it was definitely tasty.  Quick highlights of what we ordered:

Crab cakes
Mixed (seafood) grill
Clam Chowder
and the fried seafood platter?

All in all, everything tasted excellent and was very fresh BUT the glaring issue with this place is the SERVICE! Understanding it was a saturday evening in tourist central (Pier 39), I kept my patience but when the table behind us that got seated after we did got their entrees first, we had to complain to the waiter.  I know it's not his fault but in the words of the ESPN NFL countdown crew, COM'N MAN!!! At the beginning of the meal, our waiter, Khaiman, recommended we write a review after I showed him my Yelp check-in that earned the free garlic bread so things looked promising too.  The big save was that this place validated up to 2 hrs parking if you parked in the garage next to pier 39.  

If you're looking for a full service restaurant in touristy Fisherman's wharf, then you could definitely do worse than FHFH but I wouldn't necessarily go out of my way to eat here.  I don't know the SF area that well but I'm sure there's plenty of great seafood restaurants in town.  In fact, I'll do a quick search on Yelp to prove it!
author: David Y.

description: Food tastes quite nice, but I do not think that it is good enough to justify its price. The decoration is pleasant and you can have a great view of the sea if you sit near the window.
author: Sydney C.

description:
I was looking forward to this as reviews were good, and it was the first day of the dungeness crab season.  The service was friendly, but incredibly slow.  It took about 15 minutes to get my one glass of champagne, and I could literally see it sitting at the bar for 5 minutes.  It was a busy Saturday night, but the service was just so slow it was painful.  When my steamed crab finally arrived, it was mediocre quality and it took another 5 minutes for them to check in so that I could tell them that they didn't give me crab crackers.  Despite request, I never got a small fork to actually get the crab out.  
I would not recommend it.  I'm sure there are other nice places to try.  The view was however nice and the waiting area with the fireplace was very nice.
author: Kathy N.

description:
I came here for my birthday recently, and I must say, not too shabby.  I generally stroll down Pier 39 just because I love the pier/ocean view, and I've always see this restaurant.  Truth be told, I thought it was one of those upscale, dress up like a douche type restaurants.  I was wrong.

I was coming from San Jose, and was planning on having dinner before I go back home.  I was craving for sea food.  You come to San Francisco, you gotta have some sea food if not steak.  Anyways, I was looking for seafood, and found some reviews that shows this place was pretty good.  I didn't know how reservations were, so I had made reservations via Yelp.  When I did it on Yelp, my reservation became at 9:30PM. Meh, lame. 

So we came to Pier 39 walked around a bit, and said screw it.  Let's just ask them how long the wait is.  If it's longer than expected, we've already made reservations anyways.  So we walk up to the restaurant and their layout is quite cozy and warm for those who have to wait.  They have a nice little fireplace that will keep you warm because everyone knows Frisco can get quite cold.  So anyways, I ask the young woman at the podium about the wait time, and suggested I would like a window view.  I didn't expect it to be available considering it's around 6-7ish.  She took me by surprise and said, we are currently cleaning the table right now, and it's window view.  We sat down for like literally 2-3 minutes boom, here comes our waiter--let's go!  Omg, the view was amazing, I mean of course, I'm a sucker for scenery, but damn.  We sat towards the back, window view of the hills and the bridge, to the left was Alcatraz.  Perfect. 

Our waiter was Shawn, absolutely amazing.  Very fast pace, generous, and helpful on the suggestions.  My brother thought differently, felt although he could have been more helpful.  So.. Maybe I was more excited on eating than service. Who knows!

OK, food:  Quite expensive if you ask me, but was it worth it? Yes and no.  Some of the items, you can go out to the fish market and get it for cheaper.  But how it was cooked, well.. Stay tuned.

1/2 Oysters:  Mini oysters was what it was really.  The sauce they had made was delicious, I don't remember what it was, but I have pictures. Haha! Foodie!  It was placed over some ice to keep it cool, which everyone should place raw fish over ice, if you don't... Ugh...

Crab Cakes:  Oh my, these were so good.  They were going for $16, only two pieces, which I felt kind of ripped off.  I cannot deny it, they were bomb!  Once in a while, yes worth the $16. Lol, I'm all for cheap eats.

Bread Bowl:  Personally, I feel although they were better than Boudins.  I had Boudins down the street where you had to get it via cafeteria style and I am not a fan. This bread bowl was much smaller though, but you could taste the clam chowder better.  Not too much breading either, just enough to distribute.

Fog Harbor Burger:  Made was Angus Chuck Patty was quite amazing.  Definitely cooked to perfection without asking.  Medium rare, but not too rare that it made you feel weirded out to eat it.  They got it down as far as burger goes.

Fog Harbor 1/2 Lobster/Crab Meat:  Ok... This was quite disappointing.  This was their current specialty on the menu, and I honestly felt like I should have just gotten a full damn lobster tail.  The crab meat was just baked crab.  Nothing special about it.  They charged me a little more than just the lobster tail.  I prefer the lobster tail so much more than to order this again.

Fish and Chips:  Fried to a golden texture, very delish.  On point  Not much I can really say, I didn't really eat it.  My boyfriend ordered it. :P Sorry guys


Overall my experience was great.  The best part was that I got to see the sunset, and oh yea, even if you're not facing the window, there are mirrors so you can reflect the image.  I sat right in front which had the perfect view.  I loved it.
author: Nhu-Quynh N.

description: You wil love the xlam chowder n steamed Dungeness crabs. Waiters sevices are also nice to customers. But,cant find the shop easily from inside walkways.
author: Soe O.

description: Gotta tell you for being a "tourist trap", food was pretty damned amazing. Well cooked seafood, perfectly seasoned, incredible service. A tourist or a local, like myself, could do far worse for way more money. Excellent cocktails and the view can't be beat. Give this place a try when you're waxing nostalgic about the city and want a reliable place to get well made food. The service will impress and you'll remember why visiting the sights of the city are so fun.
author: Miranda G.

description:
Went here for Happy Hour.

Got the Lombard Lemonade. The bartender made it very well. Tasted yummy. I can barely taste the alcohol, but it somewhat creeps up on you (in a good way). 

The calamari was good. Nice, crispy, and filling.
The smoked salmon crostini was very flavorful. 

The view from the window looks out into the water, very beautiful. 
The outside area of the restaurant is very cozy with a fire place.
author: Mandy D.

description: I've never been disgusted by sea food this much before. If this restaurant is in your list to go visit, remove it from your list right now. Bad attitude staffs and very low quality food. At first when we walked up to the host to order they asked us what the name is like they were trying to fight us. I know at that time we should've walk away just because of that but we said to give it a try. We went in and we praised the view but but we actually didn't know what a horrible horrible food we are about to experience. First when we ordered the drinks I specifically asked the server for a cold glass of beer. And she came back with a really worm glass and when I told her she was likee awwwww really? Like she felt bad for me and there is nothing she can do about it. We ordered two lobster tailes for $39 each with mashed potatoes, when they brought us the plates as soon as I smelled the food I wished that I would've go eat burgers instead of this low quality small and stinky dish. I eat lobsters all the time and let me tell you this was really really gross and unpleasant that it almost seemed like they boiled it in water. And the most sad part was the mashed potatoes that litterly seemed like they took the potato powder from the box and mixed it with water. THE WORST FOOD EXPERIENCE EVER! the whole dish didn't been worth $10 and a $10 meal would've taste much better than this. And guess what my bill was ? $139.00 for the most disgusting plate in the world. Save your money guys and don't absolutely give you business to this Jack A..es that don't even know anything about cooking food or hospitality skills. They littarly should be shut down. Don't let the view trick you.
author: Sean T.

description:
Super small portions of their chowder in a bread bowl and the place was full up with an older crowd. At $10 a plate, I should get more than 3 spoonfuls. I was still hungry afterward. Come on. 

It was tasty, but no where near "San Francisco's best" like they claim. The service was practically non-existent and we had to flag down our waiter for everything even though it wasn't very busy (maybe 5-6 other parties total?). Super disappointed and would urge you to go somewhere else.
author: Katie K.

description: Came here based on reviews. It was tasty! I got the whole crab and my husband got the lobster tail stuffed with crab. Both were awesome. Don't forget to get your fun book of the Pier 39 website for an extra 20% off coupon. Definitely helps because this restaurant is on the pricey side. We will be coming back in the future to try the lobster mac and cheese.
author: Angela H.

description: This is our second time coming to the Fog Harbor Fish House. We ordered crab cakes to start along with a few drinks. I was so happy to find that they had Anchor Steam Lemon Wheat beer! The crab cakes were perfectly crispy & an ideal proportion for two. I ordered the clam chowder in a sourdough bread bowl with crab. I wish I had room to finish the whole thing! Best chowder I've ever had. My fiancé ordered the swordfish that was served with zucchini, potatoes, onions, & red bell peppers. The service was great - a server walked by with a tray of desserts but we didn't have room for any more food. We enjoyed watching the sun set as ferries pass by on the bay. Wonderful experience!
author: Dani M.

description: Had a wonderful dinner here, service and food was excellent.  So may crappy seafood restaurants,  was nice to find one that lives up to the San Francisco reputation of good seafood!
author: J R.

description: The food was pretty good. It was our anniversary and we werent even offered a complimentary dessert , we drove very far to celebrate as well. Our server Trevor, was terrible, he rook over foe our other server never stopped by to introduce himself, took forever to take our order, we felt he was kind of ignoring us. Overall the experience just wasnt that great. Ive been there numerous times, kind of thinking we will be finding a different go to restaurant when coming up north to san francisco.
author: Erica M.

description: 1st night visiting San Francisco.  Took kids to the Aquarium by the Bay in Pier 39 and decided to stop here for dinner.  Our party of 4 was served by Anthony who is an outstanding waiter and gave us lots of tips on how to make the most of our stay.  We had their famous bowl of clam chowder, calamari, and ahí tuna ... all of which were DELICIOUS.  So happy we stopped here. Highly recommended it.
author: Gina R.

description: I had the most amazing experience here! All the staff bent over backwards to make us have an enjoyable time. From the hostess to the bartender to the server and manager. We were sat by the window and it was really hot. They close the shades and noticed it was still warm. Without us asking they offered to open the window. He even put a napkin on the chair before he stood on it. Our server was very knowledgeable about all the specials and he suggested so many different options. His vibe and energy were so welcoming and if you end up coming here I definitely suggest to ask for Michael. We ordered the clam chowder and we added crab to it all I can say is phenomenal! We also ordered the fried scallops and they were so moist. For our entrées we ordered the ribeye that was on special and the Pacific cod. The Pacific cod came out so flavorful I really enjoyed it.  Unfortunately the ribeye came out a little too rare. But the manager walked over and noticed we were eating it. He was so nice and was willing to take it off the bill or get us a new one. The flavor was so good we just decided to take home our same steak and reheat it. When we looked inside of our to go box it was a whole brand-new steak. He also offered us a complimentary dessert which I thought was also very nice. The manager was very hospitable!  So all in all we loved this place!!! Food and service were well over what we expected. We will be back!!!
author: Lorna C.

description: An awesome surprising find in an ultra touristy area. The clam chowder in the sourdough bread bowl is so worth the calories. All 6 of our meals were delish. Still dreaming of going back.
author: Nia J.

description:
There are tourist traps and then there are city gems that are conveniently placed for tourists to relish in. This is one of the later.

A great atmosphere with a great smattering of universal and signature sf seafood dishes.

Plus, they have paper on their tables which puts them on my list of fav sf restaurants quite automatically.
author: Sajid R.

description: The seafood here is definitely among the best I have ever had!! The red chili garlic shrimp is amazing!!! It's very sour and hot. Though we did wait for the wait to order our food, the food didn't take that long.
author: Grace L.

description: AMAZING! First of all, great location right on the pier, beautiful views. I ordered a cup of clam chowder which was hot and delicious, served with fresh sourdough bread. For my entree I ordered the crab and avocado salad - sooo good! Can't beat that fresh crab. Our waiter was super friendly and attentive. I would recommend this place to anyone visiting the SF area looking for some good seafood with great views.
author: Heather C.

description: Great calamari with a cold beer was a great choice just wish they were better in their service
author: Peter S.

description: On Pier 39, yes a touristy place, but we were doing the tourist thing! Great views of the dock, fresh oysters, cold beer, creamy yummy clam chowder, crusty sourdough bread, yummy I am in heaven!  They have a great seafood menu of every crustacean, Dungeness crab, fresh fish, and items for the land lovers too.  Great white tablecloth dining and servers.
author: Rhondi S.

description:
This is just for the bar because we didn't eat there at all.  In fact, we didn't even drink inside the restaurant so I can't justify giving 5 stars but I did spend around 2.5 hours a whole lotta dough getting drinks at the bar and drinking outside in front of the fireplace listening to the live Christmas music they were playing in the streets below.  The atmosphere was really nice, air was fresh and it was warm enough.  The bartender was really nice but it did take a long time for him to ring us up but that's because he was making the drinks for everybody in the house and NO ONE was helping him.  In fact I was mad for him because the other guys should have at least helped us while he made the drinks for the other patrons, but that's not my place.  

I think it'll be a nice area if you just want to grab a few drinks and relax, the couches outside are comfy and the people there were totally cool with us chilling there drinking. 2 blue moons and 2 shots equaled to 24.00, not bad especially in a place that has a lot of tourists.
author: Meena N.

description:
Blueberry Press was a great drink to start off with.   
The clam chowder in sourdough bowl was delicious.
OMG their sour dough bread was to die for.
Great place to eat, but has a tourist price tag.
author: Midnight M.

description: I can truly say that service at this restaurant is held to a higher standard than any other restaurant in the area, considering they cater to the flip flops and shorts wearing tourists as well as the well-dressed. The food is plated beautifully and does not disappoint. But, did I mention the service? This is probably the best trained waitstaff on the waterfront and the space that they operate out of is gorgeous. Clean and luxurious with an astounding view. Worth every penny.
author: Gary B.

description: I love coming here and I love the view. Blue cheese garlic bread is yummy. Fish and chips I'm not crazy about the batter. Crab is delicious and generous portions. I just had the pumpkin martini and love it!
author: Glenn S.

description: So it's touristy here, like it is all over the wharf, but the food is incredible and the view is amazing.  The fish was to die for - especially the poke dish which was an appetizer.  The service is outstanding.  What more can you ask for when you visit the wharf?  We had to wait for about 20 minutes on a Thursday afternoon, but it's well worth the wait.
author: Liza W.

description: Bartender put the wrong salad in for me. Corrected it& asked the kitchen for the correct one but I came out a half hour later than everyone else's food - & she still charged us the full $25 for it! No apologies. The other wait staff was great but when you make an error you go out of your way to fix it. Customer service 101
author: A O.

description:
I had the salmon house salad..it came with two little tomato, salmon, mixed greens, bacon...lemon vinegrette and ranch dressing..i gota admit it was pretty good..the salmon was cooked perfectly..it was on top of the bacon and onion..i didn't even know..and man I haven't had real bacon for so long..it taste crunchy..

The dressing was a bit greasy..blah..fat..but it went well with the overall dish. I came here for lunch on a Friday and it wasn't crazy packed. The bread was nothing special..the butter wasn't either..

I really want to try the crab soup next time..the décor is nice enough to get me to come back.
author: Minerva L.

description: Amazing lunch!!! Our waiter, Michael (#23), was great and gave us excellent service! Clam chowder, roasted crab, and fish and chips were delicious! Will definitely be back whenever I'm in SF! Thanks Michael and Fog Harbor for an amazing lunch!
author: T H.

description:
Don't try the chicken penne pasta, it wasn't very good at all.

The clam chowder bowl is great but it tastes about the same as the fast food place below it, and you'll save a couple bucks
author: Brad S.

description: Had some delicious clam chowder in a bread bowl to warm up on a brisk day. Fantastic service from Khaiman, our waiter, who was super helpful with directions, activities, etc. The best place to visit on Pier 39!
author: Rebecca B.

description:
Ambiance was nice, service was not awesome and food wasn't good but wasn't bad either. The view is absolutely incredible though!

After a long afternoon in the rain at Alcatraz we were STARVING when we got back around 3:30. I looked up trusty Yelp reviews that had been spot on for the last 5 places we ate. Considering this place had 4 stars and a bazillion reviews we thought it would be great! Well... It was just OK.

Our waiter took over 10 minutes to greet us and take our drink orders and by this time we knew what we wanted to eat.. then after another 5 minutes came back to confirm our drink orders and they didn't arrive for another 5 minutes. 

Now we've been here 20 min with only glasses of water, did I mention we were incredibly hungry??! 

The bread and drinks arrived and literally on top of that was the appetisers. Calamari was nice. However for a place that prides themselves in Crab Season - their crab cakes were shit. From Maryland and I work at a high end seafood restaurant, these crab cakes were not very nice.

Then we had burgers (I know it's a SEAFOOD restaurant but we wanted lunchy food) and they weren't very good. We didn't finish them. 

Since we arrived during the lunch-dinner transition our waiter changed, but we got sort of lost in the transition where no one came by to check on us long after we finished. To the point that I stacked our plates myself to let them know we wanted our check! 

Now, I am a server, I have high expectations for such a highly rated restaurant but I was disappointed by the service and quality of the food.
author: Laura C.

description:
So we took a Trip to San Francisco and of course you have to go to Fisherman's Wharf and we came here.  My husband and I do not eat shellfish so after trying Crab Shack, which we did not like we came here.  They are almost next door to each other on the 2nd floor.

We walked in and it was such a nice restaurant and great service.  The place did not spell fishy like next door, and they had sourdough bread, yum.  I ordered and loved the Fish and Chips the Cod tasted like it was just caught and cooked just for me.

My husband loved the trout and we will come again when we visit San Francisco.
author: Naz H.

description:
Wow! I did NOT expect to find such good food at the Pier. Fog Harbor is a sure bet for excellent food and service with the killer view and convenience you're looking for. 

Clam Chowder breadbowl was as luxurious and decadent as you want it to be. It is perfection on a cold (or even cool, for this FL gal) day.
Tuna Poke was uninspired and lacked texture
Chilled half crab was so fresh and delicious. Cracked - easy to eat
All of the cocktails we tried were creative, well-balanced, and strong.

Total bill approximately $100 including tax and tip (two people). 

*Although I didn't order them, my friend's crab cakes looked way too bread-y for the price*

Bonus points to our Ken doll look-alike server, who proactively separated our checks by couple. 

Fog Harbor would've earned 5 stars if not for the lackluster Tuna and high drink prices. Still, not to be missed if you're in the area.
author: Tal T.

description:
We started off our meal with Baked Oysters & the Poke,  both were excellent. Their seasonal specials were extremely delicious and hit the spot. The braised short rib was incredibly tender and melts in your mouth. The Salmon was also very delicious. The service was also very good & promt. To sum it up it the experience was very good & we will definitely be back. 
                                                                 Mike H.
author: Mike H.

description:
Went to this restaurant based on Yelp reviews, the menu and the proximity to our hotel. I never would have expected such poor service from a restaurant like this, especially one in a prime tourist location. A little background, we had reservations for Sunday at 4:00 PM. Here's a summary of our experience here after being seated:

-No one acknowledged us, no one as in any other waitstaff
-Another server had to take our order 10 min after being seated. He tells us out waiter didn't know he had the section we were in.
-Our waiter served a table that was seated after us and still don't stop by our table which was four feet directly across from their table
-We didn't get water after 20 minutes and that's after asking multiple times 
-Our waiter didn't acknowledge us for over 15 min, didn't say hello or apologize for the wait
-We had to ask for bread
-It took 50 min to get our food
-We had to flag down our waiter to get boxes and the check
-The general manager didn't even ask how everything was even though it was obvious we weren't happy and were looking all over the place for our waiter throughout our entire time there

I cannot stress how bad this dining experience was. How could a tourist restaurant be so poor in customer service? It should be the exact opposite in my opinion. I will not be returning here and will tell others to not go here. The food was mediocre. We ordered the blue cheese garlic bread, clam chowder bowl, crab roll, and the mixed grill. Nothing memorable besides the food was rather bland especially the mixed grill plate. Don't waste your time and money going here. The view of the water and Alcatraz isn't worth it, trust me, the ambiance isn't worth it. If anyone from this restaurant is reading this (which I highly doubt), I'd recommend on training your staff better, especially your general manager working on August 11, 2013.
author: Sammie B.

description: Delicious fresh seafood with a great view. I recommend the ahi tuna entree. It was incredibly flavorful and paired well with stir fry veggies. Prices were reasonable (worth it) and the service was attentive and friendly. I was worried this would be an overpriced tourist trap but it exceeded my expectations.
author: Sarah E.

description: I wasn't expecting anything great in such a touristy area, but everything was great.  Food, service, view.  Brought kids, and we all had a great dinner.  Chowder, mixed grill were both great.  And the mussel fries were evil.
author: Jesse M.

description: Very pleased with my experience here! As this is a touristy location, expectations are always a bit lower. Great view, our Server (Christina?) was super nice, very helpful and attentive. My step-mom has many food restrictions, so we were a bit of a challenge. Not only did Christina go out of her way to make sure everything ordered was safe, but she made suggestions to modify items we were interested in and never made us feel that we were that problem table. Just the opposite, she really cared about making sure we had a good experience. We began with cocktails that were unique and delicious, then shared a large crab salad, one of the daily specials; great flavor, (on romaine, not the most interesting of greens, but did provide a good crunch). We also shared cioppino, a delicious seafood entree. (I would have given 5 stars, but the shrimp in this dish was overcooked and not good. Since there were only a few pieces and the rest of the seafood was tasty, it wasn't worth mentioning or sending back.) We had planned to order another entree, but were informed that the portions of these two items were pretty large. They were! It was good we didn't order more. We finished with desert. 10 stars for service, 4 stars for food.
author: Pam C.

description: Hostess station is sub par but our waitress was fantastic. Food was excellent, love the chili sauce on the shrimp appetizer.
author: Cindy K.

description:
Amazing view, great food, friendly server - what more can I ask for?
I know that this place isn't the cheapest, but Fog Harbor Fish House is in the center of tourist mecca. I know there are lots of similar restaurant options nearby, but they either lack in food or interior or attentive servers. I tried to nitpick and find things I don't like about this place, but honestly I couldn't (again, apart from having to deal with major tourist crowds, which is no fault of the restaurant)
Just be sure to check out tourist brochures and/or yelp check-in for modest discounts or freebies. In fact, most Wharf/Pier39 restaurants have some form of promotion. They also validate parking so make sure to take advantage of that.

My party had clam chowder, cioppino, crabs, shellfish platter along with some white wine and dessert.  Clam chowder wasn't the best I've had around bay area, but they were above average. Seafood was fresh and prepared right.

This probably isn't the best place for family with small children, but for more adult-oriented crowd or date nights, I would highly recommend.
author: Christina P.

description: My fiance and I just enjoyed a fantastic dinner here. The food was on point! all of the seafood was obviously fresh. The oysters were great! The crab cakes were delish! You can tell that they used fresh crab because of the softness of the cake. They were good size too! 2 for 16 bucks. The ciopinno was loaded with seafood. Not skimpy at all. And the texture of the crab was soft and snow white! Our waitress was okay.. she missed a few steps of service. Our apps and soups all came out at once.. no refills.. reaching way over... but we will definitely be back!
author: Stephanie S.

description: Awesome food and great ambience! Great for a romantic occasion or lunch/dinner near the Wharf.
author: Chris A.

description:
While the food was good and visually very appealing, we found the actual amount of crab/ lobster you receive very lacking. You definitely had to work for your food with the crab. And the crab stuffed lobster was mostly potatoes and spinach. 

The appetizer of mussels was amazing however the crab and shrimp ceviche was mostly avocado. 

The sword fish was great.. My 10 year old son cleaned his plate!
author: Brandi H.

description:
ordered sword fish, tastes real good.
it was very busy so the waitress is not always available, even need to wait a long time for water.
author: Harry R.

description: Let me start by saying.  I live on the gulf coast and I have lived off of seafood my entire life. I know the good from the bad. Overpriced for the tourist.  We went for something lite, the chowder.  Not wonderful like we had wished for. Our drinks were the best part of our experience.  We did sit by a window, so we had a great view.  I would say if you are a virgin to seafood this would be the perfect place. Just not for me.
author: Angela B.

description: Great restaurant, awesome views! Nice relief from a sunny day at Fisherman's Wharf. The seafood penne and fish & chips were both delicious selections. Friendly waiters and an attentive manager were on top of their game. Try to get a seat near a window, it's worth it!
author: Rachel F.

description: Fantastic service. I got Ashley G. as a server and requested to sit by a window if a spot opened up. She didn't complain and happily moved me over to a window. The clam chowder was great and Ashley was great serving me in another section.
author: Jill W.

description: Spectacular food, view and customer service !!! Definitely will be back ! We ordered fall special pumpkin curry salmon, and grilled salmon. Also the shrimp ceviche OMG! Soooooo good !!!!
author: Lisa R.

description: Clam Chowder was deeelicious as well as the oysters!! Definitely going back when i visit S.F.
author: Esther C.

description:
I honestly just went to this place because we had a group of 8 in our party, and it was the best compromise amongst what everybody wanted for a Saturday lunch.  Seafood is better at the small hole in the wall places, but those only seat like 10 at capacity and don't take reservations.  So I came into this place knowing what I was getting to myself into, and still the food was just ehh.

I got a chowder bowl, which was okay at best.  You can honestly get better chowder by walking down the wharf a little bit and getting it from one of the stands.

I also got a seafood pasta dish which was good but definitely not memorable (probably why I can't even remember exactly what it's called).

I think I spent like $45 total with a beer on top of those 2 dishes so this place is definitely not on the cheap side.

In the end, it's basically one of the touristy spots, and you should only expect as much.  If you have to, then it's an okay choice, but it wouldn't be my first choice, or second, or third...
author: Travis D.

description: Great strawberry dacquiri!  Although at Pier 39, not just for tourists!!  We came here and had drinks and a nice dinner.  A bit pricey but worth it once in a while.
author: C L.

description: Food was good but you would expect more for this price.
author: Kyle H.

description: The environment, view and food were all amazing... As well as our server Sarah P.  We ate right at sunset and had a gorgeous view of the bay with the Golden Gate Bridge and Alcatraz in the background.
author: Garrett F.

description: I was visiting the area on business from Atlanta and randomly selected Fog Harbor based in Yelp reviews and location. I had the Pacific Sole and crab cakes. The crab cakes were ok but not the best I've had and same for the Sole. All in all the view is awesome and I'd order the food again so although it wasn't the best I've had, it was good.
author: Bridgette D.

description: I was really disappointed by my fellow Yelpers. I read many good reviews about this place,but I guess they were reviews by people who arent from SF. My friends and I heard that they had really good fish and chips but we lost our appetite after the incident. Not only was our table at the corner of the restaurant,but our waiter lost our ticket and didn't let us know til 30 minutes after he lost it. What kind of service is this? Poor service. We all lost our appetite and just decided never to come back to this restaurant. They had okay calamari and a waiter that wasn't ours and the manager apologized but that's the only good thing I'd have to say about this place.
author: Hazel E.

description: I thought the clam chowder tasted like it had flour or starch or something in it. And my bf didn't think the ahi tuna was that great kinda chewy. For the price tag i would say try somewhere else
author: Misha M.

description: This is place is amazing. I love the seafood here, especially for its homemade chowder and garlic crab. I would say this is the best restaurant I've ever tried around Pier 39 area.
author: Arthur Z.

description: I really like this place .  I had the seafood grill with swordfish salmon and shrimp .   Great service and food. Really a tourist area and I mean huge tourist area.  Must be a cruise ship close by.   Crazy amount of ppl in the area.   Reservations are recommended .
author: Rick S.

description: Excellent! We came here for a late lunch on a Tuesday and had no problems getting a table. Service was top notch. We ordered the blue cheese bread and added crab. We also ordered the soup and salad combo with a Caesar salad and garlic roasted crab. Everything tasted amazing and we would definitely return. Don't expect cheap. Our bill for lunch was $86.00, but that is to be expected especially for eating at the wharf.
author: Shell B.

description: Great food! Highly recommended steamed whole crab and jumbo shrimp! The dinner made SF trip better!
author: Ruonan W.

description: Great chowder and a nice view across to Alcatraz. Good atmosphere, bartenders attentive. Agave marg was nice as well. Very nice meal.
author: Larry B.

description: Came here for dinner after graduation with no reservations so I was pleased that we were able to be seated within 15 minutes. It's true, the views are beautiful and the food is even better. We started off with the mouthwatering clam chowder. It was honestly amazing and then I had the mixed grill which was also great, along with a wonderful glass of sparking Pinot Noir. The service was great and I had an overall wonderful experience!
author: Laura F.

description: Great food and an awesome view...the mixed grill was wonderful! The only reason I didn't give a five star review was because our waitress was like a sad emo girl who hated life and her job... Other than that, it was great!!!
author: David B.

description: Delicious! I had the tuna poke, which is a must try. Perfectly marinated and seasoned, it's a great dish all around. The tuna was fresh and full of flavor, and the wasabi mayo was a perfect garnish. For the entree I had the lobster ravioli special with tarragon, butternut squash, and sun dried tomato. It was creamy, but not too heavy, and the tarragon balanced the dish really well. My lunch-mate had the clam chowder and ciopinno. Both were great. Get the crab out of the shell for extra convenience--it's worth the money!
author: Maria M.

description: There was a 45 min wait so decided to sit at the bar. The service was great! Jason bartender/server was very attentive and quick! We ordered the Blue Cheese Garlic bread, Jumbo Shrimp Cocktails and Chowder for appetizers. For the entree we ordered the Ahi Tuna, Shellfish Platter and finally for dessert Tiramisu. My favorite would be the Chowder, the Jumbo Shrimp and the Tiramisu. The consistency of the chowder was perfect... not too creamy nor too watery. It had the right amount of clam and not too much potatoes which makes it PERFECT! Shrimp cocktail was simply great! And the Tiramisu is amazing!!! The Ahi Tuna was good. I just felt like if I wanted this Asian taste I would've simply gone to a Japanese restaurant. I was hoping for something different. The Shellfish Platter was my least favorite. It was way too garlicky for my taste and it was overflowing with potatoes. My hubby did enjoy the extra garlic tough so for garlic lovers... this is the platter for you! This is a great restaurant! Highly recommended!!!
author: Alana L.

description:
I'm so glad I picked this place to have lunch!

Went here with my bf last Wednesday after we walked the GG bridge.

It's located in Pier 39, on the second level adjacent to the Eagle Cafe.

Outdoor lobby of the restaurant is nice as well as the interior--great view of the pier/ocean...

Customer service is great!

Our waiter served us complimentary sourdough bread while waiting for our food--I'm not that much of a fan of sourdough bread, but this bread was an exception, only cuz it came fresh out of the oven...

For appetizers we ordered the calamari (everytime I eat out with my bf, and if the restaurant serves calamari, we'll  order it!)...portion is enough to feed 2 people. Love the seasoning and breading of the calamari--texture of the calamari is perfect! Soft, easy to chew, not too firm...

I ordered the fried combo (beer battered fish,shrimp, more calamari!, and fries). Love the taste of the fries--tastes like BK fries, fish was yummy--batter wasn't thick, but thin enough and crispy. The shrimp seemed a bit overfried but whatever, and of course the calamari was my fave out of all of em.

Bf ordered seafood fetuccine. Says it's one of the best he's ever had.

Overall great experience...I'll be sure to come back here again!
author: Zerrilyn P.

description: If I could give 0 stars for service alone, I would. Our second time eating here but today I was very disappointed with our experience today. Our server left and was MIA for at least 25 minutes. Someone who I assume was the manager came by and asked if everything was okay and I let him know she was MIA so he asked what we needed. He came back without the items we requested (A1, refills) to let us know she had ended her shift and apparently forgot to tell us. Wow! What a great manager, not even apologetic. Our 3 meals cost over $140 and they weren't bad, I just don't think they were worth what we paid. I have no problem paying for high qualify food and good service but I don't feel we received either at this establishment. I don't think we'll be back anytime soon.
author: M V.

description:
Place is in a good location. Customer service is great! We requested a table for 9 with a view since we have some visitors from EU and we were accommodated. Wait time is not bad. We made a reservation but we were seated after everybody in the party are present which is ok. 
For the food, we order different kind of appetizers, main course and dessert. Overall it was good but the garlic butter is a bit too much butter and the spicy garlic is not what I expected. I would say overall it's not bad. The price is on the higher side. For first-timers I think it would be ok. Are we going to come back? Hmmm, maybe we'll try other seafood restaurant in the area first.
author: jojo a.

description: Got sat right to the bar Memorial Day weekend. Beer glass was dirty. Service was inattentive. Oysters had shells and grit. No real menu so I don't think they can call themselves an oyster bar. Over priced for sure. The only thing which was expected was the white wine. I don't ever bash like this but they seemed totally ignorant that it was a poor experience. The host did her job just fine.
author: Bridget M.

description: The view is one of the best parts of this restaurant. Besides that, the food is ok. Ok, the clam chowder in the bread bowl was good but otherwise, we just did appetizers because nothing else on the menu was to-die for. We tried the Ahi Poke and literally, we love sushi but this tasted like the fish was still swimming. It was almost too fresh lol! Then I really wanted to have crab legs but the only way that they serve crab is by bring you a full crab - body, head and all... not my thing. I would pass on this place next time.
author: DMarie M.

description: Had the shrimp Louie salad and it was huge!  Couldn't even finish it, which means a lot because I have a crazy appetite.  Kinda wish I would of ordered the clam chowder so I could compare it to the fish hopper but oh well there's always next time.  I also tried the crab, shrimp sandwich.  It was eh, alright.  Kinda dry, lacked some flavor.  If you get it I would order a side of tarter sauce.  The bread they give you to start with is amaze.  Sour dough bread makes me happy!  Staff was also very accommodating.  See you soon fog house :)
author: Angelica C.

description:
Well with the wait and the beautiful seating outside I guess I was expecting too much from this place. We were startled to see several waitresses and waiters with white uniform button up shirts but no undershirts beneath!! I could see the women's bras and one mans nipples clear as day!!! For a place like this I would have expected management to have that under control at least! 
We were seated in the far back of the restaraunt where a party of about 15 teenage girls of 15 years old were seated with no adult supervision and were so loud throughout our whole meal that I could barely make out anything my friend was saying to me. And I really feel bad for the people who were sitting next to them as we were half way across the room! When I said something to our waiter he stated "yeah, they are pretty annoying" but never attempted to rectify the situation. 
 It took about 15 minutes for someone to come get our drink orders and I ordered a margarita and was able to hardly drink it because it was about 70% syrup and way too sweet. We ordered the ahi tuna poke which I really enjoyed and my friend had the crab dip which absolutely loved and devoured. When the main meals arrived my friend had the chowder and said it wasn't really all that special and was just ok. I ordered a plate of clams, mussels, shrimp, crab and corn. The dish was absolutely COVERED in Garlic....there so much garlic everywhere and I had a hard time scraping it off. The clams were ok and there wasn't too much to the mussels. The corn was ridiculous as you couldn't really bite into it but if you scraped it with your teeth you might actually get a little bit. The whole dish was hard to eat because of the ridiculous amount of garlic. It was like someone took about 6-8 whole garlic, minced it and to threw it in. With what we paid, we were severely disappointed....this restaurant needs someone competent enough to actually make this place worth the price...
author: Amanda O.

description: Great food! Went here on a quick visit to family and was looking for yummy seafood. This place got great reviews, so we decided to try it. The swordfish dish, mussel fries and steamed clams were outstanding. Usually swordfish is grilled too long and becomes a task to eat--not at this place. They grilled it perfectly and served it warm. Very pleased. Also, the cream and fennel sauce that was used for the muscle fries was a delicious way to serve a nontraditional combination of fries and chips. As a plus, the wait staff was very willing to accommodate our two-year-old who is often a dining challenge for most eateries. I will go back!
author: Sarkit S.

description: Great food, service and views of bay.  Pierre took great care of our party of 5!  Seated quick.  Clean restrooms.
author: Charles T.

description: The best clam chowder I have ever had. And I'm a bonafide San Franciscan. This place is awesome, great, fresh seafood, and a lot of delicious menu items to choose from. Highly recommend it.
author: Andy P.

description: The food was delicious, our server was great & very polite, I believe his name was Jon (Jonathan). The prices are reasonable. We had Shellfish platter & it was a hit! I will def come back again.
author: Glam Sass M.

description: I usually don't ever come to the Piers because it's super touristy and crowded. The food here is pretty good. I got the Trout and calamari appetizers. My friends got the lobster mac and cheese, salmon, cippino and fried platter. Everything was pretty good and the portions are pretty big. I would definitely come here again. We parked at 80 francisco parking garage it's $10 for the full day until 9 pm.
author: V N.

description:
There was one thing I was determined to do while in San Francisco, and that was to find a good seafood place in Fisherman's Wharf where we could enjoy fresh fish and a nice view of the harbor. So I went to Yelp, because I did not want to chance ending up somewhere not so good on my SF Fisherman's Wharf seafood adventure!

I was looking for a nicer dinner place, not just a clam chowder hut, so Fog Harbor caught my eye and with good reviews, we decided to give it a try. I am *so* happy we did .... best meal on our entire vacation!

We had problems figuring out where to enter the place! lol. I saw the Fog Harbor sign on the wall, but finally after walking around some, we realized we had to walk up the stairs and enter from above! :)
It is a very touristy area, but we didn't have to wait to get seated. It's a good-sized restaurant, also with options for eating at the bar, so the capacity for customers is quite good.   They escorted us to a nice table where we could oversee the ocean, Alcatraz and the Pier 39 traffic below while we ate. Loved it.

We started off with some clam chowder.  While waiting for soup, we were served nice fresh sourdough bread, it was so delicious! Nice and smooth and not "too sour", it was perfect.  The clam chowder was wonderful.  Full of clams!! (As a clam chowder should be, but you'd be surprised at how often you can count the clams in a chowder on one hand ....).  We mopped up every single drop with the remains of our sourdough bread, that bowl was clean and ready for service again by the time we were done with it.

For dinner, I had selected the swordfish. It was served atop ratatouille and fingerling potatoes and was accompanied by pesto sauce and chimichurri.
The flavors were amazing, I loved the combination of all these vegetables and sauces along with the swordfish, it really brought the fish "to life". I love swordfish, but it can be a little bland if served with the wrong sides.  
This vegetable/ratatouille blend along with the sauces really did the fish justice, I loved every bite!

My husband decided on the crab cake dinner. 
Now, I'm very picky when it comes to crab cakes.  I'm picky on seafood overall actually, but especially food involving crab.  If it is fishy tasting at all, I won't have it, so most crab cakes never pass "the test" ;-) 

I'm very happy to say, the Fog Harbor crab cakes DID pass the "Laila" test with flying colors!! They were so smooth and delicious, I even reached over for a couple of extra bites and luckily my husband is good at sharing ;-) 

At the end of the night, when our bill came, we actually did feel we got our moneys worth ... between the food, the service and the beautiful view, it was totally worth it and it was exactly the San Francisco Fisherman's Wharf seafood experience that I had dreamed about!! :-)
author: Laila R.

description: Some of the best sea food I have ever had! Ate here with my family of five. We got to sit in a booth near the window. There was a really nice breeze which was really nice considering it was a hot day. We started with the shell fish tower and it came with crab, lobster, oysters and shrimp. Everything tasted amazing and fresh. For the entree I had the classic clam chowder and my parents had the halibut which I think was super tasty and flavorful! This is a must eat place when you come to the pier! It's worth every penny!
author: Devin D.

description: When I'm in the Bay Area this is the only place I will eat at. The food is exquisite and delicious. Service is excellent but call in advance to get a table by the windows most amazing views of the ocean.
author: Maria M.

description: Yummy food and a beautiful view. Started off with a cucumber gimlet that was very refreshing. We enjoyed a couple oysters on the half shell which were delish. For my entree I had the Ahi Tuna which I asked for extra rare, it came out perfectly cooked. Or should I say hardly cooked. It was just the way I like it. It was topped with a wasabi aioli and fresh ginger. They complimented each other really well. Noir server Dirk was friendly and very attentive for us being a group of 11. It was nice that he didn't have a problem splitting our check. My husband and I will definitely be back. Looking forward to trying more yummy seafood dishes! :D
author: Brooke G.

description: Went on a Monday afternoon, still relatively busy but service was excellent. Ordered the mussels and fries - definitely one of my top ten meals of all time. Perfectly cooked and simmered in a delightfully light, creamy sauce. Fries were crisp and the combination hit the spot  Hubbs got the clam chowder and it was yummy. Must also write about the hot, fresh sourdough we were served - that alone was probably worth the 5-star review!!!
author: Irice S.

description: Great view, friendly staff, and the food was good, but it wasn't really anything special. I'm not sure if it was worth the price.
author: Samantha J.

description:
The location is great, with great views from a window seat. The sourdough bread was good, the clam chowder was great, and the oysters fresh. I had the mixed grill for my entree, and the salmon and shrimp were good. The swordfish was a little dry, as was the wild rice.

I had the tiramisu for dessert, and it was much better than expected.

My only complaint was the bar - mixed drinks seemed watered down. Go for the Lagunitas IPA.
author: Floyd A.

description: Spent New Years eve with my family in San Francisco. Went to pier 39 to eat dinner and stumbled upon this place. Every dish ordered was exquisite (chicken penne, seafood pasta, clam chowder) and prices were reasonable for the location (60 Dollars per couple: main dish + drink each)... You can't actually see the fireworks from their windows, but it was a short walk afterwards. Fully recommend this place for a fancy night out!
author: Natalia F.

description: Their clan chowder in a bread bowl was incredible. The fried shrimp was good...the cole slaw was a little losing.
author: Eric L.

description: Food is amazing and so was the service from Shawna! We will for sure come back to this place!
author: Jill I.

description:
This rating is mostly because of the service, not that the food was any better (I'd give the food a 2.5).  We had the most incompetent waiter EVER.  I swear to god, this guy was high or something he was so bad.

He was constantly disappearing on us and each time we asked for basic things (i.e. utensils and extra napkins), it took him like 15-20min to come back, and that was after several reminders.

COMPLETE idiot.  I wish I remembered his name so I could warn people to stay away from his tables, I think it was Rudy or something like that.

Basically, stay away.  This place is overpriced and given the service and food quality, it is not worth it.
author: Michelle L.

description: Came in after touring Alcatraz for a bowl of clam chowder. The restaurant was very nice and the staff was very friendly. The soup was very very good and would have received 5 stars if only it was a bit hotter. Other than that I totally recommend Fog Harbor.
author: Nelson F.

description: The clam chowder was simply amazing!! Make sure to add crab for extra $6. The blonde dessert was to die for. Will definitely come back to this place!
author: Marina R.

description: Had a great time at Fog harbor house on Saturday night. Our server Brenda was amazing she went out of her way to give us tips on places to watch the football gamer he next day and her recommendations were spot on. Food was sooooo good. Had the whole crab with a bowl of clam chowder plus the view is great. Would recommend to friends/family.
author: Mae B.

description: Waited almost an hour at the chilly pier on a Sunday.  Great ambiance, perfect for a nice date. I came here with my boyfriend and some of his friends. We were starving and took a while for our waitress to greet us. We weren't even offered bread to begin with until after we ordered. We all shared the fried calamari which was pretty tasty. My boyfriend's friends ordered their famous clam chowder and thought it was really good with the sour dough bread. I ordered the fog harbor burger and it was so delicious. The carmelized onion was perfect and it came with a generous amount of fries. I tried and couldn't even finish the burger. My boyfriend had the fried combo, which included fish and chips along with calamari but he thought that the fish wasn't crispy enogh and could have been better. Overall, it was a good experience, pretty pricey but that's expected since it's on the pier.
author: Sharon Y.

description: Such a GREAT find. Amazing bread, yummy chowder, delicious crab cocktail. Wasn't expecting much as often by the pier there's no quality, taste, or uniqueness  to the food. You won't be disappointed.
author: Mama M.

description: Clam chowder was delish and ciopinno was full of seafood and amazing. Would recommend this if you are looking for seafood in Fisherman's Wharf
author: Stephanie L.

description: Nice view! The best clam chowder! You can add crab for $6 which is a nice addition but you can always have it in a bread bowl for I think another $4-$6. I would not recommend doing this! They give you amazing sourdough bread for free so just dip away! The fish and chips was some of the best I have ever had. Light and crispy and not too greasy.
author: Suzanne R.

description:
food - okay
service - terrible, the waiter was not attentive at all
price - 54 dollars for a lobster? Not only that, everything was very so pricey
author: Tan D.

description: I ordered the clam chowder in a sourdough bowl. The sourdough bowl itself wasn't anything to write home about, but the clam chowder is some of the best I've ever had! Definitely worth checking this place out if you love some good clam chowder! The view of the bay is hard to beat too!
author: Christina P.

description: This place is perfectly placed on the pier. The food is pretty good.. I had the crab roll which was awesome. The bread was perfectly buttered and crispy but soft at the same time. The crab was fresh but the mayo crab ration was a little disappointing. The mayo does take away the taste from the crab. Our server was awesome! She was young, smiling from ear to ear and always asked if we needed anything. Basically, if you're looking for a decently priced lunch or dinner with a view of the bay, give this place a visit!
author: Anna M M.

description: Me and my wife were there for new years last night. For new years eve the wait was suprisingly not that long. The waiter was also very nice and helpful and although she didnt seem to overwhelmed. We got the calamari as an appetizer cooked to perfection the only problem, they were a little on the salty side. I got seafood penne and my wife got the chicken penne both of our dishes were absolutely amazing and very fresh. The only reason i gave a 4 star instead of 5 is beacause they charged us four dollars for a soda i understand that this a tourist trap type place but their food is marked above food cost already and suggested a 20 % gratuity. All in all i would come back.
author: Nick K.

description: Great scenic view and attentive waiter and staff. We took Tyler's recommendations and most were good but we're not getting the enthusiasm over the chowder or bread.
author: Greg A.

description:
This is such a good restaurant at Pier 39. Prices are an average of $20 per Entrée but the food is really good.

Atmosphere 5/5: Great ambiance and cozy restaurant with fireplace and good seatings next to the bay area. They don't have any outside seating tho.
Food 5/5: Food is definitely great there. I tried the 1/4 Crab Languini that you can ask to be out of the shelf for an extra $4. We had as well the Mixed Grill which looks to be a little bit small but good! And last but not least, the Clam Chowder in a Sourdough is priceless.
Service 3/5: I never had perfect service at this place. There's always something that goes wrong, misunderstanding or takes time to bring the receipts to cite a couple examples. Too bad for a restaurant of that quality that the service isn't at that level as well.
author: Shay R.

description:
Fish was good - salmon.Very crowded, but service was excellent.  My big problem is the garlic mashed potatoes were instant/fake potatoes.  Also, the Creme brulee was fake! Creme brulee should be a custard; this dessert was basically vanilla pudding with the crusty glazed top.  When we spend $100 + for 2, I expect real potatoes and dessert.

Having traveled cross country, I was looking forward to a great experience on Pier 39.  This was a disappointing dinner.
author: Kristi N.

description:
The place is on the 2nd floor of pier 39 plaza.  Didn't realize how big the place actually is until we went in,  They have a nice pink lit bar facing the water, with tables for the smaller type groups on the same side.

Now, I'd like to start by WE LOVED this place.  Great atmosphere, awesome service, and fantastic food.

We went there on a Sunday evening after making a reservation on Yelp (via OpenTable i believe) and we were able to get seated right away, on a very nice table with a great bay view.  The fresh bread and butter made for a nice starter along with the strawberry Nojitos.

I ordered the clam chowder but unfortunately I couldn't have it since it had bacon (BUT yes it looked and smelled amazing).  The wifey had the fried shrimp plate which came with fries and a dip sauce.  I on the other hand had the seafood platter .... Ready for this Crab, Shrimp, Mussels, a big thing of corn on the cob and CLAMS and all for responsible prices 

The overall experience was great, and will be soon next time we're in the city and in the mood for seafood.

So why 4 stars and not 5.  I was hoping for better parking option (but that doesn't take away from the place of course) and the restrooms could use a bit more attentions.
author: Mike S.

description: Amazing service and seafood! My husband enjoyed the fish and chips, I enjoyed the Fall special cod . Delish! Can't wait to go back!
author: Jan B.

description: Wow... The view here is no joke. Our sever was excellent and the food was fresh and delicately prepared. We started with the blue cheese garlic bread and clam chowder, both made with their own sourdough. Excellent drinks and the wild salmon entree is a great recommendation. Can't wait to come back
author: Holly M.

description:
Stopped by on a busy Sunday evening and was told the wait was 45 minutes. My daughter and I definitely wanted to try Fog Harbor so we hung out and sat in the super comfy chairs near the fireplace out front. 25 minutes later my name was called and we were seated at a lovely table in front of the windows. Our waitress was sweet but the service wasn't particularly fast. To be honest, that was ok with us, we wanted to take our time and enjoy our last dinner in the city. Fog Harbor was full of tourists but didn't feel touristy.

Our food was AMAZING. She had shrimp cocktail for dinner and was happy with the six very large shrimp plus the warm boudin bread and butter. I had the half garlic roasted Dungeness crab with fingerling potatoes and corn on the cob. My mouth is watering just thinking about it and dinner was two hours ago!

I highly recommend Fog Harbor Fish House!
author: Sara S.

description:
Had a great burger here! The caramelized onions made the burger sweet and delicious. 
Madison was very helpful and knowledgeable about the SF area. Staff in general were friendly. 
Would recommend to anyone who wants a great view and scrumptious food.
author: David F.

description: Had the best time ever! food was wonderful! But what made our experience the best was having Sarah as our waitress.
author: Mathew A.

description: Great seafood. I had the fried fish combo and the calamari was great. The blue cheese garlic bread was really good.
author: Bradley G.

description:
Yummy food. Great service. Wonderful restaurant overall.
Had the Lipstick Lemondrop, Crab Spinach Dip, cup of Clam Chowder, and Chicken Breast. Since I am not a mushroom fan, I asked our waitress to hold the sauce on the chicken and she suggested a creamy butter sauce that they use on one of their fish dishes. It was delicious! 
Definitely a must try.
author: Sarah W.

description: We read Yelp's reviews & dined here 2 days ago on the Grilled Shrimp Brochette. 8 jumbo shrimp, spinach, butternut squash & garlic mashed potatoes, cooked to perfection. Wonderful! Warm delicious sourdough bread, and an excellent martini! Shawna was the perfect, efficient server we always hope to have. And the view? What more can I say? Except, that we are not tourists, we live here! Going back soon for a Holiday lunch with friends.
author: Flavia M.

description: We celebrated my husbands birthday here this weekend. Dinner was very fresh and fun right off the water. We had a beautiful view of Pier 39 and the sea lions. The shellfish platter comes piled high with crab, shrimp, mussels, and clams, in garlic butter.  I highly recommend the platter and it was fun to eat and very fresh! The clam chowder was delicious!
author: Shanna M.

description:
Came here Sunday morning at 11:15 ish with reservations, to be greeted with quick customer service! With my party of 6, we were delighted to get a table with just a breathtaking view. Absolutely gorgeous. With a quick change of waiters, because why not, a new friendly lady (I should get on top of remembering my servers names...) helped up decently well. We all ordered the clam chowder in a bread bowl, a half garlic crab, and some drinks.

The chowder was delicious but pretty much the same thing as everywhere else in the Pier 39 area. I ordered a ginger lemonade, while expensive (like everything at Pier 39), was refreshing! They also had alcohol-free wines which my friend enjoyed. The garlic crab was decent, but I've had better in the area from small restaurants. The check-in for the free blue cheese garlic bread was a nice touch! 

Food is high quality, overall good customer service, and an AMAZING view of San Francisco! Excited for the next time around!
author: Winson T.

description: We ate lunch here today and were extremely impressed by both the food and service. We were running late due to traffic yet the restaurant held our table for us for 25 min. As for the food, we highly recommend all the seafood here, which was so fresh and perfectly cooked. Some of our favorites were the clam chowder bread bowl (chock full of clams and the right consistency), calamari (not greasy and comes with a delicious garlic tartar sauce), and shrimp cocktail. The service speed was also outstanding for a busy Saturday lunch, and the ambiance was very nice with lovely views of the bay. We've eaten at quite a few upscale seafood restaurants, and Fog Harbor Fish House was a clear stand-out. We will definitely be returning to this restaurant in the near future.
author: Janice K.

description: Food was amazing! We had the crab and avocado salad and oysters! The oysters were some of the best I have ever had and the salad was up there as well! We also indulged in Margaritas, we had the regular and also the hibiscus and they were both delicious.
author: Tyler H.

description: Great food. Better atmosphere . I was dining with the Webdoc. Peter had the Dungeness crab and I blackened swordfish. Portions were good, quality even better. Nice view from the window. Shawn our waiter was on top of it and tended to every detail. Get a window table and enjoy! #ronmadmax
author: Ronald M.

description:
I was able to book a reservation last minute thru yelp. Awesome. 
Ha the margarita (organic) was really good and well done. My dish was the crab cake. Good portion if you are not a huge portion fanatic. Was very good and the crab cake was real crab. Coffee was really good as well. The bread was still warm! I like this place.
author: Ade R.

description: Got very upset when ordered steamed clams only to find out that out of about 20 clams 10 were empty :(
author: Vadim K.

description: Great Food!  Had the Clam Chowder and the Surf and Turf.  Excellent service and food!
author: Ryan O.

description: Great place to eat! Staff was amazing and so was their food!! Their clam chowder was fantastic! With a view of the bay can even see Alcatraz.
author: Karen B.

description: They have the best clam chowder I've ever had. I loved the view, the service & wish it were closer to home!
author: _ C.

description:
This is a surprisingly great restaurant right in the heart of Fisherman's Wharf.  My mother and I visited San Francisco over the recent holiday and spent one afternoon strolling from the Ferry Building down to Pier 39.  There were already good reviews of this place, so we made a reservation through Open Table (which was nice and easy on a Sunday afternoon) and did some souvenir shopping while we waited for our late lunch.

The hostess seated us at our reservation time to the minute, and we had a great window seat looking directly out on the pier, the Rock, and the beautiful bridge.  Our server Barry was excellent; he was friendly and attentive without hovering, and he got everything right the first time with no hesitation.  I think I overheard him say that he just moved to San Francisco.  I mention this because it sounded like he was trying to play down a heavy British accent - don't you know us American girls (well, at least me and my mom) love that sort of thing?!

All of our dishes and drinks came out perfectly.  We had an appetizer from the specials list - the Dungeness crab and spinach dip - which was delicious, and mom had the "Escape from Alcatraz" cocktail, which she loved.  I had the Gewurztraminer, which is impossible to get by the glass in Florida, so I was thrilled.  For the main dish, I had the Halibut special with quinoa, pine nuts, and arugula, and mom had the garlic whole Dungeness crab.  Both of our dishes were wonderful - perfectly cooked and seasoned, and everything was obviously fresh and carefully prepared.

The meal wasn't too expensive, and certainly worth the price both for the quality and the volume of food we received.  It is definitely a worthwhile spot to relax, refresh, and refuel while seeing the sights!
author: Ramona T.

description:
I wanted to take my mom to a nice restaurant where she can have great expierence and eat something delicious. First off, we were seated and patiently waiting for our server to greet us, as most Restaurants do nowadays. We had another server who greeted us, so unprofessional. He stated that our server for the evening was actually not him but someone else and he was currently on break for the next 20 minutes! Who says that? We asked for a round of water to start with before ordering our drinks and appetizers. This server brought out glasses of water with no ice nor straws, luke warm water on a pretty hot day in City, not to mention how greasy/dirty did the glasses look. Where is the great customer service and best quality of customer care you can get from a moderate expensive restaurant? I totally get it if this was from an Apple Bees but no from this kind of restaurant. 

The food was "ok" not to impress with the quality of food, I could have eaten a better meal somewhere else and much less expensive. 

Finally our so call server came back from break, he greeted all of his tables except for us, seriously? We had our meals and didn't even bother to intorduce himeself until towards the end of our meal course. He didn't even check on us, to see how our meals were, if he can get us anything else, perhaps another soft drink, beer, or a cocktail - no refills were given to us throughout the whole evening. I was very dissapointed. Like I said before I could have recieved a better treatment somewhere else. 

Sometimes a plain-o-fancy restaurant is not all customers need - customer service is a must and ALWAYS! The best quality of food is also needed! 

It must have been that it was located at the Pier and in a very touristy area as well. 

Overall I will give them two stars because I was truly dissapointed with the customer service provided but their food was "OK" not terrible but probably not worth that much.
author: Daisy Z.

description: Chowder excellent!   Crab / Avocado salad delicious.    Salmon was very good.   Service was prompt.    4 Stars
author: Dan F.

description: Well, we had yet another outstanding meal here at Fog Harbor Fish House. The other night we tried some dishes from their seasonal offerings and they were just outstanding! The Pumpkin Curry Salmon and Braised Beef Short Rib were spot on delicious. It's always an enjoyable experience here as not only is the food good, but their entire staff is just so gracious and hospitable. Thank you!!
author: Mike H.

description:
Great food, pleasant service (although the hostess was a bit snobby).  We had a 15 minute wait but that was no problem.  They had a nice fireplace with comfy couches to sit on.  We started with clam chowder.  I enjoyed it and as a native new englander, couldn't find anything to complain about.  My mom had the twin lobster tails with wild rice and veggies.  She loved everything except the veggies which were undercooked according to her.  I wanted something different so I went for the beef and shrimp chow mein.  I'm not sure why they called it chow mein because it was definitely more of a lo mein.  Still it was delicious and I'd order it again.  I'm not a fan of ginger at all, and did bite into a few tiny pieces, so perhaps I'd ask if it could be prepared without the ginger.  

People with reservations get seated at the window tables first.  We sat in a booth right next to those tables, so we had as nice a view as if we were at a window table.  Some people complained that they couldn't sit at a window table even though they were seated in the booths around us and still had a great view.  

I'd definitely come back again.
author: Anastasia E.

description: I came here last week with my sister, specifically looking for clam chowder in a bread bowl. The sourdough bowl was fantastic; however, the clam chowder was definitely mediocre and lacking seasoning. We also tried the ginger lemonade. It was refreshing and delicious. Lovely view of the bay as well.
author: Hannah N.

description: I really enjoyed this restaurant but it was a bit touristy.  In all fairness, I was a tourist too.  We had a short wait, even though the restaurant was pretty busy.  The view, from our table, was nice.  The entrees we had were excellent and the service was great.  I wasn't use to a server telling me she had to take a break, but the server that filled in was just as good.  I did not notice on the receipt until after I left but the restaurant charged a surcharge percentage for the employee's health care plan.
author: Randy B.

description:
Yes, the rumors are true, their clam chowder soup is good.Get it while it's hot! 
First of all, I totally love the view. The restaurant is right next to the bay on the second floor Pier, so anywhere you sit, you can dine and enjoy the ocean/harbor view. I like to daydream while I eat, so this place was a dream come true. 
Service was superb, they seated us prompted and gave us a quick meal as we mentioned we were on a time constraint. I order oyster anywhere I go, and theirs were fresh, no surprises though since this is the bay area. Really wished I had time to try the Dungeoness crab, but we were rushing around. But no worries, I will be back for you, San Francisco!
author: Vy L.

description: Tasty little spot with good service. Had to wait but really enjoyed the mussel fries and clam chowder. Had a hearty taste!
author: Steph R.

description: We've tried a few seafood restaurants in this area but kept getting disappointed. This place took us by surprise. You've got to try the shellfish platter. It was so good. The seafood was pretty fresh and the portion was quite large. We ordered extra plates in case the platter was small but ended up with lots of leftovers. The price is quite decent as well. The line can be long at lunch time but they take your phone number down and text you when your table is ready so you don't have to wait in line. Will definitely come back again.
author: Joy H.

description: Beautiful view of the harbor. The service was  professional and inviting. This trip the food was good but not out of the ordinary. We had the market price Salmon and Mixed grill. The presentation was acceptable but not exciting to the eye. The taste was just not over the top. Absolutely no wow factor. I also got the clam chowder. Again the taste was good but not great. If you want an awesome view inviting ambiance and welcoming attentive service. This is your place. Mila, Thanks for a your wonderful table service.
author: Gigi H.

description:
When in San Fran, I always get cioppino and this place did not disappoint!  Cioppino was full of awesome mussels, clams, fish and shrimp.  We had the calimari as an appetizer and not only was it amazing, but they brought out way more than we could possible eat- so bring your appetite!  Michael took great care of us...
Will definitely be back.
author: Michelle M.

description: Overrated.  Overpriced.  Lobster was over cooked. Filet mignon was just ok. The size of meal you get is pretty small. Make sure you're not that hungry. Clam chowder was decent. But not the best.
author: A.J. C.

description: Glad we booked our table ahead of time! The food was amazing will definitely be back!
author: Harry R.

description: Great restaurant with great service.  Would recommend this restaurant if you're looking for a nicer sit down establishment. All the food we ordered was delicious. Not a bad item on the menu. Great scenery also.
author: Tamra S.

description: The service was heinous! The food was ok... I will never bring my gorgeous girl back to this place!
author: Brian H.

description:
I had a great experience eating dinner here! Jeremy, who is our waiter did an excellent job, despite the fact that he spilled wine on the table. We all make mistakes, right? 
He was friendly and very professional. And had a great smile! We all loved him. The manger also was very accommodating! He gave us a free bottle of wine and a desert :) 
Overall, our experience here was fantastic!
author: Shou W.

description: This place has no flavor. I hate to say it because the service was great, very accommodating and the menu is complete... Anything you want is here. Great location. But this is a restaurant, and the food all tastes the same... Flavorless! I would not return. Super expensive to get food that I wouldn't give to the dogs. We had fish and chips, Mac n cheese, salad, bread, etc. and it all tasted the same, like they ran out of spices?!? Go to the market and get some spices please!
author: Mike C.

description: loved this place. i arrived around 530pm on a tuesday. i was quickly seated and they gave me a table with a view which was fantastic. my server was polite and very sweet. she bought us out our drinks and appetizers out quickly. our meal did take a little long but with the view i had i didnt mind. the food was DELICIOUS. the clam chowder is to dye for. will be coming back!
author: Marge G.

description:
This is a great restaurant, especially for a big group (ask for the Alcatraz room) that needs / wants to unwind after a long day at a tradeshow or work in general.  Waiters are very attentive and also provide some entertainment!  Menu has a lot of San Francisco classics - clam chowder, Shrimp or Crab Louis, and tons of seafood - and they also have steaks.  I like the Pacific Sole or the Swordfish.  Crab cakes are awesome and can also be ordered as an entree.  

If you want a nice view, you can request a table by the window, but this really only works if you have a small party (like 6 or less to get a booth that faces the window of a table right next to it).
author: Evelyn B.

description:
Second time here. Beautiful views, effective service and good menu that is reasonably priced. Quality food in a very touristy environment. Unlike other nearby restaurants that prey on tourists, this restaurant does care. 
We went day after valentine's day, which server said was busiest day in restaurant s history. Waited one hour on Sunday after valentine's day, which we spent walking the pier. 
At 730 pm they were already running out of fresh fish. Ordered mix grill and seafood pasta. Mix grill was decent but small portions. Loved the garlic broccoli. Nice bottle of well priced riesling. Seafood pasta basically only had cod in it. When we ultimately complained both waiter and manager apologized and gave meal AND Dessert free. They just ran out of fish. When a company has a problem but then rectifies so well, it is much appreciated. 
This is certainly not the City's best fish house, but a good bet for the tourist fisherman's wharf area.
author: Greg L.

description: Great location, view, oysters, clam chowder and bread - amazingly reasonable price on top of all that! I highly recommend.
author: Celina M.
