description: The view is amazing. The food was delicious. The service was excellent. I would highly recommend this restaurant.  The dungeness crab was excellent and the surf and turf was expertly prepared. Good cocktails.  Not inexpensive but worth it. The view alone.
author: Sandra A.

description: I went to this very lovely restaurant with my friends. We were enjoying our time, but then one of the employees started cussing right next to us. He dropped the F-bomb at least 3 times. We asked our server if we could talk to a manager. When the manager came he asked us what the problem was, and just when we were about the to tell the manager, the employee was standing nearby making it very obvious that he was listening to our conversation. I decided to tell the manager anyway. He was very friendly and apologetic. He told us that he would handle the situation and that he does not allow unprofessional behavior from any of his employees. For the rest of our stay the employee glared at us from a distance. He even glared at us as we were leaving.  I walked out with confidence. Dinner was delicious!
author: Esther C.

description:
Took my visiting mom here for some fish & chips and it was a-ok. The view is remarkable and worth a visit for any tourists. The food is about what you'd expect in Pier 39. 

All and all a decent experience if you're looking to patronize any of the Pier 39-area restaurants and stay budget-conscious.
author: Nadine H.

description: Very friendly staff at the bar, delicious food. I highly recommended. I wanted to try the lobster Mac and cheese because I saw it on a yelp post but they weren't offering at the current time. They were nice enough to accommodate my request and make it for me. It was awesome! The clam chowder in a bread was delicious too. Very nice food. My review is for dinner time.
author: Lacomida C.

description:
Overall, a great experience but unnecessary for the hostesses to keep us waiting outside in the cold while they set up our 15 minute table in an empty restaurant. 

Oysters- fresh and tasty 
Cioppino with linguini for extra $2- yummy and large but wished they provided more pasta
Garlic fried crab- overly drenched in butter and lackluster in flavor 
Service- great
author: Sherry P.

description: Ate here with the family. The appetizers were great - the sliders, calamari and crab legs. Hubby had the ciopino and shrimp, really good. The kids had the clam chowder and salmon, yummy. I had the ahi, it was ok. Had too much sesame, should have read the description. I ended it with good sauvignon blanc wine so it was all ok.
author: Billie B.

description:
Awesome Moscow mule served just right in a copper mug.  We did not eat here because it was more touristy then what we were looking for hat night.

Seemed very busy so I assume the food is good.  They had a nice looking menu.
author: Katelin M.

description: Very impressive! Scallops were good if you like them fried. Mixed Grill was great as well as the Fish and Chips-not too greasy! Dessert was wonderful. They have an interesting Chocolate Martini and a great Apple Crisp. Though the food was great, the best part was the view of the bay. Definitely try to get a window table. Enjoy!
author: Keyaun H.

description: The best clam chowder in a bread bowl I have ever and will ever have! Phenomenal!! Chase it down with a Anchor Steam and you're good to go! My GF and I absolutely loved this place. From the ambience to the outstanding service. If it's the famous Clam Chowder in a Sourdough Bowl you're looking for ....Fog Harbor is the place to go.
author: Robert F.

description: Delicious, and perfectly spiced halibut. This was my first visit and and I'll be back for sure. Thanks for the great service as well!!!!
author: Anne L.

description: Best place to eat in Fishermen's Wharf IMO. A lot of its very touristy, but this place seemed more high end and less cheese-tastik plus the view is very nice. We got the crab dip appetizer and it was ok, I didn't think there was much to it. The chowder was good, but not my favorite. The entrees really stood out here. The mussels were awesome and had an amazing broth. The tuna steak was seared perfectly rare and very tasty. The mashed potatoes lacked seasoning and might have been instant. Our server was great, very attentive and knew the menu well.
author: Faith A.

description: This place is superb! Went here the dat after vday .. It was def packed and a long wait buuuut luckily i made reservations 2 weeks prior lol the food was awesome, the customer service was awesome. Everything was great. We had great seats by the water with an amazing view. Ordered a bottle of champagne ($34) dollars and made it a super classy meal. The CRAB CAKES ARE TO KILL FOR. So most and full of crab. Seriously delicious. The hype about this place was their clam chowder bowl which i thought was ok. I wasnt blown away by it but literally everything was great. Highly recommended place for an anniversary, birthday, or proposal dinner!
author: Marcus P.

description:
As most locals do, I usually avoid Pier 39 like the plague because it's always so crowded. When I found out a work dinner had been booked at a restaurant at Pier 39, I wasn't thrilled. In hindsight, I'm really glad they chose that location because I wouldn't have discovered this great restaurant. Fog Harbor is well worth braving the tourist masses.

Fog Harbor is located at the front of Pier 39, upstairs on the left side. There is an outdoor seating area with a fireplace and comfy couches. Once inside, there is a small bar just to the right and tons of table seating, all with great views. We sat in the back right area of the restaurant, where we had a view of both Alcatraz and the Golden Gate Bridge.

Our server was really helpful and friendly. Every item on our order came out correctly and within a reasonable amount of time, and the food was delicious! All in all it was a great dining experience and I'm sure we'll be back soon.
author: Kimberly Y.

description: It started out a bit rocky because I called in to make sure the restaurant could hold our reservation since we were running slightly late (being stuck on Embarcadero traffic).  After having booked a few city reservations in my time, I'm fairly certain I get how they work ~ long story short, everything worked out.  We had a lovely, very attentive waitress named Ashley.  Our food was served on time and fresh.  The calamari had a kick to it because it was both crunchy and a little spicy since it was served with pieces of jalepeno peppers ~ loved it.  I ordered a bowl of clam chowder with crab.  It was light and flavorful, with the crab bits adding the right amount of fill to the dish.  Clam chowder is a simple enough soup but, yes, it can go horribly wrong.  Fog Harbor got it right.  The view was refreshing, the company I kept (my engaging and very entertaining family) was top notch, and the food was definitely what we came for.
author: Joy H.

description:
Same prices as everywhere else on the wharf once you factor in the price of the drinks at the other places. We had chowder in sourdough bowls and a beer. $27. 
We had exceptional service, a beautiful view, and delicious food! Highly recommend.
author: Stefanie R.

description: Excellent service, great food, Our server suggested the ahi poke and baked oyster for starters,we gave it a try and OMG,best ahi poke ever!!! Oysters were ok,"am not a oyster lover anyway" we also had the chili crab, lobster tail and the cioppino to share and we ended up with the dessert combo, we would definitely come back to this place because the food and the excellent service our waiter Oscar provided us.
author: Pau S.

description: Chowder is absolutely fabulous!!!! Calamari w/ lemon aioli -- yuuuuuummmy! Sourdough bread is served hot and is sooooo good- addictive- fried shrimp is butterflied, not my favorite way to have shrimp, but very good. Good fries and coleslaw- fish / chips good, light, huge portion, had to give hubs a piece- sea bass absolutely delish!!!!!!!! Great service from the hostess to the waiter! Very engaging. Reservations were for 6:30, we were able to get in at 5:30 and got a great view. My complaint... Food comes out at a rapid rate. No time to savor and enjoy..
author: Evie B.

description: Though my 1st visit didn't start well.... it ended well. Fog Harbor burger is awesome as well as the baked Oysters. Have visited multiple times and since I drive tourist this is 1 of 2 places that I recommend
author: A D.

description:
The sourdough bread bowl for the clam chowder was amazing, but for salad and clam chowder it comes in at a whopping $15pp, but can be expected for being directly on the pier. The check with dessert  came to around $50 for 2 before tip with only tea and soda ordered for drinks. 

The views are great with a window over looking the harbor where you can see the sea lions resting on pier 39. 

The service was varied. the food came out fast and multiple servers would come to refill drinks, but no one checked on us during any point when refilling glasses and we had to ask to see the dessert tray.
author: Shannon S.

description: This place is amazing! The Dungeness crab cakes are to die for! I had the clam chowder sourdough bread bowl with crab, and he had the crab sandwich. Both were amazing! Our server Maron was the best! She made wonderful suggestions, and made the dining experience memorable!
author: Samantha D.

description:
Every time my family and I come up to San Francisco, we always stop by here for a meal. 

Service is excellent!!! Ask for Bong. He's amazing and definitely treats you like family. 

Food. Oh gosh, the oysters were delicious. My sister had the salmon, which was caught the day we dined. I had the ahi tuna, which was just as good. And the cioppino is always my parents' go-to. 

It can get a bit pricey, but you're paying for excellent food and excellent service.
author: Marielle S.

description: Excellent clam chowder in a sourdough bread bowl! Definitely opt to add crab! Oysters are superb!!!! Really great view of a the bay and excellent atmosphere. Would definitely return!
author: Kristen K.

description:
First, I need to give a shout-out to Faycal and Oscar. Their service was five star quality. Be sure to ask for them the next time you're dining at Fog Harbor.

Ours was a big party - two full tables - and we were seated in the back of the restaurant, which had lovely views, but no air circulation. As the sun went down, the room became entirely too stuffy for comfort. I had to get up to walk outside several times just to clear my head. The bar and main restaurant areas were a good 10-15 degrees cooler. That said, it was really nice outside; the wharf is a beautiful place to have dinner.

The fried calamari is an excellent way to start a meal at Fog Harbor. Crispy and expertly cooked, they were absolutely delicious.

If you like sourdough bread, then you'll love the stuff here. People at our tables also raved about the clam chowder, the tuna and the garlic-roasted crab. 

The red chili prawns are flavorful, and pack a decent zing, but the steamed clams lacked flavor. Stick with the more highly spiced dishes and you'll be fine.

Desserts were A-OK as well. Nothing too fancy. Our table had just about every dish offered, and I tried most of them. My favorites were the blondie, the apple crisp, and the cheesecake.
author: Maria S.

description:
Went here to have dinner with friends, were looking for a nice spot by the water for some good seafood, and one friend who is local recommended fog harbor.  Well, it would have been good, except for the fact that my entree never arrived!  The waiter didn't acknowledge that until my friends were done eating, and said "oh, your food will be out shortly" to which I suggested that I no longer even wanted it (I wasn't going to sit and eat after they were all done).  He said, "ok, well we will take it off the bill then" and moved on with life... of course I am not paying for it - I didn't even get it!!  

Now, these things happen, but as a former waitress myself, I would have sent a manager over or even comped dessert - nothing.  Then, when I went to check my credit card bill, turns out the waiter decided to give himself a nice big tip!!  Am absolutely livid - be warned before you decide to eat here.
author: Lynn H.

description:
Yes, 4 star is for Fog Harbor. I went with my Fiance to have dinner a few days ago. We went on a little mini adventure for food. Our frist time at the Fog Harbor. THE CUSTOMER SERVICE WAS EXCELLENT!  although the food was not as great, i come for a good experince of customer service and i got that from the bar and NELSON was our server. awesome server! I got a fish and chips with fries and it was not what i expected. Ive had BETTER fish n' chips. my partner got herself a bowl of clam chowder and baked oysters. She liked the Oysters, since she wanted to try something out of the ordinary. she said baked oysters was OK. 

Her Clam Chowder on the other hand, she took 2 bites and she was done! she said the clam chowder tasted like its been sitting out to get it to our table. Basically she said the chowder was not what she expected. she was expecting something delish since we are at the Harbor and they are known for their chowder. 

Overall, i will probably give this place another chance for a 2nd come back. MAYBE their other entrees are better.
author: P S.

description: Good place when you are hanging around this area. It's a nice spring day. Not too hot, not too cold. We enjoyed the the food. The price ok for SF higher end dining. Khaiman was our waiter. He is a nice guy and took care of us. The Oyster was excellent giving me some mojo for a few days. Try the Calamari too. I ordered the Laguenita IPA beer that worked out well. The Clan Chauder was good in that bread bowel as well. Try the place if you can spend money on food. It's a good dining experience.
author: Ali B.

description:
We have a large party of 9 for Mother's day dinner.

1. Reservation, with open table was easy. However, I am very disappointed at their services. First off, I have requested 4 times (4x) to sit by the window and they said no problem four time.. ended up sitting by the bathroom!

2. if you don't ask, they won't give you. I have to ask for bread and water. LOL.. seriously needed to ask them to fill our water, but there were 6 cups only 2 were filled up.. and the empty one is right next to the full one!! WTF.. what kind of service was that.

3. no surprise with food, nothing really worth raving about. 

I don't think i would consider there again, especially with large group. BTW, they do charge a standard 18% surcharge for large groups..
author: E C.

description:
Love Love Love !!!

Excellent: sourdough bread, blue cheese garlic bread, clam chowder!

Highly recommend!!
author: Leslie E.

description:
After just 3 years in the Bay Area I still feel like a tourist. So any opportunity to act like one is taken with gusto. My cousin came in on a cruise ship en route to Alaska or something and she wanted to see my family while she was at port. 

Now - I have 2 kids, a 2 year old and a 11 month old, so I am always cautious not to go out to restaurants that are not kid friendly. Luckily, most tourist venues fit the bill - even nicer one's like Fog Harbor.  

I made reservations right here with Open Table, noted that I had 2 kids and we were set-up with crayons, a coloring menu and a very attentive, patient staff. 

Now onto the food - it was good, nothing too fancy. I had a delicious steak, fried calamari, my wife enjoyed an Ahi Tuna and our guests were full from Chinese Dim-Sum - but they did have some lovely shrimp cocktail.

I can't complain, the 4 stars were really for the kid-friendly atmosphere and great views from almost anywhere inside. Oh and they validated parking. 

TLDR version: Good for kids, good food, validate parking, enjoy the Pier :)

p.s. there is an awesome merry-go-round at the end of the pier, it was epic. :)
author: Pierre C.

description: Nice view, nice food and wonderful service. Samir is a nice waiter. I definitely will visit again in the future
author: Link C.

description: Food and service were very good for a restaurant in tourist's row at the wharf.  Great seats overlooking the water.  Seafood was well prepared and very tasty.
author: Len S.

description: Stopped by on a recent trip to san fran, and their food is delicious! The seafood in their pasta was so fresh and the view of the harbor made the food taste that much better. The clam chowder was also great.
author: Connie S.

description: This place was awesome! The clam chowder in the bread bowl was delicious and we topped it off with some hot chocolate cake, perfect ending to a perfect meal. Our server was Meron and she was really nice and had great suggestions. I'd definitely recommend coming here, even if only for the views of Alcatraz or the bridge!
author: Callie R.

description:
Why would this Finding Nemo lovin' girl like the Fog Harbor Fish House? 

I'll tell you why. Lean in...


...a little closer...



...juuuuust a bit closer...


Because it does. The End. 
(Just Kidding!)
The food has great quality, you'll fill up on the free sourdough bread (the best I've had), they have wonderful meals and for a fishy joint, it's not all bad. Compared to OTHER restaurants that primarily serve seafood, I have to say Fog Harbor blows them out of the water. 

You have a beautiful scenic view, there are large windows showing the skyline and water of San Francisco. They validate and you have many other attractions on the Pier 39 wharf. Do yourself a favor and use yelp to reserve a reservation. It was a God-send for me and my party.
author: Jackie H.

description:
Just Delightful!

I was in San Francisco for a conference and had an early dinner at the Fish House. We had an amazing view and the food was fresh and flavorful!

I strongly encourage anyone who is going to be in the area to try this restaurant, even the prices were reasonable. A 5* all around!
author: Mary C.

description: my favorite fish place in san francisco. its soooo good. their fish n chips are really good thats my usual. their calamari is really good it comes with fried jalapenos which are tasty and fried onions. also their clam chowder is really good. for desert i shared a banana and chocolate bread pudding that was good. the thing that i love most about this place, the bread. i could eat basket after basket if i couldnt stop. its so fresh and tasty. i highly recommend. if you decide not to go good, less wait for me. lol. but seriously its very good. my mom even likes it after going multiple times, and she usually doesnt go back to places more than twice because she claims nothing tastes better than the first time. she ordered the halibut and loved it.
author: Steven C.

description:
Very upscale restaurant!  More so than I was expecting.  We tried the Dungeness Crab Cocktail for an appetizer - very fresh!  The clam chowder soup was outstanding.  So creamy and delicious.  I had the special lobster roll for my main dish and it was great.  Good pieces of lobster.  Stuffed when we left!  Service was only ok, but food was great!

312/365
author: Emily C.

description: There are a lot of restaurant choices on Pier 39. We stayed for 10 days so we had the chance to try quite a few. I thought Fog Harbor was a step up from the other restaurants. It had a more classy feel to it, with more intimate lighting and decor. I ordered the cioppino, which is a fish stew like a bouliabaise - I'm sure my spelling is not correct! - and it was great. My husband had salmon which was equally great. Everything in SF is really expensive and this restaurant charges the San Francisco mandate tax, like most other SF businesses do. That adds another 5% tax to their already high sales tax, so be aware of that anywhere in SF that you travel. I thought the service was very friendly and professional, too.
author: Nancy C.

description:
Great location on Pier 39. Had the platter for two. Was good, came with crab, mussels, clams, shrimp and corn. Tasty buttery garlic sauce. The Caesar salad was really good. Dinner comes with hot baked sour dough bread. Platter was just perfect for two. Desserts all looked delicious, had the Apple Crisp. Yum! Comes with a scoop of vanilla bean ice cream. 
Atmosphere was nice, had a table over looking the water. Prices are decent. So good ate here twice on one trip!!
author: Chelle A.

description: Returned here from our trip of last year and again  it did not disappoint. ...our waitress, ariana was polite and on point....chatting with us and providing feedback on the food.  The fish and chips were delicate and flavorful...French fries were delish...fried platter also was light and delish....the chowder was filled with clams and the oysters were as fresh as could be....our table was at,the window and the view was delightful....will return
author: Elizabeth F.

description:
As a Bay Area resident, I try to avoid eating where tourists normally flock to. But since we were in the area playing "tourists", I booked us a reservation for 2. 

The restaurant is situated in the heart of Pier 39. The inside is classy without being too intimidating. You can come in here dressed up for a date night or casually stroll in wearing jeans and tennis shoes. They have sone awesome window seats overlooking the bay and the Alcatraz view. 

They start you off with fresh-out-the-oven sourdough bread. I usually shy away from white bread, but I just can't say no to crunchy on the outside, soft and warm inside--fantastic sourdough bread. We also ordered the calamari and clam chowder for appetizers. The calamari is great! The batter is very light, crisp and tasty. It's served with lemon aioli sauce. The clam chowder was also very yummy. It was the right creamy texture with good flavor and the perfect amount of saltiness.
For our main entrées, I got the Seared Tuna with a side of mashed potatoes and my bf ordered the whole garlic crab with fingerling potatoes. Blame the appetizers because I didn't get to finish my entrée. However, the tuna was delicious. Perfect seared exterior with the pink inside. It wasn't overly seasoned, and still featured the natural flavor of the tuna. My bf devoured THE WHOLE CRAB. That means it's good right?

I will definitely brave the touristy crowd and the expensive parking to eat some great seafood from here.
author: Carmela A.

description: We ate here twice during our vacation and were equally impressed and satisfied each visit. The food & service were great. We were surprised to get such great food and have such awesome service in an area (pier 39) populated with chains or restaurants relying on their location to carry them all these years. Best sourdough I've ever had. The clam chowder is fantastic, the fish and chips were great and the crab roll was out of this world.The kids ended their meal with hot fudge Sunday's for $0.95. We'll definitely make this place a staple of our SF vacations.
author: Eric L.

description: Today was my 50+ birthday. My crazy sister decided we should pretend to be tourist at the Pier! I picked Fog Harbor Fish House. From the moment we walked in the service was incredible. I don't know how long we waited but it was no very long. Loved our seating the view was great of Alcatraz.  Our server Pierre was incredible, making my birthday more enjoyable!  We split & order the  Calamari  perfect! I had the Clam Chowder/Salad combination. The soup was in a sour dough bowl (I try to avoid bread). NOT today! OMG so creamy delicious.  Pierre made sure we were taken care of and then; He came over with the most delicious desert plate of a creamy dark chocolate cake, vanilla bean ice cream & fresh whipped cream.  I & speaking for my Sister, Pierre was perfect, thank you for being so attentive, and to all the other thanks for the best birthday.  I need to hit the gym good food! I will recommend & return great staff.
author: Karolyn H.

description:
very beautiful restaurant! though the wait for four was fourty minutes, it was very worth it. the service was quick and very friendly- props to Martin!
the seafood was very fresh and very delicious. i had the swordfish- super tender, very moist and sweet, an amazing meal. my aunt had the crab and my uncle had the cod, as my cousin had shrimp- everyone was amazingly thrilled with their dinner. the ambiance is casual and very inviting. we aren't "locals" but we aren't "tourists" either; but regardless whether you're visiting from far away for close, definitely visit this restaurant. it's worth every penny.
author: Amanda H.

description:
My girlfriend and I had the crab, mango, and avocado ceviche as well as the garlic dungeness crab. The food was phenomenal and worth every penny! We also got a bottle of moscato wine, which was delicious. We asked to sit by the window, and the staff was more than accommodating. The view was beautiful. 

If you're looking for a great place to splurge for awesome seafood, stop here.
author: Carden B.

description: This place was surprisingly good! It's located in probably THE most touristy spot in town, so we were skeptical. We didn't have reservations, but were seated right away. They have a great selection of drinks to choose from. The blue cheese garlic bread, calamari, and scallops apps were all REALLY good! Their sourdough bread is awesome, and the chowder bread bowl was some of the best around. Fantastic views of the water and GG Bridge, with reasonably priced good seafood and fantastic drinks ..... we recommend it!
author: Ann H.

description: Made a reservation for dinner and requested a table with a view. They seated us at a table with a beautiful view of the Bay, Alcatraz, and the Golden Gate Bridge. For starters I had a chocolate martini and hubby had a Manhattan. Both prepared perfectly. For appetizer we had the calamari served with jalapeno and onion and drizzled with lemon aioli. It was the best calamari we have ever had. Absolutely loved it! We also had a cup of clam chowder and it was excellent. For entrees we both had the jumbo scallops over a bed of arugula and quinoa with pine nuts. It was to die for. Best scallops we ever had. Cooked to perfection, tender and juicy. Our whole dining experience here was wonderful. Our waitress, Ashley, did an excellent job of taking care of us on a very busy night, and her recommendations were spot on. We thoroughly enjoyed our dining experience at Fog Harbor. Kudos to all for a wonderful dining experience. The chef's are fantastic! This place is definitely fit for us foodies and our foodie friends. We will be back!
author: Sue C.

description:
First time in SF so I wanted to have the best clam chowder bread bowl experience. This IS a tourist trap! 

For three people, we each got the clam chowder bread bowl, a salad, the tuna ahi poke, calamari and two cocktails. Total before tip comes to about $95 dollars. Not worth it for appetizer meals. 

Although the chowder was good, nothing about it was outstanding from the rest of the chowders. I wish it contained more or cost less. What makes up for the price is the view of the bay; but depending on where you were seated it wasn't much of a view.
author: Christine N.

description: Great location. Gave the crab a try. Not a crab guy but was pleasently surprised and enjoyed it. Rest of fam enjoyed the fish n chips and grilled fish were divine. Good service look forward to coming back.
author: D K.

description: The manager and wait staff helped me select items that were dairy free. The crab roll morphed into a crab sandwich on excellent sourdough bread. I tasted my friends' desserts. Perfection.
author: Ayla M.

description: A little disappointed here. Hostess want the friendliest but the service while very slow was friendly. Food was good but I wasn't blown away. Clam chowder was excellent but very rich! Crab Louis salad wasn't worth the price tag!
author: Rachel V.

description: Excellent choice after a night cruise to Alcatraz. The atmosphere was warm and inviting. Great service, warm bread and nice house Merlot. We started with clam chowder to warm up after the cold cruise. The chicken with mashed and spinach was fantastic, and the fish and chips were delicious! Nice finish to a great day in San Francisco.
author: Victoria C.

description: Highly recommend this place.  Chowder is AMAZING!  We always make it a point to stop in for chowder every time we are in SF.  We had Madison this time as our server.  She is phenomenal!!!  Ask for her, you won't be disappointed.  We will be back soon!!
author: Britton J.

description: I would normally leave a full detailed review. But frankly it's not worth my time to invest even a second leaving a review for this restaurant. My wife and I left very unhappy. The quality and service is terrible. I do not recommend it.
author: Giovanni F.

description: Listen...there are soooo many great places to eat in San Fran.....this place is mediocre at best.... Find a place that the servers are passionate about the food they serve ...this place has order takers that dress up to cater to the tourists that get caught up in the hype of seafood and San Fransisco..
author: Jim R.

description: Excellent bar - Barrel Aged Manhattan with oysters to start.  In crab season you can't beat their garlic roasted whole Dungeness crab!  Great service, even if just for one guy at the bar.  Comfortable place to relax, and AWESOME harbor views.
author: John K.

description:
AMAZING! My sister flew in today and I wanted to show her a good time.  We decided on Fog Harbor at Pier 39, and we're glad we did.    I had the Ahi Tuna and it was absolutely incredible.  My sister had the crab cake entree, and from the look of orgasm that came across her face as she ate, I would say she loved it.

The restaurant venue was very nice, with views of the GG bridge.  If the food and ambiance were not enough, the service was remarkable.  Oscar was our waiter and was very helpful, and Ryan, the manager, stopped by to check on us and make sure we were enjoying our experience.

I'll definitely be back! Thanks Fog Harbor!
author: Manny O.

description:
Came here after walking the area and the menu and view looked good from afront. It is a white table cloth type of place with large windows and a view from almost every table. The bar scene was vibrant but we were at a table. There was no wait as compared to other places with a wait. Perhaps because they are located upstairs, people don't know about it.

I had the bread chowder bowl and a crab cocktail. The crab cocktail was small for the price. They give you really good sourdough bread while you wait. The service was friendly. All in all, a good experience.
author: Steve V.

description: Amazing food and service (Bernie)! We had a the clam chowder in bread bowl, sliders and baked oysters to eat. To drink; the gimlet and dirty martini. Everything was on point and we were very pleased with Fog Harbor.
author: M H.

description:
Your typical touristy restaurant. Nothing amazing about it, not terrible either by any means.

First of all, I will mention that this location is superb and the views are amazing. This added some enjoyment to the experience. Unfortunately, the experience was rather meh.

The biggest downfall to our visit was the fact that our server was very timid and didn't explain anything that well. It felt instead of being a knowledgeable server, he was rather just fetching our meal/drinks back and forth.

I ordered the lobster tail which was pretty tasty, but the vegetables that accompanied the dish were under-seasoned and boring.

If you can, steer clear and spend your money elsewhere.
author: Dante M.

description: Great food. I'm glad I came here. We got crab cakes, jumbo shrimp, and lobster tail. Loved all of them. I wish I could try more.
author: Stephen B.

description: If you're near pier 39, come to this restaurant! Everything we got was fresh, not heavy, an absolutely delicious. From the freshly baked sourdough garlic bread to the lobster Mac and cheese to the mixed seafood platter, everything was delicious and they don't skimp on the portions. Come here, for what you get for the price you will not be disappointed!!
author: Jake M.

description:
My wife and I had a great time! We were anxious to find some great clam chowder while in SF and this place did not disappoint! The sourdough bread bowl was incredible! The best we've had while on the West Coast. 

Our service was very good. It's clear the service team knows they provide great food and it shows in how they take care of their guests. Our waiter was very knowledgable and efficient. We did have to do a little bit if waiting but only because we went on a busy Saturday in early August. All that in mind, the service was very good. 

The prices are not cheap but not overly outrageous. We got what we paid for and left happy!
author: Jarred H.

description: We have used yelp for several restaurants on this trip and this one BY FAR IS THE BEST! Get the Ahi Poke, it literally melts in your mouth. For an appetizer we had the fried scallops with jalapeño dipping sauce..wow seriously incredible  the clam chowder was also to die for... Pretty much everything we ordered was the best we've ever had. Also for 15% off go to the welcome area next door
author: Rebecca C.

description: I just had to visit this place on Pier 39 to sample the famous crab and it didn't disappoint. The rest of their seafood was delicious too. The one gripe I have is that there was quite a shady character seated behind us who tried to skip out on his bill and security had to be called. The host should really be a better judge of character than that.
author: Matthew R.

description:
Outstanding views.  Friendly but slow service:  we were seated right away but it took 10-15 minutes for a waiter to show up and take our drink order and another 10-15 minutes to actually receive our drink order (very fresh cold Lagunitas IPA, Yummy!).  This slow theme repeated itself throughout the meal.  No biggie, we weren't in a hurry but it seemed like the waiter was spread too thin and the lag times were noticeable....not really a good thing.
Sourdough Bread:  A+
Steamed Mussels:  A-
Clam Chowder:  A
Crab Roll:  B+/A-
Tuna Poke Salad:  B+/A-
Lagunitas IPA:  A
All in all a nice meal.  Were it not for the slow service and low cozy factor of Pier 39, we would be back.
author: David K.

description: We had an early dinner and a nice view of Pier 39.  For appetizers, we had the dungeness crab cakes and our daughter had their award winning clam chowder in a sourdough bread bowl.  Hubby had the pacific sole with fingerling potatoes, spinach, peppers, tarragon & capers.  I had the mixed grilled salmon, swordfish and shrimp, with citrus buerre blanc, wild rice and steamed broccoli.  Our daughter had the kids meal fried shrimp & french fries.  The food was delicious, and we were too full for dessert. A couple of hours later, we were able to enjoy the fireworks display over the bay.
author: Racquel E.

description: Delicious calimari, shrimp brochette and mixed grill -  all fantastic.  Warning... calimari is a huuuge portion. Would have been 5 stars but we had to keep asking for water refills (but it is California during a drought...)
author: Jill G.

description: Amazing and you can taste the quality in there seafood and sour dough bread is fresh and hot. Part of the SF experience for sure. I had the clam linguini and the clam chowder and it was fabulous. My aunt from Atlanta had the fried sole and she can't stop talking about it. Hands down a must try.
author: Juicy C.

description: Award winning clam chowder was perfect in a sour dough bread bowl. Fresh bread and butter as an appetizer was excellent. Friendly waiters, fast service, and just a great atmosphere! If your around Pier 39 this is a good place for amazing sea food.
author: Kristi P.

description:
A good place but just 3 stars.

Ambience - excellent, clean, great views
Food - good.  better than most pier 39 tourist spots, but not excellent.
Service - excellent.  one of the better servers I've had in a long time.
Wines and beers - good
author: M F.

description:
I spent a good part of my life in San Francisco, and I have never had a positive food experience at Pier 39. ...until now!  This place is great for groups!  The seafood is fresh, the view is amazing, and the service is en pointe.  

My friend just graduated from medical school. To celebrate, she and her husband planned a lunch at Fog Harbor for their family and about 20 of their closest friends. I was really impressed by the way For Harbor was able to accommodate such a large group with such ease.  We were each allowed to order from the regular menu; no pre-fixe menu needed.  Huge plus!  All of the food came out at the same time and nobody's order was incorrect.  On top of that, the food was definitely delicious. Don't miss the calamari, clam chowder, and crab roll!  I'll be coming back to eat those dishes again. As for the prices, they do run a little on the steep side, but it's not totally unreasonable for a seafood restaurant in one of San Francisco's busiest tourist spots. If you have kids, there is a pretty good kids menu, high chairs, and they give crayons and stuff to color on.  

Quick note, they validate parking for the Pier 39 Parking Garage. One hour free with validation.
author: Emcee K.

description: This place did not have a wow factor. Being 4 1/2 stars, I had high expectations. We got the fried calamari which was good. I give it a 3 stars. My husband got the fried combo which cam with calamari, one fried shrimp and one fried fish (had way to much batter). He really didn't like his dinner. I got a crab with garlic butter. It came with fingerling potatoes and steamed broccoli  (which where huge clusters. I had to cut each one smaller ). The crab itself was a little disappointed. I was hoping for more of a garlic taste. It wasn't bad; I was expecting a more of a garlicky taste since it was called garlic butter crab. The fingerling potatoes were soooo good. It was roasted. I tried it and probably won't come back.
author: Teresa D.

description:
I really wanted to like Fog Harbor, from the beautifully warm and comfortable entry way to beautiful views and what looked like a great menu.  There are so many great seafood restaurants in this area that competition and expectations are high.  

The crab cakes were great.  But from there the experience went downhill quickly.    Part of my food was undercooked while I had to spit out a piece of swordfish because I couldn't chew it and my husband indicated that his dinner was nothing special.  As our meal progressed, I noticed our neighbors sitting for long periods of time waiting for...well, waiting for service.  And soon, we too joined the ranks of the ignored.  Water glasses went unfilled and it took 25 minutes for them to notice that our plates needed to be cleared.  

Now, I enjoy lingering over my dinner, particularly when we have a view of the bay and the food is worth enjoying, but for the money that was spent, the lack of service and food quality was inexcusable.  

It might have been an off night--we're all allowed those--but as we're close enough to the city to visit often and do, this restaurant will not be receiving any more of our business when we're down that way.
author: Tiffany G.

description: The complimentary bread basket was a wonderful way to start out our meal. The sourdough bread was served warm, allowing the butter to melt as we spread it. Though tasty, the calamari was a bit on the salty side for our taste. However, the clam chowder in the bread bowl was delicious. It was served piping hot, and it's taste left a lasting impression before our departure back home.
author: Terry M.

description: Excellent!!! Beautiful view. Impeccable service. Delicious five star food. Caitlyn, our server was friendly and courteous. The food came out quickly. Presentation was perfect. I ordered the shrimp plate and it was fresh and tasty. The fries and coleslaw were great. My husband ordered soup and sliders and loved the plates. We came to San Francisco on a cruise and having excellent fresh food was just what we needed! Thank you! We will be coming back here!!
author: Diana B.

description: Food was decent service was really sub par. The appetizer came after the meal was served and was cold. We never received our second round of drinks that we ordered and those drinking water never received a refill. The server had no clue and even tried to charge us for the second round. This was the second time I have dined here and the first time was excellent but I will definitely try another place next time.
author: John S.

description: We came here on a very cold night, no reservations and was seated right away with wonderful view,the decor was cool kinda low lights with low music playing,I had the  best Salmon BLT on the face of earth I really think (really) the only thing I had to do was take the becon off this was by far a top notch toasted sandwich on a french roll with pesto aioli and fries,my other half had the grilled shrimp brochette w/ sauteed spinach,mashed potatoes,and veggies she said everything was good except the veggies,they were very attentive to our needs,we had two shirt and tie males come to our table asking how was everything and were we o.k. with then 45 mins.while we were there,very good customer services,to tell you the truth I would have been happy just eating the complimentary bread its just that good.
author: Tommy M.

description:
For good seating with a view, MAKE A RESERVATION ahead of time! 

Food: the mediocre-est, whatevs. 
Clams appeteaser: so-so, nothing special.

Service: was great, prompt, even though they were quite busy.

They had me at the warm sourdough bread basket, which doesn't say much for the restaurant at all. 

Oh! And if you're annoyed by tourists, do go elsewhere.
author: Thy N.

description:
Super friendly staff, small but varied menu, and everything was really tasty. I got the garlic half crab and it was drenched in olive oil; super delicious, but trying to crack it and get the meat out was certainly a challenge with slippery hands. 
We went at a fairly busy time and were seated right away, and our food came fairly quickly, as well!
author: A M.

description: My son wanted clam chowder in a bread bowl, and when I punched this information into yelp this restaurant came up. The calamari and chowder were outstanding! The view from the window, close to where we were sitting, was fabulous. We had a clear view of Alcatraz and the sea lions on the docks below. Our waiter was perfectly attentive, and our entire dining experience was exceptional.
author: Tina G.

description: Fantastic food, efficient and gracious service. Clementine was a joy. I chose the salmon special (pumpkin coconut curry, spinach, and seared salmon). More expensive than most of their other dishes, but wonderful. My husband loved his fish and chips. Generous portions. We recommend!
author: Erin D.

description:
Seafood is excellent, staff is very nice and polite.
A bit too expensive, visit "Welcome California Center" to get a discount card.
author: Evgeny G.

description:
It's been two years and this place is still amazing. I brought my co-workers here while on a business trip and we had dinner. Considering the place was full and there were 6 of us, they still seated us quickly. We all ordered an assortment of things and the food came quickly. 

The wait staff was wonderful and even when our first server had to leave and we received a second waiter, they never missed a beat! 

I personally had the salmon, swordfish, shrimp, mashed potatoes and veggies. It was delicious! After it was all said and done I think my favorite part was the restaurant tweeted at me. That was just great.
author: Will B.

description: Awesome views.  Non-touristy place (although it's in the middle of tourist central).  Excellent service.  Pricy but very tasty drinks.   Entrees were lackluster.   It's a rarity that I have to send something back to the kitchen, but talk about overcooked fish.  The manager visited my table and definitely took care of my party for the mishap, but be careful on your entree selection here.  I think there's either a new crew in the kitchen or some kinks that need to be worked out.  All that said, if you're in the area, come here! But maybe for a few drinks and appetizers...and the awesome view.
author: Timothy H.

description: Ew. That is really all I have to say about this place. I was so disappointed when I came here. I was ready to enjoy a fine bowl of cioppino and, instead, all I found was dirty everything. Dirty cups, dirty plates, dirty silverware. It was so unappetizing. We left before we even ordered because of how disgusting it was. Never again.
author: Sienna S.

description: We've eaten here several times and always have a great experience.  The clam chowder bread bowls are terrific, make sure and add the crab to the top.   You can't beat the view and service has always been solid.
author: Rick R.

description: Excellent views and the food was excellent! A little expensive but in a high tourist area so to be expected.
author: Brian G.

description: The service is under par. For the type of restaurant and class, the manners of the waitresses are up to standard. It appears they treat you with disrespect of your not of a certain class. The only good thing about this place is the food.
author: Mike H.

description:
Our clam chowder came fully loaded with PLASTIC SARAN WRAP in it.  Yummy.  We also ordered the ahi poke appetizer (decent) and the crab ceviche (no flavor).   Service was slow- we waited 10 minutes before they were ready to take our order.  The room was crowded - they packet everyone into one room like sardines even though there were other empty rooms, which made it tough to have a conversation and tough for the servers to move around to the different tables.

After the discovery of plastic in our clam chowder, the waiter apologized and also had the manager come over to apologize (and make excuses for why there was plastic in the chowder).  They took the chowder off the bill, which was the least they could do since we only ate a couple spoonfuls of it anyway.  They really should have offered us another appetizer or more $$ off the bill... but they didn't.

2 stars (instead of 1) for the view and location on Pier 39.
author: Alex B.

description:
I brought my family from Australia for an afternoon snack here while touring the fisherman's wharf. Seriously I did not expect this restaurant be so great both in quality of food as well as service. 

1. There is a very nice area for waiting, with nice couch and chairs.
2. The hostess is very friendly and attentive (given that we are actually Asian looking Asian).
3. The Clam Chawder with bread bowl is delicious and of high quality, the waitress actually told us it is pretty big portion, so we decided to share, which worked out great.
4. The deserts, especially the Tiramisu is phenomenal, even in my opinion ( I almost never order desert and liked desert voluntarily)
4.5 The price is very reasonable -- not outrageously high because of being part of the touristic area.
5. The view is great if you could get the window seat (we did not, but we can still see because of the large windows the restaurant has).

All in all, I will come back here to try more food, and I recommend you as well even if you are not a tourist :)
author: Mary L.

description:
Great service and amazing food. Their sour dough bread lives up to the hype as well.

We had the crab cake appetizer and the sword fish.  Both were excellent!  We were too full for dessert but their options looked really good.
author: Charles S.

description: Not sure why this gets four stars. It earned two because of the outstanding views. But clam chowder was mediocre. The "side salad" was four pieces of Romaine. And the oysters left much to be desired. Not to mention the crappy service at the bar.
author: Sara C.

description: Wow, wow and wow! Top notch! Really like this place. The food and bonus views are excellent! The food quality is really there! The clam chowder is excellent; tasty served perfectly temperatured, the fish and chips delicious with just the right amount of crisp to the batter and French fries. Pan seared chicken breast with mashed potatoes is tasty and delightful. On top of the tasty food you will enjoy the views of water. Love it! You won't be disappointed with food and views!
author: Love Food And Wine W.

description: Enjoyed a table with a view of the Golden Gate Bridge and Alcatraz.  Everything was good from the bread to the crab cake, tuna, fish and chips to the desserts.  Good service and menu items at a good range of prices for the quality make this a strong option.  Won't dissapoint if you are ready to spend a little.
author: Charles O.

description: This five star review is for our server Meron. She was fantastic and truly the San Francisco treat at this restaurant on the wharf. We came for the SF Restaurant Week and the service was perfect. Meron has a great personality and was very attentive to everything we needed. I'm glad we got her as our server because the food was lackluster for such a promising SFRW dinner menu. Meron was awesome, stay away from the swordfish (dry), and the oyster with cheese and bacon (small). Not worth your time.
author: Jeromy G.

description: clam chowder bread bowl topped with crab is amazing and KHAIMAN is an awesome polite server and brought us everything on time so he just made a good experience great! you should be lucky to have him as your server!
author: Carlos C.

description:
My husband and I had dinner at Fog Harbor Fish House our first night in San Francisco. We had made our reservations on Yelp and they were ready for us when we arrived. The service was excellent as was the food! 

Tip: when you make your reservation, request a table by the window with a view of the bay. It's beautiful and very romantic. I look forward to coming back again!
author: Gail E.

description:
We stopped in for a late lunch two years ago and the food was delicious.  We returned this fall and the food was still wonderful.  We had the shell fish plate for two and a bowl of clam chowder each. So much food, all wonderfully cooked.  After all that good food I wanted something light for desert.  I ordered the tiramisu  and it was just right, just a bit of sweetness for the end to go with the coffee.  

I'm sorry some of the reviewers had a bad time.  Our waitress, Madison, was delightful. She took the time we needed to answer questions and made sure we had everything we needed.  We came in right before the rush, I am sure that helps.
author: Dawn M.

description: Good lunch. Overcharging for the view, but then again - what a view ! Had the crab and avocado ceasar and cob w/ beans and chorizo. Fresh and good tasting. Service was great, our 2y old was more than welcome.
author: Anders A.

description: Started with the calamari. Needed some seasoning but definitely not overcooked. We ordered three entrees and they were: ahi tuna, crab roll and the garlic roasted dungeness crab.  The portions were pretty decent and the ahi tuna with mashed potatoes was incredibly fresh and unbelievable.  The crab roll was really good and came with fries and the garlic roasted dungeness crab came with corn on the cob and was good. It was the first time I tried a roasted dungeness crab.  I definitely prefer steamed but it was worth the try. Plenty of garlic and was definitely happy with the choices we made. Will definitely visit again the next time we're in town.
author: Susan C.

description: Yelpers, you have let me down once again. Service was unimpressive - waiter forgot to bring us bread. We had to ask for water! Calamari was salty, cioppino was mediocre - too much pepper and not much flavor. Spring special lobster stuffed with crab was underwhelming - too much celery and no flavor. The sauteed spinach used low quality oil. Finally,  house merlot was too acid with little body. Margarita was too sour. The good: nice view of the water. Not returning and will not recommend to a friend. This is a bad deal for the money.
author: Abe N.

description: Words can't express how delicious and fresh the food is at this restaurant. The waitress we had could improve but the quality and tastiness of the food is why we were here this past weekend! We had the mussel fries, clam chowder, fried calamari, linguine and clams and cioppino all of which were to die for. Wonderful ambiance, table overlooked the bay and docks where the ferry would come in. Wait wasn't as bad as expected considering it was fleet week. Will only dine here for all future trips to San Francisco!
author: L K.

description: Really nice view! Their clam chowder is indeed good. We had Amy R for our server, she is really nice and quick:))))Thank you
author: Kaylie W.

description: This is my first yelp review and its quite unfortunate that it will be a not so good one. We ate here last December 2014 and the food was really superb. Unfortunately this time, Oct. 10, my issue has something to do with the way the frontliners queue customers. This is the first time i have experienced this policy of "we cant seat you until your entire group is complete" in any restaurant i have ever been. This is despite the fact that we told them we already got their items they wanted to order in advance. I was thinking they might have a full place inside and tables will not be available, but when we were able to come in, I counted at least 8 tables that were vacant and ready for customers. This policy is ridiculous. If you are planning to eat as a group here, beware of this crazy policy before you decide to go.
author: Frederick R.

description:
Went to Fog Harbor for dinner with my family to celebrate my daughter's birthday. Beautiful view, good food and nice atmosphere. Only one thing marred my experience, our waiter Pedro. He was condescending and rude, chuckling at any questions we asked about certain items on the menu. (in particular laughing at my father) 
We had to ask for water, then for bread for our table after a pretty long wait, while other tables in his area were getting water and bread shortly after being seated. I don't know if he didn't feel he had to go the extra mile for us because we are hispanic or what his issue was with us. (all his other tables were non hispanic customers, and when my father asked me a question about the menu in spanish, he chuckled to himself.)
Not sure if we will be dining here again, though If I were to return to Fog Harbor, I'd make sure not to be seated in Pedro's area.
author: CLauDia V.

description:
Came here around 2pm with no reservation. The wait was only about 15mins. 

I'll start by saying I am not a fan of blue cheese AT ALL but figured id try the blue cheese garlic bread since it was free with a yelp coupon. It was AMAZING! Exceeded expectations. 

Tried some oysters from here and they were great! I definitely recommend. Next for the clam chowder and it may have been the best chowder I have ever had!!! Loved it 

I ordered the entree with the crab cakes, big mistake!!! I love crab cakes but I tasted everything EXCEPT the crab so that's obviously not something I would order here again. 

My boyfriend ordered the fish and chips which were exceptional! Wish I had ordered that instead. It's cooked to perfection! 

I ordered a Long Island, which was sub par. It's a pretty strong drink but the purpose of the Long Island is to not taste how strong it is. I'd try something different.
author: Danielle F.

description: I was not having a good experience at this Restaurant. Then they switched servers and this Beautiful young Lady Arion just lit the atmosphere up. Otherwise the wait was long and the other server was very rude to us. Foid was deliciously flavorful! The server change made it the Best Meal in a while. Thank you Fog Harbor for this server.
author: Dre T.

description: Coming from SoCal, we wanted to try out a great seafood place in the Fisherman's Wharf. Good thing we found this place! It was definitely what my girlfriend and I were expecting. Great food and great service! Both in what we were looking for. Next time we come back to NorCal, we'll be making our way to this place again!
author: Jeffrey M.

description:
Delicious Blue Cheese bread!

Tried the Cioppino with pasta and was very good!
author: Yude S.

description:
Located on the second floor toward the entrance of Pier 39.  Interior decor ok.  View of the wharf.  Yummy bread to start off the meal.  Very nice service.  Had the burger because I wasn't feeling seafood.  Cole slaw was tasty.  

Saw a gigantic tour group come in and dine here.
author: Doctor G.

description: A bit of a tourist trap but actually impressed with their food. Fresh grilled fish and shrimp.  Started with a bowl of clam chowder with crab. Great service as we had a large table.
author: Jennifer K.

description: Great view, amazing food. The mixed grill and scallop are both the best you can have in the area.
author: Stan L.

description: Like a lot of people who come here, I fancy the view. I went on a Saturday morning during the Restaurant Week for their $25 lunch special. For appetizers, i had the crab salad, then the crab cakes for main entree. I wouldn't recommend any crab dish here actually, the seasoning or the way they prepped their food washed away the tint of sea freshness. Although, the first time i was here, I liked their clam chowder, right consistency and just overall heart-warming. Hits the spot.
author: Lizi F.

description: Went for lunch the day after our anniversary and we were under dressed. This is really a beautiful  restaurant with a magnificent view. Ok now your asking why only 4 stars? Simply the food was great the service superb and the view as mentioned simply the best, It unfortunately is a simple victim of its own position., on the pier which makes it way to touristy for my taste. Very very nice but just too much geared for the tourist crowd. Not bad but not 5 stars.
author: Alan J.

description:
We were celebrating my wife's birthday.  The food was tasty.  
My wife had the crab cakes, she liked them, but she felt more
crab could of been added .  I had the pan fried sole on white beans with 
spinach; enjoyed it very much.  Good choice.
author: Jose M.

description: Service was good.  I can only review them on their raw oysters and clam chowder,  because that's what I had. The clam chowder was plain and bland. Very small pieces of clam and nothing else but cream base. It was boring.  As for the oysters,  they had one kind.  They were just ok.   Walk down to the ferry terminal and Hog Island has 7 fantastic choices.  Take a pass here if these two items are what you're looking for.
author: Brian M.

description:
It's everything I love about wharf restaurants:
Classy dining room
Sweeping vistas of the bay
Crisp white clothes on the waiters

Delicious seafood, over 14/entree for lunch
Giddy energy of other diners
Attentive waiter who makes you feel welcome
author: Em L.

description:
Our waiter was great but hostess wasn't very nice or welcoming and that's always my first impression. 
The food was pretty good but some dishes lacked seasoning. 
Great view of the pier.
author: Naomi J.

description:
My companion had the clam chowder with crab in a bread bowl and loved it, with the Caesar salad on the side. 

I wanted something slightly lighter so I got the iceberg wedge with blue cheese, which ended up literally being exactly 1/2 of an iceberg head, with cloy-y dressing dumped on top and chopped crispy bacon bits. Not necessarily bad, just clumsy and very very heavy in the end. 

The bread they offer you is complementary though-- many places sneak a large charge in with bread so this was a nice surprise. 

We had their namesake lager which was unremarkable but definitely nice, and a lagunitas ale which was lovely. 

All in all, probably one of the nicer places on pier 39, it's all expensive since it's a super touristy place, and you'd be best off walking three blocks away and cutting your bill in half. 

But the view was lovely over the water, and we could see the sea lions. So if that's what you want, then go here. Service was VERY scripted but polite.
author: Em K.

description: Wonderful service by Ashley L., Seth, Jose, Christian,  Lesley & the chefs who prepared a 5 star experience with 5 star food.  Highly recommended !!!
author: Cera D.

description:
If you're looking for a nice sit down seafood restaurant at Pier 39, the Fog Harbor Fish House is a great restaurant! We came here in the afternoon and enjoyed sitting by the fireplace outside and listening to the waterfall while we waited for our table. The restaurant has beautiful bay windows with panoramic views of the wharf. It's worth asking for a table next to the window where you can actually see the seals below! 

Being in SF I really wanted fresh baked bread so I was delighted when a bread basket of warm, freshly baked sourdough bread arrived. To kick things off, we enjoyed the Crispy Lemon Calamari ($12), which was delicious! The calamari was seasoned with lemon zest and delicious on it's own even without the lemon aioli. For lunch, one of us enjoyed the award winning Clam Chowder in a Bread Bowl ($9) and the other had the Soup and Salad Combo ($14) with a Caesar side salad. The soup was served in a fresh baked sourdough bread bowl. We enjoyed the complimentary Biscoff cookie that arrived at the end of the meal.

Visit Fog Harbor Fish House, you won't be disappointed!
author: Meghan L.

description: Busy lunch hour at Pier 39 but we were seated in less than 5 minutes at a table with a great view. Crab cocktail was very good, fresh sourdough bread was excellent - warm & crunchy. My crab cakes were ok. Next time I think I'd chose something else. Nice server, didn't rush us out, which I appreciate. It's so busy & crowded at Pier 39 - this was a classy rest stop.
author: Secret S.

description: I ate here about two weeks ago so this review is well overdue. I explained to the waiter that I don't use yelp and my experience that night inspired me to join and write a review. I want to start off with the service.  My girlfriend and I had Khaiman which was one of the best servers I have had. Next was the food.  The food was great and it was a fair price for good quality.  We also had a view of the bay which my girlfriend loved...I give it 5 stars because I was inspired here to spread the word about this place.
author: Vince R.

description: Amazing location, average American menu, decent service and decent prices ($15-25 / person) for the area.  The clam chowder was a bit gritty, which was very unfortunate, but everything else was prepared perfectly and tasted delicious.  I think this is one of the better places to take the family or go on a date, if you're on Pier 39 and want to steer clear of the usual chain restaurants.
author: Heath C.

description: Delicious! Decent wait time for a Thursday evening down by the water, but the food was fantastic (clam chowder and shrimp and grits), and the price was fair. We will definitely go back next time we're in town!
author: Courtney O.

description:
We tried this place on Sunday, a new spot for us.  The atmosphere was really nice, the view was amazing and so was the Crab.  We try a lot of crab places, I love crab.  This one is probably the best.  I had the red chili garlic crab and it was delicious.  Now, I said it is probably one of the best "Crab" places because the rest of the meal was just "OK".  My husband had fish and chips, they really had no flavor.  

So if you are looking for "CRAB" this is the place to come.
author: Stephanie M.

description: We enjoyed a wonderful dinner as we watched the sunset on the bay. Very beautiful!! Our waiter Samir was very funny and prompt with all of our requests. The seafood tower was very fresh and delicious. Must try if you like raw oysters, shrimp and crabs. We ordered the black cod, salmon and clam pasta. All very well prepared and extremely fresh!
author: Ann C.

description: Loved it! Its a must visit place when in San Francisco. Super delicious sea-food and very attentive and fast service. Their Award winning clam chouder is a must try! Ohh and dont forget about deserts! Cream brulee is soo light and tasty!
author: N. C.

description: WONDERFUL! I have no complaints. The staff were friendly and always checking in. The appetizer came out really fast and the main dish as well. The pricing was pretty reasonable. The seafood was fresh amazingly good.
author: Lakeshia J.

description: Yummy clam chowder! Great and clean environment with fast service. I recommend having the clam chowder. Easy access and great location near tourist locations.
author: Remona B.

description: Came here on a Thursday at 4pm and there was no wait time -- we were seated right away. My husband, baby, and I were seated in a very comfortable booth. For drinks, my husband had a beer, I had a virgin strawberry mojito which was very good! The complimentary bread came out next... *happy dance* (I love bread, I love bread!) For our meal we opted for a variety of appetizers. We had the calamari as many yelpers recommended -- it did not disappoint. Next we had the clam chowder in a bread bowl -- yummy as well. Next time, however, I will not get the bread bowl. Although the bread bowl was good, the complimentary table bread that came out at the beginning of the meal was just as good (maybe even better). Being the bread connoisseur that I am, paying for a bowl of bread when the complimentary bread is just as yummy -- well... I won't be doing that again. For our final appetizer, we got the mussels with fries. That also did not disappoint. The mussels were cooked in a tomato base with what tasted like a coconut broth -- yummmmm. The fries on top were the icing on the cake, as they were cooked perfectly being crunchy and soft at the same time.
author: Maria C.

description: I've been here twice to get the clam chowder, and it was just that, clam chowder. I had it in a bread bowl which was actually pretty good. We also ordered the calamari which was delicious. The waitress forgot to bring out our complementary bread. The clam chowder in a bread bowl was 10$.
author: Adri D.

description:
As of now, I see that the overall rating is at a 3.5 stars, and I think that is what I would give it.  I'm deciding to give it a 4 stars though, because I think if I had to go .5 star higher or lower, I would go higher because the overall experience was pretty good.

The warm, fresh sourdough bread was fantastic.  It really made me wish I got the clam chowder to go with it though.

As a starter, my hubby and I got the calamari.  I have to say, the only reason why I would give it a 3.5 stars is because of the calamari.  I'm no cooking expert, but I've heard when things are not fried at the right temperature, they absorb a lot more oil.  The calamari was SUPER UBER oily.  I didn't even feel like I could taste the calamari, just the breading and oil.   It was on a bed of lettuce and there was tons of oil on the lettuce.   It was pretty ick.  Did I mention it was oily???

My hubby ordered the lobster tail, which was pretty good.  He let me try some of his plate.  The vegetables were cooked perfectly, not mushy or anything.  The mashed potatoes were....regular.  They were too mushy and the taste wasn't that spectacular.

I wasn't THAT hungry so I got the tuna tartare.   That was pretty damn good, so I would highly recommend that.  The ripe (but not mushy) mango and avocado were so good with it.  I do miss that and hope to go back for that and then probably get the soup to go with the yummy bread.

The other thing is that I didn't get to sit where there was a view since it was too crowded, but it was one of those times where it seemed everyone else had a nice view except me.  Oh wells, overall, it was a nice lunch.  I'm not going to blame them for being too busy to seat me with a nice view, but I'm sure that would have added to the experience.  I MIGHT have given a strong 4 stars. ;)

So, I guess after writing this review, I realized I don't like mushy things that aren't supposed to be too mushy...

UPDATE...

The manager contacted me and apologized to me that I did not have a great experience and for the fact I did not get a window seat.  Well, it totally wasn't their fault I didn't get a window seat, so I definitely don't blame them for that at all. I just knew it would have added to the experience.  Anyways, the reason why I felt so compelled to give an update is because I admire the fact that the manager contacted me and was not defensive at all.  And he also said he would let the whole team there know about my experience.

SO, I will take my family there and try it another time and see what my experience is.  I might take one for the Yelp team and even order the calamari again to see if it's super uber oily or fried to perfection and let everyone know.  

I'm sure with that kind of attitude, the restaurant will continue to improve.  So, we'll see what my next visit is like!  In the meantime, I think they deserve 5 stars though.
author: Katy K.

description: Very friendly and good service. Of the seafood places we tried while on vacation this was our favorite. Food was very good. Beer was a little pricey but probably goes with the town. Overall very pleased.
author: Zach M.

description:
The clam chowder bread bowl was the best we had during our entire visit to San Fran. The chowder had the right amount of potatoes in it (not too many), and the bread was so yummy and warm after the chowder was gone. I had the mussels appetizer as well, and it was great. This is a must eat place while visiting Pier 39. We went fairly early (530 PM), and there was no wait. By the time we left (7ish), the place was packed. It was a Saturday night, so my advice is go early during the weekend!

The decor in the restaurant was very nice...pleasing to the eye. It was probably one of the best decorated places that we visited while in San Fran.
author: Brooke W.

description:
We just got to San Francisco and were wandering around looking for a good place to eat dinner. Thought this may be touristy but the reviews seemed pretty good. 
We loved our waitress Nicole. She was very friendly and helpful in helping us decide what to order. She also was very accommodating as we substituted rice for potatoes, etc. 
The drinks were a bit disappointing. My husband said his margarita was ok. I had the Lombard and was disappointed, didn't have much flavor, mostly tasted the club soda. Our son's fiancee had the ginger coconut cooler and it wasn't too flavorful either. 
The sourdough bread was great. My husband had dungeness crab as an appetizer, it was excellent. I had the pacific sole with rice instead of fingerling potatoes. It was so good and more than I could eat. One son had the trout and the other had the ahi tuna. Our son's fiancee had a salad-think it was the chili lime shrimp salad. Everyone loved their food. 
A bit pricy, but we are in a touristy area. Overall, we enjoyed our meal and the service.
author: Debbie V.

description: We couldn't decide between here and House of Crab. Both had very good ratings. We chose this place because of a 15% off discount we got from California Welcome Center. Woohoo we love discounts! We ordered the whole garlic dungenous crab, 2 orders of kids fish chips, a cup of clam chowder and clams with linguine. Our faves were the calms and linguine and the chowder. Crab was decent and fish n chips could've been a little better. Bread was delicious and wished they offered more. But service was a soso and that's why the 3 stars. He barely came to check on us and when he did he seemed annoyed I was asking for stuff.. Example, my daughters sprite... he forgot, the soup... he forgot.. And the crab cracker metal thingy lol.. Again, he forgot. Oh n he never gave us utensils. I'm Filipino but damn I don't always eat w/my hands. So my bad!!! Apparently I was asking too much. Nevertheless, he still got his 20% tip cuz I had a HORRIBLE experience at Starbucks prior, lucky him. House of Crab is our next stop
author: Kat G.

description: Plain and simple, best clam chowder I've had. I recommend you order with the crab meat. Be patient though as it's always a full house.
author: Ben R.

description: Dining at this restaurant for a second time brought an equally pleasant experience. Again, the swordfish was cooked to perfection. The sole was also surprisingly satisfying as well. And, as always, the fresh spur dough bread brought to the table before the meal was delightful.
author: Ashley D.

description: Hands down this was the best food I've ever had in my entire life . I highly recommend this place for anyone traveling all over the world . Service was great ! Our server Bong was the best he sure knew what was the type of platter I was looking for thank you Fog Harbor I sure will come back again to eat your delicious food !
author: Yuri M.

description: What a great way to end a family day at Pier 39!  The food here is absolutely delicious.  We ordered the Fried calamari appetizer, Surf n Turf, Linguine with clams and Crab roll.  The food did not disappoint- everything tastes fresh.  The service was also great and we had a nice view of the water.  Too bad I didn't have any room left over in my tummy because the desserts looked yummy!  That will give me another reason to come back.
author: BJ J.

description:
Had the crab legs-  Was ok not overly impressed.  Wouldn't really send anyone here as a go-to place.

Environment was nice and a pretty good view though.
author: Lauren P.

description: Went to the aquarium and stumbled in this place afterwards. Drinks were great and the roasted dungeoness crab was delicious!! The place was packed so we sat at the bar. The bartender, Tony, was very down to earth and friendly
author: Ernest C.

description: Clam chowder bread bowl was amazing. The swordfish was fantastic, but the veggies under it were not so great, a different taste. And shrimp was jumbo yummy. The view was good, but was hoping to see the golden gate. Not quite the award winning view I was hoping for. All in all, my wife and I enjoyed a romantic dinner in downtown San Fransisco that didn't break the bank. Great place. Good food.
author: Thomas B.

description:
A review written by a 9 year-old: At Pier 39, I dined at Fog Harbor.  Sitting by the window, with a view of the ocean, was a great experience. The service was prompt and courteous. The food was tasty and they had an extensive kid's menu. I had the grilled salmon and it was delicious. The bread bowl clam chowder was good but I had better at Boston Chowder. Next time you go to Pier 39 I hope you can try Fog Harbor.  I recommend Fog Harbor for your family. 

Note from Parent: If you get you're your reservations through Open Table then you will get a surprise treat. There is also a 15% to 20% off coupons at California Welcome Center at Pier 39 with/without your AAA card.
author: Anthony C.

description:
I can't say to much about this place! It's a great location for a tourist. Maybe we just came on an off night. We sat at the bar for dinner since the wait was about 30 min wait. They had 2 bartenders on and they were slammed so the manager was back there helping. We ordered but had to ask 3x for bread. No big deal but once the food was dropped we never saw another person. So we paid and left. 
The food wasn't that impressive.
author: Jennifer P.

description: WE are happy we came here, really amazing delicious food! Loved every bit of it. The place, the staff, the food, the view, all of it. Came here for the ratings and I was not let down.
author: Suzie H.

description: Mixed Grill. Sword fish, salmon and shrimp. Nice combination. Tasty. Very nice harbour view.
author: Mike M.

description:
Perfect view at sunset, perfect timing for the perfect table. We had enjoyed a sunny day on the Bay and decided to stop here for a bowl of clam chowder. This was our first time at this Pier 39 restaurant and we enjoyed the clam chowder which was one of the best with alot of clams that had a nice flavor and it was  perfectly prepared, not tough nor rubbery. Also, we enjoyed the crab cakes as an appetizer. Then our entrees arrived,  my grilled salmon was fresh and delicious with roasted vegetables but my husband did not enjoy his fish and chips, he said it had no flavor and he would not order that again. Food at surrounding tables looked really good and people seemed to enjoy their meals. The nearby table had a red chili shrimp appetizer that looked delicious although it  would be too hot and spicy for us . Service was excellent and friendly from all staff. We were happy we ate here and we will definitely return especially for the chowder.
It was a beautiful  sunny, warm  day on the Bay and this was a great choice for dinner.
author: Catherine D.

description: Not a great dinner option if you're looking for quality seafood. Clam chowder was alright, shrimp was alright, and I would never go back for a fish fillet. Don't be fooled by the cheesy waterfall facade outside, it's not an upscale restaurant. How this place has an average 4-star review is beyond me, it's like a want-to-be McCormick and Schmick's.
author: James D.

description: Dining at Fog Harbor last week was the best dining experience in San Francisco for the week long trip. Oscar was the server and if you want superb customer service, request him. His recommendation of the cod was greatly appreciated. It was a feature  and I suggest they make it a permanent addition to the menu. Oscar convinced me that I would be pleased and I assure you there was not a morsel left on my plate. When Oscar  came to remove my plate, I told him that I was not pleased with his selection and that I wanted a lobster to replace the cod. All a joke of course. What ensued was outrageous. With finesse he brought me a lobster and the appropriate bib. The details of the delivery made for a fun time for all the tables surrounding ours. We had the best laugh and clearly the best server. Kudos to Oscar and thank you. I can't wait to return.
author: F R.

description: No stranger to Fog Harbor. I've been here numerous times, and they never disappoint every time. I mainly order the crab cake entree, and it's tasty. Crab cakes were not dry at all, and their fries were grease-free. Our party also ordered the Ahi Tuna entree, and it was one of the best ahi tuna that I have ever tasted with the ginger soy glaze and wasabi aioli sauce = yum!!! I'll definitely order the Ahi Tuna for myself next time!
author: Anna Z.

description: If your feeling a little fancy and have a little extra money to spare... Treat yourself to a wonderful lunch or dinner here! The restaurant is beautiful and the view looking out to the ocean is amazing! The food was fabulous and our waiter was very pleasant.
author: Ryan Sonia B.

description: Food was good but the place was really expensive, more like $$$ than $$. Typical for a touristy area.
author: Stephanie C.

description:
For somebody who doesn't like seafood that much it's kind of strange to book a table in a fish house. So I was very curious what to expect and I have to admit that I wasn't disappointed at all!

After the lady on the front desk remarked our reservation (directly from Yelp via Open Table) we got straight to our table. Our server, I dont't remember his name, arrived promptly and showed us the menu and explained the specials of the day.
