To me I felt fine from the first moment so I ordered as a Starter the Tuna Carpaccio, which I normaly wouldn't cause I don't like fish that much. Nevertheless it was delicous and very nice presented. As a main course I had a very tender and perfect cooked steak which hasn't to fear any compare to a traditonal steak-house. Also my financee was very happy with her choice, altough I can't remember exactly what she ordered.

After the Entrees our waiter presented us the desert-list in original on a tablet. It looked so delicous that even I couldn't deny and went for an Irisch Coffee as well. All in all, I was kindly surprised what this restaurant had to offer.

Besides the very good food and the overwhelming charme of our waiter, it was the atmosphere of this place that I liked about it. Not to busy, not to calm, just the right way.
author: Oliver M.

description: Good food, great service at the bar, and nice environment. I think you can get more for your money.
author: Natalia E.

description:
Spent the weekend in SF and had dinner here on an early Saturday evening.  Staff and everyone at the restaurant were extremely polite and accommodating.  
Started off with the oysters and both the taste and quality were very good.  We had the linguine with clams and the lobster.  Both dishes were good and the price was within line for the quality.  Good atmosphere and generally a place for all.
author: Ryu C.

description: This place was pretty good. The calamari is was really good and free FRESH sourdough bread was a definite plus!  My mom had the seafood pasta and I had the 1/2 garlic crab.  You can see in my photos how much crab meat I got out and it was delicious!  If you're looking for a clean sit down place to have lunch at the warf, I would recommend this place.
author: Jane W.

description: Just ate here yesterday for the first time, I loved it. I have to confess that we decided to eat here because our parking garage said they validated parking, so we got 2 hours free :). We just wanted a good bowl of clam chowder, in a bread bowl, of course. We got right in, and got a window table, and the view was amazing! The server (I think she said her name was Clementine, maybe?) was there promptly to take our drink orders and had our iced teas and water out in a flash. We ordered 4 clam chowder bread bowls ($10 each, not bad for a nice restaurant on the wharf) and we had those in less than five minutes, so so so so so yummy! It was the best clam chowder any of us have ever had, (we've tried a lot of clam chowder). We will definitely be back and recommend this restaurant to others!! All in all, great view of the wharf, great service, awesome atmosphere and DELICIOUS food!
author: Sara B.

description: Food was good, atmosphere was a touristy (no surprise there) and VERY loud.  We were seated rather quickly on a Friday night but our table was awkwardly positioned under a beam of some sort, right next to the waiter area (where the waiters gather, put their orders in, etc).  It was VERY warm, so much so that I almost left midway to cool off outside.   I ordered the clam chowder, which I usually DON'T order, as I am not a fan of cream soups, but I actually enjoyed it a lot.  I didn't order a dinner, but got the red chili garlic shrimp appetizer and a salad.  I think the waiter was a bit confused, but didn't make too much of a fuss over it.  Hubby ordered the ciopppino and said it was good, but not what he had hoped it would be.   Overall, I would probably look for other places to eat before I headed back here.
author: Michelle D.

description:
If you haven't already figured this out, I'm in love with seafood. So when I tried Fog Harbor at the Yelpin' La Vida Loca Party, the Crab Ceviche, the Ahi Tuna - I wanted to come back. I received a coupon for a free appetizer with dinner at the Yelp event, but it was the food that kept me thinking about trying it out. After having a touristy boat ride on the Bay, me and my friend went over to Pier 39 for an early dinner.

Don't be fooled by the novelty of the Pier, Fog Harbor is a nice classic seafood restaurant. Nice big booths with great views of the bay to Golden Gate Bridge.  The place is huge and would be ideal for a Holiday Party, dinner party or event. They have a nice big bar that serves up anything you want, although they have quite a few custom cocktails.

I ordered myself a Bloody Mary, I can appreciate a good bloody mary outside of normal brunching hours, especially if I'm enjoying some seafood.  Since we were going for the full tasting experience, we ordered the: 

*Ahi Tuna on a fried wonton and Cajun seared with cayenne aioli  ~Absolutely delicious. I tried this at the yelp event and had to order it again.
*Red Chili Garlic Prawns: Red chili paste, onions, peppers and garlic ~Spicy and so good, the sauce and peppers had so much flavor, I added a couple spoonfuls to my bloody mary. Yeah, it's THAT good.
*Garlic Roasted Crab: Roasted 1/2 crab with a garlic herb butter ~At $15.00, I could eat this every night. Served with hot butter, I sat there happily cracking my crab and tasting every bit of that garlicky buttery goodness. If you need a crab fix, I highly recommend this dish. 
*Salmon BLT: Served on a toasted french roll with a pesto aioli. ~ Really great, probably one of the best salmon sandwiches I've had. You know that feeling when you take a bite of someone's sandwich and you want more. If I wasn't so entertained cracking my crab, I'd be all over this sandwich. 

When they came up with the dessert platter, I didn't know if I could possibly do it...but there was the crème brulee. Just tempting me. It was just as good as expected, creamy with that sugar glazed candy crunch top.  I had my dessert with an Absolute Lemonade cocktail, very refreshing. 

I really enjoyed my dinner at Fog Harbor and will definitely come back.  The service was excellent, the food was incredible, affordable for the quality and the whole overall experience was worth coming down to the pier to try out. My mouth is watering just thinking about it!!
author: Rebekah T.

description: Great food! Great views ! and Christian who served us was fantastic! Enjoyed our dinner here with the family. Thank you!
author: Sunit S.

description: Fabulous!!! Picked this place for lunch with my boyfriend for his birthday, and we both loved it! It was his first time having clam chowder, and he said it was the best soup he'd ever had! We both had the crab stuffed lobster as our entree which was pretty awesome, and our waiter Daniel was attentive and helpful! All in all a wonderful dining experience.
author: Amanda H.

description:
Similar to most of the Pier 39/most Embarcadero restaurants, I would classify this as a tourist trap. 

Although there are many options on the menu, after my third time at this restaurant, I would not recommend anything on the menu. The sea food chowder was average, but average sea food chowders in San Francisco are a dime a dozen. 

Like all restaurants with a west facing view, you may be lucky enough to see an amazing sun set...... if you are not in the position for this, please search for another restaurant.
author: Tim M.

description:
Food was good. Service was terrible.  It was so bad that I had to get up and go get my check after asking the server for it twice.

Avoid this and grab a bowl of clam chowder to go downstairs.  If you have a couple hours for a meal, this is ok and the view of Alcatraz is cool.
author: Chad J.

description: Ate lunch here with the wife and kids.  I had the Ciopino and it was fantastic.  Very rich tomato broth and all the seafood was very tender.  Nice views out over the bay.
author: Brian B.

description:
My wife and I feel bad that we couldn't have rated it higher. Here's the deal. We both treated us to two lobster tail dinners however, much to our surprise, they were "extremely salty"! We've never known lobster tails to be served that salty but were told by the manager that they are flash frozen in salt water during shipping and that perhaps that caused the problem. The manager did, however, comp our dinners and the only thing we paid for was our clam chowder which was perhaps the BEST, or possibly second-best that we've EVER had! 

We also waited a long time for our meal. And, of course, the typical sourdough bread they served in San Francisco was EXCELLENT!
author: Marshall K.

description: wonderful!delicious!steamed clams,shrimp brochette,wh steam crab!AMY.R,FROM THAILAND,VERY NICE!
author: Sys S.

description: Great ambiance, it has a nice dim romantic feel to it. They have a fireplace outside with seats while you wait to be called inside. Sadly, thats where it stops. The service is extremely slow, waited a long time to get water, straws ect. It was getting frustrating. I was with 4 other people so we ordered a variety of things since it was our 1st time there. We ordered the crab & shrimp sandwich and it was ok not worth the $15 that its priced. The crab melt sandwich was not that good either $16 (I was feeling nauseous had to drink coke to feel better, didn't taste fresh).  Ordered the crab cakes and popcorn shrimp for our appetizers and they were not any better. The clam chowder in the bread bowl was great. They also serve free sourdough bread with butter which was good. I would not return or recommend.
author: Jay O.

description: Amazing! Our server was Mel, very nice, prompt and attentive. We had the house salad, clam chowder topped with crab. The clam chowder was over the top. I had crab cakes, had a little too much bread in it for my taste but still worth it. We enjoyed ourselves so much that we made reservations for tomorrow night. Just a side note we made reservations thru the yelp links to the restaurant. They walked us right in and had a great view. A bunch of places down here just fake the food because of location but not here! Would definitely recommend!
author: Steve C.

description: Tried 3 different flavors of dungess crab, first started with garlic, then Cajun and finally red chilly.  They were so full of flavors and just the perfect texture on each and every bite.  Cajun was my favorite.  The bit of a complaint is they wouldn't take reservation, so you'll have to come and wait.  There was a line but with a fireplace outside, the wait was not that bad.  Service was great, I canceled my entree while going thru my appetizers so I could order more crab :) and the waiter was happy to make it happen.  Strongly recommend!
author: Andrew T.

description: Craving fresh seafood? Then this place is a must. After a long afternoon walking the pier, we walked up to Fog Harbor and were pleased to be seated right away. We ordered the fried calamari which was tender and crisp! And the aioli was a perfect addition. I ordered the Pacific Cod and was in heaven, it was fresh and cooked to perfection. Our waiter was attentive and my glass was never empty. The clam chowder was exactly what it should be, creamy and chocked full of clams! I can't wait to return to SF so I can enjoy Fog Harbor again.
author: Shar B.

description: Great service to go along with the amazing food! solid performance. samir made our experience the best, especially with that hairflow. Best clam chowder though
author: Alahni T.

description: We tried this place for a special occasion. They were great over the phone for a reservation for 11 people. We arrived on time but most of our party was running late. They typically only hold a table for 10 minutes. However, they were a little slow that day for lunch so they said they would hold it as long as they could. When the majority of us arrived, they seated us. We got a fantastic corner window table with views from both windows. Lovely. Our waitress was funny and attentive but let us linger after our meal without rushing us. The food was great. Would highly recommend this restaurant for a special occasion.
author: Nancy M.

description: I have to say. This is my first time in San Fran. The hotel recommended I come here on pier 39. Wonderful atmosphere. Awesome lobster dinner. Staff was lovely. The kicker.. I rarely eat dessert and I was already busting from a conference day worth of eating. I saw a vanilla creme brûlée about to be sent to a table and it raised my eyebrow. It's one of only a few desserts I care  to indulge. My server asked nusan, the manager if they could do a half portion. They accommodated me with grace. I love a place that is flexible to a person's enjoyment. And I gotta tell ya - the dessert was "the bomb". Worth the extra time on the treadmill tomorrow.
author: Mary V.

description:
I tried to order lobster here and they were sold out.. Then I tried to order crab and they were sold out. To be fair, it was a busy night and in a tourist area, but I was hoping to treat my friend to some good seafood and we were both disappointed. 

I will say that the environment is nice, but it isn't quiet in any way, shape, or form. It's quite noisy and sometimes I couldn't hear the waiter over the noise, but it wasn't a big deal. 

Of course being in a tourist area made it relatively pricey, so I was expecting that. I don't remember the name of the dishes I ordered but there was some lobster in it, but not the whole thing. It was good, but not out of this world. 

The waiter was helpful though, and did attend to us very nicely. Good manners and timely, etc. All the good stuff. 

Maybe I'll come back here one day and finally get to try the crab.
author: Tina C.

description: Amazing dishes, service, and view!! A must-visit if you're traveling to San Francisco!
author: Elizabeth W.

description: I was a bit nervous to eat at a touristy spot but the food was delicious, drinks was fabulous and our waitress was wonderful - plus the views were wonderful on a sunny afternoon! We had a group of 7 so we had a little wait but they texted us when the table was ready and we were seated as soon as we got back to the restaurant. I would definitely go back again.
author: Kelly M.

description:
I've been here before with my brother a couple years ago and was excited to visit again. I enjoyed the ambiance, friendly staff and excellent food. As some of the other reviews I've read, I agree that it does feel a little crowded, but I appreciate that the food makes up for anything I could say.  
Our view was fantastic, right near the window. I ordered the Cajun shrimp and ham pasta: excellent! Highly recommend. Overall, a very pleasant evening and dinning experience!
author: Joshua A.

description: A touristy spot but definitely worth visiting! The view from Fisherman's wharf was beautiful and the food and cocktails were great. We loved the crab and seafood pasta. We went to celebrate a friends birthday and got a free dessert as well!
author: Katelyn D.

description: Great seafood restaurant with a great view. Clam chowder is definitely worth trying. The staff was extremely friendly. Great place for casual lunch or even fancy dinner. We dined there two days in a row, and both times we were seated within 10-15 minutes. We would definitely recommend this restaurant for any seafood lover. Filet is also worth trying.
author: German C.

description: Very tasty clam chowder. I have been there twice and got the fish and chips both times. The fish is nice and crispy on the outside but deliciously flakey and tender on the inside served with fries and a horseradish coleslaw. Love the hot and fresh sourdough bread service. this place is great for crowds and I would go again even if it was just for the chowder!!!
author: Robin G.

description:
Food was great, but what I appreciated most was when I asked the busboy if I could have a glass of milk to fill my daughter's bottle and the manager came to our table with the carton and filled up the bottle right there, no charge. It's the little things that make an impression, and I'll definitely be back. 

Oh, and have the shellfish platter- so good!!!
author: Angela S.

description: Great food and very attentive staff. I had the rock cod, it was very enjoyable. I liked the chorizo, but I was hoping it would be of a spicier and authentic variety. Overall a great experience.
author: Kari P.

description: We have been in San Francisco for four days and finally had a wonderful meal!  The halibut, clam chowder, and crab cakes were delicious.  The service was phenomenal!!!
author: Honey's F.

description: Beautiful view, huge yummy plates of food. Made a reservation two days in advance by phone and they did not have it when I arrived. They were able to seat us in 15 minutes but the hostess was a total you know what about it. So incredibly rude and did not bother to apologize or anything. This did not set the evening off on the right foot at all and the manager should know there are plenty of hard working people looking for jobs out there who would not be rude to your customers after you all made a mistake!
author: Al W.

description: Sorry gotta give this place 2 stars service was so so waiter didnt clear the table till we were leaving.i ordered the crab with a spicy tomatoe pepper concoction how are you sopposed  to eat the crab with a ton of sauce poured over it?my wife had the alfrado and crab it was bland at best not enough parm in the sauce.for this price it wasnt worth it great views but 1 star food go to bubba gumps much better quality.
author: Mike H.

description:
Honestly, when I first looked at the number of stars this restaurant had, and that it had two dollar signs, I was a little hesitant because we already spent some money that day, and we didn't want to splurge for lunch/dinner.  I went to the Welcome Center, showed them my AAA card, and picked up the coupon book which offered 2 hrs of validated parking and 20% off at Fog Harbor Fish House, and a few other restaurants. Since we had the 20% off, we decided to try this place! And I'm SO glad that we did.  

We arrived around 2:30 and were seated right away.  There was a good amount of people in there, but it wasn't busy.  I loved the front entrance because it was very peaceful and elegant.  Once seated, I knew I wanted a Bread Bowl because that is what was highly recommended on Yelp (and it was only $9).  My boyfriend had the salmon that was stuffed with crab.  We were given a bowl of bread which was so good and I almost ate all of it until I remembered that I was also getting bread with my meal.  The view was gorgeous outside our window.    

My boyfriend ordered a chardonnay, and I want to say that it was the floor manager who helped him pick one out.  He was very knowledgable and helpful, and knew exactly what he was talking about.  We ordered the calamari for an appetizer.  This was a FULL plate too, it wasn't just a few pieces.  They really were generous, and it was delicious.  Our food arrived about 10 minutes after we got the appetizers.  Of course the bread bowl was delicious, and my boyfriends salmon was amazing!  The salmon wasn't dried out, and the crab was fantastic.  

The service is also good here.  The waiter checked up on us and had no problem when I gave him the coupon.  He also validated our parking which we didn't need (because you can't combine the 2 hr validation with 1hr of restaurant), but he did anyways!  

Also, one more thing:  my boyfriend and I have also eaten at crab house which is right next door.  And we loved that place as well, but if you want to save some money, you get quality food at a lower price at Fog Harbor!  We will definitely be coming here again soon.
author: Alicia Q.

description: The chowder with added crab was amazing. My husband got the local rock cod special and it was really fresh!
author: Mindy R.

description: We have come here a few times before and unfortunately we always get the same pushy, annoying, rude woman server. Tall, dark hair and tan skin. If you're not ordering the drinks/appetizers/entree add ons she tries to SHOVE down your throat, go elsewhere because you will not get good service. We came for a light lunch and since we didn't have a huge bill for her we were treated with disrespect. The manager had to have 2 other servers come over to clear our plates and give us drink refills. Absolutely ridiculous and unprofessional. It's a shame because we've always had great experiences with the male staff and their food is great. If we come back we will request another server who deserves our money.
author: Chiddy B.

description: If yelp can add negative stars I would! I mean the place is supposed to be formal and professional right? I mean after all we're paying for a pretty expensive food. With market prices. I don't mind that but when you have a server with a sarcastic attitude that's when I mind. It was my friends birthday and wanted to make the night special for her but she ruined it! If you have issues on your own personal life then deal with it at your own time !  Manager if your reading this her name is Katie and maybe you should do something about that before someone experience such bad service again!
author: Charmaine O.

description: Not cheap, but the food was excellent. Service was good, not great. Amazing views.
author: Unter C.

description: Party of 4, waited about 15 minutes to be seated. Reasonably priced, pleasant atmosphere, great "fresh" food and service.
author: Robert M.

description:
Okay, yes, my opinion of this delightful establishment is *slightly* biased because it was a corporate dinner so I REALLY enjoyed it.  But overall, the food is fantastic, the service was SO awesome (the waiter swept away the table crumbs between courses) and to entice you to get dessert, servers bring a tray of ready-prepared desserts to your table for you to peruse (and then bring you a new one so it doesn't have everyone else's breath and germs from being carted around).

I will totally look forward to returning to this restaurant!
author: Deborah C.

description: Made a reservation online with a request for a seating with a view and in an area where our party of 3 could carry a conversation while dining and promptly received a confirmation from the manager by email.  Upon arriving, we were greeted and comfortably seated and enjoyed the great atmosphere and buzz as well as the excellent fresh seafood.  I would have never expected this kind of restaurant in the crowded and touristy Pier 39.
author: Dorene P.

description: Went on a recommendation and found the place to be good. I ordered the trout which was delicious, my only issue was that I ordered mash and received rice. Other than that the food was good a little on the pricy side but a great location. I had the clam chowder as a starter and it was very nice indeed, best I've had anywhere! I would recommend to friends when visiting San Francisco and I will be sure to return.
author: Ryan B.

description: My family and I had an excellent experience here. The crab roll and clam chowder are definitely must haves. The view is amazing. The wait staff is courteous. We didn't wait very long for our food (although it is worth mentioning that we went right at the beginning of lunch and we probably beat the crowd). No complaints! Worth every penny (and you will spend a few pennies).
author: Amelia L.

description: We only sat at the bar and split some appetizers, but the service and food was amazing! Steamed clams were by far the best I have ever had
author: Courtney M.

description: Samir was a great waiter, he was so kind and very friendly, always there checking on us and answering our questions, all the crew was great generally, I love the food here, somehow it test very good!! You must come here!!
author: Amine Z.

description: Just like several other reviews we got the poor service and attention I expected. It started with the hostess that seemed bothered that she had to seat us. Then the drinks that finally arrived after the entrée was served. Wait for a table by the window the view is great. The food is 4 star and the service was 2 star. The chowder is good. Don't waste your money on the fish and chips. This place is no different than any other tourist trap.
author: J J.

description:
The service is great! Even with the high volume of people who come into this seafood house of deliciousness, the staff maintain their can-do attitude! 

I really enjoyed the Ahi Tuna, the wasabi aioli and stir fried vegetables compliments the Tuna very well. The view of the Bay was nice especially around 5:30 when the sun starts to set.  

It's obvious that the folks who work there really enjoy what they do and are professionals. I would expect no less from a Mom & Pop restaurant that has been open for over 6 years.

I am glad that I took a visit to the California Welcome Center which is right next to the restaurant. They gave me plenty of information on places to dine and visit around  San Francisco.
author: Richard S.

description: Given the location -- a tourist trap --this could easily be a five-star review. A bunch of us found ourselves on Pier 39, starving after a day's sailing and dreading the food we'd find. We checked Yelp. Fog Harbor seemed like the best bet. It was better than we could have hoped. In fact, it's actually better than Sam's Chowder House in Half Moon Bay. All the food was very fresh, not just the fish but the greens as well. The wine list was small but decent and decently priced. Caesar salads are usually the downfall of places like this but we were very pleasantly surprised.
author: Edward K.

description: This restaurant is right on Pier 39, so it's hard to miss it. Perfectly crispy calamari served with lemon aioli sauce = perfection! The sourdough bread bowl clam chowder is the best bang for your buck (only $10). My husband got the cioppino which had crab meat, fish, shrimp, scallops, clams and mussels served in a tomato herb broth. Even though this is tourist hot spot, we will return every time we're by the bay.
author: Stephanie M.

description: I remember this place being really good. I came back and it was not that good. The food was salty and not to my liking. However, the service was amazing and the waiter was a sexy thang... Sam
author: Scott K.

description: Located conveniently at pier 39 as a nice place to pop in for lunch or dinner after checking out the sea lions and many tables have a great view of the water. As a party of two we only had a five minute wait at around noon. Service was great, our server even answered some of our touristy questions. Food was good but not memorable, pricing is over priced as much as everywhere else in this expensive city.
author: Hal H.

description: I ate a crab burger here. The portion was quite generous, but crab filling was scarce and barely noticeable. Great view. Service was very friendly, although the waitress was importunate and interrupted our discussion twice. Typical tourist trap.
author: Maciej M.

description: Firstly this place should have three dollar signs as definitely expensive. We ate fried calamari which was good. nojito (non alcoholic  mojito) was nice too. The $44 Red Chilli crab (seasonal) didn't live up to expectation. The red Chilli sauce was the regular sauce you get with Chinese food. Once I cracked open the crab and mixed the meat with rice and sauce, the whole thing tasted too salty and way too cheap Chinese food like. The lobster tail was good so were the mashed potatoes. Crab dish and pricing takes away 2 stars for us.
author: Vikas S.

description: Amazing view, attentive service, best lobster tail and mash potato! Solo or with a date or family exciting dining awaits for you here! And Alcatraz Escape will add a cherry on the top!
author: Ally M.

description:
When we got there a waiter guided us to a booth and brought my brother and I kids menus. I got the fish and chips and the fish were big! They even came with lemons to squeeze. First we got some yummy blue cheese garlic bread. My mom and dad got the oysters while my sister got a salmon BLT. 

The waiters were nice to us.We got a good view of Alcatraz and the top of the golden gate bridge while every once and a while the fog would roll in then pull back. I did not feel rushed and we could relax and enjoy the view.
author: Ford S.

description: Amazing service! I think what makes or breaks a restaurant is the service and this place had great fast and friendly service. Not to mention great shrimp
author: Mindy R.

description:
I'm giving a 5 star because I can't think of anything that I didn't like. Maybe just the wait? but good places always have to wait. 

I ordered the fish & chips, the fish is really good, big chucks of meat, very light batter great fresh taste. Fried calamari was very good as well, very fresh and chewy. Clam chowder has lots of clams. 

Been to a few places at pier 39 and this time was my best experience. Nice view, nice staffs, would go back.
author: Stephen S.

description: Chowder was good (but don't get your hopes too high). Crab bacon avocado Caesar salad was gross. Service was good. Overall average.
author: Jason B.

description: Delicious place to eat.  The sourdough bowl is excellent, their pan chicken delicious. The kids meals were enjoyed by all the kids. The service was exceptional, the wait is little long but worth it.  The prices were reasonable, our party of 11 ate for 180 with tip, make sure to visit the Welcome Center for a discount card!
author: Lina T.

description:
I like this place. The hostess was nice and our waiter let me charge my phone close to the ceiling why my phone dangle and killed the killer view we had. They know how to treat their guest right! They sat us immediately up stairs over looking the bay and it was really nice since we went there for my GF bday dinner. we didnt even asked for it but the hostess read our minds :)

important points:

1. food is decent but i didnt get the dungenous crab they had. my gf liked her crab sandwich though. their fries are friend with special oil making the fries rich and flavorful.
2. great View upstairs. water front, good view of the bay.
3. food is mid range $
4.nice ambiance.
5. When you ask for a dessert menu, they bring out a tray of the desert they serve! looks amazing!
author: Bugal K.

description:
I like the location of this restaurant.  My family watched the sea lions, before coming back to this restaurant.

The restaurant had a lot of windows and I could see outside.  The host gave me crayons and I colored on the children's menu and paper table top throughout the meal.  We didn't have to wait for a table, so that was a bonus.

There was a children's menu and I got the chicken tenders and fries.  There were other good things on the children's menu-- even fish and chips.  The food was good.

I didn't get soda this time, but the waiter refilled my water when I needed it.

At the end of the meal, the server brought around the dessert tray.  Everything looked good!
author: Cam M.

description: Great views of the harbor hence the name fog harbor fish house. I had the Crab sandwich which was loaded with crab meat and served in deliciously toasted bread. The oysters were also great along with the crab dip. If you like seafood this is a great place to stop in. We ate at the bar so we didn't have to wait for a table and had great service from the bartender.
author: Scott M.

description:
Loved it! We were a party of 6 plus a baby. They told us it was going to be 40 minutes but ended up being sat within 15 minutes which was nice!   I really liked the ambiance of the restaurant.  Although the tables were a little too close together.   We were sat on a window view of the pier and had view of Alcatraz.  Our waiters were sweet and attentive although they sometimes forgot to bring us stuff and it took a while..... I had the grilled shrimp brochette.  They were perfectly cooked and had delicious seasoning with a spicy kick to them  definitely will be coming back here on our next trip to San Francisco.  
The had a nice waiting area with a fireplace that made it coZy on a cold day.
author: Betty C.

description: Service was legit.  Chowder was on point.  They also have cell phone chargers available.  my parents were impressed.
author: Matthew A.

description:
Disappointed experience! 

Our dinner. arrive before the waitress brought the complimentary bread. Glass of water never arrived.

My salad was OK but right at the last bite there was a piece of plastic within the veggies. 

I would not come back! We got better service at Bubba Gump, just walk a little bit more and you will have a better experience (and view)
author: Lulu B.

description: My wife and I wanted a comfy place to sit after a long day of sight seeing.  This hit the spot. We had a table at a window so we overlooked the bay. Great view. We had some very tasty crab cakes and clam chowder. I only rated 3 stars, however, because the prices were high and the service was very poor.  $18 for two 4-in diameter cakes was rediculous and our server only came to our table 3 times (to take our order, to offer desert  and to refill our drinks while handing over our bill. 4 visits if you count bringing back the cc.)
author: Brandon V.

description: Best clam chowder sourdough bread bowl ever--flaky and crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. And the baked oysters--the best my oyster-aficionado boyfriend and I have ever had. Reasonably priced considering how delicious the food was, and service was good--very friendly.
author: Virginia B.

description: Went for dinner a few nights ago and it was just ok at best. Nice views, but food pricey and just very average and service was poor. The place is packed with tourists, there are so many better places to eat in San Francisco
author: Simon C.

description:
Food Poisoning!!!

The Clam Chowder tasted great and then uh oh... The girgle shmirgles began we went back to the hotel and we were became very ill all night and into this morning with Food Poisoning..  It was the only thing we ate yesterday besides Coffee and Toast so we know this was the culprit. Also, while we were there the people behind us were complaining that the fish and chips tasted old. The manager said he would pay for their glasses of wine and said unfortunately they get some bad fish now and then. We will not go back... Thank goodness for Imodium and Emitrol...
author: Karen M.

description:
For the most part, any restaurant that is on or around Fisherman's Wharf in SF is pretty terrible and expensive. However, I was pleasantly surprised by Fog Harbor Fish House! My clam chowder in a sourdough bread bowl was delicious and the fish and chips were probably one of the best fish and chips I have ever had! The breading was light, fluffy, and *shockingly* not greasy at all. I would return here as the prices weren't that expensive either. Two thumbs up!

I think the view during the day or early evening would be spectacular. We visited at night and had a window seat - but not much to see that late.
author: S R.

description:
Clam chowder - delicious!
Ahi tune Poke - not so much. I literally had 2 bites and couldn't force myself to eat it.
The waiter was super nice, when he asked me how I like it I was honest and said I didn't care for it. He saw that I barely even touched it and didn't end up charging me for it - that is some good customer service skills! I would go back to try other food on the menu.
author: Baciula L.

description:
Dropped into the bar for dinner on a Monday evening.  The restaurant wasn't too populated and we were two alone at the bar.  The service was great and friendly and our food came out quickly and was delicious.  

Tried the ahi tuna poke which was a nice fresh dish with some great spicy sauce artfully drizzled along the plate.  We also had the calamari appetizer which was cooked perfectly and was definitely more fish than batter (the way it should be!).  Also had the shrimp chili lime salad.  This was a good portio and the salad was good, there were only about 5 or 6 shrim around the edges of the plate - they were nothing special, I even left a few behind.
author: Janelle C.

description: Ate here a couple of weeks ago on our final night of our trip.  Very much enjoyed it.  Great service and I finished with the Apple Crumble Dessert which was amazing!!!  I don't eat seafood - so you don't need to like it to eat here....still lots of delicious options!
author: Rachael T.

description: Food was great. Started off with blue cheese baked garlic bread on sourdough and bowl if clam chowder. For the main course, we ordered the porterhouse steak special and subbed it with the whiskey peppercorn sauce....amazing and steak was tender and juicy! Also got the fried combo....calamari, fried shrimp with a medley of bomb aiolis! Khaiman, our server was awesome.
author: Mark M.

description: The quality of food was fantastic here. Service is good and it's a little pricey but well worth it for good seafood.
author: Sally S.

description: Great meal. The view spectacular. Tyler was amazing. I would definitely suggest this restaurant to any one looking for a wonderful experience.
author: Arwen R.

description:
I just want to say, this place is really a three $ sign place as opposed to the two that yelp shows...

Aside from that, very good food, and very nice views of the harbor..
Salad=$6 very good
cup of Clam Chowder=$7 very good.
Chefs special (2 prawns, fresh tilapia, on top of some asian veggies)=$32 was good
Crab Cake burger w/ fries= $16 very good

Table bread (which was sourdough), was very good...

Service was really good, and friendly.
author: Kim G.

description: I ordered a 5 oz glass of wine the bartender charged me for 8oz glass at the bar. When I got my Surf & Turf the lobster was tuff & I didn't like the sweet sauce they put on the steak. The waitress was very friendly though.
author: Becky M.

description: Delicious!  Great service ! I'm temporarily living in San Francisco and this might be one of my favorite places.
author: Kelli C.

description: The food here is goooood. I had the stuffed Maine lobster, out of this world. Can't wait to go back. Super friendly wait staff too.
author: Damion W.

description:
Excellent customer service - right from the get go. Came here at 915 pm on a Saturday with kids under 8.

Khaiman was our server. He went the extra mile to make sure we had an excellent experience. 

He had an opinion on the drinks and the entrees an suggested a few changes so I could get fresh salmon and enjoy the quinoa salad base. A little mix and match not listed on the menu.

When I mentioned something about the Moscow mule - he added extra lime to get it right - as I wanted it.

When we wanted some rice instead of the ordered fries - he went ahead and got that.

Finally kept checking to make sure we felt very appreciated

The salmon with the quinoa based salad had the right amount if citrus, spice and flavor that I was looking for. The sole was also very well prepared.

They have grilled seafood for kids instead of only fried options. That is a big plus for us.

All in all a much richer experience compared to some of the other places we visited.

Absolutely worth the 15 min wait and the AAA discount also helps.

Highly recommend the place and would visit it the next time we visit Fisherman's Wharf.
author: M V.

description:
My boyfriend and I went here (after reading some reviews on Yelp!) for a nice lunch on the waterfront on our recent trip through San Francisco. I was looking for some high quality, fresh seafood and this place prides themselves on their sustainable seafood selection!  First they seated us at a table away from the windows and when asked, quickly and politely got us a nice booth instead with a view of the water and sights. 

Service was nothing short of great: a prompt, courteous waiter who didn't hover but brought us our drinks and complimentary fresh-baked sourdough bread with butter and tended to our needs unobtrusively.

Food was delicious; I ordered the Grill Combo which featured perfect portions of shrimp, swordfish and salmon in a delicious citrus butter sauce with a side of veggies and choice of wild rice or garlic mashed potatoes. My boyfriend ordered the Fried Combo, which came with a very generous portion of house-battered and fried calamari, shrimp, and cod, with French fries on the side and dipping sauces. My one disappointment: the side of veggies was not to my liking, a green that looked like stringy broccoli cooked with some cocktail onions. I expected some mixed veggies at least! 

All in all a great meal and experience! No wonder they get such great reviews! MUCH better than a generic Joe's Crab Shack experience any day!!!
author: Lilie D.

description:
Absolutely incredible seafood! Great quality, great preparations, perfect ambiance.  

Enjoyed dinner here with bf and his parents - awesome experience.  Didn't feel rushed (even for a Friday night) and very attentive wait staff.

Definitely returning here
author: Rita R.

description: I am providing this review as a caution to other diners as my husband and I chose not to come here as we witnessed something very disturbing and quite disgusting. The open kitchen is a nice concept as it is usually great to see the chefs at their craft. At this restaurant,  we saw one of the cooks eat what appeared to be a baked potatoe as he continued to cook some other meal. This was not a "taste test." He had his fork still sitting on the platter filled with more baked potatoes. My husband gave feedback to the manager, who's response was "He shouldn't be doing that" That lackluster response is disappointing.  We will never eat here and other diners should beware!
author: Quyen N.

description: We got to sit by the window and we had such a nice view of the bay and Alcatraz. The food was good! I loved the crab cakes. Our server, Madison was so helpful and courteous. The desert was SO good! We got the chocolate fudge cake with whipped cream and vanilla ice cream. It's a bit pricey but definitely worth waiting in line for.
author: Natalia V.

description: Great place to celebrate holiday, fresh seafood and well services, their house chardonnay was worth to try btw.
author: Margaret L.

description:
Yes, it is a touristy restaurant in an extremely touristy area. However, even tourists like to eat well. 
The food we ordered (the Fish & Chips, the Clam Chowder, the Kids grilled salmon) were all fantastic. The view was nice, the service was good, and the prices were to be as expected. I wouldn't drive out of my way to go here, but I sure wouldn't turn it down if in the neighborhood.
author: Reza S.

description: Samir is absolutely the very best server ever!!! When you come please request him. He's sweet and cute too! Also, the food here is fantastic. Came here for my birthday and was very pleased.
author: Cara L.

description: Our second visit here...had to celebrate my wife's birthday. She again ordered the Fried Fish Combo,,,fresh and flavorful. I had the White Sea Bass and it was excellant. For desert we had Tiramasu and would highly reccomend it. Our waitress was excellant,,,attentative and checked back with us several times. She also advised us to take our time and not to hurry (never hear this)...good advice. Will certainly return there.
author: John F.

description: I heard from Yelp that this place had some of the best crab cakes on Fisherman's Warf. So we went to check it out. And let me just say, they were amazing! Now the downside: it cost $16 and we only got 1 crab cake. It was delicious, but at the end of the day, it's just a crab cake. And in our case, we ordered 2. So we were out $32 for 2 crab cakes. But mind you... 2 amazing crab cakes.
author: Android O.

description: Amazing restaurant. Our waiter Tyler was authentic and made our experience at this restaurant memorable. It's worth the wait if there is one!!!
author: Laurence L.

description: What can i say wrong about this place. The ambiance was romantic and welcoming. It sits on the water at pier 39, which at night is stunning. The sourdough AND the crab cakes were A-MAZ-ING!!! I highly recommend this place to everyone!!!
author: Shomari W.

description: I'm from south Orange County and I wish this place was close to me!  The food was great! Salmon plate  calamari  bread  everything.  The restaurant is clean and the view is gorgeous!!! Our server (the black guy with the gold earrings) was so awesome, he was attentive and fast and had a great sense of humor but still managed to be perfectly discrete at the same time.  Great place!! Thank you guys!!!
author: Rachel D.

description:
We had a nice lunch there recently.
The food was better than average and the service was great.  The view is the best part.
We would go back.
author: Robert W.

description: Pass. This is a hard review to write after just one visit, but as it is located at Pier 39/fisherman's wharf, most folks will have a very similar experience. Lots of tourist crass, as expected in the general area, we chose this restaurant because it had the best yelp rating. As walk-ups on a slowish Tuesday night we were seated way in the back far from the scenic window view. Ok, fair enough. We liked but didn't love the lobster Mac and cheese. We liked the creamy clam chowder. The broth for the steamed clams was dull, and the panko encrusted scallops served with jalapeño aioli were a deep fried mess. The cocktails, @$13 per were tasty and along with the fresh sourdough bread were the highlights of the meal. Not likely to recommend this place to foodie tourist.
author: Drew P.

description: The food was fantastic. My brother, cousin, and I had lunch here after the bay cruise. We had the fish and chips, chicken penne, and the ahi tuna poke. The service was amazing. Our waiter, Khaiman was really attentive and made really great suggestions. Great view while eating, and it's really filling.
author: Jennilyn Kate R.

description: Went for happy hour after getting off a boat at the pier. Decent happy hour menu, $5 beers (including local craft beers), $7 martinis and cocktails, and some food specials. I had the 805 Blonde which was good, my husband had the Alcatraz escape, also very tasty. We ordered the calamari which was ok, wasn't a fan of the lemon tartar sauce. Great views, very clean inside. I asked the bartender if there was an outlet where I could charge my phone, he said he would be right back which I thought was strange. He brought over personal charging stations for my husband and I (they looked like the pager restaurants give you while waiting for a table), I had never seen anything like it at a bar! I was able to charge my phone right in front of me. Very cool.
author: Nicole ..

description: I would've given them two stars, but the view & service was excellent.  The food is way too pricey & not good.  The best thing was the complimentary bread.  I had the grilled shrimp with spinach & garlic mashed potatoes.  They were lacking flavor.  We had the crab cakes for an appetizer & they were not good at all.
author: Erica F.

description: Everything was great, with a nice blend of interesting flavors and perfectly prepared fish.
author: Terry T.

description: The service was pretty disappointing. The food tasted delicious, however you could observe the economic discrimination. The tables that ordered a lot of food were given a significant amount of service to. At one point I believe the manager was walking around my table's area and asked everyone how their meal was except for my table. We did not receive bread or any refills for water while the other tables around us did. I am extremely disappointed because I was expecting to have a great experience here due to the large amount of reviews and high ratings on Yelp, however this place simply failed my expectations.
author: Victoria Y.

description:
My wife, daughter and I took the ferry from Vallejo for my daughter's birthday celebration in SF.  We had eaten at the Fog Harbor once before and decided to take her there for her birthday lunch.  

We got there fairly early - about 11:30 AM, and got a wonderful booth that was raised above the window tables across the aisle from them, and had an outstanding view through the large picture windows.  You can see the Golden Gate Bridge, Alcatraz and all the sailboats riding on the bay.  It is truly a spectacular view.

But on to the restaurant. The first time we were there, we had a great waiter who was not only personable but efficient.  This time, we had someone who's level of service is equal to the finest of the fine dining restaurants of which we've partaken.  Her name is Madison, and she was beyond belief, especially since she has just turned 21 - her service is well beyond her years.  

We're a military family - I'm ex-Navy and my daughter is married to an Army LCOL.  Madison is married to a Coast Guardsman - if you are lucky enough to get one of her tables, ask her how she met her husband - it's a great story. Actually, I'd suggest you ask for her if she's on. You'll thank me later.  

Not only was she personable, and her service excellent, but she truly wanted to give us an exceptional experience.  We were there fairly early, but the restaurant was still pretty full (it was packed when we left, with people waiting outside), but she still found time to tell us the story of the restaurant and Pier 39, as well as talking with us quite often.

But her service was top-notch.  She constantly came by our table and asked us if we needed anything, and then spoke with us for a few minutes just to make our visit more enjoyable. She is a gem. 

OK, on to the restaurant itself. I ordered the crab roll, which was fantastic.  It's served on a brioche rather than a roll - the brioche is split and butter-toasted, and it is filled all the way to the bottom with a crab salad.  The crab tasted fresh, and considering that it's not crab season, must have been flown in from Oregon or Washington.  My wife had the lobster fried in their special Anchor Steam beer batter, which she said was one of the best lobsters she'd ever had.  Our daugher had the beet salad and a cup of clam chowder topped with crab.  All of our food was excellent.  

One thinks of restaurants on the water as being touristy and not fine dining. Not the case with Fog Harbor.  This place has incredible food, top-notch service (especially Madison), and a view that cannot be beat.

The only down side (this is funny) is that the food came out of the kitchen so fast we didn't have time to enjoy the view before it was there. We had just ordered (or so it seemed). I wanted to go to the restroom before our food arrived, so I got up and started out. I saw a waiter coming down the aisle near us with some plates of food, so I waved him by.  He gave me a puzzled look, and then said, "These are your meals, sir."  

Oops.  I've never had food served that quickly.  I sort of wish that they'd taken their time so we could enjoy the view a little more and settle in, but no one rushed us out of the table or made us feel like they were hoping we'd leave so they could turn the table.

I can't recommend this restaurant enough. As last time, the manager came by to ask us how everything was, and we told him honestly that it was fantastic. But the shining star was Madison.  She was personable and efficient.  

One other tip: if you go to this web site: https://www.google.com/?gws_rd=ssl#q=fog+harbor+fish+house+coupon  you can get a coupon that gives you a "Fun Pack" when you go to the California Welcome Center located on level two by the Fog Island Fish House.  In it is a 20% off coupon on food at the Fog Harbor.  It saved us almost $16 on the meal.  You can also get this book at the various Ferry Buildings.

If you do go there, say 'Hi' to Madison for us.  She's worth the whole trip.
author: Bruce H.

description: Food was good. Service not good. Took about 2 hours to eat for party of 4. We didn't have a reservation but they worked us in about 30 minutes--they projected that time and that was accurate.
author: Troy W.

description:
Amazing food and a beautiful atmosphere. Outstanding service; our waiter, Khaiman, was fun, helpful, fast, and just on it. He really made this place standout in my mind. 

I won't lie - it's a bit expensive and probably more deserving of a $$$ rating, but it was definitely worth it. The food was absolutely delicious (get the clam chowder no matter what) and super filling, and the service is top notch.
author: Michael M.

description: I would like to Thank the Fog Harbor  Manager for making my daughter and her Prom party a success. With the phenomenal customer service and great food we as parents couldn't have picked a better restaurant. I would also like to take some time to Thank the couple who paid the bill as a good gesture. Once again THANK YOU to the couple who sat next to my daughter and her prom party for paying the bill.
author: Fredo R.

description: We had the mussel fries in garlic aioli. Fries were perfectly crunchy and the mussels were perfectly done.I ordered the crab roll sandwich for my main dish.  Lots of crab meat.  Great view of Alcatraz and the water. Attentive service.
author: Virginia N.

description: Awesome!!!!!  Reviews  didn't do justice.  We had a variety of food and all was more than we could eat and wonderful.        My son said clam chowder was best he had ever eaten.  Wait staff very friendly and fast.  Also wonderful views!
author: Michael B.

description: Agreed tourist trap. Acclaimed clam chowder does not have much flavor and clams are lacking. Blue cheese garlic bread was tasty for the first few bites, but the blue cheese becomes truly overpowering. Salmon BLT fell apart in my hands (the combination of the weight of the salmon and the sauce tore right through the thin bread). Additionally, my friend's fish and chips were not cooked through. Plusses: oysters were fresh and delicious and the view of Alcatraz is great. Servers were also attentive and courteous.
author: Jonathan G.

description: Great food, great views and great service! My son had the burger and fries for dinner. He said that it was the best burger he had ever tasted. Two other members of our group had Shrimp Louie and Crab Louie salads. Everyone raved about how good the food was.  The serving sizes are huge too. Thank you for a wonderful evening.
author: Angie D.

description: Great meal..... Blue cheese garlic bread was a great app. My hubby enjoyed the cioppino and my crab sandwich was delicious.
author: Angela L.

description: Clam chowder was delcious! Best we had after three days of eating chowder. Mix grill was good, as was calamari.  I had crab ceviche which was flavorless.  Needed some type of sauce.  Our waiter was an elderly ESL man. Horrible service.  The other waiters kept jumping in to help and they were great. Would go again.
author: K Two's Mom N.

description: Fog harbor was really really good, I'm reluctant to give a full 5 stars usually, especially to a touristy restaurant, but I really enjoyed this. I got the mixed grill and my husband got the Cioppino. I've never had swordfish before, but it really was quite good, their shrimp was delicious, just wish it was more than 3 for that price, and their salmon..... Ohhhh their salmon, it was delicious!!!! I loved it! Side veggies and potatoes were just okay, but they're not the main focus anyway. The Cioppino my husband had was good, the only thing he didn't like was the unknown 'fresh fish' that was in there.... All in all, very delicious. I would recommend if you don't mind dropping about $60-$70 on lunch... It's a bit pricy, that part I didn't love.
author: Megan E.

description: Went to Fog Harbor on a Tuesday night and was able to sit at the bar with no wait. Had the Cioppino and it's the best I have had in the bay area (and I have tried many).  Service was great and dinner served in just a few minutes. The views of Alcatraz, the bay, and Pier 39 provide the atmosphere you are looking for when visiting San Francisco. A great find. Looking forward to trying other menu items.
author: Patrick P.

description: Unusual for me, we just walked in without knowing anything about this place. AMAZING. Hands down the best Ceasar salad and Clam Chowder I have ever had. The Ahi Poke was pretty good. Service and views were amazing. The sourdough was delicious and made us forget the trip to Boudin Bakery we were going to take. This is a must revisit!
author: LAURA F.

description: We had a wonderful meal. The seafood was perfectly prepared,  the drinks were tasty and service was prompt. We were waiting for a table at another resturant when we checked  the menu here and the wait was only 15mins. So glad we ate here instead.
author: valari b.

description:
I always shunned Pier 39/Fishermans Wharf for it's extreme touristy'ness. I never liked places like this, but when, on a family outing, we found ourselves eating at this place "out of convenience", I quietly also ate my words.
The place looks nice, staff was friendly, we got a table pretty much immediately, and the food was both good and totally reasonably priced! It made me wonder what it is I am paying so much for in so many hipster joints in Frisco these days, because the food is not that much better.
author: Stefan G.

description: My suggestion is to sit at a table that is being served by Tyler. He addressed us quickly and very honest about the food choices. I had the mixed grill and it was nicely seasoned and cooked to perfection. This was my second time coming here and much better than the first.
author: James M.

description: Ok at best . For the money I spent I wish the dinner was as good as the little cookie they gave us after dinner
author: Arnie G.

description: Meron was the best!! Nuff said. She's quick, fast and hilarious! 5 stars for her :) #happyCustomer
author: Fidel V.

description: The two times I've traveled to SF I've eaten here and left very satisfied. Really enjoyed the view of the harbor and the service was great.  Try the Ciopinno and the crab both were succulent.
author: Gabriela F.

description: 1st thing I want to say was our waiter Michael was the best, very engage and helpful with all or food a drink choices as well as just being friendly.  We started with the blue cheese bread (yum) and crab cakes. I had the salmon it was cooked perfect and was very good. My friend had the Ahi, the sauce that it was served with was amazing. My friend and I were in our own little world laughing and having a great time the atmosphere seemed to suit us. We were here on 2/19/15 @8:30pm.
author: Sarah E.

description: The service was nice and the food came out within the first five minutes, a major plus for a hungry college student. The atmosphere is great for conversation or a casual date. But let me put emphasis, the Clam Chowder is no joke! Order it with the sourdough bowl! Amazing!
author: Ken S.

description:
Fog Harbor is putting older restaurants in the Wharf to shame. The food and service reflects the ambition the restaurant has to be the best seafood option in the Wharf. I would never send my guests anywhere else unless competing restaurants seriously upped their game; Sorry Scoma's and Alioto's, it's not 1990 anymore.

Cheers to the manager Ryan, in particular, for his gentlemanly attitude, ready smile, and great service. Good bloke.
author: Nate L.

description: Just left from having dinner. I had the 1/2 Dungeness Crab. It was delicious and messy just as it should be. My husband had the Seafood Penne, also delicious. The drinks were strong and the bread was great. Great  view of Alcatraz and the sunset. Would definitely go back!
author: Wendy D.

description: The fish here is pretty darn good. The restaurant is very clean and the staff is always nice. The prices are within reason and the wait is not bad whenever I have gone for lunch. Looking forward to the next time im able to go.
author: Forrest D.

description: Was so full after this. Our server told us one of the things we ordered was about appetizer size so we should order more but that thing was huge! The seafood tower. We ended up over ordering and not finishing..
author: Priscilla C.

description: Yes, yes, yes! I went for the crab cakes, but I'll go back for the chile shrimp on the appetiser menu. In fact, I'll probably have a side salad, the complimentary (and amazing!) sourdough bread and the chile shrimp and call it a day. They were outstanding!  The view is to die for, the atmosphere wonderful and, in my case, the service was superb. I'll be back!
author: Paul F.

description: At first I had my doubts.  I mean this restaurant is smack dab in the middle of tourist trap heaven!  But once we were greeted and seated, it felt miles from the madness.  Our window side table was fabulous with a clear shot of Alcatraz right before the fog rolled in.  Our waitress was not only friendly and attentive, but also gorgeous. Our party of 9 + 2 kids was a handful, but she took care of all of us and was prompt and attentive.  I had the filet and a ginger beer cocktail (skinny style) and both were great.  For dessert I ordered the apple crumble and it did not disappoint.  My colleagues all enjoyed their meals -- ranging from kids meals to linguini and clams -- and the ambiance of the place.  It was classic, with soothing music and a nice busy vibe without being overwhelming.  This place is a classic and if you want a nice view and some good food & service, book a table here right away!
author: Lisette C.

description: Service was excellent from the hostesses to our server Quianna...we had a lovely experience, fabulous meal and beautiful view. We will definitely come back again and again and again....
author: Annemarie M.

description: Came here for a late lunch at 2PM visiting from LA on Valentines day weekend. Took about 40 min for 4. We had the seafood tower ($65), fried shrimp ($20) and muscle fries ($20). The food was good, but probably not worth the price. The seafood tower had half of a small lobster, half a dozen oysters, and half of a small crab. The best part of the meal were probably the raw oysters. Clean, sweet, and delicious. However, we did happen to get $1 oysters at happy hour the night before at Boudin which made the comparison price here expensive. Beautiful view of the ocean though.
author: C K.

description: Horrible place and awful service. My wife and I and another couple had a bottle of wine at the bar while we waited for our table and the bartender was very rude and unpleasant. Then we were seated and given menus and not 5 minutes later the manager came over and said they would not serve us any more drinks. At no point were we rude or obnoxious. I guess the bartender was having a bad day and needed to take it out on someone. Overall the service and atmosphere was severely lacking.
author: Charlie C.

description: Party of 7 people  every one was veryr happy food is good service is verey nice.  Nothing complain ...
author: yagusa t.

description: Won't be coming back. Our server was slow, actually served drinks and took order of a couple that came in after us (hadn't even been to our table yet). The lobster roll was so-so, needed salt, nothing special, not for $19. The clam chowder wasn't that good. Have had much better there at fishermans wharf. I come to the city quite a bit, but won't be eating here again.
author: Lori A.

description: Great place to bring out of town guests. Unlike some of the other Fishermans wharf options, the food is delicious and worth the price. I would highly recommend the lobster mac and cheese!
author: Ali H.

description: I live locally and typically detest the tourist trap restaurants. So I was pretty surprised when I went in here and not only found the bar awesome and drinks inspired but the food is delicious as well. The seafood tower is a must try and for a fish house the steaks are mighty tasty! They recently won a margarita contest and if you try the Hibiscus Margarita you'll see why. Ignore the tourist location and give it a try, you won't be disappointed. Oh and the staff is super friendly. Always welcoming and talkative with all the customers.
author: Jacob C.

description: For a restaurant that is in the middle of a tourist attraction it is very good. The chowder was great and the service was very good.
author: Karim E.

description: Best clam chowder I've ever had, hands down.  The waiter was very patient with my six year old and seven month old daughters.  We also had the blue cheese toast for an appetizer- so good!  I was surprised by the quick service by noticing how busy they were.  There were no open tables around and our food was delivered in a timely fashion.  So delicious and we would go back!!
author: Katie S.

description: The clam chowder was great and the mixed grill had great salmon, swordfish and shrimp. Our server Tyler took great care of us!!
author: Dustin J.

description: Had really high hopes for this one but it really failed. We waited 30 minutes for a table and when we were finally sit and excited to eat the food was so bland i could not believe it. We had a party of 6 and i tasted every plate and nothing impressed me except the drinks. The bill was over 300 and I will never go back. Dont know if it was just a bad night but I am not taking that chance again.
author: Jimmy M.

description: Lots to choose from on Fisherman's Wharf, but this place was w GREAT choice. Got seated right away, near the windows, and the view of the Marina is spectacular. Crab cakes were delicious, and we are East Coasters! Linguini w/ clams was split between two people and was plenty after crab cakes and salads. Service was timely and friendly. We had Madison and she was wonderful!
author: Alex B.

description: I didn't think the food was any thing spectacular. The wedge salad was gnawingly overdressed and could have used 4X more bacon and tomatoes. I had a steak and it was fine but I wouldn't order it again. My husband had a fish platter and again, it was pretty mediocre.
author: Ashley L.

description: The food here was very good and our server Shawna was awesome.  The have a great view of the bay too.  We had their special which consisted of dungeness crab, lobster, boiled shrimp, and oysters on the half shell. Everything was very fresh and tasted very good.
author: Brent S.

description: We were seated promptly via our Yelp/Open Table reservation. All dishes were presented well. The lettuce of the Crab Louis looked like it could have been fresher. The portions were decent, except for the most expensive entree of the night -- Crab-stuffed Salmon -- at $33. Service was excellent; otherwise, I would have given them three-stars. Overall, a little spendy for what you got, but it is on Pier 39.
author: Jason H.

description: Great food, like really really great! Wonderful atmosphere and staff. Also have out of this world aged manhattan, must try it!!! Only down fall was server didn't come by often enough and we sat a long time
author: Tonya M.

description: Best place we ate while on vacation last week. We LOVE seafood & the other joints on the wharf came up short compared to this place. The crab & avocado caesar salad was phenomenal. The hubs had a pasta dish w/ shrimp. The cocktails were so good, we had several - especially recommend the Long Island iced tea & a pink hibiscus concoction that I can't remember the name of. Our only regret is that we didn't eat there first and wasted money at other substandard restaurants.
author: Farcie F.

description:
Wow, the fresh sourdough bread is the bomb here.  They apparently make it fresh every 20 minutes. 

I am not a fan of eating in this area given the large crowds of tourists. Fog Harbor however is a little oasis in the middle of all the madness. Everything we ordered was pretty good. The views of the water are pretty spectacular too. Definitely a better option than Hard Rock and other tourist traps nearby. 

Tip - you can get 20% if you purchase $20 worth in the gift shop downstairs.
author: Sunil R.

description: Great restaurant in with a great view. Pier 39 is always a favorite stop when entertaining our out of town guests . Fog Harbor always impresses.
author: Bob B.

description: Sorry very disappointed in this place.  The waiter was unfriendly and seemed to avoid me.  The crab was stringy and tasteless and I was only given 1/2 full butter cup.  Went here 5-6 years ago and had a great experience.  I guess it is all about who your with!
author: Beverley M.

description: The appetizer (spicy garlic shrimp) was awesome!!  The clam chowder was good and my wife and I shared the fish and chips which were also very good.  We sat by the window and enjoyed an amazing view!!
author: Jason C.

description: Touristy? By association to Pier 39 anywhere near would be. That's not the feel inside; classy and clean. All staff we encountered were friendly and engaging. Pierre, our server, was patient and attentive. Good service was fast and well portioned. Price was reasonable and food was good. wife had California Crab Salad and it was mostly crab and very tasty. 10 y/o had the kids salmon and cleaned his plate.
author: Kenneth C.

description: I love this place. You can ask for the nice enjoyable window view. Try the fish n chips and clam chowder in bread bowl yum yum. Also try creme brûlée for dessert.
author: Sara K.

description: They have the freshest, best seafood of any place. It is on par with Scomas. The clam chowder is delicious.
author: Lyn K.

description:
We started our day hiking the Perimeter Road on Angel Island and ended it among the crowds on Fisherman's Wharf. I'd neglected to get reservations the day before, so we were stuck with a 9pm reservation I made at the last minute. With 3 hungry teenagers, a 7-year-old, and two hungry/tired parents, 9pm seemed forever away. I figured we'd try for earlier and see what we could do. Amazingly, they sat us right away--a party of 6--and we still had a great view!

Dinner was pricey, all in all, but quite frankly, it was worth it. Don't go to a restaurant in a tourist trap if you want inexpensive. The wine list was good, the food was large portions and tasty. We had the breadbowl chowder, calamari, bleu-cheese garlic bread, hamburgers, tuna, and I don't know what else. We had extra to take home. The deserts about killed us, but we couldn't resist. Our waitress was fabulous and I left extra for her. We had a great experience.
author: David H.

description: They were able to get us in late and accommodate out tight schedule, we sat right on the water with awesome views. The food was fantastic and our waitress couldn't have been better.
author: Devin Q.

description:
In a touristy spot, but it's a beautiful restaurant with great views.  They validate parking, so you end up saving $8 from the parking garage right across the street.

I've had the chowder and as a New Englander, it stands up!  Love the fresh sourdough and the cioppino was great and huge!
author: Jenn S.

description: A great meal and wonderful, attentive server Curtis made for a delightful evening at Pier 39 in San Francisco. The house Cabernet was full bodied and just right. The Blue Cheese Garlic Bread and Spicy Shrimp appetizers didn't disapoint.  Wedge salad and Dungeness Crab cocktail were delicious and the fabulous creme brulee/dark chocolate cake combo dessert was perfectly balanced and out of this world.
author: Mairead D.

description: I ordered the Crab Louie, and for a $22 salad you really don't expect to get wilted lettuce. The crab was good, and the rest of the dish was fine, but if you're going to charge premium prices I expect a premium meal.
author: Rajesh S.

description: Really good food for a touristy place! Had the crab and really enjoyed it.  The drinks where great too!
author: Tiff W.

description: I really wanted to love this place but sadly it wasn't what I expected. We came after strolling around pier 39 and were not super hungry but I really wanted to try some SF sea food and have a drink so we decided to stop. We lucked out and were seated at a window seat. Beautiful view! We had a bottle of wine and ordered a cup of chowder and the crispy scallops. The wine was recommended by our waiter and was fabulous the chowder was full of clams and had a great flavor but when it came down to the crispy scallops and later the crab cake entree both were lacking and to me were not on par with a seafood restaurant. The crispy scallops were super fried- I thought they would be lightly breaded but they were chewy and covered in deep fried batter. The crab cake was the same thing. Instead of delicate crab cakes lightly fried or baked they were as fried as the scallops and truly lacked flavor. I wish I had more time to try this place again but I want to explore more places here in SF before we head home to Chicago.
author: Isabel C.

description: Great fare, friendly and professional service team. Near Pier 39 but not a tourist trap. Fresh seafood expertly prepared.
author: Pony J.

description: Fog harbor was so delish!!! The service, view and atmosphere really made me feel at home. Request Khaiman as your waiter if you can. He truly gave us VIP service and tips for our time in San Fran.
author: Allison M.

description: Delicious food and excellent service! If you get Khaiman as your waiter, expect a wonderful dining experience.
author: Inez A.

description: Good food and views. Enjoyable setting and family environment. Make sure you bring a large line of credit. But well worth the cost.
author: Keith B.

description: Had a great birthday dinner for a friend here. Samir, our waiter, was on point and awesome providing the best service you could ask for and even joining in for a birthday song for our mate! Samir you rock and we'd definitely come back again because of him!
author: Rosslee M.

description: Incredible food and service! Samir made our experience awesome we will definitely come back because of him!!!
author: Katina Y.

description: Wow is all I have to say. Every single thing we ate was out of hand. I suggest skipping out on the appetizers and just saving room for your meals. Lobster mac and cheese, garlic crab everything was out of hand good!
author: Jackie B.

description: My husband and I looked for restaurants at Fishermans Wharf on yelp before we went there.  So glad we took other reviewers advise.  We shared a bowl of Clam Chowder in a sour dough bowl, the bay scallops and the beet and blue cheese salad.  Everything was outstanding, the service was a bit slow but that is ok.  I think the prices were very good and the desserts look amazing but I was full so we passed!
author: Kelley G.

description: I gave it 3 stars because of the food. Dungeness crab meat sandwich is super yummy  but the  service was poor.
author: Alex T.

description: The food here is amazing! Sat by the window and had a great view of the bay. Our server, Tyler, was excellent. Hope to be back soon!
author: Meghan M.

description: Very good! I'm glad I went
author: Ryan A.

description: Was not at all impressed with this place. The tables were too close to each other and I felt very claustrophobic. We ordered fried calamari, baked oysters, clam chowder - have had better, chicken penne - pasta was dry, wild salmon, crab roll, and fried combo. Overall, the food was just okay. Service wasn't too great either.
author: Micah Anne M.

description:
Came here with my family on Christmas Eve. Got seated pretty quickly, even without a reservation. The food was very good, I had the Shellfish Platter with 1/2 crab, mussels, clams, and shrimp. Very good portion, but pretty pricey. The other portions (not specifically sure what the rest of the fam got) were quite small though. Not worth the money they said. The service was...ok. I wasn't able to get a refill on my ice tea because my waiter didn't come around to check enough. Waters stayed empty for most of the night. Waiter seemed very flustered and looking to get our table closed out and on with our nights. 

No matter, Pier 39 is a nice place to search for desserts and coffee too!
author: Lauren F.

description: Amazing view and vibe. Excellent service and to top it off the food hit the spot. I was in for lunch and now I need to go back for dinner.
author: Jason T.

description: Beautiful views. Food arrived in a timely manner. The waiter was very courteous and quick. Tuna was delicious.
author: Diana G.

description: Such an awesome experience! Our waiter Samir was awesome!!! The food was great, the service was great, couldn't have asked for a better experience. Samir. Thanks for the awesome night!
author: Connie X.

description:
What is the deal people? 

Of course this is a tourist spot. San Francisco is a vacation destination. So what, The restaurants in these locations can't be good?

 They should be amazing considering all the people walking in off the pier from all over the world, however FOG HARBOR- doesn't cut it when it comes to food. Great location, beautiful views, great staff but OK food. 

 The bread is warm and delicious. The bay shrimp cocktail is very fresh and tasty. 
Crab Cake platter- ugh. Cakes were mushy and lacking flavor, slaw was warm, maybe from being under the lamp too long? Fries nothing special. Left half of my entree on my plate, including a whole crab cake!!!! Not good. 
My husband ordered shrimp scampi and our waiter made it happen even though its not on the menu.(excellent service).  It Needed more garlic but it was ok. 

BEST PART of THE MEAL?  The mashed potatoes. Amazing!!!  The best I ever had. 
The rest was just ok. Nothing great. 

Our waiter, Mike was fantastic. We really liked him.
author: Nicole F.

description: Niloufar is an excellent server. Restaurant has excellent food and is a must when in the San Francisco area. View is incredible.
author: Larry S.

description: What an amazing experience we had at fog harbor! The place was booming on this 4th of July. The food was great the staff was amazing! My wife and I sat at the bar to have drinks and wait for a table. We ended up staying at the bar for dinner because our bartender Mark was awesome.  He asked us what we usually like to drink and eat and whipped up some crafty cocktails to begin then paired our dinner with wine.  A definite win at pier 39, despite the large crowds and touristy area you can't go wrong with fog harbor. Try the swordfish, hibiscus margarita and ask for Mark!!
author: Frank M.

description:
Here on a min-vacation from Texas.  Great view and service.  I am not a big fan of crab cakes, but thought I would be adventuresome.  WOW - glad I was.  The crab cakes dish was among the most delicious meals I have ever eaten...period.  Real crab, not fishy, just delicious.

Get there as quick as you can.

Jp
author: John P.

description:
One of the best restaurant experiences my husband and I have ever had! It's a lovely, elegant place while still having a relaxing, casual feel.

We made reservations, and secured a nice table overlooking the bay. I enjoyed the bleu cheese garlic bread, which is free with yput Yelp check-in! Too bad my husband couldn't eat any, because of a gluten allergy.

I ordered a couple oysters, which were amazing and made me wish I ordered more! I ordered Garlic Herb Dungeness Crab, which was amazing!

This place is great about handling food allergies. My husband has gluten and mushroom allergies, and ordered the chicken, with which he was thoroughly impressed. 

Definitely go here for a lovely atmosphere, delightful food, and a classy experience!
author: Mindy B.

description: Very well run restaurant with great service and great food. We had salmon club salad and swordfish, both were amazing.
author: Steve S.

description:
I sat at the bar and the service was great!  Nice cold beer and to start off we had calamari...very good.  I had the tuna and it was perfect.  served with veggies and mash potatoes.  

I will be back!
author: Kenneth G.

description:
