We made our reservation through yelp earlier in the day. Our table was ready when we arrived and service was great. We had a lovely view from our table. The calamari was great and the spicy shrimp appetizer was also delicious. It is very spicy though so be ready! We had the tuna and scallops for our main meals and both dishes were delightful.
We would definitely go back! A couple dining with us actually did go back a couple days later because they enjoyed it so much.
author: Valerie F.

description: Best place for family eats (adults and kids) near the aquarium. We had Tyler as our server- he was exceptional and patient with three generations of folks at our table!
author: Brian S.

description:
Definitely an A-OK spot for lunch. Being from San Francisco originally, it's always fun to come back and visit my parents and see the city. Because they live across the street from Pier 39 it made sense to walk over and find a spot to eat. Typically I'd avoid a place so filled with tourists but they raved about Fog Harbor's views and so off we went. The views were indeed lovely! We looked out across the bay to Alcatraz and saw lots of boats sail past. 

The food was by no means bad but I think because it's a large restaurant in a heavily trafficked area, some quality gets lost in the mix. There must've been at least 60 other people dining at 3pm. The interior of the space is beautiful, the staff was very professional and polite and the food was good. Nothing wowed me but if you're from out of town and you want an affordable option that's not divey or cheesy, Fog Harbor is perfect. 

Expect seafood options like clam chowder in a sourdough bowl, crab cakes, shrimp louie, and even lobster. Other options include salads, sandwiches and lots of seafood pasta. Definitely something for everyone!
author: Katy H.

description: Had Kyle for our server.  First place we stopped after landing.  He is an excellent server.  Had spot on recommendations.  So pleasant.  Made our meal very enjoyable.  It's always nice when a server is happy. Plus in our party of 8 we all loved our food!
author: Karen O.

description: Outstanding food and superior service! The crab is the freshest in town and the salads are outstanding. The grilled veggies are delicious.
author: Jack J.

description:
Went here on Saturday night with my boyfriend. We ordered the chili shrimp appetizer oh my this was so flippin good! You have to like spice and heat for this one but were huge spicy fans. The sauce it comes in is excellent when you dip your sour dough bread in!

For our meal we ordered the whole garlic crab it came with corn (didnt really like) and potatoes. This was sooo good and so big! Great Great Great.

This place has excellent views as well. Its pretty touristy though which I didnt love.
author: Jess O.

description: Clam chowder was fantastic and jumbo shrimp cocktail was very fresh but sorely disappointed at our server Amy. She just handed us the 2 menus, didn't inform us of the specials. We had to hear it from the other table's server. She also didn't check back with us while eating. It took her a long time to process our payment. Great views and food , bad service .
author: M L.

description: My wife and I went here for our 5th Anniversary. I made the reservation via Open Table and put in a special request to get a booth by the window. Without me following up they granted our request which was even more impressive since it was a busy night. The service was upbeat and prompt and the speed in which we got our food was even prompter. My wife got the Alaskan Halibut and I got the mixed grill. Both were great! Atmosphere and views were amazing! Instead of a dessert menu they bring out a desert tray for you to pick from. Desserts on the menu tray are fake but that's not a big deal. The only complaint I have was a hidden charge on the bull for $3.50. Not exactly sure what t was for. But altogether our experience was wonderful and I will definitely be recommending this place to friends!
author: Dustin C.

description: Place was amazing, the Clam Chowder Sourdough Bowl with crab was awesome. And our waitress Sarah was amazing.
author: Frederick T.

description:
My family and I love eating at Fog Harbor when we are visiting SF. This review is for our recent visit on Father's Day and our excellent waiter Khaiman! With our numerous visits to Fog Harbor this man really stood out! He is a 5 star waiter and we hope to be served by him again.


As for the hostess, Velvet: My 1 year old was sleeping as we arrived for our 4:30 reservations (as she also informed us that we didn't have, but later was told by another hostess that we did) told us that I had to leave my stroller outside in the front as they have a "no stroller" policy. I was upset because he had just gone down for a nap and didn't want to wake him. So my husband parked the stroller and woke up my son so we could go sit down in the restaurant. About 15 minutes into sitting at our seat, what do you know??? A mom strolling on by with her stroller to her seat-- AND Velvet walking around with her clip board checking out the restaurant not saying a word that this other mom had her stroller in the restaurant (not to mention the baby in the stroller was not even sleeping).
author: C F.

description: Nice views, ok food, horrible service (newbie waitress was frazzled yet management didn't notice or stepped in, and my coffee cup came out with a hot pink lipstick stain on it!).
author: T L.

description: Ask for Meron she was amazing! Great service great food and great view! Def coming back when I visit again!
author: Kulsum J.

description: Beautiful view. Short wait for our bachelorette group with no reservation. Food was excellent suggest the salmon blt, crab clam chowder, and crab avocado Caesar salad thanks Madison
author: Michelle L.

description: This place inspired me to write my first yelp review. The food is great and so is the service. Our server Travis was very nice and took care of us very well.
author: Devrim B.

description: We shared a chopped crab in broth. Crab meat is more tasty this way.
author: Python C.

description: Great food, service, and views make this restaurant a must when in the area.  If you make a reservation consider requesting a window table to have amazing views. Sunset was beautiful to watch.
author: Derrick D.

description: Leslie and Oscar were both great they gave us exceptional service. Our meals arrived quick . The food was really good and to top it off it had a great view
author: Stefanye S.

description:
Don't let the location fool you, it's quality food. I have to say that I was bit worried about the food not being great with the restaurant located in such a touristy area. My whole family was VERY happy with everything about this restaurant.

After our tiring tour of Alcatraz, we were hungry and ready for diner. While our reservation wasn't for another 1/2 hour, they were happy to seat us when we arrived.

The ambiance, food, and service was superb. I'd be happy to bring any of my friends, including the pickiest foodies I know, to this restaurant and know they'd be happy.
author: Wendy L.

description:
I was on my way to a tour of Alcatraz, and my only requirement was that I find somewhere with seafood. I'm pretty sure I walked into a tourist trap, but that's OK - I'm a tourist. I probably paid more than I should have, but the food was good, the service was attentive, and I had a beautiful view of Alcatraz and the San Francisco Bay out the windows. I may be a tourist, but I'm a happy tourist!

Before I went, I was told to definitely order Dungeness crab. My dining companion ordered the whole crab, steamed, and it was delicious. As a crab aficionado, she was happy to report that the crab was good quality and cooked perfectly. I had the special of the day - a blackened fish (I'm sad to say I can't remember what kind of fish!) served on a bed of sauteed spinach and mashed potatoes. The spinach was served in an absolutely delicious sauce, I had to refrain from licking the bowl!

If you're a local, you can probably take the time to dig around in the area and find somewhere less expensive to enjoy seafood in the area. Compared to other tourist-"friendly" locations, though, this was definitely a good choice.
author: Laura S.

description: Half of our party were not seafood lovers but everyone was happy! Steak and chicken were amazing. Sea food was also great according to those who had it. Kids loved their portions. Got a great table with a view of the bay! Ambiance was great, casual but not too casual and fancy but not pretentious. We walked in off the street and were seated in less than 5 minutes. Would
author: Emmanuel B.

description: Soooo good. Thanks Samir for everything. Shellfish platter was variety and yummy, Alcatraz escape was a bomb and crem brûlée topped off the evening...
author: Heidi Y.

description: I've been here twice, so I might be biased. Love their wine sodas--a highlight to any meal. Their famous clam chowder is pretty good, but once you had a bowl, you are full! Their fish is very fresh and delicious. I feel like their menu is seasonal...they paired the Halibut with a mango salsa beautifully, but it was a little over cooked. Service is excellent even though there is a LOT of foot traffic in Pier 39. I would love to visit again!
author: Debbie C.

description: Tasty food, good sized portions, great service, amazing sourdough bread.
author: Jeanine C.

description: Hubby and I had lunch at this restaurant and it was phenomenal. The fish and chips, clam chowder, calamari and Marguerite were awesome. Our waiter Tyler was truly exceptional and so helpful, he made our experience so pleasurable considering this is my first time to the bay area, we will definitely be back.
author: Alesia B.

description: It's in fishermans wharf so I expected it to be over priced, but it's a seafood restaurant so I thought it would at least be tasty. I was very disappointed. They claim their clam chowder is the best in the city, but it's just ok, nothing special. It wasn't served with any crackers and it's a tiny cup for $6. The crab in the mixed platter has a decent amount of meat, but none of the other shellfish had any flavor. You'd expect the fish in the cioppino to have a ton of flavor, but it was the opposite. For a ridiculously expensive meal I would have hoped to be a little more satisfied at the end of the meal. People who give this place a high rating aren't used to eating good, fresh seafood so they're purely confused.
author: Sam W.

description: Our server Madison was adorable! She shared the history behind the restaurant which is fascinating, gave great meal suggestions, and was fast and accurate with our order. On her recommendation, we will be back for the fresh crab and AMAZING desserts!! Loved it!
author: Sarah J.

description: Party of 4 had a variety of food : shrimp cocktail and bluecheese bread to start, swordfish, mix grill, surf and turf and garlic dungeness crab and then desert-everything was fantastic. Great setting on the Pier. Our server was Samir and he was great too. I would recommend to anyone.
author: K M.

description: First time in the pier so we had to eat there. I am a sucker for great views so we decided on this place.  Based on the reviews my expectations were not really high but I was pleasantly surprised by how good the food was. My husband had half portion of crab and I had the pacific sole which was pretty good. After touring all afternoon, we both left satisfied. We wouldn't mind coming here if we were in SF again.
author: Yaheiry G.

description:
I really like this place! My fam and I wanted to the stereotypical SF experience and get Clam Chowder in a bowl.  We decided on For Harbor Fish House because it was close to the parking lot- Pier 39 garage and just looked nice!  Of course pretty much every place there has Clam Chowder in a bowl. 

For Harbor Fish House is on the second floor so its away from the craziness of downstairs.  Their lobby area has a fireplace where people were sipping cocktails which was cool.  We were seated right away at a half round table and got to see an amazing view of the Bay waters, Alcatraz, and Golden Gate Bridge. 

This place def had a classier feel and may be a really nice romantic place for a date. 

We ordered:
-calamari
- clam chowder in a bowl

I thought they were all really good.  Our waitress was super friendly and our food came out quick.  I mean they were simple orders but still.  The clam chowder had a lot of clams in it and the pepper sprinkled on top was good.  The bread was also very soft and it made me want to eat the whole bowl! haha carbs galore tho. 

I would totally come back but I'd be down to try other places at Pier 39 too.
author: Anya R.

description: Absolutely beautiful views of the Bay Bridge, Alcatraz, and the bay. The waitresses/waiters we have had are always very attentive and kind. Both times they have shared their stories of moving to the Bay Area with us once finding out we are/were new to the area with great recommendations on places to check out. The seafood is always outstanding and worth the price. We always leave larger than when we arrived. My favorite dish by far has been the seafood cioppino. Every bite was outstanding. I also always have to have clam chowder in a sourdough bread bowl. I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone visiting Pier 39.
author: Morgan M.

description: This spot is good! I took my girlfriend, now Fiance, here on the night I proposed to her... last week! I like how the menu changes seasonally and that they do their part to create sustainable seafood dishes. I ordered the King Salmon, I was expecting it to be dry and overcooked - I've had it served to me that way at even fine dining restaurants - but it was perfectly made here... pretty damn good! We had the clam chowder, shrimp cocktail, and some moscow mule drinks too. Great experience. I'm looking forward to coming back!
author: Mel L.

description: What a terrific restaurant. I had seared tuna for my main course that was wonderful. Although located in a tourist area it was not a tourist restaurant! I live outside SF and would never think a Pier 39 restaurant would be this good. The cleanliness of the restaurant was amazing.service was top notch. Enjoy.
author: John M.

description: Tyler was such an amazing server! Food & drinks were great. Much recommended! Ask for Tyler.
author: Teresa V.

description: We waited just 10 mins for a table at lunch. Ordered the fried seafood combo and crab cake platter, which arrived quickly. Delicious meal, fresh products. Madison was super attentive, friendly, and speedy!
author: Bonnie K.

description:
Happy hour :)

I came here with my boyfriend, (we are kinda broke grad students). So happy hour is our nice time out. We had a great time. They were playing the football game so my bf was happy. We got Angel Island Iced Teas .... it was a very unique long island: cute, girly, sweet, fruity thang... my by never gets fruit drinks but he got this one! I will add a pic.. 

As for food we got the calamari, our fav appetizer. Ill add a pic of this too. We really enjoyed this a lot. 

Good times!
-jf
author: Jenna F.

description: Great food, view, service! Seated by the window with a view of Alcatraz and the sea lions. The complimentary freshly baked sourdough bread was amazing. We enjoyed the crab, which was fresh caught locally that morning, and shrimp salad. The service was top notch in general, but in particular our server Martin was fastidious and knowledgable. Items are generally on the expensive side, but we felt they were fair given the delicious food, excellent view, and superb service.
author: John B.

description: Good food, great views, and quick service. Suuuuper touristy though and some very loud children. It's like a red lobster but with MUCH better food. My group split the wedge salad, mixed grill, and seafood pasta. We left stuffed to the rafters. The table next to us got the bread pudding which looked so good but I just couldn't fit any more food in my belly. I recommend this place, for tourists anyway!
author: Brittany W.

description: Omg!! If you have not visited this place you are in for a treat! I recently visited and had the surf and turf. The lobster was very tender and moist every bite was juicy and very well complimented with a pinch of lemon and butter. As for the meat good portion cooked to perfection ( depending on your choice) moist as well and tender. The mash potatoes compliment the whole platter very well! Make sure to notice the ( market price ) I had no problem with the price, but other might. Now on to the calamari which was so crispy and crunchy. I've had several calamari at different places but this was just too good not to finish. As for the crab cakes. Me being a self proclaimed food critic ( which I do very well) loved the crab cakes, first time and let me just say! You're better of trying them for yourself rather than keep reading. On to the clam chowder. It was very good, BUT it had more crab than I had expected still creamy and good but if you're looking for a San Francisco clam chowder I'd hold off.
author: German L.

description: Absolutely delicious! Had the steamed crab and it was worth every penny! The cocktails are great and the service is beyond incredible. I was extremely pleased with this place.
author: Ashley C.

description: great food and service. love the lemon drop！the seasonal crab is delicious！！the server MERON is super nice and friendly~
author: Alina L.

description: I had the best birthday dinner with my husband a couple weeks ago at Fog Harbor. We were on a trip to celebrate our anniversary, my birthday, and our "babymoon" as I am 7 months pregnant. We chose the restaurant randomly as we were walking through Fisherman's Wharf and I am so glad we did! Our server Shawna was absolutely amazing. She was happy and funny and very knowledgeable about the food and wine menu. She took such good care of us and made sure I had a fabulous birthday! Our table was right by the window overlooking the wharf. We had the calamari, halibut, crab louis salad, and a complimentary Ghirardelli chocolate cake that was to die for! We will definitely return to Fog Harbor for dinner the next time we are in San Francisco. Thanks for a great experience!!
author: Jaclyn M.

description: I've been to this restaurant twice now about a year apart. Both times, the service was excellent, efficient and the food is fantastic. It is also reasonably priced. Add the beautiful view of the bay and you've got a definite destination to visit after a busy day in SF!
author: Mike H.

description:
Breakdown: High price, good location, very mediocre food. Wouldn't come again.

I expected better food from this place after seeing the reviews. I ordered the Curry Muscles and Calamari. The muscles were some of the tiniest I have ever seen and the curry was bland and heavily watered down, more soup-like than curry. My brother ordered the raw oysters and chili pepper shrimp. The raw oysters didn't come until after we finished our other appetizers, and only after we asked about them.
author: Nicholas D.

description: Great food.professional manager .we ordered mixed grilled and grilled shrim.very fresh and tasty.
author: Max K.

description:
So rarely get to this part of town - but when visitors are staying nearby and have mobility issues, why not eat close?

Having tried a few places on Pier 39, I think this is the best choice.

View is EXCELLENT, service is very good, food is above average (tho not outstanding).

I had a rare tuna salad - it was quite good though not something I would crave.  Everyone else had some form of fried fish.  They all thought it was very good.  (Looked fine to me but nothing special.)

Overall, it can be a great experience when you need to be in this part of the city.
author: Mike B.

description: Wow. ..best clam chowder and crab salad!..Excellent service by Tyler his quick response and his friendly disposition gives this place a MUST COMEBACK!
author: Maria T.

description: Shellfish tower was more like a shellfish plate. Good quality food. Kids had fish and chips, mac n cheese both cooked well and adequately portioned. Salads are a joke-wedge was ok, Caesar was a head of romaine tossed. A/C was blowing in our table- everyone had to put on a fleece!
author: Pete M.

description: Found the food very good and there is a great view of the Golden Gate bridge if you make it before sunset.
author: Arnaud E.

description:
As tourists to San Fran, my boyfriend and I came to Fog Harbor with two goals: a nice-ish dinner and good clam chowder. We got both. We were also lucky enough to get a table with a view. Overall it was a fine meal, with fine service, at a fine price, but I don't think it's something that will stick out in my memory. We had better food at other places that weekend -- but I do think that Fog Harbor is a nice way to cap off an afternoon/evening of exploring Fisherman's Wharf.

Edited to add: My boyfriend had the clam chowder in a soup bowl, along with a glass of red wine, and I had a Caesar salad and the calamari appetizer as my dinner.
author: Kristan H.

description: beautiful location and great service. very clean and enjoyable, the menu was quite original but delicious nonetheless. great for intimate date night or night out with friends
author: Taylor A.

description: Yes, in Pier 39, one of the best seafood restaurants in the city! Gorgeous bay view, comfy big booths, unbelievably friendly staff. We had clam chowder w/crab, fresh Alaskan salmon and halibut, and our server brought a complimentary dessert for my husband's birthday. Ask for Madison -- one of the planet's best and most fun servers. Nice area with fireplace/sofas to wait for a table. They'll validate your parking ticket.
author: Karen M.

description: I was definitely impressed. Better than your typical tourist spot.  This restaurant is fit for foodies.  The restaurant staff keeps the establishment very clean and maintenance is efficient.  The clam chowder is very good especially w a garnish of fresh Dungeness crab. The crab avocado Caesar salad is a wonderful seafood treat.
author: Elyse R.

description: Everything was absolutely amazing! I took my parents here for dinner and the service was fantastic. Food was even better.
author: Noa R.

description:
Our waiter was amazing. I feel like a bad customer because I don't remember his name and he told me twice! I really wish I can give him a shout-out, so here is the best I can do: he's from Hawaii, looks Filipino-ish, has family in Los Angeles and is probably the best, most polite, most sociable waiter I've ever had (without being obnoxious!) So there Fog Harbor Fish House, give him a well-deserved raise!

My boyfriend and I walked all the way through Pier 39 and no other restaurant was calling my attention. I finally spotted two restaurants upstairs, and right when I read the menu for Fog Harbor, I was convinced. My cheffy boyfriend is very picky as well  (though he'll never admit it) and I knew it was a good choice for the both of us.

The crab menu was super impressive. The crab season is about to end and they offered a page worth variety of crab entrees if you're into it. I ordered the crispy calamari before we sat down by the window with a great Golden Gate Bridge view, and it came out within 8 minutes or so. It definitely did not disappoint! They served it with a delicious aioli and the calamari were thicker chunks with light and crunchy batter.

With me being prego, and already having had my 3rd 6oz low-mercury dish for the week, I unfortunately had to go with a non-seafood option. I only say "unfortunately" because Fog Horn looks like they can serve up a mean seafood dish. I chose to go with the Chicken breast sandwich with shallot aioli, bacon, avocado, lettuce and tomato. It was perfectly juicy and flavorful and the aioli brought the sandwich together, setting it apart from what a Chicken BLT w/ avocado would taste like.

Tony ordered the Fog Horn Burger medium rare, with a half glass of red wine. The Fog Horn came with caramelized onions and Tony asked to substitute the jack cheese for blue cheese instead. It also had 1000 Island Chipotle on it and he seriously savored every single bite. The blue cheese swap definitely made a huge difference. I had one happy chef man sitting in front of me!

All in all, we spent $50. With the presentation, the wine, the amazing service, the freshness of the food and the promptness of the food arrival, I was impressed and beyond satisfied. I would recommend this place and I would definitely come back.
author: Aileen P.

description: This place looks like a typical fish food shack from the outside.  But it is quite nice on the inside and definitely on the higher end of sea food.  Excellent view of the water.  The blue cheese garlic bread was awesome.  We got the fish and chips and penne with chicken, both were very good.  The service was excellent.  It was pricey though.  2 people, 2 plates, and 2 sodas ran about 70 bucks.
author: Joel S.

description:
This restaurant looks good on the surface. Sustainable fish (hooray! A priority for me), amazing view of Alcatraz, nice decor, and a tasty sounding menu. However, many of the items we ordered were mildly disappointing. 
Our starters, chili lime shrimp salad and (on special) crab ceviche with mango and avocado, were bizarrely similar just with different protein. The ceviche was served on lettuce, drizzled with the same salad dressing which was mildly mustardy and didn't go with the dish. Also, while the amount of crab was decent, it actually seems skimpy on the mango, avocado, and lime. Definitely missing a ceviche sort of flavor, but it was a tasty pile of shredded crab meat. Both starters also had the same house made tortilla chips, just in different shapes. 
My husband liked his crab roll sandwich, and the sweet potato fries that came with it were good. If I had realized my salmon sandwich came with fries, I would have upgraded to sweet potato. Blackened salmon was a nice option. Half my sandwich was leftover and still good the next day, cold. 
Our drinks were just okay. We didn't stay for dessert. If you go, insist on a seat with a view.
author: Karin W.

description:
Amazing. 
For a tourist, like myself, the view was very nice and all. Water. Alcatraz. Golden gate bridge. Good stuff.
But I'm not the type of person who will make excuses for mediocre food, based on what I have to look at while i eat. I could go outside and look at whatever I want for free.
Fortunately, the food here stands on its own.
I ordered the swordfish. It was undoubtedly the best swordfish I've ever eaten in my life. It came on a bed of fingerling potatoes, grilled onions, peppers and capers. The pesto aioli was perfect, and the fish seriously melts in your mouth.
The sourdough bread is pretty awesome, too.
However, looking around at the plates of my fellow diners, I can see why some people would be disappointed.
My husband got the crab melt, which I tasted. It was alright, nothing amazing. 
All I know is, I got that swordfish and it was the bomb diggity.
author: Bri B.

description: Our server, Madison, went the extra mile in making sure we had everything we wanted (including plenty of warm sourdough bread!). My son said the Mixed Grill was the best meal he's had this year, maybe ever. The service was great and the food was awesome. Our wait was less then 20 minutes at 2:00 PM on Saturday. Totally satisfied.
author: Shawn M.

description: Awesome Ambience, Fandamntastic Food, Stupendous Wait Staff. Be sure to request the sourdough bread. Order anything, but be sure not to skip the baked oysters - 2nd best in the country.
author: Sean T.

description: Food was good and service was ok. Nothing outstanding. Our waitress, although nice was not on top of drinks.
author: Chris G.

description: Samir was the best.. Service was excellent and the blue cheese bread was phenomenal.  A must try at Pier 39 in San Francisco.
author: Adam C.

description: Went yesterday when we were craving some fish and chips - we saw that theirs is made with anchor steam and were sold!  The fish and chips were great, but slightly too salty. The tartar sauce was the best, it didn't overwhelm the fish as most sauces usually do!  Ryan got the angus burger and it was great as well, the bun was just slightly too soft and got a little soggy.  The best part of the meal was the amazing clam chowder!  I will be going back just to have that clam chowder in a bread bowl!
author: Katherine M.

description:
This place is absolutely amazing. Fog house really blows you away from the moment you walk in, to the moment you exit. You can always sit at the bar and enjoy their marvelous drinks, (skinny sparkling blueberry martini is my favorite), or wait outside near the little fireplace. 
The service was great, we were served by the manager, Greg, and he was just delightful. Starting with the delicious warm sourdough bread, to the calamari for appetizer, then to the seafood pasta. Everything was delicious the food tasted so fresh, and the view is great. 
This place definitely is worth trying for. It deserves five + stars! This place leaves all other fisherman's wharfs tourist restaurants in the dust, they really know how to provide quality, and great service.
author: Yolanda O.

description:
Fish & Chips - the batter was soggy. 
The service was slow but it was very busy. 
Had to wait 45 min for a table.
author: Chris A.

description: Yesterday french friends and I had a lunch at this place . We enjoy  very much   the food and Tylor who helped us to choose with effency and kindness.. We shall come back.
author: Jean-Pierre J.

description: Great spot at Pier 39. My kids love seafood and begged to go here for lunch. Didn't see the kids menu so we expected to be ripped off. However, it wasn't bad at all. Kids menu came with the usual crayons and good seafood selection. Son loved his grilled salmon. I had crab cakes which were pretty good. They obviously had panko in them but no lumps of crab which was disappointing. This is why they lost a star.  I should take off two but everything else was good even the service.
author: Carol C.

description: Wonderful experience at Fog Harbor. Family owned and run makes all the difference on Pier 39. The cracked crab is delicious and I recommend the walnut berry apple crisp for dessert--splendid! Madison was our waitress and we can't compliment her enough; she's pleasant, personable, and very informative. Great view of Alcatraz as well.
author: Faith J.

description: Sad to say, I need to write a slightly negative review for the first time. This place is very nice, clean and has a great view. Here is where it went unfavorable: ordered the clam chowder bowl and the salmon blt. When a waitress brought the clam chowder it was in a bread bowl. By the time we realized and said, "Excuse me..." she had just dropped it on the table and left rather abruptly. They later brought the bowl that we ordered. When the salmon blt arrived, I looked and noticed...hot dog, no salmon wtf?! I was borderline insulted by this and asked the waitress, "What is this??" She was nice and was surprised as well and took the order back. The cook manager (?) eventually brought the salmon blt, but by then I was sort of full eating some of my wife's fish n chips. I still give it three stars as the salmon blt was actually pretty good and they comp'd my order. Just wish they had their act together back there in the kitchen...
author: ryan o.

description:
We went as part of a fairly good-sized group (8) and they were able to seat us at a table right away in the bar area without a reservation at 5:45 on a Saturday evening.  I was shocked considering how busy the wharf area was Independence Day weekend.  Had the clam chowder (very good), calamari (very good) and crab cocktail (OK).  The place did proceed to get very packed very quickly so it would seem we got lucky with the seating.  Luck or not, I'm giving this place extra points just for the fact that they could accommodate us.
Edit: We went back two years later and the clam chowder and calamari were still great. My wife had the linguine alla vongole and enjoyed it very much (it was loaded with clams). The fish and chips my son had were only OK. Extra points to our server Pierre for really being charming and making an impression. While competence is critical, it's not what makes you remember a meal.
author: Bat F.

description: The wait was about thirty minutes, not bad for dinner time. The food pricing ranges from about 12-35$ per plate. It was amazing food, service, and had a great ambiance. My server was Jason, and he recommended the best dish and was super kind and helpful! I'll be back for sure!!
author: Alexcess Z.

description: I had the crab roll and it was absolutely delicious. Tyler was our waiter and he was absolutely great also. I would definitely come back and visit Fog Harbor Fish House next time I'm in San Francisco.
author: Karl F.

description: My fiance had the lobster special and I had the clam linguini. The food was pretty good with an awesome view. The price was decent. The only thing was the waitress wasn't very friendly and took a long time to attend to us, but the food made up for it. I also had  scoop of vanilla ice cream with drizzled chocolate on top and that was amazing all in itself.
author: Lisa N.

description: Great tourist location, fresh seafood.  Highly recommend a visit to Fog Harbor.  Good food, decent service with decent prices.  The garlic crab was wonderful!!!
author: Christy D.

description: Lived in Bay Area for years. This place exceeded our expectations great service,wonderfull fresh seafood .Ask for Alma she will recomend great food.
author: Simon H.

description: We flew into SF from NJ for an overnight, on our way to Hawaii. We chose Fog Harbor House because of excellent reviews, their sustainable fish program, amazing views and their Ciopinno sounded amazing! The Ciopinno, Ahi & Calamari lived up to all the reviews! The Red Chili Paste Garlic Shrimp was the best shrimp appetizer I ever had! Other members in our party highly recommend the Clam Chowder as well. Desserts were equally as good!  Our waiter was excellent: attentive, courteous, funny and enjoyable. Fog Harbor House is clearly "The Gem of the Wharf"!
author: Susie Q T.

description: Tyler the budding author with Florida roots was responsible for outstanding service and the crab cakes, chowder in the sourdough bowl and the crab roll were out of this world!  A great local restaurant hiding among the louder tourist magnets - don't walk by.. go in!
author: C T.

description:
This place is not too bad if you're not looking for something mind blowing. Don't get me wrong, I believe the food here is great and the quality is phenomenon. But the food just doesn't make you crave to remember. The place has a nice view, it's located on the pier, and the decor is very lovely. 

I had the oysters and I believe they were from fanny bay if I could remember. Only 1 selection. The condiments given could have been better. They are a seafood restaurant so I expected to have a larger oyster selection. The ceviche with crab was very delicious, but I felt the chips that were given to compliment it were just thrown on there. It felt a little stale to me. The ceviche could have been a bit more sour as well. I split the cioppino with a friend and because I'm a girl it was an okay amount. I didn't leave feeling full. The seafood in the cioppino tasted a bit dry and the mussels I had did not taste so fresh. I've had better cioppino with much more seafood in it before. We had the Alcatraz escape and the drinks were well made. It tasted great and it wasn't too weak. Instead of giving mints they gave a biscoff cookie, which I thought was weird. Overall, its's an okay place. Not great but definitely not something you must try. I tried to like the place, but I can't still. 3 stars because it's not a bad place.

My friend had the lobster stuffed crab. He enjoyed it. Still he agreed that it's not a memorable place. 

The server was nice though. He helped us quite a bit.
author: Lisa n.

description: This place must be avoided. The food is insanely overpriced, and the seafood was completely underwhelming. I can understand why tourists may enjoy the novelty of eating on Pier 39, but trust me, the view from the window will not make up for the disgusting taste in your mouth. I urge you to eat somewhere else - anywhere else - and keep your $120 for two revolting meals in your pocket.
author: Isabella F.

description: The service is great, the food at best is poorly adequate. The seafood tower is a waste of money and the Dungeness crab and lobster on the seafood tower doesn't taste fresh. The night before, we had Dungeness crab at another restaurant that was amazing. Sorely disappointed. The best bet is the mussels with garlic French fries. The ambiance of the restaurant is that of a large chain restaurant where the food is good but standard. Unfortunately, we all chose poorly since nobody at our table was really happy with their meal.
author: Sheryl W.

description: Came here for the first time after a tour of Alcatraz. Our waitress, Madison, politely informed us that she was new and a little rusty, but did a superb job! She was extremely friendly, but also very professional and efficient. The dining experience was above par. They serve you San Francisco's popular sourdough bread to start, which is a big plus. Additionally, we ordered calamari to start, which was served with a really excellent lemon sauce. Although it was very busy while we were there, we were served our entrees promptly. I ordered salmon, which was served on a bed of peppers, leafy greens, and fingerling potatoes. It was priced at $32 that day, but well worth the cost! Didn't end up ordering dessert, but everything looked excellent. Great if you're looking for something a little more special but nothing too fancy! Definitely would recommend this restaurant.
author: Emily F.

description:
I was delighted to be seated right away, but the experience was far from 5 stars. Our waitress brought us dirty plates. I requested new ones and they came back less dirty (probably the same ones wiped down). 

We ordered the Cioppino to share and half a dozen oysters. The oysters were fresh and delicious. The Cioppino was average and not loaded with enough seafood. Two shrimps, two scallops...not to mention we ordered the additional pasta ($2) but there was none. 

We decided to order a burger because it wasn't enough food. We waited for a while. Our waitress came back to tell us that the kitchen was busy and if we want to cancel our order. We agreed and she apologized about the pasta and the burger. $46 spent and still hungry, it would have been better if we ate somewhere else in Fisherman's Wharf. Despite the awesome romantic view of the ocean and nice ambience of the restaurant, the food and service were not up to par.

Avoid touristy restaurants I guess, unless they are the only available option.
author: Alice A.

description:
This is a late review, however, I wanted to input the info. GREAT CLAM CHOWDER bowl, great ambiance, service marvelous (even though it was so busy on a Friday night!), the fresh flower arrangements are beautiful, and found the staff all to be quite pleasant.

I spent a girls weekend, visited SFwith 8 gals, was very nice there and we all had great things to say about the place!  YES, DO GO AND YES ENJOY THE EATS AND THE PRICES ARE GREAT!  THUMBS UP!!!
author: Joyce A.

description: Ate at this restaurant twice while in SF this week. Got the Dungeness crab... Which was awesome but a LOT of work for very little meat. I mentioned this to my server who kindly brought me out some more! Very friendly staff...good food and drinks! A little pricey but a nice treat!  Clam chowder is to die for!!
author: Mary S.

description: Great food and experience! How awesome to find a truly great restaurant at Pier 39 that's not just a tourist trap! Excellent clam chowder!! Everything we had was great, including the views. Will definitely go back for the cioppino...saw another diner order it and it looked delicious!"
author: Jeanie L.

description: Food is okay, poor service, good view. server left and forgot my fish and chips and second waiter got my order but wasn't much better in service. I suppose, tourist don't matter. and they added extra SF employee tax. Thanks for nothing.
author: Kathy K.

description: Food and service are good. Location is great, very convenient.
author: Francisco S.

description:
5 Star food, 5 Star location, 5 Star Drinks and 5 Star views. What let Fog Harbor down tonight was Pedro our waiter who was simply awful. 
My wife and I shared a warm spinach salad and crab cakes for starters. The salad was enormous, fresh and tasty with just the right amount of feta and the crab cakes were perfectly cooked and seasoned.
For mains we chose Lobster Tail with mashed potato and Seared Scallops and salad. These also did not disappoint as the serving size was excellent and the taste, brilliant. Just enough seasoning to enjoy while still allowing us too enjoy the natural flavor of the fresh catch.
I would return again anytime as looking around he restaurant it was clear our waiter was the exception to what appears to be an extremely well run and professional establishment with excellent food.
author: Nick B.

description: Tourist trap. Nothing special if you live in SF. Dollar sign should actually be 3 $$$ for this restaurant. Service was great.
author: Alexis G.

description:
This was kinda late but i had to leave a review. I came here with my boyfriend on forth of july to see the fireworks. We yelped this before we came to the pier and gave this place a try. I know they were busy and i didnt mind the wait for an 1 hour and a half. Luckily there was a lounge so my boyfriend and i were able to rest. When we were seated we thought we got the best seat because it was at the corner near the windows. We can see the fisherman wharf but on my right, people from outside can see us which was awkward. So the waiter was very sweet and was kind to take a picture of my boyfriend and I. Since I LOVE the picture so much, i had to give him a tip. So anyways, 1 star for the service. Food....however....
Was HORRIBLE. My boyfriend order the Surf and Turf, medium rare. Nope. It was well-cooked. Then he ask the waiter for a recommendation for a heavy wine. My boyfriend thought it was all right. Wasn't heavy for him, but everyone is different.
So for my food. I order the Caesar salad (idk the full name but it's close to it). Maybe it was me, but I have never really experience not having my lettuce cut so i had to cut them myself. I asked for chicken too but they only gave me like 8 small pieces and 3 croutons.....I was upset. I had way better salad at other places. Other than that, if you love oysters, you gotta try the baked one. IT WAS DELICIOUS! +1 Star. If i knew it was that good, i would have ordered three instead of that salad -_- but nope. The osyter appetizer came after our dinner. But yeah i don't think i'll come back :l
author: Frances S.

description: Very tasty food and nice romantic atmosphere. The crab cakes were especially delicious.
author: Alex I.

description: If I could give this place zero stars I would! This place is the most disrespectful and unorganized place I have ever been and I didn't even get to try the food. Made a reservation for 9 people and they refused to seat us at 8 people because we needed everyone there. I would not mind waiting if the restaurant was not 90% empty! Makes no sense. On top of this when we had everyone, they made us wait saying they needed to talk to a manager before seating us. ?!? Wtf?!  A couple comes up to the restaurant and asked to be seated 5 minutes into my party waiting for the manager and they sat them nooooooo problem. The absolute worse service by far. They need to hire new hostesses who know how to do their job. And manager that never showed up...you suck the worse!
author: Wendy T.

description: First time here and really impress me, the foods and drinks are really good, Moscow Mule cocktail please try it guys, I really like it!! But here is the issue, me and my family here for vacation and we order some crab, but for some reason when the crab come out, it looks like the crab swimming on the butter pool?.....whats this? Well I dont know, so we call our server and tell him about the problem, and then he say he will call the manager, so when the manager come we let him know the issue, he was like im so sorry about the problem then give us the new crab for free, so this is really impress me, the manager is really nice and friendly, he didnt say anything just give us new dish~will come back again next time if I have a chance!!!!
author: Scott T.

description: This place is over rated. The food is just OK.. not bad, but not impressed neither. I could give a 3.5 only because of the view. We had clamp chowder, fried mix (fish is not good at all) and clamp linguini. Dont recommend. U can find better seafood in Monterey.
author: Chen H.

description: Okay, so this place is not cheap but you WILL NOT REGRET IT.  We had dinner here, I got the King Salmon and my husband got the swordfish.  We LOVED IT!!  You must try these dishes, so much flavor and the fish is local so it just looks and tastes so fresh.  I highly suggest you try this place, the staff is so friendly and it's a large restaurant, don't let the entrance fool you it curves around the back of the pier.  Very clean and we didn't wait long at all for our food (maybe 15 minutes).  ENJOY!  Wish we had something like this back home.
author: J P.

description: Samir was wonderful. Great waiter and meet all our requests. Lovely food and drink.  View was lovely. Sole was light and very tasty. Hibiscus Margarita was best.
author: Kim U.

description:
This place was really awesome. We made reservations even though it was located in the heart of Pier 39. I was looking for a delicious restaurant that didn't have a strict dress code. (I'm 8 months pregnant and don't have the widest variety of formalwear) ;) 

We decided to try several appetizers, and then split a dinner instead. It turned out to be an excellent decision. The meal starts out with a perfectly prepared sourdough bread, it was so delicious. We had the calamari, I really enjoyed the dipping sauce and found it the batter to be delightfully crispy. My fiancee, didn't agree with the breading, as he prefers the light crispy kind. We also split the steamed mussels, they came in a delicious broth that was savory and delicious. We both agreed, these were absolutely amazing! We followed it with an order of raw oysters, and they were so fresh and delectable. They were a bit small, but the freshness and taste really made up for any shortcomings. We also shared a cup of clam chowder (how could we not?), and via others suggestion used the free sourdough bread in place of the bread bowl. We noticed a bar patron eating some amazing looking sweet potato fries topped with blue cheese, which you NEED to try because they are to die for! Upon further questioning with our waitress, there is a little happy hour bar menu that you should ask for if you happen to get the chance! For our main course, we split the cioppino. It was stocked full of delicious fish, crab, mussels, and shrimp, and featured a savory and thick tomato broth. It was really delicious, my fiancee found it to have too strong of a "fish" taste for him, but that's what made it awesome for me. For dessert we had the creme brulee, and it was perfectly caramelized on top, and creamy thick and fabulous... they really know their way around the dessert area! 

The entire meal only set us back about $150 which was pretty awesome for location and the amount of food we ordered. Make a reservation and ask for a window seat, the view is beautiful. If we happen to make our way back to the San Francisco area, we will definitely be back!
author: Lauren Y.

description: Excellent shrimp, specially the chili shrimp. The bread was fresh and well cooked. The mixed fish grill was very flavorful, especially the salmon. I recommend it for everyone, specially people who like light seafood.
author: Anupam M.

description:
We stopped in here after wandering around the wharf for a bit, looking for a late lunch, some drinks, and a nice view.  We were seated right away and our server was very attentive throughout the meal.

My boyfriend's clam chowder in a bread bowl and an Anchor Steam was just what he was looking for and he was very happy.  I ordered a shrimp appetizer that was very flavorful and a cup of chowder.  

We had a pleasant experience here and thought the food was good as well.  Nice alternative to the boisterous Bubba Gump nearby.  Nothing to blow you away, but a nice place to sit and relax for awhile.
author: Stephanie W.

description:
The food - 3 stars
Service - 4 stars
View & Ambience - 4 stars
Average 3.5 stars

After spending the morning around Fisherman's Wharf, we were looking for a place to share a late lunch.  We stumbled upon this place in Pier 39 and saw they served Fish & Chips on their HH menu.  They were having a HH bar special, but you had to sit at the bar for it.  The hostess sat us at the windows overlooking the Pier and at first I was resenting it because we couldn't get the HH specials, but I'm sure glad she did.  The sun was just setting and we had the most gorgeous view minus the smell and bird poop outside.  

We got the fish & chips and calamari to split and when we told our waitress, she was so nice to ask the kitchen to put the order onto 2 plates.  She was extremely pleasant and helpful checking in on us, and even getting us 2 different choice of dipping sauce for the calamari when we didn't like the mayo aioli.  

The food itself wasn't memorable and they serve large portions that we couldn't finish. I could taste the freshness in both the fish & calamari that was lightly battered.  I prefer a little more batter on my fish & chips, but the service & view was amazing.  The bill came out to a little more than $30 for our shared late lunch.
author: Sandy C.

description:
The food was better than expected for a place right on Pier 39.  The view is awesome.
The garlic bread with blue cheese was so good.  I make it at home like that now.
I'm not a fish person but everyone else at the table who ordered any seafood loved it.
I did like the calamari appetizer too!  The steak and lobster was really good.  I liked the stead more...  I would come back again and try the clam chowder.
author: Lisa N.

description:
One of those places that doesn't have to try very hard, with a Pier 39 location offering splendid views of San Francisco Bay, Fisherman's Wharf and Sausalito. And, because putting its best foot forward isn't necessary, it doesn't. 

Yes, the sourdough bread was excellent. And the fish part of fish and chips earned rave reviews. But the chips were mediocre, and lunch went downhill from there. The calamari was fishy. The Crab Louie, which generally includes avocado in California, didn't here - it was added for an extra charge. And a warm spinach salad "with bacon" had only microscopic hints, as if it was lightly sprinkled from a shaker.    

If you want a nice San Francisco meal at a tourist destination, consider the Ferry Building instead.
author: Steve L.

description: I'm giving this place 5 stars for service but 2 stars for food.  I guess that's why it comes out a 3.  Super smiling faces and genuinely nice people that work here but unfortunately have to serve mediocre food.  And for these prices I do expect more flavors.  Their Dungeness crab cakes were hugely disappointing with much more filler taste than crab.  I don't know if they make their crab cakes fresh but if they did they still taste like pre-processed ones with lots of bread crumbs and salt added.  Even the remoulade sauce tasted processed also.  I really wanted to like this place because the bartenders and drinks and hostess were excellent, but the food fell short.
author: Linda H.

description: I never go to Pier 39 unless I have visitors who want to go and I am so happy to find this gem in the total tourist traps. The food is fresh and of high quality, especially comparing it to all the junk on pier 39. THe chowder was loved by everyone at the table.  The crab cakes were very good and not the disgusting frozen heavily breaded patties with hardly any crab. These were full of crab, green onion, peppers- full of flavor! Everything we had was good, the service was very good and the view was gorgeous!
author: Piper W.

description:
this is a great place to grab some seafood at a sane price. the food was well cooked, portions were acceptable. not exceptionally tasty, but damn good. Definitely  would go back again. 

the bar was the best part. there are just enough locals at the bar. our bartender, Vinnie  , was the best. he took great care of us and was always smiling.
author: Sam N.

description: worst customer service ever!!! even the manager! i am not going to a restaurant that has a bad employees! doesn't want to understand your situation!
author: Marc R.

description: I know it's a seafood restaurant but I ordered the New York steak and it was very good. My husband ate the crab cakes and clam chowder and said they were better than what he had in Boston. The views of the bay were beautiful too.
author: Jovita E.

description:
This used to be my favorite restaurant on Pier 39 because of the view, food, and service. A trifecta!

However, my recent visit this weekend left me slightly disappointed due to the service. First, we were seated at a table too small for our party though we made reservations weeks in advance. The sun was glaring on our table and made us uncomfortable, so we ended up changing tables. However, once we changed tables, we ended up with a waitress that was extremely grumpy. Maybe she picked up an extra couple shifts? She was tired and lifeless and was not keen on interacting more with us than possible. There were plenty of servers and waiters around on a Sunday evening when only 30-40% of the restaurant was filled, yet our service was so slow. Our waters were too often completely empty. It was also a birthday as stated during our reservation, but we had to remind the waitress a couple times to get a candle... When the desserts came out, low and behold, candleless... and then the waitress brought out another dessert with a candle 20 minutes later. She then, charged us for the extra dessert and we had to ask her to take it off. Sloppy... and off... 

The food was quite good and well-priced, as usual and the view was nice, though slightly too sunny during sunset (they didnt lower their shades over the offending windows). Enjoyed the mixed grill, clam chowder, crab ceviche, and seafood cioppinos. Don't know what's wrong, but service is getting sloppy.
author: Farrah N.

description: Food was great, Service fantastic, and the view incredible!
author: Jim W.

description: Boudin was a cluster so we headed upstairs to FHFH for a snack.  So glad we did.  We opted to sit at the bar and were promptly taken care of.  The chowder in a bread bowl was amazing with a little added pepper and a little bit of tabasco.  The parmesan risotto crab fritters were a tad over fried but were delicious nonetheless.  And the baked oysters - I could eat several dozen of them!
author: Aileen D.

description: This was my best meal in California yet. We were seated very quickly, granted it was 2pm but still, it was appreciated. We got a beautiful view of the water. They claimed to have the best clam chowder in San Francisco and boy, did they not disappoint! It was creamy and savory and oh so good. The fresh bread they gave us was also amazing. I also ordered a virgin pina colada which was just sweet enough to not be tart-- perfection. I didn't think there was anything special about my mom's Mixed Grill she ordered but my Crab Roll Sandwhich.... oh man, the bread was light, airy, and slightly crunchy around the edges with plenty of crab filling. Our waiter was very nice when my mom thought she ordered a dish with mashed potatoes but instead received rice by giving her a side of mashed potatoes no questions asked. It's wonderful! Come here if you are ever in the area!
author: Lisa P.

description:
Lovely view, excellent service...drinks only ok, fish only ok. I saw a lot of tourists, as you might expect, and was overall not too thrilled. 

Our server was obviously new. My husband enjoyed his fish and chips, but those are hard to mess up. I had some sort of cold seafood on salad dish that I'd heard was good, and it was ok...Maybe a Crab Louie? Portion sizes were very large, prices were fair.

I really enjoyed looking out across the bay!
author: Celeste T.

description: Visited this place mid week and it wasn't overly crowded with tourists. Got a great spot in the window with views toward the GG bridge. It was really a nice meal and made for a solid date spot. The portions were huge. We shared the cioppino , a couple appetizers (including the NE clam chowder), lobster and sea bass. The chowder was packed with clams and no potatoes, it was quite good, but perhaps not as flavorful as say Sotto Mare or woodhouse fish co. Overall, the food was really good. I would definitely go back, but I think the fact it wasn't crowded at all made for a really nice meal. I probably wouldn't go on a weekend night.
author: Adam F.

description: So yummy! Nice meal in front water. Definitely have to try.
author: Jessica C.

description: Found ourselves on Pier 39 looking for something small to eat (already had a bread bowl with clam chowder while walking around).  Saw the yelp offer of a free appetizer for this place so figured what the heck.  Turned out fantastic.  Had a beautiful seat with a view, a fee appetizer and our Liquini with clam sauce was amazing.
author: Anne B.

description: Super busy on a Saturday night at 6pm. We were able to get seated fairly quickly though.  The calamari appetizer we ordered came fast and the dip that came with it was the highlight of the dish. Crab stuffed lobster was next.  The lobster was delicious but i wasn't a fan on the crab mixture which was strange since i love crab.  I also didn't like the garlic mashed potatoes either,  they just tasted strange to me.  My dinner companion thought they were delicious.  Now the best part of the meal. .... dessert.  I happened across a chocolate cake.  I don't normally go for chocolate but it was the best dessert option.  You know the fudge inside a molten lava cake?  That's exactly what it tastes like!  The entire thing and it doesn't have a cake texture,  more like a thick pudding.  Worth every calorie and more.  I honestly believe it's the best thing I've ever eaten,  in my life! It's a must have,  I may go get another today!
author: Rena A.

description:
Love this place. Visiting SF for the first time and found this on Yelp. 

Food was inexpensive and tasty. 

Starters: $16 place of two pieces of crab cake. Massive serving around 150g each. 

Main: $23 for a huge plate of mixed grill seafood (prawn skewer, a palm sized piece of grilled salmon, and a palm sized piece of sword fish, topped with brocolli and wild rice). 

Value for money! Highly recommended.
author: James L.

description: Came with 7 relatives that came to visit from Asia.  We wanted a view of the bay while we eat lunch.. This place was the perfect setting.  We had a corner window seat which I thought was the best seat in the house!  They started with fresh sourdough bread that seemed to came straight from the oven.  It was really really good.  They made sure we had aplenty and always double check to see if we were like more, which they would bring out promptly.  The food turned out to be superb!! The clam chowder and crabs were amazing! I will definitely come back if I'm ever in San Francisco again!
author: Lily H.

description:
Yeah, I had two bowls of clam chowder and I ain't ashamed, hunty!

Family always man handles the fish and chips, sometimes they get hella fierce and order calamari too. What can you say? When it's good, it's GOOD!

Always seating available even though they are consistently busy. 

Gorgeous view and wonderful staff, the GM is also very caring and attentive.
author: Matthew H.

description:
Nice location and great food. The service was also good.
Good choice of wine and great desert. The desert menu is rather limited, but they have really good stuff. We recommend a table next to the window enjoying the sunset ;)
Good price/quality ratio
author: Kenny A.

description: Not a bad seafood restaurant - although way overpriced, the view off of Pier 39 makes up for it. The service is attentive, and the food was pretty decent. I tried the Ahi Tuna Poke, which was fresh but under seasoned. I also tried bites of the calamari and several pasta dishes, which were all very good. It's a good place to go as a tourist.
author: Lauren O.

description: AWFUL service. I am not sure if we just hit them at a weird time but literally the table next to us got in after us and left before us. We sat around most of the time just waiting waiting for our food which was soup and salad only. One of the girls in our party ordered a clam chowder bread bowl and we were all half way down with our meal before she got hers. I think they must have completely forgot about our soup because after we said something to the waiter it came right out - except for our one friend. The bread it came with was good, I would not call the clam chowder "award winning" too creamy but did have some good flavor. The drinks we had were good but all in all this place is an over priced tourist trap.
author: Kayla H.

description: This was the best seafood I have ever had.  Tyler was an incredible waiter and we followed all of his recommendations for a wonderful dining experience.
author: Katea K.

description:
I would give it 3 1/2 stars if I could. At the end of the day....it's better than not bad. A little touristy for my taste but thats what you would expect from Pier 39.
I probably won't go back but only because I know there are dozens of better places nearby.
author: Chris T.

description: The BEST swordfish I have ever had. Fresh, moist, flavorful. Great view and good service. I sat at the bar. It was pricey, I had one glass of wine and the main dish and it was over $40, but for good food and a view I would recommend it and go back, on occasion.
author: Tiffany E.

description: Amazing view. Incredible food. The clam chowder bread bowl was to die for! Great staff...extra kudos to Leslie, he was so nice and hospitable!
author: Anabel L.

description:
My family and I went for lunch on a Saturday.  The service was top notch and the food was excellent.

I started with the dungeness crab cocktail.  It was shredded crab dresses with a touch of cocktail sauce and some lemon wedges.  It was fresh and chilled perfectly.
The main course was fish and chips; something I haven't had in a while since it's usually so greasy.  This fish on the other hand was beer battered perfection using the locally made Anchor Steam beer.  It was crispy and the fish was tender and moist.

The view was also great, looking right out into the bay.  I would definitely return.
author: Jeff P.

description: Our hotel concierge recommended this restaurant and we found it to be quite good. The food was much better than average fare available around the area and the prices were reasonable for the location. One thing crazy was their reservation system - we walked up and put our name down and were told that there was a wait time of one hour BUT we will have to check back in half an hour to make sure we were around and still interested in eating there. So, we walked around the pier and checked back with them to keep our place on the waiting list. There were several large groups and the place was very busy, but they did have tables for smaller groups of 2 and 4. The 10% off coupon from the concierge was honored. Will visit again if we are in the area as we liked the food and the staff was friendly. Getting in was a big problem as we had not planned ahead and had not made advance reservations. Next time we will be more organized.
author: Ramesh K.

description: Stopped here for lunch before going on Adventure Catamaran Tour at Pier 39 (an awesome tour by the way). Decided to eat at the bar to save time. The bartender, Tony, made our visit extra special. Despite being very busy, he took care of our food order and got us in and out in less than 30 minutes. The fish and chips were awesome, and they have a good kids menu. I agree, its nice to see a not quite so touristy place with good food, in the middle of this tourist trap of a Pier. We will definitely come back when we can spend more time!
author: Rob C.

description: We had a fantastic view from our table! The waiter was super nice and he suggested some good plates to chose from. i had the Mix Grill i would recommend getting it with the rice instead of the smash potatoes. The food was out in no time, quick service. I also liked how in the waiting room they have a fire place it made you feel at home. i will definitely be coming back!
author: Roberto M.

description: Came here to eat a crab. Pretty big legs, lots of good meat, fresh as can be. I got steamed veggies, and a salad. The service as a tad bit slow, not the warmest, but I was content.  Pretty pricey.
author: Shane N.

description:
Decided to make a day of it and play the tourist role with the family. Went to Fishermans Wharf  to check out the sea lions and decided on this place for lunch. Mostly because it was the highest rated place at the wharf and the free blue cheese bread with check-in. 

Food was good not great. Blue Cheese bread might have been the best part, it was very good. Cioppino was very good. 

Service was excellent, views are great. Good place overall.
author: Brent A.

description: Love their clam chowder!  Great location with beautiful view!!
author: Liliana B.

description:
We had the greatest service and the food was phenomenal. NOT! I wanted to treat my little girl to her favorite meal of fish and chips at her favorite place in the City, Pier 39. Since my daughter was famished, I stopped by the first restaurant that served a kids portion of fish and chips. It was Fog Harbor Fish House. What a big mistake that was. Our waitress, who acted like she had some sort of hearing impairment, seemed like she was on 'something'. I had to repeat my order four times. Yes four times. But whatever. Maybe she was having a bad day. We ordered the kids fish and chips, curry mussels, and the cheeseburger. After waiting for about ten minutes, my daughter started to complain for that she was hungry, and was there any bread for her to nibble on before her fish and chips?  Looking around for our waitress, she was no where to be found. Finally the double doors to the kitchen opened and out came our deaf waitress carrying our mussels. She sets  it down and I start digging in. I offered my daughter some. She refused, she just wanted bread. The mussels were fresh, but didn't taste curry enough (probably the freshest thing that we ordered) and  the curry sauce just sat at he bottom of the dish. It was like the mussels were steamed separately and the curry sauce was just an afterthought.  I looked up to ask for the bread, but the deaf waitress disappeared again. She not only forgot our bread but also a bowl to put my shells. I told my daughter to simply drink her cranberry juice that she ordered. She was quiet. I asked her what's wrong. She just looked at the juice. I grabbed the juice and sipped throughout he straw and to my horror that juice was SPOILED!  Half-way through eating, the double doors flung wide open and out comes our deaf waitress. I practically shouted for a bread basket. And as quickly as she came through the doors she quickly disappeared through them again. But too fast for me to request a bowl for my shells and to fill my water cup. Sigh. She comes out 5 minutes later with warm sourdough bread and butter. My little girl was finally in food heaven. After 10 minutes, my daughter's long-awaited fish and chips and my cheeseburger finally came. I finally asked for a bowl for my shells. Our waitress noticed that the cup was still full of cranberry juice. I politely told her that it was a bit rotten. She stated she'll take the juice out of my bill. My burger looked awesome. But at the first bite I noticed the burger was a bit tough and the bacon old and leathery, liked it was MICROWAVED :( NOT GOOD. The fries were okay, nothing spectacular. I was thirsty and asked my daughter for a little of her water, since i drank all mine and the deaf waitress was now where to be found. Then I looked at my daughter's fish and chips. I asked her why she was just picking at it. She didn't say anything. I asked her if she wanted a to go box for it. She said, "No box, please". She NEVER says this. I took a fork full of fish, that $hiT was COLD AND HARD! OMG. I quickly looked around for our deaf and invisible waitress, but she was no where to be found. I finally saw her robustness and asked for the check and two boxes (hey, I wasn't going to waste food. My dog hadn't eaten and could use the cold fish and hard burger). The check came and as I was about to sign it, the manager came up to me and inquired about our meal. I made a face and rolled my eyes.  He said that wasn't a good sign and to tell him what happened. So I proceeded to tell him about the fish and chips and cranberry juice. I was about to tell him about our lack of service, but he grabbed my check and went to fix my bill. He took out my daughter's meal and gave me an extra 20% off.  He even offered to fix my daughter another meal. Nice gesture, but it was too late. This place already gave me indigestion. Any minute longer there would have given me food poising.

*KUDOS*:

clean bathrooms
my adjusted bill
sourdough bread
mussels (but see below)

*ATROCIOUSNESS*:

service
fish and chips
cheeseburger with the leathery bacon
the lack of 'curriness' in the mussels
author: Anna D.

description:
Of the restaurants on the Wharf, I think this is a good choice... 
- great views
- decent food (5-6 out of 10... but it is on the wharf, where most food is a 2-3 out of 10)
- good friendly service
- good for large parties or children
- events room in back for large parties
- convenient to parking garage (we took my grandpa here, he didn't have to walk far to go to dinner!)

- try the blue cheese garlic bread, its quite good... and the wine selection is decent as well, I like the 1.5 glass option for a few dollars more
author: Beth P.

description: Really enjoyed the Ahi Tuna - rich and light and oh so tender. Get the Crab ceviche, not too much citrus and very full of flavor.  Service is friendly and knowledgeable. Classy atmosphere and a great view of the bay at sunset.
author: Charlene K.

description: Great experience from the front door in including the service, the view, and the food.  We got to share the cioppino and there was more than enough food. The sourdough bread is perfect with this dish. Pumpkin bread pudding and excellent coffee made for a wonderful end to this meal.
author: Barb P.

description:
My mom and I stopped in San Francisco on our way down the coast, and we had not made any plans, just stopped at Fisherman's Wharf and saw this place and decided to eat here. I cannot believe how awesome this place is. The staff was AMAZING and the food was unbelievably good.

We were sat down right away, because we didn't need a table by the window which I guess takes a little while. The view was still very pretty from our table inside the restaurant. I ordered clam chowder and my mom ordered fish and chips. The food took a little while, but they WERE pretty busy, so we didn't mind. And when the food came it was incredible, so no complaints at all. And then they came over and apologized for the little wait, and offered us free dessert!

I think I've just become so accustomed to horrible service in restaurants, but I was stunned and mightily impressed. And the desserts, like the entrees, were utterly delicious. Fish and chips were great, the clam chowder is the second best I've ever had (first best is Splash in San Luis Obispo), my mom's creme brulee was fantastic and the chocolate cake and ice cream I got..... no words. Just tears of joy.

Thank you to Shawna, our waitress, and Krystle, the hostess, for being ridiculously awesome at what you do. You earned yourselves some fans for life.
author: Deanna G.

description: For Fisherman's Wharf this place is good.  I had the clam chowder, which was good, not great.  But then I had the Ahi Tuna - this was fantastic and cheap.  For $23 it was a huge piece with veggies and mashed potatoes.  Tasted great!  Get the free blue cheese garlic bread from the yelp ad too ;)
author: Jordan S.

description:
A huge expectation beater. Really touristy area, so our expectations were low for good food. Had some great chowder an amazing bread. Also got a blueberry cocktail that was super refreshing. Most impressive was our waiter (Khaiman). He was super warm and friendly and made us feel like we were on home soil.  Loved that all of it was sustainable too. This place just hit all the right notes.

Great second experience. The highlight remains chowder and bread and view...and awesome service. Get there 11:30 or sooner, or you'll hit a wait. Skip the crab. Garlic bread yummy. Kids salmon meal excellent value.
author: Khalid N.

description: Upon arriving we were seated fairly quickly.. And were immediately greeted by our waiter David.. The restaraunt had amazing ambiance And the food was off the page delicious...!  We were completely satisfied . The muscle fries were hashtag pow!! David is absolutely and asset to this business..
author: David C.

description: Got the fish and chips with a cup of clam chowder. Both if which were pretty good , can't say they were the best I've ever had but worth going back to again. I think my server forgot to put the rest of my order in because the table cleaning guy came by to clean my table and clear it. 20 minutes later  and still no fish and chips. I mentioned to him I was still waiting for the rest of my order. It then arrived 5 minutes later.
author: Joey H.

description: Great place to have a decent dinner by the bay! The price is affordable and the food taste great!
author: Xin D.

description:
We came here on a Wednesday so it wasn't too busy and we were seated very quickly.  The view is fabulous even if you're not right at the window.  You don't want to be there when a bird poops on it anyways ;)

We started off with their sliders which were so good! I ordered the special of the day which was a stuffed lobster tail sitting on a mountain of mashed potatoes with spinach.  They also brought out sourdough bread and butter.  It was very yummy and a bit pricy but worth it.

I would come here again.
author: Sophia T.

description:
WOW this place is AMAZING! You HAVE to get the baked oysters! We also loved the blue cheese garlic bread (I know, sounds strange but is fantastic) dipped in the red curry steamed mussels broth.

The waitstaff is knowledgeable, friendly, and accommodating. They didn't seem to be bothered that we showed up with four people more than our reservation! They told us to come by again right at sunset; apparently the view is incredible. 

I got half a garlic crab which was super fresh, delicious, and economical. Also, in order to not single me out, they put bibs on our whole table - we had a blast taking pictures!

Go here, bring friends!
author: Cristina M.

description:
We were absolutely starving & didn't care if this place was touristy, we needed food! 

Lucky for us, our meal was absolutely amazing. For starters, the bread basket is so good we had 3. Warm sourdough - what else could be better? For my entree I ordered the clam chowder in the bread bowl & Ryan ordered the crab cake sandwich. The chowder was fabulous with big chunks of clams. Ryan's sandwich was very good - so good it was gone in no time.

We had a great seat by the window & our waitress was very nice. I'd definitely go back!
author: Kimberly T.

description: We went here for a girls night put dinner. Amazing food and staff! The view is awesome! Our server was extremely helpful and friendly. She made a lot of recommendations and was very attentive. Highly recommend the seafood grilled combination, wedge salad, clam chowder, and seared ahi tuna. They also have fresh complimentary house-made sour dough bread! Although, this was not the best clam chowder I've had (best is pikes place clam chowder in Seattle, Washington) it is pretty darn tasty! I wish I had room for dessert, but I was stuffed already! Great food, ambiance, and great service, what more can you ask for?
author: Diana U.

description: Bay scallops and calm chowder.. all you need to know.    Only bad thing is getting a table you want. I have yet been able to get a window seat despite open tables. If you want one I guess you have to make a reservation.  The food is worth putting up with the snooty attitude on seating. Waiters are friendly and helpful.
author: C C.

description:
I REALLY didn't want to do this. I even gave you guys numerous chances to prove that it was an off day (they were off dayS)...

The service at the place has gone down the sh*t hole. Seriously? I brought an old friend here today after boasting about how great it was. 

1. The hostesses paid more attention to the sign they were putting up than us. We weren't acknowledge for a while. 
2. Our waiter ... oh wait? Did we have one? I never saw him. 
3. We never got our bread and butter.
4. Took forever for the bill. 
5. We were trying to pay and get the hell out and were ignored. I mean..the guy walked right by us and our waving. 

Times recently before this:

*The hostess that was supposed to seat us sat a large group that came after us first. 
* The hostess told us to wait and that they'd seat us. They FORGOT about us. 
*Waiters were never around and when they were, did not seem to want to be there. 

I'm sure there was a lot more that bugged me/ pissed me the f**k off.

The only reason I'd come back is for the chocolate lava cake, but then again I've discovered places with the same thing...probably even better. 

As to not say that ALL their waiters and..well, everyone working there are horrible, Pedro is the only good waiter. He's friendly, attentive, and tries to make sure everything is good. 

Maybe it's gotten busier since we've discovered it. Maybe management changed. Whatever the reason, I will probably no longer be coming back or at least not as often as I used to (not even a third as often).

Fog Harbor is now the ex-boyfriend that has treated you like a princess and then turned into a complete douche. You want to go back to him hoping he'd go back to the way he was, but you know it's a lost cause.
author: Jeanette P.

description: Table by the window over the pier.  Crispy tasty calamari strips. Clam chowder that wasn't too thick nor too runny,  lots of clams, yummy.   They split the cioppino with pasta for us in the kitchen before serving.  Delicious.  Our waiter Tyler was attentive, efficient, not intrusive.
author: Lisa C.

description: We had seafood platter and it was fantastic! 1 is enough for 2 people. Anthony was very helpful! Try the chowder. Great food! Amazing views! Nothing bad to say
author: Alona F.
