description: Food was ok. Beautiful view. Very dressy and fine dining.  But food was not very flavorful. I had fish n chips and it had no spice to the breading. Two adults and two kids and our bill was 120+. Yipes.
author: Katie B.

description: I am not a sourdough fan so I am not really impressed by it. This restaurant is all about seafood, i ordered Pacific Sole, it's a bit salty and I don't like the way they cooked it, it's more like indian flavor. One of my friends ordered Dungeness Crab and looks good though. The service is very good, we've been there till 10:30pm and nobody seems impatient with us. I would say it's a good restaurant for treating friends just visiting SF since the location is great.
author: Vivian Y.

description:
A more solid 3.5 stars but I gave it a bonus 1/2 star.  

Service was excellent 5 stars.  We were very well attended to the entire time.  

We had the 1/2 crab Louis w/sub for blue cheese which was a nice side salad for 2 if you're not too hungry.  The dressing is one of the best I've had.  Cheesy and creamy just like my grandfather used to make!  Forget the Louis dressing and go for the blue cheese!

We also had the sliders which were pretty average and overpriced.  I wouldn't order them again.

The crab sandwich was excellent.  Bread was freshly made and the crab filling was delicious.

We had the kids and they had the salmon which tasted very good and the $0.95 sundae was a can't miss

Overall a really good experience.
author: Jason N.

description: We thought we had  a very good experience at the Franciscan...well, we topped it at the fog harbor. The crab clam chowder is EXcELLENT! And to top it off: great view of the harbor, great service and a very first: view on the sea lions of the San Francisco Bay! I thought it was going to be touristy: it was, but the quality was there too!
author: Sebastien I.

description:
I found Fog Harbor on trusty Yelp and was very excited to go! I made a reservation for 7:30 on a Wednesday and had to change it to 8 which was no problem. The restaurant was decently full too. And a giant party of about 50 people came in right after us. 

My boyfriend and I were seated at a very nice table, I had a glass of house Chardonnay and he had an Arnold Palmer. It was so difficult to choose what to order and two waiters overheard us trying to decide and at separate times chimed in with recommendations, which was nice. 

I ended up ordering the Shrimp Scampi, delicious, with mashed potatoes and steamed vegetables. My boyfriend ordered the whole lobster which was also delicious. It came with an ear of corn that was grilled and he opted to get the mashed potatoes with it. 

For desert I ordered the creme brulee. The melted sugar on top was a little burnt in areas but it was still satifying. My boyfriend ordered a pumpkin spice cake thing, it was good but we can't remember the name!

We had a very pleasant experience at Fog Harbor and I look forward to returning!
author: Kate J.

description: It was one of the rainiest Saturday afternoons all winter and we really just wanted a place to sit down.  We chose Fog Harbor based on how close it was (we'd just left the aquarium), and being the tourist trap that Pier 39 is, I wasn't expecting much.  But I was wrong - IT WAS GREAT!  We were seated right away, our waiter was right there.  When I said I wanted to leave to feed the meter, he suggested holding our orders briefly, which was brilliant.  All we had was the clam chowder with a side salad (it was early and again, I wasn't expecting much), a glass of wine and a Shirley Temple, but it was all DELICIOUS.  Truly, some of the best clam chowder ever - with bunches of actual lovely, meaty clams.  The sourdough bread was amazing.  My husband's ranch dressing on his green salad was delicious, and my caesar salad was great.  The prices were reasonable, and the food everyone else around us had looked amazing!  My husband is already plotting to go back, just for the chowder, but I'm excited to try something else with it!  But on top of this, the whole place was a class act - fresh flowers in the bar, waiters who were well groomed and attentive, a gorgeous view, even the bathroom was exceptionally clean and well-serviced.  Pier 39 is overrun with tourists,and we were there on a slower day because of the rain, but I have a feeling this place will hold up to the crowds.  Very, very impressed overall.
author: Lorraine C.

description:
Horrible. Saturday night waiting more than an hour. This place is a
Tourist spot. Low quality food, high price
author: Hasan Y.

description: Great food, great view, don't make the mistake of getting the bread bowl though. You can just get the large chowder and keep ordering free bread. Use the 2 dollars to buy half a coffee in a hip coffeeshop somewhere nearby.
author: Ben Z.

description: Parked in Garage across from the pier, walkway above street was nice and they validate ,sweet. We were seated right away.  Waitress made our night and the Manager was super wonderful, just checking to make sure all was to our liking.  Food was yummy. Good Evening with Family.
author: Mrs. E.

description: The service was very good, managers were nice and helped the waitstaff. The food was hot , the portions were good, they just lacked flavor. Nancy P is correct, no salt used in prep.
author: Lee P.

description: Stopped by on my visit to California. Had reservations for the evening but stopped in for lunch and was quickly accommodated.  Food was delicious, had the clam chowder, a must, baked oysters and the seafood penne and had the penne substituted for linguine. All were excellent. Would definitely recommend. Beautiful views of the bay and Alcatraz.
author: Melanie T.

description: This place was pricier than expected. It is a great place for dinner/date but you don't get good bang for buck with seafood.
author: Jin N.

description: Must order the Dungeness crab cioppino, so deliciously flavorful since the seafood is very fresh. The portion is very generous so there will definitely be left overs, which it taste even better the next day! It's also nice that they provide the option to de-shell the crab for you.
author: Stephanie C.

description: Their food is delicious! My husband and I went while on our honeymoon and absolutely loved it. The food was great, our waiter was delightful, and the ambiance was perfect. The only thing I would change is the time we waited. But overall the wait was worth it!
author: Amanda J.

description: The clam chowder was good. For fish and chips, the batter was falled off
author: Thang N.

description: This place is perfect for special occasions! The seafood is fresh and the portions are justified with regards to pricing. But remember you are also paying for the location. So don't be surprised if the bill comes out to more than a few Benjamins, even for a party of 4 that shared dishes.
author: Katsurina C.

description:
Looking for a restaurant in the Wharf that wasn't a total tourist trap, but would satisfy my lady's desire for seafood, I found Fog Harbor through Yelp. We weren't disappointed.

The food was excellent, and service was stellar throughout. Our waitress was attentive without being a hovering presence, and took care of everything from corkage (it's only $12; you might do well to bring your own bottle) to dessert recommendations (more on this later--holycarp). When we asked for more lemon, she brought a plate of six nicely arranged wedges. 

We started with the clam chowder in a bread bowl, which we shared. It was, as others have noted, creamy, full of clams, and not too salty. Of course you must not only dip the small wedge-shaped bread top, but also eat as much of the bread bowl as you can handle without jeopardizing your ability to put away dessert. 

Next came a half-dozen oysters, raw on the half-shell, with cocktail and wasabi sauces. Despite being an aggressively openminded eater, I'd somehow never had oysters before. Without the benefit of further experience, I think it's safe to say this was a good place to start. The oysters tasted very fresh, nice and briny, with a much more pleasant texture than I'd imagined.

For the entree, I got the special salmon (stuffed with crab) and Em had the mixed grill (salmon, swordfish, and prawns). Again, everything tasted absolutely fresh. All the fish was cooked perfectly--my salmon was just opaque, tender-firm and flaky. The swordfish, which I don't normally like much, was juicy and delicious. If I must pick a gripe, I'd take issue with the mixed vegetables--they were overcooked (to my taste; some of the zucchini strips were completely soggy) and unimaginative, though still a step up from the simply steamed carrot, cauliflower and broccoli you'd find at many common seafood joints. 

The dessert tray offered some interesting selections alongside a couple old standbys. In addition to the expected creme brulee and apple crisp, there was a pumpkin bread pudding, some kind of individually baked chocolate cake, and a pumpkin cheesecake. My girlfriend is currently obsessed with pumpkin to what's likely an unhealthy degree, so we got the cheesecake. Moreover, our waitress said it was to die for. She never lied--eating it was like biting into the spiced flesh of an angel, only sweeter and less sacrilegious.  

Two appetizers, two entrees, corkage fee and dessert came to just over $100. You can easily pay more for less in the heart of San Francisco's #1 tourist trap. If you're not on a budget, and you want to enjoy some well-prepared seafood with minimal frills and gimmicks, you might give Fog Harbor a try. We left thoroughly stuffed, and very happy.

PS: Parking is $7/hr in the nearby Pier 39 garage, but dinner will get you 2 hours free if you remember to validate (NB: I did not remember to validate).
author: Luke R.

description: Touristy, but solid.  Big restaurant in Fisherman's Wharf with a nice view of Alcatraz.  The seafood is fresh and well-prepared.  The service is attentive and professional. The swordfish entree that I had was excellent. It came with rice pilaf and steamed vegetables; both of which were delicious without being overly greasy.  The sourdough bread that they serve before the meal is also good.
author: Karma S.

description: Nice place. Swordfish was great. I would come back. They have a really nice bar, but a pretty limited drink menu, weird.
author: Eric D.

description:
I'm a East Bay Native and have been to the city for many a tour guide trip for guests from out of town and this was my first time eating at Fog Harbor. We had a party of 13, half of which were from various parts of the country and not local to the Bay Area. The experience was hands down one of the best dining experiences I've ever had at a restaurant.  The service was impeccable and the food was to die for. We had a wonderful gentleman named David G as our server. He was attentive and charming and just did an awesome job tending to our large party and his other tables. Will be coming back here again with more friends! Thank you David and Fog Harbor for giving us such a wonderful dining experience! (David deserves a raise or a paid vacation, or both! You are blessed to have such a wonderful server on staff!)

Ordered 
Wedge Salad with ranch instead of bleu cheese: it was a half a head of lettuce! huge and good :)
Blackberry non alcoholic drink: tasty & refreshing
Burger: super yum, caramelized onions were super tasty on this
Chocolate Banana Bread Pudding: to.die.for!
also tasted the chocolate ooey gooey goodness (mix between a chocolate flourless cake & a molten lava cake) it's like having brownie batter that is half cooked...in my book, super yum!
The FRESH baked sourdough bread was AH-MAZING!!!!!! crunchy on the outside and super soft on the inside, I would taken home whole loaves of that had I had a ziploc in my purse :)
author: Angie E.

description: My husband and I decided to come to SF Sat to get away from the heat of the East Bay. We walked in around 3:30pm, and were told it would be about a 20 minute wait. In under 20 minutes they sat us in the corner on the sunny side, which became a little bit of a problem for me. Thank goodness they have shades they can pull down or this would have been a deal breaker. Susan was our waitress in the beginning. It took a little while to get drinks, and even longer to get some yummy SD bread. We decided to order some appetizers so we went with the Crab Cake $19, and Calamari $12. Well, the bread, and apps all came out at the same time, followed by the entrees way too soon after. It's all about the timing, which you would think this place would have down by now. The SD bread was hot and yummy, as was the Calamari with Garlic Aioli. Now in most restaurants you get 2 Crab Cakes per order, especially when they're charging $19!!!! It was ok, we've definitely had better for that price. For our entrees I got the Shrimp Brochette which was good but not incredible for $22. My husband got the Surf & Turf $58, which he did enjoy. The Lobster tail was actually pretty big. My favorites were the garlic mashed potatoes, & Calamari with Garlic Aioli.
author: Cheryl C.

description: Clams in the chowder (one or two in every spoonful) were meaty and not chewy. The blue cheese garlic bread was nice. Heavy, but great. I thought the tanginess of both the cheese and sourdough would be too much but they were a nice combo. Since we had bread for an app, I just got the soup in a bowl. We also shared 1/2 a crab, which was my least fave item. Crab is so much work and this crab wasn't sweet or moist enough.  Lastly, the oysters were great! Cold, fresh, and big!
author: Rita S.

description:
LOVED this place. We rolled in, in t-shirts and sweats b/c we just got off a plane from the east coast and were whiling away a few hours before we could check in to  our hotel. 
They treated us like royalty... 
ASK FOR AMELIA- greatest, nicest, awesomest server-- EVER. 

We had mussels and fries, fried seafood platter and the ahi poke ... Everything was exceptional. All of the fried seafood was AWESOME. We come from an east coast coastal (read: seafood) town. So we get fresh seafood all of the time.  
The food at this restaurant was exceptional. We hear that there are a lot of tourist traps on the piers. 
At Fog Harbor-- you get what you pay for... And it is exceptional! 
Highly recommend it!
author: K. H.

description: I've lived in the bay area all my life and I can never imagine getting tired of coming to the Pier and trying a new restaurant each time I go. Fog Harbor had the most amazing Mussel Fries & Surf and Turf i have ever tried!! Yum Yum...
author: Esperanza M.

description: This place is probably the nicest restaurant at pier 39 and it's barely more pricey than the other places.  The seafood we had was cooked perfectly and everything was packed with flavor.  For a nice sit down, this was a great spot.  Crab risotto fritters were super creamy, rich and delicious.  Clam chowder was legit and the grilled seafood was perfect.  Our waiter Rudy did a great job, was very attentive, and made some great recommendations.
author: Ian S.

description: Staff members were friendly and attentive, great views (they were even kind enough to make a space for us by the window), and yummy food! Would highly recommend during your trip to San Fran!
author: Bethany M.

description: Our waiter, Jason, made my mom's birthday a stellar experience!! He is awesome, the food was great. Happy Birthday written on the table when we arrived. Wine and cocktails, bread fresh from the oven, at the table right away, my brother is vegetarian and he gave him great off menu options, kids were picky he made them happy, Cioppino was amazing, lobster tail YUM, clam chowder, crab cakes all delicious, birthday dessert with a candle... great view of the bay and sea lions. Seriously, this was an amazing night. Thank you Fog Harbor team and especially Jason!
author: Steph S.

description: Had fish & chips.  It was delicious!  The blue cheese garlic bread was yummy.  Would order it especially if you like blue cheese!  We also had the apple cranberry crisp.  That was the best!!
author: Linda H.

description: Clam chowder in a bread bowl with crab was delicious! We also ordered the fried scallops and crab cakes and I'd probably pass on those next time. The fried scallops were so tiny that the batter just overwhelmed the little pieces and it ended up tasting like bites of breaking. The crab cakes were also small, had no crab flavor.
author: Rie M.

description: Absolutely loved the clam chowder and my garlic roasted dungeoness crab. It was so good. Our wait was long but it was Christmas Day and they had these really comfortable shairs and sofas set up like a family room that made the wait actually pleasant. We had such a good time.
author: Niki A.

description: ...not sure if it was the happy hour food or what, but this place was just ok.  Nothing to brag on that I recall.  We did have the calamari and it was decent, but i've had better.  I've even had better from an asian restaurant.  We also had some shrimp that was like out of the oven or something.  I wasn't impressed.  Next time I think we will eat off the dinner menu.
author: S T O.

description: Decided to brave Pier 39 on a Sunday evening since we were craving whole crab... Because it's such a touristy area I really wasn't expecting such an amazing experience. Excellent service and the freshest seafood you could ask for... a dozen oysters, crab stuffed lobster and a whole roasted garlic crab. We also shared chowder and a salad... Outstanding... will definitely back again before crab season is over! :)
author: Donna V.

description: What a better way than to spend a chilly afternoon nestling with a steaming bread bowl of chowder right on the pier :)
author: Eddie F.

description: I expected a lot more from this place. We got there at 5:30 seated right away despite looking as if every table was full; big place. Service started out good then turned into the run of the mill like you were at McDonalds. Ordered calamari, shrimp cocktail, chowder in a bread bowl. The food was okay. Nothing that blew my mind away. The views however are great. Right on the water. But I wouldn't go here again.
author: Ashley R.

description:
What a beautiful restaurant located on Pier 39! I'm glad the boyfriend and I went here over the weekend while we were in SF. 

The view here is to die for -- I'd come here for just the view alone. Alcatraz and the ocean is in sight; two things that I love! This restaurant is also located within walking distance of where you board for the Alcatraz tour, so it's a good option if you're doing the tour before or after you eat. 

I ordered the Claim Chowder Bread Bowl with a side salad and a glass of the House Merlot. My food and wine was pretty solid and I ate it all. My boyfriend ordered their chicken dish and he didn't seem too impressed with the food. I'm guessing that the food is either a hit or a miss here. 

Service was decent -- the waiter came by to check on us often. I like that. 

All in all, decent place for a restaurant in a touristy area. 

Cheers!
author: Michelle M.

description: My first visit in San Francisco and found this restaurant on Yelp.  Since it had good reviews I figured lets check it out. Had the clams, dungeness crab, mussels, in an awesome tomato based sauce, it was delicious! Also loved our waiter David.. He was extremely knowledgeable and was very personable.. Would definitely recommend this place..
author: Melinda P.

description: Very cool restaurant. It's Super Bowl Sunday so we had no problem getting a table an hour before our reservation. The food was excellent and our server Khaiman was awesome. Very nice, helpful, but most of all, was not annoying by any means. A model server that made a great experience even better. My fillet mignonette was perfect. I like it med rare so orders it med to be safe, it came med rare.  The place is very clean.  I also liked how mellow it was. I could have a conversation without saying "what?" after every sentence.
author: Brad C.

description:
After our Alcatraz tour ended, we went exploring around Fisherman's Wharf for a late dinner spot and we stumbled upon Fog Harbor. 

The atmosphere = Awesome! We got a table for 2 right at the window. The view of the bay with Alcatraz in the distance was unforgettable. The whole atmosphere was perfect.

BUT...and this is what really made me love this place....the Blue Cheese Garlic Bread!!! SOOOOO GOOOOOD! I could have eaten this for my meal by itself!
I got the seared ahi tuna, it didn't disappoint either! It turned out to be a very good choice!
  
Great spot for dinner if you are out on Pier 39.

PS: No pressure, but you HAVE to get the Blue cheese garlic bread....just sayin'
author: Jay H.

description:
We visited frm LA & made reservations for V-day & I couldn't be any happier w my choice. We had an awesome time. Attentive waiter, food came descently quick for a busy night, the food was delicious. I had the Fried shrimp & fries, my bf had the garlic crab. It is a bit pricy, but it's good sea food & totally well worth it. We had a magical & beautiful night. I also received a gorgeous red rose  courtesy of the restaurant. 
 If you're thinking about it...just go. I def recommend it. Plus the views are stunning. Try to go arouind sunset time. Enjoy. :)
author: Brenda D.

description: As far as seafood goes, the place is pretty average. It would appear that one would be paying for the view which is a pretty good view. There is nothing wrong with the food it just wasn't singing a Broadway musical in my mouth. The service was just fine, again nothing bad but nothing fantastic either.
author: Kris C.

description: Food was delicious, pricey but not too much! Definitely going back soon. The atmosphere was great considering how busy it is at Pier 39, the waiters/waitresses were very nice and we had a great view! Planning my next visit for my husband's birthday.
author: Candice G.

description: Quality over quantity. Unlike a lot of harbor side restaurants, they focus on the quality of food and service. Beer, bread, chowder and seafood is all you really need.
author: Joe T.

description: Uh no. The restaurant is gorgeous. The servers were nice. The manager was a sweet heart. Apparently the chef/cooks have not heard of salt, because there was none on anything. Some things need salt when they are cooking. You get damn kicked off of top chef for not using it. Salt is fabulous and I like it in my food. It's an expensive restaurant too. No lunch menu.
author: Nancy P.

description:
Dude.  This place is legit.

I have a foodie family and we were on vacation when we tried out Fog Harbor.  Being a foodie family, we tried many excellent restaurants, but Fog Harbor was FAR AND AWAY the best meal of our vacation.  So so good.

We started with the grilled artichoke appetizer with the crab dip and it was... amazing.  Then our meals came out.  My dad ordered the Mixed Grill dish.  He said that everything on it was excellent but the salmon blew him away.  My mom had the fish and chips and it was a solid, well-done version of fish and chips.  My brother ordered the garlic crab which was outstanding... as was everything else on his plate (like the corn and potatoes).  I ordered one of the specials - a pesto halibut that was phenomenal.  Great flavors.

It was such a wonderful meal that we were nervous to get dessert, fearing that we might end on a clunker.  Our waitress assured us, though, that the desserts where worth trying and so we ordered the chocolate banana bread pudding.  The waitress was so right... that dessert was... INCREDIBLE.  It was so good, we were trying to figure out if we could go back there and get another one as an afternoon snack before we leave town.  

Oh, and the atmosphere is lovely, the view is pretty nice depending on where you sit, and the service was fantastic.

Seriously.  If you're on Pier 39... go here.  It is a divine blessing.
author: Beth G.

description:
For natives, Pier 39 is rarely a destination.  But the area has the highest concentration of crab serving restaurants.  Based on a recommendation, I found myself staring at the Dungeness Crab menu at Fog Harbor Fish House.  I tried the crab cake sandwich and garlic roast crab with popcorn shrimp appetizers.  The shrimp was super tender and hot (Yum!).  The crab cake was delicious and filling and the garlic roast crab was as good as you can find on the wharf.  The views are my favorite and the service was attentive and kind.
Parking is easy at the garage across the street and you can walk your meal of on the pier.  A great place for crab with a view!
author: Pablo R.

description: We came in on a whim while spending a weekend in San Francisco and were amazed at the fabulous food. Seasonal special pumpkin salmon, to die for!
author: Cheri L.

description: yes yes hot bowl of clam chowder and friendly Waitress , what else could you ask for , best view , yup that too, prices were good for such a touristy spot and the food was good , mixed grill and halibut was our choice .until next time
author: NAEL K.

description:
My wife and I had dinner here the other night because we had a coupon for a free appetizer. It turned out to be serendipitous.  We live in the North Bay and come to the City often. When it comes to restaurants, we are nothing but a bit jaded. That said, we had a splendid meal at Fog Harbor. Instead of a main course, we ordered several items listed as starters because that gives exposure to more dishes especially when there are only the two of us dining.

We started with the fried calamari which was served with a lemon aioli for dipping. The dish was all rings, no tentacles. The batter was light, something like you would expect to find in a very good tempura bar. We also had the sliders, the crab cakes and the red curry mussels.

The sliders were great. Cooked perfectly (medium rare) and smothered in caramelized onions. My wife loves crab cakes and pronounced them as good as any she has ever had. I'm not much of a crab cake lover, but I thought they were good. I will never love crab cakes, so don't take my word as gospel.

Then I had the red curry steamed mussels. I am a mussel fanatic. I've eaten them over half the world, particularly in Belgium (where mussels is the national dish), and I can honestly say that these are the most delicious steamed mussels I have ever had. These are not the red curry mussels you will find in Thai restaurants. You are going to have to try them to see what I mean. By the way, although listed as a starter, there were enough for a main dish, especially when accompanied by Fog Harbor's terrific sourdough bread which is made on site.

I asked the restaurant manager for the mussels recipe, but he couldn't comply. I then emailed the company and was sent the recipe by one of the senior execs. That is service above and beyond.

By the way, we were there during happy hour, and were able to enjoy a very good house Pinot Grigio for $5/glass - an added bonus.

Fog Harbor is located at Pier 39, a venue most locals associate with tourists and would not normally think of as a place to go for fine dining. Wrong.  Fog Harbor is considerably better than most of the famous places in the Fisherman's wharf vicinity. To make matters even better, with the appropriate coupon (available everywhere in the City) you can park free, a huge benefit in San Francisco where parking fees are equivalent to winnings in the Powerball lottery.
author: Michael B.

description: HUGE portions. $17 for fish & chips and fries. It's one of their most popular dishes for a reason. Fish was extremely fresh and the beer batter was crispy and sweet. Our sever was super nice and charged us Happy Hour prices for our second round of drinks even though it was past 6pm. Be careful of their freshly baked sourdough complimentary bread. It's easy to overstuff yourself before your mail dish arrives.
author: Joanna H.

description:
Such a wonderful water view while having a great birthday dinner. Our waiter Osscar was so nice & very helpful. The wines were yummy, as were the calamari & the cioppino (which was large enough for us to share)... The icing on the cake was the complimentary dessert - the chocolate cake was still warm & just melted in my mouth. I will definitely come back to try the other dishes & will recommend this place to everyone! Love this place ;-)

P.S. why is there no hot water in the restroom?
author: Jennifer R.

description: Brought the future father in law here looking for some good seafood close to where he was staying and we were all pleasantly surprised, especially by the service.  Khaiman was our server and definitely took care of us that night offering excellent suggestions and frank feedback on specific dish details that we really appreciated.  All in all, the service he offered really made the experience.
author: Brian T.

description: Best chowder and great service! The Meal was fantastic! Service was over delivered. The bar tender made the most delicious Moscow mules! We were sat before our reservation and the fire works topped it off!
author: Joy c.

description:
What a great spot!
They took in our large group with no problem. Service was excellent! A little on the slow side, but again, there were alot of us and it was a busy night, so no fault of theirs. The servers worked hard and were very pleasant. 
Food is so delicious, great atmosphere and lovely view.
A great spot to visit if you are in town and looking for a nice meal.
author: Crystal M.

description: The steamed mussels were one of the best things I have ever had! Also tried a few salads, linguine with clams, clam chowder and baked oysters. Visited twice in our trip. My husband had a few shell pieces in the pasta on our second visit but other than that we didn't have any issues. Baked oysters were probably my least favorite.
author: Christi G.

description: Somewhat disappointing. The view makes up for the diner-style food/presentation. Was expecting better. Service is okay...not 4 or 5 stars as rated. One person's opinion.
author: Dale M.

description: Madison was our server.she was very polite . Since my dad is diabetic patient she made sure our food was upto date..thank u Madison..other than that view was great .
author: Merry S.

description: Wonderful atmosphere overlooking the bay. Our server was excellent and our food was delicious. I liked that they offered "skinny" drink options. It was our anniversary and our server bought us dessert, which was a delicious apple crisp with vanilla ice cream. I would definitely go back!
author: Emily S.

description: Great place at pier 39. The ambience is great with an excellent view towards the harbor. Seafood cioppino was delicious, husband had fish and chips and no complaints. I definitely recommend this place! Our waiter was very attentive, only complaint was the klan of kids next to us that wouldn't be quiet!
author: Conchita L.

description: I loved this place. Nice view of the pier, delicious food and fresh sourdough bread. I had the linguini with clams and it was delicious. The server suggested Kendall-Jackson, "Grand Reserve", Chardonnay. It paired well with the clam linguini. My Aussie friend had the fog harbor burger medium well. He said that it has been one of the best burgers so far.
author: Sergio S.

description: Beautiful view of Alcatraz from our table. Ask for it.
author: Darin S.

description: Brought out of town visitors here and everyone left happy.  My wife and I shared the garlic crab and really enjoyed it.  Most in the party had chowder and they loved it.  We had a large party with prepaid tip and was surprised to still get excellent service.  This review is specifically for someone wanting a touristy thing on the pier.
author: Barry C.

description: We are locals and just went here because of good yelp reviews for father's day. Service was good and our waitress was sweet. Except she didn't tell me that there is $4 fee for them to remove the crab meat out of the shell for my ciopinno. We had to send sliders back because they were fishy tasting. They did comp up for those,  but still...gross! My dad actually spit his out. The food was mediocre tourist trap at best. But I guess what can you expect in the heart of pier 39.
author: Alisa L.

description: Excellent clam chowder in a sourdough bread bowl and the cioppino was delicious as well. I highly recommend either of these dishes.
author: Daniel T.

description: Your basic toursist trap, fried food and watered down cocktaiks. Much better places to eat in SF if you dont mind looking. Good came very quickly at the expense of being barely cooked.
author: Philip S.

description: The food was very good.  The clam chowder, oysters, crab, dessert were all very good.  The sour dough bread they serve was really good.  The atmosphere was nice and the bathrooms were really clean.  The wait was about 30 minutes on a Saturday night.  Would go again when I am in San Francisco.
author: Mark H.

description: I had some delicious oysters as an appetizer then a chicken dish that was amazing. The waiter was very knowledgeable about wines which was very helpful.  The best part must have been the service, it almost seemed like we were the waiter's only table.  The wait was a bit long but we put in our name before our whole party arrived and got in just as they were calling our group.  It was a good place.
author: Lisbeth B.

description: The best Cioppino ever! Also, great view of the bay.
author: Arthur M.

description:
Great views, great service and awesome food. 
We literally came off the street and were looking for a great happy hour place to grab a few drinks and appetizers and we hit a jack pot. 
First of all, staff is courteous, very neat appearance and nice, shout out to the waiters!

We were promptly seated, and our drinks came fairly quick. That's always a plus when you're a thirsty traveler. We went ahead and grabbed 3-4 appetizers to share and we couldn't have been happier with our choices. Our favorites? the raw AND baked oysters(oyster quality- smooth and creamy). A close second to the fried calamari, it was light and crispy not over fried and breaded. 
Overall had a great time, we were never forgotten by our waiter which so happens so often in more touristy areas of SF. 
Thanks again guys.
author: Loic B.

description:
Your in SF and you want seafood and a water view right?!! You'll get all of these here..but  I'd say all in all, we were a bit underwhelmed for the price point..
Did we clean our plates? Of course!  Shared, jumbo shrimp cocktail and Ahi and Crab Cakes.. I think I expected the Ahi to blow me away and whileit was  good- it didn't blow me away.. crab cakes had lots of nice crab and the shrimp were just fine though.  Our waiter was nice enough. However, he did reach across our table from the opposite side and pick up empty glasses by the rims. I notice these things because I used to be in service and these are just simple things that clearly the mgmt doesn't watch for.  Otherwise,  their staff wouldn't be dong these things.. we had a very nice evening and enjoyed the views and the food but we'd probably try some other places next time.
author: Sopla R.

description: We went here for dinner on our final night in San Francisco. We booked a table earlier in the day to reserve a window seat. I highly recommend doing this as the views are amazing. Even at night, you can see the boats sailing on the harbor and the flashing of the lighthouse on Alcatraz. We ordered the oysters and chowder to start with. Although most places claim to have the best chowder in the area, this was the best I've ever had. The menu is good as it offers something for everyone even if you don't like fish. We all really enjoyed meals. I had the tuna which was cooked to perfection and came on a delicious bed of wild rice. The only reason it gets 4 stars opposed to 5 is because the service was very average. Our waitress was slow and forgot something that we ordered. Overall I highly recommend Fog Harbor if you are in the area and a fan of fish.
author: Louise F.

description: Overall fantastic experience. Fantastic food and service and view of the water. Highly recommended!
author: Mike C.

description: I am a local, born and raised in SF, and this was the first time I have gone here. It was definitely worth fending off all the tourists and crappy parking to go here. The oysters were phenomenal and the crab ceviche was very fresh. I had the seafood cioppino which was very good and my boyfriend had the king salmon which he said was great as well. The drinks are overpriced but the food more than made up for it. The service was great as well. We had a very attentive waitress who checked on us multiple times. I will definitely be back again!
author: Lauren C.

description: We love this place.  We came from Southern California for a little vacation and found Fog Harbor after touring Alcatraz.  We looked at the other restaurants and decided to eat here.  Amazing!  We started with the Ahi Poke, I fell in love!  The taste and the mango sauce was mouth watering.  My husband had the steak and he loved it.  I had the Clam Chowder and it is the best I have ever had.  Especially in the Sourdough bowl.  Our server Khaiman was wonderful, excellent with tour information and service.  I recommend it for anyone going to San Francisco and I will go again!!
author: Kristen M.

description:
Second time here and still not disappointed. The sourdough bread is addictive the service is great.

Clementine was my server and I really can't say anything bad about her. 

She was attentive funny and made the experience even better. 

I am vegetarian so I had a special dish made by the kitchen. It was good. My partner ordered fish and chips and loved it. 

Clementine made sure our drinks were strong and that we were enjoying everything. 
Now if only they would get rid of the silly dessert tray.
author: Ramon B.

description: We had lunch today at this marvelous restaurant, my friend had the Pacific Sole and I had the Short Ribs both of our lunches were outstanding and the service was superb, the sun had just come out when we arrived about 11:45 a.m.  we had window seating the view was spectacular. I would recommend this restaurant to family and friends.
author: Marlene B.

description: This place has really good calamari and clam chowder sourdough bread bowl! And a nice view
author: Collin W.

description: Excellent dining spot overlooking the Bay Area. Some of the tables have great views. The food is very good. We had the king Salmon and a seared Tuna and both were cooked to the correct temperature, in addition to being good quality fish. I ordered an 8oz glass of wine and was very satisfied: the wine was in very good condition (i.e. opened recently), it was a very good wine, and the amount was generous.
author: Bacco D.

description: Excellent service, food, and drinks! My husband and I ate here while on our honeymoon. We had some steak, lobster, and crab legs:) The clam chowder is very good as well. We highly recommend
author: Erika D.

description: The food was great. We came at a very busy time so we had to wait about 30 minutes for a table. And we couldn't even get a table with a good view. When we sat down I saw a window table open up and I asked the waitress if we could simply move but she had to make a big deal about it and go talk to somebody else to see if it was okay to get up and move two tables. And wow can u believe she said no! That automatically dropped her tip by $10. Her loss. I wasn't very happy about that. Plus she felt super fake. The crab fritters were delicious so was the clam chowder and the shell fish platter, honestly I was not a big fan of the lobster mac and cheese it did not appeal to me at all. The service was okay the food was good. I'd probably go somewhere else before coming back there.
author: Hardy P.

description: Delicious!  The salmon was the freshest I have ever tasted.  Madison was the best waitress ever!  Over the top service!
author: Peyton M.

description: Pretty amazing! Try their French Fries!!! I never like french fries but i love their french fries in fog harbor fish house
author: Boobii B.

description: Loved the red chili shrimp. Stopped by for a light snack and was delighted by the right amount spice, and really fresh Shrimp. Would love to come here again.
author: Sumit Singh G.

description: Definitely not a destination place. Very touristy spot. My wife and I ordered a jumbo shrimp cocktail a house salad and two lobster tail dinners. The shrimp cocktail came out lukewarm on a bed of melted ice with a supermarket style cocktail sauce. Presentation was awful. The house salad looked like a half-filled soup plate of wilted lettuce topped with a house vinaigrette that smelt like dirty socks. We have yet to receive our lobster tails but I am sure that they are definitely less than stellar. I will definitely update you all on the lobster tails. That is if my wife and I make it out of this place without food poisoning.
author: Anastasios V.

description: Came here with the fiance and mother after taking a walk along the Pier. We wanted to escape the cold and have some cocktails with a view. We were promptly seated by the window and the view was beautiful. We got there just in time to see the sunset. We each had a couple cocktails. All were delicious including their Moscow Mule which was served in a copper mug.  We shared the calamari which was decent. Not as crispy as I would've liked it but not bad. Overall, we had a nice experience. We didn't try their dinner but ambiance is candlelight with white table cloth, classy! Service was impeccable and we definitely would come back to try it again.
author: Victoria N.

description: We spent nearly a week in S.F., including a food tour in the Mission District, and by far the best food we had was at Fog Harbor. Excellent food, and great service by Jason and Nelson made the experience top shelf. Next time my wife and I are in S.F., we will be sure to stop by Fog Harbor for stellar food and service.
author: Terry L.

description: One of the best creme brûlée I've had in San Francisco! Clam chowder and crab was also delicious
author: Munique M.

description: Great raw seafood platters.  Good for weekends.
author: Germán P.

description: My family and I went here for dinner and had a great time.  The view overlooking the bay is gorgeous and all of the drinks were wonderful. Their Lombardi Lemonade is so addictive. We started off with the blue cheese garlic bread and steamed clams.  We found that the clams were a little bit bigger here than anywhere else we had been to so that was a plus. I ordered the half shellfish platter, when it got to our table I completely devoured it.  A generous serving of crab, mussels, shrimp, and steamed clams hit the spot. The atmosphere is very nice and the waitstaff are friendly. Definitely worth a try!
author: Laura B.

description: Excellent food (had crab) in very pleasant surroundings on a mild Friday evening in January. Not as touristy as it seems from the outside. Good choice of food and drink. The waiter wasn't that great, hence the 4 stars rather than 5 but no actual complaints about the service.
author: Steven D.

description: Everything was fantastic. Service was great. Food was way better than expected. Clam chowder bread bowl was some of the best I've had. Make sure you order extra jalapeno aoili for added flavor for the already good fish and chips.
author: Sinai G.

description: I like this place a lot. I had a shellfish for two shared with my husband. It was delicious but don't eat dessert. Your server brings you samples and they all look terrible...our waiter even recommended other places for dessert.
author: Topanga S.

description: We were on a company event and it was my first time to visit this place. Never been to a true sea food place, but this was a good start. The food here was AWESOME and I had Clam Chowder for the first time and it was really good. I would go back to this place with no issues. So I recommend this place and of course the food as well.
author: Josh B.

description:
My boyfriend booked a reservation for Valentine's day. We arrived earlier than expected. They were able to bump up our reservation and seated us right away. They had a small Valentine's special menu. It has a nice setting, very romantic feeling.

We were seated close to the window but then again it was dark already. I'm sure during the day it would have been a pretty view. We ordered raw oysters, baked oysters with spinach and parmesan, steam clams with veggies in light broth and also a bread bowl chowder to share as appetizers! Those are all just starters! 

For my main course, I had the filet Mignon with lobster tail ( the whole reason why my boyfriend made reservations at a seafood restaurant was so that I can get my lobster! How sweet!) My boyfriend had the fried combo with consist of fried fish, fried calamari and fried shrimp. All the food we ordered was super delicious!

Our billed came out to be a bit pricey but its okay to splurged on yourself once in a while! As a Valentine's day special, all the ladies received a single rose!
author: Jennifer W.

description: If you want a nice sit-down meal at Pier 39, and a great view of Fisherman's Wharf, this is the place!  Only had one day to spend with cousins from Brazil and this is where we went, they liked it.  Love the fireplace and waiting area out front on a foggy cold Fisherman's Wharf day...
author: Tanya S.

description: The food is off the chain!  My favorite is the swordfish with the delicious potatoes!  I also have my favorite desert, the chocolate cookie with ice cream....
author: Darla M.

description: This is a lovely restaurant, the food was great with very decent sized servings. The service was wonderful, Neissa was looking after us and she was cheerful, friendly and did a great job!
author: Kellie R.

description: we were treated with great courtesy by the staff and the waiter, which was a sign of management commitment to the client well being. the food and service were excellent. we will return the next time we are in san francisco.
author: Mariza M.

description: We've been here a couple of times and never received a bad meal.  Love the food...love the atmosphere!  Definitely a must if you're visiting San Fran.
author: Joy A.

description: If you're looking for a McCormicks and Shmicks it's the best of the brand. If you're looking for a out of the ordinary,"made your visit" seafood restaurant, look someplace else.
author: Kristophe C.

description:
One of the best seafood restaurants on Pier 39. Very reasonably priced. The oysters tasted like the ocean.
My only pet peeve was that my table did not get any bread!! As we were leaving we realized everyone who hadn't started their meal yet were given complimentary bread! But not us!
author: Owl R.

description: They serve an awesome Ahi Tuna with wild rice, and their clam chowder bowls give Boudin a run for their money. The cioppino is tasty, and of course anything fried like the  fish and chips, and  calamari appetizer are good as well.
author: Gabriella C.

description: Vacationing in San Francisco and we hit pier 39 on our first day. We were starving and read all the excellent reviews so we settled in here. We're San Diego natives so we're no strangers to fresh, delicious seafood. This place was neither. We ordered clam chowder, fried shrimp & a shrimp & crab sandwich. Clam chowder was mediocre at best. Fried shrimp was good. Sandwich was alright. The spoon that came with my soup was wet with a brown colored substance. I smelled it and it was unmistakably coffee. Not sure I even want to think about how that happened. Nothing, besides the dirty spoon, stood out to us. I kinda felt like this restaurant thinks it can just serve anything simply because it's on pier 39. Not impressed. The fact that my spoon had coffee on it did this place in. I just can't get past that.
author: Lisa B.

description: Beautiful restaurant; very high end looking with ok view of water. Biggest draw is the ambiance and the fireplace directly outside! Cool place to wait while table is arranged.
author: Marc T.

description: Went here for dinner on a whim... Ordered the garlic butter crab... AMAZING!! The view and the ambiance really set the tone for my mini getaway with my love. The clam crowder was to die for!! Khaiman was a great waiter attentive and helpful.
author: Amy I.

description: Rudy was wonderful, there is nothing better than a sever who is knowledgeable, clever,  and personable. He made our experience wonderful, paired every course with an applicable glass of wine. We will be back very soon, happy guests.
author: Liz M.

description: We walked in an hour before our actual reservation and sat right down which surprised me due to the crowd of people at Fisherman's Wharf.  The prices are expensive, but heck everything in San Fran is expensive.  Service was prompt and the food was good.  Nothing spectacular, but good.
author: Christina H.

description: Anchor Steam Beer Batter Fish and Chips is ON!
author: Daphnie A.

description: Went here with a group of 8 friends for our last night in San Fran. Our apps were awesome! We had the baked oysters and red chile shrimp. The clam chowder was good, but not the best ever. Everyone really enjoyed their entrees; I had the crab cakes, and they were awesome! Sevice was ok.
author: Leah P.

description: Wow, I'm on a strict Diet and normally that annoys people but not here. Both my server Justin and the manager Brian were accommodating and most importantly were smiling the whole time. Amazing views and food was incredible (had the grilled Salmon(no butter) and added grilled corn. Should have taken a picture... just arrived in San Francisco for work and have been traveling all day and now leaving with a smile in my face. Was in a Rush and it only took me around 30 minutes to get this great service...
author: Al S.

description:
So I have mixed feelings. On one hand the service and my boyfriend's meal were very good, but my tuna steak was fatty and tasted weird. I am a huge seafood person and so I know the difference between good and bad seafood. The waiter offered a new tuna steak, but I had better at many other places and it was not worth the money. 

My boyfriend's pasta was good and so were the crab cakes, but I believe that for a 4 or 5 star rating a restaurant that is a seafood place would have all of its seafood at a high standard. 

I would recommend the restaurant and I would go back myself, but order the pasta or crab cakes or something that is fully cooked.
author: Magdalena Z.

description: The view is beautiful. Food and service is okay. My friends were traveling in SF for the first time and wandering around Fisherman's Wharf. That's why I was dining in the place, just to meet my friends. I probably wouldn't go there if otherwise.
author: Sitang L.

description: I went with my husband and we were seated by the window.  There is a beautiful view of the pier.  We ordered the crab cakes and crab roll, which were delicious.  Our server Madison was really sweet and took our picture.  It was a nice way to begin our trip.
author: Veronika K.

description: Great atmosphere, great food, great service. Khaiman was our server, he went the extra mile to make sure we had a perfect experience. Try the clam chowder and the banana bread pudding for sure.
author: Krystal W.

description: Excellent food and nice atmosphere. Grilled seafood was so good. Seafood penne was very good
author: Tariq A.

description:
I grew up in San Francisco and typically steer clear of anything touristy.  Fog Harbor is one of the few exceptions!  If I find myself on Pier 39 with friends or family I go to one of two fabulous restaurants.  If I want something a little fun and casual, then Wipeout Bar and Grill fits the bill.  When I want to dazzle and impress, Fog Harbor is the place.  

My husband and I had lunch at Fog Harbor last week as we had a friend from Germany in town visiting.  We wanted something nice, and Fog Harbor was the first thing that popped into my mind.  We walked in without a reservation (next time I would make one, just to be safe because they were pretty busy) and were greeted by a friendly host and also by the bartender who was also busy with guests at the bar.  Within minutes, our sever came over to say hello and offered us drinks.  

We decided to order several appetizers because we love everything on the menu and thought that would be the easiest way to share a variety of things with our friend.  

The ceviche- to die for
The poki - fresh, delicious and beautifully presented
The clams in a choizo broth - Cooked perfectly and I soaked up every ounce of broth with the hot, delicious Boudin sourdough.
The prawns - yum! (if no one was looking, I may have licked the plate...)
All the desserts are made in house and are fabulous.  
Seriously, everything is fresh and delicious at Fog Harbor.

Between the friendly service, the consistently scrumptious food, and the stunning view, Fog Harbor is not only a great place to take friends from out of town, but also a great excuse for San Franciscans to play tourist for the day!
author: L L.

description: We ordered clam chowder, cod and risotto fritter. The calm chowder was good. The other two dishes are mediocre. The view and service was good :)
author: Marian C.

description: Well done! Our meal was great and our waitress, Meron, even better. The clam chowder bowl was quite tasty.
author: Christina D.

description: We were at the wharf for the afternoon and decided to grab a late lunch here based on the yelp reviews. I had the Ahi Poke appetizer and the Grilled Shrimp Brochette. Both of them were very good! The service was okay but not overly impressive. The ambiance and views of the water were great, although the windows needed a good cleaning (the amount of bird poop on them was gross). The 4 stars is strictly for the quality of the food.
author: Lori C.

description: Nothing special about the food, which isn't a bad thing in this case.  Its good fresh seafood that isn't heavily seasoned.  I had the mix grill and it was just what I was looking for, quality, well cooked, fresh fish.  The one special thing is they had the best sourdough of my vacation!
author: John B.

description: Great food and service. We have their ahi tuna and halibut special. Def. would recommend for some fresh sea food and good wine list
author: Angelica M.

description: The most delicious and fresh oyster and yummy steamed clam. Try these you never regret!
author: Woo Jin L.

description:
We came for the Clam Chowder, which my niece voted best ever. I enjoyed  barrel aged Negroni, which was a tasty delight - I wish the menu had specified which gin was used.

All but my wife had the excellent fish and chips, she enjoyed a crab salad.

The setting, view, and service were all first rate. Saying it is the best dining on Pier 39 is damning with faint praise, which I do not wish to do. It is as good as the best eateries in Fisherman's Wharf.
author: David B.

description: I'm a fan.  Our waiter (red-head with a beard and sideburns but no moustache) was great.  We had a table by the bay.  Talk about fun.  The bread was excellent.  The clam chowder was very good.  The crab cocktail I had was very good, nice amount of crab with a decent mix of the various meat.  My wife had a fish fry plate and it was very good.  The ambiance is 5 star, the service is 4 star, the food is a solid 3, maybe 4 here and there, certainly was NOT bad at all.  We didn't have room for desert but the ones we saw looked great.
author: Mike G.

description: Me and my wife had a dinner here for our honeymoon. The service was excellent! Very informative and fun as well. The food was excellent. We were told to get clam chowder and it was the best I have ever had and then we got the steamed platter. That was a great choice it was awesome. I would tell anyone to go here if you make it to Pier 39..
author: Cameron M.

description: Coming here every Mother's Day for the past four years and although it's A bit crowded and touristy, The food never disappoints. Love the garlic crab, love the clam chowder bread bowl. Madison, our server, it was great. Will be back next year! Happy Mother's Day everyone!!
author: Cindy Y.

description: Best Clam Chowder! Faycal was a great waiter with a wonderful sense of humor. The outside fireplace makes you hope you have a bit of a wait, while enjoying a few cocktails.
author: Brendan T.

description: Went here with my husband for an early lunch.  The food was very good and the wait staff was friendly.  Nice sized portions for the meals.  Sorry I missed the clam chowder, but the Mixed Grill was not to be missed.
author: Sara K.

description: Stopped by yesterday night for dinner with the family. Their seasonal dishes, pumpkin-curry salmon and braised short ribs, were extremely delicious. It is rare to find such a good restaurant in a touristy area, but this one goes above and beyond.
author: Brandon H.

description: Wow, this establishment gets my four stars for location, atmosphere, service and food! I was on a hunt for the best clam chowder and I think I found it! We also got window seating which had the perfect view of the pier from our table! :) The restaurant is super cute and fancy. Between my boyfriend and I, we shared the sourdough clam chowder bread bowl, the red curry mussels and a beer. Both dishes we're amazingggg. The clam chowder- super creamy and filling that pair perfectly well with their warm sourdough bread. Red curry mussels- I'm not a huge seafood gal, but as one bite, yum! They paired it with what seems like toasted garlic bread (they need to include more pieces!). I'll be back!
author: Shirley N.

description:
Went to this place with a friend during a visit to San Fran. After seeing a lot of local fare on tv a few weeks prior and with my boyfriend not being much of a fish person thus meaning I get to eat it so infrequently, I figured I'd seek out one of the better restaurants on pier 39 to have a delicious fish dinner.

We sat by the window and had a gorgeous view of Alcatraz and the harbor, and most of the restaurant has this view even if you're not sitting at the window, so this is an excellent spot if you're a tourist and want the whole experience while you dine.

I had the swordfish with chimichurri sauce. I'm seeing some photos here of that dish served with mixed greens in addition to the wild rice, but my vegetable was broccoli mixed with pearl onions and that was it. I love broccoli, but for such a delicious fish it seemed really lackluster in comparison, and the pearl onions didn't really do much to help. I would have much preferred asparagus, or at least for the broccoli to be anything other than steamed. I dipped it in the garlic sauce from my friends meal, big improvement, sad it wasn't better. 

The swordfish steak, however, was perfectly tender and seasoned. I haven't had swordfish in years and after having read that their menu is sustainably caught I had to try it. It didn't disappoint!

We also got a sampling of their seasonal dungeness crab menu by trying the mango and avocado dungeness crab cocktail. The portion could feed one person as a meal it was so huge, and between the two of us we were concerned we wouldn't have enough room for our meals (but not in a bad way, we were loving every minute of it!). This appetizer was packed with crab and really showcased the ingredient in a deliciously fresh way.

My friend ordered the seafood platter which had clams, mussels and crab legs and claws in a garlic butter sauce. I'm not much of a shellfish person, but thanks to Fog Harbor, I now know it was simply because I hadn't had them done well, and these were so delicious I'm seriously wondering where garlic mussels have been all my life. If I were to return I would order this item in a heartbeat, and if you're a garlic lover, you'll absolutely love this!

I look forward to returning and trying more from their menu, but given that their seasonal dungeness crab menu is for a limited time, I'd say definitely try something from that list if you go in the next few weeks, it all looks good!
author: Nicole D.

description:
We found the Fog Harbor Fish House on Yelp.... and we're happy we did.  We had an excellent evening starting with super drinks and ending with one of their yummy desserts.  Service was excellent.  Dinner was fantastic... seafood of course... with a large selection.  Recommend it highly.  

We hadn't been in San Francisco in many years.  Dinner at Fog Harbor was a highlight of a super two night stay.  We'll be back.
author: Mike D.

description: Yumm! Went here during vacation with three of my girlfriends. Our waiter was super nice and on point with service. Food was bomb too! The oysters were super fresh and their complimentary bread was super good!
author: Kimm P.

description: I chose this restaurant based on yelp and not only was the food and view amazing but our waitress Madison really made the experience great. I highly recommend!
author: Olivia W.

description: Excellent food, great service. Bit pricey and crowded, but all in all a great experience
author: Rolf D.

description:
Our concierge recommended Fog Harbor when discussing options to visit Alcatraz.  Unfortunately, tickets to the prison were sold out so we made a day of it at Haight-Ashbury instead.  I made a reservation at Fog Harbor earlier that day and requested to have a window seat (after all, I heard the place overlooked Pier 39, so why not take advantage of the view)?  

This restaurant is definitely more of a tourist attraction than an authentic fish house, but we still thoroughly enjoyed ourselves.  Our waitress was the sweetest older woman you'd ever met, and she went out of her way to make sure everything was spot-on.  The location of our table added to the romantic, special experience. 

To start, we had the crab cake, clam chowder, and a salad.  The cake's consistency was perfect--dense with crab meat, lightly seared, accompanied with a red pepper aioli.  The clam chowder was thick, rich and..well...clammy (in a good way), and my boyfriend said the sourdough bread was divine.  I was bummed to hear that they were out of baby spinach...but the portion of romaine more than compensated for this. 

We chose the whole dungeness crab for our entrees.  Ladies, if you're wearing a nice outfit, I'd opt for a different dish instead of this messy treat.  The seafood cioppono looked tasty, as did some of the cuts of meat.  We were bibbed for the big event and spent a good 15 minutes hacking away at the shells prior to digging in (our plan of attack:  shell all the meat before feasting).  The waitstaff kept our area clean, even as the shards of shell flew around us.  

I wish that there had been more veggies on the plate, and the potatoes were a little runny for my taste.  We spent a good two hours enjoying our meals and each others company, never once feeling rushed to leave.  It was a good, solid meal for to conclude our adventure in San Fran.  My senses are piqued and I'm eager to return to the Wharf for more fruits of the sea.
author: Sarah K.

description: Hands down the best calamari I've had, not over-breaded and cooked just enough and not chewy. The blue cheese garlic bread was very rich and flavorful. Fish and chips for the main course - also perfect! Our waitress was super nice and the manager was very friendly and took time to tell us about how they only use sustainable fish suppliers. So, they don't overfish the areas and wipe out populations. They have closely inspected all their suppliers and it shows in the quality of the food. Great experience!
author: Jenn E.

description: I took my family from Los Angeles, whom never been to the city. We went after a Giants game and we were ready for dinner. What a AWESOME and BEAUTIFUL place. The scenery and food was perfect. We got to watch the sun go down on the bay. You must go and take your wife or significant other. Perfect place for a perfect day. This day will stay with me.
author: Valentino R.

description:
I had the Whole Dungessness Crab & My boyfriend had the Surf & Turf. Next time I'd like to get the Whole Lobster. The Crab was cooked perfectly in garlic! It came with mashed potatoes & steamed vegetables. It was perfect! I was pretty full afterwards. I had a drink called Alcatraz Escape, it was good, but a little too sweet, perhaps the margarita next time? Or maybe, just a beer.. 
We had the steamed clams for an appetizer. They were delicious and melted in your mouth. The leftover sauce was great for our bread! 

Our server was very nice, & we didn't get bothered much! :) 

We made a reservation online so we didn't have to wait, (it was 645 on a Wed, a small crowd)
author: Katrina M.

description:
The service was nice but the food left a lot to be desired.

I ordered the special, Basa on garlic mash potatoes.  Fish is my favorite protein so if I don't like it ...it's bad.

I don't believe  it was cooked properly.  It seemed a bit raw and very greasy.

There were five of us and nothing was outstanding.  

Hate giving a low rating but the cooks need some seasoning and cooking lessons.
author: patty h.

description:
Trying to get a table on a Friday night is damn near impossible. 

My boyfriend took me here for a sea food platter for two: crab, muscles, oysters, corn, scallops the works.  The bread was fabulous and the clam chowder was perfect.  Although I did enjoy my dinner here, I suspect this is the type of place for upscale tourists to dine at during after hours.  This place comes with a price tag as everything here is pretty pricey.  The only thing that you'd be happy with is validation for parking if you park in the garage across the street.
author: Lea M.

description: My husband and I dined here twice in the week we visited San Francisco. The food was incredible! The crab cakes were delicious, the calamari was good, the sourdough bread was wonderful. Oysters on the half shell were fabulous as well. They were accommodating to our friend with dietary limitations too. Our server offered suggestions on the menu for her.
author: Jennifer L.

description: Boyfriend was in town from Chicago, so I made him be a tourist with me.  Went to Pier 39 to check out the sea lions, and then stopped in here for some clam chowder in a sourdough bread bowl.  Did not disappoint.  Thought they might judge us for just stopping in for some wine and to share some soup, but the server was nothing but nice.
author: Chelsea A.

description:
Ok so I've been in the restaurant business for over 15 years and I NEVER do this because I know how it is. Bad day, fluke experience, whatever but this place was ATROCIOUS! We started with some beer/wine once we finally got service...the drinks were good once we got them after our appetizer had arrived....the was the start of the bad meal with horrible service. 

We ordered the baked oysters to start because they resembled oysters Rockefeller which we love no matter what type of oysters they are. What came out was a weird cream based, over sauced oyster plate. I was ok with eating them until I got to the last one which was totally and completely rank! I'm not a huge oyster aficionado but not only did it taste as though the cute sea lions down the pier had pooped in them but it smelled totally stank (which I actually thought was either my servers breath or a fellow patrons unfortunate gas at first...a little harsh and I feel bad for ever thinking that but I never thought an oyster or any seafood for that matter could smell that bad) Ruined the rest of the meal...the only reason I'm giving 2 stars is because my Salmon entree, which was a special with veggies including Brussels sprouts which are some  of my favs, was pretty good after I sucked on a lemon, downed my entire water, and shot some tobacco sauce in attempt to get the bad oyster taste out of my mouth. Little did I know that would be the only water I would be offered throughout the rest of my meal...

Super unfortunate because I'm a huge foodie and love using yelp but this turned out to be an awful choice. Would have walked a bit further into the heart of Fishermans wharf to try different food or the street car (cods something...) everyone is raving about.
author: Abby W.

description:
We were tourists in Dec '11 and I think so was everyone else in the place.  The food was decent and it was an alright first stop - got off plane, check in hotel, get food!  We were in no position to really research and this place did hit the spot.  

My husband I split a crab cake sandwich and each had a cup of chowder.  i think we waited about 30mins for a table.  It was okay not great - a lil pricey compared but we were in the hub of tourist central.
author: Blythe Z.

description: If you want a view of the bay, this place is probably as good as any. The menu has the seafood fare that you'd expect, priced on the high side. The food is safe though not special. The staff is competent and aim to please. You can't go wrong.
author: Oliver V.

description:
Some friends were in from out of town last weekend and they were totally excited to go Fisherman's Wharf.

We chose Fog Harbor based on the slightly lower prices and great looking space. We asked for a table with a view and they happily gave us one by the windows. 

Camille was our waitress and she was awesome. Five star service. She listened to all the various dietary restrictions - no gluten and no milk - and made several trips into the kitchen just to inquire about ingredients for us. Turns out there is a lot with milk in it. Though the menu has little "G"s next to all the gluten free options! She made sure we enjoyed all the food brought to us!

The food was alright. Our guests loved the heck out of everything they got, so really, what more can accomodating hosts ask?
author: John X.

description: Very average. Was a bit disappointed as was looking forward to their amazing seafood. Clam chowder in a sour dough bowl was nice, average. Seafood penne pasta was underwhelming. Both came very quickly which put me off a bit as nothing is freshly prepared. Great views as I was by the window. I would not come back or recommend, there are so many other restaurants to try.
author: Danielle H.

description: Really good! Had the crab fritters, clam chowder, poke, and blue cheese bread. We are from the area and felt like being tourists. I think if we have people come visit and want to go to the wharf we will take them here.
author: Tiffany B.

description: You can do a lot worse in a touristy area. Very tasty. Great service. Highlights: crab cakes, cioppino, crab Louie salad, good burgers. We had a party of 12 and had excellent service. I'd reco in the area.
author: Greatest E.

description: Well, the seafood cioppino has gone from 5 stars to only 2 stars. Fog Harbor no longer servers crab legs in the soup and now they use shredded crab meat (not sure of the source) that doesn't taste good. What a shame/sham.
author: Scott B.

description: The yelpers are right this place is really good both in food and service.   Had the Tuna poke, cup of clam chowder and the freshest salmon ever!  Also tried cable car, gimlet and margarita.  Everything was prepared extremely well and served quickly.   The place is crowded and you should expect a wait, but it is worth it.  Waiter was new, but really hustled.  Will certainly be back.
author: Craig D.

description: My wife and I went here for a nice dinner on our trip to SF. It's a classy establishment with nice views of the Bay. We ordered the scallops appetizer which was Amazing as was the sauce that came with it. I had the Crab Cakes which were LITERALLY the BEST I've ever had and I've had my share. My wife had the crab cocktail. The actual crab was delicious BUT order the cocktail sauce on the side. They smothered the crab in sauce which was sort of unexpected. I would absolutely go back again. I will say expect to run a decent tab if you go BUT you're at the ocean. You can't skimp on fresh seafood.
author: Jude W.

description: We were at Fog Harbor yesterday. The food was outstanding the waiter staff the best. I can not think of a better place to go.
author: Sherri K.

description:
First off the atmosphere was nice, had a great table overlooking the pier and Alcatraz.

We started off with a cup of chouder which was very good.

After that I dont have much good to say....

We ordered the Crab Linguini & Fried Prawns.

The prawns were ok, the beading could have been seasoned better.

The linguini was extremely bland, very disappointing.  Tried adding salt and pepper to make it better but still wasnt very good.  

The waiter was less than attentive, our glasses remained empty most of the time and never got a refill until same time we were getting the check, and had to ask for the refil.  A near by table seemed to get a lot more attention not sure if thats because they were dressed better and he thought they would tip better, but doubt I would return.
author: Mike D.

description: Food is better than other restaurant on Pier 39. Good view and reasonable priced. There is short wait during dinner time.
author: Yejun Y.

description: I should have known not to expect too much at a tourist restaurant. I ordered the crab cake burger and it had a lot of bread crumbs and very little crab meat. They also added a lot of vegetable within the crabcake to fill up the crab burger. This was a really big let down. However, their clam chowder is amazing. It was a little thick and the flavor was perfect. I wished I ordered the sourdough bread bowl instead because the girl on the next table finished the whole thing. Also, I guess we were lucky because we had a table with an amazing view. You can see the sea lion on the piers and you can also see Alcatraz Island from where I was sitting.
author: Mabel N.

description: I have tried the seafood in several restaurants at Fisherman's Wharf in San Francisco and this is the best so far! I had the baked scallops appetizer and the mixed grill seafood dish, plus I sneaked a taste of my friend's clam chowder. The food is amazing! The staff was very pleasant and our waiter was exceptionally friendly and attentive. I highly recommend Fog Harbor Fish House in San Francisco!
author: Loni B.

description:
Great food! Excellent Service.

Great view!  Very good atmosphere, nice bar.  A great place to stop in on vacation, but don't get confused by the place downstairs, I walked in after looking on YELP and almost ate there... but different restarurant... Fog Harbor is much nicer and is on the SECOND STORY.

Little pricey for a lunch ($120), but well worth it.
author: Kevin F.

description: The food there is quite good but really not worth the price though. I guess it happens when the restaurant located by the site seeing spot. My family ended up spending a little over 200 for that meal. It was four of us and we do have two rounds of beverage.
author: Wenyi Z.

description: First time visited was 10 years ago on our honeymoon trip to portland.  Nothing seems to have changed since then.  Nice clean restaurant with good food and people.  But it can get pricey when you have large group of people with you.
author: Paul K.

description: Seared Ahi tuna was spectacular! The clam chowder was very good. Great sourdough and an excellent wine recommendation. Service was perfect.
author: John B.

description:
Actually, a little higher than 4 stars ... =)

We had a very friendly & attentive waiter which is always great ... no matter where you dine.

I ordered the scallops and it was de-li-ci-ous!!!  Too bad there were only 3 JUMBO scallops, I would have loved at least 1 more ... but that's just greedy me especially when something tastes so great! I asked for a little extra of their Balsalmic Vinegrette Glaze for the scallop on the side.  Very tasty.

My husband ordered the Cioppino and took the server's advice of paying a little extra for additional shelled crab meat.  For just a few extra dollars, the extra crab meat was the way to go ... instead of adding pasta for a couple dollars.  My husband absolutely loved his dish and went on to say that it was probably one of the best Cioppinos he's ever had.  His main props for the dish was because he felt they used quality seafood and not a lot of "filler, cheaper" seafood like calamari.
author: Leslie L.

description: Nice atmosphere. We went in for a small meal. Stuck with some basic dishes, clam chowder, crab cakes with fries and coleslaw. Obviously, when eating at Pier 39 everything is overpriced, the Fog is no exception. The clam chowder was ok, crab cakes meal was rather bland. Better off grabbing fare like this at a cart or hole in the wall that puts love into their food.
author: Adam T.

description: Fog Harbor serves sustainable seafood, and has an american style menu. You can get everything from crab dishes, to sandwiches. They have a good happy hour. The atmosphere is casual and family friendly. Good views of the bay, and Golden Gate bridge.
author: Michelle W.

description: came here based on other yelp reviews.  view is awesome food isn't too bad.. had the dungeness crab...I never get crab so don't know what to base it on but to me seemed pretty plain???? hubby had clam chowder in bread bowl and that was so so so good! our waiter, khaiman was very friendly, knowledgeable about the menu and had a great personality! if we ever come back to s.f. we would come back to eat here
author: Jamie D.

description: We had a great lunch and our server, Madison, made the experience special.  She was attentive and gave excellent service.  The clam chowder was very good and the meal was good.  We'll be back!
author: Ken K.

description:
Tourist spot  at its finest.   I had friends from out of town who wanted to eat here for there seafood.  I  suggested going some where were real city people eat but they insisted  the hotel recommended it -- well they ended up being upset  they didn't listen to me.   
The service was poor,  the  food over  priced,  some of our meals  didn't  come  on  time (thanks server for not charging  is for the food  we  never  got,  seriously  you thought  you were hooking is up!).   He didn't ask if we wanted coffee or dessert, he just gave us our bill.  Worst this is that he charged us 20% Tip (though we did not give him that much) because we had an international credit card.  What he didn't realize is that the girl who paid lives in the US and called to complain and the management were gracious and appologetic, which is nice to see
author: HR W.

description:
We love this place!  We stumbled upon it while wandering the tourist trap known as Fisherman's Wharf with our friend, who had never been.  The clam chowder here is by far the best we've had and the bread bowl it came in was freshly baked and really, really good. 

All 3 of us got the Dungeness crab and it was really good.  It's usually hard to find a good place in the middle of all the tourist stuff, but this is definitely one not to miss.  If you like crab and clam chowder, this is the place to try!
author: Maggie A.

description:
Had a terrific dinner here tonight. Started with the bleu cheese bread and fritters. I would recommend both.   My wife had a bowl of the chowder.   It was creamy, and had wonderful flavor.  Especially liked the crab meat topping.  I had the seafood platter.  The portion was a good size, and felt it was reasonably priced. All the shellfish was cooked properly and loved the slice of bread for dipping in the garlic butter. Finished off the meal with tiramisu- which was spectacular.
