Our server was Shawna.  She was absolutely terrific.  Took the time to answer all of our questions, and was very prompt with her service.  She frequently checked in with us and ensured that everything was good.  If I were to be back in this area again, I would definitely ask to be seated in her section.

Beyond the food and service, the place has a wonderful ambiance. The views overlooking the water are terrific, and found the noise level was not so loud that you could not have a conversation.  All in all,  really enjoyed the meal and service we had.
author: Mark C.

description: Food was delicious and fresh! Bread bowls were yummy and so was the crab Cesar salad! Very clean and service was great! Touristy but a must go to!
author: Melissa A.

description: I have eaten here twice and both times were outstanding! I had the new York steak and to was cooked perfectly and had wonderful flavor!  My sister had the crab last time and oysters tis time both were excellent! I have also had the molten cake both times and it is sooooooo good! The Blondie is also great!  I will be back!
author: Kirsten F.

description: Clam chowder and oysters are delicious. Do not get the calamari. Worst calamari ever. Server went on break and no one was really checking up on us. I ordered a cup of clam chowder and never received it.
author: Grace H.

description: The food and service here are fabulous. Make sure to grab a reservation so that you get a seat by the window. The fresh bread at the beginning was perfect. Madison the waitress was on point. Nice view!
author: Emily L.

description: Waited literally 10 minutes just to be asked for what I wanted to drink. While another couple seated nearby got there after I did and got served immediately. When the waitress did come by I told her this and she was shocked. I left right after and went to nearby place for an amazing lunch.
author: Bibiano L.

description: We had seconds thoughts about eating at Fog Harbor but we decided to still give it a shot anyways and we are not disappointed thanks to our amazing server Khaiman!!!!!! Definitely coming back again!
author: RM L.

description:
Whenever I go to a tourist trappy kind of area, I get nervous about eating at anywhere nearby. I may be kind of a food snob but I don't think I'm wrong here. Anyway we were in the area and starving and I saw that it had surprisingly good yelp reviews so we decided to give the harbor a try. It was quite a good experience. 
Let me start by saying that the waiting area is really nice. We had to wait a bit to get a table but it was an enjoyable time spent sitting on the couch by their fireplace outside.
Inside there was a really great view of the bay and Alcatraz. 
They have a really great selection of seafood and I had a really hard time making a decision on what I wanted. I ended up getting the swordfish. It was cooked to perfection. I also loved all the seasonings and sides that came along with it. Though I have to say that on the menu it said that it came with a chimichurri sauce (which I was amazed to see paired with a seafood dish) but what was actually on it was nothing like a chimichurri sauce. It seemed like more of a parsley oil mixture. While it is probably for the best that they did not pair a intense sauce like that with a mild flavored fish, I think they should change the name on the menu.
We actually ended up getting charged for someone elses (much more expensive) bill, which was a pain. But the management was very nice about it so it all worked out in the end. 
So if you end up being a tourist in SF and feeling hungry after hours of hanging out with the sea lions this is the place to go!
author: Ashley R.

description: Beautiful and relaxed atmosphere.  The cuisine left a lot to be desired.....lacked flavor and flair for the price and ambiance.
author: Surai J.

description: This place is awesome! Great view, it's worth every minute that you have to wait for a seat near the window. Great service, very friendly. Great food, I had the oysters, clam chowder, and mixed grill, all superb!
author: Victor G.

description:
Headline: Remarkably good burger for a fish house.

I am in San Francisco on business this week, and - due to the ridiculously high hotel prices down by the Moscone - staying near Fishermans Wharf.  We needed dinner, and picked this place.  Good choice, all things considered.

I ordered the Fog House Burger.  If you are going to put your restaurants name on it, it had better be good.  To be honest, I was expecting to be underwhelmed.  Let's face it, this place is in a tourist area and serves fish.  How good could it be?  Fortunately for me, this burger came out as ordered, with a perfectly toasted bun, caramelized onions and bacon on it.  The fixings (limp piece of lettuce, two slices of tomato and a couple of rings of onion) were ok.  The fries were hot and crispy, and they have malt vinegar (which I love on fries).  Overall, this was a well-executed burger, which surprised me.

My wife had the prawn ravioli.  We were expecting the prawns to be inside the ravioli.  However, the ravioli were cheese ravioli - tasty on their own.  The prawns were perfectly cooked, and the spinach was tasty.  The sauce was sweeter than expected, but very good.  My wife was mopping up the remains of the sauce with the supplied San Francisco sourdough (which was way too strong, as is normal).

If you find yourself down at Pier 39, you can do a lot worse than this place.
author: Adrian H.

description: Definitely recommend the crab cakes.  the crab roll was fantastic, the softest bread ever.  I generally don't order the crab chowder but boy am I glad I did.
author: Christo P.

description: Had a fantastic meal tonight....great oysters, shellfish platter was immense and creme brulee was delicious.  Couldn't recommend highly enough! Also service was no.1. A must visit in San Francisco if you're looking for great seafood.
author: Laura P.

description: was looking for the best clam chowder bread bowl in sf, not sure if it was the best, but i wont argue if they say it is. sat at the bar, had some chowder, went along my way.
author: Kai P.

description: Surprised to find this hidden gem in tourist central. Lots of different fresh seafood selections instead of the usual fish and chips. Quick and attentive service! They have Robledo on the wine list!
author: Rafunzel F.

description: Service is terrible. Food was mediocre = overpriced and won't come back. Better luck at fisherman's warf.
author: Martin T.

description: My date and I came here for Valentine's Day. What I was most impressed about was how fast they were to attend to our reservation despite the fact that it was a full house, they were on schedule for those reservations (clearly I've had bad experiences with reservations in the past). The place was clean and had a nice environment. It was a place that you'd expect to look like since it was right by the sea. Our waiter was very nice, and the service was on point for the most part, however at the end it was kind of lagging. We received our food quickly from when we ordered our food, so that was really nice. I didn't expect it to be so prompt since it was a full house. Now onto their food! We ordered Choppino, clam chowder in a bread bowl, and fried combo platter. The Choppino was good, I found it to be a little salty, and was disappointed in the fact that the waiter didn't mention there was an extra fee of 4 dollars for having the crab without the shell (nor did I see it in the menu). I also was disappointed that in the Choppino, I only had two shrimps, and it was loaded with fish (probably to cut out on cost), but seriously for $28 you'd had better give more of a variety of the seafood. My dates fried combo was pretty good, but I didn't find it to be excellent. The fact that she only received two butterflied shrimp was ridiculous, and just to make the volume of the plate look bigger they load it with calamari, which if that was the case, my date stated "I should've just went with the fried calamari and chips." The breading on the items on the plate was nice and light, I didn't find it to be overpowering and you could taste the seafood which was nice. Now for the best part of this experience....the clam chowder bread bowl. This was the highlight of the night, the clam chowder wasn't too thick nor was it too liquid, it was just right. The soup had the right amount of saltiness, it wasn't overbearing. I found that there was a lot of clams in it which was a huge plus, so they didn't cheat you off of that. The bread was delicious, crispy on the outside, nice and soft in the inside. If I go back it'll probably only be for the clam chowder, but overall experience was just alright, nothing to really go crazy over since the prices were pretty high for the kind of seafood they would serve in their dishes.
author: Justin P.

description: Excellent food and service.  Fish and chips were delicious.  Family enjoyed  the fried shrimp, fried calamari, and garlic crab.  All prepared well and tasted awesome.  Reservations quick and services timely.
author: Robert W.

description:
GREAT seafood!

Anyone who knows me know that this east coast transplant is a seafood snob.  I don't want to be, but when you're raised on the best it's hard to eat crappy seafood ever.

I came here with friends from LA who was looking for good seafood at a fairly affordable price.  Bonus points for the lovely views.  We had a table right by the window overlooking the water and it was beautiful :)  Our service was great, the food was fresh and tasty.  All of us really enjoyed our meals and the ambiance.  I will certainly return!
author: Jen K.

description:
First off, I just want to say that I originally had 1st intentions of going to another restaurant to celebrate a 6 year anniversary. Unfortunately, that place was already booked (place is called Navio located in Half Moon Bay; attempted to book reservation two weeks ago; no luck). Anyway, I must say that I'm so grateful to have found Fog Harbor Fish House.  This restaurant was going to be my backup plan B; however, should never be considered a plan B. This restaurant is the real deal. 

I booked a reservation at 9:15pm (used open-table) and right below reservation time I stated under special requests...this is my first time for the restaurant and personally wanted to see if any staff representative can label "Happy anniversary" on the table nearby a window for viewing and personally requested to buy a cake and have the plate labeled in icing "Happy Anniversary Day". Little did I know that they would actually do this; well turns out they granted all requests. My server was Pedro; hands out provided the best experience for my girlfriend and I. Thank you Pedro for a job well done.   

My girlfriend and I sat down at exactly 9:15pm as stated, anniversary in coloring on the table and a great view of the bay. Atmosphere like can be a little noisy, but that didn't bother me at all. Service is excellent and the food is superb. It's the real deal. My girlfriend got the lobster plate stuffed with crab for 35 dollars; it's worth every penny!!!! I got the halibut for 32 dollars; best tasty fish ever!!!!! They both are seasonal.

My girlfriend was speechless when she saw the "Happy Anniversary" in coloring on the side of the table. Toward the end, Pedro closed it by bringing a tiramisu cake, candle on top and with "happy anniversary day" labeled in icing for my girlfriend chanting Happy Anniversary Day. She was blown away!!!!!!!!!!  Even better, while I expected to pay for the cake (as listed on my special request through open table), I realized that the cake which was 8.50 was reimbursed as a manager compensation. I can't believe this tremendous service, outstanding food, gorgeous view of the bay and last but not least experience exceeded beyond my own expectations. Plan to come here more often. Drive is worth it. Pier 39 parking is free for two hours (make sure you ask waiter to stamp the back of card for you). 

Thank you Pedro and Fog Harbor Fish House!!!!!!!
author: Derek L.

description: Although it's nestled into the tourist trap of Pier 39, this place was surprisingly enjoyable. The food was great, the view was really pretty. Slightly noisy due to hard surfaces and high ceilings, but the good service and yummy chowder make up for it.
author: Kristen A.

description: The clam chowder in a bread bowl was excellent! The calamari was also outstanding! Next time I visit San Francisco I plan to dine here again & I will definitely order calamari as a starter! Delicious!  Our waiter was great too!
author: Harolynn H.

description: My family and I were visiting  from out of town and spent a wonderful day at Fisherman's Wharf. After a long day of walking around and taking the Alcatraz tour we were excited for a nice and relaxing meal at Fog Harbor. Unfortunately we were seated in a section where the rudest waiter I have ever encountered was stationed. My first I instinct was to leave, but we were tired and hungry...so we stayed and ended up regretting ever choosing this restaurant in the first place. Our waiter was rude and irritable and really put a damper on our otherwise wonderful day. I cannot believe that he is employed in the service industry. I can't even remember if the food was good!
author: M S.

description:
The Good, the Bad, and the Ugly!
The Good:We were seated right away and the view was great.
The Bad:We didn't even see our server for 10 minutes.What kept us entertained while waiting was dodging chairs being moved above us to add to the table next to us. No waters, no bread. Finally the server shows up.  Got our waters and ordered appetizers. Waters showed up and nope can't order main yet so our server can get a couple of people out of there first...Ok then..alright, he's back so we ordered our main courses just in case we don't see our server for another long while.  Kids get clam chowder bread bowls(they miss these since we did live in Monterey) and burgers & fries.  Hubby gets the linguine with crab added on top as recommended by our server.  I get the shellfish combo also recommended by our server. Appetizers showed up-poke & sliders were really good. Baked oysters-nothing special. Glass of Sauv. Blanc. maybe thins will get better? Finally had to ask for some bread & butter (SF sourdough should make up for something). Another family of 3 gets seated next to us.  
At this point, I'm envious of the table of 8 in front of us whose server is checking on them constantly.
Appetizers gone, kids & I start to draw w/ the crayons they gave...waiting...waiting...

and now The Ugly: family next to us got their food before us?  I watch another server take our food (had to be because that table were already ordering desert) to the table in front of us then walks away..Our server returns and asks,"You guys ordered the bread bowls right?" I say "yes, but she went to the wrong table-the one in front".  The poor girl apologizes to our server.  Not her fault she was given wrong directions.  Hubbies linguine arrives-no crab added so server asks the girl to have the crab added.  My shellfish plate arrives-I try a clam & mussle, oh great-it's cold.  Server takes it back saying well the bottom is warm..ok..girl server comes back with another bread bowl?  uh, not us.  Our server puts the bread bowl in front of me to start with until my plate is fixed.  Taste the chowder--oh my how much I miss my Monterey Old Fisherman's Grotto. The 14 year old eats it instead. BTW, the kids were starving after a long drive and golden gate bridge adventure.  Hubbies linguine comes back with crab on top all right.  They threw a pile of COLD crab on top of hot pasta?  Yuck.  Hubby is starving so he decided to just mix it all together to warm the crab. Shellfish mix shows back up-and now it's hot since according to our server he watched just come off the grill. I look down at what was my original plate just reheated so now the food is over done. Clams, crab and mussles are dried up. The shrimp were overcooked so they were tough-I gave these to the hubby.  The best part of this $35 plate-the corn on the cob.
Considering the price ($196) is about the same as our family usuals-Sardine Factory, the Whaling Station, Old Fisherman's Grotto, Saporo, etc., we were all very disappointed.
author: Josefina L.

description: Great food.  The king salmon was awesome and amazing jumbo shrimp cocktail.  They even gave us tape to fix a shoe.
author: Doug K.

description: Ate here with the wife and kids...fantastic.  Wait looked long but we grabbed a high table by the bar with no wait time and no reservation. Ceviche and calamari apps were top notch.  I'm a crab cake nut and loved the Dungeness crab cake dinner.  Even the kids meals and desserts were top quality.  Was worried it would be a tourist only type place but the food really lived up to its hype.
author: Gary S.

description: This is my favorite place ever. A friend and I were in the city one day and took a cab to Pier 39 for lunch, we were soooo hungry that we walked upstairs and said "Hey, this place looks nice, let's eat here" it was the best meal either one of us has ever had. I now come here for birthdays, anniversaries, and any other excuse I can find to get there. The clam chowder is amazing, but the swordfish is why I keep coming....the service is great EVERYTIME. The drinks are delicious.
author: Stacy M.

description: This place has a beautiful view. The food is also very good. Service was excellent. We had the free appetizer with yelp check in and it was ok. The shellfish platter for 2 at $55 was very good. Fresh seafood a must while in S.F. The dessert creme brulee was just ok.  Would come here again for the view and seafood.
author: Chenille R.

description: Definitely worth the price. The clam chowder was delicious as was the sourdough bread. The crab salad was amazing as well. Plus the views of the pier are hard to beat
author: Jason W.

description:
Pros:  convenient location for tourists.  Great view. 

Cons:  Bad food. Slow service. Bad cocktails.  Rude hostess--the heavy-set hispanic woman with glasses is horribly impolite.
author: Bayarea K.

description: Probably as touristy an area on Fisherman's Wharf as you could find.... But food is good---better than all the others(cept for Hog Island). Good crab rolls, fresh oysters, ok house white & great SF homemade sour dough. Clam chowder excellent. If stuck in area I'd return over all the other spots around it.
author: Surfdawg M.

description:
So yummy! I love coming to this place, I've been here a couple of times, but this last time, the food and service were exceptional.
The host was super nice (I forget his name, but he was a young Latino). The waitress (I think her name was Monica) was very friendly and checked up on us frequently, but not too much. 
And let me tell you about the food- I'm getting hungry as I write this....
I had the calamari (very tasty, not the usual rubbery yucky stuff); the cioppino (also very tasty, but I couldn't finish all of it); and the tiramisu (man, that's the stuff right there...). I've never really had managers come up to my table and ask me how I'm doing, I was really impressed that they did that. For such a large restaurant, they're on top of it. 
Plus, the view of the bay isn't too shabby :) Check it out- it's NOT a tourist trap, I pinky swear.
author: Cindy D.

description: Service is great, food really good! Nice atmosphere and view. A little warm inside but to be expected. Try the lemon calamari and mixed seafood grill.
author: Darci R.

description: I've taken visiting family here twice. It's expensive and touristy but good, and the family members clamoring for "fresh seafood" approved. They have a kids menu and were very good with our kids. They validate parking for the Pier 39 deck.
author: Leigh C.

description: Excellent New England clam chowder and fish and chips!  The portion sizes were big too.  Service was excellent also.  Will definitely be back again when visiting.
author: Glen C.

description:
this place was amazing!! after the chipotle festival we came here for dinner. since we didn't have reservations we had to wait about 20 mins for a table. Luckily, two seats opened up at the bar. our waitress was great, super sweet and took really good care of us. i can't remember her name but she works at the bar and has great make up :). so we ordered drinks, i had chardonnay and the bf had an IPA. we ordered calamri as an appetizer. th e calamari was good but the main event was the shellfish platter for one and the bfs surf n turn. needless to say it was more than delicious. my boyfriend absolutely loved his steak and i was in heaven with the fresh shrimp and awesome crab. the little corn on the cob that came along with it was great also. i'm by no means a professional when it comes to eating crab. i get all messy and stain my shirt but i don't care!!! needless to say it took me a while to eat the crab but it was sooooo good and i had fun. our tab came out to 150 but it was sooo worth it! the service was truly great. 

since this place is super busy on the weekend, i strongly recommend reservations. next time we hope to get  a table by the windows. also the best parking has to be the pier 39 structure since it directly connects the third floor to the restaurant and they validate. 

all in all, it was a great day in the city by the bay!
author: Cecilia G.

description:
Love Fog Harbor!  Great food, great views.  The chocolate cake is to die for!
The waitstaff is very helpful and friendly.  Miss Madison rocked today and we had a blast!  Thanks, be back soon!!!!
author: Kyle S.

description: Bit disappointed with seating selection!  With virtually every table with a view, they tried to seat us toward the rear. I even pointed to an empty window table and was told it was reserved. The Crab House adjacent to this place had the same Yelp rating. Wish I would have gone with my gut feeling.
author: Fernando G.

description: I loved this place! Not a bad seat in the house. Water views and GREAT service. We came for some quick bites. We ordered the blue cheese bread (husband's favorite of the meal), calamari (very tasty) The clam chowder in a sourdough bowl was out of this world!!! I added crab to the chowder.. AMAZING. I would highly recommended this place and plan on taking future SF visitors here!
author: Lindsay L.

description:
I have to say, they have a very nice view of the harbor! And yummy clam chowder!! 
But the excitement kinda ended there. We ordered the seafood penne and the crab cake but both were OK. The seafood penne didn't have much flavor, though it had a lot of seafood so that was nice. You couldn't really taste much of the crab in the crab cake because the herbs kinda overpowered it.
author: Diana U.

description: Great food very beautiful restaraunt!  The Best clam chowder ever !!!We always come here when we come to the city !!!! You wont be dissapointed !!!
author: Jason T.

description: Great service, beautiful view and good food. Considering the location in the middle of tourist central, prices were reasonable for what you got!  Good burger (though they overcooked it a bit) and a good crab Louie.
author: GD Y.

description:
Review of a happy hour/snack time while on vacation:

Came in for a "snack" during our SF trip and not just any snack... clam chowder in a bread bowl.  It looked beautiful, but not even close to the best I've ever had.  The bread left a lot to be desired and the soup was just ok.  The service (sat at the bar) was good and so was the ambiance, but I would say if you're looking to show off the bay's famous clam chowder fare (like I was trying to do to my husband), head elsewhere.  We did enjoy a couple of other bar bites that were alright- I do recall a Shrimp app that we enjoyed, but it was definitely way spicier than what the average Joe could handle.

The real estate and drinks are what bumped up the rating to 3 stars, but in a city with tons of amazing eateries, this one is better left to the tourists who don't know any better (obviously none of which are Yelpers).
author: Gina S.

description: Saved myself from eating too much breakfast so I could have the Clam chowder here at the Fog Harbor.  Ordered just the bowl of chowder, $8.00 and  was served warm bread  with it.  It is very filling and absolutely the best chowder I have ever had.  Sat at the bar, and although I usually don't like to eat while sitting on a bar stool, I found the service at the bar was incredible.  I had 3 people waiting on me, and another just came by to see if I liked the chowder.  Great place.  Will do dinner next time.
author: Marilyn L.

description: Lovely server Madison charmed her way into our hearts just about instantly!  Charm, grace, wit, humor and maturity beyond her years created a stellar experience for us last Saturday night at this most dreamy of ocean view restaurants!  The view of the boats and sparkling lights on the water was mesmerizing.  A window seat on the water front, a full moon night, a first date!  What more could a girl ask for?  Granted, I am not let out of my cage that often, but this was a truly magical dining experience.   As my date and I basically took out a rental on the table we occupied for the greater part of the evening, I would say that our server went above & beyond the call of duty in catering to all our whims and needs.  Oh yes, and the food was delicious!  We loved the clam chowder, I ordered the Mixed Grill plate, and darned if I remember what my date ordered, but I know he cleaned his plate!  Five stars for sure!
author: Celeste S.

description: Shawna suggested the Moscow Mule and it was very refreshing. She is a great bartender I highly recommended you stop in and say Hi to Shawna  shrimp cocktail was nice as well
author: Diane C.

description: Great location, right at Pier 39. Decent food with reasonable price. My friends and I had a great time there. The view is also splendid. Make sure you get a table near the window to the sea. Also, make reservation ahead of time!!
author: Lin Z.

description: Nice seat overlooking the water (although the windows needed to be cleaned) with some very good to great sea food (halibut, sole, salmon).
author: Nick F.

description: Crab rolls and shrimp cocktail are excellent and tasty!  Service is attentive and would totally go back!
author: John N.

description: Great seafood, the lobster mac n cheese was delicious.  Moderately priced food.  Try the Blue cheese bread, it's free if you check in on YELP.  Great view of the bay as well.
author: Gil A.

description: Good view, very thick clam chowder but i liked it. Should try the Ahi tuna with avacado and mango for a starter! Nice in general!
author: Julian N.

description: Beautiful view, and their clam chowder was one of the best I've ever had! And their garlic shrimp was also SO yummy. Definitely a good food spot to bring your out of town friends. :)
author: Sam U.

description: We had lunch here via a reservation on Yelp.  They got us in early with a fantastic view of the pier.  The service was solid and atmosphere calming.  The food is what really stood out.  All options on the menu are sustainably chosen and extremely fresh.  I had the seared Ahi Tuna and it was to die for.  My parents each loved their dishes as well.  Come here, stay away from the chain restaurants, and you will not be disappointed!
author: Kyle W.

description: This place was great!  Great views of the craziness on the streets, the bay, and it was clear enough for us to see Alcatraz from the bar.  My friends and I were hanging out at the bar, and our bartender Brittany made it even better.  She took care of us, attentive, made great drinks, and was just really cool to talk to - kind of like we were hanging out with her too.
author: Michael J.

description: I loved the Halibut.  Can't beat it.  Excellent dish.  Prepared very well.  The server recommended an excellent wine.  I'll be back for sure.
author: Chris W.

description:
Great view, okay food, poor service and management.

My family and I have been there twice.  We chose this restaurant because they advertise that they can make most of their dishes gluten free (we have food allergies in our family) and have marked those dishes on the menu.  

The first time we went I was served wine in a (very) dirty glass.  I told the server, and about 15 minutes later he brought me a new glass of wine.  

The second time we went was on the Sunday of a holiday weekend.  My wife and I both ordered their warm spinach salad, but the server told us that they had run out of spinach.  Really?  On a holiday weekend?  Seems like poor planning, but not that big of a deal.

No worries, we ordered some other dishes, and waited for our food.  And we waited, and waited, and waited.... After 40 minutes our server told us that the chef had made a mistake - I had ordered a gluten free dish, and the chef made prepared it improperly.  So I had the server bring the rest of the dishes and sat there and watched my family eat for 15 more minutes while they made my dish.

Finally, after almost an hour, I got my tuna.  Admittedly, it was pretty tasty... but by that point I was hungry and in a bad mood, so anything would have tasted good. 

For our trouble, the manager offered us 30% off during our next visit.  When I told him I was in the military and we were moving overseas and we wouldn't be back, he simply said, "Okay, well, we'd still love to have you back."  Didn't offer to take care of our appetizers or take the 30% off of our bill that day... would have been a nice gesture.  

The view is nice, the food is above average, but the service is terrible.  Wouldn't go back even if we weren't moving.
author: Tim W.

description: Ate here this past weekend.  The food and service was excellent.
author: Shawn W.

description: very touristy so it gets crowded and busy. Great sourdough bread, good clam chowder in their bread bowl. Wanted to order the dungeness crab but we didn't feel like dealing with the mess which i regret bc everyyyyyy table ordered it! We had the linguini and clams, crab roll, and the creamed crab dip. Everything was very good, ask for a table with a view of the water, you'll see the cute seals!
author: Saeeun B.

description:
kid friendly white table cloth restaurant with incredible views
Amazing customer service from the hostess to our server Ashlie to the manager who came by to check on our meal
felt great eating at a place that values sustainable seafood and right across from the aquarium by the bay!

Fried shrimp and fried fish were ok
calamari was delicate but too bland
Salmon over beets and brussel sprouts hearty dish excellent 
Apple crisp very good - esp light caramel sauce over high quality vanilla ice cream

by far was the customer service that was impressive
my salmon was supposed to have sauce on the side- cook made it with sauce on top but Ashlie caught it before it even got to us and made them redo it
That process made our wait time a lot longer for food. manager came by and offered a discount for us! Ashlie meanwhile made sure we had plenty of warm fresh bread - even before we finished the first loaf.
thank you - what a great place in the midst of a big tourist trap with incredible service
author: Win H.

description: Been here a couple times and I love the ambiance--it's got great views. The food is pretty good too. The crab melt was a little soggy (prob too much mayo), but the scallop dish was amazing!
author: Allison S.

description: Fabulous food and quick attentive service.  We had the fish and chips, crab cakes, and crab stuffed lobster.  Fish was tender, crab cakes crispy, and lobster crab combo was out of this world!!
author: Lori D.

description: One of the waiters here name Khaiman was really friendly. He gave us really good suggestions. The food was amazing for reasonable pricing and this place has very good service.
author: Marvin C.

description: Solid overall dining experience.  Highlight of the meal was the clam chowder!  Great views, attentive staff.  A little pricey at times, but, hey, what do you expect in the touristy areas of SF!  Would definitely stop by again!
author: Josh L.

description: Great views, great food, great service! Miyagi oysters, score :) Portions are quite large, so beware of over-ordering (or just get yummy leftovers to go). Wine list is reasonable also - the Syrah was a winner!
author: Claudia J.

description:
great food..
great service
great prices.
make a visit you wont be disappointed.
author: Anil J.

description: Slightly better than your average tourist place around here. Great view and nice decor. Food was pretty good but not fantastic by any stretch. Nice selection of seafood on the menu with some good choices for landlovers as well. Prices are definitely inflated by about 20% over what they should be, but what do you expect for Pier 39 right? Didn't need a reservation for weekday lunch. Make sure to check in on Yelp for free appetizer.
author: Peter R.

description:
My wife and I went for Dinner.  We had to wait a few minutes for a table, not a long wait at all.  We had a nice view from our table and the waiter was attentive and friendly.   We shared scallops and calamari as appetizers, she had crab cakes for her entree and mine was the Shellfish platter.

The calamari were very good, they were fresh, had a good remoulade and pleasantly spicy batter.  The scallops however, were not good, they're obviously frozen with a thick, greasy unseasoned batter.  The crab cakes were good, with a lot of crabmeat.  The shellfish platter included a half Dungeness crab, 5-6 peeled shrimp and 5-7 clams and mussels.  It's all swimming in an eighth-inch of melted butter, crab juices and garlic.  How can it not be good?  

Next time I'm in SF, I'd come back, just wouldn't order the scallops.
author: Travel A.

description: The food was good, the service was great, and the view was fantastic!
author: Jorja R.

description: Just had a fantastic and *fresh* meal with a special friend. I have to say that Khaiman took expert care of us the entire time and also paid close attention to my food allergen issues (gluten intolerance) and recommended substitutes and alternates. What a nice touch. Overall the ambience was superb, the views gorgeous and again, the seafood superb. Lovely night, nice memories.
author: Brian L.

description: We had a great meal and wonderful service here! I had the pacific sole, and it was delicious! We will definitely be coming back! Mila was our waitress and she was fantastic.
author: Sandy C.

description:
This is not a four stars yelp for all of Fog Harbor. I wasn't that impressed with most of the menu (nothing too original, Pier 39 pricesfare), the by the script service (nice, but felt like a standard spiel), or even the complimentary two glasses of wine given to my grandparents for their 60th anniversary. Nice gesture, but bringing just two when there were four of us at the table? Awkward. But drink up gparents!

All said, none of the above is what I remember most about eating here. That memory is saved for an outstanding cioppino. A ridiculous amount of seafood simmering in a perfect tomato broth. Sis and I got one to split, they were kind enough to bring it on two plates, and each half was easily enough for one person. It was simply fantastic, enough so to recommend coming here just for your own, and perhaps getting one all for yourself.

Just make sure to bring some extra champagne if you are celebrating. Cioppino all over yourself is awkward enough.
author: Jason B.

description: An alright seafood restaurant. Lots of menu choices to pick form..I had a hard time deciding. For appetizers, I got a bowl of clam chowder and shared a dish of baked oysters. The chowder was pretty good, not the best, but still full of potatoes and clams. The oysters had a strange flavor. I would not get it again, but it was edible. For my dinner, I got the Ahi tuna; it turned out to be alright too. I was expecting a bit more flavor. Atmosphere was nice and service was also above average, but next time, I'm going to try another restaurant on the pier.
author: Kristine L.

description:
The 3 stars are kind of for the view. The food is nothing remarkable, but you could do worse around Pier 39. I've had lunch a few times at Fog Harbor...today I had a Caesar Salad which was pretty good, and Fried Calamari which was good enough but arrived cold. 

I was interested in Salmon but they only serve farm raised. Prices aren't cheap, and I think for an expensive seafood lunch you're better off at McCormick and Kuleto's in Ghirardelli Square, which I'm no big fan of but their food is a notch above and the view is beautiful there too....
author: Gwynnie P.

description:
Kind of a tourist-trap, but prices and food are more than OK for what it is. 
We had the Ahi tuna (very good), and the Fish and Chips (I'd give them 3.5 stars.)
The service was nice, with good sights of the pier.
author: Chiqui E.

description: What a nice resturant. Started off with a great bloody mary. Def one of my top 5 fav bloody marys. Then i ordered some oysters. And man they were great. So clean and a great vinegar sauce along with hot sauce put them in my top 5 fav oysters. Which i knew what kind they where (waiter did not say). Then i got the smoked salmon with a cup of clam chowder. Salmon was good but not memorable. But clam chowder was really good too. Wish i lived in SF just to be able to go here more often.
author: Kyle T.

description:
the service was a 5 star - our server was top notch even with the craziness of veterans day weekend.  saw some poor reviews regarding service but the restaurant was packed for the entire time we were seated and our waiter was always there for us.  

the food was generous, very fresh and flavorful.   the poke was some of the best i have ever tasted...even better than poke i've had in hawaii.  both the crab louie salad and shrimp salad looked and tasted fresh from the farmer.  the mussels in curry broth was delicate and bread dipping worthy.   one family member found the shrimp cocktail somewhat 'mushy'.  

A+ on the view.  A++  on the fact that fog harbor fish house is a sustainable restaurant.  being a local, the only downside is that its located in pier 39.  having to work your way into the parking lots and thru  the crowds, really takes away attention from this restaurant and how good this place is.
author: n y.

description:
Hm.... the service was good, the whole lobster was juicy, but the crab was gross. The saving grace of this restaurant was the gorgeous view over the bay and the kick ass tuna/tuna appetizer. Their "supposed" award winning chowder would win awards for mediocrity!

What really annoyed me was that walking by, you can see all their sealife critters moving about in the holding tanks, yet when my crab came out, it was definitely not live when they cooked it. I think it was probably alive a couple years ago and then lost in the deep abyss of their freezers.... Add insult to injury when I brought it up with the manager, he said that the roasted crab was made with frozen crab and the regular steamed crab was made with live crab. ??!?!?!?! *pulls out hair.*

It's a decent place to go to when the meal's expensed... but other than that, there are so many other great fantastic places to eat in the city....
author: Vicky L.

description: Knew we we in for a tourist place at pier 39. Location and service were good, the food was good but not great. Got just what we expected.
author: Jon S.

description:
I wasn't that impressed.  My wifes Chili LIme Shrimp Salad was greasy,  the shrimps overcooked to hell and just not as light as the name suggests.   My seafood penne was OK,  but I could knock up  something as good with my eyes shut (in fact the mirepoix was way too chunky to extract much flavour and of course didn't cook through).

Daughters fish and chips was good  though as was the Calamari.   Service was good, the view was good and the location of course, but coming from near Marseille in France,  where you can eat great seafood the meal was disappointing.
author: Matt M.

description: Great food with a great view. My Alaskan halibut was cooked to perfection. My husband's fried fish was equally well-cooked. All of this with a view of the boats and the famous sea lions. The cocktails were inventive and quite delicious - cucumber basil gimlet amid Moscow mule (vodka and ginger beer concoction).
author: Jennifer A.

description: Great Place! My boyfriend and I were visiting San Francisco and had just finished the Alcatraz evening tour and couldn't wait to get dinner at a local seafood house.  This was definately a great place to dine!  The entrance is gorgeous with the backlighting to the water feature in the entrance by the fireplace and nice seating added a welcoming touch to our dinner. We had 2 free drink vouchers from our hotel (Radisson Fisherman's Warf) to use which was a nice surprise.  Along with drinks we got a chicken caesar salad and the fried shrimp plate with veggies and wild rice pilaf.  Fantastic!  We arrived at 930pm and were immediately seated, received our food and were out the door within 1 hour.  Very nice Fog Harbor!
author: Jennifer P.

description:
After a long day in the city, we decided to go to Pier 39 for dinner.  Despite all the restaurants available to us, we decided on Fog House based on the decor outside (a nice fireplace with a seating area and ample room inside).  I ordered the spicy shrimp appetizer and it was pretty tasty, but VERY spicy if you like that kind of thing.  For my entree, I ordered the garlic roasted whole crab.  Although it was very flavorful and good, it was missing a claw (my favorite part and the best meat in my opinion).  So I told the waiter who was very apologetic and said he would take care of it.  About 5 minutes later, a whole plate of seafood arrived at my table and the waiter proceeded to apologize and the chef made a special dish for us to make up for the gaffe.  

I'm a firm believer that it's not what the restaurant does wrong, but it's what they do to correct the problem and they get an A++++ from me for that.  4-stars based on the good, but not outstanding food.
author: Jerome W.

description:
Don't be put off by the fact that this restaurant is on Pier 39 (up the stairs). You will be completely segregated from the tourists below while you are enjoying your meal from an extensive menu. 
My partner and I booked a table at around 3pm on Friday afternoon for that evening and were told that the only available times were 5:30PM or 8:30 PM, so just be warned that it is best to book a bit earlier in the day, although we were quite happy to eat early and didn't feel rushed to finish our meals. 
We both had starters and shared the seafood platter which was plenty enough for the both of us.
The menu had loads of gluten free options and the waiter was very knowledgeable about cross contamination - before I could even ask he told me he would speak to the chef to make sure he didn't touch anything with gluten when preparing my meal. Despite being quite a busy restaurant, the waiter was extremely friendly and attentive. However, a different waiter brought our main meals out before the plates from our starter had been cleared. Overall we had a very pleasant evening at this restaurant. We recommend requesting a table next to a window with a sea view.
author: Hanna V.

description: Stopped in for a snack at the bar during a day in the city. I had a yummy tuna poke salad that was fresh and bright and really delicious. Hubby had some clam chowder in a bread bowl. It just isn't a visit to the city for him without some clam chowder :) Would definitely go here again. Great view and friendly service too!
author: Goldi J.

description: I tried their clam chowder. It was thick but not flavorful enough. However I like their big chunk of clam. However it was not the best clam chowder I ever had. Make sure you try their sourdough bread though.
author: J L.

description: What a beautiful place this is! At the entrance there is a fireplace and sitting area which is so cozy when it gets chilly at night! Came here on the evening of fourth of July and although they said the wait would be an hour it was only 30 minutes! Ordered the clams appetizer, and clam chowder in a bread bowl both oh sooooooo good! Ordered a moscow mule which comes in a beautiful bronze challas! Had the apple cobbler with ice cream on top which was also delicious. Best part was the view, over looking fisherman's wharf and the water! Definitely come here worth the wait!
author: Milana K.

description: Absolutely delicious!  I had blue cheese garlic bread from the check-in, some calamari, fried scallops, and the clam chowder for my appetizers.  For the main course I had the garlic whole crab...it ROCKS.  If you happen to eat here be sure to get your parking ticket validated for a parking garage nearby - we didn't notice the garage until AFTER we finished our meal and explored the area.
author: Timothy C.

description: Excellent seafood and great customer service! I ate the Pacific Sole fish and it was fantastic! One of the best dishes I've ever had!
author: Gemma K.

description: Food was average, not worth what we paid. Our waitress was really good and took care of our needs just wish I could say said the food was great! My lobster Mac and cheese was okay, the noodles were too over cooked and my husbands seafood cioppino didn't have enough seafood in it.
author: Danyel W.

description:
I made a reservation, and upon arrival I had to wait for about 15 minutes while a table cleared. Other than that, my service and food was top notch.

The view of the bay was excellent. Service was prompt and attentive, and I never lacked without.

The food... holy moley. Maybe I don't know what good is, but the selections I had were fantastic. First, the sourdough bread? It exploded with happiness in my mouth. I ate two baskets over the course of the meal. My starter course was a cup of their clam chowder. Even better (I'm drooling thinking about it now). It made me wish I'd ordered the chowder in a bread bowl. For the main course I had the lemon sole with steamed veggies and mashed potatoes. I stuffed as much of it into me as I could, while savoring every bite. I passed on dessert as I couldn't eat another bite.

The prices for the food were reasonable, the beer (though in a very tall glass) was a bit overpriced. Next time I'm at the wharf, I'll be back.
author: William B.

description: The food was great, but the service was very disappointing. The salad arrived well before drinks and bread, water wasn't refilled, and the waiter was completely inattentive.
author: Bill B.

description: Walked in with a California hoodie and SF Giants hat. Knew this was a bit more upscale by looking at the other diners and the table setup. But not worries, as more tourist came in after we did. I ordered the Grilled Everything. It included shrimp, Salmon, and Swordfish. Tasted great. My girlfriend got some delicious crab cakes which I happily sampled too. Where we sat we got a nice view of Alcatraz and the window was slightly open, letting in some cool air. I did notice most of the people sitting near us as international tourists. The table next to us was French (know some of the language) and they ordered the Maine lobster. They were waiting for an hour at least. We left and they still did not have their food.
author: Tone A.

description: Shellfish platter and crab cakes are SUPER DELICIOUS ... The waiter Khaiman provides us with a very good service!!! It is obvious that he likes his job and he is professional at this... I would like to come to this restaurant every time I come to San Francisco!!!
author: Lamya A.

description: This was the best seafood experience we had in San Francisco. The sourdough clam chowder bowl was most delicious and I would recommend that to anyone who loves clam chowder. My husband had ahi tuna for his main app and he couldn't get enough of it. He said the next time he is working in San Francisco he will order this and have it delivered to his hotel!! I had the lobster Mac and cheese for the main app and it was pretty dang good. Surprised at how much lobster was actually in the Mac and cheese. The server was very attentive even though this place was packed and they were so busy. I was happy with the food and the service.
author: Kari M.

description:
Sometimes it's a blast to head down to Pier 39 or Fisherman's Wharf and hang out with the throngs of tourists. Fog Harbor is a classy restaurant with gorgeous views in the middle of tourist central. I mean seriously, you can't get a better view than this! It also helped that after a gloomy summer, even by San Francisco standards, we had an epic weekend of beautiful weather!

To start we ordered the Red Chili Garlic Prawns and the Ahi Tuna 2 ways. The prawns were succulent and tasty and this dish definitely took me to the outer edges of my spice tolerance. The Ahi Tuna appetizer was sesame "poke" style with fried wonton and Cajun seared with cayenne aioli. The tuna on the crispy wonton with the creamy sauce was a cool and creamy antidote for my taste buds which were still recovering from the red chili garlic prawns.

For my entree I ordered the Salmon BLT served on a toasted french roll with a pesto aioli. I almost never finish an entire entree, but I couldn't put this thing down! Bacon truly is the miracle meat that goes great with just about anything. The sandwich came with fries and it was an extremely generous portion, I didn't come close to finishing all of them.

My dinner companion ordered the Garlic Roasted Crab, it's a roasted half crab cooked in a garlic herb butter. I didn't try this dish as I'm not much of a crab eater, but it was a sight to behold. It looks like a lot of work, but she is a gigantic crab fan and actually loves the whole process of cracking the thing open and pulling out every last tasty morsel.

Usually at this point, I'm stuffed and dessert is out of the question, but we were in a mood to take it to the limit so we ordered the crème brûlée. It was creamy, crackly and a perfect way to end the meal with a cup of coffee.

No complaints out of me when it comes to this place. It was such a beautiful day, the view was spectacular and the service outstanding. It's my pleasure to give credit where credit is due, these people work hard and I would seriously consider eating here the next time I hang with the tourists.
author: Nate R.

description: Fresh seafood, fantastic view. The service can improve though. Our waiter was nice but too slow. We had a baby with us and he didn't take that into account when serving. Water wasn't refilled and requests were forgotten. We had to wait a while for our food, which i think he either forgot to put in or was too busy. Nonetheless, we did enjoyed our food.
author: Katie S.

description:
Went to have lunch after my son and I toured the aquarium by the bay. We where in rain gear and the hostess just blew us off and seated all the "better" dressed folks.  Before I was about to say something someone else came and took us to our table.
Got seated and ordered drinks and our meal at the same time. Juice for my son and and local brew for me, fried calamari and linguine and clams.
Bread came with water, then a few mins. later the calamari.
After the linguine arrived I'm like "where's my son's pineapple juice and my anchor steam"?  They said the bar didn't get the ticket.
The waiter looked like he lacked focus. The saving grace was the Calamari and the view. 
But I know there's plenty better out in the pier area.  So the next time I'll be going else where.
author: Michael K.

description: Excellent view,  food and service!  My son loved the steamed crab!
author: Michelle N.

description:
This was our first meal in San Francisco. We were a party of four.when we arrived we were informed that there is a wait of 20 minutes. We were seated inside of 20 minutes at a nice window seat overlooking the harbor.

The waiter was very knowledgeable about the menu and the specials. We ordered and received our food fairly quickly for a restaurant which were very busy. All the staff was helpful and professional.

Of the four dishes we ordered three were excellent and the fourth was described as good. The only negative was that the wine was fairly expensive. We therefore settled for the house wine which were also good.
author: Ian G.

description: Great Place the Food was good. The service was good. and I check the restrooms which was clean. The place was very busy but it was quick service once we was seated.  Try the Clam Chowder Bowl in the Sourdough Bread... Very Good.
author: Chris C.

description:
Still on my quest to find the perfect crab cake, I will leave no wave or shore unturned :)

Being born and raised in San Francisco I can sometime forget how busy things can get at Pier 39, I still cannot gage when the down season or off peak hours will be. No matter, Fog Harbor has great view, OK service and the food is pretty good.  

Just a quick stop in for my date and I to refuel after being tourists in our own city.  We ordered the garlic bread, Crab Cake Entree and Crab Cake Sandwich. Yum Yum and Yum. Not too bad of a meal or snack if you prefer. I wish we could have paid the "locals price" those three items an SF Cosmo for my date and a virgin fruit daiquiri aka smoothie for me totaled $68.00 15% tip included 

I guess the price included the view and clear days in San Francisco where you can see all the way across the bay are priceless!!
author: ARSON P.

description: Excellent food and excellent customer service. Our server was incredibly helpful and punctual. I typically avoid "touristy" areas but do recommend.
author: Ross C.

description:
We sat outside by the fireplace because we wanted to relax and warm up after our city tour.   

The setting outside was perfect for us.  We played some Uno and had a few drinks.  We decided to try the mussels and I must admit that it was very tasty and well prepared.   We did not have dinner there only because we had reservations somewhere else.  

So if you are looking for a place to relax with a fireplace and still catch some of the waterfront action then I would recommend this place.
author: Selvan M.

description: Some may write this restaurant off as it's located in the heart of tourism town at Pier 39, but don't judge it so quickly. The food here is amazing. Upon arrival we were quickly seated at a nice table with a great view. Shortly after we received a delicious amuse-bouche as a thank you for making a reservation. It was rock shrimp with aioli -- delicious. I had the wild salmon, and it was incredible. I am a huge salmon fan, and this was the best I have ever had. It's served over a bed or arugula, fingerling potatoes and crispy onions. It's delightful. The dinner was satisfying but not heavy, so we had room for dessert. We split the tiramisu. It was delectable. The wait staff was highly attentive throughout the dinner and very friendly. I would definitely recommend this restaurant for your time in SF.
author: Kristen G.

description: I had the mixed grill, it was salmon, swordfish, and shrimp. It was probably my favorite meal of the entire trip to San Francisco. Waitress was very nice. Prices were a little bit on the expensive side.
author: Nick L.

description: Had the Garlic crab for my birthday dinner... wasn't sure how good it was going to be...Loved the food and got a free birthday dessert too. Nice view and romanti.
author: Victoria C.

description:
We came here to celebrate our engagement and our friends' wedding and had a wonderful time! We made reservations so out wait was less than 5 minutes, and that gave us a chance to take a few pictures in front of the pier 39 Christmas tree, so it was a welcomed wait. Our server was really sweet and patient. They have a delicious selection of appetizers, featuring many with crab, and the drinks were really good! (I had a pumpkin pie martini which was really good!) 
We split the seafood penne pasta and the surf and turf, both of which I would highly recommend. The view was gorgeous and it didn't seem like there were any bad tables in the place. 
We had a wonderful time having a celebratory dinner here and would highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a nice evening at a tasty restaurant. I am definitely going back here!!!
author: Jessica L.

description:
I came here per the suggestion of my roommate who works as a hostess there because she always would recap to me all the delicious food she ate that day with eyes wide and everything, so I finally got the chance to  try it.

First off, let me just say the ambiance of the place is very...ritzy. The restaurant itself is beautiful--definitely a place to wine and dine someone special with a beautiful view of the bay (*hint hint* guys!). The servers are friendly and attentive, and they made sure my water glass was never left empty.

I had the crab cakes and ahi tuna to start off with, and the crab cakes were by far some of the best I've had in San Francisco. They were moist, creamy, and had a great balance of breading and crab. The ahi tuna was okay--I didn't really care for the seared tuna; it was a little dry but the sesame poke with the wonton chips was delicious to snack on. 

I had the Mixed Grill with the salmon, mahi-mahi, and prawns, and I was worried that the fish would come out dry, but surprisingly, the fish was quite juicy and flavorful. I didn't care too much for the prawns though.

Finally, I had the lava cake for dessert, and this is where the 5 star acclaim comes from. The chocolate lava cake was the BEST cake I have ever had. Drizzeled with a heap of warm gooey fudge and served with vanilla ice cream, each bite was a taste of what heaven should taste like. They could have served me dirt for the main course and this cake for dessert and I probably would have still been happy. 

All in all, this restaurant was a pleasant dining experience. The prices are a bit steep but a seafood restaurant at the wharf with a view overlooking the bay will cost you a shiny penny.
author: Winnie T.

description: Sit in Khaiman's section, he rocks! Best waiter I've had in a while. The food is delicious and reasonably priced.
author: Ben O.

description: Excellent seafood and a great atmosphere all for a great price!
author: Alex J.

description: Such great food and service! Always a treat to come here. Not to mention the hot blonde bartender and the sexy muscled GM!
author: John U.

description: Food was great! Fancy place to go on a nice date. Service was a bit slow, but nothing to be worried about. Great Clam Chowder!
author: Sergio G.

description: Just got back from a vacation to San Francisco and we could not have been happier with the food and service here. We went here after a hop on hop off tour and really wanted a nice sit down meal. We had the jumbo shrimp cocktail, mussels cooked the way they make the clams (per my cousins request), clam chowder, and crab cakes. Everything was fresh, reasonably priced (even the drinks), and service was excellent. We made several recommendations when people asked us where to eat at Pier 39. I will definitely be going back.
author: Victoria R.

description: We love fog harbor and dirk he makes us feel like we are at a 5 star restaurant and the food is wonderful.
author: Jill G.

description: Loved this restaurant!  It's right at Pier 39 - so the location can't be beat.  We got the crab, and it was totally amazing!  The garlic butter is to die for.  You gotta go for it!  Also ordered the fish - it was only so-so.  My big piece of advice is don't do fish - just get double the crab!
author: Jane S.

description:
Had Madison as our waitress. Very polite and very attentive. If she wasn't working we would ask her to join us for lunch. Great food, great service!

Complimentary bread is baked into the price in the menu therefore being perceived as free, at least that's what I theoretically think. 

Hopefully will get a chance to try the creme brulee someday ;)
author: Doug T.

description:
OH. MY. GOD.  Best calamari I have EVER had in my San Francisco experience to date!!  

My friend and I were quoted 15 minutes on our wait, and were seated within about 5.  The decor and lighting is just stunning, it really sets a nice mood for a romantic date and feels really swank.  Lots of patrons in business suits, dressy attire, and couples lounging around, not a lot of younger people dining here (as in, under 16).  

We were seated, checked on promptly, the wait staff was friendly, polite, and knowledgeable.  The food was absolutely TO DIE FOR.  Pairing the Calamari appetizer with a Savignon Blanc was just the perfect dining choice, while my friend ordered the Garlic Bread, which was by far, also the best I ever tasted in my life.  I am putting this restaurant away in my mental filing cabinet for "place to go on a really hot swanky date"... om nom nom... I had to shield my eyes from the rest of the menu because everything sounded amaaaaaaazing!
author: Jenna B.

description: My husband & I enjoyed this place. The service was great. The food was awesome. This would be a great place to bring friends, your family, in-laws, its so comfortable u could dine alone!
author: Kris J.

description: This experience was great from beginning to end. We visited San Francisco over 4th of July holiday so Pier 39 was crowded, but Fog Harbor did a great job at getting us in. And regardless of the crowd, it was worth the wait! The portions are large and the food was fabulous.  In our week stay in San Francisco, Fog Harbor was the only restaurant we visited several times.  Each time we went we got the same server named "Bong" - who has now become our favorite server.  He was excellent! Some things we tried that I would definitely recommend - the Clam Chowder (has to be THE BEST I've ever had) - the Red Chili Shrimp - the Shellfish Platter (lots of food) - the Salmon BLT - and for appetizers try the Fried Scallops, Baked Oysters or Calamari. They are all GREAT!
author: Evette B.

description: We stopped in here for a couple of drinks before the rehearsal dinner. Its a huge place but its awesome - kind of touristy but it is what it is. We had some great drinks - I had some girly pink lemonade drink but it was awesome and strong. The food smelled and looked great so I would definitely go back to try some of it.
author: Krista N.

description:
My wife and I decided to try Fog Harbor for dinner on the first night of our vacation to SF.   Our waiter was prompt, and eager to please.  I started off with an Alcatraz escape, and my wife soon followed up after stealing mine twice, it was that good!  The clam chowder was hot, but felt gritty.  I had one of their specials, Cajun shrimp with Tasso ham over fettuccine, which was delicious.  My wife had the fried calamari which also was very good and cooked just right.  

Portion sizes were large enough that we both did not finish our meal, which is somewhat common for her, but a rarity for me.  The prices were more than fair for fresh seafood in a tourist  trap.  The local may cringe, but it's great being a tourist to see a good place to eat close by instead of the normal gouging greasy options.
author: Bryan L.

description: We usually have very, very bad luck on Fisherman's Wharf when it comes to food but we finally found a winner! Large portions, great sauces, sustainable seafood and well educated service. The blue cheese garlic bread was just like we make it at home...but bigger. Cannot say I'm mad about that. The swordfish and sole we had were both fresh and well prepared to flaky goodness. Though service was a little slow it was worth it. Our waiter understood what we wanted and directed us accordingly. The place was packed on a Sunday night with tourists so definitely make reservations if you're headed this way.
author: Stevie C.

description: This place was amazing....ordered the blackened ribeye, clam chowder was the best I ever had....topped it off with fresh crab and it was great....service was satisfactory and the view great. I would definitely return
author: Ramil P.

description: My Mother was craving crab, and for $37, Fog Harbor Fish House serves a whole dungeness crab steamed just the way she likes it. The caesar salad comes with speared romaine, the way I prefer, and the dressing is delicious. Bread is complimentary and is difficult to stop eating! I conservatively ordered linguine with clams. The linguine could have been more al dente, but the serving was generous. My husband ordered fish and chips. The woman who served us was extremely polite and doting. The restaurant is very clean with a pretty interior and a picturesque view of the waterfront. This is the second meal that we've enjoyed at Fog Harbor Fish House.
author: KJ N.

description: know this place from few years ago, food was good.    Yesterday, we decided to go there ... had the worst service. Didn't get pass the hosts and walked out.
author: Mehran R.

description: Excellent Dungeness crab and great views!! Wait staff was awesome very informative. I would highly recommend the crab
author: Ryan T.

description: This place is touristy but it is pretty good! I've been here a few times, specifically when I have visitors at home that want to see Pier 39, and they all loved it!! I absolutely love their baked oysters and the clam chowder is really delicious!
author: Rocio A.

description: DO NOT waste your time, or palette at this place.  We were at Fisherman's Wharf anyway, so figured the seafood would be fresh and delicious.  First of all, the service was terrible.  The waiter was downright rude and unfriendly.  The food was fresh enough, but wouldn't have made me think I was sitting alongside the ocean!  I was not impressed with the flavorless dish I ordered, nor was my husband with his choice.  I would absolutely not go back here.
author: Melissa E.

description: Had the "WOW" factor!  Amazing food!!!  Prices were reasonable.  You get what you pay for.  Will definitely be back again to try everything else =D
author: Reynell C.

description: You're paying for the view but the food's pretty good. Clam chowder is as good as anywhere else on the wharf. The crab very good.
author: chad k.

description: Superb service. Delicious food. Beautiful view. It could not get any better.
author: Aaron H.

description: Amazing view of the the bay. Oysters were so very good and the bartender was very attentive.
author: Ramin P.

description:
Pleasant enough to placate your cardigan wearing grandmother, but the foodie in your family will not be so satisfied. 

I had a tuna salad for lunch, which only had 4 very small pieces of tuna; not nearly enough to fill me up. And the quality? Meh. The waiter also all but disappeared after he delivered the food. 

On the plus side, the restuarant is clean and airy, and the huge windows surrounding the restaurant offer a truly great view of the water & Alcatraz.
author: Amy Z.

description: A good time. Evidently their happy hour had just changed and they hadn't updated their website yet, but they were nice enough to give us the old happy hour, which I really appreciated as their prices were normally high. Bartenders were exceptionally friendly - we had 2-3 that were checking on us regularly. I had the  Agave Margarita and the calamari and both were great. I'd go back for sure - it's not on the full-on bay side so the view isn't the absolute best of the places we went, but it was a good time!
author: Christina M.

description: First time at Fog Harbor and first time for clam chowder!  The soup was great and server Madison was awesome!  Definitely will return on future visits to San Francisco!
author: Mary S.

description: It was Madison's first day off orientation.  She was clear, concise and very personable.  She's a keeper and the food was awesome!  The view was spectacular and the ambiance was great.  We will be back in August and will definitely come back.
author: Mary M.

description: The blonde bartender was helpful and very knowledgable. Great atmosphere and fantastic salmon. Thumbs up!
author: Kyle B.

description: A friend was visiting from India so wanted to show off with the food available in SF. I had an option of Boudine or this place, and i selected FHFH because I had never visited here before and thought, well, two birds with one store. We started off with drinks: Alcatraz Escape and the Blueberry Ginger beer drink (don't remember the name). AE was OK, I liked my blueberry ginger beer concoction. We then moved to the starters: Blue cheese garlic bread, Fried Scallops, Crab Cake & fries. Special shout out to the fries! Just the right amount of crunch and softness that I like in my fries. CRAB CAKE was the bomb, LOVED IT! Blue cheese garlic bread was tasty. The fried scallops did not do anything for us and we left that plate almost untouched. The dips we got with each of the dishes was awesome! Unfortunately, after the above dishes we felt stuffed and did not actually try the sea food platters/ entrees that we set out to originally have. Well, then again, there is always a next time!
author: Shruti D.

description:
Best crabs I ever had :) order the platter and you'll get mussels, shrimps,crab all in one!
 Thanks to Khaiman for his amazing service and cinnamon biscuits!
author: Mihir S.

description: Fresh-tasting seafood, great service, and a wonderful (and rather romantic) view of the pier at sunset =) In particular, the clam chowder was amazing, along with the crab louie and seared ahi tuna dish. The baked crab spinach was pretty good too, though not as good as the other dishes we had. I will definitely be back here in the near future!
author: Jean B.

description: Out of all the restaurants on the pier this one might be the best. Great location overlooking the San Francisco harbor, and the menu makes you hungry after going over each item. The service was good, our waiter suggested a few places to see as well as other restaurants to try while staying in the city. Cioppino was excellent, hearty, rich broth and plenty of seafood to satisfy any appetite. Can't go wrong with this house.
author: Kyle S.

description:
Not kind staffs
Long waiting time for food
Not delicious food (fried calamari was not hot) 

Not satisfied with most things they provided.
author: Yoonmo K.

description:
Ok so my first trip to San Fransisco and I can say out of all the landmarks and places you can visit the Fog House Harbor Fish house is a must on any to-do-list super romantic with great views of alcatraz and the bay and the golden gate bridge.
It was my Gf bday and after spending the day at union square shopping around and taking in the city we stopped by this place for a quick drink and ended up spending like the whole afternoon there ... lol We were greeted by Shana and Mike at the bar and if u get a chance to eat anywhere ... I recommend you sit at the bar .. they were so cordial and down to earth, so "san fransisco" and so very helpful with drink selections... their seasonal drinks were recommended by Shanna and let me tell u she was spot on ! The ________ mule is my fav drink its served in a gold cup super good i ordered one and after my 4th one i lost track lol and my gf ordered the pumpkin pie martini she loved it and couldnt resist havinga few aswell#pumpkinmartini=food/drinkpornmeetsfoodieorgasam #andyesitsthatdamngood! .... So we ordered a few menu items all very good and of course we had five star service from the minute we walked in but the clam chowder was the best clam chowder not only for me n my gf who are foodies ,but when u walk in this place you'll see the awards they have on the walls for best clam chowder on fishermans wharf... personally I tried others on the wharf even boudins and the freshest (as in daily hand selected ocean fresh clams n garden selected veggies) tastiest heartiest clam chowder belongs to fog harbor fish house.... this place  is a SanFransisco ICON and Shanna made our trip memorable

To recap the clam chowder is the best ever...we got 1 togo and we'll definetly be back .. also ask for Shanna and Mike at the bar they are the best bartenders ever #seriously.. and the reason why me and my family will be customers for years to come 

Ps....@shanna....  lakers beat the Warriors :p
author: Eliseo B.

description: I love this place! We were seated right away even though it was a busy Friday evening........we had a great view of the harbor and Alcatraz. The bread is to die for as is the clam chowder,crab cakes and the fresh fish! The service was good and I can't wait to go back! Hmmm maybe tomorrow for lunch?
author: Lisa C.

description: The food was good but it is a little expensive, which is okay since we were splurging anyway. However, the waiter ruined the night for me and everyone who was with me. Not only he was rude, he was giving us attitude AND came to us while we were getting ready to leave and said we didn't tip him. That was the only time he was trying to be nice to us. We actually left a $50 tip but he TOOK OUT all of our receipts and ADDED it in front of our faces and said we didn't tip him! That is rude and I've never had a waiter do that to me. We didn't want any trouble so we tipped another $50 because he was basically crying about it. I still can't believe he did that. I was dumbfounded. I wish the people I went with wasn't that nice because he deserved no tip  for being so damn f**king rude.
author: Tru T.

description: Celebrated my 50th last Saturday night with 11 family members and the dinners were fabulous, the desserts were incredible and the service was wonderful!  They even sang to me and it was priceless!  I think we will have to celebrate here every year.
author: Mary D.

description:
If you want to eat seafood on the wharf, this is a good choice. Very very good service and the food is pretty darn good!

Don't go to Swiss Louis down the pier. Fog Harbor may cost more, but it's worth it.
author: Shannon M.

description: Amazing food, service and view! I would come back in a second. Very impressed
author: Kevin F.

description:
This place was the ONLY good thing about Pier 39 on our visit recently. I have lived in the Bay Area for 30+ years...... and I don't usually got to Pier 39. But a friend wanted to go, and I agreed. This place was a saving grace of our day trip. 
The food was excellent, and our waiter, Derik was super. The sour dough bread was the best, and it's baked every 15 min!  I had the crab cakes, and they were Yummmmy.
 Everything was fresh, and served hot. We did not feel pushed to finish our meal, so they could seat someone else.  GREAT PLACE.   If I go back, I will NOT use the parking garage (big rip -off) and will go straight to FOG HARBOR.
author: A N.

description:
BEST CLAM CHOWDER EVER! Dead serious too. It's creamy, thick and  delicious. They've got kickass mahi mahi as well. Loved their citrus butter with mango salsa that they style the plate with. And their mash potatoes are creamy and delicate. So nom nom nom. Their molten lava chocolate cake is so warm and gooey. One bite and your in chocolate heaven. 

Also, a major plus, my boyfriend and his family went to eat this past week and he ordered his steak medium-rare. His steak came, but it came well done. The manager came to our table because he heard us complaining and pushing my boyfriend to complain. He asked if he could order him another steak, but my boyfriend was hungry and said no no it was ok. The manager then came at towards the end of our meal and informed us that he removed his steak meal from the bill. How awsome of a guy. Anyway, this place rocks.
author: Marita P.

description: Stopped here for a beer and the view.  This was a first day in SFO so we decided to come down to the warf.  I had the clam chowder and it was delicious and the bread was yummy.   Ordered shrimp cocktail and it was okay. My partner ordered the crab meat cocktail which totally rocked!
author: Rob W.

description: Awesome restaurant and a great staff. We came here to hold a surprise party dinner for a friend and the staff was incredibly helpful and accommodating in helping us get set up! Our waiter Khaiman was also great and made sure we had everything we needed. Even with a full house he made sure to make regular stops at our table to make sure we were doing alright. Will definitely be back when I'm on pier 39 again.
author: Erik Z.

description: Nice meal, classy service, great view!  Only negative to entire meal, don't bother with the calamari. Breaded, breaded again, breaded again then fried, not so good!
author: Michelle C.

description: The clam chowder was good. They did not take the time to de-vein the shrimp, yet they cut the backs as if the purpose was just to slice it and not remove the fecal matter. If you are in the area, go somewhere else.
author: Eliseo M.

description: Food was great and service was excellent... Although our waiter seemed a bit quick and didn't hear us a couple times because it got a little hectic, in the end we had a great night and great service.
author: Joi G.

description: Being a lover of seafood this place is a must. Fantastic picturesque location with great service and food. I had clam chowder for the first time ever and it was amazing.  Also had the panko crumbed scallops and was amazed by the serving size and quality.  Had the mixed grill for mains and again, it was flawless.  Wish seafood was this price in Australia!
author: Steve M.

description: The Clam chowder was delicious! My entree, crabsalad roll, left a lot to be desired. The portion size was good and the location is great. Next visit to the Pier, I'll try elsewhere.
author: R B.

description: We came here from the reviews and feedback. Great atmosphere, great service. Our waitress was very helpful regarding the menu. Manager stopped by to see how dinner was and chatted. Don't see that very often! Will come again! The food was delish!
author: Jeanne K.

description: Hostess was very unfriendly. She had orange hair wearing a brown leather jacket. Wish she could be a bit more inviting to an establishment such as this.
author: Mohamed O.

description:
Well this was a pleasant surprise. After pounding the pavement all day as a tourist we just wanted a decent meal before heading home. I figured any restaurant on Pier 39 would be, more or less, a tourist trap and didn't expect much from Fog Harbor Fish House.

We had no reservation so they quoted a 45 minute wait. It was actually really nice lounging by their awesome outdoor fireplace and sipping drinks from the bar. But after an hour, we still weren't seated and I got cranky. When we finally got seated they plunked us down at what is clearly the worst table in the place: poor view, low to the ground, and uncomfortable seating. When the waitress asked how we were doing, I couldn't help venting a little bit, and she handled it politely and professionally.

Now's where the good stuff starts. A few minutes later a guy comes to our table and says "please follow me". Apparently the waitress told the manager of our displeasure and he took matters into his own hands by moving us to a totally rad table with a killer view. We shot the shit with guy for a while since he once lived in Santa Cruz and suddenly we were in a much better mood!

The food was all fantastic. I think they make their own sourdough here as it was hot and fresh. I ordered the garlic roasted dungeoness crab which was huge and delicious. I think the kitchen will clean it for you for an extra charge, but I donned the bib and did all the work myself which was actually an entertainment of its own.
