For my 7 year old daughter, they were happy to do a simple mahi over rice instead of fish and chips which was just perfect.

In retrospect, walking into a nice restaurant on a warm Saturday night in SF without a reservation was a dumb move on my part. They should probably be trying to overestimate the seating times rather than underestimate them, but people make mistakes.

The main takeaway for me is that 1) the staff here clearly gives a shit about their patrons 2) they communicate well enough to do something about it when someone's not happy and 3) the seafood here is awesome.
author: John S.

description:
We had a table by the window which really didn't matter bc there are so many windows that any table could have a good view of the bay.  I met some friends from outta town there and they seemed to like the place.  Which was a plus for me.  I have no complaints about their food.  I ordered crab cakes for an appetizer and they were what I expected...nothing fantastic, just good.  I had the trout which was actually good...considering I don't eat fish much.  One of my friends ordered lobster and lost her appetite bc I think she said there was lobster poop.  Lol.  I'm not a regular lobster eater so I wasn't sure if that was really what it was.  Waiter was nice except I could tell he wasn't too thrilled to see that the  lobster wasn't eaten, which shouldn't matter since we paid for the meal.  
Anyway, nice atmosphere.  Got a nice view of the Bay.  Food was satisfying.
author: Johnny M.

description: This place has great ambience, but the service is lacking. We had to constantly  get our servers attention along with other wait staff. I got the seafood penne which was good,  though I think the food isn't worth the $19,granted its fresh seafood. We probably won't rush back here. The crab cakes were okay and the popcorn shrimp were good.
author: Suny O.

description: Clam chowder is awesome. Cocktail shrimp is so-so. Whole dungeness crab is ruined by cooking in that way.
author: Patrick J.

description: Came here for a Mai Thai while waiting for the Alcatraz Cruise, we had been once before and remembeedr how good they were and how friendly the bartenders are. We hadn't planned on trying the food, but upon sitting at the bar we looked over the specials menu and saw Poke that sounded so good it was irresistible. It didn't disappoint, we had a nice chat with the bartender, had a nice snack and cocktail, and wasn't too pricey.
author: Roxanne R.

description: Our family was in town for 24 hours so trying to narrow down were to eat a GREAT seafood dinner in San Fran was hard. We totally picked the RIGHT PLACE! We ordered the garlic crab, fish in chips, crab roll, calamari (OUTSTANDING), and clam chowder. We absolutely LOVED everything!!!!!
author: Lori D.

description: We randomly found this restaurant and it looked amazing so we walked in. The place is beautiful and it has a great view. I was able to see Alcatraz for our entire lunch it was pretty cool. Our waiter was really nice and we were starving so he offered the best appetizer they have which was the blue cheese garlic bread and it was one of the best if not the best garlic bread I have ever had, but also the most expensive. We both ordered the crab cake burger and at first it tasted really good and then I felt like it was missing something and I just couldn't even finish it all. I did not think their food was a good as I expected considering the prices but the view and the garlic bread made me feel better...
author: Cindy M.

description: We have come here the last two years for my mother-in-law's birthday.  We take the ferry boat in, and always manage to avoid the lunch time rush.  We always get a table right next to the window with a beautiful view.  The service is really good and the servers are very attentive.  For such a fancy looking place, they are extremely family friendly, and I am comfortable bring my 4 and 2 year old there for lunch.  We will be there same time next year!
author: Jenny C.

description: Can't visit SF without eating some seafood.  Yelped this place for dinner and decided to give it a try. The food was pretty amazing especially the fresh oysters. They serve sourdough bread that is extremely fluffy but be careful it can fill you up. We tried the crab roll, clam linguine, sample platter and the clam chowder. All of it was delicious. Our server, Bong, was great. Actually he was excellent! And the reason I prob would've given this place 5 stars instead of 4 but the kitchen was slow and it took almost 45 mins to get our food. Other than that I'd recommend giving this place a try.
author: Elizabeth L.

description:
If you're visiting pier 39 this is definitely the place to go. I've read all the positive reviews on yelp before deciding to go and was definitely not disappointed. 

We've ordered seafood cioppino and it was a home run.  Fresh tomato sauce based broth, mussels, shrimp, scallops,and crab legs perfectly blended together. The dish was large enough for 2 people to start with but added pasta to our order and it was a perfect compliment to the seafood. Order a bottle of wine to go along with the food and you have a complete meal. 

There is a little bit of a wait line when you get to restaurant. Make sure you tell the hostess that you want a table with a view on the bay. There is a different waiting time on these tables but the view makes up for it.
author: Vlad P.

description: We ordered the shellfish platter and wild salmon, tasted great! The service was amazing and the waiter was very nice to my kid. The dessert was delicious. Prices are a bit high but still affordable.
author: Diana R.

description: Was concerned about low ratings and tourist location, but gave it a go on a friend's recommendation.  Very glad I did.  Party of 6, weekday late lunch.  Got a beautiful view of the harbor and beyond.  Appetizers were bleu cheese garlic bread, fried calamari and mussels with fries.  All were excellent, especially the calamari and mussels (had to get every bit of the mussels' sauce with the warm french bread -- heavenly!!).  All the entrees were prepared perfectly, from steak, to cioppino, crab roll, fresh halibut, chowder (outstanding, better than anything I had in Boston), seafood linguine..  I could rhapsodize more, but just trust me -- the food was outstanding.  Truly outstanding service by Khaiman -- he made our lunch so enjoyable.  Highly recommend eating here.
author: Mimi F.

description:
We came here for a late dinner after a SF bay cruise and were able to be seated earlier than our reservation. It was super easy to find and the atmosphere was great. Their outside waiting area is really nice with a fireplace and couches and the ambiance inside is great, including the view of the bay and lighthouse.
We didn't order appetizers, but I had the ahi, which was AMAZING, and my date had the crab cake dinner which he liked as well. I would definitely order the ahi if you go. Over all, I would definitely go back because the restaurant was nice, wait staff was friendly, and food was delicious! :)
author: Kristina R.

description:
The most remarkable thing about this place was the cohesive team attending to their guests. We sat near a high traffic employee intersection and I was blown away by observing the level of efficiency, professionalism and camaraderie demonstrated by these hard working folks. It was like watching a finely tuned symphony. As for the manager on duty, if he was in charge of the Gulf oil spill debacle, I suspect he would of had the leak plugged in half the time it took BP to do the job. He was spot on keeping the symphony on track during busy season on a Saturday night.

Now for the food. The blue cheese garlic bread is a must. The popcorn shrimp was excellent as was the fillet Mignon and crab cakes. The prices were right on target for being in a high traffic tourist area. There were many high and low priced items to find a comfort level with.

Being on the second floor made for a beautiful view and even though the place was humming, there was a little less traffic than below.

Of the dozens of restaurants to choose from in the Fisherman's Wharf area, we were fortunate to find Fog Harbor.
author: Joel G.

description:
One of my favorite places by far!!!

My 5 favorites on the menu:

1. Crab Cakes: crunchy on the outside, so soft and moist on the inside. Its good for the appetizer and for the regular meal as well.

2. Ahi Tuna: a BIG chunk of tuna (Seasoned on the outside of course). It was laying on a bed of wild rice and sauteed vegetables with this light soysauce/teriyaki flavor that just added soo much flavor to the tuna. if you are a tuna fan, you will LOVE IT!!! 

3. Fog harbor burger: My first "sweet" burger ever. This burger is so juicy and tender (i usually get it medium rare). the caramelized onions add such a bursting flavor into my mouth... and the saltiness of the bacon balances the taste.

4. Prawn ravioli: i usually get this w/CIOPPINO (type of tomato sauce) sauce on top. I've noticed that the raviolis change in size once in a while from small to big-- but no matter what the size is... this dish will forever be my favorite pasta dish at Fog Harbor.

5. Seafood Cioppino: This dish is VERY flavorful. I see alot of tourists trying out this dish but for me personally, i wish i could've just had all the seafoods out of its shell. I didnt even bother eating the crab legs because i didnt have tools to crack them with.. but everything else was easy to eat :) 

The service is fantastic and the hosts are super friendly! :) :) 

Oh and before i forget--- 
Dessert recommendations: Lava cake and tiramisu!!!! I love the creme bruele.. but the caramelized topping can be often too chewy for me.

ENJOY! hope this helped!
author: Hanna K.

description: Very tasty food and great service.  Madison, our waitress, was personable and informative.  View is outstanding.
author: Wendy H.

description: Had the best food, experience and personalized service from Madison! Thank you for your sincerity, attentiveness and kindness. Your service is bar none! Hope you and your soon to be husband enjoy a world of love, happiness and success.
author: Nathan S.

description: Awesome food.   Clam chowder in a bowl and a salad was a perfect lunch.   Awesome service.  Madison was awesome. She is fast, friendly and funny.  We will decently return to the fog harbour.
author: Craig M.

description: Over rates, food is ok.. Just alright! Good view but services isn't great! The waiter which doesn't speak prefect English and don't understand, make the wrong order. Then try to be nice by making change for us, yet "with condition" like kinda "blackmail" u and make you order more. So just wan more money. Isn't a pleasant experience for a traveller who came all the way from Australia and first time to San Fran! Mos of all disappointed my mum who wanted so much to eat the cold crab but didn't get to! No apologies but only deny.
author: Canmy A.

description: Good service from Michael and free blue cheese bread from Yelp a good offer too. Wine list and menu all good with large portions, food fairly pricey but ok as you're in a tourist area. Recommend getting on early. We are before 5pm.
author: Llew J.

description: Me and a friend were visiting for the weekend and were very pleased with our service at fog Harbor from our hostess finding a nice table with a view and sitting seating us early to our bartender who lent my friend a phone charger to our wonderful waitress Meron who was so charming fun and very attentive the service was top notch. And as an added plus the food was amazing as well. Definitely will make a reservation again next time we're in town
author: Katie T.

description:
Great place, right in the heart of tourist country! Great views, nice bar, great food!
Had the snapper special, very good and light. House salad was good. Co worker got chowder and fish n chips. He said chowder was ok, good, but not the best. Fish n chips is HUGE! Come hungry for those!
Waitress was very nice and helpful. Kept the waters full at all times.
author: Scott B.

description: Good service, award winning clam soup was ok ok... As it wasn't that  hot enough. Loved the crab roll with sweet potato fries.
author: Prasanna M.

description: We had a fantastic meal here tonight! We got in towards the end of the night, but the staff and food was fantastic! Khaiman made great recommendations for the meals. The Dungeoness (garlic roasted) was incredible. Catherine helped with cocktail and wine suggestions and the entire experience was spectacular. Totally unlike what you'd expect in such a tourist destination. Highly recommended to anyone in the area!
author: Brennon H.

description: Food is amazing. We tried the swordfish that was cooked perfectly, sour dough clam chowder that is so creamy and delicious, oysters was fresh, lobster and calamari were great too.
author: L C.

description: I recently took a group of 17 for appetizers and cocktails during a team building day in the city.  We ordered crab cakes, crab dip, stuffed artichokes and calamari.  The food and service were good and from what I heard the drinks were good as well.  The atmosphere was a little lively for a Wednesday afternoon but we were on Pier 39 so expect crowds.  What I really liked was that they cold accommodate us without reservations and the food did come out promptly.  It's a little pricey and the food is not what I would call healthy but it was fun to stop and have a little treat right there on the pier.
author: Kristina T.

description: The food was good but the service was BAD. The waiter didn't refill our drinks,  food took awhile to come out, and got one of our order wrong. When we asked for our ticket that even took some time. The people next to us said the same thing.  Only thing was the food.
author: Moon M.

description: We were looking for a place to have a special dinner (Easter); this place was perfect! The restaurant itself is very appealing with the views and decor...of course the food and service is the most important. The service was great! Thank you Mila! We had drinks and appetizers as soon as we ordered them! There were 7 of us and between us all we ordered raw oysters, calamari, lobster tails, ahi tuna, crab cakes, and the cioppino (and of course dessert...the chocolate soufflé is delicious). Everyone loved everything!
author: C D.

description: Nice place, not too fabulous, friendly stuff. There is almost no complaints about the food! Swordfish was delicious, but scallops as appetizer was nothing special and a lil overcooked. Same goes for desserts.
author: Masha M.

description: My hubby and I went out to dinner on a date night to this place! I loved the crab it was so good! we ordered the cajun style. over all we had a great experience.
author: Claudia H.

description: The food and service was outstanding!! It is on the higher scale as far as price.
author: Debra S.

description:
Great location and view. Seated promptly, and no problem when I called that we were running late.
Dinner was good, but nothing exceptional.
author: john s.

description: Delicious food, fresh and full of flavor! Our waiter, Oliver, was brilliant and very amiable- he also remembered us from our previous visit which made me and my group feel immediately welcomed. I highly recommend this place for a taste of good seafood and a great seaside view!
author: Chauncy F.

description: tourist trap don't do it! hostess was a B. waitress was awesome. food was mediocre. had the surf and turf. going rate $58. totally not worth it. steak was dry and my 1/2 main lobster was more like a 1/4 with stuffed crab. go somewhere else!
author: Christine D.

description:
MMMmmmm! I loved my dinner. I ordered the mixed grill which consist of Mahi-mahi, salmon, and shrimp. All perfectly cooked! I ate every bit. 

Great view, and good wine. The clam chowder was not good...I got a mouthful of sand. Also, expected to pay more for five people, that was a pleasant surprise!!
author: Kari D.

description:
If you are thinking of any service, do not enter! It was a Saturday night and an engagement dinner for my brother. We were seated within 5 minutes since it was an intimate (my fiance, myself, brother, & his new fiance) small party. The place was not crowded, yet we were seated next to the kitchen in the most remote area possible from anything or anyone. That felt like a middle finger! Why not just put us next to the bathroom? Next, I noticed no place settings. I thought maybe those would be on their way shortly.

After getting our beverages and food, still no silverware. We each had a butterknife! Only butterknives!!! After 10 minutes the waiter finally appears and my fiance asked for a fork. He finds one a few tables away and says "here ya go" and vanished like water on asphalt in 101 degree weather.... We didn't even get a chance to ask for anything else. Maybe we should have left at that point. 

Regardless, we endured the way less than sub-standard service and waited 10 minutes for the check. To no avail I should add, we had to find the check. I left exact change for the appalling treatment I never had experienced before. We chose this place because of YELP and only reading the overall star status. We should have read ALL the reviews. I informed the "manager" of what happened just so he would have a knowledge of a horrific experience it was. I thought maybe that could be avoided for other customers.

Boy was I wrong!!!!! Turns out the manager was the assistant and was stand offish. He would just nod his head and smirk like it was funny. Not one bit of sincerity on his face. I would recommend this Fog Harbor Fish House if you WANT to ruin your night. Thank you for ruining ours.
author: M G.

description: This was my second time eating at Fog Harbor. I wanted to return for their amazing fish and chips! The batter is so thin and light and the fish is white, moist, and soft (not mushy) The tartar sauce is soo good! Great food and service. Their view on the water is amazing!
author: Catalina V.

description:
With all the restaurant choices on Pier 39, it's hard to choose which one to go to. I've tried most of them over the years but have only gone to 2 of them more than once. This one and Bubba Gumps. Completely different experiences but both have really good food.

When I'm looking for a quieter, more intimate meal, I'll definitely choose Fog Harbor over the other cloth-napkin restaurants on the pier.
author: Madeline R.

description:
We got a window table which had a very nice view.  Our server was very nice and offered good recommendations.

We started with the half garlic-roasted dungeness crab and clam chowder.  The crab was delicious.  The chowder was a little on the thick side, but it was still very tasty with lots of clams and minimal potatoes.

For the main course, we got the seafood penne pasta and the cioppini with pasta.  Both were very very delicious.  This was actually a lot of food, and we couldn't finish it all.

If you save your ticket stub from the nearby Aquarium, you get 15% off.
author: Claire J.

description: Everything was excellent. Great waitress. Manager checked to see if all was good. Food was amazing - large fresh whole crab. Atmosphere is perfect, overlooking the bay. Highly recommended.
author: Aditi S.

description: I'm an SF resident and try to stay clear of Fisherman's Wharf, but I was taken here on a business lunch. It surprised me because it was so good. I thought it wouldn't be that great since it is such a touristy restaurant. But the food tasted fresh & was delicious.
author: Alpha B.

description: Started with some great crab cakes. The clam chowder is off the hook and khaiman we a great waiter full of information.
author: Van Etten D.

description: We arrived at the restaurant for my birthday.  We had made reservations and we seat promptly. the service was great and the food was wonderful.  I had the grilled seafood platter, salmon, halibut,  and shrimp with garlic mashed potatoes.  wonderful!  We had drinks and all of us were very happy with the food and service.  We would highly recommend.  Great views of the bay.
author: Brenda H.

description: I had the cioppino for the first time and it was tasty and flavorful. The portion is big enough for two or a very hungry person. Great service, very attentive waiters. Reservations are available but we walked in (two of us) with no wait at around 5pm on a Saturday.  Beautiful view of the wharf if you are seated by the window.
author: Lyn T.

description: Clam chowder was something else, the bread was fresh out of the oven and all the rest of the food was exceptional.
author: Nick G.

description: Madison was the best! Food was great!  I had the salmon and it was seasoned well and delicious.
author: Lisa S.

description:
I've walked through Pier 39 countless times but I've never actually gone upstairs to check out the restaurants before this past week.  Fog Harbor is a great little spot with an amazing view of the Bay, the Wharf, and the City.

The food was amazing and the service was excellent.  The manager that night came over to talk to us, his name was Brian.  Our server Pedro kept the food and drinks coming.  I had the Seared Prawns Ravioli and it was excellent!  Not a single person in our party of 6 had a single complaint!  The chocolate banana nut dessert is a great choice!

I will definitely bring my family out to Fog Harbor when they come out for the Holidays this year.
author: Phil S.

description: We went here after going on the Alcatraz Cruise. The service was excellent! Khaiman, our server, provided us with delicious recommendations and some welcomed advise about the surrounding area. We definitely suggest trying the clam chowder. If you've had the clam chowder from Pike Market it is just as good. Great service, great food!!!
author: Allison P.

description: This place is awesome, and the service there was wonderful.  Dalal our server, took care of all of our needs.  Fast and friendly and great food.  Definitely great service and a wonderful experience. I recommend this place to anyone who visits San Francisco.
author: Derek C.

description: The best jumbo shrimp cocktail on the pier! All for under 15. Great service and environment.
author: Stacy A.

description: Wonderful place,nice veiw , amazing food and most of all our servant KHAIMAN such a great person :) was fun being here :) would definitely come again
author: Dina S.

description:
This is my favorite seafood restaurant on Pier 39. It's a little high scale, but very delicious, fresh fish.

I've had the seared ahi tuna, and have been in heaven. The fish is super fresh and the service is great. It does get a bit crowded (due to being located on Pier 39). 

Also, I love the location -- it's high up right above the pier and the view is beautiful, especially at sunset. Great restaurant!
author: Lauren F.

description: Beautiful and delicious. 7:45 PM reservation Thurs night, waited briefly in gorgeous livingroom setting/lobby area.) Had crab cakes entree, substituted salad for french fries, no problem. Gluten-free teen daughter loved shrimp brochettes. Great service (maybe a little too fast?). Even after having eaten the incredibly wonderful, warm sour dough bread, I had to have a few bites of amazing creme brulee. Two hours free validated parking in Pier 39 lot. Kinda perfect.
author: Jory L.

description: Very nice service people. I had to step out to grab my daughter something else to eat. And they brought me an entirely new plate!!  Talk about kind.  :-)
author: Ron P.

description: Place had a great view but very very slow service. It's really expensive too. The food was good but nothing spectacular. I had shrimp salad and clam chowder.
author: gator N.

description:
Fog Harbor

Went here for lunch. Get the clam chowder in the sourdough bread bowl!!! it is delicious enough for a meal by itself! the sourdough is baked fresh and they give you more sourdough bread on the side! their clam chowder is FILLED with clams! yes a rarity since sometimes its just all potatoes and other fillers.

oh and also get the cioppino!!! its work..but it is sooo worth it! they give you the bib and all. the sauce was very tomato-ey...tasted so fresh. It goes great with the sourdough bread to scrape off the bottom of the bowl! they've got a great combination of crab, mussels, clams, and assorted fish in there! this is a must try!
author: Michelle V.

description: Both the service and the food was fantastic. I started off with their clam chowder, which they rightfully called award-winning. I have to also complement their sourdough bread, which was also delicious. I ordered their swordfish -- I don't usually get seafood but this made me see why some of my friends really like it. Overall: great experience. Our server Khaiman really treated us well. Though my friends don't like going to touristy areas, I'll be recommending this place to them.
author: Richard Y.

description:
Had dinner here on a Saturday night.  Used Open Table via Yelp to make reservations, which I highly recommend because it was pretty busy. Normally my husband and I wouldn't head over to Pier 39 for dinner because it's so touristy, but we had a friend in town and she wanted seafood.  Thanks to Yelp, I'm very glad we ended up here.

The view was outstanding. We got a nice table by the window looking out at the water. The menu had such a large variety of items to choose from. We had crab cakes and clam chowder as an appetizer. The crab cakes were full of crab meat and not to much filler and the clam chowder was nice and thick, but not to thick.  I had the shellfish platter, my friend had the scallops, and my husband got the pacific sole. The food was all outstanding.  I was definitely having a hard time finishing my meal. 

The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars was for the service.  It was pretty good for the most part, but after our food was brought out there wasn't much following up.  My husband wanted a second beer and my girlfriend wanted some more wine which took some time to get.  Again it was really busy, so we were patient.  We'd definitely go back again.
author: Lisa C.

description: The sourdough bread here is really good you could fill up just on the bread!  I ordered the Salmon BLT which I liked, but the bread could have been toasted a bit more.  My family really enjoyed the steak and the seafood pasta as well as the clam chowder.  The clam chowder had large chunks of clams in it.  I would recommend this place if you're looking for a place to eat on the wharf.
author: L C.

description: Food was good. Oysters were amazing but calamari didn't taste fresh. Service was subpar at best. Great view.
author: Jay O.

description: My husband and I were looking to eat at a waterfront restaurant. We choose Fog Harbor since the reviews were not bad. The food was ok,  begin that it was on the pier I was expecting more.
author: Celi R.

description: Yummy seafood! We were looking for some of that famous San Fran seafood and we def found it here! You won't be disappointed! Just dont forget to make a reservation...it was packed!
author: Alisha P.

description: No need for a reservation on Sun afternoon. View is spectacular and so is the ambiance. Initially got a diluted Lombard cocktail and our waiter performed excellent customer serv and got me a Lipstick Lemondrop (yum!!) to replace. Ordered the calamari ... it was a meal in itself. Perfectly breaded and the slices were a good sizeThe clam chowder was so scrumptious ... not too watery and not too thick.
author: Laura G.

description: Great location. Seafood was fresh. Amazing service with a phenomenal view!
author: Taylor B.

description:
Food was good, not great, not bad. Came for the dungeoness crab during their high season and wasn't disappointed, but also not overwhelmed.

Decor is upscale and service is attentive. The view of the ocean is a perk, but may not be as visible depending on your seat.
author: Jessica N.

description:
I usually only read review on yelp, this is my first review since I am so disappointed at such a highly rated restaurant.

It's our wedding anniversary last night and my husband want a special dinner for me. After reading so many positive yelp reviews, we decided to give it a try.

Food - we ordered seafood cioppino, fish n chips and Garlic roasted whole crab. 2 out of 3 are disappointing. The only dish which is really GREAT is seafood ciopino. The shrimps, scallops are very fresh. You can feel its original freshness even with the strong flavor soup. Highly recommended.
For Fish n chips, the chips are ok but the fish is obviously overcooked and very very oily. The MOST DISAPPOINTING dish is our MOST PRICEY dish- garlic roasted crab. Once I cracked the shell and trying to take out the meat, from the meat texture, I could tell it's NOT FRESH. My husband verified that since he only tasted the garlic and butter from the crab NOTHING MORE! For me, it's even worse, it's completely tasteless, maybe with a little bit of garlic flavor. But we shouldn't pay $37 for garlic and butter!! We had crab several times before from Nick's Lighthouse food stand. We can tell the difference. Nick's crabs are so fresh and with minimal processing, no garlic no butter, the meat alone is already so tasty. Our conclusion is NEVER get CRAB at FISH House. Even the crab in the seafood cioppino is tasteless. From meat texture to taste, you can definitely tell the crabs are NOT FRESH!

Service- we are surprised to have ALL our dishes coming out AT ONCE. I don't know if that's standard practice for seafood restaurant or not. But to us, this is SO WRONG. After we finish fish n chips(the most time sensitive dish), the rest were already cold as ice. Besides that, the service is ok, not very attentive but will do when you ask. 

Ambiance- the view is unbeatable, 5 stars.

Other- this's the first time I saw "SF Emp Ord 4%" from my bill.we paid anyway. I have no clue what the heck is that. After I google it, I felt like being scammed. Why should I pay for the restaurant employee's health insurance?!That should be the restaurant's responsibility! Does that mean they treat their employees like dirt so customers have to do what they don't to keep their employees live a normal life? They don't pay insurance, customers are obligated to pay for them. They pay waiters poor salary, customers have to pay a large sum to cover it(I DO think tips are necessary for rewarding good service, just don't like it when it become obligation even for poor service) And if that really helps the employees get better health insurance, I feel better with that. But according to Wall Street Journal, mostly are just scammer and go to restaurant. I don't know about this restaurant.

Conclusion-It's very unlikely we will return. If we do, we will NEVER order any crab again
author: Kolen C.

description: Great view, friendly service, and delicious food.  The Fog Harbor Fish House is the best choice for crab and oysters on Pier 39 in terms of quality and price.  All the seafood we ate was very fresh and well-prepared - from raw ahi tuna and oysters to salmon and whole crab.  Our drinks were strong and tasty and the creme brule was perfect.  While pricy, we had a great time and were full for the rest of the day.
author: Marianna K.

description: Fog Harbour has the best service, food and atmosphere on the Wharf.  I highly recommend that you give it a whirl when entertaining your family, friends and loved ones. Superb clam chowder and cucumber basil martini.
author: Bud F.

description:
Seared Ahi Tuna. It was the first time I ever had it and I have fallen in love. It was just so tasty. Encrusted with sesame seeds, it was just good. I can't even describe it. What is the texture suppose to be? It's just good!!!

Mint Mojitos. SO much mint, therefore I like. covered up the taste of the alcohol more.

Service was great! Warm bread as well.

Chocolate Bread Pudding was a little too dense/hard for my liking. I like my bread pudding on the softer side. 

Tiramisu was actually really good. I thought it was very coffee-ey which is good cause I usually complain about it being too light, but this was on the stronger side so I really enjoyed it. 

All the desserts were $7 so they weren't too bad for a nice restaurant. The portions were HUGE too.
author: Nancy L.

description: Great clam chowder and yummy crab. Good attentive service
author: Annie Y.

description:
An absolute trio of perfection. Stunning water views, stellar food plus all-star service. Snugly tucked into Pier 39, walking through these doors firmly transports you away from the tourist set on the outside.

It's the crown jewel which outshines them all.

Fish = fabulous. View = staggering. Service = extraordinary. 

It's all key to a fantastic dining experience. If you find yourself in San Francisco, lose your self in this wonderful restaurant. I did and absolutely loved it.
author: Julie W.

description:
The wife and I went to see the America's Cup and, while the decor, the service and view were sensational, the food was mediocre at best. I had the calamrai and while the amount was huge, it was warm at best and heavily breaded and not having much taste. My wife had the sole which was also lacking in taste..

Not sure we will be back
author: Ron B.

description: Madison gives awesome service. She met our every need and is very friendly. Great location and will definitely be back here.
author: Ryan R.

description: Really good fish and chips, great atmosphere, but I was most impressed with this Manhattan. Expertly poured, incredible bourbon.
author: Chad M.

description: I had my family visiting from Michigan, and what better place to take them then fishermans wharf for sightseeing and lunch? Well, we stumbled across fog harbor and when I told the hostess, Denise, how many people were in our party (4) she said the wait was 10 minutes. Then I said "oh! We also have a baby but she doesn't need a highchair (baby's 6 months and was in her stroller). Denise then proceeds to tell me "oh, well it's a longer wait then...it's kind of an inconvenience to be honest for us to have highchairs and strollers in here." At that point, my father heard Denise, and said "umm..okay, we won't eat here then." Without apologizing or ANYTHING, she just didn't say anything and started talking to her coworker next to her. She was so rude and disrespectful I couldn't believe. I then asked to speak with a manager who didn't know her left from right. We ended up leaving and going to crab house on the wharf where all staff were sooooo nice and friendly and were sweet to my niece. Word of caution...don't eat here, check out crab house right next store for sure!
author: Karley A.

description: Amazing food and drinks! amazing staff & service!  I will def go back!  Clam chowder and crab cakes were amazing!
author: Ilke V.

description: Fog Harbor Fish House was great! It had great views, great service, and great food. We started with the ahi appetizer. I wasn't a big fan but my husband loved it. He cleaned the plate. I had the trout with garlic mashed potatoes. The trout was awesome! My husband had the fish platter. He loved it all! I would go back!
author: Stephanie S.

description: This was my first time in SF and I wanted to have one dinner by the water and really go for it with the seafood.  This place did not disappoint!  The service was fantastic, and we were seated right by the water.  I was able to look at the seals and get a great view of Alcatraz.  The food was wonderful, and drinks were affordable.  My boyfriend got the mixed grill, which was incredible, and I got the garlic crab.  Overall, I had a great experience!
author: Morgan D.

description: Excellent service! Food was great and very fresh! We ordered garlic butter crab, fresh oysters, clam chowder in bread bowl and fried combo! It was plenty for two people, but we manage to finish most of it! Would definitely go back!
author: Laura C.

description: Food is good for the amount you pay, but not necessary value and beyond expectation.
author: Stephen O.

description: I went here for my birthday dinner and the service and food were great!  My friend and I had the Cioppino and it was pretty awesome.  I would definitely come here again!
author: Janessa F.

description: Waiter was friendly and very responsive.  I had the their award winning clam chowder to start and it was excellent.  For my entree, I had the Ahi Tuna which said it was served rare as I like it.  When it came out it was more like medium.  The flavor was great but it could have been cooked better.  The restaurant has a great view of Alcatraz and the Golden Gate bridge also which is nice to enjoy.
author: Dennis B.

description: We ate here our first night in San Francisco and due to the touristy location we did not expect much from the food.  The ambiance and bar are great.  We truly enjoyed our appetizers and meals.  It is definitely not a tourist trap but some very good and fresh seafood.
author: Carlos G.

description: The service, at Fog Harbor, was absolutely horrific.  However, I've never experienced such amazing damage control.  A resident of North Beach, I would never recommend one to eat near or around Fisherman's Wharf, the biggest tourist trap in the world.  However, this experience proved that there is simply an exception to every rule, as my friends and I truly enjoyed our dinner.  The sourdough bread loaf was absolutely amazing, and complimented the broth of our dinners.  The dungeness crab was to die for, and I will forever be a fan!  While I once lived in Santa Barbara, we made sure to purchase many rock crab during the season, which we all felt could not be matched.  Fog Harbor proved me wrong, and I would be happy to bring future guests and friends to this venue.
author: Daniel G.

description: We visited this place a few weeks ago for dinner and had a large party so we had to wait around 45 minutes to be seated. The food was fabulous and so you might ask why the low rating, well the service was absolutely terrible! Our waiter was abrupt, curt, and made us feel as if he simply did not have time to wait on us. He was attentive to every other table in his station except ours, and we had to resort to stopping another waiter to ask him to take over our table which he gladly did. To their credit the manager did come over to apologize and we were treated to complimentary desert so it wasn't a total loss and the food was great. I had the steak and lobster and it was cooked exactly as I requested. the second waiter we had did save the day and was very helpful and apologetic, and based upon his service we will definitely return.
author: Jeremy R.

description: The food was awesome! Word's are not enough to say how good it was. An the service was everything I can say, our servicer " Madison" she was we everything an more. My cup was not dry at all lol... I'll have to come back again.
author: Lawrence N.

description: Stopped here along my walk on the Embarcadero. The bread is great, seafood is fresh, and the vegetables are prepared perfectly! Overall it was a very satisfying experience.
author: Ashley E.

description: This is the first restaurant we tried at Pier 39 and this probably came in at #3 of the 5 restaurants we tried in a 200 meter diameter. We sat at the bar since I didn't want to wait 45 minutes for a party of 2 to be seated. The bartender/waiter was steady but not busy busy. He seemed rather distracted/tired during 7pm service on a weekday. It's like when you know a child needs a nap. You had to shout out to him and make a hand gesture to get him out of it and back to reality. He also broke a wine glass behind the bar,  doing god knows what. I prevailed every time (4-5x). This included: Me ordering our first drink, he brought us waters and forgot about us. Gaining his attention to let us order an appetizer. Letting him know we're ready for our 2nd drink and have decided on dinner. Lastly, when I had to flag him down for the bill... I looked over at this woman who had also dined at the bar and she had a bread basket. Where's My breadbasket? ? The free shit always tastes the best!
author: Paige G.

description:
My husband and I took some friends from out of town here for dinner because they were in the mood for seafood.  The food was very fairly priced and generally did not disappoint.  We ordered cocktails, clam chowder, crab cakes, lobster fettuccine, Salmon, Tuna, and a steak.  My husband ordered the steak, and requested medium and it came barely pink.  That's generally OK because most places will happily prepare another steak, to your preferred doneness.  This is where things got a little odd.  The waiter happily took back the steak, but another employee came over with a photo of my husbands steak on their cell phone, asking if this is how he wants it done.  The photo made the steak look more red than it did in person (lighting? filters?) and we're like "sure, that looks better."  Then this employee says, "well, that's your steak, and that's how we prepare medium."  That was such a ridiculous and bizarrely unprofessional way of telling the customer that they are wrong.  Just make the steak, ok?  

Overall, the service was friendly and fun.  However, another strange moment was when our server brought us our check.  He placed the check on the table, and made sure to point to the bottom where it states gratuity percentages.  Reading out, I kid you not, each percentage, each amount of money, along with a note as to how he might have earned each percentage.  Like, "15% if I..., 18% if I..."  I was almost embarrassed for the waiter who thought that this was a proper thing to say to guests.  The food was enjoyable, but perhaps not enough to experience their gauche missteps again.
author: Tara B.

description: We didn't have a reservation but were told they take walk-ins so we called as we got close to the restaurant and they said there was no wait time but once we parked and walked to the restaurant they had filled up in a matter of 10 min max and told us the wait would be 45 min- 1 hr long so we waited. An hour and a half later we were still waiting. Someone in our party finally complained and we were seated. By that time 2 hours had passed and mind you we had kids in our party. They comped a few drinks but we ended up getting ripped off when we had to pay $24 for parking because only 2 hours were free with validation and that was the time we were waiting for our table. Food was ok but we shouldn't have had to wait 2 hours when they said 45-1hr. We could've gone somewhere else but we had already waited for so long! They should've comped us more for having to wait as long as we did and not tell us there's no wait without considering parking time and walking to the restaurant.
author: Shivs B.

description: I had an outstanding experience at this restaurant. Weekday lunch time, not so many people, wonderful water view, boats.. Pretty good chowder and OUTstanding service by Brandon! He definitely added extra star to this review.
author: Lesia L.

description: The fish and vegetables are cooked perfectly!  I had the mixed grill & I recommend that if you can't make up your mind what kind of fish to have.  Very friendly & professional staff.  The sourdough bread is fresh and warm.
author: Linda H.

description:
I give 5 stars alone for being Seafood Watch friendly however the experience was not great. I went with four guests on a Sunday night. We were seated in about 40 minutes when we were told 20 minutes and after we ordered it was over an hour before our dinner arrived. The waiter and the manager came over to our table several times and apologized. We were starving and were not offered bread and my drink from the bar was never refilled. When our food finally did arrive my table mates ate very quickly and were done before I really even started on my pasta which turned out to be cold and flavorless. The 1/2 crab on top was divine, however. The three other plates were cleared before I even touched my food as I was waiting for our waiter or manager to come so that I could tell him. The manager apologized and brought me a chicken ceasar salad as I requested because I didn't want to have my table mates sitting watching me eat which would have made me feel very awkward. The manager ended up taking my meal off and giving us a discount because it took so long. My dinner the next day was great because I had the crab that I would have had with the pasta the night before. Everone else said that the food was good but they couldn't really tell because they were so hungry! The entire experience took about 2.5 hours with probably 5 minutes or less being taken to actually eat. 
I will be back to try Fog Harbor again and I hope that I won't be going on a busy night.
author: Janelle R.

description: For Pier 39, this is about as good as it gets. Most of the food at Pier 39 is greasy tourist crap, but this place is actually pretty good. Overall the seafood is fresh and tasty. I wouldn't go so far to say that this is the best seafood I've ever had but it's been my go to place for seafood in SF. You want to make sure to book a reservation a day or two in advance unless you're ok with having dinner at 4:00. The reason I took off a star is that although the staff is friendly they're pretty inexperienced. They're going to forget to bring you water. And bread. And that extra lemon you asked for 15 minutes ago. It's a fact. No matter which server you get. But if you're patient and persistent enough you will eventually get those things and your order. Last time we were there I told them on the reservation that it was our anniversary so they decorated the table with flowers, a candle, and they wrote happy anniversary on the paper table cloth. It was really sweet and I enjoyed that extra care.
author: Elizabeth R.

description: Nice atmosphere and pleasant staff. The mixed seafood grill was great, but the ahi tuna was a real disappointment!  The texture was very soft and the flavor was very bland...I think that it was the worst ahi I have ever had.
author: William H.

description: the selfish tower is really awesome. food is great and super view. definitely a good place with wife or girlfriend.
author: Xu W.

description: Be careful of this restaurant! I told the waitress I just want 2 waters. Then she kept asking sparkling or still water. I said I just want normal water. She finally served a bottle of water and charged me for $7. We never got our bread and butter. The waitress even argued that I should have said "tap water". Who have time for this! What kind of restaurant does that! Just cut the tip half and will never go back again.
author: Jun L.

description: My wife and I enjoyed the food and service! The staff really made our  17 th anniversary very special
author: Hazrat K.

description: Loved the food. The mussels in the tomato coconut sauce are to die for! Also, the crab cakes are delicious - heavy, but very moist and tasty!
author: Sym Z.

description: We were in the San Francisco area and decided to try out the Fog House. We ordered two bowls of clam chowder, the crab cakes, and the poke. We requested that the clam chowder came out first and I tried with all my might to stop eating it to leave room for the other stuff, but it was too yummy. Although it wasn't quite as rich as chowder usually is. The crab cakes were also good. The poke had a unique mango flavor and paired well with the filling chowder. Overall the food was really good. We will definitely be going back if we find ourselves in the area. I would say that the one thing everyone going here has to order is that clam chowder.
author: Megan P.

description:
We were starving and after looking around settled on this place. 
I give this place points for ambience and style. The views are great. The place looks great. Makes you feel nice. 
The food not so good. My opinion of course. I got to sample their clam chowder and i have definitely had better. I also ordered the swordfish which I was satisfied with but not wholly impressed. I think its probably due to my lack of understanding upscale food. I enjoy flavorful dishes and this was not it unfortunately. On the upside it was like steak as far as texture. 
Go here for romance. not so much for flavorful food. That you should go down the street to the street vendors.
author: Zan O.

description: First place I ate at last time I was in San Francisco. Very nice place to have dinner, but I was actually disappointed in the meal. I got a simple Fish and Chips dinner, and while the fish was fresh, the batter and fry job was pretty bad. Very greasy. Couldn't decide on dessert so went with the crème brulee and the tiramisu, both of which I loved, and would go back to Fog Harbor for.
author: Joseph W.

description: We really love this place.  Have had dinner here many times and now lunch.  Excellent value and the food is always good.  Very attentive service and Greg and the staff check with their customers at every meal to ensure that you are happy!  The fish and chips and slaw were great yesterday.
author: George P.

description:
Best views. Sourdough bread was excellent and the clam chowder was awesome. Cole slaw weaker than Amy Winehouse in a methlab. Fish and chips are a 3 out of a 5. The wife had the crab cakes and said it was mostly bread (as a native Virginia, we like predominately crab meat).

The staff is awesome and the service is fast!
author: Marty W.

description: Superb food at a reasonable price.  Go after 6 and you get 2 hrs of free parking at the Pier 39 garage.
author: C J.

description: Great tourist spot for the seafood lover if you're strolling around Pier 39. Delicious Dungeness crab cocktail and Cioppino. We had a lovely view of Alcatraz.
author: Lauren W.

description: All the years we have lived in the Bay Area and have visited Pier 39, we could never find a really good seafood restaurant.  We usually just eat at the crab stands at Fisherman's Wharf.  We move out of state and just happened upon this place on one of our visits because of the free parking validation (lol 2nd time that happened to us).  We were actually looking for the Crab House, but found this place first.  When we got there, it had a cute entrance with a lil fireplace and seating out front.  We were seated right away and got to sit by the window overlooking the sea lions.  Our waitress was very nice and it was a beautiful day in The City so the window was opened and we could feel the nice Bay breeze.  I ordered the lobster tail with fingerling potatoes and broccoli and hubby ordered the crab pot.  We ordered crab cakes for appetizer and they were so huge and so delicious!  Hands down best crab cakes I've ever had.  I was expecting our portions to be small, but my lobster tail was as big as my arm and so tasty.  Hubby devoured his crab, potatoes, and corn and said it was more than enough for his big appetite.  The check was reasonable too, it was a very good dining experience and will definitely return next time we are back in the Bay for my hubby's bday next weekend :)  When we left there was a 15 minute wait because it got so packed, we were lucky we got there when we did.
author: K M.

description: Being in a tourist location I wasn't expecting much. I was surprised at how exceptional the food was. My wife had a crab melt and I the filet. Both were excellent.
author: Chris H.

description: We came here on a Saturday evening around 5pm with little to no wait. It became very busy within an hour, but the service was good and maintained even though the waiter was keeping several tables. The best part was the food- delicious! Plus they purchase local, sustainable seafood right in the SF bay. Very close (5 minutes walking) from Alcatraz cruises so if you are looking for a good place to eat- this one won't disappoint.
author: Heather C.

description: Ratings for this restaurant range all over the place, some 5's all the way down to 1's. Mine is a 4.  I went there with my group of 45 seniors for lunch and that is a tough crowd, believe me.  Despite the size of our group, everyone was served promply with their exact choices, and by an large everyone was most happy with the meal, the ambience, and the service.  I had the shrimp skewers and my wife the salmon, both tasty. Yes, it is a little pricey but this is SF.  You can go cheaper in your own hometown, but just to be in the sunshine on Pier 39 adds to the overall experience.  I would go there again on my own.
author: Marshall W.

description: I was impressed, I had the crab roll it was pretty good i would recommend it. one person in our group had the cioppino and really liked it.
author: Greg V.

description: Delicious and very knowledgable about Celiac Disease (gluten free). Our waitress Meron kindly taught us how to open our first crab and delivered terrific service even during prime time. Portions were extremely generous, albeit of course rich/heavy. Manager came over to ensure care with Celiac order - oysters were delicious as well. Highly recommend, despite the slightly touristy location you wouldn't know you were inside pier 39.
author: E R.

description: Great food and even better view. Really good service too.
author: Wendy E.

description: We were seated promptly expecting to enjoy a excellent lunch amidst the beautiful scenery; however the scenery is the only thing that could be described seeing as how we were never served. We sat for ten minutes without ever being approached or even garnering a glance from the waitstaff. After being ignored for 15 minutes without so much as a glass of water, we left. Making customers feel invisible is unacceptable and we took our business elsewhere.
author: Aj C.

description: Whole Dungeness Crab is either steamed or garlic roasted and served with your choice of wild rice or garlic mashed potatoes and sautéed vegetables. I chose the steamed method with just sautéed vegetables. If you enjoy the inside of the crab, let your waiter know that you would like them to steam it whole and not to break it open and clean it out. The best part of the crab is inside. It reminds me of crab bisque. Grab a spoon and dig in! A tip to the kitchen: if someone orders it like this, serve it with the legs up and do not crack open the body shell so the "soup" doesn't drain out. You can also dip your crab meat into it for a luxurious flavor. The drawn butter is good too just like with snow or king crab legs. The crab was steamed to perfection and the meat is sweet and juicy. Fog Harbor receives crab deliveries every day, freshly caught off the California coast, transported in ocean water filled tanks, held until you order it up. You can't get anything fresher than that! The vegetables were sautéed to perfection -crisp with a wonderful butter flavor. Add a little salt and pepper and you're good to go. Thumbs up, way up!
author: Chelsea M.

description: This place is just okay. We were wondering why this place got such high marks... ah, yes, because it is a tourist trap. We are San Francisco natives and used to very good food. Two stars... calamari not crispy, crab piled on top of iceberg lettuce in a bland crab Louis. Fish and chips were greasy. Beautiful surroundings and decent service, but we won't go back. It is a tourist spot with unreliably high marks.
author: Mollie C.

description: We expected Pier 39 to have high prices and bad food.  We were very pleasantly surprised by Fog Harbor Fish House.  The food, prices, services, views and atmosphere were all excellent.  Don't miss the Blue Cheese Garlic bread.  Their fish is sustainable!  I had the swordfish, it was excellent.
author: Roxanne C.

description: My wife and I dined here on the first evening of her fist visit to San Francisco. I couldn't have made a better choice! The staff was friendly, knowledgeable and ubiquitous without being obtrusive.  For appetizers, I had the Dungeness Crab Cocktail, which was fresh, plentiful and delicious.  My wife had the Baked Oysters which garnered rave reviews.  For my entree, I had the Seafood Cioppino which was rich, spicy and full of delicious seafood. My wife opted for the Seared Jumbo Scallops, which evoked the comment "This is the best meal I've ever had, any where!"  If I return to San Francisco, the Fog Harbor Fish House will be #1 on my list of places to dine!
author: Mark J.

description:
I seriously could have just sat and looked out the window all evening and been happy with just a cocktail or a glass of wine at this place. After a day of sitting on the beach and taking in the last day in San Francisco, we headed here. I made reservations before the trip because this place looked and sounded like a winner. 

We were seated upstairs right next to a huge window that overlooked the harbor and had sweeping views of the Golden Gate Bridge. We left the window slightly cracked so the breeze blew in. We had the sunset and the views and on top of that some amazingly fresh seafood. 

The waitress was even so sweet to give me an extra glass of wine on the house since the wine I first requested had run a bit low and she couldn't get a full glass out of it. Try getting that just anywhere! The meal was wonderful, the view was wonderful and the service was outstanding. 

This was one of those places that living in Texas, I really could appreciate because we don't get those same views. Nice views from certain places, but completely different. I didn't even mind hearing the seals outside. Again, one of those things that you don't get to experience in Texas ;)

Like I said, the ambiance was completely worth the money spent, but add an amazing meal and drinks to it and it's a stellar evening. I believe the bill was close to 100.00, including a starter, two dinners, dessert, coffee and drinks. 

Hope I'll be seeing you again one day Fog Harbor and please....don't change a thing!
author: Danielle P.

description:
When visiting San Francisco not only did my gf and I go here once, but twice! It's not a cheap night out if that's what you're looking for, but considering the quality and service that you get it was more than worth the price. Not only that, but it is comparable to other restaurants in the Fisherman's Wharf area in price.

The food was excellent and considering it's a seafood place, I couldn't get enough of their chicken! The apple crumble dessert was awesome and tasted just like your grandma's. The service was excellent and attentive and they garnered a great tip from me both times.

You won't be disappointed by this place!
author: Chad M.

description: Excellent food, great service, beautiful restaurant. I had the best Seafood Penne pasta with fish, clams and mussels in to die for tomato cream sauce. Definitely will be back.
author: Yelena Z.

description:
I'm a vegetarian so I can't comment on the seafood myself, but my partner just loved this restaurant
Not only is it a pretty restaurant, with a nice view, the wait staff was very pleasant. We actually got there about 10pm on a Saturday night, not realizing that they should be closing at 10 - they let us in along with several other couples, and we were there until after 11 at least, until we found out they should have closed at 10 - very very pleasant staff.

My partner got the crab cakes as an app, and said they were some of the best he has ever had. He had the fish trio as a entree, and really enjoyed it.
There weren't too many vegetarian options, however the chef made me a wonderfil vegetarian pasta, which was delicious.
For a really nice meal, I would highly suggest this place.
author: Mary T.

description: Awesome view of the bay. Food was great (between the 4 of us we got ciocippino, crab roll, half garlic crab, and seafood penne, all great). Service was perfect (especially our waitress Madison).
author: Matt S.

description: We were disappointed. My wife's salmon was tasteless. My fish and chips were average at best. Especially given how good San Francisco food can be, we feel that we made a mistake coming to the Wharf.
author: Steve J.

description:
FOR the damn clam chowder and view!!!!!!!!!!! 

This place used to be named Chic's. Goodness tho the soup didn't change. Actually the menu is much the same with a few updates.  Fresh n quiet n located at the beginning of the pier.  

Many similar options when coming to Pier 39, this place is a solid, safe bet.
author: Rafael N.

description:
This is an outstanding restaurant that offers the very best that San Francisco can  give. It's very pricey but the food is just amazing. I ordered a warm spinach salad and swordfish. The swordfish was moist and delicious on a bed of ratatouille. My husband had the ahi tuna and he was shocked at how perfectly it was done. We have barbecued ahi tuna at home and there's no way he could reproduce what he had that night. The service was stellar and the staff were very accommodating as they put us at the bar even though we didn't book ahed of time. We were able to enjoy a full meal at the bar. It turned out to be a great way to meet people, too! We really enjoyed the spectacle of basil martinis being made - basil leaves were crushed with a glass pestle in a thick glass filled with ice cubes. They seemed to be a popular drink!

Highly recommended to anyone visiting Fisherman's Wharf!
author: Paige L.

description: Great food. Great view. Great drinks. Dungeness crab melt and clam chowder were fantastic.
author: Jonathan W.

description: Great Food!  I could eat their bread & clam chowder Everyday!  Great Service and the cocktails are awesome! The bartenders are friendly and always have a suggestion on new cocktails or wine to compliment our meal.
author: Tambo T.

description:
creme brulee!

great food

great service 

great location

*ask for Micheal :)
author: Affinity Z.

description: first time here and the food & service is EXCELLENT!!! I had the Salmon BLT  & the red chilly shrimp appetizer super good I totally recommend!!! the best part our waiter BERNIE gave us the best service.
author: Art E.

description: Fog Harbor had wonderful views and the staff was super friendly and efficient.  I was there with a party of 14 that had all traveled to San Francisco from various areas of the country for a client meeting/ dinner and they made every effort to accommodate our large group and ensure we had a great experience. The food was delicious and plentiful and everyone loved their meal.
author: Amy T.

description: Great place for seafood with an outstanding view but the service was slow.
author: Conway B.

description:
We went for an early dinner to celebrate my anniversary so we were able to beat the crowds. The sun was setting so they had their blinds down. However, if you care to watch the setting sun which, from the restaurant, you have a perfect view, you'll have to be mindful of others who don't necessarily want the sun in their eyes.

We asked to have them opened and they offered us a different seat so as not to bother other guests. That was fine since they moved us to a nicer area although there were two families with children in that area. 

The food was wonderful. The calamari and the aioli was wonderful. I had the Ahi and vegetables. Now I grew up in Hawaii were fresh seafood, especially Ahi, was widely available and you had the best of the best resort chefs and restaurants around.  I'm also not a vegetable person. However on both accounts I was blown away. 

The seasonings and sauces were amazing. The portions I think were just right; they didn't skimp but yet you could finish your meal without feeling bloated or having to carry a doggy bag around Pier 39 all night. 

Overall it was a wonderful night. The staff was very friendly and attentive. They seemed to be around when I needed them and absent when I wanted to be left a lone to enjoy.
author: Daniel O.

description:
An excellent restaurant to relax in on Pier 39. The second-story location of the restaurant opens the view of the entire harbor, and of Alcatraz from every corner of the place.

The greeting staff was very courteous, and the service inside was exceptionally warm and professional. The chef's special was salmon stuffed with shrimp and crab- a novel concept, entirely delicious! The stuffing was just rich enough to delight, but not too overpowering. The dessert platter looked fantastic, and picking just one was a challenge. The lava chocolate cake is pure indulgence!

The servers could be more attentive to the customer's drinks.

In the high-traffic tourist place, this restaurant provides great service and dining at a very reasonable cost.
author: Polina P.

description:
This place is wonderful. Great views, prompt service, and delicious food. Husband had some kind of seafood platter/sampler that had crab, shrimp, mussels, clams, etc etc...it was all REALLY good and cooked perfectly.  Everything was really fresh and seasoned well.

I had the crab linguine, and it was probably the best seafood pasta I've ever eaten.  The creamy sauce was light but rich, and the crab was perfect.

The only disappointment at this place was the dated wine list....apparently they were out of the wine we ordered, and had been out of it for almost 6 months! Definitely not a huge deal, but just a heads up!
author: V.J. M.

description: Went here for New Year's Eve dinner.  Food was great, but the service was excellent.  Very attentive, patient wait staff, with attention to detail and able to make great conversation (not just do the minimum job).  A bit pricey for some, but well worth it!
author: John B.

description:
We had a pleasant meal in here with a great view of Alcatraz and Pier 39. 

The food was presented beautifully but non of us found our meals particularly note worthy.

Family friendly and certainly okay for a pleasant lunch.
author: Lottie R.

description: Madison was the bomb!  Great service and excellent ideas for out of towners. Thanks Madison.
author: Brent M.

description: Excellent food, great view of Alcatraz and the wharf. Some of the best service we have had in San Francisco. Our waitress Madison was everything we look for and would recommend this place and her to anyone who asks!! The service here really does set it apart
author: James J.

description: After appalling service at Bubba Gumps we were in search for a more upscale lunch spot.  We we got right in and were given our choice of tables with water views.  The waiter was very attentive and helpful with menu items.  We appreciated his recommendation to try a dish with crab as they may not have it for long and it's from local waters.  The crab cocktail did not disappoint.  The clam chowder really is as good as they tout.  And the fish and chips came out warm and tasty.  Overall, great service, clean restaurant and very good food.  We will definitely be back next time we are on the Pier.
author: Jessica C.

description: Their chowder in a bread bowl is pretty good.  The kids' fish and chips were excellent for their value.  Will return.
author: Donatella P.

description:
****Updated****
After receiving a polite message from the Manager who seems earnest in his desire to make sure his guests are comfortable and not rushed I'm bumping this review up to three stars.
*******************************

I've lived in San Francisco for over 20 years and I've finally tried chowder in a bread bowl.

I was meeting my Sister, her husband, and his mother at Pier 39 for dinner. I'd already decided that if the place they chose had chowder bread bowls I'd finally try one.

The soup was expensive for such a small portion. It was good but it was garnished with cilantro, which completely over powered the taste, every other spoonful had a chunk of cilantro in it so I only enjoyed half of the already small portion.

The service was fairly rushed and not very friendly. I get that this is a touristy place and you are playing a numbers game but not everyone likes to feel like cattle, for these prices I expect better.

I think I had a salad as well but I'm drawing a blank, not a good sign.
author: Manny F.

description:
First time here.  Loved the food.  Got the seafood platter.  Got the bib and all lol.  My wife does not like seafood one bit and got the steak.  She loved it.  Then, she got brave and asked to try my crab legs.  With nothing on them, straight out of the shell, she actually liked it!  She has never liked crab before this.  Says a lot.

The waiter was awesome too.  Unfortunately, I forgot his name.  Something like Gene or Rene.  Short name.  He lived in New York for a couple of years and moved to to San Fran for his fiances job.  We live in NY too, so we chatted a bit.  Great great service.

He even recommended a place for the best Bloody Marys in NYC and the Buena Vista Cafe as a SF staple (originator of the Irish Coffee).
author: Jason E.

description:
The food was AMAZING. My family and I went on Thanksgiving, the place was packed. But the service was still great. I had the lemon dill salmon and their sunset mimosa.... both perfect. 

It's a bit pricey, so I'd probably only go for special occasions. =)
author: Keeks M.

description:
food - mediocre
view & decor - amazing.
clam chowder - relatively good

would go back to take out of town guests, but probably wouldn't go there on my own.

Food: 2 stars
Service: 4
Ambiance: 5 stars
Overall:  3 star
author: Tina J.

description: I was rather unimpressed with this restaurant.  The service was sub-par and the food uninteresting.
author: Zechariah S.

description:
It is a tourist trap, do not eat there, do not waste your time and money. We tried this restaurant because of the free Pier 39 Parking validation, a bad idea...

Our lobster tails were not only overcooked and chewy, but also pretty small (not acceptable for $32 each + tax); Our broccoli was spongy and waterlogged.

The service was very fast but not really friendly and welcoming. We were ignored and our waiter also forgot to bring our wine. What a poor service there.

He quickly tried to apology while giving us the check to get a decent tip, very awkward.

This restaurant ruined our night and I would not recommend it, even to my worst enemy.
author: John D.

description: Was not expecting food and service to be as good in a tourist area. The Poke, and calamari perfect. Sourdough bread best I've tasted. Would absolutely return.
author: Mike L.

description: My wife and I enjoyed ourselves with nice wine and entrees of crab louie and linguini with clams.  We sat at the bar right insider the front door which was still comfortable.  The service was attentive and the food was delicious
author: Steve O.

description: Awesome food and bartenders! Came here last Thursday for company party and appetizers were delish!! Tried beef on skewers with orange marmalade, mini lettuce wraps and bruschetta. . Also for main entree, steak was the best for me- cooked to perfection along with pasta and Salmon.
author: Kristine P.

description: We dined here because the view of the bay caught my eye. Our waiter was incredible. He was cheerful, always had a smile on, and very tentative throughout our meal. We ordered the baked oysters- flavorful and cheesy, clam chowder- not the best but it was solid, and the seafood penne- tomato cream sauce with loads of seafood (mussels, clams, swordfish and salmon). All three dishes did not disappoint.
author: Uyen L.

description: I'm new to the area and have been exploring the city. . We we're looking for a great  place that would feature fresh seafood ..it just so happened to be labor day so Pier 39 was exceptionally busy. . Parking was a nightmare.  We walked the Pier viewed the menu and finally decided on Fog Harbor.  The interior and atmosphere was great however our service and food wss mediocre.   We had a lifeless server who seemed to have way too much going on for her to handle. In the end she did not deliver our food  or for that matter bring us our check.  We seemed to have multiple people at our table that created a confused dynamic.  We ordered the chili lime shrimp salad to start which the best part of our meal.  We decided to the garlic dungenous crab entrée as well as the seafood combo. The crabs presentation was great however everything seemed over cooked.  The platter came out with a fish filet noticeably darker/over cooked and was sent back.  Will not be visiting again as I feel I would receive better service and quality of food elsewhere.
author: Xavier G.

description:
We were here on Christmas Day... one of the few places open for Lunch on Christmas.  It was FANTASTIC!!!  Nice staff, amazing views of the bay, bridge and Alcatraz.
We had:
Clam Chowder, Popcorn Shrimp and Fish & Chips.  All of it was delicious and fresh.  The fish was so delicate and the batter was light, perfection!
Would LOVE to go back for dinner!
author: Lindsey B.

description: Excellent food and service! Good swordfish dish and blue cheese garlic bread starter. The music was at an average volume so it didn't bother.
author: Victoria J.

description: Visiting SFO, we ate here on the first day. It was good; nothing spectacular and a little overpriced. The waiter was great. It has a good view of Pier 39. You're paying for the location.
author: Mikala C.

description: Good food for reasonable pricing in a very tourist hotspot. Was surprised about the excellent quality served here. Surely exceeded my expectation. crab cakes were good, steak was awesome and also the tuna steak well prepared (although cooked a little too far). Will surely come back here.
author: C S.

description: Live in So. Cal but my sister lives in the bay area and we have been to this restaurant twice now.  I have nothing bad to say about it except that if you go there and it is in no way crowded they should let you sit by the window if you request it.  I requested a window and was told the tables were reserved (which I later observed was a lie).  Other than that the food was to die for both times and the service (save for the hostess) was excellent.  Will definitely eat there again when I get back up to the city.
author: J M.

description:
Taste: 4
Value: 3
Service: 4

I came here with my gf on July 4th last year after looking at all the different restaurants. Unfortunately, there were a ton of people at Pier 39, and every restaurant had a wait time of at least 30 minutes. I think Bubba Gump had a wait time of nearly an hour? We ended up choosing this place since it looked pretty nice, and the wait was only 15 minutes.

To be honest, I don't remember exactly what either of us got, but I remember the food being okay. I think we probably both got a fish entree dish. Will update this if I happen to go again sometime. The view was pretty good, and so was the service.
author: David L.

description: Excellent view.  Awesome food. And a great service.  It is a bit pricy for my budget but it was worth it.
author: Sushi L.

description: There are so many touristy (and mediocre)  restaurant choices near Fisherman's Wharf, so we were surprised to have enjoyed such a wonderful dinner at Fog Harbor. I really enjoyed the cioppino, which had a good variety of fish, crab, mussels, clams, shrimp and scallops. Others enjoyed the crab cakes and steak too. The view at sunset topped off the meal.
author: Brian G.

description: The service was amazing in spite of how busy the restaurant seemed to be and the view offered up Alcatraz and the Golden Gate Bridge which was nice to look at because it was so loud inside that it was hard to have a conversation.  The food came super fast, but we fish & chips and combo platter with fish, shrimp, and fried calamari, so other dishes might take longer.  The calamari was cooked perfectly but the breading didn't have a lot of flavor and the texture was a it dense. The fish batter needed some salt but the fish was nice and flaky.  The price ($21 per) was reasonable for the location and choice.  If it were quieter and the food seasoned a tiny bit better this would have been a four star because of the service and views.
author: Julie M.

description: My husband, in-laws, and I visited Fog Harbor Fish House a few weeks ago, after finding it here on Yelp.  It was really great!  I had the Crab Cake Entree and the crab cakes were really flavorful, full of crab and not too much filler.  My husband had the Fried Combo, which includes fish, calamari, shrimp, french fries, and cole slaw.  It was like fried seafood heaven!  I tried some of his calamari and it was perfectly cooked, not chewy at all, and lightly breaded.  Yum.  My father-in-law had the Seafood Cioppino (crab, fresh fish, shrimp, scallops, clams and mussels in tomato broth, with or without pasta).  They even offer to crack the crab for you, for a few bucks extra, which gets you more crab meat.  It looked fantastic!  And lastly, my mother-in-law got the Fish & Chips, which had an incredible beer batter.  Also, I must highlight that the coleslaw was fantastic:  crunchy cabbage and not overly creamy.  The views of the bay are also beautiful and we enjoyed snapping shots of Alcatraz from our table. It also has a classy, relaxed atmosphere that was even nicer than I imagined from the reviews and price range designation.  I would have liked options for sides (fries came with everything, but I like variety).  Basically, this is a great place to go if you want delicious seafood and great service, with gorgeous views.
author: Amber K.

description: Very disappointed in this restaurant. Should have read more reviews before attempting this one. Hubby had the shrimp scampi, which was floating in what looked like a yellow watered-down butter "sauce" and tasted about as good. My calamari had no flavor at all. Still hungry, decided to try dessert. Well, that was just about as successful as the meal - flavorless creme brûlée with a burnt tasting caramelized crust. An expensive waste of food.
author: Lori M.

description:
I have GOT to stop bringing visitors to Fisherman's Wharf during lunch hours. For the money we spent here, in a not so touristy area we would have been treated like royalty.

Don't get me wrong, the food was indeed good. The calamari was fresh and not chewy. The halibut was wonderful. The shrimp were large and well battered. I had garlic mashed potatoes, but I think they left out much of the garlic. I actually had to add salt to mine! That was not good.

The dessert trays looked fantastic. But we were too full to indulge. The calamari app was very large, great for 3 people!

The servers were nice and dressed well. I like women in ties! The views are nice as well.
author: Penguin S.

description: I'm going to try and be fair with this review.  Sure the place is in the MOST TOURISTY area of town and the prices do reflect that, but that being said the restaurant is comfortable, has professional staff and a great view of the golden gate bridge so you expect to pay more.  I sampled a lot of appetizers while I was there.  I thought the oysters, shrimp cocktail, ahi tun, crab and avocado with mango salad and calamari were all excellent.  My fellow diners were really impressed with the fresh sourdough.  Is this a towny restaurant, no, but it was a good choice for a large group of business people from out of state.
author: Maria S.

description: I went here recently with friends from out of town.  I got one of the specials a Seabass with a citrus sauce. The seabass was ok.  It was moist and well cooked but I wasn't as excited about the flavors as I had hoped to be.  The grilled asparagus and garlic mashed potatoes were excellent though. As well as the service.
author: Renata P.
