description: This place is a must try. Amazing food, nice people and the view is gorge. Absolute must try is a swordfish. Im such a not-about-fish person but the one  i tried here was beyond delicious. Pacific sole is also very very good. If you're confused which fish restaurant to choose, go here!
author: Ksenia Z.

description: Great food and service. I don't usually like to eat at restaurants off the Wharf because they do feel a bit generic, especially in SF were you can find some of the best food in the country but we were at the Warf and got late so we gave this place a try and so happy we did. It actually reminded me of the quality of food and restaurants that use to be on the Warf before Applebees and Subways were added to make it of course appealing to tourist lol So that being said I am not a fan of seafood I know SF known for seafood and all but whatever I don't so get over it lol. But I do like Fish n Chips so I ordered that and my hubby had shoot can't remember but some kind of braised chicken meal and both were so good! I hate to say this but the food here was better than what we had at Gordon Ramsey's Steak in Vegas a few months before! I know what?! I didn't want to admit it either but I gotta be honest ;) The warm sourdough bread was so delish and the waitress was on top of refilling the bread and drinks And I l loved the ambiance and the lighting, fancy & romantic...but still could wear shorts and Tshirt because of the location so not a bad deal lol. So I will definitely be back here, probably not when I am at other locations in SF but for sure when I am at the Warf =)
author: Sofia H.

description: reading the reviews we thought that this was THEEE seafood experience.  NOT.  One star is for the views.  We had tasteless dishes that were presented with fine flair.  And the cocktails were good. But seating next to a couple who were arguing that their date wasn't going well, and then the next foursome that we college kids trying to impress each other, helped to ruin this experience. Don't consider the the blue cheese bread our's was dried out.  And the shrimp cocktail was blah blah.  The blue cheese dressing on the salad also was watery.  Sorry. but the truth is this was a terrible disappointment.
author: Jim H.

description: Loved the cioppino!  It was absolutely delish!  Large portions and excellent service. Food came surprisingly fast considering we walked in with 9 people in our party. The sourdough bread was hot with a crisp crust. My daughter loved the clam chowder. Said it was even better than Boudin's!
author: Jodi L.

description: A great restaurant with a great view. The food was pretty yummy. Their mac n cheese was one of the best I've tried. Their calamari was spot on too except they used old oil that gave a slight bitter aftertaste. The linguini was pretty good, not the best though.
author: Mickey D.

description: Fog Harbor Fish House offers a nice break from the touristy feel of Fisherman's Wharf. My fiance and I went here for a late dinner after a sunset cruise on the bay. If you can, try to request a seat near the windows - the view is unbeatable! We both got fish, her the tuna and myself the swordfish. The swordfish was a little overcooked and tough, but the tuna was some of the best I've had. I suppose it just depends on what you order. The service was good, walking the fine line of giving you privacy while not letting you sit too long with an empty plate. Overall, this is definitely a step up from the normal fare on Pier 39, however your dollar will go further at a place off of the Wharf. I'd stop by again if I was in the area but won't be making a special trip for it anytime soon.
author: Rich Y.

description:
best sourdough , clam chowder, service, 
*pricey
author: Fabiola T.

description: My husband and I went to SF for our honeymoon.  When we arrived in town and to our hotel, we were starving.  We walked down to Pier 39 and went in to this place.  It had a nice view and was not too crowded.  Our goal was to try as much different eatery spots as we could, so we wanted to share most of our meals.  We chose the red chili garlic prawns appetizer and the seafood cioppinio.  They were both good and filled us up.  The reason I gave it 3 stars because I was dreaming of something with a San Francisco twist...
author: Leslie F.

description:
Everything about this place during my visit was fantastic! I went with a coworker while we were on a business trip and this was by far our best and most memorable meal of the week. 

Here is the highlight reel: Red Snapper (special) was delicious, quite possibly the best fish dish I've had in recent memory. My coworker had the shellfish platter which he also found to be very good. We started off the meal with some of the biggest and best crab cakes I've ever had the pleasure of eating, and the service was fantastic as well. We were in and out of a very busy restaurant inside of an hour. I should also mention that the view was quite impressive and this looks like it would be a good place for a date. 

The not so great: Not really the restaurant's fault, but the address really confused my GPS... both the sprint nav and google maps put me in an industrial area, which I later found out meant that I drove right by the Mythbuster's warehouse. The price is also a bit on the high side for the amount of food you get, but the quality of the food was spot on.
author: Dan B.

description: This placed seemed like it would be better but I should have expected mediocre at best. The service was so quick it was dizzying at moments. I do realize that since it's on pier 39 they are probably slammed often, but Geezus it was quick. I didn't get that relaxed restaurant atmosphere. We ordered calamari with a lemon aioli which was pretty good and it was good serving size however you get the tiniest ramekin of aioli to go with such a large portion. Me and the hubs ordered clam chowder in a bread bowl (cuz we were being tourist-y)  he ordered his with a side Caesar salad. The salad came out as three whole romaine lettuce leaves with a splatter of dressing. It was so bad he didn't eat more than a bite. The clam chowder was full of clams and nice and thick, but it had HUGE pieces of celery in it and the bread bowl was half full at best so I was a bit disappointed. Overall not a restaurant I would enjoy again.
author: Chandra C.

description:
My boyfriend and I had lunch here on our first day in San Francisco as tourists and I will have to tell ya if we ever visit again we will be returning here no matter how touristy everyone else seems to think it is!! 

The food was great and our server David is probably the best waiter I have ever had the great pleasure to meet. He obviously loves his job and the interaction he is able to have with his guests ( and I mean guests, we were not just mere customers to him). 

We started off with the Red Curry Steamed Mussels as appetizers with the fresh sourdough bread. My boyf is Sinhalese and knows his curries and he really liked this dish, I loved it!!  The mussels cooked perfect!

We then moved on to a special they were offering that day, steel head over cheese ravioli and cream sauce that was truly to die for and the Seafood Cioppino which again with the sourdough was very good. 

We had a couple of the hot drinks from the bar that were good however when 1 turned out to be too strong for us we ordered something else and fully expected to pay for it and were pleasantly surprise to see it not on our bill. 

Dont know when I will get a chance to visit San Fran again but u can be sure I will be stopping by here!!
author: Leslie B.

description: First timer in San Francisco and visited several restaurants in the Fisherman's Wharf area during our stay.  By far Fog Harbor was our favorite spot during our trip.
author: Robert W.

description: The fish and chip are simply.... AMAZING! Golden brown crust with moist flakey white meat, this is a must try! The only reason why I'm giving this place 4 stars is because of the lack of attention to detail. Out server was very friendly and brought us our water, after inspecting one of the glasses we noticed it had a couple "floaters"... We asked for a fresh water. The waiter returned with a smile and a "fresh" glass. After another inspection we noticed the 2nd glass has even more "floaters" than the first. We inquired for the 3rd time about a fresh glass of aqua, this time she assured it was clean... It was. I decided to quench my thirst with a Anchor Pear Ale, a fricken great beer! I took the etched glass in compensation for the dirty H20. Full belly and a cool souvenir in hand we left Fog House satisfied. Next time make sure your buss boy isn't using the water pitcher as a spit cup and there should be no problems.
author: Matt W.

description: Came here 2 days in a row...ordered a Sourdough clam chowder bowl with crab meat...freaking delicious. And on both days I ordered Fish and chips. Best fish and chips I have ever tasted IMO.
author: Tony M.

description: We were looking for a seafood restaurant with great views of the Bay and we found it!  The clam chowder + bread bowls are to die for and our waitress (an older woman who has been at Fod Harbor for many years) was enthusiastic in her delivery and helpful with our questions about the area.  My husband didn't think the beer battered fish & chips were the best he's had though...the batter overwhelmed the actual fish and in result, was very filling.  We loved the "feel" of the dining area and bar...the waiting spot with couches & fireplace warmed us up on a chilly September evening.
author: Beth R.

description: Great food!  After a long day of tourist attractions we referred to yelp and thought we would give this place a chance based on the reviews.  Great ambiance and waterfront!  Reasonably priced for waterfront restaurant.  We got the Blue Cheese Garlic Bread.  Tasted awesome!  Also ordered the crab cake entree and ahi tuna entree.  Very good!  Would recommend.
author: Kristine W.

description: Very good seafood.  Clam chowder was excellent.  A little pricey, however.  I would have given it a higher rating except the waiter was VERY pushy in trying to offer us extra things.   I felt like he was trying to "up-sell" us the entire time.  It was very annoying.
author: Dan P.

description: Despite all the other positive reviews and 4 stars, our dinner did not live up to the hype. Service was slow and kids entrees came out with our appetizers (my kids are pretty normal and they are not going to sit by patiently while we eat). The crab ceviche was missing the promised lime juice and didn't have enough seasoning. The clam chowder, which is touted as the best in SF, was decidedly not. Gloppy, gritty, and devoid of any authentic flavor does not define greatness. The crab cakes were atrocious -- almost all filler and no nice crust from a proper own fry -- the purveyors should be embarrassed to offer those. The lobster in the lobster mac n cheese was overcooked. Hint: if you fully cook a lobster and then put it in hot mac n cheese and then put it under the broiler, it will turn horribly chewy.  The only positives were the view, nicely appointed dining room, reasonably priced kids meals, and the sourdough. That's not worth about $50 per person.
author: Mark S.

description:
Fog Harbor Fish House is a gem with an amazing view of San Francisco Bay and the City. On Pier 39, surrounded by many other restaurants that seem to get more exposure, Fog Harbor has the best food and service on the pier. 

The Cioppino is superb with loads of fresh seafood in a delectable broth. I could not find a pasta and seafood combination I wanted so after 30 seconds of discussion with the waiter, I had a custom designed meal with pasta, spinach, garlic, oil, jumbo shrimps, and pine nuts - absolutely delicious and only $18.00.

Anywhere you go on the wharf you will find good to great seafood but if you miss Fog Harbor, you will have missed some of the best seafood and service anywhere in San Francisco.
author: Joel W.

description: We decided to eat here on the recommendation of the boat captain who had taken us out to watch the America's Cup boat race.  We are not a big fan of the crowds and restaurants on Pier 39, but he indicated this was the best of the bunch.  Since our boat had left from Pier 39, we opted for convenience.  We came about 2 pm and were told it would be a 40 minute wait.  It would have been nice to have a device to take on the pier that would have vibrated when our table was ready, but the waiting area was pleasant.  The table had a nice view of the harbor, and we were attended to in a timely manner.  There was a good variety of choices on the menu, but my brother in law was very disappointed with the non existant vegan selections.  He opted for the Salmon BLT sandwich with no bacon or fish.  The waiter was one of those who doesn't write down your order but trys to memorizes everything, which made me very nervous.  Sure enough, even after asking me twice, I received a chicken dish instead of the sandwich, and my brother in law had fish in his sandwich.  The manger came by and was very apologetic, offering to comp his sandwich, I told him I would eat mine for the lower price of the sandwich.  The food was delicious, but not once did our waiter come back to apologize or check on us, and sure enough when he brought our bill, they charged us for the comp items.  By this time my brother in law was worn down, and despite my objections just paid the entire bill so we could leave.  I guess I came out ahead since he paid for my meal, but overall it was not a pleasant experience.
author: Kurt H.

description:
Being the kind of person that never complains to anybody especially a restaurant,  I have to go far as to write a review on this restaurant.  A group of 20-25 of us came to eat here while we visited San Francisco.  They sat us right away in the bar section,  but since we had a 1 yr old we could not sit in the high table and chairs we had to sit in the booths right next to everybody else.  We were asked to leave our strollers outside since they said strollers were not allowed inside the restaurant.  The waitress named Jack served and was very nice but we asked her for a high and said they had NO high chairs.  We opted to leave and go to another place but we roughed it out and had to sit our son on our laps and just take turns holding him.  Since my son was getting fussy we asked Jack again, "You really don't have high chairs or even a booster seat?"  She proceeded and said No they have none and she didn't know why.  
     I then needed to take my son to restroom to change him and approached the hostess and asked her if they had changing tables and she didn't know since she's never used the restroom here and she also asked her nearby coworker and she didn't know either.  So I had to walk outside,  downstairs and wait in this long line just to change my son.  
    When we got back our food was served and while we were trying to enjoy our food I see a man walk right in the restaurant with a stroller.  I never saw that stroller e brought out.  So I told my husband I was going to the restroom and as I was walking to the restroom of of the restaurant I saw a child in a high chair and a stack of high chairs near the restroom.  
    I was very angry and very hurt that I felt we were treated different and my son got and us got cheated out of a good experience.  My husband talked to the manager who was very nice and apologetic and explained that they do have have high chairs but just not in the bar area since its a fire hazard.  I totally understood that but that wasnt was told to us and we weren't even given the option to move to a different table where high chairs were permitted.  We brought a lot of business that day and all we got was an apology and that's it.  It doesn't take back from our horrible experience and the fact that we didn't get to enjoy our food because we had to keep passing our son back and forth so we can eat.  Our food got cold and couldn't enjoy it.  Nevertheless,  it is a nice place but will never go there again.
author: Verenice N.

description: Shocked to find such a pleasant surprise on Fisherman's Wharf.  Great vibe, great food, warm personable service. . . Shocked.  Among dishes our party of seven tried were Grilled Shrimp, Lobster Squash Ravioli, Chowder in Sourdough and Seafood Penne.   All judged entrees as solid.  Great respite among the chaos.
author: David R.

description:
I ordered the seared ahi and it was outstanding. I have eaten a lot of ahi..even in Tokyo and this was the best. I had  requested a table by a window with a view and that's exactly what they gave us. Great service, food and atmosphere's doesn't get any better. 
Dave
author: David R.

description: Went for dinner.  Had the sirloin steak, which I enjoyed.  Went for lunch the next day and had the fried calamari, which I did not enjoy.  I recommend that you go to the visitors center on the same level and ask for a coupon book, which has a 20% off coupon for lunch or dinner at Fog Harbor.  Also, double check your bill as I received another table's bill during my lunch visit.
author: Mike A.

description:
We've been eating at Pier 39 on our anniversary for 35 years.  Our last experience at Fog Harbor featured the best seafood and the worst service we've had in all of those years.  The food was simply outstanding.

When we were seated (after a 15 minute wait despite our reservation) there was a window open at our table (the table was immediately adjacent to the window).  Anyone who has been to Pier 39 knows how strong and cold the wind can be there.  The wind was so strong that it immediately blew both of our menus off the table!  It was so cold that we were flapping our arms for fear of numbness.  The waiter's response when I explained that we needed to shut the window: "I'll check with my manager."  The cretin who she referred to as a manager came to our table and told us that he needed airflow in the restaurant and could not close the window.  We asked for an "indoors" seating and were given another table.  Sure enough, 10 minutes after we sat down at the new table we looked over and found that all of the windows had been closed.  So much for "needing airflow".  At our new table, the waiter took our drink orders and then forgot about us (she literally never returned).  After 15 minutes, I flagged down another waiter and asked what happened.  Ten more minutes of waiting produced a 3rd waiter with our drinks and an explanation that our first waiter was a "floater" who was used only to substitute for other wait staff when they were eating their own meals.  I have to stop this review now - there were more service problems, but just recounting them is making my blood pressure too high.

Despite the great food, I would never recommend this place and would never go back --there are so many other good restaurants at Pier 39 that know something about service.
author: Martin M.

description: Good seafood spot for being in such a touristy area. I had the Sole which was flavorful and light. Desserts looked delicious but I didn't have room for one. Decent prices for the area too.
author: M K.

description: Definitely on the pricier end, but they have a lovely view of the pier & Golden Gate Bridge. Aside from the prices, the food is delicious. I loved by Blueberry Smash cocktail, and the clam chowder really is award winning (forget, Boudin. This sh*t is no joke). I also shared a seafood penne pasta with my friend, and it was plenty of food for the both of us. Lunch ended up being $35 per person, which is pretty steep for a soup, cocktail and shared entree. But whatever, it was still good! Just be prepared to spend $40+.
author: Jeanne C.

description:
My husband and I went to dinner here while staying at Fisherman's Wharf for a seminar. The front of the house staff had lost my reservation on Open Table, and suggested that is was my fault, and mustn't I have made it for an earlier time and missed my time? Therefore, we had to take a non-window table. This was not awful, as it was not a special occasion, but what if it had been? Why no accountability on their part? 
I had the crabcake meal, knowing it is crab season, and they were not high on crab at all!  Service was good, fast, and my husband enjoyed his steak. The location is beautiful, and prices are in line with other wharf establishments.  I just wish that the food and attitude matched the setting. After dinner, I checked my email and indeed I was correct about my reservation time.
author: Leslie C.

description:
We had the Swordfish and the Mahi-Mahi. Both were delicious and the delivery was very fast. The waiter was friendly and asked for the drinks first which was good; we were thirsty. 
After the meal we spent some time and felt no pressure to go. 4 stars.
author: Thomas W.

description: Fresh Bay Crab Ceviche and fried shrimp plate were simply D-LISH! The entire staff was super friendly and my wife and I were seated next to the window overlooking the bay. The waiter was very prompt and the food was absolutely amazing! We WILL be back. The decor and ambiance was superb. Kudos to the entire team at Fog Harbor.
author: Big Daddy C.

description: Fair customer service, view was nice, food was also fair. Better to come on a sunny day.
author: Michelle K.

description:
We turned the kids loose on the Pier to do their own thing for a while while hubby and I duck in for a drink and an appetizer for lunch.

The place is bumping so we are thinking "it must be good".  We did not stick around long enough to find out what the food was like.

I guess I should consider us lucky for the drinks we did get even though they were just as bad as the lack of service!
author: Peggy N.

description: We love coming here. We come for happy hour and enjoy a wonder meal of appetizers and bowls of clam chowder. Nice warm sour dough bread and butter. We like the oysters, spicy shrimp, and calamari. The clam chowder is great. The staff welcoming and friendly. I know it's a tourist place but hey, when I come to San Francisco, I'm a tourist!
author: Jim H.

description:
We stopped by last Tuesday on a recent tourist trip to Pier 39.  I was skeptical of any place here, due to the nature of the scenery, but I was impressed.

We were greeted warmly, immediately seated and what a view of Alcatraz!  

I had the simple chowder in a bread bowl and it was great.  Others at the table had the fish and chips - it was fabulous.

Prices were very reasonable and the service was great, plus a beautiful view and great food = 4 stars.  I wouldn't hesitate in going back.
author: Mark J.

description: I love fresh salmon at Fog Harbor! Amazing taste and fresh ;) also they have the best clam chowder in the city. Love this place!
author: Aikerim S.

description:
This is a really nice restaurant with a great view.  The seafood and sourdough bread are excellent.  The prices are ridiculous.  
I didn't know that the week after Christmas was such a crazy-fest in San Francisco.  Every place you go is packed with foreigners and tourists, and 99% of all restaurants are understaffed for the rush.  
We sat at the bar, and there was a single bartender handling all the drinks for the restaurant, as well as the entire bar and several tables in the bar area.  To top it off, she was pregnant (quite far along), and I have no idea how she did it, but she kept us in food and drinks.  
I was shocked that two appetizers and four drinks totalled $70.00, but I'm on vacation, so I chalked it up to a once-in-a-while fun allowance.  If given a choice, I probably wouldn't return to this place, though.
author: Steve S.

description:
I came here for a late birthday lunch on Sunday and my experience was not at all what I hoped for.  First of all the waitress I had was beyond rude I think because we were a big party of 8 she figured she didn't have to provide good service since she would be getting her tip anyway.  She cut me off a few times, didn't bring crayons out for my daughter to color and when she brought out the "birthday dessert" she told my guests "uh aren't you guys gonna sing?" because apparently the waiters don't sing. She also promised my husband that the dessert would be on the house but they charged us for it which I didn't realize until we already left and it was too late. Also she was rushing us when the bill came and said "I need to know how much is cash and how much is card" and was hovering over us until I told her to come back and wait until we figured that part out. I regret not getting her name to warn others.  I also regret not complaining to her manager but I didn't want to make a big deal in front of my guests.  

I would've given a higher rating if the food was good but I ordered the lobster and I was not at all impressed. So I wouldn't recommend this place, there are much better restaurants down the pier a little ways.
author: Jeanette S.

description:
Dec 29, 2012 9PM. Wife & I were served by Amelia. Food was: Garlic Roasted 1/2 Crab,
Mixed Grill of Salmon Swordfish and Shrimp.. Wife had Salmon.

Place was packed. Service was spot-on. Server Amelia was on us immediately. We ordered the 1/2 crab appetizer. It was on our table in 4 minutes and hot.

Dinner was the same. FAST, complete and hot.  Salmon was not overdone and dry. Drinks? Same. I liked the place so much, I had to tell the manager what a good ship he oversees. Manager Nusan was dressed professionally, and polite to us. 

Wife used to work there when it was Chick's Place back in the day. She loved seeing  the place again. 

To qualify my opinion, I am ususally very picky on my kudos for eateries. This place deserved a 5.
author: Azuresees n.

description: This place is exceptional. This is my third time here and I must say I am thoroughly impressed with the service, quality and freshness of the fish, and the dishes overall. The only complaint I had was it was impossible to get parking since they don't have their own private lot so we had to drive around for an hour practically stopped in traffic looking for an open spot. I guess that's what you get when you go to the city on a Saturday afternoon. I ordered the clam linguine with garlic, basil, and tomatoes in a white wine sauce. All of the flavors blended together perfectly, not one ingredient overpowering the other, and each flavor complementing the next perfectly. Some other dishes this place serves that really pops out is the fish and chips, the tuna poke, and the red garlic shrimp appetizer. I definitely recommend this place if you are in the city and looking for a nice seafood lunch.
author: Amin J.

description: I found this on Yelp and decided to go because of the reviews- I was not disappointed!!  I had the shrimp scampi and it was fantastic.  My friend had the clam chowder in a bread bowl and raved about it.  We also had the fried calamari appetizer and it was outstanding.  The atmosphere and the view were certainly wonderful.  We had great service- I'll certainly go back next time I'm in the city!
author: Colleen C.

description: Ask for a table by the window. :) The drinks were refreshing & good sized. The clam chowder in the bread bowl was delicious & a good size portion. The fish & chips were nice & crispy & tasty! We were too full for dessert, but the table next to us ordered almost one of everything & they all looked great!
author: Jill R.

description:
4 stars for the food! If you're in the area you need to try their clam chowder that comes in the freshly baked bread bowl. It's the best you're going to get in SF. The dungeness crab is very good too.

I will say that their service (particularly the hostess staff) need to get over themselves. They are very stuck up. Ignore them. I promise the food is worth it.
author: Annette P.

description:
Sitting by the window is an experience.  You get a great view of the bay, GG bridge, and "the Rock."

The service was also great.  The hostesses were nice and seated us quickly, and our waitress was very attentive and personable. Our waitress even wrote down restaurant recommendations for us.

But, I've gotta knock off stars because the food was just average.  In fact, the crab cakes were below average (if you've ever had a crab cake from Legal Seafood in the Boston area, you'll understand - every other crab cake will be below average).
author: Matthew D.

description: Visiting San Francisco with family as part of a long birthday/bachelorette week. After taking a BYOB bay cruise, we were starving and looking for a nice sit down place (not so easy to find in Fishermans wharf) but not so nice that our slightly loud, relatively inebriated (for 1:30 on a Saturday afternoon) party wouldn't ruin the experience for anyone else. Enter Fog Harbor. Were seated at the bar immediately, able to enjoy not only great views and excellent food (the oysters are to die for) but also great bartenders- they created an impromptu cocktail crafting competition and we did not leave disappointed. If you're in a group, this is a great choice as the San Francisco know it all were just as impressed as the first timers.
author: Rachel C.

description:
Our Valentine's Day plans fell through so we had to come up with a place that wasn't completely booked, that should have been warning since we had no wait getting in here.

The atmosphere is nice, good view and the staff is adequately helpful.  However, it is a restaurant so the food is also important especially at these prices.  We started with the calamari which was probably what I would expect at Long John Silvers if they added it to the menu.  I had a fish dish which was bland and very dry with zero flavor.  My GF had the special which was crab - also terrible and quality expected somewhere like a state fair or maybe a school cafeteria.

Fog Harbor basically is for tourists only and absolutely not worth going for any reason.
author: Ryder M.

description: My family and I came in for lunch this past Saturday. We ordered the appetizers listed on the specials of the day menu, crab roll, and fish and chips. The food was only okay but the location and view were lovely.  I don't mind paying a little extra but the food just wasn't worth it.
author: Chris A.

description:
We were hangout on the wharf and got hungry, so randomly we decided to try this place.

--FOOD--
01. Steam clams (Full for $15.95 on webiste, but $16 on check)
Roasted peppers, corn, chorizo butter served with garlic toast -- clams were gritty and sandy... uh, did they clean them?

02. 24oz. New York steak ($24.95 on website, $25 on check)
Cooked in a whiskey peppercorn sauce, and served with garlic mashed potatoes and sauteed veggies -- subpar steak

03. Fish of the day ($19)
Bundle of prawns on top a bed of mashed potatoes and spinach. -- didn't even finish them, ate like less than 10% 

Hmm... they seem to round everything up to the nearest dollar. Food total is $60 with tax and health fee, total is $67.38. Yes, almost freakin' $70 for lunch.

--OVERALL--
The servers were okay. It would've been better if she noticed that I barely ate my food and not charge.  I wouldn't come here ever again, spent way too much money for no good food. Meh... it was in the tourist area. Next time, we'll do some research.
author: Ann N.

description: Excellent food, atmosphere and service.  Madison was about server today and she was cheery, informative and professional.  We will come back.
author: Kristi C.

description: Had an excellent dinner here with my boyfriend on our trip to the west coast.  The clam chower was sooo delicious.  We also enjoyed the shrimp scampi and the crab pasta.  The icebuef wedge was also yummy.  We really enjoyed sitting by the window and looking out on the bay and the city.  It was a great treat!
author: Amanda A.

description: I spend my birthday dinner here. It was the most amazing dinner I ever had so far. Everything we order was delicious. The clam chowder is just off the charts, their blackened ribeye steak was so soft and flavorful, their seafood pasta is really fresh and very satisfying, the wine was delicious. Food was just amazing. Customer service is also superb. Our server did make sure we are comfortable and everything was alright. Even though they are very busy, he checks on us from time to time. He provided a really amazing customer service. He is polite and very patient and very welcoming. The ambiance of this place makes you feel belong. This is definitely one of the best restaurants in San Francisco. So I highly recommend this restaurant. If you happen to be in the pier39, make sure you passed by this place and I am so sure that it will satisfy your clam chowder craving and seafood craving as well.
author: Gicele C.

description: The decor was nice, but the quality of the food was very impressive.  My mom had the seafood mixed grill and I had the steak and we both enjoyed the sourdough bread.  The food was seasoned well and the portions were decent but not mega large.  Fortunately, we didn't have to wait for a table and the views of the bay/Pier 39 were enjoyable.
author: Latrice R.

description: I am here now enjoying beautiful views.  What is important than the views is the fact that this restaurant is one practicing and certified in sustainable food.  Local fish sources, grass fed beef, and fish caught fresh.  As a pescatarian and conscience person, this Fog Harbor stands out, in service and food.  I hope more restaurants follow suit to what their excellence taste like and looks like.
author: Reggie F.

description:
As I approached this place the hostess was standing in the open lobby inviting people in. It was a nice touch and probably nets them a fair bit of business. 

I liked the  atmosphere with staff in crisp white shirts and aprons and a simple, classy decor. They had a nice little happy hour menu with appetizers and drinks, but I was in need of a full lunch. So they sat me at a table with a very nice view (which wasn't difficult - except for a few seats at the bar, every table in the house seems to have a good view). 

The waitstaff was very pleasant and efficient, especially Monica, who was friendly and attentive. I'm not normally a big fan of clam chowder but I'd heard good things about Fog Harbor's, so I gave it a try. It was very nice - buttery, creamy, and with just the right amount of potatoes and clams. San Fran sourdough was simple but good, especially with the soup. I could've eaten the chowder, bread, and beer for lunch and been perfectly content. But I was keen to try the seafood, so I got the mixed fried seafood plate. It seemed like the best match for the Anchor Steam I was already drinking. The fish, shrimp, and calamari were good (but not great or special). And my one complaint about this place is proportions. One would think a combo plate of three items would have the items in roughly equal proportion, not one piece of fish, two fried shrimp, and a giant mound of calamari, so that was a bit disappointing. 

Two managers stopped by during my meal to ask if everything was good, and while I toyed with registering my minor complaint, I decided I'd prefer to enjoy my meal rather than raise such a minor quibble. All in all, a decent meal. The food here was probably only three stars, but the service was a bit above.
author: Roland S.

description: We were a group of seniors and very much in a hurry for a quick meal so as to catch the ferry to Alameda and had the best server and service in many times, on Friday the 13th too.. What a great day this made for one that had started out so badly..
author: David B. P.

description:
Very pleasant experience, waiter was everything I love in a waiter, straight talker, reliable recommender of food and seemed genuinely interested in our opinion of his recommendations, wine and other venues and attractions, friendly but not overly chatty or personal.  

The food was great, I loved the chowder in the bread bowl, I know it's gimmicky but that's some good sourdough and chowder!  The crab cakes were delicious, as gigantic as they were, they were light yet flavorful, good portion size!  

The table/view was awesome, a sea lion had jumped up on the dock right below us so we got a front row seat of him/her preening and swimming and jumping on and off the dock, and then a sea gull came down and grabbed some guys head and hair and then flew off, so pretty good entertainment!  

As a resident of SF (as opposed to a tourist), I thought Fog Harbor was better than a lot of less "touristy" places that I've been to on recommendations from bay area folks, the prices seemed perfectly inline with the quality and service and it was calmer and more sedate than some of the other restaurants at Pier 39.  I would definitely come back here!
author: sasha y.

description: Good service, excellent Seafood. Make your reservation here to save time. We got an amuse buche for reserving online. We had scallops on the half shell (probably not worth the money, but still good). My entree was delicious: mixed grill. Swordfish, salmon and shrimp all cooked to perfection. Delicious asparagus side and garlic mashed potatoes that were strictly okay. Fresh, homemade sourdough on your table is warm and soft and crusty and delicious. I also had their yummy tiramisu, apple crisp, and a skinny coconut ginger cocktail, all delicious!
author: Leslie K.

description: My husband and I went here for our 1 year wedding anniversary.  The restaurant looks great.  It is in a very crowded area of the wharf.  We were able to watch seals lounge on the docks during our meal.  We were really hoping for fresh local seafood but instead the menu s filled with alaskan fish or maine lobster.  The only local catch is the crab.  I had the halibut and it was dry and sitting on a bed of undressed arugala.  My husband's seafood platter looked great and tasted alright but was swimming in garlic butter.  We ordered an appetizer of baked oysters that did not come out for about 45 minutes but the waiter was great and gave us complementary small bowls of clam chowder to tide us over.  The service staff is very friendly and they have a good wine/champagne selection.  All in all I am glad we went there but I don;t feel the need to go there again.
author: Laura F.

description: A perfectly adequate place to get food. The place looks clean, the server was nice enough, and the food was edible and not bad for any particular reason.
author: Brian D.

description:
Aight, I'll keep it short and simple. 

The waiter was nice, check. 

BOMB AHI TUNA STEAK. EAT IT.

That's actually all I can remember. I'll update my review in a weekend or two.
author: Nicole L.

description: We visited this restaurant from out of town and the food was amazing, the staff was courteous, but my girlfriend has food allergies and when she started having an allergic reaction the manager comped our entire table, nearly $100 worth of food and drinks, and personally aplogized. Never did we expect to be taken care of so well. Everything was great outside of the small reaction and I created a yelp account and downloaded the iPhone app just to share this with yelp.
author: ben f.

description: It's ok, clam chowder is thick if you like that.  Beer is cold and people are nice.  Prices are reasonable for seafood in a touristy area.
author: Brian S.

description: Looks like some good food. Khaiman (our waiter) was great! Good views and a nice atmosphere. definitely recommend it!
author: Philip H.

description: This was a most pleasant experience. Our waiter, Joel, was very courteous and extremely knowledgeable. We ordered an appetizer and apparently there was a mess up in the kitchen with our ticket unbeknownst to us but the manager was very apolegetic and took the app off our ticket. And the food was AMAZING!! I would definitely go back!
author: Pamela C.

description: I appreciate the follow up from the management as a result of my review. I'd recommend reevaluating the branding and menu to make them more special and less generic. This feels and tastes very much like every other restaurant ever, which can be good but is most often boring.
author: Courtney W.

description: Went here for dinner after a disappointing trip to the Aquarium.  This place did not disappoint.  Ordered the calamari appetizer and it was very good.  My husband had the crispy bay scallops for an appetizer and they were even better.  Both dishes were very ample servings and in retrospect would have been better to order just one and share.  I had the fresh catch of the day, king salmon while my husband had the mixed grill of salmon, swordfish and shrimp.  Both were very good.  The views of the bay were nice though if eating around sunset, bring sunglasses as the window coverings won't block the glare.  All in all a very enjoyable meal at not too outrageous of a price, considering it is located on Pier 39.
author: Ileen G.

description: Started out with calamari ($12), clam chowder ($6) and the blue cheese bread ($8).  All was great.  Two of my colleagues added crab meat (an EXTRA $6 each!) to their soup.  The guys all chose cioppino ($32 each) with pasta (an extra $2 each).  It was a large portion chuck full of clams, mussels, shrimp, and crab.  There was plenty of yummy sauce to sop up with bread.  I had the whole garlic crab ($41) and I was VERY DISAPPOINTED.  I was expecting a succulent crab dripping in garlicy butter, but instead got a very dry, over-cooked crab with almost no flavor.  Can't say I would recommend the mixed grill ($26) either as everything was over-cooked. We shared the tiramisu ($8.50 and the dessert duo ($14) along with cappucino ($4).  Bottom line - view is great, drinks were great, have the cioppino!  BTW, we sat at the bar and had a drink before dinner and the service AND the drinks were great.  Good bartender!  The service at the table was very good as well - just need someone to pay attention to the reviews on the overcooked crab!
author: Scilla M.

description: Amazing crab cakes (Remind them to bring you the sauce that should come with it). Super delicious chocolate cake.
author: Tania G.

description:
So, we went to Alcatraz on Saturday and wanted to have lunch in the city. We decided to walk down to Pier 39 and spotted Fog Harbor (formerly Chic's) The front waiting area had a lovely fireplace with waterfalls on either side. It was very inviting, so we went in.

The place is all white tablecloths and beautiful views. It was semi-crowded and smelled really good.

Our waitress Claudia was extemely friendly and helpful. She brought our drinks right away and sourdough bread just out of the oven. Yum! We all ordered crab dishes. When in San Francisco you have to get the seafood, yes?

I had the Bloody Mary (spicy), it was decent. The bf had the Angel Island Iced-Tea, he said was very refreshing. Some of us ordered the crab melt. The crab was delicious and the fries were hot and crispy. The bf ordered the crab louie...it was huge! He ate the crab and said it was good. My niece ordered the fried combo (shrimp, calamari and deep-fried fish)...another big portion. I didn't try any but everyone else did so it must have been good.

All in all a pleasant dining experience. Great service. Good food. Great view. The best company. A little pricey, but hey, it's the city. It was worth it.

If you are in the area of Pier 39, give Fog Harbor a try.

P.S. Alcatraz was a lot of fun. Should have gone there years ago.
author: Mary S.

description:
The view is nice. So is the little waiting area out front with the fireplace. The decor is attractive as well. Um, that's really all the good things I could say. I guess the service was ok, it wasn't bad at least. And we were seated quickly. And water seems to get refilled if you ask. 

As for the bad stuff. They screwed up my opentable reservation a couple times. Once just because, the other they weren't able to record the reservation because their connection was down. And I missed out on my points, dammit. The food is blah. The clam chowder, not so good. Small little cup. About on par with something out of a can. The seafood dishes are nothing special. Some highlights include overcooked prawns, cold mashed potatoes and dry fish. Plain presentation of food. As in I think once there was a tiny sprig of parsley on my plate.
author: The Sock S.

description:
This place got our business after the peeps at Eagle Cafe ignored us for 20+ mins after being seated (not even water was brought to the table)!

We were starving so everything sounded good.  I had the ahi tuna, friend had the stuffed salmon special and we both had a cup of the clam chowder.  The meal was tasty, the service friendly and prompt.  

Menu was a bit pricey but we were so hungry.  If it weren't for the nightmare of getting to this place we'd go back.
author: Sara S.

description:
we had a great table by the window, we had great food, the fish and chips and chowder. and daughter had the burger.

we had the calamari to start and it was yummy!

our server was a little strange but it was a good fun lunch
author: jessi s.

description:
So, let me first say my internet went out just as I was sending my review and erased it, BUT I'm determined to tell everyone else not to waste their time and money so I wrote the whole thing again.

If I could give this place .04 stars I would.  Prior to this my worst dinner was at McCormick and Kuleto's but at least they tried to seem like they cared about their customers.

My bf and I went there last night to celebrate our anniversary.  Granted we weren't looking for anything too fancy or high maintenance.  After we were seated it was close to 15 mins. until anyone came by, so we sat there with no water or anything.  When the waitress came she was abrupt and pretty rude.  We ordered our wine and the oyster appetizers.  The oysters were small and I've had better quality at the super market.

For dinner my bf ordered the rib eye and I had the seared prawns over linguine with the house salad to start.  When the salad came it was WILTED spring mix, two cherry tomatoes, one slice each of red onion and cucumber, and super stale croutons.  The food took a long time after that.  The steak was ok, nothing special and my pasta tasted worst then a noodle roni dinner.  I've had much better frozen food from Trader Joes.

We didn't order dessert bc we didn't want to waste anymore time or money.  So, overall - service was horrible, food was just as bad, and halfway through dinner they started blasting the AC until another customer complained for them to turn it off.

I wouldn't go back here if they paid for my dinner ! Sorry, I'm just pissed about a wasted meal out.
author: Kristine T.

description: We got a great table, not by the window but it still had a great view of the bay.  The server that we got was excellent.  She was very attentive to our needs and making sure that everything was good.  The food was very good and reasonably priced for the area.  I definitely recommend this place.
author: Manny L.

description:
Pleasant place on Pier 39 of Fisherman's Wharf.  It is everything you expect from a touristy San Francisco restaurant.

On July 3rd I was surprised to find it very easy to get in.  We were seated and served promptly.  Solid seafood cuisine (my chowder was superb).  The sourdough bread was out of this world (but hey, if you are in San Francisco you expect that).

The view from our table was the bay.  Absolutely stunning in the moonlight with Alcatraz sitting out there quietly.

A little on the pricey side but I walked away happy.
author: Randy W.

description: I went here with a lady friend. Of the restaurants at Pier 39, I'd say this is probably one of the best. The atmosphere is very nice. A great place for a date. Because we made an online reservation, we were treated to a complementary amuse bouche which was very good. For an appetizer, we had the crab cakes, which were amazing. The main course was a little disappointing. To be fair, perhaps ordering a crab melt and fries at a restaurant of this sort was my own fault, but my thinking was that they must be able to have an interesting and fancy take on this relatively lower class meal. I was wrong. It was just a regular greasy crab melt that I could have got anywhere on Fisherman's Wharf. It still tasted fine, but I was disappointed. My companion's meal was a much more classical fish dish, and looked quite scrumptious. Taken all together, I'd say our evening here warrants the 4 stars I've given them.
author: Stephen C.

description:
3.5 stars...I just came from a company sponsored event at Fog Harbor Fish House.  

The teasers served were incredible!  Lamb, to die for, crab cakes yes I'll have another and the peanut chicken skewers amazing!  I also feasted on the Cesar salad, and prime rib. Everything was really good but I had to give 3.5 stars because I didn't have the dining experience which can be different from a catered event.

Nonetheless everything I had was incredible! They just remodeled and the space is beautiful.  This restaurant is worth a visit just for the views alone.
author: Frankie F.

description: Great service, pretty descent food and a great view of the sunset over the golden gate bridge. Was going to order the crab cakes and the waiter recommended that I SHOULD NOT order them, said there may be a little to much breading and suggested another appetizer. I had the 1/2 crab fettuccine which was awesome. I would definitely eat here again and recommend it to anyone.
author: P B.

description:
Complete tourist restaurant. My friends were in from out of town and of course they wanted to eat in Fisherman's Wharf. My fish and chips were probably the most bland I've ever had. The service was pretty bad and our server was very rude. I waited tables for a long time and splitting checks sucks I admit but you don't have to be rude about it. 

Only reason I would consider giving it a star is because the bartender seems to be the only one who showed up to work.. great mojitos!

Skip it!
author: Sarah W.

description: the view was amazing. a lil pricey. I ordered the crabcakes, my bf ordered the trout, i think it was supposed to be a fillet (grilled) but it had a lot of fish bones. the staff was friendly.
author: Sheila M.

description:
Came here for Xmas Day, the Oysters with Mignonette are still incredible, as is all the food - mouth watering good.

but WTF?? no Happy Hour on Xmas?  That was the biggest draw last year, and they put the sign out - but the bartenders said it was a no-go this year.  That saddened me for about 2 seconds.  (i still love their food)

Although the bartender was a bit of a bitch all around this time,  If you don't want to work on Xmas, then you should find someone else to cover your shift, and not be grumpy with the people who come it.. I'm just saying..
author: Samanta V.

description:
Sat at the bar on 1 of the nicest days San Fran had this yr.  GR8 views!  Had a perfect Sunday afternoon.  

Raymond, bartender, was extremely attentive & courteous.  We concocted a new martini, which i suggested should be their signature drink!  

The manager, Micheal, was professional and came over to make sure entire experience was to our liking.  Hubby luved the baked oysters.  

FYI: Spoke to friends of ours who live in San Franciso, and although this is suppossidly a 'tourist' place, locals visit here on a regular basis.
author: LINDA R.

description: I love the food here!!! Such a great view during the day and the portions are massive. Great drinks. Had the steamed mussels, their famous clam chowder, crab louis salad (huge dish), crab roll, seafood cioppino... Everything was delicious. Sat a huge booth, plenty to share. Really great experience... a must try!
author: Vanessa L.

description: The owners could have lazily rested on their location laurels and served boring, expensive tourist fare. Instead, they take the high road serving fresh sea food provided by friendly, professional staff. It's the exceptional restaurant indeed  that is right in the heart of one of the biggest tourist traps on the west coast that provides really good food. Our server "Bong" (not a typo) was courteous and prompt and got our order right. On the downside: my salmon was a bit dry, the atmosphere is unimaginative and the place is packed to the rafters. If you're stuck at Pier 39 for whatever reason, this is the place to go.
author: JJ M.

description: The popcorn shrimp appetizer with jalepeno dipping sauce was excellent.  I decided to have the pan seared chicken and it was great, but my wife did not particularly like the fish and chips, she said it was too greasy. Our waiter was phenomenal and quite professional.  Dessert was a real treat of course, my wife chose the creme brulee and she loved it.  While I decided to have the raspberry cheese cake, hmmm.  Overall we enjoyed our visit to Fog Harbor Fish House and would recommnend to eat there anytime you are at Pier 39.
author: Darryl H.

description: My family had lunch at Fog Harbor during a recent vacation.  The meal was a general disappointment.  We ordered 2 entrees - the salmon salad and the fish & chips.  More on the food in a moments, but first the highlights.  One, the view is wonderful.  Two, the service - though quirky- was generally good. Lastly, the sourdough bread is incredible.  Unfortunately, the good food ended there.  FIrst, the fish & chips.  The fish was greasy, and the breading far too thick.  Also, the fries tasted as though they were cooked in dirty oil leftover from shrimp poppers or something similar.  As for the salmon salad, the salmon was unevenly cooked, and the salad both bland and overdressed.
author: David C.

description: The clam chowder was amazing! Their popcorn shrimp was quite delicious as well. Not to mention, their swordfish was out of this world, too. The crème brûlée & bread pudding were really tasty desserts. The service itself wasn't all that great - but all in all, it was a great experience.
author: Davey K.

description: Excellent food and relaxing, yet fun atmosphere with beautiful view at Pier 39. Greeted by friendly bartender while waiting for our table! Unfortunately our waiter wasn't so friendly... He acted like we were doing him a favor, a bit snooty. We didn't let it ruin our evening and would definitely return!
author: Gail M.

description: grilled salmon was very fresh and prepared just right . delicious seafood experience ..
author: Scott L.

description: Myself and my girl and another couple ate her Saturday night, the place rocks.   I had the crusted Ahi Tuna and garlic mashed and t was the best i've ever had.   My girl had the Seafood Capinnio and that was also great, the other couple both had the Clam Chowder bread bowl, being from Boston Im very picky on chowda, but that chowda was some of the best i have had.   Our Dinner was $ 104, but there where a few drinks also added in there....will be back for sure...
author: Chris H.

description: Madison was awesome as our waitress. She was not pushy and we stayed longer and spent more! He is a keeper!
author: Rene C.

description: This is one of the pricey seafood places at Fisherman's Wharf, on Pier 39. We treat ourselves to one of these on each visit, and this time we chose Fog Harbor. We asked for and were given a window seat with a very nice view. Our waiter was friendly and knowledgeable about the menu. I had the Cioppino and it was outstanding. My kids enjoyed the garlic steamed crab, and my wife loved the seafood penne. There is a clean restroom inside the restaurant - shhh, don't tell anyone! My only complaint with the experience is the utterly bogus 3.5% health care surcharge tacked on to every bill. Being California, there's always some nonsense like this going on that people are forced to deal with. I will leave it to you to investigate the origins of this surcharge, but the bottom line is that restaurants are not, in fact required to apply this charge, and their reason for doing so amounts to a political temper tantrum at customer's expense. When I questioned the waiter about this, he gave the straight-faced party line as expected. Can't blame him, really.
author: Paul K.

description: We went here with my Grandma, husband and 4 month old baby. The hostesses were pleasant and very accommodating. You can order wine by the glass or glass and a half (which I have never heard of before but really liked the idea). I would give this place 5 stars, but I ordered prawns and it seemed like they were more like jumbo shrimp. Still delicious. If I lived in San Francisco I would come back.
author: Darcy R.

description: Our family of 6 (4 adults, 2 kids) recently ate here and it's a-ok.  The fish and chips were pretty good, the clam chowder was ok (had some sand in it though...ugh!), the swordfish was decent, the crab cakes (2, small patties) were fine and the sourdough bread was also fine. The kids menu was adequate and the desserts looked good but we finished our meal around...11pm and were starting to fall asleep, so we had to skiddadle.  This place is a fair, reliable Fisherman's Wharf option with a psuedo-New England atmosphere.  I'd go back again...someday.
author: yvette l.

description: My family loves this place. Great views, good food and spacious enough to accommodate groups with kids. Nice environment tucked onto Fishermans Wharf. Love the Popcorn Shrimp.
author: Grant B.

description: The food was delicious and our waiter Derrick was fantastic. The crab roll was excellent and a nice portion. Sweet potato fries delicious. My husband is a fussy person that likes his burger well done. This was cooked to perfection and the grilled onions were tasty and sweet.
author: Trish T.

description: Clam chowder was the best I ever had. Full of clam. The Ahi Tuna was cooked perfectly. Booked marked this for future visits and recommendations.
author: Rob C.

description:
I would only give it one star. But, due to the Ahi Tuna 2 ways I'd give it the extra stars. The service was really way below par and slow. The bath room was totally out of paper tower. 

p.s. I don't see how the clam chowder is award winning. I couldn't find one piece of clam in their chowder. The view is GREAT but over all......... over price!
author: John A.

description:
My family and I were on peir 39 and were amazed by how touristy it was- all the places seemed to attract tourists with cameras and I heart San Fran sweatshirts. We wanted to find a place with good food- especially fish without feeling like total tourists. Although the seating hostess asked us where we were from (showing they get tons of tourists) she was super nice and got us a great table with stunning view.
The waiter was accommodating and kind as well as professional- he spent a bit too long eying my sisters ID when she ordered wine (she is 23). 
The bread was hot and fresh and a great way to start. We also got a smoked salmon appetizer which was incredible. 
My dad order the fish & chips and really enjoyed them. My mom got a platter of different fish and shrimp with rice pilaf made w/ wild rice and broccoli. It was all excellent and the fish was so fresh tasting. My sister got the special- a very tasty white fish that is from the coast of Vietnam. It was prepared in a wonderful sauce on top of creamy mashed potatoes and wonderful spinach. My pan-seered chicken also had a great sauce and mashed potatoes/spinach. It was wonderful.
The waiter somehow convinced me to get dessert even though I was stuffed. All the desserts looked to die for. I got the caramel toffee cake- it was wonderful.
I would highly recommend going here if you are visiting San Francisco and want a less touristy place. It is pricy but I would say it is all worth it.
author: Allison K.

description: We went for dungeness crab, and oh boy we got a huge serving of it. It was delicious. The location is really nice, service was great. We had a couple visiting from Australia and this was a great introduction for them to great San Francisco food.
author: Andrew K.

description:
My wife and I loved the food and the service given to us. The ambiance was superb. It was a perfect place to hold our anniversary, which happened to be on the 4rth of July. Kudos to the wait staff especially Steven who not only took great care of us but also the table next to us. Would like to make a shout out to manager Seth  who personally greeted us a Happy Anniversary. 

We got a real treat as they had a wide selection of great desserts to choose from... They were DIVINE! We highly recommend this place. If there were more stars to rate this restaurant, I would surely give it to them. Keep up the good work guys. God Bless You all.
author: Dino B.

description: Food is delish! Super fresh and tasty! The portions are a good size so you're not left hungry. I loved it!
author: Mina D.

description: We decided to go here for my daughter's sweet 16 birthday party.  We had been here before and have always really enjoyed it.  The food was wonderful.  I had the salmon with the lemon dill sauce.  It was so fresh and tasty.  Plus the service was outstanding. Overall we had a great time.
author: C. K.

description: Found this randomly walking around the wharf. Amazing! Great attentive staff! Can be dressy or casual, I went in a t-shirt. They lay the napkin in your lap for you! Great menu. Great tea selection. Ordered the mahi mahi with salsa, veggies and mash potatoes and the tuna steak. Both were excellent! Get the tuna! Great food for the price and view of the pier.
author: Rhea S.

description: This restaurant offers beautiful views of the sunset and of the bay. The food is good. All restaurants in the area have great food, usually fresh. Service is sometimes tough because of the frequentation but i've never been too many issues there.
author: Remy L.

description: I lived in the bay area for 14 years, and have eaten a lot of clam chowder. I was pleased with the clam chowder bread bowl and recommend it. The halibut special was very good, and the crabbed stuffed lobster was good, though not excellent. The service we received was excellent and we had a party of 7. The waiting area is beautiful and comfortable with a fireplace and comfy couches, a nice retreat from the crowds. We had reservations for middle of the afternoon on a Saturday, and it was a good thing because even at 2:30 they were very busy and walk ins needed to wait. Overall a very good experience, we will be back!
author: Dawn P.

description: We stopped by for dinner without a reservation and got seated in a very busy area outside the bathrooms. We were right next to the server's station with a constant flow of traffic. We were even jostled a few times by servers in a hurry. We finally asked and were allowed to move a table back out of the flow of traffic. Our server was very friendly and the manager was nice too when he stopped by the table. The sourdough bread is really delicious. Its served with ice cold butter though - I think its nice if the butter is a least warm enough to spread. I had the whole steamed Dungeness crab with fingerling potatoes and corn on the cob. I've had king crab legs many times, but a whole crab was a new experience. The crab meat was delicious but very difficult to extract from the body. The legs were typical and easier although much smaller in this type of crab. The potatoes and corn were fine. My husband had a seafood pasta dish and he thought it was good. He orders this type of dish often and said it was good but not great compared to other places. Overall, with the amount of seafood restaurants available to choose from, you can probably do better than this one.
author: Sheila L.

description: Best steamed clam I've ever tried!!!
author: Shen L.

description: Absolutely LOVE this place. As soon as we approached the restaurant we were met by a most delightful young man - Anthony. He shared some of the highligts of the place and the food and got us in the door and to our beautiful table - right on the water overlooking pier 39! The service and food were OUTSTANDING - this has become one of our haunts whenever we head to the city! I highly recomend this place ... if you care about great service, great food, yummy wines and unique locations, you will love Fog Harbor Fish House
author: Sharon F.

description:
The view is great,  the booths are roomy and the food probably would have been satisfying, but the service was terrible.  I sat in a booth for 15 minutes and not one person came to the table.   I asked one person and he said he was setting up a table, one waiter was showing up at the table nearby four  times, and one table was seated after me and got their order.

Maybe they do not prefer single women.
author: marilyn d.

description: Unfortunately Fog Harbor Fish House was a bit of a let down for us. We had a special crab ceviche appetizer which was okay. I think the problem with crab and acidity though is that the crab flavor just gets completely hidden. Entrees were not great. My wife got the mixed grill fish. The sauce was nothing like what the menu described - it was just missing. The fish was over cooked and dry. I had the seafood cioppino. The sauce tasted like canned plum tomatoes boiled briefly with some dried herbs and was over salted. The seafood was end piece leftovers. The only reason for the second star is service. Our waiter was great. I just wished he had asked us not to order!
author: Timothy L.

description: I had a lovely lunch there couple of days ago. It is quite a dining room with spacious corridors and large tables. You dont feel cooped up at all. However the food is mediocre for those dollars. My pasta was barely cooked and the sauce was a bland. Although I liked the service even the server guy had no clue about the menu.
author: Emre T.

description:
Appetizer:
The clam chowder was just average.  It arrived in a plain white bowl garnished with some parsley that did not seem very fresh.  On the menu it said that the chowder was award winning but my guest and I did not feel that it was great.  The soup was not hot enough when it came out so I felt that it was slightly older.  My guest commented that he had a couple pieces of clam where that was sand.  I however did not come across any sand.

The second appetizer was the crab cakes.  I felt that the crab cakes were well made and had a good flavor.  I felt that the crab was fresh which is very important, especially for a restaurant located on the pier.  With that said, I'm not sure about the salad that accompanies the crab cake.  The salad had a good dressing that was somewhat tart and a little spicy.  It was very good but overpowered the natural flavors of the crab.  By itself, the crab cake is good but I would suggest pairing it with a salad that has a lighter dressing that can enhance the flavors of the crab more rather than over power it.

Our final appetizer was the Jumbo Shrimp Cocktail and it was actually our favorite.  The shrimp was fresh and large.  It was served in a martini glass filled with cocktail sauce and the cocktail sauce was perfect!  It had just the right blend of horseradish in it and it was delicious.  I would definitely order this dish again.

Entrees:
My husband ordered the whole lobster and it was served with two sides - mashed potatoes and corn on the cob.  He said the corn on the cob was very good.  The mash potatoes were good also but compared to the corn, it wasn't as memorable.  The lobster was fresh and "sweet".  It was a little on the smaller side but adequate since we had a few appetizers. 

I got the shrimp scampi.  The shrimp was in an oval dish filled with oil, garlic, and parsley with tons of shrimp.  The rest of the plate was filled with wild rice and fresh vegetables.  Instead of the mash potatoes and I requested wild rice.  

I was extremely pleased with the wild rice because I felt that it went very well with the shrimp.  The vegetables were abundant and I was only able to eat about one third of it.  Now onto the shrimp - it was delicious and nicely flavored.  The shrimp was cooked just right and was very crisp.  I was happy with the portioning, often times restaurants will skimp on the shrimp but I felt that Fog Harbor was more than generous with their portioning.

Service:
A bit on the slow side
author: Jo B.

description: I can't say I've had food any better. (May have had some just as good, but not better.) I had the Ahi, excellent taste, my boyfriend, the salmon - loved it. We also had the bread bowl of clam chowder and Cesar salad combo which we shared and truly enjoyed it. The sourdough bread was terrific. No room for dessert but they leave little biscoff cookies (some of my favorites) with the check.
author: Sharon R.

description: It was tasty, a bit on the $$ side, but hey it is in a tourist trap in San Francisco, pier39.  I had swordfish which was very good. The Ahi that my daughter had was a bit overcooked, it was supposed to be seared, but I think they left on in the pan too long.
author: Scott C.

description: Alright, you can call me a tourist!  I've taken numerous visitors to the wharf for clam chowder, sourdough bread, and a ton of salt water taffy.  We usually just stroll around and end up in whatever restaurant is available since they all mostly serve the same things.  This has been my favorite one BY FAR.  There was a bit of a wait in the beginning, about 30 minutes but it was completely worth it.   The inside was right by the water, great atmosphere and comfortable.  The food came seriously so fast I didn't even get a chance to blink.  They must have the kitchen in some kind of military boot camp order if the drinks came out before the drink!  All the food was delicious and I will definitely be back here.  I feel like such a tourist giving a place like this 5 stars but I can't help it!  The food, the night, the company, the atmosphere this evening was just perfect =)
author: Tiffany L.

description: Amazing food!  The crab was delicious and the salmon was out of the world! Must try! Best crab I ever had.
author: S J.

description: After reading on Yelp how great their clam chowder is, I was really looking forward to trying a cup. Unfortunately, the cup was completely forgotten and I was left with two pieces of (delicious, fortunately) undipped sourdough bread. I ended up having the crab melt, which was pretty good. This place is worth going for the view and the bread, as far as I know, but that's about it. I'd stop by again for some clam chowder, but I'm feeling it's a little risky now.
author: Kyle H.

description: Service was excellent, appetizers were great. The food was just okay. Sometimes salt goes a long way.
author: Lynda E.

description:
Went here with my family last night for my birthday. It was my husband, my 22 year old son, 18 year old daughter and myself. My son was late for our reservation as he got stuck in traffic. We checked in with the hostess 10 minutes before our reservation time and explained to her that he was going to be late. She suggested that we wait in the lounge area for him and let her know when he arrived. Beautiful lounge area, nice couches and fireplace! We had a cocktail and really enjoyed sitting by the fire.
 
When he arrived we were seated at a nice table with a view of Alcatraz. We sat there for a very long time before we were ever acknowledged. When our waitress finally came over to our table she took our drink and appetizer order and tried to get us to order our meal at the same time. I had some questions and hadn't decided what I wanted yet. I asked her a couple of questions and also asked what she recommended.  She was very vague with her answer and went away without really recommending anything. From that point on the only time she came to our table was when she had something to drop off. She took our dinner order when she brought the calamari (which was the highlight of the meal by the way). She never came by to check on us our ask how our meals were. 3 of us had leftovers that we wanted to bring home and when we finally got her over to ask for boxes it was obvious that 3 plates still had quite a bit of food left on them and she asked if 1 box was okay!  She never offered us dessert (and it was my birthday! Although she did not know that, and she also did not know that my daughter had baked cupcakes for me that were waiting at home). I saw her and the rest of the wait staff bring a large tray of beautiful desserts to other tables to see and decide what they wanted to order. I really wanted to see the desserts up close but we were not given that opportunity.

 It really didn't appear that she was treating her other tables this way, she seemed much more attentive to her other tables than she was to us which left us feeling that for some reason she just didn't like us!

The food was good, not spectacular, but the poor service outweighed the food by a long shot! We would not go back here for a meal but would definitely go back to the lounge area for cocktails and appetizers as it was very warm and inviting!
author: Vickie S.

description: This place has a great view of the bay! It's directly on Pier 39 so beware of lots of crowds. My boyfriend and I went here for lunch and really enjoyed our meals. I had the salmon and I wanted to finish it all! It was delicious! Even the vegetables were great! lol. Our waiter was very friendly and gave us some options for sightseeing around the city.
author: Erica L.

description:
I have never been to this location but the samples I've had at a travel convention on Alcatraz was delicious.  I believe it was Ahi Tuna Tartar with a hint of cavier.  Needless to say, I went back for seconds.

At the event, they handed out little pocket size menus - very good idea.  Of course they do chowders, salads, sandwiches, pastas, rib eye etc.  Located at Pier 39.  Has live lobster and crab tank, it says.  Someplace I'll check out eventually.
author: Bernadette M.

description:
to be honest I expected better
seemed kinda like a tourist trap that thrives on the view/location
food was, sadly, about as good as Red Lobster, but more expensive
after we had ordered our food, about 5 min later it came out, which is sort of disturbing considering you just ordered $20+ seafood, almost like it was pre-made under a warming lamp, and it half tasted that way
wasn't awful, but definitely not worth the price
good view though
author: Dayne P.

description:
The food was mediocre. There are so many other places in the City that offer much better food for the same price if not, cheaper!

Okay, it's a tourist place but that is a sorry excuse for bad food. Okay, so the portions are large but that just means I have more crap too get through. Okay, there's a nice view of the water and the restaurant looks reasonably good but that is not what I paid for! I could sit outside and enjoy the same view for free. 

I went one night and I ordered the Ciopino and was soooo looking forward to it. I was soooo disappointed. The sauce was not bad but just not very good. The ahi two ways (poke and seared) was okay. The fish (salmon and mahi mahi) was dry, the shrimp was flavorless. The tiramisu was good but I could have done without the obscene amount of whipped cream on top. The meal for two was about $100, including tip. Don't waste your money, go someplace else.
author: Mary R.

description:
The location of this restaurant is killer. 

After spotting it yesterday morning, I took the long trek back down to the pier in search of the beautiful view and a fantastic seafood dinner. 

Beautiful view - check. 

Fantastic seafood dinner - not so much. 

The crab appetizer was tiny. The wines offered boring. My salmon was overcooked, my mahi-mahi had zero seasoning, and the rice was completely dry. The food overall was bland and unadventurous. 
The service was good however so I gave them a star for that. 

Final Verdict: Nothing to write home about!
author: Christina B.

description: This restaurant was "A-OK."  There was really nothing special about the restaurant.  It was a nice atmosphere, the bread was good.  My husband loved the clam chowder bowl and the wine was nice.  However, the food was okay.  The vegetables were far too greasy and oily for my preference.
author: andrea m.

description:
20% discount with AAA membership

I had a late lunch on a Sunday afternoon. The service was good. The garlic mash potatoes were yummy.
author: Xica D.

description: Simply the best crab cakes and clam chowder my wife and I have ever had.
author: Brad P.

description: Delicious!!!  Nikko hands down best costumer service.. Had a wonderful dinner food is great..
author: Sandy C.

description:
So I think this used to be Chic's before or something and they changed the name, but the chowder, fish and chips, and calamari that we usually come back for was the same and still quite good.

I'm surprised at how bad the reviews here are, but speaking for the three dishes that I go back for, it really isn't so bad.  

I went back something like three weeks ago.  Sometimes it's nice to just wander around touristy areas for no reason, so we thought of heading to the city to check out the wharf.  I ordered the same dishes I always have and did not notice anything particularly off.  the boyfriend did not like batter of the fish, but i loved it.  i also liked how the calamari is light, though i ditch the cocktail sauce for the tartar sauce that comes with the fish n chips plate.  the chowder is always good but i feel like i've had better in other places around the bay.

it's good, but nothing ridiculously good.  i'd still come back if i ever had to wander around the pier are again.  that being said, the view of the water is very nice and the general ambience of the place bumps this up to like a 3.5, really.  good service too, considering it's a tourist joint.
author: J C.

description: Best clam chowder I've ever had. A bit on the pricey side but well worth it. Great atmosphere and views.
author: Jason M.

description: WONDERFUL!  the service was quick and efficient, the food DELICIOUS!  we arrived at 5pm and asked for  window seating and were accomodated immediately. This place is very friendly and welcoming, if you do have to wait theres a nice patio with fireplace to enjoy a drink while you wait for seating.  I Highly reccomend Fog Harbor Fish House at pier 39,  and order the Red Chili Shrimp appetizer, nothing short of spicy and delicious, My Salmon was cooked to perfection. the entire experience from the moment we arrived to leaving was excellent...
author: Barbara M.

description:
Ate here with family Saturday night. Party of 11.

Service was pretty slow, it took nearly 3 hours for the one course meal then desert. Luckily that gave us time to catch-up, but we were pretty hungry there.

Food was OK. Nothing came out "bad" enough to return to the kitchen, but it was truly mediocre.
author: Jeff V.

description: When I arrived, there had still been people waiting for a table. Luckily for us, we made a reservation for lunch day. Our hostess seated us right next to wall-sized windows, which had a beautiful view of the San Francisco harbor. We could see Alcatraz and Fisherman's Wharf. Known for its oysters, we ordered a dozen, followed by the seafood platter. The food was quite delicious.
author: Gary H.

description: Had the clam chowder bread bowl, they were not shy with the clams! View was great and the pricing was reasonable.
author: Chris W.

description: Had an amazing night here with a view of the bay and delicious seafood.  Highly recommend this place.  We had great and attentive service from Khaiman, look out of him, and were able to have a romantic evening out at fisherman's wharf all thanks to Fog Harbor Fish House!
author: Lauren H.
