description: In town from San Diego with my brother from ATL.  Tried Fog Harbor out bc we were at Pier 39.  Great place, reasonably priced, good service.  We got the Mussels Curry appetizer which was delicious, the Field Green salad which was huge and very good, and the Sea Food Penne which was a vey goo choice as well.
author: Doug T.

description: Nice atmosphere. Poor service. Mediocre food.
author: Brett M.

description:
The food is not that great, OVER-PRICED!!!.
I came here to try their seafood dishes, my friend came with me who is allergic to seafood.  He ordered a Filet Mignon.  Don't know where they buy their Filet, but they are like RUBBER! You cannot eat that S*#$ at all!!!  I thought my friend was joking until I took the knife and tried to cut it, the knife cannot cut thru the beef.  The waitress saw the plate and asked what's wrong, she can bring him something else.  He told her about the Filet and he preferred nothing else.  Waitress spoke to manager and gave us a 20% discount. 

The atmosphere is great and the service was excellent.  
Food is not.
author: Mike C.

description: Went to Fog Harbor Fish House for my birthday with a group of girl friends. We loved the baked oysters, the red curry mussels, and the blue cheese garlic bread for appetizers. I had the ahi tuna for my entree- it was delicious and the portion was bigger than I expected. . The service was fantastic- everyone was friendly and gave us great recommendations of what to order. They really went out of their way to make my birthday special.  I would definitely recommend it!
author: Meera V.

description: For a vegetarian, this place is very limited on it's choices.  I could basically order a salad or some plain pasta.  I went for both.  The salad came out first and was enough for a table of four to share as an appetizer.  Beautifully prepared, I got a mix of all the flavors in each bite.  I was pleased.  Next came the pasta, and let me just say that it was the most delicious bowl of pasta that I've ever eaten!  The sauce was a basic olive oil blend, no red sauce.  It came with sun-dried tomatoes, spinach, and basil on top.  Portions were plenty and I left feeling satisfied, not too full.  I was told by my omnivore friends that the seafood was great as well.  Definitely a great spot after spending a day at Angel Island and Alcatraz, and with the spectacular view a great place to treat out of town guests.
author: Beenish K.

description: Our server Khaiman is awesome! So much fun and super helpful!! Love it! All the bartenders are great. Super beautiful spot. Right on the water. Great atmosphere. And family friendly! Food is amazing!
author: Kylee R.

description:
We held a lunch here to celebrate sending my brother off to the Navy.  We had very large party, and though larger parties often get stuck with one server, we had several waiters in and out of our private section regularly.  Even the manager, Greg, checked in with us several times to make sure we had everything we needed.  Never did we have to search them down to ask for something extra, they were consistently available and more than happy to accommodate.  
     The food was fairly priced, particularly for the quality and the location.  Great spot following a cable car ride, or right before a leisurely walk down the pier.  
     We were there with a large party, but I can see it being the perfect spot for a party of two as well.  Enjoy!
author: Alexis K.

description: Attended a retirement luncheon here and must say the views are fantastic.  We were in the private dining room and it can be a little tight if you have over 30 people.  We had submitted out menus earlier but it still took awhile to receive our appetizers.  The clam chowder was pretty good and I was glad I didn't select the Caesar Salad- it was two pieces of lettuce and  a crouton.  A co-worker said Caesar must've gone broke! The salmon and shrimp were both delicious and moist.  We also enjoyed cheesecake for dessert.  Service was good and they constantly were refilling our water glasses.  For a nice dinner with a great view of the sea lions and Alcatraz, I would definitely return.
author: Chrisy C.

description:
Average and Over Priced.

We asked "do you have a lunch menu?"  Answer was 'yes' and we were seated.  View was OK....basically looking out at the harbor, and other piers.  Not much to write home about.  Turns out that the lunch menu is really just the dinner menu, not much to choose from for less than $15/$20.....not much at all.  So, DON'T GO HERE FOR LUNCH.

Food was OK at best.  Clam Chowder in Sour Dough Bread Bowls.....well, the bowls were mostly bread, very little chowder.  Calimari was good, small, and overpriced.  The slider appetizer (3 burgers) was SMALL.....and just OK.  

None of us would return here.  Admittedly, there are not that many quality choices on Fisherman's Wharf, but the prices here are too high and there are not many lunch selections.  

Maybe it's OK for dinner, but they should have said 'we are really more of a dinner restaurant'.  

Recommendation.....try somewhere else.
author: Jay J.

description: Being a local, I try and stay away from Pier 39, but with parents and in-laws in town, we decided to stop here for dinner based on a recommendation from a friend. I am glad we did! We were able to get a table for 6 by the window and we had a spectacular view. The service was prompt and friendly. Everyone in my party seemed pleased by the food. My FIL ordered a whole [steamed] lobster and I got to try a bite and it was delicious! I ordered the shrimp skewers which were good, but nothing special. I probably wouldn't order them again, just because I would want to try something else next time. My MIL ordered fish cooked a special way and they were able to accommodate her requests. The filet mignon was also delicious according to my wife. All in all, this is a great restaurant. It's pricey, but we all thought it was well worth it and everyone was happy, which is a miracle considering we were entertaining the very picky in-laws! Oh, and the sourdough bread is amazing. It comes out warm and you smother it in butter.....to die for! I'll be back next time the relatives come to town. It's a nice place without feeling too touristy.
author: Lulu B.

description:
I've been to Fog Harbor twice so far (the only two times I made it to Pier 39 in the past year) and felt the service and food was incredible both times. The view is great--I could even see a sea otter swimming in the Bay from my seat! The restaurant is very well-kept and clean (including the restrooms).

I ordered fish both times, and had the sustainably harvested salmon this past weekend and it was perfect! I was also in a big enough group that we ordered almost every different kind of dessert and I enjoyed every single one. :)

Although this would be a great place for a nice date, I'd find a slightly quieter place for an intimate, romantic date. The restaurant was bustling even in the late afternoon.

Definitely recommend it ... and save room for dessert!
author: Tracy H.

description:
I use to live in the Bay Area so I have never done any of the tourist things. I had my niece with me so I decided to give one of these places a try. We were cold and decided to step into the Fog Harbor to warm up with a bowl of clam chowder.
I thought the service was excellent. The chowder was good. Creamy and had small pieces of clam. The sourdough bread bowl was fresh. I really enjoyed the view. Prices were high but well worth it due to the service, view, and ambiance.
author: Bobbi Jean H.

description: great place to have a nice seafood meal. fish was very fresh, large portions of dishes, and very very tasty food. They were very accommodating to children.
author: The Critic A.

description:
Ok so the one star is for the time me and my husband came here for lunch one saturday afternoon.  He got the lobster tails and I got the seafood penne.  I was not that impressed with the penne but the lobster was so good I wished I had ordered that instead.  The waitress was so friendly and would check on us every time if we need anything else etc.  The view was great and we said that we would definitely be back the next time we're at pier39.

So now months later, a friend of mine who moved from NY to CA is traveling from Fresno to SF.  I suggested that we go to pier39 and meet up with a couple of our other friends.  Now here comes the "bad experience" part.  

We ordered Clam chowders, Fish and Lobster.  Well, I did order the Lobster because it was so good the last time we were here.  Wrong choice.  It was the saltiest Lobster ever!  Why not just give me pure rock salt and charge me $32 at that! Im not kidding it is real salty.  To top it off, our waiter didn't even bother refilling our water.  Well, I know some of us didn't order any drinks and just water but can't you even bother ASK if we want our glasses refilled.  After all you're still getting 18%  or $35++ in tips.  3.5% health fee is $6.88.  WTH is that for when you gave me salty lobster and no water refill.  Now, I always ask the waiter to leave the little desert menu wherever I go as I have the tendency to change my mind about getting a desert afterward.  He didn't even bother.  Oh and did I tell you that I was still munching on my french fries when he took the plate right then and there.

So far, this has been my WORST experience in a restaurant ever.  I will NEVER go back and I will NEVER recommend this place to anyone ever!  At the end of the night we ended up paying well under $300 for lousy service and bad food. What's funny is at the receipt there is an option for Additional Tip even after they put in 18%.  Never again.
author: DaYeen M.

description:
Right on Pier 39

Clam Chowder: They say it's the best, It was good but wasn't Jaw dropping. It  taste like better than average clam chowder.

Good: Quick Seating, Near the big Parking Structure.Nice view of Alcatraz(if there windows are clean)

Bad:Can be on expensive side but really what you would expect given the location.
author: David Q.

description: This was by far the best restaurant my boyfriend and I went to while in San Francisco.  We were skeptical that all of the restaurants down in Fisherman's Wharf  (especially Pier 39) would be a tourist trap, and then Fog Harbor Fish House by far exceeded our expectations.  The meal was amazing from beginning to end.  First, the view from every table is spectacular.  We were fortunate enough to catch an Americas Cup race while sipping on a cocktail.  Then our VERY attentive server Rudy gave us detailed recommendations about all of the specials.  Everything on their menu is appealing.  We ended up with the crab salad and fish and chip combo plate.  All of the seafood was EXTREMELY fresh and by far the best calamari I have EVER had.  Although we had a couple of hiccups with the order, the staff went over and above to make sure that we received the best experience.  Not only did the server Rudy say to us several times "We strive for perfection at Fog Harbor" but the manager came over to us and personally apologized for any problems with the meal.  For such a small mistake the team at Fog Harbor made sure that they fixed it right away and that we walked away pleased with our meal.  And boy did we!!!   I will recommend this restaurant to anyone I know visiting San Francisco and until next time I will dream about those calamari!!!  Eat at Fog Harbor....I promise you won't be disappointed!!!
author: Liz F.

description: Bernie the waiter was extremely personable  and very friendly which made my lunch at the Fisherman's Wharf location that much more enjoyable.  The clam chowder was outstanding and so was the crab Caesar salad.  I would recommend them for lunch!
author: Dave D.

description: Tasty, decently priced, nice view. Of course it's a bit of a madhouse being on Pier 39.
author: Jim B.

description: had lunch at fog harbor and foods were all delicious.... crabs, oysters , mussels and desserts as well...... thank you to our server Shawna ,for making it possible, you're the best...traffic & parking was horrible....also, thank you  to Bernie g.... great place, and excellent foods..
author: Pamela V.

description:
When you have out-of-towners visiting you there are a few touristy things you really must do.  One of those things is a visit to the wharf.  It was on such a Saturday that we discovered Fog Harbor Fish House.

Having grown up around here I have a fairly typical disdainful attitude about 'tourist trap' type places, I have to tell you, I was pleasantly surprised by my experience here.  The prices were not nearly as bad as I expected (about $30/person with drinks but without dessert) and the food was actually quite tasty.  It was here that I had my first experience with oysters, and raw ones at that! The cocktail sauce served with them had just the right amount of sinus clearing heat, the oysters themselves were very fresh and delicious. 

Between the three of us we had the seared tuna salad, a pasta dish and a burger, we were well satisfied with our meal.  The wine list had several pleasant options and the view was, of course, spectacular.  It was one of those rare days when the sun was shining, the sky was clear and the water was sparkling, the perfect day to enjoy a table by the window, which we did. There was a bit of a miscue at the beginning of the meal, we hung out in the bar while waiting for our table and despite being there for about 15 minutes never did manage to get one of the bar tenders to take our drink order.

What made our experience though was our server, Jay, apparently it was his first weekend there (though not his first weekend as a waiter), he was quick, attentive without hovering, friendly and funny.

While I don't often spend time in this part of town you can bet that the next time I have visitors we'll make our way back here.
author: Renae H.

description: Nice atmosphere. The waiter kept our drinks full and the.food.was great.
author: Nicolle B.

description:
Good service
Fish, crab, sourdough bread, cioppino, etc.
Finished off with birthday apple crumble to die for... 
How can it be wrong?
author: Juliana T.

description: Had a great dinner here in November.  I had the mixed grill and my husband had a red clam based pasta dinner.  Both were delicious.  The place is beautiful and we had a really nice table.  The service was fantastic.  I would definately go back there and I highly recommend it.
author: Kas B.

description:
Walked by here one time after my cousin's Gf's bday dinner at Bubba Gumps and I wanted to check it out one of these days. I was like.."this place looks cool to chill at...juander how it is." Decided to take my friend who luckily is down with the Pier frisco touristy crap even though she is from the bay and not the out of town decent. 

Sorry...I aint one of those stuck up critics who gives a damn about a great ambience because I am one who makes the best out of any situation.

I guess when you walk into the joint.... its all stuck-uppie high class or whatever for tourists...but i ignored that fact since i just wanted some brew, good calamari, and a new spot to check out. Maybe it was just kinda dead for the night...(cuz it was a tuesday when we came through)...but i felt like I was sitting in the lower section of a Warriors game being too loud or something. 

I was like.."Oh..you think its okay that we laugh this loudly? It is okay to have a good time right?"

I think it was appropriate because the bartender seemed to appreciate our company. She informed us we were different from the typical customers. 

There are tables there for a sit down dinner and stuff, but I decided it be best to chill at the bar because I thought it would be more fun. 

The bartender we had was really sociable and rocked a friendly smile...so she provided a comfortable atmosphere. She even made us one of her famous cong-cock-shong...the all so famous....PBJ. it was good...nothing strong..just smoov since we were knockin down 24oz pints of brew and vodka tonics on the side. 

i'll definitely be back juan of these days. maybe when i feel like being pier 39 tourishy or something.  I dont ask for much in life if my satisfactions for calamri and brew are fulfilled...so i give this spot a five holy smackonlies. an extra hi pibe to the bartender. thanks.
author: Romes K.

description:
HEALTH FEE?
HA HA you have got to be kidding me. I am searching in advance for anyone adding on "heath fees" or "resort fees" Anyone willing to scam their customers like that deserves to go byebye.
author: cliff m.

description: The one star is for the location and ambience of the restaurant.  We came here yesterday for lunch.  I ordered the crab melt and my hubby got the fried calamari.  Half way through my crab melt, I started tasting vomit in my mouth.  The vomit taste was so real that I seriously thought maybe I vomitted in my mouth and I just didn't know it.  So, I ate few more bites and the taste got worse so I had my husband taste the crab melt and he said the seasoning tasted bad on the melt.  I also got a stomach ache from the crab melt that afternoon.  My hubby couldn't finish the fried calamari because it was way too acidy.  I am very disappointed at their food.  Our waiter never came back to check on us after bringing the food to the table nor did he refil our water and drinks.
author: Chris R.

description: Wonderful lunch today. The clam chowder is really fantastic with the warm sourdough bread. I also really liked the salmon BLT. No bacon for me but they kindly subbed fresh tomatoes. Delish!
author: Max H.

description: We love this place!  Yesterday was our second time here and we had lunch with a view.  This place is upstairs at Pier 39 and one of the first restaurants as you enter.  The prices are reasonable and the food was more than satisfying as well as plentiful.  We shared a shrimp cocktail, served in a good sized martini glass.  There were a few  European lettuce leaves on the bottom (for color but it still tasted good covered in sauce!) and a ton of bay shrimp in cocktail sauce.  That alone with bread could be a meal for me!  Dale ordered a beer and the Fog Harbor Hamburger.  It was huge (Niman Ranch 1/2 lb patty) bacon, jack cheese, carmelized onions and a tasty Chipotle Thousand Island Dressing.  I had the Fish & Chips, three big pieces of fish (I think it was Cod) moist on the inside with a beer batter cooked to perfection - nice crunch with every bite!  We both got a mess of fries with our meals and I got some coleslaw that tasted homemade.  The coleslaw had red bell pepper that gave it a nice sweetness but I thought it had a little too much mayo.  Our server, Marilyn was the best and made sure that we had whatever we needed at all times.  She remembered everything like when I asked her for mustard for my fries when we ordered.  It's servers like her with a confident and positive attitude that make dining more enjoyable.  Overall, we had a nice lunch with a great view.  Also, they have a very nice fireplace and sitting area outside.  I'm sure that area is for people waiting for a table but I wouldn't mind sitting there to have a drink - not sure if that's allowed tho!
author: Ruthie V.

description: FANTASTIC July 4th!!!  Food was delish and the view can't be beat.  Greg the Manager was a wonderful host.  BEST 'tourist' spot for locals.  Did I mention the inventive cocktail menu???????
author: Kim C.

description: We eat here almost every time we come to San Francisco. On those cold rainy days, you can't beat thier bread bowl clam chowder! Service is always great an there is a great view of the bay.
author: Todd F.

description: Food was great as was the service....friendly and attentive.  As a bonus they brought a complimentary creme brulee as it was the birthday for my guest.  I would definitely go back.
author: Mary S.

description: Overall a wonderful evening thanks to the staff specifically our waiter Khaiman, the beautiful view of the sunset over the bay, and  perfectly enjoyable food especially the seafood salad with dungenese crab.
author: Roni D.

description:
i came here for lunch and we were pleasantly surprised by this place. not only did this place have a great view of fisherman's wharf, but the food was BOMB too!!

the cioppino was AMAZING! i love the tomato sauce that it was it! makes you want more just thinking about it. there was crab, clams, shrimp and a few different types of fish in my cioppino... squeeze some lemon.. and you have PERFECTION!!

the fish and chips were great too!!! perfect batter! perfect!!!

another must try was the clam chowder in a bread bowl! the sourdough bread was warm and chewy! the bread wasnt hard at all, which is important in bread bowls cuz some places have sucky bread!

great time at fog harbor! will come back when in town!
author: Jeannette V.

description: Food was good, service was a little stuffy though. We got the clam chowder which was pretty good, but a couple bites were a little gritty though. Then had the fish and chips, really yummy. Finished with the creme brulee which was the best I've EVER had. All in all it was good, and I would go back, not sure if I would order the chowder again though.
author: Ann A.

description: I loved this restaurant. I made a reservation  for 8 on line on Saturday morning for lunch the same day and was very happy to receive a window table with amazing views of the Bay. We could even watch The Americas Cup! I was a bit nervous because I had never been to this restaurant before and because it was on Pier 39 I had my doubts, but it was excellent! We took the ferry from Jack London and to Pier 41 and it was an easy walk to the restaurant. The crab cakes were delicious and plump! The linguini with clams was well seasoned. The spicy prawns starter was flavorful and interesting. The service was great, even on such a busy weekend we were not rushed in and out.  I would definitely go back to this  elegant white tabled clothed restaurant!!!
author: Nancy A.

description: Was there yesterday, had reservations through Open Table, we got a table with a view.  Food was fresh and flavorful.  I had the salmon with spinach.  Great kids menu, very family friendly. Would love to go back soon.
author: Fatma K.

description: great food, great service, great price, great views. the night before we ate at one of those stands and our steamed crab cost us $27. here it cost us a few bucks more and it came with mash potatoes, corn, and great atmosphere. the only downside is that they cleaned out the crab of all the gooey, disgusting stuff (which for 99.9% of customers is great, but isn't for my husband). he loves the junk in the crab.
author: Chelsea K.

description: Overall very pleased with my experience.  Went on a Tuesday at 5:30 PM, no wait with good seats and a nice view of the bay. Staff was very pleasant and accomodating.  Started with clam chowder which was decent but had a little sand in some spoonfuls.  Then had the mixed grill with shrimp, salmon and swordfish all prepared beautifully, especially the shrimp.  For a "tourist trap" I was very happy with the service, food quality and portions and the price.  Check it out!
author: Chris B.

description: Came here with a large party of 14. The service was actually really good and I was impressed with our waiter. The entrees my boyfriend and I ordered on the other hand was terrible. We got a scallop appetizer and the blue cheese garlic bread. Both were decent. My boyfriend ordered the crab cake dinner and I got linguine with clams. My boyfriend's crab cakes were burnt and cold when they came out. The menu description for my linguine should have said "small portion of linguine and a couple clams." For $18 it was way overpriced for pasta and literally like three clams. Not to mention they didn't even clean the clams and the whole bottom of my plate was covered in gritty sand. Since we already had to send my boyfriends food back and his family seemed horrified that he did, I didn't complain about my sandy pasta, but when the waiter picked up the dish, I am surprised he didn't notice the thick layer of grit left on my plate. We won't be back.
author: Dayna P.

description: My family and I visited at the beginning of August.  We all tried the clam chowder...man was it great!  We all had different entrees that consisted of shrimp, crab, oysters, etc.  Everything was fresh and tasty. The prices were in the medium range, but it was good value for money.  The great service from our waiter, Khaiman, made the experience one that we won't forget.  We will return next year!!!
author: Leo J.

description: My sister and I had the great pleasure of visiting SanFrancisco recently.  This was our first time to SanFrancisco, seafood has always been a favorite of our family.  We live on the Texas Gulf Coast, so anytime we have the opportunity to eat fresh seafood from the West Coast we jump on it.  Our visit to Fog Harbor did not dissapoint, we reasearched restaurants in the area before choosing and we have never been ones to dismiss a restaurant based on it being a "tourist" spot.  Instead, we went with consumer ratings and as usual we were not disappointed.  We had a great waiter his name is Tim, we arrived in the late afternoon during the week and Tim was able to spend time with us and share his receommendations of places to visit in his city.  The food was amazing, we had the scallops with a Quinoa salad and the dungeness crab.  We are both looking forward to our next visit, hopefully we can bring along some friends.
author: Carolyn M.

description: We didn't expect much from a tourist restaurant on a Friday night. Our server, Faysel, gave us a fantastic experience; the best quality Parisian style server I've experienced in America. We had a great view and the food was quite good,  but Faysel made it special. We had out of towners and a special needs friend at the table and he was patient and a perfect gentleman.
author: Katherine B.

description: Great experience for the three people in our party. Excellent clam chowder. The rest of the meal was top drawer. Friendly and helpful waiter. Reasonable prices for great food. I would recommend Fog Harbor Fish House to anyone.
author: Trisha V.

description: Came here on a rare night with my sisters and we stumbled upon this place. We sat at the bar until our table was ready. Staff was attentive and friendly. Drinks were good and made exactly like we wanted. The prices and portions are average, for a restaurant on the wharf. The Clam Chowder and the Seafood Cioppino were our favorites, for an extra charge they will crack the crab so you don't get messy. Best of all, they have a nice fireplace with comfy seating that you can relax and warm up before adventuring back into the cold.
author: Amy M.

description:
Had the Calamari with lemon aioli to start-good stuff we were hungry. A REALLY skimpy bowl of clam chowder-maybe I should've gotten the bread bowl, but I like my soup and bread separate, so I ate all the bread... 
My friend had a couple glasses of wine, a fish portion, the garlic mashed potatoes with some great looking mixed veggies. (They said they were disappointed with their meal, it was really bland) A cup of coffee and the bill came to over 80 bucks.
author: Juno R.

description: Pretty good food, and great views. The Calamari is especially yummy!
author: K. D.

description: It was my birthday so when I made the reservation I asked for a window table and when we arrived at 6:30 we got the window table. Very good service, lovely view and the dungeness crab cocktail and ahi lomi lomi appetizers we had were excellent. The halibut on the special that night, however, wasn't. It was perfectly cooked, moist but rather tasteless. Halibut is a fish that can soak up sauces and be flavored as the chef determines. This was just cooked with a few tomatoes on top and some quinoa underneath neither of which added any taste. When we told the waitress that we had had better halibut she was quite nice about it and a minute or two later the matre de was at our table asking what we didn't like about the halibut. We told him, he thanked us for our feedback, adding that usually the halibut is the most praised item on the menu, and comped us a dessert of our choice. The service, the setting, the experience were all fine and would have been perfect if not for the main dish. We would go back and try a different item except there are so many other seafood restaurants we want to try first.
author: Bill P.

description:
We went here on the Fourth of July, which was probably not the best time to go but we hadn't eaten and it looked like the best choice on the pier. Well, we waited for 2 hours to get a seat and by the time we got in there we were starving. They were packed and the place was so noisy from the bar that I couldn't hear my husband talk from across the table. The waiter had a really thick accent which made it impossible to understand him over all the noise. Once he got orders it took him 15 min to bring us some bread which I was dying for! and then about a minute later he brought the food, which was quick considering the amount of people there. I had crab cakes which were ok but not for the price I paid for them. My husband got the clam chowder bread bowl and he loved it and it was relatively inexpensive. 
Maybe this place would be better on a regular day, but I am not in a hurry to go back again.
author: Megan T.

description: Great food. Not as touristy as I would have thought for the location at fisherman's wharf.  The clam chowder was very good.  I don't recommend getting it in the bread bowl though because the bread soaks up the soup.  Definitely get dungeness crab!  Messy but delicious.
author: Cris O.

description: After the Alcatraz tour we were starving! So, we decided to stay in the area and try out a local restaurant. Fog Harbor seemed to be a yelp favorite so we decided to take the short 3-5 minute walk from Pier 33 and try it! The crackling fireplace at the entrance was warm and inviting and the floor to ceiling views of the marina were gorgeous. The fried calamari was the BEST we've ever had... that's saying a lot since we ALWAYS order calamari when dining out. My sister loved the fish & chips and said it was 10x better than Gladstone's in Malibu. So why the four stars? They dropped the ball on the clam chowder :- ( I'm not much of a fan for an overwhelmingly clammy aftertaste nor do I jump for joy for undercooked potatoes. We topped the evening off with the chocolate cake a la mode and it was a perfect complement to the most perfect sunset view. I totally recommend this restaurant if you're willing to pass  on the chowder.
author: Kaputachya A.

description: The sevice was fabulous and the clam chowder was the best in the entire state of CA.I love this place. I will recomende for all those who enjoy great taste helty food and service,sheer
author: Julio G.

description: Went here with my friends on v-day and the service was phenomenal the food was fresh and great and the manager came to the table and brought us each flowers. Also I asked for a window table when we got here and they were more than happy to accommodate us and the view was beautiful. I cannot recommend this place more well priced great service and excellent location
author: M W.

description: The service made the meal.  Our server was exceptional and went so far as to bring back 2 clams from the kitchen when she noticed that there were a couple of closed ones in my dish.  View of the harbor was picture perfect and made for a very romantic lunch for two.  Definitely make reservations in advance if you are looking to get a good seat; only too easy to do online.  Food was very good as well.  Seafood was fresh and flavorful as one would expect.  My wife had the Dungeness Crab and was thrilled.  I had the Cioppino and was very happy with the selection.  Couple of snivels; comes served with a piece of sourgough on top that is over-oiled and gets soggy in the sauce right away.  I would discourage this presentation technique.  Better to just serve fresh bread on the side.  Also, the sauce itself was a bit on the plain side; non-remarkable flavors beyond a thin tomato sauce.  Otherwise, a wonderful place and would recommend to friends.
author: Kenneth W.

description:
I was very impressed with this place. For being in such a touristy location, the ambiance, service, drinks and food were as good as it gets. We walked in and were seated a table with a nice view of the harbor (most tables have a pretty good view.) Our server came over quickly and was attentive and funny throughout the whole meal. Our drinks were delicious (I had the Ginger Coconut Cooler and my husband had an extra dirty martini.) I was only planning on having one but of course I had two! Then, we split the Chili Lime Shrimp Salad and the classic clam chowder in a sourdough bread bowl. It was the perfect amount of food for two people. The salad was delicious - the shrimp were prepared perfectly and there was just enough of hte dressing - and while the chowder in the bread bowl wasn't knock-your-socks-off, it complemented the sourdough bread perfectly and really allowed you to taste the bread, which was the best I had while I was in San Fran. 

We only had about an hour to eat, which we let our server know in advance, and we were done within 50 minutes. However, if I had more time, I would have loved to linger longer over some more drinks and watch the sunset...

All in all, this place was terrific and I can't imagine that there is a better restaurant that truly captures the spirit of Fisherman's Wharf.
author: Natalie C.

description: Came here last night after a day trip to the SF Zoo and it was really nice. We were sat right away in a booth near the great view of the Golden Gate bridge. The server was nice and friendly until the end of our visit. I ordered the Napa Landing Chardonnay which was divine and my husband ordered a glass of Anchor Steam which helped each of us unwind. Jumbo Shrimp Cocktail for starts and a clam chowder bread bowl for me. My husband ordered the Seafood Cioppino with added pasta and we both got  added deshelled crab to top our dishes off and there is nothing better than crab out of the shell! YUM! I tried catching our server for another glass of wine but he seemed really busy and didn't look my way. I ended up leaning over to catch his attention and noticed that the table across from us was trying to catch him too but he didn't noticed that they had a question about their check....we enjoyed each of our meals very much and the warm bread in the basket was delicious! If the server stayed engaged the whole time we might have given this 5 stars.
author: Mowdukes H.

description: Delicious dinner, awesome view of the bay, and the desserts had us all reaching for each others' plates to share. Thanks to Greg and Zarah for a great afternoon meal.
author: Colin P.

description: Great service, great food, great time!  Greg and Zarah went out of their way to make sure that we were well taken care of.  Thank you!!
author: Erin T.

description: Overpriced and service was below par. I was on business and stopped in for a nice meal but apparently they don't think a single person is worth any attention. I was seated right next to the door so whenever people were leaving or entering (which was every few minutes) a cold gust of wind would hit me. The waitress, Brenda, also did not seem I was good enough for attention so she barely provided service. I received my salad first, which the romaine hearts were brown at the tips so I had to cut them off. Then the wine that came several minutes later had visible lint around the whole goblet. The water with lemon I asked for never came. The main dish was okay, but the fish was dry around the edges. Not the food I expected right on the water. After asking 2 more times for water and already halfway through my meal, a manager stopped by and asked how my meal was. I told him that I was still waiting for the water I asked for 3 times. He quickly brought out water and I was grateful. After another few minutes, I finally see Brenda with a glass of water (no lemon) and she scowled as she saw that there was a glass already on my table. She took my water to someone else and I heard her ask very loudly if anyone else would like water....really? With an empty water glass in front of me, Brenda drops off my check - which I had not yet asked for. I really wanted to leave no tip because I felt so unwanted by Brenda but my guilt took over and I left her a around 17%. When I got up to leave, Brenda stood there and said nothing to me (not even a "have a good night"!) As I was pushing the door, I looked back to see Brenda opening the check book in front of my table to see what tip I left her. At that moment I really wish I would have left her nothing and should have asked for a discount based on horrible attitude and treatment from Brenda. Truly despicable. I am never going to return. I think I'll stick inland or go back to Neptune's.
author: Crystal x.

description: I really love taking visitors here and the food and service has always been excellent.  I believe the prices are reasonable for the quality and portions you receive (you are on the wharf!)  Visiting friends enjoy the view of the harbor and bridge and the excellent seafood and sourdough.  I also appreciate that they allow you to linger and enjoy your meal unlike other pier restaurants.  Our recent server, Faycal, treated us like royalty--or so it seemed.  We enjoyed the chowder, shrimp louis, stuffed salmon, and shellfish platter.
author: L D.

description: I had the lobster and filet, the surf and turf...it was delicious.  Our waiter was great and the views are spectacular.  Next time we are in Frisco we will be back.
author: Gary B.

description: I've been here a couple of times. You really can't beat the view! The food is pricy, but the service we got from Faycal was awesome! Better than awesome! The food is quite good too! I love taking people here from out-of-town, they seem to dig it.
author: Matt M.

description: My friends sister was visiting California for the first time so we headed down to fishermans wharf. We were starving so we basically went to the first restaurant we saw which was fog harbor. We were seated immediately and had a very friendly waitress. The view was fantastic and the fresh warm bread they brought out was perfect. But that's about where it all ends. Some of my friends had the crab cakes which they said were not as good as they thought they would be. I remember the words overly salty and very little crab. I had the Alaskan halibut which I found dry and flavorless. I was looking forward to the vanilla bean creme brûlée which wasn't bad but the harden sugary top was soft and didn't even cover the whole thing. We all left a little disappointed and needless to say will not be returning.
author: Deborah H.

description:
my boyfriend and i went here tonight. it was our one year. parking garage was very close by, and the first 2 hours is free. the front of the restaurant is very pretty. the decor inside the restaurant is even nicer. we were seated by the window which had a great view of the harbor. 

my boyfriend ordered:
stella beer (they accidentally gave him a large, which he enjoyed)
salmon BLT which came with fries - he loved this so much. he wants me to write he he loved loved it. he wouldnt stop talking about it on the way home

i ordered:
cup of clam chowder ($5) - delicious. very clammy. it does not have potatoes in it or i didn't find any. im not complaining because there were plenty of clams.
sea bass with garlic mashed ($20) - the sea bass was a little on the dry side. i have had sea bass in different places were it was so much more buttery and flaky. this sea bass had the texture of tilapia. the potatoes were good, wish i had more. it was also served with brocoli and red bell. 

our total bill was only 50 bucks plus tip. not bad at all!!  overall, a delicious place to eat, not as pricey as we thought. plus it had a great view and its in the city
author: Ness H.

description: We requested and were seated at a table by the window.  The view is spectacular and worth the price of lunch or dinner.  Our waiter, Faycal, couldn't be more attentive, professional and friendly.  The calamari was excellent and the half wedge of iceburg with blue cheese was refreshing and delicious.  With so many restaurant choices at Pier 39, we chose wisely!
author: Anna A.

description: I came here with a second time on June 10th, 2010 for my birthday.  I had a great experience.  The waitress was very attentive and was awesome.  The only issue I had was when I told the receptionist I had a reservation on OpenTable and she wasn't too friendly...  Didn't greet us really or say anything.  We were seated, but waited for about almost 5 minutes before being asked about what we wanted.  However, after that, the experience was awesome.  Food was excellent.  It, overall, was a very pleasant expectations for the most part...  Thanks to my great waitress who was awesome!!
author: Brian C.

description:
Went there with my husband, 5 yr. old and 2 yr. old, and my father this weekend. My Dad likes to visit Pier 39 when he comes to the bay area to stay with us. (which isn't my favorite place, but we go there just for him.) He really wanted to go to a good seafood place, so I looked up reviews on yelp and found Fog Harbor. I'm always a little leery of restaurants in tourist-y places (especially since a couple other places I've been to at Pier 39 turned out to be really terrible), but Fog Harbor turned out to be a great choice. 

My husband and I have high expectations for our food when we go to nice restaurants in the $20-$40 range, and we were very impressed with this place. My husband and dad both got the swordfish, which they raved about. I got the special, which was a gumbo with vegetables and rice topped with a filet of salmon and grilled shrimp. The salmon was like butter on the inside, and had a deliciously seasoned and seared outside. I also had a fresh squeezed lemonade with ginger. Not overly sweet like most lemonades, just perfect. We got the chocolate cake for desert. It was super moist and I couldn't stop eating it, even after I was already stuffed from dinner. Our waiter was friendly and helpful. My kids kept themselves entertained by drawing on the paper tablecloth with crayons provided to us. My 5 yr. old got the burger from the kid's menu and it was HUGE! enough to easily feed an adult. And it was arguably one of the best burgers I've ever had, too. We will probably go back to Fog Harbor, the next time my dad wants to go to Pier 39 ;)
author: Kathryn C.

description: Our company retreat was in S.F. this year and the company dinner was held at Fog Harbor Fish House. After last years dinner (in Vegas) I didn't have high hopes.. ;-)... I was pleasantly surprised! Our table had each one of the options (Veggie Pasta for the Vegetarian, she didn't look too excited..),, but what I think since it is a seafood place is much more important... the mixed fish plate was AWESOME! Everything grilled to perfection (including the veggies!). It was a very good meal! My bf had the steak and he was a happy camper as well. The dessert was nothing to write home about, but if you are looking for a nice restaurant with good seafood and a nice view.. this is it!
author: Esther B.

description:
I been here a few times.

Service is always great!

Drinks are really good.

I really like their fried combo platter (fish, shrimp, calamari, fries, served with tartar sauce and a red sauce and cole slaw)).

My wife had the special of the day. Salmon stuffed with crab meat. She really likes this place.

It has a great view of Alcatraz since it's on the top floor.

I would go back with no hesitation.
author: John B.

description: Decent place, food was good but service was lacking, not sure why as other tables appeared to have good service, for whatever reason the waitress didn't seemed to be concerned with our table. The crab cakes were amazing and the fried shrimp were very well cooked. For using open table they gave us a free amuse bouche which was pretty good too. The location was great with pretty good views in a well decorated restaurant. If not for the sub par service this might be on my list next time I'm back in town.
author: Kris K.

description: I really enjoyed dining here. We had a great view of Alcatraz, server was prompt and courteous, and food was great. Just a little too much garlic on everything... The best part was the dessert. Creme Brulee was fantastic! I can't wait to go back.
author: Vicky K.

description: After a LONG day at a trade show, the dinner here was incredible. Calamari is about the best I've ever had.
author: Kevin F.

description:
Hey you guys guess what?  The food here was actually pretty damn good!  I think this is the first meal I have ever had at Pier 39 (aside from maybe a breadbowl of chili from a Boudin cart when I was a kid).  We were done up all cute and knew we stood out like sore thumbs, but so what.  We're local and we can play tourist if we want to.  In all fairness, we were in the area to see a show across the deck, but I'm really glad we stopped in to Fog Harbor for dinner first.
The views ARE great - we looked out onto the boats at the pier and Alcatraz in the distance.
The service was a bit crap - absentee and completely non-engaging or interested; Lizzie noted that the other tables were getting much friendlier service.
The food was solid.  Is it expensive?  I dunno, the prices seemed pretty standard for SF prices to me, especially given its waterfront location - everywhere with views is a little pricier.  If I recall it was almost $90 for the three of us - we didn't order that much food, but did have wine.
Three of us split a bottle of Pinot Grigio and shared our food.  Originally, we were all going to order the exact same thing - the halibut with herb butter, wild rice and veggies, which is why I had to branch out a bit.  I ordered the chili garlic prawns which were fight over worthy.  We must've eaten an entire loaf of the nice hot sourdough bread they give you just sopping up all the broth to be sure we didn't miss any of it.  I also got the spinach salad which was totally skippable.  
Liz did not like her fish, rice or veggies and left a bit unfulfilled.  Mel and I however seemed more into it.  I actually thought it was pretty damn tasty and ate all of my share with no problem - the fish was cooked perfectly, the rice was a good texture and the veggies weren't swimming in oil or butter and were also cooked well.
I would absolutely eat here again and I really think it's an excellent bet for any tourists in the area.  Just keep in mind that entrees are $20-$30 - McDonald's pricing it is not, but it's totally in line with SF and a waterfront property at that.  Also, try not to have a heart attack at the 3.5% health surcharge which is much higher than most other spots in the city.
author: Jennifer D.

description: I think the management in this restaurant is awful.  I will never go there again.  I was on a Tour Bus with 50 senior citizens, some with handicaps and walkers.  They paid in advance for the bus, the theater and the restaurant.  They had a reservation and when we got there the tables were still empty.  The bus,because of heavy traffic, was late by about 10 minutes and the management refused to honor a reservation for this party that was made months ago.  The people did not have time for lunch and this restaurant did not even try to compensate these people when they refused to honor the reservation after many of these old people walked up the stairs and were tired.  At least they should have asked some of the elderly people if they wanted water or a piece of bread etc before they sent them away with no food and no recommendation of a place where 50 people could go at 5:20 pm.  They were told via phone that the bus was late due to traffic and when got to the restaurant and the tables were still empty and we sat down to be served.    We were told we had to leave and they would not serve us.  This is totally unacceptable behavior for any restaurant management to take and commit to serve a part y of 50 and then refuse because they come in 10 or 15 minutes late. .  Do not go to this restaurant.  There are 100's of excellent restaurants in San Francisco.  Leave this off your list.
author: Estelle K.

description: At first I thought we were in luck.  Yeah it is in a heavily tourist area but it appears the non-touristy places are up on Russian Hill which is quite a hike from the wharf area.  The wait was fairly short given that situation and there were some nice tables and chairs for waiting where you could get a drink from the bar to enjoy while you wait.  The very poor rating was from a one-two punch.  The service was pathetic, we saw our server a few times and that was it.  I would have ordered more drinks if he came by more.  Also, I was away from the table when the food was served but my party noticed the coleslaw had hair in it and sent it back.  Sadly there was no apology but new coleslaw was bought.  Finally I had to flag down a bus boy to get ketchup since none was delivered with the fries and the server never came back. When I finally could flag down our server for the bill, I was afraid he'd never come back to take my credit card.  When I finally paid, I didn't just leave, I ran.
author: Scott M.

description: Serviceable seafood for tourist from Toledo.  Large Middle American portions too.  A classy alternative for those who've outgrown the Hard Rock.
author: E C.

description: I made a reservation for a pre-mother's day dinner on a Friday evening.  I am local to SF Bay Area, and I am usually unusure about seafood restaurants located on a touristy spot like Pier 39.  I read the Yelp reviews, and I am glad we went.  This restaurant is excellent - from the courteous/helpful team that answers their phone reservation, the food, their wait staff, and chefs.  The view is fantastic with Alcatraz and the East Bay right across.  They even provide you with a free 2-hr parking on the Pier 39 Garage!   The food - everything is good.  Their fish is cooked properly so that it is still juicy.  My daughter had the Filet Mignon, and she said it was excellent and properly cooked.  My 83 year old mom and 91 year old Father-in-Law loved their mixed grill seafood dish.  The only minor improvement is the asparagus needs to be a bit more crunchy (i.e. not too soft).   The desserts are awesome (we had the creame brulee and Tiramisu).   I also think their price is quite reasonable given the quality of their food, service, and location - I hope it stays that way.  This place has a great staff who are really attentive to their customers.   A special shout-out to our wait staff, Veronica, and the front desk hostess team (especially Ashley who helped me with the reservation)!   Any owner or business can only dream to have this excellent team!  Dined on 5/10/2013.
author: Roland L.

description:
after listening to Gene Burns ( the food voice on KGO radio) rave about
this restaurant  and mentioned that they ONLY use Halibut for their fish and chips as Mahi Mahi was tasteless served this way. I totally agreed
and the night we were there our waitress Marilyn (said she has worked
there for 18years) stated they ALWAYS used Mahi Mahi and never used
Halibut. Well, Gene Burns raved about it so we both ordered it. It was so
tasteless we did not eat even half of it. I emailed Gene Burns and told him
what I am saying here and he emailed me saying there is  a choice of fish.
NOT according to our waitress. Yes, the view is nice but its a shame the 
food does not live up to the talk,
author: Robert F.

description: Got a great dinner here today. We started off with the calamari, it was crispy and delicious. I had the halibut and my husband had the mahi-mahi with the mango salsa - both very delicious with a Cajun seasoning. We got the chicken tender kids dinner for the little one. Everything was yummy and the fresh baked sourdough bread was excellent. We sat by  the window and had a great view of the bay.
author: Lisa M.

description: Best sour dough bread EVER before meal.  Great Crab.  Beautiful views, great modern feel & nice wait staff.  Full bar comes in handy too!
author: Debbie M.

description: This is an upscale restaurant with a nice view of the bay located at Pier 39. The server was very attentive and gladly took the 20% discount I found from the "California Welcome Center," which is located on the 2nd floor. I ordered the Fried Combo which was $20, and it came with a hefty plate of fried calamari, octopus, shrimp, filet, and chips. It also came with cole slaw which was too spicy because of the overload of horse radish. The bread bowl clam chowder was delicious, but the bits of clam meat was not sufficient-it can be more accurately described as potato soup with clam. The downside to this restaurant is the ridiculous taxes they charge. The tab was charged a 3.5% heatlh fee on top off of the price of the meal which is then taxed at a sales tax of 10%. Overall, the food was great and the dining was pleasant.
author: Carol S.

description: lobster mac and cheese! tons of lobster, everywhere you dug in there were huge lobster pieces. it is pretty steep though, $30 for a decent size bowl. go for happy hour and sit at the bar for 1/2 off drinks. i knocked off a star because we had called in ahead about happy hour and when we arrived at the restaurant heard a bartender mumbling that when it gets too busy, they dont advertise happy hour and gave us an attitude about it. Besides that, the food was good !
author: Ryan N.

description: Don't bother waiting for a table. Just sit at the bar and enjoy the most outstanding service around.  Yes, the food is über-fresh, and fabulously tasty - we had the California Crab & Avocado Caesar Salad (enormous and delicious) and the swordfish (flawlessly grilled, with melt-in-your-mouth ratatouille veggies). And yes, the view is great. But what really made this place stand out in a town full of tourist traps was the service. Archer, Nelson, and Jason behind the bar were exceptional - personable, attentive, fun, they went out of their way to deliver everything we asked for and much more, which made for a truly unforgettable meal. Extra special thanks to Archer for the warm and crusty sourdough heels, and to Nelson for the ridiculously good ginger lemonade and for the soon-to-be-famous wickedly yummy Half Nelson ;-) Thank you for making us feel special tonight. We will most certainly be back.
author: Adriana V.

description: me and my wife went here last nite for my birthday and it was our first time coming here and wow ! FOOD AND SERVICE was perfect 10 and don't forget the price is wroth every penny of it .
author: Jimmy V.

description: I've been here a few times since moving to the Bay Area.  The food always is very good here.  The Clam Chowder is really tasty.  Last trip, I had the mixed grill and again no disappointments in the food.  However, I have to agree there are some service issues with this place.  I've eaten at the bar a couple times and usually pretty good service considering the bartender is doing a lot of other things besides the food.  Took a guest to Fog Harbor last Saturday and we were seated in the restaurant portion.  Probably 10-15 mins. before anyone came and asked if we had been helped.  Then when our waiter took our order, he failed to ask if we wanted anything to drink besides the water that finally showed up, so he lost a sale on that.  Then after he took our order, we never saw him for another 10-15 minutes.  A long time between the chowder and the main meal.  Never brought us the famous sourdough bread he promised.  The food again - very good - recommend eating at the bar if you go.
author: Steve A.

description: The only reason I'm giving this three stars is for the food. Our service was great at the very beginning of the dinner but as the evening went on.... it went on and on and on. After finally getting our food, it was another while to get the drink refilled, and another while to get plates cleared, and then a really long while to get the bill. We had great sea food but if you go, make sure and block off the evening.
author: Keeton C.

description:
(3.5 stars)
Based on my experience and the comments of my friends.
We were about 20 mins early for our reservation, but were seated right away. Table was set & ready. Got service right away.
Enjoyed the appetizers: shrimp, bleu cheese toast & my friends had 2 orders of raw oysters. They really enjoyed those.
The entree portions were ample. I finished my crab cake sandwich and fries. Others finished their tuna and shrimp scampi. Others took home what was left of the fried combo plate. Although they said they did not like the fish. 
The cocktails looked nice but not special. Supposedly had 2 types of rum in my drink but could hardly taste it. My friend ordered a pomegrante "daquiri" which the menu read $4 because it was a 'virgin'. She was charged $9 for an actual cocktail. It was corrected.
They were nice enough to split the checks three ways for the 8 of us. 
I got a free dessert for my birthday. Warm chocolate cake, vanilla ice cream and whipped cream. Which we shared because we were too full for individual desserts.
The decor is clean and the windows are huge & give a nice view of the piers. 
Got parking validated.
Not sure if I would ever go back since I hardly ever go to Pier 39. But overall not a bad experience.
author: M C.

description: Went here the other day for dinner expecting an overpriced seafood place with a view and marginal food.  What I got a was a restaurant that had a solid price point and very very good food!  They bring fresh sourdough to the table and the waiter was pretty attentive.  I ordered a bowl of clam chowder and split it with my girlfriend (and needless to say dipped the sourdough in the chowder), it was a huge portion!  For my entree I got the Ahi Tuna with garlic mashed potatoes, this dish was really on point!  You have to cook Ahi Tuna just right or it will by too dry or overdone, not this tuna, it had a perfect sear on the outside and it was nice and rare on the inside!  They serve it on a bed of sauteed onions green peppers and the mashed potatoes with an Asian inspired soy-teriyaki tasting sauce.    I was very surprised to find a pretty good (and not insanely overpriced) restaurant in Pier 39, would definitely eat here again!
author: Ray M.

description: The service is great, the people were super nice and friendly. I like how they give customers a sample of wine without asking or anything, which I guess is a form of marketing. The clam chowder s really good, creamy and chunky, although there isn't really anything about it that makes it particularly any better than other places. Their baked oysters look really good, on a bed of sea salt, but it tasted slightly weird. I didn't enjoy it as much as I had anticipated. For the entree, I had the cioppino, and I have to say, it was really, very good. I like my foods more on the acidic side, so the tang of the tomatoes were perfect for me. There is a lot of crab meat, the serving size is fairly large, and the celery in it was dynamite. The fish in the cioppino was alright, some pieces better than others, so the consistency wasn't always there. The crostini that comes with the cioppino was kind of small, but was rubbed with great herbs and spices. All in all, a good experience, especially with the spaciousness and the view.
author: Katherine L.

description:
we must've came on an off night--for some reason, every ten minutes or so the power would shut off and come back on again about five or ten minutes later. i came with four other people, they received their meals fairly fast but i was still waiting for mine, finally my fiance told the manager about that.  by the time everyone was finished with their meals i got mine. thankfully, the manager came up to our table and took off 50 dollars from our bill.
other than that, it was an ok restaurant, im guessing it was just a bad night.
author: Sarah G.

description:
Had a very satisfactory meal here, although the price probably was more worthy of the location than the dinner itself. We started with crab cakes and I moved onto tasty bread bowl of chowder and some longish leaves of lettuce that was their caeser.
The view of the foggy harbor was as advertised as well and we enjoyed it, even though we were in the back end of the restaurant. I do have to say that our waitress was very pleasant and definitely made our dinner as comfortable as it should be, certainly a place I'd return to if I had to dine in the touristy Pier 39 area again.
author: Eric H.

description: came here because of the reviews .. only thing good was crab cake... really delicious... but the pasta was bad .. sauce too oily .. and the clam chowder wasn't fresh .. tasted like it came out of a can.. my friend had a real bad stomach ache and diarrhea after eating the seafood pasta (w/ prawns .. that tasted mushy and for sure looked nothing like prawns but frozen shrimps)
author: Janice C.

description: Even though this is a fish house, I had a cheeseburger.  I'm way picky, so I was disappointed that they couldn't leave the produce in the back. Why? I'm not going to eat it, seems like a waste.  I'm so picky, in fact, that I wont eat what the pickle was sitting on, which was several fries. More to waste. The burger was decent, I can't complain about that.  We got a table with a great view out the window, that was pretty nice.  Oh, the orange juice was basically water with a yellowish color. Very disappointing!
author: Todd V.

description: Fog Harbor offers a fantastic dining experience. I had the pleasure of eating here over the weekend just before going to see the symphony. When you arrive you are greeted by a host or hostess and are told you can wait for your table in the outdoor patio area. This area is a great lounging set up complete with a table for your drinks and a beautiful waterfall for ambience. I was promptly seated even though the pier was quite busy and it was mid evening. One of the big attractions is a wall of windows that face the bay. This offers A great view while you enjoy your dinner. Our properly dressed waiter introduced himself and offered to get drinks and an appetizer for my family and I. We quickly received our refreshments and a wonderful bread basket accompanied with soft butter. Our calamari appetizer arrived shortly after that. Both the bread and calamari were excellent starters for our dinner. Our empty plates were taken and exchanged with our entrees of the night. My girlfriend had ordered the clam chowder bread bowl, I ordered the swordfish plate. The bread bowl lived up to its name, a classic San Francisco must. The sword fish was wonderfully cooked and served with delicious potato fingerlings and sautéed shallots. Both plates expressed a wonderful presentation of placement and color. Unfortunately we were in a hurry and did not get to experience dessert. The staff at fog harbor seem well dressed and organized. I did not see many dirty tables waiting to be cleaned and reset. Our waiter promptly brought us our check and offered to validate it since we had used the parking garage. There was a problem with our ticket and it took longer than usual. He knew we were in a hurry so for our inconvenience he graciously discounted our bill. Excellent food, great ambience and attentive service is a recipe for a pleasant dinner. Fog Harbor is a must if you are in the San Francisco area.
author: Andrew R.

description: We ate at the Fog House on our recent visit to SF. Me and my husband love seafood so we were pretty excited. We were a party of 6 people and we were seated immediately. Our server was attentive and helpful while explaining about the dishes. We bumped into a friend while we were there and on his recommendation we got the Red Chili Prawns and a clam chowder bowl as appetizers. It was a hit! The prawns were fresh and the seasoning was a thai-like preparation. Oh so yum! I got their crab cakes for the entree, my husband got their mahi-mahi with citrus butter and a friend got their fish and chips. The crab cakes were good and crispy, slightly bread-ier ( if I may use that word ) for my taste but the meat was fresh. The remoulade sauce which came with it was nice too. My husband loved the mahi mahi which was so fresh and moist that it was melting in his mouth. The citrus butter sauce was light and refreshing, not too buttery which was good. The mango salsa which came with it complemented the white mahi-mahi well. The fish and chips had some really fresh fish but they could have done with some more seasoning like some more salt or some paprika. One of our vegetarian friends got their Spring Salad with the pomegranate dressing which was pretty well made. Overall we really enjoyed our lunch experience here and will definitely go back!
author: Neha S.

description: We sat by a window where the view was nice. Also, our waiter was very friendly and our food came pretty fast. As for the food, I'm really not that picky, but it was just ok, nothing special. I think they wash their lettuce with warm watter....yikes! It was too soft (not crunchy) and the chicken tasted a 'bit plain. It wasn't horrible, it was just "whatever."
author: Narina A.

description: My wife and I had lunch at Fog Harbor on New Year's Day.  She had the crab cakes which as usual were good.  I ordered the fried seafood platter...what a disaster.  The fish and shrimp were so over cooked they were chewy and flavorless.  The calamari was disgusting.  It was heavily processed and not fresh as I would expect and had a strong 'fishy' flavor.  I obviously didn't eat the calamari and the waiter didn't ask why.  Service was horrible...we were ignored the entire time we were there until the check came.  Paid $3.25 for an iced tea and never got a refill.
author: Jerry M.

description: My boyfriend and i were on vacation in SF for his bday and i was looking for a place to take him for dinner on his special day. i came across this place and man was i happy i chosen it. first let me say i think this was the best seafood ive ever eaten. we started off with the baked oysters and they were so delicious! we almost ordered a second round. then the clam chowder came and oh man i was glad we we didn't get the second order the sourdough bread and the soup was to die for! then my main dish the salmon came and i just didn't want the night to end. the salmon was perfectly cooked and the mashed potatoes were so yummy. my mouth is watering just thinking about all the terrific food we had. the view is the best in town you see the bridge and Alcatraz. oh and our service was so great! he was hilarious and sang a beautiful happy bday solo to the bf. couldn't of wished a better experience.
author: Angelina A.

description: My company went here for dinner and they treated us like royalty.  It was perfect because the view was great, not a stuffy atmosphere and the food was a nice assortment for everyone whether you like fish or a vegetarian.  That blue cheese bread is to die for.  We will certainly be back and  loved their service.
author: L J.

description: we came with a party of 25, several with specific eating needs. we called ahead and spoke to greg who assured us they would be able to take care of us. we were seated in a room with a gorgeous view. the service was flawless and the food was absolutely delicious. we never had to ask for anything, a totally enjoyable experience.
author: Melody P.

description: Really good food and great ambiance. Shared the calamari app and seared tuna entree.. both tasty!  Also, the warm sourdough bread they bring is fantastic!  Would recommend to someone in the area looking for a quick/tasty bite!
author: Kara S.

description: Hit Fisherman's Wharf for some chowder for my friend, and this place looked like a good bet. It was nice but casual inside, but the prices were outrageous. $18 for a salad that was mostly lettuce. I mean, I'm not naive, I knew that the closer to the water you get the more you'll pay, but at least make it worth the cash. The $5 add-on salad was literally five leaves of romaine. The bar area looked fun, though. Would try again and just sit there.
author: Robin N.

description: I spent 5 weeks in San Francisco in 3 trips this past 2013.  I ate at a lot of places and I have to say that this one was the best for customer service.  The waiter I had whose name was Michael is simply the best waiter I had during my entire time visiting eateries in the area.  The food is excellent as are the cocktails they have.  I had such a good time with a co-worker I went back and requested Michael the other 3 times I went.  I was by myself this last time and sitting at the bar having a drink waiting for him to show up.  I feel a grab at my shoulder and after almost 2 months he recognized me and welcomed me back.  On top of that the manager came by and we chatted as well as one of the other waitresses.  Traveling on business can be a real pain, but that level of customer appreciation by staff was incredible.  I have dealt with two managers there who were both great.  If you go to this place ask for Michael if your looking to impress those your with.  He really does a great job and he got some very solid tips from my co-workers and myself for his EXEMPLARY service.  Do yourself a great big favor and stop by to have a cocktail, food, and a great experience with this waiter.
author: Brian P.

description: Was there during fresh crab week.  Appetizer of blue cheese fresh sourdough bread was wonderful and the main course of crab-stuffed salmon was just as good.  Would definitely tell my friends about this place.
author: Che B.

description: This has got to be one of the best restaurants in the Pier 39 area. They have the best Seafood Cioppino that I have ever tasted along with the best waitstaff. During my trip to the bay area a friend and I dined there twice and each time was wonderful.  I recommend you give it a try.
author: Adriana M.

description: Surprisingly good for being a restaurant in a tourist area. The restaurant was very nice and it was right on the water, so it had a good view. Our waitress wasn't the friendliest person , but the manager was wandering around helping tables out too, which was nice to see. The food was good and again the portions were huge! I will say, I don't like seafood, but went here because everyone that I was with does like seafood and the menu doesn't offer many options for non-seafood eaters; maybe two or three items. I had the cheeseburger and it was delicious. The people that I was with said they liked what they had too, which was the clam chowder and calamari.
author: Carly W.

description: The fish house was very delicious. With relatively heap prices, the restaurant looked very fancy and elegant. I got the linguini and clams which compared to bistro boudin had much more variety. There were bigger clams and sun dried tomatoes in it, along with a piece of bread on top with red pepper flakes and regular pepper. It also had parmesan cheese already mixed in instead of on top, and it was very delicious however the parmesan on top tasted much better. Along with the clams in the shells, there were also smaller clams not in the shells spread around, and these clams were not crunchy, which I like. This place is great and highly recommended. Quick tip: the restaurant looks tiny from the outside but is gigantic on the inside, and it looks under staff compared to the size, so get there early or else you will definitely have to wait a very long time for the food, but it will not be a long wait at all for a table. ALSO KEEP IN MIND: THEY CHARGE AN ADDITIONAL SERVICE CHARGE OF 3.5% ON EVERY CHECK FOR A HEALTH ORGANIZATION, SO DON'T BE ALARMED WHEN IT COMES UP ON THE CHECK. U CAN READ MORE ABOUT IT AT THE BOTTOM OF THE MENU.
author: Cameron F.

description: I came here for my birthday a couple months back, and as I went around the table, I got both positive and negative feedback. I heard that the pasta was horrible, but they could've been exaggerating. However, everyone else that ordered food besides from the pasta said that it was pretty good. I enjoyed my lobster tails very much =) The prices aren't cheap, but for a nice restaurant at Pier 39 with a killer view, what do you expect? Overall, I'm not dying to go back, but definitely wouldn't mind if I do.
author: Elaine H.

description: Wonderful view of the bay, Golden Gate, harbor, just what I was looking for.  Best Crab Louis I have had in years!  I love crab and this is crab had that underlying sweetness that only fresh crab has.  The sour dough bread was spectacular.  It was from Boudin across the street, they get it half baked and then they finish the process in their kitchen.  I had eaten at Boudin and they surprising serve their bread cold,  as a native San Franciscan that is not the way the bread should be served in a restaurant.  My husband had the half of garlic crab that he enjoyed to.  I look forward to going back. I think their prices are normal for the type of food they serve which is upscale.
author: Deanna M.

description: The clam chowder was good, the fish and chips were great, and the view was amazing.  Go during a weekday for lunch, and you're set.
author: Maggie D.

description: Food was okay.  Clam chowder was fair but linguine and clams were tastier.  Service was very good but the main reason I won't go back is due to host/hostesses.  We were told it was a 30 minute wait but we didn't get a table for and hour and 20 minutes. I know predicting times can be difficult but this was way off.  There were many other people in same position as us and the manager was aware off situation was he came out many times to see hostesses.  No reasonable explanantion was given for long wait so the entire evening was pretty much ruined.  Horrible front of the house service means no repeat business!
author: Ron L.

description: So we went to this place when we were visiting SFO last week.  My husband was in a mood for a "broiled seafood" type of dish and since they had something similar we decided to go here.  We ordered the calamari for appetizers-not good and I would not recommend it at all.  It was "soaked" in oil and we started feeling sick after the first bite.  We asked the waiter if we could order something else and got the "Red Chilli Prawn" instead.  It was an appetizer with a lot of gravy-it was tasty though.  For entrees, I ordered the mixed grill which has grilled salmon, mahi mahi and prawns.  The salmon was tough and overcooked and there was too much salt on the mahi mahi.  I ordered the crème brulee for desert which was descent.  Overall, I was very disappointed with this place.
author: Zainab T.

description:
Brunch on Suday was a great experience. My crab omlette was light and full of flavor,  husband's poached eggs were perfect and pancakes evoked "how can they make pancakes delicious?" Service was attentive and sincere; real cloth napkins and tablecloths.:) Plus, views of active harbor, and sounds of seals doing their thing... OMG we could actually have a conversation without shouting, and it felt really clean. We are locals, so exploring new (tourist? oh my!) 'hoods has become a weekend adventure. We were drawn to the outdoor coctail area, and will now count it as a must for out of town guests' breakfast, as well as ours.  Yep, you can have an Irish Coffee for breakfast! Good place to rest feet and have a drink, too, if enjoying the waterfront area. We will try it for other meals as well.
Parking across the street at the grungy Pier 39 garage. It's a quick walk over the pedestrian bridge to the restaurant.  Ask the server to validate your parking ticket.
author: Barbara W.

description: We came back to this location after two successful dinners under a previous owner only to be disappointed. The greet and wait staff seemed somewhat chilly to our party of 3, and the food was hardly a "wow" that we had experienced before. The chowder that I was looking forward to was very thick and soon had a thick skin over the surface of the bowl that was a bit unappealing to me. The crab cakes were okay, although nice and crispy on the outside. The mashed potatoes were blah -- seemed obviously from  a box and could have used a healthy does of garlic. My husband enjoyed his fried platter, although he said it was hard to tell the difference between each seafood item's taste. My friend enjoyed her fried calamari, saying she could still taste the fish in spite of the fried exterior. While the views and the inside decor is impressive, I don't think we'll be coming back to this one. =(
author: Danielle P.

description: We made reservations here after our Alcatraz night tour and we were starving!! We started off with the Lemon Calamari - YUM!!! Best calamari ever! The other people in our party had the clam chowder and crab cakes.  They absolutely loved the crab cakes, but were not blown away by the chowder.  The sourdough they give you is delish - it was gone in minutes.  The fish and chips looked amazing! HUGE portion of fish and it was thick and really good according to my sister in law.  My husband and I both had the crab roll with sweet potato fries.  The fries were amazing, but I wish the roll had chunks of crab, instead of the flaked kind.  It was just a little mushy, but good flavor.  If I had to do it over, I'd probably get fish and chips.  The table next to us had a little of everything - and we were drooling watching it come out.  They had the lobster, which looked divine and oysters looked good too.  We saw someone else with the whole crab and it was HUGE! But, it was late and we were too hungry to be hassled with tearing apart a crab to eat.  Service was great and the view was really nice.  We will be back if we return to San Fran!
author: Anne B.

description: This restaurant was one of the few highlights in an otherwise disappointing birthday weekend.  The waiter we had was top-notch; he was fast and attentive, without hovering.  He overheard that we had theater tickets and were on limited time and rushed our order. Our food was ready and delicious.  The shrimp scampi was cooked just right, and the only compliant I would have is that the garlic mash potatoes weren't garlicky enough (but I love my garlic--so it just might have been me...lol.)  We had a table in the back that over looked the pier and the bay.  It was a beautiful day and the windows were opened.  It is great dressy-casual place that was really enjoyable!
author: Deborah A.

description: This place really surprised me!  My company picked Fog Harbor Fish House for our Christmas party.  But it's Pier 39 location made me wonder if it would be any good.  Boy, was I surprised.  Delicious food, carefully prepared and served.  And long open views of the Bay out the window.   I'll be back on my own to Fog Harbor Fish House soon.
author: ray k.

description: The service and the views are great but the food was horrible! I had a crab louie, the crab meat was shredded like what you find in the bottom of canned crab. Actually I've had canned crab that taste better than what they served. I had them add prawns which also were lousy. Dressing was bad too. I live in SF and should've known better than to take out of town guest to this place.  It was expensive and not worth it. I'd never go back. The bread was good.
author: nicolas v.

description:
