went only for the happy hour. i think everything on the happy hour menu was between $5-7. 

the drinks are yummy, but not strong. i ordered the orange cremesicle and it was very sweet.

the appetizers are pretty good, but the portions are small. we ordered: 

lemon calamari--- pretty standard calamari, but def. did not taste like lemons

crab cakes---good, but they only give you 2 small cakes.

spicy shrimp---very good, they hardly give you any shrimp, but the sauce makes for great dipping sauce with the house bread.
author: krystina ann r.

description: There are quite a few place near the wharf/Pier 39 where the staff herd the customers around like cattle... but this one takes the cake. I went to fog harbor with my girlfriend because we wanted to try somewhere new and kind of nice, and she had a 20 percent off coupon that she received from working at her hotel. So we decided to give it a shot. The views seemed pretty good, but heck if I know, because we weren't asked if we wanted to sit near a window, despite the obvious fact their were many open window seats. Strike one. We asked the waiter if it was okay to drink our own wine and whether their was a corkage fee (their wine list was overpriced), and he didn't know. There was a twelve dollar corkage fee. Strike two. We told him as soon as we got our waiter that we had a coupon for 20 percent off, which he took to put on the tab, but never did. Strike 3-5. He neglected to remember our waters: twice. The food was pretty good, but certainly not better than many other nearby options. We decided to look at a desert menu, which apparently is one of those fossilized versions of the food itself there. My girlfriend had to pee, and the waiter gave me shit for having to wait with the menu until she returned. The next day, when we realized we had been overcharged the 20 percent that should have come off when he took our coupon, we called and tried to get that money refunded, and were refused very shortly. If you're looking for any kind of service normally associated with fine dining at an expensive restaurant... don't go here! I would never recommend this place to anyone.
author: Alexander W.

description: The food was decent, but I don't think I would come back.  I had the Crab Melt, which was a bit bland, but the fries were the better part of this entree.  The clam chowder was seasoned just right; the good thing was that it did have good-sized chunks of clam.  The tiramisu was perfect.  This meal cost about $32.00 before tip.  You can catch some great views if you sit at a window.
author: AC A.

description: We went here on a Friday for lunch.  After walking around the pier and looking for somewhere to eat...  We happened to stop at Fog Harbor.  Manager came out and spoke with us as we were looking over the menu.  What we were seeing looked okay, but the manager's sense of humor and friendly personality is what sold us.  We were immediately brought to our table.   It was nice to look at all the people on the Pier and to see the different boats pull in.  Our server greeted us, he was hard to understand, but seemed friendly.  Unfortunately as time went on we saw less of him and his friendliness seemed to go away as well. He told us about the Fresh Market Fish of the Day...sounded great...salmon stuffed with crab, etc, etc.. for $20.  After looking at our menus, two of us decided on the salmon with stuffed crab..I was craving crab and for the price it seemed decent.  After taking our orders...we waited, waited, waited, and waited...and waited some more.  During the time I saw two businessmen come in, order, eat, and pay their bill.  I saw 3 ladies come in, order, and eat.  And two old ladies come in, order and eat...all while we were still waiting.  After about 40 minutes our food was brought.  BTW, during this time we were waiting for drink refills..hardly ever checked on, etc.  The food arrived...all looked great and was very excited to eat!  We start to eat... hmm...the "salmon" tastes okay, kind of bland...  I said to my dad..I don't think this is salmon.  So, we ask the waiter again what he said the special of the day was.  He AGAIN said salmon stuffed with crab...we then POLITELY and RESPECTFULLY said that we didn't think it was salmon and that it tasted good, but it's not the special.  The waiter then said he would go and double-check.  Come to find out...he was wrong!!!  That was YESTERDAY'S SPECIAL!!  He said that he could get the salmon for us though...no apology or anything.  Too bad we weren't checked on until 20 minutes into our meal though.  By that time half the meal was gone, and we didn't want to chance waiting another 40 minutes for our food.  We were very polite about the whole "mistake", which you would have thought the waiter would have been even extra nice.  No such thing.  He never refilled our drinks.  Once it came time to get a box and check...that tooks another 20 minutes!  When he brought the check, he stepped on my dad's foot and didn't say a thing.  Overall...the food was good, but the ONE waiter needs to be switched out.  The other waiter that had to start picking up his slack was great.  Wish we could have had the OTHER waiter.  Got the bill, thought we would maybe be compensated for at least one of the "salmon" bills since I barely even ate half, but all was full price.  Would I go here again?  NO.  Didn't expect a lunch to take 2 hours!  BTW, the waiter's name was something like Lubo.
author: Melissa H.

description: Wow oh wow...great & I do mean Great service...we stopped in for lunch 4  adults & one over active toddler.  We were seated by the window....our waiter was top notch. My daughter ordered the steamed clams  &  they were cooked to perfection, my son-in-law had the curried steamed mussles - even more amazing than the clams- he let me taste one.  I had the clam chowder...and it was perfect!  I have had many a bowl of chowder in SF and I am a tough critic.  Hubby had a cup of clam chowder & a crab cocktail- he gave those the thumbs up too.  The bread basket was filled with hot, sour dough & I swear no matter how much we consumed the waiter managed to keep fresh, hot breat on our table.  The little one had the grilled cheese & fries...as with most little ones he ate the fries & some of the grilled cheese...it was a beautiful sandwich...toasted a little too much for a toddler...but perfect for a child, a little older.  In fact the grilled cheese looked so go, I would have been happy to have had it for lunch with my soup.  Best of all since it was my daughter's birthday they brought us the most AMAZING butterscotch soaked bread pudding with a side of ice cream....the dessert was so yummy...I am not a big bread pudding fan...but next time we are here I am ordering one JUST for me!
author: Debbie M.

description:
I was here in San Francisco on vacation with my daughter and we stopped by here because we had heard it was amazing...and my friends didn't do it justice!!! We had a fantastic table with a view of the Golden Gate bridge and a waiter (Ryan) who treated us with a lot of care and attention. 
We had a dozen oysters which were on the table shortly after our drinks and delicious bread. I had the Ahi Tuni starter that was very fresh and had spectacular flavor, would be a recommendation for those looking for some good flavor. My daughter had the seafood pasta which was huge and when she was done he offered a to go box. Even though we had a coupon for 20% off, he made sure we were taken care of. When we asked him about movie theaters in the area he was enthusiastic and offered info on three different locations.
While the food here is amazing, make sure you ask for Ryan to make the experience even better! We will be coming back the next time we visit the West Coast.
author: Ashley G.

description: We really enjoyed our meal here. I had the mahi mahi and I think my husband had the salmon. Both dishes were well prepared tender, juicy, and flavorful. Also the crab cakes were pretty good too not superb but good. The ambiance of this place is great and has a really nice view. Our waitress was friendly but not as attentive as I would have liked. My husband felt that because the place was busy she did her best and left a nice tip. I would recommend this place great food, great atmosphere, good service and nice view.
author: Nurah M.

description: Went last night for dessert and drinks and couldn't have been happier.  It was very quiet, but the warm lava cake was wonderful and their service was absolutely impeccable.  I expected a much different experience going to a bigger restaurant in a tourist-haven, but was quite solidly impressed.  Will be back, without a doubt.  Reasonably priced drinks and food, and of course pretty views of the pier/bay.
author: Tony G.

description: This is a classic tourist trap where the decor is nice and the location is in the busy fisherman's wharf in SF. Problems started from the moment we were seated. We requested a table near the window which the host granted us but then as we sat down, the manager came over, leaned over over the host at our table and admonished him something to the effect to check if the table was reserved in the future. During the course of our lunch, we noticed the manager being all over the staff, as discreet as tried, about every little thing. It was just horrible mgt and the place was horribly run. Our waiter, while a very nice man, was very inexperienced (which he admitted). Towards the end of our lunch, his inexperience became outright annoying as we had to raise our hands or flag down the staff for every need. We ordered clam chowder (very good), crab linguini (very rich, creamy, and not so good..you have to crack the crab to get the crab meat), and a crab sandwich (very greasy). Overall, the food was mediocre but the crab linguini was very disappointing. To top off our lunch, we were presented with the bill where they charged us a %3.5 surcharge to help the place cover their staff medical coverage. WTF? I've never seen this before. When we asked about this, our waiter said it was a new law which was complete bull crap. Anyway, save your money and go elsewhere.
author: nik t.

description: We had the best food. 2 separate appetizers and entrees just because we wanted to try all of them. Both appetizers were full of flavor and my stake was cooked to perfection. The garlic mash were the absolute best I've ever had. Nothing felt heavy and the vegetables were also perfectly cooked, flavorable and  crisp, not soggy at all. I recommend this restaurant to everyone. Our server was also wonderful. She was stuck with a big party that were seated right after us but she always made sure that we were taken care of. Then she went the extra mile to help me find a family member.
author: Shari R.

description: Went this weekend w/ my hubby & kids. Enjoyed myself. Prices are a bit high but hey...its  Pier 39 so what do you expect? Loved the entrance way...very inviting. Our waiter was very hospitable. I would go back again!
author: teresa s.

description:
We have been here several times, but it has been a couple years (on previous visits food was great too)  They have re-modelled the entrance a bit since last visit, nice, actually more tables inside as a result.  One thing I first must mention in a positive way, this restaurant is a bit more upscale than alot of the burger/cafe-type places in the area, which is nice.  Perfect setting for that special occasion, or to impress an out-of-town guest.  The staff all seem sincerely helpful, prompt service, friendly, fill empty glasses, confirm your order when it is placed, etc.  The prices are what I would call "competitive", and given the atmosphere, nice view, cleanliness of the restaurant,  I would say the prices are very fair.
I ordered the salmon entree - DELICIOUS, best salmon I have had in a long time, very fresh, prepared perfectly, and the wild rice was nice and flaky with bits of fresh herb also.  My partner ordered the Mixed Seafood entree, and that was great too - the calamari was delicious, deep fried, but not too greasy.  Their portions are generous - I was almost tempted to order the sourdough blue cheese/garlic bread, which sounds delicious, but I didnt, because I knew I would get stuffed on that before the meal came - I got stuffed on the entree alone!
The views are great from this restaurant, and I really dont think there is a "bad" table in the entire place.  The bar area looks nice too - we ate lunch at the Bar one time, and I remember the nice Coffee Drinks they have.  So after 3 or 4 visits and no negative issues, I would say safe to take anyone here with no fear of feeling like "gee, we've been here before and it was good" and have regrets about saying this!
author: Craig H.

description: I went here with my friends for a bachelorette party and we had a blast.  The food was delicious (not too big or too small).  4 of the 5 of us got the mahi mahi and really liked it.  The dessert was to die for- very smooth creme bru le.  The chocolate cake melts in your mouth.  To top off our fab experience our waitress (Adrian) was so friendly and kept the water, drinks, and smiles coming.
author: Diana J.

description: So what if this is a tourist spot?!  I love to watch the tourists, and it was especially funny to see these people with their large cameras fixated around their necks, sportin' the Hawaiian polo shirts, too-short shorts, and Birkenstocks... in a restaurant with cloth tablecloths.  My friend and I were going to get a table like these tourists, but opted to just sit at the bar because well, we were really just wanting to drink and have a good time.  Thank goodness for great drinks, free bread, and a nice bartender.  It made for lots of laughs, but I felt like the 3 of us were the only ones in the entire place having fun.  It's ok to laugh here in the City tourists- try it!  Although it was a good time out, I think next time we'll take the bartender's suggestion and go to John Colins...
author: Christine H.

description: This place was really great. I'm not sure why other other people are complaining but, it definitely was not a-OK type of place during our visit. We ordered 1/2 lb. crab with linguine, crab cake entree, salmon scruttoni (?) appetizer. The waiter was fun, fast, friendly, had some jokes up his sleeve. The view was breathtaking. I really, really wanted to try their vanilla creme brule but was too stuffed to even attempt. We had lunch so I didn't feel like drinking so I have no idea how that menu looks but the food was great, simple and just enough. We will be back.
author: Mala S.

description: I was in town recently, and visited this restaurant with a couple of friends. After some great appetizers ( the red chili prawns and blue cheese garlic bread), we ordered dinner. The entrees were outstanding, and the service even better. I was in the mood for steak so I tried the Cajun Rib Eye. My friends shared the crab linguini and a plate of calamari with fries. Everything was delicious, well prepared and promptly served. Add the spectacular view, and it was a great experience. Well worth visiting.
author: Paul V.

description: really good seafood and if you get a table by the window it has a nice view of the bay.
author: Rahul S.

description: We are visiting from NYC and took our 9month old daughter with us. Staff was very accommodating.. They have a kids menu but only suitable for 2yrs and above. Food was tasty but slightly overpriced for the quality. The flavor was great but it was a little pricey for what you actually got.. It is in pier 39, right in the middle of tourist country so I expected this... They did have Fat Tire on tap which was awesome.
author: Kevin S.

description: I've been to the Fog Harbor several times, and I've enjoyed it every time. The view's alright, and the service is fine. The decor is pretty nice, but I really enjoy the food. I usually order the grilled salmon - delicious. Afterwards, you can walk around the pier (if you're not afraid of spending an evening in tourist land).
author: David P.
